Declan Rudd.name: Declan Rudd
Declan Rudd.intro: '''Declan Thomas Rudd''' (born 16 January 1991) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City as a goalkeeper.

Orlando Trustfull.name: Orlando Trustfull
Orlando Trustfull.intro: '''Orlando Trustfull''' (born 4 August 1970 in Amsterdam) is a NetherlandsDutch Association footballfootball manager and a former professional player, who is currently head coach of Ajax A1 (Under 19s).

Matt Piper.name: Matt Piper
Matt Piper.intro:
'''Matthew James "Matt" Piper''' (born 29 September 1981 in Leicester, England) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer. He most recently played for Oadby Town F.C.Oadby Town.
Piper was educated at Rawlins Community College, and came through the youth ranks of hometown club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. After signing a professional contract in 2000, he made his first team debut in the League Cup on 9 October 2001, playing the whole of a 6–0 home defeat to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. After another appearance in a 4–1 league defeat to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, he was loaned to Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, for whom he played 8 times. He impressed there,[
url=
title=Mansfield 3-0 Swansea
publisher=BBC
date=1 December 2001 accessdate=19 April 2010 On his return in January 2002, Piper played 27 games as Leicester fought relegation from the Premier League. Although Leicester were ultimately relegated with a mere five league wins all season, Piper made his mark in the club's history by scoring the last ever competitive goal at Filbert Street against Tottenham Hotspur as Leicester won 2–1.cite web
url=
title=Leicester's Filbert farewell
publisher=BBC
date=11 May 2002 accessdate=19 April 2010
Sunderland A.F.CSunderland signed Piper from Leicester City F.C.Leicester in August 2002, for a fee of £3,500,000.[
Following Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland's promotion to the Premiership in the 2004-05 in English football2004-05, Piper was included in Sunderland's squad for the pre-season tour of USA and Canada, playing in two friendlies against American opposition. Although Piper was said to be fit, Sunderland manager Mick McCarthy was reluctant to rush Piper back into the first team, and made just one start against Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town in the Football League CupLeague Cup. This was to be Piper's final appearance for Sunderland, and his contract was terminated by mutual consent in January 2006 following an unsuccessful trial with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He had made just 29 appearances, including 15 starts, in three and a half years at Sunderland.
In the summer of 2007, Piper participated in pre-season training at Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, in an attempt to rebuild his fitness. However, he decided to retire before the start of the 2007-08 in English football2007-08 season. In March 2008, he started training with local side Anstey Nomads F.C.Anstey Nomads. He managed just one appearance before retiring from football completely[
Piper is now in charge of the under 15s at Leicester.
In 2011 Piper returned to local football, signing for Oadby Town F.C.Oadby Town of the East Midlands Counties Football League along with another former Leicester City player Jon Stevenson.

Mauricio Isla.name: Mauricio Isla
Mauricio Isla.intro: '''Mauricio Aníbal Isla''' (born 12 June 1988) is a Chilean association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, on loan from Italian side Juventus F.C.Juventus,  and for the Chile national football teamChilean national team. A tactically versatile player, Isla plays mainly as a right wing-back, but he can also play in numerous other positions, including as a right full-back or as a midfielder, both in the center and on the right wing. This is possible due to his stamina, technique, strength, and pace.

Tim Breacker.name: Tim Breacker
Tim Breacker.intro: '''Tim Breacker''' (born July 2, 1965) is an English former footballer and current football coach.

Kurt Zouma.name: Kurt Zouma
Kurt Zouma.intro:
'''Kurt Happy Zouma''' (born 27 October 1994) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (football)#Centre-backcentre back for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
He began his career at AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne, making his professional debut aged 16. Zouma won the Coupe de la Ligue with the club  2013 Coupe de la Ligue Finalin 2013, and joined Chelsea for £12 million in January 2014. Chelsea loaned him back to his first club for the remainder of the season, and in his first full campaign in England, Zouma helped Chelsea win the Football League CupLeague Cup.
Zouma has represented France at youth levels, up to France national under-21 football teamunder-21. He made his senior international debut against  on 29 March 2015.
Kurt Zouma.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Gylfi Sigur\u00f0sson.name: Gylfi Sigurðsson
Gylfi Sigur\u00f0sson.intro:
'''Gylfi Þór Sigurðsson''' (born 8 September 1989) is an Icelandic Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City as a midfielder. He is a specialist on set-pieces and possesses great long-range shooting ability.
He began his professional career with Reading F.C.Reading in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship, and in 2010 was sold to TSG 1899 HoffenheimHoffenheim in Reading's biggest sale. He was voted player of the season for two consecutive seasons for Reading F.C.Reading in 2009–10 season and for TSG 1899 HoffenheimHoffenheim in 2010–11. After a season back in English football with Swansea he joined Tottenham Hotspur for £8.8 million, and in 2014 moved back to Swansea as part of an exchange for Ben Davies (footballer, born 1993)Ben Davies.
Gylfi made his senior international debut for Iceland national football teamIceland in 2010 and has since earned over 25 caps.

Willian.name: Willian
Willian.intro:
'''Willian Borges da Silva''' (born 9 August 1988), commonly known as '''Willian''', is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking_midfielderattacking midfielder for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
He started his career at Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians, before joining FC Shakhtar DonetskShakhtar in August 2007 for a fee of €14 million.  After six years at the Ukrainian club, he briefly signed for Anzhi Makhachkala before joining Chelsea for £32 million.
Willian made his debut for Brazil national football teamBrazil in 2011 and represented the country at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

S\u00e9bastien Schemmel.name: Sébastien Schemmel
S\u00e9bastien Schemmel.intro:
He played for AS Nancy and FC MetzMetz before being signed by manager Harry Redknapp for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. Metz president Carlo Molinari had complained about Schemmel's character, saying he was "phenomenally unstable."  Schemmel was dropped from the Metz team and fined after an incident in December 2000 when he insulted two journalists, who later lodged a formal complaint with police.
In his first season in the Premier League, 2001-02 in English football2001–02, he won the "West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the YearHammer of the Year" award. Whilst at West Ham he played in their 1–0 victory over Manchester United at Old Trafford in the 2000–01 FA Cup, and scored once in the league against Derby County.cite news
url=
date=26 December 2001 accessdate=5 November 2009 The following season saw a downturn in form, perhaps caused by family problems. He left West Ham for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 2003. He scored once during his spell with Portsmouth, in a 2–1 win over Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in the FA Cup.
After being released by Portsmouth in December 2004, he joined Le Havre AC for the rest of the season and played eight games.

Steve Thompson (footballer, born 1964).name: Steve Thompson (footballer, born 1964)
Steve Thompson (footballer, born 1964).intro: '''Steven James "Steve" Thompson''' (born 2 November 1964) is a football Coach and a retired English Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (football)midfielder. As of 18 December 2014, he is the assistant manager of Football League Championship side Leeds United F.C.Leeds United.

Ishmael Miller.name: Ishmael Miller
Ishmael Miller.intro: '''Ishmael Anthony Miller''' (born 5 March 1987) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town. Starting his career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Miller has also played for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Eduardo da Silva.name: Eduardo da Silva
Eduardo da Silva.intro:
'''Eduardo Alves da Silva''' (born 25 February 1983), commonly known as '''Eduardo''', sometimes nicknamed '''Dudu''', is a Brazilian-born Croatian Association footballfootballer who plays for Clube de Regatas do FlamengoFlamengo. Capable of playing any Forward (association football)forward position, he started as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker, but is deployed mostly as a Forward (association football)#Wingerwinger or Forward (association football)#Second strikersecond striker during the last few years.
He began his career with his hometown club in Brazil, Bangu Atlético Clube. He later joined NK Dinamo ZagrebDinamo Zagreb's youth team. He spent a period on loan at NK Inter ZaprešićInter Zaprešić, scoring 10 goals in 15 matches. His prolific scoring at Dinamo Zagreb, where he scored 74 times in 111 appearances, attracted the interest of Arsenal F.C.Arsenal who signed him for a fee of £7.5 million in 2007. A serious leg injury hampered his time with Arsenal and, after 3 seasons with the club, he moved to Shakhtar Donetsk in 2010.
Eduardo took up Croatian citizenship in 2002 and made his international debut for the Croatian national football teamCroatian senior team as a second-half substitute in a friendly match against the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland on 16 November 2004 at the age of 21. He was selected by the national team's coach Slaven Bilić for the UEFA Euro 2012 tournament and again by Niko Kovač for the 2014 FIFA World Cup. With 29 goals scored for Croatia, Eduardo is the team's second most prolific striker on record, behind Davor Šuker with 45 goals.

Jak Alnwick.name: Jak Alnwick
Jak Alnwick.intro: '''Jak Alnwick''' (born 17 June 1993) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City on loan from Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. He has also represented England at England national under-17 football teamunder-17 and england national under-18 football teamunder-18 levels.

Vinnie Jones.name: Vinnie Jones
Vinnie Jones.position: Misconduct  association football  sent off,Dane Whitehouse

Jermaine Johnson.name: Jermaine Johnson
Jermaine Johnson.intro: '''Jermaine Johnson''' (born 25 June 1980) is a Jamaican professional association footballfootballer, plays for Indy Eleven, in the North American Soccer League, after being released by Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He started his career in his homeland with Tivoli Gardens F.C.Tivoli Gardens, before coming to England, where he has also played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. Johnson has also won 74 cap (sport)caps for Jamaica national football teamJamaica.

Tomasz Kuszczak.name: Tomasz Kuszczak
Tomasz Kuszczak.intro:
'''Tomasz Mirosław Kuszczak''' (; born 20 March 1982) is a Polish Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English Championship side Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Born in Krosno Odrzańskie, Kuszczak previously played for Śląsk Wrocław in Poland, as well as for the German clubs KFC Uerdingen 05 and Hertha BSC, before moving in 2004 to England with West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. During the summer of 2006 he transferred to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and in 2012 joined Brighton & Hove Albion, who released him at the end of the 2013–14 season.
Kuszczak made 14 appearances for the Poland national under-21 football teamPoland under-21 side, and has been cap (sport)capped 11 times at Poland national football teamsenior level. He was a member of the nation's squad at the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Eirik Bakke.name: Eirik Bakke
Eirik Bakke.intro: '''Eirik Bakke''' (born 13 September 1977 in Sogndal) is a Norwegian retired Association footballfootball player. He played on the right-hand side or centre of midfield.

Aaron Wilbraham.name: Aaron Wilbraham
Aaron Wilbraham.intro: '''Aaron Thomas Wilbraham''' (born 21 October 1979) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City as a Forward (association football)forward.

Matthieu Louis-Jean.name: Matthieu Louis-Jean
Matthieu Louis-Jean.intro:
'''Matthieu Louis-Jean''' (born 22 February 1976 in Mont-Saint-Aignan) is a FranceFrench former football (soccer)footballer, who is currently a scout for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He finished his career at Norwich in June 2005 after several seasons at Nottingham Forest, who he joined from Le Havre AC in 1999 following a loan spell. An experienced full-back, Louis-Jean made 198 league appearances for Forest. His transfer to Norwich was a player exchange deal that saw Gary Holt (footballer)Gary Holt move to the City Ground.
Louis-Jean made just two appearances for Norwich at the start of his first season with the club (2005–06 in English football2005–06) before injury problems ruled him out of action for the remainder of the campaign. The Frenchman was near a return to the first team, but an injury playing for the reserve team saw his recovery set back yet again.
Norwich manager Peter Grant (footballer)Peter Grant announced in February 2007 that Louis-Jean would be released at the end of the 2006–07 in English football2006–07 season.

Branco.name: Branco
Branco.intro: '''Cláudio Ibrahim Vaz Leal''' (born 4 April 1964 in Bagé, Brazil), better known as '''Branco''', is former Brazilian association footballfootballer who played as a Fullback (association football)left back. A member of the triumphant Brazil national football teamBrazilian team in the 1994 FIFA World Cup, Branco was a renowned free kick specialist (as was his international successor, Roberto Carlos (footballer)Roberto Carlos) known for the habit of placing the valve of the ball in the direction that he wanted the free kick to go.[

Richard Gough.name: Richard Gough
Richard Gough.intro: '''Charles Richard Gough''' (born in Stockholm, Sweden, 5 April 1962) is a former Scottish association footballfootball defender (football)defender.  He captained Rangers F.C.Rangers to nine successive Scottish Football League titles. He also played for Scotland national football teamScotland 61 times and had a brief spell as head coachmanager of Livingston F.C.Livingston. He is now resident in San Diego.

Wayne Jacobs.name: Wayne Jacobs
Wayne Jacobs.intro: '''Wayne Jacobs''' (born 3 February 1969) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball coach and former professional player who was most recently assistant manager at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City.
Wayne Jacobs.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Chris Freestone.name: Chris Freestone
Chris Freestone.intro:
'''Chris Freestone''' (born 4 September 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer.
As a young striker, Freestone joined Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough from Nottinghamshire club Arnold Town of the Northern Counties (East) League midway through the 1994-95 season. Before joining Boro for a small fee he had netted 54 goals for Arnold Town and had trials with Leeds United, Nottingham Forest, Notts County and Chesterfield. Fast and confident, he had averaged almost a goal a game for Boro reserves in two seasons since joining. Freestone scored on his full first team debut in the 3-1 win over Sheffield Wednesday in April 1996.cite web
url=
title=Wednesday not out of trouble yet
publisher=The Independent
date=6 April 1996 accessdate=5 September 2012 His only other goal for Boro came in the Football League CupLeague Cup against Barnet F.C.Barnet in September 1997.cite web
url=
title=Hateley's Hull look forward to trip to the Palace
publisher=The Independent
date=18 September 1997 accessdate=5 September 2012 He was also on the pitch as a late substitute as Boro confirmed their spot in the 1997 FA Cup Final with a semi final replay victory over Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield,cite news
url=
title=Foreign legion go back to Wembley
publisher=The Independent
date=22 April 1997 accessdate=1 May 2010
location=London
first=Glenn
last=Moore however he was left out of the final match day squad altogether as they lost 2-0 to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. After a loan spell, Freestone joined Northampton Town F.C.Northampton in December 1997. The highlight of his time at Northampton was scoring two goals against Premier League side West Ham United in the 1998-99 Football League CupLeague Cup. Freestone's brace in the first leg gave Northampton a 2-0 lead going into the second leg,cite web
url=
title=Northampton 2 West Ham 0
publisher=Sporting Life
date=15 September 1998 accessdate=5 September 2012 in which West Ham were only able to muster a 1-0 win with a Frank Lampard goal meaning that Northampton knocked out their illustrious opponents.cite web
url=
title=Hammer horror for Old Lady
publisher=The Guardian
date=22 September 1998 accessdate=5 September 2012 After leaving Northampton, Freestone had spells at Hartlepool and Cheltenham before signing for Shrewsbury Town. At Shrewsbury he failed to score in the league but did score once in the League Cup against Preston North Endcite web
url=
title=Worthington Cup 2000-2001 Season Round 1 Fixtures & Results
publisher=Sky Sports
date=22 August 2000 accessdate=5 September 2012 and once in the FA Cup against former club Cheltenham.cite web
url=
title=Cheltenham 4-1 Shrewsbury
publisher=BBC
date=18 November 2000 accessdate=5 September 2012
After football Freestone decided to turn to Football coaching and now works with the Notts FA.

Landon Donovan.name: Landon Donovan
Landon Donovan.intro:
'''Landon Timothy Donovan''' (born March 4, 1982) is an American former professional association footballsoccer player. Widely considered to be the best player to ever come out of the United States, he played as a withdrawn Forward (association football)forward and winger (association football)winger for the LA Galaxy, Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen, San Jose Earthquakes, FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich, and Everton F.C.Everton. He is also a former captain of the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States men's national team.
A member of the inaugural class of the IMG AcademyU.S. Soccer residency program in Bradenton, Florida, Donovan was declared player of the tournament for his role in the United States men's national under-17 soccer teamUnited States U17 squad that finished fourth in the 1999 FIFA U-17 World Championship. Donovan later signed with the German team Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen. In 2005, after six years with the club, the majority of which were spent on loan (association football)loan at the San Jose Earthquakes, Donovan moved to the Los Angeles Galaxy. He later returned to the Bundesliga for a three-month spell at the start of 2009 on loan to FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich, and twice went on short loans to English Premier League team Everton F.C.Everton, in 2010 and 2012.
In Major League Soccer, Donovan won a record six MLS CupMLS Cups and is both the league's all-time top scorer with 144 goals and the league's all-time assists leader with 136.
For the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States men's national team, Donovan is the List of top international association football goal scorers by countryall-time leader in scoring and assists, and has the most cap (sport)caps of all active players.  Donovan is the only American player to reach the 50 goals/50 assists mark.  He is a four-time winner of the U.S. Soccer Athlete of the Year award (the only man to do so and the first man to win in consecutive years), as well as the only seven-time winner of the Honda Player of the Year award. Donovan starred in the U.S. team that reached the quarter-finals of the 2002 FIFA World Cup where he received the FIFA World Cup awards#Best Young Player AwardBest Young Player Award. His three goals in the 2010 FIFA World Cup made Donovan the highest scoring male American player in World Cup history and one of the three male American players to score in more than one World Cup (along with Brian McBride and Clint Dempsey). On January 15, 2015, Major League Soccer announced it was naming its MVP award after Donovan, The Major League Soccer MVP Award will now be named the Landon Donovan MVP Award.
Landon Donovan.position: Winger  association football  Winger,Forward  association football  Forward

Dean Sturridge.name: Dean Sturridge
Dean Sturridge.intro: '''Dean Constantine Sturridge''' (born 26 July 1973 in Birmingham, England) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Striker (football)striker. As of the 2013/14 Premier League season, he is a football match commentator for beIN Sports.

Nabil Abidallah.name: Nabil Abidallah
Nabil Abidallah.intro: '''Nabil Abidallah''' (born 5 August 1982 in Amsterdam) is a former NetherlandsDutch professional association footballfootballer of MoroccoMoroccan origin.

Mohamed Salah.name: Mohamed Salah
Mohamed Salah.intro:
'''Mohamed Salah Ghaly''' (; born 15 June 1992) is an Egyptian professional association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club ACF FiorentinaFiorentina, on loan from English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and the Egypt national football teamEgypt national team as a Winger (association football)#Midfielderwinger.
As well as representing the Egyptian national team at an early age, he also participated in the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup and the 2012 Summer Olympics. He won the Swiss Super League in his first season with FC BaselBasel, and was awarded the CAF AwardsCAF Most Promising African Talent of the Year in 2012. In 2013, he was awarded the Swiss Super LeagueSAFP Golden Player award for being the best player in the Swiss Super League.

Seth Johnson.name: Seth Johnson
Seth Johnson.intro: '''Seth Art Maurice Johnson''' (born 12 March 1979) is a retired former English Association football. He spent his career at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Derby County F.C.Derby County and Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, and played one international for England national football teamEngland in 2000.

Paul McGregor.name: Paul McGregor
Paul McGregor.intro:
'''Paul Anthony McGregor''' (born 17 December 1974 in Liverpool) is a former English professional association footballfootballer and lead singer of London based punk musicpunk band Ulterior (band)Ulterior where he is known under the stage name '''Honey'''.
As a footballer he was a striker (association football)striker from 1991 to 2003, notably playing in the Premier League and UEFA Cup for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He also appeared in the Football League for Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town before retiring from professional football at the age of 29 to take up a career in music.

Isaiah Brown.name: Isaiah Brown
Isaiah Brown.intro:
'''Isaiah Jay "Izzy" Brown''' (born 7 January 1997) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward or a Winger (association football)winger for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in the Premier League. Brown played for West Bromwich Albion's academy and under-21 teams before making his senior debut in 2013. Since signing for Chelsea, he has played for their under-21 team.
Brown has represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17 and England national under-19 football teamunder-19 levels.

Nathan Doyle.name: Nathan Doyle
Nathan Doyle.intro:
'''Nathan Luke Robert Doyle''' (born 12 January 1987) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town in Football League Two.
Doyle, who developed as a player through Derby County F.C.Derby County's academy, has played for the England U16 side, England U17 side and England U20 side. He can play at Defender (association football)#Full backright-back, central Midfieldermidfield, or the right side of midfield.

Calum Davenport.name: Calum Davenport
Calum Davenport.intro: '''Calum Ray Paul Davenport''' (born 1 January 1983) is an English former Association footballfootballer. During his career he played for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Watford F.C.Watford, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Wootton Blue Cross F.C.Wootton Blue Cross and  Elstow Abbey as a Defender (association football)defender.
Calum Davenport.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

John Sheridan.name: John Sheridan
John Sheridan.intro:
'''John Joseph Sheridan''' (born 1 October 1964) is a Association footballfootball Manager (association football)manager and former player who is the manager of Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle.
A midfielder, he began his playing career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and then moved to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, where he scored 47 league goals in 230 appearances. He played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest briefly, under the managerment of Brian Clough, and then joined Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, for whom he scored the winning goal in the 1991 Football League Cup Final at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley Stadium. Near the end of his time with the club, he played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers on loan before joining the latter permanently. Sheridan made 199 league appearances for Wednesday and scored 25 goals. He won the Football League with Bolton in 1997.
Sheridan played for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers after leaving Bolton and then joined Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, where he spent the last six years of his playing career, scoring 14 league goals in 144 appearances. He played international football for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, for whom he won 34 Cap (sport)caps and scored five goals over a seven-year period. Having been included in the Republic's squad for UEFA Euro 1988, Sheridan went on to play one game at the 1990 FIFA World Cup and four in the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 tournament.
He became Oldham's manager in 2006, having served as Caretaker managercaretaker twice during his time as an Oldham player. Sheridan left the club in 2009, having spent more than ten years there as a player, coach and manager. He joined Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield later that year, where he achieved success in Football League Twoleague and Football League Trophycup competition. Sheridan resigned after three years in charge and became Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle's manager at the beginning of 2013. His brother, Darren SheridanDarren, also played for several clubs in the Football League.

Christian Bassedas.name: Christian Bassedas
Christian Bassedas.intro:
'''Christian Gustavo Bassedas''' (born 16 February 1973 in Buenos Aires) is a retired ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootball defensive midfielder who works as General manager#Sports teamsgeneral manager (not to confuse with Coach (sports)coach) for Club Atlético Vélez SársfieldVélez Sársfield of the Argentine Primera División.
Bassedas is most notable for his spell at Vélez Sársfield, where he made 267 appearances for the club, giving him the eleventh most appearances in their history.

Ivica Mornar.name: Ivica Mornar
Ivica Mornar.intro:
'''Ivica Mornar''' (born 12 January 1974 in Split, CroatiaSplit) is a retired Croatian association footballfootballer.
He started as Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker, but was mostly deployed as a Forward (association football)#Wingerwinger during his career.
Mornar began his career with Hajduk Split before going on to play for Eintracht Frankfurt, Sevilla FCSevilla, CD Ourense, Standard Liège, R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth.
He played 22 matches and scored once for the  Croatia national football teamCroatian national team, representing them at 2004 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2004.

Yordi.name: Yordi
Yordi.intro:
'''Jorge González Díaz''', commonly known as '''Yordi''' (born 14 September 1974), is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
A journeyman, he amassed La Liga totals of 180 games and 37 goals in ten seasons, in representation of five teams (notably Real ZaragozaZaragoza), and 161/61 in Segunda División.
In 2002 Yordi had a six-month spell in England, with Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.

Gabriel Heinze.name: Gabriel Heinze
Gabriel Heinze.intro:
'''Gabriel Iván Heinze''' (; born 19 April 1978) is an Argentine former Association footballfootballer. He could operate as either a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back or a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Nicknamed ''Gringo'' ("Blonde" in Argentine-Spanish slang), he made a name for himself at Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain, moving in 2004 to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and subsequently to Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, winning three major titles with the latter two clubs. He started and finished his 18-year professional career with Newell's Old Boys.
Heinze played 72 times with Argentina national football teamArgentina, representing the nation at two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and as many Copa América tournaments.

Chris Lucketti.name: Chris Lucketti
Chris Lucketti.intro:
'''Christopher James "Chris" Lucketti''' (born 28 September 1971 in Littleborough, Greater ManchesterLittleborough, Lancashire, England) is an English former association footballfootballer, who played as a Defender (association football)central defender. He is mainly known for his success at Bury F.C.Bury, for whom he made over 200 appearances, and the mighty Preston North End Football Club.
He is currently the assistant manager of Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town.

John Stones.name: John Stones
John Stones.intro: '''John Stones''' (born 28 May 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Everton F.C.Everton and the England national football team. Mainly a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, he can also play as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.

Glenn Murray.name: Glenn Murray
Glenn Murray.intro: '''Glenn Murray''' (born 25 September 1983) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a forward (association football)striker. Prior to joining Crystal Palace in June 2011, Murray previously played for Workington A.F.C.Workington Reds, Wilmington Hammerheads, Barrow A.F.C.Barrow, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Stockport County F.C.Stockport, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion.

Kevin Cooper.name: Kevin Cooper
Kevin Cooper.intro: '''Kevin Lee Cooper''' (born 8 February 1975 in Derby) is a former English professional association footballfootballer.

St\u00e9phane Sess\u00e8gnon.name: Stéphane Sessègnon
St\u00e9phane Sess\u00e8gnon.intro: '''Stéphane Sessègnon''' (born 1 June 1984) is a Beninese Association footballfootballer who plays for English club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in the Premier League. He is a Benin national football teamBenin international having starred for the nation at both the 2008 Africa Cup of Nations2008 and 2010 Africa Cup of Nations2010 editions of the Africa Cup of Nations. Sessègnon plays a variety of positions as a forward, a winger and as a midfield playmaker.
St\u00e9phane Sess\u00e8gnon.position: Midfielder Winger,Midfielder Attacking Midfielder,Forward  association football  Second Striker

Gilberto da Silva Melo.name: Gilberto da Silva Melo
Gilberto da Silva Melo.intro: '''Gilberto da Silva Melo''', (born 25 April 1976 in Rio de Janeiro), more commonly known as '''Gilberto''', is a retired Brazilian professional association footballfootballer. He has played at left back for the majority of his career. Gilberto's brothers Nildeson da SilvaNildeson and Nélio da Silva MeloNélio are also footballers.

Iain Turner.name: Iain Turner
Iain Turner.intro: '''Iain Ross Turner''' (born 26 January 1984) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootball goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who currently plays for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He has represented the Scotland national under-21 football teamScotland under-21 team, the Scotland B national football teamScotland B team and been selected for the full Scotland national football teamScotland squad. Turner previously played for Stirling Albion F.C.Stirling Albion, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Everton F.C.Everton and several other clubs on loan.

Niko Kranj\u010dar.name: Niko Kranjčar
Niko Kranj\u010dar.intro:
'''Niko Kranjčar''' () (born 13 August 1984) is a Croatian Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers, on loan from Dynamo Kyiv, and the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team. He primarily plays as an Midfielder (association football)#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder, but can also operate as a Midfielder (association football)#Wingerwinger or Forward (association football)#Second strikersecond striker.
He represented two of the biggest clubs in his homeland, playing for Dinamo Zagreb before sparking controversy by making a move to their fierce rivals Hajduk Split in January 2005. A transfer to England with Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth soon followed in August 2006, and after several years of attempting to hold on to their key players, Portsmouth decided to sell him at the start of the 2009–10 Premier League2009–10 season, opening the way for a move to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham in September 2009, where he was reunited with his former manager at Portsmouth, Harry Redknapp.
Hailed as the next Robert Prosinečki, Kranjčar was given his international debut by his father Zlatko KranjčarZlatko in August 2004. Since then, Kranjčar has represented his country in the 2006 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2008 and UEFA Euro 2012. So far he has won 81 caps for the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team, scoring 16 goals in the process.
Kranjčar spent his childhood years in Austria, where his father played for Rapid Vienna. He therefore holds an Austrian passport, which qualified him as an European UnionEU player before Croatia's admission in 2013.

Kenwyne Jones.name: Kenwyne Jones
Kenwyne Jones.intro:
'''Kenwyne Joel Jones''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 5 October 1984) is a Trinidadian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, on loan from Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, and the Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago national team.
He began his football career with Joe Public in his native Trinidad and Tobago. He moved to W Connection in 2002, and he was a utility player in the Trinidad and Tobago team in 2003 against Finland national football teamFinland. In 2004, he joined Southampton F.C.Southampton, where he was converted to a striker. He was later loaned to Sheffield Wednesday and Stoke City during the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 season. In 2007 he joined Sunderland for £6 million where he spent three seasons before he signed for Stoke City in August 2010. In his first season at Stoke Jones scored 12 goals and played in the 2011 FA Cup Final. Following the arrival of Peter Crouch in August 2011, Jones struggled to hold down a regular place in the side which saw him score just four more league goals in the next three seasons. In January 2014 he joined Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in a player-exchange with Peter Odemwingie.

Dean Kiely.name: Dean Kiely
Dean Kiely.intro: '''Dean Laurence Kiely''' (born 10 October 1970) is a former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He won 11 cap (sport)caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. Kiely has worked as the coach (sport)goalkeeping coach at West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion & Norwich City F.CNorwich City

Runar Normann.name: Runar Normann
Runar Normann.intro: '''Runar Normann''' (born 1 March 1978 in Harstad, Norway) is a NorwayNorwegian former football (soccer)footballer.

Ei\u00f0ur Gu\u00f0johnsen.name: Eiður Guðjohnsen
Ei\u00f0ur Gu\u00f0johnsen.intro:
'''Eiður Smári Guðjohnsen'''Usually spelt '''Eidur Gudjohnsen''' in English-language sources (born 15 September 1978) is an IcelandersIcelandic professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as a Forward (association football)forward or attacking midfielder.
He has previously played for Premier League club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and FC Barcelona of Spain, having made his name with Bolton earlier in his career. He was the captain of the Iceland national football teamIceland national team until manager Ólafur Jóhannesson (coach)Ólafur Jóhannesson took over the team. Throughout his professional career, Guðjohnsen has scored over 150 goals in all competitions with his clubs and the national team.
He is the son of Arnór Guðjohnsen, a former professional footballer, and is often considered to be one of the greatest Icelandic footballers, having won titles in the Netherlands, Spain, and England as well as the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League. He made his full international debut for Iceland as a substitute for his father in 1996, and is the nation's top scorer of all time with 25 international goals in 79 caps.

Mel Sterland.name: Mel Sterland
Mel Sterland.intro: '''Melvyn "Mel" Sterland''' (born 1 October 1961 in Sheffield) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played in the Football League for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and in the Scottish Football League Premier Division for Rangers F.C.Rangers, and was cap (sport)capped once for England national football teamEngland.

Derrick Williams.name: Derrick Williams
Derrick Williams.intro: '''Derrick Williams''' (born 17 January 1993) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City as a Defender (association football)defender and is a Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland under-21 international.
Derrick Williams.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Jean Beausejour.name: Jean Beausejour
Jean Beausejour.intro:
'''Jean André Emanuel Beausejour Coliqueo''' (; born 1 June 1984), nicknamed ''Palmatoria'',  is a Chilean footballer who plays for Chilean Primera DivisiónPrimera División club Colo-Colo as left back. He has played at Chile, Switzerland, Brazil, Belgium, Mexico and England, reaching the Carling Cup and F.A. Cup in that last.
He has 60 cap (sport)caps for the Chile national football teamChilean national team, and represented his country in the FIFA World CupWorld Cups of 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014.

Fabien Barthez.name: Fabien Barthez
Fabien Barthez.intro: '''Fabien Alain Barthez''' (; born 28 June 1971) is a French former association footballfootballer who won honours as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper with Olympique de MarseilleMarseille, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the France national football teamFrench national team, with whom he won the 1998 FIFA World Cup and 2000 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 and reached the final of the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup. He shares the record for the most FIFA World Cup records#GoalkeepingWorld Cup finals clean sheets with Peter Shilton, with 10. In club football he won the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League as well as several Ligue 1 and Premier League titles.

Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1982).name: Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1982)
Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1982).intro: '''Mark Alexander Hudson''' (born 30 March 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a centre half for Football League Championship side Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town, where he is also the Captain (association football)captain.

Leon McKenzie.name: Leon McKenzie
Leon McKenzie.intro:
'''Leon Mark McKenzie''' (born 17 May 1978) is an English professional boxer who competes in the Super middleweight class. He is also a former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)forward from 1995 to 2013.
McKenzie started his professional career with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1995. He also appeared for Fulham F.C.Fulham and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United on loan whilst with The Eagles before securing a permanent move to Peterborough in 2000. Three years later he joined Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and became a part of the side who won promotion to the Premier League. He has since gone on to play for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town before dropping into Non-league football with Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town and Corby Town F.C.Corby Town. He retired from competitive football on 1 January 2013.

Chris Brown (footballer, born 1984).name: Chris Brown (footballer, born 1984)
Chris Brown (footballer, born 1984).intro: '''Christopher Alan "Chris" Brown''' (born 11 December 1984) is an English association footballfootballer, who currently plays for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers as a Forward (association football)forward.

Martin Cranie.name: Martin Cranie
Martin Cranie.intro: '''Martin James Cranie''' (born 23 September 1986 in Yeovil, Somerset) is an English association footballfootballer currently playing for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He began his career with the Southampton youth academy playing alongside Theo Walcott and Gareth Bale before moving to local rivals Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and later to Coventry City after several loan spells. He is a versatile defender who can play all across the back four, though his main position is usually centre back.

Andy Turner.name: Andy Turner
Andy Turner.intro:
'''Andrew "Andy" Turner''' (born 23 March 1975 in Woolwich) is an EnglandEnglish-born former Association footballfootballer who represented the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland at youth level and played in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham.
As part of his Tottenham career, Turner set a then-Premier League record as the division's youngest-ever goalscorer, when he scored against Everton on 5 September 1992, aged 17 years and 166 days.cite news
url=
title=The Premiership's youngest gunspublisher=BBC Sport Academy date=27 December 2002
Turner also played for numerous other clubs in the Football League, including several seasons at Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United.
After retiring from playing he has moved into coaching; he was appointed assistant manager at Coalville Town F.C.Coalville Town in January 2014, having had spells as a coach at both Kidsgrove Athletic F.C.Kidsgrove Athletic and Chasetown F.C.Chasetown and then as manager of Alsager Town F.C.Alsager Town from May 2012 to January 2014.cite news
url=
title=Alsager appoint Andy Turnerpublisher=NonLeagueDaily.com date=14 May 2012

Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1963).name: Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1963)
Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1963).intro:
'''Thomas''' "'''Tommy'''" '''Wright''' (born 29 August 1963 in Belfast) is a former football Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper and current manager of St. Johnstone F.C.St Johnstone.
Wright represented Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland 31 times as a player. At club level he played for Grange Rangers, Linfield F.C.Linfield, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Reading F.C.Reading, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Since retiring as a player he has worked as a coach or manager for Limavady United F.C.Limavady United, Ballymena United F.C.Ballymena United, Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers and St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone.

Robert Fleck.name: Robert Fleck
Robert Fleck.intro:
'''Robert William Fleck''' (born 11 August 1965 in Glasgow) is a Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer and manager. He played as a Striker (association football)striker from 1983 until 2001, notably in the Scottish Premier League for Rangers F.C.Rangers, in England for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in the Premier LeagueFA Premier League, and for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in the The Football LeagueFootball League.
He also played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Reading F.C.Reading. He earnt 4 caps for Scotland national football teamScotland featuring in the 1990 World Cup. He went into management in 2000 with a spell as player-manager of Non-league Gorleston F.C.Gorleston, and later having a four-year spell in charge of Diss Town F.C.Diss Town. Fleck was made a member of Norwich City's Hall of Fame. Since retiring as a player, he has worked in football management, but is now a teaching assistant in Norwich.

Steven Whittaker.name: Steven Whittaker
Steven Whittaker.intro:
'''Steven Gordon Whittaker''' (born 16 June 1984) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Wing-backright back for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.
Whittaker began his career with Hibernian F.C.Hibernian and made over 170 appearances for the Easter Road side. He also won the Scottish League Cup in 2006–07 Scottish League Cup2007 before signing for Rangers F.C.Rangers in August that year. Whittaker won three Scottish Premier League titles, two Scottish Cups and three Scottish League Cups with Rangers. At the start of the 2012-13 in English football2012–13 season he signed for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City as a free agent.
Steven Whittaker.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Right Back

David Unsworth.name: David Unsworth
David Unsworth.intro:
'''David Gerald Unsworth''' (born 16 October 1973 in Chorley, Lancashire) is an English football coach and former professional association footballplayer. As a player, Unsworth played as a Defender (association football)centre-back or Defender (association football)left-back from 1991 until 2009.
Unsworth is best remembered for his time at Everton F.C.Everton during the 1990s, where he was part of their FA Cup winning team of 1995 FA Cup Final1995 and commonly known as '''"Rhino"'''. He earned one full England national football teamEngland cap in 1995. He also played in the Premier League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, and in the Football League for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town. After retiring he moved into coaching with Preston North End F.C.Preston North End where he was twice appointed caretaker manager.
He returned to Everton in September 2013 as assistant to Everton U21s head coach Alan Stubbs.
David Unsworth.position: Defender  association football  Centre back,Defender  association football  left back

'''Maarten Stekelenburg''' (; born 22 September 1982) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays for French club AS Monaco FCAS Monaco on loan from English club Fulham F.C.Fulham and the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Stekelenburg is a product of the Ajax AmsterdamAjax youth system, where he followed in the footsteps of Edwin van der Sar, who he succeeded in the Dutch national team, with whom he reached the final of the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Jeremy Goss.name: Jeremy Goss
Jeremy Goss.intro: '''Jeremy''' "'''Jerry'''" '''Goss''' (born 11 May 1965 in Oekolia, Cyprus) is a former WalesWelsh international association footballfootballer. He is most noted for playing for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City from 1984 to 1996. He came to prominence during their successful period in the mid-1990s. Goss played in the midfield, and was known for scoring spectacularly but not often, and was noted for his superior volleying skills and high level of stamina.

John McGrath (footballer, born 1980).name: John McGrath (footballer, born 1980)
John McGrath (footballer, born 1980).intro: '''John Matthew McGrath''' (born 27 March 1980) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays for Alfreton Town F.C.Alfreton Town as a midfielder.

Afonso Alves.name: Afonso Alves
Afonso Alves.intro:
'''Afonso Alves Martins Júnior''' (born 30 January 1981), known as simply '''Afonso Alves''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker.
Alves enjoyed the most successful period of his career playing at SC HeerenveenHeerenveen in the Dutch Eredivisie, where his goal-to-game ratio was higher than a goal a game. This precipitated a club record move to Football in EnglandEnglish club Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in January 2008. Alves has been cap (sport)capped for Brazil national football teamBrazil on eight occasions.

Robert Pir\u00e8s.name: Robert Pirès
Robert Pir\u00e8s.intro:
'''Robert Emmanuel Pirès''' (born 29 October 1973) is a French association footballfootballer who plays for FC Goa in the Indian Super League.
He is a former List of France international footballersFrench international footballer and is best known for his time with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where he won three FA Cups and two Premier League titles including the club's unbeaten season of 2003–04 FA Premier League2003–04. A former France national football teamFrance international, Pirès earned 79 caps between 1996 and 2004 for his country, including winning both the 1998 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000. He has been included in the PFA Team of the Year for the PFA Team of the Year#2001.E2.80.93022001–02, PFA Team of the Year#FA Premier League 112002–03 and PFA Team of the Year#FA Premier League 122003–04 seasons, was the Player of the Tournament for the 2001 FIFA Confederations Cup, FWA Player of the Year for the 2001–02 season, Ligue 1 Young Player of the Year for the 1995-96 French Division 11995–96 season, and was included in the FIFA 100 by Pelé. He was also voted by Arsenal fans as the 6th [
Pirès has played the majority of his career as a Left midfieldleft winger, but can also play all across the midfield or in a position to support the forward line.

Kyle Bartley.name: Kyle Bartley
Kyle Bartley.intro:
'''Kyle Louis Bartley''' (born 22 May 1991) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City as a Defender (association football)defender.
Bartley started his career with Arsenal, making his debut in 2009. He spent some of the 2009 season and the first half of the 2010 season with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in the Football League Championship. He then spent the second half of the 2010 season with Scottish Premier League club Rangers F.C.Rangers and returned to them for the 2011–12 campaign. He signed for Swansea in 2012, and spent the first half of the 2013–14 season on loan to Championship club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He has also represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16 and England national under-17 football teamunder-17 level.

Matty Pattison.name: Matty Pattison
Matty Pattison.intro: '''Matthew Joseph "Matty" Pattison''' (born 27 October 1986) is a South African association footballer who plays for Gateshead F.C.Gateshead in the Conference Premier.

Marco van Ginkel.name: Marco van Ginkel
Marco van Ginkel.intro:
'''Wulfert Cornelius "Marco" van Ginkel''' (; born 1 December 1992) is a Dutch professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Serie A club A.C. MilanMilan on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team. Van Ginkel began his career in the youth ranks of SBV Vitesse, joining the Arnhem-based club as a seven year old in 1999. After making his way through the various youth levels at the club, Van Ginkel debuted for the senior team in 2010 before sealing a transfer around £8 million to Chelsea FCChelsea in 2013.
He is the son of former professional footballer Alex van Ginkel, who scored a goal for FC Utrecht in the 1987–88 UEFA Cup second round match against Hellas Verona F.C.Hellas Verona.
At the international level, Van Ginkel represented the Netherlands at the Netherlands national under-19 football teamU19 and Netherlands national under-21 football teamU21 levels before making his Netherlands national football teamsenior team debut against Germany national football teamGermany in November 2012.

Will Atkinson.name: Will Atkinson
Will Atkinson.intro:
'''William Henry''' "'''Will'''" '''Atkinson''' (born 14 October 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Southend United F.C.Southend United. Described as a tricky winger, he can play on either side of the midfield.
Having begun his professional career with Hull City A.F.C.Hull City in 2006, Atkinson spent time on loan with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale (twice), Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle. He was promoted out of League Two with Rochdale in 2009–10. He signed with Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in July 2012, and played in the 2013 Football League Cup Final2013 Football League CupLeague Cup final defeat and the 2013 Football League Two play-off Final2013 Football League TwoLeague Two play-off final victory. He signed with Southend United in July 2013.

Jon Gittens.name: Jon Gittens
Jon Gittens.intro: '''Jonathan Antoni "Jon" Gittens''', (born 22 January 1964), is a former footballer who played for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town as well as for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United and Exeter City F.C.Exeter City.
Jon Gittens.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

Shaun Bartlett.name: Shaun Bartlett
Shaun Bartlett.intro: '''Shaun Bartlett''' (born 31 October 1972 in Cape Town) is a retired South African Association footballfootball striker who last played for Bloemfontein Celtic. He is currently the assistant manager of Golden Arrows in South Africa.

Nick Barmby.name: Nick Barmby
Nick Barmby.intro:
'''Nicholas Jon "Nick" Barmby''' (born 11 February 1974) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and former manager of Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.
As a player he played as a midfielder and at his peak he earned a total of 23 cap (sport)caps for England national football teamEngland between 1995 and 2001. As well as two Premier League seasons with Hull, Barmby has appeared in England's top flight for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Everton F.C.Everton, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United having also represented Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest outside the Premiership. Barmby is one of only nine players to have scored Premier League goals for six different teams (the others being Nicolas Anelka, Craig Bellamy, Darren Bent, Marcus Bent, Andy Cole, Peter Crouch, Les Ferdinand and Robbie Keane).

Kazenga LuaLua.name: Kazenga LuaLua
Kazenga LuaLua.intro: '''Kazenga LuaLua''' (born 10 December 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Championship club Brighton and Hove AlbionBrighton & Hove Albion.

Vito Mannone.name: Vito Mannone
Vito Mannone.intro: '''Vito Mannone''' (born 2 March 1988) is an Italian Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He previously played for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and has represented Italy at youth level.

Alan Rogers (footballer, born 1977).name: Alan Rogers (footballer, born 1977)
Alan Rogers (footballer, born 1977).intro: '''Alan Rogers''' (born 3 January 1977) is a retired association footballfootballer who usually played at Defender (association football)#Full backleft-back.

Danny Collins.name: Danny Collins
Danny Collins.intro:
'''Daniel Lewis''' "'''Danny'''" '''Collins''' (born 6 August 1980) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest as a defender. Collins also plays for the Wales national football teamWales national team.
Collins started his career in the Welsh leagues with Mold Alexandra F.C.Mold Alexandra and Buckley Town F.C.Buckley Town before joining Chester City F.C.Chester City in 1996. His first two seasons at Chester saw him make 20 appearances, during the 2002–03 season he went on loan to non-league side Vauxhall Motors F.C.Vauxhall Motors. Following his return to Chester, Collins became a regular in the side and produced some fine performances which attracted the attention of Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland who brought him for £140,000. Collins spent five years in the North East EnglandNorth East making over 150 appearances and earning two promotions to the Premier League during that time. In August 2009 Collins joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for £2.75 million and played at left back for the "Potters". After losing his place in the squad he joined Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town on loan in September 2011 and then West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in March 2012. He signed for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in July 2012.
He has also been capped for England national football C teamEngland C on six occasions before being called up to the Wales national football teamWelsh national side.

Peter Fear.name: Peter Fear
Peter Fear.intro:
He is best remembered for his spell with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon. He signed for them as an apprentice on leaving school in July 1990 and turned professional for the 1992-93 in English football1992–93 season, when they were FA Premier League founder members. He made his debut against Norwich City F.C.Norwich City on 5 December 1992 when they lost 2–1 in the league at Carrow Road. A further three appearances followed that season, but he had far more chances in the 1993-94 in English football1993–94 campaign with 23 appearances and his first senior goal, as the Dons finished sixth—equalling their highest-ever league finish. The next two seasons brought limited first-team opportunities, but he had more chances of action in 1996-97 in English football1996–97, when he scored twice in 18 league games as the Dons finished eighth in the Premier League and were semi-finalists in both domestic cups. For much of the season, the Dons were in the top five of the Premier League and they were rarely more than a few points off the top of the table, so the failure to achieve UEFA Cup qualification was quite a disappointment, though the season was still a great success for a club of Wimbledon's stature.
Fear featured in a famous weekly comedy sketch in Match magazine''Match'' magazine, entitled "What if Peter Fear was?" the picture would then show the player in a humorous new job such as a vicar, or, most famously, as a potato.
Peter Fear's career highlight to date was scoring twice in the space of ten minutes, against Tottenham Hotspur in the 1997-98 in English football1997–98 season. Unfortunately for Fear, Wimbledon went on to lose the game 6–2, and Fear's goals counted merely as a consolation. They were the last goals he would score for the Dons, as he was back on the sidelines and managed just eight league games that season. He made the team just twice in 1998-99 in English football1998–99, before signing for Oxford United on a free transfer on 13 July 1999.
Oxford had just narrowly avoided bankruptcy when Fear joined them, and had been relegated to Division Two. He played 38 league games over two seasons, scoring three goals, helping them narrowly avoid a second successive relegation in 1999-2000 in English football1999–2000 but not being able to prevent relegation in 2000-01 in English football2000–01, when Oxford suffered 33 league defeats (the joint second worst ever of any Football League or Premier League club) and went down in bottom place. Fear then left the club.
On the edition broadcast on 23 August 2007, Peter was a contestant on the TV gameshow The Weakest Link. He was also a contestant on Ken Bruce's BBC Radio 2 'phone-in pop music quiz Popmaster on Thursday 13 May 2010 and again on Thursday 31 January 2013. During this last appearance, Peter informed the host that he was working as a cab driver.
There is a strong rumour that he has invested in his passion, gardening, and will be imminently opening a nursery near his home in Sutton, England.

Stefan Moore.name: Stefan Moore
Stefan Moore.intro:
'''Stefan Leroy Moore''' (born 28 September 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Solihull Moors F.C.Solihull Moors of the Conference North. He is a product of the Aston Villa Under-21s and AcademyAston Villa Academy where he came through the ranks with his younger brother, Luke Moore, who went on to play for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and other teams in the Premier League.
He started his career as a youth playing for Romulus F.C.Romulus before joining Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa's academy, Captain (association football)captaining them to win the FA Youth Cup in 2003. Moore played for Aston Villa in the Premier League, before going on loan spells to The Football LeagueFootball League clubs Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Millwall F.C.Millwall and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He then joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers where he played for three years, making 39 appearances in the League. He was loaned out to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 2006, before joining Walsall F.C.Walsall, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, Silhill 4th XI, and Halesowen Town F.C.Halesowen Town. He joined  St Neots Town F.C.St Neots Town in 2010, and helped the club to the United Counties League Premier Division title and Huntingdonshire Senior Cup in 2010–11 and Southern League Central Division title in 2011–12. He joined Leamington F.C.Leamington in December 2012, and was dual-registered with Brackley Town F.C.Brackley Town four months later. Leamington won the Southern Football LeagueSouthern League title in 2012–13. He joined Solihull Moors in December 2014.

Oleh Luzhny.name: Oleh Luzhny
Oleh Luzhny.intro: '''Oleh Romanovych Luzhny''' (, born 5 August 1968 in Lviv) is a retired UkraineUkrainian Association footballfootballer . His name is alternatively Romanization of UkrainianRomanised as '''Oleg Luzhny'''.
Oleh Luzhny.birth_place: Lviv,Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic|Ukrainian SSR,Soviet Union

Sami Hyypi\u00e4.name: Sami Hyypiä
Sami Hyypi\u00e4.intro:
'''Sami Tuomas Hyypiä''' (; born 7 October 1973) is a Finnish Association footballfootball Manager (association football)manager and former Defender (association football)defender. He last managed Football League Championship club Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion.
Hyypiä began his playing career with Ykkönen side Kuusankosken KumuKumu and soon moved to Veikkausliiga outfit MyPa. He spent four years at the club, helping them win the Finnish Cup in 1992 and 1995. He moved to Willem II Tilburg in 1995 and spent the next four years there. He became the team captain and was nominated their player of the year after helping them qualify for the UEFA Champions League.
In 1999 he moved to Liverpool, the team he supported as a child, in a deal worth £2.6 million. He quickly established himself in the first team, partnering Stéphane Henchoz in defence. By 2001, he regularly captained the team and that season Liverpool won a slew of honours, completing a cup treble of the Football League CupLeague Cup, FA Cup and UEFA Cup, in addition to winning the UEFA Super Cup and FA Community Shield. He became first choice captain in the 2001–02 FA Premier League2001–02 season and was part of the Football League Cup winning team in 2003. Steven Gerrard superseded him as captain in 2003 but Hyypiä still occasionally captained the side in his absence. Hyypiä won his highest football honour in 2005 as part of Liverpool's victorious 2004–05 UEFA Champions League2004–05 Champions League campaign, where his defensive partnership with Jamie Carragher helped them win in the final. During his ten years in Merseyside he became a fan favourite and remains a popular figure at the club. From 2009 to 2011 Hyypiä played for German Bundesliga side Bayer 04 Leverkusen, where he retired as a player in 2011.
Hyypiä was a prominent figure in the Finland national football teamFinland national team and was selected as the Finnish Sports' Journalists and Football Association Finnish Footballer of the YearPlayer of the Year numerous times. He made his debut in 1992 and, with 105 caps before retiring in 2010, is the country's second most capped Finnish player after Jari Litmanen.
From the 2012-13 season, he returned to Leverkusen as full team manager. After two successful seasons in the Bundesliga he returned to English football in 2014 for a brief spell as manager of second-tier club Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, from which he resigned in December 2014.

James Coppinger.name: James Coppinger
James Coppinger.intro: '''James Coppinger "Copps"''' (born 18 January 1981) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in Football League OneLeague One. He is in his 10th season at the club, and has become one of the handful to reach 400 first class appearances for Doncaster.

Terry Fleming.name: Terry Fleming
Terry Fleming.intro:
'''Terence "Terry" Fleming''' (born 5 January 1973) is an EnglandEnglish professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder, most recently for Sleaford Town F.C.Sleaford Town.
During Fleming's professional career he notably played for Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United having also had spells with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town and Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers before going to play for Non-League side's Moor Green F.C.Moor Green, Halesowen Town F.C.Halesowen Town and Grantham Town F.C.Grantham Town. In 2008 he joined Lincoln United F.C.Lincoln United and went on to manage the club from 2011 and 2013.

Carlo Nash.name: Carlo Nash
Carlo Nash.intro:
'''Carlo James Nash''' (born 13 September 1973) is a English former Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Nash started his career at non-League footballnon-League Rossendale United F.C.Rossendale United and Clitheroe F.C.Clitheroe before being signed by Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and then moved back north to Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. He then played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for whom he helped gain promotion to the Premier League and Everton F.C.Everton before re-joining Stoke in 2010. Throughout his career Nash has been used as a second and third choice keeper but did play regularly for Stockport and Preston.

Luciano Zavagno.name: Luciano Zavagno
Luciano Zavagno.intro: '''Luciano Germán Zavagno'''(born August 6, 1977 in Santa Fe, ArgentinaSanta Fe) is an ArgentinaArgentine retired football (soccer)footballer.

Andrew Taylor (footballer, born 1986).name: Andrew Taylor (footballer, born 1986)
Andrew Taylor (footballer, born 1986).intro: '''Andrew Derek Taylor''' (born 1 August 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He has previously played for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Watford F.C.Watford on loan.
Andrew Taylor (footballer, born 1986).position: Defender  association football  Left back,Midfielder Left midfielder

Colin Doyle.name: Colin Doyle
Colin Doyle.intro:
'''Colin Anthony Doyle''' (born 12 June 1985) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team. A Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, he made his debut in the Football League in April 2005 while on Loan (sports)loan to Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He has also had loan spells at Chester City F.C.Chester City, Millwall F.C.Millwall and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
At international level, Doyle has represented the Republic of Ireland at Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamunder-21, Republic of Ireland B national football teamB and senior levels. He made his full international debut in May 2007 against Ecuador national football teamEcuador.

Abdoulaye M\u00e9\u00eft\u00e9.name: Abdoulaye Méïté
Abdoulaye M\u00e9\u00eft\u00e9.intro: '''Abdoulaye Méïté''' (born 6 October 1980 in Paris) is a French-born Côte d'IvoireIvorian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Ross County F.C.Ross County. He represents Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire internationally and has been awarded 48 cap (football)caps.
Abdoulaye M\u00e9\u00eft\u00e9.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Mark Bosnich.name: Mark Bosnich
Mark Bosnich.intro: '''Mark Bosnich''' (born 13 January 1972) is an Australian former goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper and sports pundit. He played in England for Premier League clubs Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He also played in Australia for Sydney United FCSydney United, Central Coast Mariners F.C.Central Coast Mariners and Sydney Olympic FCSydney Olympic, as well as representing Australia national association football teamAustralia 17 times during his career, scoring 1 goal for his nation.

Colin Woodthorpe.name: Colin Woodthorpe
Colin Woodthorpe.intro: '''Colin Woodthorpe''' (born 13 January 1969 in Liverpool) is a veteran English association footballfootballer currently serving as assistant manager at A.F.C. FyldeAFC Fylde.

Karim Bagheri.name: Karim Bagheri
Karim Bagheri.intro: '''Karim Bagheri''' (, born 20 February 1974 in Tabriz, Iran) is a retired Iranian professional Association footballfootball player and coach. He played over half of his professional career for Persepolis F.C.Persepolis in the Iran Pro League. He was known as a two-footed midfielder and was famous for his powerful and thundering long range shots and free kicks.

Jimmy Willis.name: Jimmy Willis
Jimmy Willis.intro:
'''James Anthony "Jimmy" Willis''' (born 12 July 1968) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer, and manager who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1986 to 1997.
He notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, and in the Football League for Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Darlington F.C.Darlington and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. During his career he scored goals in all of the top five divisions of the English football league system. This was a record that Willis held until it was equalled in 2004, by then Liverpool F.C.Liverpool defender Steve Finnan. From 2001 to 2002 he was manager of Bamber Bridge F.C.Bamber Bridge.

Jordi G\u00f3mez.name: Jordi Gómez
Jordi G\u00f3mez.intro:
'''Jordi Gómez García-Penche''' (born 24 May 1985) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in England, mainly as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
After playing for the reserve teams of both FC BarcelonaBarcelona and RCD EspanyolEspanyol, he went on to spend the vast majority of his career in England, mainly with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.

Shefki Kuqi.name: Shefki Kuqi
Shefki Kuqi.intro:
'''Shefki Kuqi''' (pronounced ; born 10 November 1976) is a FinlandFinnish former professional association footballfootball player of AlbaniansAlbanian descent, and is currently the manager of FC Honka.
Kuqi played predominately as a Forward (association football)striker. He spent most of his career in the English football league system, for clubs including Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He made over 500 career league appearances, scoring almost 150 goals.
Kuqi also represented the Finland national football team at international level, with eight goals from sixty two appearances. His trademark goal celebration of bellyflopping onto the ground has led to his nickname of the "Flying Finn".

Mark Schwarzer.name: Mark Schwarzer
Mark Schwarzer.intro:
'''Mark Schwarzer''' Order of AustraliaOAM (born 6 October 1972) is an Australian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He represented Australia national association football teamAustralia at international level from 1993 to 2013, and was selected for both the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cups.
Having progressed through the youth ranks of Colo Cougars, Penrith Nepean United Football ClubPenrith, Blacktown Association and Marconi Stallions, he turned professional for National Soccer League side Marconi Stallions in 1990. After making 58 appearances for the club, he moved to Fußball-BundesligaBundesliga side Dynamo Dresden in 1994, appearing twice, and then to Bundesliga side 1. FC Kaiserslautern in 1995, appearing four times. Schwarzer joined then second tier side Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in 1996, and made sixteen appearances before joining Premier League side Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in February 1997. He made 445 appearances for Middlesbrough, but decided to leave the club in May 2008. He then switched to Premier League side Fulham F.C.Fulham, and made 218 appearances for the club until he  moved to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2013. He was the first, and, to date, only non-Briton to have made more than 500 Premier League appearances, and also the oldest player to have played in the knockout stages of the UEFA Champions League. He joined current club Leicester City on a free transfer in January 2015.
Having played for Australia national association football teamAustralia at Australia national under-17 football teamunder-17 and Australia national under-20 football teamunder-20 level, Schwarzer made his full international debut in a FIFA World Cup qualifying match against Canada national football teamCanada in 1993. During the course of his international career, he won a total of 109 cap (association football)caps for his country. He became Australia's most capped player when he surpassed Alex Tobin's appearance record in January 2011. In November 2013, Schwarzer announced his retirement from international football.

Arjen Robben.name: Arjen Robben
Arjen Robben.intro:
'''Arjen Robben''' (; born 23 January 1984) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays for German Bundesliga club FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich and the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team. Robben has appeared at the UEFA Euro 20042004, UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012 UEFA European Championships, and the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups. He is a forward (association football)forward who usually plays as a left or right sided Forward (association football)#Wingerwinger. Robben is known for his Dribbling#Association footballdribbling skills, speed, crossing ability and his accurate left foot long-range shots from the right wing.
Robben first came to prominence with FC GroningenGroningen, for whom he was player of the year for the 2001 in football (soccer)2000–01 Eredivisie season. Two years later he signed for PSV EindhovenPSV, where he became the Johan Cruijff AwardNetherlands' Young Player of the Year and won an Eredivisie title.cite news
title = UEFA Champions League – Players – Robben
url =
publisher = uefa.com
accessdate =3 August 2008
archiveurl =
archivedate = 9 September 2008 The following season Robben's signature was pursued by leading English clubs, and after protracted transfer negotiations he joined Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2004.
Robben's Chelsea debut was delayed through injury, but upon returning to fitness he helped Chelsea bring home two consecutive Premier League titles, and was the Premier League Player of the Month#2004–05FA Premier League Player of the Month in November 2005.cite news
title = Arjen Robben
url =
publisher = ChelseaFC.com
accessdate =3 August 2008
archiveurl =
archivedate = 16 June 2008cite news
title = FA Premier League Seasonal awards 2004/05
url =
publisher = Premierleague.com
accessdate =3 August 2008
archiveurl =
archivedate = 20 June 2007 After a third season in England which was punctuated by injury, Robben moved to Spanish club Real Madrid for Euro€35 million.
In August 2009, Robben transferred to Bayern Munich for a fee of around Euro€25 million, scoring two goals on his debut. In his first season in Munich, Bayern won the league title, Robben's fifth league title in eight years, and Robben scored the winning goal in the 2013 UEFA Champions League Final. After his first season with Bayern, Robben was also named Footballer of the Year in Germany.

Kevin Doyle.name: Kevin Doyle
Kevin Doyle.intro:
'''Kevin Edward Doyle''' (born 18 September 1983) is an Republic of Ireland national football teamIrish international Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. With his contract with Wolves expiring at the conclusion of the current season, Doyle has signed a pre-contract agreement to join the Major League Soccer club Colorado Rapids from 1 July 2015.
