He played for St Patrick's Athletic F.C.St Patrick's Athletic, and Cork City F.C.Cork City in his homeland before he moved to English side Reading F.C.Reading. He was part of Reading's record-breaking promotion to the Premier League in 2006. In June 2009, he moved to Wolverhampton Wanderers for a then-club record £6.5 million.
Doyle made his debut for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team in 2006. He has scored fourteen goals in 61 appearances for Ireland, and  played at UEFA Euro 2012.

Karl Henry.name: Karl Henry
Karl Henry.intro:
'''Karl Levi Daniel Henry''' (born 26 November 1982) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.
Henry was a product of the Stoke City F.C.Stoke City academy who went on to make over 120 appearances for the club, whilst having a brief loan spell at Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town in 2004. He joined Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2006 and went on to become captain of the side in the Premier League.

Claudio Pizarro.name: Claudio Pizarro
Claudio Pizarro.intro:
'''Claudio Miguel Pizarro Bosio''' (; born 3 October 1978) is a Peruvian peoplePeruvian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. He is known for his scoring ability and headers.
On 23 October 2010, Pizarro surpassed the 133 goals record previously reached by Giovane Élber, making him the top foreign scorer in German football history, when he scored with his team, SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen against Borussia Mönchengladbach. As of May 2014, Pizarro is the ninth highest goalscorer in the history of the Bundesliga with 176 goals.

Matt Jansen.name: Matt Jansen
Matt Jansen.intro:
'''Matthew Brooke "Matt" Jansen''' (born 20 October 1977) is an English association footballfootballer, who plays as a striker for Chorley F.C.Chorley.
He started his career with hometown club Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, and also played for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as well as a loan spell with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. A goalscorer in Blackburn's Football League CupLeague Cup in 2002 Football League Cup Final2002, his career declined after a near-fatal motorcycle accident later that year. He won six England national under 21 football teamEngland under-21 cap (sport)caps and was called up once to the England national football teamsenior national team.
After three years out of contract, Jansen went into non-league football with Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, Leigh Genesis, and is currently player-coach for Northern Premier League Premier Division side Chorley F.C.Chorley, where his former Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers team mate Garry Flitcroft is manager.

Lee Clark.name: Lee Clark
Lee Clark.intro:
'''Lee Robert Clark''' (born 27 October 1972) is an English association footballfootball manager and former player. He is the current manager of Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.
As a player, Clark had two spells at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, and was their reserve team manager and coach after he retired. He also played for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Fulham F.C.Fulham, and made 11 appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team. He was manager of Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town for three years and of Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for two.

Mathias Svensson.name: Mathias Svensson
Mathias Svensson.intro:
'''Mathias Svensson''' (born 24 September 1974 in Borås, Sweden) is a retired Swedish Football (soccer)footballer. He played as striker and his last team was IF Elfsborg, having spent much of his career in England. He won three full international caps for Sweden national football teamSweden during his career. He is currently assistant manager at Elfsborg.
Svensson began his career with Elfsborg, and was their top scorer when they won promotion to Allsvenskan in 1996. Following his success, he moved to England in the same year to play for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He then moved to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton, and had a spell on loan with Derby County F.C.Derby County before joining Norwich City F.C.Norwich in December 2003, making his debut for the Canaries in the East Anglian Derby against Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town at Portman Road.
Norwich paid an initial fee of £50,000 for Svensson, which rose to £300,000 when the Canaries won promotion at the end of that season. It took Svensson some time to find his form at Norwich and he came in for criticism from some City supporters. However, he began scoring goals towards the end of the season - including two in a 5-3 win at Burnley F.C.Burnley and a long range effort in a televised match against Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan - and ended the season with a first division championship medal as The Canaries won promotion to the Premiership.
Svensson scored 4 times in Norwich's premiership season of 2004-05, including two in a 3-2 win against Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Norwich were relegated at the end of the season and a clause in Svensson's contract allowed him to move to a top flight club in another country in the event that such a club showed interest to him. IF Elfsborg offered Norwich £100,000 for Svensson, and he returned to the club where he began his career.
After his return to Elfsborg Svensson played his first Allsvenskan game on 4 July 2005 against Kalmar FF, and he scored the only goal of the game. The 2006 in Swedish football2006 season was very successful for Svensson. He started all games and scored 6 goals, and at the end of the season he won the first title of his career, as Elfsborg were crowned Swedish champions. In 2008 he was forced to retire due to a knee injury. He has remained at Elfsborg, with various duties.

Moustapha Salifou.name: Moustapha Salifou
Moustapha Salifou.intro: '''Moustapha Salifou''' (born 1 June 1983) is a Togolese association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder in Germany for TSV 1860 Rosenheim, as well as the Togo national football team. Salifou is perhaps best known for representing Togo at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 FIFA World Cup and spending four years at EnglandEnglish Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.

Yoan Gouffran.name: Yoan Gouffran
Yoan Gouffran.intro: '''Yoan Gouffran''' (born 25 May 1986) is a French association footballfootballer[

Nwankwo Kanu.name: Nwankwo Kanu
Nwankwo Kanu.intro:
'''Nwankwo Kanu''', Order of the NigerOON (born 1 August 1976), or simply '''Kanu''', is a retired Nigerian association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He was a member of and later captained the Nigeria national football teamNigerian national team for 16 years from 1994 until 2010. Kanu is a member of the Igbo peopleIgbo ethnic group; his name, Nwankwo, means ''Child born on Nkwo market day'' in the Igbo language.[
Kanu has won a UEFA Champions League medal, a UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup medal, three FA Cup Winners Medals and two African Player of the Year awards amongst others. He is also one of few players to have won the Premier League, FA Cup, Champions League, UEFA Cup and an Olympic Gold Medal.  He made the third-most Substitute (association football)substitute appearances in Premier League history, appearing from the bench 118 times.[

Eggert J\u00f3nsson.name: Eggert Jónsson
Eggert J\u00f3nsson.intro:
'''Eggert Gunnþór Jónsson''' (born 18 August 1988) is an Icelandic Iceland national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who plays predominantly as a midfielder but is also capable of playing as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back or in both Defender (association football)#Full backfull back roles. He current  plays for the DenmarkDanish club FC Vestsjælland.
He joined Scottish Premier League side Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts as a teenager and eventually established himself in the first-team where he displayed his versatility and even went on to captain the Edinburgh side on numerous occasions before moving to the Premier LeagueEnglish Premier League in January 2012 when he signed for Wolves, with whom he made only seven appearances during an eighteen-month stay.
He made his international debut at the age of 19 and is considered to be part of Iceland national football teamIceland's golden generation along with the likes of Gylfi Sigurðsson and Kolbeinn Sigþórsson.

Ian Bryson.name: Ian Bryson
Ian Bryson.intro:
'''Ian Bryson''' (born 26 November 1962 in Kilmarnock) is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer.
He began his career at Hurlford United F.C.Hurlford United before moving to Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock, where he spent seven years making almost 200 appearances, mostly as a midfielder.
After moving to England, he spent the next 5 years of his career at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United with whom he was promoted to the old Football League First DivisionFirst Division. After a brief spell at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, he joined Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in 1993 on his 31st birthday, where he briefly played alongside a young David Beckham.
Bryson was appointed captain of the north west club. Although Preston lost the Football League Third DivisionThird Division playoff final 4-2 to Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Bryson himself scored with a spectacular overhead kick. Two years later he led them to the Third Division title, lifting the trophy at Deepdale in front of a capacity crowd. Bryson ended his professional league career at Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, later playing for Bamber Bridge F.C.Bamber Bridge.
However, he is still remembered with great affection at Preston, one of the founding members of the Football League, where he also spent time coaching youngsters at North End's academy. Ian still lives in Preston and still plays regularly for AC Sporting in the Preston area Veterans League.

Matt Holland.name: Matt Holland
Matt Holland.intro:
'''Matthew Rhys "Matt" Holland''' (born 11 April 1974) is a former professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a central midfielder. He began his career at West Ham United and subsequently joined AFC BournemouthBournemouth, before spending long spells at Ipswich Town and Charlton Athletic, where he retired in 2009.
He represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland from 1999 to 2006 at international level, earning 49 caps and scoring 5 goals. He was included in their squad for the 2002 FIFA World Cup.
Since ending his football career he has worked in the media, including with the BBC, Talksport and RTÉ.

Nigel Worthington.name: Nigel Worthington
Nigel Worthington.intro:
'''Nigel Worthington''' (born 4 November 1961) is a Northern Irish former professional Association footballfootballer who was most recently the Manager (association football)manager of York City F.C.York City.
He played a Defender (association football)defender and a midfielder, playing his club football for Ballymena United F.C.Ballymena United, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. With Sheffield Wednesday he won the Football League CupLeague Cup in 1991 Football League Cup Final1991. As an international player, he was Cap (sport)capped 66 times for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, and appeared for them at the 1986 FIFA World Cup.
Worthington began his managerial career as Player-coach#Player-managers in association footballplayer-manager of Blackpool in 1997 before he took over as manager of Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 2000. He guided Norwich to the Premier LeagueFA Premier League in the 2003–04 in English football2003–04 season as Football League First DivisionFirst Division title winners. He left just over two years afterwards, having failed to keep them in the top-flight in 2005. He was briefly caretaker manager of Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in 2007 prior to starting as manager of Northern Ireland, from which he stepped down in 2011.

Matty Appleby.name: Matty Appleby
Matty Appleby.intro: '''Matthew 'Matty' Wilfred Appleby''' (born April 16, 1972 in Middlesbrough) is a former EnglandEnglish association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder who retired in 2008. He played in the Premiership with Barnsley and had a distinguished spell at Darlington, before dropping into non-League and eventually leaving football to become a deep-sea diver.

Justin Channing.name: Justin Channing
Justin Channing.intro:
'''Justin Andrew Channing''' (born 19 November 1968 in Reading, Berkshire) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender or midfielder in the Football League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient.
Channing signed professional forms with QPR in August 1986 and made his debut in November that year against Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. He played 55 league games for QPR scoring 5 goals before transferring to Bristol Rovers in 1993 for a fee of £275,000, and later spent two seasons at Leyton Orient before moving into non-league football with Slough Town F.C.Slough Town.

Jody Morris.name: Jody Morris
Jody Morris.intro: '''Jody Steven Morris''' (born 22 December 1978) is an English former Association footballfootball midfielder. He has previously played for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Millwall F.C.Millwall and St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone.

Mikel Arteta.name: Mikel Arteta
Mikel Arteta.intro:
'''Mikel Arteta Amatriain''' (born 26 March 1982) is a Spanish professional association footballfootballer who plays for and Captain (association football)captains English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a midfielder.
Arteta started out as a trainee with FC Barcelona but could not break his way into the first team and was eventually loaned to Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain in the Ligue 1French league. He was then signed by Scottish Premier League club Rangers F.C.Rangers with whom he would win the Treble (association football)#Domestic Trebledomestic treble of the league, Scottish Cup and Scottish League CupLeague Cup in the season of 2002–03. After success in Scotland, Arteta moved back to Spain to play for Real Sociedad but failed to establish himself within the first team and was loaned to Everton F.C.Everton for the remainder of the 2004–05 season, prior to signing permanently in July 2005. He then made a permanent transfer to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 2011. He was appointed captain of the club in August 2014.
Arteta has represented Spain at Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, but he has not played for the Spain national football teamsenior national team.

Joe Allon.name: Joe Allon
Joe Allon.intro:
'''Joseph Ball''' "'''Joe'''" '''Allon''' (born 12 November 1966) is an English former Association footballfootballer. A Forward (association football)striker, he scored 112 goals in 300 league games in a 14-year career in the Football League.
Starting his career with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 1984, he failed to break into the first team and moved on to Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City three years later. After a season with the "Swans" he signed with Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United. After scoring 50 league goals for the club he transferred to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 1991. After a season with Chelsea, including a loan spell with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, he joined Brentford F.C.Brentford. In 1994 he moved back to Port Vale permanently, before moving back to Hartlepool United via Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in 1995. He retired in 1998. He won three promotions with three different clubs, and was voted onto the Fourth Division PFA Team of the Year in 1990–91 Football League1990–91.

Pepe Reina.name: Pepe Reina
Pepe Reina.intro:
'''José Manuel "Pepe" Reina Páez''' (; born 31 August 1982) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for German club FC Bayern Munich and the Spain national football teamSpain national team.
The son of famed FC Barcelona and Atlético Madrid goalkeeper Miguel Reina, Reina began his career with the Barcelona youth team and made his La Liga debut in the 2000–01 La Liga2000–01 season. He signed for Villarreal C.F.Villarreal in 2002, winning the UEFA Intertoto Cup twice. Reina moved on to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and made his debut in the 2005 UEFA Super Cup, which Liverpool won. He instantly became first-choice goalkeeper and went on to win both the FA Cup – where he saved three out of four West Ham United F.C.West Ham United Penalty shootout (association football)penalties in 2006 FA Cup Finalthe final – and the FA Community Shield. In 2007, he reached the 2007 UEFA Champions League FinalChampions League Final with Liverpool, matching the feat achieved by his father in 1974, but they lost to A.C. Milan.
Following eight consecutive seasons as Liverpool's first-choice keeper, Reina spent the 2013–14 season on loan at S.S.C. NapoliNapoli, where he was reunited with Rafa Benítez, the coach who signed him to play for Liverpool in 2005. During his loan tenure at the Italian club, Reina was part of the side that won the 2014 Coppa Italia Final2014 Coppa ItaliaItalian Cup and finished third in the domestic league.
At international level, Reina played for Spain's youth team, winning the UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship in 1999. He made his senior debut in 2005, and has generally been selected as the second-choice keeper behind Iker Casillas. He was part of the Spain squad for the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and made one appearance in their victorious Euro 20082008 European Championship campaign, earning him his first international honour. He was later part of the Spain squads that won their first ever 2010 FIFA World CupWorld Cup in 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and their third Euro 2012European Championship in Euro 20122012, as well as playing at the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup.
He is also the record holder for appearances by a Spanish player in the Premier League, with more than 200 appearances in just the first five seasons, 108 of the 219 appearances being clean sheets. In the 2010–11 season, he kept his 100th Premier League clean sheet for Liverpool, in a 3–0 win against Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.
Reina is well known for his distribution, and ability to save penalties. He has set a number of goalkeeping records for Liverpool and won the Barclays Golden GlovePremier League Golden Glove award for Clean sheetsclean sheets in his first three seasons at the club.

Ben Reeves.name: Ben Reeves
Ben Reeves.intro: '''Benjamin Neil Reeves''' (born 19 November 1991) is a Northern Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons as a midfielder.

Ben Turner.name: Ben Turner
Ben Turner.intro: '''Ben Howard Turner''' (born 21 January 1988) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City as a Defender (association football)defender.

Matt Mills.name: Matt Mills
Matt Mills.intro: '''Matthew Claude "Matt" Mills''' (born 14 July 1986) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as a defender (association football)defender. His younger brother Joseph Mills plays for Oldham Athletic, on loan from Burnley. He has also represented England national football teamEngland side's at various age levels. He is also a former player of Reading F.C.Reading and captain of Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.
Matt Mills.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Fernando Torres.name: Fernando Torres
Fernando Torres.intro:
'''Fernando José Torres Sanz''' (; born 20 March 1984) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Atlético Madrid, on loan from Italian club A.C. MilanMilan, and the Spain national football teamSpain national team as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Torres started his career with Atlético Madrid, progressing through their youth system to the first team squad. He made his first team debut in 2001 and finished his time at the club having scored 75 goals in 174 La Liga appearances. Prior to his La Liga debut, Torres played two seasons in the Segunda División for Atlético Madrid, making 40 appearances and scoring seven goals.
Torres joined Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2007, after signing for a club record transfer fee. He marked his first season at Anfield by being Liverpool's first player since Robbie Fowler in the 1995–96 in English football1995–96 season to score more than 20 league goals in a season. The most prolific goalscoring spell of his career, he became the fastest player in Liverpool history to score 50 league goals. He was named in the FIFPro World XIFIFA World XI in 2008 and 2009. Torres left the club in January 2011 to join Chelsea for List of most expensive association football transfersa British record transfer fee of £50 million, which made him the most expensive Spanish player in history. In his first full season at Chelsea, Torres won the FA Cup and the UEFA Champions League, despite receiving criticism for a comparatively low goal-scoring record. The following season he scored in the final of the 2012–13 UEFA Europa League, helping Chelsea to win the competition for the first time.
Torres is a Spain national football teamSpanish international and made his debut against Portugal national football teamPortugal in 2003. He has been List of footballers with 100 or more capscapped over 100 times and is his country's Spain national football team#Top goalscorersthird-highest goalscorer of all time. With Spain he has participated in six major tournaments; UEFA Euro 2004, the 2006 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2008, the 2010 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Spain won the three tournaments from 2008 to 2012, with Torres scoring in the finals of both UEFA Euro 2008 FinalEuro 2008 and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012.

Lee Morris.name: Lee Morris
Lee Morris.intro: '''Lee Morris''' (born 30 April 1980) is an English association footballfootballer. He is currently player/joint-manager of Loughborough Dynamo F.C.Loughborough Dynamo. He has previously played for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Derby County F.C.Derby County and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City among others.

Sam Aiston.name: Sam Aiston
Sam Aiston.intro: '''Samuel James''' "'''Sam'''" '''Aiston''' (born 21 November 1976) is an English retired professional footballer who played as a midfielder He made over 200 appearances in the Premier League and the The Football LeagueFootball League, particularly for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Chester City F.C.Chester City, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Wrexham F.C.Wrexham.

Ian Woan.name: Ian Woan
Ian Woan.intro: '''Ian Simon Woan''' (born 14 December 1967) is an English former Association footballfootballer and current assistant manager at Burnley F.C.Burnley. He played as a midfielder from 1985 until 2004, starting in non-league football. Signed by Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in 1990, he played for the club for 10 years, including a spell in the Premier League. After leaving the club he played for a number of sides, both in England and in the United States, before retiring in 2005. He is the son of Alan Woan who also played professionally, most notably for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Aldershot F.C.Aldershot.

Hakan \u00dcnsal.name: Hakan Ünsal
Hakan \u00dcnsal.intro:
'''Hakan Ünsal''' (born 14 May 1973) is a Turkish former Turkey national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer.
Hakan Ünsal is remembered by many for his rocket left foot and his pinpoint passing as well as his nonstop desire for victory. He played most of his career at Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray after joining from Karabükspor in 1993/94.  After being a part of the squad that won  the UEFA Cup in 2000, Hakan moved to Blackburn Rovers of the Premier LeagueEnglish Premiership in January 2002.  His return to Galatasaray was rapid as he was once again in Galatasaray colours for the 2002/03 season.  After leaving Galatasaray following the 2004/05 season, he had a brief stint with Çaykur Rizespor before retiring from football.
He played for Turkey national football team and was a participant at the 2002 FIFA World Cup where he collected his third place medal.
He is most famous for an incident during the World Cup when Brazil played Turkey.  Rivaldo was about to take a corner and Hakan kicked the ball at him as he was annoyed about the time Rivaldo was taking, delaying the game, as Brazil was winning 2-1. The ball hit Rivaldo on his legs but he collapsed dramatically holding his face and consequently Ünsal was sent off and Brazil went on to win the match. Rivaldo was fined, but the sanctions were criticized by many as being too lenient.
Ünsal is also remembered for his high level of sportsmanship on the field.
Hakan currently works as a pundit for Turkish sports show Altipas. And he also presents a TV show on NTV Spor called 100% Futbol.
Hakan \u00dcnsal.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Left wingback

Mark Bright.name: Mark Bright
Mark Bright.intro:
'''Mark Abraham Bright''' (born 6 June 1962) is an English peopleEnglish former Association footballfootballer who is now a sports pundit (expert)pundit on BBC TelevisionBBC, EurosportBritish Eurosport and Al Jazeera, as well as a coach at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
He made the move from non-league Leek Town F.C.Leek Town to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1981, where he remained for three years before he signed with Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. In 1986 he transferred to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, where he would score 92 league goals over the next six years. Joining Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 1992, he stayed with the club for five years before moving to Swiss side FC Sion in 1997, following a short loan stay at Millwall F.C.Millwall. He returned to England later in 1997 to play for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, before he announced his retirement in 1999. A Forward (association football)forward, he scored 167 goals in 463 league games throughout an 18-year career in the Football League. He played in one Football League CupLeague Cup and two FA Cup finals, all of which ended in defeat. He helped Crystal Palace and Charlton Athletic to win promotion to the top-flight via the play-offs.

Jeff Minton.name: Jeff Minton
Jeff Minton.intro:
'''Jeffrey Simon Thompson''' "'''Jeff'''" '''Minton''' (born 28 December 1973) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder. He scored 49 goals in 296 league and cup games in a ten-year career in the Football League.
He began his career at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, but only made two Premier League appearances before being allowed to join Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in July 1994. He made 199 appearances for the "Seagulls", and was voted onto the PFA Team of the Year (Football League Third DivisionThird Division) in 1998–99. He moved on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in June 1999, but did not establish himself in the first team. He was transferred to Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United in March 2001, and helped the "Millers" to win promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division, before signing with Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient in July 2001. He joined non-league Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic in August 2002, before quickly moving on to Canvey Island F.C.Canvey Island. He helped the "Gulls" to the Isthmian League title in 2003–04, following their second place finish in 2002–03, and also played in the 2004 FA Trophy Final. He moved onto Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City in August 2006, and helped his new side to the Isthmian League title in 2007–08. He signed with Welling United F.C.Welling United in July 2009, but left the club a month later. He joined amateur side Ware F.C.Ware in November 2012.

Igor Bi\u0161\u0107an.name: Igor Bišćan
Igor Bi\u0161\u0107an.intro: '''Igor Bišćan''' (; born 4 May 1978) is a retired Croatian professional football (soccer)footballer. He was a very versatile player and could play almost every position in the defence or midfield, but was featured most as a Midfielder (association football)#Central midieldercentral midfielder, or as a Defender (association football)#Centre-baccentral defender in his latter years. Bišćan played for GNK Dinamo ZagrebDinamo Zagreb, the English team Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Greek side Panathinaikos FCPanathinaikos and represented Croatia at the international level, debuting in UEFA Euro 2000 qualifying#Group 8UEFA Euro 2000 qualifying match against Macedonia national football teamMacedonia in Skopje on 13 June 1999.
Igor Bi\u0161\u0107an.birth_place: Zagreb,Socialist Republic of Croatia|SR Croatia,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Steve Haslam.name: Steve Haslam
Steve Haslam.intro: '''Steven Robert "Steve" Haslam''' (born 6 September 1979) is an English association footballfootballer for A.F.C. Fylde and academy coach at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.

Adam Hammill.name: Adam Hammill
Adam Hammill.intro:
'''Adam James Hammill''' (born 25 January 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger who plays for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, on loan from Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town.
At international level, Hammill has represented England national under-21 football teamEngland U21's, though he also qualifies to play for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level.
Hammill is a product of the Liverpool F.C.Liverpool academy, but failed to make a league appearance for the club at senior level, before leaving to join Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 2009. After a successful period at Barnsley, he entered the Premier League when he moved to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2011, with whom he remained until 2013.

Jlloyd Samuel.name: Jlloyd Samuel
Jlloyd Samuel.intro: '''Jlloyd Tafari Samuel''' (pronounced "Jay-Lloyd", born 29 March 1981) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender and midfielder for Paykan F.C.Paykan, while representing Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago at international level.[

Andy Keogh.name: Andy Keogh
Andy Keogh.intro:
'''Andrew Declan "Andy" Keogh''' (born 16 May 1986) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for A-League club Perth Glory FCPerth Glory.
Keogh began his professional career at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United but failed to break into their first team. Instead, he made his mark during a loan spell at Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United which was later made into a permanent deal. His goalscoring partnership with Billy Sharp caught the attentions of Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers to whom he moved in 2007.
As a Wolves player he helped the club to promotion to the Premier League in 2009, but failed to make a strong impact in the top flight. Instead, he spent several seasons on loan at various lower league clubs before moving to Millwall F.C.Millwall in 2012.
After two and a half seasons with Millwall, Keogh was sent out loan to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool for the remainder of the 2013–14 season. He was released by Millwall at the end of that season, and joined Australian side Perth Glory FCPerth Glory in May 2014.

Bj\u00f8rn Tore Kvarme.name: Bjørn Tore Kvarme
Bj\u00f8rn Tore Kvarme.intro:
'''Bjørn Tore Kvarme''' (born 17 June 1972 in Trondheim) is a NorwayNorwegian former Football (soccer)football defender.
Kvarme first signed with Rosenborg in 1991, transferring from Utleira, a local club. He played six seasons, winning the Norwegian Premier LeagueTippeliga five times. In the fall of 1996 Kvarme was on his way to sign for Stabæk FotballStabæk, but Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool outbid the Norwegian club.
Bjørn Tore Kvarme announced that he would retire after the 2007 season.  Stating injuries and lack of playing time as the main reasons for retiring, he did however agree to take another year with Rosenborg BKRosenborg. Kvarme retired in June 2008, mid-season.

L\u00e1rus Sigur\u00f0sson.name: Lárus Sigurðsson
L\u00e1rus Sigur\u00f0sson.intro: '''Lárus Orri Sigurðsson''' (born 4 June 1973), known in English as ''Larus Sigurdsson'', is an Icelandic former professional Association footballfootballer, who played most notably for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in England. He is currently the manager of Icelandic team Knattspyrnufélag FjallabyggðarKF.

Dave Watson.name: Dave Watson
Dave Watson.intro:
'''David "Dave" Watson''' (born 20 November 1961 in Liverpool, Merseyside) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer and Youth Team Coach at Premier League side Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1980 to 2001. He played his entire career for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Everton F.C.Everton. He also made 12 appearances for the England national football teamEnglish national team.

Mark Blake (footballer, born 1970).name: Mark Blake (footballer, born 1970)
Mark Blake (footballer, born 1970).intro: '''Mark Anthony Blake''' (born 16 December 1970 in Nottingham, England) is a former EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who played in Midfieldermidfield for seven clubs.

Lloyd Dyer.name: Lloyd Dyer
Lloyd Dyer.intro:
'''Lloyd Richard Dyer''' (born 13 September 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City on loan from Watford F.C.Watford.
Dyer began his senior career with West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, and had loan spells with Kidderminster Harriers, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Queens Park Rangers before joining Millwall F.C.Millwall. After half a season, he moved on to Milton Keynes Dons, where he spent two years. In 2008, he signed for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, where he played for six seasons, and joined Watford in 2014.

Mark Burchill.name: Mark Burchill
Mark Burchill.intro: '''Mark James Burchill''' (born 18 August 1980) is a Scottish peopleScottish professional Association footballfootballer, currently playing as a Forward (association football)striker for Livingston F.C.Livingston in the Scottish Championship. Burchill also holds the position of head coach at the club. He previously played for Scottish clubs Celtic F.C.Celtic, Dundee F.C.Dundee, Hearts F.C.Hearts, Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic and Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock, and in England for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United. He has been cap (sport)capped six times for the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.

Jared Borgetti.name: Jared Borgetti
Jared Borgetti.intro:
'''Jared Francisco Borgetti Echavarría''' (Spanish ; born 14 August 1973) is a retired Mexican peopleMexican Association footballfootballer.
Borgetti is the all-time leading goal scorer for the Mexico national football teamSelección de fútbol de México (Mexico national team), with 46 goals. A prolific goal scorer at club and national levels, Borgetti was renowned for his heading ability. He is popularly known by the nickname of ''El Zorro del Desierto'' ("The Desert Fox") in reference to his debut professional team and his birthplace. He is currently an analyst for ESPN Deportes and ESPN Latin America for football matches and the show Fútbol.

Shane Long.name: Shane Long
Shane Long.intro:
'''Shane Patrick Long''' (born 22 January 1987) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Southampton F.C.Southampton and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He is known as "a powerful, no-nonsense striker." He also played hurling for Tipperary GAATipperary in his early career.
Long began his football career at Cork City F.C.Cork City. He later moved to Reading F.C.Reading where, among other achievements, he scored three goals in ten substitute appearances during his team's Football League ChampionshipChampionship-winning 2005–06 in English football2005–06 campaign, guided his team into the Fourth round of the FA Cup by defeating Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in a third round replay match in 2010, and later won a player of the season award. He signed for Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in 2011 for a fee of £6 million, and joined Hull City A.F.C.Hull City in January 2014 then Southampton in August 2014.
He made his senior debut for the Republic of Ireland in 2007, and has since earned over 50 international caps. Long represented the nation at UEFA Euro 2012.

Eldin Jakupovi\u0107.name: Eldin Jakupović
Eldin Jakupovi\u0107.intro:
'''Eldin Jakupović''' (born 2 October 1984) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City in the Premier League.
He started his professional career at Grasshopper Club ZürichGrasshopper in 2004, then moved to FC Thun a year later. After success there, Jakupović joined FC Lokomotiv Moscow in March 2006. In September 2011, he joined Aris F.C. (Thessaloniki)Aris, and in 2012 moved to Hull.
Having played at under-21 level for both Bosnia and Switzerland, he earned his only senior cap for the latter in 2008, and was part of their squad at UEFA Euro 2008.
Eldin Jakupovi\u0107.birth_place: Prijedor,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Jos\u00e9 Enrique.name: José Enrique
Jos\u00e9 Enrique.intro: '''José Enrique Sánchez Díaz''' (; born 23 January 1986), known as '''José Enrique''', is a Spanish footballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool.
Jos\u00e9 Enrique.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Liam Rosenior.name: Liam Rosenior
Liam Rosenior.intro: '''Liam James Rosenior''' (born 9 July 1984) is an English peopleEnglish footballer who plays for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a defender (association football)defender. He is the son of former Brentford F.C.Brentford manager Leroy Rosenior, and spent time on loan at Torquay United F.C.Torquay United, where his father was manager, during their promotion season (2003–04 in English football2003–04).Her Mother is From Sierra Leone and Her Father is English.

Paul Ifill.name: Paul Ifill
Paul Ifill.intro: '''Paul Everton Ifill''' (born 20 October 1979) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Team Wellington in the New Zealand ASB Premiership.  Born in Brighton, England, Ifill was in part of Watford F.C.Watford's youth programme but was not offered a professional contract and moved to non-league Saltdean United F.C.Saltdean United.  From there he was spotted by Millwall F.C.Millwall where he spent nearly seven years before being signed by Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 2005.  After two season with the Blades he transferred to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace where he spent a further two seasons, before moving to New Zealand to play for Wellington Phoenix in the A-League.  Ifill has also made ten appearances for Barbados national football teamBarbados, scoring six goals.

Keith Scott.name: Keith Scott
Keith Scott.intro:
'''Keith James Scott''' (born 9 June 1967) is a former professional footballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.
Scott had a nomadic career playing for no less than 21 different teams. He played professional football with Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Watford F.C.Watford, Reading F.C.Reading and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United.

M\u00e1rio Jardel.name: Mário Jardel
M\u00e1rio Jardel.intro:
'''Mário Jardel de Almeida Ribeiro''' (; born 18 September 1973) is a retired Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer. Jardel was most noted for his positioning on the field and his heading ability. He was a legend for Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto AlegrenseGrêmio, playing a major part in the squad that won the Copa Libertadores da América1995 Copa Libertadores.
With his exceptional positioning ability, he was able to become one of Europe's most prolific strikers during his time at F.C. PortoFC Porto, Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray, and Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting CP, scoring 266 goals in 274 games for those clubs.
After leaving Sporting in 2003, at 29 years old, Jardel had a succession of brief and unsuccessful stints at clubs in England, Italy, Spain, Cyprus, Bulgaria, Argentina and Australia. He then played several smaller clubs in Brazil before retiring in 2011.
Jardel made his debut for the Brazil national football team in 1996, making a total of 10 appearances and being selected for the 2001 Copa America.

Tony Adams.name: Tony Adams
Tony Adams.intro:
'''Tony Alexander Adams''', Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 10 October 1966) is an English Association footballfootball manager and former Arsenal player.
Adams spent his One club manentire playing career of 22 years as a Defender (association football)defender at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.cite news
url        =
title      = A night out for the Adams family
work       = The Guardian
date       = 14 May 2002
accessdate = 2008-10-28  first=Jon  last=Brodkin  location=London He is considered one of the greatest Arsenal players of all time by the club's own fans  and was included in the Football League 100 Legends. With Arsenal, he won four top flight division titles, three FA Cups, two Football League Cups, a UEFA Cup Winners' Cup, and three FA Community Shields. A statue honouring Adams was unveiled at Emirates stadium on 9 December 2011, along with statues of Thierry Henry and Herbert Chapman.
When his playing career finished Adams went into football management, spending periods in charge of Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Azerbaijan side Gabala FKGabala.

Richard Walker (footballer, born 1977).name: Richard Walker (footballer, born 1977)
Richard Walker (footballer, born 1977).intro: '''Richard Martin Walker''' (born 8 November 1977 in Birmingham) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Devon and Exeter Premier side Beer Albion FC.

Dean Gordon.name: Dean Gordon
Dean Gordon.intro:
'''Dean Dwight Gordon''' (born 10 February 1973) is a former English professional association footballfootballer who played in the Defender (football)position of left back between 1991 and 2009 in his native England as well as Cyprus and New Zealand. He notably played Premier League football for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, having also had spells as a professional with Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Reading F.C.Reading, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, APOEL Nicosia, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Albany United, New Zealand Knights, Auckland City and Torquay United F.C.Torquay United. Gordon also spent time playing in the English Non-League system with Worksop Town F.C.Worksop Town, Crook Town F.C.Crook Town, Lewes F.C.Lewes, Whitby Town F.C.Whitby Town, Ilkeston Town F.C.Ilkeston Town, Glapwell F.C.Glapwell, Workington A.F.C.Workington and Thornaby F.C.Thornaby.
Gordon, who was born in Croydon, South London, is an example of a journeyman footballer having represented 20 different clubs during an 18-year career, but despite this he had only played for two clubs in his first ten years in the game but spent his latter years playing for numerous clubs.

Euzebiusz Smolarek.name: Euzebiusz Smolarek
Euzebiusz Smolarek.intro: '''Euzebiusz "Ebi" Smolarek''' (; born 9 January 1981 in Łódź) is a former Polish Association footballfootballer who is currently a Feyenoord Youth manager. He has played 47 times for the Poland national football teamPolish national football team. Smolarek plays primarily as a Forward (association football)striker or midfielderwinger.
Euzebiusz Smolarek.position: Forward  association football  Striker,Midfielder Winger Winger

Russell Watkinson.name: Russell Watkinson
Russell Watkinson.intro:
'''Russell Watkinson''' (born 3 December 1977) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football midfielder (football)midfielder. Whilst at Southampton, Watkinson made two substitute appearances in the Premier League in games against Tottenham Hotspurcite web
url=
title=The Neilson touch sinks Southampton
publisher=The Independent
date=16 September 1996 accessdate=21 September 2012 and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.cite web
url=
title=Saint Le Tissier at beatific best
publisher=The Independent
date=30 September 1996 accessdate=21 September 2012

John Salako.name: John Salako
John Salako.intro:
'''John Akin Salako''' (born 11 February 1969) is a Nigerian-born EnglandEnglish former professional football (soccer)footballer, sports television pundit and U16 coach of Premier League side Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
He played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1986 until 2005, he notably played in the Premier League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, in the Football League for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Reading F.C.Reading and Brentford F.C.Brentford. He represented English national football teamEngland at senior level, earning five caps, all during 1991 while he was a Crystal Palace player.[

Nabil Bentaleb.name: Nabil Bentaleb
Nabil Bentaleb.intro: '''Nabil Bentaleb''' (born 24 November 1994) is an Algerian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the Algeria national football teamAlgeria national team.

Andrew Robertson.name: Andrew Robertson
Andrew Robertson.intro: '''Andrew "Andy" Robertson''' (born 11 March 1994) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Scotland national football team. Robertson began his senior career with Queen's Park F.C.Queen's Park in 2012 before joining Dundee United F.C.Dundee United a year later. His form in his first season as a professional led to him being named SPFA Young Player of the Year and also making his international debut. He joined Hull in July 2014 for a fee of £2.85 million.
Andrew Robertson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Jordon Mutch.name: Jordon Mutch
Jordon Mutch.intro:
'''Jordon James Edward Sydney Mutch''' (born 2 December 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
Mutch joined Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2007 from Derby County F.C.Derby County's youth system. He made his competitive debut for the club in the Football League CupLeague Cup in August 2008, and his first appearance in the Football League while on loan to Hereford United the following year. He also spent loan spells in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship with Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Watford F.C.Watford, and became a first-team regular for Birmingham, before leaving for Cardiff City in 2012. Mutch contributed to Cardiff's promotion to the Premier League in his first season, and after their relegation in 2014 he returned to the Premier League with Queens Park Rangers. Unable to establish himself in their first team, he signed for Crystal Palace in January 2015.
He has represented his country at levels from England national under-17 football teamunder-17 to England national under-21 football teamunder-21.

Andrey Arshavin.name: Andrey Arshavin
Andrey Arshavin.intro:
'''Andrey Sergeyevich Arshavin''' ( ; born 29 May 1981) is a Russian professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for FC Zenit Saint Petersburg in the Russian Premier League. Arshavin is an Captain (association football)ex-captain of the Russia national football teamRussian national team.
Arshavin began his career at FC Zenit Saint PetersburgZenit in the year 2000. He won numerous trophies with the club until his departure in 2009 including the Russian Premier League, Russian Premier League Cup, Russian Super Cup, UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup and the UEFA Super Cup. During his time with Zenit, Arshavin was named Footballer of the Year in Russia (Futbol)Russian Footballer of the Year.
In 2009, Arshavin signed for the English Premier League club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, becoming the most expensive player in Arsenal's history at that time with a fee of £15 million (since surpassed by Mesut Özil). Arshavin returned to FC Zenit Saint PetersburgZenit on 24 February 2012 for a loan deal that concluded in July 2012, and returned permanently on a free transfer in June 2013.
Andrey Arshavin.position: Forward  association football  Second striker Second striker

John Ebbrell.name: John Ebbrell
John Ebbrell.intro:
'''John Keith Ebbrell''' (born 1 October 1969 in Bromborough, Cheshire) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who is currently the Centre of Excellence manager at Football League Two side Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1986 until 1999. After playing the majority of his career with Everton F.C.Everton, which included seasons spent in the Premier League and an FA Cup winners medal in 1995, he ended his career with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United.

Cauley Woodrow.name: Cauley Woodrow
Cauley Woodrow.intro:
'''Cauley Woodrow''' (born 2 December 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham as a Forward (association football)forward. He made his debut in the the Football LeagueFootball League for Southend United F.C.Southend United in September 2013.
Woodrow previously played for Conference Premier club Luton Town, for whom he made three appearances in the FA Trophy as a 16-year-old. While a Luton player in 2011, he became the first non-League footballer to be cap (sports)capped at youth level for England since the 1970s.

Calum Willock.name: Calum Willock
Calum Willock.intro:
'''Calum Daniel Willock''' (born 29 October 1981) is an EnglandEnglish-born Saint Kitts and NevisSaint Kittitian and Nevisian international Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Conference South club Staines Town F.C.Staines Town.
Beginning his career with Fulham F.C.Fulham in 2000, he enjoyed loan spells with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, before switching permanently to Peterborough in 2003. In 2006 he signed with Brentford F.C.Brentford, moving to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in summer 2007. He switched to Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough in January 2008, before joining Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town the following year. He played on loan at Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United 2010, before transferring to Ebbsfleet United F.C.Ebbsfleet United later in the year. He helped the club to win promotion out of the Conference South in 2011, before he returned to the division when he signed with Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic in June 2012. He joined Boreham Wood F.C.Boreham Wood in July 2013 and was dual registered with Harrow Borough F.C.Harrow Borough before he joined Staines Town in January 2014. In his career he has played in each of the top six levels of English football.

Roy O'Donovan.name: Roy O'Donovan
Roy O'Donovan.intro: '''Roy Simon O'Donovan''' (born 10 August 1985) is an Irish association footballfootballer who plays for Mitra Kukar F.C. in the Indonesia Super League. He has been capped by Ireland at Under-19, Under-21 and B level. O'Donovan has previously played for Cork City F.C.Cork City, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, and Brunei DPMM FCDPMM FC.

Jeff Whitley.name: Jeff Whitley
Jeff Whitley.intro: '''Jeffrey''' "'''Jeff'''" '''Whitley''' (born 28 January 1979 in Ndola, Copperbelt Province) is a Zambian-born Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former professional Association footballfootball player. He twice won promotion to the Premier LeaguePremiership with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2000 and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2005 and was an Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international. His brother, Jim WhitleyJim was also a professional footballer.

David Healy.name: David Healy
David Healy.intro:
'''David Jonathan Healy''', Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 5 August 1979) is a retired Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. He is the all-time leading scorer for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland with 36 goals, and also holds the record for the highest scoring tally during a UEFA European Football ChampionshipUEFA European Championship qualifying campaign with 13.
He began his career as a youth player at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 1995, turning professional in 1999, but signed for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End two years later after a short loan spell. He spent three years with Preston, maintaining a healthy goals to games ratio, before transferring to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in 2004. After three years to Leeds he moved on to Fulham F.C.Fulham for a season, before settling at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2008. He moved north to Scotland to play for Rangers F.C.Rangers in January 2011. He helped the club to the Scottish Premier LeagueSPL title in 2010–11 and also played in the 2011 Scottish League Cup Final2011 Scottish League CupLeague Cup final victory, before departing when the club entered liquidation towards the end of the 2011–12 season. He joined Bury F.C.Bury for a one-season spell in August 2012. In addition to these clubs he has also played for Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers on loan. He was released by Bury in May 2013, and chose to retire in November 2013 after failing to find a club.
Before representing his country at a senior level, he also played for both the Northern Ireland national under-21 football teamU21 team and the Northern Ireland B national football teamB team.

Maurice Edu.name: Maurice Edu
Maurice Edu.intro:
'''Edu Maurice Edu, Jr.''' (born April 18, 1986) is an American Association footballsoccer player who plays for the Philadelphia Union and at one time played sporadically for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.
A highly-touted prospect, Edu was the first overall pick in the 2007 MLS SuperDraft and won the MLS Rookie of the Year Award with Toronto FC. His performances for Toronto earned him international call ups to the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team and the attentions of clubs in Europe. He signed with Scottish powers Rangers F.C.Rangers, winning the Scottish Premier League three times. Following Rangers' financial problems, he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City; however, failing to make an impact, he spent time on loan with Turkey's Bursaspor before returning to MLS with Philadelphia.
Maurice Edu.position: Central Midfielder Midfielder,Defender  association football  Defender

Faustino Asprilla.name: Faustino Asprilla
Faustino Asprilla.intro:
'''Faustino Hernán "Tino" Asprilla Hinestroza''' (born 10 November 1969 in Tuluá) is a former Colombian football (soccer)football player who most notably played for Parma A.C., Newcastle United F.C. and the Colombia national football team as a Forward (association football)forward. Though never a prolific goalscorer, he was known for his skill and pace, as well as for being temperamental and controversial both on and off the field.
Asprilla was known by his supporters in his home country as ''The Octopus'' for his voracious appetite.[

Antonio Luna.name: Antonio Luna
Antonio Luna.intro: '''Antonio Manuel Luna Rodríguez''' (born 17 March 1991) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club Spezia CalcioSpezia on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
Antonio Luna.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Jos\u00e9 Campa\u00f1a.name: José Campaña
Jos\u00e9 Campa\u00f1a.intro: '''José Ángel Gómez Campaña''' (; born 31 May 1993) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for F.C. Porto on loan from U. C. Sampdoria in Italy as a midfielder.

Bj\u00f8rn Otto Bragstad.name: Bjørn Otto Bragstad
Bj\u00f8rn Otto Bragstad.intro: '''Bjørn Otto Bragstad''' (born 5 January 1971) is a former football defender from Norway.

Brynjar Gunnarsson.name: Brynjar Gunnarsson
Brynjar Gunnarsson.intro: '''Brynjar Björn Gunnarsson''' (born 16 October 1975) is an Icelandic former Association footballfootballer who last played for Knattspyrnufélag ReykjavíkurKR as a midfielder. Brynjar had previously played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Watford F.C.Watford and Reading F.C.Reading in England as well as Vålerenga IF FotballVålerenga and Moss FKMoss in Norway and Örgryte IS in Sweden.

Michael Branch.name: Michael Branch
Michael Branch.intro:
'''Paul Michael Branch''' (born 18 October 1978) known as '''Michael Branch''' is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a striker (association football)striker from 1995 to 2010.
He notably played Premier League football for Everton F.C.Everton after coming through the club's youth academy, also playing for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 side where he earned one cap. He went on to play in the Football League with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Reading F.C.Reading, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Chester City F.C.Chester City before finishing his career in Non-league football with Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town and Burscough F.C.Burscough.
On 9 November 2012 he was jailed for seven years for serious drug offences.

Craig Dawson.name: Craig Dawson
Craig Dawson.intro: '''Craig Dawson''' (born 6 May 1990) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a defender (association football)defender. He previously played for Radcliffe Borough F.C.Radcliffe Borough, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale.

Fabian de Freitas.name: Fabian de Freitas
Fabian de Freitas.intro:
'''Fabian de Freitas''' (born 28 July 1972 in Paramaribo, Suriname) is a former Surinamese-NetherlandsDutch football (soccer)footballer who plays as a striker. De Freitas played in England with Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and in Spain with CA Osasuna.
Fabian de Freitas is probably best known for his late goals in the 1995 Division 1 Play-off final between Bolton Wanderers and Reading at Wembley which finished 4-3 to Bolton.Wanderers found themselves 2-0 down (although goalkeeper Keith Branagan saved a penalty in the first half to prevent Reading going 3-0 up) with 15 minutes to go before Owen Coyle pulled one back.  De Freitas' goal in the 86th minute forced the game into extra-time, before Mixu Paatelainen headed Bolton in the lead. De Freitas then added the winner, firing in from close-range, with a minute to go, promoting Bolton to the Premier League, though Reading responded with a last gasp consolation goal which made the scoreline 4-3.
He made his Albion debut on 22 August 1998 in a 3-0 away win at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale; in the 87th minute he replaced Lee Hughes, who had scored a hat-trick in the game.
He missed a home match against Crewe Alexandra on 5 April 1999 which West Bromwich Albion lost 5-1 due to a misunderstanding over the fact he thought the game was an evening kick-off.The club got through to him by phone at 2.20 PM and he arrived at The Hawthorns just before the 3.00 PM kick-off and by then the team sheet had already been handed in.

George Boateng.name: George Boateng
George Boateng.intro: '''George Boateng''' (born 5 September 1975) is a former Dutch Association footballfootballer who is of Ghanaian descent. He is currently the technical director of Kelantan FA playing in Malaysia Super League.

Tom Thorpe.name: Tom Thorpe
Tom Thorpe.intro:
'''Thomas Joseph "Tom" Thorpe''' (born 13 January 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)centre-back for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United.
A product of the youth academy of Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Thorpe was loaned out to Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2014. He was called into the Manchester United first team in September 2014 and made his Premier League debut shortly after. He has represented England at all youth levels from England national under-16 football teamEngland U16 to England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 winning the 2010 UEFA European Under-17 Championship.

Lucas Leiva.name: Lucas Leiva
Lucas Leiva.intro: '''Lucas Pezzini Leiva''' (born 9 January 1987), known as '''Lucas''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielderdefensive midfielder for Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team. Lucas is the nephew of former Brazilian footballer Leivinha and also holds an Italian passport due to his descent from the country.

Paul Moran (English footballer).name: Paul Moran (English footballer)
Paul Moran (English footballer).intro: '''Paul Moran''' (born 23 May 1968) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball striker (football)forward.

Steve McMahon.name: Steve McMahon
Steve McMahon.intro:
'''Stephen Joseph "Steve" McMahon''' (born 20 August 1961) is an  EnglandEnglish former professional Football (soccer)footballer, manager and sports television pundit.
As a player he was a midfielder from 1979 to 1998, most notably played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the late 1980s. McMahon was placed in 42nd position in the 100 Players Who Shook The Kop poll, which asked Red supporters to name the best 100 players of all time.  He also played for Everton F.C.Everton, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. After his playing career ended, he began his coaching and managing career with the Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, and later managed Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, winning a promotion with both of these clubs. He later had a brief spell as manager of Perth Glory in Australia.
He was last seen as a football pundit for the Asia-based sports broadcaster ESPN Star Sports.[

Jonathan Parr.name: Jonathan Parr
Jonathan Parr.intro:
'''Jonathan Parr''' (born 21 October 1988) is a NorwayNorwegian association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)full back for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He made his debut for the Norway national football teamNorwegian national team in 2010.
Hailing from Oslo, Parr started his professional career with the local team FK LynLyn, where he made his debut in Tippeligaen. He then transferred to Aalesunds FKAalesund in 2007, where he was a part of the team that won the Norwegian Cup in both 2009 Norwegian Football Cup2009 and 2011 Norwegian Football Cup2011. Parr transferred to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Crystal Palace in July 2011 and was a part of the team that won promotion to the Premier League in the 2012–13 Football League Championship2012–13 season.

Ga\u00ebl Bigirimana.name: Gaël Bigirimana
Ga\u00ebl Bigirimana.intro:
'''Gaël Bigirimana''' (; born 22 October 1993) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Rangers F.C.Rangers on loan from Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
Born in Burundi, Bigirimana moved to the United Kingdom with his family as a refugee in 2004 and chose to represent England at England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level in 2013.

Nico Vaesen.name: Nico Vaesen
Nico Vaesen.intro: '''Nico-Jos Theodoor Vaesen''' (born 28 September 1969) is a Belgian former association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He retired from football shortly after joining K. Lierse S.K.Lierse, but returned to the game in 2008 with K.F.C. Verbroedering Geel for one season where his contract wasn't renewed.

Yossi Benayoun.name: Yossi Benayoun
Yossi Benayoun.intro:
'''Yosef Shai "Yossi" Benayoun''' (, born 5 May 1980) is an Israeli peopleIsraeli professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Israeli club Maccabi Haifa F.C.Maccabi Haifa and captains the Israel national football teamIsraeli national team. He plays as an attacking midfielder, often occupying the space just behind the striker. Born in Dimona, he is sometimes nicknamed "The Diamond from Dimona" in Israel.
Benayoun played for Hapoel Be'er Sheva F.C.Hapoel Be'er Sheva and Maccabi Haifa before moving to Racing de Santander in Spain. Three years later he moved to the Premier League with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, and later Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. In 2010, he signed for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, where he was used rarely, being loaned to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and back to West Ham, but nonetheless won the 2012–13 UEFA Europa League. After that, he was released by the club and spent a season in the Football League Championship with Queens Park Rangers before returning to Maccabi Haifa.
A full international since 1998, Benayoun is Israel's most capped player of all time with 96 caps, and their joint second top scorer with 24 international goals.

Franck Songo'o.name: Franck Songo'o
Franck Songo'o.intro: '''Franck Steve Songo'o''' (born 14 May 1987) is a Cameroonian Association footballfootballer. His senior career has been spent primarily in the English football league systemEnglish and Spanish football league systemSpanish football league systems, and has also been Cap (sport)capped for the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team.

Kieran Agard.name: Kieran Agard
Kieran Agard.intro: '''Kieran Ricardo Agard''' (born 10 October 1989) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City as a Forward (association football)forward or a Midfielder (association football)#Wingerwinger.

Sylvain Wiltord.name: Sylvain Wiltord
Sylvain Wiltord.intro:
'''Sylvain Wiltord''' (born 10 May 1974) is a French former footballer who played as a winger.
Highlights of his club career included his four-season spell at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, with whom he won two Premier League titles and two FA Cups. He also won the Ligue 1 title in each of his three subsequent seasons at Olympique LyonnaisLyon.
With the France national football teamFrench national team, Wiltord  earned 92 caps and scored 26 goals. He  played at the 1996 Olympics, two World Cups and two European Championships. Wiltord was part of their teams which  won 2000 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 and reached the final of the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Nicky Shorey.name: Nicky Shorey
Nicky Shorey.intro: '''Nicholas Robert "Nicky" Shorey''' (born 19 February 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Football League TwoLeague Two side Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. Shorey now plays as a defensive midfielder as well as a left back. He is also known for his pace and is a known set piece specialist.

Elliott Bennett.name: Elliott Bennett
Elliott Bennett.intro: '''Elliott Bennett''' (born 18 December 1988) is an English-born Jamaican professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He is the elder brother of footballer Kyle Bennett (footballer)Kyle Bennett and a cousin of Jake Bennett who plays for AFC Telford United.

Benny Feilhaber.name: Benny Feilhaber
Benny Feilhaber.intro: '''Benny Feilhaber''' (; born January 19, 1985) is an American professional Association footballsoccer player who plays for Sporting Kansas City in Major League Soccer as a midfielder.

Kaspars Gork\u0161s.name: Kaspars Gorkšs
Kaspars Gork\u0161s.intro:
'''Kaspars Gorkšs''' (born 6 November 1981) is a Latvian professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Ergotelis F.C.Ergotelis in the Superleague Greece. Gorkšs is also the current captain of Latvia national football team.
Gorkšs firstly established himself in his native Latvia before moving to English football in 2006 with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He has twice won promotion to the Premier League, with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Reading F.C.Reading respectively.

Damien Johnson.name: Damien Johnson
Damien Johnson.intro:
'''Damien Michael Johnson''' (born 18 November 1978) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish association footballfootballer who is currently without a club.
He began his career with Portadown F.C.Portadown FC in his native Northern Ireland from whom he signed as a trainee for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and spent five years with the club, as well as spending time on loan with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He moved to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2002, where he spent the next eight seasons and became the club's captain. Johnson was transferred to Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in 2010 and spent the 2010–11 and 2011–12 season on loan with Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town. He represented the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team over an eleven-year period, earning 56 cap (sport)caps.
Damien Johnson.position: Midfielder  association football  Centre midfielder Central midfielder

Cyrille Regis.name: Cyrille Regis
Cyrille Regis.intro: '''Cyrille Regis''', Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 9 February 1958) is a French GuianaFrench Guianese-born English former association footballfootballer. His professional playing career spanned 19 years, where he made 614 league appearances and scored 158 league goals, most prolifically at West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.

Jon Stead.name: Jon Stead
Jon Stead.intro:
'''Jonathan Graeme "Jon" Stead''' (born 7 April 1983 in Huddersfield) is an English Forward (association football)football striker who currently plays for Bradford City FC on loan from Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town.
Stead is a former England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 international earning 11 caps, scoring once.

Colin McKee.name: Colin McKee
Colin McKee.intro:
'''Colin McKee''' (born 22 August 1973 in Glasgow, Scotland) is a former ScotlandScottish football (soccer)footballer. He retired from football in 2001 after a season with Fauldhouse United F.C.Fauldhouse United. His usual position was as a forward, but he was equally adept at playing on the wing.
McKee began his career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, joining the club in 1989 after he was spotted playing for the Scotland schoolboys side. In 1992, he made the starting line-up for the FA Youth Cup final against Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, along with future United stars such as Gary Neville, Nicky Butt, David Beckham and Ryan Giggs. United won the final 6-3 on aggregate, and McKee was offered a professional contract in August 1992.
He went on loan to Bury F.C.Bury for a month in January 1993, making two appearances for the Shakers. He returned to Manchester United, winning the Denzil Haroun Reserve Team Player of the Year award in 1993, but struggled to break into the first team, making only one appearance before being sold to Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock in September 1994 along with Neil Whitworth in a combined deal worth £350,000.
On the creation of player squad numbers in the Premier League for the 1993-94 in English football1993-94 season, McKee was issued with the number 17 shirt, which became the property of the much more famous Andrew ColeAndy Cole, who joined United from Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle four months after McKee's departure.
McKee stayed at Kilmarnock for three years, his longest stay at any club. He made 78 appearances for the club - two in the Scottish Cup - and scored twelve goals, all of which came in the league. However, he was released by Kilmarnock in October 1997.
Partick Thistle F.C.Partick Thistle took him on a one-month trial in March 1998, but he failed to earn a contract with them and was allowed to leave. In June 1998, he signed for Falkirk F.C.Falkirk, but only made four appearances for the club before being released yet again in October 1998.
He spent the rest of the 1998-99 season with two different clubs; first he signed for Queen of the South F.C.Queen of the South, where he made two appearances, and then he moved to Ross County F.C.Ross County on a free transfer, making one more appearance before finding himself unattached again.
Summer 1999 saw McKee join his fifth club in two years when he put pen to paper for Stirling Albion F.C.Stirling Albion, but yet again he made only two appearances before moving on to Queen's Park F.C.Queen's Park. He saw out the season with Queen's Park, making seven appearances for the Glasgow club, and then moved again, this time to Fauldhouse United F.C.Fauldhouse United. McKee retired from professional football soon after, calling time on a career that lasted twelve years and ten different clubs.

Kelvin Davis.name: Kelvin Davis
Kelvin Davis.intro:
'''Kelvin Geoffrey Davis''' (born 29 September 1976) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton. Born in Bedford, Davis began his career with Luton Town F.C.Luton Town as a youth player in 1991 and remained there until 1999. Davis later played for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland before moving to Southampton F.C.Southampton in 2006.
Davis was team captain of Southampton from 2009 to 2012, after which he became club captain.

Laurent Koscielny.name: Laurent Koscielny
Laurent Koscielny.intro:
'''Laurent Koscielny''' () (born 10 September 1985) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the france national football teamFrench national team. He primarily plays as a Defender (association football)centre back but he can also  play as a Defender (association football)right back, a position where he started his  career. He is described as an aggressive, strong, quick and ball-playing defender.
Koscielny was born in the city of Tulle  and began his football career playing for a host of amateur and youth clubs such as ESA BriveBrive, Tulle Corrèze and Limoges FCLimoges. In 2003 he moved to En Avant GuingampGuingamp, where he made his professional debut the following year. Koscielny joined Tours FCTours for an undisclosed fee to play in  the third tier of the French league in 2007 and enjoyed promotion with his new side before being named in the Ligue 2 Team of the Season the following campaign. In 2009, newly promoted Ligue 1 side FC LorientLorient signed Koscielny for around €1.7 million, and his performances caught the eye of Arsenal manager Arsène Wenger, who signed him in 2010. Arsenal fans voted Laurent Koscielny as Wenger’s most effective signing of 2010–11 following an impressive debut campaign.
Koscielny was called up to the French national team on 4 February 2011 and represented the country at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Prior to his call-up for France, he was also eligible to play for Poland national football teamPoland, as a result of his family roots.
Laurent Koscielny.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Carlo Cudicini.name: Carlo Cudicini
Carlo Cudicini.intro:
'''Carlo Cudicini''' (; born 6 September 1973) is an Italian Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who is currently a free agent. He is the son of the former A.C. MilanAC Milan goalkeeper Fabio Cudicini, and the grandson of Circolo Sportivo Ponziana 1912 defender Guglielmo Cudicini.
Cudicini started his professional career at Serie A side A.C. MilanAC Milan in 1992, but struggled to break into the first team, and spent the 1993–1994 season on loan to Como Calcio 1907Como, making six league appearances for the club. He switched permanently to A.C. PratoPrato in 1995, and made 30 league appearances for the club, before moving again to S.S. LazioLazio in 1996. Having only made a single league appearance for Lazio, he moved again in 1997, this time to Castel di Sangro CalcioCastel di Sangro. He made fourteen league appearances in a three-year spell at the club, before being loaned to English Premier League side Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for the 1999–2000 season. He signed permanently for the English club in 2000, and quickly dislodged Ed de Goey from the number one spot, being voted Chelsea's Player of the Year for the FA Premier League 2001-022001–02 season, and the ITV (TV network)ITV  Premiership Goalkeeper of the Season for the FA Premier League 2002-032002–2003 season. However, he struggled with injury for the following season, and Petr Cech was signed in 2004; Cech would displace Cudicini as the number one goalkeeper, with Cudicini only appearing sporadically afterwards. In 2006, both Cech and Cudicini suffered head injuries in a game against Reading F.C.Reading; as Cudicini recovered sooner, and third-choice goalkeeper Henrique Hilário's form dipped, he briefly took over the starting role, until Cech returned towards the end of January 2007. Cudicini left Chelsea in 2009, having made 141 league appearances for the club, and joined local rivals Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. At Tottenham, he remained second-choice or third-choice throughout his spell, and only made 19 league appearances for the club; first Heurelho Gomes, then Brad Friedel and Hugo Lloris kept him out of the team.
