He left the club in 2012, having made 19 league appearances. In 2013, Cudicini signed for Los Angeles Galaxy.
Cudicini played 20 times for the Italy national under-18 football teamItaly under-18 team between 1990 and 1992, and made a single appearance for the Italy national under-21 football teamunder-21 team during the 1992–1993 season; however, he never played for the full Italy national football teamnational team. In 2003, during his successful period at Chelsea, the The Football AssociationEnglish FA attempted to select him for the England national football teamEngland national team, but he was ineligible.

Adam Mitchell (footballer, born 1993).name: Adam Mitchell (footballer, born 1993)
Adam Mitchell (footballer, born 1993).intro: '''Adam Mitchell''' (born 18 October 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Darlington 1883 in the Northern Premier League Division One North, as a Forward (association football)forward or Midfielder#Wingerwinger. He began his career at FA Premier LeaguePremier League side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, for whom he made one professional appearance.

Kevin Stuhr Ellegaard.name: Kevin Stuhr Ellegaard
Kevin Stuhr Ellegaard.intro: '''Kevin Stuhr-Ellegaard''' (né ''Kevin Stuhr Larsen'', born 23 May 1983) is a DenmarkDanish professional football goalkeeper who is currently playing for IF Elfsborg in Sweden. He has played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in England, as well as German club Hertha BSC and Dutch club SC Heerenveen. Ellegaard has played 56 games for various Danish youth selections, including 20 games for the Denmark national under-21 football team. He has been selected several times for the Denmark national football teamDenmark national squad, but has not appeared in a match.

Gu\u00f0ni Bergsson.name: Guðni Bergsson
Gu\u00f0ni Bergsson.intro: '''Guðni Bergsson''' (born 21 July 1965 in Reykjavík), is an Icelandic former association footballfootball player who played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Niclas Jensen.name: Niclas Jensen
Niclas Jensen.intro:
'''Niclas Christian Monberg Jensen''' (born 17 August 1974 in Copenhagen, Denmark) is a former Danish professional Association footballfootball player and current sports agentfootball agent. He played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back, and most notably won three Danish Superliga championships with F.C. Copenhagen. He played abroad for NetherlandsDutch club PSV Eindhoven, EnglandEnglish clubs Manchester City and Fulham F.C., as well as GermanyGerman club Borussia Dortmund. Jensen played 62 games for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team between 1998 and 2008, representing Denmark at the 2002 FIFA World Cup and 2004 UEFA European Football Championship2004 European Championship. He was named 1995 Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the YearDanish ''Under-21 Player of the Year''.
He is the older brother of Danish national team player Daniel Jensen.
Niclas Jensen.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Aaron McLean.name: Aaron McLean
Aaron McLean.intro:
'''Aaron McLean''' (born 25 May 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, on loan from Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. At international level he gained five caps for the England C national football teamEngland C team during his time in the non-league.
McLean began his senior career with Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient in 1999, having graduated from the club's youth ranks. Never really breaking into the first team, he made 40 league appearances in a four-year spell, which also included a brief loan to Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic. He switched to Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town in 2003, and, after making 68 league appearances, moved again to Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic in 2005. He quickly became a regular player for Grays, making 59 league appearances before switching to Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United in 2006; initially on loan, which became permanent the following year. He was a regular for Peterborough, and made 148 league appearances before moving to Hull City in January 2011. Initially a regular player for Hull, he fell out of favour following the club's promotion to the Premier League, and moved on loan to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and then Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2013. In January 2014 McLean completed a move to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City.

Paul Smith (footballer, born 1979).name: Paul Smith (footballer, born 1979)
Paul Smith (footballer, born 1979).intro: '''Paul Daniel Smith''' (born 17 December 1979) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, for Southend United F.C.Southend United.

Antol\u00edn Alcaraz.name: Antolín Alcaraz
Antol\u00edn Alcaraz.intro:
'''Antolín Alcaraz Viveros''' (born 30 July 1982) is a Paraguayan professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Everton F.C.Everton as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He rarely settled with a team in his early career, before signing in 2003 with S.C. Beira-MarBeira-Mar and remaining with the club five seasons, after which he joined Club Brugge K.V.Club Brugge. He spent the remainder of his career in the Premier League, mainly with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.
Alcaraz represented Paraguay national football teamParaguay at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup and the 2011 Copa América.
Antol\u00edn Alcaraz.birth_place: San Roque González de Santa Cruz,Paraguay
Antol\u00edn Alcaraz.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Christian Atsu.name: Christian Atsu
Christian Atsu.intro:
'''Christian Atsu Twasam''' (born 10 January 1992) is a Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Everton F.C.Everton on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Ghana national football teamGhanaian national team, as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
He began his career with FC PortoPorto, also spending a season on loan at Rio Ave F.C.Rio Ave. In 2013 he was signed by Chelsea for £3.5 million, and was loaned to Vitesse and Everton.
A full international with over 30 caps since his debut in 2012, Atsu has represented Ghana at the 2014 FIFA World Cup and two Africa Cup of Nations tournaments.

Danny Tiatto.name: Danny Tiatto
Danny Tiatto.intro: '''Daniele Amadeo''' "'''Danny'''" '''Tiatto''' (born 22 May 1973) is an Australian former Football (soccer)footballer who played for Bulleen Lions, Melbourne Knights FCMelbourne Knights, Salernitana Calcio 1919Salernitana, FC BadenBaden, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Brisbane Roar FCBrisbane Roar, St Albans Saints and Werribee City FCWerribee City.

David O'Leary.name: David O'Leary
David O'Leary.intro: '''David Anthony O'Leary''' (born 2 May 1958) is an Irish association footballfootball manager (association football)manager and former player. His managerial career began at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and later he managed Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He most recently worked as the manager of Al-Ahli Dubai. The majority of his 20-year playing career was spent as a defender (football)defender at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal; O'Leary's tally of 722 appearances for the North London side stands as a club record.
David O'Leary.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

Tim Flowers.name: Tim Flowers
Tim Flowers.intro:
'''Timothy David "Tim" Flowers''' (born 3 February 1967) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and goalkeeping coach.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1984 until 2003. He was notably part of the Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers side that won the Premier League in 1995 and earnt 11 caps for England national football teamEngland. He also played for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
In May 2014 Flowers became goalkeeping coach of championship club Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest he was hired as part of Stuart PearceStuart Pearce's backroom staff. In February 2015 Flowers left the club after the departure of Pearce and appointment of Dougie Freedman he left alongside Steve Wigley and Brian Eastick who worked alongside him as colleagues.

Mikkel Beck.name: Mikkel Beck
Mikkel Beck.intro: '''Mikkel Venge Beck''' (born 12 May 1973) is a DenmarkDanish former association footballfootball player. He scored three goals in 19 games for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, and represented Denmark at the international UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996 and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000 tournaments.

Dani Osvaldo.name: Dani Osvaldo
Dani Osvaldo.intro:
'''Pablo Daniel Osvaldo''' (commonly known as '''Pablo Osvaldo''', or '''Dani Osvaldo''') (born 12 January 1986) is an Argentinian  Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Boca Juniors, on loan from Southampton F.C.Southampton, and for the Italy national football teamItalian national team.
Born in Argentina, Osvaldo began his career at Club Atlético HuracánHuracán in 2005 and the following year moved to Italy in a co-ownership deal between Serie B clubs Atalanta B.C.Atalanta and U.S. LecceLecce, later playing in the top flight for ACF FiorentinaFiorentina and Bologna F.C. 1909Bologna. After a loan to RCD Espanyol, he joined the Spanish club on a permanent basis before earning a return to Italy to A.S. RomaRoma for an initial fee of €15 million in 2011. He spent two seasons at the club and was then signed by Southampton, where he has spent most of his time out on loan, at Juventus, Internazionale and Boca Juniors.
Osvaldo qualifies to represent Italy through his ancestry, having played initially for Italy national under-21 football teamthe nation's Under-21 team before making his senior debut in 2011.
At times, Osvaldo has been disciplined for having participated in various incidents with opponents, teammates and managers.

Michael Frontzeck.name: Michael Frontzeck
Michael Frontzeck.intro: '''Michael Frontzeck''' (born 26 March 1964) is a German Coach (sport)football coach and former Association footballfootballer. For the Germany national football team, he earned 19 caps and was in the squad for 1992 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 1992.
Michael Frontzeck.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Left Wingback

Peter Butler (footballer, born 1966).name: Peter Butler (footballer, born 1966)
Peter Butler (footballer, born 1966).intro: '''Peter James Butler''' (born 27 August 1966 in Halifax, West YorkshireHalifax) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who made more than 450 appearances in the Football League and the Premier League. He then took up coach (sports)coaching, first in England and then in Australia and South-East Asia. He is currently in charge of the Botswana national football teamBotswana national team.

Michael Tonge.name: Michael Tonge
Michael Tonge.intro:
'''Michael William Eric Tonge''' (born 7 April 1983) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall on loan from Leeds United F.C.Leeds United. He plays as a Midfielder. He is also a former England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 international,
Tonge began his career in Manchester United F.C.Manchester United's youth team before joining Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 2001. He soon became a vital player for Neil Warnock's Blades, helping the Bramall Lane side achieve promotion to the Premier League in 2006. However, they were relegated after one season back in the top flight, and after an unsuccessful attempt to gain an instant return, Tonge signed for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2008 for £2 million. Since joining Stoke, Tonge struggled to break into the first-team and had been sent out on loan to Preston North End F.C.Preston North End (twice), Derby County F.C.Derby County, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Leeds United F.C.Leeds United. He joined Leeds on a permanent basis in January 2013.

Kevin Watson.name: Kevin Watson
Kevin Watson.intro: '''Kevin Edward Watson''' (born 3 January 1974 in London Borough of HackneyHackney, London, UK) is a former professional association footballfootballer, turned coach and sports commentatorsports broadcaster. He can now regularly be seen as a touchline pundit for Sky Sports show Soccer Saturday.

Tope Obadeyi.name: Tope Obadeyi
Tope Obadeyi.intro: '''Temitope Ayoluwa "Tope" Obadeyi''' (born 29 October 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock. Obadeyi has previously played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Rio Ave F.C.Rio Ave, Bury F.C.Bury and Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle.

Ibrahima Sonko.name: Ibrahima Sonko
Ibrahima Sonko.intro:
'''Ibrahima Sonko''' (born 22 January 1981) is a Senegalese international association footballfootballer who plays professionally for Turkish Süper Lig side Akhisar Belediyespor.
Sonko has previously played in France and England for Grenoble Foot 38Grenoble, Brentford F.C.Brentford, Reading F.C.Reading, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
Ibrahima Sonko.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre Back

Scott Fitzgerald (footballer, born 1969).name: Scott Fitzgerald (footballer, born 1969)
Scott Fitzgerald (footballer, born 1969).intro: '''Scott Brian Fitzgerald''' (born 13 August 1969 in London) is an English-born Irish football coach, best remembered for his spells with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Millwall F.C.Millwall and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. He won one cap for Republic of Ireland B national football teamRepublic of Ireland B at international level. After retiring as a player with Brentford F.C.Brentford in 2005, Fitzgerald began his career in coaching, heading the youth teams at Brentford, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham and Millwall. He had a spell as a first team manager at Brentford during the 2006-07 Football League One2006–07 season. Fitzgerald is currently academy manager at Millwall.

Neil Finn.name: Neil Finn
Neil Finn.intro: '''Neil Finn''' (born 29 December 1978 in Rainham, LondonRainham, Essex) is a former professional association footballfootballer. He played one game for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in the Premier League during the 1995-96 season, aged 17, becoming at that time the youngest player to ever to appear in a Premiership match.

Tomas Brolin.name: Tomas Brolin
Tomas Brolin.intro:
'''Per Tomas Brolin''' (born 29 November 1969) is a Swedish former professional Association footballfootball player who had a successful period with Parma F.C.A.C. Parma during the early nineties winning the Coppa Italia 1991-921992 Coppa Italia, the UEFA Cup Winners' Cup 1992–931993 UEFA Cup Winners' CupCup Winners' Cup, the 1993 UEFA Super Cup1993 UEFA Super Cup and the UEFA Cup 1994-951995 UEFA Cup.[
Crystal Palace FC Supporters' Website – The Holmesdale Online
Brolin also played for the Sweden national football teamSwedish national team, finishing third in the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 World Cup and was also a beaten semi finalist at the UEFA Euro 19921992 European championship as well as having competed in the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 World Cup.
Although a class act in his youth,[
His once glittering career never recovered after the transfer to Leeds United, and by the age of 28 he had retired from playing.

Simon Donnelly.name: Simon Donnelly
Simon Donnelly.intro: '''Simon Thomas Donnelly''' (born 1 December 1974) is a former ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer. He is currently assistant manager of Dundee United F.C.Dundee United.

Stiliyan Petrov.name: Stiliyan Petrov
Stiliyan Petrov.intro:
'''Stiliyan Alyoshev Petrov''' (Bulgarian languageBulgarian: Стилиян Альошев Петров, born 5 July 1979) is a retired Bulgarian professional footballer.
Petrov joined Celtic F.C.Celtic from CSKA Sofia in 1999, and stayed with the club until he moved to  Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier League, along with his former manager Martin O'Neill. He later became club captain. Petrov also played 106 matches for the Bulgaria national football teamBulgaria national team.
In March 2012, Petrov was diagnosed with acute leukaemia, suspending his football career to have treatment which was ultimately successful. He announced his retirement from the game in May 2013.

Alex Baptiste.name: Alex Baptiste
Alex Baptiste.intro: '''Alexander Aaron John "Alex" Baptiste''' (born 31 January 1986) is an English footballer who plays for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers on loan from Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He usually plays in Centre backcentral defence, but has also played at both full back positions.

Sebastian Larsson.name: Sebastian Larsson
Sebastian Larsson.intro:
'''Sebastian "Seb" Bengt Ulf Larsson''' (born 6 June 1985) is a Swedish association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and the Sweden national football teamSweden national team.
After beginning his career at hometown club IFK Eskilstuna, Larsson was signed by Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He made three appearances for the Gunners, before joining Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, initially on loan for the 2006–07 season, before a permanent transfer in the summer of 2007. Larsson spent five years at Birmingham, experiencing promotion to, and relegation from, the Premier League on two occasions. He joined Sunderland on 1 July 2011 upon the expiry of his contract, after Birmingham suffered relegation. Larsson is renowned for being a set-piece specialist.
A full international since 2008, Larsson played for Sweden at the European Championship in Euro 20082008 and 2012.

Clive Clarke.name: Clive Clarke
Clive Clarke.intro: '''Clive Richard Luke Clarke''' (born 14 January 1980) is a former Irish association footballfootballer. He played primarily as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back, but also as Defender (football)#Centre backcentre back, Midfielder (football)#Wingerleft midfielder or Midfielder (football)#Defensive midfieldercentre midfielder. He is now a football agent, after leaving Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland for health reasons.
Clive Clarke.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Adam Tanner.name: Adam Tanner
Adam Tanner.intro: '''Adam David Tanner''' (born 25 October 1973) is an English former professional footballer who is most notable for his spell with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He played both as a defender and as a midfielder.

Ryan Mason.name: Ryan Mason
Ryan Mason.intro:
'''Ryan Glen Mason''' (born 13 June 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. A versatile player, Mason is most comfortable as a midfielder but has also played extensively as a Forward (association football)forward.
He made his Tottenham debut in 2008, and was loaned to Yeovil Town, Doncaster Rovers. Millwall F.C.Millwall, FC LorientLorient and Swindon Town before playing his first Premier League match in 2014.
Mason is a former England youth international, having represented teams up to England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level. In March 2015, he received his first senior international call-up.

Scott Golbourne.name: Scott Golbourne
Scott Golbourne.intro: '''Juliou Scott Golbourne''' (born 29 February 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Scott Golbourne.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Mathew Birley.name: Mathew Birley
Mathew Birley.intro: '''Mathew Mark Birley''' (born 26 July 1986 in Bromsgrove, England) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Solihull Moors F.C.Solihull Moors, where he plays as a Midfielder (football)midfielder.

Andy Griffin.name: Andy Griffin
Andy Griffin.intro:
'''Andrew''' "'''Andy'''" '''Griffin''' (born 17 March 1979) is a former English Association footballfootballer.
Griffin began his career at Stoke City, where he established a reputation as a solid wing-back defender. His impressive performances for the "Potters" led to him being signed by Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for a fee of £1.5million in January 1998. He spent six years on Tyneside before moving south to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 2004. He was unable to establish himself as first choice right back at "Pompey" and re-joined his old club Stoke on loan for the 2006–07 Stoke City F.C. season2006–07 season.
Stoke narrowly missed out on a play-off position and so Griffin decided to sign for newly promoted Derby County F.C.Derby County, however with Derby struggling to compete in the Premier League he joined Stoke for a third time in January 2008. He helped Stoke to claim promotion and was made captain of the side for the 2008–09 Stoke City F.C. season2008–09 season. Griffin lost his place in the side after an on the pitch altercation with Ricardo Fuller at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in December 2008. He joined Reading F.C.Reading in 2010 helping them gain promotion at the second attempt after failing in the play-offs. He was released by Reading in May 2012 and joined Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in October 2012. He spent two years at Doncaster before ending his career with a short spell at Chester F.C.Chester
Andy Griffin.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

\u00c1lvaro Negredo.name: Álvaro Negredo
\u00c1lvaro Negredo.intro:
'''Álvaro Negredo Sánchez''' (; born 20 August 1985) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Valencia CF on loan from Manchester City F.C.Manchester City as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Nicknamed ''La fiera de Vallecas'' (The beast of Vallecas), his early career was associated with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, although he could never become a part of its first-team setup, going on to represent other clubs in his country, with his longest spell being at Sevilla FCSevilla. Over the course of seven seasons, he amassed La Liga totals of 228 games and 105 goals.
A Spain national football teamSpanish international since 2009, Negredo was part of the team that won UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012.

Geoffrey Mujangi Bia.name: Geoffrey Mujangi Bia
Geoffrey Mujangi Bia.intro:
'''Geoffrey Mujangi Bia''' (born 12 August 1989) is a Democratic Republic of the CongoDR Congo-born Belgium national football teamBelgian international Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Standard Liège.
He established himself in Belgian football with R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi before experiencing the Premier LeagueEnglish Premier League with a loan spell at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. In 2011 he returned to Belgium to join Standard Liège.

Attilio Lombardo.name: Attilio Lombardo
Attilio Lombardo.intro:
'''Attilio Lombardo''' (born 6 January 1966) is a retired association footballfootball player turned manager, best known for his two spells at U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria; throughout his career he was usually deployed as a wide midfielder, or as an offensive right Winger (association football)winger, although he also played as a Fullback (association football)fullback or Wingback (soccer)wingback on occasion later in his career. He is currently the assistant manager at FC Schalke 04Schalke 04.
Lombardo is one of the few players that has won the Serie A title with 3 different teams. He was given the nicknames "Popeye the SailorPopeye" during his career, due to his appearance, as well as "the Ostrich", due to his physique, pace, stamina, and work-rate. Although not gifted with particularly notable technical ability, he possessed good control when dribbling, and he frequently used his acceleration and agility to beat opponents in one on one situations; a versatile team player, he was also known for his accurate crossing ability as a winger, as well as his contribution in front of goal.

Steve Hodge.name: Steve Hodge
Steve Hodge.intro:
'''Stephen Brian Hodge''' (born 25 October 1962) is a retired English footballer who enjoyed a high-profile club and international career in the 1980s and 1990s.
Prior to the 2013-14 season Hodge was appointed Development Squad Coach at Notts County F.C.Notts County.
On 27 October 2013 Hodge was appointed caretaker manager,  reverting to his position as Development Squad Coach on 6 November 2013 with the appointment of Shaun Derry as manager.

Heurelho Gomes.name: Heurelho Gomes
Heurelho Gomes.intro: '''Heurelho da Silva Gomes''' (), born 15 February 1981), commonly known as '''Heurelho Gomes''' or just '''Gomes''', is a Brazilian Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, who is currently playing for Watford F.C.Watford. He previously made a name for himself at Dutch club PSV EindhovenPSV, and also spent six years at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.

Olivier Kapo.name: Olivier Kapo
Olivier Kapo.intro: '''Narcisse-Olivier Kapo-Obou''' (born 27 September 1980 in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire), known as '''Olivier Kapo''', is a French association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Ekstraklasa club Korona Kielce. He plays as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.

Dalian Atkinson.name: Dalian Atkinson
Dalian Atkinson.intro: '''Dalian Robert Atkinson''' (born 21 March 1968) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker in the Football League and Premier League for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, in La Liga for Real Sociedad, in Ligue 1 for FC MetzMetz, in the Turkish Super League for Fenerbahçe S.K.Fenerbahçe, in Saudi Arabia for Al-Ittihad (Jeddah)Al-Ittihad, and in the K-League for Daejeon Citizen and Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors.

Noel Whelan.name: Noel Whelan
Noel Whelan.intro:
'''Noel David Whelan''' (; born 30 December 1974) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and Academy Coach at Football League Championship side Derby County F.C.Derby County.
As a player he was a striker (association football)striker from 1993 to 2010, notably playing in the Premier League for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. He also played in the Scottish Premier League with Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Livingston F.C.Livingston and Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic, and in the Football League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Millwall F.C.Millwall, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Boston United F.C.Boston United and Darlington F.C.Darlington. He also had spell in Non-league football with Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town and was capped twice by England national under-21 football teamEngland U21, scoring once.

Jack Wilshere.name: Jack Wilshere
Jack Wilshere.intro:
'''Jack Andrew Garry Wilshere'''  (born 1 January 1992) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the England national football teamEngland national team. He plays primarily as a midfielder (association football)central midfielder.
Wilshere came up through Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal's youth academy and impressed from an early age.  He made his first team debut in 2008, becoming Arsenal's youngest ever league debutant at the age of 16 years, 256 days. Wilshere has earned a number of accolades including the PFA Young Player of the Year award, nomination to the 2010–11 in English football2010–11 PFA Team of the Year, and Arsenal's Player of the Season award, as voted for by fans for his performances in his first full campaign for Arsenal during the 2010–11 Premier League2010–11 season.
Wilshere is an England national football teamEngland international, having previously represented his country at under-16, under-17, under-19 and under-21 levels. He made his debut for the England national football teamsenior team against Hungary national football teamHungary at the age of 18 years and 222 days, making him the 10th youngest debutant in England's history.

Jeff Schlupp.name: Jeff Schlupp
Jeff Schlupp.intro: '''Jeffrey "Jeff" Schlupp''' (; born 23 December 1992) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and the Ghana national football teamGhana national team as a Full back (association football)left back or winger. He started his career as a Forward (association football)striker.
Jeff Schlupp.position: Full back  association football  Left back

John Fashanu.name: John Fashanu
John Fashanu.intro:
'''John Fashanu''' (, born 18 September 1962), often referred to as '''Fash''', is an English television presenter and former professional association footballfootballer of Nigerian (paternal) and GuyanaGuyanese (maternal) descent. In his former career, he was a striker (football)centre-forward from 1978 until 1995, most notably in an eight-year spell at Wimbledon F.C. in which he won the FA Cup in 1988 and scored over 100 goals in all competitions.
He also played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Miramar Rangers, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Millwall F.C.Millwall and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He scored 134 league goals in a career lasting 17 years. He was also capped twice at senior level by England national football teamEngland, but failed to score on either occasion.
Following his football career he went on to co-host British television show Gladiators (UK TV series)Gladiators in the mid-1990s, and between 2003 and 2004 he managed his own Sunday league football side Fash FC on Bravo (UK TV Channel)Bravo.

Mat\u011bj Vydra.name: Matěj Vydra
Mat\u011bj Vydra.intro: '''Matěj Vydra''' (, born 1 May 1992) is a CzechsCzech Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Football ChampionshipChampionship side Watford F.C.Watford on loan from Serie A club Udinese CalcioUdinese. He has also played for FC Vysočina JihlavaVysočina Jihlava, FC Baník OstravaBaník Ostrava, Club Brugge K.V.Club Brugge and had an earlier spell at Watford F.C.Watford. Vydra has won Cap (sport)caps at full international level for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic national team.

Martin Olsson.name: Martin Olsson
Martin Olsson.intro: '''Martin Tony Waikwa Olsson''' (born 17 May 1988) is a Swedish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and the Sweden national football teamSweden national team. He signed for Blackburn from Högaborgs BK for a nominal fee in January 2006 after a Trial (association football)trial period. In 2013, Premier League side, Norwich City, signed him for an undisclosed fee.

Darius Henderson.name: Darius Henderson
Darius Henderson.intro: '''Darius Alexis Henderson''' (born 7 September 1981) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient as a Forward (association football)striker. Born in London Borough of SuttonSutton, England, (although he is often mistakenly cited as being born in Doncaster, where he moved at a young age and attended Carr House Middle School, and Hall Cross Comprehensive school), Henderson started his football career as a junior with Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers before signing professionally for Reading F.C.Reading. Having spent four years at Reading he then moved initially to Gillingham F.C.Gillingham before being signed by Watford F.C.Watford with whom he achieved promotion from the Football League ChampionshipChampionship and played in the Premier League during the 2006–07 Watford F.C. season2006–07 season.  Leaving Watford, he then had spells at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Millwall F.C.Millwall before signing for Forest.  Henderson has also played on loan for both Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town during his career.

Jon Otsemobor.name: Jon Otsemobor
Jon Otsemobor.intro: '''Jon Otsemobor''' (born 23 March 1983) is an English professional Association footballfootballer, who is a free agent. Born in Liverpool, Defender (association football)#Full-backright back Otsemobor has notably played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.
Jon Otsemobor.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Robbie Brady.name: Robbie Brady
Robbie Brady.intro: '''Robert "Robbie" Brady''' (born 14 January 1992) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for English club Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team. He has also played internationally for Ireland at Republic of Ireland national under-17 football teamunder-17, Republic of Ireland national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels. On 6 September 2012, Brady became the highest ever scorer at U21 level with his seventh goal for his country. Within days he had been called into the senior team for a friendly against Oman national football teamOman. He scored on his senior debut and set up two more goals in a 4–1 victory.

Reece Styche.name: Reece Styche
Reece Styche.intro: '''Reece Styche''' (born 3 May 1989) is a professional association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Tamworth F.C.Tamworth on loan from Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, and the Gibraltar national football teamGibraltar national team.

Per Frandsen.name: Per Frandsen
Per Frandsen.intro: '''Per Frandsen''' (born 6 February 1970) is a DenmarkDanish former professional association footballfootball player, who won the 1995 Danish Cup with F.C. Copenhagen, and played 265 league games as a midfielder for Bolton Wanderers in England. Frandsen played 23 matches for the Denmark national football team between 1990 and 2003, and he represented his country at the 1992 Summer Olympics and 1998 FIFA World Cup tournaments. Currently, he is youth coach at Brøndby IF.

Didier Agathe.name: Didier Agathe
Didier Agathe.intro:
'''Didier Fernand Agathe''' (born 16 August 1975) is a professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for JS Saint-Pierroise in Réunion.
Agathe began his career at French side Montpellier HSC before moving to Scotland to join Raith Rovers F.C.Raith Rovers and then Hibernian F.C.Hibernian. His performances gained him a high profile transfer to Celtic F.C.Celtic where he enjoyed the most successful spell of his career winning three championships and was part of the squad that reached the 2003 UEFA Cup Final.
Didier Agathe.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Wingback

William Kvist.name: William Kvist
William Kvist.intro:
'''William Kvist Jørgensen''' (born 24 February 1985) is a Danish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as well as for the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team.
He played 43 matches and scored four goals for various national youth teams, and is now an important player for the Denmark national football teamsenior team.

Aki Riihilahti.name: Aki Riihilahti
Aki Riihilahti.intro: '''Aki Pasinpoika Riihilahti''' (born 9 September 1976 in Helsinki) is a retired FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer. He is known as a hard working, Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder. He is now working as the CEO of HJK HelsinkiHJK, as well as coach for HJK's reserves, Klubi-04.

Rodrigo Possebon.name: Rodrigo Possebon
Rodrigo Possebon.intro:
'''Rodrigo Pereira Possebon''' (born 13 February 1989) is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Clube Náutico CapibaribeNáutico. He signed for Santos from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United on 20 August 2010. He previously played for Sport Club InternacionalInternacional in Brazil, and went on loan to S.C. BragaBraga of Portugal for the first half of the 2009–10 season.
Due to his ancestry, he has been capped for the Italy national under-20 football teamItaly under-20s, playing one match for them in 2009.
Rodrigo Possebon.position: Midfielder  Box to box  midfielder Central midfielder

Rufus Brevett.name: Rufus Brevett
Rufus Brevett.intro: '''Rupis Emanuel "Rufus" Brevett''' (born 24 September 1969 in Derby) is an English former professional association footballfootball player who played as a defender. He has retired from professional football, last playing for Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, and was manager of Arlesey Town F.C.Arlesey Town between 2013 and 2014.

David Edgar.name: David Edgar
David Edgar.intro:
'''David Edward Edgar''' (; born 19 May 1987) is a Canadian Association footballsoccer player who currently plays for Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town, on loan from Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He can play as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back, Defender (association football)#Full-backright or left back or defensive midfielder.
Edgar has represented Canada at various levels and is currently a member of the Canadian senior squad. He was a member of the of Canada U-20 men's national soccer teamUnder-20 team at the 2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup. He made his debut for the Canada men's national soccer teamCanadian senior squad on 9 February 2011.

Marc Hottiger.name: Marc Hottiger
Marc Hottiger.intro:
'''Marc Hottiger''' (born 7 November 1967 in Lausanne) is a retired SwitzerlandSwiss football defender.
He was capped 63 times and scored 5 goals for the Switzerland national football teamSwiss national team between 1989 and 1996. He was in the Swiss squad at the 1994 FIFA World Cup, playing all four games, as well as the UEFA Euro 19961996 UEFA European Championship.
After starting his club career in his native Switzerland, he headed for England on 1 August 1994 to sign for Premier League side Newcastle United in a £525,000 deal. He was their first choice right-back in the 1994-95 in English football1994-95 season, during which he memorably scored a 25-yard goal in a victory over Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in the FA Cup third round. However, manager Kevin Keegan signed right-back Warren Barton from Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon the following summer and Hottiger lost his place in the first team for the 1995-96 in English football1995-96 season.
On 19 January 1996, he agreed terms with Everton F.C.Everton for a £700,000 transfer, but had difficulty obtaining a work permit, which was finally granted on 9 March 1996 when his long wait to become an Everton player ended. However, he only made limited appearances for Everton, scoring once against Bolton Wanderers,cite news
url       =
title     = Bolton going down without a fight
publisher = The Independent
date      = 8 April 1996 accessdate=23 March 2012 and left in June 1997 to sign for his hometown club Lausanne in a £25,000 deal. He then moved back to FC Sion in 1999 and remained there until the end of his playing career in 2002.

Bruno Rodriguez.name: Bruno Rodriguez
Bruno Rodriguez.intro: '''Bruno Rodriguez''' (born  25 November 1972) is a French peopleFrench former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.

Antti Niemi.name: Antti Niemi
Antti Niemi.intro: '''Antti Mikko Niemi''' (born 31 May 1972) is a retired Finnish association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, who is currently working as a goalkeeping coach for Brighton and Hove Albion. He spent much of his playing career in  the Scottish Premier League (with  Rangers F.C.Rangers and  Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian) and the Premier League (with Southampton F.C.Southampton and  Fulham F.C.Fulham), and in 2008 announced his retirement due to injury. However in 2009 he returned to sign for Premier League club Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth although he did not make any appearances before leaving in 2010.

Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Piquionne.name: Frédéric Piquionne
Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Piquionne.intro:
'''Frédéric Piquionne''' (; born 8 December 1978) is a French association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Strikerforward for US Creteil in Ligue 2. His former clubs are Golden Star (Fort-de-France)Golden Star of Martinique, Nîmes Olympique, Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes, AS Saint-Etienne, AS Monaco, Olympique LyonnaisLyon, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Portland Timbers.
He plays for Martinique national football teamMartinique at the international level and represented them in the run up to the 2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup and he was named in the 2012 Caribbean Cup squad. He also played once for France national football teamFrance in a Exhibition gamefriendly against Austria national football teamAustria in 2007.

Marcin Wasilewski.name: Marcin Wasilewski
Marcin Wasilewski.intro: '''Marcin Wasilewski''' (; born 9 June 1980 in Kraków), commonly known as '''Wasyl''', is a PolandPolish defender currently playing for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and the Poland national football team. He previously played for R.S.C. Anderlecht.
Marcin Wasilewski.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Billy Jones (footballer, born 1987).name: Billy Jones (footballer, born 1987)
Billy Jones (footballer, born 1987).intro:
'''Billy Jones''' (born 24 March 1987) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a right-back for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in the Premier League.
Jones started his career at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and made his professional debut in October 2003 in a 3–0 win over Derby County F.C.Derby County. Since then, he was a regular in Crewe's back-line and, for the 2005–06 season, he played a majority of games in midfield. He moved onto Preston North End in 2007 and then made his first Premier League appearance with West Bromwich Albion in 2011.

Lee Dong-gook.name: Lee Dong-gook
Lee Dong-gook.intro:
'''Lee Dong-Gook''' () (born 29 April 1979) is a South Korean association football Forward (association football)#Centre forwardstriker who currently plays for Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors. He is a record scorer in the K-League, and had brief spells in Europe with Werder Bremen and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.
Lee has earned 103 international caps for South Korea national football teamSouth Korea since 1998,  scoring 33 goals. He has played at two FIFA World Cups, two CONCACAF Gold Cups, two AFC Asian Cups and the 2000 Olympics.

Matthew Briggs.name: Matthew Briggs
Matthew Briggs.intro: '''Matthew Anthony Briggs''' (born 6 March 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, on loan from Millwall F.C.Millwall as a defender (association football)defender.

Paul Murray.name: Paul Murray
Paul Murray.intro: '''Paul Murray''' (born 31 August 1976) is a former Association footballfootballer who last played for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic.

Steve Anthrobus.name: Steve Anthrobus
Steve Anthrobus.intro: '''Stephen "Steve" Anthrobus''' (born 10 November 1968) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. Active in both England and Wales between 1986 and 2003, Anthrobus made nearly 300 career League appearances.

Stuart Nethercott.name: Stuart Nethercott
Stuart Nethercott.intro: '''Stuart Nethercott''' (born 21 March 1973 in Ilford, Essex) is a former English professional association footballfootball player.

Sebasti\u00e1n Coates.name: Sebastián Coates
Sebasti\u00e1n Coates.intro:
'''Sebastián Coates Nion''' (; born 7 October 1990) is a Uruguayan Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Premier League side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland on loan from Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, and for the Uruguayan national football teamUruguay national team.
Having begun his career at Club Nacional de FootballNacional, where he was a regular from his debut in 2009, Coates joined Liverpool in 2011. He has spent time out on loan, back at Nacional, and at Sunderland.
Coates made his international debut at the 2011 Copa América, and was voted Young Player of the Tournament after Uruguay won it. He also represented the country at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Olympics and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Clive Baker (footballer, born 1959).name: Clive Baker (footballer, born 1959)
Clive Baker (footballer, born 1959).intro:
'''Clive Baker''' (born 14 March 1959) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in the Football League and for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in the Premier League.
Baker was born in West Runton, Norfolk. He began his career at Norwich City in July 1977 appearing 14 times in his 7 years at the club. From Norwich he moved to Barnsley where he again played for seven years, this time racking up 291 appearances and twice winning the club's Player of the Year award. He was transferred to Coventry City in August 1991, and a year later, without having appeared for Coventry's Football League team, he moved to his final club, Ipswich Town. He retired from professional football in the 1994–95 season as one of only a few to play for both Ipswich Town and Norwich City. After his retirement from football he moved into a job in the insurance industry in London.
Baker was for thirteen years in the same school class at Sheringham Primary School and then at Paston School as controversial British Ambassador Craig Murray.  The two were friends.
Baker captained England schoolboys at both cricket and football.  Norwich City were uncertain whether to sign him as a goalkeeper or midfielder. He currently plays in goal for The Football Ramble 5 - A - Side team. In 2011 clive came out of retirement & made his debut in goal for PSV Mindblowin in Chantry Monday 5's league, earning the MOM award on his debut

Doriva.name: Doriva
Doriva.intro:
'''Dorival Guidoni Júnior''', known simply as '''Doriva''' (born 28 May 1972) is a Brazilian retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder, and the current Coach (sport)coach of CR Vasco da GamaVasco da Gama.
From 2003 until 2006, he played for English Premier League club Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, winning the 2004 Football League Cup Final2004 League Cup and finishing as runner-up in the 2005-06 UEFA Cup. He retired due to a misdiagnosed heart condition while playing for Brazilian club América Futebol Clube (SP)América-SP in 2007.
Doriva played for the Brazil national football team between 1995 and 1998, making a brief substitute appearance in the 1998 FIFA World Cup in which Brazil finished as runners-up.

Ruben Loftus-Cheek.name: Ruben Loftus-Cheek
Ruben Loftus-Cheek.intro: '''Ruben Ira Loftus-Cheek''' (born 23 January 1996) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea as a midfielder.

David Murphy.name: David Murphy
David Murphy.intro:
'''David Paul Murphy''' (born 1 March 1984) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who made more than 200 appearances in the English and Scottish Leagues. Born in Hartlepool, County Durham, Murphy played as a left back.
Murphy started his professional career at Premier League side Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 2001, and remained at the club for three years, making sixteen appearances. During his time at Middlesbrough, he also had a loan (football)loan spell with Football League Second DivisionDivision Two side Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 2004, where he made ten appearances. He left Middlesbrough for Scottish Premier League side Hibernian F.C.Hibernian in the summer of 2004, and made 134 appearances for the club, before signing for Birmingham City in January 2008. He played 132 matches for the club in all competitions, and was an unused substitute as they won the 2011 Football League Cup Final2011 League Cup Final, but his six-year stay was blighted by injuries, and he retired from football on medical advice in March 2014.
He played several times for England national under-16 football teamEngland at under-16 level.

John O'Kane.name: John O'Kane
John O'Kane.intro: '''John Andrew O'Kane''' (born 15 November 1974 in Nottingham) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer who last played for Hyde United F.C.Hyde United.

Jonathan Grounds.name: Jonathan Grounds
Jonathan Grounds.intro:
'''Jonathan Martin Grounds''' (born 27 February 1988) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City.
Grounds began his career with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, making 33 league appearances spread across five years. He also spent time loan (sports)on loan to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City (two spells), Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield and Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town. He left Middlesbrough in 2012 and signed for Oldham Athletic on a free transfer. After two seasons with Oldham, he signed for Birmingham City.
He plays primarily at left back, but can also play as a centre half.

Colin Pates.name: Colin Pates
Colin Pates.intro: '''Colin George Pates''' (born 10 August 1961) is an English former association footballfootballer born in Carshalton, London, who made more than 400 appearances in the Football League. He played for various clubs, mainly in London, in a defensive role.

Emmanuel Rivi\u00e8re.name: Emmanuel Rivière
Emmanuel Rivi\u00e8re.intro: '''Emmanuel Rivière''' (born 3 March 1990) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. Rivière primarily plays in the Forward (association football)#Strikerlead striker role, but can also operate on the Midfielder#Wingerwings. He was a France national youth football teamFrench youth international having played at all levels.

Rodrigo Moreno Machado.name: Rodrigo Moreno Machado
Rodrigo Moreno Machado.intro:
'''Rodrigo Moreno Machado''' (born 6 March 1991), commonly known as '''Rodrigo''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Valencia CF, as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
He started his career with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, appearing solely for its reserve teams. In 2010 he signed with S.L. BenficaBenfica with whom he won several titles, including the 2013–14 Primeira Liga2014 national championship.
Born in Brazil, Rodrigo represented Spain national youth football teamSpain at youth level, and in 2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship2013 he won the UEFA European Under-21 ChampionshipEuropean Championship with the Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 team. The following year, he earned his first cap for the Spain national football teamsenior team.

Freddie Sears.name: Freddie Sears
Freddie Sears.intro:
'''Frederick David "Freddie" Sears''' (born 27 November 1989) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He started his career with his local club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United at the age of eleven, progressing through the West Ham United F.C. Reserves and AcademyWest Ham United Academy. He made a scoring first-team debut in March 2008 when he netted the winner against Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers after coming on as a second-half substitute. Sears made over 50 first-team appearances for West Ham, but never held down a regular starting position.
Sears had fruitless loan spells with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, before joining Colchester United F.C.Colchester United for the latter half of the 2011–12 Colchester United F.C. season2011–12 season. He scored two goals in 11 appearances for the U's, prompting the club to sign him on a permanent basis from the Hammers in July 2012. After joining the Essex club, Sears rediscovered his scoring form, grabbing 34 goals in 99 games in his two-and-a-half year stay before departing for Ipswich. Sears has also represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-19 football teamunder-19, England national under-20 football teamunder-20 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels.

Paul Browne.name: Paul Browne
Paul Browne.intro: '''Paul Browne''' (born 17 February 1975 in Glasgow) is a retired ScotlandScottish football defender.

Keiren Westwood.name: Keiren Westwood
Keiren Westwood.intro: '''Keiren Westwood''' (born 23 October 1984) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team. He qualifies to play for the Irish national team by virtue of grandparents from County Wexford was for a time Ireland's first choice keeper, following the international retirement of Shay Given.

Giles Barnes.name: Giles Barnes
Giles Barnes.intro: '''Giles Gordon K. Barnes''' (born 5 August 1988) is a English born Jamaican international association footballfootballer, who plays as a forward for Houston Dynamo in Major League Soccer. He is most notable for his spell at Derby County F.C.Derby County, where he won the club's Young Player of the Year award in 2007 and was Football League Championship Player of the MonthChampionship Player of the Month in March 2007. He has played for England at England national under-19 football teamUnder 19 level. He plays as an attacking midfielder and can also play as a Winger (sports)winger. Since Barnes' move to Houston Dynamo, he has been played in both an attacking midfield role and striker position.

Eddy Bosnar.name: Eddy Bosnar
Eddy Bosnar.intro: '''Eddy Bosnar''' (born 29 April 1980) is an Australian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)centre back for A-League side Central Coast Mariners FCCentral Coast Mariners. He has scored numerous goals for his clubs with his free kicks.cite weburl=

Jesse Lingard.name: Jesse Lingard
Jesse Lingard.intro: '''Jesse Ellis Lingard''' (born 15 December 1992) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for Derby County F.C.Derby County on loan from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Lingard made his senior debut while on loan at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in 2012, and spent time on loan at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Brighton & Hove Albion during the 2013–14 season. He has represented England national under-17 football teamEngland at under-17 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Imants Bleidelis.name: Imants Bleidelis
Imants Bleidelis.intro: '''Imants Bleidelis''' (born 16 August 1975 in Riga, Soviet Union) is a former Association footballfootball midfielder from Latvia. He last played for FK Liepājas Metalurgs. He has made 106 appearances for the Latvia national football teamLatvia national team.

Muhamed Konji\u0107.name: Muhamed Konjić
Muhamed Konji\u0107.intro: '''Muhamed Konjić''' (born 14 May 1970) is a BosniansBosnian former association footballfootballer who played as a centre back, most notably for English club Coventry City.

Jason Kearton.name: Jason Kearton
Jason Kearton.intro:
'''Jason Brett Kearton''' (born 9 July 1969) is an Australian former professional Association footballsoccer player who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1987 until 2004.
After starting his career with Queensland Lions Soccer ClubBrisbane Lions, before playing in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton. He also played in England with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra. He finished his career with Brisbane Strikers F.C.Brisbane Strikers and now owns his own Goalkeeping coaching school.

Hugo Viana.name: Hugo Viana
Hugo Viana.intro:
'''Hugo Miguel Ferreira Gomes Viana''' (; born 15 January 1983) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Al-Wasl F.C. in the United Arab Emirates, as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
His main assets are good Set piece (football)set pieces and Assist (football)passing skills. After starting out at Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting he moved abroad at the age of 19, going on to have unassuming spells in England (Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United) and Spain (Valencia CFValencia) before settling back in his country with S.C. BragaBraga. He amassed Primeira Liga totals of 165 games and 23 goals over the course of six seasons.
Viana represented Portugal national football teamPortugal in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012, also appearing with the Portugal national under-23 football teamunder-23s at the 2004 Summer Olympics.

Johan Cavalli.name: Johan Cavalli
Johan Cavalli.intro: '''Johan Cavalli''' (born September 12, 1981, in Ajaccio) is a FranceFrench footballer playing for FranceFrench side AC Ajaccio. He plays on the left side of midfield.

Zheng Zhi.name: Zheng Zhi
Zheng Zhi.intro:
'''Zheng Zhi''' (, born 20 August 1980) is a Chinese peopleChinese footballer who currently plays for Guangzhou Evergrande F.C.Guangzhou Evergrande in the Chinese Super League.
Starting his career as a defender, Zheng was moved into centre midfield by his manager at Shenzhen Ruby F.C.Shenzhen Jianlibao and experienced immediate success there by winning the 2004 league title with them. A move to Shandong Luneng Taishan F.C.Shandong Luneng saw a prolific goal scoring period in his career and he soon became the captain of the China PR national football teamChinese national team which then led to moves to Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Celtic F.C.Celtic.

Jan Kromkamp.name: Jan Kromkamp
Jan Kromkamp.intro:
'''Jan Kromkamp''' (born 17 August 1980) is a Dutch retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
He amassed Eredivisie totals of 201 games and eight goals over the course of nine seasons, in representation of AZ (football club)AZ and PSV EindhovenPSV. He also competed professionally in England and Spain, and started and finished his career at Go Ahead Eagles.
Kromkamp appeared for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup.
Jan Kromkamp.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Guy Demel.name: Guy Demel
Guy Demel.intro: '''Guy Roland Demel''' (born 13 June 1981) is a professional footballer who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a defender (association football)defender. Demel can play in several positions including right back and centre back.

Andy Hill.name: Andy Hill
Andy Hill.intro:
'''Andrew Rowland''' "'''Andy'''" '''Hill''' (born 20 January 1965) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender in the Football League from 1983 to 1998. He played 464 league games in the Football League and Premier League.
After starting his career as a youth at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, he went on to play for Bury F.C.Bury, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He helped Bury to win promotion out of the Football League Fourth DivisionFourth Division in 1984–85, played in the FA Youth Cup final for Manchester United in 1982 and the Anglo-Italian Cup final for Port Vale in 1996, and competed in the Premier League with Manchester City.
Andy Hill.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Slavi\u0161a Jokanovi\u0107.name: Slaviša Jokanović
Slavi\u0161a Jokanovi\u0107.intro:
'''Slaviša Jokanović''' (; born 16 August 1968) is a Serbian retired professional Association footballfootballer who played in the 1990s and early 2000s. Since October 2014 he has been the Manager (association football)coach of Watford F.C.Watford.
A physical player, by no means devoid of skill and with excellent ability in the air, he played as Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.[
Jokanović represented Yugoslavia national football teamFR Yugoslavia at the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000.
Slavi\u0161a Jokanovi\u0107.birth_place: Novi Sad,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Ignacio Scocco.name: Ignacio Scocco
Ignacio Scocco.intro: '''Ignacio "Nacho" Martín Scocco''' (born 29 May 1985) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Newell's Old Boys.

John Harkes.name: John Harkes
John Harkes.intro:
'''John Harkes''' (born March 8, 1967 in Kearny, New JerseyKearny, New Jersey) is an United StatesAmerican former soccer player. Harkes was the first American ever to play in the English Premier League, and the second American to score at Wembley Stadium. He is a member of the National Soccer Hall of Fame. He appeared in two FIFA World Cup tournaments, and won two MLS Cup titles with D.C. United, and was the second American footballer to appear in the final of a major English tournament since Julian Sturgis in 1876 FA Cup Final1876. Harkes is of Scottish peopleScottish descent.
A mainstay in the United States men's national soccer teamUS national team midfield for most of the 1990s, Harkes was named the team's "Captain for Life" by then head coach Steve Sampson before having that title stripped from him by Sampson soon after. Harkes ended his national team career with 90 Cap (football)caps and 6 goals. Harkes was formerly a color commentator for the ESPN Major League SoccerMLS on ESPN, since being replaced by Taylor Twellman.  He called matches in the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup with  JP Dellacamera, and at the 2010 FIFA World Cup with Ian Darke.

Darren Byfield.name: Darren Byfield
Darren Byfield.intro:
'''Darren Asherton Byfield''' (born 29 September 1976) is a association footballfootballer who plays Solihull Moors F.C.Solihull Moors as a forward (association football)forward.
Byfield won six caps for Jamaica national football teamJamaica in 2003, and has scored 110 goals in 484 appearances across all domestic competitions so far in his football career. He was briefly married to pop star Jamelia, with whom he had one child.
He began his career with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 1997, and enjoyed loan spells with Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, before winning a move to Walsall F.C.Walsall in June 2000. He scored the winning goal in the 2001 Football League Second Division play-off Final2001 Football League Second DivisionSecond Division play-off final, and then made a £50,000 move to Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United in March 2002. He was traded to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in February 2004, and then moved on to Gillingham F.C.Gillingham five months later. He transferred to Millwall F.C.Millwall in June 2006, before joining Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in August 2007. He moved on to Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in July 2008, before linking up with Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic in August 2009, having played on loan at the club during the previous season. His stay at Oldham lasted only a handful of games, after which he returned to Walsall. He left the Football League in June 2011 following an injury-hit 2010–11 campaign. He joined non-league Solihull Moors F.C.Solihull Moors for a brief spell in March 2012, before moving on to A.F.C. Telford UnitedAFC Telford United six months later. He joined Tamworth F.C.Tamworth in January 2013.

Fraser Digby.name: Fraser Digby
Fraser Digby.intro: '''Fraser Charles Digby''' (born 23 January 1967) is an English association footballfootball coach and former player who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He spent much of his career with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, for whom he played in the Premier League. In 2008, he found new fame through repeated references to "Fraser Digby's washbag" on Danny Baker's ''6–0–6'' programme on BBC Radio 5 Live.

Temur Ketsbaia.name: Temur Ketsbaia
Temur Ketsbaia.intro: '''Temuri "Temur" Ketsbaia''' (; born 18 March 1968) is a Georgian association footballfootball Coach (sport)coach and former player. As a player he represented the Georgia national football teamGeorgian national team and played for FC Dinamo TbilisiDinamo Tbilisi, Anorthosis Famagusta FCAnorthosis, AEK Athens F.C.AEK, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Dundee F.C.Dundee.

Scott Sellars.name: Scott Sellars
Scott Sellars.intro:
'''Scott Sellars''' (born 27 November 1965) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootball player, who was Head of Academy Coaching [
Manchester City sacked Scott Sellars on 11 April 2014 due to difference in footballing opinion with current regime led by director of football Txiki Begiristain.

Gary Walsh.name: Gary Walsh
Gary Walsh.intro:
'''Gary Walsh''' (born 21 March 1968 in Wigan) is an English association footballfootball coach and former footballer who is the goalkeeping coach for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1985 to 2006, notably playing Premier League football with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He also played in Scotland for Airdrieonians F.C. (1878)Airdrieonians, He became goalkeeping coach at Wigan under manager Paul Jewell before teaming back up with Jewell at Derby County F.C.Derby County.

Maniche.name: Maniche
Maniche.intro:
'''Nuno Ricardo de Oliveira Ribeiro''', Order of Infante D. HenriqueOIH (born 11 November 1977), known as '''Maniche''' (, or less commonly ), is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Known for his teamwork, stamina and powerful shot, he received his nickname after S.L. BenficaBenfica's 1980s Danish Forward (association football)#Centre forwardforward Michael Manniche.
He played top-flight football in Portugal, Russia, England, Spain, Italy and Germany. In 2004 UEFA Champions League Final2004 he helped F.C. PortoPorto win the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, one of eight major trophies conquered with that club. He amassed Primeira Liga totals of 177 games and 31 goals over the course of seven seasons.
Maniche won 53 Cap (sport)caps for Portugal national football teamPortugal, representing the nation at UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 and the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and finishing runner-up in the former competition.

John Keeley.name: John Keeley
John Keeley.intro: '''John Henry Keeley''' (born 27 July 1961) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper in The Football League.

Daniele Daino.name: Daniele Daino
Daniele Daino.intro:
'''Daniele Daino''' (born 8 September 1979 in Alessandria) is an ItalyItalian association footballfootball player.
He has previously played for A.C. MilanAC Milan, S.S.C. NapoliNapoli, Perugia CalcioPerugia, A.C. AnconaAncona and Bologna F.C. 1909Bologna in Italy, as well as Derby County F.C.Derby County in England.
He was successively signed by Modena F.C.Modena on November 2008 as a free agent, after his contract with Bologna F.C. 1909Bologna expired.  He left Modena on June 2009, and joined newly promoted Gallipoli at the end of August.

Paul Stalteri.name: Paul Stalteri
Paul Stalteri.intro:
'''Paul Andrew Stalteri''' (born October 18, 1977) is a former Canadian association footballsoccer player who spent most of his professional career in Germany. He won the Double (association football)league and cup double with Werder Bremen in the 2003–04 Fußball-Bundesliga2003-04 season. Stalteri also played football in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Fulham F.C.Fulham.
A regular for the Canada men's national soccer teamCanadian national team, Stalteri made a national record 84 appearances at the senior level, scoring 7 goals. He was part of the squad that won the CONCACAF Gold Cup in 2000.
He announced his retirement from the game at the age of 35 on March 20, 2013.

Frank Nouble.name: Frank Nouble
Frank Nouble.intro: '''Frank Herman Nouble''' (born 24 September 1991) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Football League OneLeague One side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.  He started his career with the youth team at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea before signing for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.  While at West Ham, he was loaned to various clubs including Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City and Gillingham F.C.Gillingham.  Nouble made two appearances for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers before signing for Ipswich in 2013.  After 18 months at Ipswich he was loaned to Coventry and in January 2015 signed for the club on a free transfer.  Nouble has played international football for England at both under-17 and under-19 levels.

Matthew Upson.name: Matthew Upson
Matthew Upson.intro:
'''Matthew James Upson''' (born 18 April 1979) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He is a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender who played for England national football teamEngland at full international level including at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.
Upson started his career with Bedfordshire club Luton Town F.C.Luton Town before he joined Premiership side Arsenal F.C.Arsenal for a fee of £2 million in May 1997. Upson struggled to force his way into the first team at Arsenal StadiumHighbury making 57 appearances in 6 seasons and also spent time out on loan at Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Reading F.C.Reading.
Upson joined Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2003 where he enjoyed regular first team football. However following Birmingham's relegation in 2006 he went on to join West Ham United F.C.West Ham United for £7.5 million in January 2007. He was made captain in 2009 following the departure of Lucas Neill. At the end of the 2010–11 season West Ham were relegated to the Championship and Upson left after his contract had expired. Upson signed a two-year contract with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2011. After a loan spell with Brighton & Hove Albion in the 2012–13 season, he signed a one-year contract with the club in 2013.
Matthew Upson.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Gareth Ainsworth.name: Gareth Ainsworth
Gareth Ainsworth.intro:
'''Gareth Ainsworth''' (born 10 May 1973) is an English peopleEnglish former professional association footballfootballer who is manager at Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers.
A former youth player at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, the midfielder, who is known for his crossing ability, won a move to Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in 1992 after impressing at non-league Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria. He moved on to Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, who in turn loaned him back to Northwich Victoria. He returned to Preston North End in 1993, and established himself in the first team during his second spell at the club. Sold on to Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in October 1995 for a £25,000 fee, his performances at Lincoln earned him a place on the PFA Football League Third DivisionThird Division PFA Team of the YearTeam of the Year in 1996–97 Football League1996–97, and also won him a £500,000 move to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in September 1997. After being named as the Port Vale F.C. Player of the Year in 1998, he was sold on to Premier League Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon for £2 million in October 1998. He was dogged by injuries at the club, and following loan spells with Preston North End and Walsall F.C.Walsall, he moved on to Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City for a nominal fee in March 2003. He signed with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in June 2003, after went on to spent seven years with the club. During his time at QPR he helped the club to win promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in 2003–04 Football League2003–04, and twice served as caretaker-manager.
He joined Wycombe Wanderers in February 2010, following a short loan period. He was named in the PFA Football League TwoLeague Two Team of the Year in 2010–11 Football League2010–11, as Wycombe won promotion out of the division. He was appointed as the club's manager in November 2012, after a short period as caretaker-manager. He retired as a player to concentrate on his management duties in April 2013.

No\u00e9 Pamarot.name: Noé Pamarot
No\u00e9 Pamarot.intro: '''Louis Noé Pamarot''' (born 14 April 1979), more commonly known as '''Noé Pamarot''', is a French Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender. Before moving to Spain, Pamarot played for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in the Premier League. He is a right-footed defender who is also known for his great strength. Pamarot has previously played for FC MartiguesMartigues, OGC NiceNice and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and also had a brief loan spell at Portsmouth in the 1999–2000 season.
No\u00e9 Pamarot.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

John Spencer (Scottish footballer).name: John Spencer (Scottish footballer)
John Spencer (Scottish footballer).intro:
'''John Spencer''' (born 11 September 1970) is a Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer and coach.
As a player he was a Forward (association football)forward from 1988 until 2004, notably in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Everton F.C.Everton and the Scottish Premier League for Rangers F.C.Rangers and Motherwell F.C.Motherwell. He also played in his native country for Greenock Morton F.C.Morton, in Hong Kong for Lai Sun and back in England in the The Football LeagueFootball League with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He finished his career in the United States with a three-year spell with the Colorado Rapids. He also earned 14 caps for Scotland national football teamScotland. Since retiring in 2004, Spencer has remained in America, and was assistant coach of Houston Dynamo before becoming head coach of the Portland Timbers in 2011 until being relieved of his coaching position on 9 July 2012.

Carlton Cole.name: Carlton Cole
Carlton Cole.intro:
'''Carlton Michael George Cole Okirie''' (born 12 October 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer  who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a Forward (association football)striker.
Cole began his career at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2001, spending spells out on Loan (sports)loan at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa before being transferred to West Ham United in 2006. He made 19 England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 appearances (scoring six goals), and made his full international debut for the England national football teamEngland national team on 11 February 2009 in a friendly match against Spain national football teamSpain.

Scott Oakes.name: Scott Oakes
Scott Oakes.intro:
'''Scott Oakes''' (born 5 August 1972) is a former professional Association footballfootballer, best known from his time at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town in the early 1990s. Oakes began his career at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City but was transferred to Luton in 1991 as part of the deal that took Steve Thompson (footballer born 1964)Steve Thompson the opposite way.
At Luton, Oakes soon became a regular in the side, and a fan favourite, usually playing on the left wing. During his time at Kenilworth Road, he became regarded as one of the most promising players in English football, and was often rumoured as a target for bigger clubs. He was capped once for England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21.
In 1996, Oakes was signed by Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday for a £425,000 transfer fee. However, the move to the Owls would turn out disastrous. Following a spate of unfortunate injuries, Oakes spent most of his time on the sidelines in the 1996–97 season, and the following seasons he usually was not even on the bench due to a knee injury that cruelly dogged what had been a promising career at the age of just 25. In his four years at Hillsborough, Oakes started only seven games, scoring once against Sunderland,cite news
url=
title=Wednesday delighted by Carbone's craft
publisher=The Independent
date=23 November 1996 accessdate=8 March 2010
location=London
first=Mark
last=Pierson and in 1999–2000, his final season with the Owls, he did not feature for the first team at all.
In 2000, Oakes was released by Sheffield Wednesday and joined Burnley F.C.Burnley, and then moved to Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United a mere three months later. He finished his The Football LeagueFootball League career with a spell at Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient before signing for non-league St Albans City F.C.St Albans City in 2002.
In 2003, he signed for Shelbourne F.C. but only lasted three games due to the poor health of one of his children.
His younger brother Stefan Oakes is also a professional footballer.
His father is the musician Trevor Oakes, who performed with Showaddywaddy.
He now works teaching football to children in schools in Leicestershire and Bedfordshire.

Nicklas Helenius.name: Nicklas Helenius
Nicklas Helenius.intro: '''Nicklas Helenius Jensen''' (born 8 May 1991) is a DenmarkDanish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Striker (association football)striker for AaB FodboldAaB in the Danish Superliga on a loan from Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.

Steve Sedgley.name: Steve Sedgley
Steve Sedgley.intro:
'''Stephen Philip "Steve" Sedgley''' (born 26 May 1968 in London Borough of EnfieldEnfield) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, and football manager.
As a player he was a midfielder and a Defender (association football)defender. He was cap (sport)capped 11 times for England under-21 national football teamEngland at under-21 level.
