who made more than 450 appearances in the Football League and Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. He became manager of Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian in 2001, and later joined the coaching staff of Luton Town F.C.Luton Town.

Danny Pugh.name: Danny Pugh
Danny Pugh.intro:
'''Daniel Adam "Danny" Pugh''' (born 19 October 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
Pugh began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United where he made a handful of appearances before joining Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in the summer of 2004. Pugh spent two seasons at Elland Road before joining Preston North End F.C.Preston North End. Another two-year spell followed until he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in November 2007. He became a regular under Tony Pulis helping the club gain promotion in 2007–08 Stoke City F.C. season2007–08. He struggled to hold down a regular place in the side in the Premier League and had loan spells back at Preston and then Leeds where he joined permanently for a second time in January 2012. Pugh made 62 appearances in his second spell at Leeds and also played on loan at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 2012–13 Sheffield Wednesday F.C. season2012–13.

Orlando S\u00e1.name: Orlando Sá
Orlando S\u00e1.intro: '''Orlando Carlos Braga de Sá''' (born 26 May 1988) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Polish club Legia Warsaw as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.

Craig Short.name: Craig Short
Craig Short.intro: '''Craig Jonathan Short''' (born 25 June 1968 in Bridlington, in the East Riding of Yorkshire, England) is a former association footballfootball player who played as a Defender (association football)central-defender. He is currently first team coach at Blackburn Rovers.

Hermann Hrei\u00f0arsson.name: Hermann Hreiðarsson
Hermann Hrei\u00f0arsson.intro: '''Hermann Hreiðarsson''' (born 11 July 1974) is an IcelandersIcelandic Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back for Icelandic club Fylkir. He spent 15 seasons in England, gaining a total of 315 appearances in the English Premier League. Hermann was relegated from the Premier League five times, a record he holds jointly with Nathan Blake.
Hermann Hrei\u00f0arsson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Emiliano Ins\u00faa.name: Emiliano Insúa
Emiliano Ins\u00faa.intro:
'''Emiliano Adrián Insúa Zapata''' (born 7 January 1989) is an Argentine footballer who plays for Spanish club Rayo Vallecano, on loan from Atlético Madrid, as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
Insúa is a European Union citizen due to one of his grandparents being a Spanish citizen.
Emiliano Ins\u00faa.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Jos\u00e9 Bosingwa.name: José Bosingwa
Jos\u00e9 Bosingwa.intro:
'''José Bosingwa da Silva''' (born 24 August 1982), known as '''Bosingwa''', is a PortugalPortuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Turkish club Trabzonspor as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
An attacking fullback, his pace and ability to get up and down the flanks creates problems for the opposition. He spent most of his professional career with F.C. PortoPorto and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, winning 15 major titles both clubs combined, including the 2012 UEFA Champions League Final2012 Champions League with the latter.
A Portugal national football teamPortuguese international since 2007, Bosingwa represented the nation at UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008 and the Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2004 Olympics.
Jos\u00e9 Bosingwa.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Bernardo Corradi.name: Bernardo Corradi
Bernardo Corradi.intro:
'''Bernardo Corradi''' (born 30 March 1976) is an ItaliansItalian association footballfootballer. He has played in the highest leagues of Italy, Spain, and England, and has been without a club since leaving Montreal Impact of Major League Soccer in 2012. Corradi was a tall, strong striker who excelled in the air; during his prime, his playing style drew comparisons with that of Pierluigi Casiraghi.
He is a former Italy national football teamItalian international, with 13 caps and two goals from 2003 to 2004. Corradi represented his country at UEFA Euro 2004.

Alexis Nicolas.name: Alexis Nicolas
Alexis Nicolas.intro: '''Alexis Nicolas''' (born 13 February 1983) is an Anglo-Cypriot former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.

Paul Devlin.name: Paul Devlin
Paul Devlin.intro:
'''Paul John Devlin''' (born 14 April 1972 in Birmingham) is a Scotland national football teamScotland international professional association footballfootballer who plays for Northern Premier League Division One South side Romulus F.C.Romulus, where he plays as a midfielder.
Over his career, Devlin has made more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League.

Michael Meaker.name: Michael Meaker
Michael Meaker.intro: '''Michael Meaker''' (born 18 August 1971) is a WalesWelsh football (soccer)footballer who plays for Yate Town F.C.Yate Town in the Southern Football LeagueSouthern League South and West Division.

Karl Ready.name: Karl Ready
Karl Ready.intro: '''Karl Ready''' (born 14 August 1972 in Neath) is a Welsh peopleWelsh former professional Association footballfootballer and Wales national football teamWales international. During his career, he gained five Cap (sport)caps.

Cheikhou Kouyat\u00e9.name: Cheikhou Kouyaté
Cheikhou Kouyat\u00e9.intro:
'''Cheikhou Kouyaté''' (born 21 December 1989) is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who plays as a central midfielder for English club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. Kouyaté is a very physical player as he is known well for his pace and strength.
Kouyaté moved from Senegal to Belgium in 2006, having been offered a youth contract at RWDM Brussels FCBrussels. After breaking in to the first team, he went on to play just ten appearances before moving to Belgium team R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht aged 19. In June 2014, he joined West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He represented his country's national team at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics.

Santiago Vergini.name: Santiago Vergini
Santiago Vergini.intro: '''Santiago Vergini''' (born 3 August 1988) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland on loan from Estudiantes de la PlataEstudiantes, as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back.
Santiago Vergini.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mitchell Thomas.name: Mitchell Thomas
Mitchell Thomas.intro: '''Mitchell Thomas''' (born 2 October 1964 in Luton) is a retired EnglandEnglish football defender. While at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur he started in the 1987 FA Cup Final.

Robert Molenaar.name: Robert Molenaar
Robert Molenaar.intro:
'''Robert Molenaar''' (born 27 February 1969 in Zaandam, Noord-Holland) is a former professional association footballfootballer from the Netherlands. He played as a defender for FC Volendam, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and RBC Roosendaal.
He was signed for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United by the then manager George Graham (footballer)George Graham from FC Volendam for £1m in January 1997 to try to shore up the defence. He became a regular in the side until the end of the 1996-97 in English football1996–97 season. In the 1997-98 in English football1997–98 season however his performances were not up to scratch and he fell down the pecking order playing around half the matches. In 1998-99 in English football1998–99 he was once again a first choice centre-back, above David Wetherall but a challenge by Nicolas Anelka, then playing for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, kept him out via ligament damage until 2000.  He failed to make another appearance for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and was sold to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in the summer of 2000 to help their dog fight against relegation.  He stayed there until 2003, scoring twice against Newcastle Unitedcite web
url=
title=Magpies class outwits Bradford
publisher=BBC
date=16 December 2000 accessdate=10 March 2010 and Nottingham Forest,cite web
url=
title=Bradford 1-0 Nottm F
publisher=BBC
date=14 December 2002 accessdate=10 March 2010 when his contract was not renewed and he moved to RBC Roosendaal before eventually retiring in the summer of 2007.
While at Leeds he picked up the nickname ''"The Terminator"'' from the fans due to his bulky physique and height.

He is most notable for his spell playing for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in England between 1997 and 1999. He helped them reach three domestic cup finals as well as win promotion to the Premier League.
He earned 1 cap for Czechoslovakia national football teamCzechoslovakia on 16 June 1993 against the Faroe Islands national football teamFaroe Islands in a World Cup qualifier. Kinder then earned 38 caps for Slovakia national football teamSlovakia, scoring one goal in a 4-2 friendly win over Croatia national football teamCroatia on 20 April 1994.

Lo\u00efc R\u00e9my.name: Loïc Rémy
Lo\u00efc R\u00e9my.intro:
'''Loïc Rémy''' (born 2 January 1987) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the France national football teamFrance national team, primarily as a Forward (association football)striker. He was described by his former manager Didier Deschamps as "a young international who is fast and powerful with huge potential".
Born in Rillieux-la-Pape, Rhône, Rémy began his career playing for a local youth club in his home city of Lyon. In 1999, he joined the biggest club in the city, Olympique Lyonnais, and spent six years in the club's Olympique Lyonnais Reserves and Academyyouth academy. In 2005, he was promoted to the senior team and struggled to establish himself in three seasons under managers Gérard Houllier and Alain Perrin. In 2008, he was loaned out to RC Lens and, after a successful stint, was purchased by OGC Nice ahead of the 2008–09 Ligue 12008–09 season. With Nice, Rémy flourished in the lead striker role scoring over 25 goals in his two years with the club. In 2010, after enduring interest from several clubs domestically and abroad, Rémy joined the 2009–10 Ligue 1defending champions Olympique de MarseilleMarseille on a five-year contract. The transfer had initially been put on hold due to medical issues. He moved abroad for the first time to join Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in January 2013, but could not prevent their relegation. The following season he remained in the Premier League on loan at Newcastle United. He signed for Chelsea  for £10.5 million in the summer of 2014.
Rémy is a former France national under-20 football teamFrance under-20 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 international. He earned his first cap for the France national football teamsenior team  in June 2009 against Nigeria national football teamNigeria and played at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Jonny Howson.name: Jonny Howson
Jonny Howson.intro:
'''Jonathan Mark "Jonny" Howson'''  (born 21 May 1988) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Centre midfieldercentral midfielder for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. A graduate of Leeds United F.C.Leeds United's youth system, he previously served as the club's Captain (association football)captain.
Howson was born in Morley, West YorkshireMorley and started his professional career at Leeds United. He was the longest serving player at the club, having served under four different managers and making 225 appearances since he made his debut in the Football League CupLeague Cup in September 2006.
In April 2008, United manager Gary McAllister awarded the captaincy to a nineteen year-old Howson for the league game against Millwall F.C.Millwall, making him the youngest player to captain the club since Billy Bremner led the side from the mid 1960s. Since 2010, he has regularly captained the side in the absence of Richard Naylor. In July 2011, Howson was made the permanent captain of Leeds United.

Jonathan Hogg.name: Jonathan Hogg
Jonathan Hogg.intro: '''Jonathan Lee Hogg''' (born 6 December 1988) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town as a central midfielder. He previously played for Watford F.C.Watford and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, and spent periods on loan at Darlington F.C.Darlington and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth.

Chris Smalling.name: Chris Smalling
Chris Smalling.intro:
'''Christopher Lloyd "Chris" Smalling''' (born 22 November 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the England national football teamEngland national team.
During his youth, Smalling played for the Millwall F.C.Millwall academy before joining local non-league side Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United. He was selected for the Kent Schools Under-16 squad in 2005 before progressing to the Under-18s in 2007, and his performances for Kent Schools resulted in him being selected to play for the English Schools Football AssociationEngland Schools Under-18 squad in 2008. During this time Smalling had also established himself in the Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United first team, and his impressive displays for club and country led to him signing a two-year deal with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in May 2008.
Barely a month after signing for Middlesbrough however, Smalling had his contract with the club terminated after raising concerns with home sickness. Shortly after, in June 2008, he signed for Premier League side Fulham F.C.Fulham. He made his professional debut with them in May 2009 in the final game of the 2008–09 Premier League2008–09 season and helped them reach the 2010 UEFA Europa League Final2010 Europa League final the following season.
In January 2010, Smalling signed a pre-contract agreement with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and joined them officially on 1 July. He made his competitive debut in the 2010 FA Community Shield2010 Community Shield victory over Chelsea F.C.Chelsea which earned him his first career medal. Since his debut, he has gone on to make more than 50 appearances for the club.
Smalling has represented England at various levels and is currently a member of the England senior squad. He played for the England Schools Under-18 team in early 2008 before making his debut for the England national under-20 football teamUnder-20 side and the England national under-21 football teamUnder-21 side in 2009. He made his debut for the England national football teamEngland senior squad in the 3–0 win over Bulgaria on 2 September 2011.

Dwight Gayle.name: Dwight Gayle
Dwight Gayle.intro: '''Dwight Devon Boyd Gayle''' (born 17 October 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a Forward (association football)striker. Gayle began his career in the Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal Academy, after being released by the club as a teenager he dropped down to the 9th tier of English football joining Stansted F.C.Stansted of the Essex Senior League. Over the following seasons, Gayle worked his way back up the English football league systemEnglish football pyramid via stints at Bishop's Stortford F.C.Bishop's Stortford, Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.Dagenham & Redbridge and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United before establishing himself in the Premier League with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.

Joe Bennett.name: Joe Bennett
Joe Bennett.intro: '''Joseph "Joe" Bennett''' (born 28 March 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. Born and brought up in Rochdale, Bennett signed his first professional contract with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough prior to the 2008–09 season and is comfortable playing anywhere on the left, although he usually operates as a left-back. He completed his move to Aston Villa on 29 August 2012 for an undisclosed fee. He has been capped at England national under-19 football teamU-19, England national under-20 football teamU-20 and England national under-21 football teamU-21 for England.

David N'Gog.name: David N'Gog

'''David N'Gog''' (born 1 April 1989) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Stade de Reims.
N'Gog started his career with French Ligue 1 club Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain. He made his senior debut in 2006 and in 2008 won the Coupe de la Ligue Final 2008Coupe de la Ligue. English Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool signed him at the start of the 2008-09 Liverpool F.C. season2008–09 season. After three years he moved to fellow Premier League club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, but was relegated with them after just one season.
N'Gog is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international, having earned caps at all youth levels. However, he is also eligible to represent Cameroon national football teamCameroon, by way of his father, and has been approached by Cameroon to make the switch.

As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1986 until 2000, notably for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in the Premier League, and in the Football League with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Bury F.C.Bury, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Halifax Town F.C.Halifax Town. He finished his career with Non-league Altrincham F.C.Altrincham.

Fabian Delph.name: Fabian Delph
Fabian Delph.intro:
'''Fabian Delph''' (born 21 November 1989) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and the England national football teamEngland national team.
He was on the books of Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City as a youngster until he moved to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United aged 11. Having played  45 games for Leeds at Football League OneLeague One level and once in the Championship, he transferred to Premier League side Aston Villa in August 2009 for £6 million. In 2012, he returned to Leeds United for a short loan spell. Delph had a successful start to the 2012–13 Premier League season, leading Aston Villa manager Paul Lambert to call for his inclusion in the England squad.
Delph has represented his country at  under-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level and made his senior debut in a friendly against Norway national football teamNorway on 3 September 2014.

Alan McDonald (association football).name: Alan McDonald (association football)
Alan McDonald (association football).intro: '''Alan McDonald''' (12 October 1963 – 23 June 2012) was a Northern Ireland footballer and manager. As a player, he spent most of his career in England with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, as well as having short spells with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town. He was capped 52 times for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland and played at the 1986 FIFA World Cup in Mexico. After retiring as a player, he managed IFA Premiership side Glentoran F.C.Glentoran from June 2007 until his resignation at the end of February 2010. McDonald collapsed and died whilst playing golf at the Temple Golf Club near Lisburn on 23 June 2012.
Alan McDonald (association football).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

He is predominantly a left-footed player.Cox, Michael (22 August 2013). [
A Spain national football teamSpanish international since the age of 20, he was an integral member of the squads that won three consecutive international tournaments — UEFA Euro 2008, 2010 FIFA World Cup, and UEFA Euro 2012.

He has previously played for Crystal Palace where competed for his position with Jonathan Parr, but due to Parr's injury, he was Palace's first choice left-back.

Prior to his appointment at Hartlepool, Cooper was part of the Middlesbrough coaching staff after leaving his role of assistant manager at Bradford City.

Michael Keane (footballer, born 1993).name: Michael Keane (footballer, born 1993)

Keane has represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at Republic of Ireland national under-17 football teamU17 and England national football teamEngland at England national under-20 football teamU20 and England national under-21 football teamU21 levels and was named as Manchester United F.C. Reserves and AcademyManchester United's Reserve Player of the Year in 2012. His twin brother, Will KeaneWill, is also a footballer, playing for Manchester United as a striker.

Mark Gower.name: Mark Gower
Mark Gower.intro: '''Mark Gower''' (born 5 October 1978) is an English association footballfootballer who currently plays for Ebbsfleet United F.C.Ebbsfleet United.

Ross Turnbull.name: Ross Turnbull
Ross Turnbull.intro: '''Ross Turnbull''' (born 4 January 1985) is an English association footballfootballer, who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.

Lee Dixon.name: Lee Dixon
Lee Dixon.intro:
'''Lee Michael Dixon''' (born 17 March 1964) is a retired English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (football)right-back for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Bury F.C.Bury, Chester City F.C.Chester City and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City as well as the England national football teamEngland national team.
A childhood Manchester City F.C.Manchester City fan, Dixon began his footballing career as a youth at Burnley F.C.Burnley, making his professional debut for them in 1982. From there he played for Chester City F.C.Chester City and Bury F.C.Bury before joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in 1986 for a fee of £50,000. He instantly impressed at Stoke and forged a fine defensive partnership with Steve Bould. The pair's potential and performances attracted the attention of Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and in January 1988 they both joined the "Gunners" for a combined fee of £765,000.
The following season, as Dixon cemented his place in the team, Arsenal won their first league title in eighteen years in a dramatic Liverpool 0–2 Arsenal (26 May 1989)final game of the season. A defensive mainstay in a successful Arsenal team until his retirement in 2002, Dixon's tenure at Arsenal saw him collect four league championship medals, three FA Cup winner's medals and a UEFA Cup Winners' Cup medal. He was named in the PFA Team of the Year twice, for the seasons 1989–90 and 1990–91. His retirement came at the end of Arsenal's Double (association football)#Englanddomestic double-winning 2001–02 season, their second in his time at the club. At the time of his retirement, he had played at 91 out of the 92 The Football LeagueFootball League grounds – every one except Fulham F.C.Fulham's Craven Cottage.
At international level, Dixon was capped 22 times for England national football teamEngland, scoring once.
Since his playing retirement, Dixon has worked as a football Pundit (expert)pundit and columnist. He began his television career working for the BBC, primarily on their ''Match of the Day'' and ''Football Focus'' programmes, then moved to ITV Sport in July 2012.  Starting in 2013, he will provide commentary alongside Arlo White for NBC's Premier League coverage in the United States.

Paul Stewart (footballer, born 1964).name: Paul Stewart (footballer, born 1964)
Paul Stewart (footballer, born 1964).intro: '''Paul Andrew Stewart''' (born 7 October 1964) is an EnglandEnglish former professional footballer who played top division football for Manchester City, Tottenham Hotspur and Liverpool, and was capped three times at senior level for England national football teamEngland in the early 1990s, also winning the FA Cup with Tottenham Hotspur.

Guy Whittingham.name: Guy Whittingham

Having started his career with non-league Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town he went on to play in the Football League for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Watford F.C.Watford, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. He amassed over 450 appearances throughout his career.

Nick Proschwitz.name: Nick Proschwitz

He began his career in Football in GermanyGermany and Football in SwitzerlandSwitzerland, before moving to Football in EnglandEngland to join Hull City A.F.C.Hull City in 2012.

Hal Robson-Kanu.name: Hal Robson-Kanu
Hal Robson-Kanu.intro:
'''Thomas Henry Alex "Hal" Robson-Kanu''' (born 21 May 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Reading F.C.Reading as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Robson-Kanu started his career as a schoolboy at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal but was released at 15 and joined Reading F.C.Reading. After graduating from the Academy in 2007 he spent time on loan at Southend United F.C.Southend United and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town before returning to Reading and making his first team debut in 2009. Limited to mainly substitute appearances during his first season, he became an important member of the squad appearing regularly during the 2011–12 Football League ChampionshipChampionship winning campaign. He made his Premier League debut in 2012 and has since gone on to make over 100 appearances for the club.
At international level Robson-Kanu initially represented the country of his birth, England, at England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level. In 2010 he switched allegiance to Wales, the country of his grandmother, playing for the Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 side before his debut for the Wales national football teamsenior team against Croatia national football teamCroatia on 23 May that year. He scored his first senior international goal against Scotland national football teamScotland in March 2013 and his second against Cyprus national football teamCyprus in October 2014.

Sammy Ameobi.name: Sammy Ameobi
Sammy Ameobi.intro:
'''Samuel Oluwaseyi J. "Sammy" Ameobi''' (born 1 May 1992) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as a winger (sports)winger. He is the younger brother of fellow players Shola AmeobiShola and Tomi Ameobi.
Born in England, Ameobi was capped by England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level before switching his allegiance to Nigeria national football teamNigeria in August 2014.

Christopher Wreh.name: Christopher Wreh
Christopher Wreh.intro:
'''Christopher Wreh''' (born 14 May 1975, in Monrovia) is a retired Liberia national football teamLiberian international association footballfootballer. He was a member of the Arsenal F.C.Arsenal side which won the Premier League and FA Cup double in 1997–98 Arsenal F.C. season1997–98.
He won 36 caps for Liberia national football teamLiberia, scoring 11 goals, and was in their squad for the 1996 Africa Cup of Nations.

Liam Daish.name: Liam Daish
Liam Daish.intro:
'''Liam Sean Daish''' (born 23 September 1968) is a former association footballfootball player who played as a defender (association football)centre-half. Despite being born in England, Daish played internationally for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland due to his Irish ancestry. He earned a total of five cap (sport)caps for his adopted country.
Although Daish's playing career was shortened by a knee injury in 2002, he continued his football career as a manager and coach. He was appointed Nuneaton Town F.C.Nuneaton Town manager on 22 September 2014, replacing Brian Reid.

Ian Evatt.name: Ian Evatt
Ian Evatt.intro:
'''Ian Ross Evatt''' (born 19 November 1981) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield.
He began his professional career in 1999 at Derby County F.C.Derby County and has also played for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town (on loan), Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Simeon Jackson.name: Simeon Jackson
Simeon Jackson.intro:
'''Simeon Alexander Jackson''' (born 28 March 1987) is a Canadian international soccer player who plays for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.  He has spent the majority of his career playing in England, relocating from Mississauga, OntarioMississauga, Ontario, to South London as a teenager to pursue his interest in soccer.  Following a rejection by Gillingham F.C.Gillingham after a trial, he played semi-professionally before making his name with Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds of the Football Conference. His goalscoring feats for the club earned him a move to Gillingham, then of Football League Two, in 2008. He scored the winning goal for the club in the 2009 Football League Two play-off Final at Wembley Stadium.
In 2010 Jackson was transferred to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, then of the Football League Championship, and scored the goal that clinched Norwich's promotion to the Premier League the following year.  He fell out of favour at the club during the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 season, however, and opted to join German club Eintracht Braunschweig who were newly promoted to the Bundesliga.  Desiring regular playing time, his contract with the German club was mutually terminated in January 2014 and he returned to England.
Jackson has played for the Canada men's national soccer teamCanadian national team since 2009.  During qualification for the 2014 FIFA World Cup he scored a hat-trick against Saint Lucia national football teamSaint Lucia.

Tony Vidmar.name: Tony Vidmar
Tony Vidmar.intro: '''Antony "Tony" Vidmar''' (born 4 July 1970 in Adelaide) is an Australian former Association footballfootball (soccer) player and coach. He was a member of the Australia national football teamAustralian national team, competed at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona for his native country, and is currently Australia's third highest capped player. His brother Aurelio Vidmar was also an Australian football player.

Ben Alnwick.name: Ben Alnwick
Ben Alnwick.intro:
'''Benjamin Robert "Ben" Alnwick''' (born 1 January 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United.
Alnwick started his career at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2004, having progressed through the club's youth ranks, but never fully established himself in the first team. He left for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in January 2007, having made 19 league appearances, but never made more than a single league appearance for Tottenham. Instead, he spent several loan spells away from the club, at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient. He switched permanently to Barnsley in July 2012, and made 12 appearances, but was deemed surplus to requirements in September 2013, and his contract was terminated by mutual consent.
Alnwick has represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-18 football teamunder-18, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, but has yet to represent the full international side.

Chris Morris.name: Chris Morris
Chris Morris.intro: '''Christopher "Chris" B. Morris''' (born 24 December 1963 in Newquay, Cornwall, England) is a former professional Association footballfootballer who made his name as a defender with Celtic F.C.Celtic in Scotland and Sheffield Wednesday & Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in England, among others. Morris also had a successful playing career with the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national side during the Jack Charlton era.

Jovan Kirovski.name: Jovan Kirovski
Jovan Kirovski.intro: '''Jovan Kirovski''' () (born March 18, 1976 in Escondido, California) is a former United StatesAmerican association footballsoccer player who is currently an assistant coach for Los Angeles Galaxy in Major League Soccer.

Imre Varadi.name: Imre Varadi
Imre Varadi.intro: '''Imre Varadi''' (born 8 July 1959) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer of Hungarian origin, known as a Journeyman (sports)journeyman forward (association football)forward who appeared for 16 different clubs at all levels of professional football in England.

Glen Little.name: Glen Little
Glen Little.intro: '''Glen Matthew Little''' (born 15 October 1975) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic. Born in Wimbledon, London he also previously played for Burnley F.C.Burnley, Derry City F.C.Derry City, Glentoran F.C.Glentoran, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Wrexham F.C.Wrexham and Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town. He has also appeared in the Premier League for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Reading F.C.Reading and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth.

Martin Brittain.name: Martin Brittain
Martin Brittain.intro: '''Martin Brittain''' (born 29 December 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer, who plays for Bedlington Terriers F.C.Bedlington Terriers.

Nathan Ellington.name: Nathan Ellington
Nathan Ellington.intro:
'''Nathan Levi Fontaine Ellington''' (born 2 July 1981) is a free agent EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker.
Ellington started his playing career with non-League side Tooting & Mitcham United F.C.Tooting & Mitcham United. Having played once for the club, he switched to Walton & Hersham F.C.Walton & Hersham in 1997, and remained there for two years, before signing for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers in February 1999. He played for Bristol Rovers in 116 league games, before switching to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in March 2002. He made 134 league appearances for Wigan before joining Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in 2005. Although he made 68 league appearances for the club, he struggled to settle in the area, and moved to Watford F.C.Watford in 2007. During his time at Watford, he spent three loan spells away from the club; at Derby County F.C.Derby County during the 2008–2009 season, Skoda Xanthi F.C.Skoda Xanthi in 2010, and Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in 2011. Having made 55 league appearances for Watford, he switched to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in June 2011, but once again struggled to break into the first team, and spent the start of the 2012–13 season on loan to Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. Having cancelled his Ipswich contract by mutual consent, he joined Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra in March 2013, and made eight league appearances. He was released in July 2013 after his contract expired. He signed for Southport F.C.Southport on October 2013, but was released two months later.

Fran M\u00e9rida.name: Fran Mérida
Fran M\u00e9rida.intro:
'''Francisco "Fran" Mérida Pérez''' (; born 4 March 1990) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for SD Huesca as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
He signed at the age of 17 with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal from FC BarcelonaBarcelona, but only appeared in 16 official games over the course of three seasons with the club. Subsequently he returned to his country with Atlético Madrid, where he also featured sparingly before leaving in 2012.

Marcos Rojo.name: Marcos Rojo
Marcos Rojo.intro:
'''Faustino Marcos Alberto Rojo''' known simply as '''Marcos Rojo''' (; born 20 March 1990) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team as a Defender (association football)defender.
He began his career at local club Estudiantes de La Plata, where he won the Copa Libertadores in 2009 and played in the 2009 FIFA Club World Cup FinalClub World Cup Final later that year. After a short spell with FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow he joined Sporting CP in 2012, and transferred to Manchester United F.CManchester United for £16 million two years later.
Rojo made his first appearance for Argentina at senior level in 2011 and has since earned over 25 caps. He was part of their side which reached the 2014 FIFA World Cup Final, and was the only Argentine included in the Castrol Performance Index Team of the Tournament.
Marcos Rojo.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Michael Owen.name: Michael Owen
Michael Owen.intro:
'''Michael James Owen''' (born 14 December 1979) is a former English association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City as well as the England national football teamEngland national team. He is a regular pundit on BT Sport football coverage and sometimes appears on BBC's ''Match of the Day'' as a pundit. Since retiring from football he has become a successful racehorse breeder and owner.
The son of former footballer Terry Owen, Owen was born in Chester and began his senior career at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 1996. He progressed through the Liverpool youth team and scored on his debut in May 1997. In his first full season in the Premier League he finished as joint top scorer with 18 goals. He repeated this the following year and was Liverpool's top goal scorer from 1997–2004 and gained his name as a proven goal scorer, despite a recurring hamstring injury. In 2000–01 Liverpool F.C. season2001, Liverpool won a cup Treble (association football)treble of the UEFA Cup, FA Cup and Football League Cup, and Owen was the recipient of the Ballon d'Or 2001Ballon d'Or. He went on to score 118 goals in 216 appearances in the Premier League for Liverpool, and 158 goals in 297 total appearances. Regarded as one of the greatest Liverpool players, Owen came 14th in the "100 Players Who Shook The Kop" – an official Liverpool fan poll.[
Owen moved to Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid for £8 million in mid-2004; he was frequently used as a substitute (football)substitute. He scored 13 goals in La Liga before returning to England the following season where he joined Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for £16 million. After a promising start to the 2005–06 season, injuries largely ruled him out over the next 18 months. After his return he became team Captain (association football)captain and was the team's top scorer for the 2007–08 Newcastle United F.C. season2007–08 season. Newcastle were relegated in the 2008–09 Newcastle United F.C. season2008–09 season and Owen moved to Manchester United as a free agent. He spent three years at Old Trafford before joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in September 2012. Owen is one of seven players to have scored List of Premier League players with 100 or more goals150 or more goals in the Premier League.
Internationally, Owen first played for the senior England team in 1998, becoming England's youngest player and youngest goalscorer at the time. His performance at the 1998 FIFA World Cup brought him to national and international prominence and he went on to score in UEFA Euro 2000, the 2002 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2004. He is the only player to have scored in four major tournaments for England. He played at the 2006 FIFA World Cup but suffered an injury which took him a year to recover from. Occasionally playing as captain, he is England's eleventh most-capped player and has scored a former national record (since overtaken by Wayne Rooney) of 26 competitive goals, with 40 in total from 89 appearances, most recently in 2008.
Owen's long injury absence after the 2006 World Cup resulted in a dispute between FIFA, The Football Association and Newcastle United, and eventually resulted in an unprecedented £10m compensation award to Newcastle, and brought changes to the compensation arrangements between club and country regarding injuries sustained by contracted club players while on international duty.

Alan Harper.name: Alan Harper
Alan Harper.intro:
'''Alan Harper''' (born 1 November 1960 in Liverpool) is an English former professional Association footballfootball player who played in the Football League and Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Luton Town, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. Harper is best remembered for playing in the Football League First DivisionChampionship winning Everton side of the mid-1980s.
Harper was a utility player whose first-choice position was right-back but he could perform competently in almost any position on the park and he frequently turned up in central defence, at left-back, centre midfield, wide midfield and sometimes even as a makeshift striker. Perhaps partially as a result of his great versatility however, he often found himself used as a squad player rather than as a first-team regular at many of the clubs he played for. He is remembered as a largely unspectacular but solid and reliable performer who very rarely made a mistake. Harper scored few goals but many of those he did score were spectacular efforts, often from long range. Everton fans nicknamed him 'Bertie Bassett' because he played in 'allsorts of positions'.
Harper started out at Liverpool F.C. in the late 1970s, the club he had supported as a boy, but he never made a first team appearance for Liverpool before Howard Kendall took him across Stanley Park, LiverpoolStanley Park to Everton in the summer of 1983 for £100,000. Harper initially became first choice right-back but after a few months he lost his place to Gary M. StevensGary Stevens, who went on to become an England national football teamEngland international. From then on, Harper never really held down a regular first team place at Goodison ParkGoodison but like Kevin Richardson (footballer)Kevin Richardson, he became a vital squad player, filling in for various positions on the park when first-teamers were injured and frequently appearing as a substitute. During his first season, Harper scored a spectacular goal against his previous club Liverpool in the Merseyside derby at Goodison. Everton went on that season to finish runners-up to Liverpool in the Football League CupLeague Cup before winning the FA Cup at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley in May, beating Graham Taylor (footballer)Graham Taylor's Watford F.C.Watford 2-0. Harper was an unused substitute at Wembley and he received a cup winners medal as a result.
The following season, 1984/85, Everton won the League Championship and the UEFA Cup Winners' Cup as well as finishing runners-up in the FA Cup to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. This was the most successful season in Everton's history and Harper played an important role as a squad player - he received both a Championship winners medal and Cup Winners' Cup medal (again he was an unused substitute in the final). Everton were not allowed to contest the following season's UEFA Champions League due to the ban on English clubs entering European competition after the Heysel Stadium disaster involving Liverpool F.C.
The following year Everton were runners-up to rivals Liverpool in both the League Championship and the FA Cup - Harper came on as a substitute in the FA Cup semi-final against Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and scored Everton's opening goal with an audacious lob from outside the area. Then in 1986/87, Everton reclaimed the league title and Harper received his second Championship medal after playing in the majority of Everton's games due to an injury crisis in the first half of the season. Harper scored a vital and spectacular winner at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea during the title run-in.
Howard Kendall then left Everton to join Athletic Bilbao and a year later in 1988 Harper left Everton for Sheffield Wednesday in search of regular first-team football. Wednesday paid £275,000 for Harper's services but after a fairly unremarkable spell at Hillsborough StadiumHillsborough, he rejoined Howard Kendall at his new club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in December 1989 for a fee of £150,000 and he became City's regular right-back. Kendall returned to Everton the following autumn and in the summer of 1991 he took Harper back to Goodison for £200,000. After two more seasons with the Toffees, Harper left top-flight football to play for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town in 1993 and a year later he joined Burnley F.C.Burnley. After two seasons at Turf Moor, Harper retired from professional football.
After retirement, Harper went back to Everton once more in the early 2000s as a youth coach, spending several years there before leaving in 2005.
In November 2007 he was employed as a scout by Premier League side Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers who were looking for a number of ex-professionals to head their recruitment drive led by former Everton F.C.Everton manager Colin Harvey.
In October 2010 he left Bolton to join first club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and was given a senior role under then Reds manager Roy Hodgson.
Alan Harper.position: full back  football  full back,central defender,central midfielder

Kevin Campbell.name: Kevin Campbell
Kevin Campbell.intro:
'''Kevin Joseph Campbell''' (born 4 February 1970) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a striker from 1988 until 2007, most notably in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Everton F.C.Everton and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.
He has also played in the TurkeyTurkish top flight for Trabzonspor and in the Football League for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Simon Ireland.name: Simon Ireland
Simon Ireland.intro: '''Simon Piers Ireland''' (born 23 November 1971 in Barnstaple) was a professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder for Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers & Boreham Wood F.C.Boreham Wood.

Kepa Blanco.name: Kepa Blanco
Kepa Blanco.intro:
'''Kepa Blanco González''', simply known as '''Kepa''' (born 13 January 1984), is a Spanish retired professional Association footballerfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
He was best known for his spell with Sevilla FCSevilla, for which he appeared in 58 competitive games and scored 14 goals, winning four major titles including two UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cups. In La Liga he also represented Getafe CFGetafe, amassing totals of 61 matches and 11 goals during six seasons.

Marlon King.name: Marlon King
Marlon King.intro:
'''Marlon Francis King''' (born 26 April 1980) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker. He is currently serving an 18-month jail sentence following a conviction for dangerous driving in May 2014.
Born in Dulwich, London he started his career in non-League football with Dulwich Hamlet F.C.Dulwich Hamlet, he played for Barnet F.C.Barnet, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest before moving to Watford F.C.Watford in 2005. At Watford he was the Football League Championship top scorer, and was voted Watford player of the season as the club earned promotion to the Premier League. King joined Wigan Athletic in 2008, and subsequently spent loan spells at Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. He joined Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in September 2010, following his release from prison, and made 29 appearances for the club before controversially switching to Birmingham City in June 2011. He made 79 appearances for Birmingham, before suffering a series of injuries during the 2012–13 Birmingham City F.C. season2012–13 season that prevented him from playing again, leaving the club in August 2013 by mutual consent. King has also played and scored for the Jamaica national football teamJamaican national team.
King has served three jail sentences, and has a number of other criminal convictions including: theft from a person and from a car, criminal damage, and attempting to obtain property by deception; fraudulent use of vehicle licence document, driving without insurance, speeding, drink driving; a wounding incident while playing amateur football, and two cases involving assault of young women rejecting his advances in the Soho area of London. King had his playing contract cancelled by Wigan after being convicted of the sexual assault charges and being sentenced to eighteen months in prison.

Micky Cummins.name: Micky Cummins
Micky Cummins.intro:
'''Michael Thomas''' "'''Micky'''" '''Cummins''' (born 1 June 1978) is an Irish footballer who plays and coaches for Gateshead F.C.Gateshead. He has also appeared for the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland under-21 team and played all of Ireland's five games at the 1997 FIFA World Youth Championship.
He started his career with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 1996, where he stayed for four years. In 2000, he moved on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, and made over 250 appearances for the club in a six-year stay, picking up a Football League TrophyLeague Trophy winners medal in 2001 Football League Trophy Final2001. Between 2006 and 2008 he was signed to Darlington F.C.Darlington, and in 2008 he joined Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United. Two years later he transferred to Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, before he joined Gateshead in May 2011.

Jordan Bowery.name: Jordan Bowery
Jordan Bowery.intro:
'''Jordan Nathaniel Bowery''' (born 2 July 1991) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, as a Forward (association football)#strikerstriker.
After beginning his career with Derby County F.C.Derby County, Bowery had an extended spell at Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, coming through their youth team to make over 100 appearances in all competitions for them. While with Chesterfield he also had a short loan spell with Barrow A.F.C.Barrow. Bowery moved to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 2012; in 2014 he had a short loan spell with Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. He moved to current club Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United in 2014.

Henrik Pedersen.name: Henrik Pedersen
Henrik Pedersen.intro: '''Henrik Pedersen''' (born 10 June 1975 in Kjellerup, Denmark) is a retired Danish association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker for Silkeborg IF, Bolton Wanderers F.C. and Hull City FC. He played three games for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team.

Diego Trist\u00e1n.name: Diego Tristán
Diego Trist\u00e1n.intro:
'''Diego Tristán Herrera''' (born 5 January 1976) is a Spanish retired professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
At his peak, he was considered amongst the best players in his position in Europe, displaying a vast array of skills: dribble, shot accuracy, aerial ability and off-the-ball movements. He is best known for his Deportivo de La Coruña spell, where he spent six years, often overshadowed by physical and personal problems.[
Over the course of eight La Liga seasons, Tristán amassed totals of 227 games and 95 goals. He appeared with the Spain national football teamSpanish national team at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup.

Bryan Small.name: Bryan Small
Bryan Small.intro:
'''Bryan Small''' (born 15 November 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer who played in Defender (association football)defence.
He started out as a trainee at his hometown club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and played for a total of 11 clubs in a series of free transfers and loan deals. Small played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Bury F.C.Bury, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Walsall F.C.Walsall. At international level he was cap (sports)capped 12 times for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team.

Gavin Mahon.name: Gavin Mahon
Gavin Mahon.intro:
'''Gavin Andrew Mahon''' (born 2 January 1977) is an English Association footballfootballer who most recently played for Conference National side Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, where he played as a midfielder
Mahon started his career as a trainee at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, although did not make any first-team appearances for the club. In July 1996, he joined Hereford United F.C.Hereford United on a free transfer, and went on to play two-and-a-half years of regular first-team football. Mahon signed for Brentford F.C.Brentford in November 1998, for a fee that rose to £130,000. He helped the club earn promotion from Division Three during the 1998–99 in English football1998–99 campaign, and went on to make over 150 appearances for the west London side. He joined Watford F.C.Watford for £150,000 in March 2002, and would later captain the club to promotion into the Premier League. Mahon then signed for another Football League ChampionshipChampionship side in the form of Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers ahead of the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season, following a successful Loan (sports)loan spell the previous season. Injuries hampered the latter stages of his QPR career, and he was briefly loaned out to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in March 2011, although did not making any appearances for the club. Mahon signed for Notts County on a free transfer in August 2011. He was loaned to Stevenage in February 2013, for the remainder of the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 campaign.

Junior Stanislas.name: Junior Stanislas
Junior Stanislas.intro:
'''Felix Junior Stanislas''' (born 26 November 1989), more commonly known as '''Junior Stanislas''' is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth as a Winger (soccer)winger.
He started his career in the youth team of West Ham United F.C.West Ham United at the age of 10 in 2000. He signed a three-year academy contract in the summer of 2006, playing regularly for the under-18 side and reserves. In November 2008, he joined Football League One side Southend United F.C.Southend United on a six-week loan. He made his first-team debut for West Ham in March 2009, at the age of 19. He signed a three-and-a-half-year contract in April 2009. In August 2011, he joined Football League Championship side Burnley F.C.Burnley on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee. In June 2014 he signed for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth on a free transfer.

Richard Ord.name: Richard Ord
Richard Ord.intro: '''Richard Ord''' (born 3 March 1970) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender.

Lee Hendrie.name: Lee Hendrie
Lee Hendrie.intro:
'''Lee Andrew Hendrie''' (born 18 May 1977) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Basford United F.C.Basford United.
Born  in Birmingham, Hendrie started his career at Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa where he spent fourteen years. He also played for the England national under-21 teamEngland U21s and earned one full cap for England national football teamEngland in 1998. He has also played in Football League for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. Following a spell in Indonesia with Bandung F.C.Bandung he has since become a Journeyman (sports)journeyman in non-league football, playing for Daventry Town F.C.Daventry Town, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, Chasetown F.C.Chasetown, Redditch United F.C.Redditch United, Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, Corby Town F.C.Corby Town and Highgate United F.C.Highgate United.

Hern\u00e1n Crespo.name: Hernán Crespo
Hern\u00e1n Crespo.intro:
'''Hernán Jorge Crespo''' (; born 5 July 1975) is a retired ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootballer, who scored over 300 goals in a career spanning 19 years. At international level, Crespo scored 35 goals and is Argentina national football team#Top goalscorersArgentina's third highest goalscorer behind only Gabriel Batistuta and Lionel Messi. He played in three FIFA World Cups: 1998 FIFA World Cup1998, 2002 FIFA World Cup2002, 2006 FIFA World Cup2006.
At club level, Crespo was the List of most expensive association football transfersworld's most expensive player when he was bought by S.S. LazioLazio from Parma A.C.Parma in 2000 for €56 million (£35.5m).[
His awards include three Serie A ''scudetti'', a Copa Libertadores de AméricaCopa Libertadores, a Premier League title and an Olympic Games silver medal. In 2004 he was named by Pelé in the FIFA 100 list of the world's greatest living players. Crespo never received a red card during his career.

Scott Sinclair.name: Scott Sinclair
Scott Sinclair.intro: '''Scott Andrew Sinclair''' (born 25 March 1989) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa on loan from Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. Sinclair plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, having previously played for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He represented England at youth level, from the England national under-17 football teamunder-17s to the England national under-21 football teamunder-21s, and also played for Great Britain national football teamGreat Britain at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics.

Graham Fenton.name: Graham Fenton
Graham Fenton.intro:
'''Graham Anthony Fenton''' (born 22 May 1974 in Whitley Bay, Tyne and Wear) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and manager (association football)manager of North Shields F.C.North Shields.
As a player he played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder, notably played in the Premier League for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, as well as in the Football League for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Darlington F.C.Darlington. He also spent a year in Scotland with St. Mirren F.C.St. Mirren before later playing for Non-league Blyth Spartans F.C.Blyth Spartans. He was also capped once by England national football teamEngland at under-21 level. He took over as manager of North Shields F.C.North Shields on 6 April 2012.

Trond Andersen.name: Trond Andersen
Trond Andersen.intro: '''Trond Andersen''' (born 6 January 1975) is a former NorwayNorwegian association footballfootballer, who played as a central defender or holding midfielder. He played professional for Molde FKMolde, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, AaB FootballAaB and Brøndby IFBrøndby.

Fernando Hierro.name: Fernando Hierro
Fernando Hierro.intro:
'''Fernando Ruiz Hierro''' (; born 23 March 1968) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer, and the current assistant coach of Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid. He is mostly known for his spells with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and Spain national football teamSpain, appearing in more than 500 official games with the former and representing the latter on nearly 90 occasions, whilst appearing in four FIFA World CupWorld Cups and two UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships.
Equally at ease as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender or Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder, he had the ability, at his peak, to combine solid defensive play with a near-unlimited passing range and surprising goalscoring talent,[
Fernando Hierro.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Kevin Muscat.name: Kevin Muscat
Kevin Muscat.intro:
'''Kevin Vincent Muscat''' (born 7 August 1973) is a former association football player who is current Head Coach of Melbourne Victory FC. Muscat earned a reputation as a "hard man", with his aggression and passion occasionally boiling over into some violent incidents.
After beginning his professional career in the Australian National Soccer League with Sunshine George Cross FCSunshine George Cross in 1989, Muscat forged a successful, albeit controversial career in the United Kingdom with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Wolverhampton Wanderers, Rangers F.C.Rangers and Millwall F.C.Millwall. He returned to Australia in 2005 to captain Melbourne Victory in the A-League 2005-06inaugural season of the A-league.
Muscat retired from professional football in March 2011 after Melbourne Victory's 2011 AFC Champions League campaign, citing his growing frustration at his inability to keep pace with the game. In June 2011 Muscat was reconfirmed as assistant coach at Melbourne Victory. Muscat briefly rejoined his former club Sunshine George Cross for part of the 2011 Victorian State League Division 1 season.
During his international career, Muscat represented the Australia national under-20 football teamAustralia U-20 side at the 1991 FIFA World Youth Championship in Portugal and the 1993 FIFA World Youth Championship in Australia. He represented the Australia national under-23 football teamAustralia U-23 side at the Football at the 1996 Summer Olympics1996 Summer Olympics. After making his full international debut for Australia national football teamAustralia in September 1994 against Kuwait national football teamKuwait, Muscat represented the national side at the 1997 FIFA Confederations Cup, 2000 OFC Nations Cup, 2001 FIFA Confederations Cup and the 2005 FIFA Confederations Cup.

Wayne Brown (footballer, born August 197.name: Wayne Brown (footballer, born August 1977)
Wayne Brown (footballer, born August 197.intro: '''Wayne Lawrence Brown''' (born 20 August 1977 in Barking, England) is an English association footballfootballer, who last played for Bury Town F.C.Bury Town in 2011.
Wayne Brown (footballer, born August 197.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Du\u0161an Tadi\u0107.name: Dušan Tadić
Du\u0161an Tadi\u0107.intro:
'''Dušan Tadić''' (Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic: Душан Тадић; born 20 November 1988) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton and the Serbia national football teamSerbia national team. He is primarily a left-sided midfielder.
He spent his youth at hometown club AIK Bačka Topola and FK Vojvodina, eventually playing in the UEFA Europa League with the latter. After two seasons with FC Groningen he joined FC Twente in 2012, where he earned a move to Southampton.
Tadić has over 25 caps for Serbia, having made his international debut in 2008, and represented the country at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournamentOlympics in that year.
Du\u0161an Tadi\u0107.birth_place: Bačka Topola,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Jay Simpson.name: Jay Simpson
Jay Simpson.intro: '''Jay-Alistaire Frederick "Jay" Simpson''' (born 1 December 1988) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker or Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient. He is a product of the Arsenal F.C.Arsenal Arsenal F.C. AcademyAcademy.

Tim Sherwood.name: Tim Sherwood
Tim Sherwood.intro:
'''Timothy Alan "Tim" Sherwood''' (born 6 February 1969) is an English professional Association footballfootball manager (association football)manager and former midfielder who is the current manager of Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1987 until 2005, notably as captain of Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers' Premier LeaguePremiership title-winning side in 1995. He also played for Watford F.C.Watford, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He made three appearances for the England national football teamEngland national team. Sherwood began his coaching career at Tottenham Hotspur, progressing from assistant first team coach to manager in a five-year spell.

Scott Green.name: Scott Green
Scott Green.intro:
'''Scott Paul Green''' (born 15 January 1970 in Walsall) is a retired EnglandEnglish football defender.
As a schoolboy, Green spent time at Stoke, West Brom and Walsall before Derby County took him on trial as a centre-forward. He ultimately failed to play a single game for Derby but would score 24 goals in 16 games for Finnish club Euran Pallo. In 1990, Green signed for Bolton Wanderers for £50,000, making his début against Shrewsbury Town. He would help Wanderers reach the play-offs that season, and made an appearance in the 1991 play-off final against Tranmere. In 1994, Green switched to full-back helping Bolton achieve promotion and played in the 1995 Football League Cup Final.
Green joined Wigan Athletic for £300,000 in June 1997, scoring on his début in a 5-2 win over Wycombe Wanderers on the opening day of the 1997/98 season. Now a regular fixture at right-back, he was part of the side that would win the Football League Trophy at Wembley in 1999. A virtual ever present in the first half of Wigan's Second Division Championship winning season, he would be allowed to leave the club for Wrexham in 2003.

Nick Blackman.name: Nick Blackman
Nick Blackman.intro: '''Nicholas Alexander "Nick" Blackman''' (born 11 November 1989) is a professional English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Reading F.C.Reading. Born in Salford, Greater Manchester he started his career at Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town before moving to Premier League Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. After 3 years at Blackburn Rovers he was sold to Sheffield United for an undisclosed sum. After scoring 11 goals in only 6 months at Sheffield United, he signed a 3-and-a-half-year contract with Premier Club Reading F.C. He has also spent time on loan at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Motherwell F.C.Motherwell and Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen.

Nick Culkin.name: Nick Culkin
Nick Culkin.intro: '''Nicholas James "Nick" Culkin''' (born 6 July 1978) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for F.C. United of ManchesterFC United of Manchester.

Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Kanout\u00e9.name: Frédéric Kanouté
Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Kanout\u00e9.intro:
'''Frédéric Oumar Kanouté''' (born 2 September 1977) is a retired Malian professional Association footballfootballer who played for several top-tier clubs within UEFA, enjoying his greatest success with La Liga side Sevilla FC. Kanouté was named the 2007 African Footballer of the Year, the first player born outside Africa to win the award.
Kanouté began his career with Olympique LyonnaisLyon in France before moving to West Ham UnitedWest Ham of the Premier League in 2000. After a spell at their London rivals Tottenham Hotspur, Kanouté moved to SpainSpanish club Sevilla FCSevilla where he won two consecutive UEFA Cups in 2006 and 2007 in addition to various other European and domestic honours and remains the club's highest-scoring foreign player. He joined Beijing Guoan F.C.Beijing Goan in June 2012.[
Despite appearing 16 times for France under-21 national football teamFrance U-21, Kanouté was a member of the Mali national football teamMalian squad which reached the semi-finals of the 2004 African Cup of Nations and also featured in their selections for the tournament in 2006 and 2010. His international career ended in 2010 with a total of 39
caps and 23 goals.

Ryan Noble.name: Ryan Noble
Ryan Noble.intro: '''Ryan Andrew Noble''' (6 November 1991) is an English footballer who currently plays for Durham City A.F.C.Durham City. Noble has played as a striker for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Watford F.C.Watford, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Gateshead F.C.Gateshead.

Graeme Murty.name: Graeme Murty
Graeme Murty.intro:
'''Graeme Stuart Murty''' (born 13 November 1974) is a former association footballfootballer. He made more than 400 appearances in the Football League playing for York City F.C.York City, Reading F.C.Reading, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Southampton F.C.Southampton. Though born in Nunthorpe, Middlesbrough, England, Murty qualified for the Scotland national football team through his family, and won four full cap (sport)caps.
After his playing career, he moved on to coaching, and was appointed a Youth Development coach at Southampton F.C.Southampton's Southampton F.C. AcademyAcademy.
On July 14th 2014 it was announced that Murty had joined Championship club Norwich City, talking the role at the club as Coach for the U-16 sides in the clubs Academy.
Graeme Murty.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Aleksandar Kolarov.name: Aleksandar Kolarov
Aleksandar Kolarov.intro:
'''Aleksandar Kolarov''' (; ; born 10 November 1985) is a Serbian professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the Serbian national football teamSerbian national team. Although primarily a left back, Kolarov can also operate anywhere along the left flank and is known for his overlapping runs on the wing and his ball striking ability. He was named Serbian Player of the Year in 2011.
Kolarov began his career at Red Star Belgrade, but he did not break through and moved onto FK ČukaričkiČukarički in 2004. Two years later he joined OFK Beograd before moving abroad for the first time by signing for SS LazioLazio of Serie A, where he won the Coppa Italia and Supercoppa Italiana in 2009. In 2010 he joined Manchester City, and has won two Premier League titles, the FA Cup and the Football League CupLeague Cup.
He made his senior international debut for Serbia in 2008 and has since earned over 50 caps. Kolarov was a member of Serbia's squads for the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Olympics and the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
Aleksandar Kolarov.birth_place: Belgrade,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Aleksandar Kolarov.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Philippe Senderos.name: Philippe Senderos
Philippe Senderos.intro:
'''Philippe Sylvain Senderos''' (born 14 February 1985) is a Swiss professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and the Switzerland national football teamSwitzerland national team as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He began his career at Servette FCServette, before moving to England as a teenager with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He became a regular at Arsenal and won the 2005 FA Cup FinalFA Cup in 2005, and was loaned to A.C. MilanMilan and Everton F.C.Everton later on in his time at the club.  He then moved to Fulham FCFulham on a free transfer and spent a brief spell in Spain at Valencia CF before signing for Aston Villa in 2014.
A full Swiss international since 2005, Senderos has won over 50 caps and scored 5 international goals. He was included in the Swiss squads for three World Cups and Euro 2008.
Philippe Senderos.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Liam Ridgewell.name: Liam Ridgewell
Liam Ridgewell.intro:
'''Liam Matthew Ridgewell''' (born 21 July 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Portland Timbers of Major League Soccer. He is primarily a centre half but can also play at left back.
Ridgewell began his senior career with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, spending a spell on loan at A.F.C. Bournemouth in 2002, before moving to Villa's local rivals Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2007, where he was part of the 2011 Football League Cup Final-winning team. He spent two-and-a-half seasons with West Bromwich Albion, who released him at the end of 2013–14.
Internationally, he has eight caps for England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level.

Gary Borrowdale.name: Gary Borrowdale
Gary Borrowdale.intro: '''Gareth Ian "Gary" Borrowdale''' (born 16 July 1985) is an English association footballfootballer who was most recently on the books of Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. A left-sided player, Borrowdale plays as a Defender (association football)#Full backleft-back. He has also been known to operate as a central defender.

Wayne Gray.name: Wayne Gray
Wayne Gray.intro:
'''Wayne William Gray''' (born 7 November 1980) is an English professional Association footballfootball Forward (association football)forward.
He started his career with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon in 1999, leaving the club following its controversial move to Milton Keynes. He then had a two years spell with Southend United F.C.Southend United, one year with Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and spent 2007 to 2009 with Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient. He made almost 300 appearances in the Football League. He then dropped into non-League football with A.F.C. HornchurchAFC Hornchurch in 2009, before joining Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic in 2010. The following year he moved on to Chelmsford City via Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United. He signed for Woking F.C.Woking in summer 2011, and stayed at the club for one season. Following a brief stint at Carshalton Athletic F.C.Carshalton Athletic, he returned to AFC Hornchurch in September 2012.

Paul Pogba.name: Paul Pogba
Paul Pogba.intro:
'''Paul Labile Pogba''' (born 15 March 1993) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club Juventus F.C.Juventus in Serie A. He operates primarily as a central midfielder and is comfortable at playing both in attack and defence.
Pogba was described by his former club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United as a "powerful, skilful, and creative" player who has "an eye for goal and a penchant for the spectacular". After his transfer to Juventus, he gained the nickname ''Il Polpo Paul'' ("Paul the Octopus") for his long legs that look like tentacles during tackling or running. These characteristics have led him to be compared with former France international Patrick Vieira. He received the Golden Boy (award)Golden Boy award for 2013, given to the best under-21 player in Europe, followed by the Bravo Award in 2014, awarded to the best under-23 player who has participated in European competitions.
Pogba played internationally for France with the France national youth football teamnational youth football team, representing his nation at all levels for which he was eligible. With the under-16 team, he Captain (association football)captained his nation to victories at the Aegean Cup and the Tournoi du Val-de-Marne and, at under-17 level, played at the 2010 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship. At under-20 level, he captained his nation to victory at the 2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup and took home the 2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup#AwardsBest Player award for his performances during the tournament. He made his debut for the senior French national football teamFrench national team on 22 March 2013 in a 3–1 win against Georgia national football teamGeorgia, and scored his first 2014 FIFA World CupWorld Cup goal on 30 June 2014 against Nigeria national football teamNigeria; he was awarded the 2014 FIFA World Cup awards#Best Young PlayerBest Young Player Award for his performances at the 2014 FIFA World Cup, after reaching the quarter-final.
In January 2014, Pogba was named by ''The Guardian'' as one of the ten most promising young players in Europe.

Steve McAnespie.name: Steve McAnespie
Steve McAnespie.intro: '''Steve McAnespie''' (born 1 February 1972) is a retired ScotlandScottish association footballfootball defender (football)defender.
Steve McAnespie.position: Defender  football  Full back Right Back

Sascha Riether.name: Sascha Riether
Sascha Riether.intro: '''Sascha Riether''' (born 23 March 1983 in Lahr) is a German peopleGerman professional Association footballfootballer who plays for SC Freiburg. He plays as a Defender (association football)right back.

Andy Couzens.name: Andy Couzens
Andy Couzens.intro:
'''Andy Couzens''' (born 4 June 1975) is a retired English association footballfootballer who was a  midfielder. He was born in Shipley, West YorkshireShipley, and started his career with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, for whom he played in the 1993 FA Youth Cup FinalsFA Youth Cup final, when they beat Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He also managed 29 Premier League appearances for Leeds, scoring once, and for a while was tipped for a bright future in the game, but he never lived up to expectations and in 1997 he dropped down two divisions to sign for Carlisle United.[
After Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United were relegated in 1998 and narrowly avoided relegation from the Football League completely a year later, he signed for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in Division Two but was unable to prevent their relegation at the end of the 1999–2000 in English football1999–2000 season.
He then left the Bloomfield Road club and his career was over at a professional level by the time he turned 25.

Mario Stani\u0107.name: Mario Stanić
Mario Stani\u0107.intro: '''Mario Stanić''' (born 10 April 1972) is a former Bosnian-born Croatian Association footballfootballer. Being a versatile offensive player, he was no stranger to any forward or attacking midfield position, and was even deployed as a Defender (association football)#Wing-backwing-back in the national team.
Mario Stani\u0107.birth_place: Sarajevo,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Mario Stani\u0107.position: Midfielder  association football  Attacking midfielder Attacking midfielder

Andriy Shevchenko.name: Andriy Shevchenko
Andriy Shevchenko.intro:
'''Andriy Mykolayovych Shevchenko''' (, ; born 29 September 1976) is a former UkrainiansUkrainian footballer who played for FC Dynamo KyivDynamo Kyiv, A.C.
