MilanMilan, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and the Ukrainian national team as a Striker (association football)striker. Shevchenko is ranked as the  fifth top goalscorer in all UEFA club competition records and statisticsEuropean competitions with 67 goals. With a tally of 175 goals scored for A.C. MilanMilan, Shevchenko is the second most prolific player in the history of the club, and is also the all-time second-best scorer of the ''Derby della Madonnina'' (the Local derbyderby between Milan and their local rivals F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale) with 14 goals. Furthermore, he is the all-time top scorer for the Ukrainian national team with 48 goals.
Shevchenko's career has been highlighted by many awards, the most prestigious of which was the Ballon d'Or in 2004 (becoming the third Ukrainian, after Oleh Blokhin and Ihor Belanov, to receive it). He won the UEFA Champions League in 2003 with Milan, and he has also won various league and cup titles in Ukrainian Premier LeagueUkraine, Serie AItaly, and Premier LeagueEngland. He was also an UEFA Champions League runner-up in 2005 UEFA Champions League Final2005 and 2008 UEFA Champions League Final2008.
In his illustrious international career, the striker led Ukraine as captain to the quarter-finals in their first ever FIFA World Cup appearance in 2006 FIFA World Cup2006. A fast, hardworking, energetic, opportunistic, and prolific goalscorer, Shevchenko was usually deployed as a centre-forward, although he was capable of attacking from the Winger (association football)left wing as well, a position which he occupied upon his return to Kiev; he was also effective from set-pieces and penalties. A strong and physical striker with an eye for goal, he was primarily known for his powerful and accurate shot, although he also possessed good technique and aerial ability.
On 28 July 2012, Shevchenko announced that he was quitting football for politics. He was standing for election to the Ukrainian Parliament in the October 2012 Ukrainian parliamentary election. But Ukraine – Forward!his party failed to win parliamentary representation.

Charles N'Zogbia.name: Charles N'Zogbia
Charles N'Zogbia.intro:
'''Charles N'Zogbia''' (born 28 May 1986) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. N'Zogbia was cap (sport)capped for the France national under-21 football teamFrance under-21 team on thirteen occasions, and made his debut for the senior side in 2010.
He plays primarily as a right or left Midfielder#Wingerwinger, but can also play as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.

Paul Miller (footballer, born 1968).name: Paul Miller (footballer, born 1968)
Paul Miller (footballer, born 1968).intro: '''Paul Miller''' (born 31 January 1968 in Woking) is a retired EnglandEnglish football forward. Miller notably played in the Premier League for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon during the 1993–94 FA Premier League1993-94 season.

Steve Baker (footballer, born 1978).name: Steve Baker (footballer, born 1978)
Steve Baker (footballer, born 1978).intro:
'''Steven Richard "Steve" Baker''' (born 8 September 1978 in Pontefract, West Yorkshire) is an English association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Darlington F.C.Darlington and Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United.
Baker joined Scarborough F.C.Scarborough, initially on loan from Middlesbrough, in 2001, and went on to make more than 100 Conference NationalConference appearances for them. He was released at the end of the 2005-06 in English football2005–06 season. He signed for Gateshead F.C.Gateshead in July 2006, but missed the whole of the 2007–08 season with injury.

Simon Rodger.name: Simon Rodger
Simon Rodger.intro:
'''Simon Lee Rodger''' (born 3 October 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defensive Midfielder from 1989 until 2004.
He played the majority of his career with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, which a number of seasons in the Premier League. He also played in the Football League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, and non-league for Bognor Regis Town F.C.Bognor Regis Town and Woking F.C.Woking.

Ian Selley.name: Ian Selley
Ian Selley.intro:
'''Ian Selley''' (born 14 June 1974) is an English peopleEnglish former professional footballer, and coach at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal's training camp in Dubai.
He notably played in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, winning the 1994 UEFA Cup Winner's Cup with them, and in the Football League for Fulham F.C.Fulham, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon and Southend United F.C.Southend United. Beleaguered by a number of serious injuries which cut-short his professional aspirations, he thereafter forged a career in non-league football with Woking F.C.Woking, Lewes F.C.Lewes, Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic, Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United, Croydon Athletic F.C.Croydon Athletic, Dorchester Town F.C.Dorchester Town and Havant & Waterlooville F.C.Havant & Waterlooville.
During his time at Arsenal he made three appearances for the England Under-21 international team.

Benjamin Stambouli.name: Benjamin Stambouli
Benjamin Stambouli.intro: '''Benjamin Stambouli''' (born 13 August 1990) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in the English Premier League. Stambouli's father is  Henri Stambouli, a former player and the current youth director of French club Olympique de MarseilleMarseille, and his grandfather is former manager Gérard Banide. The younger Stambouli is a France national youth football teamFrance youth international having earned caps at France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.
Benjamin Stambouli.position: Defender  association football  Defensive midfielder Defensive midfielder

Neil Webb.name: Neil Webb
Neil Webb.intro: '''Neil John Webb''' (born 30 July 1963 in Reading, Berkshire) is an English former association footballfootballer and television pundit. He played as a midfielder but could also play as a defender (association football)defender between 1980 and 1997 notably for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Webb also played for Reading F.C.Reading, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town and Hong Kong side Double Flower FAInstant-Dict.

Mile Sterjovski.name: Mile Sterjovski
Mile Sterjovski.intro:
'''Mile Sterjovski''' (, born 27 May 1979) is a retired Australian Association footballfootball (soccer) player. Sterjovski played mainly as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger or as a Forward (association football)#Second strikersecond striker, but also played as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger and Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Sterjovski played youth football with Wollongong Wolves and the Australian Institute of SportAIS before making his senior debut for Wolves in the National Soccer League. After also playing for Wollongong United, Sydney United and Parramatta Power, Sterjovski moved overseas to play for French club Lille OSC. He also spent time in Switzerland (with FC BaselBasel) and Turkey (with Hacettepe Spor KulübüHacettepe) before joining Derby County F.C.Derby in the English Premier League. He eventually returned to Australia to play in the A-League for Perth Glory FCPerth Glory and Central Coast Mariners FCCentral Coast Mariners, separated by a period playing for Dalian Aerbin F.C.Dalian Aerbin in the Chinese Super League.
He played for the Australia national football teamAustralian national team from 2000 to 2010, making 43 appearances and scoring 8 goals, including 3 games at the 2006 FIFA World Cup and an international hat-trick against Tahiti national football teamTahiti.

Moussa Sissoko.name: Moussa Sissoko
Moussa Sissoko.intro:
'''Moussa Sissoko''' (born 16 August 1989) is a List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who plays for Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. He plays as a Midfielder#.22Box-to-box.22 midfielderbox-to-box midfielder capable of playing in either the Midfielder#Defensive midfielderholding role or as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacker. Sissoko is described as a "well-rounded central midfielder" who is "tall, rangy, and strong in the tackle".
Sissoko began his football career playing for local youth clubs in the Île-de-France (region)Île-de-France Regions of Franceregion, such as Espérance Aulnay and Red Star Saint-OuenRed Star FC. In 2002, he moved south to join professional club Toulouse FCToulouse. Sissoko spent four years in the club's youth academy and made his professional debut in the 2007–08 Ligue 12007–08 season. He also played in the UEFA Champions League for the first time. In the following season, Sissoko earned award nominations for his performances and also helped Toulouse qualify for the newly created UEFA Europa League.
Sissoko is a France national youth football teamFrench youth international having played at all levels he was eligible for. In August 2009, he was called up to the France national football teamsenior team for the first time and made his senior international debut in a 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification against the Faroe Islands national football teamFaroe Islands. He made his first international start four days later in a qualifier against Austria national football teamAustria.

Javier Hern\u00e1ndez (footballer, born.name: Javier Hernández (footballer, born 1988)
Javier Hern\u00e1ndez (footballer, born.intro:
'''Javier Hernández Balcázar''' (Spanish ; born 1 June 1988) is a Mexican association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Spanish club Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, on loan from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, and the Mexico national football team.
Hernández is commonly known by his nickname, '''Chicharito''' (Mexican Spanish: ''little pea''), which he wears on his shirt. He previously played for the Mexican club C.D. GuadalajaraGuadalajara, before becoming the first Mexican player to join Manchester United in July 2010.
Hernández made his debut for Mexico in September 2009 in a match against Colombia national football teamColombia. He has also represented them at the 2010 FIFA World Cup, the 2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup and the 2014 FIFA World Cup. He was the Gold Cup's top scorer with 7 goals and was named the most valuable player of the tournament. Hernández is the Mexico national football team#Top goalscorersjoint-second highest goalscorer of all-time for the Mexico national team.

Daniel Van Buyten.name: Daniel Van Buyten
Daniel Van Buyten.intro:
'''Daniel Van Buyten''' (; born 7 February 1978) is a Belgian former Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back for the Belgium national football team. Nicknamed 'Big Dan', Van Buyten was known for his uncompromising style of play, exploiting both his physical strength and aerial ability.
Starting out at Sporting Charleroi as a striker, his career took off when he converted to a centre back, playing for a series of top flight clubs, including Olympique de Marseille, Manchester City, Hamburger SV and Bayern Munich. Throughout his career, Van Buyten was also a regular starter for the Belgium national football team, achieving 84 caps in an international career that spanned 13 years and included two FIFA World Cupworld cups.
Daniel Van Buyten.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Lee Hodges (footballer, born 1973).name: Lee Hodges (footballer, born 1973)
Lee Hodges (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''Lee Leslie Hodges''' (born 4 September 1973) is English Association footballfootball player and Manager (association football)manager. He made four appearances in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and 394 appearances in the Football League for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Barnet F.C.Barnet, Reading F.C.Reading and Torquay United F.C.Torquay United. A versatile player, Hodges was capable of playing in defence, midfield and attack. He was more recently the player-manager of Conference South club Truro City F.C.Truro City. Until 2013 Lee was part of the football extravaganza enrichment week at South Dartmoor Community College.

Abdeslam Ouaddou.name: Abdeslam Ouaddou
Abdeslam Ouaddou.intro: '''Abdeslam Ouaddou''' () (born November 1, 1978 in Alnif, Morocco) is a Moroccan Association footballfootballer. He last played for AS Nancy-Lorraine as a central defender or defensive midfielder.

Paul Bernard.name: Paul Bernard
Paul Bernard.intro: '''Paul Robert Bernard''' (born 30 December 1972) is a former professional association football player who played as a midfielder for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham, Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, St Johnstone F.C.St Johnstone and Drogheda United F.C.Drogheda United.

Yaniv Katan.name: Yaniv Katan
Yaniv Katan.intro: '''Yaniv Katan''' (; born 27 January 1981) is a retired Israeli international association footballfootballer who played professionally for Maccabi Haifa F.C.Maccabi Haifa, as a Forward (association football)forward and Midfielder#Wingerwinger. He earned 31 caps for Israel national football teamIsrael, scoring 5 goals.

Bernard Lama.name: Bernard Lama
Bernard Lama.intro: '''Bernard Pascal Maurice Lama''' (; born 7 April 1963) is a French association footballfootball coach and former Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He was born in the Indre-et-Loire ''département'' but grew up in French Guiana. He spent a number of years in goal for Lille OSCLille and Paris Saint-Germain. He was also a member of the France national football teamFrance national team that won the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and the UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000.

Radamel Falcao.name: Radamel Falcao
Radamel Falcao.intro:
'''Radamel Falcao García Zárate''' (; 10 February 1986), also known as '''Radamel Falcao''', '''Falcao García''' or simply as '''Falcao''', is a Colombian Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United on loan from AS Monaco FCAS Monaco, and the Colombia national football teamColombia national team. He is sometimes nicknamed ''El Tigre'' (Spanish for ''The Tiger'') and ''King of the UEFA Europa LeagueEuropa League''.[
Falcao is commonly cited as one of the best strikers in world football today. He surpassed Jürgen Klinsmann's record of 15 goals (17) in a single annual club football European competition UEFA Champions League/UEFA Europa League campaign in 2011. He also played a key role in guiding FC Porto to a second 2010–11 UEFA Europa LeagueEuropa League title, as well as finishing undefeated in the 2010–11 Primeira Liga season. In July 2011, Falcao received the Portuguese Golden Ball award, becoming the first Colombian to do so.
/ He came fifth in the 2012 FIFA Ballon d'Or and was named in the FIFProFIFA XI for 2012.
In his first three seasons in European football, Falcao scored over 100 goals.[
Falcao made his full international debut for Colombia national football teamColombia in 2007 and has since earned over 50 caps and scored 24 goals for the team, making him their joint top scorer of all time, alongside Arnoldo Iguarán. He represented the country at the 2011 Copa América, but missed the 2014 FIFA World Cup through an Anterior cruciate ligament injuryACL injury.

Sam Williamson.name: Sam Williamson
Sam Williamson.intro: '''Samuel James "Sam" Williamson''' (born 15 October 1987) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender. He is currently without a club. He signed for Wrexham on an 18-month contract, after impressing on a loan spell from Premier League side Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.

Habib Beye.name: Habib Beye
Habib Beye.intro: '''Habib Beye''' (born 19 October 1977) is a French born Senegalese former footballer who retired after being released by Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. His primary position was as a right back, though he was also able to play in central defence.

Dean Windass.name: Dean Windass
Dean Windass.intro:
'''Dean Windass''' (born 1 April 1969) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. He is best known for his spells at Bradford City F.C.Bradford City and contributing to his hometown team Hull City A.F.C.Hull City's promotion to the Premier League in 2008. He currently plays for Walkington F.C in the Premier Division of the East Riding League, where his ex-teammate Leigh Palin is the manager.
Windass started his footballing career as a trainee at his hometown club, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, and signed his first professional contract there. He scored 64 goals in 205 games for Hull, and, when he left, he brought the club a record transfer fee at the time, going on to play in the top divisions in both English and Scottish football. Later in his career, he returned to Hull City, and scored the only goal of the 2008 Football League Championship play-off final to take them to the top flight for the first time in their history.
Windass also had two spells at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, where he became the club's third-highest scorer of all time. He has also played for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He is seen as a controversial player, once being sent off three times in a game for Aberdeen, as well as grabbing another opponent's testicles in a match at Bradford City.
Windass scored his last Premier League goal at the age of 39, becoming Hull City's oldest-ever scorer. He officially announced his retirement from the game on 19 October 2009, but hoped to carry on with a career in coaching. He briefly worked as player-coach, under former manager Colin Todd at Darlington F.C.Darlington, but the pair only lasted nine games in charge.
He came out of retirement and played for Barton Town Old Boys F.C.Barton Town Old Boys before joining Scarborough Athletic F.C.Scarborough Athletic on a game-by-game deal.

Neil Heaney.name: Neil Heaney
Neil Heaney.intro: '''Neil Heaney''' (born 3 November 1971 in Middlesbrough) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for a number of British clubs.

Hayden Mullins.name: Hayden Mullins
Hayden Mullins.intro:
'''Hayden Ian Mullins''' (born 27 March 1979) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Notts County F.C.Notts County. He is primarily a defensive midfielder, but can also play as a sweeper (football)sweeper and at defender (football)right-back.
Mullins began his career with Football League Division OneDivision 1 side Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1996, and signed his first professional contract with the club in 1998. He quickly established himself in the first team, and made 257 senior appearances for Palace in five seasons. In October 2003, he switched to First Division side West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, initially on a short-term loan, which quickly turned into a permanent transfer. He remained at the club for five-and-a-half years, making 213 appearances, before joining Premier League side Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in January 2009. He made 129 appearances for Portsmouth, but the club's financial difficulties meant that he joined Championship side Reading F.C.Reading on loan in March 2012. At the end of the 2011-12 Portsmouth F.C. season2011–12 season, Mullins left Portsmouth, and joined Birmingham City on a free transfer. After two years, during which he also spent time on loan at Notts County F.C.Notts County, Birmingham confirmed he would be released when his contract expired at the end of the 2013–14 season.
Mullins made three appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 squad in 1999.

Francesco Sanetti.name: Francesco Sanetti
Francesco Sanetti.intro: '''Francesco Sanetti''' (born 11 January 1979 in Rome) is an ItalyItalian professional Association Footballfootballer who currently plays for Colleferro Calcio 1937Colleferro Calcio.

Darren Kenton.name: Darren Kenton
Darren Kenton.intro: '''Darren Edward Kenton''' (born 13 September 1978) is an English association footballfootballer who currently plays for Rochester Rhinos in the USL First Division.

\u00d8yvind Leonhardsen.name: Øyvind Leonhardsen
\u00d8yvind Leonhardsen.intro: '''Øyvind Leonhardsen''' (born 17 August 1970) is a NorwayNorwegian former Norway national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer. He retired after the 2007 season, and at that moment he was captain of Strømsgodset IF in the Norwegian Premier Division, ending a career with nine years in English football with clubs like Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. In Norway he played for Molde FKMolde, Rosenborg BKRosenborg, FK LynLyn and Strømsgodset.

Michel Vorm.name: Michel Vorm
Michel Vorm.intro:
'''Michel Armand Vorm''' (; born 20 October 1983) is a Dutch footballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for the English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
Vorm began his professional career at FC Utrecht in 2005, spending his first season on loan at FC Den Bosch. He transferred to Swansea City in 2011, playing three Premier League seasons and winning the 2013 Football League Cup FinalLeague Cup in 2013. Vorm joined Tottenham for £3.5 million in 2014.
A full international for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands since 2008, Vorm was included in their squads for two World Cups and Euro 2012, as back-up in all three tournaments.

Marc Keller.name: Marc Keller
Marc Keller.intro: '''Marc Keller''' (born 14 January 1968) is a French former professional Association footballfootballer who played primarily as a midfielder. In his club career he played in France, Germany and England. For the France national football teamnational side he played seven times, scoring one goal against Brazil national football teamBrazil. He later became Director-General of RC Strasbourg and AS Monaco.

Sam Vokes.name: Sam Vokes
Sam Vokes.intro:
'''Samuel Michael "Sam" Vokes''' (born 21 October 1989), commonly known as '''Sam Vokes''', is an English-born Welsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Premier League club Burnley F.C.Burnley and the Wales national football teamWales national team.
Vokes began his professional career at then League One A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, making his debut in 2006. His form there earned a move to Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, where he helped them win promotion to the Premier League in his first season.
He has become an established member of the Wales national football teamWelsh national team, who he has also represented at Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. Although born and raised in England, Vokes is eligible to represent Wales through a Welsh-born grandfather.

Colin Calderwood.name: Colin Calderwood
Colin Calderwood.intro:
'''Colin Calderwood''' (born 20 January 1965 in Stranraer) is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootball player and coach.
Calderwood made over 150 league appearances for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He was a regular player for the Scotland national football team during the late 1990s, appearing in two major tournaments. Calderwood retired as a player in 2001.
Calderwood became manager of Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town in 2003, guiding the club to promotion in 2006. He then became manager of Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, helping the club win promotion in 2008. Calderwood was sacked by Forest in December 2008 and then moved to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, working as first team coach. After a year with Newcastle, Calderwood became a manager again by moving to Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, but he was sacked after just over a year in that job.
In November 2011 he was appointed as Chris Hughton's assistant manager at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. Calderwood followed Hughton to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in June 2012, and left the club when Hughton was dismissed in April 2014. In early February 2015, he was appointed assistant manager at Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, rejoining Chris Hughton for a fourth time.

Vangelis Moras.name: Vangelis Moras
Vangelis Moras.intro: '''Evangelos "Vangelis" Moras''' (; born 26 August 1981) is a Greek association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Serie A club Hellas Verona F.C.Hellas Verona.
Vangelis Moras.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Martin Jir\u00e1nek.name: Martin Jiránek
Martin Jir\u00e1nek.intro:
'''Martin Jiránek''' (; born 25 May 1979 in Prague) is a Czech Republic national football teamCzech international association footballfootballer who plays for Russian club FC Tom Tomsk. A defender (association football)defender, Jiránek has played in the top division of several countries.
Jiránek played in a number of international tournaments for his country. In 2002 he was part of the Czech Republic national under-21 football teamCzech under 21 side which won the 2002 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship in Switzerland. He subsequently travelled with the senior international squad for the 2004 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2004 and 2006 World Cup tournaments.

David Burrows.name: David Burrows
David Burrows.intro: '''David Burrows''' (born Dudley, 25 October 1968) is an English former association footballfootballer. During his career he played for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Everton F.C.Everton, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday as well as the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 and England B national football teamB teams. As a Liverpool player he won the Football League, the FA Cup and twice won the Charity Shield.

Yohan Cabaye.name: Yohan Cabaye
Yohan Cabaye.intro:
'''Yohan Cabaye''' (; born 14 January 1986) is a List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who plays for French club Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain in Ligue 1 and the France national football teamFrance national team, as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder. He is described as a player who possesses "excellent vision, great ball control", and "provides technical quality". Cabaye is also known for his free-kick and penalty-taking ability.
Cabaye began his football career playing for hometown club Tourcoing FC at the age of six. After seven years developing in the club's youth academy, he joined professional club Lille OSCLille. Cabaye spent six years in the club's youth academy before making his professional debut in the 2004–05 Ligue 12004–05 season helping Lille win the 2004 UEFA Intertoto Cup. He became a regular starter in the following season and participated in the UEFA Champions League for the first time under Claude Puel. Under manager Rudi Garcia, Cabaye developed into a playmaker and had his best season to date in the 2009–10 Ligue 12009–10 season scoring over 15 goals from the midfield position. In the 2010–11 in French football2010–11 season, he was a part of the Lille team that won the Double (association football)league and cup double. Following the season, in June 2011, Cabaye joined English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United on a five-year deal. On 29 January 2014, Newcastle accepted a £19 million offer for Cabaye from French List of French football championsLigue 1 champions Paris Saint-Germain.
Cabaye is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international having represented his nation at France national under-16 football teamunder-16, France national under-18 football teamunder-18, France national under-19 football teamunder-19, France national under-20 football teamunder-20, and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. At under-19 level, he played on the team that won the 2005 European Under-19 Football Championship. With the under-20 team, Cabaye played at the 2006 edition of the Toulon Tournament. At under-21 level, he served as Captain (association football)captain of the team for a portion of his stint. In August 2010, Cabaye was called up to the France national football teamsenior team for the first time under new Coach (sport)manager Laurent Blanc, and made his international debut on 11 August in a 2–1 Exhibition matchfriendly defeat against Norway national football teamNorway. He has since earned over 30 caps and represented France at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Marcus Stewart.name: Marcus Stewart
Marcus Stewart.intro:
'''William Marcus Paul Stewart''' (born '''William Marcus Paul Tubbs''')[
Stewart played over 500 games and scored over 250 goals in his professional career and had notable spells in the Premier League for Ipswich Town and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, and was the Premier League's second highest goalscorer for the 2000-01 in English football2000–01 season. He  also played for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and Exeter City F.C.Exeter City.

Rolando Bianchi.name: Rolando Bianchi
Rolando Bianchi.intro:
'''Rolando Bianchi''' (; born 15 February 1983 in Lovere, Province of BergamoBergamo) is an Italian Association footballfootballer, who currently plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for  Bologna F.C.Bologna.
With 77 total goals, he occupies 10th place in the all-time scorer list for Torino F.C.Torino.

Mats M\u00f8ller D\u00e6hli.name: Mats Møller Dæhli
Mats M\u00f8ller D\u00e6hli.intro:
'''Mats Møller Dæhli''' (born 2 March 1995) is a Norwegian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for German club SC Freiburg.
Born in Oslo, he was previously contracted to English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, where he played for the Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academyreserve team. He joined Norwegian club Molde FKMolde, managed by former Manchester United striker Ole Gunnar Solskjær, in July 2013 and made his professional debut the same year. He transferred to Cardiff City in January 2014 after Solskjær had been hired as manager of the Welsh team.
Dæhli has been a key player for every Norwegian youth team up to Norway national under-19 football teamunder-19 level. He has also played for the Norway national under-21 football teamunder-21 team, and made the step up to the Norway national football teamsenior team in 2013.

El Hadji Diouf.name: El Hadji Diouf
El Hadji Diouf.intro:
'''El Hadji Ousseynou Diouf''' (born 15 January 1981) is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who plays for Sabah FASabah. He can play on both Midfielder#Wingerwings as well as in the Forward (association football)attack position.
Having started his professional football career in France with FC Sochaux-MontbéliardSochaux, Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes and RC LensLens, Diouf's performances in the 2002 FIFA World Cup for Senegal national football teamSenegal prompted a move to Premier League side Liverpool F.C.Liverpool later that summer. He has also played in England's top flight for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers before a stint in the Scottish Premier League with Rangers F.C.Rangers. In 2011 he joined Football League Championship side Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers but was released at the end of the 2011–12 season following the club's relegation. During his nine-year international career, he scored 21 goals in 69 caps; he has also garnered a large amount of notoriety for a series of controversial incidents.

Sergio Peter.name: Sergio Peter
Sergio Peter.intro: '''Sergio Mario Peter''' (born 12 October 1986) is a German Association footballfootballer who currently plays for German side SV Südwest LudwigshafenSüdwest Ludwigshafen in seventh tier Landesliga.

Roy Keane.name: Roy Keane
Roy Keane.intro:
'''Roy Maurice Keane''' (born 10 August 1971) is an Republic of IrelandIrish association footballfootball Coach (sports)manager and former professional football player. He is the assistant manager of the Republic of Ireland national football team.
In his 18-year-long playing career, he played for Cobh Ramblers F.C.Cobh Ramblers, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, before ending his career at Celtic F.C.Celtic. Keane was a dominating defensive midfielder, noted for his aggressive and highly competitive style of play, an attitude that helped him excel as Captain (association football)captain of Manchester United from 1997 until his departure in 2005. Joining the club in 1993, Keane helped United achieve a sustained period of success during his twelve year tenure at the club. He then signed for Celtic but retired as a player less than a year later.
Keane played at international level for much of his career, representing the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland over a period of 14 years, most of which he spent as captain. He played in every Republic of Ireland game at the 1994 FIFA World Cup, although he was sent home from the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup after an Saipan incidentincident with national coach Mick McCarthy. Regarded as one of the best defensive midfielders of his generation, in 2004 Keane was named by Pelé in the FIFA 100 list of the world's greatest living players.
He was appointed manager of Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland shortly after his retirement as a player and took the club from 23rd position in the Football League Championship, in late August, to win the division title and gain promotion to the Premier League. Keane's arrival was cited as the key catalyst in Sunderland's recovery. He managed to keep Sunderland from relegation in the 2007–08 season but in his second season as a top-flight manager he left his position with Sunderland in the relegation zone. In April 2009, he was appointed as manager of Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town but was sacked after 20 months in January 2011 due to the club's position of 19th in the Championship.
In November 2013, he was appointed Assistant coachassistant manager of the Republic of Ireland national football team by manager Martin O'Neill. Keane also served as a studio analyst alongside Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gordon Strachan, fellow contemporary footballers of his time, for ITV (TV network)ITV's football coverage up until 2014.

Daniel Carri\u00e7o.name: Daniel Carriço
Daniel Carri\u00e7o.intro:
'''Daniel Filipe Martins Carriço''' (born 4 August 1988) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Sevilla FC mainly as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He spent most of his professional career with Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting, appearing in 154 official games over the course of four-and-a-half seasons and scoring five goals.
All categories comprised Carriço gained 70 Cap (sport)caps for Portugal national football teamPortugal, including 16 for the Portugal national under-21 football teamunder 21s (four goals).
Daniel Carri\u00e7o.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Paul McDonald.name: Paul McDonald
Paul McDonald.intro:
'''Paul Thomas McDonald''' (born 20 April 1968 in Motherwell, North Lanarkshire) is a Scottish former football (soccer)football Defender (association football)defender.
After playing for a local boy's club in his hometown McDonald was spotted by Hamilton Academical F.C.Hamilton Academical and signed for the club in June 1986. McDonald, who usually featured on the left wing played at the club during a period of comparative success, picking up winners medals for the Scottish Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 1987–88 in Scottish football1987–88 and the Scottish Challenge CupB & Q Cup in 1991–92 in Scottish football1992 and 1992–93 in Scottish football1993.B.J. Hugman, ''The 1996-97 Official PFA Footballers Fact File'', Harpenden: Queen Anne Press, 1996, p. 153 After a long spell at the Accies he was signed by Southampton F.C.Southampton for £75,000 in the summer of 1993. McDonald failed to make an impact at The Dell (Southampton)The Dell, although a successful loan spell at Burnley F.C.Burnley prompted Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion to pay £25,000 for his services in 1996. He left the club the following year and returned to Scottish football, with spells at Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic, Partick Thistle F.C.Partick Thistle and Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton before returning to Hamilton for a final two season run in 2001.
After this spell with the Accies McDonald, who had also been serving the club as Youth Development Manager from 2002, retired from playing and became the Scottish Football AssociationSFA community coach at Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock.[

Zvonimir Vuki\u0107.name: Zvonimir Vukić
Zvonimir Vuki\u0107.intro:
'''Zvonimir Vukić''' (Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic: Звонимир Вукић; born 19 July 1979) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderoffensive midfielder.
Vukić represented Serbia and Montenegro national football teamSerbia and Montenegro at the 2006 FIFA World Cup.
Zvonimir Vuki\u0107.birth_place: Zrenjanin,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Brett Williams (footballer, born 1968).name: Brett Williams (footballer, born 1968)
Brett Williams (footballer, born 1968).intro: '''Brett Williams''' (born 19 March 1968) is a former English association footballfootballer who played for Hereford United F.C.Hereford United, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.

Ruud Gullit.name: Ruud Gullit
Ruud Gullit.intro:
'''Ruud Gullit''', Order of Orange-NassauOON (;Surname in isolation:  born '''Rudi Dil''', 1 September 1962), is a Dutch association footballfootball manager and former football player who played professionally in the 1980s and 1990s. He was the captain of the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team that was victorious at 1988 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 88 and was also a member of the squad for the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 World Cup and 1992 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 92.
At club level, in 1987 he moved from PSV Eindhoven to A.C. Milan for a World football transfer recordworld record transfer fee.[
Gullit was named the European Footballer of the Year in 1987 and the World Soccer AwardsWorld Soccer Player of the Year in 1987 and 1989. Normally an attacking midifielder, he was a versatile player, playing in numerous positions during his career.  In 2004 he was named one of the FIFA 100Top 125 greatest living footballers as part of FIFAFIFA's 100th anniversary celebration. Gullit was working to promote the Belgian-Dutch 2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cup bid.

Gl\u00e1uber.name: Gláuber
Gl\u00e1uber.intro: '''Gláuber Leandro Honorato Berti''' (born 5 August 1983), more commonly known as '''Gláuber''', is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Columbus Crew in Major League Soccer.
Gl\u00e1uber.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Chris Coleman.name: Chris Coleman
Chris Coleman.intro:
'''Christopher Patrick "Chris" Coleman''' (born 10 June 1970) is a Welsh Association footballfootball manager and former player who is the current manager of the Wales national football team.
As a player, Coleman usually played in Defender (association football)defence, while also occasionally appearing as a forward. He won 32 Caps (sport)caps playing for Wales national football teamWales. Coleman's playing career ended at the age of 32, when his leg was broken in a car crash. Following this, Coleman started his coaching career.
In his first full season as manager of Fulham F.C.Fulham, Coleman guided the club to a respectable ninth place finish in the 2003–04 FA Premier League2003–04 Premier League. After leaving Fulham, Coleman was appointed manager of Real Sociedad. However, he resigned in January 2008, citing differences with the incoming president. In February 2008, he returned to England to manage Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, but was dismissed in May 2010 following a disastrous run of results. Coleman then managed Greek side AEL 1964 FCLarissa for the first half of the 2011–12 season before resigning due to financial troubles at the club.
In June 2010, Coleman worked as a sports commentatorcommentator for ITV (TV network)ITV at the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa.

Rafael (footballer, born 1990).name: Rafael (footballer, born 1990)
Rafael (footballer, born 1990).intro:
'''Rafael Pereira da Silva''' (born 9 July 1990), commonly known as '''Rafael''' or '''Rafael da Silva''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He normally plays as a defender (association football)right-back, but can also play on the right side of midfield. He and his twin brother, Fábio Pereira da SilvaFábio, both joined Manchester United from Fluminense FCFluminense in January 2007.
Rafael has two caps for Brazil national football teamBrazil, having made his debut in a 3–1 victory over Denmark national football teamDenmark on 26 May 2012. He has also played for Brazil at Brazil national under-17 football teamunder-17 level and was part of the silver medal-winning Brazil national under-23 football teamunder-23 side at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Summer Olympics.
Rafael (footballer, born 1990).position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Nicky Summerbee.name: Nicky Summerbee
Nicky Summerbee.intro:
'''Nicholas "Nicky" Summerbee''' (born 26 August 1971) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer, sports television pundit and commentator.
He notably played in the Premier League for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, as well as in the Football League for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers before finishing his career with Non-league Tamworth F.C.Tamworth. He was capped by both the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 and England B national football teamEngland B sides.

Beno\u00eet Assou-Ekotto.name: Benoît Assou-Ekotto
Beno\u00eet Assou-Ekotto.intro: '''Benoît Pierre David Assou-Ekotto''' (born 24 March 1984) is a professional Association footballfootballer who is currently without a club. He most recently played for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur before they terminated his contract in February 2015. Born in France, he plays internationally for the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team.
Beno\u00eet Assou-Ekotto.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Ron Willems.name: Ron Willems
Ron Willems.intro:
'''Ron Willems''' (born 20 September 1966 in Vaassen, Gelderland) is a former NetherlandsDutch football (soccer)footballer.
During his career he played for PEC Zwolle, FC Twente, AFC Ajax, Grasshopper Club Zürich, and Derby County F.C., where he made 26 appearances and scored 2 goals in the Premier League.
His relative Menno Willems was also a professional footballer.

Ahmed Fathy.name: Ahmed Fathy
Ahmed Fathy.intro:
'''Ahmed Fathy''' (; sometimes spelt '''Fathi''', born 10 November 1984) is an Egyptian international Association footballfootballer who plays for Umm Salal SCUmm Salal in Qatar Stars League .
Born in Banha, he has played a variety of roles in the midfield, including right and defensive Midfieldermidfield and has also occasionally played in the right back role for club and country.  He started his career with Egyptian side Ismaily SC before moving to England to play in the Premier League with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 2007.  Fathy returned to Egypt after only a few months however, signing for his current side Al-Ahly where he has remained since, whilst also spending some time on loan at both Kuwait side Kazma Sporting ClubKazma and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City back in England.  Alongside his club career, Fathy has represented Egypt national football teamEgypt since 2002, playing over one hundred games and scoring nine goals for his country.

Wayne Brown (footballer, born 1988).name: Wayne Brown (footballer, born 1988)
Wayne Brown (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Wayne Jonathan Brown''' (born 6 August 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays in midfield for Seinäjoen JalkapallokerhoSJK.
He has had Loan (sports)loan spells with Brentford F.C.Brentford, Turun PalloseuraTPS and Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers before joining the side on a permanent deal on 25 May 2010. On 13 December 2012 he signed a two-year contract with his former club Turun PalloseuraTPS after rejecting a contract extension at Rovers.

Rickie Lambert.name: Rickie Lambert
Rickie Lambert.intro:
'''Rickie Lee Lambert''' (born 16 February 1982) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the England national football teamEngland national team. Lambert began his career at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, having been previously dropped by Liverpool as a youngster. He later played at Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Southampton F.C.Southampton, before returning to Liverpool in 2014.
Lambert proved a key signing for Southampton, becoming their top scorer as they were promoted to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship from Football League OneLeague One in 2011 and to the Premier League the following season. He has won a number of personal awards, including three league Golden Boots. Lambert is known for his large stature and physical performances, drawing comparisons with Southampton legend Matthew Le Tissier for his ability in front of goal and penalty record.
On 8 August 2013, Lambert was called up to the England national football teamEngland team for the first time, scoring on his England debut at Wembley stadiumWembley in a friendly against Scotland national football teamScotland with his first touch. On 12 May 2014, he was named in the England squad for the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Russell Hoult.name: Russell Hoult
Russell Hoult.intro:
'''Russell Hoult''' (born 22 November 1972) is a former EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He notably spent time playing in the Premier League and played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Derby County F.C.Derby County and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He also played in the Football League for Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Notts County F.C.Notts County and Darlington F.C.Darlington.

Arturo Lupoli.name: Arturo Lupoli
Arturo Lupoli.intro:
'''Arturo Lupoli''' (born 24 June 1987) is an Italian footballer who plays as a striker for Serie B side Frosinone CalcioFrosinone.
His former clubs include Parma F.C.Parma, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and Derby County F.C.Derby County, where he spent the 2006–07 season on loan. He was renowned as having a rivalry with Italian International Giuseppe Rossi, as the media had billed the two as the future of Italian football. Despite this Lupoli has not prospered to the level of his compatriot.
Arturo Lupoli.position: Forward  association football  Striker Striker,Forward  association football  Winger Winger

Jake Kean.name: Jake Kean
Jake Kean.intro: '''Jacob "Jake" Kendall Kean''' (born 4 February 1991) is a goalkeeper who plays for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic on loan from Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.

Gavin McGowan.name: Gavin McGowan
Gavin McGowan.intro:
'''Gavin McGowan''' (born 16 January 1976 in Blackheath, LondonBlackheath, England) is a retired English peopleEnglish Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender. He played for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in the Premier League and for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town in the Football League Championship.
McGowan joined Arsenal's youth team in 1992  at the age of 16, and was with the Premier League club for over six years and made seven appearances (six in the Premier League, one in the FA Cup) for the London side. In 1994, he won the FA Youth Cup with Arsenal when they beat Millwall F.C.Millwall 5–3 in the final.[
Unable to win a first-team place at Arsenal, McGowan moved to Luton Town in the summer transfer window of 1998, having already spent a period on loan there. McGowan was initially a first-team player but an injury during the 1999–2000 in English football1999–2000 season limited his appearances. Unable to play to the best of his ability, he left the club on a free transfer in 2001 after a clearout by recently employed manager Joe Kinnear. Since then he has played in non-League football, including spells at Horsham F.C.Horsham, Hornchurch F.C.Hornchurch, Bromley F.C.Bromley, Redhill F.C.Redhill and Dulwich Hamlet F.C.Dulwich Hamlet.
McGowan is now a P.E. teacher at Edenham High School in the borough of Croydon but is referred to as one of the best centre-backs to ever play for Arsenal F.C.

Martin Phillips.name: Martin Phillips
Martin Phillips.intro: '''Martin John "Buster" Phillips''' (born 13 March 1976) is an EnglandEnglish former professional footballer.

Stephen Bywater.name: Stephen Bywater
Stephen Bywater.intro: '''Stephen Michael Bywater''', (born 7 June 1981) is an English professional Association footballfootball player who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. He has made appearances for thirteen clubs, most notably for Derby County F.C.Derby County, where he made over 150 appearances and won the 2007 Football League Championship play-off Final2007 Championship play-off Final and for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, where he spent eight seasons, made over 60 appearances and won the 2005 Football League Championship play-off Final2005 Championship play-off Final. He is also a former England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 international. Bywater has worn the number 43 shirt in memory of his mentor and coach, Les Sealey, who died aged 43 in 2001. He believes Sealey is guiding his way in football.

Jovo Bosan\u010di\u0107.name: Jovo Bosančić
Jovo Bosan\u010di\u0107.intro: '''Jovo Bosančić''' (; born 7 August 1970) is a retired Serbian Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielderright midfielder. The players name is actually Mark Barlow, but many people have incorrectly misinterperated the name as Jovo, since the mistake was so prevalent Mark has now adopted this nickname.
Jovo Bosan\u010di\u0107.birth_place: Novi Sad,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia

Deco.name: Deco
Deco.intro:
'''Anderson Luís de Souza''' (born 27 August 1977), known as '''Deco''', is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer.
Deco is one of the few players to have won the UEFA Champions League with two different clubs – F.C. PortoFC Porto in 2004 and FC Barcelona in 2006. He was named UEFA Club Footballer of the Year and UEFA Best Midfielder in Porto's Champions League-winning season and was named Man of the Match in the UEFA Champions League 2003-042003–04 Champions League final. Deco was the first player to win the UEFA Best Midfielder Award with two different clubs, Porto and Barcelona. He was awarded the 2006 FIFA Club World Cup Golden Ball and the Man of the Match award in the final despite losing to Sport Club InternacionalInternacional.
Born in Brazil, Deco received Portuguese citizenship in 2002 having completed five years of Portuguese residence, subsequently opting to play internationally for the Portugal national football team. He earned 75 caps for them, playing at two European Championships and two World Cups.
Deco announced his retirement on 26 August 2013, following a hamstring injury.
Deco.position: Midfielder  football  Attacking midfielder Attacking midfielder

Moses Ashikodi.name: Moses Ashikodi
Moses Ashikodi.intro: '''Moses Ashikodi''' (born 27 June 1987) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Cray Wanderers F.C.Cray Wanderers as a Forward (association football)striker.

Shaun Byrne (footballer, born 1981).name: Shaun Byrne (footballer, born 1981)
Shaun Byrne (footballer, born 1981).intro: '''Shaun Byrne''' (born 21 January 1981) is a professional footballer who last played for Slough Town F.C.Slough Town. He plays as a Defender (football)defender or a midfielder.

Vinny Samways.name: Vinny Samways
Vinny Samways.intro:
'''Vincent "Vinny" Samways''' (born 27 October 1968) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer and manager, who played as a midfieldercentral midfielder from 1986 until 2006.
He notably played in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Everton F.C.Everton. He also played in the Football League for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Walsall, and in Spain for Sevilla FCSevilla, UD Las PalmasLas Palmas and Algeciras CF. After retiring he went on to manage Spanish lower league side San Pedro.

Erik Nevland.name: Erik Nevland
Erik Nevland.intro: '''Erik Nevland''' (born 10 November 1977) is a NorwayNorwegian former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He played for clubs in Norway, England, Sweden and the Netherlands, and earned eight caps for the Norway national football teamNorway national team from his debut in 2001.

Roger Espinoza.name: Roger Espinoza
Roger Espinoza.intro: '''Roger Aníbal Espinoza Ramírez''' (; born 25 October 1986) is a Honduran Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Sporting Kansas City in Major League Soccer. Capable of playing both as a Midfielderdefensive midfielder and as a Defender (association football)wing back, Espinoza has represented Honduras national football teamHonduras at two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and the Football at the Summer OlympicsSummer Olympic Games.
Roger Espinoza.position: Midfielder Defensive midfielder,Defender  association football  wing back

Lance Key.name: Lance Key
Lance Key.intro: '''Lance Key''' (born 13 May 1968) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. His elder brother Richard KeyRichard was also a professional goalkeeper principally for Exeter City F.C.Exeter City and Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United.

Michael O'Neill.name: Michael O'Neill
Michael O'Neill.intro:
'''Michael Andrew Martin O'Neill''' (born 5 July 1969) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former Association footballfootballer who is the current manager (association football)manager of Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland.
O'Neill started his playing career in his native Northern Ireland with Coleraine F.C.Coleraine, before playing for a number of clubs in England, Scotland and the United States. He was Cap (sport)capped 31 times at international level by Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, in which he scored four goals. His first managerial role was with Brechin City F.C.Brechin City, who he managed from 2006 to 2008, when he accepted the post at Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers. Having won two League of Ireland titles and the Setanta Cup with Rovers, he took over as Northern Ireland manager in 2012.

Claude Davis.name: Claude Davis
Claude Davis.intro: '''Claude Davis''' (born 6 March 1979) is a Jamaican association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender. He is currently without a club, having been released by Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United. He previously played for Portmore United F.C.Portmore United (Jamaica), Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town. He has also played international football for Jamaica national football teamJamaica.

Philippe Christanval.name: Philippe Christanval
Philippe Christanval.intro: '''Philippe Charles Lucien Christanval''' (born 31 August 1978 in Paris) is a retired Football in FranceFrench footballer of GuadaloupeGuadeloupian origin who most recently played for Fulham F.C.Fulham as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. During his career, he played top-flight football in France, Spain and England, and earned six full international caps, as well as a selection to the 2002 FIFA World Cup.
Philippe Christanval.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Gilles Grimandi.name: Gilles Grimandi
Gilles Grimandi.intro:
'''Gilles Grimandi''' (born 11 November 1970 in Gap, Hautes-Alpes) is a retired FranceFrench Association footballfootballer who currently is a scout (sport)scout for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.
In his playing career, he went from hometown team Gap FCGap to top-flight AS MonacoMonaco before arriving at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal of the Premier League in 1997. He won two league-and-cup doubles with them before leaving in 2002.

Jim Brennan.name: Jim Brennan
Jim Brennan.intro:
'''James Gerald "Jim" Brennan''' (born 8 May 1977 in East York, Ontario) is a retired Canadian soccer player. During his playing career he gained experience playing extensively in Europe and North America, most notably with Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City (with whom he won the 2004 Football League First Division title) and Toronto FC.
He also played 49 times for the Canada men's national soccer teamCanadian national team, was member of the Canada side which won the 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cup, and later represented his country at the Confederations Cup 2001, the 2002 CONCACAF Gold Cup and the 2005 CONCACAF Gold Cup.
He is currently First Team Assistant Coach of the Toronto FC.

Simon Lappin.name: Simon Lappin
Simon Lappin.intro: '''Simon Lappin''' (born 25 January 1983) is a Scottish professional association footballfootballer who plays for St. Johnstone F.C.St Johnstone. Born in Glasgow, Lappin began his career with St Mirren F.C.St Mirren before moving to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 2007. He has had short loan spells at Motherwell F.C.Motherwell and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City before moving to Cardiff permanently in 2013. He was cap (football)capped 10 times by the Scotland national under-21 football team.
Simon Lappin.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Steve Lomas.name: Steve Lomas
Steve Lomas.intro:
'''Stephen Martin "Steve" Lomas''' (born 18 January 1974) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former professional Association footballfootballer and was most recently Manager (association football)manager of Football League Championship club Millwall F.C.Millwall.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1991 to 2010. He had spells in the Premier League for both Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United before moving into the The Football LeagueFootball League with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. In 2009 he became player-manager of Non-league side St Neots Town F.C.St Neots Town. Lomas was capped 45 times by Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, scoring 3 goals.
Lomas was appointed manager of Scottish Premier League club St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone in 2011. He guided them to UEFA Europa League qualification places in 2011–12 and 2012–13. He moved to Championship club Millwall in June 2013.
He is a nephew of the former Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and Northern Ireland goalkeeper Harry Gregg.[

Andy Dawson.name: Andy Dawson
Andy Dawson.intro: '''Andrew Stuart "Andy" Dawson''' (born 20 October 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United.

Paul Holmes.name: Paul Holmes
Paul Holmes.intro: '''Paul Holmes''' (born 18 February 1968 in Stocksbridge) is an English former professional association footballfootball defender (association football)right back who made more than 400 appearances in the Football League and Premier League. He played for Doncaster Rovers, Torquay United, Birmingham City, Everton F.C.Everton and West Bromwich Albion. He is the son of Albert Holmes (footballer born 1942)Albert Holmes, who played football for Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield.

Luke Daniels.name: Luke Daniels
Luke Daniels.intro: '''Luke Matthew Daniels''' (born 5 January 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United.

Jack Rodwell.name: Jack Rodwell
Jack Rodwell.intro: '''Jack Christian Rodwell''' (born 11 March 1991) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and the England national football teamEngland national team. Rodwell joined Everton F.C.Everton's academy at the age of seven, and made his debut in 2007. He spent five years in the first team before he secured a move to Premier League champions Manchester City in 2012. Rodwell has represented his country at all levels from England national under-16 football teamunder-16 to the senior team.

Matteo Sereni.name: Matteo Sereni
Matteo Sereni.intro: '''Matteo Sereni''' (born 11 February 1975) is an Italian Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper.

Bruno Andrade (Portuguese footballer).name: Bruno Andrade (Portuguese footballer)
Bruno Andrade (Portuguese footballer).intro:
'''Bruno Miguel Carvalho Andrade''' (born 2 October 1993) is a Portuguese Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Stevenage F.C.Stevenage, on loan from Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.
Born in Viseu, Andrade joined the academy of Queens Park Rangers at a young age, and has gone on to make a total of four first-team appearances for the club. He has also had loan spells at Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers.

Ali Benarbia.name: Ali Benarbia
Ali Benarbia.intro: '''Ali Benarbia''' (; born 8 October 1968 in Oran, Algeria) is a retired Algerian Association footballfootballer. As of 2009, he is currently a consultant and presenter for Al-Jazeera Sports in Doha.

Corrado Grabbi.name: Corrado Grabbi
Corrado Grabbi.intro:
'''Corrado Grabbi''' (born 29 July 1975 in Turin) is a retired Italian Association footballfootball player.
Grabbi began his career with the Juventus F.C.Juventus youth team. He was promoted to the first team and scored on his debut against Lazio, in one of his total two appearances in the 1994–1995 season. Unable to break into the team, because of his young age and
the contemporary explosion of Alessandro Del Piero, he was loaned to A.S. Lucchese-LibertasLucchese (76 games, 8 goals) and then A.C. ChievoVeronaChievo (18 games, 2 goals) before switching to Modena F.C.Modena. There he found some real form, scoring 30 times in 58 appearances. This performance saw him signed by Ternana CalcioTernana, where he played for one season before been loaned to Ravenna CalcioRavenna where he scored 13 goals. When he returned to Ternana he became a regular scorer again, with 20 goals in 34 games and became idol for the local supporters, who still remember him as the best player to ever have played for Ternana.
His season with Ternana saw him attract attention of various Serie A clubs, including Udinese and AC Milan. But apparently Luciano Moggi of Juventus, who had previously pressured Grabbi to change his agent and join GEA World with no success, made it impossible for Ciccio to play in Italy, so in 2001 he was signed by Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers for a record fee of £6.75 million in July 2001-02 in English football2001, but due to injuries and personal reasons, he failed to repeat this progress, scoring just once in fourteen league games, his goal coming in a 1–0 win over Everton.cite web
url=
title=Blackburn sink Everton
publisher=BBC
date=22 September 2001 accessdate=15 September 2009 He scored once more before going on loan to Messina, in the FA Cup against Barnsley.cite web
url=
title=Blackburn dispatch Barnsley
publisher=BBC
date=15 January 2002 accessdate=2 November 2009 Grabbi's move to Blackburn is widely regarded as one of the worst transfers in the history of the Premier League.
In the same interview, Grabbi stated that the only person who he became friends with in this time was Tugay Kerimoğlu.
Despite his unsuccessful spell at Blackburn Rovers, Grabbi still has a cult following with fans of the club.
During a loan spell back in Italy with F.C. Messina PeloroMessina, he scored 2 goals in the final game of the season and saved Messina from relegation. Upon his return to England, he failed to reignite his form, and after a further 16 games and three goals (against Liverpool in the league,cite web
url=
title=Blackburn hold Liverpool
publisher=BBC
date=28 August 2002 accessdate=15 September 2009 CSKA Sofia in the UEFA Cupcite web
url=
title=Rovers held by CSKA
publisher=BBC
date=18 September 2002 accessdate=15 September 2009 and Walsall in the League Cup)cite web
url=
title=Blackburn edge through
publisher=BBC
date=5 November 2002 accessdate=2 November 2009 with Blackburn, who had meantime signed ex-Manchester United strikers Dwight Yorke and Andy Cole, he was allowed to return to Italy permanently with A.C. AnconaAncona in 2004.
After spending 1 year without a team, trying to recover from the injury caused by a rare form of foot disease (Leveraus Morb) which had afflicted him for the past 3 seasons, he joined Genoa Cricket & Football ClubGenoa of Serie C1/A in September 2005. With his new team, he gained promotion to Serie B on playoffs scoring 9 goals in 25 games.
Before the return playoff final, Grabbi announced he was considering retiring from football, because of his physical conditions, but later he declared he was persuaded to go on by the Genoa supporters and fellow players, as well as club president Enrico Preziosi. Preziosi though decided then that Genoa did not need Grabbi anymore, so during the 2007 winter transfer window, Grabbi signed for A.C. ArezzoArezzo, still in Serie B, after having never made a single appearance in the first half of the season for Genoa. After relegation with Arezzo, scoring no goals, Grabbi signed a contract with AC Bellinzona, a team from the Swiss Challenge League (second division). Ciccio scored the winning goal (his first after more than 1 year) in the Swiss Cup game Bellinzona-Gossau: 2–1 [
Grabbi was also directly involved in the Calciopoli scandal of summer 2006 as a victim: It was in fact only then that Ciccio could tell the media what Luciano Moggi had done to affect his career: after Ciccio Grabbi had refused to drop his Agent in favour of Luciano  Moggi's son, Moggi told him "''you will never play football again, if not in my garden!''" Grabbi was propriety of Juventus until he was sold to Ternana.

Clint Easton.name: Clint Easton
Clint Easton.intro: '''Clint Jude Easton''' (born 1 October 1977 in Barking) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who is unattached.
Clint Easton.position: Midfielder,Defender  association football  Full back Left back,Centre back

Patrick van Aanholt.name: Patrick van Aanholt
Patrick van Aanholt.intro:
'''Patrick John Miguel van Aanholt''' (born 29 August 1990) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as a Full back (association football)left back.
He began his professional career at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, where he was used sparingly, spending time on loan at five other clubs. In 2014, he joined Sunderland for around £1.5 million.
Van Aanholt represented the Netherlands at numerous youth levels before making his full international debut in 2013.
Patrick van Aanholt.position: Full back  association football  Left back

David Smith (footballer, born 1968).name: David Smith (footballer, born 1968)
David Smith (footballer, born 1968).intro:
'''David Smith''' (born 29 March 1968 in Stonehouse, Gloucestershire) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. Between 1986 and 2003, he played for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, A.F.C. Bournemouth, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town and Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, making more than 400 appearances in the Football League and Premier League. He won 10 cap (sport)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team.
Since 2004 he has been employed as the commercial manager at former club Grimsby Town.

Jay Tabb.name: Jay Tabb
Jay Tabb.intro:
'''Jay Anthony Tabb''' (born 21 February 1984) is  British-Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Football League Championship side Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He began his career at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace but was released as a junior and joined Brentford F.C.Brentford in 2000. He moved to Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town in 2003 on a loan which was ultimately cut short by injury. He played in both of Brentford's unsuccessful play-off campaigns in 2005 and 2006, making over 150 appearances for the club in total.
Tabb moved to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in June 2006 and spent two-and-a-half years at the club, picking up the List of Coventry City F.C. Players of the YearPlayer of the Season Award for his performances during the 2007–08 season. In January 2009 he joined Reading. In 2012, he achieved the first promotion of his career as part of the 2011–12 Reading F.C. season2011–12 Football League ChampionshipChampionship winning squad. He joined Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town on loan in March 2013 before making the move permanent three months later. He is primarily a Midfieldercentral midfielder but has also played as Full back (association football)full back, on both Midfielder#Wingerwings and as Strikercentre forward. In February 2015 Tabb won the "Dan Bartram Player of the Month" award, which included pre-match a trophy presentation at Portman Road.
Born in England to Irish parents, he is a dual citizen who has represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level and won ten caps for the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamunder–21 side between 2004–06. He received his first call up to the senior team in 2006 but has yet to make an appearance.

Chris Kamara.name: Chris Kamara
Chris Kamara.intro:
'''Chris Kamara''' (born 25 December 1957) is an English former association footballfootballer and football manager who now works as a presenter and football analyst at Sky Sports.
As a player he was known as a tough-tackling midfielder. He joined the Royal Navy at the age of 16, before being signed up to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in November 1974. He spent three years at the club before being sold on to Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town for £14,000. He returned to Portsmouth in 1981 for a £50,000 fee, but was traded to Brentford F.C.Brentford in October 1981. He spent four years with the "Bees" before leaving the club after picking up a runners-up medal in the Football League Trophy in 1985 Football League Trophy Final1985. He re-signed with Swindon Town in August 1985 and helped the club to two successive promotions into the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division. He moved on to Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in 1988, and a successful spell with the club won him a move to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in 1990. He helped the club to the Second Division title in 1989–90, but was never a first team regular before being sold to Luton Town F.C.Luton Town for £150,000 in 1991. He had loan spells with Premier League clubs Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, before joining Sheffield United on a permanent basis in 1993. The following year he joined Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City as a player-coach.
He was appointed Bradford City manager in November 1995 and took the club from a relegation scrap to promotion out of the Second Division via the play-offs in 1996 Football League Second Division play-off Final1996. He left the club in January 1998 and quickly took the reins at Stoke City, before he left the "Potters" in April 1998. From there he became a broadcaster with Sky Sports.

Alan Kernaghan.name: Alan Kernaghan
Alan Kernaghan.intro:
'''Alan Kernaghan''' (born 25 April 1967) is a professional association footballfootball player and coach (sport)coach.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1985 to 2006, notably in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and in the Football League for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. He played the final nine years of his career playing in Scotland with St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, Brechin City F.C.Brechin City, Clyde F.C.Clyde, Livingston F.C.Livingston, Falkirk F.C.Falkirk and Dundee F.C.Dundee. He was capped 26 times by Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, scoring one goal.
During his coaching career, Kernaghan has manager (football)managed Scottish clubs Clyde and Dundee. He has also worked for other clubs in a variety of coaching roles.

Alan Blayney.name: Alan Blayney
Alan Blayney.intro: '''Alan Blayney''' (born 9 October 1981) is a professional association footballfootballer from Belfast, Northern Ireland, currently with Glenavon F.C.Glenavon, having signed at the end of the 2013–14 NIFL Premiership season following his release from Linfield. Blayney Football (soccer) positionsplays as a Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper.

Bob Taylor.name: Bob Taylor
Bob Taylor.intro:
'''Robert Taylor''' (born 3 February 1967 in Easington, County Durham), better known as '''Bob Taylor''', is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a centre forward. Known by supporters as '''''Super Bobby Taylor''''', '''''Superbob''''' or simply '''''Super''''', Taylor scored more than 250 goals in a professional career that comprised almost 750 games in 20 years. He is West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion's eighth highest goalscorer of all-time.
He began his professional career at Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, making his debut in 1986 at the age of 19. In 1989 he moved to Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, before joining West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in 1992. Taylor signed for Bolton Wanderers in 1998 following two successful loans spells at the club, but in 2000 returned to West Bromwich Albion, where he remained for a further three seasons. He then moved to Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town before ending his career at non-league sides Tamworth F.C.Tamworth and Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers.

Nathan Dyer.name: Nathan Dyer
Nathan Dyer.intro: '''Nathan Antone Jonah Dyer'''  (born 29 November 1987) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He started playing as a teenager at Southampton F.C.Southampton and making the first team. He has also played for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City with loan spells at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Burnley F.C.Burnley.

George Elokobi.name: George Elokobi
George Elokobi.intro:
'''George Nganyuo Elokobi''' (born 31 January 1986) is a Cameroonian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for English Football League OneLeague One club Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic.
Elokobi moved from his native Cameroon to England aged 16 and soon entered non-league football. He was signed by league club Colchester United F.C.Colchester United in 2004, where he caught the attention of Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers to whom he moved in 2008. He was part of their promotion-winning squad to the Premier League the following year, playing over fifty games in the top flight, and remaining with the club until 2014.

John McGreal.name: John McGreal
John McGreal.intro:
'''John Leslie McGreal''' (born 2 June 1972 in Liverpool, Merseyside, England) is an English footballer who is an experienced Defender (football)central defender. He was educated in Liverpool at the all-boys' De La Salle School, (home to other famous names such as Olympian Steve Smith (British high jumper)Steve Smith, Brian Reade, Francis Jeffers & Wayne Rooney) with his best mates Tony Stewart, Michael Morgan & Tony Simpson.
He began his career at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers rising through the club's youth system to become a regular first team player making 195 league appearances. By the summer of 1999 he was one of the highest rated defenders in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division which led to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town signing him for £650,000.
At Ipswich, him became the linchpin of Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town's defense as George Burley led the club back to the premiership via the play offs and subsequently to a 5th place finish in the next season. During that season he memorably scored the first goal at the Gwladys Street end in a famous 3-0 rout of Everton F.C.Everton at Goodison Park. The following season he also scored an important winner against Tottenham Hotspur.  Also, during that season he helped the club to the 3rd round of the UEFA Cup before losing to Inter Milan. Injuries impacted he later years with Ipswich and he was released at the end of the 2003-04 season.
McGreal joined Burnley F.C.Burnley in 2004 and proved to be an excellent signing and was a key figure in improving the team's defensive record in the 2004-05 season. He played alongside Gary Cahill, on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and was key in the young central-defender's growth and development. McGreal is known for his aerial ability, commanding nature and tough, no-nonsense attitude.  Despite his attributes, he was pushed out of the Burnley first team towards the end of the 2005/06 season by Michael Duff (footballer)Mike Duff.
