A combination of injuries and strength in depth in Burnley's squad at centre-back saw McGreal used less frequently in the 2006-07 season. He was not offered a contract at the end of the 2006-07 season and was released on 8 May 2007. He scored once during his spell at Burnley, his goal coming in a 3-0 win over Crewe Alexandra on 11 September 2004.
After he was released he went on trial with Championship team Colchester United F.C.Colchester United however manager Geraint Williams did not offer him a contract. Subsequently he returned to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town to study for a UEFA B Licence after it was suggested to him by Town manager and ex-teammate Jim Magilton. This led to speculation that he would joining club's backroom staff but they proved unfounded.
He was later recruited by former Town coach Tony Humes

Michu.name: Michu
Michu.intro:
'''Miguel Pérez Cuesta''' (born 21 March 1986), commonly known as '''Michu''' (), is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club S.S.C. Napoli on loan from Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City as either a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker or an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
He started playing for Real Oviedo, subsequently representing Celta de Vigo and Rayo Vallecano, making his La Liga debut with the latter in 2011–12 La Liga2011–12. In 2012 he signed with Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, scoring 22 goals across all competitions in 2012–13 Swansea City A.F.C. seasonhis first season and 2013 Football League Cup Finalwinning the League Cup.

James Chester.name: James Chester
James Chester.intro: '''James Grant Chester''' (born 23 January 1989) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back for Premier League club Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Wales national football teamWales national team. Born in Warrington, Cheshire, England, he began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and has also played on loan for Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.
James Chester.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Danny Butterfield.name: Danny Butterfield
Danny Butterfield.intro:
'''Daniel Paul "Danny" Butterfield''' (born 21 November 1979 in Boston, Lincolnshire) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender and midfielder (association football)midfielder for League Two side  Exeter City F.C.Exeter City.
He has previously played for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United. He is primarily utilised as a Rightbackright back.  However, Butterfield originally started out as a central midfielder for Palace and has played on the Left midfieldright of midfield as well. He also had spells for Palace as a striker whilst first choice strikers were absent.

Tyias Browning.name: Tyias Browning
Tyias Browning.intro: '''Tyias "Ty" Browning''' (born 27 May 1994) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League.

Ledley King.name: Ledley King
Ledley King.intro:
'''Ledley Brenton King''' (born 12 October 1980) is a former English Association footballfootballer who played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He retired in July 2012. Highly rated as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentral defender, in 2009 he was named by ''The Times'' as Tottenham's 25th best player of all time. King made 21 international appearances for England national football teamEngland.
In the latter part of his career, King was plagued by chronic knee problems, for which no effective treatment or remedy was found. Instead of training with the rest of the squad King undertook fitness exercises on his own, allowing him to play one first team game per week. His former manager Harry Redknapp called King "an absolute freak" for being able to perform at Premiership level despite not training. Whilst playing, King was cited by opponents and pundits as one of the best defenders in the Premier League.
King announced his retirement from all forms of football on 19 July 2012 as a result of the chronic knee injuries that plagued much of his career. He continues to represent Tottenham Hotspur on an ambassadorial level.

Kenny Cunningham.name: Kenny Cunningham
Kenny Cunningham.intro:
'''Kenneth Edward "Kenny" Cunningham''' (born 28 June 1971) is an Republic of IrelandIrish former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. He played international football for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland until his retirement in 2005. He spent his entire professional club career, from 1989 to 2007, in England, making more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League playing for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.
After retirement as a player, he worked as a pundit for RTÉ Sport, and successfully completed the UEFA Pro Licence coaching qualification in 2011.

Anders Andersson.name: Anders Andersson
Anders Andersson.intro:
'''Anders Andersson''' (born March 15, 1974 in Tomelilla) is a former SwedenSwedish soccerfootball Midfielderforward and TV pundit. He has played 27 international matches for the Sweden national football teamSwedish national team, and was a squad player for the Euro 2000 and Euro 2004. He also participated in the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona.
He played for Svenstorps IF as a child, but joined Malmö FF in 1990. He gradually became a star in the AllsvenskanSwedish league, and was bought by English FA PremiershipPremier League outfit Blackburn Rovers. There, he played four league matches, and scored once against Preston North End in the League Cup.cite web
url=
title=Different class as Blackburn show Premiership pedigree
publisher=Lancashire Evening Telegraph
date=17 September 1997 accessdate=27 November 2009 He went on to play in Denmark and Portugal, and returned to Malmö FF in July 2005. He remained in the club until the end of the 2008 season, when the team decided not to extend Anders contract. The news was received with dismay among Malmö supporters, and Anders himself has written about the situation at his blog at local newspaper Skånska Dagbladet. [

Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink.name: Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink
Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink.intro:
'''Jerrel Hasselbaink''' (born 27 March 1972), usually known as '''Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink''',[
A Forward (association football)striker, he began his career with Telstar (football club)Telstar and AZ (football club)AZ, before leaving the Netherlands for Portuguese club S.C. CampomaiorenseCampomaiorense in August 1995. He joined Boavista F.C.Boavista the following year, and won the Taça de Portugal with the club in 1997. Later that year he was signed by English side Leeds United F.C.Leeds United for a £2 million fee, and went on to win the Premier League Golden Boot award in 1998–99. He was sold on to Spanish club Atlético Madrid for £10 million in 1999, helping the club to the final of the Copa del Rey despite the club also suffering relegation from La Liga.
Hasselbaink returned to the Premier League with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for a club record £15 million fee in May 2000. He scored 23 league goals in his 2000–01 in English footballdebut season, which earned him a second Premier League Golden Boot. He also helped the club to the 2002 FA Cup Final and a second-place league finish in 2003–04. He moved to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough on a free transfer in July 2004, and helped the club to the final of the UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup in 2006. He signed with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic in July 2006, before joining Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in August 2007. He played on the losing side in the 2008 FA Cup Final before retiring. He also scored nine goals in 23 matches in a four-year international career for the Dutch national team, and appeared at the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
In May 2013 he was appointed manager of Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp in the Belgian Second Division, where he stayed for one season. In November 2014, he was hired by Burton Albion.

\u00c1lvaro V\u00e1zquez.name: Álvaro Vázquez
\u00c1lvaro V\u00e1zquez.intro: '''Álvaro Vázquez García''' (born 27 April 1991) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Getafe CF as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.

Peter Atherton.name: Peter Atherton
Peter Atherton.intro: '''Peter Atherton''' (born 6 April 1970), is an English former professional association footballfootballer who plays as both a defender and a midfielder. He was assistant manager at Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, although on 16 October 2007, he came out of playing retirement to appear for the Shaymen.  He is now Development Squad manager at Wigan Athletic F.CWigan Athletic. He was born in Wigan, Lancashire

Billy Sharp.name: Billy Sharp
Billy Sharp.intro:
'''William Louis "Billy" Sharp''' (born 5 February 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Leeds United F.C.Leeds United. He has also played for  Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Reading F.C.Reading.
Three days after the death of his newborn son in 2011, Sharp famously chose to play and scored the opener in that game, and 5 days later he was applauded by opposing fans following his goal against their team. He and his wife set up The Luey Jacob Sharp Foundation in aid of gastroschisis research and to support other people affected by this condition.

Craig Harrison.name: Craig Harrison
Craig Harrison.intro: '''Craig Harrison''' (born 10 November 1977) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. He suffered a horrific leg break in January 2003 whilst playing for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and subsequently retired from professional football. He is now Director of Football at The New Saints F.C.The New Saints having previously held the same position at Airbus UK Broughton F.C.Airbus UK Broughton.

Iago Aspas.name: Iago Aspas
Iago Aspas.intro:
'''Iago Aspas Juncal''' (; born 1 August 1987) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Sevilla FC on loan from Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
He spent most of his career with Celta de Vigo, appearing in 153 official games over the course of six seasons and scoring 50 goals. He made his La Liga debut with the club in 2012, and moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool the following year.

Alen Bok\u0161i\u0107.name: Alen Bokšić
Alen Bok\u0161i\u0107.intro:
'''Alen Bokšić''' (; born 21 January 1970) is a former Croatian Association footballfootball player. A prolific forward who spent most of his career in France and Italy, he was renowned for his technique and is regarded as one of the greatest players in the history of the Croatia national football team.
With Olympique de MarseilleMarseille Bokšić won the 1992–93 UEFA Champions League, and was voted fourth in the 1993 European Footballer of the Year poll. That same year he was named Croatian Footballer of the Year. He also won two Serie A titles in 1997 and 2000 with Juventus F.C.Juventus and S.S. LazioLazio respectively, and is regarded as one of the best foreign players in the history of Serie A since 1980.
Although selected for Yugoslavia national football teamYugoslavia squad at the 1990 FIFA World Cup in Italy, the 20-year-old Bokšić did not play in the tournament, with coach Ivica Osim preferring more experienced forwards in the lineup. Following Croatia's independence from Yugoslavia Bokšić became an integral part of Croatia's national team in the 1990s under coach Miroslav Blažević. He played for Croatia at the UEFA Euro 19961996 European Championship but was not included in the squad for the 1998 FIFA World Cup in France due to injury he suffered only weeks before the tournament. Bokšić finally made his World Cup debut at the age of 32 at the 2002 FIFA World Cup in Japan, appearing in all three of the team's group stage matches, before retiring only a year later in 2003.

Mark Bowen.name: Mark Bowen
Mark Bowen.intro:
'''Mark Rosslyn Bowen''' (born 7 December 1963) is a WalesWelsh former footballer
He was a left-back who played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Shimizu S-Pulse, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Reading F.C.Reading. He also played international football for Wales national football teamWales. Since retiring in 1999, he has worked as assistant to former international team-mate Mark Hughes with Wales, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City Fulham F.C.Fulham, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.

Mike Pollitt.name: Mike Pollitt
Mike Pollitt.intro: '''Michael Francis "Mike" Pollitt''' (born 29 February 1972) is an English former Association footballfootballer who last played for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, and is now employed as the club's goalkeeping coach.

Nigel Clough.name: Nigel Clough
Nigel Clough.intro:
'''Nigel Howard Clough''' (born 19 March 1966) is an EnglandEnglish former association footballfootballer and current coach (sport)manager of Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. Playing predominantly as a Forward (association football)striker, but later in his career used as a midfielder, Clough was capped by England national football teamEngland 14 times in the early 1990s.
Born in Sunderland, Tyne and WearSunderland and raised in Allestree, Derby,[
He subsequently had spells with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday before moving into non league football at the age of 32 when he became Player-manager#Player-managerplayer manager with Southern Football League Premier Division side Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion in 1998. Over the next decade, during half of which he continued to play a regular role on the field, Clough took Burton up from the seventh tier of the English football league system to the brink of promotion to Football League TwoLeague Two before leaving halfway through the 2008–09 season to follow in his father's footsteps and take over at Derby County F.C.Derby County, where he served for four years until September 2013. He would go on to resurrect Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United's season, pulling them out of the relegation zone and taking them to an FA Cup semi-final.

Jores Okore.name: Jores Okore
Jores Okore.intro:
'''Tetchi Jores Charlemagne Ulrich Okore''' (born 11 August 1992), known as '''Jores Okore''', is a Danish professional footballer who plays as a defender (association football)centre back for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier League and the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team.
Okore is considered a capable and aggressive defender, who is known for his pace and strength.
Jores Okore.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Cala (footballer, born 1989).name: Cala (footballer, born 1989)
Cala (footballer, born 1989).intro: '''Juan Torres Ruiz''' (born 26 November 1989), commonly known as '''Cala''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Granada CF as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Cala (footballer, born 1989).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mickey Evans (footballer, born 1973).name: Mickey Evans (footballer, born 1973)
Mickey Evans (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''Michael James''' "'''Mickey'''" '''Evans''' (born 1 January 1973) is a former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He spent most of his career with Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, for whom he scored 73 goals in 384 appearances in the Football League. He also played in the Premier League for Southampton F.C.Southampton and the Football League for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Torquay United F.C.Torquay United. Evans earned one Cap (sport)cap for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at full international level.

Daniel Cordone.name: Daniel Cordone
Daniel Cordone.intro:
'''Carlos Daniel "Lobo" Cordone''' (born 6 January 1974 in General Rodríguez PartidoGeneral Rodríguez), is a former ArgentinaArgentine professional football (soccer)football player who played as a striker.
Cordone started his career at Club Atlético Vélez SársfieldVélez Sársfield and played there for six seasons before moving to Racing Club de Avellaneda in 2000. Later that year he moved to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for a fee of £500,000, but failed to meet expectations at Newcastle and only played for the club for one season. He scored three goals, against Derby County,cite web
url=
title=Nervous Newcastle beat Derby
publisher=BBC
date=23 August 2000 accessdate=3 November 2009 Tottenham Hotspurcite web
url=
title=Newcastle make Spurs suffer
publisher=BBC
date=26 August 2000 accessdate=3 November 2009 and Bradford City in the League Cup.cite web
url=
title=Newcastle 4-3 Bradford
publisher=BBC
date=2 November 2000 accessdate=3 November 2009
In 2001 he returned to Argentina to play for Argentinos Juniors. After one season with them he moved to Club Atlético San Lorenzo de AlmagroSan Lorenzo where he helped the club to win the Copa Sudamericana in 2002.
Towards the end of his career he has played for Club Atlético Argentino de MerloArgentino de Merlo in the Primera C MetropolitanaMetropolitan 4th division and Club Sportivo Independiente RivadaviaIndependiente Rivadavia in the Torneo Argentino A3rd division Interior.

Paul Simpson.name: Paul Simpson
Paul Simpson.intro: '''Paul David Simpson''' (born 26 July 1966) is an English association footballfootball manager and former player who is currently the first-team coach of Football League Championship side Derby County F.C.Derby County. His son Jake SimpsonJake is also a professional footballer.

Hossam Ghaly.name: Hossam Ghaly
Hossam Ghaly.intro:
'''Hossam El Sayed Ghaly''' (; born 15 December 1981) is an Egyptian international Association footballfootballer who plays for Egyptian club Al-Ahly. Ghaly plays mainly as a central midfielder, less frequently as a right full-back and due to injuries even an outside midfielder.
He has played 55 international matches for Egypt national football teamEgypt since his debut in 2002, and was part of their squads for the 2004 African Cup of Nations and their victory in the same tournament 2010 Africa Cup of Nationsin 2010.
Ghaly played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur of the Premier League between 2006 and 2009. His time at the club was marked by scandals.cite news
url=
title=Ghali faces wrath of Jol after shirt protest
publisher=Daily Mail
date=11 May 2007 accessdate=24 April 2010
location=London

Gavin Strachan.name: Gavin Strachan
Gavin Strachan.intro:
'''Gavin David Strachan''' (born 23 December 1978 in Aberdeen) is a ScotlandScottish former professional association footballfootballer, current coach and sports journalist. He is the son of manager and former player Gordon Strachan, and currently is youth team coach at Peterborough United.
Spending most of his early years with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Strachan has played for ten different senior clubs, and is a self-described journeyman (sport)journeyman. He was cap (sport)capped eight times for the Scotland national under-21 football team.
As part of a degree in sports journalism at Staffordshire University Strachan wrote a blog for BBC News 2008–2009.

Darren Eadie.name: Darren Eadie
Darren Eadie.intro: '''Darren Malcolm Eadie''' (born 10 June 1975 in Chippenham, WiltshireChippenham) is a former professional Association footballfootballer, who made his name as a pacey left-sided midfielder with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He later played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.

John Barnes.name: John Barnes
John Barnes.intro:
'''John Charles Bryan Barnes''' Member of the Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 7 November 1963) is a Jamaican-born English former Association footballfootballer and manager (football)manager, who currently works as a commentator and pundit for ESPN and SuperSport (TV channel)SuperSport.
During his playing career, Barnes had successful periods at Watford F.C.Watford and Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the 1980s and 1990s, winning the  Football LeagueFirst Division twice, the F.A. CupFA Cup twice, and playing for England national football teamEngland 79 times (at the time, a record for a black peopleblack player). After a period at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, he ended his playing career at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic in 1999.
After retiring as a player, Barnes had a brief stint as head coach of Celtic F.C.Celtic in 1999–2000, working alongside Kenny Dalglish. He took over as manager of the Jamaica national football teamJamaica national team in 2008, but resigned six months later to become manager at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. He was sacked by Tranmere in 2009, after a series of poor results that saw the club make one its poorest starts to a season in its history.
An Anfield legend, Barnes was voted by Liverpool fans at number five in their 2006 poll of 100 Players who shook the Kop. A year later in 2007, FourFourTwo magazine acclaimed Barnes as the best Liverpool player of all time.
Barnes featured on the song "World in Motion" by New Order, performing a rap towards the end of the song, which was released ahead of England national football teamEngland's 1990 FIFA World Cup campaign.

Simon Cox (footballer, born 1987).name: Simon Cox (footballer, born 1987)
Simon Cox (footballer, born 1987).intro:
'''Simon Richard Cox''' (born 28 April 1987) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Reading F.C.Reading and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. With Ireland he participated at UEFA Euro 2012.
Cox began his career at Reading F.C.Reading. He has also played for Brentford F.C.Brentford, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion before his transfer to Nottingham Forest.

Joachim Bj\u00f6rklund.name: Joachim Björklund
Joachim Bj\u00f6rklund.intro: '''Joachim Björklund''' (born 15 March 1971 in Växjö, Sweden) is a former SwedenSwedish professional Association footballfootballer. For many years he formed a successful defender (football)central defensive partnership with Patrik Andersson for the Swedish national football teamSwedish national team. Björklund was selected for the UEFA Euro 1992, 1994 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000. He was also a member of the Swedish squad that competed at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona. His maternal uncle is Tommy Svensson, the Sweden national football team manager from 1991 to 1997.
Joachim Bj\u00f6rklund.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Clint Hill.name: Clint Hill
Clint Hill.intro:
'''Clinton Scott''' "'''Clint'''" '''Hill''' (born 19 October 1978) is an English association footballfootballer who currently is the captain (association football)captain of Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. His preferred position is at Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre-back, although he can also play at Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back.
Hill began his career with local side Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers in 1997. He broke into the first team and became a regular as Rovers reached the Football League Cup Final 2000League Cup final in 2000. Hill was sent-off however as Tranmere lost 2–1. He remained at Prenton Park until 2002 when he joined Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and after impressing there he was signed by Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. His first season with Stoke was cut down due to injuries which hampered his time at the club. He left for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace after making 84 appearances for Stoke in five years. At Palace he played well despite the club struggling financially and when manager Neil Warnock joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers Hill followed him in July 2010. In his first season at Loftus Road QPR won the Championship and gained promotion to the Premier League. They went on to ensure survival on the final day of the season, Hill winning the supporters Player of the year awardplayer of the year award for his performances this despite playing 25 matches and also spending a short time on loan at Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.

Peter Shirtliff.name: Peter Shirtliff
Peter Shirtliff.intro:
'''Peter Andrew Shirtliff''' (born 6 April 1961) is an English Association footballfootball coach and former player. As a player, he made more than 500 appearances in the Football League playing as a Defender (association football)central defender for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United. He has managed Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, and now is currently unemployed.
Shirtliff was born in Hoyland, near Barnsley. He began his football career with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, where in two spells with the club he achieved promotion and relegationpromotion from the Football League Second DivisionSecond Divisionin 1983–84, a third-place finish in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in the 1991–92 season, and a Football League CupLeague Cup-winners' medal in 1991 Football League Cup Final1991, but missed the 1993 Football League Cup Final1993 League Cup and 1993 FA Cup FinalFA Cup finals with a broken arm. He played more than 350 games for the club in all competitions. After his first spell with Wednesday, he joined Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, where his two goals in the last 10 minutes of extra time in the 1986–87 playoff final replay against Leeds United F.C.Leeds kept the club in the First Division. He also played for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United).
Shirtliff retired from the game in 1997, after 18 years as a professional footballer. He has since been youth team coach at Barnsley and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. In 2005, he was appointed assistant manager at Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town. He became the manager of Mansfield following the dismissal of Carlton Palmer in September 2005, and lasted 15 months in the job before getting sacked in December 2006 following a poor run of results.
In 2007, he was appointed assistant manager at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, and two years later took up the equivalent post at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town. He was also Assistant manager and Caretaker manager of Bury F.C.Bury before departing in 2013.
His younger brother Paul ShirtliffPaul was also a professional footballer.

Lee Peltier.name: Lee Peltier
Lee Peltier.intro: '''Lee Anthony Peltier''' (born 11 December 1986) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City as a Defender (association football)defender. While capable of playing anywhere across the defensive line and in midfield, he primarily features at Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. He started his career with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool before moving on to spells with Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town, Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, before returning to Huddersfield. He is also a former England national under-18 football teamEngland under-18 international.

Bernt Haas.name: Bernt Haas
Bernt Haas.intro: '''Bernt Haas''' (born 8 April 1978 in Vienna, Austria) is a SwitzerlandSwiss former Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender who last played for the SwitzerlandSwiss club FC St. Gallen.

Isaac Okoronkwo.name: Isaac Okoronkwo
Isaac Okoronkwo.intro: '''Isaac Okoronkwo''' (born May 1, 1978 in Nbene, Nigeria) is a professional football (soccer)football player who last played as a defender for FC Rostov in Russia.
Isaac Okoronkwo.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

\u00c1ngel Di Mar\u00eda.name: Ángel Di María
\u00c1ngel Di Mar\u00eda.intro:
'''Ángel Fabián Di María Hernández''' (born 14 February 1988) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team. He can play as either a Midfielder#Wingerwinger or Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
After beginning his career with Rosario Central, Di María moved to Europe in 2007 to play for S.L. BenficaBenfica, earning a €25 million move to Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid three years later. After winning the 2013–14 UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League with Real Madrid, he signed for Manchester United in 2014 for a British record £59.7 million.
A full international for Argentina since 2008, Di María has earned over 50 caps for his country. He scored the goal that won the country gold at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Olympics, and has also represented them at two World Cups and the 2011 Copa América.

Matthias Breitkreutz.name: Matthias Breitkreutz
Matthias Breitkreutz.intro:
'''Matthias Breitkreutz''' (born 12 May 1971) is a former GermanyGerman Association footballfootballer.
Born in Crivitz, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, he played during his career for Berliner FC Dynamo, SG Bergmann-Borsig, Aston Villa F.C., FC Hansa Rostock, Arminia Bielefeld, 1. FC Saarbrücken, VfB Leipzig, and FC Augsburg.

Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1980).name: Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1980)
Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1980).intro:
'''Mark Hudson''' (born 24 October 1980) is an EnglandEnglish professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Northern Football League side Shildon A.F.C.Shildon.
He has previously played for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Worksop Town F.C.Worksop Town, Bradford Park Avenue F.C.Bradford Park Avenue, West Auckland Town F.C.West Auckland Town, Ashington A.F.C.Ashington and Sunderland RCA F.C.Sunderland RCA

Jamie McMaster.name: Jamie McMaster
Jamie McMaster.intro:
'''Jamie McMaster''' (born 29 November 1982) is an Australian Football (soccer)footballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for the Sutherland Sharks in the NSW Premier League.
Despite being born in Sydney, Australia, McMaster represented England at England national under-18 football teamU18 and England national under-20 football teamU20 levels before successfully requesting to be eligible for the Australia national soccer teamAustralian national team.

Abdisalam Ibrahim.name: Abdisalam Ibrahim
Abdisalam Ibrahim.intro: '''Abdisalam Abdulkadir Ibrahim''' (born 1 May 1991) is a NorwayNorwegian association footballfootballer who currently plays for Superleague Greece club Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos, as a midfielder.
Abdisalam Ibrahim.position: Midfielder  association football  Midfielder,Defender  association football   Defender

Patrick Vieira.name: Patrick Vieira
Patrick Vieira.intro:
'''Patrick Vieira''' (born 23 June 1976) is a retired French association footballfootballer who is the Manager of the Reserves squad at Premier League club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, known as the Elite Development Squad.
He rose to prominence during a hugely successful spell at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal from 1996 to 2005, where he eventually became club captain, and won three Premier League titles – one unbeaten – and four FA Cups. He transferred from Arsenal in 2005 and spent one season at Juventus F.C.Juventus, helping the team to the Serie A championship. Following Juventus' relegation for their part in a 2006 Serie A scandalmatch-fixing scandal, Vieira moved to F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale and won three Serie A titles. He has 107 cap (sport)caps for France, and was part of their 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000-winning sides, as well as their runner-up finish in the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup. Vieira was a complete, powerful, tenacious and aggressive footballer, with outstanding physical and technical attributes. He was a competent tackler, and a tactically intelligent midfielder, gifted with good ball skills, distribution, and vision; he also excelled in the air. These attributes, in addition to his pace, strength, pressing ability, and stamina, allowed him to link up the defence with the attack effectively.
In May 2010, Vieira was nominated FAO Goodwill AmbassadorGoodwill Ambassador of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. He announced his retirement from professional football on 14 July 2011. Vieira is currently Football Development Executive at Manchester City with a role to oversee aspects such as youth development, commercial partners and the club's social responsibility programme, "City in the Community".

M\u00e1rton F\u00fcl\u00f6p.name: Márton Fülöp
M\u00e1rton F\u00fcl\u00f6p.intro:
'''Márton Fülöp''' (; born 3 May 1983) is a HungaryHungarian association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.  After playing in Hungary for MTK Budapest FC, BKV Előre SC and BFC Siófok, he signed for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
Loan periods with Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield and Coventry City F.C.Coventry was followed by a spell on loan with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland with whom he permanently signed in 2007.  Further loans to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City ended with a transfer to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
Fülöp has also represented his country at Hungary national under-21 football teamunder-21 and Hungary national football teamfull international level.

Ty Gooden.name: Ty Gooden
Ty Gooden.intro:
'''Ty Gooden''' (born 23 October 1972) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer. He played for teams including Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham and Canvey Island F.C.Canvey Island.
He became the first transfer to take place in the new millennium, when Gillingham manager Peter Taylor (footballer born 1953)Peter Taylor signed him for £100,000, in a deal that saw Swindon team mate Iffy Onuora join the Kent club as well.  Later that year Gooden won promotion to the First Division with Gillingham, after they beat Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic 3-2 in the Division Two play-off Final at the old Wembley Stadium, Gooden providing the cross for Andy Thomson (Scottish footballer)Andy Thomson for the winning goal. He had a successful first season in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division with Gillingham, helping them to finish 13th in the league. He also scored in an FA Cup tie at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where he came through the youth ranks.
However, injury hampered the rest of his time at the Gills and, in 2003, he was sold to non-league Canvey Island.
Gooden was the European scout (sport)scout for Reading F.C.Reading operating from France. Gooden finished working for Reading after they failed to gain promotion to the Premiership. He has now joined Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as their scout in France.
After a brief spell with Sunderland, Gooden has secured a contract working as a scout at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in France.

Mark Ford.name: Mark Ford
Mark Ford.intro: '''Mark Stuart Ford''' (born 10 October 1975) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played in the Football League for Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United and Darlington F.C.Darlington and in the Belgian First Division for K.F.C. Lommel S.K.Lommel. He was cap (sport)capped twice for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s.

Dean Holdsworth.name: Dean Holdsworth
Dean Holdsworth.intro:
'''Dean Christopher Holdsworth''' (born 8 November 1968) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootball player and manager. As a Forward (association football)striker he scored 193 goals in 610 league games over a 22 year career. Despite playing for 16 clubs in 19 spells the majority of his goals and appearances came at Brentford F.C.Brentford, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He is the twin brother of David Holdsworth.
As a player he started his career at Watford F.C.Watford in 1986, where he spent three years before signing with Brentford F.C.Brentford, following a short loan spell. A highly successful three years followed before he was signed by Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon in 1992. After an impressive five year spell he transferred to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He spent six years at Bolton, before in 2003 joining Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds and then back to Wimbledon. In 2004 he signed with Havant & Waterlooville F.C.Havant & Waterlooville, where he spent one season before joining Derby County F.C.Derby County. In 2006 he dropped out of the Football League for the final time, joining Weymouth F.C.Weymouth. Short spells followed at Heybridge Swifts F.C.Heybridge Swifts, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, and Newport County A.F.C.Newport County.
His management career started at Redbridge F.C.Redbridge in 2007. After one season there he took the reins at Newport County. In his second season with the club he took them to the Conference South title with 28 points to spare. In January 2011 he switched clubs to take charge at League Two side Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town until his dismissal in February 2013. He took charge at Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City in May 2013, before resigning five months later.

Ross Wallace.name: Ross Wallace
Ross Wallace.intro: '''Ross Wallace''' (born 23 May 1985) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Adam Lallana.name: Adam Lallana
Adam Lallana.intro:
'''Adam David Lallana''' (born 10 May 1988) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an attacking midfielder for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the England national football teamEngland national team.
He began his youth career with AFC BournemouthBournemouth before transferring to  Southampton F.C.Southampton in 2000, where he became a professional in 2006. After a brief loan back to Bournemouth he broke into Southampton's first team as they earned two promotions from Football League OneLeague One to the Premier League, becoming captain in 2012. After two seasons in the top flight and an international breakthrough, he joined Liverpool for an undisclosed fee in July 2014.
Lallana was given his senior international debut for England in 2013 and was selected for the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Ben Watson (footballer, born July 1985).name: Ben Watson (footballer, born July 1985)
Ben Watson (footballer, born July 1985).intro:
'''Ben Watson''' (born 9 July 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for  Watford F.C.Watford as a midfielder. He has previously played for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and had loan spells at Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He has also represented England at England national under-21 football teamU21 level.
Watson won an FA Cup winners medal in 2013 FA Cup Final2013, by scoring a stoppage time header and the only goal of the game against Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. This was the first time Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic had won the FA Cup.

Nikola Jerkan.name: Nikola Jerkan
Nikola Jerkan.intro:
'''Nikola Jerkan''' (born 8 December 1964) is a former football (soccer)football defender (football)defender from Croatia.
Jerkan was born in Split (city)Split and started playing football professionally for NK Zagreb. In 1983 he moved to Dinamo Vinkovci where he would spend three years before moving to Hajduk Split in 1986. In 1988 he started playing for the first team and played two seasons before he moved to Real Oviedo in Spain in 1990. In 1991, in his second season there, he was selected for the best defender of La Liga.
He played for the Croatian national football team between 1992 and 1997, attaining 31 caps and scoring one goal (against Lithuania national football teamLithuania in Zagreb during the qualifications for 1996 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 96). He played three games at the 1996 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 96 and was at that point established in the centre of the Croatian defence.
Jerkan joined Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in the summer of 1996 for a fee of £1million. Jerkan's time at Nottingham Forest was traumatic. He struggled to hold down a first-team place and after the departure of Frank Clark (footballer)Frank Clark never hit it off with new manager Dave Bassett.
He went on a year-long loan to SK Rapid WienRapid Vienna of Austria at the start of the 1997-98 season and was never seen in the English game again. He spent the 1998/99 season at the City Ground but played no games.
In 1999 he moved R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi where he played during the next two seasons, and then retired. He then moved to live in Oviedo.
Nikola Jerkan.birth_place: Split (city)|Split,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Henning Berg.name: Henning Berg
Henning Berg.intro:
'''Henning Stille Berg''' (; born 1 September 1969) is a NorwayNorwegian Association footballfootball manager (association football)manager and former player.
He played as a right back from 1988 until 2004, most notably in the Premier League where he won titles with both Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, thus becoming the first player to win the Premier League with two different clubs. He also played in his native land for Vålerenga IF FotballVålerenga and Lillestrøm SKLillestrøm before finishing his career in the Scottish Premier League with Rangers F.C.Rangers. He was capped list of footballers with 100 or more caps100 times by Norway national football teamNorway, scoring 9 goals.
Berg became a manager in 2005 with FK LynLyn and then Lillestrøm. He returned to Blackburn as manager in 2012, but was sacked after just 57 days in the post, overseeing ten games including only one victory. In January 2014 he became the new coach of Legia Warsaw (football)Legia Warsaw.

Patrick Kluivert.name: Patrick Kluivert
Patrick Kluivert.intro:
'''Patrick Stephan Kluivert''' (; born 1 July 1976) is a football coach and a former Dutch Association footballfootball player. As a player, he played as a Forward (association football)striker for AFC AjaxAjax, A.C. MilanMilan, FC Barcelona, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Valencia CFValencia, PSV Eindhoven, and Lille OSCLille.
He began his coaching career as an assistant coach for AZ (football club)AZ and then N.E.C. (football club)NEC, before coaching Jong FC Twente to a national title in the Beloften Eredivisiereserves league., He was the assistant manager to Louis van Gaal, for the Netherlands national football team, in their third place finish at the 2014 FIFA World Cup in Brazil. He is currently coaching the Curaçao national football team.
Part of Ajax's Golden generation#AFC AjaxGolden Generation of the 1990s, aged 18, Kluivert scored the winner in the 1995 UEFA Champions League Final. He spent six years with Spanish club Barcelona where he formed a successful partnership with Rivaldo, and won the 1998 and 1999 Spanish La Liga championship and the 1998 Copa del Rey.
Kluivert played for the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team from 1994 to 2004, and with 40 goals from 79 appearances was their highest goalscorer until surpassed by Robin van Persie in 2013. He was selected for three European Championships and the 1998 FIFA World Cup, and was the joint top scorer at Euro 2000 where he scored 5 times. In 2004, he was named in the FIFA 100, a list of the 125 greatest living footballers chosen by Pelé as part of FIFA's centenary observances.

Nicky Law (footballer, born 1988).name: Nicky Law (footballer, born 1988)
Nicky Law (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Nicholas "Nicky" Law''' (born 29 March 1988) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Scottish club Rangers F.C.Rangers, as a midfielder. He is the son of football manager and former player Nicky Law (footballer born 1961)Nicky Law, Sr.
Law began his career with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, however he failed to make a significant breakthrough into the first team and had loan spells with Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and twice at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. In 2009, he was given a free transfer (association football)free transfer joining Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and later moved to Scotland to join Scottish Premier League side Motherwell F.C.Motherwell. Whilst with Motherwell Law was named in the PFA Scotland Team of the Year#Scottish Premier League 7PFA Scotland Team of the Year for season 2012–13 and the following summer joined Rangers F.C.Rangers.

Neil Moss.name: Neil Moss
Neil Moss.intro: '''Neil Graham Moss''' (born 10 May 1975 in New Milton, Hampshire) is a retired footballer who last played as a goalkeeper for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth.

Klas Ingesson.name: Klas Ingesson
Klas Ingesson.intro: '''Klas Inge "Klabbe" Ingesson''' (20 August 1968  – 29 October 2014) was a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer and manager. He spent most of his career as a midfielder in Europe, mainly in Sweden, Belgium, Netherlands, England, Italy and France. Ingesson represented the Sweden national football teamSweden national team on 57 occasions, including the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 and 1994 FIFA World Cup, as well as the UEFA Euro 19921992 European Championship. He was the manager of IF Elfsborg from 2013 to 2014 until his death in October 2014.

Liam O'Brien (footballer, born 1964).name: Liam O'Brien (footballer, born 1964)
Liam O'Brien (footballer, born 1964).intro: '''William Francis "Liam" O'Brien''' (born 5 September 1964 in Dublin) is an Irish former association footballfootballer who played for Bohemian F.C.Bohemians, Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers and Cork City Football ClubCork City.

Adri\u00e1n Paz.name: Adrián Paz
Adri\u00e1n Paz.intro:
'''Adrián Paz''' (born 9 September 1968 in Montevideo, Uruguay) is a professional Association footballfootballer who, playing intermittently for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town during the 1994-95 in English football1994–95 season the transfer was done by his FIFA agent Marcelo Houseman together with another player Mauricio Taricco. He became the first Uruguayan to play in the English Premier League.Cite web
