In January 1996, Major League Soccer began 1996 MLS Inaugural Allocationsallocating players to its newly established teams.  Paz was sent to the Columbus Crew where he played 27 games.  On February 1, 1997, the Crew sent Paz to the Colorado Rapids in exchange for the first-round selection in the 1997 MLS Supplemental Draft.[

Graham Hyde.name: Graham Hyde
Graham Hyde.intro:
'''Graham Hyde''' (born 10 November 1970) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer, turned manager.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1988 to 2008, notably in the Premier League with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He also played in the Football League with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Hereford United F.C.Hereford United, before moving into Non-league football with Worcester City F.C.Worcester City, Hednesford Town F.C.Hednesford Town, Halesowen Town F.C.Halesowen Town and Fleet Town F.C.Fleet Town. In 2011 he became manager of Redditch United F.C.Redditch United but departed at the end of the 2011–12 season.

Vegard Heggem.name: Vegard Heggem
Vegard Heggem.intro: '''Vegard Heggem''' (born 13 July 1975 in Trondheim) is a former Norway national football teamNorway international association footballfootballer.
Vegard Heggem.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Chris Basham.name: Chris Basham
Chris Basham.intro: '''Christopher Paul "Chris" Basham''' (born 20 July 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He can play in Defender (association football)defence or midfieldermidfield.  Having started as a junior with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, he played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, as well as having loan spells at Stafford Rangers F.C.Stafford Rangers and Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, prior to joining Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in August 2010.

Maxi Rodr\u00edguez.name: Maxi Rodríguez
Maxi Rodr\u00edguez.intro:
'''Maximiliano Rubén "Maxi" Rodríguez''' (; born 2 January 1981) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays for Newell's Old Boys. Nicknamed ''La Fiera'' (AnimalBeast in English) he is commonly used as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger on both flanks, but can also operate as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.[
Rodríguez arrived in Spain in his early 20s, and went on to spend the bulk of his professional career there, playing for RCD EspanyolEspanyol and Atlético Madrid and amassing La Liga totals of 232 games and 58 goals over the course of eight seasons. He also spent two years with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in England.
An Argentina national football teamArgentine international in the 2000s, Rodríguez represented the country in three FIFA World CupWorld Cups, finishing second in 2014 FIFA World Cup2014.

Milan Jovanovi\u0107 (footballer, born 1.name: Milan Jovanović (footballer, born 1981)
Milan Jovanovi\u0107 (footballer, born 1.intro:
'''Milan "Lane" Jovanović''' (Serbian Cyrillic: Милан Јовановић, born 18 April 1981) is a former Serbian Association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (football)winger.
He began his career with FK Vojvodina and had brief spells at Shakhtar Donetsk and FC Lokomotiv MoscowLokomotiv Moscow before joining Standard Liège, where he was named Belgian Pro League player of the year in 2008 and Belgian Golden Shoe the following year. In 2010–11, he spent the season at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, returning to Belgium afterwards to spend the rest of his career at RSC AnderlechtAnderlecht.
Jovanović earned 44 caps for the Serbia national football teamSerbian national team from his debut in 2007, and scored 11 international goals. Coach Radomir Antić created a wing-tandem with Jovanović and Miloš Krasić which is remembered as the best wing-partnership in the modern history of the Serbian national team. He represented 2010 FIFA World Cup squads#SerbiaSerbia at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
Milan Jovanovi\u0107 (footballer, born 1.birth_place: Bajina Bašta,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Milan Jovanovi\u0107 (footballer, born 1.position: Forward  association football  Forward,Midfielder Winger Winger

Artur Boruc.name: Artur Boruc
Artur Boruc.intro:
'''Artur Boruc'''  (; born 20 February 1980) is a Polish Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a goalkeeper for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth on loan from Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton. He has previously played in Poland for Miejski Klub Piłkarski Pogoń SiedlcePogoń Siedlce, Dolcan Ząbki and Legia Warsaw, in Scotland for Celtic F.C.Celtic and in Italy for ACF FiorentinaFiorentina.
Boruc began his career in the Polish third division with Miejski Klub Piłkarski Pogoń SiedlcePogoń Siedlce.  He joined Ekstraklasa team Legia Warsaw in 1999 and, whilst still a reserve, had a spell on loan at Dolcan Ząbki in 2000.  Boruc broke through to the Legia Warsaw first team in 2002 and by 2003 had become the club's first choice goalkeeper.  Boruc made his international debut against the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland in April 2004 and became a regular in the Poland national football teamPolish international squad.
In the summer of 2005, Boruc joined Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic.  In his five years in Glasgow, Boruc made 221 appearances for the club, winning the Scottish Premier League three times, the Scottish Cup once and the Scottish League Cup twice.  Boruc frequently found himself at the centre of controversy in his time at Celtic and was on various occasions fined by the club and the Scottish Football Association and was even issued with a formal caution by Strathclyde Police.  Celtic fans nicknamed Boruc, 'The Holy Goalie'.
Boruc moved to Italy in 2010 to join ACF FiorentinaFiorentina, spending two years at the Serie A club before returning to Britain in 2012 to sign for Premier LeagueEnglish Premiership side Southampton F.C.Southampton.
Boruc has played in the finals of two major international competitions for his country, and won praise for his performances.  After a spell out of favour, he has since regained his starting place in the Poland side.

Thomas Hitzlsperger.name: Thomas Hitzlsperger
Thomas Hitzlsperger.intro:
'''Thomas Hitzlsperger''' (born 5 April 1982) is a German former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.  He spent the early part of his career playing for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in England (accompanied by a short loan spell at Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield), before returning to Germany to play for VfB StuttgartStuttgart, where he won the Bundesliga in 2007. In 2010 he signed for ItalyItalian side S.S. LazioLazio, before moving back to England to join West Ham United F.C.West Ham United later that year. He then had brief spells with VfL WolfsburgWolfsburg and Everton F.C.Everton.
Hitzlsperger also represented the Germany national football teamGerman national team, earning 52 caps and being selected for the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008.  Following a series of injuries, he retired from football in September 2013.

Denny Landzaat.name: Denny Landzaat
Denny Landzaat.intro: '''Denny Domingues Landzaat''' (, born 6 May 1976 in Amsterdam) is a Dutch former Association footballfootballer who mostly played as a defensive midfielder.

Iv\u00e1n Guerrero.name: Iván Guerrero
Iv\u00e1n Guerrero.intro: '''Mario Iván Guerrero Ramírez''' (born 30 November 1977) is a Honduran Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Fort Lauderdale Strikers in the North American Soccer League. He is the club captain.

\u00c1d\u00e1m Bogd\u00e1n.name: Ádám Bogdán
\u00c1d\u00e1m Bogd\u00e1n.intro: '''Ádám Bogdán''' (; born 27 September 1987) is a Hungarian professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and the Hungary national football teamHungary national team as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Chris Makin.name: Chris Makin
Chris Makin.intro:
'''Christopher Gregory Makin''' (born 8 May 1973 in St Helens, MerseysideSt Helens, Lancashire, England) is an English professional association footballfootballer currently playing for Radcliffe Borough. He spent the final part of his career at Southampton F.C.Southampton, but is perhaps most famous for his spell at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.  He played as a defender (football)defender.
His previous clubs are Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Olympique de Marseille, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Wigan Athletic, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Reading F.C.Reading and Southampton F.C.Southampton.
On 23 April 2008, on advice from his doctor, Makin retired from football after failing to overcome a hip injury which had prevented him playing since September 2007.[
In March 2010 he sigined for Northern Premier League Division 1 side Radcliffe Borough F.C.Radcliffe Borough.

Martin Pringle.name: Martin Pringle
Martin Pringle.intro:
'''Martin Ulf Pringle''' (born 18 November 1970) is a SwedenSwedish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Centre forwardcentre forward, and the current assistant manager of FC Copenhagen.
As a player he played from 1991 until his career was cut short by injury in 2002. Having started his career with Stenungsunds IFStenungsunds he soon moved on to Helsingborgs IF before a switch to Portugal in 1996 with S.L. BenficaBenfica. In 1999 he moved to England with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. Having suffered a horrific injury at Athletic that sidelined him for up to a year he returned in 2002 in a loan spell with Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town but was forced to retire in his second game for the club following a leg breaking tackle that ended his professional football career.
Pringle has since subsequently forged a career in coaching, notably in Women's association footballwomen's football.
Martin Pringle.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

J\u00fcrgen Klinsmann.name: Jürgen Klinsmann
J\u00fcrgen Klinsmann.intro:
'''Jürgen Klinsmann''' (, born 30 July 1964) is a German association footballfootball Manager (association football)manager and former player who is currently the head coach of the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team. As a player, Klinsmann played for several prominent clubs in Europe and was part of the West Germany national football teamWest German team that won the 1990 FIFA World Cup and the unified German team that won the 1996 UEFA European Championship. One of Germany's premier strikers during the 1990s, he scored in all six major international tournaments he participated in, from Euro 1988 to 1998 World Cup. In 1995 he came in third in the FIFA World Player of the Year award; in 2004 he was named in the FIFA 100 list of the "125 Greatest Living Footballers".
Klinsmann managed the German national team to a third-place finish in the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup. On 12 July 2006, he officially announced that he would step down as Germany's coach after two years in charge and be replaced by assistant coach Joachim Löw. He took over as coach of Bundesliga club FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich in July 2008 when Ottmar Hitzfeld stepped down. On 27 April 2009, he was released early, even though he had won five of the previous seven league games and was only three points behind league leader VfL Wolfsburg. In the jointly initiated reforms at Bayern, it emerged there was a severe clash of opinions between coach and club management. On 29 July 2011, the US Soccer Federation named Klinsmann the coach of the United States men's national team. In CONCACAF Gold Cup 20132013 he won the CONCACAF Gold Cup with the United States. He led the United States team to the last 16 of the World Cup in Brazil in 2014. Outside of his professional football life he completed an apprenticeship as a baker in 1982, runs a Children Charity foundation in four countries, and is a certified helicopter pilot.

Gabriel Paulista.name: Gabriel Paulista
Gabriel Paulista.intro:
'''Gabriel Armando de Abreu''' (born 26 November 1990), known as '''Gabriel Paulista''' or simply '''Gabriel''', is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He began his career with Esporte Clube VitóriaVitória in 2010, and also spent a season-and-a-half in Spain's top flight with Villarreal CFVillarreal before joining Arsenal in January 2015.
Gabriel Paulista.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Damien Duff.name: Damien Duff
Damien Duff.intro:
'''Damien Anthony Duff''' (born 2 March 1979 in Ballyboden, County Dublin, Leinster) is an Irish peopleIrish professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Melbourne City FCMelbourne City.
Duff has previously played for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, with whom he won the Football League Cup; Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, where he won two Premier League titles and another League Cup; Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United where he won the 2006 UEFA Intertoto Cup; and Fulham F.C.Fulham, with whom he played in the 2010 UEFA Europa League Final.
He played international football for Republic of Ireland national football teamIreland for 14 years from his debut in 1998. He played at the 2002 FIFA World Cup and captained the country at UEFA Euro 2012.
He is predominantly a footednessleft footed player.[

Sean McCarthy.name: Sean McCarthy
Sean McCarthy.intro:
'''Sean McCarthy''' (born 12 September 1967) is a WalesWelsh association footballfootball coach and former professional player who made over 500 appearances in the Football League. McCarthy is currently a first team coach at Football League Two club Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle.
McCarthy played primarily as a Forward (association football)striker; however, he was also used in Defender (association football)defence.

Kevin Miller.name: Kevin Miller
Kevin Miller.intro: '''Kevin Miller''' (born 15 March 1969) is an English association footballfootball Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper, currently playing for Bodmin Town F.C.Bodmin Town in the South West Peninsula League.

Ivan Klasni\u0107.name: Ivan Klasnić
Ivan Klasni\u0107.intro:
'''Ivan Klasnić''' (; born 29 January 1980 in Hamburg, West Germany) is a Croatian Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker. He is currently a free agent, having last played for 1. FSV Mainz 05Mainz 05 in the Fußball-BundesligaBundesliga in 2013.
He began his career with local side FC St. PauliSt. Pauli, and moved to Werder Bremen in 2001 after helping his previous team to promotion to the Bundesliga. He scored 49 league goals in 151 appearances with Werder Bremen, winning a league and cup double in 2004. After a season in France with FC NantesNantes, he moved to English Premier League team Bolton Wanderers in 2009, initially on loan. After their relegation in 2012, he spent a season back in Germany with Mainz.
Klasnić is also a player for the Croatia national football teamCroatian national football team. In 2007, Klasnić underwent a kidney transplant, and became the first player to participate in a major tournament (UEFA Euro 2008) after a transplant. He also represented Croatia at UEFA Euro 2004 and the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Marvin Robinson.name: Marvin Robinson
Marvin Robinson.intro: '''Marvin Leon St.Clair Robinson''' (born 11 April 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Hednesford Town F.C.Hednesford Town.

Jan Vennegoor of Hesselink.name: Jan Vennegoor of Hesselink
Jan Vennegoor of Hesselink.intro: '''Johannes "Jan" Vennegoor of Hesselink''' (; born 7 November 1978) is a Dutch former association footballfootballer who last played for PSV Eindhoven. He formerly played for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team as a forward (association football)striker. He played for clubs such as the Dutch Eredivisie's FC Twente and PSV Eindhoven, the Scottish Premier League's Celtic F.C.Celtic, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City of the English Premier League and SK Rapid WienRapid Vienna of Austria's Austrian Football BundesligaBundesliga.

Paul Parker.name: Paul Parker
Paul Parker.intro:
'''Paul Andrew Parker''' (born 4 April 1964 in West Ham, London) is an EnglandEnglish former professional footballer, manager and sports television pundit.
He attended Sanders Draper School in Hornchurch .As a player he was a defender (football)full back from 1982 to 1997 most notably in the Premier League for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, also having spells with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Farnborough Town F.C.Farnborough Town. He was also a crucial player at the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 World Cup with England national football teamEngland and earned 19 caps. He had a brief spells as a manager from 2001 to 2005 with Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City and Welling United F.C.Welling United.

Libor Koz\u00e1k.name: Libor Kozák
Libor Koz\u00e1k.intro: '''Libor Kozák''' (born 30 May 1989) is a Czech RepublicCzech professional association footballfootballer who plays as a striker (association football)striker for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier League. He is a member of the Czech Republic national football team.

Hans Segers.name: Hans Segers
Hans Segers.intro:
'''Johannes "Hans" Segers''' (born 30 October 1961) is a Dutch former professional association footballfootballer and goalkeeping coach of Premier League side Fulham F.C.Fulham.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1981 to 2001, notably spending 8 years with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon where he featured in the Premier League. He also played in England's top flight for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He also had spells in his native the Netherlands with PSV Eindhoven and in Scotland with Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic, and in the Football League with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.

Chris Wood (footballer, born 1991).name: Chris Wood (footballer, born 1991)
Chris Wood (footballer, born 1991).intro:
'''Christopher Grant Wood''' (born 7 December 1991) is a New Zealand professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town on loan from Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.
Wood was born in Auckland and started his senior career with Cambridge FC, Waikato FC and Hamilton Wanderers before moving to England to play for Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. After playing for a number of clubs on loan, wood moved to Leicester City in 2013.
Wood has been capped over thirty times for the New Zealand national football teamNew Zealand national team, scoring thirteen goals. He played for the side at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Itzik Zohar.name: Itzik Zohar
Itzik Zohar.intro: '''Itzik Zohar''' (; born October 31, 1970) is a former Israeli international Association footballfootballer and  television sports personality. Born in Bat Yam, Israel to a family of North African extraction, he holds the distinction of scoring the first two goals for Israel national football teamIsrael in its first world cup qualifier in the UEFA confederation on October 28, 1992. He is widely regarded as having been one of the best Direct free kickfree kick takers in Football in IsraelIsraeli football, and presumably in European football in general.

Goran Popov.name: Goran Popov
Goran Popov.intro:
'''Goran Popov''' (, born 2 October 1984) is a Republic of MacedoniaMacedonian Association footballfootballer, who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Macedonian side Vardar and the Macedonia national football teamMacedonia national team.
Popov started his career with local side FK BelasicaBelasica and moved to Greece with Proodeftiki F.C.Proodeftiki and AEK Athens F.C.AEK Athens. He signed for Red Star Belgrade in 2004 but injuries prevented him from making an impact and he returned to Greek football with Egaleo F.C.Egaleo after a short loan spell in Poland with Odra Wodzisław. Egaleo were relegated in 2007 and Popov joined Levadiakos F.C.Levadiakos before moving to Dutch club SC HeerenveenHeerenveen in July 2008. At Heerenveen he finally found some success and won the KNVB Cup in 2009 scoring in the final against FC Twente. After good form in European competitions Popov signed for Ukrainian side FC Dynamo KyivDynamo Kyiv.
Goran Popov.position: Defender  association football  Left back Left back

Josh Walker.name: Josh Walker
Josh Walker.intro:
'''Joshua "Josh" Walker''' (born 21 February 1989) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for I-League side Bengaluru FCBengaluru.
Walker started his career at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, progressing through the Middlesbrough F.C. Reserves and Academyclub's youth academy and was part of the club's FA Youth Cup winning team in 2004. He subsequently made his first-team debut for Middlesbrough in 2006, and made a handful of appearances during his four-year professional tenure at the club. During his time at Middlesbrough, Walker was loaned out on four separate occasions, playing for Football League clubs in the form of A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, and Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United respectively, as well as Scottish Premier League club Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen.
Walker joined Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Watford F.C.Watford on a free transfer in August 2010. He made four appearances for Watford, before joining Stevenage F.C.Stevenage on loan in November 2010. He was subsequently loaned out to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town in January 2011, Stevenage in August 2011 and Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United in January 2012. In April 2012, Walker agreed a permanent move to Scunthorpe United and signed for the team on 1 July.
After playing for non-league Gateshead F.C.Gateshead between 2013 and 2014, he joined Bengaluru as the club's marquee signing. Walker has represented England in various youth levels and has also captained the team at 2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup.

Joonas Kolkka.name: Joonas Kolkka
Joonas Kolkka.intro: '''Joonas Einari Kolkka''' (born 28 September 1974 in Lahti) is a retired FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer who last played for Texas Dutch Lions in the United States. He has played as a left Midfielder#Wingerwinger most of his career, but can also play on the right wing.

Martin Albrechtsen.name: Martin Albrechtsen
Martin Albrechtsen.intro: '''Martin Albrechtsen''' (born 31 March 1980) is a DenmarkDanish professional association footballfootball player, currently playing for the Danish superliga team Brøndby IF. He can play in any position across the back four and has played four games for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team. He is the older brother of Jacob Albrechtsen.
Martin Albrechtsen.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Danny Ings.name: Danny Ings
Danny Ings.intro:
'''Daniel "Danny" William John Ings''' (born 23 July 1992) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Burnley F.C.Burnley in the Premier League. Ings has played internationally for England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21.
Ings started his career in the youth team of Southampton F.C.Southampton but was released as a schoolboy. He subsequently joined the Centre of Excellence at A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, progressing through the system to sign a two-year scholarship in the summer of 2008. He made his first professional appearance in October 2009. He signed his first professional contract in May 2010 and extended it in September of the same year, the same month in which he joined Conference South side Dorchester Town F.C.Dorchester Town on loan for two months. He scored his first professional goal for Bournemouth in February 2011. In August 2011, he joined Football League Championship side Burnley F.C.Burnley, on a four-year contract.
Off the field, Ings has gained a reputation for charitable acts.

Matt Duke.name: Matt Duke
Matt Duke.intro: '''Matthew "Matt" Duke''' (born 16 June 1977) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Chris Waddle.name: Chris Waddle
Chris Waddle.intro:
'''Christopher Roland "Chris" Waddle''' (born 14 December 1960 in Felling, Tyne and WearFelling, Tyne and Wear) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer, manager and current Football commentator and pundit. He still plays at semi-professional level for Northern Counties East League side Hallam F.C.Hallam, as well as being contracted to ESPN as part of their commentary team.
During his professional career that lasted from 1978 to 1998, he played for clubs including Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in England, and Olympique de Marseille in France. Waddle earned 62 caps for the England national football team between 1985 and 1991, and was a member of England's squads for the 1986 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 1988, and the 1990 FIFA World Cup. He famously missed the decisive penalty in England's World Cup 1990 semi-final shootout defeat against West Germany national football teamWest Germany. Having left Sheffield Wednesday and the Premier League in 1996, he had a brief stint with Scottish Premier League side Falkirk F.C.Falkirk. He returned to England with Football League sides Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. In 1997 he became player/manager of Burnley F.C.Burnley but having failed to gain promotion from Division Two, he quit and joined Division Three side Torquay United F.C.Torquay United as a full-time player. His time at United didn't last very long and he decided to retire from professional football. In 2000 he came out of retirement by signing for semi-professional side Worksop Town F.C.Worksop Town of the Northern Premier League, where he remained for two years and also helped out on the club's coaching side. Having left Worksop in 2002, he moved further on down the football ladder by having brief stints with both Glapwell F.C.Glapwell and Stocksbridge Park Steels F.C.Stocksbridge Park Steels before officially hanging his boots up in 2002.
Despite spending the 1997–98 season as a manager Waddle never returned to the coaching side of the game following his retirement and became a TV football pundit, commentator and sports newspaper writer. He previously worked for Setanta Sports and currently works as a co-commentator for ESPN (UK)ESPN's Premier League football coverage, and for BBC 5 Live. In 2013 after playing amateur football in the Sheffield area he came out of retirement for a second time by signing for Hallam F.C.Hallam at the age of 52.

Iago Falque.name: Iago Falque
Iago Falque.intro: '''Iago Falque Silva''' (born 4 January 1990) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Genoa C.F.CGenoa, as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.

Rob Quinn.name: Rob Quinn
Rob Quinn.intro: '''Robert John "Rob" Quinn''' (born 8 November 1976) is an English peopleEnglish-Republic of IrelandIrish association footballfootballer, currently playing for Sevenoaks Town F.C.Sevenoaks. He plays as midfielder predominantly in the centre but can also play at centre back. He has represented the Republic of Ireland under-21 national football teamRepublic of Ireland under-21's and Republic of Ireland B national football teamRepublic of Ireland B team.

Lorenzo Amoruso.name: Lorenzo Amoruso
Lorenzo Amoruso.intro: '''Lorenzo Pier Luigi Amoruso''' (born 28 June 1971) is a retired ItaliansItalian Association footballfootballer who played for seven teams during his footballing career but is perhaps best known for his six-year spell with Glasgow side Rangers F.C.Rangers. In that six-year spell, he managed to win nine major honours with the club including domestic trebles in seasons 1998–99 and 2002–03, representing them over 150 times in competitive football.

Edwin van der Sar.name: Edwin van der Sar
Edwin van der Sar.intro:
'''Edwin van der Sar'''  () (born 29 October 1970) is a Dutch former association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for AFC AjaxAjax, Juventus F.C.Juventus, Fulham F.C.Fulham and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He is the most Cap (sport)capped player in the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team's history. He currently works as marketing director at Ajax.[
He started his senior career at Ajax and is considered to be a member of a Golden Generation#AFC Ajaxgolden generation of players at the club. He remained there for nine years before moving to Italian club Juventus and then to England, first to Fulham and then to Manchester United. He is one of the few footballers to have won the UEFA Champions League with two different teams – with Ajax in 1995 and Manchester United in 2008; in the latter, he was also named UEFA Man of the Match. Van der Sar also won the UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup with Ajax in 1992.
Throughout a long and successful career, Van der Sar achieved and set numerous records. In the 2008–09 Premier League2008–09 season he set the world league clean sheet record by not conceding a single goal for 1,311 minutes. Along with being the most capped player for the Netherlands national team, with 130 caps, he is also the oldest player to win the Premier League, at 40 years and 205 days old. Individually Van der Sar has won several honours, including Best European Goalkeeper in 1995 and 2009, and UEFA Club Football AwardsUEFA Club Goalkeeper of the Year in 2009. He is considered, by critics and fellow players, as one of the greatest goalkeepers of all time.

Andranik Teymourian.name: Andranik Teymourian
Andranik Teymourian.intro:
'''Andranik Timotian-Samarani''', commonly known as '''Andranik "Ando" Teymourian''' (, , born 6 March 1983) is an Iranian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Tractor Sazi F.C.Tractor Sazi in the Iran Pro League and Iran national football teamIran. He usually plays as a Midfielderdefensive midfielder, but can also play as a wide midfielder. He is notably the first Armenian ChristianityChristian to captain the Iranian national team.
From 2006 to 2010, he played for three clubs in England, including Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton and Fulham F.C.Fulham in the Premier League.
Teymourian played his first match for Iran in 2005, and has featured in their squads for the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cups, and also the 2007 AFC Asian Cup2007, 2011 AFC Asian Cup2011 and 2015 AFC Asian Cup2015 Asian Cups.

Phil Walker (footballer, born 1954).name: Phil Walker (footballer, born 1954)
Phil Walker (footballer, born 1954).intro: '''Philip 'Phil' Leonardus Walker''' (born 29 August 1954) is an English retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.

Christian Wilhelmsson.name: Christian Wilhelmsson
Christian Wilhelmsson.intro:
'''Christian Ulf Wilhelmsson''' (; born 8 December 1979), nicknamed ''Chippen'', is a Swedish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
After playing several seasons with Mjällby AIFMjällby (three years), Stabæk FotballStabæk (four) and R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht (three), he played in quick succession for teams in France, Italy, England and Spain, before spending the better part of four years in the late 2000s in Saudi Arabia with Al-Hilal FCAl-Hilal.
Wilhelmsson played 79 times with Sweden national football teamSweden, representing the nation at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and in three UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships.

Marc Wilson (Irish footballer).name: Marc Wilson (Irish footballer)
Marc Wilson (Irish footballer).intro:
'''Marc David Wilson''' (born 17 August 1987) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender or midfielder for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team.
Wilson left his home town of Aghagallon in 2000 to join the Manchester United F.C.Manchester United Manchester United F.C. Reserves and AcademyAcademy, after four years he was released and was signed by Hampshire club Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He went out on loan to A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town to gain first team experience before making his Premier League debut on boxing day in 2008. After Portsmouth were relegated to the Football League in 2010 Wilson was named as club captain.
In August 2010 he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in a deal which saw Stoke duo Liam Lawrence and Dave Kitson join Pompey. He converted to left back under Tony Pulis and in his first season at Stoke he played in the 2011 FA Cup Final as Stoke lost 1–0 to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. Wilson was a regular in 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 as Stoke played in the UEFA Europa League. He suffered a broken leg in October 2012 which saw him miss most of the 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 season.
Wilson got his first call up to the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland senior squad for their game against Brazil national football teamBrazil in March 2010, and made his first appearance as a substitute in February 2011 during the 3–0 2011 Nations CupNations Cup win over Wales national football teamWales.

Vance Warner.name: Vance Warner
Vance Warner.intro: '''Vance Warner''' (born 3 September 1974) is a former EnglandEnglish professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a defender (football)defender from 1994 until 2000 notably for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, as well as appearing for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town and Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United.

Jordon Ibe.name: Jordon Ibe
Jordon Ibe.intro: '''Jordon Ashley Femi Ibe''' (; born 8 December 1995) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as a midfielder#Wingerwinger. He previously played for Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, spent time on loan at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Derby County F.C.Derby County, and has represented England from England national under-18 football teamunder-18 to England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level.

Hogan Ephraim.name: Hogan Ephraim
Hogan Ephraim.intro: '''Hogan Phillip Ephraim''' (born 31 March 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. He is a graduate of the West Ham United F.C.West Ham United The Academy of FootballAcademy and a former England Under-19 international. His primary position is as a winger but he can also play as a forward.

David Grondin.name: David Grondin
David Grondin.intro: '''David Grondin''' (born 8 May 1980 in Juvisy-sur-Orge, Essonne) is a former FranceFrench football (soccer)footballer.

\u013dubom\u00edr Michal\u00edk.name: Ľubomír Michalík
\u013dubom\u00edr Michal\u00edk.intro: '''Ľubomír Michalík''' (born 13 August 1983) is a SlovakiaSlovak professional Association footballfootballer who plays for as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back who currently plays for FC DAC 1904 Dunajská StredaDunajská Streda.
\u013dubom\u00edr Michal\u00edk.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jon Harley.name: Jon Harley
Jon Harley.intro: '''Jon Harley''' (born 26 September 1979 in Maidstone, Kent) is an English association footballfootballer. He has previously played for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Watford F.C.Watford, Notts County F.C.Notts County and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth.

Paul Dickov.name: Paul Dickov
Paul Dickov.intro:
'''Paul Dickov''' (born 1 November 1972) is a Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer and is the current manager (association football)manager of Football League OneLeague One side Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers.
Dickov played as a forward (association football)forward from 1990 to 2011, starting his career with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where he won the UEFA Cup Winners Cup in 1994, but often struggled to hold a place in the first team and spent time on loan with Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion before moving to  Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1996 who were then in Football League First DivisionDivision One. Over six seasons at the club, Dickov experienced two promotion and relegationpromotions and two relegations, playing in three different divisions. Dickov left in 2002 to join Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, where he stayed for two seasons and, in 2004, he signed for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, and was part of the team which qualified for the UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup in 2005–06 in English football2005–06. Upon the expiry of his Blackburn contract in 2006, he rejoined Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and later went on to play for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Derby County F.C.Derby County and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He joined Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic in 2010 as Player/Manager and later retired from the playing side of the game to concentrate on the managerial side of his position. He held the position at Oldham until he resigned in February 2013. He became manager of Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in May 2013.
In 2000, he made his debut for Scotland national football teamScotland, against San Marino national football teamSan Marino. In total he represented his country ten times, scoring one goal.

Tyler Blackett.name: Tyler Blackett
Tyler Blackett.intro: '''Tyler Nathan Blackett''' (born 2 April 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back or Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He joined Manchester United's academy in 2002, and has also played on loan for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. Born in Manchester, he qualifies to play for England national football teamEngland, Barbados national football teamBarbados or Jamaica national football teamJamaica internationally.

Bryan Roy.name: Bryan Roy
Bryan Roy.intro: '''Bryan Edward Steven Roy''' (born 12 February 1970 in Amsterdam) is a NetherlandsDutch Association footballfootball manager and a former professional player. He has managed various of Ajax' youth teams – formerly Jong AjaxAjax E1 and now Jong AjaxAjax B.

Juan Sebasti\u00e1n Ver\u00f3n.name: Juan Sebastián Verón
Juan Sebasti\u00e1n Ver\u00f3n.intro:
'''Juan Sebastián Verón''' (; born 9 March 1975) is a retired Argentine Association footballfootballer and the current chairman of Estudiantes de La Plata,[
In 2004, he was included in the FIFA 100 centenary list of the 125 greatest living footballers, selected by Pelé as part of FIFA's centenary celebrations. Verón has both Argentine and Italian nationality lawItalian citizenship. His nickname is ''La Brujita''  (''The Little Witch''), a nod to his father Juan Ramón VerónJuan Ramón who was known as ''La Bruja'' (''The Witch'') and was also a championship winning player with Estudiantes.[

Graeme Sharp.name: Graeme Sharp
Graeme Sharp.intro: '''Graeme Marshall Sharp''' (born in Glasgow, Lanarkshire on 16 October 1960) is a former association footballfootballer.

Paul Shepherd.intro:
'''Paul Shepherd''' (born 17 November 1977) is a n English former professional association footballfootballer.

Chris Perry.name: Chris Perry
Chris Perry.intro: '''Christopher John "Chris" Perry''' (born 26 April 1973 in Carshalton, Greater London) is an English former Association footballfootballer. He was a Defender (association football)defender and retired from the game after having been released from Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Aly Cissokho.name: Aly Cissokho
Aly Cissokho.intro:
'''Aly Cissokho''' (, born 15 September 1987) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier League and the France national football teamFrance national team. He plays as a Defender (football)#Full backleft back and has been described as a "sprightly left-back with good speed and stamina".
Cissokho began his career playing for local clubs within his hometown, such as Blois Foot 41. In 2004, he signed with professional club FC Gueugnon and spent three years in the club's youth system before making his debut in the 2006–07 Ligue 22006–07 season. Cissokho spent only one season at the club and, in June 2008, signed with PortugalPortuguese club Vitória F.C.Vitória de Setúbal in the Portuguese Liga. After spending only 1/2 the season with the club, Cissokho departed Vitória for the league's 2007–08 Portuguese Ligadefending champions F.C. PortoPorto. With Porto, Cissokho won the Portuguese 2008–09 Portuguese Ligaleague and Cup of Portugal 2008–09cup Double (association football)double and played in the UEFA Champions League for the first time. In July 2009, after a failed transfer attempt to Italian club A.C. MilanMilan, he signed a five-year contract with French club Lyon for a fee of €15 million. At the beginning of the 2012–2013 season Cissokho was sold to Valencia CF and was subsequently loaned to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for the 2013–14 season.
Cissokho is also a France national football teamFrench international and earned his first call-up to the team in November 2009. He made his senior debut a year later in August 2010 in a Exhibition matchfriendly match against Norway national football teamNorway.
Aly Cissokho.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Steve Guppy.name: Steve Guppy
Steve Guppy.intro:
'''Stephen Andrew''' "'''Steve'''" '''Guppy''' (born 29 March 1969) is an English former England national football teaminternational Association footballfootball Midfielder#Wingerwinger, who most recently worked as a first team coach at Premier League club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.
Starting his senior career with Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers in 1989, over a five-year period he made around 200 appearances for the club, helping Wycombe win promotion to the Football League. Earning a move to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 1994, later in the year he transferred to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. After three successful years at Vale he signed to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in 1997. After a four-year spell with the "Foxes" he moved to Scotland to play for Celtic F.C.Celtic. In 2004 he returned to Leicester, before brief spells with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, and another return to Wycombe. In 2005 he joined American club D.C. United, and after another year returned to the English non-league scene with Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough. He then retired in 2008 following a spell back in the States with Rochester Rhinos.
As well as a successful nineteen-year club career, he earned England caps at England national under-21 football teamunder-21, England C national football teamsemi-pro, 'England B national football teamB', and finally at full England national football teamsenior level.

Paul Okon.name: Paul Okon
Paul Okon.intro:
'''Paul Michael Okon''' (born 5 April 1972 in Sydney) is a former Australian Association footballfootball (soccer) player and current coach.
He previously captained the Australia national football teamAustralian National Team and has represented Australia Olympic Football Team at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona. Okon's career began at Marconi Stallions in the old National Soccer LeagueNSL in Australia.  He then went on to play at many European clubs including S.S. Lazio and ACF FiorentinaFiorentina in Italy's Serie A, Vicenza Calcio in Serie B, Middlesbrough F.C. and Leeds United F.C. in the English FA Premier LeaguePremiership, Club Brugge, K.V. Oostende in Belgium's Jupiler League and APOEL F.C.APOEL in the Cypriot First Division. Okon was inducted into the Australian Football Hall of Fame in 2009, for his services to football in Australia.[

Alejandro Pozuelo.name: Alejandro Pozuelo
Alejandro Pozuelo.intro: '''Alejandro Pozuelo Melero''' (born 20 September 1991) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Rayo Vallecano as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.

Aljo\u0161a Asanovi\u0107.name: Aljoša Asanović
Aljo\u0161a Asanovi\u0107.intro: '''Aljoša Asanović''' (born 14 December 1965 in Split (city)Split, SR Croatia, SFR Yugoslavia) is a retired CroatsCroatian footballer best known from his performances in the mid-to-late 90s when he played for  Derby County F.C.Derby County and for Croatian national football teamCroatia during Euro 96 and 1998 FIFA World CupWorld Cup 98. He was nicknamed "Vatreni Lakat" (meaning "fiery elbow") for his style of running with elbow pointed out, moving opposing players.
Aljo\u0161a Asanovi\u0107.birth_place: Split (city)|Split,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Darren Huckerby.name: Darren Huckerby
Darren Huckerby.intro:
'''Darren Carl Huckerby''' (born 23 April 1976) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and academy coach at Championship side Norwich City F.C.Norwich City
As a player he was a Forward (association football)forward from 1993 until 2009 and is notably remembered for his time spent playing in the Premier League, appearing for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He also played as a professional for Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Millwall F.C.Millwall and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest before finishing his career for Major League Soccer side San Jose Earthquakes.

Reece Grego-Cox.name: Reece Grego-Cox
Reece Grego-Cox.intro: '''Reece Randall Grego-Cox''' (born 12 November 1996) is a footballer who plays as a striker for English club Queens Park Rangers. Born in England, he represents the Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team.

Theo Walcott.name: Theo Walcott
Theo Walcott.intro:
'''Theo James Walcott''' (born 16 March 1989) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the England national football teamEngland national team. Walcott won the BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year Award in 2006.
Walcott is a product of the Southampton F.C. AcademySouthampton Academy and started his career with Southampton F.CSouthampton before joining Arsenal F.C.Arsenal for £5 million in 2006. His speedy pace and ball crossing led his manager Arsène Wenger to deploy him on the Forward (association football)#Wingerwing for most of his career. In the 2012–13 season, a contract dispute led him to being played as a Forward (association football)striker, before returning in the 2013–14 season playing on the wing once again.
On 30 May 2006, Walcott became England's youngest ever senior football player aged 17 years and 75 days. On 6 September 2008, he made his first competitive start in a 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)World Cup qualifier against Andorra national football teamAndorra, and in the following match against Croatia national football teamCroatia on 10 September he opened his senior international goals tally and became the youngest player in history to score a hat-trick for England. He has represented England national football teamEngland at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and UEFA EuroEuro 2012 and has 36 Cap (sport)caps, scoring five goals.

Andy Pearce.name: Andy Pearce
Andy Pearce.intro: '''Andrew Pearce''' (born April 20, 1966 in Bradford on Avon, England) is a retired English football defender. He spent his career in England, starting at Halesowen Town F.C.Halesowen Town, then moved to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and, after 3 seasons at Highfield Road moved to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday where he achieved cult status following his goal against Sheffield United in a memorable 3-1 victory at Hillsborough. In 1995 he moved to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon for £ 600,000 but this proved a waste of money as Pearce only made 7 appearances in his first season and no more after that. So in 1999 he joined Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot, where he spent the remainder of his career.

Ronny Johnsen.name: Ronny Johnsen
Ronny Johnsen.intro:
'''Jean Ronny Johnsen''' (born 10 June 1969) is a Norwegian former association footballfootballer who played at both professional and international levels as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back or Midfielder#Defensivedefensive midfielder.
Johnsen played club football in Norway, Turkey, and England for Sem IFSem, Stokke ILStokke, Eik-Tønsberg, FK LynLyn, Lillestrøm SKLillestrøm, Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Vålerenga FotballVålerenga.
He was capped 62 times for Norway national football teamNorway, and competed at the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
Ronny Johnsen.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Andrejs \u0160tolcers.name: Andrejs Štolcers
Andrejs \u0160tolcers.intro: '''Andrejs Štolcers''' (born 8 July 1974 in Riga) is a Latvian former professional Association footballfootballer, who is currently playing for Surrey South Eastern Combination League side Chessington KC FC based in Chessington, Surrey.
Andrejs \u0160tolcers.birth_place: Riga,Latvian Soviet Socialist Republic|Latvian SSR,Soviet Union

Tam\u00e1s Priskin.name: Tamás Priskin
Tam\u00e1s Priskin.intro: '''Tamás Priskin''' (; born 27 September 1986) is a HungariansHungarian Association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Győri ETO FC and the Hungary national football teamHungarian national football team as a Forward (association football)striker.

Marcel Gecov.name: Marcel Gecov
Marcel Gecov.intro: '''Marcel Gecov''' (born 1 January 1988) is a CzechsCzech Association footballfootballer who plays for Romanian club FC Rapid BucureștiRapid București as a midfielder.

Maceo Rigters.name: Maceo Rigters
Maceo Rigters.intro: '''Maceo Rigters''' (born 22 January 1984) is a Dutch former Association footballfootballer, who last played for Gold Coast United in the Australian A-League. His previous clubs include SC HeerenveenHeerenveen, FC DordrechtDordrecht, NAC Breda and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He is also a former player for the Netherlands national under-21 football teamNetherlands Under-21 team.

Paul Telfer.name: Paul Telfer
Paul Telfer.intro:
'''Paul Norman Telfer''' (born 21 October 1971) is a ScotlandScottish former professional Association footballfootballer who is an assistant coach for North American Soccer League side Indy Eleven.
Telfer made over 300 league appearances in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Southampton F.C.Southampton between 1995 and 2005, whilst with Coventry he was capped once by Scotland national football teamScotland and had also previously played just under 150 times for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. In 2005 he signed for Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic where he made 57 appearances in two seasons in his native country. He has since gone on to feature for Bournemouth F.C.Bournemouth and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before finishing his career with non-league side Slough Town F.C.Slough Town in 2009.
In 2011 he joined the coaching staff at Sutton United F.C.Sutton United and also agreed to make a return to the playing side of the game.

Andy Campbell.name: Andy Campbell
Andy Campbell.intro: '''Andrew Paul "Andy" Campbell''' (born 18 April 1979) is an English former association footballfootballer who currently manages Norton & Stockton Ancients F.C.Norton & Stockton Ancients.

Martin Petrov.name: Martin Petrov
Martin Petrov.intro: '''Martin Petyov Petrov''' (; born 15 January 1979) is a former Bulgarian Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Martin Petrov.position: Midfielder Winger Winger,Forward  association football  Forward

Rudy Gestede.name: Rudy Gestede
Rudy Gestede.intro: '''Rudy Gestede''' (born 10 October 1988) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and the Benin national football team   Benin national team

Per Mertesacker.name: Per Mertesacker
Per Mertesacker.intro:
'''Per Mertesacker''' (; born 29 September 1984) is a German professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He also played for the  Germany national football teamGerman national team but retired in August 2014 after winning the World Cup. Mertesacker is a youth product of Hannover 96 and he made his senior league debut in November 2003. Mertesacker was soon dubbed "the Defence Pole" (die Abwehrlatte) by German tabloids and gained a reputation for his good disciplinary record and went 31 Bundesliga games without being booked. Since joining Arsenal, their fans have nicknamed him ''the BFG'', which is short for "Big Fucking German" and an allusion to Roald Dahl's ''The BFG'' due to his height. He has been described as an imposing, reliable, dominant and an accomplished defender.
With SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen, Mertesacker has won a DFB-Pokal title and finished runner-up in the 2008–09 UEFA Cup. With his quiet but effective game, he established himself as Germany's first choice centre-back. Prior to playing at senior level, he played at Germany national under-20 football teamunder-20 and Germany national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. In September 2004, Jürgen Klinsmann, then-manager of Germany national football teamGermany, called Mertesacker up to the 9 October 2004 game against Iran national football teamIran.
He made his debut less than two weeks after his twentieth birthday when he came on as a second-half substitute for Christian Wörns. Over the course of his final two seasons at Werder Bremen, the defender received just one yellow card in 63 league matches. He has participated in the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cups and the European Football ChampionshipUEFA Euros in UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA EURO 20122012. In 2006, the defender established the "Per Mertesacker Stiftung", a charitable foundation that helps support amateur sportsmen and the poor.
Per Mertesacker.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Danny Coyne.name: Danny Coyne
Danny Coyne.intro:
'''Daniel "Danny" Coyne''' (born 27 August 1973) is a Welsh former professional association footballfootballer and Goalkeeping coach of League Two side Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, where he also acts as joint assistant manager along with Michael Jackson (footballer)Michael Jackson.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who played between 1992 and 2014. He came through the youth ranks at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers during the 1992–93 season. Coyne eventually went on to become the club's first choice keeper and went on to make 111 appearances in the league before signing for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town in the summer of 1999. He spent four seasons at Blundell Park, two of which saw him named "Supporters Player of the Season" and thus becoming an integral part of the every Grimsby team he played in. In his final year at Town the club suffered relegation from the Football League First Division. In July 2003 Coyne signed with Premier League side Leicester City F.C.Leicester City where he was understudy to Ian Walker (footballer)Ian Walker for one season before moving to Burnley F.C.Burnley. Initially signed as the first club's new first choice keeper he eventually was replaced by Brian Jensen (footballer born 1975)Brian Jensen, and only made 40 league appearances in a three-year stay at Turf Moor. In 2007 he returned to Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers for two years where he made a further 80 league appearances before joining Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 2009 who had recently suffered relegation from the Premier League. Coyne went on to make 26 league appearances in a three-year stay at Boro where he was mainly used as reserve keeper. During the 2012–13 campaign he joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United but failed to make an appearance and departed at the end of the season.
Between 1996 and 2007 Coyne picked up 16 international caps for Wales national football teamWales.

Robbie Fowler.name: Robbie Fowler
Robbie Fowler.intro:
'''Robert Bernard "Robbie" Fowler''' (born 9 April 1975) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and Manager (association football)manager who played as a Forward (association football)striker from 1993 to 2012. Fowler was known for being a natural scorer with an instinctive goal-poaching ability.
Fowler is best remembered for his time at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and is the List of Premier League players with 100 or more goalssixth-highest goalscorer in the history of the Premier League. He scored 183 goals in total for Liverpool, 128 of which were scored in the Premier League (162 Premier League goals in total). He earned the nickname "God" from the Anfield crowd, becoming a club legend due to his ruthlessness in front of goal and his cheeky personality.[
He moved clubs 18 months later to sign for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. He refused a one year "pay as you play" contract extension and signed with Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers on a three-month "pay as you play" deal instead. In December 2008, he departed Blackburn and forged a career in Australia with North Queensland Fury and Perth Glory. In 2011, he joined ThailandThai side Muangthong United F.C.Muangthong United as a player, but later was appointed player-manager which he remained until his retirement in 2012.
He was Cap (sport)#Association footballcapped for England national football teamEngland 26 times, scoring 7 goals. Fowler was included in England's squads for Euro 96, Euro 2000 and the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

Christophe Dugarry.name: Christophe Dugarry
Christophe Dugarry.intro: '''Christophe Jérôme Dugarry''' (; born 24 March 1972) is a former List of France international footballersFrench international footballer. His clubs include FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux, A.C. MilanMilan, FC BarcelonaBarcelona, Olympique de MarseilleMarseille, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Qatar SC. He was also a member of the France team that won the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000.

Steven Reid.name: Steven Reid
Steven Reid.intro:
'''Steven John Reid''' (born 10 March 1981) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for Premier League Club Burnley F.C.Burnley, having previously played most of his career in midfield. Born in England, he was cap (sport)capped 23 times at international level for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland and scored two goals for them from 2001 to 2008 before retiring from international football on 13 July 2010.
He once notably played for 45 minutes against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium with a broken leg.
Steven Reid.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Nemanja Vidi\u0107.name: Nemanja Vidić
Nemanja Vidi\u0107.intro:
'''Nemanja Vidić''' (, ; born 21 October 1981) is a Serbian Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club Inter Milan. He was part of the Serbia national football teamSerbian national team from 2002 to 2011.
After establishing himself at Red Star Belgrade during the early 2000s, Vidić moved to FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow in the summer of 2004. He further increased his reputation when he was part of the "Famous Four" Serbia national football teamSerbian national team defence that conceded just one goal during the 2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)#Group 72006 FIFA World Cup qualification campaign. He would later sign for Manchester United for around £7 million in January 2006 before establishing a prominent defensive partnership with Rio Ferdinand the following season, and earning a reputation as one of the world's best centrebacks, due to his defensive consistency and awareness, as well as his strength, leadership, and ability in the air. He left Manchester United at the end of his contract in July 2014, joining Inter on a free transfer.
Vidić collected a host of honours in his United career, including three consecutive Premier League titles (five titles in total), the UEFA Champions League, the FIFA World Club Cup, three Football League CupLeague Cup medals, as well as being included in three consecutive (four in total) PFA Team of the Year sides from 2007 to 2009. In the 2008–09 season, he helped United to a record-breaking run of 14 consecutive shutoutclean sheets and was awarded the 2008–09 Premier League#Barclays Player of the SeasonBarclays Player of the Season. He also collected both the club's Fans' and Players' Player of the Year awards. At the start of the 2010–11 season, Vidić was selected as the new Captain (association football)team captain of Manchester United. He collected his second Premier League Player of the Season award in 2010–11.Premier League, [
Nemanja Vidi\u0107.birth_place: Užice|Titovo Užice,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Nemanja Vidi\u0107.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Wojciech Szcz\u0119sny.name: Wojciech Szczęsny
Wojciech Szcz\u0119sny.intro:
'''Wojciech Tomasz Szczęsny''' (; born 18 April 1990) is a Polish Association footballfootballer who plays for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the Poland national football teamPoland national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
His composure, agility and command of his area led to his establishment as Arsenal's first choice when he was 20. After winning his place in the first team, Szczęsny expressed his desire to continue as Arsenal's first choice goalkeeper for the rest of his career.
Szczęsny has earned over 20 caps for Poland from his debut in 2009, and was included in the nation's squad as it co-hosted UEFA Euro 2012.

DJ Campbell.name: DJ Campbell
DJ Campbell.intro:
'''Dudley Junior''' "'''DJ'''" '''Campbell''' (born 12 November 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Maidenhead United in the Conference South.
Campbell's early career was in non-League football between 2000 and 2005, during which time he was capped by England C national football teamEngland C. Following a successful spell at Yeading F.C.Yeading he then moved into the Football League with Brentford F.C.Brentford. Campbell then went on to play in the Premier League for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Queens Park Rangers, and in the Football League for Birmingham, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Blackpool, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Ipswich Town, Blackburn Rovers and Millwall F.C.Millwall.

Lomana LuaLua.name: Lomana LuaLua
Lomana LuaLua.intro:
'''Trésor Lomana LuaLua''' (; born 28 December 1980) is a Democratic Republic of the CongoCongolese Association footballfootballer who plays for Turkish Süper Lig club Akhisar Belediyespor and the Congo DR national football teamCongo DR national team.
LuaLua was born in Kinshasa, but moved to England at a young age. After impressing in a college football match, he signed for Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. There, he scored a total of 21 goals in 68 appearances which prompted Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United to sign him. However, the competition for places meant he was less of a regular in the first team, and after four seasons and 88 appearances, he transferred to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, the club that had previously Loan (association football)loaned him for three months while at Newcastle. He remained there for three seasons, but his spell was marred by disciplinary problems and malaria. After this, he moved to GreeceGreek club Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos and spent a season there, helping them to win their fourth straight Super League Greece title, before joining Al-Arabi SC (Qatar)Al-Arabi in 2008. LuaLua received his first Cap (sport)cap in 2002, and has since represented his national team in the 2004 African Cup of Nations2004 and 2006 Africa Cup of Nations.
LuaLua is also known for setting up the ''LuaLua Foundation'', which provides care for orphans in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and for being a patron for the Haslar Visitors Group. He has a brother, Kazenga LuaLua, who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, and two cousins who play professional football, Albacete BalompiéAlbacete striker Trésor Kandol and Bristol City F.C.Crystal Palace's Yannick Bolasie.

Juan Pablo \u00c1ngel.name: Juan Pablo Ángel
Juan Pablo \u00c1ngel.intro:
'''Juan Pablo Ángel Arango''' (born 24 October 1975) is a retired Colombian Association footballfootballer who last played for Atlético Nacional in Categoría Primera A.
He began his career at Nacional, whom he helped to win the championship in 1994, and then moved to Club Atlético River PlateRiver Plate of Argentina, where he was the league's top scorer in 2000. The following year he moved to Europe, joining Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa of the Premier League for a club record £9.5 million. In 2007, he moved to the United States, where he played for three clubs in Major League Soccer before returning to Atlético Nacional in 2013.
Ángel was also a full international for Colombia national football teamColombia, and made 33 appearances from his debut in 1995, scoring 9 goals.

Gilberto Silva.name: Gilberto Silva
Gilberto Silva.intro:
'''Gilberto Aparecido da Silva''' (; born 7 October 1976), commonly known as '''Gilberto Silva''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who last played for Clube Atlético MineiroAtlético Mineiro as a midfielder or Defender (association football)defender.
Gilberto was raised in a poor family and as a child he balanced playing football with various labour jobs. He began his football career in 1997 with América Futebol Clube (MG)América Mineiro, where good form earned him a move to Clube Atlético MineiroAtlético Mineiro in 2000. He became a star player for Atlético, playing for three years in the Brazilian football league systemBrazilian Campeonato Brasileiro Série A. He came to particular prominence when he helped the Brazil national football teamBrazilian national team win the 2002 FIFA World Cup, playing in all seven of Brazil's matches.
In August 2002, for a fee of £4.5 million, he joined Arsenal, with whom he won the 2003–04 Premier League as an 'Invincible', and two FA Cup trophies. In his first five seasons with the club, he played 208 games and scored 23 goals. On 19 August 2006, he scored Arsenal's first competitive goal at the newly built Emirates Stadium. He was made Captain (association football)#Vice-captainvice-captain of Arsenal in 2006. He has also scored Arsenal's fastest ever goal coming in at just 20 seconds in a game against PSV EindhovenPSV in the 2002–03 UEFA Champions League. During his time with the ''Gunners'', Gilberto developed into one of the best defensive midfielders in Europe. In 2007, he was selected as Brazil Captain (association football)captain for the 2007 Copa AméricaCopa América tournament, which Brazil went on to win. In 2013, Gilberto returned to Atlético Mineiro, where he had won the Libertadores Cup, the South American Champions League.

S\u00e9bastien Puygrenier.name: Sébastien Puygrenier
S\u00e9bastien Puygrenier.intro: '''Sébastien Nicolas Puygrenier''' (born 28 January 1982) is a French Association footballfootball player. He is a  Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back, who currently plays for French team AJ Auxerre.

Yakubu Aiyegbeni.name: Yakubu Aiyegbeni
Yakubu Aiyegbeni.intro:
'''Yakubu Aiyegbeni''' (born 22 November 1982), known as '''Yakubu''', is a Nigerian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Reading F.C.Reading and the Nigeria national football teamNigeria national team. His nickname is "The Yak".
His performances in the 2002–03 UEFA Champions League for Maccabi Haifa F.C.Maccabi Haifa earned a loan move to English club Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth which became permanent as they were promoted to the Premier League in 2003. He has since appeared in over 250 Premier League matches for Portsmouth, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Everton F.C.Everton, and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, and is the second highest African goalscorer in Premier League history with 96 goals. He is the third highest scorer in the history of the Nigeria national football team, and represented them at four African Cup of Nations finals, the 2010 FIFA World Cup and the football at the 2000 Summer Olympicsfootball at the 2000 Summer Olympics.

Billy Kenny (footballer, born 1973).name: Billy Kenny (footballer, born 1973)
Billy Kenny (footballer, born 1973).intro:
'''William Aidan "Billy" Kenny''' (born 19 September 1973) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder for Everton F.C.Everton and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, making a total of 21 appearances in the Football League.[
Kenny is the son of former Everton midfielder Billy Kenny, Sr..

Hugo Lloris.name: Hugo Lloris
Hugo Lloris.intro:
'''Hugo Lloris''' (; born 26 December 1986) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and is the Captain (association football)captain of the France national football teamFrance national team. Lloris is described as a goalkeeper who "boasts lightning reflexes and good decision-making" and is "a formidable opponent in one-on-one situations". Lloris also "commands his box well". Considered one of the best keepers in the world, he is a three-time winner of the National Union of Professional Footballers (UNFP) Trophées UNFP du football#Goalkeeper of the YearLigue 1 Goalkeeper of the Year award.
Lloris began his career with hometown club OGC Nice. He made his debut as a teenager in October 2005 and started in goal during the team's run to the 2006 Coupe de la Ligue Final. After excelling at the club for three seasons, Lloris moved to seven-time Ligue 1 champions Olympique Lyonnais, amid interest from several other clubs, notably A.C. MilanMilan. Lloris won several domestic awards in his first season with Lyon and, in his second season, earned award nominations at European level for his performances in the UEFA Champions League, which saw Lyon reach the semi-finals for the first time.
Lloris is a France national football teamFrench international having represented his nation at France national under-18 football teamunder-18, France national under-19 football teamunder-19, and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. Prior to playing at senior level, he played on the under-19 team that won the 2005 European Under-19 Football Championship. Lloris made his senior international debut in November 2008 in a Exhibition matchfriendly against Uruguay national football teamUruguay. He helped France qualify for the 2010 FIFA World Cup and was applauded by the media for his performance over two legs against the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland in the 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Second Roundqualifying playoffs. In 2010, he captained the national team for the first time.

Alvin Martin.name: Alvin Martin
Alvin Martin.intro:
'''Alvin Edward Martin''' (born 29 July 1958) is a retired English Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender.
Playing most of his footballing career for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United he appeared in 598 games for scoring 34 goals. With the club for 21 years, and winning the 1980 FA Cup Final1980 FA Cup Martin left West Ham in 1996 and played one season with Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient before moving into football management with Southend United F.C.Southend United. This lasted only two seasons before he started a career in the media on radio station talksporttalkSPORT and also as a Pundit (expert)pundit on Sky Sports TV football talk shows.
Playing 17 times for England national football teamEngland during the 1980s, Martin represented them at the 1986 FIFA World Cup1986 World Cup.

Bernard Lambourde.name: Bernard Lambourde
Bernard Lambourde.intro:
'''Bernard Lambourde''' (born 11 May 1971 in Pointe-à-Pitre, Guadeloupe) is a former FranceFrench football defender.
During his spell in England at Chelsea, he is most remembered for scoring the winner in a 1-0 away victory over rivals Tottenham Hotspur in February 2000.cite web

publisher=BBC

At the start of the 2000-01 season, Lambourde found himself out of favour at Chelsea. After failing to make an appearance that campaign, he joined Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth on loan in September, playing 6 games. R\u00e9my Cabella.name: Rémy Cabella
R\u00e9my Cabella.intro: '''Rémy Cabella''' (born 8 March 1990) is a French professional association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in the Premier League. He plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder and has been described as a fast, agile and creative midfielder who can play on the wing or behind a striker.

Ashley Young.name: Ashley Young
Ashley Young.intro: '''Ashley Simon Young''' (born 9 July 1985) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder#Wingerwinger for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the England national football teamEnglish national team. Born and raised in Hertfordshire, Young's father was from Jamaica. Young started his career at Watford F.C.Watford, making his first senior appearances in 2003 under the management of Ray Lewington. He became a first-team regular in 2004–05, and was one of Watford's key players in their promotion winning 2005–06 season. Young continued to play well for Watford in the Premier League, and in January 2007 he transferred to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa for a fee of Pound sterling£8 million, rising to £9.65 million with add-ons. He established himself in the first team at Villa Park, and has since earned 28 caps (sport)caps for England, scoring 7 goals. On 23 June 2011, Young signed for Manchester United for an undisclosed fee.

Stan Collymore.name: Stan Collymore
Stan Collymore.intro: '''Stanley Victor "Stan" Collymore''' (born 22 January 1971) is a retired EnglandEnglish football player who played as a centre-forward from 1990 to 2001. He held the English transfer record when he moved from Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for £8.5 million in 1995 and  was capped three times at senior level by the England national football team. He is currently a association footballfootball pundit.

Chris Greenman.name: Chris Greenman
Chris Greenman.intro: '''Chris Greenman''' (born 22 December 1968) is a retired English Association footballfootball defender (football)defender.
