Rom\u00e1n Golobart.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Paul Shaw.name: Paul Shaw
Paul Shaw.intro: '''Paul Shaw''' (born 4 September 1973 in Burnham, BuckinghamshireBurnham) is a retired English association footballfootballer.

Martyn Margetson.name: Martyn Margetson
Martyn Margetson.intro:
'''Martyn Walter Margetson''' (born 8 September 1971 in NeathWest Neath) is a Welsh peopleWelsh former professional association footballfootballer and Wales national football teamWales international, who is a goalkeeping coach for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.
A youth player at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, where he went on to appear over 50 times, he spent time on loan at Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town before moving to Southend United F.C.Southend United on a permanent basis in 1998 where he remained for one season, joining Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town in 1999. After signing for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in 2002, he went on to win his first and only cap for Wales in a friendly with Canada men's national soccer teamCanada in May 2004. He retired from playing at the end of the 2006–07 season, becoming a full-time goalkeeper coach at Cardiff City.

Jimmy Carter.name: Jimmy Carter
Jimmy Carter.intro:
'''Jimmy Carter''' (born 9 November 1965 in Hammersmith, London) is an English former association footballfootballer. During his career, he played for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and then Millwall for a second spell.
Millwall bought Jimmy in 1987 for £15,000 from Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, where he made his Football League debut in a 0-0 draw with Oldham at The Den. He quickly established himself in the Millwall first team and was an integral part of the team which gained Millwall promotion to the top flight in 1987–88 in English football1987–88, the first time ever in Millwall's 100 year history.
Carter was part of a side that included players such as Teddy Sheringham, Tony Cascarino and Terry Hurlock. Millwall made a strong start to the 1988/89 season where they remained in the top four for much of the season before a poor finish saw them slip to tenth, their lowest position all season.
Jimmy’s reputation was growing and in 1991, Kenny Dalglish signed him for Liverpool for a fee of £800,000. Unfortunately Dalglish resigned shortly after and within a year Jimmy found himself returning to London where he signed for Arsenal, a club he supported as a young boy. Arsenal paid £500,000 for Carter.
He spent 3 and a half years at Highbury and during his time there, Arsenal won the FA Cup and the League Cup in 1993 and in 1994 went on to win the UEFA Cup Winners' Cup. However he was very much a bit-part player making only 25 League appearances for the Gunners, and did not feature in any of the major finals Arsenal contested that time.
In the summer of 1995, with Graham having left the club for disciplinary reasons in the February and new manager Bruce Rioch rebuilding the team, Carter then signed for Portsmouth, where he spent three years. In 1998, Jimmy re-signed for Millwall, but did not have the same impact as his first spell there. He was forced to retire from football at the end of the 1998/99 season as a result of a serious back injury.
Carter has recently appeared for Arsenal in the Masters Cup Football competition for veteran players shown live on Sky Sports. He also plays for the Arsenal Charity Team, a team of ex Arsenal players and celebrities.

Nikodimos Papavasiliou.name: Nikodimos Papavasiliou
Nikodimos Papavasiliou.intro:
'''Nikodimos Papavasiliou''' (; born August 31, 1970) is a CyprusCypriot manager and former football (soccer)football midfielder.
He was the first Cypriot to play in the FA Premier League. He is the current manager of Cypriot club Ermis Aradippou.

J\u00falio Baptista.name: Júlio Baptista
J\u00falio Baptista.intro:
'''Júlio César Clemente Baptista''' (born 1 October 1981) is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder or Forward (association football)#Forwardforward for Cruzeiro Esporte ClubeCruzeiro. Baptista is nicknamed "The Beast" due to his physique.
Baptista began his career as a defensive midfielder, and after a series of impressive performances for his home town squad São Paulo FC, Baptista signed for Sevilla FC in 2003. Upon signing for Sevilla, he was converted into a forward, and in his two seasons, he scored 50 goals, leading to his 2005 transfer to Spanish giants Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid. After two unsuccessful seasons at Real Madrid with a loan spell at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal sandwiched in between, Baptista transferred to A.S. RomaRoma in Italy. On 3 January 2011, Baptista completed a move to Spanish club Málaga, signing on a three-and-a-half-year deal.

Didier Drogba.name: Didier Drogba
Didier Drogba.intro:
'''Didier Yves Drogba Tébily ''' (; born 11 March 1978), known as '''Didier Drogba''', is an Ivorian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker, and is the Top international association football goal scorers by countryall-time top scorer and former Captain (association football)captain of the Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast national team. He is best known for his career at Chelsea, for whom he has scored more goals than any other foreign player and is currently the club's List of Chelsea F.C. records and statistics#All-time top goalscorersfourth highest goal scorer of all time. In October 2012, he was voted by Chelsea supporters as the club's greatest ever player. He has also been named African Footballer of the Year twice, winning the accolade in 2006 and 2009.
After playing in youth teams, Drogba made his professional debut aged 18 for Ligue 2 club Le Mans Union Club 72Le Mans, and signed his first professional contract aged 21. After finishing the 2002–03 Ligue 12002–03 season with 17 goals in 34 appearances for Ligue 1 side En Avant GuingampGuingamp, he moved to Olympique de Marseille, where he finished as the third highest scorer in the 2003–04 Ligue 12003–04 season with 19 goals and helped the club reach the 2004 UEFA Cup Final.
In the summer of 2004, Drogba moved to Chelsea for a club record £24 million fee, making him the most expensive Ivorian player in history. In his debut season he helped the club win their first 2004–05 FA Premier Leagueleague title in 50 years, and a year later he won another 2005–06 FA Premier LeaguePremier League title. In March 2012, he became the first African player to score List of Premier League players with 100 or more goals100 Premier League goals, and also became the only player in history to score in four separate FA Cup finals the same year, when he scored in Chelsea's win over Liverpool in the 2012 FA Cup Final2012 final. He also played in the 2012 UEFA Champions League Final, in which he scored an 88th-minute equaliser and the winning penalty in the deciding shoot-out against FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. After spending 6 months with Shanghai Shenhua F.C.Shanghai Shenhua in China, and one and a half seasons with Turkish giants Galatasaray S.K. (football)Galatasaray where he scored the winning goal in the final of the 2013 Turkish Super Cup, Drogba returned to Chelsea in July 2014. With a career record of scoring 10 goals in 10 finals winning 10 trophies at club level, Drogba has been referred to as the "ultimate big game player."
An Ivory Coast international between 2002 and 2014, Drogba captained the national team from 2006 until his retirement and is the nation's Top international association football goal scorers by countryall-time top goalscorer with 65 goals from 104 appearances. He led the Ivory Coast to the 2006 FIFA World Cup, their first appearance in the tournament, and also scored their first goal. He later captained the Ivory Coast at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups. He was part of the Ivory Coast teams that reached the final of the Africa Cup of Nations in 2006 Africa Cup of Nations2006 and 2012 Africa Cup of Nations2012, but were beaten on penalties on both occasions. On 8 August 2014, he announced his retirement from international football.

Javier Garrido.intro:

J\u00e1n Koz\u00e1k (footballer, born 19.name: Ján Kozák (footballer, born 1980)
J\u00e1n Koz\u00e1k (footballer, born 19.intro: '''Ján Kozák''' (born 22 April 1980) is a SlovakiaSlovak Association footballfootballer who most recently played for DSG Union HABAU Perg in the Austrian 2. Landesliga.

Olof Mellberg.name: Olof Mellberg
Olof Mellberg.intro:
'''Erik Olof Mellberg''' (; born 3 September 1977 in Amnehärad, Gullspång) is a SwedenSwedish former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentral defender or Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back. During his career Mellberg was described as being "big, strong and exceptional in the air". He is best known for playing the majority of his career at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as well as spells with Italian side Juventus F.C.Juventus and Greek side Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos.
Mellberg played for Sweden in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and four UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championships and is a former captain of the national team. Mellberg ended his international career with 8 goals in 117 matches.

Anders Limpar.name: Anders Limpar
Anders Limpar.intro:
'''Anders Erik Limpar'''  (born 24 September 1965 in Solna MunicipalitySolna) is a Swedish former professional Association footballfootballer and assistant coach of Sollentuna FKSollentuna Fotbollsklubb. He is also the CEO of the betting site www.BestBetToday.com
As a player he was a Winger (sports)winger from 1981 until 2000. He has played for clubs in Switzerland, Sweden, Italy, England, and the United States, appearing for IF Brommapojkarna, BSC Young BoysYoung Boys, U.S. CremoneseCremonese, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Everton F.C.Everton, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, AIK FotbollAIK, Colorado Rapids and Djurgårdens IF FotbollDjurgårdens IF. He was capped 58 times by Sweden national football teamSweden, scoring 6 goals.

James McClean.name: James McClean
James McClean.intro:
'''James McClean''' (; born 22 April 1989) is an Irish footballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and the Republic of Ireland national football team. He played with Trojans F.C.Trojans, Institute F.C.Institute, his hometown club Derry City F.C.Derry City, and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland before moving to Wigan in August 2013.
McClean was born in Derry, Northern Ireland and played for the Northern Ireland national under-21 football team. However, McClean declined a call-up to the top level squad because he wanted to play for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. In February 2012, McClean received international clearance from FIFA which made him eligible to play for the Republic of Ireland, making his debut against Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic in the same month, and representing the nation at UEFA Euro 2012.

Andy Marshall.name: Andy Marshall
Andy Marshall.intro:
'''Andrew John "Andy" Marshall''' (born 14 April 1975) is a retired English Association footballfootballer. He is the goalkeeping coach and was one of the two caretaker managers alongside Scott Marshall (footballer)Scott Marshall at former club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.
He has previously played for the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21s, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He has  three children and was married to a former model and law graduate who filed for divorce in 2012.

Juninho Paulista.name: Juninho Paulista
Juninho Paulista.intro:
'''Osvaldo Giroldo Júnior''' (born 22 February 1973 in São Paulo), known as '''Juninho Paulista''' or '''Juninho''',A nickname based on the common Brazilian diminutive ''Juninho'', used for anyone with the word ''Júnior'' in their name, combined with ''Paulista'', indicating his place of origin, São Paulo. is a former Brazilian association footballfootballer. During his professional career, he played for Brazilian clubs São Paulo Futebol ClubeSão Paulo FC, Clube de Regatas Vasco da GamaVasco da Gama, Sociedade Esportiva PalmeirasPalmeiras, Clube de Regatas do FlamengoCR Flamengo, as well as English club Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Spanish club Atlético Madrid, Celtic F.C.Celtic in Scotland and Sydney FC in Australia.
Known as "The Little Fella" or "TLF", He is regarded as one of the greatest players in Middlesbrough FC's history.
Juninho played 50 international matches for the Brazil national football teamBrazilian national team from 1995 to 2003, winning the 2002 FIFA World Cup and the bronze medal at the 1996 Summer Olympics1996 Olympic tournament.
Juninho Paulista.position: Association football positions Attacking midfielder  AM  Attacking midfielder

Mo Johnston.name: Mo Johnston
Mo Johnston.intro:
'''Maurice John Giblin "Mo" Johnston''' (born 13 April 1963) is a Scottish former association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.
Johnston began his football career with Partick Thistle F.C.Partick Thistle in 1981 before moving to Watford F.C.Watford in 1983. With Watford Johnston scored 23 league goals, made his international debut, and helped the team reach the 1984 FA Cup Final. After just over a season with Watford Johnston moved to Celtic F.C.Celtic where he became a prolific goalscorer with a return of 72 goals in 128 matches, winning the Scottish Cup in 1985 and League Championship in 1986. Johnston left Celtic for FC Nantes AtlantiqueNantes in 1987 before returning to Scotland with Rangers F.C.Rangers. In doing so he became only the second player to have played for both sides of the Old Firm since World War II (the first was Alfie Conn, Jr.Alfie Conn) and the most high profile Catholic to have played for Rangers. After winning two Premier League titles with Rangers and scoring 46 goals in 100 games Johnston moved to Everton F.C.Everton. Johnston played out the rest of his career with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts, Falkirk F.C.Falkirk and American MLS side Kansas City Wizards before retiring in 2001. Since his retirement Johnston has become a coach in MLS.
Johnston received his first international cap in 1984; he represented Scotland 38 times scoring 14 goals and appeared for his country at the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 World Cup. He was most recently the manager later and Director of FootballDirector of Soccer at Major League Soccer club Toronto FC  until he was fired on 14 September 2010.

Delroy Facey.name: Delroy Facey
Delroy Facey.intro: '''Delroy Michael Facey''' (born 22 April 1980 in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, England) is a British-GrenadaGrenadian professional association footballfootballer who plays for Albion Sports A.F.C.Albion Sports. Facey is a Journeyman (sports)#Association footballjourneyman, having previously played for Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Burnley F.C.Burnley, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Hereford United

Wayne Rooney.name: Wayne Rooney
Wayne Rooney.intro:
'''Wayne Mark Rooney'''  (born 24 October 1985) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays  for and Captain (association football)captains both Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the England national football teamEngland national team. He has played much of his career as a Forward (association football)forward, but he has also been used in various midfieldermidfield roles.
Aged nine, Rooney joined the youth team of Everton F.C.Everton, for whom he made his professional début in 2002 at the age of 16. He spent two seasons at the Merseyside club, before moving to Manchester United for £25.6 million in the 2004 summer transfer window. Since then, with Rooney in the team, United have won the Premier League five times, the UEFA Champions League once, the FIFA Club World Cup once and the Football League CupLeague Cup twice. In September 2013, Rooney scored his 200th goal for United. He is currently on 229 goals, making him the club's Manchester United F.C. records and statistics#Goalscorersthird-highest goalscorer of all time.[
Rooney made his senior international debut in February 2003 aged 17, becoming the youngest player to represent England (a record since broken by Theo Walcott) and he is England's youngest ever goalscorer. He played at UEFA Euro 2004 and scored four goals, briefly becoming the youngest goalscorer in the history of the UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship. Rooney has since featured at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cups and is widely regarded as his country's best player. He has won the England Player of the Year award three times, in 2008, 2009 and 2014. As of March 2015, he has won 102 international cap (sport)caps and scored 47 goals, making him England's England national football team#Most capped playersninth most-capped player and England national football team#Top goalscorersthird-highest goalscorer in history. Along with David Beckham, Rooney is the most Red card (sports)red carded player for England, having been sent off twice.
In 2009–10, Rooney was awarded the PFA Players' Player of the Year and the FWA Footballer of the Year. He has won the Premier League Player of the Month award five times, a record he shares with Steven Gerrard. He came fifth in the vote for the 2011 FIFA Ballon d'Or and was named in the FIFPro World XIFIFPro World 11 for 2011. Rooney has won the 'Goal of the Season' award by the BBC's ''Match of the Day'' poll on three occasions, with his bicycle kick against rivals Manchester City winning the 'Premier League Goal of the 20 Seasons' award. A March 2012 report listed Rooney as the fifth highest-paid player in the world, with an annual income of $32.6 million.

Ugo Ehiogu.name: Ugo Ehiogu
Ugo Ehiogu.intro:
'''Ugochuku "Ugo" Ehiogu''' (pronounced oooooo-go; born 3 November 1972 in Homerton, London) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (football)centre back from 1989 to 2009. He is currently the coach of the Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and AcademyTottenham Hotspur U-21 Team.
He played in the Premier League with lengthy spells at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. He also played in the Football League for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, as well as a spell in the Scottish Premier League with Rangers F.C.Rangers. Ehiogu was an England national football teamEngland international, with a record of 4 caps and 1 goal. In 2012, he came out of brief retirement by signing for non-league side Wembley F.C.Wembley to participate in the club's FA Cup games alongside other retired veteran players.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.name: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.intro:
'''Alexander Mark David "Alex" Oxlade-Chamberlain'''  (born 15 August 1993) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the England national football team as a Winger (soccer)winger.
After rising to prominence with Southampton F.C.Southampton during the 2010–11 season aged 17, he signed for Arsenal in August 2011. Scoring twice in his first three games for the club, Oxlade-Chamberlain became the youngest English goal scorer in UEFA Champions League history and has also claimed a regular place in the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21s team. Fans have nicknamed Oxlade-Chamberlain "The Ox", derived from the first part of his surname, as well as his physical tenacity and powerful playing style.
Oxlade-Chamberlain made his debut for the senior England side on 26 May 2012 in a 1–0 win against Norway national football teamNorway in a friendly. Following this, he received a surprise call-up to the England squad for UEFA Euro 2012, becoming the second youngest player ever to represent England in the European Championships behind Wayne Rooney.

Brian Kilcline.name: Brian Kilcline
Brian Kilcline.intro:
'''Brian Kilcline''' (born 7 May 1962 in Nottingham, Nottinghamshire) is a retired English professional footballer. He played as a centre half for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town and Halifax Town F.C.Halifax Town, and was famous for his long hair and moustache.
Kilcline captained Coventry City in the FA Cup Final 19871987 FA Cup final at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley against Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. At the time it was thought that Kilcline was possibly responsible for scoring an own-goal to give Spurs a 2-1 lead on the 40 minute mark, but this goal was eventually accredited to Gary Mabbutt. Kilcline and Mabbutt were to clash again in the second half when, Kilcline brought down Mabbutt with a tackle. Kilcline was not cautioned by referee Neil Midgley (referee)Neil Midgley but had to be replaced by substitute Graham Rodger just a minute before then end of normal time due to the injury he himself sustained in the clash. After Coventry's extra time winner (the match finished 3-2) Kilcline limped slowly up the famous Wembley step to receive the trophy for the first time in Coventry's history.
In 1991, Kilcline joined newly promoted Oldham Athletic but his stay at the club was not to be a long one.
When Kevin Keegan became manager of Newcastle United in 1992, "Killer" Kilcline was his first signing, and was immediately installed as club captain. He became known for his hard tackling and aerial ability - he often would prefer a diving header to a volley, even for balls only half a metre off the ground.  Keegan later remarked that Kilcline was the most important signing he had ever made for the club.  This was echoed by fans, who considered him partially responsible for saving the club from relegation and possible bankruptcy.
During the 1993-94 season, he briefly played for Swindon Town in the Premier League and wore the squad number 31.

Dariusz Kubicki.name: Dariusz Kubicki
Dariusz Kubicki.intro: '''Dariusz Jan Kubicki''' (born 6 June 1963 in Kożuchów) is a former Polish peoplePolish football (soccer)football player and the current manager .
Dariusz Kubicki.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Bobby Convey.name: Bobby Convey
Bobby Convey.intro:
'''Robert Francis "Bobby" Convey''' (; born May 27, 1983) is an American association footballsoccer player who most recently played for New York Red Bulls in Major League Soccer.
In addition to several MLS clubs, Convey spent five years in England with Reading F.C.Reading, whom he helped into the Premier League for the first time. He played in 46 international matches for the USMNTUnited States, and made their squads for the 2003 Gold Cup and 2006 World Cup.

Liam Lawrence.name: Liam Lawrence
Liam Lawrence.intro:
'''Liam Lawrence''' (born 14 December 1981) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town in Football League Two.
Lawrence started his career at his local club Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, after impressing at the Field Mill he signed for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in June 2005. He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, on loan in 2006, and made his move permanent in January 2007. He became a key player for Stoke, and helped the club to promotion to the Premier League in 2008, earning himself Player of the Year award. In September 2010, he signed for Portsmouth on loan, and signed permanently in the January transfer window. With Portsmouth in financial difficulties he spent time out on loan at Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and joined Greek side P.A.O.K. F.C.PAOK in the summer of 2012. He then returned to England for a brief spell at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 2014 before joining Shrewsbury.
Although born in England, Lawrence made his international debut for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland in 2009, and earned 15 caps in a two-year spell.

Ishmel Demontagnac.name: Ishmel Demontagnac
Ishmel Demontagnac.intro:
'''Ishmel Demontagnac''' (born 15 June 1988) is an English Association footballerfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger is currently playing for Thurrock F.C.Thurrock.
Demontagnac previously played for Walsall F.C.Walsall. He has played in all four divisions of professional football in England, in the Football League and Premier League.
He has also represented England at England national under-18 football teamUnder-18 and England national under-19 football teamUnder-19 levels.

Val\u00e9ry M\u00e9zague.name: Valéry Mézague
Val\u00e9ry M\u00e9zague.intro:
'''Válery Mézague''' (8 December 198315 November 2014) was a Cameroonian Football (soccer)footballer. He was a midfielder and last played for Sporting Toulon Var.
A French-born player, Mézague represented  at international level. His most notable moment with the ''Lions Indomptables'' was at the 2003 FIFA Confederations Cup, where he became the starter central midfielder in the lost final against host , after replacing the late Marc-Vivien Foé during won semifinal versus .
In 2003, he was involved in a serious car crash which ruled him out of the game for four months. Despite this he fought back to reclaim his form and his performances attracted the attention of Harry Redknapp, with Mézague joining Portsmouth F.C. on loan for the 2004/05 season.  However, he failed to make any sort of substantial impression and returned to France in June 2005, where he followed his former manager at Portsmouth Alain Perrin to FC Sochaux-Montbéliard.
His younger brother Teddy Mézague is also a footballer.
He was found dead in his apartment on 15 November 2014 due to a cardiac arrest caused by a heart disease.

Neal Eardley.name: Neal Eardley
Neal Eardley.intro: '''Neal James Eardley''' (born 6 November 1988) is a Wales national football teamWelsh international association footballfootballer who plays for Football League Championship club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. His predominant position is as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back. He previously played for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, and represented Wales at Wales national under-17 football teamunder-17, Wales national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, before winning his first Wales national football teamfull cap in 2007.
Neal Eardley.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Robbie Slater.name: Robbie Slater
Robbie Slater.intro:
'''Robert''' "'''Robbie'''" '''Slater''' (born 22 November 1964) is an English-born  Australian former professional Association footballfootball (soccer) player and sports commentator. He played as a Midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1982 until 2001 notably in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he was amongst the title winning side of 1995.
He also played in England's top flight for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Southampton F.C.Southampton, as well as playing in the Football League for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. Slater also played in Europe for R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht and RC Lens as well as playing in has native land for St George Saints, Sydney United and Northern Spirit FC.

Gareth Grant.name: Gareth Grant
Gareth Grant.intro: '''Gareth Michael Grant''' (born 6 September 1980) is an English association footballfootballer, who plays for Frickley Athletic F.C. He played as a professional in the Football League and Premier League for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City.

Gerry McMahon.name: Gerry McMahon
Gerry McMahon.intro: '''Gerard''' "'''Gerry'''" '''McMahon''' (born 29 December 1973) is a former Northern IrelandNorthern Irish association footballfootballer who played for Glenavon F.C.Glenavon, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Barnet F.C.Barnet, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone.

Caleb Folan.name: Caleb Folan
Caleb Folan.intro: '''Caleb Colman Folan''' (born 26 October 1982) is a professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Kanbawza FC of the Myanmar National League in Southeast Asia. He plays as a Forward (association football)striker. Born in England, he has represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland in international football.

Eoin Jess.name: Eoin Jess
Eoin Jess.intro:
'''Eoin Jess''' (born 13 December 1970 in Portsoy) is a former ScotlandScottish Association footballfootball player. He was capped 18 times by Scotland national football teamScotland, scoring two goals.
His career started at Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, helping the Dons to finish second in the Scottish Premier League in the 1993-94 in Scottish football1993–94 season. Whilst at the top of his game for Aberdeen, he was connected with moves to the likes of Parma F.C.Parma, at the time flying high in the Italian Serie A. In 1996, he earned a move to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City but this lasted just over a year, during which he scored just once against QPRcite news
url=
title=QPR play the fall guys in Strachan's antics roadshow
publisher=The Independent
date=15 April 1996 accessdate=11 April 2012 in 39 Premier League games and scored an own goal in a game against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He did, however, score twice in Coventry's run in the 1996–97 FA Cup, netting in the 1996–97 FA Cup#Third round properthird round game against Woking F.C.Woking,cite news
url=
title=Woking wound Premier pride
publisher=The Independent
date=27 January 1997 accessdate=11 April 2012 and again in the 1996–97 FA Cup#Fourth Round Properfourth round victory at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.cite news
url=
title=Ogrizovic's glory
publisher=The Independent
date=16 February 1997 accessdate=11 April 2012 He then returned to Aberdeen for a second spell.
He returned to the Premier League with Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in 2000 but despite finishing the season as top scorer, financial problems meant he was released in 2002 following the collapse of ITV Digital. He joined Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in August 2002 and in his first season steered Forest into the play-offs. However they were relegated in 2005 and Jess moved on as a free agent. In July 2005 he signed for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, and was released from his contract there on 11 April 2007.[
In April 2009, at the age of 38, Jess suffered a mild stroke.

Asier del Horno.name: Asier del Horno
Asier del Horno.intro:
'''Asier del Horno Cosgaya''' (born 19 January 1981) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
After solid displays in La Liga with Athletic Bilbao, for which he appeared in 126 official games in five years scoring 17 goals, he moved to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in England, where he spent the 2005–06 FA Premier League2005–06 season.
Subsequently, del Horno – who missed the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup with Spain national football teamSpain due to a last-minute injury – returned to his country with Valencia CFValencia, who loaned him to several clubs for the duration of his contract.
Asier del Horno.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Erik Hagen.name: Erik Hagen
Erik Hagen.intro: '''Erik "Panzer" Hagen''' (born 20 July 1975 in RingerikeVeme) is a Norway national football teamNorwegian football (soccer)football player who plays as a centre-back.

Darren Pratley.name: Darren Pratley
Darren Pratley.intro: '''Darren Antony Pratley''' (born 22 April 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as a midfielder.

Mark Flatts.name: Mark Flatts
Mark Flatts.intro: '''Mark Michael Flatts''' (born 14 October 1972) is an EnglandEnglish former association footballfootballer who played in midfieldermidfield. He started out in the top flight as a trainee with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Youssef Safri.name: Youssef Safri
Youssef Safri.intro: '''Youssef Safri''' (, born 3 January 1977) is a Moroccan  former association footballfootballer who currently is an assistant coach for Raja Casablanca.

Rob Wolleaston.name: Rob Wolleaston
Rob Wolleaston.intro:
'''Robert Ainsley "Rob" Wolleaston''' (born 21 December 1979) is an English association footballfootballer who most recently played for Harrow Borough F.C.Harrow Borough. He is a midfielder.
Wolleaston started his career with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, but he only made two first-team appearances in five years, and instead had short loan spells with Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town. Following his release from Chelsea, he moved to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, but was released after one season, in which the club suffered promotion and relegationrelegation and administration (insolvency)administration. He spent more than a season with Oxford United F.C.Oxford United but left following a series of injuries and instead dropped into non-league with Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, for whom he played 92 league games in three seasons, until he moved to Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds in 2008. He played another 57 games at Rushden, and went on to have a short spell with Farnborough F.C.Farnborough before moving to Weymouth F.C.Weymouth.

Lacina Traor\u00e9.name: Lacina Traoré
Lacina Traor\u00e9.intro: '''Lacina Traoré''' (born 20 August 1990) is an Côte d'IvoireIvorian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for AS Monaco F.C.AS Monaco. He is nicknamed the “Gentle Giant”, due to his 6 ft 8in frame.

Jay Fulton.name: Jay Fulton
Jay Fulton.intro: '''Jay Fulton''' (born 4 April 1994) is a ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer currently playing for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in the Premier League.

Mike Sheron.name: Mike Sheron
Mike Sheron.intro: '''Michael Nigel''' "'''Mike'''" '''Sheron''' (born 11 January 1972) is an English former association footballfootballer, who made nearly 500 appearances in the Premier League and the Football League playing as a forward (association football)striker for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Bury F.C.Bury, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town. Sheron was capped by England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level.

Alan Shearer.name: Alan Shearer
Alan Shearer.intro:
'''Alan Shearer''' Officer of the Order of the British EmpireOBE, Deputy LieutenantDL (; born 13 August 1970) is an English retired Association footballfootballer. He played as a forward (association football)striker in the Premier Leaguetop level of English league football for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and for the England national football teamEngland national team. He was widely regarded as one of the world's best strikers, being both Newcastle's and the Premier League's Premier League Top Scorersrecord goalscorer. Since retiring as a player in 2006, Shearer has worked as a television pundit (expert)pundit for the BBC. In 2009, he briefly left his BBC role to become Newcastle United's manager in the last eight games of their Newcastle United F.C. season 2008–092008–09 season, in an unsuccessful attempt to save them from relegation.
A native of Newcastle upon Tyne, Shearer made his professional debut with English top-flight club Southampton F.C.Southampton in 1988–89 in English football1988, scoring a Hat-trick (association football)hat-trick in the process. During several years on the south coast, he became known for his classic style of play, strength and goalscoring ability; he soon received an international call-up along with a transfer to Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 1992. Shearer established himself as a player at the Lancashire club; he became a regular in the England national football teamEngland squad, and his 34-goal tally helped Blackburn secure the List of English football championsPremier League title in 1994–95 FA Premier League1994–95. He was named FWA Footballer of the YearFootball Writers' Association Player of the Year in 1994 and won the PFA Player of the Year award in 1995. The 1995–96 season saw Shearer make his first UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League appearances and finish as the top scorer in the Premier League with 31 goals. He was also top scorer at UEFA Euro 1996 with England, scoring five goals, and in the 1996–97 FA Premier League1996–97 Premier League, with 25 goals. In 1996, he was third in the FIFA World Player of the Year awards. Shearer scored 283 league goals in his career, including a record 260 in the Premier League (of which 58 were Penalty kickpenalties) with a record 11 List of Premier League hat-tricksPremier League hat-tricks, and a total of 422 in all competitions including international at all levels. Shearer has amassed a goals to game ratio of 0.667 throughout his career at every level.
A  World football transfer recordworld record £15 million transfer to his boyhood heroes, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, followed the Euro '96 tournament, and Shearer spent the remainder of his career with the club. Shearer helped his team to runners-up finishes in the Premier League and FA Cup with Newcastle, and won a second PFA Player of the Year award. After being named England's captain (sport)captain in 1996 and Newcastle's captain in 1999, he retired from international football following UEFA Euro 2000, having amassed 63 appearances and 30 goals for his country. In 2004 he was named as one of the FIFA 100Top 125 greatest living footballers as part of FIFA's 100th anniversary celebration. As well as his media work, he has raised substantial amounts of money for various national and local charities, both within and outside of sports. Shearer is an Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE), a Deputy Lieutenant of Northumberland, a Freedom of the CityFreeman of Newcastle upon Tyne and an Honorary degreehonorary Doctor of Civil Law of Northumbria UniversityNorthumbria and Newcastle UniversityNewcastle Universities.

Danny Wallace.name: Danny Wallace
Danny Wallace.intro: '''David Lloyd "Danny" Wallace''' (born 21 January 1964) is an English former association footballfootballer who played for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. He won one Cap (sport)full cap for England national football teamEngland. His football career was ended prematurely by the effects of multiple sclerosis.

Paddy McNair.name: Paddy McNair
Paddy McNair.intro: '''Patrick James Coleman "Paddy" McNair''' (born 27 April 1995) is a Northern Irish professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)centre-back for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team. He has also played for Northern Ireland at under-17, under-19 and under-21 levels.
Paddy McNair.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Robert Huth.name: Robert Huth
Robert Huth.intro:
'''Robert Huth''' (; born 18 August 1984) is a German professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City on loan from Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Huth was signed for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea from the youth system of German club 1. FC Union BerlinUnion Berlin in 2001 by then Chelsea manager Claudio Ranieri. Huth struggled to establish himself in the Chelsea first team and with the likes of John Terry, William Gallas, and Ricardo Carvalho ahead of him in the pecking order at Stamford Bridge (stadium)Stamford Bridge and so he joined Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in August 2006 for a fee of £6 million. He spent three years at the Riverside StadiumRiverside and after the club were relegated in 2009, Huth signed for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for a then club record fee £5 million. After a successful 2010–11 Stoke City F.C. season2010–11 season for Huth which saw him play in the 2011 FA Cup FinalFA Cup Final, he was named as Stoke's Stoke City F.C. Player of the Yearplayer of the year.
Huth was also a Germany national football teamGerman international, earning 19 caps and scoring 2 goals between 2004 and 2009. He was part of the German squad which came third at the 2006 FIFA World Cup on home soil.
Robert Huth.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jean-Guy Wallemme.name: Jean-Guy Wallemme
Jean-Guy Wallemme.intro:
'''Jean-Guy Wallemme''' (born 10 August 1967) is a former FranceFrench Football (soccer)footballer.
He was a mainstay of the RC Lens team which won the French championship in 1998.
In August 2011 he took over the Republic of Congo national team.
On 23 March 2012, it was announced that Wallemme would combine his Congolese job with management of Auxerre.

Kevin Nolan.name: Kevin Nolan
Kevin Nolan.intro:
'''Kevin Anthony Jance Nolan''' (born 24 June 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for and is the current club captain of West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in the Premier League. An attacking midfielder, he has represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.
After growing up in Toxteth, Liverpool, Nolan signed for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers at the age of 16. Part of the team that beat Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in the Football League Championship play-offs#20012001 Football League Championship play-offs to gain promotion to the Premier League, he soon became a regular first-team player for the club. He scored as Bolton beat Manchester United F.C.Manchester United at Old Trafford in both of his first two seasons in the English football league systemtop tier of English football, as well as important goals that helped Bolton regularly finish in the top half of the Premier League table. Nolan was also a first team regular as Bolton qualified for the UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup for the first time in the club's history—where they reached the knockout stages. Following the departure of Jay-Jay Okocha in 2006, Nolan was appointed as the Captain (sport)team captain, and he led the team once again to UEFA Cup qualification and, once again, eventual progression to the knockout round of the competition.
Following the arrival of Gary Megson as Bolton manager, the team's and Nolan's performances were criticised by a section of the club's fans. This resulted in the midfielder completing a £4 million transfer to Newcastle United in the January 2009 transfer window. He formed part of the team who were relegated to the Football League Championship at the end of the season, making ten appearances as the team finished in 18th position. Nolan's performances the following season were widely praised, as he scored 18 goals—including the first hat-trick of his career—to help the club gain promotion back to the Premier League as the division's champions. Following promotion, Nolan was promoted to club captain.
In the summer of 2011 Nolan joined West Ham United on a five-year contract, joining up once again with new West Ham boss, Sam Allardyce. He was appointed captain soon after his arrival and led the team to an instant return to the Premier League.

\u00c1ngelo Henr\u00edquez.name: Ángelo Henríquez
\u00c1ngelo Henr\u00edquez.intro: '''Ángelo José Henríquez Iturra''' (; born 13 April 1994) is a Chilean Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for GNK Dinamo ZagrebDinamo Zagreb on loan from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United.

Steven Caulker.name: Steven Caulker
Steven Caulker.intro:
'''Steven Roy Caulker''' (born 29 December 1991) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Defender (association football)defender.
Caulker is a product of the Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and AcademyTottenham Hotspur Academy and spent a season long loan spell in the 2009–10 season at Football League One side Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town. His performances during this loan spell brought him to the attention of the England national under-19 football teamEngland U19 side and made 11 appearances including reaching the semi-finals of the 2010 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship2010 Under-19 European Championships. He followed this up with another loan spell at Football League Championship side Bristol City F.C.Bristol City making 30 appearances and winning recognition from the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 side before injury cut his season short. A third loan spell followed at newly promoted Premier League side Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. Caulker made 26 appearances and helped the club maintain their Premier League status, and the following summer he represented the Great Britain Olympic football team at the 2012 Summer Olympics. Caulker received his first call up to the England national football teamEngland senior side and later in November 2012 made his full England debut against Sweden national football teamSweden, scoring a debut goal.

Lee Powell.name: Lee Powell
Lee Powell.intro: '''Lee Powell''' (born 2 June 1973) is a WalesWelsh football (soccer)football striker (football)forward.

Robbie Keane.name: Robbie Keane
Robbie Keane.intro:
'''Robert David''' "'''Robbie'''" '''Keane''' (born 8 July 1980) is an Irish professional footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker and is Captain (association football)captain of both Los Angeles Galaxy and the Republic of Ireland national football team.
Keane has scored a total of 65 goals for the Irish national team since his debut in 1998, making him the all-time record Irish scorer. He is currently the highest male international scorer among active players following Miroslav Klose's retirement in August 2014, and the fifth highest scoring European in history. He is also the top scorer of all time in European Championship qualification matches. Keane was Ireland's top scorer at the 2002 FIFA World Cup with three goals as they reached the Last 16, and also played at UEFA Euro 2012.
He began his professional career at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, scoring twice on his first team debut aged 17. The following season he was the club's leading goalscorer and scored his first international goal with Republic of Ireland. He changed club frequently between 1999 and 2002, breaking transfer fee records, but his brief spells at Inter Milan and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United were unexceptional. He joined Tottenham Hotspur in 2002 and played there for six years. The 2007–08 Premier League2007–08 season was the most fruitful of his career as he set a career record of 23 goals in a season, including a landmark 100th competitive goal and he won his first senior honour, the Football League CupLeague Cup.
Keane moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in July 2008 but he spent only six months at the club before returning to Tottenham, where he was made first team captain. In January 2010, Keane moved on loan to Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic for the rest of the season, and spent the second half of the following season loaned to West Ham United. He left Tottenham for Los Angeles Galaxy in 2011. In January 2012, Keane joined Premier League side Aston Villa on a two-month loan, during the Major League SoccerMLS off-season. He is the tenth highest goalscorer in Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur history and as of 21 January 2012, had scored 126 Premier League goals (List of Premier League players with 100 or more goalslist), which ranks him as eleventh most successful goal scorer in the history of the Premier League.
On 21 January 2012, Keane achieved the rare feat of having scored goals in competitions for ten different clubs, when he scored twice for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa against his former club Wolverhampton Wanderers in the Premier League. This meant Keane had now scored in competitions for Aston Villa, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Tottenham Hotspur and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, all in the Premier League, Wolverhampton Wanderers in the English First Division, Celtic F.C.Celtic in the Scottish Premier League, Inter Milan in Italy's Coppa Italia as well as Supercoppa Italiana, and LA Galaxy in Major League Soccer.

Terry Fenwick.name: Terry Fenwick
Terry Fenwick.intro: '''Terence William 'Terry' Fenwick''' (born 17 November 1959 in Seaham, County Durham) is an English association footballfootball coach and former player. Playing as a Defender (association football)defender, he made a total of 455 appearances in the Football League, for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town. He is currently the manager at C.S. Visé in the Belgian Third Division.

Frankie Bennett.name: Frankie Bennett
Frankie Bennett.intro:
'''Frankie Bennett''' (born 3 January 1969) is an EnglandEnglish former professional football (soccer)football striker (football)forward.
Bennett played for Halesowen Town F.C.Halesowen Town before joining Southampton F.C.Southampton in February 1993 for an initial fee of £10,000.cite news
url=
title=Sport in Short: Football
publisher=The Independent
date=25 February 1993  accessdate=26 November 2010 He played 19 times, mainly as a substitute, before joining Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town on loan in October 1996 and moved to Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers the following month for a fee of £3,000.
He joined Exeter City F.C.Exeter City on non-contract terms in February 2000, but left to join Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers the following month. He was a part of the Forest Green side that reached the 2001 F.A. TrophyFA Trophy final after he scored in a 4-1 semi final win over Hereford United F.C.Hereford United at Edgar Street.
He moved to Aberystwyth Town F.C.Aberystwyth Town and then followed manager Frank Gregan to Weston-super-Mare F.C.Weston-super-Mare. He joined Bath City F.C.Bath City in June 2002.  He struggled with injury and turned down a reduced deal in May 2004, joining Brislington F.C.Brislington in August 2004.
Bennett has a wife named Michelle, a son, Joshua, and a daughter, Shanee.

Zoran To\u0161i\u0107.name: Zoran Tošić
Zoran To\u0161i\u0107.intro:
'''Zoran Tošić''' (Serbian Cyrillic: Зоран Тошић, born 28 April 1987) is a Serbian Association footballfootballer who plays for PFC CSKA MoscowCSKA Moscow and the Serbia national football teamSerbian national team, primarily as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger. He has built a reputation as a free-kick specialist and a tricky dribbler.[
Tošić began his career with his local side FK Proleter ZrenjaninProleter Zrenjanin. He then joined FK Budućnost Banatski DvorBudućnost Banatski Dvor, who then merged with Proleter to form FK Banat ZrenjaninBanat Zrenjanin. A year later, he signed for Serbian giants FK PartizanPartizan, for whom he played for two years before a high-profile move to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United of England. After he struggled to break into the ''Red Devils'' first-team, he was sent on a six-month loan to German side 1. FC KölnKöln in January 2010, and was then transferred to PFC CSKA MoscowCSKA Moscow of Russia that summer.
A full international since 2007, Tošić has earned over 60 caps for Serbia. He was part of their teams at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Summer Olympics and the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.
Zoran To\u0161i\u0107.birth_place: Zrenjanin,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Philip Ifil.name: Philip Ifil
Philip Ifil.intro: '''Philip Nathan Ifil''' (born 18 November 1986 in Willesden, London) is an English Association footballfootballer who is currently at a free agent.

Mark Summerbell.name: Mark Summerbell
Mark Summerbell.intro:
'''Mark Summerbell''' (born 30 October 1976 in Durham, EnglandDurham) is an EnglandEnglish football midfielder. He has played for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Cork City Football ClubCork City, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.
At Middlesbrough he scored once in the league against Tottenham Hotspur,cite news
url=
title=Boro in Spurs stalemate
publisher=BBC
date=22 August 2000 accessdate=10 February 2010 also scoring three times in the League Cup in games against Bolton Wanderers,cite web
url=
title=Middlesbrough 2 Bolton 1 (aet)
publisher=Sporting Life
date=18 November 1997 accessdate=10 February 2010 Everton F.C.Evertoncite news

title=Bakayoko strike puts Everton in the clear
publisher=The Independent
date=28 October 1998 accessdate=10 February 2010
location=London
first=John
last=Donoghue and Macclesfield Town.cite news
url=
title=Middlesbrough 2-1 Macclesfield
publisher=BBC
date=19 September 2000 accessdate=10 February 2010 He ended his professional career at Carlisle United, where he scored once against Torquay United in 45 league appearances.cite news
url=
title=Torquay 2-3 Carlisle
publisher=BBC
date=26 April 2003 accessdate=10 February 2010 Whilst at Carlisle he played in the 2003 Football League Trophy Final.

Peter Whiston.name: Peter Whiston
Peter Whiston.intro: '''Peter Whiston''' (born 4 January 1968) is an English football (soccer)football defender, currently playing for non-league side Widnes Vikings F.C.

Joe Ledley.name: Joe Ledley
Joe Ledley.intro:
'''Joseph Christopher "Joe" Ledley''' (born 23 January 1987) is a Welsh association footballfootballer who plays as a central midfielder for Premier League club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and the Wales national football teamWelsh national team.
He started his career with then Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff where he spent six years. He helped the club to the FA Cup final in 2008 FA Cup Final2008 and to the Football League Championship play-offsChampionship play-off final in 2009-10 Football League Championship2010. In 2010, he moved to Celtic on a free transfer. He won the league title in his second season with the club in 2012 and both the SPL and the Scottish Cup in 2013. He signed for Crystal Palace on transfer deadline day in January 2014.
Ledley has played for Wales at Wales national under-17 football teamunder-17, Wales national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Wales under-21 national football teamunder-21 levels, before making his Wales national football teamfull debut in 2005.  He has since gone on to make over 50 international appearances and has captained his country on several occasions.

Pajtim Kasami.name: Pajtim Kasami
Pajtim Kasami.intro: '''Pajtim Kasami''' (born 2 June 1992) is a SwitzerlandSwiss Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a midfielder for Superleague Greece club Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos and the Switzerland national football teamSwitzerland national team.

Aaron Hughes.name: Aaron Hughes
Aaron Hughes.intro:
'''Aaron William Hughes''' (born 8 November 1979) is a Northern Irish professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team as a Defender (association football)defender. Hughes plays mainly at centre back, but can also be used at right back or left back, as well as anywhere in midfield. He is renowned for his disciplined defending, having made over 450 Premier League appearances without getting sent off, which is the second-most in the history of the league, behind only Ryan Giggs.
Hughes began his career with Newcastle United, making his debut in 1997 and remaining with the club until 2005, when he was transferred to Aston Villa for £1 million. Two years later he was signed by his former international manager Lawrie Sanchez to play for Fulham F.C.Fulham, where he remained until 2014 and reached the UEFA Europa League final in 2010. Following a brief spell at Queens Park Rangers he joined Brighton in the summer of 2014.
He made his full international debut aged 18 in 1999 and has since earned 95 caps for Northern Ireland, the third most in the nation's history. Hughes captained the national team from 2003 up to international retirement in 2011, but returned to the team the following year.

Jason Lowe.name: Jason Lowe
Jason Lowe.intro:
'''Jason John Lowe''' (born 2 September 1991) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Blackburn Rovers F.CBlackburn Rovers. Lowe was raised in Leigh, Greater ManchesterLeigh.
Lowe is primarily a midfielder but can also play at right back. He made his senior debut on 8 January 2011 in the FA Cup and his Premier League debut on 15 January 2011. He captained England U-20 at the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup and made his U-21 debut on 10 October 2011.

Henri Camara.name: Henri Camara
Henri Camara.intro: '''Henri Camara''' (born 10 May 1977) is a Senegalese association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker and is currently playing for  PAS Lamia 1964Lamia.

Nigel Spackman.name: Nigel Spackman
Nigel Spackman.intro:
'''Nigel James Spackman''' (born 2 December 1960 in Romsey, Hampshire) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football coach (sports)manager and former player who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1980 to 1998 notably for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Rangers F.C.Rangers.
He also played for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He initially started out with Non-league Andover F.C.Andover. He took over as player-manager of Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 1997, but lasted less than a year. He later had brief spells in charge of Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 2001 and Millwall F.C.Millwall in 2006. He now works for the Glenn Hoddle Academy.

Keith Andrews.name: Keith Andrews
Keith Andrews.intro:
'''Keith Joseph Andrews''' (born 13 September 1980) is an Irish peopleIrish association footballer who plays as a defensive midfielder for Football League One team Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons on loan from Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team.
Andrews began his career at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolves, where he was their youngest Captain (association football)captain for more than a century. His club career has also involved stints at Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, as well as loan spells at Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Walsall F.C.Walsall while he was at Wolves. While at Milton Keynes Dons he was club captain, helped secure promotion for his team with a vital goal, helped win his team the Football League Trophy by scoring in the final at Wembley StadiumWembley and was named in the PFA Team of the Year.
A full international since 2008, Andrews has gained over 30 caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland and was selected for UEFA Euro 2012.

Richard Lee.name: Richard Lee
Richard Lee.intro: '''Richard Anthony Lee''' (born 5 October 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Fulham F.C.Fulham on loan from Brentford F.C.Brentford.

David Seaman.name: David Seaman
David Seaman.intro:
'''David Andrew Seaman''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 19 September 1963) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for several clubs, most notably Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He retired from the game on 13 January 2004, following a recurring shoulder injury. He was appointed an Order of the British EmpireMBE in 1997 for services to the sport.
The peak of his career was during his period as Arsenal and England national football teamEngland goalkeeper in the 1990s and early 2000s; during his time at Arsenal he won many medals including three league championships (1991, 1998, 2002), four FA Cups (1993, 1998, 2002, 2003), the Football League CupLeague Cup in 1993 and the Cup Winners' CupEuropean Cup Winners Cup in 1994. During this time he also played in the Football World Cup 19981998 and Football World Cup 20022002 World Cups, and 1996 European Football ChampionshipEuro 96 and 2000 European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000, and is England's second-most capped goalkeeper with 75 caps, after Peter Shilton.cite web
url=
title=England's Goalkeepers in Most Appearance Order
work=England Football Online
Seaman's career highs came in his successful performance in UEFA Euro 96 and in Arsenal F.C.Arsenal's UEFA Cup Winners' Cup, Premier League and FA Cup (including a superb save from Paul Peschisolido for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in the FA Cup 2002–03) campaigns in the mid-90s and early-2000s. Notable lows came with two costly errors, both from long-range efforts — conceding a last-minute goal in the 1995 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup Final to Nayim and conceding to a Ronaldinho free-kick in the 2002 FIFA World Cup quarter-final.
Seaman is left-handed,  but throws the football with his right arm
In June 2012, he was appointed goalkeeping coach of Combined Counties League club Wembley F.C.Wembley.

Bradley Johnson.name: Bradley Johnson
Bradley Johnson.intro: '''Bradley Paul Johnson''' (born 28 April 1987) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, where he serves as vice-captain. His primary position is a central midfielder, but can also play as a left winger and as a left back.

Olivier Bernard.name: Olivier Bernard
Olivier Bernard.intro: '''Olivier Bernard''' (born 14 October 1979) is a French former Association footballfootballer. He announced his retirement after leaving Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United on 16 May 2007. He is currently the owner and CEO of Durham City A.F.C.Durham City A.F.C.

Pat Van Den Hauwe.name: Pat Van Den Hauwe
Pat Van Den Hauwe.intro: '''Patrick William Roger "Pat" Van Den Hauwe''' (born 16 December 1960) is a former professional association footballfootballer who made 401 appearances in the Football League playing for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Everton F.C.Everton, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Millwall F.C.Millwall. Though born in Belgium, he made 13 appearances for Wales national football teamWales at international level.

Phil Masinga.name: Phil Masinga
Phil Masinga.intro:
'''Philomen Raul "Phil" Masinga''' (born 28 June 1969 in Klerksdorp) is a South African former professional football (soccer)footballer and manager who played as a striker (association football)striker from 1991 to 2002.
He played in the English Premier League for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, and Italian Serie A for Salernitana Calcio 1919Salernitana and A.S. BariBari. He also played for Jomo Cosmos, Mamelodi Sundowns FCMamelodi Sundowns, FC St. GallenSt. Gallen and Al-Wahda FC (Abu Dhabi)Al-Wahda. He represented South Africa in 58 international games, scoring 18 goals and in 2006 briefly managed PJ Stars.

Santi Cazorla.name: Santi Cazorla
Santi Cazorla.intro:
'''Santiago "Santi" Cazorla González''' (; born 13 December 1984) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in the Premier League, and for the Spain national football teamSpanish national team. A versatile and ambidextrous Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder who can also play as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, Cazorla is noted for his speed, shooting accuracy, capacity to change the rhythm of gameplay, and excellent close control.[
He spent most of the first half of his professional career with Villarreal CFVillarreal, amassing La Liga totals of 253 games and 39 goals over the course of nine seasons. He also represented Recreativo de HuelvaRecreativo, where he won the Don Balón AwardSpanish Footballer of the Year award for the 2006–07 La Liga2006–07 campaign. In 2012, he signed for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal from Málaga CFMálaga, quickly making an impact in the first team in his 2012–13 Arsenal F.C. seasonhis first year at the club with 13 Assist (football)assists, after which he was voted Arsenal Player of the Season.
Cazorla represented Spain national football teamSpain at UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008 and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012, winning both tournaments and gaining more than 60 Cap (sport)caps. He has also played at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Sandy Robertson (footballer, born 1971).name: Sandy Robertson (footballer, born 1971)
Sandy Robertson (footballer, born 1971).intro:
His father, Malcolm Robertson (footballer)Malky Robertson, was also a professional footballer, with Ayr United F.C.Ayr United, Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian and Hibernian F.C.Hibernian.
Robertson began his career with Rangers F.C.Rangers where manager Graeme Souness labelled him the best young player in Britain. He scored Rangers' first goal under manager Walter Smith in a 1-0 victory over St Mirren F.C.St Mirren on 20 April 1991 at Love Street (stadium)Love Street.

Kevin-Prince Boateng.name: Kevin-Prince Boateng
Kevin-Prince Boateng.intro:
'''Kevin-Prince Boateng'''  (; born 6 March 1987), Mononymous personalso known by his shirt name '''Prince''', is a Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer who is currently playing and Captain (association football)vice-captaining for FC Schalke 04. A Ghana national football teamGhanaian international, Boateng primarily plays as a box-to-box midfielder or attacking midfielder and Forward (association football)forward.
Boateng has fifteen Cap (sport)caps and two goals for the Ghana national team, and has received nominations for African Footballer of the Year.
Boateng signed for Hertha BSC in July 1994. He departed Hertha BSC in July 2007 to sign for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur until August 2009 and accepted a Loan (sports)loan to Borussia Dortmund in January 2009. He signed for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth from August 2009 to August 2010. He signed for Genoa C.F.C.Genoa CFC in August 2010 and A.C. MilanAC Milan from August 2010 to August 2013. As of present since August 2013 he is currently at FC Schalke 04.
Boateng is known for his strength, footspeed, and ball-Freestyle footballjuggling tricks.
FIFA's official website describes Boateng as "blessed with strength, speed, killer instinct in front of goal, and an uncommon flamboyance in the attacking third". He is nicknamed "the Train Without Brakes", and "the Big Bang".

Jelle Van Damme.name: Jelle Van Damme
Jelle Van Damme.intro: '''Jelle François Maria Van Damme''' (; born 10 October 1983) is a BelgiumBelgian Belgium national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who can play as a central Defender (association football)defender, Defender (association football)#Full backleft back or left sided midfielder. He is signed to Belgian Pro League club Standard Liège.

John Guidetti.name: John Guidetti
John Guidetti.intro:
'''John Alberto Guidetti''' (, ); born 15 April 1992) is a SwedenSwedish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Celtic F.C.Celtic on loan from Manchester City F.C.Manchester City as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Whilst growing up Guidetti played football in his native Sweden as well as Kenya, where his father worked as a teacher. He returned to Sweden in 2008 and played with IF Brommapojkarna when at the age of 16 he earned a move to English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He spent time out on loan back at Brommapojkarna and with Championship side Burnley F.C.Burnley in November 2010. He joined Dutch club Feyenoord on loan for the Eredivisie 2011-122011–12 season where he scored 20 goals in 23 games before a virus ended his time in the Netherlands. In January 2014 Guidetti joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan until the end of the 2013–14 Stoke City F.C. season2013–14 season, and in September of that year he was loaned to Celtic for the full season.
Having represented Sweden at several youth levels, he earned his first senior international cap against Croatia on 29 February 2012.

Gregory Goodridge.name: Gregory Goodridge
Gregory Goodridge.intro:
'''Gregory Ronald St Clair Goodridge''' (born 10 July 1971 in Barbados) is a former professional footballer.
He has captained the Barbados national football teamBarbados national team and played professionally in the EnglandEnglish Football League.

Colin Kazim-Richards.name: Colin Kazim-Richards
Colin Kazim-Richards.intro:
'''Colin Kazim-Richards''' (born 26 August 1986), also known as '''Colin Kâzım''', '''Kâzım''' or '''Kâzım Kâzım''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Feyenoord (on loan from Bursaspor) and internationally for Turkey national football teamTurkey having qualified for Turkish nationality through his mother's ethnicity. An anglicised form of the Turkish languageTurkish given name ''Kâzım'' was intended to be a middle name, which would have rendered his full name as 'Colin-Kazim Richards', but due to an error, he was legally registered as 'Colin Kazim-Richards'.
Having played as a junior for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Arsenal F.C.Arsenal he was handed a professional contract by Bury F.C.Bury. He also went on to feature in the Football League for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion before transferring to Premier League side Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United where he remained for one season. He has since forged a career in Europe with Fenerbahçe S.K. (football team)Fenerbahçe, Toulouse FCToulouse, Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray and Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos. In 2007 he chose to represent Turkey national football teamTurkey at international level and has 35 caps, scoring twice.

Vladim\u00edr \u0160micer.name: Vladimír Šmicer
Vladim\u00edr \u0160micer.intro: '''Vladimír Šmicer''' (, born 24 May 1973) is a former Czech RepublicCzech football midfielder player. Šmicer was a devout player of Slavia Prague, the only Czech club he ever played for. He also played notably for RC LensLens in France, with whom he won the Ligue 1 title. In 1999, Šmicer moved to England, where he played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and won multiple honours. He is perhaps best remembered at Liverpool for his long-range goal in the 2005 UEFA Champions League Final2005 Champions League Final. Internationally, he played once for Czechoslovakia national football teamCzechoslovakia and 80 times for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic. He retired from playing professional football in 2009.

Emmanuel Ebou\u00e9.name: Emmanuel Eboué
Emmanuel Ebou\u00e9.intro:
'''Emmanuel Eboué''' (born 4 June 1983) is an Ivorian Association footballfootballer who plays for Galatasaray S.K. (football)Galatasaray and the Ivory Coast national football team.
A natural Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, he is also able to play at Midfielder#Wingerright wing. First representing his Ivory Coast national football teamnational team in 2004, he is perhaps best known in the United KingdomUK for his stint at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal between 2005 and 2011.
Emmanuel Ebou\u00e9.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back,Midfielder  association football  Right Midfielder

Micky Gynn.name: Micky Gynn
Micky Gynn.intro: '''Michael''' "'''Micky'''" '''Gynn''' (born 19 August 1961) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder in the Football League for Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.

Scott Murray (footballer, born 1974).name: Scott Murray (footballer, born 1974)
Scott Murray (footballer, born 1974).intro: '''Scott George Murray''' (born 26 May 1974) is a former ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer now turned club kitman for Bristol City F.C.

Elsad Zveroti\u0107.name: Elsad Zverotić
Elsad Zveroti\u0107.intro: '''Elsad Zverotić''' (Montenegrin Cyrillic: Eлcaд Звepoтић, born 31 October 1986) is a MontenegroMontenegrin professional Football (soccer)footballer, who is playing for FC Sion. He also plays for the Montenegro national football teamMontenegro national team as a Defender (association football)defender.

Lud\u011bk Miklo\u0161ko.name: Luděk Mikloško
Lud\u011bk Miklo\u0161ko.intro: '''Luděk "Ludo" Mikloško''' (born 9 December 1961 in Prostějov) is a Czech RepublicCzech retired Association footballfootball goalkeeper. Starting his career in his native Czechoslovakia, he played over 200 games for Banik Ostrava before moving to England where he played over 300 games for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He later played for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers where he was also goalkeeping coach; a role he later held with West Ham United. He played 40 games for Czechoslovakia national football teamCzechoslovakia and two games for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic.

Bobby Petta.name: Bobby Petta
Bobby Petta.intro: '''Alfred Manuel "Bobby" Petta''' (born 6 August 1974) is a former Dutch-Indonesian Football (soccer)footballer who is currently a personal trainer based in Glasgow.

Dirk Kuyt.name: Dirk Kuyt
Dirk Kuyt.intro:
'''Dirk Kuyt''' (Dutch languageDutch: Dirk Kuijt; ; born 22 July 1980) is a Dutch association footballfootballer who plays for Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)Fenerbahçe[
Kuyt began his professional career with FC Utrecht in 1998 and quickly became part of their first team. He spent five years at the club and in his final season he won his first senior honour, the KNVB Cup, and was chosen as the season's Dutch Golden Shoe Winner. Following this, he left Utrecht in a €1 million transfer to Feyenoord. He became the club Captain (association football)captain in 2005 and was a prolific goalscorer at the Rotterdam club; he was the club's top scorer for three consecutive seasons, the top goalscorer in the 2004–05 Eredivisie season, and the 2005–06 Dutch Footballer of the Year. Kuyt missed only five games over seven seasons from 1999 until 2006 and appeared in 179 consecutive matches between 2001–06, striking up a fruitful partnership with fellow Feyenoord teammate Salomon Kalou.
He left Feyenoord after three years, having scored 71 league goals in 101 appearances, and joined Premier League side Liverpool for £10 million. He made his Premier League debut late in 2006 and became part of the first team squad. He scored in his first ever UEFA Champions League final with Liverpool 2007 Champions League Finalagainst AC Milan.
Kuyt scored several important goals for Liverpool elsewhere, including seven goals in the 2007–08 UEFA Champions League2007–08 UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, including a goal in the quarter-final against Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium and in the semi-final against Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and two penalty kicks against Everton F.C.Everton in the derby the same season. He scored his first hat-trick for Liverpool against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in March 2011. After coming on as a substitute, his extra time goal at Wembley StadiumWembley for Liverpool against Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in the 2012 Carling Cup Final2012 League Cup Final helped win the trophy for Liverpool, and was also his only trophy as a Liverpool player.
He made his international debut in 2004 and has represented the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands at five major international tournaments, the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010, and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups and the UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012 UEFA European Championships. On 3 October 2014, he announced his retirement from international football.
Dirk Kuyt.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Forward

Nigel Gibbs.name: Nigel Gibbs
Nigel Gibbs.intro:
'''Nigel James Gibbs''' (born 20 November 1965 in St Albans), is a former English Association footballfootballer and current first-team coach of Millwall F.C.Millwall. A Watford F.C.Watford supporter, as well as a product of their youth system, Gibbs spent his entire professional career as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for the club. He was assistant manager of Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United after being appointed on 12 April 2013 alongside Brian McDermott (footballer)Brian McDermott, whom he assisted at Reading F.C.Reading. He departed from Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in August 2014.
Gibbs made his Watford debut in 1983, in front of 38,000 spectators in a UEFA Cup match against Sparta Prague. In his early career Gibbs also played nine times for the England youth team, and five times for England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s. Under the management of Graham Taylor (footballer)Graham Taylor, Gibbs eventually established himself as a first-team player at Watford, making 100 Football League appearances before the club's relegation from the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 1988. Gibbs remained a key player for the team in the Second Division, and was voted Watford F.C. Player of the Season in 1992.
Manager Glenn Roeder appointed Gibbs as club captain for the 1992–93 season, but a series of serious injuries restricted him to 33 appearances over the following four seasons. When his contract expired in 1996, Gibbs considered retirement, but he went on to earn a new contract and make the most appearances of any Watford player in 1996–97. Gibbs featured regularly in Watford's rise from the Second Division to the Premier League between 1997 and 1999, and went on to play a further 17 games at the top level of English football. Watford were relegated in 2000, and Gibbs made eight further appearances before retiring in 2002.
Gibbs remained at Watford as a coach, primarily working with the youth and reserve teams. He took charge of the first team for a week following Ray Lewington's sacking as manager in 2005, but in turn was dismissed by incoming manager Aidy Boothroyd just before the start of the following season.
