After taking a year off to acquire the UEFA Pro Licence, Gibbs joined Reading F.C.Reading as youth team manager in 2006, and became assistant manager in 2009–10 Reading F.C. season2009–10. He continued in this role, and in 2011–12 Reading F.C. season2011–12 Reading won the Football League Championship title, earning promotion to the Premier League.
Nigel Gibbs.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Fabrizio Ravanelli.name: Fabrizio Ravanelli
Fabrizio Ravanelli.intro:
'''Fabrizio Ravanelli''' (; born 11 December 1968) is an Italian football manager and former international footballer, who was until November 2, 2013 the manager of French Ligue 1 club AC Ajaccio.
Ravanelli started and ended his playing career at hometown club A.C. Perugia CalcioPerugia Calcio. Other notable career stops were Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Juventus F.C.Juventus and Olympique de MarseilleMarseille. He won five titles with Juventus, including a Serie A championship in 1995 and a UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League title in 1996. In all, during his career he played with twelve clubs from four countries; his native Italy, England, France and Scotland. He earned 22 caps for the Italy national football teamItalian national team, scoring 8 goals, and was a member of the Italian squad that took part at UEFA Euro 1996. A prolific goalscorer, Ravanelli was a strong, complete, energetic, and hardworking striker, who was good in the air, and who possessed an accurate shot.

Adam Murray.name: Adam Murray
Adam Murray.intro: '''Adam David Murray''' (born on 30 September 1981) is an English association footballfootballer who is currently player-manager for Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town.

Marco Ambrosio.name: Marco Ambrosio
Marco Ambrosio.intro: '''Marco Ambrosio''' (30 May 1973 in Brescia) is a former Italian association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. Ambrosio played for multiple teams in the Italian leagues from 1991 until his retirement in 2009 (most notably with Serie A sides Atalanta B.C.Atalanta, U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria and A.C. ChievoVeronaChievo), but also had brief spells in England with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and in Switzerland with Grasshopper Club ZürichGrasshopper. He made two appearances for his country's Italy national under-21 football teamunder-21 side during the 1993–94 season, but never made an appearance for the full national side.

Benni McCarthy.name: Benni McCarthy
Benni McCarthy.intro:
'''Benedict Saul "Benni" McCarthy''' (born 12 November 1977) is a South African former association footballfootballer who was last contracted to Orlando Pirates F.C.Orlando Pirates in South Africa.
McCarthy holds the record of international goals for a South African. He is ''South Africa national football teamBafana Bafana'''s all-time top-scorer with 32 goals.

Tony Yeboah.name: Tony Yeboah
Tony Yeboah.intro:
'''Anthony Yeboah''' (born 6 June 1966 in Kumasi, Ghana) is a Ghanaian former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker from 1981 to 2002.
He is considered one of the most prominent and prolific goal scorers in Ghanaian and African football history and gained a reputation for scoring spectacular goals which often featured in Goal of the Month or Goal of the Season competitions, often celebrated by wagging his index finger towards the crowd.
Yeboah is most noted for his time at European clubs 1. FC Saarbrücken, Eintracht Frankfurt, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Hamburger SV during the 1990s. He also played for Asante Kotoko F.C.Asante Kotoko, CornerstonesCornerstones Kumasi, Okwawu United and Al-Gharafa Sports ClubAl-Ittihad Doha. He was capped 59 times by Ghana national football teamGhana, scoring 29 goals. He now runs an international Sports agentsports agency and a chain of hotels in Ghana.

St\u00e9phane Guivarc'h.name: Stéphane Guivarc'h
St\u00e9phane Guivarc'h.intro:
'''Stéphane Guivarc'h''' (born 6 September 1970 in Concarneau, Finistère, Brittany) is a retired French Association footballfootballer who played as striker. He featured in the France national football teamFrance squad that won the 1998 FIFA World Cup on home soil.
His early career was spent in France with the Breton clubs Stade Brestois and En Avant Guingamp before moving to AJ Auxerre, where he won the double of Ligue 1 and Coupe de France in 1996. He returned to Brittany with Stade Rennais with whom he won Ligue 1's Golden Boot. At a second spell at Auxerre he retained the Golden Boot in Ligue 1 and also won the Golden Boot for the 1997-98 UEFA Cup. That Summer he won the World Cup.
Guivarc'h left France for Newcastle United of the Premier League after the World Cup but left after three months having failed to make an impact at St James' Park. He finished the season at Rangers FC of the Scottish Premier League with medals in the league, Scottish Cup and Scottish League Cup, of which he scored in the final. He then returned to Auxerre before retiring after the 2001–02 season with En Avant Guingamp.
Despite goalscoring records in France and Europe to add to his 1998 World CupWorld Cup medal, he was named as the Premier League's worst ever striker by the British newspaper ''Daily Mail'', in recognition of his brief and unsuccessful spell at Newcastle United.

Dionatan Teixeira.name: Dionatan Teixeira
Dionatan Teixeira.intro:
'''Dionatan do Nascimento Teixeira''' (born 24 July 1992) is a Brazilian-born SlovakiaSlovak Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Teixeira began playing football with local side Londrina Esporte ClubeLondrina EC in Brazil before he was given the opportunity to play in Europe with Slovakian side MFK Košice in 2008. He played in the youth teams at Košice and went on trials with a number of clubs in England. A failure to gain a work permit ended any chances of him joining an English club and after playing on loan for ŠK Slovan BratislavaSlovan Bratislava in 2011–12 he was released by Košice. After briefly playing amateur football he moved on to TJ Baník RužináBaník Ružiná and then to Slovak Super Liga side FK Dukla Banská BystricaDukla Banská Bystrica. In 2013 Teixeira was granted Slovakian citizenship and after impressing Stoke City F.C.Stoke City whilst on trial he joined them on a three-year contract in June 2014.

Jimmy Phillips (footballer, born 1966).name: Jimmy Phillips (footballer, born 1966)
Jimmy Phillips (footballer, born 1966).intro: '''Jimmy Phillips''' (born 8 February 1966 in Bolton, Lancashire) is a former professional Association footballfootball player, and Academy Director at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers after spending a number of years as youth team coach. In his playing career he turned out for a number of clubs, including Bolton, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United and Rangers F.C.Rangers. Whilst at Bolton he played in the 1995 Football League Cup Final.

Greg Cunningham.name: Greg Cunningham
Greg Cunningham.intro: '''Gregory Richard "Greg" Cunningham''' (born 31 January 1991) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a left back for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team.
Greg Cunningham.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Terry Wilson (footballer, born 1969).name: Terry Wilson (footballer, born 1969)
Terry Wilson (footballer, born 1969).intro: '''Terry Wilson''' (born 8 February 1969) is a retired ScotlandScottish association footballfootball defender (football)defender. He spent the majority of his career playing for Nottingham Forest. In his time at the City Ground, Wilson was one of the Forest players who had to cope with the horrors of the Hillsborough disaster during the opening minutes of their FA Cup semi-final against Liverpool. Wilson played in the rescheduled game at Old Trafford, which Liverpool won 3-1.

Johnny Gorman.name: Johnny Gorman
Johnny Gorman.intro:
'''Rory John McCaughan''' "'''Johnny'''" '''Gorman''' (born 26 October 1992) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger who plays for non-league side Barrow A.F.C.Barrow.
He started his career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, but was soon signed by Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. After six years there, he was released and allowed to join Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2009. Gorman made just one appearance for Wolves before spending time on loan with Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, followed by a permanent move to Leyton Orient where he remained for a season.
Born in Sheffield, he first played international football for the Republic of Ireland at under-16 level, but soon switched allegiance to Northern Ireland, playing through all the age grades before receiving his first Cap (sport)cap for the Northern Ireland national football teamsenior team in 2010.

Ian Ashbee.name: Ian Ashbee
Ian Ashbee.intro: '''Ian Ashbee''' (born 6 September 1976) is an English former association footballfootballer who retired in 2012 having previously played for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. He has also played in Iceland, on loan (sports)loan to Íþróttafélag Reykjavíkur.

Johan Djourou.name: Johan Djourou
Johan Djourou.intro:
'''Johan Danon Djourou-Gbadjere''' (born 18 January 1987), more commonly known as '''Johan Djourou''', is a Switzerland national football teamSwiss international association footballfootballer who currently plays for Hamburger SVHamburg.
He used to play as a defensive midfielder in his youth for former club Étoile Carouge FCÉtoile Carouge, but on his arrival at Arsenal, he was converted to a defender (association football)central defender. He occasionally filled in at full back for Arsenal and played several games in midfieldercentral midfield while on loan to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. According to his former profile on Arsenal's website, Djourou possesses "pace, power and whole-hearted commitment" in addition to his versatility.

Linvoy Primus.name: Linvoy Primus
Linvoy Primus.intro:
'''Linvoy Stephen Primus''' Order of the British EmpireMBE  (born 14 September 1973) is an English former footballer.
Born in Forest Gate, England, to Caribbean-born parents, Primus began his professional career at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic; where he made four league appearances. Primus moved on a Free transfer (football)free transfer to Barnet F.C.Barnet and established himself as a first team regular in the lower divisions of English football before earning a £250,000 transfer to Reading F.C.Reading.
A Bosman rulingBosman transfer to Portsmouth followed after three successful seasons at the Berkshire-based club. Initially, Primus struggled to break into the team and had his progress hindered by injuries but the 2002–03 in English football2002–03 season signalled a change in direction as Primus broke into the first team and won Portsmouth fan's player of the season as well as the PFA Fans' Player of the Year for his division. For the next three seasons Primus was in and out of the first team and worked under three different managers: Harry Redknapp, Velimir Zajec and Alain Perrin. The 2006–07 FA Premier League2006–07 season was the last injury-free season for Primus as a career threatening knee injury meant he would not make a single appearance the 2007–08 Premier Leaguefollowing season. Primus went out on loan to former club Charlton and made 10 appearances and one further appearance for Portsmouth before retiring through injury in December 2009. The Milton End stand at Fratton Park was renamed the 'Linvoy Primus Community Stand' because of his outstanding services to the club.
Primus, who is married and has three children, is also known for his Christian charity work. He is involved in the Christian charity 'Faith & Football' and walked the Great Wall of China to raise £100,000 for their cause. Other charitable causes he has been involved in are the Alpha course, a cinema advertisement about Christianity and the formation of a Prayer_group#Prayer_groupsprayer group at Portsmouth. In 2007, he released his autobiography, titled "Transformed", which details his conversion to Christianity.

Steve Kabba.name: Steve Kabba
Steve Kabba.intro:
'''Sorfitu Tejan "Steve" Kabba''' (born 7 March 1981) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)forward from 1999 to 2013.
Kabba began his career with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1999 but failed to make an impact at Selhurst Park and following loan spells with Southend United F.C.Southend United and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town he joined Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town initially on a one month loan in August 2002. His performances for Grimsby earned him a permanent switch to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He went on to earn promotion with United and would feature for the club in the Premier League whilst also being a key part of the Blades squad in several successful campaigns. He eventually moved on to Watford F.C.Watford before a series of injury woes began to damage his career and after several short loans with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic he moved on to Brentford F.C.Brentford and Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion before spending his final two seasons with Barnet F.C.Barnet. He announced his retirement at the end of the 2012-13 season at the age of 32.

Lee Martin (footballer, born February 19.name: Lee Martin (footballer, born February 1968)
Lee Martin (footballer, born February 19.intro: '''Lee Andrew Martin''' (born 5 February 1968 in Hyde, Greater ManchesterHyde, Cheshire) is an English former association footballfootball Defender (association football)#Full backleft back. He played with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Celtic F.C.Celtic and Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, among others. He represented his country at England national under-21 football teamunder 21 level.
Lee Martin (footballer, born February 19.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Magnus Hedman.name: Magnus Hedman
Magnus Hedman.intro:
'''Magnus Carl Hedman''' (; born 19 March 1973 in Huddinge MunicipalityHuddinge) is a SwedenSwedish former Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper. He played 58 matches for the Sweden national football team, and represented his country at two FIFA World Cup and two UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championship tournaments.
He is recently divorced from Magdalena Graaf, a Swedish author, former model and pop singer. The couple have two sons together.

Wayne Quinn.name: Wayne Quinn
Wayne Quinn.intro:
'''Wayne Quinn''' (born 19 November 1976 in Truro) is an EnglandEnglish ex-professional Association footballfootball player who played as a Defender (association football)defender.
He started his career at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, breaking into their first team in 1997. In 2001 he was loaned to  Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, who later purchased him for £800,000. After a difficult time at the club, scoring once against Lokeren in the Intertoto Cup,cite web
url       =
title     = Newcastle coast to Belgian win
publisher = BBC
date      = 14 July 2001 accessdate=13 November 2009 he was loaned back out to Sheffield United, and then West Ham United F.C.West Ham before being released on a free transfer (soccer)free transfer in 2004.
Quinn played for England national under-21 football teamEngland's Under 21 team, and also played for England's 'B' side. He usually played at left full-back but could play as a left-sided midfielder.
Since he left West Ham United at the age of 28, he has not been able to find another pro club. It was reported in the ''Plymouth Evening Herald'' that Quinn was offered a trial by English Championship club Plymouth Argyle but declined the opportunity, preferring to play amateur football in Cornwall because of a bad injury which led to surgery.
Quinn played for and managed Penzance AFC along with Gary Marks and as of April 2012 has transferred to Falmouth Town, making his first appearance at centre back in a 1-1 draw at home to Elburton Villa.
He is currently player-manager of South Western Premier League Division One West club Mousehole AFC.

Tommy Black.name: Tommy Black
Tommy Black.intro: '''Thomas Robert "Tommy" Black''' (born 26 November 1979) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Debden Sports Club.

John Mullin.name: John Mullin
John Mullin.intro: '''John Michael Mullin''' (born 11 August 1975 in Bury, Greater Manchester) is a retired Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder for clubs including Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley, and is the brother of former Accrington and Morecambe F.C.Morecambe player Paul Mullin. He is now a member of the coaching staff at Burnley F.C.Burnley.

Philippe Albert.name: Philippe Albert
Philippe Albert.intro:
'''Philippe Julien Albert''' (born 10 August 1967) is a former Belgian Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. He played for R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi, KV Mechelen and R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht in his native Belgium, and for English clubs Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Fulham F.C.Fulham. It was at Newcastle that he became known as an attack-minded Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back for his forward runs from defence in the team dubbed as "the Entertainers".
Albert made 41 appearances for the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team from 1987 to 1997, and represented his country at the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 and 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 World Cups.

Elliot Lee.name: Elliot Lee
Elliot Lee.intro: '''Elliot Robert Lee''' (born 16 December 1994) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town on loan from West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.

Jean-Claude Darcheville.name: Jean-Claude Darcheville
Jean-Claude Darcheville.intro:
'''Jean-Claude Ducan Darcheville''' (; born 25 July 1975) is a French Guianan association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker. He played for various clubs in France, England and Scotland. He spent the last year of his career with Greek Super League side Kavala F.C.AO Kavala.
In December 2012, he represented French Guiana national football teamFrench Guiana at the 2012 Caribbean Cup.

Rolando Aarons.name: Rolando Aarons
Rolando Aarons.intro:
'''Rolando Aarons''' (born 16 November 1995) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as a Midfield (association football)midfielder.
Born in Jamaica, Aarons was called up to the England national under-20 football teamEngland national U-20 team in August 2014 and has indicated his intention to play in the England set-up.

Colin Foster.name: Colin Foster
Colin Foster.intro: '''Colin Foster''' (born 16 July 1964) is an English retired association footballfootball defender (football)defender.

Lee Roche.name: Lee Roche
Lee Roche.intro:
'''Lee Paul Roche''' (born 28 October 1980) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer. He mainly plays as a right sided full-back but can also play on the right of midfield.
Having attended Mytham County Primary School and Little Lever Specialist Language College in his school years, where he was a keen member of the school football squad, lived his early years in Bolton, Greater Manchester.

Nils-Eric Johansson.name: Nils-Eric Johansson
Nils-Eric Johansson.intro: '''Nils-Eric "Nisse" Johansson''' (born 13 January 1980 in Stockholm) is a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootball player who currently plays as Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back for AIK FotbollAIK.

Greg Berry.name: Greg Berry
Greg Berry.intro: '''Greg Berry''' (born 5 March 1971) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder. He is the Head Coach and Technical Director at Peace Arch Soccer Club and is also coaching at Coastal WFC in British Columbia, Canada.

Tony Popovic.name: Tony Popovic
Tony Popovic.intro: '''Tony Popovic'''  , born 4 July 1973 in Sydney, Australia) is an Australian former Association footballfootball player and head coach of Western Sydney Wanderers FCWestern Sydney Wanderers.
Tony Popovic.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Eljero Elia.name: Eljero Elia
Eljero Elia.intro:
'''Eljero George Rinaldo Elia''' () (born 13 February 1987) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (soccer)winger for  English club  Southampton F.C.Southampton, on loan from German club SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen.
He turned professional at ADO Den Haag and then played for FC Twente before moving abroad to represent Hamburger SVHamburg, Juventus F.C.Juventus and Werder Bremen.
Elia scored on his debut for the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team in September 2009 and was part of the Dutch squad which reached the final at the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa.

Steffen Freund.name: Steffen Freund
Steffen Freund.intro: '''Steffen Freund''' (born 19 January 1970) is a former GermanyGerman professional Association footballfootball player. He played as a defensive midfielder. He is currently the assistant head coach of Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.

Tuncay \u015eanl\u0131.name: Tuncay Şanlı
Tuncay \u015eanl\u0131.intro: '''Tuncay Volkan Şanlı''' (, born 16 January 1982), or simply '''Tuncay''', is a TurkeyTurkish association footballfootballer who plays for Umm Salal SC in the Qatar Stars League. His natural position is the Forward (association football)striker position, but he has played as an Midfielder#Attackingattacking midfielder and on either Midfielder#Wingerwing. He was in the Turkey team that finished in third place in both the 2003 FIFA Confederations Cup2003 Confederations Cup and the UEFA Euro 20082008 European Championships.

James Wilson (footballer, born 1995).name: James Wilson (footballer, born 1995)
James Wilson (footballer, born 1995).intro: '''James Anthony Wilson''' (born 1 December 1995) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United as a Forward (association football)striker. He has also represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16 and England national under-19 football teamunder-19 level.

Emile Heskey.name: Emile Heskey
Emile Heskey.intro:
'''Emile William Ivanhoe Heskey''' (born 11 January 1978) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as a Forward (association football)striker. Before joining the club, he made more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League over an 18-year career, and represented England national football teamEngland in international football. He also had a spell for Australian A-League side Newcastle Jets FCNewcastle Jets.
Born in Leicester, Heskey started his career with Leicester City F.C.Leicester City after progressing through their youth system, making his first team debut in 1995. After winning the Football League CupLeague Cup in 1997 Football League Cup Final1997 and 2000 Football League Cup Final2000 he made an £11 million move to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2000, which, at the time, was the record transfer fee paid by the club. At Liverpool, he won multiple honours, including the FA Cup in 2001 FA Cup Final2001. He moved to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2004 and after their relegation from the Premier LeagueFA Premier League signed for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic for a club record £5.5 million fee in 2006. He signed for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 2009 and was released in 2012 before signing for Australian A-League side Newcastle Jets.
Heskey was an England international at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-18 football teamunder-18, England national under-21 football teamunder-21, England national football B teamB and senior levels. He made his England debut against Hungary national football teamHungary in a 1–1 draw in 1999. He lost his place in the squad after UEFA Euro 2004, during which he failed to shine and was the subject of much criticism. After a long lay-off from international duty, Heskey was recalled to the England squad for UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying Group EUEFA Euro 2008 qualifiers in September 2007. He retired from international football following the 2010 FIFA World Cup, having attained 62 cap (sport)caps and scored seven goals for his country.

Gareth Whalley.name: Gareth Whalley
Gareth Whalley.intro: '''Gareth Whalley''' (born 19 December 1973) is an English born association footballfootballer who qualifies to play for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland under the parentage rule.

Jesper Gr\u00f8nkj\u00e6r.name: Jesper Grønkjær
Jesper Gr\u00f8nkj\u00e6r.intro:
'''Jesper Grønkjær''' (; born 12 August 1977 in Nuuk, Greenland) is a former DenmarkDanish professional Association footballfootball player.
A pacey Midfielder#Wingerwinger, he was able to play on the right or left wing and as a Forward (association football)#Second strikersecond striker. Grønkjær played a total 400 league games for a number of European clubs, most notably winning the 1999 KNVB CupDutch Cup with AFC AjaxAjax Amsterdam and playing more than 100 games for English club Chelsea FCChelsea. He ended his career with F.C. CopenhagenFC Copenhagen, winning four Danish Superliga titles with the club.
Grønkjær was cap (football)capped 80 times for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team from 1999 to 2010, scoring five goals. He played for his country at the World Cup in 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 and the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010, as well as two UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championship tournaments. He was named 1995 Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the YearDanish Under-19 Player of the Year.

Phil Jones (footballer, born 1992).name: Phil Jones (footballer, born 1992)
Phil Jones (footballer, born 1992).intro:
'''Philip Anthony "Phil" Jones''' (born 21 February 1992) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the England national football teamEngland national team. Before joining Manchester United, Jones played for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers at both youth and senior levels. Although primarily a central defender, he has also been used as a defensive midfielder or right-back.
Jones has represented England at various levels and is currently a member of the England senior squad. He played for the England national under-19 football teamUnder-19 team in 2009 before making his debut for the England national under-21 football teamUnder-21 team in 2010. He made his debut for the England national football teamEngland senior squad on 7 October 2011.

Ashkan Dejagah.name: Ashkan Dejagah
Ashkan Dejagah.intro:
'''Seyed Ashkan Dejagah''' (, born 5 July 1986), known as '''Ashkan Dejagah''', is an Iranian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Al-Arabi SC (Qatar)Al-Arabi in the Qatar Stars League, usually as an attacking midfielder or a Midfielder#Wingerright winger.
He represented Germany national youth football teamGermany at youth levels between 2001 and 2009, going on to win the 2009 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship. He has played for the Iran national football teamIranian national team since 2011, helping them qualify for the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup and the 2015 AFC Asian Cup2015 Asian Cup.
Dejagah made his professional debut for Hertha BSC in the 2004–05 Bundesliga2004–05 Bundesliga season. In 2007, he joined VfL Wolfsburg, winning the Bundesliga in the 2008–09 Bundesliga2008–09 season. In 2012, he joined Premier League side Fulham F.C.Fulham in London, England on a €2.5 million three-year deal.

Martin Reeves.name: Martin Reeves
Martin Reeves.intro: '''Martin Reeves''' (born 7 September 1981) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder, who currently plays for Brackley Town F.C.Brackley Town.

Stephen Ward.name: Stephen Ward
Stephen Ward.intro:
'''Stephen Robert Ward''' (born 20 August 1985) is a Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland international Association footballfootballer who plays for English Premier League club Burnley F.C.Burnley. He is able to play in a variety of positions, primarily left back, but also in left midfield and as a striker.
Ward began his senior career with Bohemian F.C.Bohemians in his native Ireland, before moving to Football League ChampionshipEnglish Championship side Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2007. Featuring regularly, he was part of their promotion to the Premier League two years later and played over 230 times for the club. Following consecutive relegations though he was transfer listed, eventually leaving to return to the Premier League with Burnley F.C.Burnley in 2014.
Since 2011 he has been a regular member of the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland's international squads, and played in all three of their matches at UEFA Euro 2012.

Maurice Doyle.name: Maurice Doyle
Maurice Doyle.intro: '''Maurice Doyle''' (born 17 October 1969 in Ellesmere Port) is an EnglandEnglish Football (soccer)footballer.

Jean Makoun.name: Jean Makoun
Jean Makoun.intro: '''Jean II Makoun''' () (born 29 May 1983) is a Cameroonian association footballfootballer who plays for Stade Rennais F.C.Stade Rennais as a central midfielder. He also plays for the Cameroon national football team.

Rade Prica.name: Rade Prica
Rade Prica.intro:
'''Rade Stanislav Prica''' (born 30 June 1980) is a SwedenSwedish association footballfootballer who currently plays for Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.Maccabi Tel Aviv.
Prica is the only player who has won league championships in the three Scandinavian countries – Football in SwedenSweden, Football in DenmarkDenmark and Football in NorwayNorway.

Nathan Delfouneso.name: Nathan Delfouneso
Nathan Delfouneso.intro: '''Nathan Abayomi Delfouneso''' (born 2 February 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool as a striker. Delfouneso has been a regular England national football teamEngland youth international, having played over 50 matches at England national under-16 football teamU16, England national under-17 football teamU17, England national under-19 football teamU19 and England national under-21 football teamU21 levels.

John Hartson.name: John Hartson
John Hartson.intro:
'''John Hartson''' (born 5 April 1975) is a Welsh peopleWelsh former professional association footballfootballer who played as a striker from 1992 until 2008 notably in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic and the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He was  then the Wales national team forwards coach, until 6 November 2013.
He also played in England's top flight for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and in the Football League for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. Hartson also featured prominently for Wales national football teamWales, earning 51 caps and scoring 14 goals.

Roberto Di Matteo.name: Roberto Di Matteo
Roberto Di Matteo.intro:
'''Roberto Di Matteo''' (; born 29 May 1970) is an Italian retired Association footballfootballer and current manager of FC Schalke 04Schalke 04 in the Bundesliga.
During his playing career as a midfielder, he played for Swiss clubs FC SchaffhausenSchaffhausen, FC ZürichZürich and FC AarauAarau before joining S.S. LazioLazio of Italy and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea of England. He was Cap (sport)capped 34 times for Italy national football teamItaly, scoring two goals, and played in UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup. He retired as a player in February 2002 at the age of 31 following injury problems.
Di Matteo managed Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. As caretaker manager of Chelsea, he steered the club to double title success, winning both the 2012 FA Cup FinalFA Cup and the club's first 2012 UEFA Champions League FinalUEFA Champions League in 2012, but was dismissed later that year.

Neil Adams.name: Neil Adams
Neil Adams.intro:
'''Neil James Adams''' (born 23 November 1965) is a former professional Association footballfootballer and former manager of Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He played for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Everton F.C.Everton, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Norwich City.
Adams began his career playing for his local club Stoke City, where he earned a reputation of being a promising winger. This prompted Everton to pay a fee of £150,000 for his signature in June 1986. Injuries prevented him from reaching his potential at Goodison Park and after three years he moved on to Oldham Athletic. At Oldham, Adams played a major role in helping the club gain promotion to the newly formed Premier League in 1992 and also helped the Latics to reach the 1990 Football League Cup Final1990 League Cup Final. He signed for Norwich City in February 1994 for a fee of £250,000. He became a regular in the Norwich for the next six seasons before ending his playing career with another two years at Oldham. After retiring from playing, Adams became a pundit for BBC Radio Norfolk, before taking up a coaching role at the Norwich City Academy – guiding them to victory in the 2012–13 FA Youth Cup. In April 2014 Adams was appointed first-team manager following the departure of Chris Hughton.

Jack Grealish.name: Jack Grealish
Jack Grealish.intro:
'''Jack Grealish''' (born 10 September 1995) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a midfielder.
He joined Aston Villa at the age of 6, and made his debut for the club in May 2014, following a loan at Notts County.
Eligible to represent either England national football teamEngland or the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland internationally, Grealish has been capped by the latter up to Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamUnder-21 level.

Hassan Kachloul.name: Hassan Kachloul
Hassan Kachloul.intro: '''Hassan Kachloul''' () (born 19 February 1973 in Agadir) is a retired MoroccoMoroccan association footballfootballer. He played for the Morocco national football teamMoroccan national team and was a squad member at the 1994 FIFA World Cup.

Clayton Blackmore.name: Clayton Blackmore
Clayton Blackmore.intro:
'''Clayton Graham Blackmore''' (born 23 September 1964[
Blackmore began his professional career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 1982, having progressed through the club's youth ranks. After twelve years and 186 league appearances, he switched to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough on a free transfer, and would go on to make 53 league appearances in five years, whilst also having a brief loan spell at Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in 1996. Having left Middlesbrough in 1999, he would go on to have short spells at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Notts County F.C.Notts County and Leigh Genesis F.C.Leigh RMI over the next couple of seasons, before a much longer stint at Bangor City F.C.Bangor City commenced in 2000. He left Bangor City in 2006 (after a brief stint as player-manager), having made 176 league appearances for the club, and, after spending a season with Porthmadog F.C.Porthmadog (where he was also player-manager), switched to Neath Athletic A.F.C.Neath Athletic in 2007, where he made a further 22 league appearances before retiring in 2010. Internationally, Blackmore won 39 caps for Wales national football teamWales between 1985 and 1997.
Clayton Blackmore.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Richard Cresswell.name: Richard Cresswell
Richard Cresswell.intro:
'''Richard Paul Wesley Cresswell''' (born 20 September 1977) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played primarily as a Forward (association football)striker but could also play as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger. He is a Coach (sport)first team coach at York City F.C.York City.
Cresswell started his career with York City in their youth system, making his first team debut in 1996. Having scored 19 goals for York in the 1998–99 in English football1998–99 season he signed for Premier LeagueFA Premier League team Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 1999. After their Promotion and relegationrelegation the following year he joined Leicester City F.C.Leicester City of the FA Premier League, but was Loan (sports)loaned to Football League First DivisionFirst Division side Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in 2001 and played for them in the 2001 Football League First Division play-off Final. He signed for Preston permanently in the summer. He had four full seasons with Preston, scoring a career best 21 goals in the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 season, which culminated in defeat in the 2005 Football League Championship play-off Final.
He signed for Football League ChampionshipChampionship rivals Leeds United F.C.Leeds United in 2005. He had a number of knee injuries while with Leeds and following their relegation to Football League OneLeague One in 2007 was signed by Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. With Stoke he won promotion to the Premier League as Championship runners-up, with Cresswell scoring 12 goals in the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 season. He spent one full season in the Premier League with Stoke before signing for Championship side Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United on loan in 2009, before signing permanently in 2010. United were relegated to League One in 2011, and Cresswell played in their defeat in the 2012 Football League One play-off Final. He was made player-coach at the club in 2012 before rejoining his first club York City in 2013, initially on loan.

Jim Crawford.name: Jim Crawford
Jim Crawford.intro: '''Jim Crawford''' (born 1 May 1973) is a retired Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder for Bohemian F.C.Bohemian, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, Reading F.C.Reading, Shelbourne F.C.Shelbourne and Sporting Fingal F.C.Sporting Fingal. Born in Chicago in the United States, he represented the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland at under-21 level.

Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1960).name: Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1960)
Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1960).intro: '''Daniel Joseph "Danny" Wilson''' (born 1 January 1960) is a former Association footballfootballer and manager. He has previously coached Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.

Raul Meireles.name: Raul Meireles
Raul Meireles.intro:
'''Raul José Trindade Meireles''' ( ''Ra-Ul Mey-Re-Lesh'') (born 17 March 1983) is a Portuguese Association footballfootballer who plays  as a midfieldercentral midfielder for Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)Fenerbahçe in the Turkish Süper Lig.
Raul Meireles started his career as a trainee with Boavista F.C.Boavista but was loaned to C.D. AvesDesportivo das Aves in the Liga de Honra, where he made his professional debut. After a two-year loan spell he returned to Boavista where he made his Primeira Liga debut. His great performances brought Meireles to F.C. PortoPorto, winning three Primeira Liga titles in a row, adding two Taça de PortugalPortuguese Cups and three Supertaça Cândido de OliveiraPortuguese Supercups. In 2010 he moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool where he won the PFA Fans' Player of the Year#20112011 PFA Fans' Player of the Year award following a very successful first season in Premier League. In August 2011, Meireles signed for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, joining his former manager André Villas-Boas with whom he had spent a short period of time at Porto. During his debut season at Stamford Bridge (stadium)Stamford Bridge, he won the 2012 UEFA Champions League Final2012 UEFA Champions League and the 2011–12 FA Cup, his first titles since his arrival in England.
In international football Meireles' national career began at youth level when he represented the Portugal national under-16 football teamUnder-16 side which won the 2000 UEFA European Under-16 Football Championship in Israel. In November 2006 he was called up to the Portugal national football teamsenior squad for the first time, and represented them at UEFA Euro 2008, the 2010 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2012 and at the 2014 FIFA World Cup, earning over 75 caps.

Mark Wilson (English footballer).name: Mark Wilson (English footballer)
Mark Wilson (English footballer).intro: '''Mark Antony Wilson''' (born 9 February 1979) is an English Association footballfootballer, who plays as a midfielder and is currently unattached to a club. He has represented England at England national under-21 football teamUnder-21 level.

Billy McKinlay.name: Billy McKinlay
Billy McKinlay.intro: '''William Alexander "Billy" McKinlay''' (born 22 April 1969), is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootball player and coach. He began his career with Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, making over 200 league appearances, before joining Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 1995 for £1.75 miliion. He later played for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Clydebank F.C.Clydebank, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Fulham F.C.Fulham . He appeared 29 times for Scotland national football teamScotland and played at UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup. As a coach he has worked for Fulham, the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team and Watford F.C.Watford. He was appointed Watford head coach in September 2014 but left the post after eight days.

Peter Crouch.name: Peter Crouch
Peter Crouch.intro:
'''Peter James Crouch''' (born 30 January 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City as a Forward (association football)striker. He was capped 42 times by the England national football teamEngland national team from 2005 to 2010, scoring 22 goals for his country in that time, and appearing at two World Cups.
Crouch started his career as a trainee with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He failed to make an appearance for Spurs and after loan spells at Dulwich Hamlet F.C.Dulwich Hamlet and Swedish club IFK Hässleholm he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. QPR were relegated at the end of the 2000–01 season and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth stepped in and paid £1.5 million for Crouch. He had a good season at Fratton Park and after scoring 19 goals he joined Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in March 2002 for £5 million. He had a relatively poor spell at Villa and was loaned out to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 2003 before making a move to Southampton F.C.Southampton where he re-gained his form and was signed by Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in July 2005.
At Liverpool, Crouch enjoyed considerable success, winning the FA Community Shield and FA Cup in 2006 and also gained a runners-up medal in the 2007 UEFA Champions League Final. After scoring 42 goals in three seasons at Anfield Portsmouth re-signed him for £11 million and he forged an effective partnership with fellow England player Jermain Defoe. He spent just one season at Portsmouth and left for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur where he again linked up with Defoe and Harry Redknapp. He scored a vital goal for Tottenham against Manchester City F.C.Manchester City which earned the club a place in the UEFA Champions League. He scored seven goals in ten European matches for Spurs in 2010–11, but was unable to replicate this form in the Premier League.  He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on 31 August 2011 for a club record fee of £10 million. In his first season with Stoke he scored 14 goals and won the club's Stoke City F.C. Player of the Yearplayer of the year award.

Leon Best.name: Leon Best
Leon Best.intro:
'''Leon Julian Brendan Best''' (born 19 September 1986) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and the Republic of Ireland national football team. Best represented Ireland at Republic of Ireland under-21 national football teamunder-21 level and won his first full international cap against Nigeria national football teamNigeria on 29 May 2009.
Best had a youth career at Notts County F.C.Notts County. His first professional club was then Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton. He has also played for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United before his 2012 move to Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.

William Gallas.name: William Gallas
William Gallas.intro:
'''William Éric Gallas''' (; born 17 August 1977) is a retired French association footballfootballer who played most of his footballing career in England - notably all London teams - before finishing his career in Australia with A-League club Perth Glory. Gallas began his career in France, before being signed by English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2001. He transferred to rivals Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as part of an exchange deal in 2006. He then signed for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 2010.
While his career has been successful, including Premier League titles in 2005 and 2006, he has also had controversy due to on-field behaviour and friction with other personnel. In 2007, he was named Arsenal's captain, but was removed from the role during the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season after criticising teammates in a media interview. Gallas left Arsenal at the end of the 2009–10 in English football2009–10 season, when his contract expired. Gallas signed for North London Derbyrivals Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He was released at the end of the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 season when his contract expired. He retired on 16th October 2014.

Yaya Tour\u00e9.name: Yaya Touré
Yaya Tour\u00e9.intro:
'''Gnégnéri Yaya Touré''' (born 13 May 1983), known as '''Yaya Touré''', is an Ivorian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast national team.[
Touré aspired to be a striker during his youth and has played centre back, including for FC Barcelona in the 2009 UEFA Champions League Final. He frequently plays as a box-to-box midfielder for club and country and often switches from defensive and attacking positions throughout matches. Touré began his playing career at Ivorian club ASEC Mimosas, where he made his debut aged 18. He was voted African Footballer of the Year for 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014.
His performances attracted attention from Europe, playing for clubs in various European leagues. Touré played for K.S.K. BeverenBeveren in Belgium, FC Metalurh DonetskMetalurh Donetsk in Ukraine, Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos in Greece, and AS Monaco FCAS Monaco in France. In 2007, Touré moved to Barcelona, playing over 100 matches for the club and was part of the historic 2008–09 FC Barcelona season2009 Barcelona team which won six trophies in one calendar year.
Yaya Touré then moved to Premier League club Manchester City in 2010, where he has since scored a number of key goals for the Citizens – most notably the only goals in the 2011 FA Cup semi-final and 2011 FA Cup Finalfinal. Touré has a distinguished international career with 95 Cap (football)caps for the Ivory Coast, representing the team in their first appearance in a FIFA World Cup, in the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 competition, and also played in the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 tournaments. He is the younger brother of his Ivory Coast teammate Kolo Touré. They also played together at Manchester City for three years, before Kolo was transferred to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2013.

Perry Groves.name: Perry Groves
Perry Groves.intro: '''Perry Groves''' (born 19 April 1965) is a former English football (soccer)footballer, known chiefly for his time at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He was a fast-paced player who usually played as winger (sport)winger, and occasionally as a striker. His uncle Vic Groves also played for Arsenal, from 1955 to 1964. He now runs a successful business called [

Lee Todd.name: Lee Todd
Lee Todd.intro: '''Lee Todd''' (born 7 March 1972 in Hartlepool, England) is an EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer. He played in Defender (association football)defence.

Keith Branagan.name: Keith Branagan
Keith Branagan.intro:
'''Keith Graham Branagan''' (born 10 July 1966 in Fulham) is an EnglandEnglish-born former association footballfootball goalkeeper, who played for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level.
Branagan played for a number of clubs in his career. He began his career at Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, and later joined Millwall F.C.Millwall. However, his most successful years were spent at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, where he experienced three promotions, played two seasons in the FA Premier LeaguePremier League and played at Wembley StadiumWembley in the 1995 Football League CupLeague Cup final. After eight years at Bolton, Branagan joined Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in 2000.
At international level, Branagan won one full cap for the Republic of Ireland. His only senior cap came on 11 February 1997, in the 0–0 draw against Wales at Cardiff Arms Park#National StadiumThe National Stadium, Cardiff. Branagan also played a couple of matches for the Republic of Ireland B national football teamRepublic of Ireland "B" team.
Branagan was forced to retire from the game in October 2002 following a nine-month battle against a shoulder injury. Branagan has remained in the game following retirement; he now has a UEFA 'A' Coaching licence and has coached the goalkeepers at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County before taking up a coaching role at Bolton School. He is still there as a football coach.
Branagan become a part-time youth goalkeeping coach for Bolton on 28 March 2012.
His son Richie Branagan is also a goalkeeper, who is on the books of Macclesfield Town.

Andreas Johansson (footballer, born 1978.name: Andreas Johansson (footballer, born 1978)
Andreas Johansson (footballer, born 1978.intro:
'''Andreas Johansson''' (born 5 July 1978 in Vänersborg) is a SwedenSwedish former Association footballfootballer. He played as a midfielder and is a former Sweden national football teamSwedish international.
He got his breakthrough with Swedish team Djurgårdens IF FotbollDjurgårdens IF, winning the two Allsvenskan championships and two Svenska CupenSwedish Cup trophies. He played for Premier League team Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, before joining AaB FodboldAaB with whom he won the Danish Superliga and was named team captain. He has played 16 games for the national team.

Niall Quinn.name: Niall Quinn
Niall Quinn.intro:
'''Niall John Quinn''' (honorary Order of the British EmpireMBE;
Quinn is also heavily involved in the management side of horse racing.

Graeme Le Saux.name: Graeme Le Saux
Graeme Le Saux.intro:
'''Graeme Pierre Le Saux''' ( ; born 17 October 1968) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer of French ancestry.[
After beginning playing in Jersey, he moved to England and debuted for Chelsea in 1989. He left Chelsea in 1993 to join the Blackburn side being built by wealthy benefactor, Jack Walker, and was part of their 1994–95 FA Premier League1994–95 Premier League winning team. In 1997 he returned to Chelsea, staying there for six seasons until moving to Southampton in 2003. He announced his retirement from football upon Southampton's relegation from the Premier League in 2005.
In his club playing career, he scored 20 goals from 403 club appearances. He was twice named in the PFA Team of the YearProfessional Footballers' Association Team of the Year, in PFA Team of the Year#19951995 with Blackburn and in PFA Team of the Year#19981998 with Chelsea. His return to Chelsea in 1997 in a £5 million transfer made him the most expensive defender in English football. As an England international, he made 36 senior appearances from 1994 until 2000, including starting all four England games at the 1998 FIFA World Cup in France, and scoring one international goal, against Brazil national football teamBrazil.
Graeme Le Saux.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Thomas Helveg.name: Thomas Helveg
Thomas Helveg.intro:
'''Thomas Lund Helveg''' (born 24 June 1971) is a former DenmarkDanish professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender for Odense Boldklub in the Danish Superliga, with whom he won the 1989 List of Danish football championsDanish championship. The most prominent period of his career was five years with ItalyItalian club AC Milan, with whom he won the 1999 Serie A championship and 2003 UEFA Champions League tournament.
Helveg was named 1994 Danish Player of the YearDanish ''Player of the Year'', the year he made his debut for the Denmark national football team. He has played 108 games and scored two goals for Denmark. He has played for Denmark under three different national coaches, and has participated in the 1996, 2000 and 2004 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championship and the 1998 and 2002 FIFA World Cup tournaments.

Jonathan Spector.name: Jonathan Spector
Jonathan Spector.intro:
'''Jonathan Michael Paul Spector''' (born March 1, 1986) is an American Association footballsoccer player who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He started his professional career in England when he was signed by Manchester United F.C.Manchester United as a teenager, but rarely appeared for the club. He played on loan at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, then in 2006 joined West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, where he played over 100 games before he was released at the end of the 2010–11 season.
Although he began playing as a striker during his youth career, Spector was converted into a defender as a professional. He most commonly plays as a right fullback but is capable of playing across the defensive line and in central midfield.

Jeroen Boere.name: Jeroen Boere
Jeroen Boere.intro:
'''Jeroen Willem Boere''' (18 November 1967 – 16 August 2007) was a Dutch association footballfootball player.
He was the younger brother of Remco Boere, who played for clubs including Den Haag and Zwolle.
He started his professional career at SBV Excelsior and went on to play for several teams, mostly at Holland's Eerste Divisiesecond level.

Luis Alberto (footballer, born 1992).name: Luis Alberto (footballer, born 1992)
Luis Alberto (footballer, born 1992).intro: '''Luis Alberto Romero Alconchel''' (born 28 September 1992), known as '''Luis Alberto''', is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Málaga CF on loan from English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder or Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Jesper Blomqvist.name: Jesper Blomqvist
Jesper Blomqvist.intro:
'''Lars Jesper Blomqvist''' (born 5 February 1974) is a retired SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer.
Most recently he was the playing assistant manager of Superettan side Hammarby IFHammarby from December 2009 to November 2010. He played at IFK Göteborg, where he won four straight Allsvenskan league titles between 1993–96, and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, where he was part of the team that won a Treble (association football)treble in 1999, consisting of the Premier League, FA Cup and UEFA Champions League. He returned to Swedish football in 2003 with Djurgårdens IF FotbollDjurgården, where he won his final Allsvenskan title, before initially retiring in 2005. An injury crisis prompted a playing return for Enköping in 2008. Blomqvist has made 30 international appearances for Sweden national football teamSweden and helped them to third place at the 1994 FIFA World Cup in the United States.

Nigel Reo-Coker.name: Nigel Reo-Coker
Nigel Reo-Coker.intro: '''Nigel Shola Andre Reo-Coker''' (born 14 May 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer of Sierra Leonean descent who plays for Montreal Impact in Major League Soccer. He came through the youth team ranks at Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, and has previously played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Vancouver Whitecaps FC and Chivas USA.

Eric Tinkler.name: Eric Tinkler
Eric Tinkler.intro:
'''Eric Tinkler''' (born 30 July 1970 in Roodepoort, Gauteng) is a retired South African association footballfootballer who played for Wits University FCWits in South Africa, Vitória F.C.Vitória de Setúbal and União de Tomar in Portugal, Cagliari CalcioCagliari in Italy and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in England where he appeared in the Premier League.
He is currently caretaker coach at Orlando Pirates FCPirates.[

Gianfranco Zola.name: Gianfranco Zola
Gianfranco Zola.intro:
'''Gianfranco Zola''', Order of the British EmpireOBE, OMRIUfficiale OMRI (; born 5 July 1966) is an Italian former Association footballfootballer, who played predominantly as a Forward (association football)forward. After retirement from playing he became a manager, most recently at Cagliari CalcioCagliari.
He spent the first decade of his playing career playing in Italy, most notably with S.S.C. NapoliNapoli, alongside Diego Maradona and Careca, where he was able to win the Serie A 1989-90Serie A title, and at Parma F.C.Parma, where he won the Italian Supercup and the 1994-95 UEFA CupUEFA Cup. He later moved to English side Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, where he was voted the Football Writers' AssociationFootball Writers' Player of the Year in the 1996–97 in English football1996–97 season. During his time at the club, he won the 1997-98 UEFA Cup Winners' CupUEFA Cup Winners' Cup, the UEFA Supercup, two FA CupFA Cups, the Football League CupLeague Cup, and the FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield. In 2003 he was voted Chelsea's greatest player ever. He was capped 35 times for Italy national football teamItaly from his debut in 1991, appearing at the 1994 FIFA World Cup, where Italy finished in second place, and Euro 96.
During his playing career, Zola was primarily used as a Second strikersupporting striker or as a Playmakerplaymaking attacking midfielder, also being deployed as a Winger (association football)winger or as a Striker (football)striker on occasion. A creative and technical player, Zola was renowned for his ball control, his skilful dribbling ability, vision, and passing ability, as well as his eye for goal. His small stature gave him good balance and allowed him to be extremely quick and agile, which, along with his acceleration and ball skills, enabled him to change direction with the ball very quickly in tight spaces, and allowed him to beat defenders in one on one situations. Zola was also a penalty kick and set piece specialist, who was particularly renowned for his accuracy at Curl (football)bending Direct free kickdirect free-kicks. Zola was given the nickname "Magic box" whilst playing at Chelsea. Zola is regarded as one of the best Italian creative forwards of his generation, and as one of the best players in FA Premier leaguePremier League history.
After a stint with Italy national under-21 football teamItaly Under-21, Zola began his club managerial career with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United of the Premier League in 2008 in the Premier League, before being sacked in 2010. He was manager of Watford F.C.Watford from July 2012 until he announced his resignation on 16 December 2013. From December 2014 to March 2015 he managed Cagliari in Serie A.

Mousa Demb\u00e9l\u00e9 (footballer, bor.name: Mousa Dembélé (footballer, born 1987)
Mousa Demb\u00e9l\u00e9 (footballer, bor.intro: '''Mousa Sidi Yaya Dembélé''' (born 16 July 1987), also spelled '''Moussa Dembélé''', is a Belgian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Association football positions#Centre midfield (CM)central midfielder for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League and the Belgium national football team, for whom he has achieved over 50 caps. Dembélé started his career at Belgian Pro League team Beerschot ACGerminal Beerschot before spells at Football in the NetherlandsDutch Eredivisie sides Willem II (football club)Willem II and AZ (football club)AZ. Dembélé transferred to Premier League side Fulham F.C.Fulham in 2010 before joining current club Tottenham in August 2012. He was ranked 91st in ''The Guardian'' 's list of the 100 best current footballers in 2012.

Mark McKeever.name: Mark McKeever
Mark McKeever.intro:
'''Mark McKeever''' (born 16 November 1978, Derry, Northern Ireland) is a former professional and semi-professional association footballerfootball player who last played for Conference South club Weston-super-Mare A.F.C.Weston-super-Mare.
McKeever began his football career with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City as a youth team player. He was eventually released and moved on to Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United with ex-Canaries coach Kit Carson. McKeever became a trainee with the club, but after only 3 appearances he was transferred to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in April 1997 with David Billington (footballer)David Billington for £1,000,000.
McKeever made three appearances in the Premier League and was looking to break into the first team before a foot injury prematurely ended his season. He was subsequently sent on loan to Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and later Reading F.C.Reading. During his stint with the Royals he looked like George Best in a 4–0 away victory over Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
McKeever made his 6th appearance for Wednesday in an FA Cup tie against Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in 1999-00 in English footballDecember 1999. A year later, Mark was linked with a return to Bristol Rovers after Rovers had supposedly tabled a £100,000 bid for him. But the permanent move did not materialise.
McKeever did move to Bristol Rovers on loan for two months in 2001. In March 2001, the move was made permanent, with McKeever moving south on a free transfer. He spent 2 years with Rovers before being released in 2002-03 in English footballMay 2003. He then joined Weston-super-Mare A.F.C.Weston-super-Mare in August 2003, for whom he played for a period of three years before signing for Bath City F.C.Bath City in May 2006. It was here that he won a Southern League winners medal in 2007.
Bath City sent Mark on loan in January 2008 to Mangotsfield United, but he was soon transferred to fellow Conference South club Weston-super-Mare A.F.C.Weston-super-Mare in March 2008 for his second stint with the club.
On 18 August 2009 he was forced to retire following injury.
McKeever was spotted by agent/talent scout Pauly White in the summer of 2009, and then joined East Worle FC. He won the second medal of his career lifting the Hospital Cup in May 2010 and followed that up with a Weston and District Division 1 winners medal in 2011. At East he was a firm fans favourite and could often be seen mixing with the fans in the bar after the game. McKeever decided to retire from Weston and District football at the top, throwing his future up in the air. Rumours have begun circulating that he may follow his old manager to Banwell. Until then McKeever can be seen dominating the 5aside league at priory school on a Thursday night.
He has been capped by the Republic of Ireland at Under-18 level (12 caps) and by their Under-21s (4 caps). McKeever played for the Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team in the 1997 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship finals in Iceland.

Johnny Wright.name: Johnny Wright
Johnny Wright.intro:
'''Johnny Wright''' (born 24 November 1975) is a former professional football (soccer)footballer who played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
Born in Northern Ireland, Wright made five starts and two substitute appearances for Norwich, in a City career that stretched from 1994 to 1997. Notably, in his last three professional appearances (October to December 1996), 18 goals were scored (a 4-1 victory and 5-1 and 6-1 defeats).
Wright was capped by the Northern Ireland "B" team.
After leaving Norwich in 1997 he played non-league football for Wroxham F.C.Wroxham before returning to Northern Ireland where he played for Glenavon F.C.Glenavon and Ards F.C.Ards.

Nicky Hunt.name: Nicky Hunt
Nicky Hunt.intro: '''Nicholas Brett "Nicky" Hunt''' (born 3 September 1983) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley as a Defender (association football)#Full backright back.
Nicky Hunt.position: Defender  football  Full back Right back

Dave Kitson.name: Dave Kitson
Dave Kitson.intro:
'''David Barry "Dave" Kitson''' (born 21 January 1980) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. Kitson was most recently player/assistant manager at Arlesey Town F.C.Arlesey Town having arrived in December 2014, but he left in February 2015 at the same time as manager Nick Ironton.
Kitson began his career with non-league Hitchin Town F.C.Hitchin Town and Arlesey Town F.C.Arlesey Town whilst working as a shelf-stacker for Sainsbury's. He joined Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United in 2001 and became one of the brightest prospects in the Third Division which led to him being signed by Reading F.C.Reading in 2003 for a fee of £150,000. He enjoyed great success with the "Royals", forming a formidable partnership with Kevin Doyle as Reading gained promotion to the Premier League in 2006. After two seasons in the top flight Reading were relegated and Kitson signed for newcomers Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for a club record fee of £5.5 million.
However his career soon started to become sour and after failing to score a single goal he was loaned back to Reading. He began the 2009–10 Stoke City F.C. season2009–10 season better, scoring twice, but was then loaned out again this time to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. He returned to Stoke in January 2010 but continued to struggle and after manager Tony Pulis branded him 'petulant' he was allowed to join Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth as part of a swap deal for Marc Wilson (Irish footballer)Marc Wilson. He spent two seasons at Fratton Park but agreed to cancel his contract with Portsmouth in August 2012 with the club in danger of being liquidated, and subsequently joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United on a short-term deal, before signing a two-year contract at Oxford United F.C.Oxford United in June 2013.

Maik Taylor.name: Maik Taylor
Maik Taylor.intro:
'''Maik Stefan Taylor''' (born 4 September 1971) is a former Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international association footballfootball goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
At club level, Taylor played non-League football for Petersfield Town F.C.Petersfield Town, Basingstoke Town F.C.Basingstoke Town and Farnborough Town F.C.Farnborough Town before moving into the Football League with Barnet F.C.Barnet. He went on to play for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, where he spent eight years before his release at the end of the 2010–11 season, Leeds United and Millwall F.C.Millwall. In international football, he played for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, qualifying for that country through his United KingdomBritish passport which at that time, as he was born abroad, entitled him to play for any of the Home Nations.

Nathan D'Laryea.name: Nathan D'Laryea
Nathan D'Laryea.intro: '''Nathan Amarkine D'Laryea''' (born 3 September 1985 in Manchester) is a former EnglandEnglish footballer who played as a defender. He was a product of the Manchester City F.C.Manchester City academy and played for clubs including Rochdale A.F.CRochdale, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Hyde F.C.Hyde FC.

Paul Goddard.name: Paul Goddard
Paul Goddard.intro: '''Paul Goddard''' (born 12 October 1959 in Harlington, LondonHarlington, Middlesex) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and manager.

Mehdi Nafti.name: Mehdi Nafti
Mehdi Nafti.intro:
'''Mehdi Ben Sadok Nafti''' (; born 28 November 1978) is a Tunisian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
During his professional career he played in four different countries in representation of five teams, including Toulouse FCToulouse, Racing de Santander and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City.
Nafti gained 44 Cap (sport)caps for Tunisia national football teamTunisia, representing the nation at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and three Africa Cup of Nations tournaments.

Florent Sinama Pongolle.name: Florent Sinama Pongolle
Florent Sinama Pongolle.intro:
'''Florent Stéphane Sinama Pongolle''' (born 20 October 1984) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Swiss club FC Lausanne-Sport as a Forward (association football)forward.
He was signed at only 16 by Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, but could never impose himself in the first team. He also spent several seasons in Spain, with Recreativo de HuelvaRecreativo, Atlético Madrid and Real ZaragozaZaragoza.

Julius Aghahowa.name: Julius Aghahowa
Julius Aghahowa.intro:
'''Julius Aghahowa''' (born 12 February 1982 in Benin City) is a retired Nigerian Association footballfootballer. He is known for his pace and his back-flips when he scores goals.
Aghahowa has played for Nigeria at four Africa Cup of Nations, the 2002 World Cup and the 2000 Olympics, as well as playing top-flight football in Tunisia, Ukraine, England and Turkey.

Barry Quinn.name: Barry Quinn
Barry Quinn.intro:
'''Barry Scott Quinn''' (born 9 May 1979) is an Republic of IrelandIrish retired Association footballfootballer. His position was Defender (association football)defender.
Quinn was signed up by Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in August 1996 as a trainee from Manortown United F.C.Manortown United. He went on to appear seventy-four times for the club. In the 2004 January transfer window, he was loaned out to Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds, who at the time were playing in Football League OneLeague One. After appearing four times for Rushden, Quinn returned to Coventry, where he was released. He won four caps at international level for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland.
He signed for Oxford United F.C.Oxford United in May 2004 on a free transfer. In 2006-07 season he won the Player's Player of the Year award after a highly consistent year. Shortly after receiving the reward, manager Jim Smith (footballer)Jim Smith informed Oxford United fans that Barry was to take the captains armband for the following season.  On 30 April 2009, after 199 appearances in his 2 spells at Oxford United, the club announced that Quinn had been released and would not be offered a new deal.
In July 2010 he moved to Brackley Town F.C.Brackley Town.
He also had a share in the company ''GQL'' which owned a Bar (establishment)Bar/Restaurant in Coventry City Centre, this was then placed into administration as it did not generate enough revenue. It was later liquidated.
Quinn played for the Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team in the 1997 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship finals in Iceland.

Joe-Max Moore.name: Joe-Max Moore
Joe-Max Moore.intro:
'''Joe-Max Moore''' (born February 23, 1971) is a former United StatesAmerican Association footballsoccer Forward (association football)forward. He played professionally for football clubclubs in Germany, England and the United States.  He finished his career with the New England Revolution of Major League Soccer.  In addition to his club career, Moore earned 100 cap (sports)caps, scoring 24 goals, for the United States men's national soccer teamU.S. national team between 1992 to 2002.  During those years, he was part of U.S. teams at the 1992 Summer Olympics and the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994, 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 and 2002 FIFA World Cups.
On April 4, 2013, Moore was elected to the U.S. Soccer Hall of Fame.

Gary McSheffrey.name: Gary McSheffrey
Gary McSheffrey.intro:
'''Gary McSheffrey''' (born 13 August 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Football League OneLeague One club Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. He began his career as a striker but eventually became a left-winger.
McSheffrey began his professional career with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, and also played in the Football League and Premier League for Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before returning to Coventry in 2010. Released in September 2013, he signed for Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield later that month. In January 2014 he signed for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United on a free transfer until the end of the 2013–14 season and continued with them the following season.

Jason Bowen.name: Jason Bowen
Jason Bowen.intro: '''Jason Peter Bowen''' (born 24 August 1972 in Merthyr Tydfil) is a Welsh peopleWelsh former international footballer. Bowen was capped twice by Wales national football teamWales in a career which started at Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.

Jordi Cruyff.name: Jordi Cruyff
Jordi Cruyff.intro:
'''Johan Jordi Cruijff''' (born 9 February 1974), also known as '''Jordi Cruyff''' (both forms are acceptable in Dutch), is a Dutch former Association footballfootballer and currently Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.Maccabi Tel Aviv general manager of football. He played from 1992 through to 2010, his clubs including FC Barcelona and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He gained nine caps for the Netherlands national football team, playing in the Euro 19961996 European Championships. Cruyff is the son of Dutch former player and manager Johan Cruyff.
Jordi played mainly as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder, though he could also appear as a second striker. In his later years, notably with FC Metalurh DonetskMetalurh Donetsk, he also played as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back. After starting his career with Barcelona (under his father's management) and playing for the Netherlands aged 22, Cruyff's career stalled whilst at Manchester United, as he appeared just 36 times in the league over four years due largely to injuries. His most successful period was arguably with Deportivo Alavés, whom he led to the 2001 UEFA Cup Final. He also played for Celta de VigoCelta Vigo, RCD Espanyol and finished his playing career with Valletta F.C.Valletta in the Maltese Premier League.

Florin Gardo\u0219.name: Florin Gardoș
Florin Gardo\u0219.intro: '''Florin Gardoș''' (; born 29 October 1988) is a RomaniansRomanian professional association footballfootballer who plays as Defender (association football)centre back for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton and the Romania national football teamRomania national team.

Kyle Lightbourne.name: Kyle Lightbourne
Kyle Lightbourne.intro: '''Kyle Lightbourne''' (born 29 September 1968) is a former BermudaBermudian association footballfootballer who played for Scarborough F.C.Scarborough, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.

James Sinclair.name: James Sinclair
James Sinclair.intro:
'''James Alexander Sinclair''' (born 22 October 1987 in Newcastle upon Tyne) is an English association footballfootballer who currently plays for Östersunds FK.
He played in the Premier League and the UEFA Cup for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Peter L\u00f8venkrands.name: Peter Løvenkrands
Peter L\u00f8venkrands.intro:
'''Peter Rosenkrands Løvenkrands''' (born 29 January 1980) is a former DenmarkDanish association footballfootballer who played mainly as a forward (association football)striker or as a left midfielder#Wingerwinger, and was known for his pace.
Løvenkrands began his career in Denmark, winning the 1999 Danish Cup with Akademisk Boldklub. He then moved to Scottish club Rangers F.C.Rangers where he played for six years, winning two Scottish Premier League championships and the 2002 Scottish Cup. He moved to play for German team FC Schalke 04Schalke 04, but eventually fell out of favour during his last season there, and transferred to Premier League side Newcastle United in the winter of 2008. After three-and-a-half seasons, he moved on to Football League ChampionshipChampionship (second-tier) club Birmingham City, who released him at the end of the 2013–14 season and he subsequently retired.
He won the 1998 Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the YearDanish Under-19 Player of the Year award. He played 21 times and scored a single goal for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, representing them at the 2002 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 tournaments.

Marco Gabbiadini.name: Marco Gabbiadini
Marco Gabbiadini.intro: '''Marco Gabbiadini''' (born 20 January 1968) is an English former association footballfootballer whose career lasted 18 years from 1985 to 2003. He totalled nearly £3 million in transfer fees and played for 12 different clubs, scoring a total of 226 league goals.

Ainsley Maitland-Niles.name: Ainsley Maitland-Niles
Ainsley Maitland-Niles.intro: '''Ainsley Maitland-Niles''' (born 29 August 1997) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Wingerwinger for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Nicky Eaden.name: Nicky Eaden
Nicky Eaden.intro: '''Nicholas Jeremy "Nicky" Eaden''' (born 12 December 1972) is a retired English association football defender (football)defender who is currently working as a coach for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City under-21's. He played 550 matches in the Football League.

Mame Biram Diouf.name: Mame Biram Diouf
Mame Biram Diouf.intro:
'''Mame Biram Diouf''' (born 16 December 1987) is a Senegalese association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Senegal national football teamSenegal national team.
Diouf started his career at ASC DiarafDiaraf before moving to Molde FKMolde in 2007. In his first season with them he won the Norwegian First Division which gained promotion to the Norwegian Premier League.
