His performances and goalscoring attracted interest from a number of big clubs, he was eventually approached by Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and agreed a move there in 2009. The deal also included that he would remain at his then current club Molde on loan until January 2010, when he then joined up with his new club. He scored on his home debut for United and won the Football League CupLeague Cup as an unused substitute in United's 2010 Football League Cup Final victory. Diouf joined Hannover in January 2012 where he spent two-and-a-half-years scoring 35 goals in 71 appearances. In June 2014 Diouf joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on a free transfer.
Diouf made his Senegal debut in 2009 in a 2–1 friendly win over Congo DR national football teamCongo DR. He has so far won 18 caps and scored 3 goals for his country.

Ryan Giggs.name: Ryan Giggs
Ryan Giggs.intro:
'''Ryan Joseph Giggs''', Order of the British EmpireOBE (born '''Ryan Joseph Wilson''' on 29 November 1973) is a Welsh peopleWelsh association footballfootball coach and former player who is currently the assistant manager at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and co-owner of Salford City F.C.Salford City. Giggs made his first appearance for the club during the 1990–91 in English football1990–91 season and was a regular player from the 1991–92 in English football1991–92 season. He established himself as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger during the 1990s, and continued in this position well into the 2000s, though he was increasingly used in a deeper playmakerplaymaking role in his later years. Giggs was known for his tireless running, ball possession and ability to create goalscoring opportunities for those around him. At the end of the 2013–14 Manchester United F.C. season2013–14 season, Giggs was named as Manchester United's interim player-manager of Manchester United following the sacking of David Moyes, before being named as assistant manager under Moyes' permanent replacement, Louis van Gaal, on 19 May. Giggs announced his retirement from playing that same day in an open letter on the Manchester United website.
Giggs is the most decorated player in Welsh and English football history. He also holds the club record for competitive appearances. During his time at United, he won 13 Premier League winner's medals, four FA Cup winner's medals, three Football League CupLeague Cup winner's medals and two UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League winner's medals. He has two runner-up medals from the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, three FA Cup finals and two League Cup finals, as well as being part of the team five times when it finished second in the Premier League. Giggs Captain (association football)captained the team on numerous occasions, particularly in the 2007–08 season when regular captain Gary Neville was ruled out with various injuries.
Giggs has a number of personal achievements. He was the first player in history to win two consecutive PFA Young Player of the Year awards (1992 and 1993), though he did not win the PFA Players' Player of the YearPFA Player of the Year award until 2009. Until the end of the 2012−13 season, he was the only player to have played and scored in every season of the Premier League, but he failed to score in his final season and has now retired. Prior to his retirement, he was the last remaining player in the Premier League who had played in the old Football League First DivisionFirst Division. He was elected into the Professional Footballers' AssociationPFA Team of the Century in 2007,  the Premier League 10 Seasons Awards#Teams of the DecadePremier League Team of the Decade in 2003, as well as the FA Cup Team of the Century. Giggs holds the record for the most Assist (football)assists in Premier League history, with 271.[
At international level, Giggs played for the Wales national football teamWelsh national team prior to his retirement from international football on 2 June 2007, and was once the youngest player to ever represent his country. Giggs was named one of the three overaged players for the Great Britain Olympic football teamGreat Britain team to compete at Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Summer Olympics, and was subsequently named as the team's captain.
In addition to the many honours Giggs has received within football, he was appointed an Order of the British EmpireOBE in the Queen's 2007 Birthday Honours List for his services to English football. He was named as BBC Sports Personality of the Year in 2009. On 31 January 2011, Giggs was named Manchester United's greatest ever player by a worldwide poll conducted by United's official magazine and website. On 10 October 2011, Giggs was honoured with the 2011 Golden Foot.

Brad Guzan.name: Brad Guzan
Brad Guzan.intro: '''Bradley Edwin "Brad" Guzan'''  (born September 9, 1984) is an American Association footballsoccer player who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.

Brian McGovern.name: Brian McGovern
Brian McGovern.intro:
'''Brian McGovern''' (born 28 April 1980 in Dublin) is a retired Republic of IrelandIrish football (soccer)footballer.
The former Irish U18 and U21 player had joined Arsenal as a trainee in summer 1997. He made a single appearance for Arsenal, as a substitute (soccer)substitute against Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United on May 14, 2000, in which a youthful Arsenal side lost 4-2. While with the Gunners, McGovern also had a short loan spell with Queens Park Rangers F.C.QPR. Norwich City F.C.Norwich City manager Bryan Hamilton signed McGovern for a fee of £50,000 in August 2000.
McGovern was unable to establish himself in the first team at Carrow Road, scoring once against Tranmere Rovers, and was released in October 2002. He joined Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United but after failing to establish himself there also, and returned to Ireland when a move to Inverness Caledonian Thistle fell through. Briefly with St Patricks Athletic before going to Longford Town, where again a move to Calley fell through in autumn 2004.
Signed by the seasiders from Shamrock Rovers, who had signed him on loan from Longford Town, where he had failed to command a place.
Brian McGovern departed from Bray Wanderers in December 2006 having made a total of 40 appearances.
He made his Rovers debut on 25 March 2005.

Andr\u00e9 Bikey.name: André Bikey
Andr\u00e9 Bikey.intro: '''André Stéphane Bikey-Amougou''' (born 8 January 1985) is a Cameroonian Association footballfootballer, who plays for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He can play in the centre of defence or at right back. He began his career in Spain at the age of fifteen, before having short spells in Russia with FC Shinnik YaroslavlShinnik Yaroslavl and Lokomotiv Moscow. In 2006, he moved to England, where he joined Reading F.C.Reading on loan after impressing their manager while on trial. After three seasons at Reading, he signed a three-year deal with Burnley F.C.Burnley. He is generally known by his first surname '''Bikey''' except between 2011 and 2012 while playing for Burnley, when he decided to officially use his second surname '''Amougou'''.

Gordon Strachan.name: Gordon Strachan
Gordon Strachan.intro:
'''Gordon David Strachan'''  Order of the British EmpireOBE (born 9 February 1957) is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootball coach (sport)manager and former player. Strachan is the manager of the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.
Strachan played for Dundee F.C.Dundee, Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, as well as the Scotland national football teamScotland national team. He has managed Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Celtic F.C.Celtic and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. In club football, he played 635 league games, scoring a total of 138 goals, playing 21 of 25 career seasons in either the English or Scottish top-flight. In international football Strachan earned 50 caps, scoring five goals and playing in two FIFA World Cup final tournaments, 1982 FIFA World CupSpain 82 and 1986 FIFA World CupMexico 86. Strachan retired from playing in 1997 at age 40, setting a Premier League record for an outfield player.
A right-sided midfielder, Strachan made his senior debut in 1974 with Dundee before moving on within Scotland, to spend seven seasons at Aberdeen. He first played for the Scotland national team in 1980. While at Aberdeen Strachan won multiple domestic league and cup honours in the early 1980s, as well as the 1982–83 European Cup Winners' Cup and 1983 European Super Cup. Moving to England, Strachan won the 1985 FA Cup Final in five seasons with Manchester United, before spending the next seven seasons as club captain at Leeds, winning the 1989–90 Second Division and 1991–92 First Division league titles. He played his last game for Scotland in 1992 while still at Leeds, and then moved to Coventry in 1995 for a final three seasons, as a player-coach.
Strachan became full-time manager of Coventry when the incumbent Ron Atkinson was appointed as Director of Football. After five years in the job he was sacked in 2001, when Coventry were relegated from the top-flight for the first time in 34 years. However, he immediately returned to the Premier League with Southampton and guided the "Saints" to the 2003 FA Cup Final – where they lost 1–0 to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. Strachan resigned from Southampton in 2004 and took a 16-month break from management before returning to Scotland to become manager of Celtic in the Scottish Premier League. With Celtic he achieved three successive league titles and other domestic cup wins, before resigning in May 2009 after failing to win a fourth title. Five months later he became manager of Middlesbrough in the English Football League ChampionshipChampionship, but left the club after an unsuccessful 12 months in the job.
Strachan was named as FWA Footballer of the Year for the 1990–91 in English football1990–91 season while at Leeds. He was also named Manager of the Year in Scotland multiple times by writers and players while at Celtic. In 2007, Strachan was inducted into the Scottish Football Hall of Fame. He is the father of Craig Strachan (footballer)Craig Strachan and Gavin Strachan, also footballers.

Kevin Gallen.name: Kevin Gallen
Kevin Gallen.intro:
'''Kevin Andrew Gallen''' (born 21 September 1975 in Chiswick) is a retired English professional association footballfootballer who last played for Aylesbury United F.C.Aylesbury United.
A former England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 striker, Gallen signed a professional contract for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers on his 17th birthday after setting phenomenal scoring records whilst in the youth team, breaking Jimmy Greaves' long-standing record at that level.cite web
url=
title=Holloway praises Gallen
publisher=BBC Sport
date=18 September 2002 accessdate=14 November 2009

Yoann Folly.name: Yoann Folly
Yoann Folly.intro: '''Yoann Folly''' (born 6 June 1985 in Paris, France) is a retired French-born Togolese Association footballfootballer. His previous clubs include AS Saint-ÉtienneSt. Étienne in France, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in England and Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen in Scotland. A series of poor health and injuries eventually lead to Folly's premature retirement in 2012, aged 27.

Bruno Perone.name: Bruno Perone
Bruno Perone.intro: '''Bruno Caldini Perone''' (born 6 July 1987), or simply '''Bruno Perone''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays as a centre back or defensive midfielder for Associação Desportiva Recreativa e Cultural IcasaIcasa.

Steve Nicol.name: Steve Nicol
Steve Nicol.intro:
'''Stephen "Steve" Nicol''' (born 11 December 1961 in Troon, North Ayrshire, Scotland is a Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer. A schoolboy at Marr College, Troon he developed into a utility player who played in the successful Liverpool F.C.Liverpool team of the 1980s. He was also a regular member of the Scotland national football team, and represented his country at the 1986 FIFA World Cup.
As a player, Nicol won five Football League First Division titles, three FA Cup winners medals, and the 1984 European Cup during 14 years with Liverpool. Nicol also played with several other English teams, including Notts County F.C.Notts County, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, before emigrating to the United States in 1999. He was most recently coach of New England Revolution, and was the longest-tenured head coach in Major League SoccerMLS to coach a single club.

Stuart Slater.name: Stuart Slater
Stuart Slater.intro:
'''Stuart Ian Slater''' (born 27 March 1969 in Sudbury, Suffolk) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (sport)#Football (soccer)winger and Strikerforward from 1986 to 2009.
He notably played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Celtic F.C.Celtic, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Watford F.C.Watford, as well as representing England at under-21 and B level. Later on in his career he played for Carlton S.C.Carlton, Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers, Aberystwyth Town F.C.Aberystwyth Town, Weston-super-Mare A.F.C.Weston-super-Mare and Wivenhoe Town F.C.Wivenhoe Town.

Chris Coyne.name: Chris Coyne
Chris Coyne.intro: '''Christopher "Chris" Coyne''' (born 20 December 1978) is an Australian former Association footballfootball (soccer) player and coach of the Bayswater City SC.

Steve Mautone.name: Steve Mautone
Steve Mautone.intro:
'''Steve Mautone''' (born 10 August 1970) is an Australian football (soccer) coach with Melbourne Victory in the A-League. Mautone was initially recruited by Melbourne Victory to assume responsibility for training their goalkeepers Michael Theoklitos and Eugene Galekovic. He has been responsible for training and developing former Melbourne Victory goalkeepers Michael Petkovic, Sebastian Mattei, Michael Theoklitos, Eugene Galekovic, Glen Moss and Mitch Langerak whilst they were respectively playing at the Victory.
In 2008–09 and 2009-10 season, Mautone was assistant coach with Melbourne Victory's National Youth League team, working alongside Mehmet Durakovic. Mautone has recently relinquished this position to concentrate on the Victory's senior goalkeepers and to develop his own goalkeeping academy, 1st Choice Keeper.

Anthony Ormerod.name: Anthony Ormerod
Anthony Ormerod.intro: '''Anthony Ormerod''' (born 31 March 1979 in Middlesbrough) is an EnglandEnglish football midfielder who is currently playing for Marske United F.C.Marske United[

Nicky Weaver.name: Nicky Weaver
Nicky Weaver.intro:
'''Nicholas James "Nicky" Weaver''' (born 2 March 1979) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is currently a Free Agent after he was released by Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen. He recently returned to Sheffield Wednesday to be their Academy Goalkeeping Coach.
Weaver is a former England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 international and began his career with Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town in 1995. He joined Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1997 and would go on to be a part of the club that earned promotion from the League OneSecond Division in 1999 in which he saved the decisive penalty in the play-off final shootout with Gillingham F.C.Gillingham at Wembley Stadium. He would go on to earn promotion to the Premier League the following season and in total was promoted three times with City in a ten year spell. By the time he left the club in 2007 he had been the clubs second choice keeper for a number of years and had acted as understudy to the likes of Peter Schmeichel, David Seaman and David James (footballer)David James. He went on to appear for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen.

Alexander B\u00fcttner.name: Alexander Büttner
Alexander B\u00fcttner.intro: '''Alexander Büttner''' (; born 11 February 1989) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)left-back for Russian club FC Dynamo MoscowDynamo Moscow. He is also capable of playing as a left midfielder. Born in Doetinchem, he began his career with local club VV Doetinchem, but spent his formative years with Jong AjaxAjax before joining Vitesse in 2005 at the age of 16. He made his professional debut for Vitesse in 2008 and spent four years there before signing for Manchester United in 2012.
Alexander B\u00fcttner.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Gary Rowett.name: Gary Rowett
Gary Rowett.intro:
'''Gary Rowett''' (born 6 March 1974) is an English association footballfootball manager and former player. He was appointed manager of Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in October 2014.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender, and played in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He also played in the Football League for Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion. In May 2009 he was appointed assistant manager to Paul Peschisolido at Burton, and took over as manager in 2012.

Chris Baird.name: Chris Baird
Chris Baird.intro: '''Christopher Patrick''' "'''Chris'''" '''Baird''' (born 25 February 1982) is a Northern Irish association footballfootballer who plays for Barclays Premier LeaguePremier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and the Northern Ireland national football team. He has previously played for Southampton F.C.Southampton and Fulham F.C.Fulham.

N\u00e9lson Oliveira.name: Nélson Oliveira
N\u00e9lson Oliveira.intro:
'''Nélson Miguel Castro Oliveira''', Order of Prince HenryCavIH (born 8 August 1991), is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Welsh club Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in the Premier League, on loan from S.L. BenficaBenfica, as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
He began his career at Benfica, spending most of his tenure out on loan at various clubs in Portugal, Spain, France and Wales.
Oliveira earned 70 caps for Portugal across all youth levels combined. He made his debut for Portugal national football teamthe senior side in 2012, and later that year was part of the Portuguese squad which reached the semi-finals of UEFA Euro 2012.

Albert Riera.name: Albert Riera
Albert Riera.intro:
'''Albert Riera Ortega''' (born 15 April 1982) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for RCD Mallorca mainly as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger but also as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
He made a name for himself at RCD EspanyolEspanyol (where he won one Copa del Rey and reached one 2007 UEFA Cup FinalUEFA Cup final) and also played professionally in France, England, Greece, Turkey and Italy, notably spending three years with Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray.
Riera gained 16 Cap (sport)caps for Spain national football teamSpain, representing the nation at the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup2009 Confederations Cup.

Charlie MacDonald.name: Charlie MacDonald
Charlie MacDonald.intro: '''Charles Lea "Charlie" MacDonald''' (born 13 February 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a striker for Barnet F.C.Barnet.

Lee Philpott.name: Lee Philpott
Lee Philpott.intro:
'''Lee Philpott''' (born 21 February 1970 in Chipping BarnetBarnet) is an EnglandEnglish Professional Footballer's Agent licenced by the Football Association and a former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder and midfielderleft winger from 1986 to 2008.
He notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, he also played in the Football League with Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, before finishing his career in Non-league football with Weymouth F.C.Weymouth, Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town and Hinckley United F.C.Hinckley United. During his career he made almost 500 league and cup appearances.

Nabil El Zhar.name: Nabil El Zhar
Nabil El Zhar.intro:
'''Nabil El Zhar''' (; born 27 August 1986) is a Moroccan association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Levante UD as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger.
He has been a full international for Morocco national football teamMorocco since 2008.

John Williams (footballer, born 1968).name: John Williams (footballer, born 1968)
John Williams (footballer, born 1968).intro:
'''John Nelson Williams''' (born 11 May 1968 in Birmingham, England) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)forward from 1990 until 2009.
He notably played in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He played in the Football League for Swansea City F.C.Swansea City, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, York City F.C.York City and Darlington F.C.Darlington, as well as in Non-league for Cradley Town F.C.Cradley Town, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, Bath City F.C.Bath City, Redditch United F.C.Redditch United, Evesham United F.C.Evesham United, Weston-super-Mare F.C.Weston-super-Mare, Stourbridge F.C.Stourbridge, Willenhall Town F.C.Willenhall Town and Boldmere St. Michaels F.C.Boldmere St. Michaels.

Chris Brunt.name: Chris Brunt
Chris Brunt.intro: '''Christopher "Chris" Brunt''' (born 14 December 1984) is a Northern Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for and captains English club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He plays as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger and more recently an attacking midfield position.

Brian Priske.name: Brian Priske
Brian Priske.intro:
'''Brian Priske Pedersen''' (born 14 May 1977) is a DenmarkDanish retired association footballfootball player. He is currently the assistant manager of FC Midtjylland.
He played 24 matches for the Denmark national football team from 2003 to 2007, and represented Denmark at the 2004 European Football Championship2004 European Championship (Euro 2004) tournament.

James Milner.name: James Milner
James Milner.intro:
'''James Philip Milner''' (born 4 January 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the England national football teamEngland national team. He previously played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He is mainly a winger but in the 2009–10 season he was utilised in a more central position by Aston Villa.
Milner's talent in football, cricket, and long-distance running was recognised at a very young age. He represented his school in these sports and played football for amateur teams from Rawdon, West YorkshireRawdon and Horsforth. He supported Leeds United from a young age and was a season ticket holder at the club. In 1996, he joined the Leeds United youth academy. He made his debut for the first team in 2002, aged only 16, and gained prominence as the youngest player to score in the Premier League.
While at Leeds United, he spent time on loan at Swindon Town to gain experience as a first-team player. Following his move to Newcastle United, he was loaned to Aston Villa for a season. He went on to establish himself as a regular starter in the Newcastle, and later Aston Villa and Manchester City first teams. He made more than 100 appearances for Newcastle, as well as making a record number of appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team. He made his debut for the full team against the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands in August 2009 and also played at the 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012.

Alex Mathie.name: Alex Mathie
Alex Mathie.intro:
'''Alexander''' "'''Alex'''" '''Mathie''' (born 20 December 1968) is a Scottish former Association footballfootballer and manager, who made over 200 appearances as a Forward (association football)striker in a career that lasted from 1987 until 2007.
He notably played for English Premier League clubs Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, and in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic and Dundee United F.C.Dundee United. During his career he also played for Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton and Preston North End F.C.Preston North End before finishing his professional career with York City F.C.York City. He became player-manager of Spennymoor United F.C.Spennymoor United in 2003 but this job lasted only a few months, before he briefly returned to playing with non-league Pickering Town F.C.Pickering Town and then took over as player-manager of West Auckland Town F.C.West Auckland Town. In 2004 he took the vacant managerial position at former club Pickering, and remained in this position until 2007.

Shane Duffy.name: Shane Duffy
Shane Duffy.intro: '''Shane Patrick Michael Duffy''' (born 1 January 1992) is an Irish association footballfootballer who plays for English club Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He has chosen to represent Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at senior international level.

Glenn Whelan.name: Glenn Whelan
Glenn Whelan.intro:
'''Glenn David Whelan''' (born 13 January 1984) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team.
Whelan started his career at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City but only made one appearance which came in the UEFA Cup and after a loan spell at Bury F.C.Bury he moved on to play for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, with whom he won promotion to the Championship in May 2005. In January 2008 Whelan joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for a fee of £500,000 with whom he helped gain promotion to the Premier League. He took a while to establish himself in Tony Pulis' first team plans in the top flight but by 2009 he became a regular and went on to play in the 2011 FA Cup Final, but his old club Manchester City beat Stoke 1–0. Whelan continued to be a regular in the side under Pulis in 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 and 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 and kept his place under Mark Hughes in 2013–14 Stoke City F.C. season2013–14.

Ally Pickering.name: Ally Pickering
Ally Pickering.intro:
'''Albert Gary''' "'''Ally'''" '''Pickering''' (born 22 June 1967) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and manager (association football)manager. As a player he played as a defender (association football)defender from 1989 until 2003 notably in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
He has also played in the Football League for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield and Chester City F.C.Chester City.

Michael Harriman.name: Michael Harriman
Michael Harriman.intro: '''Michael Grant Harriman''' (born 23 October 1992) is an English born Republic of IrelandIrish Association footballfootballer playing as a defender for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, on loan from Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.

Scot Gemmill.name: Scot Gemmill
Scot Gemmill.intro: '''Scotland 'Scot' Gemmill''' (born 2 January 1971) is a former ScotlandScottish Football (soccer)footballer and a UEFA A Licensed Coach. He is currently the manager of the Scotland Under 17 Team. He played as a midfielder, most recently for the New Zealand Knights F.C.New Zealand Knights. He is the son of former Scottish international footballer Archie Gemmill, and was born in Paisley.

Laurent Charvet.name: Laurent Charvet
Laurent Charvet.intro:
'''Laurent Charvet''' (born 8 May 1973 in Béziers, Hérault) is a former French football (soccer)football player.
Charvet played in the right back position. He began his career at AS CannesCannes in 1994. Between then and 1997 he appeared 99 times for the club and scored 19 goals. In the 1997–98 in English football1997-1998 season he was loaned out to the English Premier League team Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for whom he appeared 11 times, scoring 2 goals in defeats to West Ham United F.C.West Hamcite news
url=
title=Chelsea are left to rue Gullit's legacy of squad rotation
publisher=The Independent
date=14 March 1998 accessdate=17 January 2010
location=London
first=Clive
last=White and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds.cite news
url=
title=Hasselbaink double keeps Leeds in frame
publisher=The Independent
date=8 April 1998 accessdate=17 January 2010
location=London
first=Phil
last=Shaw He was an unused substitute in Chelsea's UEFA Cup Winners' Cup 1998 Cup Winners' Cup Finalfinal win over VfB Stuttgart. Then in 1998 he was sold to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for £750,000. Between that time and the year 2000 he played 40 times for the team and scored 1 goal against Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.cite news
url=
title=Boro denied by deft Dabizas
publisher=The Independent
date=6 December 1998 accessdate=17 January 2010
location=London
first=John
last=Donoghue Whilst at Newcastle he played in the 1999 FA Cup Final.
He signed a four year contract with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City at the start of the 2000–01 in English football2000-2001 season following a £1m transfer from Newcastle, joining as a replacement for out of form Richard Edghill. However Charvet was unable to be the right back many City fans had hoped for and lost his place in the team. The following season, Kevin Keegan replaced Joe Royle as manager and Charvet was given his chance again. But in the 3-5-2 formation that Keegan adopted, Shaun Wright-Phillips was preferred to the Frenchman in the right Wingback (association football)wing-back position as was Edghill. Charvet played for City 23 times, scoring once. He left the club by mutual consent in October 2002 having made just three appearances for the club under Keegan.
Having trained with AS Monaco FCMonaco for a while after leaving City, Charvet joined French side FC Sochaux-MontbéliardSochaux in January 2003.
Having retired from professional football at the end of the 2002-03 season, Charvet joined French amateur side RC Grasse in 2008 at the age of 35.

Ross MacLaren.name: Ross MacLaren
Ross MacLaren.intro: '''Ross MacLaren''', sometimes erroneously spelled '''McLaren''', (born 14 April 1962 in Edinburgh) is a former football MidfielderDefensive Central Midfielder and coach.

Stephen Elliott.name: Stephen Elliott
Stephen Elliott.intro:
'''Stephen Elliott''' (born 6 January 1984 in Dublin) is an Republic of IrelandIrish international Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United. He has previously played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolves, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and had a loan spell at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
He has represented Republic of Ireland national football teamIreland as a youth from under 17 level up and as a full internationalist.

Ronnie Stam.name: Ronnie Stam
Ronnie Stam.intro: '''Ron Theodorus "Ronnie" Stam''' (born 18 June 1984) is a NetherlandsDutch association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for Standard Liège in the Belgian Pro League.

Mike Quigley.name: Mike Quigley
Mike Quigley.intro:
'''Mike Quigley''' (born 2 October 1970) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder.
Mike is currently the assistant manager of Chorley FC.

Andy van der Meyde.name: Andy van der Meyde
Andy van der Meyde.intro:
'''Andy van der Meijde''', anglicised to '''van der Meyde''' (; born 30 September 1979) is a retired Dutch Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
After making a name for himself at AFC AjaxAjax, he went on to represent Inter Milan and Everton F.C.Everton, his spell at the latter club being cut short due to several problems, both on and off the pitch.
A Netherlands national football teamDutch international in the early 2000s, Van der Meyde appeared for his country at UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004.

Anthony Gardner.name: Anthony Gardner
Anthony Gardner.intro:
'''Anthony Derek Gardner''' (born 19 September 1980) is an English peopleEngland England national football teaminternational association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender, who is a free agent after being released by Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. A tall centre-back, he has played once for England national football teamEngland and been bought and sold for millions in the domestic transfer market. However, his career has been dogged with injuries, limiting his appearances.
Starting his career with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1998, within two years he earned a million-pound move to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He spent eight years at the Premier League club, making 142 appearances over all competitions. In 2008 he spent time on loan at both Everton F.C.Everton and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, before signing permanently with the latter that Summer for £2.5 million. He spent the 2010–11 season on loan at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, before joining the club permanently the next season. He signed with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in June 2012, and stayed with the club for two years.
Anthony Gardner.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Lee Jones (footballer, born 1973).name: Lee Jones (footballer, born 1973)
Lee Jones (footballer, born 1973).intro:
'''Philip Lee Jones''', known as '''Lee Jones''' (born 29 May 1973[
Born in Wrexham, he began his career with his Wrexham A.F.C.hometown club. In March 1992 he moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, aged 18. However, he only managed four appearances in 5 years, in part due to suffering two broken legs. He was loaned out to Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe, twice back to Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, before transferring to Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers in 1996/97. He spent three years with Tranmere. In July 2000 he moved onto Barnsley F.C.Barnsley but in 2002 he returned to Wrexham for a fourth spell.
In the summer of 2004 he was released, subsequently joining League of Wales side Caernarfon Town F.C.Caernarfon Town. After a brief spell as joint-caretaker manager at Caernarfon (with Kenny Irons (footballer)Kenny Irons), he signed for the NEWI Cefn Druids in November 2006.
Jones has represented Wales national football teamWales at Youth, Under-21 and B level,  and he also won two caps for the senior side.

Adam Bolder.name: Adam Bolder
Adam Bolder.intro:
'''Adam Peter Bolder''' (born 25 October 1980) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Conference North side North Ferriby United A.F.C.North Ferriby United.
He has previously played for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Burton Albion and Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town.

Stephen Glass.name: Stephen Glass
Stephen Glass.intro:
'''Stephen Glass''' (born 23 May 1976) is a former Scottish professional association footballfootballer.
A midfielder, Glass started his career at Aberdeen, with whom he won the 1995 Scottish League Cup. In 1998 he moved to England, transferring to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United of the Premier League. Shortly after joining Newcastle, Glass made an appearance for Scotland national football team. He joined Watford F.C.Watford in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 2001, before returning to Scotland in 2003 with Hibernian F.C.Hibernian. He joined Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic in 2007 and was released at the end of the 2009–10 season. Glass played for American club Carolina RailHawks FCCarolina RailHawks, before joining Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers as assistant manager in January 2012.

Andreas Andersson.name: Andreas Andersson
Andreas Andersson.intro:
'''Andreas Claes Andersson''' (born 10 April 1974 in Nacka, Sweden) is a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer.  A striker, he was cap (football)capped by Sweden national football teamSweden forty-two times (including the 2002 FIFA World Cup), scoring eight goals.
Domestically, he won the 1996 AllsvenskanSwedish league title with IFK Göteborg, ending the seasons as the league's top scorer with nineteen goals. These performances earned him moves abroad to AC Milan and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United (for whom he played in the 1998 FA Cup Final).  These spells proved largely unsuccessful, resulting in Andersson's return to Sweden with AIK FotbollAIK.
Injury problems caused him to retire on August 1, 2005, with Andersson looking to remain in football as a coach. However, he resumed playing in 2010 with Swedish minnows FC Andrea Doria.

Lenny Pidgeley.name: Lenny Pidgeley
Lenny Pidgeley.intro: '''Leonard James "Lenny" Pidgeley''' (born 7 February 1984) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town on loan from Newport County F.C.Newport County. He is a former England youth international.

Papa Bouba Diop.name: Papa Bouba Diop
Papa Bouba Diop.intro:
'''Pape "Papa" Bouba Diop''' (born 28 January 1978) is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who is a free agent.
His preferred position is defensive midfield but can also play as a centre back, where he previously played at RC LensLens. His nickname is "''The Wardrobe''", given to him by Fulham fans, due to his height and large frame. Diop is well known for his strength and aggression, long-range shots, solid style of play and his leadership. His playing style and ability have drawn comparisons to Patrick Vieira.
Diop's second of a total of 11 international goals for Senegal national football teamSenegal launched his national team onto a global stage. The 1–0 defeat of then-world champions France national football teamFrance was the opening match of the 2002 FIFA World Cup, and Senegal's first ever match at the FIFA World Cup.

Glenn Pennyfather.name: Glenn Pennyfather
Glenn Pennyfather.intro:
'''Glenn Pennyfather''' (born 11 February 1963) is an English retired Association footballfootball defender (football)defender/midfielder (football)midfielder. He made a total of 315 appearances in the Football League for Southend United F.C.Southend United, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City before moving into non-league football with Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough and Canvey Island F.C.Canvey Island.
He is a former manager of Chelmsford City, becoming manager after being coach of the club, when he worked alongside long-time friend Jeff King (football)Jeff King after the pair had joined from a similar arrangement at Canvey Island F.C.Canvey Island.
He left the club on 7th May 2013, after a decision was made to not renew his contract. His departure followed Chelmsford's Conference South playoff semi-final defeat to Salisbury City F.C.Salisbury City just days before.

Alessandro Diamanti.name: Alessandro Diamanti
Alessandro Diamanti.intro:
'''Alessandro Diamanti''' (born 2 May 1983) is an ItaliansItalian professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for Serie A club ACF FiorentinaFiorentina on loan from Guangzhou Evergrande Taobao F.C.Guangzhou Evergrande and the Italy national football team. A creative and technical left-footed playmaker, Diamanti has also been deployed as a winger or as a supporting striker on occasion, and he is predominantly known for his vision, passing, control, and his ability on set-pieces and penalties.
He is nicknamed "Alino".
