Stuart Taylor (footballer, born 1980).name: Stuart Taylor (footballer, born 1980)
Stuart Taylor (footballer, born 1980).intro: '''Stuart James Taylor''' (born 28 November 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Leeds United F.C.Leeds United. He is a former England national under-21 football teamEngland Under 21 international.

Alan Kelly, Jr..name: Alan Kelly, Jr.
Alan Kelly, Jr..intro: '''Alan Kelly''' (born 11 August 1968) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, along with short loan spells at Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. Born in Preston, LancashirePreston, Kelly represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland internationally, winning 34 caps for his country. Both his father, Alan Kelly, Sr., who also represented Ireland, and older brother, Gary Kelly (footballer, born 1966)Gary Kelly, played as goalkeepers.

Andr\u00e9s D'Alessandro.name: Andrés D'Alessandro
Andr\u00e9s D'Alessandro.intro:
'''Andrés Nicolás D'Alessandro''' (born 15 April 1981) is an ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootballer who currently plays for SC InternacionalInternacional in Brazil as an attacking midfielder.
D'Alessandro has  played top-flight football in Argentina, Germany, England, Spain and Brazil. He won an Olympic Gold medal with Argentina national football teamArgentina in Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2004 and also played in that year's 2004 Copa AméricaCopa América.

Anthony Vanden Borre.name: Anthony Vanden Borre
Anthony Vanden Borre.intro: '''Anthony Henri Vanden Borre''' (born 24 October 1987) is a Belgian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as defender for R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht. He has been capped more than 25 times for the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team and is capable of playing as both a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back and a Midfielder#Wingerright winger.
Anthony Vanden Borre.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Joey Barton.name: Joey Barton
Joey Barton.intro:
'''Joseph Anthony "Joey" Barton''' (; born 2 September 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He was born and raised in Huyton, Merseyside. He began his football career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2002 after working his way through their youth system. His appearances in the senior side gradually increased over the following five years and he made more than 150 for the club. He earned his first Cap (sport)cap for the England national football teamEngland national team in February 2007, despite his criticism of some of the team's players. He then joined Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for a fee of £5.8 million in July 2007. After four years with the club, he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in August 2011, from where he was loaned to Olympique de MarseilleMarseille in 2012.
Barton's career and life have been marked by numerous controversial incidents and disciplinary problems and he has been convicted twice on charges of violence. On 20 May 2008 he was sentenced to six months' imprisonment for common assault and affray during an incident in Liverpool City Centre. Barton served 77 days of this prison term, being released on 28 July 2008. On 1 July 2008 he was also given a four months suspended sentence after admitting assault occasioning actual bodily harm on former teammate Ousmane Dabo during a training ground dispute on 1 May 2007.

Luke Shaw.name: Luke Shaw
Luke Shaw.intro:
'''Luke Paul Hoare Shaw''' (born 12 July 1995) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the England national football teamEngland national team.
Originally a member of Southampton F.C.Southampton's Southampton F.C. Academyyouth system, Shaw made his first-team debut for the club in January 2012, and signed his first professional contract in May that year before becoming a regular in the Southampton team over the next two seasons. In 2014, Shaw was signed by Manchester United for £30 million, a Transfer (association football)#Playersworld record transfer fee for a teenager, which was previously held by Wayne Rooney, when he transferred to Manchester United 10 years earlier.
On 5 March 2014, he made his senior international debut for the England team in a 1–0 friendly win against Denmark national football teamDenmark, and later that year was selected in the squad for the 2014 FIFA World CupFIFA World Cup.
Luke Shaw.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Bryan Hughes.name: Bryan Hughes
Bryan Hughes.intro:
'''Bryan Hughes''' (born 19 June 1976) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Northern Premier League Division One North club Scarborough Athletic F.C.Scarborough Athletic, where he is also the club's joint manager alongside Paul Foot.
He has previously played in the Premier League for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. He has also played in the Football League for Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion and Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley, in the Conference NationalConference for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, and for Icelandic club ÍBVÍBV Vestmannaeyjar.

Andy Todd (footballer, born 1974).name: Andy Todd (footballer, born 1974)
Andy Todd (footballer, born 1974).intro: '''Andrew John James "Andy" Todd''' (born 21 September 1974) is an English former Association footballfootball player and currently the assistant manager to Warren Feeney at NIFL Premiership club Linfield F.C.Linfield in Northern Ireland. His father is former Derby County F.C.Derby County and England national football teamEngland defender Colin Todd who was manager of Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough when Andy made his debut.  Todd attended Hermitage Comprehensive School (Chester le Street) and was in the same school team as Michael BarronMichael "Micky" Barron Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough & Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United

Milenko A\u010dimovi\u010d.name: Milenko Ačimovič
Milenko A\u010dimovi\u010d.intro: '''Milenko Aćimović''' (; born 15 February 1977 in Ljubljana) is a former Slovenian association footballfootballer who last played for Austria giants FK Austria WienAustria Wien. He was a playmaker who has a great passing range and an abundance of skill. On 15 September 2010, Ačimovič ended his football career following a persistent right knee injury.
Milenko A\u010dimovi\u010d.birth_place: Ljubljana,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Milenko A\u010dimovi\u010d.position: Midfielder Attacking midfielder Attacking Midfielder,Midfielder Winger Winger

Carl Veart.name: Carl Veart
Carl Veart.intro: '''Carl Veart''' (born 21 May 1970 in Whyalla, South AustraliaWhyalla, South Australia, Australia) is a former Australian Football (soccer)footballer.

Michael Kightly.name: Michael Kightly
Michael Kightly.intro:
'''Michael John Kightly''' (born 24 January 1986) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Burnley F.C.Burnley.
Kightly was rejected as a schoolboy by Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur but worked his way back to League football with Southend United F.C.Southend United. He again slipped into the non-League though, before being spotted by Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers while starring for Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic. He soon became a vital player for Wolves and was pivotal in their promotion to the Premier League in 2009. However injuries disrupted his time in the top flight before the club's relegation after three seasons. He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2012 for an undisclosed fee. Kightly spent the 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 season at Stoke before joining Burnley F.C.Burnley on loan in August 2013. After helping the Clarets gain promotion to the Premier League he made the move permanent in June 2014.

Facundo Ferreyra.name: Facundo Ferreyra
Facundo Ferreyra.intro: '''Facundo Ferreyra''' (born 14 March 1991), nicknamed "Chucky", is an Argentine professional association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United on loan from FC Shakhtar DonetskShakhtar Donetsk.

Charlie Adam.name: Charlie Adam
Charlie Adam.intro:
'''Charles Graham''' "'''Charlie'''" '''Adam''' (born 10 December 1985) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.
Adam was part of the Dundee F.C.Dundee youth set up between 1999 and 2003 before signing a youth contract with Alex McLeish's Rangers F.C.Rangers when he turned 17 and spent much of his early senior career on loan to other clubs. While on loan to St. Mirren F.C.St. Mirren during season 2005–06, Adam was part of the team that won both the Scottish Challenge Cup and Scottish Football League First DivisionFirst Division, playing in over thirty matches for the "Saints". Upon returning to Rangers at the end of the 2006 season, he became a regular under managers Paul Le Guen and Walter Smith. Adam was also part of the Rangers team that reached the 2008 UEFA Cup Final.
After falling out of favour at Rangers during season 2008–09, Adam was loaned out to English Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. The loan was made permanent at the start of the 2009–10 season, and Adam became an integral part of the Blackpool side, captaining the team to a 2009–10 in English footballplay off victory over Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City which resulted in their promotion to the Premier League. Adam shone in his first season in the English Premier League, his performances being recognised with a nomination for the PFA Players' Player of the Year in April 2011. However, Blackpool were relegated and consequently he transferred to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in July 2011. After one season at Anfield Adam joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2012 for a fee of £4 million.
He has played at Scotland national under-21 football teamunder-21, Scotland B national football teamB and Scotland national football teamfull international levels for Scotland.

Kevin Dearden.name: Kevin Dearden
Kevin Dearden.intro: '''Kevin Charles Dearden''' (born 8 March 1970 in Luton) is an English former professional Association footballfootball who made more than 400 appearances in the Football League, playing as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for a large number of clubs. He later became a coach.

Adie Moses.name: Adie Moses
Adie Moses.intro: '''Adrian Paul "Adie" Moses''' (born 4 May 1975) is an English former association footballfootballer. He made over 300 appearances in the Premier League and the Football League between 1993 and 2008, he notably played for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley having also featured for Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town and Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity. He also represented England at Under-21 level.

Nigel Martyn.name: Nigel Martyn
Nigel Martyn.intro:
'''Antony Nigel Martyn''' (born 11 August 1966), more commonly known as '''Nigel Martyn''', is a former English professional association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1987 until 2006.
Having started his career with Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers he moved to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace where he became the first £1million goalkeeper in British football and also won the Full Members Cup. Martyn then left to spend six seasons at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He went on to win 23 England national football teamEngland cap (sport)caps. An ankle injury forced him to retire in 2006, following three seasons at Everton F.C.Everton.

David Howells.name: David Howells
David Howells.intro: '''David Howells''' (born 15 December 1967) is a former English professional association footballfootballer, born in Guildford, Surrey, who played in the Football League as a midfielder for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, with whom he spent the majority of his career, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City.

Steven Pressley.name: Steven Pressley
Steven Pressley.intro:
'''Steven John Pressley''' (born 11 October 1973) is a Scottish association footballfootball player and manager (association football)manager. Pressley had a long playing career, playing for both halves of the Old Firm and making over 100 league appearances for both Dundee United F.C.Dundee United and Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts. Pressley captained the Hearts side that won the 2006 Scottish Cup Final, and made 32 appearances for Scotland national football teamScotland. As a player, Pressley was described as hard-working and exhibiting leadership.
After retiring as a player, Pressley was assistant manager of Falkirk F.C.Falkirk, before being appointed manager in February 2010. Pressley also served as an assistant manager to George Burley while Burley was manager of Scotland national football teamScotland. He moved to Football League OneLeague One side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in March 2013, but was dismissed in February 2015.
Steven Pressley.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jon Macken.name: Jon Macken
Jon Macken.intro:
'''Jonathan Paul "Jon" Macken''' (born 7 September 1977 in Blackley, Manchester) is an English-born Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Bamber Bridge.
He began his career with Premier League side Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 1995 but was released two years later after failing to make a first-team appearance. He joined Preston North End F.C.Preston North End for £250,000 and managed to notch up 63 goals in 189 league matches until his departure to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2002. Macken eventually made his first Premier League appearance for City. He only managed to score seven goals in 51 appearances during his three years with City but notably scored against United in the Manchester derby in 2004. He signed for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 2005 and whilst there moved to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town on loan. In 2007 he moved again to Derby County F.C.Derby County but was loaned out to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley after failing to make an impact at Pride Park where he failed to score in 11 league appearances. He joined Barnsley permanently in 2008 and moved again to Walsall F.C.Walsall two years later. He was released by The Saddlers at the end of the 2011–12 season and joined Northern Premier League side Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria, before joining Stockport County F.C.Stockport County briefly in 2013.
He has one international cap for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland which he earned in 2004 whilst a Manchester City player.

Marouane Fellaini.name: Marouane Fellaini
Marouane Fellaini.intro:
'''Marouane Fellaini-Bakkioui''' (; born 22 November 1987), known as '''Marouane Fellaini''', is a Belgian Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team.
Born in Etterbeek to Moroccan parents, Fellaini played youth football for R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht, R.A.E.C. Mons, R. Francs BorainsRoyal Francs Borains and R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi S.C. before joining Standard Liège. After winning the Belgian First Division and the Belgian Ebony ShoeEbony Shoe as a Liège player, he moved to England to join Everton F.C.Everton. At Everton, he was the club's Young Player of the Season for 2008–09, when the club were losing finalists in the FA Cup.
After five years at Everton, he transferred to Manchester United in a deal worth £27.5 million in September 2013.

Martin Taylor (footballer, born 1966).name: Martin Taylor (footballer, born 1966)
Martin Taylor (footballer, born 1966).intro: '''Martin Taylor''' (born 9 December 1966 in Tamworth, StaffordshireTamworth, England) former association footballfootballer. He was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Gary O'Neil.name: Gary O'Neil
Gary O'Neil.intro: '''Gary Paul O'Neil''' (born 18 May 1983) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. O'Neil has previously played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth where he was the Player of the Season in 2006, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Queens Park Rangers F.C.QPR.

Ryan Garry.name: Ryan Garry
Ryan Garry.intro: '''Ryan Felix Mayne Garry''' (born 29 September 1983) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender and could also operate as a midfielder for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth.

Lee Briscoe.name: Lee Briscoe
Lee Briscoe.intro: '''Lee Stephen Briscoe''' (born 30 September 1975) is an EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootball player, but is currently not signed to any Football League club.  He usually plays at left full-back but is able to play on the left hand side of midfield.

Jason Dodd.name: Jason Dodd
Jason Dodd.intro: '''Jason Robert Dodd''' (born 2 November 1970) is an English former association footballfootballer and manager, who spent most of his playing career with Southampton F.C.Southampton, where he was briefly First-Team Coach. He left the position as  Caretaker Manager of Football League Two side Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town on 4 November 2009 to return to former club Southampton as director of the youth academy.
Jason Dodd.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Uwe R\u00f6sler.name: Uwe Rösler
Uwe R\u00f6sler.intro:
'''Uwe Rösler''' (born 15 November 1968) is a German Association footballfootball Manager (association football)manager and former player. He has managed Lillestrøm SKLillestrøm, Viking FKViking, Molde FKMolde and Brentford F.C.Brentford but is currently without a club after being sacked by Football League Championship club Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.
A centre-forward in his playing career, Rösler played for several clubs, most notably Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, where he was the leading goalscorer for three consecutive seasons from 1994–95 to 1996–97, and 1. FC KaiserslauternKaiserslautern, where he played in the UEFA Champions League. He also played five times for East Germany national football teamEast Germany.
Uwe R\u00f6sler.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Paul McGee (footballer, born 1968).name: Paul McGee (footballer, born 1968)
Paul McGee (footballer, born 1968).intro:
'''Paul McGee''' (born 17 May 1968) is a retired Republic of IrelandIrish football (soccer)football midfielder (football)midfielder.
McGee scored twice as Emfa clinched the 1987 League of Ireland First Division Shield by virtue of a 4-2 win over Finn Harps at Oriel Park. It was the club's first season in senior football.
He was the PFAI Young Player of the Year for the 1987–88 season.
McGee scored the equaliser at Highbury on his debut for Wimbledon on his 21st birthday in May 1989,
McGee plays for the Republic of Ireland PFAI Over 40s team, and scored a goal in the International Social Soccer Veteran's Tournament in Dublin in May 2014

Rory Allen.name: Rory Allen
Rory Allen.intro: '''Rory Allen''' (born 17 October 1977) is an English ex-professional association footballfootball player.

Sagi Burton.name: Sagi Burton
Sagi Burton.intro:
'''Osagyefo Lenin Ernesto Burton-Godwin''' (born 25 November 1977), known commonly as '''Sagi Burton''', is an English-born former Saint Kitts and NevisKittitian international Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender. In a fourteen-year professional career in English football he made 344 appearances in league and cup competitions.
A former Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers trainee, he began his career with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1994. Failing to establish himself in the first team during his five years at the club, he joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United via Colchester United F.C.Colchester United in 1999. The following year he signed with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, where he first found regular football. In 2002 he transferred to Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United via Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra. Four years later he moved on to Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, before spending the 2007–08 campaign with Barnet F.C.Barnet. He retired from the game following a brief spell with Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds in 2008.

Carlos Bocanegra.name: Carlos Bocanegra
Carlos Bocanegra.intro: '''Carlos Manuel Bocanegra''' (born May 25, 1979) is a retired American professional association footballsoccer player. A two-time MLS Defender of the Year, Bocanegra also played professionally in England, Scotland, France, and Spain. He earned over 100 caps with the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States, serving as captain for six years. He currently is serving as technical director for the Atlanta MLS team that will join Major League Soccer in 2017.[

Dario Marcolin.name: Dario Marcolin
Dario Marcolin.intro: '''Dario Marcolin''' (born 28 October 1971 in Brescia) is an ItalyItalian association footballfootball coach and former player, currently in charge as head coach of Serie B club Calcio CataniaCatania.

Derek Allan.name: Derek Allan
Derek Allan.intro:
'''Derek Thomas Allan''' (born 24 December 1974) is a Scottish former Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender.
He is currently the coach of Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton's U17 side.

Don Hutchison.name: Don Hutchison
Don Hutchison.intro:
'''Donald "Don" Hutchison''' (born 9 May 1971) is an English-born ScotlandScottish sports television pundit, commentator and former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder and forward (association football)forward from 1989 to 2008.
He was a much travelled player and had spells in the Premier League with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Everton F.C.Everton and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, as well as in the Football League for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. He earned 26 full Cap (football)caps for the Scotland national football teamScottish national team and scored six international goals.

Kalifa Ciss\u00e9.name: Kalifa Cissé
Kalifa Ciss\u00e9.intro: '''Kalifa Cissé''' (born 9 January 1984) is a Malian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Bangkok United F.C.Bangkok United as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder or Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-half.
Kalifa Ciss\u00e9.position: Midfielder Defensive midfielder Defensive Midfielder,Defender  association football  Centre back Defender

Sam Shilton.name: Sam Shilton
Sam Shilton.intro: '''Sam Shilton''' (born 21 July 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Hinckley United F.C.Hinckley United. He previously played in the Football League, where he made over 140 appearances, and at Conference Premier level.

Scott Carson.name: Scott Carson
Scott Carson.intro:
'''Scott Paul Carson''' (born 3 September 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He joined the Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United football academy in 2002, making his full first team debut for Leeds against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in February 2004. He made his first appearance for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team in the same month and later set a record of 29 cap (sport)caps for the under-21 side.
In January 2005, he moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for a transfer fee of £750,000 and was called up for the England national football teamEngland senior team later that year. He made nine appearances for Liverpool, including the UEFA Champions League quarter-final victory over Juventus F.C.Juventus in April 2005, before going on loan (association football)loan to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in successive seasons to gain experience.
Following the 2007 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship2007 UEFA Under-21 Championship, Carson made his full debut for the England senior team against Austria national football teamAustria in November 2007. After his return to Liverpool from his loan spell at Aston Villa at the end of the 2007–08 season, he joined West Bromwich Albion for a £3.25 million fee in July 2008. In 2011 he moved to Bursaspor of Turkey. After two years in Turkey, he moved back to England with Wigan Athletic.

Colin Hill.name: Colin Hill
Colin Hill.intro: '''Colin Frederick Hill''' (born November 12, 1963 in Uxbridge, England) is a former Northern Irish professional Association footballfootball player most notable for his careers with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and Leicester City and as a Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international.
Colin Hill.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre Back

F\u00e1bio Rochemback.name: Fábio Rochemback
F\u00e1bio Rochemback.intro: '''Fábio Rochemback''' (born 10 December 1981) is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer. He is a versatile midfielder who can play in front of the defense, as an attacking midfielder, or even as a winger (sport)winger. He previously played for Sport Club Internacional, FC BarcelonaBarcelona and Sporting Clube de Portugal before joining Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in August 2005.

Albert Jarrett.name: Albert Jarrett
Albert Jarrett.intro: '''Albert Ojumiri Jarrett''' (born 23 October 1984 in Freetown, Sierra Leone) is a Sierra Leonean Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Dulwich Hamlet F.C.Dulwich Hamlet and has represented the Sierra Leone national football team.

Bruce Grobbelaar.name: Bruce Grobbelaar
Bruce Grobbelaar.intro:
'''Bruce David Grobbelaar''' (born 6 October 1957) is the current Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper coach for Ottawa Fury FC of the North American Soccer League. As a player, Grobbelaar represented Zimbabwe national football teamZimbabwe at international level and a number of clubs, most prominently the English team Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, during a professional career spanning more than 20 years. He is remembered for his gymnastic-like athletic ability, unflappable confidence and eccentric and flamboyant style of play.
Grobbelaar was born in South Africa, but raised in neighbouring Rhodesia (today Zimbabwe). After playing for several Rhodesian and South African clubs and serving in the Rhodesian Army, he joined the Vancouver Whitecaps (1974–84)Vancouver Whitecaps of the North American Soccer League (1968–84)North American Soccer League in 1979. He gained Liverpool's attention during a loan spell at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra during the 1979–80 season, and signed for the Merseyside club in 1981. Making 628 appearances for Liverpool over the next 13 years, including 440 in the League, he won the League championship with the club six times, as well as three FA Cups, three Football League CupLeague Cups and the 1983–84 European Cup1983–84 UEFA Champions LeagueEuropean Cup.
Grobbelaar left Liverpool for Southampton F.C.Southampton in 1994, transferred to Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle two years later, and thereafter played for an assortment of English lower-league teams, never for more than a few games. In the latter part of his club career Grobbalaar represented Zimbabwe notably under coach Reinhard Fabisch. He last played for Zimbabwe in 1998.

Frank McAvennie.name: Frank McAvennie
Frank McAvennie.intro: '''Francis "Frank" McAvennie''' (born 22 November 1959) is a Scottish former Forward (association football)football striker best known as a player with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Celtic F.C.Celtic, having had two spells with both of these clubs. With Celtic he won the Scottish Football League Premier Division in 1987–88 Scottish Premier Division1987-88 and the Scottish Cup also in 1988 Scottish Cup Final1988. He was capped five times at senior level for Scotland national football teamScotland during the 1980s, scoring one goal.

Andrea Silenzi.name: Andrea Silenzi
Andrea Silenzi.intro:
'''Andrea Silenzi''' (born 10 February 1966) is an Italian retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Centrecentre forward.
He was known for his goal-poaching ability, but at a highly inconsistent level. The scorer of 89 league goals during his career, Silenzi was also the first Italian to play in the Premier League, when he signed with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in 1995.
Over the course of six seasons Silenzi amassed Serie A totals of 132 games and 32 goals, with S.S.C. NapoliNapoli and Torino F.C.Torino.
Andrea Silenzi.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Andreas Weimann.name: Andreas Weimann
Andreas Weimann.intro: '''Andreas Weimann''' (; born 5 August 1991) is an Austrian Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier League and currently operates effectively as a winger (association football)winger. He has represented Austria national football teamAustria at full international level and also played for Watford F.C.Watford during two separate loan spells in 2011.

Brek Shea.name: Brek Shea
Brek Shea.intro:
'''Dane Brekken''' "'''Brek'''" '''Shea''' (born February 28, 1990) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Orlando City SCOrlando City, and the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.
Shea began his career with Major League Soccer team FC Dallas after playing in the IMG Academy. He made his debut during the 2008 season and helped Dallas reach the MLS Cup Playoffs in 2010 FC Dallas season2010 and 2011 FC Dallas season2011. In January 2013, Shea joined English Premier League side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for a fee of £2.5 million. Shea failed to make an impact at Stoke and after spending time on loan at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City he joined Orlando City SCOrlando City in December 2014.
Brek Shea.position: Midfielder Winger Left winger,Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Paul McShane.name: Paul McShane
Paul McShane.intro:
'''Paul David McShane''' (born 6 January 1986) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team.
McShane won the 2003 FA Youth Cup with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He had stints with Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland before his transfer to Hull City. He worked his way into the Republic of Ireland national team, making his debut in 2006. He was then called in from the international wilderness to the Irish squad for UEFA Euro 2012.

John Pemberton.name: John Pemberton
John Pemberton.intro:
'''John Pemberton''' (born 18 November 1964 in Oldham, Lancashire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and is currently Assistant coachassistant manager at Bristol City F.C.Bristol City. He has also coached at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, and was Academy Manager at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United.
As a player he made more than 300 appearances in the Football League and Premier League playing as a defender (association football)defender for Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He is also the former manager of Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest's reserve team, and spent a brief period as interim manager of the club's first team.

Danny Sonner.name: Danny Sonner
Danny Sonner.intro:
'''Daniel James''' "'''Danny'''" '''Sonner''' (born 9 January 1972) is an English-born former Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international Association footballfootballer. He won thirteen caps in a seven-year international career.
A much-travelled midfielder, despite 18 years of professional football he never spent more than two seasons at any one club. He played for numerous English clubs, predominantly at the Midlands (England)Midlands and also played in Germany. In the latter part of his career he was easily recognizable due to his iconic long hair. His more notable spells were with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale; as he played around fifty games for each club. In all he played 386 games in the Football League, as well as more than 42 games in German football. He played in all of the top four divisions of English football, with his greatest honour being a runners-up medal in the Football League CupLeague Cup in 2001 Football League Cup Final2001.

Youl Maw\u00e9n\u00e9.name: Youl Mawéné
Youl Maw\u00e9n\u00e9.intro: '''Youl Alidor Mawéné''' (born 16 July 1979) is a French former association footballfootballer who is currently employed as the fitness coach at Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town. Youl's younger brother, Samy-Oyame MaweneSamy, is a retired footballer.

Agust\u00edn Delgado.name: Agustín Delgado
Agust\u00edn Delgado.intro: '''Agustín Javier Delgado Chalá''' (born 23 December 1974 in Ambuquí, Imbabura ProvinceImbabura) is a retired Ecuadorian Association footballfootballer. Nicknamed ''Tín'', Delgado is the all-time top scorer for the Ecuador national football teamEcuadorian national team with 31 goals in 71 games. He played professional club football in Ecuador, Mexico and England.

Stefan Wessels.name: Stefan Wessels
Stefan Wessels.intro: '''Stefan Wessels''' (born 28 February 1979) is a retired GermanyGerman Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Michael Ricketts.name: Michael Ricketts
Michael Ricketts.intro:
'''Michael Barrington Ricketts''' (born 4 December 1978) is a former English association footballfootball player. He played as a striker and was cap (sport)capped once by England national football teamEngland, in a friendly against Netherlands national football teamthe Netherlands in 2002.cite weburl=
title= England Recorddate=work=England Football Onlineaccessdate=21 November 2012
G. & J. Rollin, ''Sky Sports Football Yearbook 2003–2004'', Headline Book Publishing, 2003, p. 836
Ricketts had a 14-year career which saw him play for Walsall F.C.Walsall, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers.

Carl Leaburn.name: Carl Leaburn
Carl Leaburn.intro: '''Carl Winston Leaburn''' (born 30 March 1969) is an English former Association footballfootball player who generally played as a Forward (association football)striker.

Juan Mata.name: Juan Mata
Juan Mata.intro:
'''Juan Manuel Mata García''', commonly known as '''Juan Mata''' (; born 28 April 1988), is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Spain national football teamSpain national team.
A graduate of La FabricaReal Madrid's youth academy, Mata played for Real Madrid Castilla in 2006–07, before joining Valencia CFValencia in 2007–08. He became an integral part of the club's midfield, making 174 appearances over the course of four seasons. In August 2011, Mata signed for English Premier League club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for a fee believed to be in the region of €28 million, and in his debut season was part of the team that won the 2011–12 UEFA Champions LeagueUEFA Champions League and the 2011–12 FA CupFA Cup. The following year, Chelsea won the 2012–13 UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Europa League, making Mata and team-mate Fernando Torres the first players to hold the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, UEFA Europa LeagueEuropa League, FIFA World CupWorld Cup, and the UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships simultaneously. After falling out of favour at Chelsea under José Mourinho, Mata was sold to Manchester United in January 2014 List of most expensive association football transfersfor a fee of £37.1 million.
Mata is a Spain national football teamSpanish international, having represented Spain at Spain national under-16 football teamunder-16, Spain national under-17 football teamunder-17, Spain national under-19 football teamunder-19, Spain national under-20 football teamunder-20, Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21, Spain national under-23 football teamOlympic, and Spain national football teamsenior levels. He played for the under-20 side in the 2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup. In June 2009, Mata was included for the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup, his first senior tournament. On 9 September 2009, Mata scored his first goal for the senior team, against Estonia national football teamEstonia, securing the nation a place in the 2010 World Cup in South Africa, and was part of Spain's 2010 FIFA World Cup-winning squad. In 2011, he went back to playing in the under-21 side, helping Spain win the 2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship in Denmark. He won the UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship#Under-21 Golden PlayerGolden Player award and was part of the Team of the Tournament.
Juan Mata.birth_place: Villafranca Montes de Oca|Ocón de Villafranca,Province of Burgos|Burgos,Spain

Darren Potter.name: Darren Potter

'''Darren Michael Potter''' (born 21 December 1984) is a Association footballfootballer who is currently signed to Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons.
He is a former Liverpool F.C.Liverpool schoolboy captain who hails from the Scotland Road area of the city[

Lee Young-pyo.name: Lee Young-pyo
Lee Young-pyo.intro:
'''Lee Young-pyo''' (; born 23 April 1977) is a retired South Korean Association footballfootballer. Lee was recognized for his speed and dribbling skills. His former manager Martin Jol once called him "the best left-back in Holland".
Prior to playing for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Borussia Dortmund, Lee started his professional career at Anyang LG Cheetahs in the Korean K League Classic and then spent two years with PSV Eindhoven of the Netherlands, earning high acclaim from PSV Coach Guus Hiddink, who had previously coached Lee and South Korea national football teamSouth Korea during the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup. Recognized as the best left-back in the Netherlands after the 2004–05 season, Tottenham signed him amidst heavy competition with several Serie A clubs. He transferred to Tottenham in August 2005. In 2006, personal trainer Levi Gale advised him to move to an Italian team.
In August 2006, AS Roma of Italy's Serie A tried to sign him, but he backed out at the last minute for "personal reasons." An Italian media report said religion played a part in his decision to reject the transfer offer. On 31 August 2006, Lee held a press conference in Korea and denied that religion was a factor in his decision.  He said that moving to AS Roma would have been great for him in terms of football alone but he decided against it for personal reasons that he would not reveal, despite being pressed for answers by 50 attending reporters.
On 19 November 2008, Lee became the seventh Korean player to earn 100 caps in a FIFA World CupWorld Cup qualifier against Saudi Arabia national football teamSaudi Arabia. During the 2011 AFC Asian Cup, Lee captained the national team twice after the substitutions of the regular Korean captain, Park Ji Sung.

Bo Hansen.name: Bo Hansen
Bo Hansen.intro: '''Bo Jannik Nyby Hansen''' (born June 16, 1972) is a DenmarkDanish former football (soccer) player in the striker position. He scored 52 goals in 143 games for Danish club Brøndby IF and 16 goals in 119 games for EnglandEnglish club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Hansen played one game for the Denmark national football team.

Damien Delaney.name: Damien Delaney
Damien Delaney.intro:
'''Damien Finbarr Delaney''' (born 20 July 1981) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
Delaney began his career at Cork City F.C.Cork City. He later played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers before moving to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in 2009. He became a free agent after leaving the club in August 2012. He then signed for Crystal Palace as he became a vital player in the centre of defence in their promotion season.
Damien Delaney.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Roger Johnson.name: Roger Johnson
Roger Johnson.intro:
'''Roger Johnson''' (born 28 April 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)central defender for Championship side Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic.
Johnson began his career with Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, where he spent six years as a professional. He then joined Welsh side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in 2006 for £275,000. He was part of the team that reached the 2008 FA Cup Final and was twice chosen as the club's Player of the Year in his three-year stint with the club.
He moved into the Premier League by signing for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2009 for £5 million, with whom he won the 2011 Football League Cup Final2011 League Cup. He departed Birmingham in 2011 after their relegation to join Midlands neighbours Wolverhampton Wanderers, with whom he suffered two further consecutive relegations, leading to his exclusion from first team involvement.

Fran\u00e7ois Grenet.name: François Grenet
Fran\u00e7ois Grenet.intro: '''François Grenet''' (born 8 March 1975 in Bordeaux) is a retired French football (soccer)football Defender (soccer)defender. He played most of his career for FC Girondins de Bordeaux, including the 1996 UEFA Cup Final.

Barry Ferguson.name: Barry Ferguson
Barry Ferguson.intro:
'''Barry Ferguson''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 2 February 1978) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who is the player/manager of Scottish League Two club Clyde F.C.Clyde.
Ferguson has previously played for Rangers F.C.Rangers (two spells), Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town. Towards the end of his playing spell with Blackpool, he was appointed caretaker manager of the club. Ferguson was appointed player/manager of Clyde F.C.Clyde in June 2014.
Ferguson made 45 appearances for the Scotland national football teamScotland national team. In 2009, following behavioural incidents while on Scotland duty, he was stripped of the captaincy of Rangers and told he would no longer be considered for international selection. Ferguson was made a Member of the Order of the British Empire on 17 June 2006.

He is currently Fitness Coach at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.

Eric Dier.name: Eric Dier
Eric Dier.intro:
'''Eric Jeremy Edgar Dier''' (born 15 January 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back or a Defender (association football)#Full Backright back.
Having moved to Portugal as a child, he began his career in the academy of Sporting CP, and broke into Sporting CP Bits B-team and eventually its first team following a loan to Everton F.C.Everton. In August 2014, he transferred to Tottenham for £4 million.
Despite interest from Portugal, Dier opted to represent England in international football, and has done so up to England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Ashley Barnes.name: Ashley Barnes
Ashley Barnes.intro: '''Ashley Luke Barnes''' (born 30 October 1989) is an Austrian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He previously played for Paulton Rovers F.C.Paulton Rovers, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Salisbury City F.C.Salisbury City, Eastbourne Borough F.C.Eastbourne Borough, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion. He has been Cap (sport)capped by Austria at international level, making one appearance for their Austria national under-21 football teamunder-20 team.

Shaun Derry.name: Shaun Derry
Shaun Derry.intro: '''Shaun Peter Derry''' (born 6 December 1977) is an English association footballfootballer who was most recently the manager at Notts County F.C.Notts County, having previously played for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers among other clubs. Derry is known for his hard-tackling and aggressive midfield style, and is primarily a defensive midfielder but can also play at right-back.

Steve Howey.name: Steve Howey
Steve Howey.intro: '''Stephen Norman "Steve" Howey''' (born 26 October 1971 in Sunderland, Tyne and Wear) is a former Association footballfootballer who played for the England national football teamEngland national team. At club level, he made more than 300 appearances in the Football League and the Premier League, playing for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United. He also played briefly for the New England Revolution of Major League Soccer.  His main playing position was as a Defender (association football)central defender.

Richard Johnson.name: Richard Johnson
Richard Johnson.intro: '''Richard Mark Johnson''' (born 27 April 1974) is an Australian former association footballfootballer who played for Watford F.C.Watford, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, Newcastle United Jets FCNewcastle United Jets, New Zealand Knights FCNew Zealand Knights and Wellington Phoenix FCWellington Phoenix.

Pavel Pogrebnyak.name: Pavel Pogrebnyak
Pavel Pogrebnyak.intro:
'''Pavel Viktorovich Pogrebnyak''' ( ; born 8 November 1983 in Moscow) is a Russian footballer who currently plays for English Football League Championship side Reading F.C.Reading and the Russia national football teamRussian national team.
Born in Moscow, Pogrebnyak began his career at FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow, making his professional debut in 2002. Over the next three years, he spent time away on loan at FC Baltika KaliningradBaltika Kaliningrad, FC KhimkiKhimki and FC Shinnik YaroslavlShinnik Yaroslavl before joining FC Tom TomskTom Tomsk in 2006. After a season with them, he moved to top Russian side FC Zenit St. PetersburgZenit St. Petersburg. There he spent three seasons and had his greatest spell of success, winning the Russian Football Premier LeagueRussian Premier League, the Russian Super Cup, the UEFA Europa League and the UEFA Super Cup. In 2009, he joined German side VfB Stuttgart. After two-and-a-half seasons, he moved to English Premier League side Fulham F.C.Fulham in January 2012, and his current club Reading six months later.
He is nicknamed ''The Pog'', ''Pogreb'' ("The Cellar") or ''Velikiy Po'' ("Po the Great"), the latter popularized by his former Zenit teammate Andrei Arshavin.  He is a "powerful player who holds the ball up well."
Pavel Pogrebnyak.birth_place: Moscow,Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Russian SFSR,Soviet Union

Jonathan Woodgate.name: Jonathan Woodgate
Jonathan Woodgate.intro:
'''Jonathan Simon Woodgate''' (born 22 January 1980) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.
Woodgate started his career at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United where he established himself in the starting eleven. However, Woodgate was sold to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for £9 million in January 2003. He impressed at Newcastle but he also suffered a number of injury problems. His performances in Europe for Newcastle led to Spanish giants Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid signing Woodgate for £13.4 million in August 2004. Injuries blighted his time in Madrid as he failed to make a single appearance during the entire 2004–05 season. He endured an awful debut for Real Madrid as he scored an own goal and was later sent off for two bookable offences.
He went on to play 14 times for ''Los Blancos'' before re-joining his hometown club Middlesbrough on Loan (sports)loan before joining the Teesside club permanently for a fee of £7million. He then joined Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur for £8 million in January 2008. He scored the winning goal for Spurs in the League Cup Final against Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and went on to play 44 times during the 2008–09 season. However after more injury problems he only made four appearances in the next two seasons and was released in June 2011. In July 2011 he signed on a pay-as-you-play deal with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. He spent the 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 season at Stoke and after his contract expired he re-signed for Middlesbrough.

Royston Drenthe.name: Royston Drenthe
Royston Drenthe.intro:
'''Royston Ricky Drenthe''' (born 8 April 1987) is a NetherlandsDutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Süper Lig side Kayseri Erciyesspor in Turkey. Although he primarily plays as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger, he can also operate as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back, speed being his main attribute.
He started his professional career with Eredivisie side Feyenoord in 2005, having graduated from the club's youth academy, and he made 37 appearances for the side, before switching to La Liga side Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid in 2007. During his five years in Madrid, he made 65 appearances for the club, spending time on loan at La Liga side Hércules CFHércules and English Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton, making 19 and 27 appearances for those clubs respectively. He joined Russian Premier League side FC Alania VladikavkazAlania Vladikavkaz in February 2013 on a free transfer, making six appearances in a brief spell at the club, before he joined Reading in June 2013. In January 2015, he joined current club Kayseri Erciyessor.
Drenthe made 17 appearances for the Netherlands national under-21 football teamNetherlands under-21s between 2006 and 2008, and was a member of the team that won the 2007 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship2007 European Championship. Since then, he has made one appearance for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands B team, and one appearance for the full national team.

Andy Carroll.name: Andy Carroll
Andy Carroll.intro:
'''Andrew Thomas "Andy" Carroll''' (born 6 January 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Forward (association football)striker.
Carroll started his professional career with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 2006, before spending a brief period on loan with Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, during which time he scored his first league goal. He established himself as a regular in the Newcastle first team by 2008, and following Newcastle's relegation from the Premier League to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship in 2009, scored 17 goals in 39 appearances to help Newcastle finish first in the league, earning immediate promotion back to the Premier League in the process. He continued to play for Newcastle in the Premier League, scoring 11 goals in 19 appearances.
Carroll signed for Liverpool on the last day of the transfer window on 31 January 2011 for a fee of £35 million, at the time the highest amount ever paid by one club to another for a British footballer.Lyon, Sam [

Luke Varney.intro: '''Luke Ivan Varney''' (born 28 September 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Ipswich Town F.CIpswich Town on loan from Blackburn Rovers F.CBlackburn Rovers. He started his career with non-League club Quorn F.C.Quorn, a club in his home county of Leicestershire, before moving to league football with Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra. His performances during Crewe's 2006–07 campaign, whe he was named in the Football League OneLeague One "Team of the Year" despite Crewe's finishing only mid-table and scoring against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in the Football League CupLeague Cup saw him come to the attentions of bigger clubs and consecutive £1m-plus transfers to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship followed, as he joined Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and then Derby County F.C.Derby County. He had made over 200 league appearances, and scored his 50th career league goal, and career first top-flight goal, in the Premier League, with a 76th minute strike against Fulham F.C.Fulham on his début for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Chris Powell.name: Chris Powell
Chris Powell.intro:
'''Christopher George Robin "Chris" Powell''' (born 8 September 1969) is a retired Association footballfootballer who is the current manager (association football)manager of Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town. He had a long club career as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back, during which he won five caps for the England national football teamEnglish national team. He was previously the manager of Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, where he had three spells as a player over eight seasons.
Powell served as chairman of the Professional Footballers' Association from November 2005 until he retired. He finished his playing career at Leicester City where he then became a first team coach. In October 2009 Powell was named as one of 50 ambassadors for England's 2018 World Cup bid. In April 2012, Charlton Athletic were promoted to the Championship as League One champions in Powell's first full season as a manager.

Matt Gilks.intro:
'''Matthew''' "'''Matt'''" '''Gilks''' (born 4 June 1982) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He has previously played for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and, on loan, for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town.
Although born in England, he qualifies to represent Scotland. He was first selected for the Scotland national football team in August 2010 and made his international debut in August 2012.

Ryan Shotton.name: Ryan Shotton
Ryan Shotton.intro:
'''Ryan Colin Shotton''' (born 30 October 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County.
Shotton progressed through the Stoke City F.C. Reserves and AcademyStoke City Academy and signed a professional contract in 2007. He went on loan to Altrincham F.C.Altrincham, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley respectively to gain first team experience. He broke into the Stoke squad towards the end of the 2010–11 Stoke City F.C. season2010–11 season. He played in the UEFA Europa League in 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 scoring twice against HNK Hajduk SplitHajduk Split and Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.Maccabi Tel Aviv. In September 2013 Shotton joined Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic on loan. He then joined Derby County F.C.Derby County on loan in August 2014 before completing a permanent move in January 2015.

He has also won 15 Cap (sport)caps for his country at Republic of Ireland national under-20 football teamunder–20 and Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamunder–21 levels.

Kevin Betsy.name: Kevin Betsy
Kevin Betsy.intro:
'''Kevin Eddie Lewis Betsy''' (born 20 March 1978) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder (association football)midfielder for Conference National side Woking F.C.Woking.
Betsy started his career with Woking F.C.Woking but went on to make a name for himself with Fulham F.C.Fulham where he became part of the squad that earned promotions in 1999 and 2002 that made the club a Premier League team. He made one appearance in the top tier of English football but became the first Seychelloise player to play in the Premier League. He then also spent time on loan with A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley before joining the latter on a permanent deal in 2002. Betsy made 94 league appearances, wrapping up 15 goals in a two year period with The Tykes before moving to Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United. His time with Pool was short and he moved on to Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and then Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. In 2007 he signed for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and whilst there spent loan spells with Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and Walsall F.C.Walsall. A year after signing for City he moved on again to Southend United F.C.Southend United before returning to Wycombe following a loan spell. In 2012 he re-signed for Woking.
Despite being born in England, Betsy qualified to represent the Seychelles national football teamSeychelles through his grandparents and earned his first cap in 2011.

Javier Manquillo.name: Javier Manquillo
Javier Manquillo.intro: '''Javier 'Javi' Manquillo Gaitán''' (born 5 May 1994) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, on loan from Atlético Madrid, as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
Javier Manquillo.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Michael Oakes.name: Michael Oakes
Michael Oakes.intro:
'''Michael Christian Oakes''' (born 30 October 1973 in Northwich) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1991 until 2008. He is currently working with Conference National side Wrexham F.C.Wrexham as a goalkeeping coach and Assistant Manager.
As a player Oakes notably played in the Premier League for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and in the Football League for Scarborough F.C.Scarborough, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Ronnie Ekelund.name: Ronnie Ekelund
Ronnie Ekelund.intro: '''Ronnie Michael Ekelund''' (born 21 August 1972 in Glostrup, Denmark) is a Danish football (soccer) player in the strikerforward position, who played professionally in both Europe and the United States. He won two List of Danish football championsDanish football championships with Brøndby IF and two MLS Cup trophies with San Jose Earthquakes, and represented a number of clubs, including FC Barcelona and several teams in Football in EnglandEnglish football. Ekelund played 21 matches and scored three goals for the Denmark national under-21 football teamDanish under-21 national team and represented Denmark at the 1992 Summer Olympics football tournament. He was named 1988 Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the YearDanish ''under-17 Talent of the Year''.

Martin Laursen.name: Martin Laursen
Martin Laursen.intro:
'''Martin Laursen''' (born 26 July 1977) is a DenmarkDanish former Association footballfootballer who played in the Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back position. He played three seasons for Italian club AC Milan, with whom he won the 2003 UEFA Champions League and the 2004 Serie A championship. He also played for Italian clubs Hellas Verona F.C.Hellas Verona and Parma FC, and was the captain (association football)team captain of English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He was most recently the manager of BK Søllerød-Vedbæk.
Laursen was cap (sport)capped 53 times and scored two goals for the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team from 2000 to 2008, and he was named 2008 Danish Football Player of the Year. He represented Denmark at the UEFA Euro 20002000 European Championship, 2002 FIFA World Cup, and UEFA Euro 20042004 European Championship tournaments.

Djimi Traor\u00e9.name: Djimi Traoré
Djimi Traor\u00e9.intro: '''Djimi Traoré''' (born 1 March 1980) is a association footballfootballer. A Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back or Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back, he is also a member of the Mali national football teamMalian national team. At club level, he previously played for Stade LavalloisLaval, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool – with whom he won multiple honours including the 2005 UEFA Champions League Final2005 Champions League – RC LensLens, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Stade Rennais FCRennes, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, AS Monaco FCMonaco, Olympique de MarseilleMarseille and Seattle Sounders FC.

Grzegorz Rasiak.name: Grzegorz Rasiak
Grzegorz Rasiak.intro:
'''Grzegorz Rasiak''' () born 12 January 1979) is a Polish former professional association footballfootballer.
After starting his career in his native Poland, Rasiak moved to England with Derby County F.C.Derby County in 2004. He subsequently had a spell with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur before joining Southampton F.C.Southampton, as well as periods on loan to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Watford F.C.Watford, before joining Reading F.C.Reading in August 2009. He left Reading for the Cypriot club AEL Limassol in 2010, spending a season there before returning to Poland where he remained until his retirement in 2014.
From 2002 to 2007, he played for the Poland national football teamPoland national team, earning 37 caps, scoring 8 goals and playing at the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Michael Carrick.name: Michael Carrick
Michael Carrick.intro:
'''Michael Carrick''' (born 28 July 1981) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays and is the Captain (association football)#Clubvice-captain for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Carrick primarily plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder, but he has been used as an emergency centre-back under Alex Ferguson, David Moyes and Louis van Gaal. At the time of his move to Manchester United, distinctive features of his play included his inventive distribution of the ball along with his passing and crossing abilities.
Carrick began his career at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, joining the youth team in 1997 and winning the FA Youth Cup two years later. He was sent on loan twice during his debut season, to Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, before securing a place in the first team by the 2000–01 season. He experienced relegation in the 2002–03 season and was voted into the PFA First Division Team of the Year in the following campaign. He made more than 150 appearances for the Hammers, but in 2004, he moved to rival London club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur for a fee believed to be Pound sterling£3.5 million. He was ever-present during his Spurs career, scoring twice in 75 appearances, before moving to Manchester United in 2006 for £18 million.
From his debut onwards he was a regular in the Manchester United first team, making more than 50 appearances in his first season with them. He established himself as a key member of the team that won the Premier League in 2006–07 FA Premier League2006–07, their first title success in four years. The following season he was part of the side that won the 2008 UEFA Champions League Final2008 Champions League final, playing the full 120 minutes as they enjoyed a 6–5 penalty shootout win, with Carrick converting his spotkick, to help achieve the Double (association football)#European DoublesEuropean Double. He enjoyed a third consecutive title triumph in the 2008–09 campaign, but couldn't prevent a 2009 UEFA Champions League FinalChampions League final defeat to FC Barcelona. He won his first League Cup medal in 2009 Football League Cup Final2009, however, for the first time during his Manchester United career, he missed out on another title success as they finished runners-up to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
Carrick has represented England at England national under-18 football teamunder-18, England national under-21 football teamunder-21, England B national football teamB and England national football teamsenior levels. He made his England debut in 2001 and has since gained 31 caps but has yet to score an international goal. Carrick has often been overlooked during his England career, with Steven Gerrard, Frank Lampard, Gareth Barry and for a brief time Scott Parker preferred in his position. This was the case until the 2012-13 season, when Carrick established himself as a regular. He has been a member of the England squads for two major tournaments, the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cups.

Roy Wegerle.name: Roy Wegerle
Roy Wegerle.intro:
'''Roy Wegerle''' (born March 19, 1964 in Pretoria) is a South African-born United StatesAmerican former professional association footballsoccer player and current professional golfer.
As a player he was a Striker (association football)striker from 1984 until 1998. He notably played in the Premier League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, as well as also playing in the The Football LeagueFootball League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. He made appearances in his native United States for Tampa Bay Rowdies (NASL)Tampa Bay Rowdies, Tacoma Stars (MISL)Tacoma Stars, Colorado Rapids, D.C. United and Tampa Bay Mutiny. He also played for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States in the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 and 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 FIFA World CupWorld Cups. He is one of two players who played in both the North American Soccer League (1968–1984)NASL and Major League SoccerMLS; the other is Hugo Sánchez.

Nathaniel Chalobah.name: Nathaniel Chalobah
Nathaniel Chalobah.intro: '''Nathaniel Nyakie Chalobah''' (born 12 December 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer. He can operate both as a midfielder or Defender (association football)defender and currently plays for Reading F.C.Reading on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.

Gary Breen.name: Gary Breen
Gary Breen.intro: '''Gary Patrick Breen''' (born 12 December 1973 in Hendon, London) is a former Association footballfootballer who made more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League. He played for numerous clubs over a 20-year career, including more than 100 appearances each for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He won 63 caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, and played in the 2002 FIFA World Cup, scoring in Ireland's 3–0 victory over Saudi Arabia national football teamSaudi Arabia.

Carlton Palmer.name: Carlton Palmer
Carlton Palmer.intro:
'''Carlton Lloyd Palmer''' (born 5 December 1965 in Rowley Regis) is a former professional Association footballfootballer, manager and football television pundit.
As a player he was a midfielder (soccer)midfielder from 1984 to 2005, playing in the Premier League for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He also played for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Watford F.C.Watford and Dublin City F.C.Dublin City. He was capped 18 times by England national football teamEngland, and went into management in 2001 when he was appointed player/manager of Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, later holding the same position at Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town from 2004 to 2005.

Manuel Almunia.name: Manuel Almunia
Manuel Almunia.intro:
'''Manuel Almunia Rivero''' (born 19 May 1977) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He competed mainly in the Spanish lower leagues in his early years, only appearing in 26 La Liga games over the course of two seasons with Recreativo de HuelvaRecreativo and Albacete BalompiéAlbacete, after starting out at CA OsasunaOsasuna.
Most of his professional career was spent with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, for which he signed in 2004, going on to play 175 official matches and 2005 FA Cup Finalwinning the 2005 FA Cup. He also had a short loan spell at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
In 2012, after his contract expired, Almunia joined Watford F.C.Watford and played there for two years, following which he retired.

Kevin Foley.name: Kevin Foley
Kevin Foley.intro:
'''Kevin Patrick Foley''' (born 1 November 1984) is an English-born Republic of Ireland national football teamIrish international Association footballfootballer who plays for the Danish Superliga side F.C. CopenhagenCopenhagen.
Foley, a right back also able to operate in midfield, previously spent twelve years at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town before joining Wolves in 2007 with whom he won promotion to the Premier League in 2009.
Kevin Foley.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Lee Howey.name: Lee Howey
Lee Howey.intro:
Starting out as a youngster at local club Bishop Auckland F.C.Bishop Auckland, Howey moved to hometown side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in March 1993, making his debut for the club on the final day of the 1992/93 season against Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth at Roker Park. The following two seasons saw Howey in and out of the squad, making 38 league and cup appearances during the two years, mostly from the substitutes bench. It wasn't until the arrival of manager Peter Reid that Howey began to see regular first team action, playing 30 times during the club's Championship winning season, including 18 starts. However, Sunderland struggled to cope with life in the F.A. Premier LeaguePremiership, and Howey was allowed to leave the club following the club's relegation back to Football League First Division on the final day of the season. Howey made just 12 appearances that season.
It was Burnley F.C.Burnley who splashed out £200,000 for the Wearsider. He scored on his debut against Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in the Football League CupLeague Cup.cite web
url=
title=Round 1 Fixtures & Results
publisher=Sky Sports
accessdate=19 April 2013 However this proved to be his only goal for the club, and Howey's career at the Lancashire club wasn't a success, and he eventually moved on to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton in February 1999 after a four-month loan period. Howey moved again two years later, completing a free transfer to Football ConferenceConference side Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers in 2001, before finishing his career at Nuneaton Borough F.C.Nuneaton Borough later in the season.
Although primarily a central defender, Howey played up front a number of times during his career, and is considered to be comfortable in either role.
Lee is famous now for the football chant regularly sung by Sunderland fans about his brother.

Roman Bedn\u00e1\u0159.name: Roman Bednář
Roman Bedn\u00e1\u0159.intro: '''Roman Bednář''' (born 26 March 1983) is a Czech RepublicCzech association footballfootballer who currently plays for Czech side AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague. Now he is on loan in 1. FK Příbram.

David Platt.name: David Platt
David Platt.intro:
'''David Andrew Platt''' (born 10 June 1966) is an EnglandEnglish former Association footballfootballer who played at both professional and international levels as a midfielder. Most recently he was Assistant Manager at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City until his resignation on 14 May 2013.
Born in Chadderton, Lancashire, Platt began his career as an apprentice at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United but later moved to Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra where he began building a reputation as a goal scoring midfield player. In 1988, aged 22, he signed for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and in 1989 he gained the attention of Sir Bobby Robson, the then England National Football TeamEngland manager and made his debut. At the 1990 FIFA World Cup, Platt increased his continental reputation by scoring goals with both head and feet, whilst displaying passing abilities and high work rates. His performances in Italy earned him a move to A.S. BariBari in 1991.
In 1992, Platt moved to Juventus F.C.Juventus, where he spent one season. Platt continued scoring goals for England, playing in Euro 92 and 96. Despite his efforts, England failed to qualify for the 1994 FIFA World Cup. In 1993, he moved to U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria where he stayed for two seasons before returning to England with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, taking the total amount of money spent on his transfer fees to £20 million.Edworthy 1997, p. 147. Platt played with the London club for three years and was part of the 1998 Arsenal team that won the Premier League and FA Cup Double (association football)Double; before his retirement in 1998.
Platt also served as manager of Sampdoria before leaving his post owing to poor results. Afterwards, he returned to England as player-manager of Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. Platt also managed the England Under-21 team.

Beb\u00e9.name: Bebé
Beb\u00e9.intro:
'''Tiago Manuel Dias Correia''' (born 12 July 1990), better known by his nickname '''Bebé''', is a Portuguese professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (association football)winger for Spanish club Córdoba CFCórdoba, on loan from S.L. BenficaBenfica. Abandoned by his parents at a young age, Bebé grew up in a homeless shelter near Lisbon. He began his football career as an amateur with Loures before joining C.F. Estrela da AmadoraEstrela in 2009. A year later, he was signed by Vitória S.C.Vitória de Guimarães but transferred almost immediately to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United for a fee of about £7 million, despite manager Alex Ferguson admitting he had never seen Bebé play.
Unable to make an impression on the Manchester United first team, he spent time on loan with Turkish side Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş and back in Portugal with Rio Ave F.C.Rio Ave and F.C. Paços de FerreiraPaços de Ferreira, before joining Benfica permanently in July 2014.

Willie Falconer.name: Willie Falconer
Willie Falconer.intro: '''William "Willie" Henry Falconer''' (born 5 April 1966 in Aberdeen) is a Scottish peopleScottish former professional association football player, who played for a string of Scottish and English clubs from 1982 to 2003. He could play in virtually any position on the pitch, but was most commonly used as a striker.

Xavier Gravelaine.name: Xavier Gravelaine
Xavier Gravelaine.intro:
'''Xavier Gravelaine''' (born October 5, 1968 in Tours) is a FranceFrench football (soccer)football manager and former football player, who played for many clubs in France and Europe and for France national football teamFrance national team.
He was sometimes seen as a mercenary because of the impressive number of teams he played for but often appreciated by supporters. In his spell in England, for Watford, he is remembered by the fans for scoring a brace in a 3-2 win over Southampton in December 1999.Cite web
url=
title=Watford 3 Southampton 2
publisher=Sporting Life
date=28 December 1999 accessdate=2 February 2010
After his retirement, he became a coach at FC Istres, but did not manage to save the team from the relegation. He is a consultant on France Televisions from 2004 to 2012, on Eurosport in 2013/2014. In 2014, he is appointed Deputy Director of SM Caen.

Luke Young (footballer, born 1979).name: Luke Young (footballer, born 1979)
Luke Young (footballer, born 1979).intro:
'''Luke Paul Young''' (born 19 July 1979) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender.
Young began his career at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 1997, before moving to Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic in 2001, where he spent six seasons. He then had stints at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa before moving to QPR in 2011. He has accumulated over 350 appearances in England's top flight.
Young has also represented the England national football teamEngland national team on seven occasions.
Luke Young (footballer, born 1979).position: Full back  association football  Full back

Mark Viduka.name: Mark Viduka
Mark Viduka.intro: '''Mark Anthony Viduka''' (;; born 9 October 1975) is an Australian retired association footballsoccer player who played as a centre forward. He Captain (association football)captained the Australia national soccer teamAustralian national team at the 2006 FIFA World Cup in Germany to the 2006_FIFA_World_Cup#Round_of_16last 16. He holds the record of most goals scored by an Australian in the prestigious UEFA Champions League competition with four.

Alan Smith (footballer, born 1962).name: Alan Smith (footballer, born 1962)
Alan Smith (footballer, born 1962).intro:
'''Alan Martin Smith''' (born 21 November 1962 in Hollywood, Worcestershire) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and current sports television pundit and the club patron of Alvechurch F.C.. As a player he was a Forward (association football)striker from 1981 until retiring from injury in 1995.
He played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City before joining Arsenal F.C.Arsenal where he played in the Premier League. He also won thirteen caps for England national football teamEngland.

Chris Casper.name: Chris Casper
Chris Casper.intro:
'''Christopher Martin "Chris" Casper''' (born 28 April 1975) is an English association footballfootball manager and former player who played in the Premier League for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and in the Football League for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Reading F.C.Reading. An injury forced him to retire from playing in 2000 at the age of 24.
