Casper then went into management and took charge of Team Bath F.C.Team Bath in 2002 before moving to Football League Two club Bury F.C.Bury for three years. At the time, he was the youngest manager in the top four tiers of the English football league system. However, a run of poor form in 2008 led to his departure from Bury. Casper then took backroom jobs at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, before joining the FA Premier League as a club support manager.

Darren Barnard.name: Darren Barnard
Darren Barnard.intro:
'''Darren Sean Barnard''' (born 30 November 1971) is a German-born WalesWelsh former professional association footballfootballer, manager and coach.
As a footballer he was a defender (association football)wing back and midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1989 until 2010, notably in the Premier League for both Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He also played in the Football League for Reading F.C.Reading, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town before a spell in the Conference National for Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town and finishing his career with Non-league Camberley Town F.C.Camberley Town. He was also capped 24 times for Wales national football teamWales
In 2007 whilst a player with Camberley Town, he also became the clubs technical director before becoming first team manager in 2010. He stepped down from his role following the end of the 2011–12 season. He has since worked as the Academy manager of Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town.
Darren Barnard.position: Defender  football  Wingback Left wing back

Eddie Lewis (American soccer).name: Eddie Lewis (American soccer)
Eddie Lewis (American soccer).intro:
'''Edward James "Eddie" Lewis''' (born May 17, 1974 in Cerritos, California) is a former United StatesAmerican Association footballsoccer player.
During his 14-year professional career he played extensively in both the United States and England, for San Jose Clash, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Derby County F.C.Derby County and Los Angeles Galaxy. He was also a veteran member of the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team throughout the late 1990s and early 2000s; he acquired 82 caps, scored 10 goals and represented his country at the 1999 Confederations Cup, 2002 FIFA World Cup, 2003 Confederations Cup, 2003 CONCACAF Gold Cup and 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Silas (Portuguese footballer).name: Silas (Portuguese footballer)
Silas (Portuguese footballer).intro:
'''Jorge Manuel Rebelo Fernandes''', commonly known as '''Silas''' (born 1 September 1976), is a Portuguese Association footballfootballer who plays for Atlético Clube de Portugal as a midfielder.
He amassed Primeira Liga totals of 236 games and 30 goals over the course of nine seasons, representing in the competition U.D. LeiriaUnião de Leiria, C.S. MarítimoMarítimo and C.F. Os BelenensesBelenenses. He also played professionally in three other countries, mainly Spain and Cyprus.

\u00c9douard Ciss\u00e9.name: Édouard Cissé
\u00c9douard Ciss\u00e9.intro: '''Édouard Cissé''' (born 30 March 1978) is a FranceFrench former football (soccer)football player of Senegalese descent whose last club was AJ Auxerre.

Mark Walters.name: Mark Walters
Mark Walters.intro:
'''Mark Everton Walters''' (born 2 June 1964) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1981 to 2002.
He notably played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Rangers F.C.Rangers and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, and later went on to play for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers. He was capped once by England national football teamEngland.

Jaros\u0142aw Fojut.name: Jarosław Fojut
Jaros\u0142aw Fojut.intro: '''Jarosław Fojut''' (born 17 October 1987) is a PolandPolish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)centre back for Scottish Premiership side Dundee United F.C.Dundee United. Fojut began his career in England, where he played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and also spent time on loan with Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. He subsequently returned to Poland with Śląsk Wrocław and also played for Tromsø IL in Norway prior to joining Dundee United in 2014. He has also competed at youth international level up to the Poland Olympic football teamPoland under-23 team.

Keith Gillespie.name: Keith Gillespie
Keith Gillespie.intro:
'''Keith Robert Gillespie''' (born 18 February 1975 in Larne, County Antrim) is a retired Northern IrelandNorthern Irish professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (football)winger.
He began his career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United after winning the FA Youth Cup in 1992, before moving to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, where he played in the UEFA Champions League. Gillespie also played in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Leicester City and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, helping the former win the Football League Cup in 2002. Towards the end of his career, he played for Glentoran F.C.Glentoran in the NIFL PremiershipIrish League and Longford Town F.C.Longford Town in the League of Ireland.
Gillespie earned 86 caps for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland between 1994 and 2008, putting him 6th in their most capped players of all time.

David Robertson (footballer, born 1968).name: David Robertson (footballer, born 1968)
David Robertson (footballer, born 1968).intro: '''David Robertson''' (born 17 October 1968 in Aberdeen, Scotland) is a retired Scottish association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full backleft back. Throughout his career, Robertson played for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Leeds United F.C.Leeds United and Montrose F.C.Montrose.
David Robertson (footballer, born 1968).position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Andy Williams (footballer, born October.name: Andy Williams (footballer, born October 1977)
Andy Williams (footballer, born October.intro: '''Andrew Phillip Rees''' "'''Andy'''" '''Williams''' (born 8 October 1977) is a former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a winger.

Fitz Hall.name: Fitz Hall
Fitz Hall.intro: '''Fitz Benjamin Hall''' (born 20 December 1980) is an English Association footballfootballer. He is now a striker who can also play as a Defender (association football)defender of midfielder.

Neil Tolson.name: Neil Tolson
Neil Tolson.intro: '''Neil Tolson''' (born 25 October 1973) is an English former association footballfootballer who is currently assistant manager to Lee Sinnott at Conference National side Altrincham F.C.Altrincham after being sacked as manager of Hyde F.C.Hyde in May 2011.

Mark Randall.name: Mark Randall
Mark Randall.intro: '''Mark Leonard Randall''' (born 28 September 1989 in Milton Keynes) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons. Randall spent his formative footballing years at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal where he was touted by manager Arsène Wenger as a key Arsenal player for the future.[

Luis Garc\u00eda (footballer, born 1978).name: Luis García (footballer, born 1978)
Luis Garc\u00eda (footballer, born 1978).intro:
'''Luis Javier García Sanz''' (born 24 June 1978), known as '''Luis García''', is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Indian club Atlético de Kolkata mainly as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
Although naturally left-footed, he has the ability to kick with both feet and has a good aerial game, despite a small frame. He played professionally for FC BarcelonaBarcelona and Atlético Madrid in his homeland, amongst others – being brought up in the former's youth ranks – appearing abroad for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, with which he 2005 UEFA Champions League Finalwon one UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League amongst other major titles.
Over the course of eight seasons, García amassed La Liga totals of 150 games and 22 goals. A Spain national football teamSpanish international for three years, he represented the nation at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup.

Jason Shackell.name: Jason Shackell
Jason Shackell.intro: '''Jason Philip Shackell''' (born 27 August 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Premier League club Burnley F.C.Burnley.

Ryan Bennett.name: Ryan Bennett
Ryan Bennett.intro:
'''Ryan Bennett''' (born 6 March 1990) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City as a defender (association football)centre back.
He was a youth product of Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town but was not offered a professional contract and thus signed for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town in 2006. He remained with Grimsby for a further four years in which he earnt international caps for England national under-18 football teamEngland U18 as well as becoming the club captain at a young age. In his final full season he scooped the board in the club's player of the season ceremony. Town cashed in on him in 2010 by selling him to Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United after an initial loan deal. Whilst with United he has represented England national under-21 football teamEngland U21s.

Chris Morgan.name: Chris Morgan
Chris Morgan.intro: '''Christopher "Chris" Paul Morgan''' (born 9 November 1977) is a retired English professional Association footballfootballer. He is currently a coach at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, the last club of his playing career, having previously spent a spell as caretaker manager. Born in Barnsley, South YorkshireBarnsley he previously had a seven-year spell with his home town club.

Jason Kennedy.name: Jason Kennedy
Jason Kennedy.intro: '''Jason Kennedy''' (born 11 September 1986) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United as a midfielder (football)midfielder on loan from Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. He attended Blakeston School in Stockton-On-Tees.

Andy Gray (footballer, born 1964).name: Andy Gray (footballer, born 1964)
Andy Gray (footballer, born 1964).intro: '''Andrew Arthur Gray''' (born 22 February 1964) is an English former association footballfootballer who played in the centre of midfield or as a striker (football)striker during his career, before going into International management. He is a former coach of the Sierra Leone national football team.

Marco Borriello.name: Marco Borriello
Marco Borriello.intro: '''Marco Borriello''' (born 18 June 1982) is an Italian Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for  Genoa C.F.C.Genoa. He has previously played for other Italian clubs, including A.C. MilanMilan, U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria, Treviso F.B.C. 1993Treviso, Reggina CalcioReggina, Empoli F.C.Empoli, U.S. Triestina CalcioTriestina, Juventus F.C.Juventus, A.S. RomaRoma and for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. A dynamic, left-footed striker, Boriello is primarily known for his eye for goal, as well as ability in the air. His reliable technique and powerful physique also aid him in holding up the ball for team-mates when playing with his back to goal.

Gianni Zuiverloon.name: Gianni Zuiverloon
Gianni Zuiverloon.intro: '''Gianni Michel Eugene Zuiverloon''' () (born 30 December 1986) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or central defender for Eredivisie side ADO Den Haag.
Gianni Zuiverloon.position: Defender  association football  Central defender Central defender

Malcolm Christie.name: Malcolm Christie
Malcolm Christie.intro: '''Malcom Neil Christie''' (born 11 April 1979) is a retired English association footballfootballer. He  previously played for Nuneaton Borough F.C.Nuneaton Borough, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, and earned 11 England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 cap (sport)caps.

Ian Ormondroyd.name: Ian Ormondroyd
Ian Ormondroyd.intro:
'''Ian Ormondroyd''' (born 22 September 1964 in Bradford, Yorkshire) is a retired EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer. Ormondroyd became famous for his height and build, similar manner to that of Peter Crouch, giving him a cult status among fans of the clubs he played for.
Ormondroyd played for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. At the age of 33, Ormondroyd retired from football due to arthritis in his left ankle.
He returned to Bradford City as football in the community officer, and also works as a commentator and match day summariser for Bradford City games with Pulse 1Pulse Radio. His son, Jack, plays rugby league for Featherstone Rovers in the Championship (rugby league)Kingstone Press Championship.

Rob Jones (footballer, born 1971).name: Rob Jones (footballer, born 1971)
Rob Jones (footballer, born 1971).intro:
'''Robert Marc "Rob" Jones''' (born 5 November 1971 in Wrexham, Wales) is a Welsh-born English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1987 to 1999.
After starting his career with Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, he went on to make a name for himself with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool before finishing his career with a brief spell with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He was capped 8 times by England national football teamEngland.

Brian Laudrup.name: Brian Laudrup
Brian Laudrup.intro:
'''Brian Laudrup''' (born 22 February 1969) is a DenmarkDanish former Association footballfootball player and current football commentator, pundit and analyst on TV3 (Viasat)TV3+. Along with former international goalkeeper Lars Høgh, Laudrup manages a football academy for marginalized youth.
During his short playing career which eventually stalled due to injury, Laudrup represented a number of European clubs. He started with Danish club Brøndby IFBrøndby, winning two List of Danish football championsDanish championships in the late 1980s. He then played for German and Italian clubs, winning the 1994 Serie A as well as the 1994 UEFA Champions League title with A.C. MilanAC Milan. He was a vital part of the Rangers F.C.Rangers team which dominated the Scottish Football League Premier DivisionScottish Premier Division in the 1990s, winning three championships among others. He won the 1998 UEFA Super Cup in his brief stint with English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and had a brief stint with F.C. CopenhagenFC Copenhagen in Denmark, before ending his career with Dutch club Ajax AmsterdamAjax in 2000. He played 82 games and scored 21 goals for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, and was a vital part of the Danish teams who won the UEFA Euro 1992Euro 1992 and 1995 King Fahd Cup1995 Confederations cup
He won the Danish Footballer of the Year award a record four times. He was named by FIFA as the fifth best player in the world in 1992 and was named by Pelé as one of the top 125 greatest living footballers at the FIFA 100 ceremony in March 2004, alongside his older brother Michael Laudrup.

Jonathan Walters.name: Jonathan Walters
Jonathan Walters.intro:
'''Jonathan Ronald''' "'''Jon'''" '''Walters''' (born 20 September 1983) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team.
Walters started his career at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers but failed to break into the first team and joined Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Again he failed to establish himself and went out on loan to Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley before joining Hull permanently. He then went on to play for Wrexham F.C.Wrexham and Chester City F.C.Chester City before finally finding regular football at Championship side Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. Walters spent three years at Ipswich before joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for £2.75 million in August 2010. He helped Stoke reach the 2011 FA Cup Final after scoring twice in the semi-final against Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as Stoke won 5–0. Walters played 54 matches during the 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 season and then played in UEFA Euro 2012 with the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. Walters remained a regular under Tony Pulis in 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 and under Mark Hughes in 2013–14 Stoke City F.C. season2013–14.

Alan Mahon.name: Alan Mahon
Alan Mahon.intro: '''Alan Joseph Mahon''' (born 4 April 1978) is a Irish former professional association footballfootballer who played a midfielder and was capped by the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland.

Martin Johansen.name: Martin Johansen
Martin Johansen.intro:
'''Martin Bro Johansen''' (born July 22, 1972, in Glostrup) is a DenmarkDanish former football (soccer) player. He played usually as a midfielder but could also play as a strikerforward. During his career he played for FC Copenhagen, Boldklubben 1903B 1903 and most notably Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in the FA Premier League.
Johansen appeared once for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team in his career. His twin brother Michael Johansen was also a professional footballer.

Fernando Guerrero.name: Fernando Guerrero
Fernando Guerrero.intro: '''Fernando Alexander Guerrero Vásquez''' (born 30 September 1989) is an Ecuadorian Association footballfootballer who plays for Club Universidad de Guadalajara in the Liga MX.

Phil O'Donnell.name: Phil O'Donnell
Phil O'Donnell.intro: '''Phillip "Phil" O'Donnell''' (25 March 1972 – 29 December 2007) was a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootball left-sided winger who played for Motherwell F.C.Motherwell, Celtic F.C.Celtic and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday over the course of his career. He also earned one cap (sport)international cap and twice won the Scottish PFA Young Player of the Year Award. He died after suffering cardiac arrest while on the pitch playing for Motherwell against Dundee United F.C.Dundee United on 29 December 2007.

Larnell Cole.name: Larnell Cole
Larnell Cole.intro: '''Larnell James Cole''' (born 9 March 1993) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Fulham F.C.Fulham. Born in Manchester, Cole began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before joining Fulham in January 2014.

Alex Marrow.name: Alex Marrow
Alex Marrow.intro: '''Alexander James Marrow''' (born 21 January 1990) is an English professional association footballfootballer. A Midfielder (association football)defensive midfielder, he plays for League Two club Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.

Rhys Wilmot.name: Rhys Wilmot
Rhys Wilmot.intro:
'''Rhys Wilmot''' (born 21 February 1962 in Newport, WalesNewport) is a former Welsh professional association footballfootballer and Goalkeeping Coach at Football League Two side Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle.
As a player Wilmot was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1980 to 1997 for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United, Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Torquay United F.C.Torquay United.

Matthew Etherington.name: Matthew Etherington
Matthew Etherington.intro:
'''Matthew Etherington''' (born 14 August 1981) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Etherington started his footballing career at Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United and was a stand-out performer for the "Posh" which attracted the attention of Premier League clubs. He joined Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 2000 along with Simon Davies (footballer born 1979)Simon Davies. He struggled at Tottenham and left for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in 2003. At the East London club Etherington showed his true form and became a vital player for the "Hammers". However he had personal problems related to an addiction to gambling and in 2009 was sold by manager Gianfranco Zola to fellow Premier League side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
At Stoke, Etherington became a vital member of the side under manager Tony Pulis, winning the Stoke City F.C. Player of the Yearplayer of the year award for the 2009–10 Stoke City F.C. season2009–10 season and also played in the 2011 FA Cup Final. Etherington remained a regular under Pulis in 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 and 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 before he was released by Mark Hughes at the end of the 2013–14 Stoke City F.C. season2013–14 season.

Brian Horne.name: Brian Horne
Brian Horne.intro: '''Brian Simon Horne''' (born 5 October 1967) is a former English association footballfootballer. He played professionally for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United.

Peter Beardsley.name: Peter Beardsley
Peter Beardsley.intro: '''Peter Andrew Beardsley''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 18 January 1961) is an English former association footballfootballer who played between 1979 and 1999. In 1987, he set a record transfer fee in the English game and represented his country 59 times between 1986 and 1996, once as captain. He played for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Everton F.C.Everton, having also had spells with Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Vancouver Whitecaps (NASL)Vancouver Whitecaps, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United and the Melbourne Knights. He was briefly appointed as the caretaker manager of Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 2010.

Ben Foster.name: Ben Foster
Ben Foster.intro:
'''Ben Anthony Foster''' (born 3 April 1983) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.
Foster began his professional career in 2001 with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, having joined from Racing Club Warwick F.C.Racing Club Warwick. However, he never made an appearance for Stoke, and spent time on loan with Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Tiverton Town F.C.Tiverton Town, Stafford Rangers F.C.Stafford Rangers, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers and Wrexham F.C.Wrexham. He switched permanently to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in July 2005, but again struggled to break into the first team, and he spent two successive seasons on loan to Watford F.C.Watford from August 2005 until the end of the 2006–07 Premier League06–07 season. Having played just 23 times for Manchester United (although he also played in the Football League Cup winning sides of 2009 Football League Cup Final2009 and 2010 Football League Cup Final2010), Foster switched to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in May 2010. An ever-present in the league for Birmingham, Foster was also part of the Birmingham side who won the 2011 Football League Cup Final2011 League Cup; he made a total of 43 appearances in that season. Following Birmingham's relegation to the Football League Championship at the end of the season, Foster was loaned to West Bromwich Albion, and moved there permanently in June 2012.
Internationally, Foster made his international debut for England national football teamEngland in February 2007 against Spain national football teamSpain. Although he announced his retirement from international football in May 2011, he returned in February 2013, and was selected in England's squad for the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Ale\u0161 Kri\u017ean.name: Aleš Križan
Ale\u0161 Kri\u017ean.intro:
'''Aleš Križan''' (born 25 July 1971) is a retired Slovenian football defender.
Križan most notably played in England for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley having joined from NK MariborMaribor, and in the 1997-1998 season played in the Premier League with the South Yorkshire club. However they were relegated after that season and he only played one more league game in the next two seasons for Barnsley.cite web
url=
title=Games played by Ales Krizan in 1998/1999
publisher=Soccerbase
accessdate=22 January 2013cite web
url=
title=Games played by Ales Krizan in 1999/2000
publisher=Soccerbase
accessdate=22 January 2013 He left the team in 2000, shortly after his teammates lost the playoff final to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
Križan was capped 25 times for the Slovenia national football teamSlovenian national team between 1993 and 1998.[
Ale\u0161 Kri\u017ean.birth_place: Maribor,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Gary Mabbutt.name: Gary Mabbutt
Gary Mabbutt.intro: '''Gary Vincent Mabbutt''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 23 August 1961) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who made more than 750 appearances playing for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, and won 16 cap (sport)caps for the England national football teamEngland national team. He was most regularly seen in central defence but was a versatile player who excelled also in midfield. His father is Ray Mabbutt and brother Kevin Mabbutt.

Stuart Massey.name: Stuart Massey
Stuart Massey.intro:
'''Stuart Massey''' (born 17 November 1964) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder.
He has worked as a manager, for the clubs Chipstead F.C.Chipstead (player-manager), Sutton United F.C.Sutton United (caretaker), and Whyteleafe F.C.Whyteleafe.
He began his career at non league level in the early 1980s before signing for FA Premier League founder members Crystal Palace at the start of the 1992-93 in English football1992-93 season, but did not play any games that season as the Eagles were relegated.
He played twice for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace during their 1993-94 in English football1993-94 promotion campaign in Football League First DivisionFootball League Division One before signing for Oxford United F.C.Oxford United. He was more active at the Manor Ground, OxfordManor Ground, making more than 100 league appearances and scoring eight goals before being given a free transfer in May 1998 following a knee injury. He never played professional football again. However, during his time with the U's he did help them win promotion from Football League Second DivisionDivision Two as runners-up in 1996.

Lee Hughes.name: Lee Hughes
Lee Hughes.intro:
'''Lee Hughes''' (born 22 May 1976) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Conference Premier side Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers as a Forward (association football)striker. A former England national football C teamEngland semi-pro international, he is a strong striker with excellent finishing abilities. After being released as a youth footballer, Hughes worked as a roofer alongside his father.
He started his career in the Football Conference with Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, before winning a £380,000 move to boyhood club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in August 1997. He finished as the club's top-scorer for four seasons running, earning a place on the PFA Team of the Year in 1998–99 after finishing as the highest scorer in the top four divisions of English football. He was sold to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City for £5 million in August 2001, before returning to West Brom for half that figure 12 months later. He failed to impress in the Premier League as Albion suffered relegation, though helped the club to make an immediate return to the top-flight by securing the runners-up spot in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 2003–04.
In August 2004, he was sentenced to six years imprisonment for causing death by dangerous driving following a fatal crash on 23 November 2003. He returned to the professional game after being released half-way through his sentence in August 2007, and was offered a contract by Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. Playing one level below where he was playing before his prison sentence, he continued his impressive scoring rate for Oldham. He left the club in May 2009, following a brief loan spell at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He signed for Notts County F.C.Notts County in July 2009, and was named on the PFA Team of the Year after scoring 30 league goals as the club won the Football League TwoLeague Two title in 2009–10. He left Notts County to sign for Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in January 2013, and helped the club to secure promotion out of League Two in 2012–13. On 3 January 2014, he signed for Forest Green Rovers on an 18-month deal. In January 2015, he returned to Kidderminster Harriers.

Kiki Musampa.name: Kiki Musampa
Kiki Musampa.intro:
'''Kizito "Kiki" Musampa''' (born 20 July 1977 in Kinshasa, Zaire, now the Democratic Republic of the Congo) is a Democratic Republic of the CongoCongolese-born, and Dutch-nationalised former Association footballfootballer.
Musampa had a journeyman career, taking in notable spells at AFC Ajax, FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux, Malaga CF, Atlético Madrid and Manchester City, he also earned 28 caps representing the Netherlands at under-20 and under-21 levels.
He was a Winger (soccer)left winger, well known for his pace and free-kicks.

Adam Henley.name: Adam Henley
Adam Henley.intro: '''Adam David Henley''' (born 14 June 1994) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He can operate in both the right-back and left-back slot.

Adrian Mutu.name: Adrian Mutu
Adrian Mutu.intro:
'''Adrian Mutu''' (; born 8 January 1979) is a former Romanian association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward. His career has included setbacks including two long suspensions for failed drugs tests. Despite this, he was regarded as one of the Serie A's best strikers of his era.
Mutu started his career in Romania, playing two years for FC Argeș PiteștiArgeș Pitești and half a year for FC Dinamo BucureștiDinamo București, before joining F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale midway through the 1999–2000 Serie A. After only 10 games there he left for Hellas Verona F.C.Verona and then Parma F.C.Parma, for which he scored 39 goals in the next three years. His excellent form brought him a €22.5 million transfer to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. Due to breach of contract  for failing a drug test, he was released and returned to Serie A to join Juventus F.C.Juventus. After the 2006 Italian football scandal and the relegation of Juventus to Serie B, Mutu decided to join ACF FiorentinaFiorentina, where he played consistently for five years. He then had a season at AC CesenaCesena and French club AC AjaccioAjaccio before returning to Romania with Petrolul Ploiești in 2014. On 5 April 2013, Mutu announced his intention to retire from football at the end of the 2013–14 season.
From his debut in 2000, Mutu played 77 matches for the Romania national football teamRomanian national team and scored 35 goals, a joint record alongside Gheorghe Hagi. He was included in their squads at the European Championship in Euro 20002000 and Euro 20082008.

Riyad Mahrez.name: Riyad Mahrez
Riyad Mahrez.intro:
'''Riyad Mahrez''' (born 21 February 1991) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Born in France, Mahrez represents Algeria national football teamAlgeria at international level. He was a member of the Algerian team at the 2014 FIFA World Cup in Brazil.

Keith Fahey.name: Keith Fahey
Keith Fahey.intro:
'''Keith Declan Fahey''' (born 15 January 1983 in Dublin) is a Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland international Association footballfootballer who plays for the League of Ireland side Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers. He plays predominantly as a central midfielder, but  also occasionally as a winger (sports)winger.
Fahey started his professional career as a trainee with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He played for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Bluebell United F.C.Bluebell United, St Patrick's Athletic F.C.St Patrick's Athletic and Drogheda United F.C.Drogheda United before his transfer to Birmingham City. With Birmingham City he won the 2011 Football League Cup Final2011 League Cup in England, as well as helping the club gain promotion from the Football League Championship to the Premier League during the 2008–09 Football League Championship2008–09 season. He left the club at the end of the 2012–13 season, and returned to St Patrick's Athletic for a third spell with the club.
With Ireland, he was part of the team that secured qualification for UEFA Euro 2012. Manager Giovanni Trapattoni called Fahey into the Irish squad for the tournament, but he was later sent home due to injury.

Daniel Pacheco.name: Daniel Pacheco
Daniel Pacheco.intro: '''Daniel "Dani" Pacheco Lobato''' (born 5 January 1991) is a Spanish association footballfootballer who plays for Real Betis in Segunda División as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger or an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder. He joined Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2007 having previously been in the youth ranks at FC BarcelonaBarcelona.

Bobby Howe (footballer, born 1973).name: Bobby Howe (footballer, born 1973)
Bobby Howe (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''Bobby Howe''' (born 6 November 1973) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. He played for Nottingham Forest from 1990 to 1998 but made just 14 league appearances in that time, later joining Swindon Town for a £30,000 fee, where he made his last league appearance in 2002. He later played non league football for Havant & Waterlooville and Farnborough Town.

Mat Sadler.name: Mat Sadler
Mat Sadler.intro: '''Mathew John "Mat" Sadler''' (born 26 February 1985) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Oldham Athletic on loan from Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United. He is a defender (association football)left back who also played in the Premier League and the Football League for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, and in the Football League for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Watford F.C.Watford, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Walsall F.C.Walsall and Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town.

Willy Caballero.name: Willy Caballero
Willy Caballero.intro:
'''Wilfredo Daniel "Willy" Caballero Lazcano''' (born 28 September 1981) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He spent most of his career in Spain, representing Elche CFElche and Málaga CFMálaga and competing in La Liga with the latter club. In the summer of 2014, he signed for Manchester City.

Nikola \u017digi\u0107.name: Nikola Žigić
Nikola \u017digi\u0107.intro:
'''Nikola Žigić''' (, ; born 25 September 1980) is a Serbian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Centre forwardcentre forward for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. At , Žigić is among the tallest professional players in the world.
Žigić started his career in the youth academy at AIK Bačka Topola in 1991, and joined the senior side in 1998. During his time at the club, he scored 68 goals in 76 league matches, before leaving in 2001 for FK MornarMornar. He spent one season at Mornar, scoring 15 goals in 23 league games, before switching to FK KolubaraKolubara in 2002, scoring 3 goals in 8 league games. A brief spell at FK Spartak SuboticaSpartak Subotica in 2003 followed, where he scored 14 goals in 11 league games. He joined First League of Serbia and Montenegro side Red Star Belgrade in 2003, and made 110 appearances for them, scoring 71 goals. A move to Spain in August 2006 followed, with Žigić  joining La Liga side Racing de SantanderRacing Santander. He spent a single season at Santander, scoring 11 goals in 33 games, before signing for La Liga side Valencia CFValencia in August 2008. He scored 14 goals in 46 games, but was rarely the first choice striker, and he spent most of the 2008-09 La Liga2008–09 season on loan to Racing Santander, scoring 13 goals in 19 games during his second spell at the club. Žigić joined Premier League club Birmingham City in 2010. In his first season, he scored in Birmingham's 2011 Football League Cup FinalLeague Cup win, and despite their relegation to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship, remained with the club for a further three years until his contract expired.
He made his senior international debut for Serbia and Montenegro national football teamSerbia and Montenegro in June 2005, and has since won 57 cap (football)caps for his country, scoring 20 goals.  He was part of both the 2006 FIFA World Cup and 2010 FIFA World Cup squads, and briefly captained his country in 2011. Following the breakup of Serbia and Montenegro in 2006, he played internationally for Serbia national football teamSerbia until 2011.
Nikola \u017digi\u0107.birth_place: Bačka Topola,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Nikola \u017digi\u0107.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Vassilios Borbokis.name: Vassilios Borbokis
Vassilios Borbokis.intro: '''Vassilios "Vas" Borbokis''' (born 10 February 1969) is a former GreeceGreek Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender.  Born in Serres, Greece, he played for Apollon Kalamarias F.C.Apollon Kalamarias, AEK Athens F.C.AEK Athens and PAOK FCPAOK Thessaloniki FC in his home country, as well as spells in England with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Derby County F.C.Derby County, and Cyprus with Anorthosis Famagusta FCAnorthosis Famagusta  The brother of fellow Greek footballer Stefanos Borbokis, he also made two appearances for the Greece national football teamGreek national side.
Vassilios Borbokis.position: Defender  football  Full back Right Back,Defender  football  Wingback Right Wingback

Alan Quinn.name: Alan Quinn
Alan Quinn.intro:
'''Alan Quinn''' (born 13 June 1979 in Dublin) is an Republic of IrelandIrish professional Association footballfootballer. He was a midfielder.
He is one of nine brothers; both Stephen QuinnStephen and Keith Quinn (footballer)Keith were on the books at Alan's former club, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United while another brother, Gerry, played for St Patrick's Athletic in the League of Ireland. Quinn has also played for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, and is the only player to have scored for both teams in the Steel City derby.

Jos\u00e9 \u00c1ngel Pozo.name: José Ángel Pozo
Jos\u00e9 \u00c1ngel Pozo.intro: '''José Ángel Pozo la Rosa''' (born 15 March 1996) is a Spanish peopleSpanish footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.

Derek Lilley.name: Derek Lilley
Derek Lilley.intro:
'''Derek Lilley''' (born 9 February 1974 in Paisley, Renfrewshire) is a ScotlandScottish former Association footballfootballer who retired after playing with Scottish Football League Third DivisionScottish Third Division side Forfar Athletic F.C.Forfar Athletic.
He started his career with Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton, before a big-money move to Premier League side Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He had loan spells with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts and Bury F.C.Bury before joining Oxford United F.C.Oxford United.
In 2000, Lilley returned to Scotland with Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, playing with them, Livingston F.C.Livingston, Morton again, and St Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, Stirling Albion F.C.Stirling Albion then finally Forfar Athletic.

John Scales.name: John Scales
John Scales.intro:
'''John Robert Scales''' (born 4 July 1966 in Harrogate, North Yorkshire) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)central defender from 1984 to 2001.
He notably played in the Premier League for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town as well as playing in the Football League for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers. He was capped 3 times by England national football teamEngland.

Mark Kinsella.name: Mark Kinsella
Mark Kinsella.intro:
'''Mark Anthony Kinsella''' (born 12 August 1972) is an Irish Association footballfootball coach and former player who is currently the assistant manager of Drogheda United F.C.Drogheda United. He played as a central midfielder for most of his career. He is the father of Liam Kinsella.
Kinsella began his career at Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, before spells at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Walsall F.C.Walsall and Lewes F.C.Lewes. He played 48 times for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, scoring three goals and playing in the 2002 FIFA World Cup in Japan and South Korea. Kinsella is a former manager of Daventry Town F.C.Daventry Town.

Mark Williams (footballer, born 1970).name: Mark Williams (footballer, born 1970)
Mark Williams (footballer, born 1970).intro: '''Mark Stuart Williams''' (born 28 September 1970) is a former Northern Irish association footballfootballer who played for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Watford F.C.Watford, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons and Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds.

Steven Watt.name: Steven Watt
Steven Watt.intro: '''Steven Mair Watt''' (born 1 May 1985) is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United. He has notably played Premier League football for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and has also played for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.Inverness Caledonian Thistle, Ross County F.C.Ross County, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town and Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic.

Muamer Tankovi\u0107.name: Muamer Tanković
Muamer Tankovi\u0107.intro:
'''Muamer Tanković''' (born 22 February 1995) is a Swedish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as
a forward (association football)forward or Forward (association football)second striker for Dutch club
AZ AlkmaarAZ.

James Vaughan (footballer, born 1988).name: James Vaughan (footballer, born 1988)
James Vaughan (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''James Oliver Vaughan''' (born 14 July 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Football League Championship side Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town as a forward (association football)striker. He has represented England at England national under-17 football teamU17, England national under-19 football teamU19 and England U21 national football teamunder 21 level but has since expressed a desire to represent Jamaica national football teamJamaica at international level. He is the Premier League's youngest goalscorer.Cite news
url       =
title     = Youngest Premiership goalscorers
publisher = BBC
date      = 11 April 2005 accessdate=18 September 2009
Vaughan, who was born in Birmingham, signed as a professional footballer with Everton F.C.Everton. He played for the club between 2005 and 2011, including loan spells at Derby County F.C.Derby County, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, before signing for Norwich in May 2011. He then had a loan spell at Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town for the majority of the 2012–13 season, before signing permanent terms on 3 July 2013.

James Perch.name: James Perch
James Perch.intro: '''James Robert Perch''' (born 28 September 1985) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. Perch is versatile and has covered many positions in both Defender (association football)defence and across Midfieldermidfield. However, he is usually deployed at Defender (association football)#Full backright back.

Fabrice Muamba.name: Fabrice Muamba
Fabrice Muamba.intro:
'''Fabrice Ndala Muamba''' (born 6 April 1988) is a retired professional association footballfootballer who played for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder. Born in Zaire (now the Democratic Republic of the Congo), Muamba moved to England at the age of 11, and subsequently played for England up to England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.
Muamba began his career in 2002, joining Arsenal's youth academy. After three years, he turned professional in 2005. He made his debut for Arsenal in the League Cup, but played only one other professional match for the club. Following a loan (sports)loan spell with Birmingham City, he made the move permanent in 2007. He stayed with Birmingham City for one additional year, and left after making more than 70 appearances and making his England under-21 debut while with the team. He joined Bolton Wanderers in 2008.
In March 2012, Muamba suffered a cardiac arrest during a televised FA Cup match between Bolton and Tottenham Hotspur, from which he recovered despite his heart having stopped for 78 minutes. Following medical advice, he announced his retirement from professional football in August 2012.

Tal Ben Haim.name: Tal Ben Haim
Tal Ben Haim.intro: '''Tal Ben Haim''' (; born 31 March 1982) is an Israeli Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Charlton Athletic. He can play at either Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back or Defender (association football)#Full backright back. He has also played for Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.Maccabi Tel Aviv, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He is also a member of the Israel national football teamIsraeli national squad. He made his debut for Israel on 13 February 2002 in a friendly match against Germany.
Tal Ben Haim.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

S\u00e9bastien Bassong.name: Sébastien Bassong
S\u00e9bastien Bassong.intro: '''Sébastien Aymar Bassong Nguena''' (born 9 July 1986) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for English club Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. Born in France, he also plays for the Cameroon national football team.

Y\u0131ld\u0131ray Ba\u015ft\u00fcrk.name: Yıldıray Baştürk
Y\u0131ld\u0131ray Ba\u015ft\u00fcrk.intro:
'''Yıldıray Baştürk''' (, born 24 December 1978) is a retired Turkish Association footballfootballer who last played for English Premier League club Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 2010.
He was capped 49 times for the Turkey national football team, representing the team at the 2002 FIFA World Cup where it finished in 2002 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Third place play-offthird place. In the same year he also appeared for Bayer 04 Leverkusen in the 2002 UEFA Champions League Final.

Leroy Fer.name: Leroy Fer
Leroy Fer.intro:
'''Leroy Johan Fer''' (born 5 January 1990) is a Dutch professional association footballfootballer who plays as a central midfielder for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and the Netherlands national football team.
Fer has various nicknames. In his youth he got nicknamed ''De Uitsmijter'' (The Bouncer) by Feyenoord youth coach Jean-Paul van Gastel for his strong physical appearance. Other nicknames are Lerra and Ferovic. Cor Pot, coach of the Netherlands national under-21 football teamNetherlands U21, compared Fer with Patrick Vieira. According to Pot both players show many similarities, on and off the field.

Stephen Darby.name: Stephen Darby
Stephen Darby.intro: '''Stephen Mark Darby''' (born 6 October 1988) is an English professional footballer who plays as a right-back for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. He is also the captain of Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City.

Ian Harte.name: Ian Harte
Ian Harte.intro:
'''Ian Patrick Harte''' (born 31 August 1977) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender and is currently playing for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth. He is best known for his spell at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and also his ability to score goals from long range, including being a Direct free kickfree kick specialist.
Harte earned 63 international caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, scoring 12 goals. He was included in their squad at the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

Steven N'Zonzi.name: Steven N'Zonzi
Steven N'Zonzi.intro:
'''Steven N'Kemboanza Mike Christopher N'Zonzi''' (born 15 December 1988) is a French association footballfootballer of Democratic Republic of the CongoCongolese descent who plays as a midfielder for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
N'Zonzi began his career with Ligue 2 side Amiens SC impressing enough to earn a move to English Premier League side Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 2009 for £500,000. He spent three years at Ewood Park which ended with Rovers being relegated at the end of the 2011–12 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season2011–12 season. He remained in the Premier League however joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for £3 million.
He has represented France at France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level and has been called up into the Democratic Republic of the Congo national football team but has yet to play a full international game.

Ray McKinnon.name: Ray McKinnon
Ray McKinnon.intro: '''Ray McKinnon''' (born 5 August 1970 in Dundee) is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootball player and manager (association football)manager currently in charge of Scottish League One side Brechin City F.C.Brechin City.

Nathan Eccleston.name: Nathan Eccleston
Nathan Eccleston.intro: '''Nathan Geoffrey Junior Eccleston''' (born 30 December 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Scottish Premiership club Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock. Eccleston started his career as a youth player at Bury F.C.Bury, before moving to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool's youth system. Having progressed through the club's youth and reserve system, Eccleston made his debut for the club in an Football League CupLeague Cup tie against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He made his Premier League debut a few days later against Fulham. During his time at Liverpool, Eccleston went on loan to Huddersfield Town, Charlton Athletic and Rochdale F.CRochdale. He left Liverpool in August 2012 and signed for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Blackpool F.C.Blackpool on a one year deal. The majority of his time at Blackpool was spent on loan at Tranmere Rovers, Carlisle United and Coventry City. In September 2014, Eccleston signed a one year contract with Partick Thistle F.C.Partick Thistle, but he left the club in February 2015, then signed for Kilmarnock.

Keith Curle.name: Keith Curle
Keith Curle.intro:
'''Keith Curle''' (born 14 November 1963) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and manager. He is currently the manager (association football)manager of Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1981 to 2005, notably playing in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City where he was also the club captain. He also played for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Reading F.C.Reading, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He became player-manager of Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town in 2002, where he remained until 2005, later becoming manager of Chester City F.C.Chester City, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United and Notts County F.C.Notts County.

Paul Huntington.name: Paul Huntington
Paul Huntington.intro: '''Paul David Huntington''' (born 17 September 1987) is an English peopleEnglish professional association footballfootballer who is a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End.
Paul Huntington.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Grant Leadbitter.name: Grant Leadbitter
Grant Leadbitter.intro: '''Grant Leadbitter''' (born 7 January 1986) is an English professional footballer who plays for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough as a midfielder. He played for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland from 2003 until 2009 after rising as a product from the team's Academy of LightYouth Academy before signing for Ipswich Town. In 2007 Leadbitter received a call-up for England U21 national football teamEngland U21, and featured for them three times.

Nick Montgomery.name: Nick Montgomery
Nick Montgomery.intro: '''Nicholas Anthony "Nick" Montgomery''' (born 28 October 1981) is an English-born ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer currently playing for Australian side Central Coast Mariners FCCentral Coast Mariners in the A-League. Born in Leeds, England he started his career with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United where he spent twelve years as a professional, making 399 appearances. Towards the end of his time in England, Montgomery had a short spell on loan with Millwall F.C.Millwall and had earlier represented Scotland at Scotland national under-21 football teamunder-21 level and as part of a Scotland 'Scotland B national football teamFutures' side.

St\u00e9phane Mbia.name: Stéphane Mbia
St\u00e9phane Mbia.intro:
'''Stéphane Mbia Etoundi''' (born 20 May 1986) is a Cameroonian Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Sevilla FC and the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
He has represented Cameroon on almost 50 occasions since winning his first cap in 2005 and scored a total of 3 goals for the national team. He was included in their squads for the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics - Men's tournament2008 Olympics, two Africa Cup of Nations tournaments and two FIFA World Cups. He was given the captain's armband on 26 August 2014.

Azar Karadas.name: Azar Karadas
Azar Karadas.intro:
'''Azar Karadas''' ('''Azar Karadaş''' in Turkish languageTurkish; born 9 August 1981) is a Norwegian Association footballfootballer who plays for SK Brann. Although he can also play as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, he operates primarily as a Forward (association football)#Centre forwardcentre forward.
He won the Tippeligaen while playing for SK BrannBrann and Rosenborg BKRosenborg, and also competed professionally in Portugal, England, Germany and Turkey.
Karadas made his debut for the Norway national football teamNorwegian national team in 2001, going on to win a total of ten Cap (sport)caps in seven years.
Azar Karadas.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

K\u00e9vin Th\u00e9ophile-Catherine.name: Kévin Théophile-Catherine
K\u00e9vin Th\u00e9ophile-Catherine.intro: '''Kévin Théophile-Catherine''' (born 28 October 1989) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (football)defender for French club AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne on loan from Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Ramires.name: Ramires
Ramires.intro:
'''Ramires Santos do Nascimento''' (); born 24 March 1987), known simply as '''Ramires''', is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team. A midfielder, he is comfortable playing in either the Central Midfieldercentre or right midfielder position. He normally plays as a Midfielder#"Box-to-box" midfielderbox-to-box midfielder role because of his energy in supporting defensive and offensive play. His attacking and defensive mentality have led to comparisons to former Chelsea teammate Michael Essien.
Ramires began his career playing for Royal Sport Club. In 2005, he signed for Joinville Esporte ClubeJoinville, before joining Cruzeiro Esporte ClubeCruzeiro, whom he spent just over two seasons with, appearing in 61 league matches and scoring 10 times. In 2009, Ramires moved to Portugal and signed for S.L. BenficaBenfica from Cruzeiro. He spent one season with Benfica in which he helped them to the Primeira Liga title, five points clear of second-placed S.C. BragaBraga. He then joined English club Chelsea in the summer of 2010 on a four-year contract. He made his Chelsea debut in a 2–0 win against Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in late August 2010 and scored his first goal in a 4–0 victory against Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.
Ramires is a Brazilian international, making his debut on 6 June 2009 in a 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification game against Uruguay national football teamUruguay. He was in the teams which won the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup and a bronze medal at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Olympics, as well as playing in two World Cups and the 2011 Copa América.

Nuri \u015eahin.name: Nuri Şahin
Nuri \u015eahin.intro:
'''Nuri Şahin''' (, born 5 September 1988) is a Turkish Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Bundesliga club Borussia Dortmund and the Turkey national football team.
He began his career at Borussia Dortmund, spending six years there and winning the Bundesliga in 2010–11 Bundesliga2011 – including a year-long loan at Feyenoord – before signing for Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid in 2011 for €10 million. In August 2012, Şahin agreed to a one-year loan deal with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, which was terminated in January 2013 to allow him to return to Dortmund on an 18-month loan.
Although born in Germany, Şahin  represents Turkey at international level and has done since under-16 level. He made his senior international debut in 2005 and has since earned over 45 caps.

Danny Cadamarteri.name: Danny Cadamarteri
Danny Cadamarteri.intro:
'''Daniel Leon "Danny" Cadamarteri''' (born 12 October 1979) is an English former association footballfootballer who played for clubs including Everton F.C.Everton, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and latterly Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United before retiring in April 2014.
Early in his career, he played three times for the England national under-21 football team.

Joe Lewis.name: Joe Lewis
Joe Lewis.intro: '''Joseph Peter "Joe" Lewis''' (born 6 October 1987) is an English professional Association footballfootball goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who plays for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool on loan from Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Frank Leboeuf.name: Frank Leboeuf
Frank Leboeuf.intro: '''Franck Alain James Lebœuf''' (;typically anglicised as '''Frank Leboeuf''', born 22 January 1968) is an actor, sports commentator and former List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who played primarily as a central defender (football)defender. With the France national football teamFrench national team, Leboeuf won the 1998 FIFA World Cup and 2000 UEFA Euro 2000European Championships as well as a number of domestic trophies, most famously during his 5 years at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. Since the conclusion of his playing career, Leboeuf has transitioned to acting, appearing in stage and film productions.

Gavin Peacock.name: Gavin Peacock
Gavin Peacock.intro:
'''Gavin Keith Peacock''' (born 18 November 1967) is a former EnglandEnglish professional football (soccer)footballer who played as midfielder (association football)midfielder and striker (association football)striker from 1984 until 2002 notably in the Premier League for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
He also played in the Football League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He then worked in the media as a pundit (expert)pundit, and in September 2008 relocated to Canada to study Christian Theologytheology with a view to becoming a Christian minister.

Antoine Sibierski.name: Antoine Sibierski
Antoine Sibierski.intro: '''Antoine Sibierski''' (born 5 August 1974) is a French former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder for clubs such as Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.

Ched Evans.name: Ched Evans
Ched Evans.intro:
'''Chedwyn Michael "Ched" Evans''' (born 28 December 1988) is a Welsh Association footballfootballer. Born in St Asaph, Denbighshire, Evans was signed by Manchester City F.C.Manchester City from Chester City F.C.Chester City's youth set up in 2002 and he subsequently progressed through the ranks. Evans was loaned to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 2007, where he scored 10 goals in 28 league appearances, before returning to his parent club. With first team opportunities at City limited he was subsequently sold to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United for £3 million in 2009. After an unspectacular first two seasons at Bramall Lane he scored 35 goals during the 2011–12 Sheffield United F.C. season2011–12 season. Evans also represented Wales at Wales national under-21 football teamWales under-21 and Wales national football teamsenior level, scoring on his debut for the national side in 2008, and making a total of 13 appearances.
Evans was R v Evansconvicted of rape in April 2012 and sentenced to five years in prison. He has not played professional football since his release in October 2014.

R\u0103zvan Ra\u021b.name: Răzvan Raț
R\u0103zvan Ra\u021b.intro:
'''Răzvan Dincă Raț''' (; born 26 May 1981) is a Romanian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for PAOK FC in Greece as a left back.
His honours include eight league titles (two with FC Rapid BucureștiRapid and six with FC Shakhtar DonetskShakhtar), one Cupa RomânieiRomanian Cup, four Ukrainian Cups, one UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup, one Supercupa RomânieiRomanian Super Cup and three Ukrainian Super Cups. In 2009, Raț came second in voting for the Romanian Footballer of the Year.
Raț is also the Captain (association football)captain of the Romania national football teamRomanian national team. He made his international debut in 2002 and has represented Romania at UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008. Raț first captained his country in 2005, in a friendly match against Nigeria national football teamNigeria, in the absence of regular captain Cristian Chivu, and was appointed captain on 2 September 2011. He is the fourth most capped Romanian international of all time, earning his FIFA Century Club100th cap on 14 October 2014.

Victor Moses.name: Victor Moses
Victor Moses.intro:
'''Victor Moses''' (born 12 December 1990) is a  professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He can play in a variety of positions, primarily as a winger (sport)winger, but also as a forward.
Moses began his career in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, before his performances caught the eye of Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, where he made his Premier League debut in 2010. After two years, his game had improved to the extent that European champions Chelsea were interested. Despite 10 goals in all competitions during his first season, he spent his second season on loan to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and his third on loan at Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Born in Nigeria, he represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, but opted to play for Nigeria national football teamNigeria as opposed to being fully capped for England. He has gained over 20 caps for Nigeria since his debut in 2012, and played in their winning campaign at the 2013 Africa Cup of Nations, as well as the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Thierry Henry.name: Thierry Henry
Thierry Henry.intro:
'''Thierry Daniel Henry''' (; born 17 August 1977) is a retired French professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He played for AS Monaco FCMonaco, Juventus F.C.Juventus, FC BarcelonaBarcelona, New York Red Bulls and spent eight years at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal where he is the club's List of Arsenal F.C. records and statisticsall time record goalscorer. At international level he represented France national football teamFrance and is his country's record goalscorer. He is regarded as one of the best players of his generation.
Henry was born in Les Ulis, Essonne (a suburb of Paris) where he played for an array of local sides as a youngster and showed great promise as a goal-scorer. He was spotted by AS Monaco FCAS Monaco in 1990 and signed instantly, making his professional debut in 1994. Good form led to an international call-up in 1998, after which he signed for the Serie A defending champions Juventus F.C.Juventus. He had a disappointing season playing on the Winger (soccer)wing, before joining Arsenal for Pound sterling£11 million in 1999.
It was at Arsenal that Henry made his name as a world-class player. Despite initially struggling in the Premier League, he emerged as Arsenal's top goal-scorer for almost every season of his tenure there. Under long-time mentor and coach Arsène Wenger, Henry became a prolific striker and Arsenal's all-time leading scorer with 228 goals in all competitions. The Frenchman won two league titles and three FA Cups with the Gunners; he was runner-up for the FIFA World Player of the Year twice, was named the PFA Players' Player of the Year twice, and the FWA Footballer of the Year three times. Henry spent his final two seasons with Arsenal as club captain (association football)captain, leading them to the 2006 UEFA Champions League Final.
In June 2007, after eight years with Arsenal, he transferred to FC BarcelonaBarcelona for a fee of €24 million. In 2009, he was an integral part of the club's historic treble when they won La Liga, the Copa del Rey and the UEFA Champions League. He went on to achieve an unprecedented sextuple by also winning the Supercopa de España, the UEFA Super Cup and the FIFA Club World Cup. In total, Henry has been named in the UEFA Team of the Year five times. In 2010, he joined the New York Red Bulls of the Major League Soccer, and won the Eastern Conference title with them in 2010. He returned to Arsenal on loan for two months in 2012.  In 2013 Henry with the New York Red Bulls won the Supporters' ShieldMLS Supporters' Shield.
Henry enjoyed success with the French national team, winning the 1998 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2000 and 2003 FIFA Confederations Cup. In October 2007, he surpassed Michel Platini's record to become France's top goalscorer of all time. Henry retired from international football after the 2010 FIFA World Cup. Off the pitch, Henry is an active spokesperson against Racism in association footballracism in football, partially due to his own experiences. He married English model Nicole Merry in 2003 and had a daughter with her, but they divorced in 2007. Henry was also one of the top commercially marketed footballers; he was ranked ninth in the world in 2006.

Samuel Eto'o.name: Samuel Eto'o
Samuel Eto'o.intro:
'''Samuel Eto'o Fils''' (; born 10 March 1981) is a Cameroonian association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria and formerly for the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team.  He is the most decorated African player of all time having won the African Player of the Year award a record four times: in 2003, 2004, 2005, and 2010. He was third in the FIFA World Player of the Year award in 2005.
Eto'o scored over 100 goals in five seasons with FC BarcelonaBarcelona, and is also the record holder in number of appearances by an African player in La Liga. In 2010, he became the first player to win two European The treble#Continental Treblecontinental trebles following his back-to-back achievements with Barcelona and Inter Milan. He is the second player in history to score in two UEFA Champions League finals and the fourth player, after Marcel Desailly, Paulo Sousa, and Gerard Piqué, to have won the trophy two years in a row with different teams.[
As a member of the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team, Eto'o was a part of the squad that won the Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics2000 Olympic tournament. He has also participated in three FIFA World CupWorld Cups and six Africa Cup of Nations (being champion twice) and is the all-time leading scorer in the history of the Africa Cup of Nations, with 18 goals. He is also Cameroon's Top international association football goal scorers by countryall-time leading scorer and third Cameroon national football team#Most capped .26 top scorersmost capped player, with 56 goals from 118 caps. He announced his retirement from international football on 27 August 2014.

Gary Gillespie.name: Gary Gillespie
Gary Gillespie.intro: '''Gary Thompson Gillespie''' (born 5 July 1960) is a ScotlandScottish former professional football defender (football)defender who played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool through much of their dominant period of the 1980s.

Dennis Bailey (footballer, born 1965).name: Dennis Bailey (footballer, born 1965)
Dennis Bailey (footballer, born 1965).intro:
'''Dennis Lincoln Bailey''' (born 13 December 1965 in Lambeth, London) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer.
Bailey started his career at Watford F.C.Watford playing in their youth and reserve sides between 1982 and 1984. He subsequently joined Barking F.C.Barking, before joining Fulham F.C.Fulham on non-contract terms in November 1986. He signed for Farnborough Town F.C.Farnborough Town in February 1987, before returning to league football in December 1987 with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, joining for a fee of £10,000. He was loaned to Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers in February 1989, before joining Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in August of the same year. He was loaned to Bristol Rovers again in March 1991.
Bailey signed for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers for £175,000 in July 1991. He made his debut on the opening day of the 1991-92 in English football1991–92 season against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, scoring in a 1–1 draw.
On 1 January 1992 he scored a hat-trick in a 4–1 win away at league leaders Manchester United F.C.Manchester United; one of the last league games to be broadcast live by ITV (TV network)ITV. He is the last player to have achieved the feat in the league at Old Trafford (football)Old Trafford. The only player to do so since was Real Madrid's Ronaldo in the 2002–03 UEFA Champions League. Bailey though, is the last player to date to score a hat-trick at Old Trafford and be on the winning side (Madrid ultimately lost their game 4–3).
In total Bailey played 39 league games for QPR, scoring 10 goals. He was soon frozen out of the first team by the likes of Gary Penrice and Bradley Allen, and in October 1993 he was loaned to Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and later that season to Watford. While with Watford he scored in three successive games after coming off the substitutes bench, greatly helping the club's escape from the relegation zone.
Bailey was loaned to Brentford F.C.Brentford in January 1995, before signing for Gillingham F.C.Gillingham in August of the same year, helping them win promotion from Division Three that season. He subsequently played for Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, before moving into non-league football for a second spell with Farnborough F.C.Farnborough Town. He then moved on to play for Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers, League of Wales side Aberystwyth Town F.C.Aberystwyth Town, Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, Stafford Rangers F.C.Stafford Rangers and Moor Green F.C.Moor Green. His final club was Midland Football Alliance side Stratford Town F.C.Stratford Town from whom he retired in November 2006. He then went on to do coaching, often helping coach a Saturday morning football group in Monkspath in the West Midlands (county)West Midlands. Bailey now coaches and plays for his local Church Renewal Christian Centre in Solihull. They play in the West Midlands Christian Football League.cite web
url=
title=Past Masters – Dennis Bailey
date=16 February 2011
publisher=Gillingham F.C. Official Website
accessdate=9 June 2011

Kevin Davies.name: Kevin Davies
Kevin Davies.intro:
'''Kevin Cyril Davies''' (born 26 March 1977) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End.
Davies originally made his name as a vital part of the Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield team which reached the FA Cup Semi-finalssemi-finals of the FA Cup in 1996-97 in English football1997. He left Chesterfield at the end of that season, having made 148 appearances for the club and joined Premier League side Southampton F.C.Southampton in May 1997. He only spent one season at Southampton, making 30 appearances, before he joined Premier League side Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in a club-record £7.5 million deal. Once again, he spent a single season at the club, making 29 appearances, before rejoining Southampton in 1999. In his second spell at the club, he made 95 appearances, also spending part of 2002 on loan to Football League Division OneDivision 1 side Millwall F.C.Millwall, where he made 9 appearances. Released by Southampton at the end of the 2002-03 Southampton F.C. season2002–03 season, he joined Premier League side Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers on a free transfer. He was made Bolton captain (association football)team captain in January 2009, but began to fall out of favour at Bolton towards the end of the 2012-13 Bolton Wanderers F.C. season2012–13 season, and the club decided against renewing his contract. In total, Davies made 407 appearances for Bolton Wanderers, scoring 85 goals. He joined current club Preston North End in July 2013.
He made three appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side between 1997 and 2000. At the age of 33, Davies made his international debut for England national football teamEngland against Montenegro national football teamMontenegro in a 0–0 draw on 12 October 2010, coming on as a second-half substitute.

Nemanja Mati\u0107.name: Nemanja Matić
Nemanja Mati\u0107.intro:
'''Nemanja Matić''' (Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic: Немања Матић; born 1 August 1988) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Serbia national football teamSerbia national team as a defensive midfielder. Matic is widely applauded for his consistently good performances on the pitch and is regarded by many as one of the best defensive midfielders of world football.
He began his career at hometown team FK Jedinstvo UbJedinstvo Ub and Slovak side MFK Košice before joining Chelsea for £1.5 million in 2009. Used sparingly during his first spell at Stamford Bridge (stadium)Stamford Bridge, he spent the 2010–11 Eredivisie2010–11 season on loan at Dutch club Vitesse, and in January 2011 he moved to S.L. BenficaBenfica in a swap deal involving David Luiz. Matić returned to Chelsea three years later, for £21 million. He has been a full international for Serbia since 2008.
Nemanja Mati\u0107.birth_place: birth_place,Serbia,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Oriol Romeu.name: Oriol Romeu
Oriol Romeu.intro:
'''Oriol Romeu Vidal''' (born 24 September 1991) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for German club VfB Stuttgart on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. Mainly a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder, he can also operate as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.[
He began his career at FC BarcelonaBarcelona, playing mainly in FC Barcelona Bits reserves. In 2011, he joined Chelsea for €5 million, who have loaned him to Valencia CFValencia and Stuttgart.
Romeu has represented Spain up to Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, and was part of their Spain national under-17 football teamunder-17 team which won the 2008 UEFA European Under-17 Championship2008 European Championship. He also represented the country at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics.

Tony Warner.name: Tony Warner
Tony Warner.intro:
'''Anthony Randolph "Tony" Warner''' (born 11 May 1974) is an EnglandEnglish-born Trinidad and Tobago professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley and is a coach at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.
Warner notably played in the Premier League for Fulham F.C.Fulham, having also being contracted to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City without playing. He has also played in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic and Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen and in the Football League with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers.
At international level, he was capped twice by Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago.

Juliano Belletti.name: Juliano Belletti
Juliano Belletti.intro: '''Juliano Haus Belletti''' (born 20 June 1976) is a Brazilian former professional Association footballfootballer who mostly played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back. He was awarded the Silver Ball by ''Placar'' for his consistently great performances for Clube Atlético MineiroAtlético Mineiro during the 1999 Brazilian Série A.[
Juliano Belletti.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Matija Nastasi\u0107.name: Matija Nastasić
Matija Nastasi\u0107.intro:
'''Matija Nastasić''' (; born 28 March 1993) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for German club Schalke 04 and the Serbia national football teamSerbia national team as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back.
He began his career at FK PartizanPartizan, and after a loan to FK TeleoptikTeleoptik joined Fiorentina in 2011.
