After one season there he transferred to Manchester City for €15 million and a swap with Stefan Savić, winning the Premier League in 2014, despite injury problems. In 2015 he joined Schalke, initially on loan.
Nastasić made his senior international debut for Serbia in 2012, and has gone on to earn over 15 caps.

Jack Hobbs.name: Jack Hobbs
Jack Hobbs.intro: '''Jack Hobbs''' (born 18 August 1988) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.

Stephen Hughes (footballer, born 1976).name: Stephen Hughes (footballer, born 1976)
Stephen Hughes (footballer, born 1976).intro: '''Stephen John Hughes''' (born 18 September 1976 in Wokingham) is an English former Association footballfootballer, who most recently played as a midfielder for Walsall F.C.Walsall. He signed as a free agent, following his release from Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, where he rejected a new contract.

Graham Potter.name: Graham Potter
Graham Potter.intro: '''Graham Stephen Potter''' (born 20 May 1975) is an English former association footballfootballer who made 320 career league appearances and is now a coach in Sweden.

Gary Bannister.name: Gary Bannister
Gary Bannister.intro:
'''Gary Bannister''' (born 22 July 1960) is a former EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who played for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City (two spells), Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Darlington F.C.Darlington.
He had a long 17 year career lasting from 1978 to 1995 during which time he made 564 appearances in league and cup matches plus 42 as substitute. Bannister played as a striker (football)striker, being just 5 foot 7 inches (170 cm) tall and weighing little over 11 stone (70 kg) he relied on his pace and skill to score 199 career goals in all competitions. He made one appearance for the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under 21 team against Poland national football teamPoland in April 1982.

Marcelo Martins Moreno.name: Marcelo Martins Moreno
Marcelo Martins Moreno.intro: '''Marcelo Martins Moreno''' (born 18 June 1987 in Santa Cruz de la Sierra), is a Bolivian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Chinese Super League side Changchun Yatai F.C.Changchun Yatai and Bolivia national football teamBolivian national team.

Raheem Sterling.name: Raheem Sterling
Raheem Sterling.intro:
'''Raheem Shaquille Sterling''' (born 8 December 1994) is a Jamaican-born English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (soccer)winger, Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder or Forward (association football)striker for Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the England national football teamEngland national team. He received the Golden Boy (award)Golden Boy award for 2014 from a pan-European panel of sports journalists, recognising him as the best under-21 player playing in Europe.
Sterling began his career at Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers before signing for Liverpool in 2010. He represented England at England under-16 national football teamunder-16, England under-17 national football teamunder-17 and England under-21 national football teamunder-21 level before being capped at full level by the national side in November 2012, and performed at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Michael Mancienne.name: Michael Mancienne
Michael Mancienne.intro:
'''Michael Ian Hugh Mancienne''' (born 8 January 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Nottingham Forest as a Defender (association football)defender.
Schooled primarily as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back, Mancienne can also play as a Midfielder (association football)defensive midfielder as well as both fullback positions as he showed during appearances for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and multiple loan spells at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
He is a former England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 player, having received his first call-up for the England national football teamsenior squad in November 2008, ahead of a friendly against Germany national football teamGermany.

Wes Brown.name: Wes Brown
Wes Brown.intro:
'''Wesley Michael "Wes" Brown''' (born 13 October 1979) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. Before joining Sunderland, Brown had spent his entire career at Old Trafford, having joined the Manchester United F.C.Manchester United youth team in 1996. He made his senior debut in 1998 and became a regular first team player in the 1998–99 season, in which he was part of the club's Treble (association football)Treble-winning team. After a year-long hiatus due to injury, Brown became a regular fixture in the first team from 2000 onwards. Over the next eight years he won numerous honours, including four more Premier League titles, an FA Cup, a Football League CupLeague Cup, and another UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League. Manager Alex Ferguson has stated that Brown is "without question the best natural defender this club has had for years."
Brown earned his first England cap in 1999 and was selected to play at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup. He played in the UEFA Euro 2008 UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying#Group Equalifiers but England failed to progress to the final tournament. He scored his first international goal in 2008 against the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic. Brown announced his retirement from international football on 8 August 2010, just a day after being recalled to the England squad by Fabio Capello.

Steve Gohouri.name: Steve Gohouri
Steve Gohouri.intro:
'''Lohoré Steve Ulrich Gohouri''' (born 8 February 1981), known as '''Steve Gohouri''', is an Ivory CoastIvorian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for German club FC Rot-Weiß Erfurt.
Gohouri started his career in France, playing in the youth teams at CS Brétigny and Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain. Due to a lack of first team opportunities, he had a brief spell in Israel with Bnei Yehuda Tel Aviv F.C.Bnei Yehuda before moving to Switzerland and joining Yverdon-Sport FCYverdon-Sport. He spent the next seven seasons in the Swiss leagues, later playing for FC VaduzVaduz, where he made his debut in European competition, and BSC Young BoysYoung Boys, where he won a runners-up medal in the Swiss Cup.
In 2007, he signed for Borussia Mönchengladbach in the Bundesliga. He struggled to become a regular in the first team, and was eventually demoted to the reserves in 2009. He was released by the club at the end of the year, and signed for Premier League side Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He has also represented Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire at international level, but has only played sporadically since first appearing for his country in 2006.

Elliott Omozusi.name: Elliott Omozusi
Elliott Omozusi.intro: '''Elliott Junior Uyi Omozusi''' (born on 15 December 1988) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient. Omozusi has previously played for Fulham F.C.Fulham, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and is in his second spell with Leyton Orient, his first contract having been terminated following a criminal conviction. He plays primarily at right back, but can also play in the centre of defence, or adapt as a midfielder if required.

Vurnon Anita.name: Vurnon Anita
Vurnon Anita.intro: '''Vurnon San Benito Anita''' (born 4 April 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team.

Chris Bart-Williams.name: Chris Bart-Williams
Chris Bart-Williams.intro:
'''Christopher Gerald Bart-Williams''' (born 16 June 1974 in Freetown, Sierra Leone) is a former Association footballfootballer. His position was Defender (football)defence or Midfieldermidfield.
Although born in Freetown, Sierra Leone, Bart-Williams grew up in North London and attended Greig City AcademySt. David's School and St Katharine in Hornsey. He represented his school, borough (Haringey), county (Middlesex), and adopted country (England national football teamEngland) at youth level and went on to play for England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s and was called up to train with the senior squad although he never won a full England cap.
He is currently an assistant coach for SoccerPlus Connecticut, a women's team in the Women's Premier Soccer LeagueWPSL in America.[

Jari Litmanen.name: Jari Litmanen
Jari Litmanen.intro:
'''Jari Olavi Litmanen''' () (born 20 February 1971 in Lahti) is a FinlandFinnish former association footballfootballer. He was the first-choice Captain (association football)captain of the Finland national football team between 1996–2008 in an international career that ran from 1989 to 2010.
He is widely considered to be Finland's greatest football player of all time. He was chosen as the best Finnish player of the last 50 years by the Football Association of Finland in the UEFA Jubilee Awards in November 2003. Litmanen also finished 42nd in the Suuret suomalaiset100 Greatest Finns voting in 2004. The Association of Football Statisticians' (The AFS) compendium of 'Greatest Ever Footballers' listed Litmanen as the 53rd best footballer ever.
In Finland, he is often called 'Litti' (after Pierre Littbarski), which dates from his early years, and is also known as 'Kuningas' ('The King').
During his club career, he represented Reipas LahtiReipas, Helsingin JalkapalloklubiHJK, MyPa and FC LahtiLahti in Finland and AFC AjaxAjax, Barcelona, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, FC Hansa RostockHansa Rostock and Malmö abroad. Once considered one of the best Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielders in the world, he became the first Finnish footballing superstar while playing for Ajax in the mid-1990s, winning the 1994–95 UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League in 1995, the peak year of his career.
His later career was marred by injuries, and he was unable to repeat the success of his Ajax years either at Barcelona or Liverpool, often finding himself on the bench, despite some impressive performances for the latter. Writing about Litmanen in 2009, Paul Simpson, former ''FourFourTwo'' editor, went as far as to assert that "his career has not been worthy of his talent".

Paolo Di Canio.name: Paolo Di Canio
Paolo Di Canio.intro:
'''Paolo Di Canio''' (born 9 July 1968) is an Italian former professional Association footballfootballer. He made over 500 league appearances and scored over one hundred goals in the course of his playing career before moving into management. During his playing days he primarily played as a forward (association football)forward but could also play as an attacking midfielder.
Di Canio began his career in the Italian Serie A, playing for S.S. LazioLazio, Juventus F.C.Juventus, S.S.C. NapoliNapoli and A.C. Milan, before a brief spell with the Scottish club Celtic F.C.Celtic. He subsequently spent seven years in the English Premier League with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He returned to Italy in 2004, playing for Lazio and Atletico Roma F.C.Cisco Roma before retiring in 2008. He played for the Italy national under-21 football teamItalian under-21s but was never capped for the Italy national football teamsenior team.
Among the individual awards he received as a player, Di Canio was named SPFA Players' Player of the Year in 1997 and West Ham's West Ham United F.C.#Hammer of the Yearplayer of the season in 2000. However, his career was at times characterised by controversy: he received an eleven-match ban in 1998 for pushing a referee and attracted negative publicity over his self-proclaimed allegiance to Italian fascismfascism.
In 2011, Di Canio entered football management in England with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, guiding them in his first full season as manager to promotion to Football League OneLeague One. He was appointed as the Sunderland F.C.Sunderland manager at the end of March 2013. His controversial appointment lasted 13 games until he was sacked on 22 September after Sunderland had won only three games under his managership.

Milan Baro\u0161.name: Milan Baroš
Milan Baro\u0161.intro:
'''Milan Baroš''' (; born 28 October 1981) is a Czech RepublicCzech Association footballfootball Forward (association football)#Forwardstriker who currently plays for FC Baník OstravaBaník Ostrava in the Czech First League.
In 2005, he was part of the Liverpool F.C.Liverpool team which won the 2004–05 UEFA Champions LeagueUEFA Champions League. He went on to win Ligue 1 with Olympique LyonnaisLyon in 2007, the FA Cup with Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 2008 and the Süper Lig with Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray in 2012. He has also had spells with Baník Ostrava, where he started his career, and English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.
Born in Valašské Meziříčí, Baroš represented the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic international team in 93 matches, scoring on 41 occasions. He won the UEFA Euro 2004#AwardsGolden Boot as top scorer of the UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 tournament, where his nation reached the semi-finals. He went on to play in three more major international tournaments. His 41 goals for the Czech Republic is second behind only Jan Koller.

Chris Day.name: Chris Day
Chris Day.intro:
'''Christopher Nicholas "Chris" Day''' (born 28 July 1975) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Stevenage F.C.Stevenage.
Day started his career at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, where he spent five years, making one Premier League appearance for the North London side. He joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace for a fee of £225,000 in July 1996, whom he played regularly for throughout the 1996–97 in English football1996–97 season. The following season Day signed for Watford F.C.Watford, but only played twice in two seasons at the club. However, during the 1999–2000 in English football1999–2000 season, he made 11 appearances for the club in the Premier League. He spent a further season at the club, before joining Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City on a three-month deal in December 2000. On return to his parent club, he was released, and later joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, spending three and a half years at the club – whilst also having brief spells on loan at Aylesbury United F.C.Aylesbury United and Preston North End F.C.Preston North End respectively.
He left QPR in 2005, and signed for Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic ahead of the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 season. He played for the club for a season before joining Millwall F.C.Millwall in the summer of 2006. After two seasons with Millwall, Day signed for his local club, Stevenage, on a free transfer in August 2008. He was part of the club's successful FA Trophy campaign during the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season, as well as playing an instrumental role in the Hertfordshire club earning promotion to the Football League for the first time in the club's history the following season. During the 2010–11 in English football2010–11 season, Day helped guide the club to back-to-back promotions following their sixth place finish and subsequent 2011 Football League Two play-off FinalLeague Two play-off victory in May 2011. Day has also represented the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 squad six times between 1996 and 1997.

Sa\u0161a \u0106ur\u010di\u0107.name: Saša Ćurčić
Sa\u0161a \u0106ur\u010di\u0107.intro:
'''Saša Ćurčić''' (Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic: Саша Ћурчић; born 14 February 1972) is a Serbian former Association footballfootball midfielder.
Known for his eccentricity (behavior)eccentricity, Ćurčić played for OFK Beograd (1991–93), FK PartizanPartizan (1993–95), Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers (1995–96), Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa (1996–98), Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace (1998–99), MetroStars (1999), and Motherwell F.C.Motherwell (2000). In Serbia, he goes by the nickname '''Đani''' ''(Gianni)''.
He also turned out 14 times for the national team of Yugoslavia.

Iain Dowie.name: Iain Dowie
Iain Dowie.intro:
'''Iain Dowie''' (born 9 January 1965) is an EnglandEnglish-born Northern Irish Coach (sport)football manager, former professional Association footballfootballer and sports television pundit.
As a player he was a striker (association football)striker from 1983 until 2001, notably in the Premier League for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He earned 59 caps for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, scoring 12 goals. He also played in the Football League for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Fulham F.C.Fulham and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, and in Non-league for Cheshunt F.C.Cheshunt, St Albans City F.C.St Albans City and Hendon F.C.Hendon. After retiring from playing he went on to manage Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City (Football Management Consultant).

Nick Powell.name: Nick Powell
Nick Powell.intro: '''Nicholas Edward "Nick" Powell''' (born 23 March 1994) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He has also represented England at all youth levels from England national under-16 football teamunder-16 to England national under-21 football teamunder-21. He began his career at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, initially as a Forward (association football)forward, making his debut at the age of 16. After impressing for Crewe during the 2011–12 Crewe Alexandra F.C. season2011–12 season, including scoring in their 2–0 victory in the 2012 Football League Two play-off FinalLeague Two play-off Final, he moved to Manchester United in the summer of 2012.

Gary Locke (Scottish footballer).name: Gary Locke (Scottish footballer)
Gary Locke (Scottish footballer).intro: '''Gary Locke''' (born 16 June 1975 in Edinburgh) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootball player and manager.

Andrej Kramari\u0107.name: Andrej Kramarić
Andrej Kramari\u0107.intro:
'''Andrej Kramarić''' (; born 19 June 1991) is a Croatian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Premier League club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team.
Kramarić started his football career in his hometown club Dinamo Zagreb and holds the record as the top youth goalscorer in the club's history. Hailed as one of the club`s biggest talents, he made his first official appearance for Dinamo at the age of 17. In 2013, after he had a dispute with Dinamo Zagreb board, Kramarić was transferred to HNK Rijeka where he scored 37 times in 42 league games prior to his move to Leicester City.
He was capped 53 times at the youth level for the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team, scoring twenty-two goals. Kramarić took part at the 2010 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship where he made four appearances for Croatian side which reached the semi-finals. He made his debut for the senior team in 2014.

Moussa Demb\u00e9l\u00e9 (footballer, bo.name: Moussa Dembélé (footballer, born 1996)
Moussa Demb\u00e9l\u00e9 (footballer, bo.intro: '''Moussa Dembélé''' (born 12 July 1996) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for English club Fulham F.C.Fulham.

Leigh Jenkinson.name: Leigh Jenkinson
Leigh Jenkinson.intro:
'''Leigh Jenkinson''' (born 9 July 1969) is an English former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1987 until 2003.
He notably played in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, and in the Scottish Premier League for St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, Hearts F.C.Hearts and Dundee United F.C.Dundee United. He also appeared in the Football League for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He finished his career in non-League football with Barrow A.F.C.Barrow and Goole A.F.C.Goole.

Paul Brooker.name: Paul Brooker
Paul Brooker.intro: '''Paul Brooker''' (born 25 November 1976 in Hammersmith, London) is a professional association footballfootballer. He is a Winger (soccer)right-winger who can also deputise on the left wing if needed.

Calum Chambers.name: Calum Chambers
Calum Chambers.intro:
'''Calum Chambers''' (born 20 January 1995) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a right back and central defender.
Originally a member of Southampton F.C.Southampton's Southampton F.C. Academyacademy system, Chambers was promoted to the first team at the beginning of the 2012–13 Southampton F.C. season2012–13 campaign. After two seasons with the club, he moved to fellow Premier League side Arsenal.
Chambers made his senior international debut for the England national football teamEngland national team in 2014.

Clyde Wijnhard.name: Clyde Wijnhard
Clyde Wijnhard.intro:
'''Clyde Wijnhard''' (born 1 November 1973 in Paramaribo, Suriname) is a former NetherlandsDutch professional association footballfootball player.
In a career spanning over ten years, Wijnhard played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Oldham Athletic, RKC Waalwijk, Willem II TilburgWillem II, S.C. Beira-Mar and Brentford F.C.Brentford.
Wijnhard appeared most recently for Bramham FC of the Harrogate and District Association Football League, who he joined in the summer of 2006.
On 6 September 2009, Wijnhard guest-starred for the Aston Villa Old Stars in a charity match against Solihull Consultants & GP's at Solihull Moors F.C.Solihull Moors' ground. He scored in the 8–1 victory.
Clyde ran an eco-friendly lighting company until 2013.
He also helps young Dutch footballers gain trials at English clubs.

Simon Coleman.name: Simon Coleman
Simon Coleman.intro:
'''Simon Coleman''' (born 13 March 1968 in Worksop) is a retired EnglandEnglish association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender. He played 475 competitive games in English football and appeared in the Premier League for both Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. His career at Bolton may have reached greater heights in the Premier League had his leg not been broken in a tackle by Derby County F.C.Derby County's Marco Gabbiadini in February 1995.
After that he worked at a football academy in Mansfield. He now works at Garibaldi College.
Simon Coleman.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Souleymane Diawara.name: Souleymane Diawara
Souleymane Diawara.intro: '''Souleymane Diawara''' (born 24 December 1978) is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for OGC Nice and the Senegal national football teamSenegal national team.

Modou Barrow.name: Modou Barrow
Modou Barrow.intro:
'''Modou "Mo" Barrow''' (born 13 October 1992) is a Swedish–Gambian Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He has the distinction of being the first Gambian footballer to play in the Premier League – Omar Koroma spent two seasons at Portsmouth from 2008-10, but failed to make an appearance.Cite news

David Hughes (footballer, born 1972).name: David Hughes (footballer, born 1972)
David Hughes (footballer, born 1972).intro: '''David Robert Hughes''' (born 30 December 1972) is a Welsh association footballfootballer, who spent six seasons in the Premier League with Southampton F.C.Southampton, playing as a midfielder.

Miroslav Stoch.name: Miroslav Stoch
Miroslav Stoch.intro:
'''Miroslav "Miňo" Stoch''' (born 19 October 1989) is a SlovakiaSlovak professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for UAE Arabian Gulf League side Al Ain FCAl Ain on loan from Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)Fenerbahçe, and the Slovakia national football team.
He has earned 45 caps for Slovakia since his debut in 2009, and was included in their squad for the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
On 7 January 2013, he won the FIFA Puskás Award for the best goal of 2012, ahead of Neymar  and Radamel Falcao. He bases his game on his two footballing idols Ronaldinho and Ronaldo and tries to emulate them on the pitch.

Kostas Konstantinidis.name: Kostas Konstantinidis
Kostas Konstantinidis.intro: '''Konstantinos Konstantinidis''' (born 31 August 1972 in Schorndorf, Baden-Württemberg) is a German-born GreeksGreek former Association footballfootball player and current manager.

Thierry Bonalair.name: Thierry Bonalair
Thierry Bonalair.intro: '''Thierry Bonalair''' (born June 14, 1966 in Paris) is a FranceFrench former Football (soccer)footballer. He is currently chief scout for Lille.

Paul Rachubka.name: Paul Rachubka
Paul Rachubka.intro:
'''Paul Stephen Rachubka''' (surname pronounced ''ra-HUB-ka'') (born 21 May 1981) is an United StatesAmerican-EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra.
Born in San Luis Obispo, CaliforniaSan Luis Obispo, California, to an English mother and an American father, Rachubka possesses dual nationality, having moved to England with his family when he was seven years old. He has represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-18 football teamunder-18 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 levels.

Espen Baardsen.name: Espen Baardsen
Espen Baardsen.intro:
'''Espen Baardsen''' (born 7 December 1977 in San Rafael, California, USA) is a former Association footballfootballer. He played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Born in the United States to NorwayNorwegian parents, he was selected for the USA under-18 national team before switching his FIFA eligibility rulesinternational eligibility to Norway national football teamNorway because of his dual nationality.

Ray Wilkins.name: Ray Wilkins
Ray Wilkins.intro:
'''Raymond Colin "Ray" Wilkins''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 14 September 1956) is an English Association footballfootball manager, former player, and television pundit who is currently the manager of the Jordan national football teamJordan national team.
He was a key midfielder for the England national football team during the 1980s, and enjoyed success at various clubs including Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, A.C. MilanMilan, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, and Rangers F.C.Rangers.
The son of professional footballer George Wilkins (footballer)George Wilkins; he has two sisters and three footballer brothers: Graham Wilkins (born 28 June 1955 in Hillingdon), a former professional, who played in the Football League as a full-back for Chelsea, Brentford F.C.Brentford, and Southend United F.C.Southend United; former Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion manager and player, Dean Wilkins; and Stephen Wilkins, who was signed by Chelsea and later made one appearance for Brentford, before playing for a number of Non-League footballnon-league teams, including Dagenham F.C.Dagenham and Hayes F.C.Hayes.

Douglas Rinaldi.name: Douglas Rinaldi
Douglas Rinaldi.intro: '''Douglas Rinaldi''' (born 29 August 1979) is a former Brazilian association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. He retired in 2013.

Adie Mike.name: Adie Mike
Adie Mike.intro:
'''Adrian Roosevelt "Adie" Mike''' (born 16 November 1973) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a striker (football)forward from 1992 to 2004.
He notably played in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, and in the Football League for Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City.

Liam Moore.name: Liam Moore
Liam Moore.intro: '''Liam Simon Moore''' (born 31 January 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Brentford F.CBrentford, on loan from Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, as a Defender (association football)#Full backright back and Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back.
Liam Moore.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Rory Ginty.name: Rory Ginty
Rory Ginty.intro: '''Rory Ginty''' (born 23 January 1977 in Galway) is a former Irish peopleIrish association footballfootball who played as a midfielder.

Gabriele Ambrosetti.name: Gabriele Ambrosetti
Gabriele Ambrosetti.intro:
'''Gabriele Ambrosetti''' (born 7 August 1973) is a former Football in ItalyItalian footballer who played as a winger.
Born in Varese, he played for several Italian sides, including Brescia CalcioBrescia and Vicenza CalcioVicenza. He won the 1996–97 Coppa Italia at Vicenza,cite web
url=
title=1996/97 Coppa Italia
publisher=gazzetta.it
accessdate=11 November 2013 and in April 1998 played in a Cup Winners Cup semi-final against Chelsea, inspiring the English Premier League club to sign him for £3.5 million in August 1999. He arrived as, according to his manager, Gianluca Vialli, the 'Italian Ryan Giggs', but struggled to live up to the tag and in four years made only a handful of appearances. He made his Chelsea debut as a substitute on 21 August in a 1–0 home win against Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, replacing compatriot Gianfranco Zola for the last three minutes.  The only goal he scored for Chelsea was in a 5–0 win against Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray in Istanbul, on 20 October 1999 during the UEFA Champions League Group Stage.cite news
url=
title=Flo inspires Chelsea exhibition
publisher=The Independent
date=21 October 1999 accessdate=5 November 2009
location=London
first=Mark
last=Bradley

Robert Warzycha.name: Robert Warzycha
Robert Warzycha.intro:
'''Robert Warzycha''' () (born 20 August 1963 in Siemkowice) is a PolandPolish former professional association football player currently serving as manager of Górnik Zabrze.
Warzycha had a long career in Europe, playing for teams in Poland, Hungary and England with Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League. He won two Polish Ekstraklasa titles and a Polish SuperCupPolish Super Cup with Górnik Zabrze. Warzycha was also a regular member of the Poland national football team throughout the late 1980s and early 1990s, amassing 47 caps.
He moved to the United States in 1996 and subsequently spent seven seasons in Major League Soccer with Columbus Crew. He later served as a coach for the team, serving as head coach for five seasons.

Andr\u00e9 Santos.name: André Santos
Andr\u00e9 Santos.intro: '''André Clarindo dos Santos''' (born 8 March 1983), more commonly known as '''André Santos''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who has previously featured for the Brazil national football team and currently plays for Figueirense FCFigueirense in the Campeonato Brasileiro Série A, of whom he is a youth product and for whom he made his senior debut in a friendly game against Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians. Santos is a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back, who can also be deployed as a Midfielder (association football)#Wingerleft winger.  On 15 June 2009, he made his first international appearance as a substitute in a match against Egypt national football teamEgypt. Santos participated and helped Brazil capture the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup. He joined Arsenal F.C.Arsenal from Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)Fenerbahçe in August 2011.
Andr\u00e9 Santos.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Riga Mustapha.name: Riga Mustapha
Riga Mustapha.intro: '''Rahamat Riga Mustapha''' (born 10 October 1981) is an  Ghanaian-born Dutch professional association footballfootballer who last played as a forward (association football)#strikerstriker for Pune F.C. in the Indian I-League.

Paddy Kenny.name: Paddy Kenny
Paddy Kenny.intro:
'''Patrick Joseph "Paddy" Kenny''' (born 17 May 1978) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
Born in Halifax, West YorkshireHalifax, West Yorkshire, Kenny began his career with Bradford Park Avenue before turning professional in the summer of 1998 upon signing for Neil Warnock's Bury F.C.Bury. He was reunited with Warnock in 2002 after he joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United where he spent much of his career and enjoyed notable success; performing in Football League CupLeague Cup and F.A. CupFA Cup Semi-Finals, two Play-Off Finals, a promotion and the Blades' subsequent first Premier League campaign for twelve years in 2006.
Kenny would later sign for Warnock once again in 2010, joining Queens Park Rangers after his time at Sheffield United ended on a sour note when he spent much of his final season on the sidelines after failing a drugs test the previous summer. During his first season at the Rs, he would achieve his second promotion to the Premier League, picking up Players' and Fans' Player of the Year awards and a Football League ChampionshipChampionship winners medal on the way. He remained as first choice goalkeeper the next season as QPR beat relegation on the final day of the season and was reunited with Warnock for the fourth time when he signed for Leeds in 2012.
Upon his return to Leeds for pre-season training for the 2014/15 season it emerged that Kenny had fallen out of favour with new owner Massimo Cellino. Kenny was left out of Leeds' pre-season training camp in Italy and was replaced in the squad by former Arsenal and Aston Villa goalkeeper Stuart Taylor (footballer, born 1980)Stuart Taylor.

J\u00e9r\u00e9mie Aliadi\u00e8re.name: Jérémie Aliadière
J\u00e9r\u00e9mie Aliadi\u00e8re.intro:
'''Jérémie Aliadière''' (born 30 March 1983) is a FranceFrench Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Umm Salal SCUmm Salal.
As a graduate of the elite Clairefontaine academy, he signed for Arsenal aged 16. After making his Premier League debut in the 2001–02 in English football2001–02 season, he ultimately had limited opportunities, partly due to injury. For the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 season he was loaned to three clubs, Celtic F.C.Celtic in the Scottish Premier League, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in the Premier League, and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in the Football League Championship, before returning to Arsenal for another season, featuring in the 2007 Football League Cup Final loss to Chelsea. At the beginning of the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 season he was sold to Premier League club Middlesbrough for £2.5 million, where he spent the next three seasons, two in the Premier League and the last in the Championship, before electing not to extend his contract and leaving the club in June 2010.
J\u00e9r\u00e9mie Aliadi\u00e8re.position: Midfielder Winger Winger,Forward  association football  Striker

Nicky Southall.name: Nicky Southall
Nicky Southall.intro:
'''Leslie Nicholas "Nicky" Southall''' (born 28 January 1972), is an English professional association footballfootballer who is assistant manager at Isthmian LeagueIsthmian League Premier Division side Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United.
During his time in professional football Southall has competed in the top four tiers of English league football, notably in the Premier League for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He has represented Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in the Football League as well as Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic in Non-league.

David Hirst.name: David Hirst
David Hirst.intro: '''David Eric Hirst'''  (born 7 December 1967) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, an exciting but injury prone striker who played for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday for much of his career. He was also capped three times at senior level for the England team.

Jamie Ashdown.name: Jamie Ashdown
Jamie Ashdown.intro: '''Jamie Lawrence Ashdown''' (born 30 November 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Football League TwoLeague Two side Oxford United F.C.Oxford United.

Paul Davis (footballer, born 1961).name: Paul Davis (footballer, born 1961)
Paul Davis (footballer, born 1961).intro:
'''Paul Vincent Davis''' (born 9 December 1961) is an EnglandEnglish former association footballfootballer.
Born in Dulwich, London, Davis signed for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as an apprentice in 1977 and turned professional the following year. A talented left-footed midfielder, he made his debut in 1980 in a North London local derbyderby against Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, and within a year he was a regular in the Arsenal side, as well as a member of the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 team.
Davis was an integral part of the successful Arsenal side of the late 1980s, winning the Football League CupLeague Cup in 1987 and the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 1989 and 1991. Davis will arguably be best remembered for an incident in 1988 when, during a match, he punched Southampton F.C.Southampton player Glenn Cockerill in the jaw. Cockerill's jaw was broken and following the FA's analysis of TV footage Davis was given a then unprecedented 9-match ban and £3,000 fine.
Despite being left out of the team for a disagreement with Manager George Graham he still appeared 447 times for Arsenal, scoring 37 goals during his career there.
Davis played in both the League Cup and FA Cup finals wins in 1993 as Arsenal chalked up their Cup Double. He also featured in Arsenal's Cup Winners' Cup win against Parma F.C the following year. Although selected for the England senior squad on several occasions, he never made an appearance for the senior team, despite 12-appearances for the Under-21 team, where he captained the side. He also played for the England 'B' team.
Davis was released by Arsenal on a free transfer in the summer of 1995.
After leaving Arsenal, he briefly joined NorwayNorwegian side Stabæk Fotball in 1995. After his spell at Stabæk, appearing in one game as a substitute, he returned to London to join Brentford. He signed on a free transfer in September 1995, but he retired within a year after just five appearances for the Griffin Park side.
Davis returned to Arsenal to become a youth coach in 1996, before leaving the club in 2003. In September 2003 Davis joined The Professional Footballers' Association coaching department. On 27 October 2005, Davis was invited to become assistant manager of Kettering Town F.C. by new manager Paul Gascoigne, he left Kettering at the same time as Gascoigne's departure from the club on 5 December 2005, but continues to work for the Professional Footballer's Association coaching department. Davis has studied and gained the FA and Pro UEFA Coaching awards, the highest coaching award in the U.K. along with his UEFA 'A' Licence and the FA Diploma in Football Management from Warwick University, as well as his coach educators awards. Davis is now a senior coach/coach educator for the organisation and he is also an ambassador for the 'Kick It Out (organisation)Kick It Out' and 'Show Racism the Red Card organisations'.

David White (English footballer).name: David White (English footballer)
David White (English footballer).intro:
'''David White''' (born 30 October 1967) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football) from 1985 to 1998.
He is best remembered for his eight-year spell at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He also played for Leeds United F.C.Leeds and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, and was cap (football)capped once by England national football teamEngland.

S\u00e9amus Coleman.name: Séamus Coleman
S\u00e9amus Coleman.intro: '''Séamus Coleman'''  (born 11 October 1988) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays for Everton F.C.Everton and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. Originally a Gaelic footballer, Coleman started his association football career with Sligo Rovers F.C.Sligo Rovers before moving to English club Everton in 2009. In 2010 he spent half a season on loan with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, helping the team to win promotion via the 2010 Football League Championship play-off Final2010 Championship play-off, before returning to Everton. In his international career Coleman has won the 2011 Nations Cup and was awarded the FAI International Football Awards#Under 21 International Player of the YearFAI Under 21 International Player of the Year in both 2009 and 2010.
S\u00e9amus Coleman.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Ferdinand Coly.name: Ferdinand Coly
Ferdinand Coly.intro:
'''Ferdinand Alexandre Coly''' (born 10 September 1973 in Dakar) is a Senegalese former Association footballfootballer.
Coly moved to France when he was 7 years old.He played in all of Senegal national football teamSenegal's matches in the 2002 FIFA World Cup. After impressing at the tournament, he moved from RC Lens to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City on loan. But this proved to be a poor career move as he only managed a single FA Premier LeaguePremiership appearance, against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. Coly then moved on to A.C. PerugiaPerugia. In his first season with the ItalyItalian club (2003–04), he made 11 appearances but never really impressed. He spent 2004-05 in Serie C (the team descended via playoffs to Serie B then suffered "another relegation", this time in the courts), making 29 appearances and scoring twice. In the summer of 2005 he made a move to Serie A side Parma F.C.Parma, where he has been a regular.
Ferdinand Coly.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Matthew Robinson (footballer, born 1974).name: Matthew Robinson (footballer, born 1974)
Matthew Robinson (footballer, born 1974).intro: '''Matthew Richard Robinson''' (born 23 December 1974 in Exeter) is a professional footballer who currently plays as a Left backfull back for Swindon Supermarine.

Ramon Vega.name: Ramon Vega
Ramon Vega.intro:
'''Ramon Vega''' (born 14 June 1971) is a SwitzerlandSwiss retired Association footballfootballer of SpainSpanish descent who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
During his 13-year professional career he was best known for his spell in England at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, but also had another stint in the United Kingdom, playing in Scotland for Celtic F.C.Celtic.
Ramon Vega.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Collins Mbesuma.name: Collins Mbesuma
Collins Mbesuma.intro: '''Collins Mbesuma''' (born 3 February 1984 in Luanshya) is a Zambian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for South African club Mpumalanga Black Aces. He is nicknamed ''The Hurricane'' or ''Ntofontofo''.

David Ginola.name: David Ginola
David Ginola.intro:
'''David Désiré Marc Ginola''' (; born 25 January 1967) is a French former international Association footballfootball player who has also worked as an actor and model.
Ginola was born in Gassin, Var. He played football for ten seasons in his native France before making the move from Paris Saint-Germain to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in the English Premier League in July 1995. He continued playing in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Everton F.C.Everton before retiring in 2002.  Since his retirement from the game he has become involved in several new pursuits, including acting. Ginola is a regular contributor to BBC, BT and CNN. He hosts 'Match of ze Day' ('MozD'), a program which broadcasts live Premier League matches on Canal+.
On 16 January 2015, Ginola announced his intention to run for the FIFA presidency.

Maurizio Gaudino.name: Maurizio Gaudino
Maurizio Gaudino.intro:
'''Maurizio Gaudino''' (; born 12 December 1966 in Brühl (Baden)Brühl, West Germany) is a retired German Association footballfootball midfielder.
He was capped five times for Germany national football teamGermany in 1993 and 1994, and was in their squad for the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 World Cup.
Gaudino played 294 Bundesliga games for Waldhof Mannheim, VfB Stuttgart, Eintracht Frankfurt and VfL Bochum. He won the league title with Stuttgart in 1992. He also helped them to the 1989 UEFA Cup Final and got himself on the scoresheet in the first leg, although they ultimately lost to a Diego Maradona inspired Napoli.
In 1995 he was loaned out to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and helped the team end the season with some magnificent performances including a 3–2 victory over the league champions that year Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He scored three times in 20 league games, but City still finished 17th in the Premier League (just three places clear of relegation) after a promising early season run of form had hinted at a UEFA Cup place or even a push for the league title.
He transferred to Antalyaspor in 1999 and played for them until Antalyaspor's relegation to TFF First LeagueSecond League A Category in 2001–02 season.
In 2006, Gaudino took part in a charity football match between England and Germany, based on the 1966 FIFA World Cup Final. In a game consisting of celebrities and former players, he was rugby tackled by politician Boris Johnson.
Gaudino is a son of the Italian emigrants from Campania. His son Gianluca GaudinoGianluca is currently on the books of FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich.

Nyron Nosworthy.name: Nyron Nosworthy
Nyron Nosworthy.intro: '''Nyron Paul Henry Nosworthy''' (born 11 October 1980) is an English-born Jamaican Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, on loan from Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. Beginning his career with Gillingham F.C.Gillingham he moved to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2005 with whom he played in the Premier League. After two lengthy loan spells with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United he made a permanent switch to Watford F.C.Watford in 2012 but was released in the summer of 2014 after a loan spell with Bristol City F.C.Bristol City. Born in Brixton, South London, Nosworthy has represented Jamaica national football teamJamaica at international level, playing ten games and scoring once.
Nyron Nosworthy.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Phil Gilchrist.name: Phil Gilchrist
Phil Gilchrist.intro: '''Philip Alexander "Phil" Gilchrist''' (born 25 August 1973) is an English association footballfootballer and was manager at Woking F.C.Woking. He played as a Defender (association football)defender.
Phil Gilchrist.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Lee Hurst.name: Lee Hurst
Lee Hurst.intro:
'''Lee Hurst''' (born 21 September 1970) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder.
He spent his whole English professional career at Coventry City, making his debut at the age of 20 on 2 February 1991 when they lost 1-0 to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon in the Football League First Division at Plough Lane. He made three more league appearances that season and 10 the following season before playing 35 times for the Sky Blues (scoring two goals) in the 1992-93 in English football1992-93 campaign when they were inaugural members of the FA Premier League and finished 15th. [
In 1998 he made a football comeback by appearing 14 times for the American side Charleston Battery.
[//www.footballsquads.co.uk/eng/1993-1994/faprem/coventry.htm]

Jamie Lawrence.name: Jamie Lawrence
Jamie Lawrence.intro:
'''Jamie Lawrence''' (born 8 March 1970) is a association footballfootball coach and former professional player.
He played as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger for Cowes Sports F.C.Cowes Sports, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Brentford F.C.Brentford, Fisher Athletic F.C.Fisher Athletic, Worthing F.C.Worthing, Harrow Borough F.C.Harrow Borough, Margate F.C.Margate, Ashford Town F.C.Ashford Town (where he was player-manager), Banstead Athletic F.C.Banstead Athletic and Cobham F.C.Cobham
Born in England, he represented Jamaica national football teamJamaica at international level.

Tim Ream.name: Tim Ream
Tim Ream.intro: '''Timothy Michael "Tim" Ream''' (born October 5, 1987) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers of the Football League Championship and for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team. He usually plays as a central defender but can be deployed anywhere across the back line.

Roman Pavlyuchenko.name: Roman Pavlyuchenko
Roman Pavlyuchenko.intro:
'''Roman Anatolyevich Pavlyuchenko''' (; born 15 December 1981) is a Russian footballer playing as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Russian club FC Lokomotiv Moscow.
He started his career at Dynamo Stavropol, and Rotor Volgograd, before transferring to FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow in 2003. His performances there earned him a £13.7 million transfer to Tottenham Hotspur of the English Premier League in 2008, where he spent three full seasons before returning to Russia to play for Lokomotiv.
A full international for a decade following his debut in 2003, Pavlyuchenko earned 51 caps for Russia national football teamRussia, and scored 21 international goals. He was named in the Team of the Tournament at Euro 2008, with Russia reaching the semi-finals, and was also in their squad for Euro 2012.

Jakob Kjeldbjerg.name: Jakob Kjeldbjerg
Jakob Kjeldbjerg.intro: '''Jakob Kjeldbjerg Jensen''' (born 21 October 1969) is a DenmarkDanish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)central defender. Kjeldbjerg won 14 Cap (football)caps and scored one goal for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, and represented Denmark at the 1992 Summer Olympics.

Saido Berahino.name: Saido Berahino
Saido Berahino.intro:
'''Saido Berahino''' (born 4 August 1993) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a Forward (association football)striker. Born in Burundi, he represents England at international level.
He spent time out on loan for The Football LeagueFootball League clubs Northampton Town, Brentford F.C.Brentford and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United before breaking into the West Brom squad. His first few matches saw him score a hat-trick against Newport County AFCNewport County, before scoring the winning goal at Old Trafford against Manchester United.
Berahino has the all-time third highest goal-tally for the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 side with 10 goals in 13 appearances, behind Francis Jeffers and Alan Shearer. He was called up for the first time to the England national football teamEngland senior squad in November 2014.

Mathieu Debuchy.name: Mathieu Debuchy
Mathieu Debuchy.intro:
'''Mathieu Debuchy''' ( ; born 28 July 1985) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He is often deployed in the Fullback (association football)#Full-backright back position, but began his career playing as a midfielder usually acting as a Midfielder#Deep-lying_playmakerdeep-lying playmaker.
He spent nine-and-a-half seasons at Lille OSCLille, including a Ligue 1 and Coupe de France double in 2010–11 Lille OSC season2010–11. He joined Newcastle United in January 2013, and was signed by Arsenal in July 2014.
Debuchy made his debut for the France national football team in 2011  and has since earned over 25 caps, playing at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Mathieu Debuchy.position: Association football positions Full back Right back

Mark Yeates.name: Mark Yeates
Mark Yeates.intro: '''Mark Stephen Anthony Yeates''' (born 11 January 1985) is an Irish association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. Born in Tallaght, Republic of IrelandIreland he began his career with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur but failed to make the transition to the first team, spending time on loan at Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.  On leaving Spurs he returned on a permanent deal to Colchester before spells with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Watford F.C.Watford. He has three under-21 cap (sport)caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland.

Paul Walsh.name: Paul Walsh
Paul Walsh.intro:
'''Paul Anthony Walsh''' (born 1 October 1962 in Plumstead, London) is an EnglandEnglish former professional footballer and sports television pundit.
As a player he was a diminutive and pacy striker (football)centre forward who played from 1979 to 1996 and shot to fame in the 1980s during spells with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He also went on to play for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He was capped 5 times by England national football teamEngland scoring 1 goal.

James McFadden.name: James McFadden
James McFadden.intro:
'''James Henry McFadden''' (born 14 April 1983 in Springburn, Glasgow) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who currently plays for St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone in the Scottish Premiership. McFadden was born and raised in Springburn, Glasgow. He attended Turnbull High School in Bishopbriggs.
McFadden started his career with Motherwell F.C.Motherwell. He came to prominence in the 2002–03 season by scoring 19 goals and winning the Scottish PFA Young Player of the Year award. Everton F.C.Everton signed McFadden for £1.25 million in 2003. He struggled to hold down a regular place in the Everton team and moved to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for £5 million in January 2008. A serious injury meant that McFadden missed most of the 2010–11 season and Birmingham, who were relegated in his absence, decided not to renew his contract. McFadden signed for Everton on a free transfer in October 2011, after regaining his fitness, and spent three months with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2012 before returning to Motherwell.
McFadden was first capped by Scotland national football teamScotland in 2002. As of October 2011, he has played 48 times for Scotland and scored 15 goals. His goal for Scotland national football teamScotland in the UEFA Euro 2008 QualifyingEuro 2008 qualification match on 12 September 2007 against France national football teamFrance in the Parc des Princes is regarded as one of Scotland's most famous goals.

Jay Emmanuel-Thomas.name: Jay Emmanuel-Thomas
Jay Emmanuel-Thomas.intro: '''Jay Aston Emmanuel-Thomas''' (born 27 December 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Bristol City FC. A product of the Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal Academy, he is a versatile Forward (association football)forward and can play as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger or Forward (association football)#Centre forwardcentre-forward. In the past he has played in a variety of positions such as fullback, centre back and in the midfield but has now found his best position as a forward.
Jay Emmanuel-Thomas.position: Forward  association football  Striker Striker,Midfielder Winger Winger

Iv\u00e1n Kaviedes.name: Iván Kaviedes
Iv\u00e1n Kaviedes.intro: '''Jaime Iván Kaviedes Llorenty''' (born 24 October 1977) is an Ecuadorian retired association footballfootballer.
