Bobby Mimms.name: Bobby Mimms
Bobby Mimms.intro:
'''Robert Andrew "Bobby" Mimms''' (born 12 October 1963) is an English former association footballfootballer.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1981 until 2001 notably for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in the Premier League when the club won the title in 1995. He also played as a professional for Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, Everton F.C.Everton, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, York City F.C.York City and Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town. He is the current goalkeeping coach at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.

Anders Svensson.name: Anders Svensson
Anders Svensson.intro: '''Anders Gunnar Svensson''' (; born 17 July 1976 in Gothenburg) is a Swedish international Association footballfootballer who plays for Swedish side IF Elfsborg. He is a playmaker and a central midfielder, well known for his passing and set piece abilities. He was capped 148 times for the Sweden national football teamSwedish national football team and has been the captain of the Sweden national football teamSwedish national football team, before he retired from international football in 2013. He is the most capped male player for Sweden after passing Thomas Ravelli's previous record of 143 caps.

Jake Hesketh.name: Jake Hesketh
Jake Hesketh.intro: '''Jake Alexander Hesketh''' (born 27 March 1996) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Matthew Bound.name: Matthew Bound
Matthew Bound.intro: '''Matthew Terence Bound''' (born 9 November 1972) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball defender (association football)defender.

Eric Lichaj.name: Eric Lichaj
Eric Lichaj.intro: '''Eric Joseph Lichaj''' (born November 17, 1988) is an American soccer player who plays for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States men's national team. He started his youth career playing for Chicago Magic and participated in the youth residency program at IMG Academy. He later played college soccer for the North Carolina Tar Heels. After playing one year at the University of North Carolina at Chapel HillUniversity of North Carolina, Lichaj left America to sign with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier League.

Massimo Maccarone.name: Massimo Maccarone
Massimo Maccarone.intro:
'''Massimo Maccarone''' (; born 6 September 1979) is an Italian association football striker currently playing for Empoli F.C.Empoli.
He made headlines in March 2002 when he became the first Serie B player in twenty years to be picked for the Italy national football teamItalian national side. He is nicknamed ''Big Mac''.

P\u00e9ter Kurucz.name: Péter Kurucz
P\u00e9ter Kurucz.intro: '''Péter Kurucz''' (born 30 May 1988) is a HungariansHungarian Association footballfootballer who plays for Ferencvárosi TC as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Steve Bruce.name: Steve Bruce
Steve Bruce.intro:
'''Stephen Roger "Steve" Bruce''' (born 31 December 1960) is an English Association footballfootball manager and former player who is currently the manager at Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. Born in Corbridge, Northumberland, he was a promising schoolboy footballer but was rejected by a number of professional clubs. He was on the verge of quitting the game altogether when he was offered a trial with Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. Bruce was offered an apprenticeship and went on to play more than 200 games for the club before joining Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 1984.
In 1987, he moved to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, with whom he achieved great success, winning the Premier League, FA Cup, Football League Cup and European Cup Winner's Cup. He also became the first English player of the twentieth century to captain a team to Double (association football)The Double. Despite his success on the field, he was never selected to play for the England national football teamEngland national team. Commentators and contemporaries have described him as one of the best English players of the 1980s and 1990s never to play for his country at full international level.
Bruce began his managerial career with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, and spent short periods of time managing Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace before joining Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2001. He twice led Birmingham to Promotion and relegationpromotion to the Premier League during his tenure of nearly six years, but resigned in 2007 to begin a second spell as manager of Wigan. At the end of the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season he resigned to take over as manager of Sunderland A.F.CSunderland, a post he held until he was dismissed in November 2011. Seven months later, he was appointed manager of Hull City, and has since led the club to promotion to the Premier League and the 2014 FA Cup Final.
Steve Bruce.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Curtis Fleming.name: Curtis Fleming
Curtis Fleming.intro: '''Curtis Fleming''' (born 8 October 1968 in Manchester) is an Republic of IrelandIrish former international Football (soccer)footballer who was most recently first team coach at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Fleming played Defender (association football)#Full-backright back and won international honours for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at under-21, under-23 (twice), and senior level. He played youth football for Belvedere F.C.Belvedere before starting his senior career with St Patrick's Athletic F.C.St Patrick's Athletic in the League of Ireland and spent the majority of his career with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. Although born in Manchester, Fleming was raised in Dublin and spent only months in Manchester.
Curtis Fleming.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Roger Joseph.name: Roger Joseph
Roger Joseph.intro:
'''Roger Anthony Joseph''' (born December 24, 1965 in Paddington, England) is a former Association footballfootballer who is most notable for playing for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon and then going on to play for AFC Wimbledon. Joseph's other clubs include Brentford F.C.Brentford, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.
Joseph's older brother, Francis Joseph (footballer)Francis, also played for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon & Brentford F.C.Brentford.
He last played for Wimbledon in 1994, but his career was then affected by injury. He was signed by Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient in 1996, followed by West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in 1997. He also earned 2 England B caps.

Nacho Monreal.name: Nacho Monreal
Nacho Monreal.intro:
'''Ignacio "Nacho" Monreal Eraso''' (; born 26 February 1986) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
He started playing with CA OsasunaOsasuna in 2005, going on to appear in 144 official games over the course of five La Liga seasons. In 2011 he signed with Málaga CFMálaga and, two years later, joined Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.
A full international since 2009, Monreal represented Spain national football teamSpain at the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup2013 Confederations Cup.
Nacho Monreal.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

John Dreyer.name: John Dreyer
John Dreyer.intro: '''John Brian Dreyer''' (born 11 June 1963) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played in Defender (football)defence and midfieldermidfield. After retiring, he became a manager.

Jonathan Fortune.name: Jonathan Fortune
Jonathan Fortune.intro: '''Jonathan Jay Fortune''' (born 23 August 1980) is an English professional Association footballfootballer.

Dougie Freedman.name: Dougie Freedman
Dougie Freedman.intro:
'''Douglas "Dougie" Freedman ''' ( ; born 25 May 1974) is a ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootball manager and former player, who currently manages Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
Freedman played as a striker, primarily for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and also had spells as a player at Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Barnet F.C.Barnet, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Southend United F.C.Southend United. Freedman had two caps for the Scotland national football teamScottish national football team where he scored one goal in a 2002 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)#Group 62002 World Cup qualifier against Latvia national football teamLatvia.
Freedman started his managerial career with Crystal Palace in 2011. He moved to fellow Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in 2012, but left this position in October 2014. He became manager of Nottingham Forest in February 2015.

Andy Ducros.name: Andy Ducros
Andy Ducros.intro:
'''Andy Ducros''' (born 16 September 1977 in Evesham) is an English football (soccer)footballer who plays for Redditch United.
Ducros began his career at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City as a trainee in 1993. He failed to break into the first team at Coventry at was sold on to Nuneaton Borough A.F.C.Nuneaton Borough in 1999. He has since played for Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers and Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion, after release from his contract in June 2007, he moved onto Solihull Moors.

Nikica Jelavi\u0107.name: Nikica Jelavić
Nikica Jelavi\u0107.intro:
'''Nikica Jelavić''' (; born 27 August 1985) is a Croatian Association footballfootballer, who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Premier League club Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.
He started his career with Prva HNL side Hajduk Split in 2002, before moving to Belgian Pro League club S.V. Zulte WaregemZulte Waregem in 2007. A year later, he moved to Austrian Football BundesligaAustrian Bundesliga club SK Rapid WienRapid Wien. In 2010 he was signed by ScotlandScottish club Rangers F.C.Rangers, with whom he won the Scottish Premier League and the Scottish League Cup in 2010-11 Rangers F.C. seasonhis first season. He moved to England with Everton F.C.Everton in January 2012, and Hull City two years later.
Jelavić is a former Croatian international, he made his debut in 2009 and has played for the team until his last game at 2014, and has represented the country at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Nikica Jelavi\u0107.birth_place: Čapljina,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Shay Given.name: Shay Given
Shay Given.intro:
'''Shay John James Given''' (born 20 April 1976) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He plays at international level for the Republic of Ireland national football team. As he surpassed the total of 100 caps required for membership, he is thus a part of the List of footballers with 100 or more capsFIFA Century Club. Given gained his first international cap in 1996 and played in goal during every match for his country during the 2002 FIFA World Cup campaign, helping them reach the knockout stage. He was later on the pitch in Paris when the Republic of Ireland 2009 Republic of Ireland vs France football matcheswere knocked out of the play-offs for a spot in the 2010 FIFA World Cup by France national football teamFrance before helping his team qualify for UEFA Euro 2012.
Given started his a career at Celtic F.C.Celtic however it didn't last long and he was released and bought by Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers on a free transfer in 1994. Given was part of the Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland team who won the Football League First Division title in 1995–96 in English football1995–96, while on loan from Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He was signed by Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 1997 for a fee of £1.5 million, and it was there that he began competing to be a first-choice Premier League goalkeeper. Given was part of the teams who came runners-up in the 1998 FA Cup Final1998 and 1999 FA Cup Final1999 FA Cup campaigns, and was named in the Premier League Team of the Season for 2001–02 in English football2001–02 and 2005–06 in English football2005–06. He played in the UEFA Champions League and UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup with Newcastle, and was involved in the club's title challenge in 2001–02. Although he submitted a transfer request during the 2000–01 in English football2000–01 campaign after losing his position in the starting line-up, it was denied, and Given went on to regain his place.
On 1 February 2009, Given transferred to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City for £6 million on a four-and-a-half-year contract. While Given was at Manchester City, the club qualified for the UEFA Champions League for the first time in its history after finishing third in the Premier League, as well as winning the FA Cup, though he did not appear in the league in the campaign that City reached the Champions League, nor did he play in the FA Cup. On 18 July 2011, Given joined Aston Villa for a fee believed to be around £3.5 million. He signed a five-year contract.

Rafael van der Vaart.name: Rafael van der Vaart
Rafael van der Vaart.intro:
'''Rafael Ferdinand van der Vaart''' (; born 11 February 1983) is a Dutch association footballfootballer who plays for and is the current captain of the German Bundesliga club Hamburger SV. He also plays for the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team. His preferred position is as an attacking midfielder; he can, however, also operate in other positions, such as second striker. Van der Vaart began his career at AFC Ajax's famous Jong Ajaxyouth academy and worked his way into the first team, debuting as a 17-year-old. His impact was so stunning that he was hailed as the new Johan Cruyff.[
Van der Vaart is well known for his passing and long range shots, and the capacity to use both feet well. Following his performances in the Premier League in the 2010–11 season with Tottenham Hotspur, Van der Vaart was nominated for the PFA Players' Player of the Year award, along with team-mate and eventual winner, Gareth Bale.

Madjid Bougherra.name: Madjid Bougherra
Madjid Bougherra.intro:
'''Madjid Bougherra''' (; born 7 October 1982) an Algerian professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Al-Fujairah SCAl-Fujairah. He is a Defender (association football)central defender, who can also play as a midfielder.
Bougherra began his professional football career with French club FC GueugnonGueugnon before having spells with English sides Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. Bougherra moved to Rangers F.C.Rangers in the summer of 2008 for a fee of £2.5 million, he made his debut against Falkirk F.C.Falkirk in August of that year. Bougherra made 113 appearances for Rangers and was a key part of the team that won the Scottish Premier League championship in seasons Scottish Premier League 2008-092008–09, Scottish Premier League 2009-102009–10 and Scottish Premier League 2010-112010–11.  In August 2011 Rangers sold Bougherra to Lekhwiya for £1.7 million.
An Algerian international since 2004, Bougherra has won 64 international Cap (sport)caps and scored 4 goals for the Algeria national football team,  participating in the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations, where Algeria finished fourth, and the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup in South Africa. He served as the team's Captain (association football)captain for the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup.
Madjid Bougherra.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

Mile Jedinak.name: Mile Jedinak
Mile Jedinak.intro:
'''Michael John "Mile" Jedinak''' (; born 3 August 1984) is an Australian international Association footballfootball player who plays for and captains both Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and the Australia national soccer teamAustralia national team. He commonly plays as a defensive midfielder.
Jedinak was born in Sydney and played youth football with Sydney United 58 FCSydney United before starting his senior career at the club. Following loan spells at NK VaraždinVarteks and South Coast United, Jedinak moved to Central Coast Mariners FCCentral Coast Mariners in 2006. He next played in Turkey, for Gençlerbirliği S.K.Gençlerbirliği and Antalyaspor on loan before joining Crystal Palace and subsequently playing a role in the club earning promotion to the Premier League.
Jedinak has made over 50 appearances for the Australian national team, scoring seven goals. This includes participation in the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups. He has also played at two AFC Asian Cups, captaining Australia to victory on home soil in the 2015 AFC Asian Cup2015 edition.

Tim Howard.name: Tim Howard
Tim Howard.intro:
'''Timothy Matthew "Tim" Howard''' (born March 6, 1979) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English club Everton F.C.Everton and the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.
Howard started his career with the North Jersey Imperials before making a move to the New York Red BullsMetroStars. His appearances soon attracted the attention of Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, who signed him in 2003. He enjoyed relative success with them as they won the 2003 FA Community Shield, the 2003–04 FA Cup and the 2005–06 Football League Cup2005–06 League Cup. However, after United signed Edwin van der Sar, Howard went out on loan to Everton to play more first-team soccer and eventually signed permanently with them in February 2007. On January 4, 2012, Howard scored a goal, his first as a professional, against Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. This made him only the fourth goalkeeper to score a goal in a Premier League match.
Howard first represented the United States national team in 2002 and was an unused substitute for the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup. He later established himself as first-choice and started all of the United States' games at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cups; the team reached the 2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16Round of 16 on both occasions.
Howard's book, ''The Keeper'', published in 2014, describes his career and his life with Tourette syndrome and obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD).

Stuart Pearce.name: Stuart Pearce
Stuart Pearce.intro:
'''Stuart Pearce''' Member of the Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 24 April 1962) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball manager (association football)manager and former player. He was most recently the manager of Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest before being sacked in February 2015. Pearce was the manager of the England national under-21 football teamEngland national under-21 team from 2007 to 2013 and also managed the Great Britain Olympic football team at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Olympics.
As a player, Pearce appeared for Wealdstone F.C.Wealdstone, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, but is best known for his spell at Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, where he regularly captained the team and became the club's most capped International, making 76 of his 78 appearances for England national football teamEngland while with the club and captaining the side on 9 occasions. He retired as a player in 2002 while at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He remained with the club as a coach under Kevin Keegan's managership until being promoted to the manager's job, which he held from 2005 to 2007.

Ricky van Wolfswinkel.name: Ricky van Wolfswinkel
Ricky van Wolfswinkel.intro:
'''Ricky van Wolfswinkel''' (; born 27 January 1989) is a Dutch professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne on loan from Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He has been Cap (sports)capped twice by the Netherlands national football team.
While playing in Portugal, he was nicknamed ''O Lobo'' (the Wolf), although during his early days in the Netherlands, he was known as HatRicky because of the number of hat-tricks he scored.[

Silvestre Varela.name: Silvestre Varela
Silvestre Varela.intro:
'''Silvestre Manuel Gonçalves Varela''' (born 2 February 1985) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club Parma F.C., on loan from FC Porto, as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
He represented mainly Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting and Porto during his career, amassing Primeira Liga totals of 190 games and 41 goals over the course of eight seasons and winning 11 major titles with the latter, including three national championships and the 2011 UEFA Europa League Final2011 Europa League. He also competed professionally in Spain and England.
Varela appeared for Portugal national football teamPortugal at UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup, scoring in both tournaments.

Chris Shuker.name: Chris Shuker
Chris Shuker.intro:
'''Christopher Alan''' "'''Chris'''" '''Shuker''' (born 9 May 1982) is an English peopleEnglish football coach and Association footballfootball midfielder who has made 400 appearances in a 14 year career in the Football League; he is a player-coach for Football League TwoLeague Two side Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers.
He began his career at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, making his Premier League debut in 2002. He enjoyed loan spells out at Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, and Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, before signing a contract with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in March 2004. A key player at the club, he helped the "Tykes" to promotion out of the Football League OneLeague One play-offs in 2006 Football League One play-off Final2006. He left the club after Barnsley withdrew their offer of a contract, and subsequently signed with Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. He played 144 games for Rovers in league and cup competitions, before transferring to Morecambe F.C.Morecambe for the 2010–11 season. He joined Port Vale F.C.Port Vale on non-contract terms in February 2012, and helped the club to secure promotion out of Football League TwoLeague Two in 2012–13. He retired in May 2014 due to a chronic knee injury, but, having rejoined Tranmere Rovers as a coach in October 2014, returned to playing two months later.

Denis Stracqualursi.name: Denis Stracqualursi
Denis Stracqualursi.intro: '''Denis Andrés Stracqualursi''' (born 20 October 1987) is an ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootball striker who plays for Baniyas F.C..
Denis Stracqualursi.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Striker

Jozy Altidore.name: Jozy Altidore
Jozy Altidore.intro:
'''Josmer Volmy "Jozy" Altidore'''  (born November 6, 1989) is an American professional Association footballsoccer player who plays for Toronto FC and for the  United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.
Altidore made his professional debut in 2006 at the age of 16 with the New York Red Bulls. In the middle of his third season with New York, in 2008, he made a transfer to Villarreal CFVillarreal for a fee of $10 million. During his time with Villarreal, he left on three loan stints – with Spanish Segunda División club Xerez CDXerez in February–May 2009, English Premier League club Hull City A.F.C.Hull City for the entire 2009–10 Hull City A.F.C. season2009–10 season, and Turkish club Bursaspor where he went on a six-month loan. In the summer of 2011, he made a switch to AZ (football club)AZ in the Netherlands. On March 3, 2013, Altidore surpassed Clint Dempsey for most goals by an American in a European club season with his 24th goal of the 2012–13 campaign. During the 2013 Summer transfer window, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland signed Altidore. He spent one-and-a-half seasons there, with a comparatively poor goalscoring record, then returned to MLS with Toronto.
Altidore has represented the United States on various levels of international competition, featuring for the United States U-17 men's national soccer teamUnited States U-17 team at the 2005 FIFA U-17 World Championship, United States U-20 men's national soccer teamU-20 team at the 2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup, the United States U-23 men's national soccer teamU-23 team at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics2008 Beijing Olympics, and the senior national team at the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup, and the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups.

M\u00edchel Salgado.name: Míchel Salgado
M\u00edchel Salgado.intro:
'''Miguel Ángel "Míchel" Salgado Fernández''' (born 22 October 1975) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
Nicknamed ''Il Due''[
During a 15-year period in Spain,  Salgado – who appeared in 343 La Liga games, scoring seven goals – represented the Spain national football teamSpanish national team, collecting more than 50 Cap (sport)caps and appearing in one FIFA World CupWorld Cup and one UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship.
M\u00edchel Salgado.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Kenny Brown (footballer, born 1967).name: Kenny Brown (footballer, born 1967)
Kenny Brown (footballer, born 1967).intro:
'''Kenneth James "Kenny" Brown''' (born 11 July 1967) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and current football manager. As a player he played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Reading F.C.Reading, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Reading F.C.Reading, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian, Portadown F.C.Portadown, Barry Town F.C.Barry Town, Tilbury F.C.Tilbury and FC Torrevieja. He has also managed Barry Town, CD Jávea, and Tooting & Mitcham United F.C.Tooting & Mitcham United and been assistant manager with Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic and Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City. Following the departure of Dean Holdsworth as manager of Chelmsford in November 2013, Brown became their caretaker manager.
His father, also called Ken Brown (footballer)Ken was also a professional footballer and managed Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle.

Simon Charlton.name: Simon Charlton
Simon Charlton.intro: '''Simon Thomas Charlton''' (born 25 October 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer who made more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League playing for Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He played most frequently as a defender (association football)left back, but could also play as a left-sided central defender or occasionally in midfieldermidfield. Between April 2009 and June 2010 he managed Eastern Counties Football LeagueEastern Counties League club Mildenhall Town F.C.Mildenhall Town.

Steve Wood (footballer, born February 19.name: Steve Wood (footballer, born February 1963)
Steve Wood (footballer, born February 19.intro:
'''Steve Wood''' (born 2 February 1963) is a retired EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football defender (football)defender.
Wood started his career as an apprentice at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal but was then snapped up by Reading F.C.Reading for whom he had eight successful years gaining promotion to the then first division. He then moved to Millwall F.C.Millwall, and finally onto Southampton F.C.Southampton. He had a brief spells at Oxford United F.C.Oxford United and Woking F.C.Woking in the latter part of his career then retired.
He now runs his own football agency business, www.midas-sports.com, where he looks after about 40 players including Chris Baird, Simon Church and Alex Pearce.

Lucas Piazon.name: Lucas Piazon
Lucas Piazon.intro: '''Lucas Domingues Piazon''' (born 20 January 1994), known simply as '''Lucas Piazon''', is a football in BrazilBrazilian association footballfootballer who plays for Eintracht Frankfurt, on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He is primarily a Forward (association football)forward, although he has also been deployed as a left Winger (association football)#Wingerwinger, as an attacking midfielder or in the hole behind the striker.

Alberto M\u00e9ndez.name: Alberto Méndez
Alberto M\u00e9ndez.intro: '''Alberto Méndez Rodríguez''' (born 24 October 1974) is a GermanyGerman retired Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.

Aliou Ciss\u00e9.name: Aliou Cissé
Aliou Ciss\u00e9.intro:
'''Aliou Cissé''' (born 24 March 1976) is a Senegalese former Association footballfootball player and coach. He has previously played for English Premier League club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and later Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. Cisse was a defensive midfielder who has, on occasion, played at full back.
He currently the head coach of Senegal national football team, having briefly taken charge of them following Amara Traoré's sacking, in a caretaker role in 2012. He was also the assistant coach of the Senegal national under-23 football teamunder-23 side from 2012 to 2013, becoming head coach from 2013 to 2015.

Youn\u00e8s Kaboul.name: Younès Kaboul
Youn\u00e8s Kaboul.intro: '''Younès Kaboul''' (born 4 January 1986) is a French Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back and is Captain (association football)captain of Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He can also play at Defender (association football)#Full backright back or in Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfield.

Markus Rosenberg.name: Markus Rosenberg
Markus Rosenberg.intro:
'''Nils Markus Rosenberg''' , born 27 September 1982), known as '''Markus Rosenberg''', is a Swedish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Allsvenskan club Malmö FF, he also serves as Captain (association football)club captain. Rosenberg is nicknamed "Sillen" (Swedish: ''the herring)'' and has played 33 games and scored six times for the Sweden national football teamSweden national team.
Rosenberg started his career at home town club Malmö FF before moving on to other European leagues. He also became List of Allsvenskan top scorerstop scorer in Allsvenskan while on loan at Halmstads BK during the 2004 Allsvenskan2004 season. Rosenberg has played for big clubs across Europe like SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen in the German Bundesliga, AFC AjaxAjax in the Eredivisie and Racing de SantanderRacing Santander in La Liga.

Eden Hazard.name: Eden Hazard
Eden Hazard.intro:
'''Eden Michael Hazard''' (; born 7 January 1991) is a BelgiumBelgian professional Association footballerfootballer, who plays for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team. He primarily plays as an attacking midfielder and a Winger (soccer)winger. Hazard is known for his creativity, speed, and technical ability and has been described as a "fearless, explosive attacking midfielder who can change the game with a turn of pace or a dribble". He has also been described as "a superb passer" and has earned critical acclaim for his playing style, which has led to the media, coaches, and players drawing comparisons to FIFA Ballon d'Or winners Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. Hazard is regarded to be one of the best young players in the world.
Hazard is the son of former Belgian footballers and began his football career in Belgium playing for local clubs Royal Stade Brainois and A.F.C. TubizeTubize. In 2005, he moved to France joining Ligue 1first division club Lille OSCLille. Hazard spent two years in the club's academy and, at the age of 16, made his professional debut in November 2007. He went on to become an integral part of Lille under manager Rudi Garcia, racking up over 190 appearances. In his first full season as a starter, he won the National Union of Professional Footballers (UNFP) Trophées UNFP du football#Young Player of the YearYoung Player of the Year award becoming the first non-French player to win the award. In the 2009–10 Ligue 12009–10 season, Hazard captured the award again becoming the first player to win the award twice. He was also named to the league's Trophées UNFP du football#Team of the YearTeam of the Year.
In the 2010–11 in French football2010–11 season, he was a part of the Lille team that won the Double (association football)league and cup double and, as a result of his performances, was named the Trophées UNFP du football#Player of the YearUNFP Ligue 1 Player of the Year becoming the youngest player to win the award. Hazard was also given the Bravo Award by Italian magazine Guerin Sportivo for his performances during the 2010–11 season. In June 2012, after over eight years at Lille, Hazard departed the club, amid much transfer speculation, to join English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
Hazard is a Belgium national football teamBelgium international, having represented his nation at Belgium national under-17 football teamunder-17 and Belgium national under-19 football teamunder-19 level. Prior to starring for the senior team, he played on the under-17 team that qualified for the 2007 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship and 2007 FIFA U-17 World Cup. Hazard made his senior international debut in November 2008, at the age of 17 years and 316 days, in a Exhibition gamefriendly match against Luxembourg national football teamLuxembourg. Nearly three years after his debut, Hazard scored his first international goal against Kazakhstan national football teamKazakhstan in October 2011. He has since earned over 50 caps, and was a member of the Belgian squad which reached the quarter-finals of the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Tom Cairney.name: Tom Cairney
Tom Cairney.intro: '''Thomas "Tom" Cairney''' (born 20 January 1991) is a association footballfootballer who plays for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. Born in England, he has played for Scotland at Scotland national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Scotland national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Massimo Taibi.name: Massimo Taibi
Massimo Taibi.intro: '''Massimo Taibi''' (; born 18 February 1970) is a retired Italian footballer, who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for several clubs, mostly in Italy's Serie A, Serie BB, and Lega Pro Prima DivisioneC1. He had a brief spell at English club Manchester United.

Paul McGrath.name: Paul McGrath
Paul McGrath.intro:
'''Paul McGrath''' (born 4 December 1959) is a retired Republic of IrelandIrish Association footballfootballer, who played as a Defender (association football)defender from 1981 until 1998. McGrath is widely recognised as one of the greatest players to have ever come out of Ireland.
In a career greatly hampered by physical and off-the-field problems, he played 14 professional seasons with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United (seven apiece). A tough tackler and brilliant reader of the game, he played extensively despite persistent problems with his knees. He also played for St Patrick's Athletic F.C.St Patrick's Athletic, Derby County F.C.Derby County and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United
Also a long-time member of the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team, he appeared at the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 and 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 FIFA World Cups, as well as UEFA Euro 1988, the team's first-ever international tournament.
Paul McGrath.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jack Collison.name: Jack Collison
Jack Collison.intro: '''Jack David Collison''' (born 2 October 1988) is a Welsh national football teamWelsh international association footballfootballer who is without a club. Collison is a product of The Academy of FootballWest Ham's youth academy and has quickly progressed from trainee to playing first team football in the Premier League since joining at age sixteen. A versatile, all-rounded midfielder, he is able to play in centre midfield or out wide.

Iv\u00e1n Campo.name: Iván Campo
Iv\u00e1n Campo.intro:
'''Iván Campo Ramos''' (born 21 February 1974) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer. Originally a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, he featured in a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfield role in his later years.
He played for Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and four other teams in his country, and is also remembered for his spell in England with Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.
Campo represented Spain national football teamSpain in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup.
Iv\u00e1n Campo.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Defender

Hugo Porf\u00edrio.name: Hugo Porfírio
Hugo Porf\u00edrio.intro: '''Hugo Cardoso Porfírio''' (born 28 September 1973) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played mostly as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Ruel Fox.name: Ruel Fox
Ruel Fox.intro: '''Ruel Adrian Fox''' (born 14 January 1968 in Ipswich) is a former professional Association footballfootballer who played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion from 1986 to 2002. He is currently chairman of Ipswich-based club Whitton United F.C.Whitton United.

Ravel Morrison.name: Ravel Morrison
Ravel Morrison.intro:
'''Ravel Ryan Morrison''' (born 2 February 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer whose contract with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United was terminated in February 2015.
A midfielder, he began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before joining West Ham in January 2012. Morrison spent the 2012–13 season on loan with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He also played for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City on loan in 2014, and was a member of the QPR side that won the 2014 Football League Championship play-off Final.
Morrison has also played for England national football teamEngland at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-18 football teamunder-18 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Rub\u00e9n Rochina.name: Rubén Rochina
Rub\u00e9n Rochina.intro:
'''Rubén Rochina Naixes''' (born 23 March 1991) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Granada CF as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Rochina began his professional career with FC Barcelona BBarcelona B before joining Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 2011, spending three years with the club that included two loan spells, at Real ZaragozaZaragoza and Rayo Vallecano.

Emerson Thome.name: Emerson Thome
Emerson Thome.intro: '''Emerson Augusto Thome''' (born 30 March 1972), also known as '''Paredão''',
Emerson Thome.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Central defender

Haris Vu\u010dki\u0107.name: Haris Vučkić
Haris Vu\u010dki\u0107.intro:
'''Haris Vučkić''' (born 21 August 1992) is a Slovenian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielderattacking midfielder for Rangers F.C.Rangers, on loan from Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Slovenia national football teamSlovenia national team.
Vučkić has represented Slovenia international youth selections in every category to date. He has made one appearance at senior level, against Scotland national football teamScotland on 29 February 2012.

David Bellion.name: David Bellion
David Bellion.intro: '''David Bellion''' (born 27 November 1982) is a French footballer who currently plays as a forward for Red Star F.C.. Born in Paris, his previous clubs include Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and OGC NiceNice.

Allan McGregor.name: Allan McGregor
Allan McGregor.intro:
'''Allan James McGregor''' (born 31 January 1982) is a Scottish PeopleScottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League side Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. McGregor previously played for Scottish clubs Rangers F.C.Rangers, St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic and Turkish team Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş.
A product of the Rangers F.C.Rangers youth development, McGregor made his first team debut in February 2002 in a Scottish Cup match against Forfar Athletic F.C.Forfar Athletic. He was later loaned out to St. Johnstone and Dunfermline Athletic, before becoming a regular Rangers first team player at the start of the 2006–07 season. McGregor made over 200 appearances for Rangers, winning 11 major honours in the process, including a hat-trick of league titles in 2009, 2010 and 2011, three Scottish Cups and five Scottish League Cups. Following the insolvency of Rangers in 2012, McGregor exercised his rights under TUPE regulations to rescind his contract and become a free agent. He then signed a two-year contract with Turkish club Beşiktaş.
McGregor made his international debut against Austria national football teamAustria on 30 May 2007 and has 30 international caps. McGregor was suspended for two weeks by his club, and the Scottish Football Association said that McGregor would never play for Scotland national football teamScotland again, after multiple breaches of squad discipline following Scotland's 3–0 defeat to the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands on 28 March 2009. The following year, McGregor's lifetime ban from association footballinternational football was overturned by Scotland manager Craig Levein.

Andy Preece.name: Andy Preece
Andy Preece.intro:
'''Andrew "Andy" Preece''' (born 27 March 1967) is an English Manager (football)football manager and former professional association footballfootballer who works as the Director of Football at Welsh Premier League club Airbus UK Broughton F.C.Airbus UK Broughton.
As a player he was a Forward (association football)forward from 1986 until 2012, however since 1999 he had mixed his playing duties with various coaching and management positions. He notably played in the Premier League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, and in the Football League for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Bury F.C.Bury. He became player-manager of Bury F.C.Bury in 1999, also going on to manage Worcester City F.C.Worcester City and Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria.

Kim Do-heon.name: Kim Do-heon
Kim Do-heon.intro:
title = West Brom land Korean midfielder
url =
publisher = BBC Sport

accessdate = 9 July 2008
He scored his first goal for West Brom in the final match of the season against Queens Park Rangers F.C.QPR, eight minutes after coming on as a second half substitute. Albion went on to win 2–0, securing them the Football League Championship title and promotion to the Premier League. On 28 May, he completed the move to West Brom for £550,000.cite news
title=Kim seals permanent Baggies move
url=
publisher=BBC Sport
date=28 May 2008
accessdate=6 July 2008
Kim made his Premier League debut on 16 August 2008 against Arsenal, where they lost the match 1–0. He scored once after the permanent move, in a 2–2 draw with Burnley in the FA Cup on 24 January 2009.cite news
url=
title=West Brom 2–2 Burnley
publisher=BBC
date=24 January 2009 accessdate=13 November 2009
On 27 July 2009 Suwon Samsung Bluewings F.C.Suwon Bluewings have signed the South Korean midfielder from West Bromwich Albion for £360,000, he has already played for Suwon from 2001 to 2005.[

Tim Krul.name: Tim Krul
Tim Krul.intro:
'''Timothy Michael''' "'''Tim'''" '''Krul''' (; born 3 April 1988) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team.
Krul started his professional career at Newcastle United in 2006, having previously played for the team's youth academy, as well as ADO Den Haag and Hvv RAS youth teams. Initially third choice behind Shay Given and Steve Harper, he spent the 2007–08 season on loan to Falkirk F.C.Falkirk, and the following season on loan to Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, making 26 and nine appearances respectively. Although he started the season as a backup goalkeeper to Harper, injuries to the latter during the 2010–11 season saw Krul break into the team, and he eventually became the number one. An ever-present in the Premier League during the following season, injuries restricted him to 24 league games for the 2012–13 season. Due to a knee injury picked up in a game versus Everton F.C.Everton on matchday 31, he came up two games short of playing all 38 Premier League matches in the 2013–14 season.
Krul represented the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands at every level from the Netherlands national under-15 football teamunder-15s to the Netherlands national under-21 football teamunder-21s between 2002 and 2011. He made his debut for the full national team in July 2011, and played at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Stefan Savi\u0107.name: Stefan Savić
Stefan Savi\u0107.intro: '''Stefan Savić''' () (Serbian languageSerbian: Стефан Савић, born 8 January 1991) is a MontenegroMontenegrin footballer who plays for Serie A club ACF FiorentinaFiorentina and the Montenegro national football team. He is a centre-back who primarily plays on the right side of the pitch.

Chris Boden.name: Chris Boden
Chris Boden.intro:
'''Chris Boden''' (born 13 October 1973) is an English former professional association footballfootballer.
Boden was a trainee at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, where he made just one senior appearance. He also played for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town and Hereford United F.C.Hereford United.
He retired from professional football after suffering a knee injury.

Nathan Blake.name: Nathan Blake
Nathan Blake.intro: '''Nathan Blake''' (born 27 January 1972 in Cardiff) is a WalesWelsh former professional Football (soccer)footballer, who played in the Premier League for several clubs and also represented his country at international level. Blake has been relegated from the Premier League five times, a record he holds jointly with Hermann Hreiðarsson.

Lee Hodges (footballer, born 1978).name: Lee Hodges (footballer, born 1978)
Lee Hodges (footballer, born 1978).intro: '''Lee Hodges''' (born 2 March 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder. He made three appearances in the Premier League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and made 184 appearances in the Football League for Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers.

Dani\u00ebl de Ridder.name: Daniël de Ridder
Dani\u00ebl de Ridder.intro:
'''Daniël Robin Frederick de Ridder''' (born 6 March 1984) is a Dutch  association footballfootballer who currently plays for SC Cambuur in the Dutch Eredivisie. He has previously played for AFC AjaxAjax, Celta de VigoCelta Vigo, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Hapoel Tel Aviv, Grasshopper Club Zürich, SC Heerenveen and  RKC Waalwijk.
De Ridder made his first-team breakthrough at Ajax on 21 January 2004 against Roda JC. He was a regular throughout the second half of the campaign, featuring in the UEFA UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, only to seek a fresh start in Spain with Celta de Vigo in August 2005.
He made his official debut for Celta de Vigo in the match against Sevilla FCSevilla in September 2005, and played as a regular after the winter break in matches against CA OsasunaOsasuna, FC BarcelonaBarcelona and other Spanish clubs in the La LigaPrimera Division.
For Birmingham City he made his Premier League debut on 12 August 2007 as a substitute in the opening match of the season against Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. De Ridder was a key player in Birmingham's 3–2 win against Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic on 27 October 2007 in which he made his full home debut.
In July 2010 he was linked with a return to Ajax under the management of Martin Jol.

Benjani Mwaruwari.name: Benjani Mwaruwari
Benjani Mwaruwari.intro:
'''Benjamin Mwaruwari''' (born 13 August 1978), often known simply as '''Benjani''', is a Zimbabwean professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Bidvest Wits in the South African Premier Soccer League.
Having started his career with Jomo Cosmos he moved to Europe in 2001 joining Swiss side Grasshopper-Club ZurichGrasshopper Zurich before moving to AJ AuxerreAuxerre a year later. He signed with Premier League club Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 2006, and was part of their team which won the FA Cup in 2008. He then went on to play in England's top flight for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers before returning to Portsmouth in 2011. The following year he returned to South Africa with Chippa United and then Bidvest Wits.
Benjani played a total 31 times for the Zimbabwe national football team and was their captain for many of those matches. A member of their squad at the 2006 Africa Cup of Nations, he retired from international football in October 2010 to concentrate on his club career.

Junior Agogo.name: Junior Agogo
Junior Agogo.intro:
'''Manuel "Junior" Agogo''' (born 1 August 1979) is a retired Ghanaian professional association footballfootballer who played as a striker. He  spent most of his career in England, as well as spells in the United States, Egypt, Cyprus and most recently Scotland.
In January 2015, Agogo was rushed to hospital following a suspected stroke.

Richard Hall.name: Richard Hall
Richard Hall.intro: '''Richard Anthony Hall''' (born 14 March 1972 in Ipswich) is an English former professional Football (soccer)footballer who played as a Defender (football)defender. He is currently a Development Coach at Colchester United, having previously been the reserve team coach at Ipswich Town.
Richard Hall.position: Football  soccer  positions Centre back  CB  Centre back

David Stockdale.name: David Stockdale
David Stockdale.intro:
'''David Adam Stockdale''' (born 20 September 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Stockdale started his career with the Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town youth system before joining York City F.C.York City's youth system in 2000, where he became a trainee in 2002. He made his first team debut on the last day of the 2002–03 in English football2002–03 season. He established himself in the team during the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 season and in 2006, following loan spells at Wakefield F.C.Wakefield-Emley and Worksop Town F.C.Worksop Town, was released by the club. He moved to Darlington F.C.Darlington and in his second season with the club played in the playoffsplay-offs. He signed for Premier League side Fulham for an undisclosed fee in 2008. He has been called up to the England national football teamEngland squad but remains Cap (sport)uncapped.

Teddy Sheringham.name: Teddy Sheringham
Teddy Sheringham.intro:
'''Edward Paul''' "'''Teddy'''" '''Sheringham''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 2 April 1966) is an English former Association footballfootballer and current Association football positions#Attackingattacking coach at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
Sheringham played as a Forward (association football)forward, mostly as a Forward (association football)#Second strikersecond striker, in a 24-year professional career. Sheringham began his career at Millwall F.C.Millwall, where he played between 1983 and 1991, before joining Football League First DivisionFirst Division Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. A year later, Sheringham scored Forest's first ever Premier League goal, and was signed by Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. After five seasons at Spurs, Sheringham joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United where he won three List of English football championsPremier League titles, one FA Cup, one UEFA Champions League and, in 2001, was named both the PFA Players' Player of the Year and FWA Footballer of the Year. The pinnacle of his career came when he scored the equaliser and provided the assist for Manchester United's winning goal in the 1999 UEFA Champions League Final against FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich.
After leaving Manchester United at the end of the 2000–01 Manchester United F.C. season2000–01 season, Sheringham re-joined Tottenham Hotspur, where he was a losing finalist in the 2002 Football League Cup Final2001–02 Football League Cup. He spent one season at newly promoted Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, scoring the club's first Premier League goal, before joining West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, where he helped the club gain promotion from the 2004–05 Football League Championship. The following season, Sheringham appeared for West Ham in the 2006 FA Cup Final, becoming the third-oldest player to appear in an List of FA Cup finalsFA Cup Final.
Sheringham is currently the ninth-highest goalscorer in Premier League#PlayersPremier League history with 147 goals, and is the competition's 19th-highest appearance maker. He holds the Premier League records and statisticsrecord as the oldest outfield player to appear in a Premier League match (40 years, 272 days) and the oldest player to score in a Premier League match (40 years, 268 days).
Sheringham was Cap (association football)capped 51 times for the England national football team, scoring 11 times. He appeared in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 and 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 FIFA World Cups, as well as the UEFA Euro 19961996 UEFA European Championship.
Sheringham retired from competitive football at the end of the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 season with Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, at the age of 42.

Ian Feuer.name: Ian Feuer
Ian Feuer.intro: '''Ian Anthony "Tony" Feuer''' (born May 20, 1971 in Las Vegas, Nevada) is a retired U.S. soccer goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper who spent most of his career with English clubs with time in Belgium and the United States. He is goalkeeper coach for the Los Angeles Galaxy.

Stephen Kelly.name: Stephen Kelly
Stephen Kelly.intro:
'''Stephen Michael David Kelly''' (born 6 September 1983) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays for Reading F.C.Reading. He plays as a Defender (association football)defender, primarily at Defender (association football)#Full-backright back. He was part of the team that secured the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland's qualification for UEFA Euro 2012.
Kelly began his professional career at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and also played for Southend United F.C.Southend United, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Watford F.C.Watford, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Fulham F.C.Fulham before joining Reading in 2013.
Stephen Kelly.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Javier Margas.name: Javier Margas
Javier Margas.intro: '''Javier Luciano Margas Loyola''' (born 10 May 1969 in Santiago de Chile) is a retired Chilean Association footballfootball defender.

Kevin Richardson.name: Kevin Richardson
Kevin Richardson.intro: '''Kevin Richardson''' (born 4 December 1962) is an English former association footballfootballer who made more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League, playing for Everton F.C.Everton, Watford F.C.Watford, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, and also spent a season in La Liga with Real Sociedad. He was cap (sports)capped once for England national football teamEngland. In October 2009 he was appointed coach (sports)assistant manager of Darlington F.C.Darlington.

Nigel Jemson.name: Nigel Jemson
Nigel Jemson.intro: '''Nigel Bradley Jemson''' (born 10 August 1969) is an English Association footballfootballer, who represented his country at the England national under-21 football teamUnder-21 level and was the Player-coach#Player-managerplayer-manager of Ilkeston F.C.Ilkeston Town, until May 2008. He finished his career at Rainworth Miners Welfare F.C.Rainworth Miners Welfare in the Northern Counties East League Premier Division.

Hakan \u015e\u00fck\u00fcr.name: Hakan Şükür
Hakan \u015e\u00fck\u00fcr.intro:
'''Hakan Şükür''' (born 1 September 1971), known by his nick name '''Kral''' – literally meaning ''The King'' – is a Turkish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He spent the majority of his professional career with Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray, being a three-time ''List of Süper Lig top scorersGol Kralı'' (Goal King, title and award given to the annual top goalscorer of the Süper Lig), representing the club in three different spells and winning a total of 14 major titles.
Şükür represented Turkey national football teamTurkey a total of 112 times, scoring 51 goals, making him the nation's top goalscorer and 19th in the world. One of the most prolific strikers of the modern era, he netted 383 goals throughout his club career, as well as FIFA World Cup records#Goalscoringthe fastest ever in a FIFA World CupWorld Cup in 2002 FIFA World Cup2002. He retired from football in 2008, only scoring once in single digits for his main team in 13 seasons; nicknamed the "Bull of the Bosphorus", he was renowned for his heading ability.
In Turkish general election, 20112011 general elections, he was elected as an  Istanbul MP for the Justice and Development Party (Turkey)Justice and Development Party. He resigned from the party in December 2013.

Dean Leacock.name: Dean Leacock
Dean Leacock.intro: '''Dean Leacock''' (born 10 June 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town, primarily as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back, but he can also play as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.

Gabriel Agbonlahor.name: Gabriel Agbonlahor
Gabriel Agbonlahor.intro:
'''Gabriel Imuetinyan "Gabby" Agbonlahor''' (born 13 October 1986), is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a Forward (association football)forward.
He is a product of Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and AcademyAston Villa's Academy, and made his first-team debut in 2006 following loans to The Football LeagueFootball League clubs Watford F.C.Watford and Sheffield Wednesday. Since then, he has made 300 Premier League appearances for the club, scoring in ten consecutive seasons.  With 73 goals, he is Aston Villa's all-time leading Premier League goalscorer, having scored in ten consecutive league seasons.
Formerly a regular with England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21, Agbonlahor made his senior international debut in 2008 and earned three caps overall.

Lee Cattermole.name: Lee Cattermole
Lee Cattermole.intro:
'''Lee Barry Cattermole ''' (born 21 March 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in the Premier League. His preferred position is in central midfield. An England national football teamEngland youth product, Cattermole has earned a reputation as a tough tackling midfielder due to his lengthy disciplinary record.
Cattermole began his professional career at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 2005, having progressed through the Middlesbrough F.C. Reserves and Academyclub's academy. After making his debut for the club in January 2006, he became a regular player, and became the youngest man to captain Middlesbrough. After making 91 appearances in all competitions, he switched to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in July 2008. He quickly became a regular for Wigan, making 35 appearances, but switched to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in August 2009. Despite a few injury problems early in his spell at the club, manager Steve Bruce selected him as the club's captain for the start of the 2010–11 season, a role he would hold for three seasons, until Paolo di Canio gave John O'Shea the role prior to the start of the 2013–14 season.
Internationally, Cattermole has represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-18 football teamunder-18, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, but is yet to make his debut for the full international side.

Craig Maskell.name: Craig Maskell
Craig Maskell.intro: '''Craig Dell Maskell''' (born 10 April 1968 in Aldershot) is a football strikerCentre Forward currently playing for Staines Town F.C.Staines Town and undertaking the role of assistant manager.

Cristian Riveros.name: Cristian Riveros
Cristian Riveros.intro:
'''Cristian Miguel Riveros Núñez''' (born 16 October 1982) is a Paraguayan professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Club OlimpiaOlimpia Asunción in the Primera División Paraguaya and the Paraguay national football team as a Midfielderdefensive midfielder.
A full international for Paraguay since 2005, he earned 90 caps for his country, playing at two FIFA World Cup competitions (2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010) and two Copa América tournaments (2007 Copa América2007 and 2011 Copa América2011).
Cristian Riveros.position: Midfielder  football  Defensive midfielder Defensive midfielder

J\u00falio C\u00e9sar (football goalkeep.name: Júlio César (football goalkeeper, born 1979)
J\u00falio C\u00e9sar (football goalkeep.intro:
'''Júlio César Soares de Espíndola''' (born 3 September 1979), known as '''Júlio César''' (), is a Brazilian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Portuguese club S.L. BenficaBenfica.
He spent seven years at Italian club F.C. InternazionaleInternazionale, where he won five List of Italian football champions''Scudetti'', the 2009–10 UEFA Champions League and the 2010 FIFA Club World Cup. He was awarded the Serie A Goalkeeper of the Year title in both 2009 and 2010, and was nominated for the Ballon d'Or 20092009 Ballon d'Or, where he was voted into 21st place.
Júlio César won 87 international cap (sport)caps for Brazil between 2004 and 2014. He was selected for the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cups, in addition to two Copa América tournaments.

Jos Hooiveld.name: Jos Hooiveld
Jos Hooiveld.intro:
'''Jos Hooiveld''' (; born 22 April 1983) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays for English side Millwall F.C.Millwall, on loan from Southampton F.C.Southampton, as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. Hooiveld is known for his strong physical performances.
Born in Zeijen, Drenthe, he started his career with Eredivisie club Heerenveen S.C.Heerenveen in 2003, before moving to Eerste Divisie side FC ZwolleZwolle, on loan, between 2004 and 2006. In 2006 he moved to Austrian Erste Liga side Kapfenberger SV and one year later moved to Finnish side Inter Turku. During his time there he won both the 2008 Veikkausliiga2008 Veikkausliiga and 2008 Finnish League Cup2008 Finnish League CupLeague Cup as well as being named the defender of the year twice.
In 2009 Swedish side AIK Stockholm signed him and he won the 2009 Allsvenskan and the 2009 Svenska Cupen. He moved to Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic in January 2010 but after one year was loaned out to Danish Superliga club F.C. CopenhagenCopenhagen. He then moved on loan to English Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Southampton F.C.Southampton shortly after the start of the 2011-12 Southampton F.C. season2011–12 season before joining them permanently in December 2011. He was a regular throughout the season helping them win promotion to the Premier League. He will spend the final year of his Southampton contract on loan to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
Jos Hooiveld.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Seb Hines.intro: '''Sebastian Tony "Seb" Hines''' (born 29 May 1988) is an English footballer who plays as  a central defender or holding midfielder for Orlando City SCOrlando City on loan from Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. His father is African American and his mother is English.

Sam Gallagher (footballer, born 1995).name: Sam Gallagher (footballer, born 1995)
Sam Gallagher (footballer, born 1995).intro: '''Samuel James "Sam" Gallagher''' (born 15 September 1995) is an English Association footballerfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton. Originally a member of the Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle youth academy, Gallagher joined Southampton in 2012 and earned a call-up to the first team at the beginning of the 2013–14 Southampton F.C. season2013–14 season.

Simon Dawkins.name: Simon Dawkins
Simon Dawkins.intro: '''Simon Jonathan Dawkins''' (born 1 December 1987) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward or Midfielder (association football)#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for English club Derby County F.C.Derby County and the Jamaica national football teamJamaica national team.

Paul Heald.name: Paul Heald
Paul Heald.intro:
'''Paul Heald''' (born 20 September 1968 in Wath-on-Dearne) is a former Association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who played for multiple clubs in England. He started his career at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 1987 and moved on to Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient and also spent loan spells at Coventry City F.C.Coventry, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and newly promoted Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town.
In 1995 a £125,000 fee took him to the Premier League side Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, where he acted mainly as backup for first Hans Segers and then Neil Sullivan. He played a total of 38 league games for the club.
In his first season at Wimbledon he was the goalkeeper who was unable to stop Tony Yeboah's thunderbolt in September 1995, the goal going on to win the Goal of the Season. He stayed with Wimbledon until the club's Relocation of Wimbledon F.C. to Milton Keynesrelocation to Milton Keynes in 2003, and also went on loan to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 2002. He remained a player with the newly rebranded Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons from their creation in 2004 until his retirement in 2005, since which he has served as the club's goalkeeper coach.

John Terry.name: John Terry
John Terry.intro:
'''John George Terry''' (born 7 December 1980 in Barking) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for and captains Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He commonly plays as a centre back. He was also captain of the England national football team, holding the post from August 2006 to February 2010, and again from March 2011 to February 2012.
A strong, tenacious, commanding, and physical defender, Terry excels in the air, and he is known for his aggressive tackling, positioning, and his ability to read the game; he is considered to be one of the best central defenders of his generation.
Terry is Chelsea's most successful captain, having led them to three Premier League titles, four FA Cups, three Football League CupLeague Cups and a UEFA Champions League since 2004. He is one of five players to have made List of Chelsea F.C. records and statistics#All-time appearancesover 500 appearances for Chelsea and is also the club's all-time highest scoring defender. In 2007, he became the first captain to lift the FA Cup at the new Wembley Stadium in Chelsea's 1–0 win over Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, and also the first player to score an international goal there, scoring a header in England's 1–1 draw with Brazil national football teamBrazil.

Steve Slade.name: Steve Slade
Steve Slade.intro:
'''Steven Anthony''' "'''Steve'''" '''Slade''' (born 6 October 1975 in Romford) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker, notably in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and earned four caps, scoring three times for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U-21 team.
He also played as a professional in the Football League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Brentford F.C.Brentford, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, as well as appearing in the Icelandic top flight 1. deild karla for Knattspyrnufélagið VíkingurVikingur. He has also played non-League football for Hayes F.C.Hayes, Maidenhead United F.C.Maidenhead United, Barking F.C.Barking and Ware F.C.Ware.

Paul Robinson (footballer, born December.name: Paul Robinson (footballer, born December 1978)
Paul Robinson (footballer, born December.intro:
'''Paul Peter Robinson''' (born 14 December 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for and captains Football League Championship club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He is a left-sided defender who can also play at centre-back.
Robinson began his professional career at Football League Second DivisionDivision Two side Watford F.C.Watford in 1996, and made 252 appearances for the club, before moving to Football League First DivisionDivision One side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in October 2003. He made 238 appearances for West Brom, before joining Premier League side Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in July 2009, initially on loan, and then on a permanent transfer at the start of the 2010-11 Bolton Wanderers F.C. season2010–11 season. Having made 87 appearances for Bolton, he went on loan to Championship side Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in March 2012, where he made ten appearances. He was released by Bolton at the end of the 2011-12 Bolton Wanderers F.C. season2011–12 season, and joined current club Birmingham on a free transfer in September 2012.
He was capped three times for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team in 1999.

Christian Ziege.name: Christian Ziege
Christian Ziege.intro:
'''Christian Ziege''' (; born 1 February 1972) is a retired German association footballfootballer.
He started his playing career at FC Bayern Munich, where he won two List of German football championsBundesliga titles and a UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup before moving to A.C. Milan, winning an List of Italian football championsItalian ''Scudetto''. In 1999, he joined Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough of the English Premier League, where he was voted the club's Player of the Year in his only season. A year later, he joined Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and was part of the squad which won a Treble (association football)treble of the Football League Cup, the FA Cup and the UEFA Cup in 2000–01 Liverpool F.C. season2000–01. In 2001, he moved to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, before ending his career back in Germany with Borussia Mönchengladbach.
With the Germany national football teamGerman national team, Ziege won UEFA Euro 1996 and finished runner-up at the 2002 FIFA World Cup. He also represented the country at UEFA Euro 2000, UEFA Euro 2004 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup. An attacking left Defender (association football)wing-back, Ziege was considered a Direct free kickdead-ball specialist.
Christian Ziege.position: Defender  association football  Left wing back

Dean Saunders.name: Dean Saunders
Dean Saunders.intro:
'''Dean Nicholas Saunders''' (born 21 June 1964) is a former Wales national football teamWelsh international association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker in a professional career which lasted from 1982 until 2001 and is currently interim manager of Crawley Town FC.
He was a high profile Premier League player in the 1990s for both Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, and set a new British transfer record when he joined the former from Derby County F.C.Derby County. He began at his hometown club Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City before also playing for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United as well as spells abroad at both Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray and S.L. BenficaBenfica.
He was capped 75 times at senior level for Wales between 1986 and 2001, scoring 22 times - making him one of the nation's highest scoring and most capped players of all time, although Wales never qualified for any major international competitions while Saunders was playing for them.
Following his retirement from playing, he has entered football coaching and became manager of non-league Wrexham F.C.Wrexham in 2008. He has since served as manager of both Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers (2011–2013) and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers (for four months in 2013), but both appointments saw the clubs relegated from the Football League ChampionshipChampionship.

Jon Flanagan.name: Jon Flanagan
Jon Flanagan.intro: '''Jonathon Patrick "Jon" Flanagan''' (born 1 January 1993) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Fullbackfullback for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. He made his debut for Liverpool in a 3–0 win against Manchester City F.C.Manchester City on 11 April 2011 at the age of 18. He is the nephew of Blackburn Rovers right-back Bradley Orr. Flanagan has earned numerous plaudits for his style of play since his breakthrough into the Liverpool first team in November 2013; most notably, the FIFA World CupWorld Cup-winning former Brazil National Football TeamBrazil captain and full-back (association football)full-back Cafu heralded Flanagan as his "successor", applauding his "speed, strength and determination".
Jon Flanagan.position: Defender  association football  Right back Fullback

Callum McManaman.name: Callum McManaman
Callum McManaman.intro:
'''Callum Henry McManaman''' (born 25 April 1991) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Born in Whiston, MerseysideWhiston, Merseyside, lived and brought up in Rainhill, Merseyside, McManaman began his youth career at Everton F.C.Everton before being released in 2007 and joining Wigan Athletic. He made his first team debut in 2009, and was the man of the match as they won the FA Cup in 2013. In January 2015, he joined West Bromwich Albion for £4.75 million.
McManaman also represented England national football teamEngland at the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup2011 U-20 World Cup.
