Gabriel Tama\u0219.intro:
'''Gabriel Sebastian Tamaș''' (born 9 November 1983) is a Romanian association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for FC Steaua BucureștiSteaua București.
He made his international debut for Romania national football teamRomania in 2003, and has gained a total of 63 caps and played at Euro 2008.
Gabriel Tama\u0219.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Anthony R\u00e9veill\u00e8re.name: Anthony Réveillère
Anthony R\u00e9veill\u00e8re.intro:
'''Anthony Réveillère''' (; born 10 November 1979) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
He spent most of his professional career with Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes and Olympique LyonnaisLyon, amassing Ligue 1 totals of 426 games and five goals over the course of 16 seasons and winning 12 major titles with the latter, including five national championships.
Réveillère represented France national football teamFrance at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012.
Anthony R\u00e9veill\u00e8re.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Daryl Sutch.name: Daryl Sutch
Daryl Sutch.intro: '''Daryl Sutch''' (born 11 September 1971 in Lowestoft) is a former professional Football (soccer)footballer who spent the majority of his career with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

Jordan Slew.name: Jordan Slew
Jordan Slew.intro:
'''Jordan Michael Slew''' (born 7 September 1992) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Football League TwoLeague Two side Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United.
Born in Sheffield, Slew began his footballing career at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United's Sheffield United F.C. Academyacademy in 2006, joining the club at the age of 11. After making his first-team debut in 2010, he attracted the interest of a number of clubs including Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, for whom he signed in September 2011 for a £1.1 million fee. He subsequently spent time on loan at Stevenage F.C.Stevenage, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Ross County F.C.Ross County, and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He joined Cambridge United in February 2015. Slew also made two appearances for the England national under-19 football teamEngland U19s in 2011.

Esteban Granero.name: Esteban Granero
Esteban Granero.intro:
'''Esteban Félix Granero Molina''' (born 2 July 1987) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Real Sociedad. Known as ''El Pirata'' (the pirate), he can play as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral or an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder, his best attributes being passing, technique and shooting.
He emerged through Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid's youth ranks, but made a name for himself in La Liga with Getafe CFGetafe, following which he returned to his previous team, winning two major titles but being sparingly played over the course of three seasons.
Granero represented Spain national football teamSpain at Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, appearing in the 2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship2009 European Championship.

Mark Wright (footballer, born 1963).name: Mark Wright (footballer, born 1963)
Mark Wright (footballer, born 1963).intro: '''Mark Wright''' (born 1 August 1963) is an English Association footballfootball manager, chairman and former England national football teamEngland international football player. As a player, he had spells with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Oxford United F.C.Oxford United during the 1980s and 1990s. He made 45 appearances for the England national football teamEnglish national football team, and was a member of the team which reached the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup in 1990.[

Craig Gardner.name: Craig Gardner
Craig Gardner.intro: '''Craig Gardner''' (born 25 November 1986) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Centre midfieldercentral midfielder for Premier League club West Bromwich Albion. A versatile midfielder, Gardner can play in many different positions, although central midfield is his preferred position. Gardner began his career at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa before spending the 2010–11 season with city rivals Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. After three seasons with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, he joined West Bromwich Albion in 2014.

Giovani dos Santos.name: Giovani dos Santos
Giovani dos Santos.intro:
'''Giovani dos Santos Ramírez'''[
Giovani began his football career at a young age, being recruited by Spanish club FC Barcelona and played for their FC Barcelona BB team until age 18. He made his way up the ranks, eventually playing for the senior squad, making his debut in 2007. That year, dos Santos was named by ''World Soccer Magazine'' as one of the "Top 50 Most Exciting Teen Footballers". After playing one season, he was transferred to Barclays Premier LeaguePremier League club Tottenham Hotspur in 2008 in search for more playing time. Though he would stay with the club until 2012, his time there was mostly spent away on loan, at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Galatasaray S.K.Galatasaray, and Racing Santander, with varying degrees of success.Tucker, Duncan (24 August 2012). [
Giovani was a member of the Mexico national under-17 football teamMexican under-17 team that won the 2005 FIFA U-17 World Championship2005 U17 World Championship held in Peru. He made his debut for the Mexico national football teamsenior national team in a 1–0 victory over Panama national football teamPanama on 9 September 2007. He has represented Mexico at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World CupWorld Cups. He was also a member of the team that won the gold-medal at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Summer Olympics.

Ole Gunnar Solskj\u00e6r.name: Ole Gunnar Solskjær
Ole Gunnar Solskj\u00e6r.intro:
'''Ole Gunnar Solskjær''' (born 26 February 1973) is a Norwegian Association footballfootball manager and former player. As a player, he spent most of his career playing as a Forward (association football)forward for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United.
Before his arrival in England, Solskjær played for the Norwegian clubs Clausenengen FKClausenengen and Molde FKMolde. He joined Manchester United in 1996 for a transfer fee of Pound sterling£1.5 million. Nicknamed "The Baby-faced Assassin", he played 366 times for United, and scored 126 goals during a successful period for the club. He was regarded as a "Substitute bench#Super-subsuper sub" for his trait of coming off the Substitute (association football)substitute bench to score late goals. Solskjær's defining moment in football came in injury time of the 1999 UEFA Champions League Final, where he scored the winning last-minute goal against FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich, completing a remarkable comeback and winning 1998–99 Manchester United F.C. seasonThe Treble for United.
In 2007, Solskjær announced his retirement from football after failing to recover from a serious knee injury. However, he remained at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in a coaching role as well as in an ambassadorial capacity. In 2008, Solskjær became the club's reserve team manager. He returned to his native country in 2011 to manage his former club, Molde, whom he led to their two first ever TippeligaenNorwegian league titles in his first two seasons with the club. He secured a third title in as many seasons, when his team won the 2013 Norwegian Football Cup Final. In 2014 he served as manager of Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, during which the club were relegated from the Premier League.
He also supervises a training academy for young footballers in his home town of Kristiansund, and is a patron of the Manchester United Supporters' Trust (formerly ''Shareholders United'').

Boncho Genchev.name: Boncho Genchev
Boncho Genchev.intro:
'''Boncho Lyubomirov Genchev''', also known as '''Bontcho Guentchev''' (; born 7 July 1964) is a Bulgarian retired professional Association footballfootballer who played as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
He started in his home country in the lower leagues before moving to FC Lokomotiv Gorna OryahovitsaLokomotiv Gorna and F.C. EtarEtar. After one year in Portugal with Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting, he went to England in 1992 and played in the Premier League with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and in the Football League for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town.
After a short spell in Bulgaria with PFC CSKA SofiaCSKA Sofia, he played non-league football in England during eight years, for Hendon F.C.Hendon and Carshalton Athletic F.C.Carshalton Athletic.
Genchev appeared with Bulgaria national football teamBulgaria at the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 World Cup and UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996 tournaments.

Ryan France.name: Ryan France
Ryan France.intro: '''Ryan France''' (born 13 December 1980 in Sheffield, England) is a former English professional association footballfootballer who last played for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United having spent the majority of his career at Alfreton Town F.C.Alfreton Town and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. His preferred position was as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger, but also played as a Defender (association football)#Wingbackright wingback.

Vedran \u0106orluka.name: Vedran Ćorluka
Vedran \u0106orluka.intro:
'''Vedran Ćorluka''' (; born 5 February 1986) is a Croatian association footballfootballer who plays for FC Lokomotiv MoscowLokomotiv Moscow and the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team. He plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre-back, though he has played in other positions across the defensive line, most notably as the Defender (association football)#Right backright-back.
Ćorluka graduated from the GNK Dinamo Zagreb AcademyDinamo Zagreb Youth Academy, before making his professional debut for Dinamo Zagreb in 2003. In 2007, he made a £8 million move to English Premier League club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, and after a season moved on to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He spent four seasons there before joining Lokomotiv.
Internationally, Ćorluka represented Croatia national football teamCroatia at various youth levels before making his first team debut in August 2006, in the friendly match against world champions Italy national football teamItaly. Since then, he has represented the country at the European Championships in UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012, and at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Maicon Sisenando.name: Maicon Sisenando
Maicon Sisenando.intro:
'''Maicon Douglas Sisenando''' (born 26 July 1981), known as '''Maicon''' (), is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)right back for Italian side A.S. RomaRoma. He has also played for the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team since 2003.
Maicon began his career in his native country Brazil for Cruzeiro Esporte ClubeCruzeiro, after initially playing for Criciúma as a youngster. He played 56 times for Cruzeiro between 2001 and 2004 and earned one Brazilian league title and several other domestic cups before moving to Europe when he signed for Ligue 1 side AS Monaco FCAS Monaco. After two years in France he signed for Inter MilanInternazionale in 2006 where he became an established first team player, going on to win the UEFA Champions League in 2010, four Serie A titles, the FIFA Club World Cup and various domestic competitions. Maicon was known to be capable both offensively and defensively. He was gifted with outstanding physical attributes, athleticism, excellent technical and crossing ability, as well as a powerful shot, making him a serious attacking threat down the right wing. Due to his success, strength, pace, power, and stamina, he earned the nickname "il colosso" (the colossus) during his time at Inter, where he developed into one of the best attacking fullbacks in the world. In August 2012, he signed for Manchester City, who at the time were managed by Roberto Mancini, the former Inter coach. Maicon failed to secure a regular place in the team competing for the same position with Pablo Zabaleta and Micah Richards and moved back to Italy to play for A.S. RomaRoma.
Maicon Sisenando.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Right wing back

Walter Alberto L\u00f3pez.name: Walter Alberto López
Walter Alberto L\u00f3pez.intro: '''Walter Alberto López Gasco''' (born 15 October 1985 in Montevideo) is a Uruguayan Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Italian club U.S. LecceLecce in defence or midfield. He also holds a Spanish passport.

Sam McMahon.name: Sam McMahon
Sam McMahon.intro:
'''Samuel "Sam" McMahon''' (born 10 February 1976 in Newark-on-Trent) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballer who played as a Midfielder (football)midfielder from 1994 to 2008.
He notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City before moving into the Football League with Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United. The final nine years of his career were played inside Non-league football, playing for Stevenage Borough F.C.Stevenage Borough, Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion, Hinckley United F.C.Hinckley United, King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn and Stamford A.F.C.Stamford.

Paolo Vernazza.name: Paolo Vernazza
Paolo Vernazza.intro: '''Paolo Andrea Pietro Vernazza''' (born 1 November 1979) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.

Simon Osborn.name: Simon Osborn
Simon Osborn.intro:
'''Simon Osborn''' (born 19 January 1972) is an English former Association footballfootballer and football manager. A midfielder, he played 434 league games in a 17-year career in the Football League.
He began his career with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, helping the club to the Football League First DivisionFirst Division title in 1993–94, before he made a £90,000 move to Reading F.C.Reading. He helped the "Royals" to a second place finish in the First Division in 1994–95, though they were then beaten in the 1995 Football League First Division play-off Finalplay-off final. He made a £1.1 million move to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in July 1995, before being sold on to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers for £1 million in December 1995. After six years and 185 appearances at Molineux StadiumMolineux, he was loaned out to Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, before switching to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in September 2001. He moved on to Gillingham F.C.Gillingham the following month, before he joined Walsall F.C.Walsall in July 2003. He joined Hereford United F.C.Hereford United in summer 2006, before moving into non-league football with Bromley F.C.Bromley. He helped the club to win promotion out of the Isthmian League in 2007, and briefly served the club as manager in 2008. He then joined Croydon Athletic F.C.Croydon Athletic, before scoring the winning goal for Cray Wanderers F.C.Cray Wanderers in the Isthmian League Division One South play-off final. In 2010, he became a player-coach at Erith & Belvedere F.C.Erith & Belvedere. He joined the coaching staff at Margate F.C.Margate in 2013, and was appointed joint-manager with Craig Holloway in April 2013, before losing his job eight months later.

Martin Kelly.name: Martin Kelly
Martin Kelly.intro: '''Martin Ronald Kelly''' (born 27 April 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Premier League club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and the England National Football TeamEngland national team.

Radoslav Kov\u00e1\u010d.name: Radoslav Kováč
Radoslav Kov\u00e1\u010d.intro: '''Radoslav Kováč''' (; born 27 November 1979) is a Czech RepublicCzech Association footballfootballer who currently plays for AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague. He plays midfield and defence. He previously played for SK Sigma OlomoucSigma Olomouc, Sparta Prague, FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, FC Basel and Slovan Liberec. On 6 January 2010, he announced his retirement from international football after representing the Czech Republic U21 and the senior team for nine years.

Claus Jensen.name: Claus Jensen
Claus Jensen.intro: '''Claus William Jensen''' (born 29 April 1977) is a former DenmarkDanish professional association footballfootballer, who played as a midfielder. Jensen played 47 games and scored 8 goals for the Denmark national football team, and represented Denmark at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup and 2004 UEFA European Football Championship2004 European Championship tournaments. He is the cousin of FC Vestsjælland winger Anders Due. He now works for the Danish TV Channel 6'eren as a commentator on Premier League.

Marc Rieper.name: Marc Rieper
Marc Rieper.intro: '''Marc Rieper-Jensen''' (born June 5, 1968) is a DenmarkDanish former professional football (soccer) player. He is the older brother of footballer Mads Rieper.
Marc Rieper.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

Vratislav Gre\u0161ko.name: Vratislav Greško
Vratislav Gre\u0161ko.intro: '''Vratislav Greško''' (born 24 July 1977) is a SlovakiaSlovak Association footballfootballer who currently plays for the Slovak Super LigaFortuna Liga club ŽP ŠPORT PodbrezováPodbrezová. His preferred position is left-back. He is an attacking full-back widely known for his crossing.

Charalampos Mavrias.name: Charalampos Mavrias
Charalampos Mavrias.intro: '''Charalampos "Charis" Mavrias''' ''(; born 21 February 1994)'' is a GreeksGreek association footballfootballer currently playing in Greek Super LeagueGreek Superleague for Panathinaikos F.C.Panathinaikos on loan from Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and the Greece national football teamGreek national team as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Mark Pembridge.name: Mark Pembridge
Mark Pembridge.intro: '''Mark Anthony Pembridge''' (born 29 November 1970) is a former footballer whose favoured position was the left side of midfield. He won numerous caps for Wales. He is currently a coach at the academy for Fulham F.C.Fulham.

Gareth McAuley.name: Gareth McAuley
Gareth McAuley.intro:
'''Gareth Gerald McAuley'''  (born 5 December 1979) is a Northern Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a defender (association football)defender.
McAuley began his career playing in Northern Irish football with Linfield F.C.Linfield, Ballyclare Comrades F.C.Ballyclare Comrades, Crusaders F.C.Crusaders and Coleraine F.C.Coleraine before joining English side Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in the summer of 2004. He impressed enough at Sincil Bank to earned a move to Championship side Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He moved on to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in June 2008 following Leicester's relegation and then on to Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in July 2011. McAuley won West Brom's player of the year award for the 2012–13 season.

Lamine Sakho.name: Lamine Sakho
Lamine Sakho.intro: '''Lamine Sakho''' (born 28 September 1977) is a Senegalese Association footballfootball player who currently plays for Championnat de France amateur side GS ConsolatConsolat Marseille.

Steve Stone.name: Steve Stone
Steve Stone.intro: '''Steven Brian "Steve" Stone''' (born 20 August 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer. He has been part of the coaching staff at Newcastle United since 2010.

Mikheil Kavelashvili.name: Mikheil Kavelashvili
Mikheil Kavelashvili.intro:
'''Mikhail Guramovich Kavelashvili''' (; born 22 July 1971 in Tbilisi) is a Georgia (country)Georgian former football (soccer)footballer.
As with many leading Georgian players, Kavelashvili began his career with FC Dinamo Tbilisi, emerging from their youth system in 1989. A skillful striker, he soon established himself in the Dinamo side before earning a move to Russian club FC Spartak Vladikavkaz in 1995.
He began training with Manchester City F.C. on March 1, 1996 [

Tommy Johnson (footballer, born 1971).name: Tommy Johnson (footballer, born 1971)
Tommy Johnson (footballer, born 1971).intro:
'''Thomas "Tommy" Johnson''' (born 15 January 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a striker (association football)striker from 1989 until 2007 notably in the Premier League for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Everton F.C.Everton and in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic and Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock.
He also played in the Football League for Notts County F.C.Notts County, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Scunthorpe United, before finishing his career in Non-league with Tamworth F.C.Tamworth and Rocester F.C.Rocester.
He is currently Head of Recruitment at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.

Taribo West.name: Taribo West
Taribo West.intro: '''Taribo West''' (born 26 March 1974) is a Nigerian former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. West represented the Nigeria national football teamNigerian national team in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 and 2002 FIFA World Cups. He is also known for the various unusual and colourful hairstyles that he has sported over the years.

Scott Howie.name: Scott Howie
Scott Howie.intro:
Howie played for local non-league side Ferguslie United before joining Clyde F.C.Clyde in 1991, continuing to study for his Business Degree. He graduated with a BA from University of StrathclydeStrathclyde Business School in July 1994. Howie was capped by Scotland national under-21 football teamScotland under-21s while with Clyde, making his debut against Malta national football teamMalta and also appearing for Clyde later the same day. He also helped Clyde to the Scottish Second Division Championship.
In August 1993 he was sold to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City for a fee of £300,000, but made just two first team appearances, both while regular goalkeeper Bryan Gunn was suspended. He was however a substitute for the UEFA Cup games against Vitesse Arnhem, Bayern Munich and Inter Milan.
With first team opportunities limited, Howie moved to Motherwell F.C.Motherwell in October 1994, again costing £300,000. His form with Motherwell resulted in call-ups to the full Scotland team, although he never appeared at full international level. With Motherwell suffering financial problems, Howie refused to sign a new contract, restricting him from playing for a few months.
He joined Coventry City F.C.Coventry City on loan in January 1998 and finally left Motherwell to join Reading F.C.Reading for a fee of £30,000 on transfer deadline day in March 1998. Reading were relegated at the end of the season, but Howie remained with them until being released at the end of the 2000–2001 season.
In July 2001 he joined Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and was their player of the year the following season. Despite this, he was released in May 2003 at the end of the following season. He had a successful trial with Exeter City F.C.Exeter City in July 2003, but failed to agree personal terms.
He joined Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town in August 2003 and played in the Conference National Playoff Final 2004final of the 2004 Conference play-offs. The match went to penalties, and Howie saved three of the spot-kicks as The Shrews won promotion back to the Football League at the first attempt. At the end of the 2004–05 season, Howie was one of only two players, the other being Stuart Whitehead, to be offered a new contract by Shrewsbury manager Gary Peters (footballer)Gary Peters. However, he was subsequently released and was on trial with Boston United F.C.Boston United in July 2005.
However, he joined Conference side Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United in August 2005, where he played under the management of his former Norwich team-mate Rob Newman (footballer)Rob Newman. He retired in the May 2006, with the Cambridge Evening News reporting on 10 May 2006 that he had retired to concentrate on his tax consultancy business.
On retiring he agreed to make himself available as cover for Cambridge's goalkeepers. In April 2007 he joined King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn. He was cover for regular King's Lynn keeper Paul Crichton the following season, but played as first choice goalkeeper during the 2008–09 season.
In June 2009 Howie joined Wroxham F.C.Wroxham, playing at Wembley for them as they lost 6–1 to Whitley Bay F.C.Whitley Bay in the FA Vase Final in May 2010.

Mikael Nilsson (footballer, born 1978).name: Mikael Nilsson (footballer, born 1978)
Mikael Nilsson (footballer, born 1978).intro: '''Mikael "Micke" Nilsson'''  (born 24 June 1978 in Ovesholm) is a retired SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder and Defender (association football)defender. His last club was Fremad Amager in the Danish 2nd Division East. Between 2002 and 2009, he played 64 matches for Sweden national football teamSweden and scored three goals. He is called "MiNi" by Swedish supporters, referring to the first letters in his first and second names.

Graham Dorrans.name: Graham Dorrans
Graham Dorrans.intro: '''Graham Dorrans''' (born 5 May 1987) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, on loan from West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team. In the 2009–10 Football League Championship2009–10 season, he helped West Brom gain promotion to the Premier League and was named in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship 2009–10 Football League Championship#Team of the YearTeam of the Year in the process. Dorrans has been described as a composed, creative, combative and consistent player.

Walter Pandiani.name: Walter Pandiani
Walter Pandiani.intro:
'''Walter Gerardo Pandiani Urquiza''' (born 27 April 1976) is a Uruguayan Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. Nicknamed ''El Rifle'', his best assets are his strength and aerial ability.
His performances for C.A. PeñarolPeñarol earned him a move to Deportivo de La Coruña in Spain, where he remained for the vast majority of his career, also representing RCD MallorcaMallorca, RCD EspanyolEspanyol (twice) and CA OsasunaOsasuna. He also spent a year with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in England.
Over the course of 12 seasons, Pandiani amassed La Liga totals of 279 games and 82 goals.

Michael Brown (footballer, born 1977).name: Michael Brown (footballer, born 1977)
Michael Brown (footballer, born 1977).intro:
'''Michael Robert Brown''' (born 25 January 1977) is an English peopleEnglish professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Football League OneLeague One side Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. A former England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 international, his hard-tackling style has sometimes caused him to take criticism from others in the game.
He began his career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City having come through their Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academyyouth ranks, and was named as the club's Player of the Year in 1998, before featuring in their Football League Second DivisionSecond Division play-off final victory in 1999 Football League Second Division play-off Final1999. He also spent time on loan at Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, before he was sold to Sheffield United for a £400,000 fee in January 2000. He scored 36 goals in 174 appearances during a four year stay in Sheffield, being named as the club's Player of the Year in 2002 and named on the PFA Team of the Year the following year. He moved back to the Premier League with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur for a £500,000 fee in January 2004. After two years with Spurs he moved on to Fulham F.C.Fulham for an 18-month stay. He was transferred to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in July 2007, where he would spend two seasons before making the move to Portsmouth in August 2009. He played for the club in their 2010 FA Cup Final2010 FA Cup final defeat to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, but could not prevent them from being relegated out of the top-flight that same year. He joined Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in July 2011, and went on to spend the next three years at Elland Road. He signed with Port Vale in July 2014, and also took on a coaching role with the "Valiants".

Danny Maddix.name: Danny Maddix
Danny Maddix.intro:
'''Daniel "Danny" Shawn Maddix''' (born 11 October 1967 in Ashford, KentAshford) is an English-born former Jamaican association footballfootballer who played as a defender for from 1986 to 2006.
He notably in the Premier League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He also played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Barnet F.C.Barnet and Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic as well as earning one cap for Jamaica national football teamJamaica.
Whilst with Barnet F.C.Barnet in 2004 he was briefly appointed caretaker manager.

Jon\u00e1s Guti\u00e9rrez.name: Jonás Gutiérrez
Jon\u00e1s Guti\u00e9rrez.intro:
'''Jonás Manuel Gutiérrez''' ( (born 5 July 1983) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team as a midfielder. He acquired his nickname "Spider-Man" or "Spider-Mag" (referencing Newcastle's nickname the Magpies) during his time at RCD Mallorca, where he celebrated a goal by putting on a Spider-Man mask. He also calls himself "El Galgo", which means "The Greyhound" in Spanish.
He was considered a key part of the Argentine national side by former coach Diego Maradona, who stated that his team was "Javier MascheranoMascherano, Lionel MessiMessi, Jonás, and eight more." He appeared for Argentina in the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.

Andreas Pereira.name: Andreas Pereira
Andreas Pereira.intro: '''Andreas Hoelgebaum Pereira''' (born 1 January 1996) is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Born in Duffel, Belgium, he began his career with nearby Lommel United. At the age of nine, he joined Dutch club PSV Eindhoven before signing for Manchester United in November 2011. He has played international football for the youth teams of both Belgium national football teamBelgium (the country of his birth) and Brazil national football teamBrazil (his father's homeland).

Jan M\u00f8lby.name: Jan Mølby
Jan M\u00f8lby.intro:
'''Jan Mølby''' (born 4 July 1963) is a DenmarkDanish former professional association footballfootballer, and manager.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1982 to 1998. He notably spent twelve years playing in England with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. After starting his career with Kolding IFKolding, he moved on to AFC AjaxAjax before spending more than a decade at Liverpool. He was capped 33 times by Denmark national football teamDenmark, scoring twice.
After leaving Liverpool he became player-manager of Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, where he spent two years, and then managed Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, guiding them to promotion to the Football League in 2000. He later had a brief spell as manager of Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and then a brief spell back in charge of Kidderminster Harriers.

Rob Bowman.name: Rob Bowman
Rob Bowman.intro: '''Robert Alexander Bowman''' (born in Durham, EnglandDurham on 21 November 1975) is an English peopleEnglish association footballfootballer who played professionally for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.

Patrice Evra.name: Patrice Evra
Patrice Evra.intro:
'''Patrice Latyr Evra''' (; born 15 May 1981) is a List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who plays for Italian club Juventus F.C.Juventus in Serie A. Originally an attacker, he primarily plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back. Evra, whom Alex FergusonSir Alex Ferguson praised for his leadership, also describing him as one of the best left-backs in Europe, has served as captain for both Manchester United and France.
The son of a diplomat, Evra was born in Senegal and arrived in Europe when he was a year old. He was raised in France and began his football career playing for various clubs in the Île-de-France (region)Île-de-France Regions of Franceregion such as hometown club CO Les Ulis and CSF Brétigny. In 1997, he had a stint at professional club Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain. A year later, Evra seized his first footballing opportunity in neighbouring Italy when he signed his first professional contract with S.C. Marsala 1912Marsala in Sicily. He made his professional debut with the club and, in the ensuing season, joined Monza. After a year playing with A.C. Monza Brianza 1912Monza, Evra returned to France to play for OGC NiceNice. Originally a midfielder, while playing at Nice, he was converted into a full-back. In 2002, Evra moved to MonacoMonégasque club AS Monaco FCMonaco and contributed to the team that won the Coupe de la Ligue in 2003 Coupe de la Ligue Final2003. He also featured in UEFAEuropean competition for the first time in his career and, in the 2003–04 UEFA Champions League2003–04 season, was the starting left-back on the Monaco team that reached the 2004 UEFA Champions League Final. In that same season domestically, Evra was named the National Union of Professional Footballers (UNFP) Ligue 1 Trophées UNFP du football#Young Player of the YearYoung Player of the Year. He was also named to the organisation's Ligue 1 Trophées UNFP du football#Team of the YearTeam of the Year.
Evra's performances with Monaco culminated into a move to English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in January 2006. While playing for Manchester United, Evra has won a slew of trophies, which included winning the 2006 Football League Cup FinalFootball League Cup in his debut season at the club. In his second season, he eclipsed compatriot Mikaël Silvestre and Gabriel Heinze as first-choice left-back and has since won five Premier League titles, one UEFA Champions League title, one FIFA Club World Cup, three League Cups, and four FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield titles. Evra has been named to the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) PFA Team of the YearTeam of the Year on three occasions. For his performances during the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season, he was named to both the FIFPro#FIFA FIFPro World XIFIFPro World XI and the UEFA Team of the Year.
Evra is also a France national football teamFrance international. Prior to playing at senior level, he played at France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. He made his senior international debut in August 2004 in a Exhibition matchfriendly match against Bosnia and Herzegovina national football teamBosnia and Herzegovina. Evra has participated in four major international tournaments for France; the UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012 editions of the UEFA European Football Championship and both the 2010 FIFA World Cup and 2014 FIFA World Cup. In the first competition, he appeared in two group stage matches. Ahead of the 2010 World Cup, Evra was named List of France national football team captainscaptain of the national team by Domenech and bore the armband for the first time in the team's friendly match against Costa Rica national football teamCosta Rica in May 2010. At the tournament, France endured a disastrous campaign which saw the players go on strike. The incident resulted in Evra, for his role as captain, being suspended from national team duty for five matches. However, he returned to the squad and enjoyed a successful 2014 World Cup in Brazil under Didier Deschamps, as France reached the quarter-finals.
Patrice Evra.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

David Fox.name: David Fox
David Fox.intro:
'''David Lee Fox''' (born 13 December 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Colchester United F.C.Colchester United.
Born in Leek, Staffordshire, Fox began his career with Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, where his father Peter Fox (footballer)Peter was player-manager, before joining Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in July 2000. However, he was unable to break into the first-team and spent time on loan with Belgian club Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp and Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town before making a permanent transfer to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in 2006. After three years with Blackpool, he joined Colchester United in 2009, before moving to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City a year later. In 2013, he went on a three-month loan to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He has also played for the England national under-20 football teamEngland Under-20s.

Daniel Cousin.name: Daniel Cousin
Daniel Cousin.intro:
'''Daniel Michel Cousin''' (born 2 February 1977 in Libreville) is a retired Gabonese Association footballfootball striker (association football)striker.
Previously he has played for FC MartiguesMartigues, Chamois Niortais F.C.Chamois Niortais, Le Mans Union Club 72, RC Lens, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Larissa F.C.Larissa and  Sapins FCSapins.

Pascal Cygan.name: Pascal Cygan
Pascal Cygan.intro:
'''Pascal Cygan''' (born 29 April 1974) is a French retired Association footballfootballer. His favoured position was Defender (association football)#Centre backcentral defender, but he could also play at Defender (association football)#Full backleft-back when needed.
After starting out at Lille OSCLille in his country, Cygan would play four years in the Premier League with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and three in La Liga with Villarreal CFVillarreal, in a 17-year professional career.

Daniele Padelli.name: Daniele Padelli
Daniele Padelli.intro: '''Daniele Padelli''' (born 25 October 1985) is a Italian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Torino F.C.Torino.

David Pizarro.name: David Pizarro
David Pizarro.intro:
'''David Marcelo Pizarro Cortés''' (born 11 September 1979) is a Chilean Association footballfootball midfielder who currently plays for ACF FiorentinaFiorentina in the Serie A. He is known for his vision, passing, dribbling skills and set piece ability.
He plays for the Chile national football teamChile national team, for which he won the Bronze medal at 2000 Summer Olympics at Sydney, AustraliaSydney and played at the Copa América. Pizarro is a Midfieldercentral midfielder, who can operate in a holding position or an attacking position in the hole behind the strikers.
During Pizarro's stay in Italian football, he won one Serie A title (2005–06 Serie A2005–06), three Coppa Italia titles and two Supercoppa Italiana titles. Pizarro's Italian nickname is "''Pek''", diminutive of "pequeño", meaning "small" in Spanish languageSpanish, because of his short height (1.70 meters).

Lukas Jutkiewicz.name: Lukas Jutkiewicz
Lukas Jutkiewicz.intro: '''Lukas Isaac Paul Jutkiewicz''' (born 28 March 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Burnley F.C.Burnley. He has previously played for the likes of Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Everton F.C.Everton, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Motherwell F.C.Motherwell, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.

Shane Ferguson.name: Shane Ferguson
Shane Ferguson.intro: '''Shane Kevin Ferguson''' (born 12 July 1991) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish association footballfootballer who is currently on loan at Scottish Championship club Rangers F.C.Rangers from the English Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. He previously spent two spells on loan to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City of the English Football League ChampionshipChampionship. Ferguson also plays for the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team. He is capable of playing anywhere on the left flank as a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back or Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Shane Ferguson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Danny Ward.name: Danny Ward
Danny Ward.intro: '''Daniel Carl "Danny" Ward''' (born 9 December 1990) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Football League Championship side Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, as a forward (association football)forward and winger.

Richard Duffy.name: Richard Duffy
Richard Duffy.intro:
'''Richard Michael Duffy''' (born 30 August 1985) is a Wales national football teamWelsh association footballfootballer who plays for Football League OneLeague One side Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. A versatile player who can play either on the right or at the centre of defence, he won 13 caps for his country between 2005 and 2008. He is the younger brother of Robert Duffy (footballer)Robert Duffy.
He began his career at Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, making his debut as a 16-year old in December 2001, before winning a six-figure sum move to Premier League side Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in January 2004. He never broke into the first team picture at Fratton Park, and instead enjoyed numerous loan moves at Burnley F.C.Burnley, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, and former club Swansea. He switched to Millwall F.C.Millwall in February 2009, before signing with Exeter City F.C.Exeter City in July 2009. He joined Port Vale in July 2012, and helped the club to secure promotion out of Football League TwoLeague Two in 2012–13.

Chris Whyte.name: Chris Whyte
Chris Whyte.intro:
'''Christopher Anderson "Chris" Whyte''' (born 2 September 1961) is an English former association footballfootballer. He made nearly 400 appearances in the Football League and Premier League for a variety of clubs, and was cap (sport)capped by England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level.
He was a pivotal part of the league title-winning Leeds United team of 1992.

Vince Bartram.name: Vince Bartram
Vince Bartram.intro:
'''Vincent Lee "Vince" Bartram''' (born 7 August 1968 in Birmingham) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, who played as a Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper from 1986 until 2004. He is now goalkeeping coach at Premier League side Southampton F.C.Southampton.
As a player he notably played in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where he was understudy to David Seaman throughout the majority of his time at Highbury. He also played in the Football League for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Gillingham F.C.Gillingham.

Carl Ikeme.name: Carl Ikeme
Carl Ikeme.intro:
'''Carl Onora Ikeme''' (born 8 June 1986) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Despite his English birthplace, he has chosen to represent Nigeria national football teamNigeria at international level. He has been called up to the ''Nigeria national football teamSuper Eagles'' squad but has not yet played for them.

Paul Allen.name: Paul Allen
Paul Allen.intro: '''Paul Kevin Allen''' (born 28 August 1962) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder in the Football League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Millwall F.C.Millwall in the 1980s and 1990s. He won three cap (sport)caps for England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level.

Gary Neville.name: Gary Neville
Gary Neville.intro:
'''Gary Alexander Neville''' (born 18 February 1975) is an English association footballfootball coach and former player who currently serves as a coach for the England national football team, and as co-owner of Salford City F.C.Salford City. Since retiring from football in the middle of the 2010–11 season, Neville has gone into punditry and is a commentator for Sky Sports. He is England national football teamEngland's most-cap (football)capped Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back and was Manchester United F.C.Manchester United's captain (association football)club captain for five years.
Neville spent his entire playing career at Old Trafford, making him a List of one-club menone-club man. At the time of his retirement in 2011, he was United's second longest serving player in the squad, behind his long-time team-mate Ryan Giggs. He made his international debut in 1995 and was first-choice right-back for club and country for more than ten years.
He is the older brother of twin siblings, former Manchester United and Everton F.C.Everton player Phil Neville and sister Tracey Neville, a retired netball international.
Gary Neville.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Stuart O'Keefe.name: Stuart O'Keefe
Stuart O'Keefe.intro: '''Stuart Antony Alan O'Keefe''' (born 4 March 1991) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder (association football)midfielder for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Enrique de Lucas.name: Enrique de Lucas
Enrique de Lucas.intro:
'''Enrique "Quique" de Lucas Martínez''' (born 17 August 1978) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Biggleswade United F.C.Biggleswade United mainly as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
He started his professional career with RCD EspanyolEspanyol, going on to amass La Liga totals of 168 games and 25 goals over the course of eight seasons, also representing in the competition Deportivo AlavésAlavés, Real MurciaMurcia and Celta de VigoCelta. He added 268/53 in Segunda División, where he played for all the clubs except his first.
De Lucas had two spells abroad, including the 2002–03 FA Premier League2002–03 campaign with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.

J\u00e1n Mucha.name: Ján Mucha
J\u00e1n Mucha.intro: '''Ján Mucha''' (born 5 December 1982) is a SlovakiaSlovak Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper who plays for FC Arsenal TulaArsenal Tula on loan from FC Krylia Sovetov SamaraKrylia Sovetov Samara.

Peter Whittingham.name: Peter Whittingham
Peter Whittingham.intro: '''Peter Michael Whittingham'''  (born 8 September 1984) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. His primary position is as a central midfielder, although he can operate as a winger on both the left and right, as well as a second-striker.

Alfons Groenendijk.name: Alfons Groenendijk
Alfons Groenendijk.intro: '''Alfons Groenendijk''' (born 17 May 1964 in Leiden) is a former NetherlandsDutch association footballfootballer and the current technical director for Romanian side FC Universitatea Cluj.

Chris Eagles.name: Chris Eagles
Chris Eagles.intro: '''Christopher Mark "Chris" Eagles''' (born 19 November 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. Primarily a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, he can also play as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder. After coming through the youth system at Watford F.C.Watford, he began his professional career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but was unable to break into the first team. He had two loan spells back at Watford, as well as with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Dutch club N.E.C. (football club)N.E.C., before a permanent move to Burnley F.C.Burnley in 2008. He has also played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Steffen Iversen.name: Steffen Iversen
Steffen Iversen.intro:
'''Steffen Iversen''' (born 10 November 1976) is a Norwegian former Association footballfootballer who played as a striker. He is the son of former Norway national football teamNorway international Odd Iversen, one of Norway's most prolific goalscorers of all time.
Iversen began his career as an 18-year-old at Rosenborg where he won two consecutive Norwegian league championships. He moved to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in December 1996, where he scored 64 goals in seven years, and won the Football League CupLeague Cup. After a brief spell at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, he moved back to his native Norway where he spent two years at Vålerenga FotballVålerenga and was a contributing factor to Vålerenga's first league championship in 21 years. In 2006 he moved back to Rosenborg, where he won his second consecutive league title, and after another league victory in 2010, Iversen spent 13 months at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, before he signed for Rosenborg for the third time in February 2012.
Iversen was capped 79 times for the national team, scoring 21 goals. He scored Norway's only goal in a UEFA European Football Championship when he scored the match-winning goal against Spain national football teamSpain in the group stage of UEFA Euro 2000.

David Watson (footballer, born 1973).name: David Watson (footballer, born 1973)
David Watson (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''David Watson''' (born 10 November 1973) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team. He currently works as a goalkeeping coach for both Southampton F.C.Southampton and England national football teamEngland.

Richard Chaplow.name: Richard Chaplow
Richard Chaplow.intro: '''Richard David Chaplow''' (born 2 February 1985) is an English professional footballer who plays  as a midfielder for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town on loan from Millwall F.C.Millwall.

Andy Clarke.name: Andy Clarke
Andy Clarke.intro:
'''Andrew Weston''' "'''Andy'''" '''Clarke''' (born 22 July 1967) is an English former Association footballfootballer. A Forward (association football)striker, he scored 74 goals in 410 league games in a 14-year career in the Football League.
After helping Barnet F.C.Barnet to the Conference NationalConference title in 1990–91, he was signed to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, a Football League side, at the relatively late age of 23. He played for the "Dons" in the Premier League, before being loaned out to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1998 and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town in 1999. He joined Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United in June 1999, and scored the only goal of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division play-off final in 2000 Football League Third Division play-off Final2000. He retired in May 2005.

Sean Thornton.name: Sean Thornton
Sean Thornton.intro:
'''Sean Thornton''' (born 18 May 1983 in Drogheda, Ireland) is a professional footballer currently playing for Drogheda United in League of IrelandSSE Airtricity League.
He made 11 appearances in the Premier League for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in the 2002–03 season and has made over 175 appearances in the Football League, mostly for Sunderland, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Leyton Orient.

Neil Pointon.name: Neil Pointon
Neil Pointon.intro:
'''Neil Geoffrey "Dissa" Pointon''', born 28 November 1964 in Church Warsop, Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, England, is a former professional Association footballfootballer. Pointon was a left-back who is perhaps best remembered for playing for Everton F.C.Everton, Manchester City and Oldham Athletic.
Pointon began his career at lower-league Scunthorpe United and quickly established himself as a regular first-teamer and a consistent and reliable performer in defence. In the autumn of 1985, after four years at Scunthorpe, Pointon was bought by the reigning English league champions Everton for £75,000, manager Howard Kendall hoping Pointon could provide squad cover for regular left-back Pat Van Den Hauwe. Ultimately Pointon ended up featuring in the majority of Everton's games during the remainder of the 1985/86 season as a result of Van den Hauwe moving to central defence to cover for the injured centre-back Derek Mountfield. Everton finished that season as runners-up to local rivals Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in both the league championship and the FA Cup, though Pointon played no part in the FA Cup final due to Mountfield's return to fitness.
In the following season, Pointon struggled with injury and had to compete with not only Van den Hauwe but also veteran defender Paul Power (footballer born 1953)Paul Power, signed from Manchester City, for the left-back spot at Goodison. Pointon did however play enough games that year to qualify for a Championship winners medal as Everton won their second title in three years.
Over the next couple of years Pointon was a consistent performer in the Everton defence when called up to the first team, although Kendall's departure to Athletic Bilbao and the break-up of the Championship winning side saw a decline in the club's fortunes. During 1989/90, Pointon became Everton's first choice left-back following the sale of Van den Hauwe to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
In the summer of 1990, Pointon left Everton to rejoin Howard Kendall at his new club Manchester City, with Kendall receiving Pointon and £300,000 in exchange for Andy Hinchcliffe. Pointon spent two years at City as a first-team regular before moving on to Joe Royle's Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, then a top-flight club. Pointon spent three years at Boundary Park, during which time the club were relegated from the FA Premier LeaguePremiership.
On 10 April 1994, Pointon put the Latics ahead in the 106th minute (extra time) of the FA Cup semi final at Wembley Stadium against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, only for Mark Hughes to equalise one minute before the final whistle and force a replay. The replay at Maine Road saw the Latics lose 4–1. United went on to win both the Premier League title and FA Cup, while Pointon and his colleagues had the double misery of an FA Cup exit and Premier League relegation in less than a month.  During this period Neil made the tabloid papers following a brief liaison with television personality Dani Behr.
Pointon joined Scottish Premier Division outfit Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian in 1995, enjoying a number of seasons up in Scotland before later playing for Walsall F.C.Walsall, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield and Hednesford Town. He scored for Hednesford against former club Oldham Athletic in an FA Cup tie at Keys Park, soon before being handed the reins as Manager at Hednesford. He lasted as little as 9 games in his first Managerial post before being sacked after not winning a single game. The club later got relegated, but very few fans of the Staffordshire Club actually put the blame with him.
After a spell as player-manager of Retford United he joined Mossley as a player and helped Mossley to win the Worthington Challenge Trophy at Gigg Lane, Bury with a 2–1 win over Clitheroe in his last ever professional game.
He currently works for the Bolton Wanderers Academy team as a coach.

Lee Sinnott.name: Lee Sinnott
Lee Sinnott.intro:
'''Lee Sinnott''' (born 12 July 1965) is an English former professional association footballfootballer turned football manager, who is in charge at Conference Premier side Altrincham F.C.Altrincham.
As a player, he was a Defender (association football)defender for Walsall F.C.Walsall, Watford F.C.Watford, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Scarborough F.C.Scarborough. His biggest impact was at Bradford City, where he stayed for five years over two spells, making over 200 appearances. He made 505 appearances in the Football League, and over 600 appearances in all competitions. He played in the 1984 FA Cup Final for Watford, taking home a runners-up medal.
He achieved enormous success as manager of Farsley Celtic A.F.C.Farsley Celtic between 2003 and 2007, winning promotion three times in four seasons to take the club from the Northern Premier League to the Conference. This was followed by a short spell at the Football Leagueleague club Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in the 2007–08 season. He managed Bradford Park Avenue A.F.C.Bradford Park Avenue for ten months in 2009, before returning to the game with Altrincham in 2011. He led Altrincham to win promotion out of the Conference North via the play-offs in 2014.

Patrick Roberts.name: Patrick Roberts
Patrick Roberts.intro: '''Patrick John Joseph Roberts''' (born 5 February 1997) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Second strikersecond striker or Midfielder#Wingerright winger for Fulham F.C.Fulham.ref name="FulhamU18". Patrick Roberts went to Wimbledon College.
Patrick Roberts.position: Forward  association football  Second striker Second striker

Tommy Miller.name: Tommy Miller
Tommy Miller.intro:
'''Thomas William "Tommy" Miller''' (born 8 January 1979) is an EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United.
He has previously played for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town.

Seol Ki-hyeon.name: Seol Ki-hyeon
Seol Ki-hyeon.intro:
