Greg Shields.name: Greg Shields
Greg Shields.intro: '''Greg Shields''' (born 21 August 1976 in Falkirk) is a former Scottish Association footballfootballer who is currently assistant coach with Carolina RailHawks in the North American Soccer League.

Franco Di Santo.name: Franco Di Santo
Franco Di Santo.intro:
'''Franco Matías Di Santo''' (born 7 April 1989) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for German club SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen.
He began his career at Chilean club Audax Italiano, earning a £3.4 million move to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2008 and a first-team place following good form in the reserves. After a season on loan at Blackburn Rovers he moved to Wigan Athletic for £2 million, where he won the FA Cup in 2013 but was released after the club's relegation.
Di Santo has represented the Argentina national football team on three occasions. He was nicknamed 'Crespito' (Little Crespo) after Chelsea's former Argentinian striker Hernán Crespo.

Jan Eriksson.name: Jan Eriksson
Jan Eriksson.intro:
'''Jan Jonas Jakob Eriksson''' (born 24 August 1967 in Sundsvall) is a former Association footballfootballer from Sweden. He played 35 matches and scored four goals for the Sweden national football teamnational team. Two of those goals came at the UEFA Euro 1992Euro 1992. He was selected for the 1990 FIFA World Cup squad, but did not play. Eriksson was also selected for the Swedish 1994 FIFA World Cup squad but had to leave the team just before the start of the tournament because of an injury. He was replaced by Teddy Lucic.
He was awarded Guldbollen in 1992. Eriksson's father Jan-Åke Eriksson and younger brother Patrik Eriksson-Ohlsson are also footballers.

Filipe Lu\u00eds.name: Filipe Luís
Filipe Lu\u00eds.intro:
'''Filipe Luís Kasmirski''', known as '''Filipe Luís''' (born 9 August 1985), is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
A player of tireless approach, he played most of his professional career in Spain, most notably for Deportivo de La Coruña, which he represented four seasons, and Atlético Madrid, winning domestic and continental honours with the latter.
Filipe Luís earned his first cap for the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team in 2009, and was part of the squad which won the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup on home soil.
Filipe Lu\u00eds.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Chico Flores.name: Chico Flores
Chico Flores.intro: '''José Manuel Flores Moreno''' (born 6 March 1987), commonly known as '''Chico''' or '''Chico Flores''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Qatari club Lekhwiya SC as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Chico Flores.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Bryan Robson.name: Bryan Robson
Bryan Robson.intro:
'''Bryan Robson''' Order of the British EmpireOBE (born 11 January 1957[
He managed Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough for seven years, guiding them to two promotions to the FA Premier League and to the first three cup finals of the club's history, later returning to West Bromwich Albion for a two-year spell as manager after a brief and unsuccessful spell in charge of Bradford City. He has also managed Sheffield United and the Thailand national team.
He has also been employed by Manchester United more recently as an ambassador for the club.
Born in Chester-le-Street, County Durham, Robson began his playing career at West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, before moving on to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, whom he captained to three FA Cups and a UEFA Cup Winners' CupEuropean Cup Winners' Cup. He also won two FA Premiership winners medals. Towards the end of his playing career he moved into management as player-manager with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. Robson had a good goal-scoring record; terrific anticipation, movement, timing on and off the ball; was fiercely competitive and brave; possessed high levels of stamina; tackled, passed well and was also a good header of the ball. He represented England national football teamEngland on 90 occasions between 1980 and 1991, making him the sixth most cap (football)capped England player of all-time,Correct as of 9 October 2007. Robson is behind Peter Shilton, Bobby Moore, Bobby Charlton, Billy Wright (footballer born 1924)Billy Wright and David Beckham in the all-time list. and has the eleventh highest goalscoring tally with 26. Robson captained his country 65 times, with only Bobby Moore and Billy Wright (footballer born 1924)Billy Wright having captained England on more occasions. Robson is also known by the nicknames "Robbo" and "Captain Marvel". Bobby Robson stated that Robson was, along with Alan Shearer, the best British player he ever worked with. In August 2011, Robson was voted as the greatest ever Manchester United player from a poll of ex Manchester United Players as part of a new book, ''19'', released to celebrate their 19th league title win.
Robson began his management career with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 1994, although he did not retire from playing until 1997. In seven years as Middlesbrough manager, he guided them to three Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley finals, which were all lost, and earned them promotion to the Premier League on two occasions. He later returned to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion for two years as manager, helping them become the first top division team in 14 years to avoid relegation after being bottom of the league table on Christmas Day. Less successful have been his short-lived spells as manager of Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, the former lasting barely six months and ending in relegation from what is now the Football League Championship, and the latter lasting less than a year and seeing his expensively-assembled side fail to challenge for promotion to the Premier League. On 23 September 2009, Robson was appointed manager of the Thailand national football teamThailand national team. He resigned on 8 June 2011. On 1 July 2011, Robson was appointed "Global Ambassador" at Manchester United.

David Elm.name: David Elm
David Elm.intro:
'''David Elm''' (born 10 January 1983) is a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer who plays for Kalmar FF as a striker. He previously played for Swedish clubs Kalmar FF, Falkenbergs FF and IF Elfsborg and for English club Fulham F.C.Fulham.
He is the older brother of Rasmus Elm of Kalmar FF and Viktor Elm of AZ Alkmaar.

Jobi McAnuff.name: Jobi McAnuff
Jobi McAnuff.intro:
'''Joel Joshua Frederick Melvin "Jobi" McAnuff''' (born 9 November 1981) is a professional Association footballfootballer playing for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient.
He began his career at Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, making over 100 appearances for the club before brief spells at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. McAnuff joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 2005, spending two years there before moving again, this time to Watford F.C.Watford before joining Reading F.C.Reading in 2009. He was appointed captain in 2011 and went on to make over 200 appearances in all competition for the Royals. Prior to Reading's promotion to the Premier League in 2011–12 Football League Championship2011–12 he had spent his entire career playing in England's second tier, amassing over 400 league appearances. He joined Leyton Orient in 2014. He is predominantly a Midfielder#wingerwinger but he has also played as an occasional central midfielder.
Despite being born in London, McAnuff has represented Jamaica national football teamJamaica, his father's country of birth, at international level. He made his debut in May 2002 although his next appearance did not come until nearly eleven years later in February 2013.

Adl\u00e8ne Guedioura.name: Adlène Guedioura
Adl\u00e8ne Guedioura.intro:
'''Adlène Guedioura''' (; born 12 November 1985) is a French born Algerian Algeria national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Watford F.C.Watford on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
Guedioura is the son of former Algerian international striker, Nacer Guedioura. His mother, Enriqueta Soreira Pons, was a former SpainSpanish basketball player. His younger brother Nabil Guedioura is also a professional footballer who last played for Nottingham Forest's under 21's development team. Guedioura is Muslim. Guedioura is known for his powerful long range shots earning him the nickname Rocket Factory. In the 2011–2012 season, he won "Goal of the Season" for both Nottingham Forest and Wolverhampton Wanderers. He is thought to be the first footballer ever to win the award for two clubs in the same season.

Geoff Thomas (footballer, born 1964).name: Geoff Thomas (footballer, born 1964)
Geoff Thomas (footballer, born 1964).intro: '''Geoffrey Robert Thomas''' born Manchester, England (born 5 August 1964) is a former English Association footballfootballer, who won nine caps for the full England team and captained Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace to the FA Cup final in 1990. He is the Founder of the Geoff Thomas Foundation, a charity that raises funds to fight cancer, a disease from which Thomas has suffered.

Efstathios Tavlaridis.name: Efstathios Tavlaridis
Efstathios Tavlaridis.intro: '''Efstathios Tavlaridis''' (; born 25 January 1980 in Serres), commonly known as '''Stathis Tavlaridis''', is a GreeceGreek Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender currently playing for Greek Superleague club Panathinaikos F.C.Panathinaikos. Tavlaridis has earned the nickname ''"Taureau"'' in France which means ''"The Bull"'' due to his aggressive style of play.

\u00c1kos Buzs\u00e1ky.name: Ákos Buzsáky
\u00c1kos Buzs\u00e1ky.intro: '''Ákos Buzsáky''' (born 7 May 1982) is a Hungarian Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder, who currently plays for Ferencvárosi TC. Born in Budapest, he has played in the Nemzeti Bajnokság for MTK Budapest FCMTK Budapest, the Primeira Liga for F.C. PortoPorto, the Premier League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, and the Football League for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Queens Park Rangers, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. Buzsáky has been Cap (sport)capped at international level by the Hungary national football teamHungary national team, for whom he made his debut in 2005.

Wilson Palacios.name: Wilson Palacios
Wilson Palacios.intro:
'''Wilson Roberto Palacios Suazo''' (; born 29 July 1984) is a HondurasHonduran Association footballfootballer who plays in the Premier League for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Born in La Ceiba, he played for C.D. VictoriaVictoria and C.D. OlimpiaOlimpia in Honduras before moving to England where he played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. In 2009 he joined Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, generally playing central defensive midfield as he did for previous club Wigan. He was occasionally used for Tottenham Hotspur as a right midfielder. He has been a regular player for Honduras national football teamHonduras since 2003, helping them qualify for the 2010 FIFA World Cup for the second time in their history. In August 2011 Palacios joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for an undisclosed fee believed to be around £6 million.

Morgan Schneiderlin.name: Morgan Schneiderlin
Morgan Schneiderlin.intro:
'''Morgan Schneiderlin''' (, born 8 November 1989) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton and the  France national football teamFrance national team as a midfielder.
He began his career with local team RC Strasbourg before joining Southampton in June 2008. He has since become a regular in the starting lineup, and was in the teams which earned consecutive promotions to reach the Premier League.
After representing the nation at all levels from France national under-16 football teamUnder-16 onwards, Schneiderlin made his senior international debut in 2014, and later that year played for France at the 2014 FIFA World CupWorld Cup.

Jes\u00fas Navas.name: Jesús Navas
Jes\u00fas Navas.intro:
'''Jesús Navas González''' (; born 21 November 1985) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger. His main assets are his pace, quick dribbling and an ability to run at opposing defenders.
He played the vast majority of his career with Sevilla FCSevilla, appearing in 393 official games and winning six major titles, including two UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cups and two Copa del ReyCopas del Rey. In 2013, he signed for Manchester City.
A Spain national football teamSpanish international since 2009, Navas helped his country win the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012.

Carlos Edwards.name: Carlos Edwards
Carlos Edwards.intro:
'''Akenhaton Carlos Edwards''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 24 October 1978), known as '''Carlos Edwards''', is a Trinidad and TobagoTrinidadian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall as a right-back. He started his footballing career in Trinidad and Tobago before moving to Wrexham F.C.Wrexham in 2000 for whom he made over 150 appearances.  He has had spells with Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, and a brief loan period with Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Edwards has made over 80 appearances for the Trinidad and Tobago national football team, scoring four goals.

Luciano Figueroa.name: Luciano Figueroa
Luciano Figueroa.intro: '''Luciano Gabriel "Lucho" Figueroa Herrera''' (; born 19 May 1981) is an Argentina national football teamArgentina international association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Malaysia Super League team Johor Darul Takzim FC.

Ricardo Gabriel \u00c1lvarez.name: Ricardo Gabriel Álvarez
Ricardo Gabriel \u00c1lvarez.intro: '''Ricardo Gabriel "Ricky" Álvarez''' (; born 12 April 1988) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for English club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland on loan from Inter MilanInternazionale.

Neil Mellor.name: Neil Mellor
Neil Mellor.intro: '''Neil Andrew Mellor''' (born 4 November 1982 in Sheffield, South Yorkshire) is an English retired professional Association footballfootballer who began his career at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the Premier League and most recently played for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End. He made his name in 2004 by scoring a stunning last-minute goal from long range to give Liverpool F.C.Liverpool a 2–1 victory over Arsenal F.C.Arsenal at Anfield. Mellor also scored a vital goal and set up another during Liverpool's match with Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos at Anfield during the group stage of the 2004–05 UEFA Champions League, which Liverpool went on to win. In December 2011, a knee injury sustained following a tackle by Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes striker Jabo Ibehre resulted in Mellor being forced into announcing his retirement on 9 May 2012. Since his retirement, Mellor has been doing media work, including match updates for SkySports News and work for LFC TV.

David Meyler.name: David Meyler
David Meyler.intro:
'''David John Meyler''' (born 29 May 1989) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Premier League side Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. He is the son of hurling manager John Meyler. He grew up in Rochestown Rise in Cork (city)Cork and, like his father, played hurling, Gaelic football and football from an early age.
After turning professional at local team Cork City F.C.Cork City, Meyler moved to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in the Premier League in 2010. He joined Hull in January 2013 after a short loan spell. He has been a full international for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland since 2012.

Roger Palmer.name: Roger Palmer
Roger Palmer.intro:
'''Roger Palmer''' (born 30 January 1959) is an ex-Football (soccer)footballer. He played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He is the all-time leading goal-scorer at Oldham with 141 goals.
Roger was an undemonstrative player, and a quiet and modest man off the field.
Roger's career culminated in a superb run of success for Oldham, including appearances in the 1990 Football League Cup Final at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley and FA Cup semi-finals. In his testimonial season (1990–91), Oldham won the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division championship and rejoined the top flight of English football.
Since his retirement from football, he has been reclusive but he is remembered with fondness in Oldham.
The Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Latics fans demonstrate their reverence for Roger in their chant "Ooooh, Roger Palmer, oooooh, Roger Palmer, ooooh Roger Palmer".
In January 2008, the BBC Sport website put out an appeal for information on Palmer's whereabouts, ahead of the Oldham v Everton FA Cup Third Round tie.  The teams last played in a cup tie in 1990, with Palmer the only player whose whereabouts were unknown. Both the media and Oldham Athletic attempted several times to contact Palmer without success. 'Where is Roger Palmer?' went round Boundary Park several times.
Finally, on 8 May 2010 on the final day of the season against Charlton Athletic, Palmer made an appearance on the Boundary Park pitch at half time to rapturous applause and chants of "OOOHH ROGER PALMER!".
Roger has been living on the Racecourse Estate in Sale, Greater ManchesterSale, Greater Manchester, since retirement. He played the odd game for local community centre and a couple of Sunday games for local pubs.

Brian Kerr.name: Brian Kerr
Brian Kerr.intro: '''Brian Kerr''' (born 12 October 1981) is a Scottish Association footballfootball player. During his career, Kerr played as a midfielder for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Livingston F.C.Livingston, Motherwell F.C.Motherwell, Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.Inverness CT, Dundee F.C.Dundee and Arbroath F.C.Arbroath. Kerr represented Scotland national football teamScotland at senior international level, earning three Cap (sport)caps during Berti Vogts' reign as national team manager.

Mauricio Taricco.name: Mauricio Taricco
Mauricio Taricco.intro:
'''Mauricio Ricardo Taricco''' (born 10 March 1973) is an ArgentinaArgentine former professional footballer and most recently the  assistant manager at Premier League side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender who initially played from 1993 to 2004. He began his career in his native Argentina for Argentinos Juniors before transferring to England where he spent the next 10 years representing Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He suffered a hamstring injury on his debut for West Ham and agreed to tear up his contract after the game, after initially retiring following the injury he came out of retirement a year later playing for lower league ItalyItalian side A.S. Villasimius before later joining Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion as player/assistant manager to Gus Poyet in 2010. He retired for the second time at the end of the 2012–13 season and would go on to follow Poyet to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland during the following season.

Bradley Wright-Phillips.name: Bradley Wright-Phillips
Bradley Wright-Phillips.intro:
'''Bradley Edward Wright-Phillips''' (born 12 March 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for the New York Red Bulls in Major League Soccer.
He began his career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City of the Premier League, spending the remainder of his time in England in second and third tiers with Southampton F.C.Southampton, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Brentford F.C.Brentford. Wright-Phillips joined the Red Bulls halfway through the 2013 Major League Soccer season2013 season, helping them to the MLS Supporters' ShieldSupporters' Shield, and in his first full season he equalled the league's record for most goals in a single campaign with 27.
Wright-Phillips earned five England national under-20 football teamEngland U20 caps in 2005.

Clive Mendonca.name: Clive Mendonca
Clive Mendonca.intro: '''Clive Paul Mendonca''' (born 9 September 1968 in Sunderland, Tyne and WearSunderland) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, who played as a striker between 1986 and 2002 notably for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. Mendonca also played for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United.
Clive Mendonca.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Striker

Jamie Vardy.name: Jamie Vardy
Jamie Vardy.intro:
'''Jamie Richard Vardy''' (born 11 January 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He plays as a Forward (association football)striker, but can also play as a winger (sports)winger.
After being released by Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday at the age of sixteen, Vardy began his senior career with Stocksbridge Park Steels F.C.Stocksbridge Park Steels, breaking into the first team in 2007, where he spent three seasons before joining Northern Premier League side F.C. Halifax TownHalifax Town in 2010. Scoring 27 goals in his debut season, he won the club's "Player's Player of the Year" award. He started the 2011–12 season with Halifax but moved to Conference Premier side Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town in August 2011 for an undisclosed fee. He scored 31 league goals for Fleetwood in 2011–12, winning the club's "Player of the Year" award, his second personal honour in two seasons, helping Fleetwood to the Conference Premier title. In May 2012, he signed for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in the Football League Championship for a non-League footballnon-league record transfer fee of £1 million.

Urby Emanuelson.name: Urby Emanuelson
Urby Emanuelson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left Back

Darren Peacock.name: Darren Peacock
Darren Peacock.intro:
'''Darren Peacock''' (born 3 February 1968 in Bristol) is an English football manager and former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentral defender. He is currently the manager of Northern Premier League Division One North league club Lancaster City having been appointed in April 2013, Peacock's first managerial position.
He made nearly 400 league appearances, beginning his career in the lower reaches of the Football League, before spending eight seasons in the Premier League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. Injury forced his retirement at the age of 32.
Darren Peacock.position: Defender  association football  Centre defender Centre defender

Gavin Johnson.name: Gavin Johnson
Gavin Johnson.intro: '''Gavin Johnson''' (born 10 October 1970) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer. A defender or midfielder, he currently plays for Needham Market F.C.Needham Market.

Leigh Bromby.name: Leigh Bromby
Leigh Bromby.intro:
'''Leigh David Bromby''' (born 2 June 1980) is a retired English association footballfootballer who last played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship of the Football in EnglandEnglish The Football LeagueFootball League as a Defender (association football)defender. Bromby subsequently became a coach of Leeds United's Under 16's side.cite news
title = PROMOTION WINNERS STEP UP COACHING DUTIES
url =
publisher = Leeds United Official Website
date = 3 April 2013
accessdate = 2013-04-03 He currently works for Huddersfield Town as the Professional Development Coach.
He's the only player to have played 100 games for each of the steel city rivals Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He is also well known for his long throw.

Ryo Miyaichi.name: Ryo Miyaichi
Ryo Miyaichi.intro: , is a Japanese professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (sports)winger for Dutch Eredivisie side FC Twente, on loan from Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He has been described by team-mate Theo Walcott as a player with great pace and trickery on the ball. He has had a number of loan spells away from Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, to Premier League clubs such as Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He also played in the Eredivisie for Feyenoord in 2011. Japan's head coach Alberto Zaccheroni has said that "Miyaichi's strengths are on the flanks and creating space going forward,".

Julian Joachim.name: Julian Joachim
Julian Joachim.intro:
'''Julian Kevin Joachim''' (born 20 September 1974) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Shepshed Dynamo F.C.Shepshed Dynamo.
During his professional career he initially played from 1992 until 2011, but he came out of retirement in 2013. Joachim notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, having also played for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Boston United F.C.Boston United and Darlington F.C.Darlington before moving into the Non-League game to play for King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn, Thurmaston Town, Quorn F.C.Quorn, Hinckley United F.C.Hinckley United, Holbeach United F.C.Holbeach United and Coalville Town F.C.Coalville Town. Over the course of his career in professional football, he has scored over 100 league goals and accumulated over 450 league appearances. Whilst at Aston Villa he played in the 2000 FA Cup Final.

Dale Gordon.name: Dale Gordon
Dale Gordon.intro:
'''Dale Andrew Gordon''' (born 9 January 1967 in Caister-on-SeaCaister, Great Yarmouth) is a former professional association football player who played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Rangers F.C.Rangers, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Millwall F.C.Millwall and A.F.C. BournemouthAFC Bournemouth. He was a midfielder – predominantly right-sided – who excited supporters by running at defenders and setting up numerous goals for his team mates.
Gordon used to be the Director of Football at Great Yarmouth Town F.C.Great Yarmouth Town.[

Jonathan Douglas.name: Jonathan Douglas
Jonathan Douglas.intro: '''Jonathan Michael Douglas''' (born 22 November 1981) is an IrelandIrish Association footballfootball player who currently plays for Brentford F.C.Brentford. Douglas made his debut in the League of Ireland for Monaghan United F.C.Monaghan United aged 16. He is primarily a Midfieldercentre midfielder.

Darren Powell.name: Darren Powell
Darren Powell.intro: '''Darren David Powell''' (born 10 March 1976 in Hammersmith) is an English association footballfootballer. He appeared over 250 times in Football League and Premier League games in his career. He is currently an academy coach with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.

Kasper Schmeichel.name: Kasper Schmeichel
Kasper Schmeichel.intro:
'''Kasper Peter Schmeichel''' (born 5 November 1986) is a Danish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is the son of former player Peter Schmeichel.
Schmeichel began his career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, but he had loan spells with Darlington F.C.Darlington, Bury F.C.Bury and Falkirk F.C.Falkirk before he made his City debut. Although Schmeichel appeared to have made the City number 1 jersey his own at the start of the 2007–08 season, the emergence of Joe Hart resulted in Schmeichel being loaned to Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. The signing of Republic of Ireland international Shay Given in January 2009 meant that Schmeichel fell even further down the pecking order at City, and in August 2009, he was allowed to link up with former manager Sven-Göran Eriksson at Notts County F.C.Notts County. He spent only one season with the Magpies as, while it was a very successful one for the club and the player himself, changes to the club's financial position made his departure necessary and his contract was terminated by mutual consent. He joined Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in May 2010, but again, his tenure at the club would only last one season before he was the subject of a transfer to Leicester City, where he would again work under Sven-Göran Eriksson.
He played 17 games for the Denmark national under-21 football teamDenmark national under-21 team. Schmeichel was called up to the Denmark national football team for the first time against Iceland on 13 May 2011.

Fabio Borini.name: Fabio Borini
Fabio Borini.intro:
'''Fabio Borini''' (born 29 March 1991) is an Italian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Forwardforward for Premier League side Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. Borini is a quick and hardworking striker, with good technique, movement off the ball and an accurate shot.
He started his career at Bologna F.C. 1909Bologna, before moving to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2007. In 2011, he joined Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City on loan, and eventually signed for A.S. RomaRoma, before moving to Liverpool in 2012. He spent the 2013–14 Premier League2013–14 season on loan at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, becoming a fans' favourite during his time there.
Borini made his senior international debut in 2012, and was an unused member of the Italy national football teamItalian squad that reached the UEFA Euro 2012 FinalEuro 2012 final.

Neil Davis.name: Neil Davis
Neil Davis.intro: '''Neil Davis''' (born 15 August 1973 in Bloxwich, England) is a professional Association footballfootballer, currently playing for Midland Football Alliance side Coleshill Town F.C.Coleshill Town, where he plays as a Striker (football)striker.

Lucas Radebe.name: Lucas Radebe
Lucas Radebe.intro:
'''Lucas Valeriu Ntuba Radebe''' (born 12 April 1969) is a former Leeds United F.C.Leeds United and South African football (soccer)football player, playing primarily as a centre back.
He began playing in South Africa with Kaizer Chiefs, before transferring to Leeds United, where he played 200 matches for the Yorkshire side. During his spells at these clubs, he picked up the nicknames "Rhoo" and "The Chief". He became captain of Leeds United and also of the South Africa national football teamSouth African national team, most notably at World Cup 2002. Nelson Mandela said of Radebe: "This is my hero."

Alton Thelwell.name: Alton Thelwell
Alton Thelwell.intro: '''Alton Anthony Thelwell''' (born 5 September 1980) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender. He was born in Islington, London.

Christian Ben\u00edtez.name: Christian Benítez
Christian Ben\u00edtez.intro:
'''Christian Rogelio Benítez Betancourt''' (May 1, 1986 – July 29, 2013), also known as '''Chucho''', was an  Ecuadorian association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)forward for El Jaish SCEl Jaish of the Qatar Stars League at the time of his death.
He began his career with Club Deportivo El NacionalEl Nacional in Ecuador and then joined Santos Laguna, with whom he won the award for Best Player of the Primera División de México Clausura 2008Clausura 2008. He spent the 2009–10 season on Loan (association football)loan to Premier League club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, and then moved to Club América for a Mexican record US$10 million, where he was a regular scorer. Benitez played 58 times for the Ecuador national football team from his debut in 2005, scoring 24 goals.  He played for them at the 2006 FIFA World Cup and two Copa America tournaments.
Following his death, the Ecuadorian Football Federation considered retiring Benítez's number 11 jersey from the national team.

Raimond van der Gouw.name: Raimond van der Gouw
Raimond van der Gouw.intro:
'''Raimond van der Gouw''' (,''Van'' in isolation: . born 24 March 1963, in Oldenzaal) is a former Dutch Association footballfootballer, who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
After a successful career with Vitesse and well into his 30s, he moved to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, also experiencing relative recognition, although he played very sparingly; he scored his only goal in the last game of his career for AGOVV Apeldoorn, before retiring at the age of 44, and becoming a coach.

Scott Thomas.name: Scott Thomas
Scott Thomas.intro: '''Scott Thomas''' (born 30 October 1974) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder.

Jacob Laursen.name: Jacob Laursen
Jacob Laursen.intro: '''Jacob Thaysen-Laursen''' (born 6 October 1971) is a DenmarkDanish retired professional football (soccer) player, who played as a Defender (football)defender. He most notably played for English club Derby County F.C.Derby County and won the Danish Superliga championship with Silkeborg IF and F.C. Copenhagen. He played 25 matches for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, with whom he won the 1995 King Fahd Cup and participated in the 1996 UEFA European Football Championship1996 European Championship and 1998 FIFA World Cup tournaments.

Saphir Ta\u00efder.name: Saphir Taïder
Saphir Ta\u00efder.intro: '''Saphir Sliti Taïder''' (; born 29 February 1992) is a FranceFrench-born Algerian peopleAlgerian footballer who plays for Serie A club U.S. Sassuolo CalcioSassuolo on loan from Inter MilanInternazionale and for the Algeria national football teamAlgeria national team.

Will Buckley.name: Will Buckley
Will Buckley.intro: '''William Edward "Will" Buckley''' (born 21 November 1989 in Oldham, Greater Manchester) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a right and left sided Winger (association football)winger for Premier League club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, having moved from Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion during August 2014. Buckley has also previously played for Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and Watford F.C.Watford.
