Ashley Ward.name: Ashley Ward
Ashley Ward.intro: '''Ashley Ward''' (born 24 November 1970) is a retired English association footballfootballer who played striker (football)centre forward.

Graham Stuart.name: Graham Stuart
Graham Stuart.intro:
'''Graham Charles Stuart''' (born 24 October 1970) is a former EnglandEnglish professional, Association footballfootballer and sports commentator. As a player he was an attacking midfielder and forward from 1989 until 2005.
He spent the majority of his career in the Premier League, playing in the top tier of English football for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Everton F.C.Everton, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He also had a two-year spell with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, and was capped 5 times, scoring twice for England national under-21 football teamEngland U21.

Shinji Kagawa.name: Shinji Kagawa
Shinji Kagawa.intro:
'''Shinji Kagawa''' ( ''Kagawa Shinji'' ; born 17 March 1989) is a Japanese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for German club Borussia Dortmund and the Japan national football teamJapan national team. Kagawa began his professional career in his homeland with Cerezo Osaka before joining Borussia Dortmund in 2010. After two years with Dortmund, Kagawa signed for Manchester United on a four-year contract. Two years later, he returned to Dortmund. A goal-scoring midfielder, he is known for his "vision, technique, movement and deft passing."
On 29 November 2012, Kagawa was named Asian Football Confederation International Player of the Year.

R\u00e9gis Genaux.name: Régis Genaux
R\u00e9gis Genaux.intro:
'''Régis Hervé Genaux''' (31 August 1973 – 8 November 2008) was a Belgian Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
During his career he represented three clubs in three countries, mainly Standard Liège and Udinese CalcioUdinese. He died at the young age of 35.[
R\u00e9gis Genaux.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Garry Thompson (footballer, born 1959).name: Garry Thompson (footballer, born 1959)
Garry Thompson (footballer, born 1959).intro:
'''Garry Thompson''' (born 7 October 1959 in Birmingham, England) is a former professional Association footballfootballer and football manager, who played as a striker. His younger brother, Keith Thompson (footballer)Keith Thompson, was also a professional footballer.[
He began his 20-year-long career at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City as a trainee and earned his first professional contract at that club. A fast and exciting player, he was a fans favourite and was part of the Sky Blues team which reached the 1981 League Cup semi-final. He was also a prominent member of the Aston Villa team that gained promotion to the old first division in the 1987–88 season. Besides Coventry, Thompson went on to play for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Watford F.C.Watford, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, making a total of 487 league appearances and scoring 124 league goals. Thompson played his final professional game for Northampton in 1997. Whilst at Cardiff in December 1993 it was his goal which gave them a 1–0 win over South Wales rivals Swansea, however the goal and the victory sparked off a mass pitch invasion and subsequent violence in what was to become one of the most notorious moments in Welsh football.
Although he spent several seasons as an inventive and influential player at top-flight clubs, he was never selected for the England international squad, though his name was regularly mentioned prior to call-ups. His non-selection is thought to be because he never played for any of the more illustrious top-flight English clubs rather than a lack of international-class ability. This was all the more surprising considering he played six times as an England Under-21 international whilst playing at his peak during the 1981–1982 season, scoring on three occasions.
After retiring as a player, he became a coach and in 2001 he took over as caretaker manager of Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers following the termination of employmentsacking of Ian Holloway. He remained in charge for 23 games, until the appointment of Gerry Francis. When Francis resigned five months later, Thompson was given the Bristol Rovers job on a permanent basis,[
He joined Conference North side Hucknall Town F.C.Hucknall Town in February 2006 as assistant to then manager Kevin Wilson (footballer born 1961)Kevin Wilson, combining his position with a full-time role in promotions. With Hucknall struggling financially, Thompson was released from his contract in December 2006.[

Pierre Wom\u00e9.name: Pierre Womé
Pierre Wom\u00e9.intro: '''Pierre Nlend Womé''' (born 26 March 1979 in Douala) is a Cameroonian Association footballfootball defender who currently plays for Canon Yaoundé. A Journeyman (sports)journeyman, Womé is a versatile and skillful left wingback who has played for 11 clubs in five countries, being one of eight players to have played in the top division in Italy, Spain, England and Germany (the others are Jon Dahl Tomasson, Abel Xavier, Gheorghe Popescu, Florin Răducioiu, Pepe Reina, Christian Poulsen and Maniche).

Matthew Rush.name: Matthew Rush
Matthew Rush.intro: '''Matthew James Rush''' (b. 6 August 1971 in Hackney CentralHackney, London) is a former professional footballer. He played as a winger.

Daniel Braaten.name: Daniel Braaten
Daniel Braaten.intro:
'''Daniel Omoya Braaten''' (born 25 May 1982) is a NorwayNorwegian Association footballfootballer, who currently playes for the Norwegian club Vålerenga.
Braaten has been capped 52 times for the Norway national football team. He usually plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Danny Dichio.name: Danny Dichio
Danny Dichio.intro:
'''Daniele Salvatore Ernest "Danny" Dichio''' (; born 19 October 1974) is an English retired association footballfootballer. He last played for Toronto FC in Major League Soccer, and is now the head coach of the Toronto FC Academy U19 team, as well as an analyst for Sportsnet and Fox Soccer News.
Dichio had the honour of scoring the first goal in Toronto FC history against the Chicago Fire S.C.Chicago Fire on 12 May 2007. Later in that same game he became the first player in club history to be red-carded.

George Friend.name: George Friend
George Friend.intro:
'''George Andrew Jordan Friend''' (born 19 October 1987) is an English Association footballfootballer who can play at either centre half or left back. He plays for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.
In the 2012–13 season Friend won Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough players' player of the season award. The following season Friend won it again along with the Player of the Season award.
George Friend.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Kamil Zayatte.name: Kamil Zayatte
Kamil Zayatte.intro: '''Kamil Zayatte''' (; born 7 March 1985) is a Guinean Association footballfootballer who plays for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday as a defender (association football)defender.

John Eustace.name: John Eustace
John Eustace.intro: '''John Mark Eustace''' (born 3 November 1979) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County as a central midfielder. He has previously been contracted to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Watford F.C.Watford, and has spent time on loan at Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Hereford United F.C.Hereford United.

Shay Logan.name: Shay Logan
Shay Logan.intro:
'''Shaleum Narval "Shay" Logan''' (born 29 January 1988) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender who currently plays for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen of the Scottish Premiership.
He began his career in the FA Premier LeaguePremier League with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and played on loan at Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers before signing for League One side Brentford F.C.Brentford in 2011. He joined Aberdeen in 2014, initially on loan.

Marvin Emnes.name: Marvin Emnes
Marvin Emnes.intro: '''Marvin Emnes''' (born 27 May 1988) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He can play as a Forward (association football)striker or Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Marvin Emnes.position: Forward  association football  Striker,Midfielder Winger Winger

Rio Ferdinand.name: Rio Ferdinand
Rio Ferdinand.intro:
'''Rio Gavin Ferdinand''' (born 7 November 1978) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers  as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back. He played 81 Cap (football)times for the England national football team between 1997 and 2011, and was a member of three FIFA World Cup squads.
Ferdinand began his football career playing for various youth teams, finally settling at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United where he progressed through the youth ranks and made his professional Premier League debut in 1996. He became a fan favourite, winning the 'Hammer of the Year award' the following season. He earned his first senior international cap in a match against Cameroon national football teamCameroon in 1997, setting a record as the youngest defender to play for England at the time. His achievements and footballing potential attracted Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and he transferred to the club for a record-breaking fee of Pound sterling£18 million. He spent two seasons at the club, becoming the captain (association football)team captain in 2001.
He joined Manchester United in July 2002 List of most expensive association football transfersfor around £30 million, breaking the transfer fee record once more. He won the Premier League, his first major club honour, in a successful first season at the club. In September 2003, he missed a drugs test and was banned from competition for eight months from January until September 2004, causing him to miss half a Premier League season, Manchester United's FA Cup triumph, and the UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 international competition. Upon his return, he established himself in the Manchester United first team and received plaudits for his performances, featuring in the PFA Team of the Year four times in five years. More club success followed with another Premier League win in the 2006–07 FA Premier League2006–07 season and a Premier League and UEFA Champions League double the following year. His career at United, in which he won 6 Premier League titles, ended when his contract expired in 2014, and he subsequently joined Queens Park Rangers.
Ferdinand has three children, Lorenz, Tate and Tia, with his wife Rebecca Ellison. He was born into a footballing family: brother Anton Ferdinand is also a centre-back for Reading F.C.Reading, and former England international striker Les Ferdinand and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United midfielder Kane Ferdinand are his cousins. Off the pitch he is involved with youth charities, film, music, and television including the prank series ''Rio's World Cup Wind-Ups''.
Rio Ferdinand.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Michael Dawson.name: Michael Dawson
Michael Dawson.intro:
'''Michael Richard Dawson''' (born 18 November 1983) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a Defender (association football)defender. He has played for the England national football teamEngland national team.
Midway through the 2009–10 in English football2009–10 season, Dawson became the team captain of Tottenham Hotspur as Robbie Keane left for Celtic F.C.Celtic on loan in January. His form that season saw him included in England national football teamEngland's preliminary 2010 World CupWorld Cup squad. Although he initially failed to make the final 23-man squad, an injury to captain Rio Ferdinand saw him drafted in as replacement.

Gonzalo Jara.name: Gonzalo Jara
Gonzalo Jara.intro:
'''Gonzalo Alejandro Jara Reyes''' (; born 29 August 1985) is a Chilean Association footballfootballer who plays for 1. FSV Mainz 05Mainz 05.  He is a versatile Defender (association football)defender and can play in either a full-back role or as a centre-back.
He has played for the Chile national football teamChile national team since 2006, and participated in the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cups as well as the 2007 Copa América2007 and 2011 Copa América tournaments.

Paul Konchesky.name: Paul Konchesky
Paul Konchesky.intro: '''Paul Martyn Konchesky''' (born 15 May 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a left back. Currently signed to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, he has previously played for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham, West Ham United F.C.West Ham, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, joining his present club in July 2011. Konchesky made fifteen appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team and was capped twice for England national football teamEngland.

David Nugent.name: David Nugent
David Nugent.intro: '''David James Nugent''' (born 2 May 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as a forward (association football)striker. Before joining Leicester, Nugent made a total of 228 appearances in the Football League playing for Bury F.C.Bury, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. While a Preston player he made his debut for England national football teamEngland, having played for the England national under-21 football teamnational U21 side earlier in his career.

Lewis Price.name: Lewis Price
Lewis Price.intro: '''Lewis Peter Price''' (born 19 July 1984) is a Wales national football teamWelsh international Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper who plays for Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He has previously played for Derby County F.C.Derby County and Ipswich Town.

Curtis Woodhouse.name: Curtis Woodhouse
Curtis Woodhouse.intro:
'''Curtis Woodhouse''' (born 17 April 1980) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer turned  professional Boxingboxer and football manager. He is currently manager of Hull United AFC. Woodhouse played football as a central midfielder, and competed as a light-welterweight boxer. He is the former British light-welterweight champion. His career in the Football League spanned across nine seasons, earning four cap (football)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 football team. Woodhouse's professional boxing record stands at 29 fights 22 wins, 13 of which are by knock-out, and 7 defeats.
He started his footballing career with York City F.C.York City's centre of excellence before joining Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. In November 2001, he was transferred to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for a fee of Pound sterling£1 million, before joining Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United in January 2003, on loan for five months. He then joined Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United on a free transfer in October 2003. In May 2005, he joined Hull City A.F.C.Hull City for £25,000, before joining Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town just eight months later in January 2006. He retired at the end of the 2006–07 in English football2006–07 season.
Woodhouse stated that he had "fallen out of love" with football and decided to turn to professional boxing, despite no previous experience. In September 2006, he won his first professional boxing match, defeating Dean Marcantonio, on points, knocking him down twice in the final round. His only defeat was by Jay Morris in April 2009, losing 37–36 on points.
He was convicted of assaulting a police officer and of using threatening, abusive or insulting words or behaviour in April 2006. As a result, he had his boxing license suspended for five months by the British Boxing Board of Control, despite the incident happening before he was under the BBBofC's jurisdiction. Woodhouse returned to football in November 2006, joining Rushden & Diamonds in the Conference National before moving to Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town in January 2009. After leaving them, he moved to Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town. At the end of February 2010, he joined Sheffield F.C.Sheffield in the Northern Premier League. Before the start of the 2011–12 football season, he moved up two divisions in the English football league systemfootball league system when he joined Conference North outfit Eastwood Town F.C.Eastwood Town.

Sone Aluko.name: Sone Aluko
Sone Aluko.intro:
'''Omatsone "Sone" Aluko''' (born 19 February 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. He can also play as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Aluko began his career at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City but failed to make any league appearances. He joined Aberdeen on loan in the 2007–08 season and was loaned to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool at the beginning of the 2008–09 season. After just one appearance for Blackpool, he signed for Aberdeen permanently in August 2008. He left Aberdeen in July 2011 at the end of his contract. Aluko signed for Rangers F.C.Rangers in November 2011 and scored 12 goals in 21 appearances during the 2011–12 season. He became a free agent after his contract expired.
Born in England, Aluko was cap (sports)capped by England at all levels up to England national under-19 football teamunder-19 before accepting an offer to play for Nigeria national football teamNigeria.

Mike Hooper.name: Mike Hooper
Mike Hooper.intro: '''Michael Dudley''' "'''Mike'''" '''Hooper''' (born 10 February 1964 in Bristol) is a former professional Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He was most notable for his spell with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, where he mainly operated as an understudy to Bruce Grobbelaar. He also played for Newcastle United, his last professional club.

P\u00e5l Lydersen.name: Pål Lydersen
P\u00e5l Lydersen.intro:
'''Pål Lydersen''' (born 10 September 1965) is a NorwayNorwegian former football (soccer)football player.
A Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back, Lydersen played for I.K. Start, until he was signed by EnglandEnglish club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 1991. However, he was unable to oust first-team regulars Lee Dixon and Nigel Winterburn, and played only 16 games in two years for the Gunners.[
Lydersen went on loan to his old club I.K. Start during the 1994-95 in English football1994-95 season, and the move was made permanent in the summer of 1995. He went on to play for Sturm Graz in Austria and then onto Molde F.K.Molde, before retiring in 1999. He also won 20 caps for Norway national football teamNorway, scoring one goal.

Emanuel Villa.name: Emanuel Villa
Emanuel Villa.intro:
'''Emanuel "Tito" Villa''' (24 February 1982) is an Argentine football (soccer)footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Liga MX club Querétaro F.C.Querétaro. He holds Mexican citizenship.
He previously played for Club Atlético HuracánHuracán, A. M. S. y D. Atlético de RafaelaAtlético Rafaela and Rosario Central in Argentina; the Derby County F.C.Derby County in England; and Club AtlasAtlas, Tecos UAGTecos, Cruz Azul and Club Universidad NacionalPumas UNAM in Mexico.
With 66 goals, Villa is the sixth highest goalscorer of all-time of Cruz Azul.

S\u00e9bastien Squillaci.name: Sébastien Squillaci
S\u00e9bastien Squillaci.intro:
'''Sébastien Squillaci''' (; born 11 August 1980) is a List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who plays for SC BastiaBastia in the Ligue 1. He plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender and has been described as a player who "reads the game well" and is "strong in the air and on the ground". Squillaci is nicknamed in France as simply ''Toto'' in reference to his surname, which is similar to former Italy national football teamItalian international Salvatore Schillaci, Totò being a standard Italian shortening of Salvatore.
Squillaci began his football career playing for hometown club FC Seynois in the Communes of Francecommune of La Seyne-sur-Mer. In 1996, he joined Sporting Toulon VarSporting Toulon and made his professional debut in the 1997–98 French Division 21997–98 season, while the club was playing in Ligue 2. After a year with Toulon, Squillaci joined AS Monaco FCMonaco. He spent two seasons on the club's reserve team before joining AC Ajaccio on loan for two years. Squillaci returned to Monaco in 2002 and contributed to the team that won the Coupe de la Ligue in 2003 Coupe de la Ligue Final2003. He also featured in UEFAEuropean competition for the first time in his career and, in the 2003–04 UEFA Champions League2003–04 season, played on the Monaco team that reached the 2004 UEFA Champions League Final. In that same season domestically, Squillaci was named to the National Union of Professional Footballers (UNFP) Ligue 1 Trophées UNFP du football#Team of the YearTeam of the Year. In 2006, Squillaci signed a long-term contract with league rivals Olympique Lyonnais and won two consecutive league titles, as well as the Coupe de France in 2008 Coupe de France Final2008 before departing for Spain in 2008 to join Sevilla F.C.Sevilla. With Sevilla, he appeared in over 65 matches and won the Copa del Rey in his 2010 Copa del Rey Finalfinal season with the club. In 2010, Squillaci signed a three-year contract with English club Arsenal.
Squillaci is a France national football teamFrance international. Prior to playing at senior level, he played at France national under-20 football teamunder-20 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. At under-21 level, he played on the team that won the bronze medal at the 2001 Mediterranean Games. Squillaci made his senior international debut in August 2004 in a Exhibition matchfriendly match against Bosnia and Herzegovina national football teamBosnia and Herzegovina. He has participated in UEFA Euro 2008, as well as the 2010 FIFA World Cup for his nation. In both major tournaments combined, Squillaci has appeared in only one match, which came in the team's final group stage match against South Africa national football teamSouth Africa at the 2010 World Cup.
S\u00e9bastien Squillaci.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Lloyd McGrath.name: Lloyd McGrath
Lloyd McGrath.intro:
'''Lloyd McGrath''' (born 24 February 1965) is a retired EnglandEnglish professional footballer.
A hard-working midfielder, McGrath made his senior debut for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City on 28 April 1984 in one of their heaviest defeats ever - an 8-2 Football League First Division defeat at Southampton F.C.Southampton. However, three years later he took part in the biggest success of their history so far - the 1987 FA Cup Final triumph over Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.He set up the winning goal with a cross that was deflected off the knee of Gary Mabbutt. By the time of his departure to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth at the end of the 1993-94 in English football1993-94 season, when the Sky Blues finished 11th in the FA Premier League, he had played 214 league games for the club and scored four goals.
He played for Pompey for the rest of his professional career, retiring in 1997. He now has business interests in the north of Coventry as licensee of the Hawkesmill Social Club.

Darren Williams.name: Darren Williams
Darren Williams.intro:
'''Darren Williams''' (born 28 April 1977) is an English semi-professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder (association football)midfielder for Whitby Town F.C.Whitby Town where he is also the club's manager.
Williams began his career at York City F.C.York City, but made his name at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, for whom he signed in 1996. He moved to Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in 2004, then on Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United in 2005. He was released by Hartlepool in 2007, and played for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City during the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 season. He went on to play with Dundee F.C.Dundee, Gateshead F.C.Gateshead and Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity before joining Whitby.

Ritchie De Laet.name: Ritchie De Laet
Ritchie De Laet.intro: '''Ritchie Ria Alfons De Laet''' (, born 28 November 1988) is a Belgian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for English club Leicester City F.CLeicester City.

Thomas Myhre.name: Thomas Myhre
Thomas Myhre.intro: '''Thomas Myhre''' (born 16 October 1973) is a NorwayNorwegian former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. The last club he player for before his retirement was KIL ToppfotballKongsvinger, having returned to Norwegian football in July 2007. Myhre earned 56 cap (football)caps for the Norway national football teamNorwegian national team, and was a part of the Norwegian squad at the 1998 FIFA World Cup and 2000 UEFA European Football Championship2000 European Championship tournaments.

Wes Morgan.name: Wes Morgan
Wes Morgan.intro: '''Wesley Nathan "Wes" Morgan''' (born 21 January 1984) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays for and captains Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as a Defender (association football)defender. He spent a majority of his career with his boyhood club, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest where he had been a regular at centre-back for the club for several years before moving to Leicester City in January 2012. He was Nottingham Forest's longest-serving player before his move to the King Power Stadium.

Den\u00edlson Pereira Neves.name: Denílson Pereira Neves
Den\u00edlson Pereira Neves.intro:
'''Denílson Pereira Neves''' (born 16 February 1988) is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer plays for São Paulo FC mainly as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder but also as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder. He is the former captain (association football)captain of the Brazil national under-17 football teamBrazil national under-17 team.
Denílson has been described as being adept at "short passing and reading of the game. He is very effective at retaining possession".

Albert Luque.name: Albert Luque
Albert Luque.intro:
'''Albert Luque Martos''' (born 11 March 1978) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger or Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
His 14-year professional career was mainly associated with RCD MallorcaMallorca and Deportivo de La CoruñaDeportivo, and he amassed La Liga totals of 248 games and 61 goals over the course of eleven seasons. He also had brief spells in England with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Netherlands with AFC AjaxAjax.
A Spain national football teamSpanish international in the first half of the 2000s, Luque represented the nation in one FIFA World CupWorld Cup and one UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship.

Jamie Cureton.name: Jamie Cureton
Jamie Cureton.intro:
'''Jamie Cureton''' (born 28 August 1975) is an English professional footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.Dagenham & Redbridge.
He began his career at Norwich City in 1994, and after the club's relegation from the Premier League at the end of the season, has spent the majority of his career in England's lower leagues, save for a season at Busan I'Park in 2003 K League2003. In over 750 professional matches, Cureton has scored over 250 goals.

Liam Miller.name: Liam Miller
Liam Miller.intro:
'''Liam William Peter Miller''' (born 13 February 1981) is an Republic of IrelandIrish association footballfootballer who plays for Cork City F.C.Cork City in the League of Ireland Premier Division. Miller began his career with Celtic F.C.Celtic and was later loan (football)loaned to Aarhus Gymnastik ForeningAarhus in 2001. He returned to Celtic Park and broke into the first team squad during the 2003–04 season. Rejecting the offer of a new contract from Celtic, he joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 2004 on a free transfer (football)free transfer under the Bosman ruling. Loaned to Leeds United F.C.Leeds United during the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 season, Miller made 22 first team appearances for Manchester United.
In 2006, he joined Sunderland A.F.CSunderland, but was linked with a move away from the club because of alleged timekeeping issues. He joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in January 2009 and was released at the end of the 2008–09 season. Miller joined Hibernian F.C.Hibernian at the start of the 2009–10 Scottish Premier League season on a free transfer. He moved to Australian A-League club Perth Glory FCPerth Glory in 2011 after his contract with Hibernian expired. Miller represents the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland team internationally, making his debut in 2004 against the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic.

Alex Pearce.name: Alex Pearce
Alex Pearce.intro: '''Alexander James "Alex" Pearce''' (born 9 November 1988) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Reading F.C.Reading, where he has played his entire career, interspersed with loan periods at various clubs. He made two international appearances for the Scotland national under-21 football teamScotland under-21 team but has played for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at full international level, having scored on his debut against Oman national football teamOman.
Alex Pearce.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mohamed Shawky.name: Mohamed Shawky
Mohamed Shawky.intro: '''Mohamed Ali Abu El Yazid Shawky''' (, born 15 October 1981) is an Egyptian Association footballfootballer. He plays the Midfielder#DefensiveDefensive midfielder position for Egyptian side El Mokawloon SCArab Contractors and former Egypt national football teamEgypt's national football team. He played every minute of Egypt’s 2006 Africa Cup of Nations campaign.

Emmanuel Olisadebe.name: Emmanuel Olisadebe
Emmanuel Olisadebe.intro:
'''Emmanuel Olisadebe''' () (born 22 December 1978 in Warri) is a retired Nigerian-born PolesPolish Forward (association football)football striker.
After moving to Poland and having a successful career with Polonia Warszawa where he won the championship title as well as Polish SuperCup with them he would attract the interests of the Poland national football teamPolish national team after he was eligible for Polish citizenship. He participated in the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

Neil Cox.name: Neil Cox
Neil Cox.intro: '''Neil James Cox''' (born 8 October 1971) is a retired English professional footballer. He spent most of his career playing as a defender (football)central defender or right-back for Watford F.C.Watford but also made over 100 appearances for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. Cox also played for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, and was cap (football)capped at Under-21 level by England national football teamEngland. His final Football League club was then League One outfit Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra. Cox retired from professional football in 2008, going on to became a property developer in Portugal.Whitbread, Joe.[

Wesley Boyle.name: Wesley Boyle
Wesley Boyle.intro: '''Wesley Boyle''' (born 30 March 1979) from Northern Ireland is a Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder, who currently plays for Loughgall F.C.Loughgall. Boyle started his career as an apprentice with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United.

Bryan Oviedo.name: Bryan Oviedo
Bryan Oviedo.intro: '''Bryan Josué Oviedo Jiménez''' (born 18 February 1990) is a Costa Rican association footballfootballer, currently playing for Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League. Oviedo has previously represented Saprissa, FC Copenhagen and Nordsjælland. He has represented Costa Rica at U17, U20 and full international level.

Gary Holt.name: Gary Holt
Gary Holt.intro: '''Gary James Holt''' (born 9 March 1973) is a former ScotlandScottish football player and is currently a first-team coach at Football League Championship side Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. Holt first played competitively for Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock, making 138 appearances, before transferring to the English Division One side Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, where Holt made 168 appearances. Holt also received 10 caps for the Scotland national football team, scoring one goal. Later in his career, Holt also played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, before signing for Isthmian League side Lowestoft Town FCLowestoft Town after an unsuccessful transfer to Colchester United F.CColchester United. After retirement from football, Holt joined the Norwich City F.C.Norwich City Academy, before being appointed manager of Falkirk F.C.Falkirk. His tenure lasted until June 2014, when he returned to Norwich as a first-team coach.

Baf\u00e9timbi Gomis.name: Bafétimbi Gomis
Baf\u00e9timbi Gomis.intro: '''Bafétimbi Fredius Gomis''' (; born 6 August 1985) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Premier League club Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.

Les Ferdinand.name: Les Ferdinand
Les Ferdinand.intro:
'''Leslie "Les" Ferdinand''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 8 December 1966)Weekend birthdays, "The Guardian", Guardian Newspapers Limited. (11 August 2007). Accessed on 15 August 2007. is an English former Association footballfootballer and current football coach and Director of Football at his former club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. His playing career included spells at Queens Park Rangers F.C, Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Reading F.C.Reading and Watford F.C.Watford during which period he earned 17 caps (football)caps for England national football teamEngland. Ferdinand is the eighth highest scorer in the Premier League with 149 goals.
He is the cousin of players, brothers Rio FerdinandRio and Anton Ferdinand, and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United player, Kane Ferdinand. Nicknamed ''Sir Les'', he was made an Order of the British EmpireMBE in the 2005 Queen's Birthday Honours.
On 5 November 2008 Ferdinand joined fellow ex-Tottenham player Tim Sherwood on the coaching staff of Tottenham Hotspur, to work with the strikers. Ferdinand left the club on 19 June 2014.

Neil Gregory.name: Neil Gregory
Neil Gregory.intro: '''Neil Richard Gregory''' (born 7 October 1972) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer. A striker, he played for several clubs in the Football League.

Jason Lee.name: Jason Lee
Jason Lee.intro:
'''Jason Benedict Lee''' (born 9 May 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer and manager (association football)manager.
Lee plays as a forward (association football)forward and has previously played in the Premier League for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He also played for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Watford F.C.Watford, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Falkirk F.C.Falkirk, Boston United F.C.Boston United, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town, Corby Town F.C.Corby Town, Ilkeston Town F.C.Ilkeston Town and Arnold Town F.C.Arnold Town. In 2011 he returned to Boston United as player/mananger but was dismissed in December 2012.

Ruud van Nistelrooy.name: Ruud van Nistelrooy
Ruud van Nistelrooy.intro:
'''Rutgerus Johannes Martinus "Ruud" van Nistelrooy''' (Dutch languageDutch: Ruud van Nistelrooij; ; when pronouncing every word in isolation. born 1 July 1976) is a retired Dutch association footballfootballer and current assistant manager for the Netherlands national football teamDutch National Football Team. He is the fourth-highest European Cup and UEFA Champions League records and statistics#All-time top goalscorersgoalscorer in UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League history with 56 goals. He is a three-time Champions League top scorer, as well as a top scorer in three different European domestic leagues.
Van Nistelrooy began his career with FC Den BoschDen Bosch, before moving onto SC HeerenveenHeerenveen, eventually making a name for himself at PSV Eindhoven where he won two EredivisieDutch leagues. His goalscoring record at PSV attracted attention from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United; a deal was in place in the summer of 2000, but because of injury problems his move was secured a year later for a then British record fee of £19 million. His time at United was successful, winning the 2002–03 FA Premier LeaguePremier League, 2003–04 FA CupFA Cup, 2005–06 Football League CupFootball League Cup and FA Community Shield, along with winning the Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year twice. Van Nistelrooy hit 150 goals in just 219 games for United, as well as being their all time European record goalscorer, but fell out of favour towards the end of his tenure. Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid then secured his services in 2006. Although an injury blighted the end of his days with Madrid, he did win La Liga twice and the Supercopa de España before signing for Hamburger SV during the January transfer window in 2010. After a season-and-a-half with Hamburg, he moved back to Spain with Málaga CFMálaga in the summer of 2011. His retirement from football was announced on 14 May 2012.

Marc-Vivien Fo\u00e9.name: Marc-Vivien Foé
Marc-Vivien Fo\u00e9.intro: '''Marc-Vivien Foé''' (1 May 1975 – 26 June 2003) was a Cameroonian international Association footballfootballer, who played in midfieldermidfield for both club and country. With success in the Ligue 1French League, and stints in England in the Premier League, his sudden death, while in the middle of an international competitive fixture, came as a shock to the worldwide footballing community. He was posthumously decorated with the Commander of the National Order of Valour.

Graziano Pell\u00e8.name: Graziano Pellè
Graziano Pell\u00e8.intro:
'''Graziano Pellè''' (; born 15 July 1985) is an Italian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton and the Italy national football teamItaly national team. He is known as a strong striker who excels in the air, with powerful and accurate finishing ability and accurate penalty-kick taking. These attributes have led him to be compared to compatriot Luca Toni.
He began his career at local Serie A club U.S. Lecce, and was loaned to three lower-division sides before moving to the Dutch club AZ (football club)AZ in 2007. He won the Eredivisie title in his second of four seasons at the club. After brief spells back in Italy with Parma F.C.Parma and Sampdoria he returned to the Dutch top flight, where his consistent scoring for Feyenoord earned Pellè an £8 million transfer to Southampton in July 2014.
Pellè represented Italy at Italy national under-20 football teamunder-20 and Italy national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. He also played for their Olympic team in 2008, but was not selected for Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournamentthe tournament. In 2014, he scored on his senior international debut.

Steve Melton.name: Steve Melton
Steve Melton.intro:
'''Steve Melton''' (born 3 October 1978) is a former English association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.
He played as a professional in the Football League from 1996 until 2006, featuring for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Boston United F.C.Boston United. At Non-League level he has represented Tamworth F.C.Tamworth and King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn before re-joining Boston United and then moving on to Lincoln United F.C.Lincoln United, Lincoln Moorlands Railway F.C.Lincoln Moorlands Railway and Grantham Town F.C.Grantham Town.

John Collins (footballer, born 1968).name: John Collins (footballer, born 1968)
John Collins (footballer, born 1968).intro:
'''John Angus Paul Collins''' (born 31 January 1968) is a Scottish Association footballfootball player and coach, who is the assistant manager of Celtic F.C.Celtic.
He played for Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Celtic F.C.Celtic, AS Monaco FCAS Monaco, Everton F.C.Everton and Fulham F.C.Fulham in a 19-year career. Collins also represented Scotland national football teamScotland 58 times, scoring in the opening match of the 1998 FIFA World Cup against Brazil national football teamBrazil.
He started his coaching career as manager (association football)manager of Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, winning the 2007 Scottish League Cup Final, but resigned later that year. He then had a brief spell as manager of R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi in 2009. Collins was appointed director of football at Livingston F.C.Livingston in February 2012, but resigned a year later. He has also worked in media coverage of football.

Peter Clarke.name: Peter Clarke
Peter Clarke.intro:
'''Peter Michael Clarke''' (born 3 January 1982) is an EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)centre back for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.
Clarke began his career with Everton F.C.Everton, during his time there he made nine league appearances and had loan spells with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Port Vale F.C.Port Vale and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He then joined Blackpool on a permanent basis in 2004, where he also captained the club. He has also captained Southend United F.C.Southend United who he joined in 2006, before joining Huddersfield Town in 2009. He helped the "Terriers" to win promotion out of Football League OneLeague One via the play-offs in 2012 Football League One play-off Final2012. He returned to Blackpool in July 2014.
He won the Player of the Season award at Blackpool, Southend and Huddersfield (twice) in the 2004–05, 2008–09, 2009–10 and 2010–11 seasons respectively. Clarke also gained eight Cap (sport)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team between 2002 and 2003.

Modibo Ma\u00efga.name: Modibo Maïga
Modibo Ma\u00efga.intro: '''Modibo Maïga''' (born 3 September 1987) is a Malian footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for  FC MetzMetz on loan from West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He also plays internationally for Mali national football teamMali. Maiga had previously played for Stade Malien, Raja Casablanca, Le Mans UC72Le Mans, FC Sochaux-MontbéliardSochaux and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.

Thomas Vermaelen.name: Thomas Vermaelen
Thomas Vermaelen.intro:
'''Thomas Vermaelen''' (;''Vermaelen'' in isolation: . born 14 November 1985) is a Belgian professional footballer who plays for Spanish club FC Barcelona and the Belgium national football team, as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Vermaelen joined the AFC AjaxAjax youth academy in 2000 and won the 2003–04 Eredivisie title in his first season with the club. He had a loan spell with RKC Waalwijk before rejoining Ajax and winning the KNVB Cup and Johan Cruijff Shield. After Klaas-Jan Huntelaar's departure in 2009, he served as club captain for the remainder of the season. He joined Arsenal in 2009 and was included in the PFA Team of the YearPFA Premier League Team of the Year for that season. Following Robin van Persie's transfer to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in August 2012, he was named club captain but found first team opportunities limited due to the success of Arsenal's new first-choice defensive partnership of Per Mertesacker and Laurent Koscielny. In August 2014, he completed a £15 million transfer to Barcelona in La Liga. However, since transferring to the Catalan side, he has endured a long run of injuries, resulting in him not playing a single minute for the club since his arrival.
Being left-footed, he usually plays as a left-sided Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back and can play at left-back as well. His key attributes include aerial ability, leadership skills, and his quickness with the ball at his feet. He is also known for his goalscoring ability as a defender.
Thomas Vermaelen.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Tony Dobson.name: Tony Dobson
Tony Dobson.intro: '''Anthony "Tony" Dobson''' (born 5 February 1969 in Coventry) is a retired EnglandEnglish professional association footballfootballer who played in the Premier League.

Andy Mutch.name: Andy Mutch
Andy Mutch.intro: '''Andrew Todd Mutch''' (born 28 December 1963 in Liverpool) is an English former Association footballfootball player. During his playing career, he was widely known for his partnership with Steve Bull at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.

Marco Branca.name: Marco Branca
Marco Branca.intro: '''Marco Branca''' (born 6 January 1965 in Grosseto) is an ItalyItalian former Football (soccer)football striker who was, until February 2014, sporting director of Serie A club Internazionale.

Nordin Wooter.name: Nordin Wooter
Nordin Wooter.intro:
'''Nordin Wooter''' (born 24 August 1976 in Breda) is a NetherlandsDutch former association footballfootballer of Surinamese descent. During his career he played in the Dutch Eredivisie for AFC AjaxAjax, Spain's La Liga for Real Zaragoza, and in 1999 he joined English Premier League club Watford F.C.Watford for £950,000, which at the time was the highest transfer fee Watford had ever paid. He made his debut for Watford in a memorable 1-0 win over Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He went on to score 3 goals for Watford in games against Leicester City,cite web

title=Collymore impresses on debut
publisher=BBC
date=12 February 2000 accessdate=6 August 2013 Norwich Citycite web
url=
title=Watford 4-1 Norwich
publisher=BBC
date=10 March 2001 accessdate=6 August 2013 and Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon.cite web
url=
title=Wimbledon stung at Watford
publisher=BBC
date=7 September 2001 accessdate=6 August 2013
He also played for Netherlands national football teamthe Netherlands under-18 and Netherlands national under-21 football teamunder-21 teams.

Dimitar Berbatov.name: Dimitar Berbatov
Dimitar Berbatov.intro:
'''Dimitar Ivanov Berbatov''' (, ); born 30 January 1981) is a Bulgarian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for AS Monaco FCAS Monaco. He Captain (sports)captained the Bulgaria national football teamBulgarian national team from 2006 to 2010, and is its all-time leading goalscorer. He has also won the Bulgarian Footballer of the Year a record seven times, surpassing the number of wins by Hristo Stoichkov.
Born in Blagoevgrad, Berbatov started out with home-town club FC Pirin BlagoevgradPirin before joining PFC CSKA SofiaCSKA Sofia as a 17-year-old in 1998. He was signed by Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen of Germany in January 2001 and played in his first UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League final 18 months later, coming on as a substitute in the 2002 UEFA Champions League Final, which Leverkusen lost 2–1 to Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid.
After five-and-a-half years with Leverkusen, he joined English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in July 2006, where he spent two years before moving to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He played in his second Champions League final in 2009 UEFA Champions League Final2009, during his side's 2–0 defeat against FC BarcelonaBarcelona. After four seasons with United he joined Fulham F.C.Fulham in August 2012, before leaving England for France in January 2014, when he joined Monaco.

Richard Jobson.name: Richard Jobson
Richard Jobson.intro: '''Richard Ian Jobson''' (born 9 May 1963) is an English former Association footballfootballer who made nearly 600 appearances in the Football League and Premier League over a twenty-year career, representing Watford F.C.Watford, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers and Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale. He was cap (sport)capped twice for England B national football teamEngland B, and spent a year as chairman of the Professional Footballers' Association.

Declan John.name: Declan John
Declan John.intro: '''Declan Christopher John''' (born 30 June 1995) is a Welsh professional Association footballerfootballer who plays for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, on loan from Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, as a Defender (association football)defender.

Peter Odemwingie.name: Peter Odemwingie
Peter Odemwingie.intro:
'''Peter Osaze Odemwingie''' (; born 15 July 1981) is a Nigerian Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)forward for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Odemwingie grew up in Russia and Nigeria and began his career with Bendel Insurance F.C.Bendel Insurance in the Nigeria Premier League. He then earned a move to European football with Belgian side R.A.A. LouviéroiseLa Louvière where he spent three seasons before moving to French side Lille OSCLille. Odemwingie scored 26 goals for Lille which prompted FC Lokomotiv MoscowLokomotiv Moscow to pay a fee of £10 million for his services in July 2007. He scored 23 times in three-and-a-half years for Lokomotiv before leaving for English side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in August 2010. He scored 30 Premier League goals for the Baggies which won him three Premier League Player of the Month awards. A failed move to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers saw him fall out of favour with Steve Clarke and he was sold to  Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in August 2013 for a fee of £2.25 million. He spent six months at Cardiff before joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in a player-exchange with Kenwyne Jones in January 2014.
Odemwingie made his debut for  the Nigeria national football team in 2002 and has represented the country over 60 times, including at two World Cups and four Africa Cup of Nations, as well as winning silver at the 2008 Olympics.
Peter Odemwingie.birth_place: Tashkent,Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic|Uzbek SSR,Soviet Union

Morgan Amalfitano.name: Morgan Amalfitano
Morgan Amalfitano.intro:
'''Morgan Amalfitano''' (born 20 March 1985 in Nice) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a midfielder. Amalfitano has earned one cap for the France national football teamFrance national team, representing his country in a friendly in February 2012.
His main position is as a wide midfielder but he can also operate as an attacking or central midfielder. His younger brother Romain AmalfitanoRomain also plays professional football.

Jody Craddock.name: Jody Craddock
Jody Craddock.intro:
'''Jody Darryl Craddock''' (born 25 July 1975) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)centre back in the Premier League for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Craddock broke into league football at Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United in the mid-1990s before spending six years at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, with whom he won promotion to the top flight. When they were relegated in 2003 he switched to newly promoted Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers where he eventually became club captain and made 237 appearances during a ten-year stay.

Dwight Marshall.name: Dwight Marshall
Dwight Marshall.intro:
'''Dwight Marshall''' (born 3 October 1965) is a retired Jamaican-born English Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
As a schoolboy, Marshall attended Holloway Boys School in North London, and was one of the most gifted right-wingers of his day, making many appearances for Islington schools. As a professional, Marshall was an attacking left-winger or striker who featured for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. He also appeared for a number of non-league sides during his career. In total, Dwight made 129 league appearances for Argyle, scoring 40 goals.[
Dwight unfortunately broke his leg during the 1995-96 in English football1995-96 season, which ended with Luton being relegated from what is now the Football League ChampionshipChampionship. After this he never really regained his place or his form, and he eventually left for a brief spell back at Plymouth. He then drifted into non-league football, playing at Kenilworth Road again for Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian against Luton in an FA Cup tie during the 1999–2000 season.
Dwight Marshall now works as a Human Resources Manager for a North London college.

Fernando Amorebieta.name: Fernando Amorebieta
Fernando Amorebieta.intro:
'''Fernando Gabriel Amorebieta Mardaras''' (born 29 March 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Middlesbrough F.CMiddlesbrough on loan from Fulham F.C.Fulham as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He played most of his professional career with Athletic Bilbao, appearing in 253 official games over the course of eight La Liga seasons and scoring four goals.
Internationally Amorebieta played for Spain national youth football teamSpain as a youth, but later decided to represent Venezuela national football teamVenezuela at senior level.
Fernando Amorebieta.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Carl Bradshaw.name: Carl Bradshaw
Carl Bradshaw.intro:
url=
title=Exeter 0 - 4 Scunthorpe
publisher=ESPN
accessdate=15 October 2012 He began his career playing as a forward before moving to defence.
Bradshaw's first club was Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. However, his first senior appearance came in a loan spell at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He joined Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in September 1988, in a swap with Imre Varadi. His Manchester City debut came in October 1988, as a substitute against West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He started the following match, against Sunderland A.F.CSunderland, but this proved to be his only start for the club. In a year at Manchester City he made a total of seven appearances. He then transferred to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in September 1989.
In September 1997, Bradshaw served a short prison sentence after an incident involving himself and Norwich teammate Andy Johnson (Welsh footballer)Andy Johnson that resulted in Bradshaw assaulting a taxi driver.

Simon Elliott.name: Simon Elliott
Simon Elliott.intro: '''Simon John Elliott''' (born 10 June 1974 in Wellington) is a retired New Zealand national football teamNew Zealand International Association footballfootballer.

H\u00e9ctor Beller\u00edn.name: Héctor Bellerín
H\u00e9ctor Beller\u00edn.intro:
'''Héctor Bellerín Moruno''' (born 19 March 1995) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He also had a loan stint at Watford during the 2013–14 season.  Internationally, Bellerin has played for Spain from under-16 to under-19 levels.
Bellerin is known for his pace; the Spanish defender broke Theo Walcott's 40 meter sprint record time, making him the fastest player in the Arsenal squad. accessdate=
H\u00e9ctor Beller\u00edn.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Stuart Barlow.name: Stuart Barlow
Stuart Barlow.intro:
'''Stuart Barlow''' (born 16 July 1968 in Liverpool) is a former English professional association footballfootballer and assistant manager of Northern Premier League side Colwyn Bay F.C.Colwyn Bay.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder and forward (association football)forward from 1989 until 2009. He notably played in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton and was part of the squad that won the 1995 FA Cup. He also played in the Football League for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Bury F.C.Bury before winding his career in Non-league football with Morecambe F.C.Morecambe, Southport F.C.Southport, Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town and Bamber Bridge F.C.Bamber Bridge.

Phil Jagielka.name: Phil Jagielka
Phil Jagielka.intro:
'''Philip Nikodem "Phil" Jagielka''' (born 17 August 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club  Everton F.C.Everton and the England national football teamEngland national team. He is a defender (association football)defender and serves as captain for Everton.
Jagielka started his career with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 2000, where he played mainly as a Centre midfieldercentral midfielder. He helped them achieve top-flight status for the 2006–07 Premier League2006–07 season, after which he joined Everton for a fee of £4 million.
An England national football teamEngland international with over 30 caps, Jagielka was included in the nation's squads for UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Phil Jagielka.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Stig Johansen.name: Stig Johansen
Stig Johansen.intro:
'''Stig Johansen''' (born 13 June 1972 in Kabelvåg, Lofoten) is a former NorwayNorwegian football striker.
He made his debut for Bodø/Glimt in 1993 and played 70 games before he was signed by English Premiership side Southampton F.C.Southampton, in 1997. His spell at the English side was spent mostly in the reserves and rarely played for the Saints. He also spent a period on loan at Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, before being transferred to Swedish side Helsingborgs IF. In 2002 he returned to Bodø/Glimt. He has won three caps for Norway national football teamNorway.
He announced his retirement in October 2009., but made a comeback in 2011 after being given a one-year contract with Bodø/Glimt.
On 31 August 2014 Johansen made comeback for his home club Kabelvåg ILKabelvåg, he just played one game to finish his career for good. He also open the new pitch for Kabelvåg ILKabelvåg.

Jan Vertonghen.name: Jan Vertonghen
Jan Vertonghen.intro:
'''Jan Bert Lieve Vertonghen''' (; born 24 April 1987) is a BelgiumBelgian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the Belgium national football teamBelgian national team. A left-footed player who usually plays as a centre back, he is equally adept at playing anywhere on the left side or in defensive midfield and frequently joins in the attack from his centre back position. Although playing as a defender, Vertonghen is well known for his offensive prowess and powerful shooting ability.
After the departure of Luis Suárez for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in January 2011, Vertonghen was appointed vice-captain of AFC Ajax under captain Maarten Stekelenburg; following Stekelenburg's transfer to A.S. RomaRoma, Vertonghen was made captain. In 2012, Vertonghen was named Dutch Footballer of the Year. Following his transfer to Tottenham Hotspur in July 2012, he won Premier League Player of the Month in March 2013, making himself the second Belgian and the 12th Tottenham player to win the award.
Jan Vertonghen.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Kevin Kilbane.name: Kevin Kilbane
Kevin Kilbane.intro:
'''Kevin Daniel Kilbane''' (; born 1 February 1977) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played as both a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back and a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger. Born and raised in England but of Irish descent, Kilbane won 110 caps for the Republic of Ireland national football team, third behind only Robbie Keane and Shay Given as the most capped Irish player of all time.
Kilbane played for several English clubs, including Everton F.C.Everton, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Derby County F.C.Derby County (the last two on loan from Hull City A.F.C.Hull City) and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
Towards the end of his career Kilbane concentrated on forging a media career. He has worked as a pundit for RTÉ Sport and is now a columnist for the ''Irish Daily Mail'' and appears on BBC Radio 5 Live, ''Football Focus'', ''Final Score'' and ''Match of the Day''.
Kevin Kilbane.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back,Midfielder Winger Left winger

Stelios Giannakopoulos.name: Stelios Giannakopoulos
Stelios Giannakopoulos.intro:
'''Stylianos "Stelios" Giannakopoulos''' (; born 12 July 1974), popularly known as '''Stelios''', is a Greek former footballer who was most recently the manager of Paniliakos F.C..
During his playing career, Giannakopoulos was one of the best known Greek footballers internationally, due to his successful spells with Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as well as his appearances with the 2004 2004 European Football ChampionshipEuropean championship-winning Greece national football teamGreek national team.

Javier de Pedro.name: Javier de Pedro
Javier de Pedro.intro:
'''Francisco Javier "Javi" de Pedro Falque''' (born 4 August 1973 in Logroño, La Rioja (Spain)La Rioja) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer.
He played as a Midfielder#Wide midfielderleft midfielder, mainly with Real Sociedad, and possessed a thunderous left-foot shot. He also played professionally in four other countries, with no impact whatsoever.
De Pedro represented Spain national football teamSpain at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup.

Sam Sodje.name: Sam Sodje
Sam Sodje.intro:
'''Samuel Okeremute "Sam" Sodje''' (born 25 May 1979) is a retired Nigerian professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender.
Born in England to Nigerian parents, Sodje represented Nigeria national football teamNigeria at international level.

Gareth Williams (Scottish footballer).name: Gareth Williams (Scottish footballer)
Gareth Williams (Scottish footballer).intro: '''Gareth John Williams''' (born 16 December 1981) is a retired ScotlandScottish professional association footballfootballer. He was capped 5 times for his country and last played for Watford in the Premier League. His career was blighted and ultimately ended by knee injuries.
Gareth Williams (Scottish footballer).position: Midfielder Deep lying playmaker Centre Midfielder

Bobby Davison.name: Bobby Davison
Bobby Davison.intro: '''Robert "Bobby" Davison''' (born 17 July 1959) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. Born in South Shields he began his career with Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town before spending time at Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, Derby County F.C.Derby County (twice), Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United (twice),  Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.  After he retired from playing he spent time on the coaching staff of a number of clubs, including brief spells as manager of Guiseley A.F.C.Guiseley and Ferencvárosi TCFerencváros, and is currently youth team coach at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and assistant manager to Noel Blake's England national under-19 football team.

Gavin Holligan.name: Gavin Holligan
Gavin Holligan.intro: '''Gavin Victor Holligan''' (born 30 June 1980 in Lambeth) is an EnglandEnglish former football (soccer)footballer and musician.

Gerald Sibon.name: Gerald Sibon
Gerald Sibon.intro: '''Gerald Sibon''' (born 19 April 1974) is a retired Dutch Association footballfootball player.

Ronnie Whelan.name: Ronnie Whelan
Ronnie Whelan.intro:
'''Ronald Andrew "Ronnie" Whelan''' (; born 25 September 1961 in Dublin) is a former Irish association football midfielder, and sometimes Defender (association football)defender, who was an integral part of the dominant Liverpool F.C.Liverpool side of the 1980s. He was at the club from 1979 until 1994. In 100 Players Who Shook The Kop, a poll of 110,000 Liverpool fans conducted by the [
Whelan finished his career at Southend United F.C.Southend United, where he was also player-manager. He has also managed in Greece and Cyprus, with Panionios G.S.S.Panionios, Olympiakos Nicosia and Apollon Limassol.
Whelan played for the Republic of Ireland national football team at one UEFA European Football Championship (UEFA Euro 19881988) and two World Cups (1990 FIFA World Cup1990 and 1994 FIFA World Cup1994), turning out a total of 53 times for the national side between 1981 and 1995.
Since retirement he has begun Ronnie Whelan#Media careera media career, and is a regular contributor to RTÉ Sport in Ireland.

Terry Cooke.name: Terry Cooke
Terry Cooke.intro:
'''Terence John "Terry" Cooke''' (born 5 August 1976) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1994 to 2011.
Born in Marston Green, he began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but struggled to break into the first team and had loan spells with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Wrexham F.C.Wrexham before moving to United's local rivals Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1999. He also failed to make an impact at City and again went on loan to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town. The loan to Grimsby became permanent in 2002, but he only remained there for a year before rejoining Sheffield Wednesday for a season.
In 2005, Cooke's career took him out of England for the first time as he joined Major League Soccer's Colorado Rapids. In four years with the team, he made more than 100 appearances, but he was deemed to be surplus to requirements at the end of the 2009 Major League Soccer season2009 MLS season and released from his contract. As a free agent, he was picked up by Australian side North Queensland Fury, and 2010-2011 he played for Gabala FCGabala of Azerbaijan. Cooke also made four appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side.

Juan Carlos Menseguez.name: Juan Carlos Menseguez
Juan Carlos Menseguez.intro: '''Juan Carlos Menseguez''' (born 18 February 1984 in Córdoba, ArgentinaCórdoba) is an ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootball Forward (association football)forward who plays for Club Atlético River PlateRiver Plate.

Conor McAleny.name: Conor McAleny
Conor McAleny.intro: '''Conor Michael McAleny''' (born 12 August 1992) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, on loan from Everton F.C.Everton, as a striker. He is a product of the club's Everton F.C. Reserves and Academyacademy.

Zurab Khizanishvili.name: Zurab Khizanishvili
Zurab Khizanishvili.intro: '''Zurab Khizanishvili''' (; born 6 October 1981) is a Georgia (country)Georgian association footballfootballer who plays for Georgia (country)Georgian club Dinamo Tbilisi as a defender (association football)defender.

Kieron Dyer.name: Kieron Dyer
Kieron Dyer.intro:
'''Kieron Courtney Dyer'''  (born 29 December 1978) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.
Born in Ipswich, he played youth football for his home club Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town before going on to make nearly 100 league appearances for the club's first team. He was sold to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for £6 million, at the time the highest fee paid for an Ipswich player, and made nearly 200 appearances for Newcastle between 1999 and 2007. A move for the same fee to West Ham United followed, but Dyer suffered from various injuries, restricting him to 30 league appearances in four seasons. After a short loan back to Ipswichin March 2011, he signed for newly promoted club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers ahead of their 2011–12 Premier League season. However, his time at QPR was again blighted by injuries and he made just eight appearances for the club before being released in January 2013, spending the rest of the season at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough before retiring.
Dyer represented England national football teamEngland on 33 occasions between 1999 and 2007. He was a member of the England squads which reached the quarter-finals at the 2002 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2004.

Danny Simpson.name: Danny Simpson
Danny Simpson.intro: '''Daniel Peter "Danny" Simpson''' (born 4 January 1987) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. A product of the Manchester United F.C.Manchester United academy, Simpson has also played on loan for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in England and Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp in Belgium. He was on loan at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for six months before signing for them on a permanent basis in January 2010. After four years with Newcastle, he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers on a free transfer in June 2013.

Olivier Giroud.name: Olivier Giroud
Olivier Giroud.intro:
'''Olivier Giroud''' (; born 30 September 1986) is a FranceFrench Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in the Premier League and the France national football teamFrance national team. He plays as a striker and is known for his size, physical style of play, heading ability, shot power, strength and link-up play. He is also associated with making runs to the front post that outwit defenders.
He began his career at Grenoble Foot 38Grenoble in Ligue 2 before joining Tours FCTours in 2008. In his second season at Tours, he was the division's top scorer with 21 goals, earning him a move to top-flight Montpellier HSCMontpellier. Giroud was again the top scorer with 21 goals in the 2011–12 Ligue 12011–12 season, giving the club their first ever Ligue 1 title. He then moved to Arsenal for an estimated £9.6 million.
Giroud made his full international debut for France in 2011. He has earned over 30 caps, and was part of the teams which reached the quarter-finals at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Danny Boxall.name: Danny Boxall
Danny Boxall.intro:
'''Daniel James Boxall''' (born 24 August 1977) is a model (person)model and former professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a Defender (association football)defender.
Boxall retired from football due to injury and is now a male model.
Danny Boxall.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Jon Bewers.name: Jon Bewers
Jon Bewers.intro: '''Jonathan Anthony Bewers''' (born 10 September 1982) is an English association footballfootballer born in Kettering, Northamptonshire, who played in the Premier League for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and in the Football League for Notts County F.C.Notts County and Walsall F.C.Walsall. He played as a defender (association football)defender or in midfieldermidfield. Throughout his career, he has been known as '''Jonathan Bewers''',

Patrick Agyemang.name: Patrick Agyemang
Patrick Agyemang.intro:
'''Patrick Agyemang''' (born 29 September 1980) is an English-born GhanaGhanaian professional footballer who plays as a Striker (association football)striker.
Agyemang began his career at Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, progressing through the club's youth system. He was loaned out to Brentford F.C.Brentford in October 1999 for three months, before returning to his parent club. Agyemang went on to play regularly for Wimbledon for the next four seasons. He joined Gillingham F.C.Gillingham in January 2004, spending ten months with the club. He attracted the interest of Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in November 2004, who signed Agyemang for a fee of £350,000. He spent four seasons at Preston, before joining Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 2008. He was part of the QPR team that earned promotion to the Premier League during the 2010–11 in English football2010–11 season. During the 2011–12 in English football2011–12 season, Agyemang was loaned out to Championship side Millwall F.C.Millwall on a one-month loan deal. He was loaned out for a second time in January 2012, this time joining Stevenage on loan until the end of the 2011–12 season. Agyemang signed for Stevenage on a permanent basis in August 2012. In February 2013, Agyemang joined Portsmouth on loan for the rest of the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 campaign. He signed for the club permanently in May 2013. He has also been Cap (sport)capped twice by the Ghana national football teamGhana national team, scoring one goal.

Sean Davis.name: Sean Davis
Sean Davis.intro: '''Sean Davis''' (born 20 September 1979 in Clapham, London) is a former English Association footballfootballer who has played for clubs such as Fulham F.C.Fulham, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Victor Wanyama.name: Victor Wanyama
Victor Wanyama.intro:
'''Victor Mugubi Wanyama''' (; born 25 June 1991) is a Kenyan professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton and captains the Kenya national football teamKenya national team. On the field, Wanyama is known for his sportsmanship and leadership qualities.
Wanyama became the first ever Kenyan player to score in the UEFA Champions League when he scored the first goal in Celtic F.C.Celtic's 2–1 win over FC BarcelonaBarcelona on 7 November 2012. On 11 July 2013, Wanyama moved to Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton for £12.5 million making him the most expensive player sold by a Scottish club, surpassing the £9.5 million Russian club FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow paid for Aiden McGeady in 2010.
He has earned over 30 caps for the Kenyan national team since making his international debut in May 2007 at the age of 15.

Malky Mackay.name: Malky Mackay
Malky Mackay.intro:
'''Malcolm George "Malky" Mackay''' (born 19 February 1972) is a Scottish manager (football)football manager and former player, who is the current manager of Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. Mackay, who played as a Defender (association football)defender, began his playing career in Scottish football, with Queen's Park F.C.Queen's Park and Celtic F.C.Celtic. He joined English side Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 1998, remaining there for six years. Between 2004 and 2006, he achieved consecutive promotions to the Premier League with Norwich, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and finally Watford F.C.Watford. Mackay won five cap (sport)caps for Scotland national football teamScotland towards the end of his playing career.
After retiring as a player in 2008, he became manager of Watford in June 2009. He was manager of Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City between June 2011 and December 2013, achieving promotion to the Premier League in 2013 but was sacked after a dispute with club owner Vincent Tan due to a number of racist comments found on his club owned mobile phone aimed at Jews, Asians and Blacks.

Ian Marshall.name: Ian Marshall
Ian Marshall.intro:
'''Ian Paul Marshall''' (born 20 March 1966) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a striker (association football)striker and defender (association football)defender from 1984 until 2002.
He notably played in the Premier League with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, as well as playing in the Football League for Everton F.C.Everton, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Ian Bishop.name: Ian Bishop
Ian Bishop.intro:
'''Ian William Bishop''' (born 29 May 1965 in Liverpool) is a former association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.
He was born on the Cantril Farm housing estate in Liverpool and on leaving school in July 1981 he joined Everton F.C.Everton, turning professional for the 1983-84 in English football1983–84 season under the management of Howard Kendall – who had taken over during the same summer that Bishop had first joined the club.
However, he failed to break into the first team at Goodison Park. After spells at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Bournemouth A.F.C.Bournemouth he signed for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1989 for £465,000 in a deal involving Paul Moulden. Bishop was a good passer of the ball and in his 24 appearances for Manchester City in his first spell helped the team demolish their local rivals Manchester United F.C.Manchester United 5–1 scoring City's third goal, on 23 September 1989. Despite being popular with the Manchester City supporters he was sold by then manager Howard Kendall to West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
Bishop joined in the same week as Trevor Morley and Colin Foster (footballer born 1964)Colin Foster, as manager Lou Macari continued to rebuild the West Ham squad. He spent the majority of his career at West Ham, playing 284 times between 1989 and 1998, scoring 16 goals and becoming something of a cult figure.
In 1998, having become surplus to requirements at the Boleyn Ground, he returned to Manchester City. His second spell at the club saw the team relegated to what was then Division Two, but then promoted to Division One and in the following season to the Premiership. Bishop was an integral player in the team which earned promotion to the premiership but only played ten times for the club in the top flight. He transferred to Miami Fusion in March 2001 and played Major League Soccer (23 apps 0 goals), before finishing his playing career with a stint at the New Orleans Shell Shockers in the USL Premier Development League.

Neville Southall.name: Neville Southall
Neville Southall.intro:
'''Neville Southall''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 16 September 1958) is a Welsh peopleWelsh former international association footballfootballer.
