He has been described as one of the best Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeepers of his generation and won the FWA Footballer of the Year award in 1985.
He joined Bury F.C.Bury from Winsford United F.C.Winsford United for a £6,000 fee in 1980, and turned professional in his early 20s after a number of years as a semi-professional and amateur player. During his teenage years he worked as a binman, waiter and Brick hodhod carrier. He moved on to Everton F.C.Everton for £150,000 in 1981 and established himself as the club's first-choice goalkeeper by the 1983–84 season. He went on to make a club record 578 appearances in the Football League and Premier League (750 in all competitions); his honours with the club include a UEFA Cup Winners' CupEuropean Cup Winners' Cup medal in 1985 European Cup Winners' Cup Final1985, a Football League First DivisionFirst Division championship medal in 1984–85 Football League1984–85 and 1986–87 Football League1986–87, an FA Cup winners medal in 1984 FA Cup Final1984 and 1995 FA Cup Final1995, and an FA Community ShieldFA Charity Shield winners medal in 1984 FA Charity Shield1984, 1985 FA Charity Shield1985, 1986 FA Charity Shield1986, and 1995 FA Charity Shield1995. He also played in the 1985 FA Cup Final1985 and 1989 FA Cup Final1989 FA Cup finals, the Football League CupLeague Cup final in 1984 Football League Cup Final1984, and helped Everton to a second place in the league in 1985–86. After leaving Everton in 1998, he became Torquay United F.C.Torquay United's regular goalkeeper for two years. He also made a handful of appearances for numerous other clubs.
He played internationally for Wales national football teamWales, winning a record 92 cap (sport)caps between 1982 and 1998, though he did not feature in any major international competitions. As an individual, he was named on the PFA Team of the Year four consecutive times, and was listed as one of the world's top ten goalkeepers by the International Federation of Football History & Statistics on four occasions. He is a member of the Gwladys Street's Hall of Fame. He has been named as one of the 100 'Greatest Players of the 20th Century' by ''World Soccer (magazine)World Soccer'' magazine. In 1995 he was appointed a Member of the Order of the British Empire (MBE) for his services to football.
Since his retirement as a player, Southall has briefly managed Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic, Hastings United F.C.Hastings United and Margate F.C.Margate, and has coached at numerous clubs as well as the Welsh national youth teams. He has also worked extensively with disadvantaged children, and set up his own educational consultancy.

Darren Moore.name: Darren Moore
Darren Moore.intro: '''Darren Mark Moore''' (born 22 April 1974 in Birmingham) is an EnglandEnglish-born Jamaican former professional Association footballfootballer. During his playing career, he earned three international caps for Jamaica national football teamJamaica. Moore is also a member of the management committee of the Professional Footballers' Association.
Darren Moore.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Richard Dryden.name: Richard Dryden
Richard Dryden.intro: '''Richard Andrew Dryden''' (born 14 June 1969) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer turned Manager (association football)manager and Coach (sport)coach.

Duncan Jupp.name: Duncan Jupp
Duncan Jupp.intro:
'''Duncan Alan Jupp''' (born 25 January 1975 in Haslemere) is a retired Association footballfootballer whose last club was Bognor Regis Town F.C.Bognor Regis Town.
Jupp began his career as a trainee with Fulham F.C.Fulham where he made more than 100 appearances before he moved to
Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon for £200,000. He later had spells with Notts County F.C.Notts County and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town before joining Southend United F.C.Southend United, where he helped the club to two consecutive promotions - including scoring the decisive goal in the Football League Two Playoff final in 2005 against Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City;cite web
url=
title=Lincoln City 0-2 Southend United
publisher=BBC
date=28 May 2005 accessdate=4 September 2012 his only goal for the club.
He signed for Gillingham on 22 May 2006 and made his debut in the 2–1 home win over Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town on 5 August. He left the club by mutual consent on 17 December 2007. He joined Bognor Regis Town F.C.Bognor Regis Town in January 2008.[
Jupp, who also works as a football coach at Dorset House School in nearby Pulborough, announced his retirement from football in July 2009. However, in September 2010, he made a comeback and returned to Bognor and has featured for the club a few times since.

Darren Fletcher.name: Darren Fletcher
Darren Fletcher.intro:
'''Darren Barr Fletcher''' (born 1 February 1984) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Centre midfieldercentral midfielder for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and the Scotland national football teamScottish national team. The industrious footballer has also played as a right midfielder or as an emergency defender.
Fletcher came through the ranks of Manchester United F.C. Reserves and AcademyManchester United's Youth Academy and has won five Premier Leagues, one FA Cup, two Football League CupLeague Cups, the UEFA Champions League and the FIFA Club World Cup. Fletcher was included in the PFA Team of the YearPFA Premier League Team of the Year for PFA Team of the Year#Premier League 182009–10. Including his time as a schoolboy, Fletcher spent 20 years with Manchester United, making over 200 appearances for the club and was named vice-captain in his last season with the club.
Fletcher made his Scotland debut in 2003 and scored his first international goal on his second appearance. After Barry Ferguson was banned from international football because of a breach of regulations, Fletcher was given the Captain (association football)captain's armband in August 2009. Fletcher has won a total of 66 Cap (sport)caps and scored five goals for Scotland.
In December 2011, he began an extended break from football due to continuing health problems caused by ulcerative colitis. He made his return on 19 September 2012, but later underwent an operation to attempt to lessen the effects of the condition, ruling him out for the remainder of the 2012–13 season.

Mario Melchiot.name: Mario Melchiot
Mario Melchiot.intro: '''Mario Deno Patrik Melchiot''' (born 4 November 1976 in Amsterdam) is a Dutch former Association footballfootballer. He played as a right-back and a central defender, and also occasionally played in midfield.
Mario Melchiot.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Andy Petterson.name: Andy Petterson
Andy Petterson.intro: '''Andrew Keith Petterson''' (born 26 September 1969 in Fremantle, Western Australia, Australia) is a former Australian association footballfootball player who last played for ECU Joondalup in the Western Australian premier league. He became the club's Technical Director in 2013 as part of the club's acceptance into National Premier Leagues WA. He has a daughter Ellen Petterson (1992) and son Cameron Petterson (1996).

Lars Leese.name: Lars Leese
Lars Leese.intro: '''Lars Leese''' (born 18 August 1969) is a GermanyGerman former professional association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper. He is now manager of SSVg Velbert.

Alan Smith (footballer, born 1980).name: Alan Smith (footballer, born 1980)
Alan Smith (footballer, born 1980).intro:
'''Alan Smith''' (born 28 October 1980) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Notts County F.C.Notts County, having signed for them in May 2014 following his release by Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons a few weeks earlier. He has also represented the England national football team, winning 19 Cap (sport)caps.
Smith first came to prominence as both a forward (association football)striker and a right winger during his early days at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before Manchester United F.C.Manchester United manager Alex FergusonSir Alex Ferguson converted him to a holding midfielder, a role in which he continued after his transfer to Newcastle United. Smith has earned a reputation as a hard-tackling player and is noted for his high work rate.

Carl Griffiths.name: Carl Griffiths
Carl Griffiths.intro:
'''Carl Brian Griffiths''' (born 16 July 1971) is an English-born Welsh peopleWelsh former Association footballfootballer and manager.
He started his career with Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town in 1988, and after being voted onto the PFA Team of the Year, moved on to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City for £500,000 in October 1993. In August 1995 he transferred to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth for £200,000, moving on to Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United for £225,000 in March 1996. He joined Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient for £65,000 in March 1997, where he stayed for four years, interrupted by short spells at Wrexham F.C.Wrexham (on loan) and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He played for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town between July 2001 and 2003 following a £65,000 transfer, later dropping into non-league football with Harlow Town F.C.Harlow Town, Braintree Town F.C.Braintree Town, Brentwood Town F.C.Brentwood Town, and Maldon & Tiptree F.C.Maldon Town. He also represented Wales at Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 level and also for the "B" team. Within his three spells with Leyton Orient he achieved cult status and in 2004 received 9% of the vote for all-time cult hero behind Peter Kitchen and Terry Howard.
Turning to management in 2008, he took charge of Brentwood Town F.C.Brentwood Town for a year. In 2010 he was made manager of Aveley F.C.Aveley, before leaving this post the following year.

Jason Wilcox.name: Jason Wilcox
Jason Wilcox.intro:
He also played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City before finishing his career with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He made three appearances for England national football teamEngland.
He is currently employed as the Manager of the under-18s academy team at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.

Neil Lewis.name: Neil Lewis
Neil Lewis.intro: '''Neil Lewis''' (born 28 June 1974) is an English Association footballfootball defender (football)defender.

Isaiah Osbourne.name: Isaiah Osbourne
Isaiah Osbourne.intro: '''Isaiah George Osbourne''' (born 5 November 1987) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. He is a former England national under-16 football teamEngland under-16 international who started his career with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. Osbourne had loan spells with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday before he was released by Villa in 2011. He then signed on a free transfer for Hibernian F.C.Hibernian and made 30 appearances in the 2011–12 Scottish Premier League. Osbourne signed for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in July 2012.

Julio Arca.name: Julio Arca
Julio Arca.intro: '''Julio Andrés Arca''' (born 31 January 1981 in Quilmes) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer, who currently plays for amateur football team Willow Pond, after having his contract with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough cancelled by mutual consent. Arca is also a former Argentina Under-20 Captain (association football)captain. He is a Defender (association football)#Wingbackleft back or Midfielder#Central midfieldermidfielder. An attack minded player, his key attributes include good long and short passing as well as hard work.

Shaun Goater.name: Shaun Goater
Shaun Goater.intro:
'''Leonard Shaun Goater''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 25 February 1970) is a BermudaBermudian Association footballfootballer who is now retired. He played as a Forward (association football)striker for a number of English clubs in the 1990s and 2000s.
Goater's first professional club was Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but he did not reach the first team, making his League debut in 1989 after moving to Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United. He played for Rotherham for seven years before moving to Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in 1996. Two years later he moved to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City for a fee of £400,000.
He is most well known for his time at Manchester City, where he scored over 100 goals between 1998 and 2003, finishing as the club's top scorer for four consecutive seasons. After leaving City, Goater had spells with Reading F.C.Reading, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Southend United F.C.Southend United, before retiring in May 2006. He represented Bermuda national football teamBermuda 36 times, scoring 32 goals.cite news
title=USL expands to Bermuda
url=
publisher=United Soccer Leagues
date=14 September 2006
accessdate=2 December 2011

Preki.name: Preki
Preki.intro:
'''Predrag Radosavljević''' (; known by the nickname '''Preki''' Преки; born June 24, 1963) is a Serbian American former international association football player currently serving as head coach of the Sacramento Republic FC in the USL Pro league, having previously coached in Major League Soccer with Toronto FC and Chivas USA.
During his playing career he played for English clubs Everton F.C.Everton and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, and was an 'MLS original' upon the formation of Major League Soccer in 1996, playing for the Kansas City Wizards and Miami Fusion. He is a two-time winner of the Major League Soccer MVP Award, and represented the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States at the 1998 FIFA World Cup. He was elected to the American National Soccer Hall of Fame in 2010.

Giovanni van Bronckhorst.name: Giovanni van Bronckhorst
Giovanni van Bronckhorst.intro:
'''Giovanni Christiaan van Bronckhorst''' Order of Orange-NassauOON (; born 5 February 1975 in Rotterdam), known as '''Gio''' in Spain, is a retired Dutch peopleDutch Association footballfootballer and former Captain (association football)captain of the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team. Formerly a defensive midfielder, he moved to left-back later in his career.
During his club career, Van Bronckhorst played for RKC Waalwijk (1993–94), Feyenoord (1994–98), Rangers F.C.Rangers (1998–2001), Arsenal F.C.Arsenal (2001–03), FC Barcelona (2003–07), and again Feyenoord (2007–10). He was an instrumental player in Barcelona's 2005–06 UEFA Champions League victory, being in the starting line-up of the 2005–06 UEFA Champions League final against his old club Arsenal, having played every Champions League match for Barcelona that season.
He earned 106 Cap (sport)caps for the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team, and played for his country in three FIFA World CupWorld Cups (1998 FIFA World Cup1998, 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010), as well as three UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championships (UEFA Euro 20002000, UEFA Euro 20042004, and UEFA Euro 20082008). After captaining the ''Oranje'' through the 2010 FIFA World Cup Final, he was elected into the Order of Orange-Nassau.
Giovanni van Bronckhorst.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Roy Carroll.name: Roy Carroll
Roy Carroll.intro:
'''Roy Eric Carroll''' (born 30 September 1977) is a Northern Irish association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English club Notts County F.C.Notts County. He is best known for his spells at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United (where he won a Premier League winners medal and the 2004 FA Cup) and Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos (where he won the Greek Superleague and the 2012 Greek Cup). He has also represented Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland over 35 times at full international level, gaining his first cap in 1997, aged 19.
Carroll has also had a one-game managerial career, leading Barnet F.C.Barnet to a 2–1 victory in the 2011 Herts Senior Cup final against Stevenage F.C.Stevenage. Therefore, Carroll holds the unusual honour of having won a trophy in his only game as a manager.[

Piotr \u015awierczewski.name: Piotr Świerczewski
Piotr \u015awierczewski.intro: '''Piotr Jarosław Świerczewski''' () (born April 8, 1972 in Nowy Sącz) is a retired PolandPolish association footballfootball player.

Neal Ardley.name: Neal Ardley
Neal Ardley.intro: '''Neal Christopher Ardley''' (born 1 September 1972 in Epsom) is an English peopleEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as either a Defender (association football)right-back or Midfielderright midfielder. He is currently the manager of AFC Wimbledon, a position he has held since 10 October 2012. He was cap (football)capped at England national under-21 football teamUnder-21 level by England. Ardley spent the majority of his career with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, making his debut for them on 20 April 1991 at the age of 18 in a 2–1 away win over Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Football League First Division. He went on to make over 100 appearances for Watford F.C.Watford before having spells at Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Millwall F.C.Millwall. Ardley announced his retirement from professional football on 30 August 2007 after suffering a series of injuries. On the same day, Ardley announced that he would return to former club Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City having been appointed manager of the Cardiff City F.C. AcademyCardiff City Youth Academy.

Yacouba Sylla.name: Yacouba Sylla
Yacouba Sylla.intro: '''Yacouba Sylla''' (born 29 November 1990) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Kayseri Erciyesspor on loan from English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and the Mali national football teamMali national football team having represented France national football teamFrance as a youth international.

Kevin Phillips.name: Kevin Phillips
Kevin Phillips.intro:
'''Kevin Mark Phillips''' (born 25 July 1973) is a retired English professional Association footballfootballer and a First Team Coach at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.
Phillips was the Premier League top scorer in the FA Premier League 1999–20001999–2000 season with 30 goals for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, a tally which won him the European Golden Shoe. He remains the only Englishman to win the trophy. He also had spells at Watford F.C.Watford, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.

Lee Power.name: Lee Power
Lee Power.intro: '''Lee Michael Power''' (born 30 June 1972 in Lewisham, London) is a former professional association footballfootballer and current chairman of Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town. Despite being born in London, his Irish ancestry allowed him to be capped by Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at Youth, Under-21 and B level. Power played in three qualifiers in the 1990 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship qualifying campaign and in the 1990 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship as well as the 1991 FIFA World Youth Championship [

Aleksandar Rodi\u0107.name: Aleksandar Rodić
Aleksandar Rodi\u0107.intro: '''Aleksandar Rodić''' (born 26 December 1979) is a Bosnia and HerzegovinaBosnian-born Slovenian professional Association footballfootball player who plays for NK Olimpija Ljubljana (2005)Olimpija in the Slovenian PrvaLiga.
Aleksandar Rodi\u0107.birth_place: Kozarska Dubica,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Tony Cottee.name: Tony Cottee
Tony Cottee.intro:
'''Antony Richard "Tony" Cottee''' (born 11 July 1965 in Forest Gate, Newham, England) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and manager who now works as a television football commentator.
As a player he was a striker (association football)striker from 1982 until 2001, notably playing in the top flight of English football for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Everton F.C.Everton and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He was capped seven times by England national football teamEngland, and played in the Football League for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Millwall F.C.Millwall. He also had a spell in Malaysia with Selangor FASelangor and spent a season as player-manager of Barnet F.C.Barnet.
He played in the 1989 FA Cup Final defeat to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, and won the Football League CupLeague Cup with Leicester City in 2000. His final career tally was 579 league games and 226 goals (99 of which for Everton). In all competitions, he managed 712 games and 293 goals. He exceeded his ambition to score 200 league goals in his career, but fell just short of his target of 300 goals in all competitions. Still, he was one of the most prolific goalscorers that English football saw during the 1980s and 1990s.

Mustapha Hadji.name: Mustapha Hadji
Mustapha Hadji.intro:
'''Mustapha Hadji''' (born 16 November 1971 in Ifrane Atlas-Saghir, Morocco) is a former Moroccan Association footballfootballer and current assistant manager of Morocco national football team.
He was named as the 50th Greatest African Player of All Time by African football expert Ed Dove.

Paulo Futre.name: Paulo Futre
Paulo Futre.intro:
'''Paulo Jorge dos Santos Futre''' (; born 28 February 1966) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played mostly as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
After starting playing for Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting, he moved to FC PortoPorto – 1987 European Cup Finalwinning the 1987 European Cup – after which he embarked in an extensive professional career, having represented clubs in Spain, France, Italy and Japan, most notably Atlético Madrid. He also appeared for S.L. BenficaBenfica during four months in 1993.
A Portugal national football teamPortuguese international since the age of 17, Futre gained more than 40 Cap (sport)caps for his country, representing it at the 1986 FIFA World Cup1986 World Cup.

Diomansy Kamara.name: Diomansy Kamara
Diomansy Kamara.intro: '''Diomansy Mehdi Moustapha Kamara''' (born 8 November 1980) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Catanzaro Calcio 2011 as a Forward (association football)striker. He plays internationally for Senegal national football teamSenegal, whom he has represented at three Africa Cup of Nations.

Nick Wright (footballer, born 1975).name: Nick Wright (footballer, born 1975)
Nick Wright (footballer, born 1975).intro: '''Nicholas John "Nick" Wright''' (born 15 October 1975, Derby) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Football (soccer)footballer who played for Derby County F.C.Derby County, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Watford F.C.Watford before his career was cut short by injury. Wright, who played as a Strikerforward, is best remembered for scoring an overhead kick in the 1999 Football League First Division play-off Final, helping secure Watford's promotion to the Premier League.

Adem Poric.name: Adem Poric
Adem Poric.intro: '''Adem Poric''' (born 22 April 1973 in London, England) is a former Australian professional Association Footballfootballer, most famous for playing for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.

John Gannon.name: John Gannon
John Gannon.intro:
'''John Gannon''' (born 18 December 1966) is an English former professional association footballfootballer.
In recent years he has held coaching roles at clubs including Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, Chester City F.C.Chester City, Notts County F.C.Notts County and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United.
He is currently working as a scout with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. As a player he helped Wimbledon to the 1988 FA Cup Final where they achieved a shock 1-0 win over Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. However, Gannon was not in the squad for that game.

Robbie Blake.name: Robbie Blake
Robbie Blake.intro:
'''Robert James "Robbie" Blake''' (born 4 March 1976) is an English association footballfootballer. He began his career as a Forward (association football)striker but has increasingly been used as midfielder in the latter part of his career.
He began his professional career with Darlington F.C.Darlington in 1994 and went on to make more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League playing for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Burnley, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. Blake has been the subject of many transfer (football)transfers throughout his career, with career total transfer fees reaching £3.6 million.cite web
url=
title=Robbie Blake
accessdate=24 February 2008
work=Soccerbase publisher=Centurycomm

Mixu Paatelainen.name: Mixu Paatelainen
Mixu Paatelainen.intro:
'''Mika-Matti Petteri "Mixu" Paatelainen''' (born 3 February 1967) is a FinlandFinnish former international association footballfootballer and the current manager (association football)manager of the Finland national football teamFinnish national team, having started the role in April 2011. He scored 18 goals in 70 appearances for the Finland national football teamFinnish national team, which makes him Finland’s all time List of Finland international footballersthirteenth most capped player and Finnish national football team#Top goalscorersfifth top goalscorer.
Paatelainen had a 20-year playing career, playing for nine different clubs in four countries. Most of his career was spent in the Scottish leagues, with Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone and St. Mirren F.C.St. Mirren. During a spell with English club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Paatelainen became the first Finn to play in the Premier League.
After retiring as a player in 2005, Paatelainen became manager (association football)manager of Scottish club Cowdenbeath F.C.Cowdenbeath, where he helped the club win the championship of Scottish Football League 2005–06Scottish Football League Third Division and earn a promotion. After a season coaching in his native Finland with Turun PalloseuraTPS, Paatelainen returned to Scotland as manager of Hibernian. He left that position by mutual consent after 18 months. After a year out of the game, Paatelainen was appointed manager of Kilmarnock.
He is the eldest of three brothers, all of whom have played professional football. Their father Matti PaatelainenMatti was also a Finnish international.

Alexander Ka\u010danikli\u0107.name: Alexander Kačaniklić
Alexander Ka\u010danikli\u0107.intro: '''Alexander "Alex" Kačaniklić''' (; born 13 August 1991) is a SwedenSwedish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham, and the Sweden national football teamSwedish national team. He normally plays on the midfielderleft wing but can also play as a Centre midfieldercentral midfielder.

Jack Cork.name: Jack Cork
Jack Cork.intro: '''Jack Frank Porteous Cork''' (born 25 June 1989) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He is a versatile player who normally plays in midfield, but can also play in defence. He is the son of former Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon player, former Bolton Wanderers coach, and former Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United assistant manager Alan Cork. He has also featured for the Great Britain Olympic football team.

Mark Robins.name: Mark Robins
Mark Robins.intro:
'''Mark Gordon Robins''' (born 22 December 1969) is an English association footballfootball manager and former player, currently manager of Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United.
As a player he was a striker (association football)striker from 1986 to 2005. After starting his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, he went on to play in the Premier League for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City before playing in the Football League with Reading F.C.Reading, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and in Europe with F.C. CopenhagenFC Copenhagen, CD OurenseOurense and Panionios F.C.Panionios. He finished his career in the Conference National with Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion and was capped six times for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side. In 2007, he became manager of Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, and joined Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in the same capacity in 2009, before leaving in 2011, following differences between him and the board.

Diego Forl\u00e1n.name: Diego Forlán
Diego Forl\u00e1n.intro:
'''Diego Forlán Corazo''' (; born 19 May 1979) is a Uruguayan Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Cerezo Osaka in Japan. He is a two-time winner of both the Pichichi Trophy and the European Golden Shoe, and also received the Golden Ball (FIFA)Golden Ball as the best player at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.
Forlán was born into a family of footballers – his father Pablo ForlánPablo having played for São Paulo FCSão Paulo (1970–1975) and Uruguay national football teamUruguay in the 1966 FIFA World Cup1966 and 1974 FIFA World Cup1974 FIFA World CupWorld Cups and his maternal grandfather, Juan Carlos Corazzo, for Club Atlético IndependienteIndependiente in Argentina.[
Forlán joined Independiente himself after rising through their youth team, and after a successful four-year spell, he signed for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United of England. His form for United was not as successful as at Independiente, although he won the Premier League in 2002–03 Premier League2002–03 and the FA Cup in 2003–04 FA Cup2003–04. In the summer of 2004, he moved on to Spanish side Villarreal CFVillarreal.
In his first season in Spanish football with Villarreal, Forlán scored 25 league goals and won the Pichichi Trophy. After two more successful seasons with Villarreal, Forlán joined Atlético Madrid, where he once again became the league's top scorer, and became the first player to win the Pichichi Trophy twice since Ronaldo achieved this feat in the 2003–04 season. Forlán scored in Atlético's 2010 UEFA Europa League Final2010 Europa League final victory against Fulham F.C.Fulham. In 2011, he joined Inter MilanInternazionale of Italy before moving to Internacional in 2012.
Forlán also has a successful international career, having scored record 33 times for his country since his 2002 debut. He scored once at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup in South Korea and Japan. He was the joint top scorer by scoring five times at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup, in which he scored 2010 FIFA World Cup Group A#South Africa vs Uruguaytwice against the host nation South Africa national football teamSouth Africa, once against Ghana national football teamGhana in the Uruguay v Ghana (2010)quarter-finals, once against Netherlands national football teamthe Netherlands in the 2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Uruguay vs Netherlandssemi-finals and once against Germany national football teamGermany in the 2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Third place play-offthird place play-off. Despite being the joint top scorer in the tournament, Forlán did not receive an award for his goals due to tiebreakers. Forlán was however recognised with the Golden Ball (FIFA)Golden Ball award, given to the best player at the tournament.
On 12 July 2011, at the 2011 Copa América in Argentina, Forlán earned his 79th international Cap (sport)cap, against Mexico national football teamMexico, breaking the record held by former goalkeeper Rodolfo Rodríguez since 1986. On 20 June 2013, in a match against Nigeria national football teamNigeria at the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup2013 Confederations Cup, he became the first Uruguayan to win List of footballers with 100 or more caps100 caps. Forlán was Uruguay's all-time leading top scorer at international level until Luis Suárez overtook him on 23 June 2013. He retired from international football on 11 March 2015.

Jon Stevenson.name: Jon Stevenson
Jon Stevenson.intro: '''Jonathan Stevenson''' (born 13 October 1982) is an English association footballfootballer, currently playing for United Counties League team Oadby Town F.C.Oadby Town, where he plays as a Striker (football)striker.

Roudolphe Douala.name: Roudolphe Douala
Roudolphe Douala.intro:
:''For the Duala peopleDuala rulers of the Dualaking see Rudolph Duala Manga Bell.''
'''Roudolphe Douala M'bela''' (born 25 September 1978), known as '''Douala''', is a Cameroonian retired Association footballfootballer. Mainly a Midfielder#Wingerwinger he could also operate as a Forward (association football)forward, and played professionally in five countries, mainly in Portugal. He amassed Primeira Liga totals of 213 games and 34 goals over the course of nine seasons, notably representing in the competition Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting (three years), Boavista F.C.Boavista and U.D. LeiriaUnião de Leiria (two apiece).
Douala appeared for the Cameroon national football teamCameroonian national team at the 2006 Africa Cup of Nations.

Jimmy Bullard.name: Jimmy Bullard
Jimmy Bullard.intro:
'''James Richard "Jimmy" Bullard''' (born 23 October 1978) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. He played youth football at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United before moving to Ebbsfleet United F.C.Gravesend & Northfleet in 1998.  Two seasons at Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United was followed by a spell at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic where he scored ten goals in 145 league appearances, helping them to their first promotion to the Premier League. Bullard was known for being a passionate leader on the pitch and for his funny antics, playing football with a smile throughout his career. Paul Jewell described Bullard as the heart and soul of the dressing room.
A transfer to Fulham F.C.Fulham in 2006 resulted in six goals in 39 league appearances before Bullard moved to Hull City A.F.C.Hull City in 2009. A loan move to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town commenced in 2011 where he scored on his debut. He later moved permanently to Ipswich and ended his career at Milton Keynes Dons. On 1 October 2012 Bullard retired from professional football, because problems with his knees meant he was unable to keep up the playing demands of up to two games a week.

Ian Nolan.name: Ian Nolan
Ian Nolan.intro: '''Ian Robert Nolan''' (born 9 July 1970) is an English-born Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)full back. During his career he won 17 cap (sport)caps for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, and made nearly 300 appearances in the Football League.

Tony Folan.name: Tony Folan
Tony Folan.intro: '''Anthony "Tony" Folan''' (born 18 September 1978 in Lewisham) was an Republic of IrelandIrish footballer during the 1990s and 2000s. He represented Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at every level up to Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamU21.

Jason Gavin.name: Jason Gavin
Jason Gavin.intro:
'''Jason Joseph Gavin''' (born 14 March 1980) is an Irish professional former association footballfootballer, who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1996 to 2012.
Gavin notably played Premier League football in England for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, before playing for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. He later returned to his native country of Ireland where he played for Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers, Drogheda United F.C.Drogheda United and St Patrick's Athletic F.C.St Patrick's Athletic. In 2010 he emigrated to Australia and played for the Stirling Lions.
Jason Gavin.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Steven Mouyokolo.name: Steven Mouyokolo
Steven Mouyokolo.intro: '''Steven Stefan Fabrice Mouyokolo''' (born 24 January 1987) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. He is currently a free agent.
Steven Mouyokolo.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ricardo Fuller.name: Ricardo Fuller
Ricardo Fuller.intro:
'''Ricardo Dwayne Fuller''' (born 31 October 1979) is a Jamaican professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Millwall F.C.Millwall. He has also played for the Jamaica national football teamJamaica national team.
Fuller started his football career with Jamaican side Tivoli Gardens F.C.Tivoli Gardens, before he moved to England with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in February 2001. He returned to Jamaica and then went on loan to Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts, before joining Preston North End F.C.Preston North End. He scored 27 goals in 58 League game at Preston, which prompted Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth to pay £1million for his services. Fuller failed to make an impact at Portsmouth and joined rivals Southampton F.C.Southampton in 2005 before Stoke City F.C.Stoke City signed him for £500,000 in August 2006.
At Stoke, he became an influential member of the first team and his goals helped the "Potters" gain promotion to the Premier League in 2008. He remained a key figure in the top-flight, despite a poor disciplinary record, and helped Stoke reach the 2011 FA Cup Final, but missed out on the final due to injury. After he recovered from his injury he was only give a bit-part role and he left the club in June 2012 for a one season stay with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He spent the 2013–14 Blackpool F.C. season2013–14 season with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Matty Fryatt.name: Matty Fryatt
Matty Fryatt.intro:
'''Matthew Charles''' "'''Matty"''' '''Fryatt''' (born 5 March 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
Fryatt currently holds the record for fastest goal ever scored by a Leicester City F.C.Leicester City player when he scored after 9 seconds in a 2–1 defeat to Preston North End F.C.Preston North End on 15 April 2006. He also holds the record for the quickest Walsall goal, also 9 seconds in a 2–1 defeat to A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth in the 2004–05 season. Fryatt broke two further records during his time at Leicester in the 2008–09 season. His first was becoming the first player in 42 years to score 20 goals before Christmas, and another being the first in 83 years to hit hat-tricks in successive matches.

Didier Zokora.name: Didier Zokora
Didier Zokora.intro: '''Déguy Alain Didier Zokora''' (born 14 December 1980) commonly known as '''Didier Zokora''' is an Ivorian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Akhisar Belediyespor.  He was on his country's national team for almost 15 years since 2000 and has become the team's most capped player.

Martin Paterson.name: Martin Paterson
Martin Paterson.intro:
'''Martin Andrew Paterson''' (born 10 May 1987) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Orlando City SCOrlando City on loan from Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town and the Northern Ireland national football team as a striker.
He has previously played for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United and Burnley F.C.Burnley. Although he was born in England, he has chosen to represented Northern Ireland at international level and has been capped at Northern Ireland national under-21 football teamU21 and Northern Ireland national football teamsenior level.

Martin Latka.name: Martin Latka
Martin Latka.intro: '''Martin Latka''' (born 28 September 1984) is a Czech RepublicCzech Association footballfootballer who currently plays as central Defender (association football)defender for Fortuna Düsseldorf.

Matthew Kilgallon.name: Matthew Kilgallon
Matthew Kilgallon.intro: '''Matthew Shaun Kilgallon''' (born 8 January 1984) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. Born in York, Kilgallon began his football career at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United where he came through the youth set up before becoming a fixture in their first-team. He then moved to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United where he spent three years before moving to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. With spells on loan at West Ham United F.C.West Ham, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, he has also made five appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21s.
Matthew Kilgallon.position: Defender  association football  Centre Back Full Back

Savo Milo\u0161evi\u0107.name: Savo Milošević
Savo Milo\u0161evi\u0107.intro:
'''Savo Milošević''' (, ; born 2 September 1973) is a retired Serbian Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.
After making a name for himself at FK PartizanPartizan, he signed for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, and went on to spend the vast majority of the following decade playing in Spain, where he represented four clubs, amassing La Liga totals of 241 games and 91 goals, and netting nearly 300 official goals over a 16-year professional career.
At the international level, Milošević played for the Serbia and Montenegro national football teamnational team of FR Yugoslavia (later renamed Serbia and Montenegro), surpassing the century of Cap (sport)caps for both teams combined, and appearing in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and one UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championship, at which he earned the UEFA Euro 2000#GoalscorersGolden Boot at Euro 2000.

James Tavernier.name: James Tavernier
James Tavernier.intro: '''James Henry Tavernier''' (born 31 October 1991) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as a defender (association football)defender, he is currently on loan at Bristol City F.C.Bristol City.

Alexander Hleb.name: Alexander Hleb
Alexander Hleb.intro:
'''Aliaksandr Paulavich Hleb''' (, ; ; born 1 May 1981) commonly referred to in English as '''Alexander Hleb''',cite news
url=
title=Gleb wins Belarus gong  date = 31 December 2002  accessdate =2 October 2011  publisher = UEFA.com is a Belarusian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Turkish club Gençlerbirliği S.K.Gençlerbirliği.
His natural and preferred position is attacking midfielder or 'in the hole' behind the strikers, but he is often deployed on the Midfielder#Wingerwing. A full international for Belarus national football teamBelarus since 2001, he has won over 60 caps for his country.

Ryan Jarvis.name: Ryan Jarvis
Ryan Jarvis.intro: '''Ryan Robert Jarvis''' (born 11 July 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town, on Loan (sports)loan from York City F.C.York City. Jarvis has represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17 and England national under-19 football teamunder-19 levels.

Matthew Le Tissier.name: Matthew Le Tissier
Matthew Le Tissier.intro:
'''Matthew "Matt" Le Tissier''' () (born 14 October 1968) is a Guernsey-born EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer and football television presenter. He works as a football pundit for Sky Sports and is the honorary president of Guernsey F.C..
Le Tissier spent his entire professional club career with Southampton F.C.Southampton and won eight Cap (sport)caps for the England national football team before turning to non-League football in 2002. In spite of interest from clubs such as Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 1990 and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 1996, Le Tissier remained at Southampton for his entire professional career, his loyalty garnering special affection from Southampton's fans who nicknamed him "Le God".
A Forward (association football)forward with exceptional technical skills, Le Tissier is the second-highest ever scorer for Southampton behind Mick Channon and was voted PFA Young Player of the Year in 1990. He was the first midfielder to score 100 goals in the Premier League. He is notable for his record at scoring penalty kicks – converting from the spot 47 times from 48 attempts – and is considered one of the greatest ever from the 12 yard spot.
Following his retirement as a player, Le Tissier became a football pundit, and currently works as a panelist on the Sky Sports show ''Soccer Saturday''. In 2011 he became honorary president of Guernsey F.C., for whom he briefly registered as a player in May 2013 to help with the club's fixture congestion.

Mike Marsh.name: Mike Marsh
Mike Marsh.intro: '''Mike Marsh''' (born 21 July 1969) is a former footballer and coach, who came through the ranks at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and was part of their 1992 FA Cup-winning side.

Stefano Eranio.name: Stefano Eranio
Stefano Eranio.intro: '''Stefano Eranio''' (born 29 December 1966 in Genova, Italy) is an Italian former football player, most remembered for his time with AC Milan and Genoa C.F.C.Genoa. Throughout his career, Eranio played mainly as a right winger, and he represented Italy national football teamItaly 20 times between 1990 and 1997. His main attributes were his technique, pace, stamina, and his ability to make attacking runs. Although he was primarily an offensive wide midfielder, he was also competent defensively, and he was occasionally deployed as a fullback. He was voted one of Derby County F.C.Derby County's 11 greatest ever footballers.

\u0141ukasz Fabia\u0144ski.name: Łukasz Fabiański
\u0141ukasz Fabia\u0144ski.intro:
'''Łukasz Fabiański''' (; born 18 April 1985) is a Polish association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League side Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.
Having begun his career at Legia Warsaw, Fabiański joined Arsenal for £2.1 million in 2007, and was mainly used as back-up, but played as the club won the 2014 FA Cup Final. On the expiration of his contract in 2014, he joined Swansea.
A full international for the Poland national football teamPolish national team since 2006,  Fabiański has represented his country on 21 occasions and was included in the squads for the 2006 FIFA World Cup and Euro 2008.

Steven Davis.name: Steven Davis
Steven Davis.intro:
'''Steven Davis''' (born 1 January 1985) is a Northern Irish peopleNorthern Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Southampton F.C.Southampton and is the captain of the Northern Ireland football teamNorthern Ireland national team. Davis made his full international debut in 2005 and has since been capped 64 times at senior level, scoring five goals.
Davis began his career with Premier League side Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and made his first appearance for the club in 2004 against Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. Davis was named "Young Player of the Year", "The Fans Player of the Year" and "Player of the Year" for the 2005–06 season after making 42 appearances during the season. Davis was sold to Fulham F.C.Fulham for £4 million in the summer of 2007. He fell out of favour after then manager Lawrie Sanchez left the club and was loaned to Scottish side Rangers in January 2008 for an initial six months. He was part of the side that reached the 2008 UEFA Cup Final and that won the 2007–08 Scottish League Cup and 2007–08 Scottish Cup.
Davis moved to Rangers on a permanent in the summer of 2008 for £3 million. As of the end of the 2010–11 season, Davis had made over 160 appearances for the Glasgow club, winning three consecutive league titles in 2008–09 in Scottish football2009, 2009–10 in Scottish football2010 and 2010–11 in Scottish football2011, two Scottish Cups and three Scottish League CupLeague Cups. Following the insolvency of Rangers in 2012, Davis exercised his rights under TUPE regulations to rescind his contract and become a free agent. Davis then signed for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Sean Kilgannon.name: Sean Kilgannon
Sean Kilgannon.intro:
'''Sean Kilgannon''' (born 8 March 1981 in Stirling) is a ScotlandScottish footballer, who is currently playing for Camelon Juniors F.C.Camelon Juniors, following his release from Angus side Forfar Athletic F.C.Forfar Athletic in the Scottish Football League Third Division.
He is known for his dead ball expertise and already in the 2008/2009 season he has netted two penalties and a free-kick against Stenhousemuir F.C.Stenhousemuir.
Kilgannon has played for numerous clubs in his time, and is at his sixth different club, having started in England at Premier League side Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough under manager Bryan Robson, where he made one appearance as a substitute against Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, replacing Andy Campbell.cite web
url=
title=Middlesbrough 2 Newcastle 2
publisher=Sporting Life
accessdate=17 October 2012
On 6 July Sean has sign for Camelon Juniors F.C.

Jordan Henderson.name: Jordan Henderson
Jordan Henderson.intro:
'''Jordan Brian Henderson''' (born 17 June 1990) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the England national football teamEngland national team mainly as a central midfielder. However, due to his versatility, he has been known to fill other roles such as a right winger, right midfielder, right back and Defender (Association football)#Wing-backright wing-back  He became the Liverpool vice-captain in 2014.
He began his career at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2008, with a loan spell at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 2009, before moving to Liverpool in 2011. In 2010, he won his first Cap (sports)cap for England, having previously played for and Captain (association football)captained the England national under-21 football teamunder-21 team. He has represented the country at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Gary Parkinson.name: Gary Parkinson
Gary Parkinson.intro:
'''Gary Anthony Parkinson''' (born 10 January 1968) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)right-back.
In 2006 he was appointed Head of Youth at his former club Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, a role he occupied until he suffered a severe stroke in September 2010, leading to a diagnosis of locked-in syndrome.

Bojan Djordjic.name: Bojan Djordjic
Bojan Djordjic.intro: '''Bojan Djordjic''' (''Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic'': '''Бојан Ђорђић''', transliterated as '''Bojan Đorđić'''; , born 6 February 1982) is a Serbian-born SwedenSwedish association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Chennai ISL teamChennaiyin FC in the Indian Super League.
Bojan Djordjic.birth_place: Belgrade,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Andy O'Brien.name: Andy O'Brien
Andy O'Brien.intro:
'''Andrew James "Andy" O'Brien''' (born 29 June 1979) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back.
Born in Harrogate, England, O'Brien won 26 cap (sport)caps for Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland between 2001 and 2006 and was a member of Ireland's 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup squad. He retired from international duty in 2006.

DaMarcus Beasley.name: DaMarcus Beasley
DaMarcus Beasley.intro:
'''DaMarcus Lamont Beasley''' (; born May 24, 1982) is an American professional Association footballsoccer player who plays for the Houston Dynamo of Major League Soccer (MLS). He plays mainly as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger on the left side of the midfield but has also been used as a left-back.
Beasley was one of the most prominent players in Major League Soccer as a star with Chicago Fire S.C.Chicago Fire and the U.S. national team before being purchased by Dutch club PSV Eindhoven during the 2004 season.  He has scored more goals in Europe's highest club competition, the UEFA Champions League, than any other American player, and is the first and only American to play in four FIFA World CupFIFA World Cups.
Beasley earned 121 caps with the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States, debuting in 2001 and becoming the only American to appear in four editions of the FIFA World Cup.

Carl Shutt.name: Carl Shutt
Carl Shutt.intro: '''Carl Shutt''' (born 10 October 1961 in Sheffield) is an English former professional Association footballfootball player.

Laurent Robert.name: Laurent Robert
Laurent Robert.intro:
'''Laurent Robert''' (born 21 May 1975 in Saint-Benoît, Réunion) is a former FranceFrench Association footballfootballer. He played as a left winger, and represented the France National Football TeamFrench national football team.
Robert began his professional career in his native France before making a move to English side Newcastle United, where he made his reputation as a free-kick specialist. His career has been noted for a number of high-profile disagreements with club management.[

Michael Johnson (footballer, born 1973).name: Michael Johnson (footballer, born 1973)
Michael Johnson (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''Michael Owen Johnson''' (born 4 July 1973) is a former association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender, primarily at defender (association football)#Centre backcentre-half, although he also played defender (association football)#Full backleft-back when called upon. He made more than 550 appearances in the Football League and Premier League, including more than 250 games for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and more than 100 each for Notts County F.C.Notts County, the club where he began his professional career, and for Derby County F.C.Derby County. Although born in Nottingham, England, he is a full Jamaica national football teamJamaican international and played 12 times for the Jamaican national team. He retired as a player at the end of the 2008–09 in English football2008/09 season, and took up the post of youth team manager with Notts County.

Mark Tinkler.name: Mark Tinkler
Mark Tinkler.intro:
'''Mark Ronald Tinkler''' (born 24 October 1974 in Bishop Auckland) is an EnglandEnglish former professional football (soccer)footballer and Academy Coach at Football League Championship side Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1991 to 2009, notably in the Premier League for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He also played for York City F.C.York City, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Livingston F.C.Livingston and Whitby Town F.C.Whitby Town.

Christian Bassila.name: Christian Bassila
Christian Bassila.intro: '''Christian Bassila''' (born 5 October 1977 in Paris) is a former France national under-21 football teamFrance under-21 international Association footballfootballer. He played as a defensive midfielder or centre-back.

Zden\u011bk Grygera.name: Zdeněk Grygera
Zden\u011bk Grygera.intro: '''Zdeněk Grygera''' (; born 14 May 1980) is a retired Czech RepublicCzech association footballfootballer. He usually played as a right back or centre back.

Tiago Mendes.name: Tiago Mendes
Tiago Mendes.intro:
'''Tiago Cardoso Mendes''' (born 2 May 1981), known simply as '''Tiago''' (), is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Atlético Madrid.
A versatile midfielder, adept as both a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral or Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive unit and with good overall skills, he has played in England, France, Italy and Spain. He notably spent four seasons with Atlético Madrid, winning five major titles including the 2013–14 La Liga2014 national championship and the 2012 UEFA Europa League Final2012 Europa League.
A Portugal national football teamPortuguese international on over 60 occasions, Tiago represented the nation in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004.
Tiago Mendes.birth_place: Viana do Castelo Municipality|Viana do Castelo,Portugal

Dean Blackwell.name: Dean Blackwell
Dean Blackwell.intro: '''Dean Robert Blackwell''' (born 5 December 1969) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. He appeared in the Premier League and the Football League for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, and the Football League for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion. Blackwell made 233 League appearances, scoring three goals, and represented England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level.

Angelos Basinas.name: Angelos Basinas
Angelos Basinas.intro: '''Angelos Basinas''' (, born on 3 January 1976 in Chalkida, Greece) is a retired GreeksGreek international Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder. He can also operate as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder and Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back. He is best remembered for his key role in the Greece national football teamGreek national team that won the UEFA Euro 20042004 European Championship. He provided the header through which Angelos Charisteas scored the winning goal in the Euro 2004 Final against Portugal.

Anton Ferdinand.name: Anton Ferdinand
Anton Ferdinand.intro: '''Anton Julian Ferdinand''' (born 18 February 1985) is an English association footballfootballer who  plays for Reading F.C.Reading. He is a product of the West Ham United F.C. Reserves and AcademyWest Ham United academy and has also played for West Ham United, Queens Park Rangers, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Bursaspor, Antalyaspor and for the England football team to England under-21 national football teamunder-21 level.

Ragnvald Soma.name: Ragnvald Soma
Ragnvald Soma.intro: '''Ragnvald Soma''' (born 10 November 1979) is a NorwayNorwegian Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for his childhood club Frøyland Idrettslag. He signed for them 02.02.2014 effectively retiring from professional football.

Antonio Nocerino.name: Antonio Nocerino
Antonio Nocerino.intro: '''Antonio Nocerino''' (; born 9 April 1985) is an Italian Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Serie A club Parma F.C.Parma on loan from A.C. MilanMilan. He has also represented the Italian national football teamItalian national team.

Nen\u00ea (footballer, born 1981).name: Nenê (footballer, born 1981)
Nen\u00ea (footballer, born 1981).intro:
'''Anderson Luiz de Carvalho''', commonly known as '''Nenê''' (born 19 July 1981), is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. A Midfielder#Wingerleft winger, he is most known for his crossing ability, as well as being a Direct free kickfree kick specialist.
He played most of his professional career in Spain, representing four clubs and amassing La Liga totals of 140 games and 23 goals over the course of four seasons, and France, where he appeared with AS Monaco FCMonaco and Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain for 142 Ligue 1 matches in four-and-a-half campaigns (55 goals).
Nenê won the 2012–13 Ligue 12013 national championship with PSG, also being chosen the league's best foreign player in 2010 whilst with Monaco.

Kevin Poole.name: Kevin Poole
Kevin Poole.intro:
'''Kevin Poole''' (born 21 July 1963) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who is the goalkeeping coach at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City.
During a career which has become best known for its longevity, Poole played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, having also appeared in England's First Division for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa before the formation of the Premiership. He also featured for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Derby County F.C.Derby County, before signing for Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion in 2006, aged 43.
Latterly employed as goalkeeping coach in addition to being registered as a player, Poole made his final appearance for the club in 2010. He had an interim spell as manager in 2012, when he retired from playing at the age of 48; however, he has since re-registered himself as a player on two occasions due to goalkeeping crises at the club, making Poole one of the few players in English football ever to be registered to a professional club at the age of 50.

Shaun Wright-Phillips.name: Shaun Wright-Phillips
Shaun Wright-Phillips.intro:
'''Shaun Cameron Wright-Phillips''' (born 25 October 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.
He began his senior career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1999, becoming part of the international set-up and earning a £21 million transfer to Premier League champions Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2005, winning several domestic honours. In 2008 he returned to Manchester City, and then joined QPR in 2011.
He made his full England national football teamEngland debut in 2004 and went on to earn 36 caps, and score 6 goals. He was selected for the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Gerry Creaney.name: Gerry Creaney
Gerry Creaney.intro: '''Gerard 'Gerry' Creaney''' (born 13 April 1970 in Coatbridge) is a Scottish former association footballfootballer who played as a striker. He is currently the head of youth development of Dundee F.C.Dundee.

Mika\u00ebl Silvestre.name: Mikaël Silvestre
Mika\u00ebl Silvestre.intro:
'''Mikaël Samy Silvestre''' (born 9 August 1977) is a French Association footballfootballer who last played as a defender for Chennaiyin FC in the Indian Super League.
He began his career at Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes and went on to Inter Milan before joining Manchester United in 1999. At Old Trafford, he won honours including five Premier League titles and the UEFA Champions League, making 361 appearances in all competitions, then joined Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 2008. Two seasons later he joined Werder Bremen, and spent time at the Portland Timbers in Major League Soccer before signing for Chennaiyin in 2014.
Silvestre has also played for the France national football teamFrench national team, earning 40 caps between 2001 and 2006. He represented France at two World Cups, UEFA Euro 2004, and two conquests of the FIFA Confederations Cup.

Massadio Ha\u00efdara.name: Massadio Haïdara
Massadio Ha\u00efdara.intro: '''Massadio Haïdara''' (born 2 December 1992) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays as a left-back for Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.

Lassana Diarra.name: Lassana Diarra
Lassana Diarra.intro: '''Lassana Diarra''' (born 10 March 1985), nicknamed '''Lass''', is a French Association footballfootballer. His predominant position is Midfielderdefensive midfielder but he can also play in a more advanced role and has played at Defender (association football)right back, which he occasionally did for former club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, as well as France national football teamFrance.

Mateja Ke\u017eman.name: Mateja Kežman
Mateja Ke\u017eman.intro:
'''Mateja Kežman''' (Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic: Матеја Кежман ; born 12 April 1979) is a Serbian former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Upon playing in his homeland, Kežman went on to play top-flight football in the Netherlands, England, Spain, Turkey, France, Russia, Hong Kong and Belarus. Arguably, he is most known for his career at PSV Eindhoven, where he amassed numerous awards and world wide recognition as having the potential to be one of the greatest strikers of his generation; he was named Dutch Footballer of the Year in 2003. He was subsequently labeled as a flop after his spell at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, as there were extremely high expectations of him. By the end of his illustrious career, he had amassed a record amount of championship medals in the top-tier competitions of five different countries. Internationally, Kežman represented Serbia and Montenegro national football teamFR Yugoslavia / Serbia and Montenegro at the UEFA Euro 2000 and 2006 FIFA World Cup.
After finishing his professional playing career, Kežman became a sports agent. He also served as a director of football at FK VojvodinaVojvodina in 2013.
Mateja Ke\u017eman.birth_place: Belgrade,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Henrique Hil\u00e1rio.name: Henrique Hilário
Henrique Hil\u00e1rio.intro:
'''Henrique Hilário Meireles Sampaio''' (born 21 October 1975), commonly known as '''Hilário''', is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He spent most of his extensive professional career with F.C. PortoPorto and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, mainly as a backup. He appeared in 160 Primeira Liga games, during nine seasons.

Alan Stubbs.name: Alan Stubbs
Alan Stubbs.intro: '''Alan Stubbs''' (born 6 October 1971 in Kirkby, Lancashire) is a retired English Association footballfootballer, who is currently the head coach of Hibernian F.C.Hibernian. He played as a centre back before he was forced to retire due to a knee injury on 20 August 2008. He played for Bolton Wanderers, Celtic, Everton (two spells), Sunderland and Derby County.

Stefano Okaka.name: Stefano Okaka
Stefano Okaka.intro: '''Stefano Okaka Chuka''' (; born 9 August 1989) is an Italian Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Serie A club U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria and the Italy national football teamItaly national team.

Sean Morrison.name: Sean Morrison
Sean Morrison.intro: '''Sean Joseph Morrison''' (born 8 January 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. He stands , and is eligible to represent both England national football teamEngland and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level.
Sean Morrison.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Viv Anderson.name: Viv Anderson
Viv Anderson.intro: '''Vivian Alexander "Viv" Anderson''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 29 July 1956) is an English association footballfootball coach and former player. Born in Clifton, Nottingham, he played for various clubs in The Football League in the 1970s and 1980s, including Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He is also notable for being the first black peopleblack football player to represent England national football teamEngland in a full international match.[

Eddie Youds.name: Eddie Youds
Eddie Youds.intro:
'''Edward Paul "Eddie" Youds''' (born 3 May 1970) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a Defender (association football)defender from 1988 to 2005.
He notably played in the Premier League with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, having also played in the Football League for Everton F.C.Everton, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town before finishing his career in Non-league with Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic.

Theodoros Zagorakis.name: Theodoros Zagorakis
Theodoros Zagorakis.intro: '''Theodoros "Theo" Zagorakis''' (, born 27 October 1971) is a retired Greek footballer. He was the captain of the Greece national football team that won the 2004 UEFA European Football Championship, and was also president of PAOK F.C.. He was elected as a Greek MEP at the European Parliament election, 2014 (Greece)May 2014 European Parliament election.

Jo\u00e3o Carlos Teixeira.name: João Carlos Teixeira
Jo\u00e3o Carlos Teixeira.intro: '''João Carlos Vilaça Teixeira''' (born 18 January 1993) is a Portuguese Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, on loan from Liverpool F.C.Liverpool.

Michael Reiziger.name: Michael Reiziger
Michael Reiziger.intro:
'''Michael John Reiziger''' (, born 3 May 1973) is a retired Dutch Association footballfootballer who played mainly as a Defender (association football)#Full backright back.
After making a name for himself at AFC AjaxAjax, with whom he 1995 UEFA Champions League Finalwon one Champions League, he went on to represent four teams in four different countries, most notably FC BarcelonaBarcelona for which he played in 249 official games in seven years.
Reiziger played one full decade with the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team, representing the nation in three UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships and the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup, finishing fourth in the latter tournament.

Paul Williams (footballer, born 1965).name: Paul Williams (footballer, born 1965)
Paul Williams (footballer, born 1965).intro:
'''Paul Anthony Williams''' (born 16 August 1965) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who made 300 appearances in the Football League for a variety of clubs. He was cap (sport)capped by England at England under-21 national football teamunder-21 and England B national football teamB international level.
Born in Stratford, LondonStratford, East London, Williams was signed by First Division Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic from non-league Woodford Town F.C.Woodford Town in 1987. Where he was top goal scorer for two successive seasons. This prompted Ron Atkinson to spend nearly a million pounds to bring the Londoner to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 1990 where he enjoyed a productive partnership with David Hirst (footballer)David Hirst. That season he won a League Cup medal at Wembley Stadium by beating Manchester United 1-0. In the same season Wednesday achieved promotion back to the Premier Division.  Williams moved back to London with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1992 in a swap deal involving Mark Bright. In season 1993/94 he won a Championship Winners medal with Palace and was second top goal scorer behind Chris Armstrong.
After loans with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City he returned to Charlton, followed by a few months at Torquay United F.C.Torquay United before ending his league career with Southend United F.C.Southend United in 1998 due to injuries.

Matthew Bates.name: Matthew Bates
Matthew Bates.intro:
'''Matthew David Bates''' (born 10 December 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United as a defender.
Bates has previously played for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Darlington F.C.Darlington, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.
Matthew Bates.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Matthew Rose.name: Matthew Rose
Matthew Rose.intro:
'''Matthew Rose''', (born 24 September 1975 in Dartford, Kent ), is a former EnglandEnglish professional footballer who currently is Head coach of Arsenal's European Elite Academy.
Rose started at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a trainee, captaining his side to an FA Youth Cup victory in 1994; he made his first-team debut against Manchester City F.C.Manchester City on 5 March 1996. He made five appearances (three as sub) for the Gunners before moving to QPR for £500,000 in May 1997. His last game in an Arsenal shirt saw him score an own goal although they went on to win 2-1. He became a regular at QPR and made over 250 appearances for them in all competitions. One of the more important of the 8 goals he scored there was in September 2004 to seal a last minute 3-2 win at Brighton with a left-foot curling shot into the top corner.
url=
title=Bristol Rovers 1-1 Yeovil
publisher=BBC
date=20 October 2007 accessdate=20 December 2009 At the end of the 2007-2008 season Matthew rejected a new contract offer from Yeovil Town.

Phil Jevons.name: Phil Jevons
Phil Jevons.intro:
'''Phillip "Phil" Jevons''' (born 1 August 1979) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and current academy coach of Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton.
As a player he was a forward (association football)forward who played between 1996 and 2014 for Everton F.C.Everton, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Bury F.C.Bury, Morecambe F.C.Morecambe, Hyde F.C.Hyde and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. Jevons came through the youth academy at Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton and was promoted to the club's first team squad in 1996. He made only 8 league appearances before being sold to Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town in 2001. It was whilst a Grimsby player that he is notably remembered for scoring a last minute 45 yard extra time winning goal for The Mariners against his home town club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the third round of the English League CupLeague Cup in 2001 which gave The Mariners a 2–1 victory at Anfield, having initially being 1–0 down. He went on to join Hull City A.F.C.Hull City on loan before returning to Grimsby for the 2003–04 campaign.
The following season he joined Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town where he hit 42 goals in 84 appearances in a two year spell before signing for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City. In 2008 he joined Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town permanently following a short loan spell and again in 2009 was loaned out again to Bury F.C.Bury and Morecambe F.C.Morecambe. In 2010 he signed with Morecambe F.C.Morecambe on a permanent basis notching up 12 goals in 65 appearances in his two year stay. In 2012 following his release from the club he took his first step into Non-league football by signing with newly promoted Conference National side Hyde F.C.Hyde. Jevons netted 15 goals in 35 appearances which aided Hyde's survival in the Conference but on 21 May 2013 he signed for Stockport County F.C.Stockport County who had suffered relegation at the expense of Hyde. In 2014 he announced his retirement to focus on his coaching career. He played his last ever professional match for Stockport County in a 3–1 over Harrogate Town in which he scored two goals.

Khalid Boulahrouz.name: Khalid Boulahrouz
Khalid Boulahrouz.intro:
'''Khalid Boulahrouz''' (; born 28 December 1981 in Maassluis) is a Dutch association footballfootballer who plays for Dutch Eredivisie club Feyenoord. His nickname is "The Cannibal" for his ability to "eat up" the opposition.  He is noted for his tackling and versatility at the back.
Prior to joining Feyenoord, Boulahrouz had played top-flight football in the Netherlands, Germany, England, Spain, Portugal and Denmark. A full international from  2004 to 2012, he earned 35 caps and was included in the Dutch squads for two World Cups and two European Championships.

Radek \u010cern\u00fd.name: Radek Černý
Radek \u010cern\u00fd.intro: '''Radek Černý''' (born 18 February 1974) is a Czech RepublicCzech former Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He played principally for SK Slavia PragueSlavia Prague in the Czech First League between its inception in 1993 and 2005, when he moved to England. Černý spent eight years in England with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers before returning to his former club Slavia in 2013, where he played one season before his retirement. Černý enjoyed a brief international career, making three appearances for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic between 2000 and 2002.

Franck Rolling.name: Franck Rolling
Franck Rolling.intro:
'''Franck Rolling''' (born August 23, 1968 in Colmar) is a FranceFrench former football (soccer)football Defender (football)defender.
Rolling began his career as an attacking player at RC Strasbourg, making his debut in a game against Sporting Club Toulon on October 15, 1988.[
After his release from Bournemouth, Rolling was briefly on the books of Gillingham F.C. and Wycombe Wanderers F.C., before leaving England to try his luck with SK Vorwärts Steyr of Austria (who went into bankruptcy during the season) and Veria F.C. of Greece. He returned to France in 2001 to play for Jura Sud Lavans, retiring the following year.

Marcus Hall.name: Marcus Hall
Marcus Hall.intro:
'''Marcus Thomas Jackson Hall''' (born 24 March 1976) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1994 until 2011.
He had two spells with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, playing in the Premier League in his first, as well as playing in the Football League for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town. He was also contracted to Southampton F.C.Southampton whilst a Premier League team but failed to make an appearances. During the 1996–97 campaign he was handed 8 England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 caps, scoring twice.

Theofanis Gekas.name: Theofanis Gekas
Theofanis Gekas.intro:
'''Theofanis "Fanis" Gekas''' (; born 23 May 1980) is a GreeksGreek Association footballfootballer who plays for Akhisar Belediyespor  in the Turkish Süper Lig, as a Forward (association football)striker.
He has been the top goalscorer of Superleague Greece and the Bundesliga in previous seasons. Most of his career has been spent in those two countries and Turkey, but he has also played top-flight football in England and Spain.
At international level, Gekas has represented Greece national football teamGreece at two UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships and two FIFA World CupWorld Cups. He was the top goalscorer of the 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)European section of 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification with ten goals. With 24 goals for his country, he is Greece's third highest all-time goalscorer.

Hidetoshi Nakata.intro:
