Nicky Butt.name: Nicky Butt
Nicky Butt.intro:
'''Nicholas "Nicky" Butt''' (born 21 January 1975) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball coach and former player who is currently the manager of the Manchester United F.C.Manchester United reserve team and co-owner of Salford City F.C.Salford City.
He played professional football as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1992 to 2011.
He began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and spent 12 years in their first-team before moving to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 2004. He spent one season on loan to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2005–06. He is also a former England national football teamEngland international; he won 39 Cap (sport)caps in a seven-year England career. He finished his career abroad, playing for South China AASouth China.

Tom\u00e1\u0161 \u0158epka.name: Tomáš Řepka
Tom\u00e1\u0161 \u0158epka.intro: '''Tomáš Řepka''' (born 2 January 1974) is a professional Czech RepublicCzech Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender. He last played for Hvozdnice (Prague-West District)SK Hvozdnice.

Bernard Allou.name: Bernard Allou
Bernard Allou.intro:
'''Bernard Allou''' (born 19 June 1975 in Cocody) is an Côte d'IvoireIvorian-born French Football (soccer)football player. He most notably played for Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain, Nagoya Grampus Eight and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
In 1997 he had a trial at Newcastle United but it didn't lead to a contract.cite web
url=
title=On The Move
publisher=The Independent

Youri Djorkaeff.name: Youri Djorkaeff
Youri Djorkaeff.intro: '''Youri Raffi Djorkaeff''' (born 9 March 1968) is a former List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who played as a strikerforward or as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder. With the France national football teamFrench national team, Djorkaeff won the 1998 FIFA World Cup and 2000 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000. He is the son of former player Jean Djorkaeff.

Craig Hignett.name: Craig Hignett
Craig Hignett.intro: '''Craig Hignett''' (born 12 January 1970), is an English former professional Association footballfootballer. He started his career as a Forward (association football)striker but later moved into midfieldermidfield.

Dean Richards.name: Dean Richards
Dean Richards.intro:
'''Dean Ivor Richards''' (9 June 1974 – 26 February 2011) was an English association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (football)defender. He began his career at hometown club Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City before a four-year stay with Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. He left to play Premier League football with Southampton F.C.Southampton and finally Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He also made four appearances for England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s.
Richards retired from playing in 2005 due to health concerns, but later returned to the game as a coach at Bradford. He died six years later at the age of 36.

Salva Ballesta.name: Salva Ballesta
Salva Ballesta.intro:
'''Salvador Ballesta Vialcho''', commonly known as '''Salva''' (born 22 May 1975), is a Spanish former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker, and the current manager of Atlético Malagueño.
A goalscorer noted for his flair and workrate, he played for seven different top division Football clubclubs, most notably Atlético Madrid, Valencia CFValencia – with whom he won his sole team trophy – and Málaga CFMálaga.
Over the course of 11 La Liga seasons Salva amassed totals of 235 games and 87 goals, adding 126/52 in Segunda División.

Andy Webster.name: Andy Webster
Andy Webster.intro:
'''Andrew Neil "Andy" Webster''' (born 23 April 1982 in Dundee, Scotland) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He has previously played for Arbroath F.C.Arbroath, Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian (two spells), Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Dundee United F.C.Dundee United. Webster has represented Scotland national football teamScotland since 2003.
Webster is also known for the transfer saga in which he invoked updated FIFA transfer regulations to leave Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian, a move which has been compared to the landmark Bosman ruling and is now known as the Webster ruling.
Andy Webster.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Eric Young (footballer, born 1960).name: Eric Young (footballer, born 1960)
Eric Young (footballer, born 1960).intro:
'''Eric Young''' (born 25 March 1960 in Singapore) is a retired footballer, who was a strong, commanding centre half nicknamed "Ninja" due to his ever-present brown headband.
Young started his career at non-league Southall and then moved to Slough Town where his commanding style was noticed by a number of league clubs; he played for Slough for 3 seasons (Slough Town also produced the former Chelsea centre half Micky Droy). Young was eventually signed by Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in 1982. During the period in non-league football Young continued with his accountancy training. He made his league debut in the first match of the 1982–83 in English football1982–83 season and went on to make 126 appearances for the club, scoring 10 goals before transferring to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon for £70,000 on the eve of the 1987–88 in English football1987–88 season.
He became a firm favourite at Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon and had a formidable central defensive partnership with Andy Thorn (footballer)Andy Thorn, playing in their famous victory over Liverpool in the 1988 FA Cup Final. After 99 appearances and 9 goals for the club he was sold to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace for £850,000 (at the time a huge fee for a 30-year-old). At Palace he played some of the best football of his career, and resumed the Thorn/Young defensive partnership that had been so successful with Wimbledon. Eric was a mainstay in the team that finished third in the old first division (now the FA Premier LeaguePremiership) and kept his place in the side until a public fall out with manager Alan Smith (manager)Alan Smith at the beginning of the ill fated 1994–95 in English football1994–95 season that saw him dropped until the final five matches of that campaign.
After 161 appearances and 15 goals for Palace he then joined Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, on a free transfer. He spent two seasons at Wolves before completing his professional career, briefly returning to Palace in 1997 without playing a senior game, but continued to play non-league football for another four seasons before finally hanging up his boots at the age of 41 at Egham Town.
He is now working as an accountant in a construction based company in Heathrow.

Quinton Fortune.name: Quinton Fortune
Quinton Fortune.intro: '''Quinton Fortune''' (born 21 May 1977) is a South African former association footballfootballer who has represented a number of European clubs including Manchester United, Atletico Madrid and Bolton Wanderers. Fortune has earned 46 caps for South Africa national football teamSouth Africa, including playing in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 and the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cups. He most recently played for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, but failed to earn an extension to his contract when it expired in January 2010.

Tamir Cohen.name: Tamir Cohen
Tamir Cohen.intro: '''Tamir Cohen''' (; born 4 March 1984 in Tel Aviv) is an Israeli JewsIsraeli Association footballfootball midfielder who plays for Hapoel Ra'anana A.F.C.Hapoel Ra'anana. He is the son of the late Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.Maccabi Tel Aviv and Rangers player Avi Cohen.

Thomas Helmer.name: Thomas Helmer
Thomas Helmer.intro:
'''Thomas Helmer''' (born 21 April 1965 in Herford, West Germany) is a former German Association footballfootballer.
His preferred playing position was Defender (association football)#Sweeper (libero)sweeper, but he was primarily deployed as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.Radnedge, Keir ''The Ultimate Encyclopedia of European Football'' (1997, Carlton Books) 153–154
Helmer spent most of his club career with Borussia Dortmund and FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich – appearing in nearly 400 Bundesliga games in 15 seasons – and won the UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship in UEFA Euro 19961996.
Thomas Helmer.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back,Midfielder Defensive midfielder defensive midfielder,Defender  association football  Sweeper  libero  sweeper

Russell Martin.name: Russell Martin
Russell Martin.intro:
'''Russell Kenneth Alexander Martin''' (born 4 January 1986) is a professional Association footballfootballer who is the captain of Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and plays for the Scotland national football teamScotland national team. He is a Football (soccer) positionsright-back but can also play as a central defender.
Starting his career with Brighton and Hove Albion F.C.Brighton, for whom he did not feature in a league match, Martin established himself at Wycombe Wanderers, for whom he made over 100 appearances. Following a brief spell with Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough, Martin joined Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in time to play an important part in the team's rise to the Premier League.

Nick Chadwick.name: Nick Chadwick
Nick Chadwick.intro:
'''Nicholas Gerald "Nick" Chadwick''' (born 26 October 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who most recently played for Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, where he played as a Forward (association football)forward.
Chadwick played in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton and has also played in the Football League for Derby County F.C.Derby County, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United and Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town.

Alec Chamberlain.name: Alec Chamberlain
Alec Chamberlain.intro: '''Alec Francis Roy Chamberlain''' (born 20 June 1964) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a  Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is currently employed by Watford F.C.Watford as the club's goalkeeping coach. He made 788 league appearances during his 25-year playing career, the final 11 years and 247 appearances of which were with Watford.

St\u00e9phane Henchoz.name: Stéphane Henchoz
St\u00e9phane Henchoz.intro: '''Stéphane Henchoz''' (; born 7 September 1974 in Billens-HennensBillens) is a former Switzerland national football teamSwiss international Association footballfootballer   who played as a Defender (association football)defender, most notably for the English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. He was Cap (sport)capped 72 times and played for his country from his debut in 1993, and played at UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996 and UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004.

Luis Su\u00e1rez.name: Luis Suárez
Luis Su\u00e1rez.intro:
'''Luis Alberto Suárez Díaz''' (; born 24 January 1987) is a Uruguayan professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club FC Barcelona and the Uruguay national football teamUruguayan national team as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
In July 2014, Suárez moved to Barcelona for a fee reported by the English press in the region of £75 million (€94 million), while Barcelona claim a fee of £65 million (€81 million), making him the List of most expensive association football transfersthird most expensive player in football history. He is widely regarded as one of the best strikers in the world.[
Suárez began his career as a youth player for Club Nacional de FootballNacional in 2003. He signed for FC GroningenGroningen in the Eredivisie in 2006 and transferred to AFC AjaxAjax in 2007. In 2008–09 AFC Ajax season2008–09 he was named List of AFC Ajax records#AFC Ajax prize winnersAjax Player of the Year. The 2009–10 AFC Ajax seasonfollowing year, he was made the Captain (association football)club captain, helping Ajax win the 2009–10 KNVB CupKNVB Cup while becoming the league's top scorer with 35 goals in 33 games. He was also named Dutch Footballer of the Year and scored 49 goals in all competitions. In the 2010–11 AFC Ajax season2010–11 season, he scored his List of AFC Ajax records and statistics#All-time topscorersone hundredth Ajax goal, joining a group of players including Johan Cruyff, Marco van Basten and Dennis Bergkamp in doing so.
In January 2011, Suárez transferred to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for €26.5 million (Pound sterling£22.8 million). In February 2012, Suárez won the 2011–12 Football League CupFootball League Cup with the club. In April 2014, he won the PFA Players' Player of the Year award, becoming the first non-European to win the award, and the FWA Footballer of the Year. As the Premier League's top scorer with 31 goals he won the Premier League Golden Boot, and shared the European Golden Shoe with Cristiano Ronaldo.
Suárez represented Uruguay national under-20 football teamUruguay in the 2007 U-20 World Cup. In the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup, he played an important role in Uruguay's fourth place finish and scored three goals, and blocked an extra time goalbound header with his hands during the quarter finals against Ghana national football teamGhana. At the 2011 Copa América, Suárez scored four goals for Uruguay as they won a record Copa América#Resultsfifteenth Copa América and was named Copa América#Copa América player of the tournamentPlayer of the Tournament. On 23 June 2013, he became Uruguay's all-time record goalscorer with 35 goals. At the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup, he scored his 40th goal.
Luis Suárez controversiesSuárez has been the source of much controversy throughout his career. As well as his 2010 World Cup goal-line handball, he has also bitten three opponents, the latest being Italian defender Giorgio Chiellini at the 2014 World Cup, has been widely accused of and admitted to Diving (association football)diving, and Luis Suárez racial abuse incidentwas found guilty by the FA of racially abusing Patrice Evra, a decision Suárez disputes.

(football)Galatasaray, Melbourne Victory FCMelbourne Victory, Al-Gharafa Sports ClubAl-Gharafa and Melbourne City FCMelbourne Heart. Internationally he has received 58 Cap (sport)caps, and scored 17 goals, while playing for the Australia national soccer teamAustralian national team. Kewell has represented Australia at the 1995 FIFA U-17 World Championship, the 1997 FIFA Confederations Cup, where Australia finished runners-up, the 2004 OFC Nations Cup, which Australia claimed for the fourth time, the 2006 FIFA World Cup, the 2007 AFC Asian Cup, the 2010 FIFA World Cup and the at the 2011 AFC Asian Cup, where Australia finished runners-up.

Gary Croft.name: Gary Croft
Gary Croft.intro:
'''Gary Croft''' (born 17 February 1974) is an English actor and former professional association footballfootballer who played as a left back from 1992 until 2008.
He notably played for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, having also had spells with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City. He is most famous nationwide for being the first footballer to play whilst wearing an electronic taggingelectronic tag, when playing for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
Croft made his England under-21s debut against Brazil under-21s on 6 June 1995, David Beckham also made his debut in the same match.[

Adam Drury.name: Adam Drury
Adam Drury.intro: '''Adam James Drury'''  (born 29 August 1978, in Cottenham, England) is a former professional association footballfootballer who last played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United as a left back. Drury is best known for his eleven-year spell at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, where he captained the club, and is a member of their List of Norwich City F.C. Hall of Fame membersHall of Fame.

Gary Pallister.name: Gary Pallister
Gary Pallister.intro:
'''Gary Andrew Pallister'''  (born 30 June 1965) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, sports television pundit and operations director of Conference National side Darlington F.C.Darlington.
As a player, he was a defender (association football)defender from 1984 to 2001 and is most noted for his nine-year spell at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United from 1989 until 1998. He also played for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Darlington F.C.Darlington and was cap (sport)capped 22 times by England between 1988 and 1996.
Gary Pallister.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Danny Higginbotham.name: Danny Higginbotham
Danny Higginbotham.intro:
'''Daniel John "Danny" Higginbotham''' (born 29 December 1978) is a former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender.
Born in Manchester, Higginbotham started his career at his local side Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He made seven appearances at Old Trafford as well as a loan spell with Belgium side Royal Antwerp FCRoyal Antwerp before joining Derby County F.C.Derby County in order to play more matches. He spent three years at the "Rams" but handed in a transfer request when the club was relegated from the Premiership. Southampton F.C.Southampton moved to sign Higginbotham for £1.5 million in February 2003, and he help the Southern EnglandSouth Coast side reach the 2003 FA Cup Final. When Southampton were relegated in 2005, Higginbotham rejected a new contact and was placed on the transfer list.
He joined fellow Championship side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for £225,000 in August 2006. He was made captain when Michael Duberry left in January 2007 and Stoke went on to narrowly missed out on a play-off place. With Stoke not being promoted Higginbotham again decided to hand in a transfer request to help force through a move to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He spent one season at the Stadium of Light before returning to Stoke in 2008. He became a vital member of Tony Pulis' squad as Stoke established themselves in the Premier League. He scored the winning goal in the FA Cup quarter final against West Ham United F.C.West Ham United but injury meant he missed out on both the semi-final and the 2011 FA Cup Finalfinal. After his recovery he struggled to force his way back into the side and spent time out on loan to Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town before joining Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United on a free transfer in January 2013. After spending eight months at Bramall Lane he left to join Conference side Chester F.C.Chester before ending his career with a short spell at Altrincham F.C.Altrincham.
Born in England, Higginbotham made his international debut for the Gibraltar national football team in a friendly against Slovakia national football teamSlovakia in November 2013 at the age of 34, qualifying through his maternal grandmother. In January 2014, Higginbotham retired from club football after a long career, but made two more international appearances for Gibraltar until his international retirement in March 2014.

Jermain Defoe.name: Jermain Defoe
Jermain Defoe.intro:
'''Jermain Colin Defoe''' (born 7 October 1982) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.
Defoe began his career with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, joining their youth team at age fourteen, before moving to West Ham United F.C.West Ham United aged sixteen and rising through the ranks. He made his professional debut for West Ham in 2000, and after a season-long loan spell at A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth during the 2000–01 season, established himself in the West Ham line-up. After West Ham's relegation in 2003, a move to Tottenham in January 2004 soon followed, where Defoe played for 4 years before being sold to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in January 2008. He spent one season at Fratton Park before returning to Tottenham in the January 2009 transfer window. He played for Toronto FC of Major League Soccer in 2014, before returning to England in January 2015 to sign for Sunderland.
In April 2011, Defoe became the 20th player to score a List of Premier League players with 100 or more goalscentury of Premier League goals, and is currently the 14th highest goalscorer in Premier League history.[
Defoe made his England debut in 2004 and has made 55 appearances, scoring 19 goals, including three appearances and a goal at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Ysrael Z\u00fa\u00f1iga.name: Ysrael Zúñiga
Ysrael Z\u00fa\u00f1iga.intro: '''Herlyn Ysrael Zúñiga Yáñez''' (born August 27, 1976) is a Peruvian peoplePeruvian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for FBC Melgar as a striker in the Peruvian First Division.

Franz Carr.name: Franz Carr
Franz Carr.intro:
'''Franz Carr''' (born 24 September 1966 in Preston, LancashirePreston) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (soccer)Winger from 1984 until 2000, notably for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, as well as playing in the Premier League for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.
He also played in the Football League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He also had spells in Italy with A.C. ReggianaReggiana before finishing his career in the United States with Pittsburgh Riverhounds.
Franz Carr.position: Forward  association football  Forward,Winger  soccer  Winger

Ricardo Rocha (Portuguese footballer).name: Ricardo Rocha (Portuguese footballer)
Ricardo Rocha (Portuguese footballer).intro:
'''Ricardo Sérgio Rocha Azevedo''' (born 3 October 1978), known as '''Ricardo Rocha''', is a Portuguese former Association footballfootballer who played mainly as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
After starting out professionally with S.C. BragaBraga he signed for S.L. BenficaBenfica in late 2001, going on to appear in 157 official games with the latter club. He spent the vast majority of his remaining career in England, with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, competing in three Premier League seasons overall.

Brett Emerton.name: Brett Emerton
Brett Emerton.intro: '''Brett Michael Emerton''' (born 22 February 1979) is a retired Australian professional Association footballfootballer who played for Sydney FC, Feyenoord Rotterdam, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and the Australia national association football teamAustralian national team. He is the third most capped player for Australia. Able to play as a wide midfielder or defender, Emerton was known for his "speed, ball control and creativity."

Daniel Sturridge.name: Daniel Sturridge
Daniel Sturridge.intro:
'''Daniel Andre Sturridge'''  (born 1 September 1989) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Forward (association football)striker.
Born in Birmingham, Sturridge spent four years in the Aston Villa Under-21s and AcademyAston Villa academy before moving to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He then signed for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2003. He continued his development at City and played in two FA Youth Cup finals. He made his first team debut in the 2007–08 Premier League2007–08 season, becoming the only player ever to score in the FA Youth Cup, FA Cup and Premier League in the same season. He left City in 2009 and signed for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, where he was loaned out to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers for the second half of the 2010–11 Premier League2010–11 season. After a successful spell at Bolton, scoring eight goals in 12 appearances, he returned to Chelsea for the 2011–12 Premier League2011–12 season. He left Chelsea to join Liverpool in January 2013.
Sturridge has represented England at all levels. He made 15 appearances and scored four goals for the England national under-21 football teamUnder-21 team. He made his debut for England against Sweden national football teamSweden on 15 November 2011 and was selected for the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Bernard Diom\u00e8de.name: Bernard Diomède
Bernard Diom\u00e8de.intro: '''Bernard Diomède''' (born 23 January 1974 in Saint-Doulchard) is a retired  Football in FranceFrench footballer of Guadeloupean descent. He played as a winger and won the FIFA World CupWorld Cup with France national football teamFrance in 1998 FIFA World Cup1998.

Matteo Ferrari.name: Matteo Ferrari
Matteo Ferrari.intro:
'''Matteo Ferrari''' (born 5 December 1979) is an Italian Association footballfootballer, who last played as a Defender (association football)defender for the Montreal Impact in Major League Soccer. He has also played top-flight football for several Italian clubs in Serie A, and Everton FCEverton of the Premier League; he is usually deployed as a centre back, although he is capable of playing anywhere along the back-line.
Ferrari played for Italy national football teamItaly at the Olympics in 2000 and 2004, winning Bronze at the latter. He also played 11 full internationals for his country, from 2002 to 2004, featuring in the squad for Euro 2004.
Matteo Ferrari.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Grant McCann.name: Grant McCann
Grant McCann.intro: '''Grant Samuel McCann''' (born 15 April 1980) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former international Association footballfootballer and current football coach at Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United. Born in Belfast, McCann played in the Lisburn Distillery F.C.Lisburn Distillery youth system from 1995 until signing for the West Ham United F.C.West Ham United The Academy of FootballAcademy of Football in 1996, where he started his professional career. He made his debut on 19 May 2001 in a 2–1 away defeat to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. McCann also won 39 caps for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland after making his senior debut against Malta in 2001, with the last of his 39 caps won in a 6–0 friendly defeat against the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands in June 2012.

Alex Bruce (footballer, born 1984).name: Alex Bruce (footballer, born 1984)
Alex Bruce (footballer, born 1984).intro:
'''Alex Stephen Bruce''' (born 28 September 1984) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a Defender (association football)defender. He has also played as a holding midfielder on occasion.
He is the son of Hull City manager and former Manchester United F.C.Manchester United defender Steve Bruce. Born in England, Bruce has played for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level. In June 2011, the then Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland manager, Nigel Worthington confirmed he had held talks with Bruce about changing his international allegiance, and he made his Northern Ireland debut in 2013.

Jostein Flo.name: Jostein Flo
Jostein Flo.intro: '''Jostein Flo''' (born 3 October 1964 in Flo, NorwayFlo, Stryn, Norway) is a NorwayNorwegian former football player, famous for his physical playing style and aerial dominance. He is currently Director of Football in Strømsgodset IFStrømsgodset.

Tomasz Radzinski.name: Tomasz Radzinski
Tomasz Radzinski.intro: '''Tomasz Radzinski''' (born 14 December 1973) is a retired PolandPolish-CanadaCanadian association footballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker and Forward (association football)#Wingerwinger.

Dexter Blackstock.name: Dexter Blackstock
Dexter Blackstock.intro:
'''Dexter Anthony Titus Blackstock''' (born 20 May 1986) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He has previously played for Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Leeds United, Derby County F.C.Derby County and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.
Having represented England at youth international level, Blackstock went on to play for the Antigua and Barbuda national football teamAntigua and Barbuda national team; he qualified through his grandfather, who was born in Antigua.

Darren Ferguson.name: Darren Ferguson
Darren Ferguson.intro:
'''Darren Ferguson''' (born 9 February 1972) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootball Manager (association football)manager and former player, who was most recently the manager of Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United. Between his first and second stints with Peterborough, he also managed Preston North End F.C.Preston North End.
As a player, Ferguson was managed at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United by his father Alex Ferguson, but spent most of his playing career at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Wrexham F.C.Wrexham in the lower divisions of English football.
Ferguson's first managerial appointment was as player-manager of Football League TwoLeague Two Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United in January 2007. After two successive promotions, and guiding the club to the English football league systemsecond-tier of English football for the first time in 17 seasons, Ferguson was relieved of his duties on 9 November 2009, with Peterborough United at the foot of Football League ChampionshipThe Championship.
Ferguson was appointed Preston North End F.C.Preston North End manager on 6 January 2010. He was dismissed on 29 December 2010 after a string of poor results. On 12 January 2011, he was again appointed as the manager of Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, where he took the club to the 2011 Football League One play-off FinalLeague One play-off finals at Old Trafford, and in this match won promotion to the Football League Championship, the club's third promotion in four years, with a 3–0 victory over Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield.
Peterborough United spent two seasons in the Championship after winning promotion. On 4 May 2013, Ferguson's side were relegated to League One after losing to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace 3–2 on the final match of the season.

Richard Witschge.name: Richard Witschge
Richard Witschge.intro:
'''Richard Peter Witschge''' (; born 20 September 1969) is a Dutch retired Association footballfootballer who is Midfielderleft footed and played as a Midfielder#Defensivedefensive midfielder. He is known for his technique and passing ability.
In an 18-year professional career he played mainly for AFC AjaxAjax, but also represented, amongst other teams, FC BarcelonaBarcelona. His older brother, Rob WitschgeRob, was also a footballer. Witschge represented  Netherlands national football teamHolland in 1990 FIFA World Cupone FIFA World CupWorld Cup and UEFA Euro 1996one UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championship.
He is currently a coach within the Ajax youth system.

Jeff Smith (footballer, born 1980).name: Jeff Smith (footballer, born 1980)
Jeff Smith (footballer, born 1980).intro:
'''Jeffrey''' "'''Jeff'''" '''Smith''' (born 28 June 1980) is an English former Association footballfootball midfielder.
He started his career with Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United in 1998, but a year he later moved on to Barrow A.F.C.Barrow, and shortly after Bishop Auckland F.C.Bishop Auckland. After two years at Bishop Auckland, he was signed by Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Rarely used by Bolton, he was instead loaned out to Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, and Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, before he signed permanently with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 2004. A regular in the first team at Vale, he left after three years to sign with Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United. In 2009 he joined Darlington F.C.Darlington, but only spent one season at the club. In August 2010 he moved to Belgium to play one season with R.O.C. de Charleroi-Marchienne, before he returned to England with Whitby Town F.C.Whitby Town a year later. In July 2012, he joined Celtic Nation F.C.Celtic Nation.

Arnar Gunnlaugsson.name: Arnar Gunnlaugsson
Arnar Gunnlaugsson.intro: '''Arnar Bergmann Gunnlaugsson''' (born 3 March 1973) is an Icelandic former professional Association footballfootballer. His position is Forward (association football)#Centre forwardforward. His twin brother is Bjarki Gunnlaugsson.
Arnar Gunnlaugsson.position: Winger  sport  Winger,Forward  association football  Forward

Ade Akinbiyi.name: Ade Akinbiyi
Ade Akinbiyi.intro:
'''Adeola Oluwatoyin "Ade" Akinbiyi''' (born 10 October 1974) is a Association footballfootballer who is currently a player-coach at Colwyn Bay F.C.Colwyn Bay.
Akinbiyi has had a much-travelled career with many different clubs with transfer fees totalling more than £11.5 million during his career, including being Leicester City F.C.Leicester City's record signing (at £5.3 million).
Born in England, Akinbiyi qualifies to play for the Nigeria national football team through his parents, and earned one cap (sport)cap for Nigeria.

Andrew Crofts.name: Andrew Crofts
Andrew Crofts.intro:
'''Andrew Lawrence Crofts''' (born 29 May 1984) is a Wales national football teamWales international association footballfootballer who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion.
He started his career with Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, for whom he made his The Football LeagueFootball League debut at the age of 16, and made over 190 appearances for the Kent-based club. He had loan (association football)loans at Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United and Wrexham F.C.Wrexham during the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season and joined Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in 2009. After a successful season at Brighton he transferred to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 2010, before moving back to the South Coast club in 2012.
A tough-tackling midfielder, Crofts represented Wales, where one of his grandparents was born, at under-19 and under-21 level and won his first senior cap (sport)cap in 2005. In 2008 he won his 12th cap, breaking the record for the most international caps received by a Gillingham F.C.Gillingham player.

Brett Ormerod.name: Brett Ormerod
Brett Ormerod.intro: '''Brett Ryan Ormerod''' (born 18 October 1976) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Padiham F.C.Padiham.

Patrik Berger.name: Patrik Berger
Patrik Berger.intro:
'''Patrik Berger''' (; born 10 November 1973) is a retired Czech RepublicCzech Association footballfootballer. He started his career in his own country with SK Slavia PragueSlavia Prague and spent a season in Germany playing for Borussia Dortmund. He moved to England in 1996, where he spent seven years with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, winning six trophies in his time there. This was followed by spells at Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. He spent the last two years of his career back in his native Czech Republic playing for AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague.
Internationally, Berger played in two major tournaments for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic. He played an important part in his nation's UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996 campaign, scoring in the final as the Czech Republic finished runners-up to Germany. He took a 17-month break from the national team between 1997 and 1998 after a dispute with manager Dušan Uhrin, returning to the setup following Uhrin's departure from the post. His second and final major tournament was UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000, but due to suspension and his country's early exit, he only played one game. He retired from the national team in 2002 at the age of 28 with a total of 44 senior international caps and 18 goals.
Capable of occupying midfield and forward positions, Berger became noted for his powerful strikes, surging runs, and strong left foot. Berger was beset with injuries throughout his career and received specialist treatment in the United States. He retired on 6 January 2010 due to knee injuries.
Patrik Berger.position: Midfielder Winger Left winger,Midfielder Attacking midfielder Attacking midfielder

H\u00e9rita Ilunga.name: Hérita Ilunga
H\u00e9rita Ilunga.intro: '''Hérita N'Kongolo Ilunga''' (born 25 February 1982 in Kinshasa) is a Democratic Republic of the CongoCongolese association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back. He currently plays for the French club US Creteil.  He has played previously for RCD Espanyol BEspanyol B, AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne, Toulouse F.C.Toulouse, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Stade Rennais FCRennes. He has also played international football for Congo DR national football teamCongo DR.
H\u00e9rita Ilunga.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Robbie Mustoe.name: Robbie Mustoe
Robbie Mustoe.intro:
'''Robin "Robbie" Mustoe''' (born 28 August 1968) is a retired English association footballfootballer who now works as a commentator for NBC Sports. He made nearly 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League, playing as a midfielder for Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, where he spent the majority of his career, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.
Mustoe was born in Witney, Oxfordshire.

Christian Kalvenes.name: Christian Kalvenes
Christian Kalvenes.intro: '''Christian Kalvenes''' (born 8 March 1977) is a NorwayNorwegian former association footballfootballer. He was first and foremost acknowledged for his strength and his heading abilities.

Scott Jones (English footballer).name: Scott Jones (English footballer)
Scott Jones (English footballer).intro:
'''Scott Jones''' (born 1 May 1975 in Sheffield) is a retired EnglandEnglish football defender.  He is perhaps most remembered for when he scored a brace as Barnsley defeated Manchester United in the 1997–98 FA Cup1998 FA Cup 5th round replay.cite web url=
publisher=BBCdate=26 February 1998 accessdate=19 December 2010 He later went on to play for Mansfield Town, Notts County, Bristol Rovers and York City, where he scored once against Swansea City.

Conor Sammon.name: Conor Sammon
Conor Sammon.intro:
'''Conor Sammon''' (born 6 November 1986) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United on loan from Derby County F.C.Derby County as a Forward (association football)striker.
Sammon started his professional career at League of Ireland Premier Division side University College Dublin A.F.C.University College Dublin. In 2008 he signed for Derry City F.C.Derry City and one season later he moved to Scottish Premier League club Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock. In January 2011, English Premier League side Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic signed him for £600,000. In August 2012, he moved to Derby County for £1.2 million. In February 2013, whilst at Derby, Sammon was capped by the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland for the first time.

Alex Manninger.name: Alex Manninger
Alex Manninger.intro: '''Alexander "Alex" Manninger''' (born 4 June 1977) is an Austrian professional Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper for FC Augsburg. He played internationally for Austria on 33 occasions, including at Euro 2008, and has represented top division sides in Italy, Germany, Austria and England.

Frank Lampard.name: Frank Lampard
Frank Lampard.intro:
'''Frank James Lampard''' (born 20 June 1978) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a central midfielder, attacking midfielder or defensive midfielder for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
Lampard began his career at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, for whom his father Frank Lampard, Sr. had also played. He secured a place in the first team by the 1997–98 season, and the following year helped the team finish 5th in the Premier League, their highest-ever Premier League placing. In 2001, he moved to rival London club Chelsea for £11 million. In 2014, he was released by Chelsea after 13 years of service. Lampard then joined New York City FC on a two-year deal, in preparation for the club's Major League Soccer debut in 2015, as a free transfer, being  loaned out to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in the meantime. On 31 December 2014, however, BBC Sport's David Ornstein revealed Lampard is under contract to Manchester City and not New York City as previously claimed by both clubs.
From his début, he was ever-present in the Chelsea first team and made 164 consecutive Premier League appearances, a record for an outfield player. He established himself as a prolific scorer at the west London club and was a key part of the sides which won back-to-back Premier League titles in 2004–05 FA Premier League2004–05 and 2005–06 FA Premier League2005–06 and a Double (association football)#FA Cup and League Cup Doubledomestic cup double in 2007. He signed a new contract in 2008, becoming the highest-paid Premier League footballer at that time, and scored in his first 2008 UEFA Champions League FinalChampions League Final that year. He won a second FA Cup winners' medal in 2009 FA Cup Final2009, scoring the winning goal in the final. In the 2009–10 season, Lampard helped Chelsea secure their first league and FA Cup Double (association football)Double, and also had his most prolific season with the club, scoring 22 league goals and 17 league assists.2009–10 Premier League In 2012, Lampard captained Chelsea to their first 2012 UEFA Champions League FinalUEFA Champions League success and a year later to their first 2013 UEFA Europa League FinalUEFA Europa League title. He was released by the club after the 2013–14 Premier League2013–14 season.
A three-time Chelsea Player of the Year,[
Internationally, Lampard was List of footballers with 100 or more capscapped 106 times by England since his debut in October 1999, and  scored 29 international goals. He was voted England Player of the Year for two consecutive years in England Player of the Year2004 and England Player of the Year2005. He played in UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004, where he was named in the team of the tournament after scoring three goals in four games. He was top scorer for England national football teamEngland in their 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup qualifying campaign with five goals, and played at three World Cups. He is England national football teamEngland's most prolific penalty taker with nine goals, surpassing the previous record holders, Ron Flowers and Alan Shearer.

Kaba Diawara.name: Kaba Diawara
Kaba Diawara.intro: '''Kaba Diawara''' (born 16 December 1975 in Toulon) is a retired French-born Guinean footballer.

Maya Yoshida.name: Maya Yoshida
Maya Yoshida.intro: is a Japanese football (soccer)football player who plays as a centre back for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton and the Japan national football team.

Mark Platts.name: Mark Platts
Mark Platts.intro:
'''Mark Platts''' (born 23 May 1979) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder. He represented England national football teamEngland as a schoolboy.
Platts began his career as a trainee with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, making his league debut, while still a trainee, on 10 February 1996 as a late substitute for Chris Waddle in Wednesday's 2-1 win against Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon. At the time this made him the youngest ever outfield player to appear for Wednesday, and the third youngest in all behind goalkeepers Peter Fox (footballer)Peter Fox and Gary Scothern. Two weeks later he came on in the second half for Lee Briscoe in the 1-0 defeat away to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
He turned professional on 16 October 1996, but failed to appear in the Wednesday first team whilst a professional. He joined Torquay United F.C.Torquay United in March 1999, making his Torquay debut in a goalless draw away to local rivals Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle on 8 March. He played 41 first team games for Torquay, but became increasingly homesick and was released by Torquay in October 2000, when he joined Worksop Town F.C.Worksop Town and played alongside Chris Waddle again.

Rafik Halliche.name: Rafik Halliche
Rafik Halliche.intro:
'''Rafik Halliche''' (; born 2 September 1986) is an Algerian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Qatar SC as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He started playing in 2005 with NA Hussein DeyHussein Dey, going on to spend the vast majority of his career in Portugal.
An Algeria national football teamAlgerian international since 2008, Halliche represented the nation in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and three Africa Cup of Nations tournaments.
Rafik Halliche.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Carl Hoefkens.name: Carl Hoefkens
Carl Hoefkens.intro: '''Carl Hoefkens''' (; born 6 October 1978) is a Belgian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for K.V. OostendeOostende.

Andy Cole.name: Andy Cole
Andy Cole.intro:
'''Andrew Alexander''' "'''Andy'''" '''Cole''' (born 15 October 1971 in Nottingham, Nottinghamshire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer. He was almost universally known as Andy Cole in the 1990s; in 2000, he allegedly asked to be known as Andrew Cole.
As a player, he was a striker (association football)striker from 1988 to 2008. He is most notably remembered for his time in the Premier League, with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, where he spent six years of his career and winning numerous trophies in the process. He also played in the top division of English football for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, as well as in the Football League for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
A former England international, Cole is the second-highest goalscorer in Premier League history; in his career, Cole has scored a total of 187 Premier League goals, placing him behind Alan Shearer who has 260 goals. Cole has the distinction of being one of the few players in England to have swept all possible honours in the English game, including the PFA Young Player of the Year award, as well as the coveted UEFA Champions League title. Cole was also cap (football)capped fifteen times for England between 1995 and 2001, scoring once, against Albania in a World Cup Qualifier.

Simon Mignolet.name: Simon Mignolet
Simon Mignolet.intro:
'''Simon Luc Hildebert Mignolet''' (; born 6 March 1988) is a Belgian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Mignolet started his career with Belgian Second Division side K. Sint-Truidense V.V.Sint-Truiden in 2004, and spent six years with the club, making 100 senior league appearances. He moved to Premier League side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in June 2010[
Mignolet has also represented the Belgium national football teamBelgian national football team at every level from the Under 16s upwards. He made his full international debut in 2011, and has since gone on to make fourteen further appearances for his national side.

Federico Bessone.name: Federico Bessone
Federico Bessone.intro: '''Federico Bessone Luna''', also known as '''Fede Bessone''' (born 23 January 1984) is an Argentine professional association footballfootballer who is currently a free agent.
Federico Bessone.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Antonio Valencia.name: Antonio Valencia
Antonio Valencia.intro:
'''Luis Antonio Valencia Mosquera''', commonly known as '''Antonio Valencia''' (; born 4 August 1985), is an Ecuadorian association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Ecuador national football teamEcuadorian national team.
After progressing through the youth system at Club Deportivo El NacionalEl Nacional, Valencia became a first team regular and made over 80 appearances for the club before signing for La Liga side Villarreal CF in 2005. He only made two league appearances for the Spanish side in between successful loan spells at Recreativo de Huelva for the 2005–06 La Liga2005–06 season and later English Premier League club Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic from 2006 to 2008. Wigan later signed Valencia on a three-year deal for an undisclosed fee in January 2008. His performances for Wigan soon attracted attention from several high profile clubs, eventually signing for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in June 2009. Valencia has since won the 2009–10 Football League Cup, the 2010 FA Community Shield, the 2010–11 Premier League and the 2012–13 Premier League during his time at Manchester United, along with being voted into PFA Team of the Year in his PFA Team of the Year#Premier League 18debut season.
Valencia made his Ecuador debut in 2005 and scored two goals in the process. He represented his country at the 2006 FIFA World Cup, the 2007 Copa América, the 2011 Copa América and the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Since making his debut, Valencia has won 72 caps and scored eight goals for his country.

Danny Murphy (footballer, born 1977).name: Danny Murphy (footballer, born 1977)
Danny Murphy (footballer, born 1977).intro:
'''Daniel Ben "Danny" Murphy''' (born 18 March 1977) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Having begun his career at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra in 1993, he moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 1997, where he won a treble of the 2001 Football League Cup FinalLeague Cup, 2001 FA Cup FinalFA Cup and 2001 UEFA Cup FinalUEFA Cup in 2001. After brief spells at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur he joined Fulham F.C.Fulham, whom he helped reach the 2010 UEFA Europa League Final, and ended his career at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He served as Captain (association football)captain at his last two clubs.
Murphy made nine appearances for the England national football teamEngland team from his debut in 2001, scoring once. Since retiring, he has been a regular analyst on the BBC programme ''Match of the Day''.

Ceri Hughes.name: Ceri Hughes
Ceri Hughes.intro:
'''Ceri Hughes''' (born 26 February 1971 in Pontypridd, Wales) is a former WalesWelsh Association footballfootball Midfielder (football)midfielder. His clubs included Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, for which he played for 8 years, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon (where he scored once against Barnsley F.C.Barnsley),cite web
url=
title=Kinnear `disgusted' by fans
publisher=The Independent
date=24 September 1997 accessdate=4 September 2012 Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth (where he scored on his debut against Stockport County)cite web
url=
title=Stockport 1 Portsmouth 1
publisher=Sporting Life
date=22 January 2000 accessdate=4 September 2012 and, lastly, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City where he made no first team appearances. He won 8 caps for the Wales national football teamWelsh national team, without scoring.

Will Hoskins.name: Will Hoskins
Will Hoskins.intro: '''William Richard "Will" Hoskins''' (born 6 May 1986) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Oxford United F.C.Oxford United. He came through the youth scheme at Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and has represented England national football teamEngland at many levels up to under-20.

Gordon Watson (footballer, born 1971).name: Gordon Watson (footballer, born 1971)
Gordon Watson (footballer, born 1971).intro:
'''Gordon Watson''' (born 20 March 1971) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward.
He played for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth and Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, making over 200 appearances in the Football League.

Anthony Pilkington.name: Anthony Pilkington
Anthony Pilkington.intro: '''Anthony Neil James Pilkington''' (born 6 June 1988) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, usually as a winger.

Wade Elliott.name: Wade Elliott
Wade Elliott.intro:
'''Wade Patrick Elliott''' (born 14 December 1978) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City. He plays mainly as a right midfielder but can play as a central midfielder.
Elliott began playing football as a youth player for Southampton F.C.Southampton before joining non-league Bashley F.C.Bashley. He began his professional career at A.F.C. Bournemouth after joining from Bashley for £5,000. After five years he joined Burnley F.C.Burnley where he won two player of the year awards and scored the only goal in the 2009 Football League Championship play-off Final2009 play-off final elevating his team to the Premier League. He moved on to Birmingham City in 2011, playing regularly for two seasons. He spent time on loan at Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in 2014, and joined them on a permanent contract after his release from Birmingham at the end of the 2013–14 season.

David Rennie.name: David Rennie
David Rennie.intro: '''David Rennie''' (born 29 August 1964) in Edinburgh) is a retired ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender or defensive midfielder.  He made more than 400 appearances in the Football League, playing for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United.

Michael Svensson.name: Michael Svensson
Michael Svensson.intro: '''Michael Lennart Svensson''' (born 25 November 1975 in Värnamo MunicipalityVärnamo, Sweden) is a Swedish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Halmstads BK in Superettan. He is best known at club level for his playing career with Southampton F.C.Southampton. He played in the 2003 FA Cup Final against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where Southampton lost 1–0 to a Robert Pirès strike.
Michael Svensson.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Tony Coton.name: Tony Coton
Tony Coton.intro:
'''Anthony Philip "Tony" Coton''' (born 19 May 1961) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1978 to 1999.
Born in Tamworth, StaffordshireTamworth, he made 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League playing as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Watford F.C.Watford, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He came out of retirement briefly in 2004 for Hereford United F.C.Hereford United following a goalkeeping crisis. He was renowned for his excellent reflexes and shot-stopping abilities, and now works as a sports agent.

Pablo Armero.name: Pablo Armero
Pablo Armero.intro: '''Pablo Estifer Armero''' (born 2 November 1986) is a Colombian association footballfootballer who plays for Serie A club A.C. Milan on loan from Udinese CalcioUdinese.

Jonatan Johansson.name: Jonatan Johansson
Jonatan Johansson.intro: '''Jonatan Lillebror Johansson''' (born 16 August 1975 in Stockholm, Sweden) is a retired FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer and the youth coach at Motherwell F.C.Motherwell.[

David Busst.name: David Busst
David Busst.intro:
'''David "Dave" Busst''' (born 30 June 1967) is a former English professional association footballfootballer and current Football Community manager at Football League One side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1991 until 1996. Having started his career with non-league Moor Green F.C.Moor Green, he moved to FA Premier League side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in August 1992. Having made over 50 appearances for the Sky Blues, he suffered a broken leg during a match with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 1996 which ended his career. His injury is often considered as the most horrific in the history of the Premier League to date. He moved into management following his retirement with Solihull Borough F.C.Solihull Borough in 2001, and later took charge of Evesham United F.C.Evesham United. He came out of retirement in 2008 as defensive cover for Highgate United F.C.Highgate United.

Mike Williams (footballer, born 1969).name: Mike Williams (footballer, born 1969)
Mike Williams (footballer, born 1969).intro: '''Michael Anthony "Mike" Williams''' (born 21 November 1969 in Bradford) is a professional Association footballfootballer, who played for a number of teams during the 1990s, but is mostly remembered for his time at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.

Kevin Long.name: Kevin Long
Kevin Long.intro: '''Kevin Finbarr Long''' (born 18 August 1990), is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Burnley F.C.Burnley. He plays mainly as a centre back but can also fill in at full back.

Anthony Barness.name: Anthony Barness
Anthony Barness.intro:
'''Anthony Barness''' (born 25 February 1973) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender from 1991 until 2011.
He notably played in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and in the Football League for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Southend United F.C.Southend United and Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle. He also played non-League football for Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic and Lewes F.C.Lewes.

Juli\u00e1n Speroni.name: Julián Speroni
Juli\u00e1n Speroni.intro: '''Julián Maria Speroni''' (; born 18 May 1979) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Philip Mulryne.name: Philip Mulryne
Philip Mulryne.intro: '''Philip Patrick Stephen Mulryne''' (born 1 January 1978 in Belfast) is a former professional association footballfootballer from Northern Ireland. He started his career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before playing more than 150 games for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, and was a Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international. After his retirement from football in 2008 he began studying for the Roman Catholic priesthood.

Shaun Maloney.name: Shaun Maloney
Shaun Maloney.intro:
'''Shaun Richard Maloney''' (born 24 January 1983) is a ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Wingerattacking midfielder or Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Major League Soccer club Chicago Fire Soccer ClubChicago Fire and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.
He began his career at Celtic F.C.Celtic, playing 215 matches across all competitions and winning honours including five Scottish Premier League titles and five Scottish Cups, spending time in England with Aston Villa between two spells at Celtic Park. He is the first player to claim both the SPFA Players' Player of the Year and the PFA Scotland Young Player of the YearSPFA Young Player of the Year awards in the same season, doing so in 2006 during his first spell with Celtic. In 2011 he returned to England with Wigan Athletic, winning the 2013 FA Cup Final before leaving for Chicago in January 2015.
Maloney made his senior international debut for Scotland in 2005, and has since earned 38 caps, scoring 4 goals.

Pierluigi Casiraghi.name: Pierluigi Casiraghi
Pierluigi Casiraghi.intro: '''Pierluigi "Gigi" Casiraghi''' (; born 4 March 1969) is an Italian former Association footballfootballer who played as a striker. Since retirement he has become a football manager. Casiraghi was a forward who was capable of playing anywhere in the front line. Throughout his career, he became renowned for his ability in the air, and for having a penchant for scoring acrobatic goals. He was a strong, hardworking player who could score goals, although he was also capable of holding up the ball to create space for team mates and provide them with assists, due to his strength.

John Paintsil.name: John Paintsil
John Paintsil.intro:
'''John Paintsil''' (born 15 June 1981 in Berekum) is a Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer, who plays in the South African Premier Soccer League for Maritzburg United and the Ghana national football teamGhana national team.
His family name is '''Paintsil''' but at birth, it was registered as '''Pantsil'''. This then appeared on his passport and his registration with the Premier League.
John Paintsil.position: Full back  association football  Full back

Jon Dahl Tomasson.name: Jon Dahl Tomasson
Jon Dahl Tomasson.intro:
'''Jon Dahl Tomasson''' (born 29 August 1976 in Copenhagen, Denmark) is a DenmarkDanish Association footballfootball manager and former player, who is currently without a club after his contract with Eredivisie side Roda JC Kerkrade had been dissolved. Tomasson is of Danish, FinlandFinnish and Icelandic heritagecite news  url=
work= kicker.de  date=17 January 2005  accessdate=17 January 2005  language = German and was known for his positional strength and fine finishing. His most notable run of football came in his first stint at Feyenoord, with whom he won the 2002 UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup, and ItalyItalian club A.C. MilanMilan, with whom he won the 2003 UEFA Champions League and reached 2005 UEFA Champions League Finalthe final in 2005. He was also honoured with the Danish Football Player of the YearDanish ''Player of the Year'' award in both 2002 and 2004.
Jon Dahl Tomasson.position: Forward  association football  Second striker Second striker,Attacking midfielder

Steed Malbranque.name: Steed Malbranque
Steed Malbranque.intro: '''Steed Malbranque''' (born 6 January 1980 in Mouscron) is a BelgiumBelgian-born French peopleFrench Association footballfootballer who plays for Olympique Lyonnais. Malbranque is in his second spell with Lyon, having begun his professional career there before moving to England in 2001, where he had spells with Fulham F.C.Fulham, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He returned to France in 2011 for a short spell with AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne before retiring. However, in 2012, he returned to football, joining Lyon for the second time.

David Hillier.name: David Hillier
David Hillier.intro:
'''David Hillier''' (born 18 December 1969) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and manager of Western Football League side Almondsbury UWE F.C.Almondsbury UWE.
As a player Hillier played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1988 until 2003, notably in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He also played in the Football League for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Barnet F.C.Barnet. He also earnt 1 cap for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 side.

P\u00e9ter Halmosi.name: Péter Halmosi
P\u00e9ter Halmosi.intro: '''Péter Halmosi''' (; born 25 September 1979) is a HungaryHungarian Association footballfootballer who plays for Szombathelyi Haladás as a midfielder. Halmosi is a Hungarian International player, having won 31 caps for his country. His previous clubs include Szombathelyi Haladás, Grazer AK, Debreceni VSCDebrecen, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.

Darren Holloway.name: Darren Holloway
Darren Holloway.intro:
'''Darren Holloway''' (born 3 October 1977 in Bishop Auckland, England) is a professional footballer. His former clubs include Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City (scoring once against Hull),cite web
url=

publisher=BBC
