Phil Morgan.name: Phil Morgan
Phil Morgan.intro: '''Phil Morgan''' (born 18 December 1974) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper.

Chris Lumsdon.name: Chris Lumsdon
Chris Lumsdon.intro: '''Christopher 'Chris' Lumsdon''' (born 15 December 1979 in Newcastle upon Tyne) is an English association footballfootballer who had to retire through a back injury in July 2010. He played for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Darlington F.C.Darlington. During his days at Sunderland, he also played on loan for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and Barnsley.

Joe Hart.name: Joe Hart
Joe Hart.intro:
''' Charles Joseph John "Joe" Hart''' (born 19 April 1987) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He began his career at his hometown club Shrewsbury Town in the Football ConferenceConference and Football League TwoLeague Two. In 2006, he moved to top-flight Manchester City, having attracted the attention of several Premier League teams. He spent time on loan at Tranmere Rovers and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in his first season, before spending the 2009–10 season at Birmingham City. Hart was nominated for the PFA Young Player of the Year and was voted as the PFA Team of the Year#Premier League 18Premier League goalkeeper of the 2009–10 season in recognition of his performances at Birmingham. He returned to Manchester City for the 2010–11 season and won the Barclays Golden Glove for keeping the most clean sheets throughout the Premier League season. Hart replicated this feat in the 2011–12 season and was a key player during City's 2011–12 Premier League title-winning campaign. He won the Golden Glove for the third year in a row in the 2012-13 Premier Leaguefollowing season, and earned a second Premier League title in 2014.
A former regular for England at Under-21 level, Hart made his senior international debut in June 2008, and has been recognised as England's first-choice goalkeeper since 2010. He has gained over 45 caps and was selected in England's squads for two World Cups and Euro 2012.

Andy Goram.name: Andy Goram
Andy Goram.intro:
'''Andrew Lewis Goram''' (born 13 April 1964) is a former Scotland national football teamScotland international association football goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. Born in Bury, Lancashire, England, he started his career with Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic and Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, but he is best remembered for playing for Rangers F.C.Rangers during the 1990s, when he earned the moniker "The Goalie". In a 2001 poll of Rangers fans, Goram was voted Rangers' greatest ever goalkeeper.
After his time with Rangers, he played for many clubs, most notably at Motherwell F.C.Motherwell and a brief loan spell at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Goram also represented Scottish cricket teamScotland at cricket.
Goram was also a league cricketer, appearing as a wicket-keeper and batsman for various Oldham clubs in the Saddleworth League, including Delph & Dobcross, Moorside and also East Lancashire Paper Mill in Radcliffe, Greater ManchesterRadcliffe, Bury. Goram played for Penicuik Cricket Club, Kelso Cricket Club, West Lothian County and Uddingston CC in Scottish cricket leagues. He represented the Scottish cricket team four times: twice (1989 and 1991) in the annual first-class cricketfirst-class game against Irish cricket teamIreland and twice (again in 1989 and 1991) in the NatWest Trophy. Goram is the only person to have played in a first class cricket match and a full international football match for Scotland.
A left-handed batsman and right-arm medium-pace bowler, he never achieved any great success, his most significant act was probably to bowl English cricket teamEngland Test cricketTest player Richard Blakey in a NatWest Trophy game against Yorkshire County Cricket ClubYorkshire in 1989. Rangers F.C.Rangers manager Walter Smith effectively ended Goram's cricket career when he ordered Goram to concentrate on his football career. Goram made a cricketing comeback after ending his football career, finally playing for Freuchie Cricket Club in their centenary week matches versus Cricket Scotland President's XI, Falkland Cricket Club and Sussex Ladies.

J\u00e9r\u00f4me Bonnissel.name: Jérôme Bonnissel
J\u00e9r\u00f4me Bonnissel.intro:
'''Jérôme Bonnissel''' (born 16 April 1973 in Montpellier) is a French former association footballfootball left back.
Bonnissel started his career with hometown club Montpellier HSCMontpellier, and proceeded to spend three seasons with La Liga club Deportivo de La Coruña.
He returned to his homeland to join FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux in 1999 and stayed until he joined Rangers F.C.Rangers during the 2003 January transfer window, on a contract until the end of the season. The highlight of his time at Rangers was a start in the 2003 Scottish League Cup Final win over Celtic F.C.Celtic at Hampden Park.
In the summer of 2003 he joined Fulham F.C.Fulham on a Free transfer (football)free transfer, going on to play in their memorable 3-1 win over Manchester United at Old Trafford.
After a short six-month spell at Olympique de MarseilleMarseille, Bonnissel retired in 2006.

Enner Valencia.name: Enner Valencia
Enner Valencia.intro: '''Enner Remberto Valencia Lastra''' (born 4 November 1989) is an Ecuadorian Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)forward for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and for the Ecuador national football teamEcuador national team. He has previously played for Club Sport EmelecEmelec in Ecuador, winning Ecuadorian Serie ASerie A and being awarded the Copa SudamericanaCopa Sudamericana Golden Boot in 2013. He also played for C.F. PachucaPachuca in Mexico and was also awarded the Liga MXLiga MX Golden Boot in the 2013–14 Liga MX season2014 Clausura tournament. He is nicknamed "Superman".[

Manuel Fernandes (footballer, born 1986).name: Manuel Fernandes (footballer, born 1986)
Manuel Fernandes (footballer, born 1986).intro:
'''Manuel Henrique Tavares Fernandes''' (; born 5 February 1986) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Russian club FC Lokomotiv Moscow as a midfielder.
He started his professional career with S.L. BenficaBenfica at only 18, then went on to compete in England in Spain, mainly at the service of Everton F.C.Everton and Valencia CFValencia. He signed with Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş in January 2011, spending the following three 1/2 seasons with the club.
Fernandes represented the Portugal national under-21 football teamPortuguese under-21 team in two UEFA European Under-21 ChampionshipEuropean Championships. He made his debut with Portugal national football teamthe full side in 2005.

Youssouf Mulumbu.name: Youssouf Mulumbu
Youssouf Mulumbu.intro: '''Youssouf Mulumbu''' (born 25 January 1987) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a midfielder.

Michael Johansen.name: Michael Johansen
Michael Johansen.intro: '''Michael Bro Johansen''' (born July 22, 1972) is a DenmarkDanish former professional football (soccer)football player who played as a midfielder in the Danish Superliga for FC Copenhagen and for Football in EnglandEnglish club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He played two games for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team in 2000 and 2002, and was an unused substitute at the 1992 Summer Olympics. He is the older twin brother of former footballer Martin Johansen, and played alongside him in several clubs.

Ronny Rosenthal.name: Ronny Rosenthal
Ronny Rosenthal.intro: '''Ronny Rosenthal''' (; born October 11, 1963), also known by the nickname '''Rocket Ronny''', is an IsraelisIsraeli former Association footballfootballer. After starting his career in the city of his birth with Maccabi Haifa F.C.Maccabi Haifa, Rosenthal went on to play in Belgium with Club Brugge and Standard Liège. He moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 1990 for a fee of £1.1million, becoming the first non-British player to move to an English club for more than £1million. After four years at Liverpool, Rosenthal finished his career with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Watford F.C.Watford. Between 1983 and 1997 he made 60 appearances for the Israel national football team, scoring 11 goals.

Leroy Lita.name: Leroy Lita
Leroy Lita.intro: '''Leroy Halirou Bohari Lita''' (born 28 December 1984) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Notts County F.C.Notts County, on loan from Barnsley F.C.Barnsley as a Forward (association football)striker. Lita was a product of the Chelsea F.C.Chelsea youth system. He failed to play for Chelsea, and moved to Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Reading F.C.Reading, where his form helped him earn a place with the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side. He has also played on loan with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion.

Jon Olav Hjelde.name: Jon Olav Hjelde
Jon Olav Hjelde.intro:
'''Jon Olav Hjelde''' (born 30 April 1972 in Verdal) is a NorwayNorwegian former football (soccer)footballer who played as a central defender.
Hjelde began his career at his local team Vuku ILVuku, which competed in the Norwegian Third Division. He joined Rosenborg BKRosenborg in 1994, where he became backup to the team's regular central defenders Erik Hoftun and Bjørn Otto Bragstad. Despite not being a regular in the Rosenborg side, Hjelde was signed by Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in 1997. He soon became a regular in Forest's first-team.
After seven seasons at Forest, Hjelde moved to South Korea in 2003, and joined the Busan I'ParkBusan I'cons. He rejoined Forest after one year in Korea, but played only sporadically and was released at the end of the 2004-05 season.
At this point, Hjelde was considering moving back to Norway, but instead signed a one-year deal with Forest's lower-league neighbours Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town in the summer of 2005. He played regularly for the Stags, forming a defensive team alongside Alex Baptiste. Hjelde indicated that he would move back to Norway at the end of the 2005-06 season, but later changed his mind, and signed a new one-year contract with the Stags. In May 2007, he retired from football.

Shaun Taylor.name: Shaun Taylor
Shaun Taylor.intro:
'''Shaun Taylor'''  (born 26 February 1963) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who made more than 500 appearances in the Football League and Premier League, playing for Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City.
Taylor was born in Plymouth. A hard-tackling no-nonsense defender, he played non-league football for clubs including St Blazey A.F.C.St Blazey and Bideford A.F.C.Bideford before moving to Exeter City F.C.Exeter City in December 1986 at the age of 23. He captained Exeter to the Football League Fourth DivisionFourth Division championship in 1989–90, and played 200 league games for the club before moving to Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town in July 1991 for a £200,000 fee. He was an ever-present as Swindon gained promotion to the Premier League in 1992–93, a season when he scored 13 goals, a high total for a defender, and played every game in their only season in the top flight. After a second relegation, he captained Swindon to the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division title, and became the first player to win the club's Player of the Year award three times. He played 259 games in all competitions for the club before joining Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in September 1996 for £50,000.
After a further 105 league games for Bristol City, helping the club to promotion to Football League First DivisionDivision One in 1998, Taylor retired as a player and joined the club's coaching staff. Released in May 2005, he moved to Conference National club Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers in June as assistant to manager Gary Owers; their contracts were terminated by mutual consent after a poor start to the 2006–07 season. In July 2009 Taylor rejoined Exeter City as youth coach. He then became Assistant manager at Exeter City's Devon rivals Torquay United until he was dismissed in May 2013
Taylor's younger brother Craig Taylor (footballer)Craig was also a professional footballer.
On 12 July 2013, Shaun was appointed Professional Development Coach with his hometown club Plymouth Argyle F.CPlymouth Argyle youth academy.

Bj\u00f6rn Runstr\u00f6m.name: Björn Runström
Bj\u00f6rn Runstr\u00f6m.intro: '''Björn Sandro Runström''' (born 1 March 1984) is a SwedenSwedish former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.

Mark Atkins.name: Mark Atkins
Mark Atkins.intro:
'''Mark Nigel Atkins''' (born 14 August 1968) is an English former Association footballfootballer and manager of Northern Premier League side Matlock Town F.C.Matlock Town.
He was primarily a Association football positions#Centre midfielder .28CM.29central midfielder but started out as right-back in a career that lasted from 1986 until 2004, notably in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he won the title in 1995. He also played for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, York City F.C.York City, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town and Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town.
Mark Atkins.position: Association football positions Centre midfielder  28CM 29 Midfielder

Carl Dickinson.name: Carl Dickinson
Carl Dickinson.intro:
'''Carl Matthew Dickinson''' (born 31 March 1987) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Football League OneLeague One side Port Vale F.C.Port Vale; he is also the club captain.
Dickinson started his career at Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, and had loan spells at Knattspyrnufélagið VíkingurVíkingur (Iceland) and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool before helping the "Potters" to win promotion into the Premier League in 2007–08. He then dropped out of the first team picture, and spent time on loan at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He was sold to Watford F.C.Watford for a £250,000 fee in July 2011 and was a first team regular in the 2011–12 campaign. However he fell out of favour the following season and was loaned out to Portsmouth and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City before being allowed to join Port Vale on a free transfer in July 2013.
Carl Dickinson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

John Heitinga.name: John Heitinga
John Heitinga.intro:
'''John Gijsbert Alan "Johnny" Heitinga''' (born 15 November 1983) is a Dutch association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Hertha BSC and the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team. A product of the Ajax Youth Academy, he played for their first squad from 2001 to 2008. After a one-year spell at Atlético Madrid in Spain, he signed for Everton in 2009. Joining Fulham F.C.Fulham for six months in January 2014, he then signed with German side Hertha BSC the following Summer, signing a two-year deal with the club from Berlin.
Heitinga previously represented various youth squads for the Netherlands. He is now a regular player for the Dutch national team, having made his debut in February 2004. He has represented his country at two FIFA World CupWorld Cups (2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010) and three UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championships (UEFA Euro 20042004, UEFA Euro 20082008, and UEFA Euro 20122012). In 2008, Heitinga was named Dutch Footballer of the Year.
He is of Indonesian descent.
John Heitinga.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Philip Scott.name: Philip Scott
Philip Scott.intro:
'''Philip Scott''' (born 14 November 1974 in Perth, ScotlandPerth) is a retired ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer.
After playing Scottish Junior Football Associationjunior football for Scone Thistle F.C.Scone Thistle, Scott signed professional terms for Alex Totten's St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone in 1991 after coming through the Perth youth system. Scott established himself as a mainstay in the midfields of John McClelland (footballer born 1955)John McClelland and Paul Sturrock. Nicknamed ''Fizzy'', he was a member of Sturrock's 1996–97 in Scottish football1996–97 squad that won promotion to the Scottish Premier LeagueScottish Premier Division.
After eight years at McDiarmid Park, Scott moved south to join English club Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday for a £100,000 fee. Scott made only two league appearances for ''the Owls'', but scored one goal — an equaliser in a draw against Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle. His time at Hillsborough StadiumHillsborough was plagued by injury, and he was released at the end of his contract in April 2002.[
Unable to overcome his injury, Scott decided to retire from the game in 2003 at the age of 29. He is now the General Manager for Virgin Active gym in Sheffield, having returned there in 2007 after becoming fitness manager at the company's Glasgow branch for a two-year spell.

Paul Moody.name: Paul Moody
Paul Moody.intro:
'''Paul Moody''' (born 13 June 1967) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball striker (football)forward. Moody was signed by Southampton from non league Fareham in August 1991. After failing to secure regular first team football at Saints, Moody joined Oxford initially on loan in Feb 1994 and permanent deal was secured soon after. Moody became a fans favourite at the Manor Ground. Fulham signed Moody the summer of 1997 to spearhead the promotion push required by Mohammed Al Fayed. Moody remained at Craven Cottage until the summer of 1999. During his time at Fulham he suffered a broken leg but scored a hatrick on his return to the first team as Fulham celebrated winning the Division 2 title. Moody was signed by London neighbours Millwall in June 1999 for £150,000. Moody became a fans favourite in his 2 years at the Den due his uncompromising style of play. Moody formed a lethal partnership with Neil Harris and won yet another Division 2 title with the Lions. In September 2001 Moody returned to Oxford, initially on loan but a £150,000 fee was agreed a week later for a permanent deal. After an initially bright start at Oxford things began to deteriorate due to results and change of manager Moody left in the summer of 2002 and joined Ryman Premier side Aldershot.
Moody started well at Aldershot but was frozen out of team around Christmas 2002... he never played for Aldershot again and after becoming disillusioned with the game he retired from the full time game in 2003.
Moody had a short spell at Wessex League side Gosport Borough but retired completely after injury problems.

Valeri Bojinov.name: Valeri Bojinov
Valeri Bojinov.intro: '''Valeri Bojinov''' (, ; born 15 February 1986) is Bulgarian Association footballfootballer currently playing for Serie B side Ternana CalcioTernana as a Forward (association football)forward.

Ian Cox.name: Ian Cox
Ian Cox.intro:
'''Ian Gary Cox''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 25 March 1971 in Croydon, England) is a former Trinidad and Tobago international association footballfootballer.
Cox joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace from Non-League footballnon-League side Carshalton Athletic F.C.Carshalton Athletic for a fee of £40,000 in 1994. Opportunities were limited and he eventually joined A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth on a free transfer in 1996 having made just a handful of appearances for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
He enjoyed a hugely successful spell at A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth where he played alongside Rio Ferdinand, his no-nonsense playing style endeared himself to the fans in a playing spell that included over 170 league appearances. In the 2000–01 in English football2000–01 season, Cox joined Burnley for £500,000. He notched up over 100 appearances for the Football League ChampionshipChampionship side scoring five goals, before joining Gillingham F.C.Gillingham on a free transfer, in the 2003–04 in English football2003–04 season.
Predominantly a central Defender (football)defender, Cox can also play in midfieldermidfield. He was named in the Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago squad for the 2006 FIFA World Cup and was on the bench against Sweden national football teamSweden, England national football teamEngland and Paraguay national football teamParaguay in Trinidad and Tobago's first ever games in a World Cup. Cox retired from international football immediately after Trinidad's elimination from the tournament.
On 28 March 2008, Cox was released by Gillingham and signed for Isthmian League Premier Division side and former rivals Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United. Up until the turn of the year Cox was a permanent fixture in Maidstone's starting XI, playing a big part in what was one of the best defences in the league. However in January 2009, Cox's work as a prison officer meant he could no longer commit himself to the club. He did not appear for the Stones in over four months, however he did return in April 2009 to make three more appearances before retiring from football at the end of the season.  In August 2013, however, he came out of retirement to play for Whitstable Town F.C.Whitstable Town, managed by former team-mate Nicky Southall.

Ionel Ganea.name: Ionel Ganea
Ionel Ganea.intro: '''Ioan Viorel Ganea''' (born 10 August 1973 in Făgăraş) is a Romanian Association footballfootball Coach (sport)manager and former Forward (association football)striker.

Patrik Andersson.name: Patrik Andersson
Patrik Andersson.intro: '''Patrik "Bjärred" Jonas Andersson''' (; born 18 August 1971 in Borgeby) is a SwedenSwedish former Association footballfootballer. Both his father, Roy Andersson (footballer)Roy Andersson, as well as his younger brother, Daniel Andersson (footballer born 1977)Daniel Andersson, have also played professional football.

Stuart Wilson.name: Stuart Wilson
Stuart Wilson.intro: '''Stuart Wilson''' (born 16 September 1977) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football midfielder (football)midfielder.

James Tomkins.name: James Tomkins
James Tomkins.intro: '''James Oliver Charles Tomkins''' (born 29 March 1989) is an English peopleEnglish association footballfootballer  who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He has represented England at all levels up to the England national under-21 football teamunder-21 team and represented Great Britain Olympic football teamGreat Britain at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 London Olympics   He primarily plays as a Defender (football)centre back, but can also play at Defender (football)right back or Midfielder (football)defensive midfield. He is a product of the The Academy of FootballWest Ham youth academy.

Edu Gaspar.name: Edu Gaspar
Edu Gaspar.intro: '''Eduardo César Daude Gaspar''' (born 15 May 1978), commonly known as '''Edu''' or '''Edu Gaspar''', is a retired Football in BrazilBrazilian footballer who is currently director of football at his former club Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians.

Gerard Deulofeu.name: Gerard Deulofeu
Gerard Deulofeu.intro:
'''Gerard Deulofeu Lázaro''' (born 13 March 1994) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Sevilla FC, on loan from FC Barcelona. Mainly a Midfielder#Wingerright winger, he can also play as a Forward (association football)forward.
He started his career with Barcelona, first appearing with the first team at the age of 17, and was loaned to Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League in the 2013–14 Premier League2013–14 season.
Deulofeu is also a Spain national youth football teamSpanish youth international, having represented the country over 60 times at Spain national under-16 football teamunder-16, Spain national under-17 football teamunder-17, Spain national under-19 football teamunder-19, Spain national under-20 football teamunder-20 and Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, being named the UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Under-19 Golden PlayerUEFA Under-19 Championship Golden Player in 2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship2012. In 2014, he made his debut with Spain national football teamthe full side.

Scott Dann.name: Scott Dann
Scott Dann.intro: '''Scott Dann''' (born 14 February 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He began his Football League career with Walsall F.C.Walsall, before moving on to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and then to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2009. After Birmingham's relegation from the Premier League, Dann joined Blackburn in August 2011 and was the club's captain.
Scott Dann.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Kei Kamara.name: Kei Kamara
Kei Kamara.intro: '''Kei Ansu Kamara''' (; born 1 September 1984) is a Sierra Leonean Association footballfootballer who currently plays for the Columbus Crew of Major League Soccer.

Wayne Routledge.name: Wayne Routledge
Wayne Routledge.intro: '''Wayne Neville Anthony Routledge''' (born 7 January 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He plays as a midfielder on the left wing, although he can play on the right. He has represented England national football teamEngland at under-16, under-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Mark Fish.name: Mark Fish
Mark Fish.intro: '''Mark Anthony Fish''' (born 14 March 1974 in Cape Town) is a retired South African association footballfootballer.

Igors Stepanovs.name: Igors Stepanovs
Igors Stepanovs.intro: '''Igors Nauris Stepanovs''' (born 21 January 1976 in Ogre, LatviaOgre) is a former Latvian defender (football)football defender, currently a manager. Stepanovs has played 100 international matches and scored 4 goals for the Latvia national football teamLatvia national team. He made his debut in 1995, and played at 2004 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2004.

Moussa Sa\u00efb.name: Moussa Saïb
Moussa Sa\u00efb.intro: '''Moussa Saïb''' (born 5 March 1969) is an Algerian football manager and former footballer. He is currently Free agentunattached, after last managing JS Kabylie in the Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1.

Geoff Horsfield.name: Geoff Horsfield
Geoff Horsfield.intro:
'''Geoffrey Malcolm''' "'''Geoff'''" '''Horsfield''' (born 1 November 1973) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and football coach. He made more than 300 appearances in the Football League playing as a forward (association football)striker.
He was a "strong and forceful" player, able to hold the ball up in order to bring other players into the game. Horsfield made his Football League debut with Scarborough F.C.Scarborough as a teenager. Released by the club, he returned to part-time football with Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, Guiseley A.F.C.Guiseley and Witton Albion F.C.Witton Albion, before a second spell at Halifax saw him help the club regain their Football League status. He moved on to Fulham F.C.Fulham, with whom he achieved promotion to the Football League First DivisionFirst Division, before joining Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for a club record fee. He played in the final of the 2001 Football League Cup Final2001 League Cup with Birmingham, and the following season helped them reach the Premier League.
After a short period at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in 2003, he joined West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, with whom he again won promotion to the Premier League. In 2006, he moved to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, but much of his time there was spent on loan to other clubs, namely Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. Horsfield announced his retirement from football in 2008 after being diagnosed with testicular cancer, but after successful treatment he resumed his career, signing a six-month contract for Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in January 2009. In July of that year he was appointed player-managerplayer-assistant manager at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale under Micky Adams, and the following summer he took up coaching full-time, before leaving the game completely in May 2012. In March 2013 he returned to playing football for Alvechurch F.C.Alvechurch.

Greg Strong.name: Greg Strong
Greg Strong.intro:
'''Gregory''' "'''Greg'''" '''Strong''' (born 5 September 1975) is an English professional association footballfootballer who is player-manager for Rhyl F.C.Rhyl. He is a defender (association football)defender.
Strong had a 20-year-long career in professional football where he was a typical Journeyman (sports)journeyman playing for a large number of clubs. Strong played for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Motherwell F.C.Motherwell, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Bury F.C.Bury, Boston United F.C.Boston United, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, Livingston F.C.Livingston, Dundee F.C.Dundee, Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria, Droylsden F.C.Droylsden and Rhyl F.C.Rhyl.

Bryan Ruiz.name: Bryan Ruiz
Bryan Ruiz.intro: '''Bryan Jafet Ruiz González''' (; born 18 August 1985) is a Costa Rican peopleCosta Rican professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Fulham F.C.Fulham. He is a right sided attacking midfielder who can play as a second striker, and is Captain (association football)captain of the Costa Rica national football teamCosta Rica national team.

Wes Hoolahan.name: Wes Hoolahan
Wes Hoolahan.intro:
'''Wesley''' "'''Wes'''" '''Hoolahan''' (born 20 May 1982) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level.
Hoolahan began his playing career with Shelbourne F.C.Shelbourne and has previously played for Livingston F.C.Livingston and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He was the subject of a contested transfer between these two clubs in 2007, eventually requiring mediation by FIFA before he was able to sign for Blackpool. Hoolahan has played more than 100 times for both Shelbourne and Norwich.

Martin Woods.name: Martin Woods
Martin Woods.intro: '''Martin Paul Woods''' (born 1 January 1986) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Ross County F.C.Ross County in the Scottish Premiership. He is an attacking left-sided midfield player noted for his long range shooting and free kicks. He is also a former Scotland national under-21 football teamScotland U21 international.

Don Cowie.name: Don Cowie
Don Cowie.intro: '''Don McCulloch Cowie''' (born 15 February 1983) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for  Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as a midfielder. He has previously played for Ross County F.C.Ross County, Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.Inverness Caledonian Thistle, Watford F.C.Watford and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. Cowie has made ten international appearances for the Scotland national football team.

Chris Woods.name: Chris Woods
Chris Woods.intro:
'''Christopher 'Chris' Charles Eric Woods''' (born 14 November 1959 in Swineshead, Lincolnshire) is a former England national football teamEngland international Association footballfootball goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, who played in the Football League and Premier League for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Reading F.C.Reading, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Burnley F.C.Burnley, in the Scottish Football League for Rangers F.C.Rangers, and in Major League Soccer for the Colorado Rapids.  He was working as the goalkeeping coach at Everton F.C.Everton and United States men's national soccer teamUnited States. But, with the departure of David Moyes, he followed him to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United to replace Eric Steele as the new goalkeeping coach.
Woods was Peter Shilton's long-time understudy in the England team in the mid to late 1980s, finally claiming the number one shirt for himself in the early 1990s. In all, he managed to accrue 43 caps in an eight-year international career.

Luke Garbutt.name: Luke Garbutt
Luke Garbutt.intro: '''Luke Samuel Garbutt''' (born 21 May 1993) is an English professional footballer who plays for Everton F.C.Everton as a Defender (association football)defender.

Alberto Aquilani.name: Alberto Aquilani
Alberto Aquilani.intro:
'''Alberto Aquilani''' (; born 7 July 1984) is an Italian peopleItalian Professional sports#Association footballprofessional Association footballfootballer who plays for ACF FiorentinaFiorentina and the Italy national football teamItalian national team. Aquilani is a Midfielder#Centre midfieldercentral midfielder who can operate as a Deep-lying playmakerplaymaker or as an attacking midfielder.
Aquilani began his career at A.S. RomaRoma and, after a brief loan spell at U.S. Triestina CalcioTriestina, returned to the Serie A club where he became a regular in the Roma side during the 2005–06 Serie A2005–06 season. During the following season, he suffered a thigh injury and was ruled out for several months. He moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for the start of the Premier League 2009–102009–10 season but in August 2010, having received only limited playing time at Anfield, he joined Juventus F.C.Juventus on loan until the end of the 2010–11 Serie A2010–11 season. Aquilani returned to Liverpool at the end of the season as Juventus did not take up their purchase option. He went on loan again in 2011, playing for A.C. MilanMilan for the 2011–12 Serie A2011–12 season.
Internationally, Aquilani has represented Italy at youth level and at UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008. He made his full international début in November 2006 in a 1–1 draw against Turkey national football teamTurkey.

Joel Robles.name: Joel Robles
Joel Robles.intro:
'''Joel Robles Blázquez''' (born 17 June 1990), known simply as '''Joel''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Everton F.C.Everton as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Joel started his professional career at Atlético Madrid, initially in the Atlético Madrid CC team in 2008, before progressing into the Atlético Madrid BB team a year later. He made 28 league appearances for Atlético B during the 2009-10 Atlético Madrid season2009–10 season, before being promoted into the senior squad. Having been used sparingly in the 2011-12 Atlético Madrid season2011–12 season, he moved on loan to Rayo Vallecano in January 2012, making 13 league appearances. He was sent out on loan again in January 2013, this time to Premier League side Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, where he was part of the FA Cup-winning side. Having made eight league appearances for Wigan, he returned to Atlético Madrid at the end of the season before joining Everton in July 2013.
Joel played internationally for Spain national football teamSpain at Spain national under-16 football teamU16, Spain national under-17 football teamU17, Spain national under-21 football teamU21 and Spain national under-23 football teamU23 level, and was part of the squad that won the 2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship2013 European Under-21 Championship.

Lionel Scaloni.name: Lionel Scaloni
Lionel Scaloni.intro:
'''Lionel Sebastián Scaloni''' (born 16 May 1978) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club Atalanta B.C.Atalanta BC. A player of wide range, he can appear as both a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or Midfielder#Wide midfielderright midfielder.
He spent most of his professional career with Deportivo de La Coruña in Spain, amassing La Liga totals of 258 games and 15 goals over the course of 12 seasons (three teams represented). He also spent several years in Italy with S.S. LazioLazio.
Scaloni appeared with Argentina national football teamArgentina at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup.
Lionel Scaloni.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Wingback

Salomon Olemb\u00e9.name: Salomon Olembé
Salomon Olemb\u00e9.intro: '''René Salomon Olembé-Olembé''' (born 8 December 1980 in Yaoundé) is a Cameroonian former football (soccer)football.

David Dunn.name: David Dunn
David Dunn.intro:
'''David John Ian Dunn''' (born 27 December 1979) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an attacking midfielder for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.
He has also played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in between the first two of three spells with Blackburn, and made his only appearance for England national football teamEngland in 2002.

Neil Taylor.name: Neil Taylor
Neil Taylor.intro:
'''Neil John Taylor''' (born 7 February 1989) is a Welsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City and the Wales national football teamWelsh national team as a Defender (association football)defender.
A former Manchester City trainee, he began his career with Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham in 2007 and moved to Swansea for an initial £150,000 in 2010.
Taylor made his full international debut for Wales national football teamWales in 2010, and has since earned over 15 caps. He also represented Great Britain national football teamGreat Britain at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics in London.

Kevin Moore (footballer, born 1958).name: Kevin Moore (footballer, born 1958)
Kevin Moore (footballer, born 1958).intro:
'''Kevin Thomas Moore''' (29 April 1958 – 29 April 2013) was an English professional footballer.
Born in Grimsby, Lincolnshire, he played for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Fulham F.C.Fulham. Moore is one of five members of his family to play for Grimsby, including his brothers David Moore (footballer)David and Andy Moore (footballer)Andy, his father Roy Moore (footballer)Roy and his uncle Norman Moore (footballer)Norman.

Clinton Morrison.name: Clinton Morrison
Clinton Morrison.intro:
'''Clinton Hubert Morrison''' (born 14 May 1979) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Exeter City F.C.Exeter City as a Forward (association football)forward.
Morrison began his career at local side Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1998, for whom he scored over 100 goals across two spells, despite a less successful period at Birmingham City in between.
Born in England, he represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland 36 times at full international level, scoring 9 goals, and made their squad for the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

David Luiz.name: David Luiz
David Luiz.intro:
'''David Luiz Moreira Marinho''' (born 22 April 1987), known as '''David Luiz''', is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for French club Paris Saint-Germain FCParis Saint-Germain and serves as Captain (association football)vice-captain for the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team.
Primarily a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, he can also be deployed as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder. After starting out at Esporte Clube VitóriaVitória, he moved to S.L. BenficaBenfica at the age of 19, remaining with the club five seasons (three complete). He joined Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in January 2011, 2012 UEFA Champions League Finalwinning the Champions League and the 2012 FA Cup FinalFA Cup in the following season. In June 2014 he transferred from Chelsea to Paris Saint-Germain for a fee of £50 million (€62 million), a List of most expensive association football transfersworld record transfer for a defender.
David Luiz made his full international debut in 2010 and has since earned over 40 caps. He was a member of the Brazilian teams which won the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup and reached the semi-finals of the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Gary Gardner.name: Gary Gardner
Gary Gardner.intro: '''Gary Gardner''' (born 29 June 1992) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. A product of the Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and AcademyAston Villa Academy, Gardner has spent brief loan spells at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 2011 as well as Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in 2014. He has made a number of appearances at different international levels for England national football teamEngland. He is the younger brother of current West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion midfielder and former Aston Villa team-mate Craig Gardner.

Serge Gnabry.name: Serge Gnabry
Serge Gnabry.intro: '''Serge David Gnabry''' (, ; born 14 July 1995) is a German Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder (association football)midfielder for the English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Olivier Dacourt.name: Olivier Dacourt
Olivier Dacourt.intro: '''Olivier Nicolas André Dacourt''' (born 25 September 1974 in Montreuil, Seine-Saint-DenisMontreuil-sous-Bois) is a former French Association footballfootballer. He is also a former France national football teamFrench international and is best known for his spells at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, A.S. RomaAS Roma and F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale.

Richard Eckersley.name: Richard Eckersley
Richard Eckersley.intro:
'''Richard Jon Eckersley''' (born 12 March 1989) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)full-back and is currently unattached.
Born in Worsley, Salford, Greater Manchester, Eckersley began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before signing a four-year contract with Burnley in July 2009. After joining Burnley, he spent loan spells with Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Bury F.C.Bury. He went on loan to Toronto FC in 2011 before making a permanent transfer to the club the following season.
Richard Eckersley.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Ga\u00ebl Givet.name: Gaël Givet
Ga\u00ebl Givet.intro: '''Gaël Givet-Viaros''' (born 9 October 1981), known as '''Gaël Givet''', is a French Association footballfootballer who currently plays for AC Arles-AvignonArles-Avignon in Ligue 2. He is a left-footed Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back who can also play left-back. Givet was a Champions League runner-up with AS MonacoMonaco in 2004 and was part of the French team which reached the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

David Rozehnal.name: David Rozehnal
David Rozehnal.intro: '''David Sebastian Klement Rozehnal''' (born 5 July 1980 in Šternberk) is a Czech RepublicCzech international Association footballfootballer who plays for Lille OSCLille in the French Ligue 1.
David Rozehnal.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Elano.name: Elano
Elano.intro:
'''Elano Blumer''' (born 14 June 1981), simply known as '''Elano''', is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Santos FC. He has been noted for his accurate passing and precise set pieces.[
After starting his career at Santos FCSantos, Elano spent six years in Europe in the service of Shakhtar Donetsk, Manchester City and Galatasaray. He returned to Santos in 2011, and later joined fellow league teams Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto AlegrenseGrêmio and Clube de Regatas do FlamengoFlamengo, before signing for Chennaiyin FC of the Indian Super League as their marquee player. In 2015, after finishing the season as league top scorer in his only season in India, Elano rejoined Santos for a third spell.
Elano earned 50 caps for Brazil between 2004 and 2011, scoring nine goals. He represented the nation at their triumphs in the 2007 Copa América and the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup, and also played at the 2010 FIFA World Cup and the 2011 Copa América.

Mamadou Sakho.name: Mamadou Sakho
Mamadou Sakho.intro:
'''Mamadou Sakho''' (born 13 February 1990) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the French national football teamFrance national team as a Defender (association football)central defender. He is known for his leadership credentials, his tireless engine, hard-working attitude,and his tackling ability. He has also been praised for his "physical and tactical qualities". Thus resulting in him acquiring the nickname '''"The Beast"'''. Sakho is also known for the eccentric hairstyles he often displays while playing, and has earned the nickname ''Kirikou and the SorceressKirikou'' by some supporters as a result.
Sakho started his career at Paris FC in 1996 before moving to professional club Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain in 2002. After excelling in the youth system, Sakho earned a call up the senior team by manager Paul Le Guen. In October 2007, on his league debut, he became the youngest player ever to captain a Ligue 1 club after wearing the armband in the club's 0–0 draw with Valenciennes FCValenciennes. Since making his debut with the club, Sakho has become an integral part of the team earning starting berths in the first 11 under managers Paul Le Guen and Antoine Kombouaré. Sakho's playing style and ability have led to the media and former players drawing comparisons to former France national football teamFrench international Lilian Thuram.
Sakho is a France national football teamsenior international who has previously earned caps and Captain (association football)captained the nation at all youth levels. Before earning his first call-up to the senior team, Sakho was playing on the France national under-21 football teamunder-21 team serving as the captain. He earned his first call-up to the senior team in August 2010. Sakho made his senior international debut in November 2010 against England national football teamEngland, and was part of the French squad which reached the quarter-finals of the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Andy Collett.name: Andy Collett
Andy Collett.intro:
'''Andrew Alfred "Andy" Collett''' (born 28 October 1973) is a retired English professional Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is currently the goalkeeping coach at York City F.C..
Collett, born in Stockton-on-Tees, was the son of a demolition worker. He began his career at his home-town club, Middlesbrough F.C., for whom he made only two first-team appearances. He then moved south to Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, where he remained for five years before moving on to Darlington F.C.Darlington. He stayed at Darlington for five years, before his career was cut short because of a shoulder injury.
In 2000, Collett played a vital role in helping Darlington reach the Football League Two play-offsDivision Three play-off final, where they lost to Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United. He was rewarded for a consistent season and some extravagant saves when he received the Division Three Goalkeeper of the Year award for the 1999-2000 in English football1999–2000 season.
Collett was appointed Darlington's goalkeeping coach after he retired as a player in 2004.
On the 26 May 2009, he was appointed goalkeeper coach of Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He rejoined Dave Penney and Martin Gray (footballer)Martin Gray, who were also amongst the coaching staff of Darlington F.C.Darlington.

Simon Grayson.name: Simon Grayson
Simon Grayson.intro:
'''Simon Nicholas Grayson''' (born 16 December 1969) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and manager of Preston North End F.C.Preston North End.
As a player he was a right back, but he was also utilised in Midfieldermidfield in a career that lasted from 1988 until 2006. Having started his career with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United he notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, before moving into the Football League with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He was appointed as player/manager of Blackpool in 2005, and a year later retired from playing to concentrate on the managerial side of his job. In 2008, he was appointed manager of Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United but despite leading them to promotion to the Championship he was sacked in February 2012. He was soon back in management though taking over from Lee Clarke at Huddersfield Town. He again gained promotion from League 1 via the play-offs, beating Sheffield United in the final. After a run of twelve games without a win though he was sacked at the end of January 2013. On 18 February 2013 Grayson was given the chance to repeat his League 1 successes as the new manager of Preston North End taking over from Graham Westley who had been relieved of his duties the previous week.

Paul Williams (footballer, born 1971).name: Paul Williams (footballer, born 1971)
Paul Williams (footballer, born 1971).intro:
'''Paul Darren Williams''' (born 26 March 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1989 until 2005 notably in the Premier League for both Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Southampton F.C.Southampton, as well as in the Football League for Derby County F.C.Derby County, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. He finished his career with United States with Richmond Kickers and remained in the country becoming manager of Fredericksburg Gunners in 2006.

Wilfried Bony.name: Wilfried Bony
Wilfried Bony.intro:
'''Wilfried Guemiand Bony''' (born 10 December 1988) is an Ivorian Association footballfootballer who plays for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in the Premier League and the Ivory Coast national football team, as a Forward (association football)striker.
Having begun his career at Issia Wazi, he moved to Sparta Prague in 2007, helping them to the Czech First League title in 2010. In January 2011 he was signed by Vitesse, where he was the top scorer in the Eredivisie in 2012–13 Eredivisie2012–13, leading to a £12 million transfer to Swansea City. He joined Manchester City F.C.Manchester City for £28 million in January 2015.
A full international since 2010, Bony was selected in the Ivorian squads for the 2014 FIFA World Cup and three Africa Cup of Nations tournaments, helping them to victory in the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations2015 edition.

Trevor Morley.name: Trevor Morley
Trevor Morley.intro: '''Trevor Morley''' (born 20 March 1961 in Nottingham) is an EnglandEnglish former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a striker for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, S.K. BrannBrann and Reading F.C.Reading.

Lucien Aubey.name: Lucien Aubey
Lucien Aubey.intro: '''Lucien Yann Sherril Aubey''' (born 24 May 1984 in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo) is a Congo-BrazzavilleCongolese Association footballfootball defender (association football)defender who last played for Cypriot side Olympiakos Nicosia.

Peter Ramage.name: Peter Ramage
Peter Ramage.intro:
'''Peter Iain Ramage''' (born 22 November 1983) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
A defender (association football)defender, Ramage began his career with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as an academy player before progressing to the first team. In the summer of 2008, he moved to London side Queens Park Rangers, thus ending his twelve-year association with Newcastle United. In 2011–12, Ramage spent time on loan at Football League ChampionshipChampionship clubs Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Birmingham City before joining Crystal Palace on a permanent contract in 2012. After Palace were promoted to the Premier League, Ramage joined Championship club Barnsley on loan in September 2013. On 3 October 2014 Ramage again joined Barnsley on a three-month loan from Crystal Palace.

Jason Dozzell.name: Jason Dozzell
Jason Dozzell.intro:
'''Jason Irvin Winans Dozzell''' (born 9 December 1967) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who made more than 500 The Football LeagueFootball League appearances for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. Dozzell holds the record for being the youngest goalscorer in the English football league systemEngland's top division after scoring for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town against Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in a Football League First DivisionFirst Division match on 4 February 1984 at the age of 16 years and 57 days (the youngest goalscorer since the formation of the Premier League is Everton F.C.Everton's James Vaughan (footballer born 1988)James Vaughan, aged 16 years 270 days).Cite news
url=
Dozzell has also managed two non-League football clubs, both in the Eastern Counties Football League — Ipswich Wanderers F.C.Ipswich Wanderers and Leiston F.C.Leiston. As of October 2008, he is not managing a club.

Martijn Reuser.name: Martijn Reuser
Martijn Reuser.intro:
'''Martijn Franciscus Reuser''' (born 1 February 1975 in Amsterdam) is a former NetherlandsDutch association footballfootballer who last played for NAC Breda in the Eredivisie.
Reuser began his career at Dutch side Ajax AmsterdamAjax and, having joined the side at youth level, made the step up to play in the first team. He was a skillful, goal-scoring midfielder who looked capable of being a permanent fixture in the Dutch national setup. His career was looking very promising, but he suffered a serious knee injury, which appeared to end his Ajax career. He moved to another Dutch side, Vitesse Arnhem.  It was here that Martijn made his one and only international appearance against Ghana national football teamGhana in a friendly. He did not really hit it off at Vitesse and was re-signed by Ajax.
He made only one appearance for the first team and he was loaned to EnglandEnglish side Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in the 1999–2000 season after being scouted by Romeo Zondervan.cite news
url=
title=The Ex-Files: Martijn Reuser
publisher=www.twtd.co.uk
date=5 December 2012 accessdate=26 December 2013 Having scored a late winner on his début against Fulhamcite news
url=
title=Ipswich 1 Fulham 0
publisher=Sporting Life
date=25 March 2000 accessdate=17 July 2012 and a memorable goal to seal off Ipswich's play-off win against Barnsley F.C.Barnsley at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley, Ipswich signed him on a permanent basis. During his four-year stay at Portman Road he established a reputation as a free-kick taker.cite news
url=
title=My Favourite Footballer ... Martijn Reuser
publisher=The Equaliser (Blog)
date=27 September 2010 accessdate=26 December 2013 He was troubled by injury problems during his Ipswich Town career. Despite this, he managed to score 6 goals in his first full season with the club, establishing himself as one of the most dangerous attacking midfielders in the Premier League, helping Ipswich to an impressive fifth place finish in the 2000-2001 season and a return for the club to UEFA Cup football. After that, however, the injuries really set in. Ipswich were relegated the following season and he also fell out with new manager Joe Royle.
Reuser left Ipswich and joined Willem II TilburgWillem II for the 2004–2005 season. He was less troubled by injury in the Netherlands, but he missed 2 months of the season with Achilles tendon problems. He was still the club's top scorer as the team finished 11th in the table. The following season was more difficult for Willem II. Reuser spent a lot of the season on the sidelines, and the side finished 16th in the table, which meant play-offs again for Reuser. He saved his side, with a hat-trick in their semi-final against FC Zwolle. Martijn signed for another Dutch side RKC Waalwijk for the 2006–2007 season. He played for NAC Breda in the 2009–10 season. In January 2012, Reuser was linked with a return to former club Ipswich Town.[

Segundo Castillo.intro: '''Segundo Alejandro Castillo Nazareno''' (born 15 May 1982) is an Ecuadorian international Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Dorados de Sinaloa in the Ascenso MX. Castillo is mostly used as a defensive midfielder but can also play as a central midfielder.

Jason Minett.name: Jason Minett
Jason Minett.intro:
'''Jason Minett''' (born 12 August 1971) is a former professional footballer who began his career with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
His Carrow Road career was limited by injuries, although he went on to play for Exeter City F.C.Exeter city and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in the Football League. In 1998, he dropped into non-league football joining Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and then Boston United F.C.Boston United. His career at Boston stalled when he suffered a broken leg in the 3-0 FA Trophy victory over Tamworth F.C.Tamworth on 13 January 2001. Regaining fitness, he joined King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn ahead of the 2001-2002 season. In January 2002 he joined Stocksbridge Park Steels F.C.Stocksbridge Park Steels on loan. In April 2002 he moved on to Grantham Town F.C.Grantham Town,cite web

title=Town seal last-Minett deal
date=4 April 2002
publisher=Grantham Journal
accessdate=2008-06-10 agreeing a contract for the following two seasons. In the summer of 2004, Minett joined up with his former Grantham manager John Wilkinson at Lincoln United F.C.Lincoln United.cite web

Alou Diarra.name: Alou Diarra
Alou Diarra.intro:
'''Alou Diarra''' ( ; born 15 July 1981) is a List of France international footballersFrench international footballer who  currently  plays for  English Championship club Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, having previously participated in the pre-season training camp of MLS team Chicago Fire Soccer ClubChicago Fire.
He primarily plays as a Midfielderdefensive midfielder, but can also deputise as a Defender (football)centre-back if necessary. Diarra is described as a player who is "strong, athletic and very powerful" and possesses a "combative edge" similar to former France national football teamFrench international Patrick Vieira. Diarra is also known for his leadership ability and has served as captain of both Bordeaux domestically and France national football teamFrance internationally.
Diarra began his career playing for clubs based in Seine-Saint-Denis, such as CSL Aulnay and hometown club FC Villepinte. In 1997, he joined CS Louhans-CuiseauxLouhans-Cuiseaux and made his professional debut with the club in the 1999–2000 French Division 21999–2000 season while the club was playing in the Ligue 2second division. In 2000, Diarra was recruited by German club FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. He spent two years playing on the club's reserve team, Bayern Munich II. In 2002, he was signed by compatriot Gérard Houllier as part of the manager's ''French Revolution'' to play for English club Liverpool F.CLiverpool. Diarra's stint at the club was deemed a disappointment as he spent both years at the club on loan in France playing for Le Havre ACLe Havre, SC BastiaBastia, and RC LensLens.
After a successful 2004–05 season with Lens, Diarra made a permanent return to France joining the club from Liverpool on a permanent deal. He spent two seasons at the club amassing over 70 appearances before signing with the then five-time defending champions Olympique LyonnaisLyon. At Lyon, Diarra struggled for playing time and left the club to join FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux after one year. He did earn a winner's medal as a result of the club winning the 2006–07 Ligue 1 title. With Bordeaux, Diarra was ever-present within the team under manager Laurent Blanc. He was a prominent figure on the Bordeaux team that won the Double (association football)league and league cup double in the 2008–09 Ligue 12008–09 season. Diarra has also won two Trophée des champions while playing for the club.
Diarra is also a France national football teamFrance international. Prior to playing at senior level, he played at France national under-20 football teamunder-20 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. With the under-20 team, Diarra played on the team that participated in the 2001 FIFA World Youth Championship. He made his senior international debut in October 2004 in a Exhibition matchfriendly match against the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. Diarra has participated in both the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 editions of the FIFA World Cup. In the 2006 competition, he appeared in a group stage match against Togo national football teamTogo and 2006 FIFA World Cup Finalthe final match against Italy national football teamItaly as a substitute. In the 2010 edition, Diarra captained France for the first time in the team's final group stage match against South Africa national football teamSouth Africa.

C\u00e9dric Avinel.name: Cédric Avinel
C\u00e9dric Avinel.intro: '''Cédric Mickael Avinel''' (born 11 September 1986 in Paris) is a Guadeloupean international Association footballfootballer, who currently plays for Clermont Foot Auvergne 63.
