Paul Mitchell (footballer, born 1971).intro: '''Paul Mitchell''' (born 20 October 1971) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder. He now works at AFC Bournemouth as a correspondent for Opta Sports

Steve White.name: Steve White
Steve White.intro: '''Steve White''' (born 2 January 1959 in Chipping Sodbury) is a retired professional association footballfootball strikerforward and manager. His son, Joe White (English footballer)Joe White, currently plays for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, having signed his first professional contract in the summer of 2008.

Ian Olney.name: Ian Olney
Ian Olney.intro:
'''Ian Olney''' (born December 17, 1969 in Luton, Bedfordshire, England) is a former Association footballfootball (soccer) player, who played as a striker. He started his career at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 1988, for whom he made 88 league appearances, scoring 16 goals, and 4 years later was sold to Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic for £750,000, at that time Oldham's transfer record.cite web
url=
title=Career stats at soccerbase.com He was part of the team that dramatically survived relegation from the FA Premier LeaguePremier League on the final day of the 1992-93 in English footballseason, after defeating Southampton F.C.Southampton 4-3. He later played for Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers and Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers.
Following his career ending, he began training to become an Independent Financial Advisor, and to this day works around the Birmingham area in this capacity.

Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Nimani.name: Frédéric Nimani
Fr\u00e9d\u00e9ric Nimani.intro: '''Frédéric K. Nimani N'Galou''' (born 8 October 1988) is a FranceFrench association footballfootballer who plays for OFI Crete  as a winger.

Fitzroy Simpson.name: Fitzroy Simpson
Fitzroy Simpson.intro:
'''Fitzroy Simpson''' (born 26 February 1970 in England) is a former professional EnglandEnglish-born Jamaican professional association footballfootballer who was a midfielder and Defender (association football)#Full backleft back from 1988 to 2008.
Simpson notably played in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Scottish Premier League for Hearts F.C.Hearts and the IFA PremiershipIrish IFA Premiership for Linfield F.C.Linfield. He also played in the Football League for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Walsall F.C.Walsall before ending his career in Non-league football with Telford United F.C.Telford United, Havant & Waterlooville F.C.Havant & Waterlooville and Eastleigh F.C.Eastleigh.

Albert Ferrer.name: Albert Ferrer
Albert Ferrer.intro:
'''Albert Ferrer i Llopis''' (; born 6 June 1970) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, and a current Coach (sport)coach.
Having represented local FC BarcelonaBarcelona for almost a decade, he went on to appear for England's Chelsea F.C.Chelsea until his retirement. During his spell in his country he was nicknamed ''Chapi'', and appeared in a total of 221 La Liga games during nine seasons.
A Spain national football teamSpanish international on more than 30 occasions, Ferrer represented the nation in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and at the Football at the 1992 Summer Olympics1992 Olympic Games, winning the latter tournament. He started working as a manager in 2010, with Vitesse.
Albert Ferrer.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

\u00c9ric Roy.name: Éric Roy
\u00c9ric Roy.intro: '''Éric Serge Roy''' (born 26 September 1967 in Nice) is a retired FranceFrench football (soccer)footballer and former manager of OGC Nice.[

Derek Whyte.name: Derek Whyte
Derek Whyte.intro:
'''Derek Whyte''' (born 31 August 1968 in Glasgow) is a former Scottish footballer who played for Celtic F.C.Celtic, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen and Partick Thistle F.C.Partick Thistle. He also won twelve cap (football)caps for Scotland national football teamScotland during his 18 year playing career. He participated at Euro 92, Euro 96 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
Whyte joined Celtic on 14 May 1985 as a 16 year old from the Celtic Boys Club. A defender with the greatest of promise, described as the new Billy McNeill, his form slumped towards the end of his time at the club. He left at the end of the 1991-92 in Scottish football91-92 season when an agreeable new contract was not forthcoming. He was sold to Middlesbrough for £900,000 where he returned to the early good form he had shown at Celtic.
After 5 seasons on Teesside, Whyte left Middlesbrough to return to Scotland, joining Aberdeen for an undisclosed fee and a four and a half year contract in December 1997. He was appointed Captain (association football)Captain at Pittodrie StadiumPittodrie and remained there until 2002, when he joined Partick Thistle on a free transfer.
Along with Gerry Britton, Whyte was appointed joint player-manager of the ''Jags'' when Gerry Collins was sacked in November 2003. In March 2004 he decided to hang up his playing boots to concentrate on management & television work, and is now a pundit on ShowSports, the sports channel on the Showtime Arabia network, based in Dubai, and writes a weekly column for the UAE's leading daily newspaper 7DAYS. UAE[

Jonathan Williams.name: Jonathan Williams
Jonathan Williams.intro: '''Jonathan Peter Williams ''' (born 9 October 1993) is a professional footballer who plays for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town (on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace) and the Wales national football teamWales national team. He is a right-footed attacking midfielder who can also play wide.

Nikola Kalini\u0107.name: Nikola Kalinić
Nikola Kalini\u0107.intro: '''Nikola Kalinić''' (born 5 January 1988) is a Croatian association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for  FC Dnipro DnipropetrovskDnipro Dnipropetrovsk in the Ukrainian Premier League.

Nick Hammond.name: Nick Hammond
Nick Hammond.intro: '''Nicholas David Hammond''' (born 7 September 1967 in Hornchurch, England) is an English peopleEnglish former football (soccer)football goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper, and currently Director of footballDirector of Football at Reading F.C.Reading Football Club.

Andy Townsend.name: Andy Townsend
Andy Townsend.intro:
'''Andrew "Andy" David Townsend''' (born 23 July 1963) is a retired footballer who played in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland and is now a television and radio Pundit (expert)pundit
Starting his career at Welling United F.C.Welling United and then Weymouth F.C.Weymouth, Townsend came to prominence at age 21 when he signed with Southampton F.C.Southampton. In 1988 he moved on to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, before joining Chelsea F.C.Chelsea two years later. In 1993 he signed with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and enjoyed four successful years before his transfer to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. His final club was West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, where he retired in 2000.
Following his retirement as a player he became a football pundit, most notably with ITV Sport

Jermaine Beckford.name: Jermaine Beckford
Jermaine Beckford.intro: '''Jermaine Paul Alexander Beckford''' (born 9 December 1983) is an English-born Jamaican international association footballfootballer who plays for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End on loan from Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He started his career as a trainee at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. Beckford has also played for Wealdstone F.C.Wealdstone, Uxbridge F.C.Uxbridge, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Leeds United F.C.Leeds United and Everton F.C.Everton. He has also received international caps for Jamaica national football teamJamaica.

Connor Wickham.name: Connor Wickham
Connor Wickham.intro:
'''Connor Neil Ralph Wickham''' (born 31 March 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as a Forward (association football)#Forwardforward.
He played youth football at Reading F.C.Reading before moving to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in 2006 where he continued in the youth structure. He made his full professional debut for the club in April 2009. He has also played at various levels of international football, scoring the winning goal in the 2010 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship Final.

Ian Thomas-Moore.name: Ian Thomas-Moore
Ian Thomas-Moore.intro: '''Ian Thomas-Moore''' (born 26 August 1976 in Birkenhead) is a retired English professional association footballfootballer He mostly played as a centre-forward but also played on the Left/right wing. He is the son of former Tranmere Rovers F.CTranmere Rovers manager Ronnie Moore. He was known as '''Ian Moore''' until he married Victoria Thomas in July 2009 and added her surname to his own.

Scott Kerr.name: Scott Kerr
Scott Kerr.intro:
'''Scott Anthony Kerr''' (born 11 December 1981) is an English semi-professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Stalybridge Celtic F.C.Stalybridge Celtic as a midfielder.
He previously played for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Frickley Athletic F.C.Frickley Athletic, Scarborough F.C.Scarborough, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, York City F.C.York City, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Bradford Park Avenue F.C.Bradford Park Avenue and Hyde F.C.Hyde.

Fabricio Coloccini.name: Fabricio Coloccini
Fabricio Coloccini.intro:
'''Fabricio Coloccini''' (; ; ; born 22 January 1982) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#centre-backcentre back for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Argentina national football team.
Coloccini has represented numerous football clubs, but it was his successful spell at Deportivo de La CoruñaDeportivo La Coruña, where he earned his reputation as a top-level defender. After beginning his career at Boca Juniors in his native Argentina, Coloccini attracted the attention of A.C. Milan. He failed to establish himself there, however, and subsequently went on loan to four different clubs.
He joined Newcastle United in August 2008, for a fee of up to £10.3 million, and in July 2011, he was promoted to club captain, after proving himself as one of the Premier League's most reliable and strong central defenders. In April 2012, he was named in the PFA Team of the Year due to his influence in Newcastle's impressive season.
He also holds an ItalyItalian passport due to his Italian ancestry.[
Fabricio Coloccini.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jamie Barnwell-Edinboro.name: Jamie Barnwell-Edinboro
Jamie Barnwell-Edinboro.intro: '''Jamie Barnwell-Edinboro''' (born 26 December 1975), also known as '''Jamie Barnwell''', is an English association footballfootballer who played in the Premier League for Coventry City and in the Football League for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, Wigan Athletic and Cambridge United. He plays as a forward (association football)forward. He went on to play for a number of non-League football clubs, most recently for Hall Road Rangers whom he rejoined in October 2010.

Brian McClair.name: Brian McClair
Brian McClair.intro:
'''Brian John McClair''' (born 8 December 1963) is a Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer and director of youth academy at English side Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He will take over as the Performance Director of the Scottish Football Association in June 2015.
As a player he was a Forward (association football)forward from 1980 to 1998, notable for his near 11-year spell at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, as well as important tenures at ScotlandScottish clubs Celtic F.C.Celtic and Motherwell F.C.Motherwell. At Motherwell, he combined his football with studying mathematics at the University of Glasgow. He was nicknamed "Choccy", as his last name rhymed with the delicacy "Éclair (pastry)chocolate eclair".

Wim Jonk.name: Wim Jonk
Wim Jonk.intro: '''Wilhelmus "Wim" Maria Jonk''' (born 12 October 1966 in Volendam) is a retired NetherlandsDutch Association footballfootballer. At the height of his career, he also played for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team.

Peter Canero.name: Peter Canero
Peter Canero.intro: '''Peter Canero''' (born 18 January 1981) is a former ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer who played as a defender (football)defender and midfielder.

Justin Skinner (footballer, born 1972).name: Justin Skinner (footballer, born 1972)
Justin Skinner (footballer, born 1972).intro:
'''Justin Skinner''' (born 17 September 1972 in Dorking, Surrey, England) is a former EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball (soccer) player.
He started out as a trainee with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, but only made 2 appearances in the FA Premier LeaguePremier League, and was sent away on loan to A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. In 1996, he was sold to Aylesbury United F.C.Aylesbury United, spending 2 seasons there, before moving to Ebbsfleet United F.C.Gravesend & Northfleet. He had 2 spells with the club, split by a period when he was out of football.cite web
url=
title=mfc: Squad After spending 8 years at the club, he moved to Margate F.C.Margate, where he plays now.

Carlos Salcido.name: Carlos Salcido
Carlos Salcido.intro:
'''Carlos Arnoldo Salcido Flores''' (; born 2 April 1980) is a Mexican peopleMexican professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Liga MX club C.D. GuadalajaraGuadalajara. Mainly a midfielderdefensive midfielder, he can perform equally as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back, and Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
After emerging through C.D. GuadalajaraGuadalajara's youth system, he went on to be a mainstay for PSV Eindhoven, acting as Captain (association football)vice-captain for the Dutch team and was the first Mexican player to be champion in the Eredivise. Salcido also played a season for Fulham F.C.Fulham before returning to Mexico.
Internationally, Salcido competed with the Mexico national football teamMexico national team in three FIFA World CupWorld Cups: 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010, 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 and three CONCACAF Gold CupGold Cups: 2005 CONCACAF Gold Cup2005, 2007 CONCACAF Gold Cup2007, 2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup2011, He was part of the Mexican team that won the gold medal at the 2012 Summer Olympics. He made his first appearance at the age of 24 in 2004. In 2014, Salcido officially retired from the national team.

Jazz Richards.name: Jazz Richards
Jazz Richards.intro: '''Ashley Darel Jazz Richards''' (born 12 April 1991), known as '''Jazz Richards''', is a WalesWelsh Association footballfootballer who plays as a right back for Fulham F.C.Fulham on loan from Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. He is also capable of playing as a midfielder.

Bruce Dyer.name: Bruce Dyer
Bruce Dyer.intro:
'''Bruce Antonio Noel Emmanuel Dyer''' (born 13 April 1975) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)striker.
His career started in 1993 with Watford F.C.Watford, before he became the country's first £1 million-teenager when he joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1994. He spent five years with Palace, playing more than 100 games, and then another five years with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, before he returned to Watford. After leaving Watford in 2005 he played for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield and York City F.C.York City. Dyer also represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, and despite scoring four goals in 11 games, he was never cap (sport)capped at full level, and instead played one exhibition gamefriendly for Montserrat national football teamMontserrat against Ashford Town F.C. (Kent)Ashford Town in 2007.

Federico Fern\u00e1ndez.name: Federico Fernández
Federico Fern\u00e1ndez.intro:
'''Federico Fernández''' (; born 21 February 1989) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City and the Argentina national football team.
He began his career at Estudiantes de La Plata, where he reached the final of the Copa Sudamericana and won the Copa Libertadores, before moving to SSC NapoliNapoli in 2011. He was used sparingly by the Serie A club, and spent time on loan at Getafe CF, before joining Swansea in 2014.
Fernández made his full international debut in 2011 and has since earned over 30 international caps, scoring 3 goals. He was part of the Argentine squad which reached the 2014 FIFA World Cup Final.
Federico Fern\u00e1ndez.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mal Donaghy.name: Mal Donaghy
Mal Donaghy.intro: '''Malachy Martin "Mal" Donaghy''' (born 13 September 1957 in Belfast) is a former Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland international Association footballfootballer who played for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town.

Suso.name: Suso
Suso.intro:
'''Jesús Joaquín Fernández Sáenz de la Torre''' (born 19 November 1993), known as '''Suso''', is a Spanish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club A.C. MilanMilan as an attacking midfielder.
Scouted by English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as a teenager, he made his professional debut there in 2012, playing sparingly and spending a season on loan at UD Almería before joining Milan in January 2015.
Suso represented Spain at various youth levels up to Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21, winning the 2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship.

Daley Blind.name: Daley Blind
Daley Blind.intro:
'''Daley Blind''' (born 9 March 1990) is a NetherlandsDutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back and Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team. He is the son of former Ajax AmsterdamAjax defender Danny Blind.
Blind rose through the youth ranks at Ajax, becoming a regular after a loan to FC GroningenGroningen. In September 2014, he transferred to Manchester United for £13.8 million.
A full international since 2013, he has earned 25 caps and was a member of the Dutch squad that finished third at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Elvis Hammond.name: Elvis Hammond
Elvis Hammond.intro: '''Elvis Zark Hammond''' (born 6 October 1980) is a Ghanaian association footballfootballer who plays for Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian as a Forward (association football)Striker.

S\u00e1ndor Torghelle.name: Sándor Torghelle
S\u00e1ndor Torghelle.intro: '''Sándor Torghelle''' (; nicknamed as ''''The Lord of the Air'''; born 5 May 1982 in Budapest) is a HungaryHungarian football (soccer)footballer, who is playing for Hungarian top division side MTK Budapest.

Nacer Chadli.name: Nacer Chadli
Nacer Chadli.intro:
'''Nacer Chadli''' (; born 2 August 1989) is a Belgian professional association footballfootballer who plays for  Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
He began his career in the Dutch Eerste Divisie with AGOVV Apeldoorn, and in 2010 transferred to top-flight FC Twente, where he won the KNVB Cup in 2010–11 KNVB Cuphis first season. In 2013, Chadli joined Tottenham.
Chadli played an international for Morocco national football teamMorocco in 2010 but the following year switched  allegiance to Belgium, and has since earned over 25 caps and played at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Roque J\u00fanior.name: Roque Júnior
Roque J\u00fanior.intro: '''José Vítor Roque Jr.''' (; born 31 August 1976 in Santa Rita do Sapucaí) more commonly known as '''Roque Júnior''', is a former association footballer who played Defender (association football)defender. He last played for Ituano Futebol Clube. He has won 48 caps for Brazil national football teamBrazil and was part of the winning squad at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup.

Chris Gunter.name: Chris Gunter
Chris Gunter.intro:
'''Christopher Ross "Chris" Gunter''' (born 21 July 1989) is a Welsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Reading F.C.Reading, and the Wales national football teamWales national team as a Defender (association football)defender. An attacking full back, he is capable of playing on both flanks but usually plays on his preferred right side.
Born in Newport, WalesNewport, he joined Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City's youth system and was signed by Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur for £4 million in January 2008. Rarely used at Tottenham, he returned to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship with Nottingham Forest, initially on loan, before joining Reading in 2012.
Gunter has been a Welsh international since Wales national under-17 football teamunder-17 level and holds the record as the second youngest debutant for the Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 team. In 2007 he became the youngest player ever to play for the full Welsh team until Aaron Ramsey took that record. Gunter has earned 57 caps for Wales.

Stephen Wright (English footballer).name: Stephen Wright (English footballer)
Stephen Wright (English footballer).intro: '''Stephen John Wright''' (born 8 February 1980) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Aberystwyth Town F.C.Aberystwyth Town as a Defender (association football)defender.

Craig Gordon.name: Craig Gordon
Craig Gordon.intro:
'''Craig Anthony Gordon''' (born 31 December 1982) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Celtic F.C.Celtic.
Gordon started his career with Scottish Premier League side Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian (Hearts). After spending part of the 2001–02 season on loan to Scottish Second Division side Cowdenbeath F.C.Cowdenbeath, Gordon established himself in the Hearts first team in 2003 and helped the team win the 2005–06 Scottish Cup. He also became the regular goalkeeper for the Scotland national football team.
English Premier League club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland bought Gordon in 2007 for £9 million, which was a record fee paid by a British club for a goalkeeper. Gordon suffered serious injuries during his time with Sunderland and was released from his contract in 2012. After two years out of the professional game, Gordon signed for Celtic F.C.Celtic in July 2014.

Ognjen Koroman.name: Ognjen Koroman
Ognjen Koroman.intro: '''Ognjen Koroman''' (, ; born 19 September 1978 in Pale (town)Pale, SR Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia) is a SerbsSerbian former international association footballfootballer. He last played for FC Krylia Sovetov Samara. He represented Serbia and Montenegro at the 2006 FIFA World Cup.
Ognjen Koroman.birth_place: Pale (town)|Pale,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Tony Roberts.name: Tony Roberts
Tony Roberts.intro:
'''Anthony Mark "Tony" Roberts''' (born 4 August 1969) is a Welsh peopleWelsh former Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper.
Roberts was formerly the goalkeeping coach at Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers until he was suspended by John Gregory (footballer)John Gregory. He became a goalkeeper coach for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal's Arsenal F.C. Reservesyouth setup, a role he held from summer 2008. He then became a goalkeeping coach of their first team in 2011.

Craig Moore.name: Craig Moore
Craig Moore.intro:
'''Craig Andrew Moore''' (born 12 December 1975) is an Australian former Association footballfootball (soccer) player who played as a Defender (association football)defender. His 2006 FIFA World Cup profile describes him as being "[t]ough-tackling and uncompromising but also calm and composed under pressure."
Moore is best known for his two spells with Scottish Football League Premier DivisionScottish Premier Division / Scottish Premier League club Rangers F.C.Rangers. Having graduated through their youth system, he made 252 appearances for the Glasgow based club from 1993 to 2005, punctuated with a season in England with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in the 1998–99 Football League1998–99 Football League First DivisionFirst Division. In his time at Rangers he became team captain and won numerous domestic league and cup honours, including making 44 appearances and scoring four goals in their 2002–03 Rangers F.C. season2002–03 Treble-winning season.
After leaving Rangers on a free transfer in January 2005, Moore spent a half-season at German Bundesliga club Borussia Mönchengladbach, before moving to English Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. Released by Newcastle after an injury hit two seasons, Moore moved to his hometown club Brisbane Roar FCQueensland Roar (later renamed Brisbane Roar) in the Australian A-League, as their captain and A-League#Marquee playerMarquee player. After three seasons with the Roar, in January 2010 Moore moved to Super League GreeceGreek Super League side AO Kavala, only to leave in March.
In international football, Moore has made over 50 appearances for the Australia national association football teamAustralia national team, including at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cups in Germany and South Africa. Having made his debut in 1995, he has been List of Australian national association football team captainsAustralian team captain a number of times.

Ryan Babel.name: Ryan Babel
Ryan Babel.intro:
'''Ryan Guno Babel''' (; born 19 December 1986) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays for Kasımpaşa S.K.Kasımpaşa in the Turkish Süper Lig. He can play as a Forward (association football)striker or Winger (soccer)left winger.
Babel began his career at Ajax in 1998, working his way up through the youth team and into the senior squad. He played three seasons for the first team before he was transferred to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in mid-2007, where under three successive managers he failed to secure a regular first team position. Babel was sold to TSG 1899 Hoffenheim in January 2011, for a sum around half of that which Liverpool paid for him. His time at Hoffenheim was marred with disciplinary problems with three managers at the club. In the summer of 2012, Babel bought out the remaining final year of his contract, making him a free agent, and re-signed a one-year contract with Ajax. After this season, Babel went on to sign with Kasımpaşa on 21 June 2013.
Babel has been part of the Dutch national football team since 2005, and has represented his country at all youth team levels. He played in two World Cups, 2006 and 2010, reaching the final of the latter.

Lucien Mettomo.name: Lucien Mettomo
Lucien Mettomo.intro:
'''Lucien Mettomo''' (born 19 April 1977 in Douala) is a Cameroonian retired  Association footballfootballer. Formerly, he has played for Tonnerre Yaoundé, AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, 1. FC KaiserslauternKaiserslautern, Kayseri Erciyesspor and FC Luzern.
He was part of the Cameroon national football teamCameroon squad at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup and the 2004 African Nations Cup.
Mettomo made his name in France, playing for St. Étienne. In September 2001, he signed for Manchester City of the English Football League First DivisionFirst Division for a £1.5 million fee. His Manchester City debut came as a substitute in a 6–0 League Cup defeat of Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He played 23 league games that season, scoring once against Bradford, helping Manchester City to win the 2001–02 in English football2001–02 First Division Championship. The following season, Mettomo rarely featured in the first team due to the signing of Sylvain Distin. He made only four Premier League appearances, p473 and in the close season signed for Kaiserslautern of the Fußball-BundesligaBundesliga.
Mettomo went on trial with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in September 2007, but the club decided not to offer Mettomo a contract due to concerns over his fitness. Later that month, Mettomo signed a short term deal at English Championship side Southampton F.C.Southampton that would run until the end of the 2007–08 season; this contract was cancelled in January, however, due to Mettomo's inability to break into the first team.

Bo\u0161ko Balaban.name: Boško Balaban
Bo\u0161ko Balaban.intro:
'''Boško Balaban''' (born 15 October 1978) is a Croatian Association footballfootballer who last played for Selangor FA in the Malaysia Super League as a Forward (association football)striker until 2013 when his contract was not extended after a mutual agreement.
He is a former member of the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team.
Bo\u0161ko Balaban.birth_place: Rijeka,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Simon Royce.name: Simon Royce
Simon Royce.intro:
'''Simon Ernest Royce''' (born 9 September 1971 in Forest Gate, England) is a retired English Association footballfootballer currently at Brentford F.C.Brentford as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeping coach. Royce joined Gillingham F.C.Gillingham in April 2007 as an emergency loan signing after the Kent team were left with no fit goalkeepers for their final three matches of the seasoncite news
title = Royce plugs Gills goalkeeping gap
url =
publisher = BBC Sport
date = 19 April 2007
accessdate = 20 April 2007  and signed for the club on a permanent basis in August 2007.

Ronald Zubar.name: Ronald Zubar
Ronald Zubar.intro:
'''Ronald Zubar''' (born 20 September 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for New York Red Bulls as a Defender (association football)defender.
Zubar's efforts at French club SM CaenCaen earned him a move to Olympique MarseilleMarseille in 2006. His time at Marseille ended sourly though, after some individual errors saw fans turn against him and him relegated to the sidelines. He found an exit in Premier LeagueEnglish Premier League club Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, for whom he signed in 2009 and remained until 2013.

Stephen Jordan.name: Stephen Jordan
Stephen Jordan.intro: '''Stephen Robert Jordan''' (born 6 March 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town. He numbers Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United amongst his former clubs.

Fabi\u00e1n Caballero.name: Fabián Caballero
Fabi\u00e1n Caballero.intro:
'''Néstor Fabián Caballero''' (born 1 January 1978 in Misiones ProvinceMisiones, Argentina) commonly referred to as '''Tyson''', is an ArgentinaArgentine-SpainSpanish-Paraguayan
Association footballfootballer for Deportivo Recoleta in the Paraguayan Cuarta DivisiónParaguayan Primera División C.
Caballero has endured a 19-year career, playing in Argentina, Paraguay, England, Scotland, South Korea, Cyprus, Chile, Greece and Guatemala, and also playing in continental competitions such as the UEFA Intertoto Cup, the UEFA Cup, the Copa Libertadores and the Copa Sudamericana. In 1998, Caballero was loaned from Cerro Porteño to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal for the 1998–99 FA Premier League season, where he made a total of three appearances in all competitions. In 2000, Caballero signed with Scottish Premier League club Dundee F.C.Dundee, where he was present until 2005. He played in the 2001 UEFA Intertoto Cup and finished as runners-up in the 2002–03 Scottish Cup, after a 1–0 loss against Rangers F.C.Rangers in the 2003 Scottish Cup Finalfinal on 31 May 2003. Caballero scored 27 goals in 128 appearances in all competitions for Dundee.
Caballero was leading goal scorer of the Torneo Apertura during the 2000 Paraguayan Primera División season with 13 goals whilst playing for Club Sol de América.
Caballero is also a coach (sport)coach who began at Sportivo Ameliano in 2012, working with the club's U16, U18 and reserve-teams, he later became a Player-coach whilst playing for the club's first-team in 2014.

Terry Hurlock.name: Terry Hurlock
Terry Hurlock.intro: '''Terence Alan''' "'''Terry'''" '''Hurlock''' (born 22 September 1958) is an English former professional football (soccer)football Central Midfieldercentral midfielder. Over the course of a 15-year career in the The Football LeagueFootball League, he had notable spells with Brentford F.C.Brentford and Millwall F.C.Millwall and won England b national football teamEngland B international caps while with the latter club. In a Football League 125th anniversary poll, Hurlock was rated the fifth greatest-ever Brentford player and the club's fifth-greatest captain. A physical player, Hurlock received seven Red card (football)red cards during his career and in 2007 was rated by The Times as the 23rd hardest player in football.

Siem de Jong.name: Siem de Jong
Siem de Jong.intro:
'''Siem de Jong''' (; born 28 January 1989) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder or striker for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
De Jong was born in Aigle, Switzerland, to Dutch parents and moved back to the Netherlands at age six.  Prior to joining Newcastle he played in the youth academy of De Graafschap and AFC AjaxAjax. He made his professional debut for the Amsterdam-based side and would go on to become the club's Captain (association football)captain as the team won a record four consecutive Eredivisie titles from 2010 to 2014. His younger brother Luuk de JongLuuk plays for PSV Eindhoven.

Martin Djetou.name: Martin Djetou
Martin Djetou.intro: '''Martin Okelo Djetou''' (born 15 December 1974) is a former Association footballfootballer.

Robert Hall.name: Robert Hall
Robert Hall.intro: '''Robert Kieran Dennis Hall''' (born 20 October 1993) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons on loan from Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Hall plays as a forward (association football)forward or Midfielder#Wingeron the wing, During his time as a young player at West Ham, Hall spent time on loan at Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, Birmingham City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers before finally signing for Bolton on a permanent basis.

Henrik Larsson.name: Henrik Larsson
Henrik Larsson.intro:
'''Henrik Edward Larsson''', Order of the British EmpireMBE (; born 20 September 1971) is a Swedish association footballfootball coach and former professional player, who is currently the Manager (association football)manager of Allsvenskan club Helsingborgs IF. He was known as an excellent striker whose main attributes were his goal scoring prowess and on-field intelligence.
Larsson began his career with Högaborgs BK. He moved to Helsingborgs IF, where he was one of the key players when they won promotion to the Allsvenskan in 1993. Larsson then moved to Feyenoord for four years before leaving for Celtic F.C.Celtic in 1997. He won four league titles in seven years with Celtic, scoring a remarkable 242 goals in 315 competitive matches before moving to FC Barcelona in 2004, where he won two league titles and the 2006 UEFA Champions League Final2006 Champions League. Following the expiration of his contract at Barcelona, Larsson returned to his hometown club of Helsingborgs IFHelsingborg, and joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United on a brief loan between January and March 2007. He announced his retirement from football on 20 October 2009.
Larsson played for Sweden national football teamSweden in three FIFA World CupWorld Cups and three UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championships and is a former captain of the national team. Larsson ended his international career with 37 goals in 106 matches. Larsson has also played competitive floorball since 1989.

Neil Clement.name: Neil Clement

He participated in a club record three promotions. His customary position was in defence, but he was also a versatile player who occupied several different positions for Albion. Clement made 300 appearances for Albion in all competitions, the most of any Albion player in the 2000s and more than any other Albion player in the 21st century thus far.Irrespective of whether the century began in 2000 or 2001 He was also known as a set piece specialist, having scored several goals from free-kicks and penalties. Later in his career, Clement was affected by knee injuries and was forced to retire in January 2010.

Sol Campbell.name: Sol Campbell
Sol Campbell.intro:
'''Sulzeer Jeremiah''' "'''Sol'''" '''Campbell''' (born 18 September 1974) is a former England national football teamEngland international association footballfootballer.  A Defender (association football)central defender, he had a 19-year career playing in the Premier League and an 11-year international career.
Born in North East (London sub region)east London to Jamaican parents, he began his career with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in December 1992.  He spent nine years at Spurs, scoring 10 goals in 255 appearances, and captain (association football)captaining the team to victory in the 1999 Football League Cup Final against Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. In 2001 he joined Tottenham's North London derbyNorth London rivals Arsenal F.C.Arsenal on a free transfer, and as a result remained a hated figure amongst many Spurs supporters for the rest of his career. In his five years and 195 appearances at Arsenal he won two Premier League winners medals and two FA Cup winners medals, encompassing the 2001–02 league and FA Cup Double (association football)double, and being part of the team that became known as ''The Invincibles (football)The Invincibles'' for their undefeated 2003–04 Arsenal F.C. season2003–04 Premier League campaign. He scored Arsenal's only goal in their 2–1 defeat to FC BarcelonaBarcelona in the 2006 UEFA Champions League Final. In August 2006 he joined Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth on a free transfer; his three years with the club included captaining them to victory in the 2008 FA Cup Final. At the end of the 2008–09 season he made the surprise move of dropping down three levels of the English football league systemEnglish football pyramid to join Football League TwoLeague Two side Notts County F.C.Notts County on a free transfer. He left the club by mutual consent in September 2009, having played just one game for the club. The next year he made a brief return to Arsenal, before ending his career with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
Having already won caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s and England B national football teamEngland B team, he gained his first full cap for England aged 21. In May 1998 Campbell became what was then England's second-youngest captain, after Bobby Moore, aged 23 years 248 days. In 2006 he become the only player to have represented England in six consecutive major tournaments, playing in the UEFA Euro 19961996, UEFA Euro 20002000 and UEFA Euro 20042004 European Championships, and the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998, 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 and 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cups. He was named in the Teams of the Tournament for the 2002 World Cup and 2004 European Championship. Other honours in the game include being in the PFA Team of the Year three times (1999, 2003, and 2004).

His favoured position was left back but he could also play in central defence or in midfield. He is one of the very few players to have played for both Newcastle United and Sunderland F.C.Sunderland.

Mendieta played 40 times with the Spain national football teamSpanish national team, appearing with it in one FIFA World CupWorld Cup and one UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship.

Steven Gerrard.name: Steven Gerrard
Steven Gerrard.intro:
'''Steven George Gerrard''',  (born 30 May 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for and Captain (association football)captains Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. He has played much of his career as a central midfielder, but he has also been used as a Second strikersecond Forward (association football)striker, holding midfielder, attacking midfielder, right back  and Winger (soccer)right winger.
Gerrard has spent his List of one-club menentire career at Anfield, making his debut in 1998, cementing his place in the first team in 2000, and succeeding Sami Hyypiä as Captain (association football)team captain in 2003. His honours include two FA Cups, three Football League CupLeague Cups, one UEFA Champions League, one UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup, and two UEFA Super Cups. He has signed a contract to join Major League SoccerMLS club LA Galaxy in July 2015, following the conclusion of the 2014–15 season with Liverpool.
Gerrard made his international debut for the England national football team in 2000, and represented his country at the UEFA Euro 20002000, UEFA Euro 20042004 and UEFA Euro 20122012 UEFA European Football Championships, as well as the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups – captaining the team at the latter two tournaments. He was named as the permanent England captain shortly before UEFA Euro 2012, where he was named in the UEFA Euro 2012#AwardsUEFA Team of the Tournament. Gerrard became the sixth player to win List of footballers with 100 or more caps100 caps for England in 2012, and is currently third in the country's England national football team#Most capped playersall time appearance list. He ended his international career in July 2014, having won 114 caps.
Regarded to be one of the best English footballers of his generation,[
Zinedine Zidane said in 2009 that he considered Gerrard to be the best footballer in the world. In 2005, Gerrard was honoured as the UEFA Club Footballer of the Year and won the Ballon d'OrBallon d'Or Bronze Award. He has also been named in the PFA Team of the Year a record eight times, the UEFA Team of the Year and FIFPro World XIFIFA World XI three times, and was named PFA Players' Player of the Year in 2006 and the FWA Footballer of the Year in 2009. He is, to date, the only footballer ever to have scored a goal in an 2006 FA Cup FinalFA Cup Final, a 2003 Football League Cup FinalLeague Cup Final, a 2001 UEFA Cup FinalUEFA Cup Final and a 2005 UEFA Champions League FinalChampions League Final.

K\u00e5re Ingebrigtsen.name: Kåre Ingebrigtsen

'''Kåre Hedley "Bruttern" Ingebrigtsen''' (born 11 November 1965 in Trondheim) is a former NorwayNorwegian association footballfootballer. He played as a midfielder.
During his career he played for Rosenborg BK, Lillestrøm SK, Manchester City F.C., and Strømsgodset IF as a midfielder. He earned 23 caps for the Norway national football team.
He made 17 appearances for Manchester City, scoring three goals, all of them in an FA Cup match against Leicester City F.C. on 8 January 1994.
He is currently the coach of Rosenborg BK. In 2007 he coached Ranheim Fotball and was the assistant coach of Rosenborg BK.
His nickname, ''Bruttern'', means the brother, i. e. the best pal of Mini Jakobsen.

Alex Rae (footballer, born 1969).name: Alex Rae (footballer, born 1969)
Alex Rae (footballer, born 1969).intro:
'''Alexander Scott''' "'''Alex'''" '''Rae''' (born 30 September 1969 in Glasgow) is a Scottish former professional association footballfootballer. He began his youth career at Rangers F.C.Rangers and started his senior career at Falkirk F.C.Falkirk. During his footballer career, Alex Rae played for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Dundee F.C.Dundee, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons. Back from rehab clinic for alcoholism in 1998, he was with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and played regularly in the top flight until September 2001. He then joined Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, and quickly became the key player in the team, winning the fans' player of the season award. In 2002, he helped the team back into the Premier League, and had his best seasonal tally with 8 goals. He then went back to Scotland, joined Rangers F.C.Rangers where he started his youth career in May 2004,Cite news

Craig Forrest.name: Craig Forrest
Craig Forrest.intro:
'''Craig Lorne Forrest''' (born 20 September 1967) is a Canadian former professional association footballsoccer player and  sports sportscastercommentator.

He made Premier League appearances for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, whilst also spending time on loan in the Football League with Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. He holds the unfortunate record of letting in the most goals in a Premier League game when Ipswich were beaten Manchester United F.C. 9–0 Ipswich Town F.C.9–0 by Manchester United in March 1995. He made 56 international appearances, representing Canada national football teamCanada. In 2012 as part of the Canadian Soccer Association's centennial celebration, he was named to the all-time Canada XI men's team.[

Brian McBride.intro:
'''Brian Robert McBride''' (born June 19, 1972) is a retired American association footballsoccer player who played for the Columbus Crew, Fulham F.C. and the Chicago Fire SCChicago Fire and is the fourth highest all-time leading goalscorer for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.  For much of his career he played in Europe, notably for Fulham F.C.Fulham in the English Premier League.
During his time in London, McBride became a fan-favourite as well as team Captain (association football)captain; after leaving the club, Fulham renamed the sports bar at Craven Cottage ''McBride's'' in his honour.

Phil King.name: Phil King
Phil King.intro:
'''Philip Geoffrey King''' (born 28 December 1967) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer. He represented England national football teamEngland at Under-21 level and in a B international. He was born in Bristol.
King began his career as an apprentice with Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, turning professional in January 1985, and making his league debut the same season. After 27 games for the Grecians, he moved to Torquay United F.C.Torquay United in July 1986 for a fee of £3,000 instantly fitting in as a regular in Stuart Morgan's struggling side.  However, in February 1987, after 24 league games in which he scored 3 times, he was sold to Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town for £25,000 with United desperately short of players and with no money to spend, Mark Gardiner and Charlie Henry (footballer born 1962)Charlie Henry (on loan) coming in the opposite direction.
At Swindon, his career really took off, culminating in England Under-21 honours and a £400,000 move to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in November 1989, after 116 games (four goals) for the Robins. He made his Owls' debut on 4 November and settled well into playing higher level football, although Wednesday were relegated to Football League Division TwoDivision Two at the end of the season. The following season, he played at Wembley in 1991, when Wednesday won the Football League CupLeague Cup, beating Manchester United F.C.Manchester United 1-0 in the final, and played his part in Wednesday's instant return to the top flight. After losing his place to Andy Sinton, King went to Notts County F.C.Notts County on loan in October 1993, and joined his former Wednesday manager Ron Atkinson at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa for a fee of £250,000 in August 1994.
After an impressive start to his Villa Park career, including scoring the winning penalty in a UEFA Cup tie against Inter Milan, he lost his place at left-back to Shaun Teale (normally a central defender) when Brian Little (footballer)Brian Little was appointed manager, and moved further out of the first team picture after the signing of Alan Wright from Blackburn Rovers. He joined West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion on loan in October 1995, but two months later suffered a serious cruciate ligament injury in the Baggies' game against Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, which took him 17 months to recover from, and meant his knee would never be fully fit again.
He eventually returned to fitness and became a regular in Villa's reserve side until leaving in March 1997 to rejoin Swindon Town on a free transfer. However, he fell out with the manager Steve McMahon (footballer)Steve McMahon, and other than a loan spell at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and more time out with injuries, mainly just saw action on the training ground until a free transfer move to Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in March 1999. He played only three times for the Seagulls, before being released at the end of the season.
He spent the following pre-season with Chester City F.C.Chester City and was offered a monthly contract, but instead decided to join Football ConferenceConference side Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers in August 1999, helping them to the Conference title the following season. It appeared that King he would return to the Football League with Kidderminster, but he moved to Bath City F.C.Bath City on a free transfer in July 2000,[
In March 2004, King came out of retirement to play for Cinderford Town F.C.Cinderford Town, answering an SOS call from manager Phil Mullen.[
Although King is currently retired from football he still runs out for the Aston Villa side in the annual Masters Football Tournament and he is currently still involved with Swindon Town. King currently commentates on Swindon Town matches for BBC Radio Wiltshire.
He remains a cult hero with many Aston Villa F.C.Villa fans as a result of his famous winning penalty in the shootout against Inter Milan.

Neil Lennon.name: Neil Lennon
Neil Lennon.intro:
'''Neil Francis Lennon''' (born 25 June 1971)[
During his playing career he represented English clubs Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. Lennon moved to Scottish club Celtic F.C.Celtic in 2000, where he made over 200 appearances and was appointed captain (association football)captain in 2005. Before retiring as a player, he returned to England to represent Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. Lennon made 40 appearances for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland in nine years, scoring two goals.
Lennon was appointed Manager (association football)manager of Celtic in March 2010, initially in a caretaker capacity after the departure of Tony Mowbray.[

Darren Sheridan.name: Darren Sheridan
Darren Sheridan.intro:
'''Darren Stephen Sheridan''' (born 8 December 1967) is an English Association footballfootballer and manager. As a player, Sheridan played as a centre midfielder. He has had one spell as a player-manager, with Barrow A.F.C.Barrow, before managing Salford City F.C.Salford City. He is currently Chief Scout at Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle.
Sheridan began his career at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, with whom he played in the Premier League in 1997–98 FA Premier League1997–98. He then spent time with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, before moving to Scotland for three years with Clyde F.C.Clyde and St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone. He moved back to England with Conference North club Barrow A.F.C.Barrow in January 2007, and was made co-manager with Dave Bayliss in December 2007. As joint managers, Sheridan and Bayliss won the Conference North in their first season, and the FA Trophy in 2010 FA Trophy Final2010. Sheridan left the club for personal reasons in February 2012. After a very brief spell with Radcliffe Borough F.C.Radcliffe Borough, Sheridan joined Droylsden F.C.Droylsden of the Conference North.

Martin Carruthers.name: Martin Carruthers
Martin Carruthers.intro: '''Martin George Carruthers''' (born 7 August 1972) is a former English association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward who played for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, York City F.C.York City, Darlington F.C.Darlington, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, Boston United F.C.Boston United, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United.

Jason Puncheon.name: Jason Puncheon
Jason Puncheon.intro: '''Jason David Ian Puncheon''' (born 26 June 1986) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays in midfield for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He is able to play on the left or right wing and sometimes plays just behind the striker. Following his goal against Everton F.C.Everton on his Blackpool F.C.Blackpool debut, he has scored in every division of English league football, scoring for Barnet F.C.Barnet in Football League TwoLeague Two, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons and Southampton F.C.Southampton in Football League OneLeague One, Millwall F.C.Millwall in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Crystal Palace in the Premier League.

Owen Hargreaves.name: Owen Hargreaves
Owen Hargreaves.intro:
'''Owen Lee Hargreaves''' (born 20 January 1981) is an English former association footballfootballer. Hargreaves was known as a hard-working and "solid defensive midfielder who worked tirelessly to win the ball" and provide his teammates with possession. Born in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, Hargreaves played with Calgary Foothills as a youth before beginning his professional football career in Germany with FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. After seven years with the Munich side – during which time he won four BundesligaGerman league titles and the 2000–01 UEFA Champions League – Hargreaves signed for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 2007, winning the Premier League and UEFA Champions League in his first season.
However, his time at Manchester United was plagued with injuries and he was allowed to leave the club at the end of his contract in June 2011. Hargreaves posted YouTube videos in a bid to convince potential suitors of his fitness, and in August 2011, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City offered a one-year contract to Hargreaves, which he accepted. As a Canadian citizen with a Welsh mother and an English father, Hargreaves was eligible to represent Canada men's national soccer teamCanada, Wales national football teamWales or England. He opted to play for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U-21 team in 2000 and was cap (sport)capped by the senior squad the following year. He is the only player to have played for England without having previously lived in the United Kingdom, and only the second after Joe Baker, to have done so without having previously played in the English football league system. He is now a regular pundit for BT Sport's and Sky Deutschland's football coverage.

Lawrie Dudfield.name: Lawrie Dudfield
Lawrie Dudfield.intro: '''Lawrence George Dudfield''' (born 7 May 1980) is an English former professional association footballfootballer. He played for many clubs, including Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town, Leicester City, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Southend United F.C.Southend United and Boston United F.C.Boston United, and had loan spells with Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield. He currently is employed as a Community Manager at Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest as well as launching his own company, Iconz Experience, who are an events company specialising in using ex International and Premier League footballers.

Cameron Jerome.name: Cameron Jerome
Cameron Jerome.intro:
'''Cameron Zishan Rana-Jerome''' (born 14 August 1986), known as '''Cameron Jerome''', is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City as a Forward (association football)striker. He earned 10 cap (sport)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team.
Jerome began his career as a trainee with Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough before signing a professional contract with Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in the summer of 2004. He quickly became a regular at Ninian Park and after scoring 20 goals in 2005–06 Cardiff City F.C. season2005–06 he was signed by Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for a fee of £3 million. He spent five years at St Andrew's (stadium)St Andrew's where he experience two promotions and two relegations and also helped the side win the 2011 Football League Cup Final2011 Football League Cup. He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2011 for a fee of around £4 million and was mainly used as an impact player by Tony Pulis. After not figuring in new manager Mark Hughes' plans Jerome joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace on loan for the 2013–14 Crystal Palace F.C. season2013–14 season. Jerome joined Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in August 2014.

Sixto Peralta.name: Sixto Peralta
Sixto Peralta.intro: '''Sixto Raimundo "Mumo" Peralta Salso''' (born 16 April 1979 in Comodoro Rivadavia) is an Argentine association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Chilean club C.D. Universidad de ConcepciónUniversidad de Concepción.

Jason McAteer.name: Jason McAteer
Jason McAteer.intro: '''Jason Wynne McAteer''' (born 18 June 1971) is a retired professional footballer, who represented the Republic of Ireland at international level. His primary position was in centre midfield, though he was an able right winger and full back. During his career, McAteer played for five professional clubs, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and finally Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, as well as winning over 50 international caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. His total transfer values reach over £9 million. He announced his retirement from professional football on 12 June 2007.

Gary Crosby.name: Gary Crosby
Gary Crosby.intro:
'''Gary Crosby''' began his senior career at Lincoln United F.C.Lincoln United. In his teenage years, he had been one of the most promising players in the Lincoln area and regularly appeared for Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City's youth and reserve sides. A slight but skilful player, it was often felt his physique would prevent him turning professional. He was finally given an opportunity in the professional ranks when he joined Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City on non-contract terms in September 1987. However, in a struggling team he found it difficult to make an impact and made just seven appearances for the Imps before rejoining Lincoln United. In 1988, Crosby came to the attention of Grantham Town F.C.Grantham Town manager Martin O'Neill while playing for the Lincolnshire County FA side and was soon signed by Grantham on a free transfer. He made just nine appearances for the Gingerbreads, scoring twice, before joining Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest for £20,000 (a club record) in December 1987 where he went on to make 152 appearances, scoring 12 goals, during a seven-year career at the City Ground.
During his time at Forest, Crosby spent three games on-loan at Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, during the 1993/94 season, before joining Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town on a free transfer in 1994. Crosby made just 44 appearances for the club, scoring six goals. His spell at the Yorkshire club included an appearance at Wembley in the playoff final. The 1997/98 season saw him play a handful of times for Rushden and Diamonds F.C.Rushden and Diamonds and he returned to Lincoln United F.C.Lincoln United for the start of the 1998/99 season.

Nick Crittenden.name: Nick Crittenden
Nick Crittenden.intro: '''Nicholas John Crittenden''' (born 11 November 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielderright midfielder for Dorchester Town F.C.Dorchester Town in the Southern Football LeagueSouthern Football League Premier and also is the club's assistant manager.

Glenn Hoddle.name: Glenn Hoddle
Glenn Hoddle.intro:
'''Glenn Hoddle''' (born 27 October 1957) is an English former Association footballfootballer and Manager (association football)manager who played as a midfielder for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, AS Monaco FCAS Monaco, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and at international level for England national football teamEngland. He was most recently first team coach at Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers having been appointed, on a part time basis, to assist Harry Redknapp in the summer of 2014. However, following Redknapp's resignation in February 2015, Hoddle also left the club.
In 2007 he was inducted into the National Football Museum English Football Hall of FameHall of Fame which cited him as one of the most gifted English footballers of his generation exhibiting "sublime balance and close control, unrivalled passing and vision and extraordinary shooting ability, both from open play and set pieces".[
He has been manager of Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town (earning promotion to the Premier League), Chelsea F.C.Chelsea (taking them to the 1994 FA Cup FinalFA Cup final), Southampton F.C.Southampton, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur (reaching a Football League CupLeague Cup final) and most recently Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
As manager, he took England to the 1998 FIFA World CupWorld Cup second round in 1998 only to lose to Argentina national football teamArgentina on penalties.
He is currently running the Glenn Hoddle Academy in Spain, set up to help young British players return to professional football after being released by their clubs. Hoddle's younger brother Carl HoddleCarl was also a footballer and died at the age of 40 from a brain aneurysm on 2 March 2008.

Jason Blunt.name: Jason Blunt
Jason Blunt.intro: '''Jason John Blunt''' (born August 16, 1977), He was born in Penzance, Cornwall, is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played in Midfielder (football)Midfielder. He is a current coach of Leeds United under 18's.

Des Walker.name: Des Walker
Des Walker.intro: '''Desmond Sinclair "Des" Walker''' (born 26 November 1965 in Homerton, London) is a former England England national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who is best remembered for his spells with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.

Joe Sheerin.name: Joe Sheerin
Joe Sheerin.intro:
'''Joe Sheerin''' (born 1 February 1979 in Hammersmith, London) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and in the Football League for A.F.C. Bournemouth.
Sheerin began his career as a trainee with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, turning professional in August 1996. He made his league debut, as a last minute substitute for Gianfranco Zola in the 1–0 win away to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon on 22 April 1997. This turned out to be his only appearance for Chelsea, giving him the record for the shortest Premier LeaguePremiership career.
He left Chelsea in February 2002, joining A.F.C. BournemouthAFC Bournemouth, and scored a spectacular hooked goal on his home debut against Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He left Dean Court by mutual consent in October 2000, joining non-league Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian. In the summer of 2002 Sheerin attended trials for AFC Wimbledon and was made captain of the newly formed side. He became a firm favourite with the fans as the Dons rose through the non-league pyramid. He left in June 2005, after scoring 35 times in 85 first team appearances, joining Croydon Athletic F.C.Croydon Athletic. He left Croydon in December 2005, briefly returning to AFC Wimbledon, before moving on to Leatherhead F.C.Leatherhead in 2006.
He was sent off in the Preliminary round of the FA Cup against Dartford FC on 1 September 2007 for throwing a punch. Leatherhead went on to lose the game 3-0.

Robert Snodgrass.name: Robert Snodgrass
Robert Snodgrass.intro:
'''Robert Snodgrass''' (born 7 September 1987) is a Scottish peopleScottish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a Winger (soccer)winger, comfortable playing on either side of the pitch. He can also play as a forward (association football)forward. After playing for Scotland at various youth levels including under-21s, Snodgrass received a call up to the Scotland national football teamScotland national team side in 2009, and won his first cap in February 2011.
Snodgrass started his senior career with Livingston F.C.Livingston. He also had a loan spell at Stirling Albion F.C.Stirling Albion before moving to England in 2008, joining Leeds United F.C.Leeds United. He helped Leeds win promotion to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship in 2010. In February 2012, Snodgrass was appointed Captain (association football)captain of Leeds, but he rejected a new contract offer and moved to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in July.

Facundo Sava.name: Facundo Sava
Facundo Sava.intro: '''Facundo Sava''' (born 7 March 1974) is an ArgentinaArgentine former Association footballfootballer. He played 17 years of professional football, mainly in Argentina, but also with spells in La LigaSpain and Premier LeagueEngland. Outside his country, Sava is best known for his goal celebration where he donned a mask which was stored in one of his socks.[
Facundo Sava.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Vlad Chiriche\u0219.name: Vlad Chiricheș
Vlad Chiriche\u0219.intro: '''Vlad Iulian Chiricheș''' (; born 14 November 1989) is a Romanian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for English Premier League club Tottenham HotspurSpurs and the Romania national football teamRomanian national team.
Vlad Chiriche\u0219.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Nick Henry.name: Nick Henry
Nick Henry.intro: '''Nick Henry''' (born 21 February 1969 in Liverpool, England) is a retired English footballer. He played as a midfielder, and spent most of his career at Oldham Athletic.

Tommy Widdrington.name: Tommy Widdrington
Tommy Widdrington.intro:
'''Thomas''' "'''Tommy'''" '''Widdrington''' (born 1 October 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer, turned football manager, who is the manager of Conference South side Eastbourne Borough F.C.Eastbourne Borough. As a midfielder, he racked up 372 appearances in the Football League in a 15-year career, before spending five years in non-league football.
His career began at Southampton F.C.Southampton in 1990, where he spent the first six years of his career. In 1996 he moved to Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, helping the "Mariners" to the Football League Trophy trophy and promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in 1998 Football League Second Division play-off Final1998. The next year he moved on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale for a two-year spell. Voted the club's Port Vale F.C. Player of the YearPlayer of the Year in 2000, he captained the "Valiants" to the Football League Trophy in 2001 Football League Trophy Final2001. Later in the year he was transferred to Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, helping the club to win promotion out of Football League TwoLeague Two in 2002–03, before he moved on to Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town. In 2005 his career in the Football League ended back at Port Vale. He then spent 2005 to 2010 at non-league Salisbury City F.C.Salisbury City. As a player he enjoyed promotion four times with three different clubs, and lifted the Football League Trophy twice.
Player-manager at Salisbury City F.C.Salisbury City for the 2009–10 season, he returned to the Football League at Southend United F.C.Southend United, as assistant manager but left the position in December 2010. He was appointed Hemel Hempstead Town F.C.Hemel Hempstead Town manager in October 2011, before he was put it charge at Eastbourne Borough F.C.Eastbourne Borough in February 2012.

Alex Song.name: Alex Song
Alex Song.intro:
'''Alexandre Dimitri Song Billong''' (born 9 September 1987), better known as '''Alex Song''', is a Cameroonian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, on loan from SpainSpanish club FC Barcelona,  and formerly for the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team. He plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral or Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder, and can also play as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Originally a utility player on the fringes of the first team, Song quickly became an integral part of Arsenal's starting eleven during the preseason to the 2008–09 campaign. He played for Cameroon in the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cups.[
