David Wheater.name: David Wheater
David Wheater.intro:
'''David James Wheater''' (born 14 February 1987 in Redcar, England) is an English footballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He is a Defender (association football)centre back, although he is capable of playing at Defender (association football)#Full backright back as well.
Wheater started his professional career at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 2004, having graduated through the club's youth teams. He had three loan spells away from Middlesbrough during the 2006–07 season; at Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Darlington F.C.Darlington (loan). An injury to Jonathan Woodgate at the start of the following season saw Wheater become a regular player for Middlesbrough, and he would make a total of 140 league appearances for the club before switching to current club Bolton Wanderers in January 2011.
Wheater has represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-18 football teamunder-18, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, but is yet to make his senior debut for his country.
David Wheater.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Andy Wilkinson.name: Andy Wilkinson
Andy Wilkinson.intro:
'''Andrew Gordon''' "'''Andy'''" '''Wilkinson''' (born 6 August 1984) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Wilkinson joined Stoke City's academy from his local club Stone Dominoes F.C.Stone Dominoes and made his professional debut in October 2001. Since then Wilkinson has gradually worked his way into the first team and after four loan moves and a number of injury problems had restricted his career. He broke into the side during the 2007–08 Stoke City F.C. season2007–08 season in which Stoke were promoted to the Premier League. He helped Stoke establish themselves in the top-flight in 2008–09 Stoke City F.C. season2008–09 and 2009–10 Stoke City F.C. season2009–10 and he played in the 2011 FA Cup Final which Stoke lost 1–0 to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He played in the UEFA Europa League in 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12 as Stoke again finished in mid-table. He remained in the side in 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 under Tony Pulis before Mark Hughes was appointed manager in May 2013 and Wilkinson became a fringe member of the squad. After failing to regain his place in the first team in 2014–15 Stoke City F.C. season2014–15, Wilkinson joined Millwall F.C.Millwall on loan.
Andy Wilkinson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Ian Durrant.name: Ian Durrant
Ian Durrant.intro: '''Ian Durrant''' (born 29 October 1966 in Glasgow) is a former ScotlandScottish professional football (soccer)footballer who played for Rangers F.C.Rangers, Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.

Mesca.name: Mesca
Mesca.intro: '''Buomesca Tué Na Bangna''' (born 6 May 1993), commonly known as '''Mesca''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham as a midfielder.

Jos\u00e9 Kl\u00e9berson.name: José Kléberson
Jos\u00e9 Kl\u00e9berson.intro: '''José Kléberson Pereira''' (born 19 June 1979), commonly known as '''José Kléberson''' or simply '''Kléberson''', is a Football in BrazilBrazilian footballer who plays as a midfielder for American club Indy Eleven. He has played in 32 internationals and was a member of the Brazil national football teamBrazil squad that won the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

Neil Cutler.name: Neil Cutler
Neil Cutler.intro: '''Neil Anthony Cutler''' (born 3 September 1976 in Perton) is an English Goalkeeper Coach and former Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper who retired in September 2007. He re-registered as a player in November 2010 for Bury F.C.Bury. He last played for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, whom he joined just a couple of days before the 2005–06 season got under way. He is a former England Youth International and a graduated member of the Lilleshall National School of Excellence.

Andy Welsh.name: Andy Welsh
Andy Welsh.intro: '''Andrew Peter David "Andy" Welsh''' (born 24 November 1983) is a Manchester-born English Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a midfielder for Farsley AFC. Welsh plays for Scotland national football teamScotland and has played for the Under-19 side.

Steve Marlet.name: Steve Marlet
Steve Marlet.intro: '''Steve Marlet''' (born 10 January 1974 in Pithiviers) is a retired French Association footballfootballer and coach, who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He was cap (sport)capped 23 times and scored six goals for the France national football teamFrench national team, winning the Confederations Cup in 2001 and 2003 and featuring at Euro 2004.
Steve Marlet.position: Forward  association football  Forward,Midfielder Winger Winger

Lars Bohinen.name: Lars Bohinen
Lars Bohinen.intro: '''Lars Roar Bohinen''' (born 8 September 1969 in Vadsø) is a NorwayNorwegian former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1986 until 2005 notably in the English Premier League for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Derby County F.C.Derby County.

Patrick Blondeau.name: Patrick Blondeau
Patrick Blondeau.intro: '''Patrick Blondeau''' (born 27 January 1968) is a former international Association footballfootballer who played in Ligue 1 and the Premier League.

Lee Norfolk.name: Lee Norfolk
Lee Norfolk.intro:
'''Lee Norfolk''' (born 17 October 1975 in Dunedin) is a New Zealand football (soccer) player who represented his country at junior level, scoring one goal in a 3-0 win over Fiji in Napier in 1991.
He was the first New Zealander to play in the FA Premier League. After graduating from the Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town youth team, he made 4 appearances for the first team, the first of which was at home to Southampton F.C.Southampton in the FA Premier League on 25 February 1995.
Norfolk went back to his native New Zealand for a period with North Shore United before returning to England where he played for A.F.C. SudburySudbury, Needham Market FCNeedham, Halstead Town F.C.Halstead and Diss Town F.C.Diss Town.
Norfolk coaches Leiston FC who have won 3 championships in 3 years.

Francis Benali.name: Francis Benali
Francis Benali.intro: '''Francis Vincent Benali''' (born 30 December 1968) is an English professional association footballfootballer and coach who spent most of his playing career at Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Kevin Scott.name: Kevin Scott
Kevin Scott.intro:
'''Kevin Watson Scott''' (born 17 December 1966) is an English former Defender (association football)football defender. He played over 300 games in the Football League for six different clubs.
Starting his career with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 1984, he spent ten years with the club, playing as captain during the 1991–92 season, and helped the club to the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division title in 1992–93. A big money move to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur followed in February 1994. However he did not settle at the club, and instead spent the majority of his three years at the club on loan at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He made the move to Norwich permanent in 1997, spending two years at the club before leaving the professional game in 1999, shortly after a loan spell with Darlington F.C.Darlington.

Ben Hutchinson.name: Ben Hutchinson
Ben Hutchinson.intro: '''Benjamin Lloyd Phillip "Ben" Hutchinson''' (born 27 November 1987) is an English Association footballfootballer who last played for Nuneaton Town F.C.Nuneaton Town as a Forward (association football)striker.

Victor Obinna.name: Victor Obinna
Victor Obinna.intro: '''Victor Nsofor Obinna''' (born 25 March 1987 in Jos, Nigeria) is a Nigerian Association footballfootballer who plays as a second striker for  FC Lokomotiv Moscow of the Russian Premier League. He is not currently registered to play with the league office.

David Hopkin.name: David Hopkin
David Hopkin.intro:
'''David Hopkin''' (born 21 August 1970 in Greenock) is a ScotlandScottish former professional Association footballfootballer who is the assistant head coach at Livingston F.C.Livingston. He was formerly the reserve team manager at Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton.
As a player he was a midfielder from 1989 until 2003 notably in the English Premier League with spells with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. He also played in the Football League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and started and finished his career in his native Scotland with Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton. He earned 7 caps for Scotland national football teamScotland, scoring 2 goals.

Andy Johnson (Welsh footballer).name: Andy Johnson (Welsh footballer)
Andy Johnson (Welsh footballer).intro: '''Andrew James "Andy" Johnson''' (born 2 May 1974) is an English born Wales national football teamWelsh international association footballfootball midfielder who last played for King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn.

Steve Bould.name: Steve Bould
Steve Bould.intro:
'''Stephen Andrew''' "'''Steve'''" '''Bould''' (born 16 November 1962) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer and assistant manager of Premier League side Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1980 until 2000. Bould began his football career with his hometown club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City where he gained a reputation as an impressive young defender. After spending seven seasons with the Potters it was inevitable that Bould would become one of the country's leading centre backs and moved to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 1988. At Arsenal StadiumHighbury Bould formed a formidable back line with Tony Adams (footballer)Tony Adams, Nigel Winterburn and his former Stoke team-mate Lee Dixon and ended up with nine major honours to his name. He left the Gunners in 1999 and ended his playing career with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.
Since his playing career has ended Bould has worked at the successful Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal Academy as Head Youth Team Coach at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He has been promoted to assistant manager for the 2012–13 season replacing the long serving Pat Rice.

Luka Modri\u0107.name: Luka Modrić
Luka Modri\u0107.intro:
'''Luka Modrić''' (; born 9 September 1985) is a Croatian Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and the Croatia national football teamCroatia national team. Modrić plays mainly as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder, but can also play as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder and Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
After showing promise in hometown club NK ZadarZadar's youth team, he was signed by Dinamo Zagreb as a teenager in 2002. His professional career began with loan spells at NK Zrinjski MostarZrinjski Mostar and NK Inter ZaprešićInter Zaprešić. While he was playing for GNK Dinamo ZagrebDinamo Zagreb, they won three consecutive league titles and several domestic cups, with Modrić named Prva HNL "Player of the Year" in 2007. In 2008, he moved to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in England's Premier League, before moving to Real Madrid in the summer of 2012. In his second season at Real Madrid, he won the 2013–14 UEFA Champions LeagueUEFA Champions League.
Modrić is a Croatian international and made his debut against Argentina national football teamArgentina in March 2006. He has since participated in four major tournaments; 2006 FIFA World Cup, 2014 FIFA World Cup and UEFA UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008 and UEFA Euro 20122012. He scored his first international goal in the friendly match against Italy national football teamItaly, and at the Euro 2008 was included in the UEFA "Team of the Tournament", becoming only the second Croatian to ever achieve this honour.

Glen Johnson (English footballer).name: Glen Johnson (English footballer)
Glen Johnson (English footballer).intro:
'''Glen McLeod Cooper Johnson''' (born '''Glen McLeod Cooper Stephens'''; 23 August 1984) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer, who plays as a Defender (association football)right back for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the England national football teamEngland national team.
He began his career at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, spending time on loan at Millwall F.C.Millwall, and was signed by Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for £6 million after West Ham's relegation in 2003. Following a successful season on loan, he joined Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 2007, where he won the FA Cup in the following year. Johnson moved to Liverpool in 2009.
He has also been capped 54 times by the national team since 2003, and was selected in England's squads for two World Cups and UEFA Euro 2012.

Alan Fettis.name: Alan Fettis
Alan Fettis.intro:
'''Alan William Fettis''' (born 1 February 1971) is a Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland former professional Association footballfootballer and Manchester United F.C. Reserves and AcademyAcademy goalkeeping coach at Premier League side Manchester United F.C.Manchester United.
As a player he was as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1988 to 2007. He notably played for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and York City F.C.York City having also had spells with Glentoran F.C.Glentoran, Ards F.C.Ards, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Bury F.C.Bury.
Alan Fettis.position: Goalkeeper  association football  Goalkeeper,Striker  association football  Striker

S\u00e9bastien P\u00e9rez.name: Sébastien Pérez
S\u00e9bastien P\u00e9rez.intro:
'''Sébastien Pérez''' (born 24 November 1973 in Saint-Chamond, Loire) is a FranceFrench professional football (soccer)football player who started his career for AS Saint-Étienne as a central midfielder.
Pérez signed for Blackburn Rovers from SC Bastia in July 1998 by manager Roy Hodgson at the time, for a fee of £3 million. His stay in East Lancashire was somewhat short, and he only made five appearances for Blackburn. He did, however, manage to score twice for the club, against Chelsea in the leaguecite news
url=
title=Flo finish seals furious battle
publisher=The Independent
date=21 September 1998 accessdate=5 November 2009
location=London
first=Guy
last=Hodgson and Lyon in the UEFA Cup.cite news
url=
title=Plucky Rovers pipped by Lyons
publisher=The Independent
date=29 September 1998 accessdate=5 November 2009
location=London
first=Steven
last=Baker
His career with Blackburn started well, but he suffered a serious injury, and upon return to the squad he struggled regaining his place back in the starting lineup. He was then loaned out and completed a move back to France, where he joined Olympique de MarseilleMarseille in June 1999. He was loaned out to Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray for the 2001–02 season, then returned to Olympique de MarseilleMarseille until the end of the 2003–04 season, when he was released. He joined FC Istres. For the 2007–08 season, he joined l'US Endoume.
Sébastien Pérez is also a member of the France national beach soccer team.
S\u00e9bastien P\u00e9rez.position: Midfielder Central midfielder Central midfielder,Defender  football  Defender

Lloyd Isgrove.name: Lloyd Isgrove
Lloyd Isgrove.intro: '''Lloyd Jeffrey Isgrove''' (born 12 January 1993) is a Welsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday on loan from Southampton F.C.Southampton. Originally a member of the club's Southampton F.C. Academyacademy system, Isgrove was promoted to the first team at the beginning of the 2012–13 Southampton F.C. season2012–13 season. He plays primarily as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, but is also comfortable in other midfield positions and as a Forward (association football)forward.

Josemi.name: Josemi
Josemi.intro:
'''José Miguel González Rey''', commonly known as '''Josemi''' (born 15 November 1979), is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Indian club Atlético de Kolkata. Mainly a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, he also can play as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He appeared in 178 La Liga games over the course of nine seasons (one goal), with Málaga CFMálaga, Villarreal CFVillarreal and RCD MallorcaMallorca. He also represented Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the Premier League for one-and-a-half seasons, and competed in Greece late in his career.

Jon Ashton.name: Jon Ashton
Jon Ashton.intro:
'''Jonathan James "Jon" Ashton''' (born 4 October 1982) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Stevenage F.C.Stevenage.
Ashton was part of Leicester City F.C.Leicester City's youth academy, progressing through the youth system for six years after joining the club at the age of 12. He made seven Premier League appearances during Leicester's 2001–02 in English football2001–02 campaign, playing a total of ten games for the club. During his time at Leicester, Ashton was loaned out to both Notts County F.C.Notts County and Oxford United F.C.Oxford United respectively, joining the latter permanently in September 2003 after his successful loan spell. He played over 100 games for the club spanning over three league seasons, before being released in May 2006.
He signed for Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds ahead of the 2006–07 in English football2006–07 season, spending one season at the club before joining Essex side Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic on a free transfer in May 2007. He spent one and a half years with Grays, before signing for Stevenage for an undisclosed fee in January 2009. Ashton was an important part of the side's defence during the club's successful 2009–10 in English football2009–10 campaign, a season in which Stevenage would earn promotion to the Football League for the first time in the club's history. The following season, Ashton played a key part in Stevenage earning back-to-back promotions to League One following their sixth place finish and subsequent 2011 Football League Two play-off FinalLeague Two play-off victory in May 2011. Ashton has also earned four cap (sport)caps for the England C national football teamEngland C team.

L\u00e9andre Griffit.name: Léandre Griffit
L\u00e9andre Griffit.intro: '''Léandre Griffit''' (born 21 May 1984 in Maubeuge) is a French professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Aulnoye-AymeriesAS Aulnoye-Aymeries in the Championnat de France amateur 2CFA 2.

Ali Al-Habsi.name: Ali Al-Habsi
Ali Al-Habsi.intro:
'''Ali Abdullah Harib Al-Habsi''' (; born 30 December 1981) is an Omani professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Al-Habsi is the current captain of the Oman national football team, whom he has represented in 92 matches since 2002, including at three AFC Asian Cup tournaments.

Andy Liddell.name: Andy Liddell
Andy Liddell.intro: '''Andrew Mark "Andy" Liddell''' (born 28 June 1973) is a ScotlandScottish former Association footballfootball midfielder who is currently fitness coach of Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He previously played with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Rotherham United.

Spencer Prior.name: Spencer Prior
Spencer Prior.intro: '''Spencer Justin Prior''' (born 22 April 1971 in Southend-on-Sea, Essex) is an English former Association footballfootballer. He was a Defender (football)central defender who retired at the end of the 2006-07 in English football2006–07 season, finishing his career with hometown club Southend United F.C.Southend United, where he began his career. In between, he played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Marc Albrighton.name: Marc Albrighton
Marc Albrighton.intro: '''Marc Kevin Albrighton''' (born 18 November 1989) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. Before signing with the club, Albrighton had spent his entire career  with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa including a loan spell at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic; he has also represented the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 and England national under-21 football teamU20 sides.

Lee Matthews.name: Lee Matthews
Lee Matthews.intro:
'''Lee Joseph Matthews''' (born 16 January 1979) is an English peopleEnglish former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. He is now working as an unlicensed football agent.
He began his career with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in 1997, after winning the FA Youth Cup with the club's youth team. He transferred to Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in 2001, following loan spells at Notts County F.C.Notts County and Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. During three years with City he was loaned out to Darlington F.C.Darlington, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, and Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town. He signed with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 2004, before moving on to Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra after a two years stay. After leaving Crewe in 2007 he joined Scottish club Livingston F.C.Livingston, before retiring from the game later in the year, at the age of 28. Dogged by injuries throughout his career, the talented striker was limited to a total of twenty goals in 138 league and cup appearances in his ten year professional career – most of these appearances were as a substitute.

Sylvan Ebanks-Blake.name: Sylvan Ebanks-Blake
Sylvan Ebanks-Blake.intro:
'''Sylvan Augustus Ebanks-Blake''' (born 29 March 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End.
He played youth team football for Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before making his professional debut in 2004. A spell on loan with Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp followed before Ebanks-Blake was transferred to Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in 2006. During his two seasons with Argyle, he scored 21 goals in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship and then joined Wolverhampton Wanderers for £1.5 million, where he won the Football League Championship Top ScorerChampionship top scorer award in consecutive seasons to help the club gain promotion to the Premier League.
Ebanks-Blake has represented England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level, but is eligible to play for Jamaica national football teamJamaica at senior international level through his parents.

Jimmy Walker (footballer, born 1973).name: Jimmy Walker (footballer, born 1973)
Jimmy Walker (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''James Barry "Jimmy" Walker''' (born 9 July 1973 in Sutton-in-Ashfield, Nottinghamshire) is an English professional Association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who most recently played for Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, where he was also employed as the club's goalkeeping coach.

Stuart Ripley.name: Stuart Ripley
Stuart Ripley.intro:
'''Stuart Edward Ripley''' (born 20 November 1967) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger from 1985 until 2002, notably for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he won the Premier League in 1995.
He also played in England's top flight for Southampton F.C.Southampton as well as playing in the Football League for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He earned two national caps for England national football teamEngland.
Ripley retired from professional football in 2002 and is now working as a solicitor.

Lee Chapman.name: Lee Chapman
Lee Chapman.intro:
'''Lee Roy Chapman''' (born 5 December 1959) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker from 1978 until 1996, in which he scored almost 200 first-team goals.
He is best known for spells with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He also played for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. As well as this he played in both France and Norway for Chamois Niortais F.C.Chamois Niortais and Strømsgodset IF, and was capped by both the England under-21 national football teamEngland U21 and England B national football teamEngland B teams. He also won the Football League Cup with Nottingham Forest and the league title with Leeds United. He scored a total of more than 250 goals in all competitions during a club career which lasted for nearly 20 years.

Djibril Ciss\u00e9.name: Djibril Cissé
Djibril Ciss\u00e9.intro:
'''Djibril Cissé''' (; born 12 August 1981) is a List of France international footballersFrench footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for SC Bastia in Ligue 1. He is well known for his speed and acceleration. Since 2005, he has been ''Lord of the Manor of Frodsham''. Cissé started his career at AC Arles in 1989 at the age of eight. After seven years at the club, he had a six-month spell at Nîmes Olympique before moving to AJ AuxerreAuxerre joining the club's youth system. Cissé spent two years in the system before graduating to the first team in 1998. Having had a move to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool delayed once, he moved to the Merseyside-based club in 2004, after playing for Auxerre for six seasons, scoring 90 goals in 166 appearances.
During his time at Anfield, he played 79 games, scoring 24 times. He had a loan spell to Olympique de MarseilleMarseille, scoring 15 goals in 25 appearances before the deal was made permanent. Cissé returned to the Premier League in 2008 with a loan spell at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, scoring 11 goals in 39 appearances. On 25 June 2009, he signed a four-year contract with Greek side Panathinaikos F.C.Panathinaikos. In the summer of 2011, he secured a move to Serie A side S.S. LazioLazio. On 31 January 2012, Cissé signed for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers for a reported £4 million, scoring in his debut in a 2–2 draw with Aston Villa.

Nathan Redmond.name: Nathan Redmond
Nathan Redmond.intro:
'''Nathan Daniel Jerome Redmond''' (born 6 March 1994) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
Redmond began his career as a youngster with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, his home-town club. He made his first-team debut in the Football League Cup second-round tie against Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale in August 2010, becoming the club's second-youngest player ever at the age of 16 years and 173 days. After representing England at levels up to England national under-19 football teamunder-19, Redmond made his first England national under-21 football teamunder-21 appearance in the 2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship2013 European Under-21 Championship finals. He joined Premier League club Norwich City in the 2013 close season.
He typically plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwide midfielder. He is right-footed, but has regularly played on both right and left wings, often cutting inside. He has also occasionally played in the centre behind a lone striker.

Rigobert Song.name: Rigobert Song
Rigobert Song.intro:
'''Rigobert Song Bahanag''' (born 1 July 1976) [
He was born in Nkenglicock, Cameroon.
Known for his defensive skills, Song usually plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back but can also operate at right back. Internationally, he has played at a record eight Africa Cup of Nations tournaments and served as Captain (association football)captain in five (the only ones he was not captain for were 1996 Africa Cup of NationsSouth Africa 1996, 1998 Africa Cup of NationsBurkina Faso 1998 and 2010 Africa Cup of NationsAngola 2010), a record, and holds the record of most consecutive games played in the tournament with 35 first team games. He has won two CAF Africa Cup of Nations titles in 2000 and 2002. In 2009, Song was dropped as Cameroon skipper by new coach Paul Le Guen, who eventually appointed Samuel Eto'o as the new captain but later caused concerns as Rigobert song had never been on the bench in more than 11 years for Cameroon. With 137 appearances, Song also holds the record of the most cap (football)capped player in the history of the Cameroon national team and has played in four FIFA World CupWorld Cups, in 1994 FIFA World Cup1994, 1998 FIFA World Cup1998, 2002 FIFA World Cup2002, and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010.
Song started his professional career with FC MetzMetz and helped the club to win the French League Cup back in 1996. After appearing at the 1998 World Cup he joined Salernitana Calcio 1919Salernitana which newly promoted to Serie A. In January 1999 he left Italy to start successive stints with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and 1. FC KölnCologne but after failing to hold down a first-team place he returned to France to play for RC Lens. He stayed there until 2004 and moved on to Turkey, where he spent four years with Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray, winning two Turkcell Super LeagueTurkish League titles and the Turkey CupTurkish Cup. Song then signed a contract with Trabzonspor in 2008, where he won another Turkish Cup and stayed until 2010.
Along with Zinedine Zidane, Song is the only player to have been sent off in two different World Cups, once against Brazil national football teamBrazil in 1994 FIFA World CupUSA 94 and against Chile national football teamChile in 1998 FIFA World CupFrance 98. He also holds the record as youngest player ever to be sent off in a World Cup, aged 17.
Nicknamed "''Big Chief''" by the Turkish fans, he is the cousin of fellow Cameroon defensive midfielder and West Ham United player Alex Song, although Alex refers to Rigobert as his uncle.

Didier Deschamps.name: Didier Deschamps
Didier Deschamps.intro:
'''Didier Claude Deschamps''' ( ; born 15 October 1968) is a retired FranceFrench Association footballfootballer and current manager of France national football teamFrance. He played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder for such clubs as Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Juventus F.C.Juventus and Olympique de MarseilleMarseille. In this position, he primarily excelled at impeding the opposition's attacking movements, and was capable of subsequently starting up attacking plays once he won back possession. This was made possible due to his high work-rate, tenacity, stamina, and his efficacy at pressing and tackling opponents. He also had an excellent positional and organisational sense, and was known for his tactical intelligence, versatility, and his leadership. As an international, he captained France national football teamFrance to victories in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000.
As well as winning two Ligue 1French league titles in 1991 and 1992, Deschamps was part of the Olympique de MarseilleMarseille team which became the first, and so far only, Football in FranceFrench winners of the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League in 1993 UEFA Champions League Final1993. Also he was the Captain (association football)youngest captain ever to lead his team to the List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League winnersChampions League title when they won. With Juventus F.C.Juventus he played three UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League finals in a row winning the Champions League 1996 with such a team. With the Turin team he won the European Super Cup and the Intercontinental cup as well. After Franz Beckenbauer and followed by Iker Casillas, he was only the second captain in the history of football to have lifted the Champions League trophy, the World Cup trophy and the European Championship trophy. On 8 July 2012, Deschamps was named as the new manager of the France national football teamFrench national team.

Lionel P\u00e9rez.name: Lionel Pérez
Lionel P\u00e9rez.intro: '''Lionel Pérez''' (born 24 April 1967 in Bagnols-sur-Cèze, Gard) is a retired French professional association footballfootballer. He played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper and more recently was a goalkeeping coach at Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough, following his retirement from the game in 2004.

Jim Magilton.name: Jim Magilton
Jim Magilton.intro:
'''James "Jim" Magilton''' (born 6 May 1969) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former Association footballfootballer and manager, who is the elite performance director with the Irish Football Association.
Magilton started his playing career with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and remained with the club until 1990 when he joined Oxford United F.C.Oxford United. After scoring 34 goals from midfield in 150 league appearances he signed for Southampton F.C.Southampton in 1994. Three years later he moved to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday for two seasons before going on briefly on loan to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town – the move was made permanent in 1999.
Magilton's club career ended at Ipswich, having made over 250 league appearances. He moved into management at Ipswich, where he led the club for three years before managing Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers for a brief spell. Magilton also represented his country, making 52 appearances for the Northern Ireland national football team, scoring five goals.

Kevin McNaughton.name: Kevin McNaughton
Kevin McNaughton.intro: '''Kevin Paul McNaughton''' (born 28 August 1982) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, on loan from Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, as a defender (association football)defender. Nicknamed 'The Silver Fox' by teammates due to his grey hair, McNaughton is a versatile player who can play anywhere on defence, including a more defensive minded midfield role. He began his career in the Scottish Premier League playing for the Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen for six years. He then joined Cardiff City.

Dennis Rommedahl.name: Dennis Rommedahl
Dennis Rommedahl.intro: '''Dennis Rommedahl''' (born 22 July 1978) is a Danish former Association footballfootballer, who played as a Winger (soccer)right winger. He played 126 matches and scored 21 goals for Denmark national football teamDenmark, currently his country's second most capped national player. Rommedahl was selected for the Danish squads at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup, UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004, the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012. He was nominated for Danish Football Player of the YearDanish Footballer of the Year in 2007, though he later won the award in 2010.

Fabio Daprel\u00e0.name: Fabio Daprelà
Fabio Daprel\u00e0.intro: '''Fabio Daprelà''' (; born 19 February 1991 in Zurich) is a SwitzerlandSwiss Association footballfootball defender (association football)defender currently playing for U.S. Città di PalermoPalermo in Serie A. He is a former Switzerland national under-21 football teamSwitzerland U21 international.

Geremi Njitap.name: Geremi Njitap
Geremi Njitap.intro:
'''Geremi Sorele Njitap Fotso''' (born 20 December 1978), known simply as '''Geremi''', is a Cameroonian former Association footballfootballer. He was a versatile player able to play at right back, right midfield or center back, known for his power, combative style and Direct free kickfree kick ability.
The most successful periods of Geremi's club career came at Real Madrid and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, winning two UEFA Champions League titles with the first and a full set of domestic honours with the latter.
He earned 116 caps for Cameroon national football teamCameroon from 1996 to 2010, scoring 13 goals. He was a member of their squad for 7 Africa Cup of Nations tournaments, winning in 2000 African Cup of Nations2000 and 2002 African Cup of Nations2002, as well as the World Cup in 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and a gold medal at the Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2000 Olympics.

Marc Muniesa.name: Marc Muniesa
Marc Muniesa.intro:
'''Marc Muniesa Martínez''' (born 27 March 1992) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. Mainly a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentral defender, he can also play as a Defender (association football)#Left backleft back.
Muniesa began his career with FC BarcelonaBarcelona, making his debut at the end of the 2008–09 FC Barcelona season2008–09 season at the age of 17. Muniesa then played for FC Barcelona BBarcelona B, helping them to win promotion to the Segunda División in 2009–10 Segunda División B2009–10. He was on the verge of breaking into the first team in 2012–13 FC Barcelona season2012–13 but suffered a torn knee ligament in pre-season and missed most of the season. In July 2013 he joined English side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on a free transfer.
Muniesa gained 26 Cap (sport)caps for Spain national youth football teamSpain at youth level, including five for the Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 side with which he won the 2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship2013 European Championship.

Robert Betts.name: Robert Betts
Robert Betts.intro:
'''Robert Betts''', (born 21 December 1981 in Doncaster) is an English peopleEnglish association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder (association football)midfielder currently playing non-league football.
He made his debut for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers when he was just 16, during the 1997–98 season, when a Doncaster side made up mostly of players from the youth team and non-league football were relegated from The Football League. He made 3 appearances that season, and impressed enough to earn a move to FA PremiershipPremiership side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
Here he settled into their youth system, appearing on the losing side in two FA Youth Cup Finals. He made a few appearances in the Premiership, and had loan spells at Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City. Coventry's relegation from the Premiership in 2001 gave him more opportunities to play, but he was still on the fringes of the team, and was released on 22 May 2003.
The 2003–04 season saw Betts move between three clubs, having spells at Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United. He was released by Hereford in the summer of 2004 and linked up with the Dr Martens League side Racing Club Warwick on non-contract terms. He soon secured a month's contract with Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers but this was not extended and, in October 2004, he rejoined Racing Club Warwick.
In the summer of 2006, the Racing Club Warwick manager Marcus Law was appointed manager of Quorn F.C.Quorn and Betts soon followed him. He won the Midland Football Alliance Player of the Season award for 2006–07.

Leon Barnett.name: Leon Barnett
Leon Barnett.intro:
'''Leon Peter Barnett''' (born 30 November 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. Although primarily a central defender, he has also played at left back, right back, midfieldercentral midfield and strikerup front.
Barnett began his career at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, and made his first team debut in 2002. He spent three seasons on the fringes of the first team, during which time he had a short loan to non-league side Aylesbury United F.C.Aylesbury United, before becoming a regular first team squad member for Luton in the 2005–06 season. After winning Luton Town's player of the season award for the 2006–07 season, Barnett joined West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in 2007 for £2.5 million. After a successful initial season at West Bromwich Albion, Barnett was demoted to a squad member role after the club was promoted to the Premier League. He was loaned out to Football League ChampionshipChampionship sides Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in this time, and eventually joined Norwich on a permanent basis in January 2011 for an undisclosed fee. Barnett again soon found himself out of favour at Norwich after their promotion to the Premier League, and was loaned out to Championship club Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in 2013. He joined Wigan Athletic from Norwich in July 2013 for an undisclosed fee.

Ignacio Mar\u00eda Gonz\u00e1lez.name: Ignacio María González
Ignacio Mar\u00eda Gonz\u00e1lez.intro: '''Ignacio 'Nacho' María González Gatti''' (; born 14 May 1982) is a Uruguayan professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Club Nacional de Football as a midfielder.

Gheorghe Popescu.name: Gheorghe Popescu
Gheorghe Popescu.intro: '''Gheorghe ''Gică'' Popescu''' (; born 9 October 1967 in Calafat) is a retired Romanian Association footballfootball defender (association football)defender, former Captain (association football)captain of FC Barcelona and key part of the Romania national football teamRomania national team in the 1990s. He played for a string of European clubs in that period, including a four-year stint at PSV Eindhoven. His tactical knowledge as a defender made him a valuable team member in top European competitions until he reached his late-thirties. Beside from his defending skills, he was also capable starting attacks. He is the brother-in-law of fellow Romania national football teamRomanian international Gheorghe Hagi.

Fuma\u00e7a (footballer, born 1976).name: Fumaça (footballer, born 1976)
Fuma\u00e7a (footballer, born 1976).intro: '''José Rodriguez Alves Antunes''' (born 15 July 1976), more commonly known as '''Fumaça''', is a Brazilian former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder in Brazil, England, Czech Republic and Germany.

Adam Green.name: Adam Green
Adam Green.intro: '''Adam Green''' (born 12 January 1984) is an English semi-professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Leatherhead F.C.Leatherhead as a Defender (association football)defender.

Tony Cascarino.name: Tony Cascarino
Tony Cascarino.intro:
'''Anthony Guy "Tony" Cascarino''' (born 1 September 1962 in St Paul's Cray, Orpington, Kent, England) is a former association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)forward for various British and French clubs and internationally for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team, with whom he competed in UEFA Euro 1988 and two FIFA World CupWorld Cups in 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 and 1994 FIFA World Cup1994.
Since retirement, he has presented on TalksportTalkSPORT radio and written for both ''The Times'' and Ireland's ''Hot Press'' magazine. He has worked for both Sky Sports in England and TV3 (Ireland)TV3 and Today FM in Ireland. After this he went on to win ''Celebrity Bainisteoir''.

Marc Degryse.name: Marc Degryse
Marc Degryse.intro:
'''Marc Gabriel Degryse''' (born 4 September 1965), nicknamed ''Le Lutin d'Ardooie'' ("The Imp of Ardooie") and ''The Little One'',[
In a 19-year old professional career he played mainly for Club Brugge KVClub Brugge and R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht (six seasons apiece), making his senior debuts at 17 and scoring nearly 200 official goals both clubs combined to win a total of ten major titles. He also competed briefly in England for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.
A Belgium national football teamBelgian international for 12 years, Degryse represented the nation in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups.

Petri Pasanen.name: Petri Pasanen
Petri Pasanen.intro: '''Petri Pasanen''' (born 24 September 1980) is a FinlandFinnish professional Association footballfootball Defender (association football)defender who is most comfortable in Defender (association football)central defense, but can play Defender (association football)right back and Defender (association football)left back as well. Pasanen plays for FinlandFinnish Veikkausliiga side FC Lahti and has represented Finland national football teamFinland national team. Pasanen was born in Lahti, Finland where he played for the local teams before moving to AFC AjaxAjax.

Florin R\u0103ducioiu.name: Florin Răducioiu
Florin R\u0103ducioiu.intro:
'''Florin Valeriu Răducioiu''' (born 17 March 1970 in Bucharest) is a Romanian former Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker, who played for FC Dinamo BucureştiDinamo Bucureşti, A.C. Milan, Brescia Calcio, West Ham United, RCD Espanyol, VfB Stuttgart and AS Monaco FCAS Monaco.
He played for Romania national football teamRomania at the 1990 FIFA World Cup hosted by Italy, the 1994 FIFA World Cup in the United States, and England's UEFA Euro 1996.

Darren Beckford.name: Darren Beckford
Darren Beckford.intro:
'''Darren Richard Lorenzo Beckford''' (born 12 June 1967) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer. His younger brother Jason BeckfordJason also played professional football. They both played as Forward (association football)forwards.
In fourteen years as a professional footballer he scored a total of 103 goals in 309 league games. Advancing through the Manchester City F.C.Manchester City youth team, he also spent a brief time on loan at Bury F.C.Bury before joining Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1987. He enjoyed the most successful time of his career at Vale, scoring 68 goals in 167 league games, helping the club to promotion via the play-offs in 1989 Football League Third Division play-off Final1989. After four successive seasons as the club's top scorer he earned a £925,000 move to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in 1991. Unable to find the form he hit at Vale Park, he was sold on to Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic for £300,000 in 1993. Three years later he moved on to Scottish side Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts. He later played for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds, Southport F.C.Southport, The New Saints F.C.Total Network Solutions, Bury F.C.Bury and Bacup Borough F.C.Bacup Borough.

Marco Boogers.name: Marco Boogers
Marco Boogers.intro: '''Marco Boogers''' is a Dutch former professional football (soccer)footballer.

Tom Williamson.name: Tom Williamson
Tom Williamson.intro:
'''Tom Williamson''' (born 24 December 1984 in Leicester, England) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)footballer, currently playing for Basingstoke Town F.C.Basingstoke Town.
His contract at Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic was terminated by mutual consent on 3 August 2007. Following his release from Grays, he joined Bishop's Stortford F.C.Bishop's Stortford for the 2007–08 season.
In July 2008, Williamson signed for Basingstoke Town F.C.Basingstoke Town.cite news

Jamie Hoyland.name: Jamie Hoyland
Jamie Hoyland.intro: '''Jamie William Hoyland''' (born 23 January 1966 in Sheffield) played in midfield for several football clubs in the 1980s and 1990s, before turning to a career in football coaching; he was Assistant Manager at Rochdale in 2002.

Stuart Parnaby.name: Stuart Parnaby
Stuart Parnaby.intro:
'''Stuart Parnaby''' (born 19 July 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for Football League TwoLeague Two side Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United.
Parnaby graduated from Middlesbrough F.C. Reserves and AcademyMiddlesbrough's Academy, which was run by his father, Dave ParnabyDave. He went on to make more than 100 appearances for Middlesbrough's first team before joining Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2007. After four years with the club, a time disrupted by injury, he was released at the end of the 2010–11 season. After having one year out of the game, Parnaby rejoined Middlesbrough on a two-year deal in July 2012.

Jonas Olsson (footballer, born 1983).name: Jonas Olsson (footballer, born 1983)
Jonas Olsson (footballer, born 1983).intro: '''Jonas Olsson''' (born 10 March 1983) is a Swedish peopleSwedish Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Premier League club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and the Sweden national football team.

Kader Mangane.name: Kader Mangane
Kader Mangane.intro: '''Abdou Kader Mangane''' (born 23 March 1983) is a Senegalese Football (soccer)football player. He currently plays for Süper Lig side Kayseri Erciyesspor on loan from Saudi club Al-Hilal FCAl-Hilal.

Michael Gray.name: Michael Gray
Michael Gray.intro:
'''Michael Gray''' (born 3 August 1974), sometimes known as '''Micky Gray''', is an English former Association footballfootballer who played at Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back or on the Midfielder#Wingerleft wing for 18 years.
He is mostly remembered for his 12-year stay with his hometown club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, where he made 363 league appearances between 1992 and 2004. Whilst with Sunderland he spent a brief loan spell with Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic. In 2004, he moved to Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and later had spells with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. In 1999, Gray earned three caps for England national football teamEngland.
Michael Gray.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Garry Brady.name: Garry Brady
Garry Brady.intro: '''Garry Brady''' (born 7 September 1976 in Glasgow) is a ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer who last played for Scottish League One club Brechin City F.C.Brechin City.

Paul Mahorn.name: Paul Mahorn
Paul Mahorn.intro: '''Paul Gladstone Mahorn''' (born 13 August 1973) is an English peopleEnglish former Association footballfootball Forward (association football)forward. He spent 1992 to 1998 with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, but only played three Premier League games, and was also loaned out to Fulham F.C.Fulham and Burnley F.C.Burnley. In 1998 he played one game for Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, before moving into non-league circles with Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough, Cambridge City F.C.Cambridge City, and Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United.

El-Hadji Ba.name: El-Hadji Ba
El-Hadji Ba.intro: '''El-Hadji Ba''' (born 5 March 1993) is a FranceFrench association footballfootballer of Senegalese descent who plays for SC Bastia in the Ligue 1 on loan from English Premier League club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He plays as a midfielder and is a France national youth football teamFrench youth international, having represented his nation at France national under-18 football teamunder-18 level. Ba made his professional debut on 24 February 2012 in a league match against En Avant de GuingampGuingamp appearing as a substitute.  Prior to making his debut with Le Havre, he was linked with a move to EnglandEnglish club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and reportedly had agreed to join the club.

Stewart Robson.name: Stewart Robson
Stewart Robson.intro: '''Stewart Ian Robson''' (born 6 November 1964) is an English former association footballfootball player and TV and radio football pundit. He played for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United where he was their player of the season in 1988, and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. After his footballing career ended he took on a role as a TV and radio pundit for Arsenal TV until 2012, TalkSPORT and as ESPN's Italian football co-commentator.

Kerry Dixon.name: Kerry Dixon
Kerry Dixon.intro: '''Kerry Michael Dixon''' (born 24 July 1961, in Luton) is a retired English professional Association footballfootballer who played most notably for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and England national football teamEngland.

Harry Kane.name: Harry Kane
Harry Kane.intro:
'''Harry Edward Kane''' (born 28 July 1993) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Forward (association football)forward.
He made his senior debut for Tottenham on 25 August 2011 in a UEFA Europa League game against Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian. Before establishing himself in Tottenham's first team, Kane spent time on loan in Football League OneLeague One playing for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, the Football League ChampionshipChampionship playing for Millwall F.C.Millwall and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and in the Premier League for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. After becoming a regular starter and goalscorer for Tottenham in 2014–15 season, he won the Premier League Player of the Month award twice, once in January 2015 and again in February 2015.
Kane represented England at youth levels, playing for the England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19, England national under-20 football teamunder-20 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels. He scored on his senior international debut on 27 March 2015.

Warren Barton.name: Warren Barton
Warren Barton.intro: '''Warren Dean Barton''' (born 19 March 1969 in Stoke Newington, London) is a former English Association footballfootball player. He is now a television pundit for Fox Soccer Channel as well as general manager and technical director for Los Angeles Blues in the American USL Pro league.

Youssef Chippo.name: Youssef Chippo
Youssef Chippo.intro: '''Youssef Chippo''' (; born 10 May 1973 in Boujad) is a retired football (soccer)footballer from Morocco. He was a renowned midfielder on the national squad during the 1990s, and was a member of the team that participated in the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona, Spain and the 1998 FIFA World Cup.

Fernandinho.name: Fernandinho
Fernandinho.intro:
'''Fernando Luiz Roza''' (born 4 May 1985), or simply '''Fernandinho''' (; meaning 'Little Fernando'), is a Brazilian professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team.
He started his career at Brazilian club Clube Atlético ParanaenseAtlético Paranaense before moving to FC Shakhtar DonetskShakhtar Donetsk in 2005, where he became one of the best foreign players to ever play in the Ukraine Premier League.
He is well known for his blistering pace and ability to shoot from long distances. He is described as "a defensive midfielder with a box to box style of play, contributing in large part to the defense and the attack. With a powerful shot and great passing range, Fernandinho has played an important part in breaking up opposition attacks and creating goal scoring opportunities."

Pierre Ducrocq.name: Pierre Ducrocq
Pierre Ducrocq.intro: '''Pierre Ducrocq''' (born December 18, 1976 in Pontoise) is a FranceFrench association footballfootballer who last played for Kavala F.C.Kavala in the Super League Greece.

Chris Price.name: Chris Price
Chris Price.intro: '''Christopher John "Chris" Price''' (born 30 March 1960 in Hereford) is an English former association footballfootballer who made 561 appearances in the Football League and Premier League, playing for Hereford United F.C.Hereford United, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He played as a defender (association football)right-back.
Chris Price.position: Defender  football  Full back Full back

Garry Flitcroft.name: Garry Flitcroft
Garry Flitcroft.intro:
'''Garry William Flitcroft''' (born 6 November 1972 in Bolton, Lancashire) is an English former professional footballer and Manager (association football)football manager of Conference North side Chorley F.C.Chorley.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1991 to 2006, and played in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, as well as playing in the Football League for Bury F.C.Bury. He was capped 10 times by England national under-21 football teamEngland U21, scoring three goals. In 2009 he became manager of Leigh Genesis F.C.Leigh Genesis and the following year took over as manager of Chorley F.C.Chorley.

Rob Hulse.name: Rob Hulse
Rob Hulse.intro:
'''Robert William "Rob" Hulse''' (born 25 October 1979) is an EnglandEnglish former association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)striker.
He had primarily spent his career at second tier level, playing there with Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra. West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He has won promotion on three occasions twice to the top flight and had his most notable spell in the Premier League with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, where he finished as the club's top scorer in the 2006–07 FA Premier League2006–07 season, despite his season finishing early due to injury. He scored his 100th career league goal with a penalty against Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday for Derby on 3 October 2009. Hulse  was a part of QPR's Championship winning team in the 2010–11 Football League Championship2010–11 season.

Stevan Joveti\u0107.name: Stevan Jovetić
Stevan Joveti\u0107.intro:
'''Stevan Jovetić''' (Cyrillic: Cтeвaн Joвeтић, ; born 2 November 1989) is a MontenegroMontenegrin professional footballer who plays for Premier League champions Manchester City F.CManchester City and the Montenegro national football teamMontenegro national team. His primary position is a Forward (association football)second striker, although he can also operate as an attacking midfielder or a Midfielder#Wingerwinger. Jovetić is known for his dribbling, technical ability, and creativity. His playing style has led to comparisons with Roberto Baggio.
Jovetić is a Montenegro national football teamMontenegrin international, having previously represented his team at Montenegro national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. He made his senior international debut in 2007,  in Montenegro's first international football match as an independent country.
Stevan Joveti\u0107.birth_place: Podgorica|Titograd,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Thievy Bifouma.name: Thievy Bifouma
Thievy Bifouma.intro: '''Thievy Guivane Bifouma Koulossa''' (born 13 May 1992), simply known as '''Thievy''', is a Congolese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for UD Almería on loan from RCD Espanyol, and the Congo national football teamCongo national team, as a Forward (association football)forward.

Kevin Pilkington.name: Kevin Pilkington
Kevin Pilkington.intro:
'''Kevin William Pilkington''' (born 8 March 1974) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Notts County F.C.Notts County. He also serves as the club's goalkeeping coach.
As a player, noted for his shot stopping abilities, Pilkington played in the Premier League for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before dropping down to the Football League, where he played in nearly 350 games in his time at Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town and Notts County F.C.Notts County, helping Mansfield win promotion out of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division in 2001–02 Football League2001–02. He spent five years with Mansfield and then another five years with Notts County; at both clubs he was usually the first choice keeper, rather than a back-up keeper as he was at most other clubs. He has also represented Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Celtic F.C.Celtic, Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, Aberystwyth Town F.C.Aberystwyth Town, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town.

Gerard Piqu\u00e9.name: Gerard Piqué
Gerard Piqu\u00e9.intro:
'''Gerard Piqué Bernabeu''' (, ; born 2 February 1987) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back for FC Barcelona and the Spain national football teamSpain national team.
A product of Barça's ''cantera'', La Masia, he initially left the club for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 2004, where he remained for four years, before returning to Barça under Pep Guardiola's leadership, helping the club win a Treble (association football)treble in 2008–09 and a List of association football teams to have won four or more trophies in one seasonquadruple in 2009–10. Piqué is one of four players to have won the UEFA Champions League two years in a row with different teams, the others being Marcel Desailly, Paulo Sousa and Samuel Eto'o.
Piqué has also represented Spain national football teamSpain, making his debut on 11 February 2009. He played an integral role in the Spain team that won the 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012.
Gerard Piqu\u00e9.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mark Ward (footballer, born 1962).name: Mark Ward (footballer, born 1962)
Mark Ward (footballer, born 1962).intro:
'''Mark William Ward''' (born 10 October 1962) is a former association footballfootballer from Liverpool. He started his career as a youth player with Everton F.C. and then spent two seasons playing for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic.
In 1985 he signed for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and was ever-present on the right wing in his first season, as they finished third in Division 1. However, in subsequent seasons, star strikers Frank McAvennie and Tony Cottee left and West Ham were relegated at the end of 1988–89.
In December 1989 Ward signed for newly promoted Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, who had just appointed Howard Kendall as manager after falling into the relegation zone. Ian Bishop (footballer)Ian Bishop and Trevor Morley signed for West Ham in exchange. Bizarrely, Ward's first six games for City included four against Millwall F.C.Millwall. City beat them in the league on 30 December 1989 but drew twice with them in the FA Cup before losing the second replay on 15 January 1990. City rose to finish 14th, with Ward scoring his first three goals for City in consecutive games in April.
Playing mainly on the left wing, Ward only missed two games in 1990–91, scoring 13 league and cup goals as City finished fifth. He scored both goals when City beat Sheffield United in the league on 19 January 1991, and then repeated the feat three days later to knock Sheffield United out of the Full Members Cup.
In the summer of 1991 he signed for Everton F.C.Everton, rejoining Kendall who had moved in November 1990. Ward stayed for three seasons before moving down the divisions to play for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Ayr United F.C.Ayr United, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Dundee F.C.Dundee, Valur, Altrincham F.C.Altrincham, and Leigh Genesis F.C.Leigh RMI.

Samir Carruthers.name: Samir Carruthers
Samir Carruthers.intro: '''Samir Badre Carruthers''' (born 4 April 1993) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, and is a Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland under-21 international.

Chris Armstrong (footballer, born 1971).name: Chris Armstrong (footballer, born 1971)
Chris Armstrong (footballer, born 1971).intro: '''Christopher Peter "Chris" Armstrong''' (born 19 June 1971 in Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear) is an English former England B national football teamEngland B international Association footballfootballer who has played as a Forward (association football)striker for Wrexham F.C.Wrexham (twice), Millwall F.C.Millwall, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers between 1989 and 2005.

Martin Hiden.name: Martin Hiden
Martin Hiden.intro: '''Martin Hiden''' (born 11 March 1973 in Stainz) is a former Austrian association footballfootball player, who is currently assistant coach at FC Pasching.

Mark Proctor.name: Mark Proctor
Mark Proctor.intro: '''Mark Proctor''' (born 30 January 1961 in Middlesbrough) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball player and coach.

John Jensen.name: John Jensen
John Jensen.intro: '''John Jensen''' (born 3 May 1965), nicknamed '''Faxe''', is a former DenmarkDanish international Association footballfootballer. His playing career lasted over a decade, during which he played most famously for Arsenal F.C. in England along with three separate stints with Brøndby IF in Denmark and amounted four goals in 69 cap (sports)caps for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, including a successful UEFA Euro 19921992 European Championship tournament, in which he scored the opening goal in Denmark's 2–0 final victory. Today John Jensen work on Danish TV channel 6'eren as a commentator.

Josh McEachran.name: Josh McEachran
Josh McEachran.intro: '''Joshua Mark "Josh" McEachran''' (born 1 March 1993) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Dutch Eredivisie side Vitesse Arnhem, on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, as a midfielder.

Stefan Maierhofer.name: Stefan Maierhofer
Stefan Maierhofer.intro:
'''Stefan Maierhofer''' (born 16 August 1982) is an Austrian Austria national football teaminternational Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker who currently plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall.
Maierhofer failed to make the grade with German giants FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich, making just two first team appearances. After spells with second division teams TuS Koblenz and SpVgg Greuther FürthGreuther Fürth he returned to his homeland with SK Rapid WienRapid Vienna. He enjoyed the best goalscoring form of his career here, which earned him a move to Premier LeagueEnglish Premier League club Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2009, where he made just ten appearances before returning to Austria.

John Beresford.name: John Beresford
John Beresford.intro: '''John Beresford''' (born 4 September 1966) is a former English football player who played as a defender, who is currently a pundit for ITV (TV channel)ITV Tyne Tees TelevisionTyne Tees and ESPN.

Joseph-D\u00e9sir\u00e9 Job.name: Joseph-Désiré Job
Joseph-D\u00e9sir\u00e9 Job.intro:
'''Joseph-Désiré Job''' (born 1 December 1977 in Vénissieux, Rhône) is a former French-born Cameroonian Forward (Association football)football striker. He also played for the Cameroon national football teamCameroon national team.
After starting his career in France, Job moved to English team Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, where he spent six years and is most remembered for scoring one of the two goals in the 2004 Football League Cup Final2004 League Cup Final, where Middlesbrough won their first ever trophy.
He also played for clubs in Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Turkey and Belgium. Whilst playing for Saudi club Al-Ittihad (Jeddah)Al-Ittihad, he won the 2005 AFC Champions League and scored in the final.

Lee Croft.name: Lee Croft
Lee Croft.intro:
'''Lee David Croft''' (born 21 June 1985) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger for St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone.
He has previously played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He also appears on ''Soccer AM'' as "Lee Croft, Story Teller", telling stories that end with the catch phrase "You can't handle the truth!"
Lee Croft.birth_place: Higher End|Billinge Higher End,Metropolitan Borough of Wigan|Wigan,Greater

Lukas Podolski.name: Lukas Podolski
Lukas Podolski.intro:
'''Lukas Josef Podolski''' (; born '''Łukasz Józef Podolski''' () on 4 June 1985) is a German Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Italian club Inter Milan, on loan from English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, and for the Germany national football teamGermany national team. He is a left-footed attacker known for his strong shot, technique and probing attacks from the left side.
He joined 1. FC Köln in 1995 where he broke into the first team in 2003 and made 81 appearances for the club before moving to FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. With Bayern, Podolski won the Bundesliga and DFB-Pokal double in 2008. Podolski returned to 1. FC Köln in 2009. He later signed for Premier League club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 2012, with whom he won the FA Cup in 2013–14 FA Cup2014.
Although he was eligible to play for Germany and Poland national football teamPoland, Podolski chose to play for Germany. He was first capped by Germany in 2004 and has been part of the squad in all major tournaments since then, winning the 2014 FIFA World Cup. He is the Germany national football team#Most capped playersthird most-capped player in German history, with 122 caps, and the Germany national football team#Top goalscorersthird-highest goalscorer in German history, having scored 48 times.
On 29 May 2013, Podolski scored the fastest goal in German national team history, after just 9 seconds of the 4–2 friendly win over Ecuador national football teamEcuador. It was also the second fastest international goal in history, second only to San Marino national football teamSan Marino's Davide Gualtieri's 8.3-second strike against England national football teamEngland in 1993.

Luke Wilkshire.name: Luke Wilkshire

Baxter has represented England at both England national under-16 football teamunder-16 and England national under-17 football teamunder-17 level as well as spending a spell on loan at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers during his time with Everton.

As a player he was a defender (association football)left-back from 1994 to 2011, notably in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He has also played for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town.

Hasney Aljofree.name: Hasney Aljofree
Hasney Aljofree.intro:
'''Hasney Aljofree''' (born 11 July 1978) is a former English Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender.
He began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, during which time he earned one cap for the England national under-18 football teamEngland U18 side. He joined Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in 1996 and made his first-team debut the following year. Aljofree moved on to Dundee United F.C.Dundee United in 2000 and spent a productive two years with the club, scoring his first four goals in league competition. He linked up with Paul Sturrock for a second time at Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, where he enjoyed the most successful period of his career to date. Having gained his first league winners medal in 2004, Aljofree played an important role in re-establishing the club in the second tier of Football in EnglandEnglish football. He spent time on loan with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic before being signed by Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town; linking up with Sturrock for a fourth time.
Aljofree Captain (association football)captained the side on numerous occasions, but was also hampered by injury problems, one of which kept him sidelined for 10 months. He was released from his contract in 2010 and then signed for Oldham Athletic on a short-term contract.
Hasney Aljofree.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Tony Gale.name: Tony Gale
Tony Gale.intro:
'''Anthony Peter "Tony" Gale''' (born 19 November 1959) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer who is now a regular pundit on Soccer Saturday. He also contributes a column for the British tabloid newspaper ''The Sun (newspaper)The Sun''.
As a player he played as a defender (association football)defender from 1977 until 1998 notably in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he was amongst the squad that won the title in 1995. He also played for Fulham F.C.Fulham, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Maidenhead United F.C.Maidenhead United.

Steve Cotterill.name: Steve Cotterill
Steve Cotterill.intro:
'''Stephen''' "'''Steve'''" '''Cotterill''' (born 20 July 1964) is an English association footballfootballer and Manager (association football)manager who is currently manager of Bristol City F.C.Bristol City.
Cotterill had an eight-year career as a footballer playing for Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth before deciding to take up football management. He began with Irish side Sligo Rovers F.C.Sligo Rovers and after a year he returned to England and took over at his home town club, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town. He did well at Whaddon Road guiding the club from the fifth tier to the third in five years. His success at Cheltenham led to Stoke City F.C.Stoke City appointing him as their manager prior to the start of the 2002–03 Stoke City F.C. season2002–03 season.
However after just 13 matches he quit to take up assistant manager position at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He did not last long at Sunderland and joined Burnley F.C.Burnley in June 2004. After three years at Turf Moor he moved on to have a short spell at Notts County F.C.Notts County in 2010 and spent a season and a half at cash strapped Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. In October 2011 he was appointed manager at Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and he managed to guide the club successfully out of a relegation battle. He was dismissed by Forest in July 2012 after the club was taken over by the Al-Hasawi family. In January 2013, he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers' coaching staff remaining until the end of the 2012–13 season. He was appointed manager of Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in December 2013.

Jonathan Blondel.name: Jonathan Blondel
Jonathan Blondel.intro: '''Jonathan Blondel''' (born 3 April 1984) is a retired BelgiumBelgian Association footballfootballer who last played as a midfielder for Club Brugge K.V.Club Brugge.

Neale Fenn.name: Neale Fenn
Neale Fenn.intro: '''Neale Fenn''' (born 18 January 1977) is a retired professional footballer. Neale played his last game in 2010

Mahamadou Diarra.intro: '''Mahamadou Diarra''' (born 18 May 1981) is a MaliMalian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder. He is currently the Captaincy (association football)captain of the Mali national football teamMali national team.

Magaye Gueye.name: Magaye Gueye
Magaye Gueye.intro: '''Magaye Serigne Falilou Dit Nelson Gueye''' (born 6 July 1990) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Millwall F.C.Millwall. He is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 international, but in 2012 he accepted a call up from Senegal for the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics - Men's tournamentOlympic games tournament, eligible due to his Senegalese parentage. Gueye started his professional career with RC Strasbourg in France, before moving to Everton F.C.Everton in 2010. He made 24 appearances for Everton in four seasons, spending time on loan at Stade Brestois 29Brest, before leaving the club and joining Millwall in 2014. He was a talented sprinter but stopped to focus on his football career. His 100m personal best remains 10.13s.

Ibrahim Ba.name: Ibrahim Ba
Ibrahim Ba.intro: '''Ibrahim "Ibou" Ba''' (born 12 November 1973) is a Senegalese-born professional French football player of the 1990s and 2000s whose career as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger lasted from 1991 to 2008.  In the late 1990s, particularly between 1996 and 1998, he was considered to be one of the hottest young talents in the world after consistently impressing with FC Girondins de Bordeaux.

Charlie Austin.name: Charlie Austin
Charlie Austin.intro:
'''Charles "Charlie" Austin''' (born 5 July 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a forward (association football)#forwardforward.
Released by Reading F.C.Reading as a youth, Austin played non-league football up to 2009, when he was signed by Swindon Town after a prolific season for Poole Town. He then went on to Burnley F.C.Burnley and QPR.

Adrian Whitbread.name: Adrian Whitbread
Adrian Whitbread.intro:
'''Adrian Richard Whitbread''' (born 22 October 1971 in Epping, Essex) is a former professional association footballfootballer. He played for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Reading F.C.Reading before retiring from playing due to a persistent knee injury.
Once qualified Adrian started a successful coaching career which has included spell as Assistant Manager at BarnetFC,Brentford FC, MK Dons & Leicester City in the UK and subsequently has coached as Assistant at Puerto Rico Islanders where he enjoyed a record breaking venture into the Semi Finals of the CONCACAF Champions League.
Following Head Coach Colin Clarke's departure to the Carolina Railhawks he assumed the post of Head Coach at Puerto Rico Islanders where he he finished in 3rd Position in the newly formatted NASL , once the Islanders were disbanded he was quickly positioned as Head Coach for Antigua Barracuda who similarly were unable to full fill there League obligations.
In April 2014 he was appointed the Head Coach of the Bahrain FA U23 Squad and Olympic team.
