'''Konstantinos "Kostas" Chalkias''' (; born 30 May 1974) is a retired Greek association footballfootballer who last played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for PAOK F.C.PAOK. Previously he had played for Panathinaikos F.C.Panathinaikos, Apollon Smyrni, Iraklis F.C.Iraklis, Portsmouth FCPortsmouth, Real Murcia and Aris Thessaloniki F.C.Aris.
He was also capped 32 times by the Greek national football team, with whom he won Euro 2004. He also was selected at the next two European Championships and the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Bruno Cheyrou.name: Bruno Cheyrou

Davis progressed from the youth academy of Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers to debut for the club in the Premier League in 2012. He failed to become a consistent member of their starting team though over the following two seasons at lower levels and departed for neighbours Birmingham City in August 2014.

'''Stephen Quinn''' (born 1 April 1986) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Premier League side Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.
He started his career with League of Ireland side St Patrick's Athletic F.C.St Patrick's Athletic before moving to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 2005. Quinn made over 200 appearances for the Blades, being their player of the season in 2011 and being in the PFA Team of the YearFootball League One PFA Team of the Year 2011-12. In 2012 he moved to Hull City and was a part of the side that won promotion back to the Premier League. Quinn also started the 2014 FA Cup Final against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He is known for his set piece taking.

\u00c9rik Lamela.name: Érik Lamela
\u00c9rik Lamela.intro: '''Érik Manuel Lamela''' (born 4 March 1992) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielderattacking midfielder or Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team. He is known for his exceptional dribbling ability and pace and is nicknamed Coco.

Matthew Lowton.name: Matthew Lowton

He can play in a number of defensive positions but is a natural right back. Born in Chesterfield, Derbyshire, he joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United's Sheffield United F.C. Academyacademy in 2004 before eventually making the break into United's first team in 2010, playing regularly for two seasons before being sold to Villa.  Lowton has also spent time on loan with both non-league Sheffield F.C.Sheffield and Hungarian side Ferencvárosi TCFerencváros.
Matthew Lowton.position: Defender  association football  Fullback Right back

Jermaine Jones.name: Jermaine Jones
Jermaine Jones.intro:
'''Jermaine Junior Jones''' (born 3 November 1981) is a American Association footballsoccer player who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderCentral midfielder for the New England Revolution in Major League Soccer (MLS) and the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States National Team.
He has previously played for Eintracht Frankfurt, Bayer Leverkusen, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, FC Schalke 04Schalke 04, and Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş.
He was born in Germany and represented them at Germany national under-21 football teamU21 and Germany national football teamsenior level. However, he was not a regular in the team. As his father was an American, and Jones had not played a competitive match for Germany, he was eligible to represent the United States national men's soccer teamUnited States. He made his debut for them in 2010 and played at the 2014 FIFA World Cup, scoring a notable goal against Portugal national football teamPortugal.

Andre Wisdom.name: Andre Wisdom
Andre Wisdom.intro:
'''Andre Alexander Shaquille Wisdom''' (born 9 May 1993) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a Defender (association football)defender, on loan from Liverpool F.C.Liverpool.
Wisdom began his career at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City before signing for Liverpool in 2008. He has also played for and captained the England national football teamEngland youth teams at various levels, winning the UEFA European Under-17 Football ChampionshipUEFA European U-17 Championship in 2010.

Earl Barrett.name: Earl Barrett
Earl Barrett.intro: '''Earl Delisser Barrett''' (born 28 April 1967 in Rochdale, Lancashire) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played in the Football League and Premier League for Manchester City, Chester City F.C.Chester City, Oldham Athletic, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Everton F.C.Everton, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Sheffield Wednesday. He played mainly at right back though could also adapt to a central defensive role. He also gained three England caps while playing at Oldham and Aston Villa. The £1.7m Aston Villa paid for him in February 1992 remains, as of 2014, Oldham Athletic's record transfer receipt.

Geoff Cameron.name: Geoff Cameron
Geoff Cameron.intro:
'''Geoffrey Scott''' "'''Geoff'''" '''Cameron''' (born July 11, 1985) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays for Premier League side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.
Cameron began playing college soccer with the West Virginia Mountaineers men's soccerWest Virginia Mountaineers and the Rhode Island Rams men's soccerRhode Island Rams, as well as USL Premier Development League side Rhode Island Stingrays, before being drafted by Major League Soccer club Houston Dynamo in 2008. After an impressive second season in professional soccer Cameron was named as MLS Best XI in 2009 and helped Houston reach the MLS Cup 2011final of the MLS Cup in 2011 as they lost 1–0 to the Los Angeles Galaxy. In August 2012 he joined English Premier League side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.

Matt Hill.name: Matt Hill
Matt Hill.intro: '''Matthew Clayton "Matt" Hill''' (born 26 March 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. Born in Bristol, Hill started his career with Bristol City F.C.Bristol City where he made over 200 appearances. He subsequently joined Preston North End F.C.Preston North End where he also spent a successful spell, playing over 100 times for the Lancashire club. A move to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers followed but first team opportunities were more limited and he was loaned to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers before leaving to join Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. After only one season at the South Yorkshire club he transferred to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool but again played few first team games before being loaned to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, with the move being made permanent in the summer of 2012.

David Johnson (footballer, born 1976).name: David Johnson (footballer, born 1976)
David Johnson (footballer, born 1976).intro: '''David Anthony Johnson''' (born 15 August 1976) is a Jamaican former Association footballfootballer. Born in Kingston, JamaicaKingston, Johnson began his career with English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but was unable to break into the first team and joined Bury F.C.Bury on a free transfer in 1995. He later played for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, as well as on loan for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, before a back injury ended his career at the age of 30. He also played international football for the Jamaica national football teamJamaica national team.

Billy Knott.name: Billy Knott
Billy Knott.intro:
'''Billy Steven Knott''' (born 28 November 1992) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Football League OneLeague One side Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City.
He joined Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland after being released from the Chelsea F.C. Reserves and AcademyChelsea Academy in 2011. He played one game for the club, and spent periods on loan at AFC Wimbledon, Woking F.C.Woking, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He joined Bradford City in May 2014. He has represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level.

Egil \u00d8stenstad.name: Egil Østenstad
Egil \u00d8stenstad.intro: '''Egil Johan Østenstad''' (; born 2 January 1972), nicknamed "Østen", is a Norwegian former association footballfootball player. He started and ended his career at Viking FKViking, where he was director of football after his retirement. His playing career also included spells at Southampton F.C.Southampton and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn, among others.

Nani.name: Nani
Nani.intro:
'''Luís Carlos Almeida da Cunha''' (born 17 November 1986), commonly known as '''Nani''' () or '''Luís Nani''',
Nani was born in Cape Verde and emigrated to Europe with his family at an early age. He was raised in Portugal and began his football career playing for local side Real Sport ClubeReal Massamá. At the age of nine, he began training with Sporting Clube de Portugal and S.L. Benfica on alternate days, eventually joining Sporting's youth squad after they offered him pre-season training. In 2005, he made his professional debut with the club and won the Taça de PortugalPortuguese Cup during his second season with them. Nani was named the SJPF Young Player of the Month for May 2007 and his performances with Sporting culminated into a move to English club side Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in July 2007 for a fee of €25 million.
Nani won the 2007 FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield on his competitive debut at Manchester United and has since added a number of trophies, which included the 2007–08 Premier LeaguePremier League and 2008 UEFA Champions League FinalChampions League during his debut season at the club. He has established himself as first-choice winger at United and has won a further three Premier League titles, the 2009 Football League Cup FinalFootball League Cup, one FIFA Club World Cup, and three FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield titles. Individually, Nani has been included in the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) PFA Team of the YearPremier League Team of the Year on one occasion and was a nominee for the PFA Young Player of the Year in 2011.
Nani is also a Portugal national football teamPortugal international. Prior to playing at senior level, he played at Portugal national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. He made his senior international debut in September 2006 in a Exhibition matchfriendly match against Denmark national football teamDenmark and scored his first international goal during the 4–2 defeat in Copenhagen. Nani has represented his country at two major tournaments, the UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012 European Championships. Since his debut, he has made 83 appearances and scored 15 goals for Portugal, making him their seventh most capped player of all time.

Matt Elliott.name: Matt Elliott
Matt Elliott.intro:
'''Matthew Stephen "Matt" Elliott''' (born 1 November 1968) is a former professional footballer, most notably as a defender for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. Although born in England, he was never selected to play for them on an international level; he instead played for Scotland, for whom he was eligible due to his Scottish grandmother.
He captained Leicester to victory in the 2000 Football League Cup Final scoring both goals.

Jhon Vi\u00e1fara.name: Jhon Viáfara

'''Graham Alexander''' (born 10 October 1971) is a former professional Association footballfootballer. He is the manager of Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town.
For most of his career, Coventry-born Alexander played as a specialist at Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, but was also deployed in Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfield,
[
Graham Alexander.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

David Ospina.name: David Ospina
David Ospina.intro: '''David Ospina Ramírez''' (born 31 August 1988) is a Colombian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Thomas Gaards\u00f8e.name: Thomas Gaardsøe
Thomas Gaards\u00f8e.intro:
'''Thomas Gaardsøe Christensen''' (born November 23, 1979) is a DenmarkDanish former professional football (soccer)footballer.
Gaardsøe most notably won the 1999 Danish Superliga with AaB FodboldAalborg Boldspilklub, and played abroad for EnglandEnglish clubs Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He played two matches and scored a single goal for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team.
Thomas Gaards\u00f8e.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

John Karelse.name: John Karelse
John Karelse.intro:
'''John Karelse''' (born 17 May 1970 in Wemeldinge) is a retired NetherlandsDutch football goalkeeper and unemployed manager after being fired by NAC Breda.
He played for AGOVV Apeldoorn in his native country for a few years before moving to NAC Breda. It was here that he caught the attention of then Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United manager Ruud Gullit, who signed him for an undisclosed fee (thought to be in the region of £800,000) in August 1999. His time at Newcastle was largely unsuccessful, as he endured a terrible start to his career at the club, losing 4-2 to Southampton F.C.Southampton on his debut. He found his first team opportunities very limited after this, not helped by the competition for his position being very high with the reliable Shay Given and Steve Harper (footballer)Steve Harper also at the club. Tony Caig was also ahead of him as third choice backup. He did, however, manage to keep a clean sheet against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal at Arsenal StadiumHighbury, in what proved to be his third and final game for the club.
A proposed move to Turkey broke down in 2000, but a year later a move back to the Netherlands seemed likely, with Feyenoord rumoured to be interested. No move materialised and the former Dutch Netherlands national under-21 football teamUnder-21 international had no choice but to stay in the Newcastle reserves. He retired in 2004 after one final season at AGOVV Apeldoorn.
In 2006 he became interim manager of NAC and led the team successfully through the relegation play-offs. Karelse became manager of NAC in 2011.

Theo Robinson.name: Theo Robinson
Theo Robinson.intro: '''Theo Larayan Ronaldo Robinson''' (born 22 January 1989) is an English-born Jamaica national football teamJamaican international Association footballfootballer who plays for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. He's previously played for Derby County F.C.Derby County, Watford F.C.Watford, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Millwall F.C.Millwall and been on loan to Wealdstone F.C.Wealdstone, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United and Southend United F.C.Southend United.

Steve Ogrizovic.name: Steve Ogrizovic
Steve Ogrizovic.intro:
'''Steven "Steve" Ogrizovic''', nicknamed '''Oggy''' (from Serbian languageSerbian: Ogrizović, Огризовић) (born 12 September 1957 in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire) is an English association football coach and former professional footballer, currently employed as goalkeeping coach of Football League One side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1977 until 2000 and achieved fame during 16 years at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City (1984 to 2000). He holds the record at Coventry for the most appearances as a player at 601 in all competitions (504 in the league) and he played in the winning FA Cup team of 1987. He also played for Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town.
Ogrizovic was also a competent cricketer, reaching minor counties level as a medium-fast bowler. He played three List A cricketList A matches for Shropshire County Cricket ClubShropshire in the NatWest Trophy, and a further game for Minor Counties#Minor Counties Representative TeamsMinor Counties in the Benson & Hedges Cup. Among his five wickets at this level were three Test cricketTest players: Chris Broad, Martyn Moxon and Alvin Kallicharran.

Neil Redfearn.name: Neil Redfearn
Neil Redfearn.intro:
'''Neil David Redfearn''' (born 20 June 1965) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who is the current head coach of Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United.
Redfearn played 790 matches in the Football League, the fifth highest total of all-time, and more than a thousand first team games overall in a career that has spanned 24 years. He has had spells as caretaker manager of Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town and York City F.C.York City and as manager of Scarborough F.C.Scarborough and Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria.

Chris Hamon.name: Chris Hamon
Chris Hamon.intro:
'''Chris Hamon''' (born 27 April 1970) is a retired association footballfootball striker (football)forward from Jersey who played for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town and Dundalk F.C.Dundalk. He also represented the Jersey national football teamJersey national team in the 1991 Island Games, scoring four goals (including a hat-trick against Greenland national football teamGreenland).cite web
url=
title=Island Games Tournament 1991 (Åland)
After retiring from football, Hamon worked as a paramedic.

Phil Neville.name: Phil Neville
Phil Neville.intro:
'''Philip John "Phil" Neville''' (born 21 January 1977) is an English association footballfootball coach and former player, as well as being the co-owner of Salford City F.C.Salford City. After 10 years as a professional with Manchester United, during which time he won six Premier League titles, three FA Cups and the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, he joined Everton F.C.Everton in 2005, where he spent the final eight years of his playing career. Neville also played for England national football teamEngland 59 times between 1996 and 2007, representing the nation at three UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships. He could play in defender (association football)defence or midfieldermidfield; due to this versatility, he operated in a number of different positions throughout his career, but was most often used as a full-back.
After earning his UEFA B Coaching Licence, Neville began his coaching career in 2012, filling in for Stuart Pearce with the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s. When David Moyes, Neville's manager at Everton, left to join Manchester United as Alex FergusonSir Alex Ferguson's replacement in May 2013, Neville was considered for the Everton job, but he ultimately followed Moyes to Manchester United as the club's first-team coach. Neville retained his position under interim manager Ryan Giggs after Moyes was sacked in April 2014, but was found to be surplus to requirements when Louis van Gaal took over in July 2014.
Neville is the younger brother of fellow former Manchester United defender Gary Neville, and the twin brother of England netball international Tracey Neville.

Simon Davies (footballer, born 1979).name: Simon Davies (footballer, born 1979)
Simon Davies (footballer, born 1979).intro: '''Simon Davies''' (born 23 October 1979) is a Welsh international Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Solva in Pembrokeshire League Division Two. Davies started his career at Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United before playing for Premier League clubs Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Everton F.C.Everton and Fulham F.C.Fulham, earning a runner-up medal during the 2009–10 UEFA Europa League with Fulham. Davies made more than 350 appearances at senior club level in England, along with earning 58 caps for the Wales national football teamWelsh national team.

Nuno Valente.name: Nuno Valente
Nuno Valente.intro:
'''Nuno Jorge Pereira da Silva Valente''', Order of Infante D. HenriqueOIH (; born 12 September 1974), is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
After settling with a club in his late 20s with F.C. PortoPorto – he started his career with Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting, but never imposed there – he moved at 31 to England with Everton F.C.Everton, where he finally retired after appearing in 60 competitive games in four seasons.
A late bloomer on the international stage, Valente helped Portugal national football teamPortugal finish second in UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004. He also participated in the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup.
Nuno Valente.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Hayden Foxe.name: Hayden Foxe
Hayden Foxe.intro: '''Hayden Vernon Foxe''' (born 23 June 1977) is an Australian former Football (soccer)footballer and assistant coach of Melbourne Heart. He played football at the top level in Germany, Japan, Belgium, England and Australia. Foxe represented his country at international level 11 times between 1998 and 2003.

Diafra Sakho.name: Diafra Sakho
Diafra Sakho.intro:
'''Diafra Sakho''' (born 24 December 1989) is a Senegalese professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Striker (association football)striker for English club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
He began his career in the lower divisions of French football, with FC MetzMetz and on loan at US BoulogneBoulogne, before joining West Ham in August 2014. Since May 2014, he has been a full international for the Senegal national football team.

Jo Inge Berget.name: Jo Inge Berget
Jo Inge Berget.intro: '''Jo Inge Berget''' (born 11 September 1990) is a NorwayNorwegian professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Malmö FF in Allsvenskan.

Rae Ingram.name: Rae Ingram
Rae Ingram.intro:
'''Rae Ingram''' (born 6 December 1974) is an English former Association footballfootballer. A defender (association football)defender, he played 151 league games in a ten-year career in the Football League and Premier League.
He began his career at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in July 1993, and made 21 appearances over the next five years. He was loaned out to Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town in March 1993, and helped the "Silkmen" to promotion out of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division in 1997–98. He joined the club permanently in July 1998, before he moved on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in June 2001. He left Vale Park in May 2003, and spent one season in the Welsh Premier League with Bangor City F.C.Bangor City, before announcing his retirement. He later became a firefighter.

Brian Jensen (footballer, born 1975).name: Brian Jensen (footballer, born 1975)
Brian Jensen (footballer, born 1975).intro:
'''Brian Paldan Jensen''' (born 8 June 1975) is a Danish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He has played more than 300 English league games since 2000 for Burnley F.C.Burnley and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.
Jensen started his career with Danish lower-league club Boldklubben af 1893B.93, before joining Dutch Eredivisie club AZ Alkmaar in 1997. He made his senior breakthrough with West Bromwich Albion, playing a total 50 games for the club. He joined Burnley in 2003, and has since played more than 300 games in all competitions, helping the club win promotion for the top-flight Premier League in 2009.

Samir Nasri.name: Samir Nasri
Samir Nasri.intro:
'''Samir Nasri''' (born 26 June 1987) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He primarily plays as an Attacking midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder and a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, although he has also been deployed in Midfielder#Centre_midfieldercentral midfield. Nasri is known for his technical ability, creativity, pace, and ability to read the game. Of Algerian Cultural heritageheritage, he is described as a player whose "vision and imagination make him an unpredictable opponent". His playing style, ability, and cultural background have drawn comparisons to French legend Zinedine Zidane.
Nasri began his football career playing for local youth clubs in his hometown of Marseille. At the age of nine, he joined professional club Olympique de Marseille and spent the next seven years developing in the club's youth academy at Centre d'entraînement Robert Louis-DreyfusLa Commanderie, the club's training center. In the 2004–05 Ligue 12004–05 season, Nasri made his professional debut in September 2004 at the age of 17 against FC Sochaux-MontbéliardSochaux. In the 2005–06 Ligue 1following season, he became a regular starter in the team and also participated in UEFAEuropean competition for the first time after playing in the 2005–06 UEFA Cup2005–06 edition of the UEFA Cup. In the 2006–07 Ligue 12006–07 campaign, Nasri won the National Union of Professional Footballers (UNFP) Trophées UNFP du football#Young Player of the YearYoung Player of the Year award and was also named to the Trophées UNFP du football#Team of the YearTeam of the Year. He finished his career with Marseille amassing over 160 appearances. He played in the teams that reached back-to-back Coupe de France finals in 2006 Coupe de France Final2006 and 2007 Coupe de France Final2007.
In June 2008, Nasri joined Premier League club Arsenal agreeing to a four-year contract. He reached prominence with the team in his third season winning the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) Fans' Player of the Month award on three occasions and being named to the association's PFA Team of the YearTeam of the Year. In December 2010, he was named the France Football#French Player of the YearFrench Player of the Year for his performances during the calendar year. In August 2011, after three seasons with Arsenal, Nasri joined Manchester City on a four-year contract. In his first season with the club, he won his first major honour as a player as the club won the 2011–12 Premier League2011–12 edition of the Premier League.
Nasri is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international and has represented his nation at every level for which he was eligible. Prior to playing for the France national football teamsenior team, he played on the France national under-17 football teamunder-17 team that won the 2004 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship. Nasri made his senior international debut in March 2007 in a friendly match against Austria national football teamAustria. Two months later, he scored his first senior international goal in a 1–0 UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying win over Georgia national football teamGeorgia. Nasri has represented France at two major international tournaments: UEFA Euro 2008 and UEFA Euro 2012.

Jamie Smith (footballer, born 1974).name: Jamie Smith (footballer, born 1974)
Jamie Smith (footballer, born 1974).intro: '''James Jade Anthony "Jamie" Smith''' (born 17 September 1974) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (football)#Full backfull back. He is currently a coach at West Bromwich Albion Academy.
Jamie Smith (footballer, born 1974).position: Defender  football  Full back Full back

Kevin Gallacher.name: Kevin Gallacher
Kevin Gallacher.intro:
'''Kevin William Gallacher''' (born 23 November 1966 in Clydebank) is a ScotlandScottish former professional Association footballfootballer and now a Pundit (expert)pundit. He played as a striker (association football)striker from 1983 until 2002, notably in the Premier League with Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he was part of the title winning side in 1995.
He started his career in his native land with Dundee United F.C.Dundee United and went on to also play in the English top flight for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, as well as in the Football League for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town. He made 53 appearances for Scotland national football teamScotland, scoring 9 goals.

Ian Walker.name: Ian Walker
Ian Walker.intro: '''Ian Michael Walker''' (born 31 October 1971) is an English former professionalAssociation football footballer. His former clubs include Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Walker is the son of former Wales national football teamWales goalkeeper, and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Everton F.C.Everton manager Mike Walker (Welsh footballer)Mike Walker. He is currently the goalkeeping coach at Chinese Super League side Shanghai Dongya F.C.Shanghai East Asia.

Ronnie Wallwork.name: Ronnie Wallwork
Ronnie Wallwork.intro:
'''Ronald "Ronnie" Wallwork''' (born 10 September 1977) is an EnglandEnglish former Association footballfootballer who could play as either a defender (association football)defender or a midfielder. An England national under-20 football teamEngland under-20 international, he began his career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, where he made his professional debut in 1997. He never fully established himself in the United first-team however, and was loan (football)loaned out to Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. During a further loan spell at Royal Antwerp FCRoyal Antwerp, he was banned from football for life for attacking a Belgian referee (association football)referee, although the ban was later substantially reduced. He returned to football in 2014 signing for Ashton United F.C.Ashton United.
In 2002, Wallwork moved to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, where he was the Player of the Year for 2004–05 in English football2004–05. He was not always a regular in the side however, and spent time on loan at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town. His spell at Barnsley was cut short when he was stabbed in a nightclub, causing him to miss more than two months of the 2006–07 in English football2006–07 season. Wallwork was transferred to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in January 2008, but was released just four months later and has since been without a club. In December 2011, he was sentenced to 15 months in prison after he pleaded guilty to three counts of receiving stolen goods.

Nicky Marker.name: Nicky Marker
Nicky Marker.intro: '''Nicholas "Nicky" Marker''' (born 3 May 1965) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer and current First-Team Manager of South West Peninsula League side Ivybridge Town F.C.Ivybridge Town.

Goce Sedloski.name: Goce Sedloski
Goce Sedloski.intro:
'''Goce Sedloski''' (; born 10 April 1974 in Golemo Konjari near Prilep) is a Macedonians (ethnic group)Macedonian retired Association footballfootballer who was a recently coached Republic of MacedoniaMacedonian side FK Turnovo, after joining them in 2013. He was also played for the Macedonia national football team.
He holds the record for playing more games for Macedonia than any other player.  His international career has until yet earned him 100 Cap (sport)caps, making him Macedonia's most capped player.
Goce Sedloski.birth_place: birth_place,Prilep,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Gary Blissett.name: Gary Blissett
Gary Blissett.intro:
He played for Crewe Alexandra, Brentford and Wimbledon in a professional career spanning almost fifteen years. Whilst at Wimbledon, he also had a short loan spell with Wycombe Wanderers.
Whilst at Brentford, Blissett became a strong fan favourite and fitted well into the team's long-ball style at the time, similar to Marcus Gayle, who was also at the club during this era and would later be his team-mate at Wimbledon.
In December 1992, Blissett was acquitted of Grievous bodily harmGBH after challenging for an aerial ball with Torquay United F.C.Torquay United player John Uzzell in an away game at Plainmoor 12 months earlier. It was alleged by Uzzell that Blissett had deliberately elbowed him in the face, fracturing his eye socket, although the court did not agree with this. Blissett has always maintained that the incident was an accidental collision and video evidence of the challenge was deemed to show that Blissett kept his eyes on the ball and, furthermore, that in jumping to head an aerial ball, a player would typically raise one or both arms to gain height.
He later played in Singapore for Sembawang Rangers and in Germany for SV Elversberg. He has stayed in Germany post-retirement, firstly as assistant manager, then reserve team manager at Elversberg.
He is currently based in Philadelphia, where he and his business partner, Alan Cockram, are coaching under 18's, as well as developing their business; Soccer Sounds.

Ryan Shawcross.name: Ryan Shawcross
Ryan Shawcross.intro:
'''Ryan James Shawcross'''  (born 4 October 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City as a Defender (association football)defender.
Shawcross began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and made his debut for the club against Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra in the Football League Cup; he then spent time on loan at Belgian feeder club Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp. He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan in August 2007 and made an instant impact scoring on his debut against Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. His good form prompted Stoke to pay Manchester United £1 million in January 2008 to keep him at the Britannia Stadium. He formed a good defensive partnership with Leon Cort as Stoke gained promotion to the Premier League for the first time, ending 23 years away from the top flight.
Despite making a bad start to Premier League football, Shawcross established himself as first-choice centre-back along with Abdoulaye Faye. Stoke comfortably stayed up, and after another mid-table finish in 2009–10 Stoke City F.C. season2009–10, Shawcross was handed the Captain (association football)Captain's armband by manager Tony Pulis ahead of the 2010–11 Stoke City F.C. season2010–11 season. With Faye drifting out of the side, Robert Huth became Shawcross's defensive partner and the team reached the 2011 FA Cup Final, finishing runners-up to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. The run to the final also meant that Stoke entered the UEFA Europa League in 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12, and they reached the round of 32 losing to Spanish side Valencia CFValencia. Shawcross continued to be a regular under Pulis in 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 and then under Mark Hughes in 2013–14 Stoke City F.C. season2013–14 which saw him win the Stoke City F.C. Player of the Yearplayer of the year award.
Ryan Shawcross.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Francis Coquelin.name: Francis Coquelin
Francis Coquelin.intro: '''Francis Coquelin''' (born 13 May 1991) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Josh Vela.name: Josh Vela
Josh Vela.intro: '''Joshua "Josh" James Vela''' (born 14 December 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as a right back defender and as a central midfielder.
Josh Vela.position: Midfielder,Defender  association football  Full back Right Back

Dion Dublin.name: Dion Dublin
Dion Dublin.intro:
'''Dion Dublin''' (born 22 April 1969)
Away from football, Dublin is also an accomplished amateur percussionist. He invented a percussion instrument, which he called "The Dube", and in 2011, he accompanied Ocean Colour Scene in a gig at the University of East Anglia, in Norwich.

Clarke Carlisle.name: Clarke Carlisle
Clarke Carlisle.intro:
'''Clarke James Carlisle''' (born 14 October 1979) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender and was chairman of the Professional Footballers' Association. Born in Preston, LancashirePreston, he began playing football at a young age, taking inspiration from his father who played semi-professionally. Carlisle represented his home county of Lancashire County Football AssociationLancashire at youth level. The start of his professional career was his The Football LeagueFootball League debut for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in September 1997. He moved to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in May 2000. In the same year, Carlisle won three Cap (sport)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 national team. He missed a number of games for Queens Park Rangers due to a Posterior cruciate ligamentcruciate ligament injury which at one stage led doctors to believe that his career was over. He then missed one month of the 2003–04 in English football2003–04 season because of an alcohol-related problem, and left Queens Park Rangers at the end of that season. In the summer of 2004, he joined Leeds United F.C.Leeds United on a Free transfer (association football)free transfer.
Carlisle spent just one season with Leeds United before signing for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Watford F.C.Watford in August 2005. In the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 season, his first with Watford, the team finished third in the division and achieved Promotion and relegationpromotion to the Premier League via the 2006 Football League Championship play-off Finalplay-offs. However, a thigh injury caused Carlisle to miss the majority of the team's inaugural top-flight season. In March 2007 he had a one-month loan spell at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. In August 2007, Burnley F.C.Burnley Manager (association football)manager Steve Cotterill bought Carlisle from Watford for a transfer fee of £200,000. In the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season he played over 40 matches as Burnley reached the semi-finals of the Football League CupLeague Cup and finished fifth in the league, earning a place in the play-offs. Carlisle was named man of the match for his performance in the 2009 Football League Championship play-off Finalplay-off final as Burnley beat Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United 1–0 to return to the top tier of English football for the first time in 33 years.
An imposing figure in the centre of defence thanks to his stature, Carlisle also provided an attacking threat from set pieces. He is a practising ChristianityChristian and regularly attends church. He attended Balshaw's CE High School where he attained 10 A-grades at GCSE and studied mathematics and politics at GCE Advanced LevelA-level, and in 2002 was awarded the title of "Britain's Brainiest Footballer" in a TV game show. He is an ambassador for the Kick It Out (organisation)Kick It Out campaign and is Chairman of the Management Committee of the Professional Footballers' Association.

Chris Riggott.name: Chris Riggott
Chris Riggott.intro:
'''Christopher Mark "Chris" Riggott''' (born 1 September 1980) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. He began his career at Derby County F.C.Derby County, before moving to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, with whom he won the Football League CupLeague Cup in 2003–04 Football League Cup2004. He also had spells with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion and represented England nine times at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.
Riggott is currently coaching the under-13s for Derby County

Ra\u00fal Bravo.name: Raúl Bravo
Ra\u00fal Bravo.intro:
'''Raúl Bravo Sanfélix''' (born 14 April 1981) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Greek club Veria F.C.Veria FC. Mainly a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back, he can also play in Defender (association football)#Centre-backthe centre.
Having played in almost all the youth ranks at Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, he went on to have a six-year spell in the first team, where he almost always served as a backup; however, it was during that period that he reached the Spain national football teamSpanish national team, representing it at UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004.[
Bravo also competed several years in Greece, most notably with Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos where he won six major titles including three Superleague Greecenational championships.

Mark Crossley.name: Mark Crossley
Mark Crossley.intro:
'''Mark Geoffrey Crossley''' (born 16 June 1969) is an English-born Wales national football teamWelsh former professional association footballfootballer, now a Goalkeeping Coach at Football Championship side Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1988 until 2011 and he has previously played for numerous clubs in England's top flight, notably for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, where he became the only goalkeeper to stop a Matthew Le Tissier penalty kick. He has also played for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Millwall F.C.Milwall, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield. He earned 8 international caps playing for Wales national football teamWales between 1997 and 2004.

Park Chu-young.name: Park Chu-young
Park Chu-young.intro: '''Park Chu-young''' (; also Korean romanizationromanised as '''Park Ju-young'''; born 10 July 1985) is South Korean association footballfootballer who is currently plays for FC Seoul

Carlos Tevez.name: Carlos Tevez
Carlos Tevez.intro:
'''Carlos Alberto Martínez Tevez''' (born 5 February 1984),Tevez's last name is sometimes written ''Tévez'', but he spells it without the accent mark. See:
He began his career with Boca Juniors, winning the Copa Libertadores and Intercontinental Cup (football)Intercontinental Cup in 2003 before moving to Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians in what was the biggest transfer by a South American club. Tevez then moved to West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, helping the team remain in the Premier League in his only season, and then won two league titles and the UEFA Champions League with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. In the 2009 summer transfer window he joined Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, becoming the first player to move between the two rival clubs since Terry Cooke in 1999.[
His career has been dogged by a long-standing relationship with Media Sports Investment (along with Just Sport), the company which owned his rights. This eventually resulted in West Ham United being fined over issues regarding third-party ownership.
Tevez made his debut for the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team in 2005. A gold medal winner at the Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2004 Olympics, he also played at two FIFA World CupWorld Cups, a FIFA Confederations CupConfederations Cup, and three Copa América tournaments.

Brian McAllister.name: Brian McAllister
Brian McAllister.intro:
'''Brian McAllister''' (born 30 November 1970 in Glasgow) is a former ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer who played for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.
McAllister played for Wimbledon between 1989 and 2000 and had loan spells at Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra. He was forced to retire in 2000 due to a heel injury.
McAllister helped Napier City Rovers win the New Zealand National Soccer League title in 1989.
He earned three Scotland cap (sport)caps in 1997, playing against Belarus national football teamBelarus, Malta national football teamMalta and Wales national football teamWales.

Stuart McCall.name: Stuart McCall
Stuart McCall.intro:
'''Andrew Stuart Murray McCall''' (born 10 June 1964), usually known as '''Stuart McCall''', is a association footballfootball player and manager, who is currently the manager of Rangers F.C.Rangers. He made a total of 763 league games and in 40 full international matches for Scotland national football teamScotland during his playing career.
McCall started his professional career with Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, where he made his senior debut in 1982. He played six seasons at Valley Parade, during which time he won the Football League Third DivisionDivision Three championship, a title which was overshadowed by the Bradford City stadium fire when 56 people died and in which his father Andy McCall (footballer born 1925)Andy was injured. After missing out on promotion in 1987–88 in English football1987–88, McCall moved to Everton F.C., for whom he scored twice but finished on the losing side in the 1989 FA Cup Final. In 1991, he moved to Rangers F.C.Rangers, with whom he spent seven seasons and won six Scottish Premier Leagueleague titles, three Scottish Cups and two Scottish League Cups. McCall returned to Bradford City as captain to take them into the Premier Leaguetop division of English football for the first time in 77 years. After four seasons he moved to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, where he retired as a player in 2005.
Despite being born in Leeds, England, McCall qualified to play for Scotland national football teamScotland through his Scottish father. He won 40 international cap (sport)caps and scored one goal in the 1990 FIFA World Cup in Italy. He also played in two UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championships but his international career ended after he was left out of the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup squad.
McCall was part of the coaching staff during his second spell at Bradford City, briefly serving as caretaker-player manager in 2000. He continued his coaching at Sheffield United and was assistant manager to Neil Warnock until May 2007, when he returned to Bradford City for a third time, this time as manager. He spent two-and-a-half seasons in charge of Bradford City, leaving in February 2010. Just before the end of 2010, he was appointed Motherwell F.C.Motherwell manager. He stayed at Fir Park for four years, helping the club finish second in the league twice. After a poor start to the 2014/15 season, he resigned in November 2014. McCall was appointed manager of Rangers F.C.Rangers in March 2015.

David Phillips.name: David Phillips
David Phillips.intro: '''David Owen Phillips''' (born 29 July 1963 in Wegberg, Germany) is a former professional and Welsh peopleWelsh international footballer who played as a midfielder for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City and Stevenage Borough F.C.Stevenage Borough.

Aidan Newhouse.name: Aidan Newhouse
Aidan Newhouse.intro:
'''Aidan Robert Newhouse''' (born 23 May 1972) is an English former Association footballfootballer. A Forward (association football)forward, he scored 15 goals in 113 league games in an 11-year career in the Football League.
He began his career at Chester City F.C.Chester City, making his debut before his sixteenth birthday. He was sold on to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon for £100,000 in February 1990. He featured once in the Premier League, but was rarely used in his seven years at Selhurst Park. He spent brief periods on loan at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, and Torquay United F.C.Torquay United. He moved on to Fulham F.C.Fulham in June 1997, before being sold on to Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City for £30,000 four months later. He joined Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in August 1999, being entering non-league football with Sutton United F.C.Sutton United and Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria.

Tugay Kerimo\u011flu.name: Tugay Kerimoğlu
Tugay Kerimo\u011flu.intro:
'''Tugay Kerimoğlu''' (born 24 August 1970) is a Turkish former Association footballfootballer who played the majority of his career for Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. Primarily a Midfielder#Deep-lying_playmakerdeep-lying playmaker in midfield, he was also competent as an Midfielder#Central midfielderattacking midfielder or playing in the Midfielder#Defensiveholding role.
Continually recognised for his ability he was highly rated in the football industry. In 2000, former Romanian legend Gheorghe Hagi rated him as one of the finest ball-playing midfielders in Europe,cite news
url=
url=
url=

Craig Armstrong.name: Craig Armstrong
Craig Armstrong.intro:
'''Steven Craig Armstrong''' (born 23 May 1975) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer, manager and currently Elite Development coach at Football League Championship side Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
As a player he was a Defender (association football)defender and midfielder from 1992 to 2012 and represented Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Watford F.C.Watford, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers, Boston United F.C.Boston United and Hucknall Town F.C.Hucknall Town. In 2011 he briefly held the position of player-manager of Eastwood Town F.C.Eastwood Town and later had a spell as manager of Quorn F.C.Quorn.

David Rocastle.name: David Rocastle
David Rocastle.intro:
'''David Carlyle Rocastle''' (2 May 1967 – 31 March 2001) was an English professional association footballfootballer, who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1984 until 1999.
He spent the majority of his career at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal where he was nicknamed "Rocky", and then went on to feature in the Premier League for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, before later playing in the Football League for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and finishing his career in Malaysia with Sabah FA. Rocastle earned 14 international caps for England national football teamEngland between 1988 and 1992.

Ben Amos.name: Ben Amos
Ben Amos.intro: '''Benjamin Paul "Ben" Amos''' (born 10 April 1990) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers on loan from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Born in Macclesfield, Cheshire, Amos began his career with Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra's youth academy, but joined Manchester United at the age of 11. He has spent time on loan at Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Molde FKMolde, and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. Additionally, Amos is an England youth international, having represented his country at every level from Under-16 to Under-21.

Stern John.name: Stern John
Stern John.intro: '''Stern John''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 30 October 1976 in Trincity, Trinidad and Tobago) is a Trinidadian Association footballfootball player who recently came out of retirement to play for WASA F.C.WASA FC. He played for a number of high-profile English football clubs that included Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Derby County F.C.Derby County.

Claus Thomsen.name: Claus Thomsen
Claus Thomsen.intro: '''Claus Thomsen''' (born 31 May 1970 in Aarhus) is a DenmarkDanish former professional football (soccer)footballer. He won the Danish Cup with Aarhus Gymnastik ForeningAGF Aarhus and played in England for Premier Leaguetop level teams Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Everton F.C.Everton, as well as VfL WolfsburgWolfsburg in Germany. He played 20 matches for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team, and represented Denmark at the 1992 Summer Olympics and 1996 UEFA European Football Championship1996 European Championship.

Leon Cort.name: Leon Cort
Leon Cort.intro: '''Leon Terence Anthony Cort''' (born 11 September 1979) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender. He is of GuyanaGuyanese descent and is the younger brother of Carl Cort.

Mike Milligan.name: Mike Milligan
Mike Milligan.intro:
'''Michael Milligan''' (born 20 February 1967 in Manchester) is a former association footballfootballer.
He left school in 1983 and signed for Oldham Athletic, establishing himself as a regular midfielder in the later part of the 1980s and helping them reach the FA Cup semi-final and Football League Cup final (which they lost to Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest) in the 1989-90 in English football1989–90. After the end of the season, he signed for Everton in a £1million deal, but the move was not a success and after just one season at Goodison Park, Joe Royle bought him back to Oldham, who had just returned to the top flight after a 68-year exile.
Milligan resumed his key role in the Oldham side that survived three seasons in the top flight (Premier League from 1992), helping them reach another FA Cup semi final in 1994, before leaving to join Norwich City F.C.Norwich City after Oldham's relegation from the FA Premier LeaguePremiership. He remained at Carrow Road until 2000, when he signed for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. At Bloomfield Road, he helped Steve McMahon (footballer)Steve McMahon's side win the Football League Third DivisionDivision Three playoffs and survive in Division Two before finally retiring in the summer of 2002, aged 35, after a career spanning 19 years. At Blackpool he scored once, in a 6–0 win over Scunthorpe United.cite web
url=
title=Blackpool 6–0 Scunthorpe
publisher=BBC
date=3 February 2001 accessdate=1 January 2010
He played once for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland in 1992, once for the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland U21 and twice for the Republic of Ireland B national football teamRepublic of Ireland B.

Alun Armstrong.name: Alun Armstrong
Alun Armstrong.intro: '''Alun Armstrong''' (born 22 February 1975 in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear) is an English former professional association footballfootballer.

Emanuele Giaccherini.name: Emanuele Giaccherini
Emanuele Giaccherini.intro:
'''Emanuele Giaccherini''' (; born 5 May 1985) is an Italian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for English club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and the Italy national football team.
He began his career at A.C. CesenaCesena, and after loans at three lower-league clubs, helped them to consecutive promotions to reach Serie A. He then left to Juventus F.C.Juventus, where he won the league title in both of his seasons, before joining Sunderland on a four-year deal in 2013.
Giaccherini has earned over 20 caps for the Italy national football team, helping the nation to the final of UEFA Euro 2012 and third place at the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup.
Giaccherini is a consistent, energetic, quick, hard-working and versatile player. He is capable of aiding his team defensively, but also offensively, due to his ability to make attacking runs, contributing with goals, and assists, due to his reliable distribution. He was initially deployed as a winger on either flank early in his career, due to his technical dribbling ability, agility, acceleration, and balance, which aid him in beating players in one on one situations. He is capable of playing anywhere in midfield, however, and has more recently been deployed as a central midfielder or as an attacking midfielder.

S\u00e9bastien Pocognoli.name: Sébastien Pocognoli
S\u00e9bastien Pocognoli.intro: '''Sébastien Pocognoli''' (born 1 August 1987) is a Belgian international Association footballfootballer who plays professionally for English club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.
S\u00e9bastien Pocognoli.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Jack Colback.name: Jack Colback
Jack Colback.intro:
'''Jack Raymond Colback''' (born 24 October 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Colback began his career at Sunderland in 2008, having graduated from Sunderland A.F.C. Reserves and Academytheir academy, and broke into the team following loans at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town of the Football League ChampionshipChampionship. After 115 Premier League appearances with Sunderland, his contract expired and he controversially moved to their biggest rival, Newcastle United.
He played once for England at England national under-20 football teamUnder-20 level in 2009, and was called up for the England national football teamsenior squad for the first time in August 2014.

Nick Tanner.name: Nick Tanner
Nick Tanner.intro:
Tanner joined Liverpool from Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and had a short spell on loan at Norwich City in 1990 where he made six appearances. He returned to Liverpool and played 59 games for the club scoring one goal against Everton F.C.Everton in 1991 before retiring through a back injury in 1994.
Since retiring, he became manager of Almondsbury Town F.C.Almondsbury Town in November 2003 leaving them two years later to manage Roman Glass St George F.C.Roman Glass St George. Tanner left Roman Glass St George to become chief scout at Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers and in November 2006 he became manager of Wotton Rovers F.C.Wotton Rovers, but quit a year later. In November 2009 he was appointed manager of Hellenic Football LeagueHellenic League side Winterbourne United F.C.Winterbourne United. Tanner quit Winterbourne in August 2011 however after a poor start to their season.
In June 2012, Tanner returned to football as joint-manager at Bristol Premier Combination side Wick.

Barry Venison.name: Barry Venison
Barry Venison.intro:
'''Barry Venison''' (born 16 August 1964) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and sports television pundit, who as a player was a defender (association football)defender from 1981 to 1997.
He notably played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, having also appeared for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray and Southampton F.C.Southampton. He was capped twice by England national football teamEngland.

Emmanuel Adebayor.name: Emmanuel Adebayor
Emmanuel Adebayor.intro:
'''Sheyi Emmanuel Adebayor''' (; born 26 February 1984), known as '''Emmanuel Adebayor''', is a Togolese Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the Togo national football teamTogo national team. Adebayor previously played for FC MetzMetz, AS Monaco FCMonaco, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He was voted African Footballer of the Year for 2008.cite news
url=
title=Adebayor named Africa's best player for 2008
date=11 February 2009
accessdate=22 April 2009
publisher=Arsenal F.C.
Adebayor represented the Togo national football team at the 2006 FIFA World Cup in Germany, the country's début, and to date only, appearance at the FIFA World CupWorld Cup. In January 2010, Adebayor was one of the players involved when the Togo team's Togo national football team attackbus came under gunfire on the way to the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations in Angola, after which he retired from national team duty. In 2013 he returned to the Togo team for the 2013 African Cup of Nations in South Africa, where he helped them to qualify for the quarterfinals. He is currently Togo's Top international association football goal scorers by countryall-time top goalscorer with 28 goals.
A towering striker, Adebayor is described as being "tall, skilful, strong in the air and with the ability to score and create."

Gareth Bale.name: Gareth Bale
Gareth Bale.intro:
'''Gareth Frank Bale''' (born 16 July 1989) is a Welsh association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and the Wales national football teamWales national team, as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Bale began his professional career at Southampton F.C.Southampton, playing at defender (association football)left back and earning acclaim as a direct free kickfree kick specialist. He moved to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 2007, for an eventual £7 million fee. During his time at Spurs, managerial and tactical shifts saw him transform into a more offensive player. From the 2009–10 season, Bale became an integral part of the team, rising to international attention during the 2010–11 UEFA Champions League. In 2011 and 2013 he was named PFA Players' Player of the Year, and was named in the UEFA Team of the Year. In 2013 he was also named PFA Young Player of the Year and the FWA Footballer of the Year.
On 1 September 2013, Bale was transferred to Spanish team Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid for an undisclosed fee. The Spanish press and Real Madrid TV reported £77 million (€91 million), while the English press reported a World football transfer recordworld record transfer fee of £85.3 million (€100 million), which would be above Cristiano Ronaldo's transfer record fee of £80 million (€94 million). He played an integral role in his first season at Real Madrid, helping the club to win the 2013–14 Copa del ReyCopa del Rey and the 2013–14 UEFA Champions LeagueUEFA Champions League, scoring in both finals. The following season he won the 2014 UEFA Super CupUEFA Super Cup and in December 2014 scored in a third major final to help the club win the 2014 FIFA Club World CupFIFA Club World Cup.
Renowned for his ball striking from distance, his free-kicks, and his ability to get past defenders with pace, Bale has received plaudits from his peers, who have described him as a footballer with "tremendous speed, great crossing ability, a great left foot and exceptional physical qualities".

Francesco Baiano.name: Francesco Baiano
Francesco Baiano.intro: '''Francesco Baiano''' (born 24 February 1968 in Naples) is a former ItalyItalian footballer and currently a coach, last in charge as Giuseppe Sannino's assistant coach at U.S. Città di PalermoPalermo. He is a well-known striker famous for his shooting technique.

Marc Tierney.name: Marc Tierney
Marc Tierney.intro: '''Marc Peter Tierney''' (born 23 August 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. Predominantly a Defender (association football)left back, Tierney can play in other positions, such as centre-back. His brother Paul Tierney (footballer)Paul is a former professional footballer.

Gary Megson.name: Gary Megson
Gary Megson.intro:
'''Gary John Megson''' (born 2 May 1959[
He has previously managed Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. His biggest successes so far came at West Bromwich Albion, where he managed them in the Premier League in 2002 and again in 2004.
He is the son of former player Don Megson and the brother of Neil Megson (soccer)Neil Megson, another former footballer.

Pavel Srn\u00ed\u010dek.name: Pavel Srníček
Pavel Srn\u00ed\u010dek.intro:
'''Pavel Srníček''' (born 10 March 1968) is a Czech RepublicCzech former professional Association footballfootballer and goalkeeping coach of Czech First League club Sparta Prague.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper from 1990 to 2007, notably remembered for his time in England, spent mostly with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, as well as Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday,  Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He also played in Italy for Brescia CalcioBrescia and A.S. Cosenza CalcioAS Cosenza, in Portugal for Beira-Mar, and in his native country for Banik Ostrava.
Srníček played internationally for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic, taking part in Euro 2000 and earning a total of 49 Cap (sport)caps.

Paul Hughes.name: Paul Hughes
Paul Hughes.intro:
'''Paul Hughes''' (born 19 April 1976 in Hammersmith) is a retired English Football (soccer)footballer who played in midfield.
Hughes began his career with his local side, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and started well, scoring on his debut against Derby County F.C.Derby County with an impressive solo effort. Thereafter, however, his career was stalled by injuries, successive managers' squad rotation policies and the signing of other midfielders like Roberto Di Matteo, Gustavo Poyet and Didier Deschamps.
Over the next three years he only featured in 24 more games for the club, and had loan spells with Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City (where he scored once against Swindon Town).cite news
url=
title=Norwich City 2 Swindon Town 1
publisher=Sporting Life
date=1 May 1999 accessdate=24 December 2010 Hughes joined Southampton F.C.Southampton, then managed by his old Chelsea manager Glenn Hoddle, on a free transfer (soccer)free transfer in the summer of 2000, but left a year later having never played a game for the Saints. Hughes' next club was Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, where he remained until May 2006, making 88 appearances and scoring seven goals for the club.

Matt Carbon.name: Matt Carbon
Matt Carbon.intro: '''Matthew Phillip Carbon''' (born 8 June 1975, Nottingham) is an EnglandEnglish Football (soccer)footballer who plays as a Defender (football)#Centre backcentre back.
Matt Carbon.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

Marcel Desailly.name: Marcel Desailly
Marcel Desailly.intro: '''Marcel Desailly''' (; born '''Odenke Abbey'''; 7 September 1968) is a retired football in FranceFrench footballer and star of the France national football team squad, with whom he won the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000. He also enjoyed a distinguished career at club level with several major European clubs.
Marcel Desailly.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Mikael Forssell.name: Mikael Forssell
Mikael Forssell.intro:
'''Mikael Kaj Forssell''' (born 15 March 1981) is a Finnish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for VfL Bochum and for the Finland national football teamFinnish national team.
Forssell began his professional career in 1997 for HJK, having progressed through the team's youth teams, but he only remained at the club for a single season, making 17 league appearances, before he moved to England to join Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 1998. He never broke into the Chelsea team (making 33 league appearances in seven years), and spent two loan spells at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, one at Borussia Mönchengladbach, and two at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He switched permanently to the latter club in 2005, but injury problems restricted him to 65 league appearances in three seasons. He joined German side Hannover 96 in July 2008 on a free transfer, but once again struggled with form and injury problems, and he left the club in 2011, having made 44 league appearances.
This was followed by an unsuccessful season back in England, this time with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United; 15 league games failed to yield a single goal. Forssell returned to current club HJK in October 2012.
Forssell made his full international debut for Finland in 1999, and has been a regular player for his country in almost every year since; the one exception being 2012, where he didn't make a single appearance. He has 86 caps for his country, and has scored 29 goals; making him the sixth most capped Finnish player, and his country's second highest goalscorer.

David Wright.name: David Wright
David Wright.intro: '''David Wright''' (born 1 May 1980) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender or midfielder, and is currently a free agent. Wright began his career at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, where he helped the club to promotion to the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 2002–03 Football League2002–03 following the clubs relegation to the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in the previous season. He went on the make over 200 league appearances for the club. He also played over 100 league games for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town between 2007 and 2010, as well as representing Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City on loan, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham on loan and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United.

Gianluca Vialli.name: Gianluca Vialli
Gianluca Vialli.intro:
'''Gianluca Vialli''' (born 9 July 1964 in Cremona) is an ItalyItalian football (soccer)football Coach (sport)manager and former player. Since retiring, he has gone into management and punditry and is a commentator for Sky ItaliaSky Sport Italia.
Vialli started his career at Cremonese in 1980 in his native Italy where he made 105 league appearances scoring 23 goals. His performances impressed Sampdoria who signed him in 1984. During which time he scored 85 league goals, won 3 Italian cups, the Serie A and the 1989–90 European Cup Winners' CupEuropean Cup Winners Cup. Vialli transferred to Juventus for a World record £12.5 million in 1992. During this time he won the Italian Cup, the Serie A, Italian Supercup, UEFA Champions League and the 1990 UEFA Cup FinalUEFA Cup. In 1996 Vialli joined Chelsea and became Chelsea player manager the following season. In England he won the 1997 FA Cup FinalFA Cup, 1998 Football League Cup FinalLeague Cup, 1998 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup FinalUEFA Cup Winners Cup and 1998 UEFA Super CupUEFA Super Cup. He is one of nine footballers to have won UEFA competition records#List of players to have won the three main European club competitionsthe three main European club competitions and is the only player in European footballing history to have winner's and runner's up medals in all three main European club competitions. During his twenty years long career as a professional footballer he has scored 259 goals at club level, 16 goals with the national team, 11 goals with the under 21 national team for a total of 286 goals in more than 500 appearances.

Itay Shechter.name: Itay Shechter
Itay Shechter.intro: '''Itay Shechter''' (or '''Etey Shechter''', ; born 22 February 1987) is an Israeli JewsIsraeli footballer currently playing for Maccabi Haifa F.C.Maccabi Haifa.

Duncan Spedding.name: Duncan Spedding
Duncan Spedding.intro:
'''Duncan Spedding''' (born 7 September 1977 in Camberley) is an EnglandEnglish former football (soccer)football midfielder.
Spedding was signed by Southampton F.C.Southampton in 1997 after completing a spell as a trainee with the club. However he failed to make much impact and was given a free transfer to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town the following year. Spedding spent five seasons at the club as a regular first teamer before departing in 2003. Now retired, Spedding manages a health club in Northampton.[

Darryl Powell.name: Darryl Powell
Darryl Powell.intro:
'''Darryl Anthony Powell''' (born 15 November 1971) is a former professional association footballfootballer who made more than 350 appearances in the Football League and Premier League and played international football for the Jamaica national football teamJamaican national team. He usually played as a midfieldercentral midfielder.
The son of a Reggae musician, he was born in Lambeth, London and his career included spells at English clubs Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, as well as a stint at Colorado Rapids in the United StatesUSA. Along with his Derby team-mate Deon Burton he was one of the ''Reggae Boyz'' playing for Jamaica national football teamJamaica in 1998 FIFA World CupFrance 98.
Powell has also appeared as a guest on the beach soccer circuit, playing for the England national beach soccer team in an exhibition game in Birmingham.

James Chambers (English footballer).name: James Chambers (English footballer)
James Chambers (English footballer).intro: '''James Ashley Chambers''' (born 20 November 1980 in West Bromwich, West Midlands) is an English Association footballfootballer playing for Walsall F.C.Walsall. He is predominantly a right-back, although he has played at centre-back, left-back and right-wing in his career.

Barry Bannan.name: Barry Bannan
Barry Bannan.intro: '''Barry Bannan''' (born 1 December 1989) is a ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfieldercentral midfielder for English Football League Championship club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, and the Scotland national football team.

Abel Hern\u00e1ndez.name: Abel Hernández
Abel Hern\u00e1ndez.intro: '''Abel Mathías Hernández Platero''' (born 8 August 1990) is a Uruguayan professional association footballfootballer who plays for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Uruguay national football teamUruguay national team as a Forward (association football)striker.
