Cristiano Ronaldo.name: Cristiano Ronaldo
Cristiano Ronaldo.intro:
'''Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro''', Order of Prince HenryGOIH (born 5 February 1985), known as '''Cristiano Ronaldo''' (, is a Portuguese professional association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Real Madrid C.F. and the Portugal national football teamPortugal national team. He is a Forward (association football)forward and serves as Captain (association football)captain for Portugal.
By the age of 22, Ronaldo had received Ballon d'Or and FIFA World Player of the Year nominations. The following year, in 2008, he won his first Ballon d'Or 2008Ballon d'Or and 2008 FIFA World Player of the YearFIFA World Player of the Year awards. He followed this up by winning the FIFA Ballon d'Or in 2013 FIFA Ballon d'Or2013 and 2014 FIFA Ballon d'Or2014. He also won the 2013–14 UEFA Best Player in Europe Award. In January 2014, Ronaldo scored his 400th senior career goal for club and country aged 28.
Often ranked as the best player in the world, alongside Cristiano Ronaldo–Lionel Messi rivalryrival Lionel Messi, and rated by some in the sport as the greatest of all time,[
Ronaldo began his career as a youth player for CF AndorinhaAndorinha, where he played for two years, before moving to C.D. Nacional. In 1997, he made a move to Portuguese giants Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting CP. In 2003 he caught the attention of Manchester United F.C.Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson, who signed him for £12.2 million (€15 million). In 2004, he won his first trophy, the FA Cup. In 2007, Ronaldo was the first player in England to win all four main PFA and FWA awards. In 2008, he won 3 of the 4 main PFA and FWA trophies and was named the FIFA World Player of the Year, FIFProFIFPro Player of the Year, World Soccer (magazine)World Soccer Player of the Year, and the Onze d'Or. In 2007 and 2008, Ronaldo was named FWA Footballer of the Year. He was the inaugural winner of the FIFA Puskás Award for Goal of the Year in 2009. He became the List of most expensive association football transfersworld's most expensive player when he moved from Manchester United to Real Madrid in 2009 in a Transfer (association football)transfer worth £80 million (€94 million/$132 million). His buyout clause is valued at €1 billion.[
Ronaldo made his international debut for Portugal in August 2003, at the age of 18. He has since been List of footballers with 100 or more capscapped over 100 times and has participated in 6 major tournaments: three UEFA European Championships (UEFA Euro 20042004, UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012) and three FIFA World Cups (2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014). Ronaldo is the first Portuguese player to reach List of footballers with 50 or more international goals50 international goals, making him Portugal national football team#Most goalsPortugal's top goalscorer of all time as well as the country's top scorer in the European Championship with 6 goals. He scored his first international goal in the opening game of Euro 2004 against Greece national football teamGreece, and helped Portugal reach UEFA Euro 2004 Finalthe final. He took over captaincy in July 2008, and he led Portugal to the semi-finals at Euro 2012, finishing the competition as joint-top scorer in the process. In November 2014, Ronaldo became the all-time top scorer in the UEFA European Championship (including qualifying) with 23 goals.

Jonjo Shelvey.name: Jonjo Shelvey
Jonjo Shelvey.intro:
'''Jonjo Shelvey'''  (born 27 February 1992) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Premier League side Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.
He began his career at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, becoming their youngest-ever player at 16 years and 59 days old.[
Shelvey has played for England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level and has captained the under–19 side.cite news
title = Shelvey aiming high
url =
publisher = The Football Association
date =
accessdate =  He won his first cap for England national football teamthe senior side in 2012.

Jordan Stewart.name: Jordan Stewart
Jordan Stewart.intro:
'''Jordan Barrington Stewart''' (born 3 March 1982 in Birmingham) is an English association footballfootballer who currently plays for San Jose Earthquakes. He plays either as a left-back or left-winger, and if required, can play at centre-back.
Stewart started his career at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, where he was relegated twice and once promoted to the Premier League. Whilst at Leicester he also spent a loan spell at Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers. He joined Watford F.C.Watford in 2005, and was part of a side that won promotion to Premier League, before being subsequently relegated. He left the club in 2008 and subsequently signed for Derby. In March 2013 he signed a 3-month contract with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City on a free transfer.
Jordan Stewart.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Charlie Miller.name: Charlie Miller
Charlie Miller.intro:
'''Charles ''' "'''Charlie'''" '''Miller''' (born 18 March 1976) is a retired ScotlandScottish football (soccer)football player. He now runs his own football academy, coaching kids from five to 15 years old at Toryglen Football Centre, Glasgow.
Miller started his career at Rangers F.C.Rangers, and won five consecutive list of Scottish football championsScottish league championships and two Scottish Cup titles. Miller was voted the SPFA Young Player of the Year in 1995 during his time with the club. After spells with English Premier League clubs Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Watford F.C.Watford, Miller joined Dundee United F.C.Dundee United in 2000 where he played for four seasons. Miller played for Norwegian club SK Brann from 2004 to 2006 and won the Norwegian Cup with the club in 2004 Norwegian Football Cup2004. After spells in Belgium and Australia, Miller returned to Scotland in 2011 when he joined Clyde F.C.Clyde.

Dennis Wise.name: Dennis Wise
Dennis Wise.intro:
'''Dennis Frank Wise''' (born 16 December 1966) is an English former association footballfootball player and Coach (sport)manager, and former Executive Director of Football at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
Wise played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder and was noted for his aggressive and highly competitive style of play. In a career spanning over 20 years, he played for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and, most notably, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. During his time at Stamford Bridge (stadium)Stamford Bridge, Wise won two FA Cups, a Football League CupLeague Cup and a UEFA Cup Winners' Cup, becoming the club's most successful captain, although has since been overtaken by John Terry.
He also played at international level for much of his career, representing England national football teamEngland over a period of ten years. Wise won 21 Cap (sport)caps and scored once, on his debut against Turkey national football teamTurkey on 1 May 1991. He was in the national squad for 2000 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 and played in group games against Germany national football teamGermany (won 1–0) and Romania national football teamRomania (lost 2–3).
In the latter years of his playing career, Wise gradually became involved in the managerial aspects of the game, starting at Millwall F.C.Millwall, where he took on the role of player-manager, taking them to the F.A. Cup final and European football for the first time ever. He was briefly caretaker manager at Southampton F.C.Southampton, following the departure of Harry Redknapp, before he took over the reins at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town on a permanent basis. In October 2006, he was appointed manager of the then-Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, who found themselves in the relegation zone. Although they were ultimately relegated, Wise reshaped his side in the close season and Leeds made an excellent start to their first season in the third tier of Football in EnglandEnglish football.
In a surprise career move, despite their strong position and likelihood of promotion, Wise left Leeds in January 2008 to join the newly reshaped management team at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in an executive role, tasked with travelling around Europe and further afield identifying young players and developing the academy. Wise left Newcastle on 1 April 2009.

Robbie Earle.name: Robbie Earle
Robbie Earle.intro:
'''Robert Fitzgerald''' "Robbie" '''Earle''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 27 January 1965) is an English-born Jamaican former Jamaica national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. He played 578 league games in senior club football, scoring 136 goals.
A former youth player with Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Earle broke into the professional game with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1982. He spent nine years at the Burslem based club, helping "The Vale" to promotion out of the Football League Fourth DivisionFourth Division in 1982–83 Port Vale F.C. season1982–83 and 1985–86 Port Vale F.C. season1985–86, and out of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division via the play-offs in 1989 Football League Third Division play-off Final1989; he was later voted the club's PFA Fans' Favourites. He moved on to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon in 1991, where he also spent nine years. He made nearly 300 league games for each club, scoring 77 and 59 goals respectively. He also represented Jamaica national football teamJamaica on 33 occasions between 1997 and 2000, scoring eight international goals. He appeared in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup, scoring his nation's first ever goal in the finals.
Following his retirement in 2000, Earle has established himself in the world of football journalism. He regularly appears in print, on the radio and on television. He was dismissed from his punditry role with ITV (TV network)ITV in 2010 after he passed ITV FIFA World CupWorld Cup tickets to a third party. After spending time as television broadcast analyst for the Portland Timbers of Major League Soccer, he is now a commentator for the Premier League on NBCSN.

Carl Fletcher (Welsh footballer).name: Carl Fletcher (Welsh footballer)
Carl Fletcher (Welsh footballer).intro:
'''Carl Neil Fletcher''' (born 7 April 1980) is a Welsh professional former Association footballfootball player and Manager (association football)manager, currently employed as youth team manager at A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth. As a midfielder Fletcher represented Wales national football teamWales at senior international level for five years, scoring one goal in 36 appearances.
Having made his professional debut for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth in 1998, Fletcher went on to play for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Watford F.C.Watford, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, making 414 appearances in league competition and scoring 34 goals. Born in Camberley, Fletcher retired from playing in 2012 to focus on his role as manager of Plymouth Argyle. He resumed his playing career in October 2013 with Barnet.

Manucho.name: Manucho
Manucho.intro:
'''Mateus Alberto Contreiras Gonçalves''' (born 7 March 1983), commonly known as '''Manucho''', is an Angolan professional association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Rayo Vallecano as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Manucho moved from Atlético Petróleos LuandaPetro Atletico to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in January 2008. Before playing a game for United, however, he was loaned out to Greek side Panathinaikos F.C.Panathinaikos for the remainder of the 2007–08 season, due to issues with obtaining a UK work permit. Manucho received a work permit soon after returning to Manchester United for pre-season training in July 2008, and made his debut for the club in the Football League CupLeague Cup against Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough on 23 September 2008. Short of first team opportunities at Old Trafford, however, on 16 January 2009 he joined Hull City A.F.C.Hull City on loan until the end of the 2008–09 season. Having failed to break into the Manchester United first team, Manucho joined Real Valladolid in July 2009. He is also a member of the Angola national football teamAngolan national team, representing them at four Africa Cup of Nations tournaments.

Mark Gonz\u00e1lez.name: Mark González
Mark Gonz\u00e1lez.intro:
'''Mark Dennis González Hoffmann''' (born 10 July 1984), commonly known as '''Mark González''', is a Chilean association footballfootballer whose preferred position is as a Left (direction)left Winger (sport)winger. He most recently played for Club Deportivo Universidad CatólicaUniversidad Católica of the Chilean Primera División, and has also played top-flight football in Russia, Spain and England. He was described by José Mari Bakero, the sporting director of his former club Real Sociedad, as "fast and explosive, the classic left winger but with technical discipline", while he has claimed himself that his speed is his greatest asset.
He made his international debut in 2003, and was selected in Chile national football teamChile's squads for two Copa América tournaments and the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.

Erik Thorstvedt.name: Erik Thorstvedt
Erik Thorstvedt.intro:
'''Erik Thorstvedt''' (born 28 October 1962 in Stavanger) is a former NorwayNorwegian professional football (soccer)football Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.  He won 97 caps for the Norwegian national football teamNorwegian national team, and was the starter in goal at the 1994 FIFA World Cup.
He has played for Viking FKViking, Eik-Tønsberg, Borussia Mönchengladbach, IFK Göteborg and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He was the first Norwegian to win the FA Cup when he won it with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Spurs in FA Cup Final 19911991. During his time at Tottenham Erik lived in the Hertfordshire town of Hoddesdon.
Thorstvedt retired in 1996 due to back injuries. After his career as a player, he worked as a goalkeeping coach with the Norwegian national football teamNorwegian national team, and had a brief spell as Director of Football at Viking.
He has worked as an expert commentator/pundit for various TV channels, and was the TV-host on the Royal League matches shown on TVNorge. He was also the coach of Tufte IL, a team created for the reality-TV show Heia Tufte!. For his appearance in this show he was awarded the ''Se og Hør (Norway)Se og Hør'' readers' TV personality of the year award. Now he has a football show every Monday called "Matchball Mandag" on TV2 NorwayTV2 where he and guests look at games played in the Norwegian Premier League with a humorous approach.
He is the father of Norwegian model and former MTV presenter Charlotte Thorstvedt.

Paul Wilkinson.name: Paul Wilkinson
Paul Wilkinson.intro: '''Paul Wilkinson''' (born 30 October 1964 in Louth, Lincolnshire) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker Recently was the Assistant Manager at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He is currently working as a coach at the Norwich City Academy.

Jack Robinson (footballer, born 1993).name: Jack Robinson (footballer, born 1993)
Jack Robinson (footballer, born 1993).intro:
'''Jack Robinson''' (born 1 September 1993) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back.
Robinson is the second-youngest ever player to have played for Liverpool, having made his senior début at the age of 16 years and 250 days. He has also been capped by England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.
Jack Robinson (footballer, born 1993).position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Des Hamilton.name: Des Hamilton
Des Hamilton.intro:
'''Derrick Vivian "Des" Hamilton''' (born 15 August 1976) is an English retired professional association footballfootballer. He was a midfielder, who played most notably for Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City which counted for nearly half his career appearances and in the Premier League with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. He also won one England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 cap (sports)cap.
Hamilton started his career with his hometown club Bradford City, making his debut at the age of 17 in 1994. He helped Bradford win promotion to the Football League First DivisionFirst Division by scoring in the 1996 Football League Second Division play-off Final. He left Bradford less than a year later for a club record £2m having played more than 100 career games. He instead signed for Newcastle United, for whom he played in both the UEFA Champions League and UEFA Cup. However, he was restricted to just 12 league games in five seasons and spent time on loan with four other clubs. He moved on to Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, but after a brief spell at Barnet F.C.Barnet for whom he never played, he retired at the age of 27.

Zat Knight.name: Zat Knight
Zat Knight.intro: '''Zatyiah "Zat" Knight''' (born 2 May 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)central defender who currently plays for Reading F.C. in the Football League ChampionshipEnglish Championship. Knight had extended spells at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Fulham F.C.Fulham in the Premier League and the English Football League ChampionshipChampionship. He has represented England national football teamEngland and both under-21 and full international levels.
Zat Knight.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jordan Spence.name: Jordan Spence
Jordan Spence.intro: '''Jordan James Spence''' (born 24 May 1990) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons. Predominantly as a right-back, Spence can also operate as a centre-back. He has represented and captained England national football teamEngland at various youth levels.

Rhys Weston.name: Rhys Weston
Rhys Weston.intro:
'''Rhys David Weston''' (born 27 October 1980) is an English peopleEnglish-born Welsh peopleWelsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender; he is without a club following his release by AFC Wimbledon in May 2014. He has represented the Wales national football teamWelsh national football team seven times.
An Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal Academy graduate, he made one appearance in the 1999–2000 campaign, before signing with Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. He spent six years with Cardiff, making 214 appearances in league and cup, helping them to two Promotion and relegationpromotions. Released by the club in 2006, he travelled to Norway to sign with Viking FK, though he only played the one game. In 2007 he transferred to Walsall F.C.Walsall via Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He then moved to Football in ScotlandScottish club Dundee F.C.Dundee in 2010 and captained the side to a second place finish in the Scottish Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 2011–12. In May 2012, he joined Football in IcelandIcelandic club Knattspyrnufélag ReykjavíkurKR Reykjavík. Five months later he signed for Football in MalaysiaMalaysian club Sabah FA. He returned to England with AFC Wimbledon in July 2013, and from there was loaned out to Sutton United F.C.Sutton United in January 2014.

Nicky Banger.name: Nicky Banger
Nicky Banger.intro:
'''Nicholas Lee Banger''' (born 25 February 1971) is a retired English professional association footballfootballer. He is currently Head of Commercial Operations with Woking F.C.
Banger was born in Southampton and started his football career as a trainee with Southampton F.C.Southampton, turning professional in April 1989. He scored a hat-trick on his first team debut for the Saints, in a League Cup tie against Rochdale F.C.Rochdale in 1990.
He moved to Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic for a fee of £250,000 in October 1994 and remained at Boundary Park for almost three years, moving to Oxford United F.C.Oxford United on a free transfer in August 1997.
Banger then moved to Dundee F.C.Dundee, again on a free transfer in October 1999, but was transfer listed by manager Ivano Bonetti in July 2000.[
After time out with a back injury, he joined Torquay United F.C.Torquay United on trial in January 2002,[
Banger joined Woking F.C.Woking in August 2002,[
In November 2005 Banger joined Brockenhurst F.C.Brockenhurst as player-coach,[
In December 2006, Banger was appointed as commercial manager at Romsey Town F.C.Romsey Town,[
In 2008 he joined Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town as Corporate Sales Manager as they prepared for promotion to the Football League.

David Kelly (association footballer).name: David Kelly (association footballer)
David Kelly (association footballer).intro: '''David Thomas "Ned" Kelly''' (born in Birmingham, England, 25 November 1965) is a retired Association footballfootballer, currently assistant manager of Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. As a child, Kelly suffered from Perthes diseasePerthes Disease, but recovered to forge a long and successful career in professional football.

Hannu Tihinen.name: Hannu Tihinen
Hannu Tihinen.intro:
'''Hannu Tihinen''' (born 1 July 1976 in Keminmaa, Lapland (Finland)Lapland) is a retired FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backdefender.
He has played for clubs in Finland, Norway, England, Belgium and Switzerland.
Hannu Tihinen.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ian Brightwell.name: Ian Brightwell
Ian Brightwell.intro:
'''Ian Robert Brightwell''' (born 9 April 1968) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and manager. As a player he was a Defender (association football)defender from 1986 to 2006 and who played 468 league games in a 20-year career the Football League and Premier League.
He started his professional career at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1986, having won the FA Youth Cup with the club, and remained at Maine Road for the next 12 years, helping City to win promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in 1988–89 Football League1988–89. He joined Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 1998, before moving on to Walsall F.C.Walsall two years later. He helped the "Saddlers" to win the Second Division play-offs in 2001 Football League Second Division play-off Final2001, before he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in March 2002. After playing for the "Potters" in their Second Division play-off success in 2002 Football League Second Division play-off Final2002, he moved on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He was appointed as a coach at Vale Park in June 2003, before joining Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town as a player-coach a year later. He served the club as caretaker-manager in October 2006, before being given the job permanently in June 2007. He left Moss Rose in February 2008 after a poor start to the 2007–08 season.

Peter Beagrie.name: Peter Beagrie
Peter Beagrie.intro:
'''Peter Sidney Beagrie''' (born 28 November 1965) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer, sports television pundit and commentator.
As a player he was a Midfielder#Wingerleft-winger in a career that lasted from 1983 to 2006. He played for ten different clubs at professional level notably appearing in the Premier League with Everton F.C.Everton, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. He also played in the Football League for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United before ending his career in 2006, with a brief stint at Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town aged 40. He is well remembered for his somersault goal celebration.

Thomas James (footballer, born 1996).name: Thomas James (footballer, born 1996)
Thomas James (footballer, born 1996).intro: '''Thomas Lynn James''' (born 15 April 1996), known as '''Tom James''' is a WalesWelsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Jamie Fullarton.name: Jamie Fullarton
Jamie Fullarton.intro: '''James 'Jamie' Fullarton''' (born 20 July 1974 in Bellshill) is a ScotlandScottish ex-professional association footballfootballer who is currently Development Coach at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Lee Bowyer.name: Lee Bowyer
Lee Bowyer.intro: '''Lee David Bowyer''' (born 3 January 1977) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer born in Canning Town, London. Bowyer has previously played for several English clubs including Leeds United, Charlton Athletic, West Ham United, Newcastle United, Birmingham City and Ipswich Town. Bowyer has been capped once by the England national football team. Since 2010, Bowyer has held the record for most caution (football)yellow cards received in the Premier League.

Mesut \u00d6zil.name: Mesut Özil
Mesut \u00d6zil.intro:
'''Mesut Özil''' (, ; born 15 October 1988) is a German association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the Germany national football teamGerman national team. Özil has been a youth national team member since 2006, and a member of the German national team since 2009. He gained international attention during the 2010 FIFA World Cup and was nominated for the Golden Ball (FIFA)Golden Ball Award, which is awarded to the tournament's best player. Özil started his senior career at hometown club FC Schalke 04Schalke in the Bundesliga in 2006, transferred to SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen in 2008 and was signed by Real Madrid in August 2010 following his break-out performance at the FIFA World Cup with Germany. On transfer deadline day of summer 2013, List of most expensive association football transfershe moved to Arsenal for a club-record fee of £42.5 million. The transfer makes him the most expensive German football player of all time.
Özil is acclaimed for his finesse and improvisation as an attacking midfielder. His style and ability for providing assists for his team-mates has been compared by former manager José Mourinho to that of Real Madrid legend Zinedine Zidane. In 2011, Özil ranked first in assists in major European and domestic competitions with 25. In 2012, he ranked first in assists in La Liga with 17. He was also one of the top assist providers in the 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012 with three in both tournaments.

Sam Hutchinson.name: Sam Hutchinson
Sam Hutchinson.intro: '''Samuel Edward "Sam" Hutchinson''' (born 3 August 1989) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back or a Defender (football)#Full-backright back.
Sam Hutchinson.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back,Defender  association football  Centre back centre back

Stephen Ireland.name: Stephen Ireland
Stephen Ireland.intro:
'''Stephen James Ireland''' (born 22 August 1986) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
Ireland began his career with Cobh Ramblers F.C.Cobh Ramblers before joining English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2001. He made his professional debut in September 2005 and soon established himself as a regular at the City of Manchester Stadium and his performances saw him earn international recognition with Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. However, a row with Steve Staunton saw his international career come to an abrupt end.
In September 2010 Ireland was transferred to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in a swap deal with James Milner. After a slow start to his Villa career he was loaned out to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United where he only played twice. In the 2011–12 Aston Villa F.C. season2011–12 season he improved and won the Fans Player of the Season award. However he fell out of the first team under Paul Lambert and in September 2013 he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan before making the move permanent in January 2014.

Mauro Z\u00e1rate.name: Mauro Zárate
Mauro Z\u00e1rate.intro:
'''Mauro Matías Zárate Riga''' (; born 18 March 1987) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for English club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, on loan from West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
Zárate started his career with Club Atlético Vélez SarsfieldVélez Sarsfield in his native country, playing three years for the team and winning the Argentine Primera DivisiónPrimera División title in the 2004–05 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Clausura2005 Clausura tournament. He later signed for Qatari side Al Sadd SCAl-Sadd in 2007, where he played only six months before transferring on loan to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in England. However, after Birmingham's Promotion and relegationrelegation, Zárate was loaned out again, this time to S.S. LazioLazio in Italy, where he won the  Coppa Italia. His move to Lazio was then made permanent for a fee of around €20 million, with a €60 million buy-out clause. After a loan at Internazionale and a brief return to Vélez Sarsfield, he joined West Ham in 2014. On 6 January 2015, he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers on loan for the remainder of 2014–15 Queens Park Rangers F.C. season2014-15 season.
In international football, Zárate scored the winning goal as the Argentina national under-20 football teamArgentina under-20 team won the 2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup final.

Jason McCarthy.name: Jason McCarthy
Jason McCarthy.intro: '''Jason Sean McCarthy''' (born 7 November 1995) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a defender for Southampton F.C.Southampton.
Jason McCarthy.position: Defender  association football  Right back centre back

Michael Proctor.name: Michael Proctor
Michael Proctor.intro: '''Michael Anthony Proctor''' (born 3 October 1980) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.

Danny Drinkwater.name: Danny Drinkwater
Danny Drinkwater.intro: '''Daniel Noel "Danny" Drinkwater''' (born 5 March 1990) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He has previously spent time on loan at Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Watford F.C.Watford, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, and played for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, and has played internationally for England at England national under-18 football teamunder-18 and England national under-19 football teamunder-19 levels.

Ian Pearce.name: Ian Pearce
Ian Pearce.intro:
'''Ian Anthony Pearce''' (born 7 May 1974 in Bury St. Edmunds, Suffolk) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1990 until 2012, notably in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he won the title in 1995.
He also played top flight for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Fulham F.C.Fulham. He also played in the Football League for Southampton F.C.Southampton and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City as well as Non-league sides Oxted & District, Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian and Lingfield F.C.Lingfield. Whilst with Lincoln he also worked as the clubs assistant manager to Chris Sutton.

Mark Bunn (English footballer).name: Mark Bunn (English footballer)
Mark Bunn (English footballer).intro:
'''Mark John Bunn''' (born 16 November 1984) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Born in London, Bunn began his career with the Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hostspur youth team, before signing for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town. He made his league debut for Northampton and went on to make 90 appearances for the club, before a succession of permanent and loan spells with various clubs before being signed by Norwich from Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers as cover for John Ruddy, in time for the 2012–13 season. When Ruddy sustained a leg injury, Bunn took his place in the first team for much of the season.

Paulinho.name: Paulinho
Paulinho.intro:
'''José Paulo Bezerra Maciel Júnior''', commonly known as '''Paulinho''', (); born 25 July 1988) is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team.
Paulinho has been described as a box-to-box midfielder, with powerful running and good movement into the box. He possesses the ability to push his side forward from midfield to supplement his strong defensive work. Paulinho also offers a useful presence in set piece situations at both ends of the pitch.

Robin van der Laan.name: Robin van der Laan
Robin van der Laan.intro:
'''Robin van der Laan''' (born '''Robertus Petrus van der Laan''' on 5 September 1968) is a Dutch peopleDutch former Association footballfootballer who spent most of his senior career in Football in EnglandEnglish football. He now works as the director of his own soccer school in Canada, also working as a senior coach for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United Soccer Schools.
He began his playing career in his native the Netherlands with Schiedamse Voetbal Vereniging in 1987, helping them to top the Eerste Divisie in 1989–90 Eerste Divisie1989–90, before moving on to FC WageningenWageningen in 1990. In 1991 he moved to England to play for Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, where after four seasons as one of the club's key players he was sold on to Derby County F.C.Derby County. He won the Football League Trophy with Vale in 1993 Football League Trophy Final1993, and won promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in 1993–94 Port Vale F.C. season1993–94. He also won promotion out of the Football League First DivisionFirst Division with Derby in 1995–96 in English football1995–96. In 1998 he transferred to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, where he saw out his professional playing career until his retirement due to injury in 2001. He made a total of 314 appearances in a ten-year career in the Football League.

Paul Marquis.name: Paul Marquis
Paul Marquis.intro:
'''Paul Marquis''' (born 29 August 1972) is an EnglandEnglish former Association footballfootball defender (football)defender.
Marquis came through the Schoolboy sides of Cheshunt F.C.Cheshunt and made 15 appearances for their first team as an eighteen year-old before moving to the youth squad for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. Graduating through the reserve team, Marquis played only 60 seconds of first-team football for West Ham, coming on in the 90th minute for Mike Marsh (footballer)Mike Marsh, in February 1994, in a 0–0 draw with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. In March 1994 Marquis was given a free transfer by West Ham and was signed by Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers.

Vladim\u00edr Weiss (footballer, born 19.name: Vladimír Weiss (footballer, born 1989)
Vladim\u00edr Weiss (footballer, born 19.intro: '''Vladimír Weiss''' (born 30 November 1989) is a SlovakiaSlovak Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielderwinger for Lekhwiya SC in the Qatar Stars League.

Robert Green.name: Robert Green
Robert Green.intro:
'''Robert Paul Green''' (born 18 January 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He has also played for the England national football teamEngland national team. Green played over 200 times for both West Ham United F.C.West Ham United where he spent six years, and for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He was a member of their 2003–04 Football League#First Division2003–04 First Division winning side. He has represented England at England national under-16 football teamEngland U16, England national under-18 football teamEngland U18,
England B national football teamEngland B level and for the full England national football teamEngland squad.

Jefferson Montero.name: Jefferson Montero
Jefferson Montero.intro: '''Jefferson Antonio Montero Vite''' (; born 1 September 1989) is an Ecuadorian Association footballfootballer who plays for Welsh club Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City and the Ecuador national football teamEcuador national team as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Adam Chambers.name: Adam Chambers
Adam Chambers.intro: '''Adam Craig Chambers''' (born 20 November 1980 in Sandwell, West Midlands) is a professional footballer with Walsall F.C.Walsall. His previous clubs include West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers and Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient.

Arouna Kon\u00e9.name: Arouna Koné
Arouna Kon\u00e9.intro:
'''Arouna Koné''' (born 11 November 1983) is an Ivorian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League, as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
After making a name for himself in the Eredivisie, with Roda JCRoda and PSV EindhovenPSV, he signed with Sevilla FCSevilla in 2007, where he rarely appeared due to injury and loans. In 2012 he moved from Levante UDLevante to the Premier League, where he represented Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Everton F.C.Everton, 2013 FA Cup Finalwinning one FA Cup with the former.
Koné appeared for Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup, as well as three Africa Cup of Nations tournaments.

Jay DeMerit.name: Jay DeMerit
Jay DeMerit.intro: '''Jay Michael DeMerit''' (born December 4, 1979) is a former American Association footballsoccer player who last played as captain for Vancouver Whitecaps FC in Major League Soccer. His improbable career is the subject of the independent film, ''Rise and Shine: The Jay DeMerit Story'', based on his rise from the ninth tier of football in England to the Premier League and FIFA World Cup.

Ali Dia.name: Ali Dia
Ali Dia.intro: '''Ali Dia''' (born 20 August 1965) is a retired Senegal national football teamSenegalese Association footballfootballer. In November 1996, Dia famously convinced then-manager of Southampton F.C.Southampton, Graeme Souness, that he was the cousin of FIFA World Player of the Year and Ballon d'Or winner George Weah, which led to him signing a one-month contract with Southampton just days later. Dia played only one match in his short spell at the club before being released 14 days into his contract.

Jan La\u0161t\u016fvka.name: Jan Laštůvka
Jan La\u0161t\u016fvka.intro: '''Jan Laštůvka''' (born 7 July 1982 in Havířov) is a Czech RepublicCzech Association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who currently plays for FC Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk.

Morten Gamst Pedersen.name: Morten Gamst Pedersen
Morten Gamst Pedersen.intro:
'''Morten Gamst Pedersen''' (born 8 September 1981) is a NorwayNorwegian association footballfootballer who plays as a winger for Rosenborg Ballklub in the NorwayNorwegian Tippeligaen.
He began his career with Tromsø ILTromsø, then played for English side Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers between 2004 and 2013. He then played for the Turkish side Kardemir D. Ç. KarabüksporKarabükspor. Gamst Pedersen signed with Rosenborg in March 2014.
Since he made his debut in 2004, Pedersen has been cap (sport)capped more than 70 times, and scored 16 goals, for Norway national football teamNorway. He was an international regular until August 2012, when he was left out of the national team squad.

Harrison Reed.name: Harrison Reed
Harrison Reed.intro: '''Harrison James Reed''' (born 27 January 1995) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Southampton F.C.Southampton in the Premier League.

Chris Iwelumo.name: Chris Iwelumo
Chris Iwelumo.intro:
'''Christopher Robert''' "'''Chris'''" '''Iwelumo''' (born 1 August 1978) is a ScotlandScottish former association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)striker.
Iwelumo started his career with St Mirren F.C.St Mirren before moving to DenmarkDanish club Aarhus Fremad for two years. A move to Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in 2000 saw him sent out on loan to several teams before a short-lived spell with 2. Fußball-Bundesliga side Alemannia Aachen. After moving to the Football League Championship with Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and then Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, he signed for Wolves in 2008 as they won promotion to the Premier League, winning Player of the Month in November 2008.
Iwelumo's father is Nigerian and his mother is Scottish peopleScottish. He won his first cap (sport)cap as a full Scottish international coming on as a substitute against Norway national football teamNorway in a 2010 FIFA World Cup 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification - UEFA Group 9qualifier in 2008, notable for his missing an open goal from only yards out as the match finished 0–0 an event which Iwelumo has said "tortured" him. He had his first international start in a exhibition gamefriendly against Argentina national football teamArgentina in November the same year.

Joey O'Brien.name: Joey O'Brien
Joey O'Brien.intro: '''Joseph Martin "Joey" O'Brien''' (born 17 February 1986) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backFull-back, for Premier League club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
Joey O'Brien.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Chris McCann.name: Chris McCann
Chris McCann.intro: '''Christopher John "Chris" McCann''' (born 21 July 1987) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as a midfielder. A graduate of the youth system at Home Farm F.C.Home Farm, McCann joined Burnley F.C.Burnley as a teenager, making his first team debut in 2005. He went on to make over 200 appearances for the club before joining Wigan Athletic on a free transfer in 2013. He has also won one cap for the Republic of Ireland national under-19 football teamRepublic of Ireland U19 team.

James McCarthy.name: James McCarthy
James McCarthy.intro: '''James McCarthy''' (born 12 November 1990) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Everton F.C.Everton and Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland as a central midfielder. McCarthy made over 100 appearances for Hamilton Academical F.C.Hamilton Academical as a teenager, before being transferred to Wigan in 2009 for an initial £1.2 million which was a record sale fee for Hamilton Academical. Born in Scotland, McCarthy elected to represent the Republic of Ireland at international level and made his competitive debut for the Republic of Ireland national football teamtheir senior team on 26 March 2011 in a UEFA Euro 2012 UEFA Euro 2012 qualificationqualifier against Macedonia national football teamMacedonia.

Cheick Tiot\u00e9.name: Cheick Tioté
Cheick Tiot\u00e9.intro: '''Cheick Ismaël Tioté''' (; born 21 June 1986) is an Ivorian association footballfootballer who plays as a defensive midfielder for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast national team,with whom he won the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations.

Paulo Gazzaniga.name: Paulo Gazzaniga
Paulo Gazzaniga.intro: '''Paulo Dino Gazzaniga''' (born 2 January 1992) is an Argentine Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for English side Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Keith Rowland.name: Keith Rowland
Keith Rowland.intro:
'''Keith Rowland''' (born Portadown, Northern Ireland, 1 September 1971) is a former footballer who played as a defender (association football)defender with A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Queens Park Rangers F.C.QPR, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield Barnet F.C.Barnet, Hornchurch F.C.Hornchurch, Redbridge F.C.Redbridge and Welling United F.C.Welling United.
He also represented Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, winning 19 caps.

Matthew Kennedy (Scottish footballer).name: Matthew Kennedy (Scottish footballer)
Matthew Kennedy (Scottish footballer).intro: '''Matthew Kennedy''' (born 1 November 1994 in Northern Ireland) is a Scottish association footballfootballer playing as a winger (association football)winger for  Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. Kennedy has also previously played for Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, Hibernian F.C.Hibernian and Everton F.C.Everton. He has represented Scotland at youth international levels.

Ludovic Sylvestre.name: Ludovic Sylvestre
Ludovic Sylvestre.intro: '''Ludovic Sylvestre''' (born 5 February 1984) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays for Çaykur Rizespor as a Midfieldercentral midfielder.

Costel Pantilimon.name: Costel Pantilimon
Costel Pantilimon.intro: '''Costel Fane Pantilimon''' (born 1 February 1987) is a Romanian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Sunderland A.F.C. and the Romania national football teamRomania national team, as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. At 6'8" (203 cm) tall, he is currently the tallest player in the Premier League.

Milton N\u00fa\u00f1ez.name: Milton Núñez
Milton N\u00fa\u00f1ez.intro: '''Milton Omar Núñez García''' (born October 30, 1972 in Sambo Creek, Honduras), aka '''Tyson''' is a HondurasHonduran association footballfootball player who currently plays as a striker for Universad de San Carlos (Guatemalan football club)USAC in Liga Nacional de Fútbol de GuatemalaGuatemala's top division.

Sa\u0161a Ili\u0107 (footballer, born 19.name: Saša Ilić (footballer, born 1972)

Gavin Hoyte.position: Defender  association football  Full back Defender

Talal El Karkouri.name: Talal El Karkouri
Talal El Karkouri.intro:
'''Talal El Karkouri''' (, born 8 July 1976 in Casablanca) is a MoroccoMoroccan former professional association footballfootballer.
He played top-flight football in Morocco, France, Greece, England and Qatar before retiring in 2012.
He made his international debut for Morocco national football teamMorocco in 2000, and earned 53 caps, playing at three Africa Cup of Nations.

Robert Ullathorne.name: Robert Ullathorne
Robert Ullathorne.intro:
'''Robert Ullathorne''' (born 11 October 1971 in Wakefield, Yorkshire, England) is former a professional Association footballfootballer, most recently playing for Notts County F.C.Notts County, where he played as a Defender (association football)defender.
He played most of his professional games for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

Kamel Ghilas.name: Kamel Ghilas
Kamel Ghilas.intro: '''Kamel Fathi Ghilas''' (born 9 March 1984) is an Algerian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)forward.

Yassine El Ghanassy.name: Yassine El Ghanassy
Yassine El Ghanassy.intro: '''Yassine El Ghanassy''' (born 12 July 1990) is a BelgiumBelgian-MoroccoMoroccan Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward and is currently playing for Stabæk.

Gunnar Nielsen.name: Gunnar Nielsen
Gunnar Nielsen.intro: '''Gunnar Nielsen''' (born 7 October 1986) is a Faroe IslandsFaroese Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is currently without a club after leaving ScotlandScottish club Motherwell F.C.Motherwell in March 2015. Nielsen has also represented Havnar Bóltfelag, Boldklubben Frem, GÍ GøtaGøtu Ítróttarfelag, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers and the Faroe Islands national football team.

David Edwards.name: David Edwards
David Edwards.intro:
'''David Alexander Edwards''' (born 3 February 1986) is an English-born Wales national football teamWales international Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. He is known for his energetic runs and work rate.
Edwards began his career at hometown club Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town before a short stay at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, brought his to the attention of Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, for whom he signed in January 2008. With Wolves he has played in three different divisions, including the Premier League.

Jord\u00e3o (footballer, born 1971).name: Jordão (footballer, born 1971)
Jord\u00e3o (footballer, born 1971).intro: '''Adelino José Martins Batista''' (born 30 August 1971), commonly known as '''Jordão''', is a PortugalPortuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.

Frank Strandli.name: Frank Strandli
Frank Strandli.intro: '''Frank Strandli''' (born 16 May 1972) is a NorwayNorwegian former professional footballer who played as a striker.

Bradley Allen.name: Bradley Allen
Bradley Allen.intro:
'''Bradley James Allen''' (born 13 September 1971) is an English former Association footballfootballer who is currently an academy Coach (sport)#Association footballcoach at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
As a player, Allen played as a Forward (association football)forward from 1988 to 2004, making Premier League appearances for both Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He also made The Football LeagueFootball League appearances for Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United and Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers. He represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, earning eight caps and scoring two goals.

Chris Willmott.name: Chris Willmott
Chris Willmott.intro:
'''Christopher Alan "Chris" Willmott''' (born September 30, 1977, in Bedford, England) is an English retired Association footballfootballer.
Chris began his career at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, before a move to Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon alongside team-mate Kelvin Davis due to the Hatters financial difficulties at the time. He returned to Luton on loan in 2002/03, and was all set to return on a Bosman transfer in the summer of 2003 as well as fellow loanee Sammy Igoe.
However, the take-over and subsequent dismissal of the Luton management team saw Chris join Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town instead, where he scored once against Cambridge United.cite web
url=
title=Cambridge 0-1 Northampton
publisher=BBC
date=6 March 2004 accessdate=17 January 2010 In the summer of 2005, Chris joined Oxford United F.C.Oxford on a free transfer from Northampton. He has proved to be a quality signing for Oxford with a series of outstanding performances. 'Motty' has missed the majority of the 2007/08 season through a knee injury. It is not known when he will return.
He was released by Oxford United at the end of the 2008/09 season.
Chris has signed a two-year contract with Southern League Premier Division side Brackley Town F.C.Brackley Town. Chris now plays for Conference North team Oxford City F.C.Oxford City where he is vice-captain.

Yannick Sagbo.name: Yannick Sagbo
Yannick Sagbo.intro: '''Yannick Anister Sagbo-Latte''' (born on 12 April 1988), known as '''Yannick Sagbo''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast national team.

Neil Danns.name: Neil Danns
Neil Danns.intro: '''Neil Alexander Danns''' (born 23 November 1982) is an is an English-born Guyananese association footballer who plays as a midfielder for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers

Robbie Savage.name: Robbie Savage
Robbie Savage.intro:
'''Robert William "Robbie" Savage''' (born 18 October 1974) is a Welsh association footballfootball pundit and former player. During his career he played predominantly as a midfielder, starting off as a youth player with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before joining Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra when he failed to make the grade at Old Trafford. He became a regular for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in the late 1990s and early 2000s, and performed a similar role for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. In 2008, he joined Derby County F.C.Derby County; after a short loan spell with Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion later that year, he returned to captain Derby, with whom he finished his playing career. He also played for the Wales national football teamWales national team on 39 occasions. He now acts as a pundit for the BBC and regularly presents ''606 (radio show)606'' on BBC Radio 5 Live on Saturday evenings alongside Darren Fletcher.
Savage gained notoriety for his playing style; in 2008, the ''Daily Mail'' labelled him as the dirtiest player in Premier League history, based on numbers of yellow cards received, though he has since been surpassed as the player with the most Premier League yellow cards by Lee Bowyer.

Patrice Carteron.name: Patrice Carteron
Patrice Carteron.intro: '''Patrice Carteron''' (born 30 July 1970) is a French association footballfootball coach and former professional player. He is currently the head coach of Democratic Republic of the CongoCongolese club TP Mazembe.

Les Sealey.name: Les Sealey
Les Sealey.intro: '''Leslie Jesse''' "'''Les'''" '''Sealey''' (29 September 1957 – 19 August 2001) was an English association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for, among others, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He was a nephew of Alan Sealey, another West Ham United player.

David Farrell (footballer, born 1971).name: David Farrell (footballer, born 1971)
David Farrell (footballer, born 1971).intro: '''David William Farrell''' (born 11 November 1971 in Birmingham, England) is an English association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Stamford A.F.C.Stamford. Farrell made over 400 appearances in the The Football LeagueFootball League for Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United and Boston United F.C.Boston United between 1995 and 2007.

Paul Scholes.name: Paul Scholes
Paul Scholes.intro:
'''Paul Scholes''' (; born 16 November 1974) is a retired English Association footballfootballer who played his List of one-club menentire professional career for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and is currently co-owner of Salford City F.C.Salford City.
Born in Salford, Greater ManchesterSalford, but later moving to Langley, Greater ManchesterLangley, Scholes excelled in both cricket and football while at school. He first trained with Manchester United at the age of 14 after being spotted by a scout visiting his school, signing for them as an apprentice on leaving school in 1991, and turning professional in 1993. He made his full debut for United in the 1994–95 in English football1994–95 season. He went on to play a key part in the club's Treble (association football)Treble-winning success in the 1998–99 in English football1998–99 season, and has won 11 Premier League, three FA Cup and two UEFA Champions League winners medals.
Scholes represented the England national football teamEngland national team from 1997 to 2004, gaining 66 Cap (sport)caps and participating in the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 and 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cups, as well as the UEFA Euro 2000 and UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 tournaments.
Cited by many of his footballing peers as one of the best midfielders of his generation, Scholes has also been criticised for his disciplinary record, amassing over 120 Yellow card (sports)#Yellow cardbookings in all competitions during his career and being sent off ten times.
Scholes made 718 appearances for United, the List of Manchester United F.C. records and statistics#Most appearancesthird-highest number of appearances by any player for the club. Scholes announced his retirement from playing on 31 May 2011, receiving a testimonial match, and began his coaching career at the club from the 2011–12 season onward. However, he reversed this decision on 8 January 2012, and went on to play one more season before retiring again in May 2013.[

Francis Jeffers.name: Francis Jeffers
Francis Jeffers.intro: '''Francis Jeffers''' (born 25 January 1981) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a forward (association football)striker. In his career Jeffers has played for Premier League teams Everton F.CEverton, Arsenal F.CArsenal, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, as well as various lower-tier clubs. He has one cap for England national football teamEngland, scoring one goal against Australia national association football teamAustralia. Jeffers is the joint all-time highest scorer for the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 side with 13 goals in 16 appearances.

Martin Bullock.name: Martin Bullock
Martin Bullock.intro:
'''Martin John Bullock''' (born 5 March 1975) is an English former Association footballfootball midfielder who is a youth team coach at New Zealand New Zealand Football ChampionshipPremiership club Waitakere United. He previously played for five league teams over fifteen years, making 452 the Football Leagueleague appearances. He also won a cap for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side in 1996.
He began his career at non-league Eastwood Town F.C.Eastwood Town, before earning a move to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 1993. In an eight-year association with the club he played almost 200 league games for the club, helping them to the Premier League at the end of the 1996–97 Football League1996–97 season. Loaned out to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 2000, the following year he transferred to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He enjoyed a highly successful four years with the club, lifting the Football League Trophy in 2002 Football League Trophy Final2002 and 2004 Football League Trophy Final2004. He then played for Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town between 2005 and 2007, before ending his professional career with Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers in 2008. He later turned out for leading New Zealand side Waitakere United, helping them to two New Zealand Football ChampionshipPremiership titles, before his retirement in June 2012.

Dominic Matteo.name: Dominic Matteo
Dominic Matteo.intro:
'''Dominic Matteo''' (born 28 April 1974) is a ScotlandScottish former professional association footballer who played as a defender (association football)defender and Midfielder (football)centre-midfielder from 1992 to 2009. He formerly worked as Football Ambassador at Leeds United.
He played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Blackburn Rovers and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. His most notable individual moment was his goal in the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League against A.C. Milan. He was capped six times by Scotland national football teamScotland after originally playing for England as a youngster. The latter part of his career was increasingly impacted by injury which led to his retirement in 2009 at the age of 35.
Dominic Matteo.position: Defender  football  Centre back,Defender  football  Left back,Midfielder  football  Centre midfielder

Nicky Mohan.name: Nicky Mohan
Nicky Mohan.intro: '''Nicholas "Nicky" Mohan''' (born 6 October 1970) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played in defender (association football)defence making 390 league appearances for seven clubs during his 15-year football league career.

Fraser Fyvie.name: Fraser Fyvie
Fraser Fyvie.intro: '''Fraser Anderson Fyvie''' (born 27 March 1993) is a ScotlandScottish professional association footballfootballer, who plays for Hibernian F.C.Hibernian as a midfielder. Fyvie has previously played for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, and has represented Scotland at under-15, Scotland national under-17 football teamunder-17, Scotland national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Scotland national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels.

Javi Garc\u00eda.name: Javi García
Javi Garc\u00eda.intro:
'''Francisco Javier "Javi" García Fernández''' (; born 8 February 1987) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Russian club FC Zenit Saint Petersburg. A Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder by nature, he can also appear as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He started his career with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, but represented mostly the reserve team, going on to have a three-year spell with S.L. BenficaBenfica in Portugal. In 2012 he signed with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
García represented Spain national football teamSpain at Spain national youth football teamvarious youth levels, including the victorious Spain national under-19 football teamunder-19s at the 2006 UEFA European Under-19 Championship2006 European Championship, and made his senior international debut in 2012.

Diniyar Bilyaletdinov.name: Diniyar Bilyaletdinov
Diniyar Bilyaletdinov.intro:
'''Diniyar Rinatovich Bilyaletdinov''' (, ; born 27 February 1985 in Moscow) is a Russian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder (association football)midfielder for FC Torpedo MoscowTorpedo Moscow on loan from FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow. His father Rinat Bilyaletdinov was also a professional footballer and is now a coach.
Bilyaletdinov has played for Russia national football teamRussia since 2005, earning 46 caps and scoring 6 goals. He played for them at Euro 2008.

Jean-Alain Boumsong.name: Jean-Alain Boumsong
Jean-Alain Boumsong.intro: '''Jean-Alain Boumsong-Somkong''' (born 14 December 1979) is a French football defender (association football)defender, a France national football teamFrance national team former player. He is known for his physical strength, pace and reading of the game.
Jean-Alain Boumsong.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

St\u00e9phane Dalmat.name: Stéphane Dalmat
St\u00e9phane Dalmat.intro: '''Stéphane Dalmat''' (born 16 February 1979 in Joué-lès-Tours) is a retired French association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. Dalmat was a very versatile player who usually occupied a variety of positions on the midfield. His good ball control and dribbling ability has often seen managers use him wide on the left of midfield. Despite being left footed, he was comfortable with either foot.

Kolo Tour\u00e9.name: Kolo Touré
Kolo Tour\u00e9.intro: '''Kolo Abib Touré''' (born 19 March 1981) is an Ivorian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as a Defender (association football)defender. He previously played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where he was a member of the famous 2003–04 Arsenal F.C. season'invincibles' side of the 2003–04 season. He is the elder brother of Manchester City's Yaya Touré and the late Ibrahim Touré (footballer, born 1985)Ibrahim Touré, who died in June 2014.

Miguel Marcos Madera.name: Miguel Marcos Madera
Miguel Marcos Madera.intro:
'''Miguel Marcos Madera''' (born 8 November 1985), commonly known as '''Míchel''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Israeli club Maccabi Haifa F.C.Maccabi Haifa as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Having been brought through the youth academy of Real Oviedo, he played with the first team of rivals Sporting de Gijón in both the Segunda División and La Liga, before eventually leaving for Premier League club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in January 2010.
He spent the second half of the 2010–11 season on loan at AEK Athens F.C.AEK Athens, before returning to Spain for a three-year spell with Getafe CFGetafe. He signed for Maccabi Haifa in September 2014.

Amr Zaki.name: Amr Zaki
Amr Zaki.intro:
'''Amr Zaki''' (; born 1 April 1983 in Mansoura) is an Egyptian Association footballfootballer who currently playes for Egyptian side El Mokawloon SCArab Contractors. Zaki has played as a striker throughout his career. He has played for numerous different clubs in Egypt, Russia, England, Turkey and Kuwait. Zaki has made 63 appearances and scored 30 goals for the Egyptian national team. In his career, Zaki has been nicknamed the "bulldozer" and has been likened to former England striker Alan Shearer.
However, his career has not been without controversy. He was labelled "highly unprofessional" by former Wigan manager Steve Bruce. Also, his decision not to join English club Portsmouth FCPortsmouth due to the nationality of some of the players which garnered much criticism in the English press.

Javi Moreno.name: Javi Moreno
Javi Moreno.intro:
'''Javier 'Javi' Moreno Valera''' (born 10 September 1974) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Best known for his Deportivo AlavésAlavés stint,[

Romelu Lukaku.name: Romelu Lukaku
Romelu Lukaku.intro:
'''Romelu Menama Lukaku''' (born 13 May 1993) is a Belgian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for English club Everton F.C.Everton and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team. In January 2014, he was named by ''The Guardian'' as one of the ten most promising young players in Europe. He is a left-footed player.Veysey, Wayne (2011-08-06). [
He started his career with local side K. Rupel Boom F.C.Rupel Boom, before  joining Lierse S.K.Lierse, where he earned a move to  R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht of the Belgian Pro League  in 2006. Lukaku made his professional debut while still at school at the age of 16, and became the 2009–10 Belgian Pro League2009–10 top scorer in Belgium as Anderlecht won the List of Belgian football championsBelgian championship. He also won the Belgian Ebony Shoe in 2011. In the 2011 summer transfer window, Lukaku joined Premier League club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for an undisclosed fee, signing a five-year contract with the London club. He did not appear regularly in his first season there, and spent the following two on loan at West Bromwich Albion and Everton respectively, signing permanently for the latter for a club record £28 million in 2014.
Lukaku made his senior international debut for Belgium in 2010, and has since earned over 30 caps. He represented the country at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Justin Hoyte.name: Justin Hoyte
Justin Hoyte.intro: '''Justin Raymond Hoyte''' (born 20 November 1984) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall and the Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago national team.

Marc Bridge-Wilkinson.name: Marc Bridge-Wilkinson
Marc Bridge-Wilkinson.intro:
'''Marc Bridge-Wilkinson''' (born 16 March 1979) is an English peopleEnglish former association footballfootballer. A left-sided midfielder and also a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, and was known for his goal-scoring ability.
Starting his career at Derby County F.C.Derby County in 1998, he instead made his name at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale following his transfer in 2000. He made over 100 appearances in four years, scoring 31 league goals, and lifting the Football League Trophy in 2001 Football League Trophy Final2001. He spent 2004–05 with Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, before signing with Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in 2005. He spent two years at Bradford, making close to 100 appearances. He signed with Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United in 2007, and went on to pick up a League Trophy runners-up medal with the club in 2010 Football League Trophy Final2010. After four years with Carlisle, he joined Darlington F.C.Darlington in 2011, breaking his run of ten consecutive seasons in the third tier of English football. With Darlington he lifted the FA Trophy in 2011 FA Trophy Final2011, before his contract was terminated in January 2012 but was re-signed on a non-contract basis until the club folded in the summer of 2012.

Graham Allen.name: Graham Allen
Graham Allen.intro:
'''Graham Allen''' born 8 April 1977 in Bolton is a former professional footballer who plays as a central defender for Bradford Park Avenue A.F.C.Bradford Park Avenue.
Graham started his career at Everton F.C.Everton making his debut against Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough on the 26 December 1996, He played 6 times for Everton F.C.Everton before signing for Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers in 1998 after a successful loan spell.
He played 200 league games for Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers scoring 10 goals before signing for Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds in 2004 playing 31 league games and scoring 2 goals before signing for Chester City F.C.Chester City in 2006. Injuries forced him to retire from professional football after only one year at the Deva Stadium, having made just three league appearances for the Blues.
After spending time on trial with Droylsden F.C.Droylsden, Allen joined Bradford Park Avenue A.F.C.Bradford Park Avenue in August 2007.

Adrian Clarke.name: Adrian Clarke
Adrian Clarke.intro:
'''Adrian James Clarke''' (born 28 September 1974) is a former English association footballfootballer, who last played for Welling United F.C.Welling United. He was a midfielder who played seven Premier League games at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.
After he retired he became a journalist.

Jon Hallworth.name: Jon Hallworth
Jon Hallworth.intro: '''Jonathan Geoffrey "Jon" Hallworth''' (born 26 October 1965 in Stockport, Cheshire) is an English peopleEnglish former professional goalkeeper.

Craig Middleton.name: Craig Middleton
Craig Middleton.intro: Middleton began his career at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, alongside his twin brother Lee MiddletonLee, before moving to Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United in 1993. He made a number of appearances in his first year but missed the whole of the following season, 1994-95. He did manage to return to the side but a shoulder injury towards the end of the season meant he was released by the club in 1996. He signed for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and quickly became a first team regular and would be a vital part of the Cardiff team for the next three years before falling out of favour and, after a short loan spell at Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, left to join Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town.

Derek Boateng.name: Derek Boateng
Derek Boateng.intro: '''Derek Owusu Boateng''' ( ) (born 2 May 1983) is a Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club SD Eibar and the Ghana national football teamGhana national team as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.  He's the brother of Kevin-Prince Boateng and Jerome Boateng.

Jens Lehmann.name: Jens Lehmann
Jens Lehmann.intro: '''Jens Gerhard Lehmann''' (; born 10 November 1969) is a GermanyGerman former Association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He was voted UEFA Club Goalkeeper of the Year for the 1996–97 and 2005–06 seasons, and he has been selected for three FIFA World CupWorld Cup squads. He was a member of The Invincibles (football)#ArsenalArsenal's Invincibles, playing every match of their famous unbeaten title winning season. He also holds the UEFA Champions League record for the most consecutive clean sheets, having not conceded a goal in 10 matches whilst at Arsenal FCArsenal.

Ian Butterworth.name: Ian Butterworth
Ian Butterworth.intro: '''Ian Stuart Butterworth''' (born 25 January 1964 in Cheshire) is a former professional association footballfootballer, formerly assistant and caretaker manager at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

John Humphrey.name: John Humphrey
John Humphrey.intro:
'''John Humphrey''' (born 31 January 1961) is an EnglandEnglish former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a  defender (football)defender from 1979 until 1997.
He notably played for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace where he featured in the Premier League. He also played in the Football League for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Reading F.C.Reading, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, before finishing his career in Non-league for Chesham United F.C.Chesham United and Dulwich Hamlet F.C.Dulwich Hamlet.

Andriy Voronin.name: Andriy Voronin
Andriy Voronin.intro:
'''Andriy Viktorovych Voronin''' (; born 21 July 1979) is a retired UkraineUkrainian professional association footballfootballer. Voronin spent five full seasons in the Fußball-Bundesliga of Germany, and last played as a Forward (association football)striker or Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for FC Dynamo MoscowDynamo Moscow.
His previous professional clubs include Borussia Mönchengladbach, 1. FSV Mainz 05Mainz, 1. FC KölnKöln, Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Hertha BSC, and FC Dynamo MoscowDynamo Moscow. In the 2002–03 season, Voronin became top goalscorer in the 2. Fußball-Bundesliga2. Bundesliga, which earnt him a transfer to the Fußball-BundesligaBundesliga club 1. FC KölnKöln.
At international level, Voronin played 74 matches for  Ukraine national football teamUkraine from his debut in 2002. He was in their squad for the 2006 FIFA World Cup and  UEFA Euro 2012, after which he retired from international football.[

Mohamed Nagy.name: Mohamed Nagy
Mohamed Nagy.intro: '''Mohamed Nagy Ismail Afash''' (Arabic script: ); born on 30 October 1984), known by his nickname '''Gedo''' (, , which means ''Grandpa'' in Egyptian Arabic), is an Egyptian footballer who plays for Al Ahly SCAl Ahly in the Egyptian Premier League, as well as the Egypt national football teamEgypt national team.

Rati Aleksidze.name: Rati Aleksidze
Rati Aleksidze.intro: '''Rati Aleksidze''' (; born 3 August 1978 in Tbilsi) is a soccerfootball striker from Georgia (country)Georgia, who plays for FC Dila Gori

Steve Jones (footballer, born March 1970.name: Steve Jones (footballer, born March 1970)
Steve Jones (footballer, born March 1970.intro: '''Steven Gary''' "'''Steve'''" '''Jones''' (born 17 March 1970) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.

Robert Earnshaw.name: Robert Earnshaw
Robert Earnshaw.intro:
'''Robert Earnshaw''' (born 6 April 1981) is a Welsh international association footballfootballer who currently plays for Vancouver Whitecaps FC in Major League Soccer. He is the only player to have scored a hat-trick in the Premier League, all three divisions of the The Football LeagueEnglish Football League, the Football League CupLeague Cup, the FA Cup, and for his country in an international match.
Earnshaw was born in Mufulira, Zambia, and spent the first five years of his life there before moving to Malawi. Soon after the death of his father in 1990, Earnshaw's mother moved the family to Bedwas in south Wales. Earnshaw joined Cardiff City as a Youth Training Scheme (YTS) trainee in 1997, and turned professional a year later. During his first spell at Cardiff he made 205 first team appearances, scoring 105 goals. Eligible to represent either Zambia national football teamZambia or Wales, Earnshaw made his debut for the latter in 2003.
Moving up two divisions in 2004, Earnshaw joined Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, finishing the 2004–05 season as top goalscorer. Earnshaw signed for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City during the January 2006 transfer window, staying at Carrow Road until the end of the 2006–07 season. At Derby County F.C.Derby County the following season, Earnshaw spent what he called his worst season in football, scoring one goal in his 22 appearances. Earnshaw's three-year contract with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest expired in June 2011. During his time at Forest, Earnshaw scored 35 goals in 87 appearances. In June 2011, Earnshaw left Forest on a Free transfer (football)free transfer and signed a two-year contract with his old club, Cardiff City. Since leaving Cardiff City in 2004, Earnshaw's transfer fees totalled £12,650,000.

Alessandro Pistone.name: Alessandro Pistone
Alessandro Pistone.intro: '''Alessandro Pistone''' (born 27 July 1975 in Milan, Italy) is a former Italian Association footballfootballer. During his career, he played for Vicenza CalcioVicenza, Internazionale, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Everton F.C.Everton and RAEC Mons, as well as the Italian national football teamItaly Under-21 national team, whom he represented in the 1996 Olympics.

Robert Koren.name: Robert Koren
Robert Koren.intro: '''Robert Koren''' (born 20 September 1980) is a SlovenesSlovenian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder currently playing for Melbourne City FCMelbourne City in the A-League. Koren earned 61 caps and scored 5 goals for the Slovenia national football team between 2003 and 2012 and played at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
