Andy Reid.name: Andy Reid
Andy Reid.intro: '''Andrew Matthew "Andy" Reid''' (born 29 July 1982) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Football League Championship club Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He turned professional in August 1999 making his debut for Nottingham Forest on 29 November 2000 against Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. Reid moved from Forest to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham in 2005, then to Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic in 2006, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 2008 and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in 2011. In July 2011 he signed a two-year deal back at Nottingham Forest. He has also represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland internationally.

Mark Patterson (footballer, born 1965).name: Mark Patterson (footballer, born 1965)
Mark Patterson (footballer, born 1965).intro: '''Mark Patterson''' (born 24 May 1965 in Darwen, Blackburn, Lancashire) is an English former association footballfootballer who made nearly 500 appearances in the Football League playing as a midfielder for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Bury F.C.Bury, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Southend United F.C.Southend United and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He went on to play, and then to manage, in non-League football.

Paul Jones (footballer, born 1967).name: Paul Jones (footballer, born 1967)
Paul Jones (footballer, born 1967).intro: '''Paul Steven Jones''' (born 18 April 1967) is a retired Wales national football teamWelsh international football Goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper. During his playing career, he played for several clubs, including Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Stockport County and Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Martin Taylor (footballer, born 1979).name: Martin Taylor (footballer, born 1979)
Martin Taylor (footballer, born 1979).intro:
'''Martin Taylor''' (born 9 November 1979) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender.
Taylor began his career with Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, for whom he made more than 100 appearances, and also spent time loan (association football)on loan at Darlington F.C.Darlington and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. While a Blackburn player, he was cap (sport)capped once for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team and played on the winning side in the 2002 Football League Cup Final. Taylor moved to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2004, where he spent six seasons, and played for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City on loan. He was involved in an incident in 2008 in which Arsenal F.C.Arsenal player Eduardo da Silva suffered a badly broken leg. Unable to force his way into Birmingham's first team after their return to the Premier League, he joined Watford F.C.Watford in January 2010. Taylor quickly established himself in Watford's first team, starting every league game in the 2010–11 season, but injury disrupted his next season, and he joined Sheffield Wednesday in August 2012. He played infrequently for Wednesday, spent time on loan at Brentford F.C.Brentford, and was released at the end of the 2013–14 season.

Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1984).name: Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1984)
Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1984).intro:
'''Thomas Andrew "Tommy" Wright''' (born 28 September 1984) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Southern Premier League side Corby Town F.C.Corby Town, where he is also the club's manager.
A former England national under-19 football teamEngland U19 and England national under-20 football teamU20 international, he started his career with Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, helping them into the Premier League in 2002–03 Leicester City F.C. season2002–03. However he failed to hold down a regular first team place, and was loaned out to Brentford F.C.Brentford and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, before transferring to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 2006. He helped the "Tykes" to promotion out of Football League OneLeague One 2006 Football League play-offs#League Onevia the play-offs, before he joined Darlington F.C.Darlington in January 2007 following a short loan spell at Football League TwoLeague Two champions Walsall F.C.Walsall. He was sold on to Scottish Premier LeagueSPL side Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen in August 2008 for a £100,000 fee. He returned to England in January 2010, signing with Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, who were soon relegated out of the Football League. He re-joined Darlington, helping the club to lift the FA Trophy in 2011 FA Trophy Final2011. He then spent a brief time with Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers and then Luton Town F.C.Luton Town.

Juergen Sommer.name: Juergen Sommer
Juergen Sommer.intro: '''Juergen Peterson Sommer''' (born February 27, 1969) is the Director of Soccer Operations and Head Coach of the Indy Eleven North American Soccer League franchise. He is a former American association footballsoccer Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, who became the first American goalkeeper to play in the FA Premier League, when he suited up for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 1995. He has served as the United States men's national soccer teamUS Men's National team goalkeeping coach.

Danny Graham.name: Danny Graham
Danny Graham.intro:
'''Daniel Anthony William "Danny" Graham''' (born 12 August 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as a Forward (association football)striker.
Graham started his professional career at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 2003, making his debut for the club in a Premier League match against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United the following year. He later represented England at England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level. During his four years at Middlesbrough, Graham made just one first team start. He was loaned out to clubs in all three divisions of the Football League, before joining his final loan club Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United on a two-year deal in 2007.
At the end of his contract, he joined Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Watford F.C.Watford, who were subsequently ordered to pay compensation. Graham was Watford's top-scorer in List of Watford F.C. seasonsboth of his seasons at Vicarage Road, as well as Watford F.C. Player of the Season and the Championship's overall top scorer in 2010–11 Watford F.C. season2010–11. In July 2011, Graham transferred to newly promoted Premier League team Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City for £3.5 million, where in his first season he was their top goalscorer with 12 league goals. He made a £5 million move to Sunderland in January 2013.

Harald Wapenaar.name: Harald Wapenaar
Harald Wapenaar.intro:
'''Harald Wapenaar''' (born 10 April 1970 in Vlaardingen, South Holland) is a former Dutch Association footballfootball goalkeeper.
Wapenaar played for Italian club Udinese Calcio and FC Utrecht before transferring to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in the summer of 2003. Portsmouth signed Wapenaar as competition for first-choice goalkeeper Shaka Hislop. However, Hislop's superb form and the emergence of young goalkeeper Jamie Ashdown meant Wapenaar struggled for games prior to his move back to the Netherlands, to Vitesse in January 2005. After losing his place in 2006–07, he signed for Sparta Rotterdam on loan in 2007, starting in their Eredivisie match against Excelsior Rotterdam on 21 January .

David Terrier.name: David Terrier
David Terrier.intro: '''David Terrier''' (born 4 August 1973 in Verdun, Meuse) is a retired French football defender who last played for US Créteil.

Neil Thompson.name: Neil Thompson
Neil Thompson.intro:
'''Neil Thompson''' (born 2 October 1963, in Beverley, East Riding of Yorkshire, England) is an English former footballer who played in defence, chiefly on the left side of the pitch, for Scarborough, Ipswich Town and Barnsley amongst others.  Thompson subsequently became a football coach and had spells at York City, Scarborough and Boston United as player-manager. Currently, he is First Team Coach at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.cite web

Gary Bull.name: Gary Bull
Gary Bull.intro: '''Gary William Bull''' (born 12 June 1966 in West Bromwich) is an English association footballfootballer currently playing for Boston Town F.C.Boston Town. He has played for many clubs, most notably Nottingham Forest, typically as a centre forward.

Michael Hughes.name: Michael Hughes
Michael Hughes.intro: '''Michael Eamon Hughes''' (born 2 August 1971) is a retired Northern IrelandNorthern Irish association footballfootballer who currently is a majority shareholder and co-owner of NIFL Championship 1 side Carrick Rangers [

Matthew Connolly.name: Matthew Connolly
Matthew Connolly.intro: '''Matthew Thomas Martin Connolly''' (born 24 September 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Watford F.C.Watford as a Defender (association football)defender on loan from Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff. He joined the club from Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers on 22 August 2012, having previously being at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Wayne Burnett.name: Wayne Burnett
Wayne Burnett.intro:
'''Wayne Burnett''' (born 4 September 1971) is an English former Association footballfootballer who is the current manager of Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.Dagenham & Redbridge.
As a player Burnett was a midfielder from 1989 until 2004 notably playing in the Football League for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town. He also briefly played Premier League football for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and also played in the Football League for Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United as well as playing non-League football for Woking F.C.Woking, Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic and Fisher Athletic F.C.Fisher Athletic. After retiring from football in 2004, Burnett went on to become manager with former clubs Grays and Fisher as well as a spell with Dulwich Hamlet F.C.Dulwich Hamlet before returning to Leyton Orient as youth team manager.

Simon Johnson.name: Simon Johnson
Simon Johnson.intro: '''Simon Ainsley Johnson''' (born 9 March 1983 in West Bromwich, England) is an English Association footballprofessional footballer.

Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1976).name: Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1976)
Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1976).intro:
'''Ashley Michael Westwood''' (born 31 August 1976) is an English former association footballfootballer who is currently the head coach of Bengaluru FC of the Indian I-League.
A graduate of the Manchester United F.C.Manchester United Manchester United F.C. Reserves and AcademyAcademy, the defender (association football)defender signed with Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra in 1995. Three years later he moved on to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City. Winning promotion to the Premier League with the "Bantams", he transferred to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 2000. He moved on to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town in 2003, where he stayed for three years. Signing with Chester City F.C.Chester City in 2006, he was loaned out to Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 2007, before joining Wrexham F.C.Wrexham via Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough the following year.
He spent the 2010–11 season with Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town, before returning to Crewe Alexandra for a brief spell in 2011. Later in the year he re-joined another former club, Northampton Town. In December 2011 he was released from the "Cobblers" after his contract was not renewed. He was appointed player-caretaker manager at Kettering Town the following month, before returning just to playing duties with Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City in May 2012. Two months later he became player-coach at Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, before becoming a full-time coach at Blackpool in November 2012. In his 18 year playing career he scored 34 goals in 468 competitive appearances in the Football League and Football ConferenceConference. He was promoted four times with four different clubs.

David Brightwell.name: David Brightwell
David Brightwell.intro:
'''David John Brightwell''' (born 7 January 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as Defender (football)defender from 1988 to 2002.
He notably played Premier League football for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and went on to play in the Football League for Chester City F.C.Chester City, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Darlington F.C.Darlington.

Damien Plessis.name: Damien Plessis
Damien Plessis.intro: '''Damien Jerome Jean Richard Plessis''' (born 5 March 1988) is a French Association footballfootballer who currently plays for LB_Châteauroux in the Ligue 2. He is also the younger brother of professional footballer Guillaume Plessis.

Goran Bunjev\u010devi\u0107.name: Goran Bunjevčević
Goran Bunjev\u010devi\u0107.intro:
'''Goran Bunjevčević''' (, born 17 February 1973)  is a former SerbsSerbian Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (football)defender in Serbia, England and the Netherlands.
Hailed in the press as the "Serbian Beckenbauer", he had a remarkably good disciplinary record and strong technique, being known for his reading of the game and flair for an incisive pass. The former Serbia and Montenegro national football teamSerbia and Montenegro international has recently moved from the dressing-room to the boardroom, back at Red Star Belgrade. He didn't hold the position very long as he resigned together with club president and board on 29 August 2008 after a disastrous start of the season.

Ciaran Clark.name: Ciaran Clark
Ciaran Clark.intro:
'''Ciaran Clark''' (born 26 September 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. Clark is naturally a Defender (association football)central defender, but is also able to operate as a Midfieldercentral midfielder and at Leftbackleft back.
Clark captained England national football teamEngland at under-18, under-19 and under-20 level, but in October 2010 declared his ambition to play for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. He was called up to the national team a month later for the friendly match against Norway national football teamNorway, and made his full debut against Wales national football teamWales on 8 February 2011.

Marcus Olsson.name: Marcus Olsson
Marcus Olsson.intro: '''Marcus Jonas Munuhe Olsson''' (born 17 May 1988) is a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer who plays for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers as a midfielder and left back.

Rohan Ricketts.name: Rohan Ricketts
Rohan Ricketts.intro:
'''Rohan Anthony Ricketts''' (born 22 December 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer, who is currently playing for Hong Kong Premier League side Eastern Sports Club.
Ricketts has played professionally in England, Canada, the United States, Hungary, Moldova, Germany, Republic of Ireland, India, Ecuador and Thailand.

Nicola Ventola.name: Nicola Ventola
Nicola Ventola.intro: '''Nicola Ventola''' (born 24 May 1978) is a retired football in ItalyItalian footballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He was a member of the Italian squad at the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney and represented Italy national football teamItaly in the under-21s team. He retired from football in February 2011.

Alex Smith (footballer, born 1991).name: Alex Smith (footballer, born 1991)
Alex Smith (footballer, born 1991).intro: '''Alex Ralph Smith''' (born 31 October 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town as a Defender (association football)defender.

Enda Stevens.name: Enda Stevens
Enda Stevens.intro: '''Enda John Stevens''' (born 9 July 1990 in Dublin) is an Irish peopleIrish professional footballer who plays for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He has experience of football at a continental level, having played in the UEFA Europa League for Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers.
Enda Stevens.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Kerim Koyunlu.name: Kerim Koyunlu
Kerim Koyunlu.intro: '''Kerim Frei Koyunlu''' (born 19 November 1993) is a Turkish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş and the Turkey national football teamTurkish national team.

Tony Witter.name: Tony Witter
Tony Witter.intro:
'''Tony Witter''' (born 12 August 1965) is a retired English Association footballfootballer who played during the 1980s and 1990s.
Witter was a central defender who played for numerous clubs during his career including Millwall F.C.Millwall, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United and Bohemian F.C.Bohemians amongst others. He spent nearly seven years at Millwall making 104 league appearances, scoring two goals. He made a solitary appearance for Bohemians when he appeared against Galway United F.C.Galway United in December 1999.
Witter who is of African-Caribbean ethnicity was notable for being accepted by Millwall supporters at a time when some of them had a reputation for racial intolerance.cite web
last = Black
first = Les
last2 = Crabbe
first2 = Tim
last3 = Solomos
first3 = John
title = ‘Lions, Black Skins and Reggae Gyals’ Race, Nation and Identity in Football
publisher = Goldsmiths College, University of London
year = 1998
url =
format = pdf
accessdate =2008-04-18  cite web
last = Richards
first = Huw
title = Tasty left foot, but what about his cultural passport?
work = Times Higher Education
publisher = TSL Education Ltd.
date = 2002-06-07
url =
accessdate =2008-04-18
He held the record for the quickest goal scored for Plymouth Argyle by a player on his debut until Jamie Mackie broke it on 12 February 2008, against Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.cite web
title = Plymouth vs Barnsley
publisher = Plymouth Argyle F.C.
date = 2008-02-12
url =
accessdate =2008-04-18

Jos\u00e9 Antonio Reyes.name: José Antonio Reyes
Jos\u00e9 Antonio Reyes.intro:
'''José Antonio Reyes Calderón''' (; born 1 September 1983) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Sevilla FC mainly as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger but also as a Forward (association football)forward.
He made his professional debut for Sevilla at only 16, signing for England's Arsenal F.C.Arsenal aged 20. After two years he returned to Spain, going on to represent the two largest clubs in Madrid, Real Madrid C.F.Real and Atlético Madrid. He also had a short loan spell in Portugal with S.L. BenficaBenfica, re-joining Sevilla late in his career.
Reyes gained 21 Cap (sport)caps for Spain national football teamSpain, and represented the nation at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup.

Martin Ling.name: Martin Ling
Martin Ling.intro: '''Martin Ling''' (born 15 July 1966) is an English Association footballfootball manager and former player, who is currently unemployed after last serving as manager of Torquay United F.CTorquay United in Football League TwoLeague Two. He played in over 100 The Football LeagueFootball League matches for Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, before moving into management where he led Orient for over five years from 2003 until 2009.

Christian Panucci.name: Christian Panucci
Christian Panucci.intro:
'''Christian Panucci''' (; born 12 April 1973) is a retired Italian association footballfootballer who last worked as an assistant coach for the Russia national football teamRussian national team under Fabio Capello.
As a player, he was a member of the Italy national football teamItalian national team at the 1996 Olympics, 2002 World Cup, Euro 2004 and Euro 2008, playing 57 matches in total. Panucci was a quick, strong, and versatile player, who was primarily deployed as a Defender (association football)#Full backright-back, but was also capable of playing on the left. He was composed defensively, and he also possessed stamina, accurate distribution, and good technical ability, as well as notable physical and athletic attributes. He was primarily renowned for his ability in the air, frequently scoring with his head from set pieces. In his later career, as he lost his pace, he played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.

Barry Hayles.name: Barry Hayles
Barry Hayles.intro: '''Barrington Edward "Barry" Hayles''' (born 17 April 1972) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Truro City F.C.Truro City.

Paul Beesley.name: Paul Beesley
Paul Beesley.intro: '''Paul Beesley''' (born 21 July 1965) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played primarily as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. He began his career at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in September 1984, before he was sold on to Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient for £175,000 in October 1989. He joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United for £300,000 in July 1990, and was voted Player of the Year at the Premier League club in 1993. He was sold to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in August 1995 for a £250,000 fee, before moving on to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in February 1997 for £500,000. He had brief loan spells at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, before he was allowed to join Port Vale permanently in July 1999. He joined Chester City F.C.Chester City in the Football ConferenceConference in July 2000, and was voted the club's Player of the Season, before he signed with Stalybridge Celtic F.C.Stalybridge Celtic in October 2001. He later finished his career in Northern Ireland with Ballymena United F.C.Ballymena United. He later coached at Notts County F.C.Notts County and Leeds United.
Paul Beesley.position: Defender  association football  Centre back   left back

Wilfred Bouma.name: Wilfred Bouma
Wilfred Bouma.intro: '''Wilfred Bouma''' (;''Wilfred'' in isolation: . born 15 June 1978) is a Dutch former association footballfootballer who last played at PSV Eindhoven. Bouma was a technically refined left back/centre back who is known for his hard working nature, defensive positioning and tackling ability.
Wilfred Bouma.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left Back,Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Marcus Allb\u00e4ck.name: Marcus Allbäck
Marcus Allb\u00e4ck.intro: '''Marcus Christian Allbäck''' (; born 5 July 1973 in Gothenburg), is a retired SwedenSwedish association footballfootballer and coach, who currently is assistant coach for the Sweden national football team. He is a well-travelled Forward (association football)striker known for his sharp finishing ability

Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1966).name: Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1966)
Tommy Wright (footballer, born 1966).intro: '''Thomas Elliott "Tommy" Wright''' (born 10 January 1966) is a retired Scottish association footballfootballer. Having work previously as assistant manager of Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic he was announced to follow John Sheridan (footballer)John Sheridan to League Two side Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield to again serve as his assistant, in June 2009. He was made Caretaker Manager following the sacking of Sheridan on 27 August 2012, with Mark Crossley assisting.

Barry Horne.name: Barry Horne
Barry Horne.intro:
'''Barry Horne''' (born 18 May 1962, St Asaph, Wales) is a Welsh former professional Association footballfootballer, former chairman of the Professional Footballers' Association and sports television pundit.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1984 until 2002, notably playing in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton. He also played in the Football League for Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Walsall F.C.Walsall, before playing Non-league football with Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers and Belper Town F.C.Belper Town. He was capped 59 times by Wales national football teamWales, scoring twice.

David Batty.name: David Batty
David Batty.intro:
'''David Batty''' (born 2 December 1968) is an English retired professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
He is most famous for playing for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Blackburn Rovers and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, also being Cap (sport)capped for the England national football team, and representing the nation at UEFA Euro 1992 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup, when he missed the crucial penalty kick in the penalty shootout against Argentina, resulting in his England side losing.

Matty James.name: Matty James
Matty James.intro: '''Matthew Lee "Matty" James''' (born 22 July 1991) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. His regular position is in midfieldermidfield, but he can play in defender (association football)defence when required. James began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, where his brother Reece JamesReece still plays, but left the club for a spell on loan at Preston North End F.C.Preston North End before joining Leicester on a permanent basis in 2012.

Alpay \u00d6zalan.name: Alpay Özalan
Alpay \u00d6zalan.intro:
'''Fehmi Alpay Özalan''', known as '''Alpay''', (born 29 May 1973) is a former Turkish Association footballfootballer, who is currently a member of the management committee of Siirtspor.
He played 87 internationals for Turkey national football teamTurkey, including at two European Championships and the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup, in which he was selected for the Team of the Tournament.
Alpay \u00d6zalan.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jamie Carragher.name: Jamie Carragher
Jamie Carragher.intro:
'''James Lee Duncan''' "'''Jamie'''" '''Carragher''' (; born 28 January 1978) is a retired English association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender for Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for 17 years. He is currently a pundit on Sky Sports alongside Gary Neville. A List of one-club menone-club man, he was Liverpool's captain (association football)vice-captain for 10 years, and is the club's second-longest ever serving player, making his 737th appearance for Liverpool in all competitions on 19 May 2013. Carragher also holds the record for the most appearances in European competition for Liverpool with 150.
Carragher started his footballing career at the Liverpool F.C. Reserves and AcademyLiverpool Academy, making his professional debut in the 1996–97 Liverpool F.C. season1996–97 season and becoming a first team regular the following season. Having initially played as a full-back, the arrival of manager Rafael Benítez in 2004 saw Carragher move to become a centre-back, where he remained. His honours with Liverpool include two FA Cups, three Football League CupLeague Cups, two FA Community ShieldCommunity Shields, one UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League, one UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup and two UEFA Super CupSuper Cups.
Internationally, Carragher held the national record for most caps at under-21 level and earned his senior debut in 1999. He represented England at the UEFA Euro 20042004 European Championship and the 2006 FIFA World Cup, before announcing his retirement from international football in 2007. He did, however, temporarily come out of retirement in order to represent England at the 2010 FIFA World Cup, before retiring again with 38 senior England caps.

Andy Roberts.name: Andy Roberts
Andy Roberts.intro:
Roberts began his career at Millwall F.C.Millwall in 1991. In 1995, he moved to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, where he was the club's Player of the Year in 1996. In 1998 he signed for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, where he stayed until 2002. He had a loan spell at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City in that year before returning to Millwall. He retired from playing in 2004, aged 30.
He was also capped five times by the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 team during the mid-1990s.

Andy Linighan.name: Andy Linighan
Andy Linighan.intro:
'''Andrew "Andy" Linighan''' (born 18 June 1962) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1980 until 2000, notably in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
He also played in the Football League for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Oxford United F.C.Oxford United before finishing his career with Non-league St Albans City F.C.St Albans City.

Hope Akpan.name: Hope Akpan
Hope Akpan.intro:
'''Hope Ini I. Akpan''' (born 14 August 1991) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Reading F.C.Reading as a midfielder.
Born in England, he represents Nigeria national football teamNigeria at international level.

John Wark.name: John Wark
John Wark.intro:
'''John Wark''' (born 4 August 1957) is a Scottish former association footballfootballer who spent most of his playing time with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He won a record four List of Ipswich Town F.C. Players of the YearPlayer of the Year awards before becoming one of the four inaugural members of the club's Ipswich Town F.C. Hall of FameHall of Fame. Wark had long spells at the club, which bookended his career, and a third, brief interlude dividing his briefer periods at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. A versatile player, Wark played most of his professional games as a midfielder, although he sometimes played as a central defender and on occasion as a forward (football)striker.
Born in Glasgow, Wark represented Scotland national football teamScotland in international football, winning 29 caps and scoring seven goals. This included selection for Scotland in the 1982 FIFA World Cup in which he made three appearances and scored twice.
During his playing career, Wark appeared in the film ''Escape to Victory''. Since retiring as a professional player in 1996, he has continued to work for Ipswich Town—since April 2009 in the corporate hospitality department. His autobiography, ''Wark On'', was published in 2009.

Charlie Hartfield.name: Charlie Hartfield
Charlie Hartfield.intro:
'''Charlie Hartfield''' (born 14 September 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.
He started out at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, turning professional in 1989, but never made a first-team appearance. He left Arsenal in 1990 for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and went on to play for Fulham F.C.Fulham (on loan), Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City (on loan), Telford United F.C.Telford United (on loan), Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town and Ilkeston Town F.C.Ilkeston Town.
During his playing career, Hartfield suffered from a gambling addiction, and in 2006 he still owed debts of "£40,000 or £50,000".cite web
url=
title='I borrowed £21,000 and lost it all in three weeks'
publisher=The Independent
date=12 April 2006  accessdate=5 May 2011
Charlie Hartfield most recently worked as a scout for Sheffield United.

Ryan Tunnicliffe.name: Ryan Tunnicliffe
Ryan Tunnicliffe.intro: '''Ryan Tunnicliffe''' (born 30 December 1992) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Fulham F.C.Fulham. Born in Heywood, Greater Manchester, he began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United but failed to break into the first team and joined Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town on loan before making a permanent move to Fulham in January 2014. He has also played internationally for England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16 and England national under-17 football teamunder-17 levels.

Matt Jones (footballer, born 1980).name: Matt Jones (footballer, born 1980)
Matt Jones (footballer, born 1980).intro: '''Matthew Jones''' (born 1 September 1980 in Llanelli, Wales) is a former Welsh international football player, who last played for Llanelli A.F.C.Llanelli in the Welsh Premier League. He has played centre-midfield for most of his career, though sometimes appeared at right back for Llanelli. He formerly played for Leeds United F.C.Leeds United and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He now attends the Bristol Institute of Modern Music.

Jay Rodriguez.name: Jay Rodriguez
Jay Rodriguez.intro: '''Jay Enrique Rodriguez''' (born 29 July 1989) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Southampton F.C.Southampton and the England national football teamEngland national team.

Kazuyuki Toda.name: Kazuyuki Toda
Kazuyuki Toda.intro:
'''Kazuyuki Toda''' () is a retired Japanese Association footballfootball player.
He played in 1997 FIFA World Youth Championship, Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics2000 Olympic football tournament and the 2002 FIFA World Cup for Japan national football teamJapan.
He played in the Premier League for Tottenham Hotspur in 2003, making 4 appearances.
He retired at the end of 2013, having played throughout the year with Singaporean club Warriors F.C.Warriors on a 1-year contract.
Kazuyuki Toda.position: Midfielder  association football  Defensive midfielder Defensive midfielder

C\u00e9sar Mart\u00edn.name: César Martín
C\u00e9sar Mart\u00edn.intro:
'''César Martín Villar''', simply '''César''' (born 3 April 1977), is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Over the course of 13 seasons he appeared in 200 La Liga games, namely in representation of Real OviedoOviedo and Deportivo de La CoruñaDeportivo, after which he had a six-month spell in England with Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton.
A Spanish national football teamSpanish international during five years, César appeared in UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004.
C\u00e9sar Mart\u00edn.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Bobby Bowry.name: Bobby Bowry
Bobby Bowry.intro:
'''Robert John "Bobby" Bowry''' (born 19 May 1971 in Croydon, England) is an English-born Saint Kitts and NevisKittian former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (football)midfielder from 1990 until 2008.
He notably played in the Premier League with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, and in the Football League with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Millwall F.C.Millwall and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. He finished his career in Non-league with Gravesend & Northfleet F.C.Gravesend & Northfleet and Bromley F.C.Bromley. Upon retiring he worked as a coach (sport)coach and is now a football agent.

Daniel Ayala.name: Daniel Ayala
Daniel Ayala.intro: '''Daniel Sánchez Ayala''' (born 7 November 1990) is a Spanish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough as a defender (association football)defender.

Gary Naysmith.name: Gary Naysmith
Gary Naysmith.intro: '''Gary Andrew Naysmith''' (born 16 November 1978) is a Scottish Association footballfootball player and manager, who is currently the player/manager of Scottish League Two club East Fife F.C.East Fife. Born in Edinburgh, and raised in Loanhead, Scotland, Naysmith started his senior career with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts before moving to England to sign with Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton, where he stayed for seven years. After spells with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Naysmith returned to Scotland with Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen. He was capped 46 times by the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.
Gary Naysmith.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Jos\u00e9 Ca\u00f1as.name: José Cañas
Jos\u00e9 Ca\u00f1as.intro:
'''José Alberto Cañas Ruiz-Herrera''' (born 27 May 1987) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for RCD Espanyol as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
He started his career with Real Betis, joining the first team in 2009 and going on to appear in 72 official games, 51 in La Liga, over the course of three seasons, and spent 2013–14 Premier League2013–14 in the Premier League with Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.

Stephen Pears.name: Stephen Pears
Stephen Pears.intro: '''Stephen Pears''' (born 22 January 1962) is an EnglandEnglish former association footballfootballer. Born in Brandon, County Durham, he played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Hartlepool United F.CHartlepool United in a career spanning 20 years.

Stuart Holden.name: Stuart Holden
Stuart Holden.intro:
'''Stuart Alistair Holden''' (born 1 August 1985) is a Scottish American professional football player who plays as a midfielder for English club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.
Holden has represented the United States at United States U-20 men's national soccer teamunder-20, United States U-20 men's national soccer teamunder-23 and United States men's national soccer teamsenior levels. He made his senior debut in July 2009 against Grenada national football teamGrenada and scored his first goal during that game. He was part of the United States squad at the 2008 Summer Olympics, 2009 CONCACAF Gold Cup2009 and 2013 CONCACAF Gold Cup and 2010 FIFA World Cup. Since his debut, Holden has gained 25 Cap (sport)caps and scored three goals.

Andr\u00e9 Ooijer.name: André Ooijer
Andr\u00e9 Ooijer.intro:
'''André Antonius Maria Ooijer''' (; born 11 July 1974) is a Dutch former association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender. He played his last professional game for AFC AjaxAjax against Vitesse on 6 May 2012.
In an international career lasting over a decade, he earned 55 caps. He was selected for Euro 2008 and three World Cups, helping the Dutch reach the final of the 2010 edition.
Andr\u00e9 Ooijer.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Zak Whitbread.name: Zak Whitbread
Zak Whitbread.intro: '''Zak Benjamin Whitbread''' (born March 4, 1984) is an American-English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County as a Defender (association football)defender.
Zak Whitbread.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Hendry Thomas.name: Hendry Thomas
Hendry Thomas.intro:
'''Hendry Bernardo Thomas Suazo''' (born 23 February 1985) also known as ''Buchuca'', is a Honduran association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
Thomas has been described as displaying a "rugged approach driven by his ample physical gifts and his significant work rate and supplemented with enough technical ability to excel in his preferred holding midfield role."

David Di Michele.name: David Di Michele
David Di Michele.intro:
'''David Di Michele''' (born 6 January 1976 in Guidonia Montecelio, Italy) is an Italian association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Reggina CalcioReggina.
He played six matches for the Italy national football team from 2005 to 2006.

Paul Gascoigne.name: Paul Gascoigne
Paul Gascoigne.intro:
'''Paul John Gascoigne''' (born 27 May 1967) is a former England national football teamEngland international association footballfootballer and football manager. He is also known by his nickname, '''Gazza'''. He earned 57 cap (sport)caps during his England career and has been described by the National Football Museum as "the most naturally gifted English midfielder of his generation".
Born and raised in Gateshead, the midfielder signed schoolboy terms with his local team Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, before turning professional at the club in 1985. Three years later he was sold on to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur for a £2 million fee. He won the FA Cup with Spurs in 1991 FA Cup Final1991, before he was sold to Italian club S.S. LazioLazio for £8.5 million the following year. In July 1995, he was transferred to Rangers F.C.Rangers for £4.3 million, and helped the club to two league titles and two trophies. He returned to England in a £3.4 million move to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in March 1998. He made his debut in the Premier League in the 1998–99 season, having already featured in the 1998 Football League Cup Final. He switched to Everton F.C.Everton in July 2000, and later had spells with Burnley F.C.Burnley, Gansu Tianma F.C.Gansu Tianma (China), and Boston United F.C.Boston United.
Though well known throughout Europe for his club career, his football career is particularly remembered for his England caps. He also won 12 caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s and four caps for the England B national football teamEngland B team. He was part of the England squad that reached fourth place in the 1990 FIFA World Cup, and was famously reduced to tears after receiving a yellow card in the semi-final with Germany national football teamWest Germany, which meant he would be suspended for the final itself had England won the game. He also helped the team to the semi-finals of UEFA Euro 1996, and again embedded himself in the national consciousness with a spectacular goal against Scotland national football teamScotland that was coupled with a memorable goal celebration.
After retiring from professional football, his life became dominated by his mental and emotional problems, particularly his alcoholism. His personal struggles have received regular coverage in the British press, especially since leaving professional football. He has attempted to live without alcohol on numerous occasions, though rehabilitation programmes have provided only temporary relief. His problems ended his coaching career, and he has not worked since being fired as the manager of Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town in 2005.

Ken Monkou.name: Ken Monkou
Ken Monkou.intro:
'''Kenneth John "Ken" Monkou''' (born 29 November 1964 in Nickerie DistrictNickerie in Suriname) is a retired NetherlandsDutch Association footballfootballer who played in a defensive role.
Born in Suriname but raised in the Netherlands, Monkou's first major side was Feyenoord Rotterdam. He moved to England in May 1989 to sign for newly promoted to the First Division Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for £100,000. He was their first player from outside the Commonwealth of Nations since Petar Borota in 1982. He made an impressive start for his new side, being voted club player of the year in his first season – the first black player to do so for Chelsea – as the team finished 5th in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division and won the Full Members Cup. He remained with Chelsea until 1992, when he was sold to Southampton F.C.Southampton for £750,000 just 3 months after signing a new 5-year contract with Chelsea.
Monkou's time with Southampton saw regular battles for Premier League survival, though the club were never actually relegated. In the FA Premier League 1993-941993–94 season he scored a last minute winner in a 5–4 defeat of Norwich City F.C.Norwich City from a Matt Le Tissier corner which helped the club to stay in the Premier League. He stayed on the South Coast until 1999, when he joined Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town on a free transfer, scoring once against Yorkshire rivals Barnsley.cite web
url=
title=Barnstorming
publisher=The Guardian
date=25 September 1999 accessdate=16 February 2010 However, disagreements with Huddersfield manager Steve Bruce ensured his time with the club was short-lived. Monkou made a return to Chelsea during the 2002–2003 season, before finally retiring from the game
After his playing career, Monkou ran a pancake house in the Dutch city of Delft (2009), and is actively involved in Dutch media as well as making appearances on Chelsea TV.
Monkou's cousin is Arsenio Halfhuid who currently plays in the Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and Academy teams.

Mikele Leigertwood.name: Mikele Leigertwood
Mikele Leigertwood.intro: '''Mikele Benjamin Leigertwood''' (born 12 November 1982) is an English-born Antiguan Association footballfootballer who currently is a Free Agent after being released by Reading F.C.Reading. He also plays for the Antigua and Barbuda national football team.

Andrew Barrowman.name: Andrew Barrowman
Andrew Barrowman.intro: '''Andrew "Andy" Barrowman''' (born 27 November 1984) is a Scottish peopleScottish professional association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic.

Michael Bradley.name: Michael Bradley
Michael Bradley.intro: '''Michael Sheehan Bradley''' (born July 31, 1987) is an American Association footballsoccer player who currently plays for and captains Toronto FC in Major League Soccer. Bradley also plays for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team.

Mike Whitlow.name: Mike Whitlow
Mike Whitlow.intro:
'''Michael William "Mike" Whitlow''' (born 13 January 1968 in Northwich, Cheshire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and Head Coach of Youth at Football League Two side Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1987 to 2007. He notably played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, and in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, and in the Football League for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Notts County F.C.Notts County

Valon Behrami.name: Valon Behrami
Valon Behrami.intro:
'''Valon Behrami''' (born 19 April 1985) is a Swiss professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Hamburger SVHamburg in the Bundesliga. His previous clubs include Stabio, FC ChiassoChiasso, FC LuganoLugano, Genoa C.F.C.Genoa, Hellas Verona F.C.Verona, S.S. LazioLazio, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, ACF FiorentinaFiorentina, and S.S.C. NapoliNapoli.

'''James McArthur''' (born 7 October 1987) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder for Premier League club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and the Scotland national football team.

He made over 190 appearances for Hamilton before joining Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in July 2010. McArthur helped Wigan win the FA Cup in 2013 FA Cup Final2013. He was transferred to Crystal Palace in the summer of 2014.

Cramb also had spells with Southampton F.C.Southampton, Falkirk F.C.Falkirk, Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Bury F.C.Bury, Fortuna Sittard, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Stenhousemuir F.C.Stenhousemuir and East Stirlingshire F.C.East Stirlingshire. Neil Moore.name: Neil Moore
Neil Moore.intro:
'''Neil Moore''' (born 21 September 1972 in Liverpool) is an EnglandEnglish professional football defender who is currently playing for Solihull Moors.
Moore joined Nuneaton Borough A.F.C.Nuneaton Borough in July 2003 following his release from Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town. He started his career at Everton and had loan spells with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City before moving to Burnley F.C.Burnley, and Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town.
In 2000, he moved into non-league with Telford United F.C.Telford United. Moore spent two seasons at Bucks Head, where he was the subject of a £40,000 bid from Chester City F.C.Chester City. Upon the completion of his contract with Telford, he signed for Division Two side Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, where he was captain until the appointment of Keith Curle as manager. He scored his first and only goal for Mansfield in the Football League CupLeague Cup against Derby County.cite web
url=
title=Mansfield 1-3 Derby
publisher=BBC
date=9 September 2002 accessdate=4 February 2014 He spent time on loan at Southport F.C.Southport before being released and joining Nuneaton Borough A.F.C.Nuneaton Borough, for whom he was skipper for three seasons. Despite being replaced as team captain by Tom Curtis at the start of the 2007–08 campaign, Moore remained a prominent first-team member, and when Curtis left at the end of the season, Moore was given the captaincy again for the 2008–09 season, following Nuneaton's two-league demotion. However, Moore was released by manager Kevin Wilkin in October 2008, so that Wilkin could free up money to buy attackers.
He was a member of the first group of legends ever inducted into the inaugural hall of fame when it began in 2009.

'''James Charles "Jamie" Mackie''' (born 22 September 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Reading F.C.Reading on loan from Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. Born in Dorking, England, Mackie has played for Scotland national football teamScotland, his eligibility gained from his grandfather who was born in Kilmarnock.
He began his career at Wimbledon F.CWimbledon, progressing through the club's youth system making his first team debut in December 2003. A squad member when the club was Relocation of Wimbledon F.C. to Milton Keynesrenamed and moved to Milton Keynes, he made few of appearances before joining Football ConferenceConference side Exeter City F.C.Exeter City. He spent time on loan with Sutton United F.C.Sutton United in 2005 and returned to establish himself as a first team regular, his performance during the 2007–08 season attracting interest from other clubs and he signed for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in the January transfer window, scoring twice on his debut in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship. He appeared regularly for the club over the next two years and finished as the club's top goalscorer in the 2009–10 season. He joined Queens Park Rangers in May 2010, signing a four year contract for an undisclosed fee. In 2013 he joined Nottingham Forest before signing, on loan for Reading in 2014.

John Ruddy.name: John Ruddy
John Ruddy.intro:
'''John Thomas Gordon Ruddy''' (born 24 October 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. While being a good and reliable shot-stopper, he also has a reputation for being a dominant keeper, commanding his box on crosses and set pieces.
Ruddy began his career at Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, before signing for Everton F.C.Everton as a 19-year-old. He spent five years with Everton, but made just one appearance, while playing on loan at nine different clubs. Ruddy was signed by Paul Lambert to play for Norwich in 2010 and, 2010-11 in English footballin his first season, was part of the team that finished second in Football League ChampionshipThe Championship, gaining promotion to the Premier League. The following year, Norwich finished twelfth in the Premier League, and Ruddy was selected by new England manager Roy Hodgson for the squad for UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012. However, on 25 May 2012, he was ruled out after breaking his finger during training. He made his debut in a 2–1 win against Italy national football teamItaly in August 2012. He suffered a long term thigh injury in November 2012, but returned to help Norwich to an 11th place finish at the end of the 2012-2013 premier league season.

Tom Huddlestone.name: Tom Huddlestone
Tom Huddlestone.intro:
'''Thomas Andrew''' "'''Tom'''" '''Huddlestone''' (born 28 December 1986) is an English peopleEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the England national football teamEngland national team.
Having progressed through the youth ranks at Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Derby County F.C.Derby County, Huddlestone began his professional career in 2003 with the latter club. He quickly broke into the first team, and made 95 league appearances before switching to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 2005. Having spent some of the 2005–06 season on loan to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, where he made 14 league appearances, he began to break into the Tottenham team during the 2006–07 season, and became a regular player for the club. However, he struggled with injury problems during the 2011–12 season, and fell out of favour. He joined current club Hull City in August 2013, having made 143 league appearances for Tottenham.
Huddlestone represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 levels before making his England national under-21 football teamunder-21 debut in 2005. He was a regular for the under-21 side between 2005 and 2009, and made 32 appearances. He made his full England debut in 2009, and has since gone on to make three further appearances.

He spent numerous seasons in the Premier League and remained with the club through several relegations, followed by several promotions. He also appeared for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in a loan spell and after leaving City in 2002 he moved on to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. During his professional career he played in France, Portugal, England, Italy and Spain, representing a host of clubs.
Yebda appeared for France national youth football teamFrance at youth level, but opted to play for Algeria national football teamAlgeria as a senior in August 2009, taking advantage of FIFA’s new ruling which allowed him to change his national allegiance despite being older than 21 years of age. He represented the latter national team in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations.

Abou Diaby.name: Abou Diaby
Abou Diaby.intro:
'''Vassiriki Abou Diaby''' (; born 11 May 1986), known as '''Abou Diaby''', is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the France national football teamFrance national team. He plays primarily in a Midfielder#"Box-to-box" midfielderbox to box role, as he is adept in both Attacking midfielderattacking and Defensive midfielderdefending, and is described as a player who is "languid, elusive, and athletic" that can either "dribble past opponents or slip passes to team-mates". Of Côte d'IvoireIvorian descent, Diaby also possesses "superb touch" and "excellent close control", however on the negative front, he often struggles with repetitive injuries, a problem that has existed since his time in France.   His physical appearance and positional preference have evoked comparisons to Arsenal legend and compatriot Patrick Vieira.
Diaby was born in the 10th arrondissement of Paris, but was raised in the Parisian Communes of Francecommune of Aubervilliers. He began his football career playing for hometown club CM Aubervilliers. In 1998, he joined FC Red Star Saint-OuenRed Star Paris. A year later, Diaby was selected to attend the Clairefontaine academy. He spent four years at the academy while simultaneously training with Red Star. A year before departing Clairefontaine, Diaby moved to professional club Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain. Following an administrative error by club officials which made Diaby a Bosman transferfree agent, he joined the academy of AJ AuxerreAuxerre. He spent two years in the club's youth academy before making his professional debut in the 2004–05 Ligue 12004–05 season. Diaby also played in the UEFA Cup with the club. After spending the Autumn portion of the 2005–06 Ligue 12005–06 season with Auxerre, in January 2006, Diaby signed with English club Arsenal on a long-term contract for an undisclosed fee. He made his debut with the club that same month and scored his first goal three months later against Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. Diaby suffered a severe ankle fracture five months after joining Arsenal, and has since struggled with numerous injuries.
Diaby is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international having earned caps at France national under-19 football teamunder-19 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. Prior to playing for the France national football teamsenior team, he played on the under-19 team that won the 2005 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship. Diaby made his senior international debut in March 2007 in a UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying match against Lithuania national football teamLithuania. He has represented France at one major international tournament; the 2010 FIFA World Cup. Diaby participated in all three group stage matches the team played as a starter.

He joined Burnley in 2011.

Mark Hughes.name: Mark Hughes
Mark Hughes.intro:
'''Leslie Mark Hughes''', Order of the British EmpireOBE (born 1 November 1963), is a Welsh former association footballfootballer and current Manager (association football)manager of Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
During his playing career he was most noted for two spells at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but he also played for FC BarcelonaBarcelona and FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich, as well as the English clubs Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Everton F.C.Everton and finally Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He also made 72 appearances and scored 16 goals for Wales national football teamWales. He retired from playing in 2002.
He won a host of medals during his playing career, including two Premier League title medals, four FA Cups, three Football League CupLeague Cups and two European Cup Winners' Cups. He also collected an FA Cup runners-up medal and a League Cup runners-up medal. Hughes was the first player to win the PFA Players' Player of the Year award twice, in 1989 and 1991.
His reign as Wales manager was his first managerial post; he was appointed in 1999 and remained in the role until 2004. He failed to qualify for a FIFA World CupWorld Cup or European Football ChampionshipsEuropean Championship during his five years in charge, although his reign coincided with a marked improvement in results; he came particularly close to securing UEFA Euro 2004European Championship qualification in 2004. Hughes then spent four years in charge of Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers guiding them to 6th place in 2005–06 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season2005–06. He took charge of Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in June 2008 for a year and a half before spending the 2010–11 Fulham F.C. season2010–11 season at Fulham F.C.Fulham.
He joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in January 2012 helping then retain their Premier League status in 2011–12 Queens Park Rangers F.C. season2011–12. Despite some high profile signings in the summer of 2012 Rangers began the 2012–13 Queens Park Rangers F.C. season2012–13 season in very poor form and Hughes was sacked on 23 November 2012. Hughes was then appointed manager of Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on 30 May 2013.

Allan Johnston.name: Allan Johnston

'''Allan "Magic" Johnston''' (born 14 December 1973) is a ScotlandScottish Scotland national football teaminternational professional Association footballfootball player and Manager (association football)manager.
He started his professional playing career with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian and then followed on to French club Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes before a spell in English football with Sunderland F.C.Sunderland before returning to Scotland with Rangers F.C.Rangers. He played for the Scotland national football team at senior and u-21 level.
He started his managerial career in 2012, as player-manager of Queen of the South F.C.Queen of the South. He won the Scottish Football League Second DivisionSecond Division championship in his first season as a manager, then moved to Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock. He left that position after 18 months, after a dispute with the club's board about the sale of a player.

Steven Taylor.name: Steven Taylor
Steven Taylor.intro: '''Steven Vincent Taylor''' (born 23 January 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. Predominantly a Defender (association football)central defender, he can also play at right back or, on rare occasions, at left back.

Alan Moore.name: Alan Moore
Alan Moore.intro: '''Alan Moore''', born November 25, 1974 in Dublin, Republic of Ireland is a retired Irish footballer.

Paul Rogers.name: Paul Rogers
Paul Rogers.intro:
''For people of a similar name see Paul Rogers (disambiguation)Paul Rogers''
''For the English footballer born 1989 see Paul Rodgers (footballer)''
'''Paul Anthony Rogers''' (born 21 March 1965 in Portsmouth) is a retired EnglandEnglish footballer who played as a midfielder.
He started his career at Non-League footballnon-league club Sutton United F.C.Sutton United,[
In January 1992, he joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, who were in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division at the time, for a fee of £35,000. He made over 120 league appearances for the club before moving to Notts County F.C.Notts County in 1995. However, he soon moved again to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in 1997 following a successful loan spell. He made 100 league appearances for the club, and scored the winning goal for Wigan in the final of the Football League TrophyAssociate Members Cup in 1999.
Rogers went on play at Brighton and Hove Albion F.C.Brighton for four years before announcing his retirement from professional football in 2003. He joined Isthmian League side Worthing F.C.Worthing as a player-coach, where he stayed until finally bringing an end to his playing career in 2008.
In 2009, he joined Burgess Hill Town F.C.Burgess Hill Town as a club coach.
He is currently Brighton's head of commercial services.

Andy Marriott.name: Andy Marriott
Andy Marriott.intro: '''Andrew Marriott''' (born 11 October 1970) is an English-born WalesWelsh professional association footballfootballer, who played as a goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper. He is a Journeyman (football)journeyman player, having represented a large number of different clubs, and has also played for the Wales national football teamWelsh national team.

Eric Djemba-Djemba.name: Eric Djemba-Djemba
Eric Djemba-Djemba.intro: '''Eric Daniel Djemba-Djemba''' (born 4 May 1981) is a Cameroonian Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Persebaya Surabaya. He has previously played club football in France, England, Qatar, Denmark, Israel, Scotland and Serbia. In international competition, he represented Cameroon national football teamCameroon, having appeared for his country 24 times, including at the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

Tony Grant (English footballer).name: Tony Grant (English footballer)
Tony Grant (English footballer).intro:
'''Anthony James "Tony" Grant''' (born 14 November 1975, Liverpool, England) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and first team coach at Championship side Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1993 until 2008, notably spending time in the Premier League with Everton F.C.Everton and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He also played in the Football League for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley and Chester City F.C.Chester City. He was capped once by England U21 in his career.

Junior Hoilett.name: Junior Hoilett
Junior Hoilett.intro: '''David Wayne "Junior" Hoilett''' (born 5 June 1990) is a CanadaCanadian Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Aaron Cresswell.name: Aaron Cresswell
Aaron Cresswell.intro: '''Aaron William Cresswell''' (born 15 December 1989) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a defender (association football)defender. He made his professional debut for Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers in 2008 and went on to make 70 league appearances for the club before signing for Ipswich in 2011, following a tribunal to agree the value of the transfer. He made 138 appearances for Ipswich scoring six goals before joining West Ham United in July 2014.

Alexis S\u00e1nchez.name: Alexis Sánchez
Alexis S\u00e1nchez.intro:
'''Alexis Alejandro Sánchez Sánchez''' (; born 19 December 1988) is a Chilean Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the Chile national football teamChilean national team as a Forward (association football)forward.
After his debut season of first-team football with Cobreloa, Sánchez was signed by Italy's Udinese Calcio in 2006. After successful loans at Colo-Colo and CA River PlateRiver Plate, he began playing in Serie A. In 2011, he was signed by FC BarcelonaBarcelona for £25 million, becoming the most expensive transfer in Chilean football history. Sánchez signed for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in July 2014 for a fee reported to be around £30–35 million, making him the second-most expensive signing in the club's history after Mesut Özil.
Sánchez has been a full international for Chile since 2006. He has earned over 75 caps and played in two FIFA World Cups (2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014) as well as the 2011 Copa América.

Mark Draper.name: Mark Draper
Mark Draper.intro:
'''Mark Draper''' (born 11 November 1970 in Long Eaton, Derbyshire) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and Kit Man of Football League One side Notts County F.C.Notts County.
As a player he was a midfielder from 1988 to 2003, notably in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Southampton F.C.Southampton. He also played in Spain for Rayo Vallecano and in the Football League with Notts County F.C.Notts County. He represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. In 2009 he briefly came out of retirement for Non-league side Dunkirk F.C.Dunkirk.

John Lukic.name: John Lukic
John Lukic.intro:
'''Jovan "John" Lukic''' (Serbian languageSerbian: Јован "Џон" Лукић, ''Jovan "Džon" Lukić'') (born 11 December 1960) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer of Serbian descent who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1978 to 2001.
He played his entire career for both Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, having two spells with each club, making a total of 668 league appearances and played at the highest level of English football in four separate decades. He was capped by both the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 and England B national football teamEngland B sides.

Liam Bridcutt.name: Liam Bridcutt
Liam Bridcutt.intro: '''Liam Robert Bridcutt''' (born 8 May 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.

Gabriel Paletta.name: Gabriel Paletta
Gabriel Paletta.intro:
'''Gabriel Alejandro Paletta''' (born 15 February 1986) is an Italian Argentine central defender who currently plays for A.C. MilanMilan in Italy's Serie A and the Italy national football teamItaly national team. Paletta is primarily known for his aerial ability and for being an attentive man-marker.
Born in Argentina to parents of ItalyItalian descent, Paletta represented his birth nation at the Argentina national under-20 football teamunder-20 level, participating in the 2005 FIFA World Youth Championship in the Netherlands. He started all seven matches as Argentina won the title. In 2014, Paletta was called up to the Italy national football teamItalian national team and made his debut in a friendly against Spain.
Gabriel Paletta.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mark Cullen.name: Mark Cullen
Mark Cullen.intro: '''Mark Cullen''' (born 21 April 1992) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town.

Christian Karembeu.name: Christian Karembeu
Christian Karembeu.intro: '''Christian Karembeu''' (; born 3 December 1970 in Lifou, New Caledonia) is a retired List of France international footballersFrench international footballer and the current Strategic Advisor of Olympiacos F.C.. He is also part of a Paris-based consortium to expand the A-League with a Pacific Island team.

Roberto Soldado.name: Roberto Soldado
Roberto Soldado.intro:
'''Roberto Soldado Rillo''' (; born 27 May 1985) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
After emerging through Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid's youth system, he went on to appear in only 27 official games for the first team (four goals). Over the course of nine La Liga seasons he amassed totals of 207 matches and 101 goals, representing also CA OsasunaOsasuna, Getafe CFGetafe and Valencia CFValencia.
An international since 2007, Soldado represented Spain national football teamSpain at the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup2013 Confederations Cup.

Mikael Mandron.name: Mikael Mandron
Mikael Mandron.intro: '''Mikael Yann Mathieu Mandron''' (born 11 October 1994) is a FranceFrench born association footballfootballer who qualifies to play for Scotland national football teamScotland through a grandparent. He currently plays for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town on loan from Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He usually plays as Forward (association football)forward.

Callum Davidson.name: Callum Davidson
Callum Davidson.intro:
'''Callum Iain Davidson''' (born 25 June 1976 in Stirling, Scotland) is a Scottish former professional association footballfootballer who played for St Johnstone F.C.St Johnstone, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Preston North End F.C.Preston North End. He began his career at St Johnstone in 1994, retiring there in 2014.
At international level, Davidson represented Scotland national football teamScotland on 19 occasions between 1998 and 2009.

Edgar Davids.name: Edgar Davids
Edgar Davids.intro:
'''Edgar Steven Davids''' (; born 13 March 1973) is a Surinamese-born NetherlandsDutch former professional footballer. After beginning his career with AFC AjaxAjax, he subsequently played in Italy for A.C. MilanMilan and Juventus F.C.Juventus before a loan spell with FC BarcelonaBarcelona. He went on to play for F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur before returning to Ajax. Having struggled with injuries for two years, Davids returned to competitive football during a brief spell with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace before retiring at the age of 37. In 2012, he was appointed player-manager at English Football League TwoLeague Two club Barnet. He resigned by mutual agreement as manager in January 2014. He was Cap (sport)capped 74 times by the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands at international level, scoring six goals, and represented his country at the FIFA World Cup (once) and the UEFA European Football Championship (three times).
Davids was known for standing out on the football field for his Dreadlocksdreadlocked hair and the protective goggles he wore due to glaucoma. A combative, energetic, and creative midfielder, Davids was nicknamed "the Pitbull" by Louis van Gaal because of his Marking (association football)marking ability and his aggressive tackling. Throughout his career, Davids was renowned for his outstanding technique and ball skills, as well as his passing ability and vision. He was also known for his pace, strength, power, stamina, tactical intelligence, versatility and tenacity, as well as his ability to read the game, which, along with his technical ability, allowed him to be deployed in several midfield positions, including as a left midfielder, or as a central, box-to-box, or defensive midielder. He was one of the players chosen by Pelé to feature in the FIFA 100, his list of the world's greatest living footballers. His cousin Lorenzo DavidsLorenzo is also a footballer.

Kevin Sharp.name: Kevin Sharp
Kevin Sharp.intro: '''Kevin Philip Sharp''' (born September 19, 1974 in Sarnia, Ontario) is a CanadaCanadian-born English former Association footballfootballer.

Joleon Lescott.name: Joleon Lescott
Joleon Lescott.intro:
'''Joleon Patrick Lescott''' (born 16 August 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre-back, though he has played in various other positions across the defensive line, including Defender (association football)#Left backleft-back.
Born in Birmingham, Lescott is a graduate of the Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers youth academy. He made his first team debut with Wolves in 2000 and he was named the supporters' Young Player of the Year two years running. He was a regular player as the club won promotion to Premier League in 2003, but missed the whole season through injury and they were relegated. He was named in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship team of the year for the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 season, and subsequently moved to Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton for a total of £5 million in August 2006. He was voted player's Player of the Season by his teammates in the following two seasons. Lescott moved to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in August 2009 for a reported £22 million, and spent five seasons at the club, winning two league titles, an FA Cup and a Football League CupLeague Cup. After his release in 2014 he joined West Bromwich Albion on a free transfer.
Internationally, Lescott represented England national football teamEngland at various youth levels before making his first team debut in 2007 against Estonia national football teamEstonia in the UEFA Euro 2008 qualifyingEuro 2008 qualifiers. He represented the country at Euro 2012.

Neil McDonald.name: Neil McDonald
Neil McDonald.intro:
'''Neil Raymond McDonald''' (born on 2 November 1965 in Wallsend, North Tyneside) is a former association footballfootball player, in the right back and midfield positions, before becoming a coach/manager.
During his career he played for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under 21 team.  As a manager he has been in charge at Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Östersunds FK. On 18 December 2008 he was appointed Assistant Manager of Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, and was sacked on 13 December 2010 along with manager Sam Allardyce. On 1 June 2011, Allardyce announced McDonald as his assistant manager at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.

Adrian Mariappa.name: Adrian Mariappa
Adrian Mariappa.intro: '''Adrian Joseph Mariappa''' (born 3 October 1986) is an English-born Jamaican professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He progressed through Watford's youth academy, and started playing for the first team in the 2005–06 Watford F.C. season2005–06 season. Although primarily a centre back, he spent some of his early professional career at right back due to competition for places in the middle. He made 247 first team appearances for Watford, including 19 in the Premier League. This included a run of 113 consecutive league appearances, the fourth longest streak in Watford's history. Mariappa captained Watford at under-18, reserve and first-team levels, and was the club's vice captain in his final few years at Vicarage Road. Mariappa accepted his first call up to Jamaica national football teamJamaica's international team in May 2012. He won his first cap against Guyana national football teamGuyana later that month, and transferred to Premier League side Reading F.C.Reading in July 2012. He made 29 league appearances for the club before joining Premier League side Crystal Palace in September 2013, following Reading's relegation to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship.

Ulises de la Cruz.name: Ulises de la Cruz
Ulises de la Cruz.intro:
'''Ulises Hernán de la Cruz Bernardo''' (born 8 February 1974 in Piquiucho) is a retired Ecuadorian association footballfootballer, who since 2013 has been a member of his country's National Assembly for the governing PAIS Alliance.
He played 101 times for the Ecuador national football team between 1995 and 2010, and was selected for two FIFA World Cup tournaments. He spent his club career at Sociedad Deportivo QuitoDeportivo Quito, Barcelona Sporting ClubBarcelona S.C., Sociedad Deportiva AucasAucas, Cruzeiro Esporte ClubeCruzeiro, Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Reading F.C.Reading and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City.
De la Cruz has set up a charity, Friends of FundeCruz, in his home village to fund a number of projects serving the local community.

Simon Davies (footballer, born 1974).name: Simon Davies (footballer, born 1974)
Simon Davies (footballer, born 1974).intro: '''Simon Ithel Davies''' (born 23 April 1974) is a former international Welsh association footballfootballer who has managerial experience in The Football League with Chester City F.C.Chester City. He is currently employed as the assistant manager for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City's under-21s Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academyreserve team, under Patrick Vieira.

Jimmy Smith (footballer, born 1987).name: Jimmy Smith (footballer, born 1987)
Jimmy Smith (footballer, born 1987).intro:
'''James Dean "Jimmy" Smith''' (born 7 January 1987) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town.
Smith began his career at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea at the age of nine, progressing through the youth ranks before signing professional terms with the club in 2005. After featuring regularly for Chelsea's reserve side during the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 season, Smith made his first-team debut in May 2006. It turned out to be his only appearance for the club.
