The following season, he joined Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers on a season-long loan agreement, before spending three months on loan at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City towards the latter months of 2007. Smith was loaned out once again ahead of the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 campaign, spending the first half of the season with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He returned to Chelsea in January 2009, only to join League One side Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient on a loan deal for the remainder of the season. Smith signed for Orient on a permanent basis in July 2009, signing a two-year contract. He spent four seasons with the club, making over 180 appearances in all competitions. He was released by Orient in April 2013, and signed for Stevenage ahead of the 2013–14 in English football2013–14 season. Smith has also represented England national football teamEngland at various youth levels. Smith signed for League One side Crawley Town in May 2014 for an undisclosed fee.

Paul Lake.name: Paul Lake
Paul Lake.intro:
'''Paul Andrew Lake''' (born 28 October 1968) is an English peopleEnglish former Association footballfootballer who played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 and England national football B teamB team level. His brother Mike Lake (footballer)Michael is also a former professional footballer.
He had an excellent early career with Manchester City, winning the FA Youth Cup in 1986 and helping the club to win promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in 1988–89. However a ruptured Anterior cruciate ligament in September 1990 would lead to several seasons struggling with knee injuries, and he would only play four further games from that point before announcing his retirement in January 1996. Despite his career effectively ending at the age of 21 he was later inducted into the Manchester City Hall of Fame, and was seen as a player who would have been a key first team player for many years had it not been for his injury problems. He went on to spend ten years as a physiotherapist in the game, before he began working in various ambassadorial roles.

Trond Egil Soltvedt.name: Trond Egil Soltvedt
Trond Egil Soltvedt.intro: '''Trond Egil Soltvedt''' (born 15 February 1967) is a NorwayNorwegian former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. After playing for Viking FKViking, SK BrannBrann and Rosenborg BKRosenborg in Norway, he played in England with Coventry CityCoventry, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Sheffield Wednesday before he retired. Soltvedt was capped twice playing for Norway national football teamNorway.

Erik Meijer.name: Erik Meijer
Erik Meijer.intro:
'''Erik Meijer''' (born 2 August 1969 in Meerssen, Limburg (Netherlands)Limburg) is a retired Dutch peopleDutch Association footballfootballer. Standing at , he was known as a header specialist.
He last worked as director of sports for Alemannia Aachen.

Carl Cort.name: Carl Cort
Carl Cort.intro:
'''Carl Edward Richard Cort''' (born 1 November 1977 in Southwark) is an Guyanese Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward for Tampa Bay Rowdies in the North American Soccer League.
He has previously played for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, UD Marbella and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

Vincent Kompany.name: Vincent Kompany
Vincent Kompany.intro:
'''Vincent Jean Mpoy Kompany''' (; born 10 April 1986) is a Belgian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for and Captain (association football)captains both English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team. He is capable of playing at centre back and midfielderdefensive midfield. In the 2011–12 Manchester City F.C. season2011–12 season he was awarded the Captain (association football)captaincy of Manchester City, leading his club to win the Premier League that season, their first league title in 44 years. He is also chairman of Belgium D3B Division club BX Brussels, as well as owner-operator of two Belgian Sports Bars named Good Kompany.
Kompany began his professional career at R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht, spending three years at the Belgian club before moving to GermanyGerman Bundesliga club Hamburger SVHamburg in 2006. In the summer of 2008, at the age of 22, he completed a transfer to his current club, Premier League side Manchester City. He has since established himself as an integral part of the Manchester City squad and is one of the bargain buys of the revolutionised City era, blossoming into one of the Premier LeaguePremier League's best centre backs. Kompany was included in the PFA Team of the YearPremier League Team of the Year for two years in a row in 2011 and 2012 as well as being included in the 2014 team, and won the Premier League Player of the Season in 2012. He was listed 23rd in ''The 100 best footballers in the world'' by The Guardian. Kompany has been described as one of the best defenders in world football, and is known to be a physically strong centreback, with excellent aerial ability, and mobility, as well as good technique and distribution. He is also a very accurate tackler and excels at anticipating his opponents.
Vincent Kompany.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Tore Pedersen.name: Tore Pedersen
Tore Pedersen.intro: '''Tore Pedersen'''  (born 29 September 1969 in Fredrikstad, Østfold, Norway) is a retired NorwayNorwegian international football defender, who played abroad for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, FC St. PauliSt. Pauli, Oldham Athletic, IFK Göteborg, Sanfrecce Hiroshima, Eintracht Frankfurt and Blackburn Rovers.

Garath McCleary.name: Garath McCleary
Garath McCleary.intro: '''Garath James McCleary''' (born 15 May 1987) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Reading F.C.Reading as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Darren Caskey.name: Darren Caskey
Darren Caskey.intro:
'''Darren Mark Caskey''' (born 21 August 1974 in Basildon) is an English former Association footballfootballer. He is currently assistant manager at Conference Premier side Gateshead F.C.Gateshead.
A central midfielder, Caskey started his career as a trainee at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, but failed to live up to early potential. He went on to have notable spells at Reading F.C.Reading and Notts County F.C.Notts County.
He captained the England side which won the 1993 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship, scoring the winning penalty in the one-nil victory against Turkey in the final.
Prior to joining Gateshead F.C.Gateshead, Caskey played in the Northern Premier League First Division South for Ilkeston F.C.Ilkeston, he was also assistant manager alongside Kevin Wilson (footballer born 1961)Kevin Wilson.
His son Jake Forster-CaskeyJake plays for Brighton & Hove Albion.
In 2014, Caskey was given the squad number 20 at Gateshead. Caskey made a substitute appearance for Gateshead in a pre-season friendly against Billingham Synthonia F.C.Billingham Synthonia on 12 July 2014, scoring the second goal from a penalty in a 2–0 win.

Phil Bardsley.name: Phil Bardsley
Phil Bardsley.intro:
'''Phillip Anthony "Phil" Bardsley''' (born 28 June 1985) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Scotland national football teamScotland national team. Although born in England, Bardsley qualifies for Scotland through his Glasgow-born father.[
Bardsley began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United where he made 18 appearances in five seasons at the club. During that time, he was loaned to several clubs, including Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United.
He joined Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in January 2008 for an initial fee of £850,000. Bardsley established himself as a regular at the Stadium of Light under Steve Bruce and Martin O'Neill and he won the player of the year award in 2010–11 Sunderland A.F.C. season2010–11. He lost his place in the team in 2012–13 Sunderland A.F.C. season2012–13 after a falling-out with manager Paolo Di Canio, before returning to the first team under Gus Poyet. Under Poyet, Bardsley helped Sunderland to avoid relegation in 2013–14 Sunderland A.F.C. season2013–14 and reach the 2014 Football League Cup Final, in which they lost 3–1 to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
After his Sunderland contract expired in June 2014, Bardsley joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on a free transfer.

Paul Furlong.name: Paul Furlong
Paul Furlong.intro:
'''Paul Anthony Furlong''' (born 1 October 1968) is a retired English professional Association footballfootballer who is currently an academy coach for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.
Furlong has played in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and in the Football League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Watford F.C.Watford, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Southend United F.C.Southend United and Barnet F.C.Barnet. He has also played non-League football for Enfield F.C.Enfield and Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town. At representative level, he has six caps for the England C national football teamEngland semi-professional team.
Furlong's son Darnell FurlongDarnell made his professional debut with QPR in 2015.

Diego Poyet.name: Diego Poyet
Diego Poyet.intro:
'''Diego Poyet González''' (born 8 April 1995) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He began his career at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, where he was their 2013–14 Player of the Season despite not featuring in the first team until January. In July 2014, he was signed by West Ham.
Poyet has played for England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16 and England national under-17 football teamunder-17 levels and for Uruguay at Uruguay national under-20 football teamunder-20 level.

Mikkel Bischoff.name: Mikkel Bischoff
Mikkel Bischoff.intro: '''Mikkel Rufus Mutahi Bischoff''' (born 3 February 1982) is a retired DenmarkDanish Association footballfootballer of Kenyan descent. He played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. At 6'4"/1.93 m he adds height to any defence and can play at full back or even as a striker. He has played four games for the Denmark national under-21 football teamDenmark under-21 national team.
Mikkel Bischoff.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Andy Dibble.name: Andy Dibble
Andy Dibble.intro:
'''Andrew Gerald "Andy" Dibble''' (born 8 May 1965 in Cwmbran) is a WalesWelsh former professional association footballfootballer and goalkeeping coach at Football Championship side Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United.
As a player he was as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1982 to 2006. During his career he played in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and in the Scottish Premier League for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen and Rangers F.C.Rangers. He also played in the Football League for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham. He also played in the Welsh Premier League for Barry Town F.C.Barry Town, and in Non-league football with Altrincham F.C.Altrincham and Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley. A journeyman (football)journeyman, Dibble won three caps for the Wales national football team.

Amaury Bischoff.name: Amaury Bischoff
Amaury Bischoff.intro: '''Amaury Armindo Bischoff''' (born 31 March 1987) is a PortugalPortuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for German club SC Preußen Münster as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.

Steven Thompson (Scottish footballer).name: Steven Thompson (Scottish footballer)
Steven Thompson (Scottish footballer).intro:
'''Steven Howard Thompson''' (born 14 October 1978) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Striker (association football)#Second strikerforward for St Mirren F.C.St. Mirren.
Thompson started his professional career at Dundee United F.C.Dundee United and then had spells at Rangers F.C.Rangers, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Burnley F.C.Burnley before his move to Paisley.
He was also a Scotland national football teamScotland international between 2002 and 2004.

Marvin Sordell.name: Marvin Sordell
Marvin Sordell.intro:
'''Marvin Anthony Sordell''' (born 17 February 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley as a Forward (association football)striker.
Sordell started his career with Watford F.C.Watford and graduated from their academy, before transferring to then-Premier League club Bolton Wanderers after showing good form during the 2011-12 season.
Sordell has played for England national under-21 football teamEngland U21, and also represented Great Britain Olympic football team at the 2012 Summer Olympics.

Geovanni Deiberson Maur\u00edcio.name: Geovanni Deiberson Maurício
Geovanni Deiberson Maur\u00edcio.intro: '''Geovanni Deiberson Maurício Gómez''' (born 11 January 1980), known simply as '''Geovanni''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer. He is mostly used as an attacking midfielder but is also able to play on both Winger (soccer)wings and Forward (association football)up front.

Martin Allen.name: Martin Allen
Martin Allen.intro: '''Martin James Allen''' (born 14 August 1965) is an English former Association footballfootball player and current head coach of Barnet F.C.Barnet. He played more than 100 games for each Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United before finishing his playing career with Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Southend United F.C.Southend United. Five years later, he took his first job in management, at non-league Barnet F.C.Barnet. He has since managed Brentford F.C.Brentford, Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, Barnet F.C.Barnet and Notts County F.C.Notts County. He rejoined Barnet F.C.Barnet as manager on 16 April 2012 on a short term, three-match contract succeeding Lawrie Sanchez. In July 2012 he became manager of Gillingham F.C.Gillingham and in the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 season led the team to the Football League Two title, earning Allen his first promotion as a manager and Gillingham's first divisional title in 49 years. He was sacked as Gillingham manager in October 2013. He played as a midfielder.

Craig Bellamy.name: Craig Bellamy
Craig Bellamy.intro:
'''Craig Douglas Bellamy''' (born 13 July 1979) is a Welsh former association footballfootballer.
Born in Cardiff, Bellamy began his career with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He went on to play for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, before spending half a season on loan at Celtic F.C.Celtic in 2005. He returned to the Premier League later that year, playing for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
For the 2010-11 in English football2010–11 season, Bellamy dropped down a division to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship in order to represent his boyhood club, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, on a season-long loan. He moved to play at former club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool the following season, before returning to Cardiff permanently. He later led Cardiff to the Premier League, the first time they had been in the top-flight for half a century.
During his career, Bellamy has won the Football League ChampionshipChampionship, the Football League CupLeague Cup, the Scottish Cup and the FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield. He also has been a runner-up in the FA Cup and UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League. He has been criticised for his behaviour on and off the pitch, but has accumulated millions of pounds for charity and also established a football academy in Sierra Leone.
He made his senior debut for Wales national football teamWales in 1998 and over the next fifteen years gained 78 caps for his country and scored 19 goals. He was the Wales captain from 2007 to 2011, when he stepped down from the role due to injuries. Bellamy retired from international football, following the 2014 FIFA World Cup qualification campaign. He was also a member of the Great Britain Olympic football teamGreat Britain Olympic team at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Olympics in London, appearing five times and scoring once.
On 1 February 2014 Bellamy scored his first Premier League Goal for Cardiff, thus becoming the first player in Premier League history to score for seven different clubs.

Pape Souar\u00e9.name: Pape Souaré
Pape Souar\u00e9.intro: '''Pape N'Diaye Souaré''' (born 6 June 1990) is a Senegalese international association footballfootballer who plays for English club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a Defender (association football)left back.

Patrice Luzi.name: Patrice Luzi
Patrice Luzi.intro:
'''Patrice Luzi Bernardi''' (born 8 July 1980) is a FranceFrench association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. The longest stint in his career was his three years with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, which came to an end when he was released by the Anfield club in June 2005. He then signed a contract with BelgiumBelgian side R.E. MouscronMouscron. In 2006, he moved from Mouscron to another Belgian club, R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi.
Having previously played for AS Monaco FCMonaco and AC AjaccioAjaccio, Luzi made his only appearance for Liverpool in January 2004 against Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in a 1–0 win. His chances were limited when Liverpool brought in Southampton F.C.Southampton's Paul Jones (footballer)Paul Jones on loan to cover Jerzy Dudek and Chris Kirkland.

Stefan Malz.name: Stefan Malz
Stefan Malz.intro:
'''Stefan Malz''' (born 15 June 1972) is a retired German footballer who played as a midfielder.
Malz is most well known for his two-year spell at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal but was never considered a first team regular; he made just eight appearances in all competitions, scoring two goals. He scored on his debut against Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in the Football League CupLeague Cup on 12 October 1999,cite web
url=
title=Arsenal 2 Preston North End 1
publisher=SportingLife
date=12 October 1999 accessdate=6 November 2009 with his second goal coming in a defeat at Newcastle United on the final day of the 1999–2000 season.cite web
url=
title=Newcastle 4 – 2 Arsenal
publisher=4TheGame
date=14 May 2000 accessdate=6 November 2009 He was also an unused substitute (soccer)substitute in the 2000 UEFA Cup Final, which Arsenal lost on Penalty shootout (association football)penalties to Galatasaray.

Gaetano Giallanza.name: Gaetano Giallanza
Gaetano Giallanza.intro: '''Gaetano Giallanza''' (born 6 June 1974 in Dornach, Switzerland) is a SwitzerlandSwiss-ItalyItalian professional Association footballfootballer, who last played for FC Basel as a striker (football)striker. He has previously played for  Darlington F.C.Darlington, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Luc Nilis.name: Luc Nilis
Luc Nilis.intro: '''Luc Nilis''' (born 25 May 1967 in Hasselt, Belgium) is a former Belgian football (soccer)football striker.  He enjoyed a successful career in his native Belgium and, in particular, in the Netherlands with PSV Eindhoven. However, his playing days came to an end in the 2000–01 season after breaking his leg in a match with his club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa following a clash with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper Richard Wright (footballer)Richard Wright.

Andy Impey.name: Andy Impey
Andy Impey.intro: '''Andrew Rodney Impey''' (born 30 September 1971) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as either as a full-back or winger.

Christer Warren.name: Christer Warren
Christer Warren.intro: '''Christer Simon Warren''' (born 10 October 1974 in Weymouth, Dorset) is a former football player.

Miles Addison.name: Miles Addison
Miles Addison.intro: '''Miles Vivien Esifi Addison''' (born 7 January 1989) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Blackpool F.C.Blackpool on loan from A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth. He can play as both a central defender or a central midfielder.
Miles Addison.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Defender

Paul Robinson (footballer, born November.name: Paul Robinson (footballer, born November 1978)
Paul Robinson (footballer, born November.intro: '''Paul Derrick Robinson''' (born 20 November 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for South Shields F.C. (1974)South Shields. Robinson is a much-travelled player, having featured for over twenty teams in his career. Due to his frequent moving, he has only passed thirty league appearances for one club, during his time with Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United.

Mario Espartero.name: Mario Espartero
Mario Espartero.intro: '''Mario Espartero''' (born January 17, 1978 in Fréjus, Var (department)Var) is a FranceFrench Football (soccer)football player who is currently without a club

Simon Webster.name: Simon Webster
Simon Webster.intro:
'''Simon Paul Webster''' (born 20 January 1964 in Hinckley, Leicestershire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender in the Football League for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Derby County F.C.Derby County. He also spent time on loan to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City without appearing for the first team, and played non-league football for St. Albans City F.C.St. Albans City.
During his spell at Sheffield United, Webster broke his leg in two places, an injury re-inflicted by a training-ground tackle by Julian Dicks within weeks of joining West Ham United. Although Webster was able to play again, he chose to retire from the professional game in November 1995 to study physiotherapy. Once qualified, he worked for West Ham United and Gillingham F.C.Gillingham.

Chris Martin (footballer, born 1988).name: Chris Martin (footballer, born 1988)
Chris Martin (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Christopher Hugh "Chris" Martin''' (born 4 November 1988) is an English-born Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for English Football League Championship side Derby County F.C.Derby County and the Scotland national football teamScottish national football team.
Martin began his career at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, joining the club's books at the age of 10 and making his professional debut at 18 in the 2006–07 Norwich City F.C. season2006–07 season. He fell out of favour in the 2007–08 Norwich City F.C. season2007–08 season and spent the 2008–09 Luton Town F.C. season2008–09 season on loan at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. On his return to Norwich, he was an important first team player as the club recorded successive promotions from Football League OneLeague One and the Championship in the 2009–10 Norwich City F.C. season2009–10 and 2010–11 Norwich City F.C. season2010–11 seasons.
However, upon the club's return to the Premier League, he found himself out of favour and spent part of the 2011–12 Norwich City F.C. season2011–12 season on loan at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and parts of the 2012–13 Norwich City F.C. season2012–13 season on loan at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Derby County F.C.Derby County. At the end of the season, he agreed a deal to join Derby on a permanent basis, signing a three-year contract and moving to the club on a free transfer ahead of the 2013–14 Derby County F.C. season2013–14 season. He ended the season as the club's top goalscorer, with 25 goals in all competitions, as the club reached the 2014 Football League Championship play-off Final.
Martin was born in England and represented the country at England national under-19 football teamunder-19 level in 2007. He was also eligible to play for Scotland, as his father was born there. Martin was first selected by the Scotland national football team and made his full international debut in May 2014.

Scott Dobie.name: Scott Dobie
Scott Dobie.intro:
'''Robert Scott Dobie''' (born 10 October 1978), known as '''Scott Dobie''', is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker, but is currently unattached.
Although born in England, Dobie has played for Scotland national football teamScotland at international level. He has previously played for Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Clydebank F.C.Clydebank, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City and York City F.C.York City.

Georgios Samaras.name: Georgios Samaras
Georgios Samaras.intro:
'''Georgios Samaras''' (, ; born 21 February 1985) is a Greek Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger or Forward (association football)striker for Al-Hilal FC and the Greece national football teamGreece national team.
Samaras started his career at OFI CreteCrete, before moving on to Eredivisie side SC HeerenveenHeerenveen in 2001. He made his first team debut two years later and after a further three seasons with the club he moved to Premier League club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City for a fee of £6 million in 2006-07 Manchester City F.C. season2006. After Sven-Göran Eriksson took over as Manchester City F.C.Manchester City manager Samaras fell out of favour with the first team. In January 2007–08 Celtic F.C. season2008 he was loaned out to Scottish Premier League team Celtic F.C.Celtic, moving on a permanent basis in the summer. Samaras helped Celtic win list of Scottish football championsScottish league championships in 2007-08 Scottish Premier League2008, 2011–12 Scottish Premier League2012, 2012–13 Scottish Premier League2013 and 2013–14 Scottish Premiership2014. He left the club at the end of his contract in 2014 and returned to the Premier League with West Bromwich Albion.
Although eligible to play for Australia national association football teamAustralia, due to the fact his father Ioannis Samaras was born in Melbourne, AustraliaMelbourne, Samaras chose to represent his country of birth, Greece national football teamGreece, and made his debut in 2006. He has become a regular in the Greek side since then, earning over 70 caps and representing his country at UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008, the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup, UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup.

Matt Jackson.name: Matt Jackson
Matt Jackson.intro:
'''Matthew Alan "Matt" Jackson''' (born 19 October 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and current Head of Football Operations at Football League Championship side Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.
As a player he was a defender (football)defender from 1990 until 2007, notably in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, as well as in the Football League for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Watford F.C.Watford and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He earned 10 caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 side.

Ricardo Gardner.name: Ricardo Gardner
Ricardo Gardner.intro:
'''Ricardo Wayne Gardner''' (born 25 September 1978, in Saint Andrew, JamaicaSaint Andrew, Jamaica), commonly known as '''Bibi''', is a Jamaican Association footballfootballer. He is naturally a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger but can also play in the Midfielder#Central midfieldercentre of midfield or at Defender (association football)#Wing-backleft wingback. He is a free agent after being released by Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in May 2012, following a 14-year spell at the club, of which 11 were spent in the Premier League.
He has earned 112 caps for the Jamaica national football team, scoring 9 goals and playing at four CONCACAF Gold Cups and the 1998 FIFA World Cup.

Brett Holman.name: Brett Holman
Brett Holman.intro: '''Brett Trevor Holman''' (born 27 March 1984) is an Australian professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for Al Nasr SC (Dubai)Al Nasr in the UAE Arabian Gulf League and has represented the Australia national football teamAustralian national team on 63 occasions.

John Eyre.name: John Eyre
John Eyre.intro: '''John Eyre''' (born 9 October 1974) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football striker (football)forward.

Jaap Stam.name: Jaap Stam
Jaap Stam.intro:
'''Jakob''' "'''Jaap'''" '''Stam''' (; born 17 July 1972) is a Dutch retired Association footballfootball player who is currently an assistant coach at his former club AFC Ajax.
Born in Kampen, OverijsselKampen, he played for several European clubs including PSV Eindhoven, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, S.S. LazioLazio, A.C. Milan and AFC AjaxAjax before retiring in October 2007. As well as club trophies, he won several personal awards, including being voted best defender in the 1998–99 UEFA Champions League1998–99 and 1999–2000 UEFA Champions League. He was known for possessing "a rare combination of speed, strength and ball-playing ability".
Stam played 67 international matches for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands, scoring three goals. He was in their squads for three European Championships and the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
Jaap Stam.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Vincent Candela.name: Vincent Candela
Vincent Candela.intro:
'''Vincent Philippe Antoine Candela''' (; born 24 October 1973, is a former French association footballfootballer. With the France national football teamFrench national team, Candela won the 1998 FIFA World Cup, as well as 2000 European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000.
Candela was a skilled right-footed Wingback (association football)left wingback, effective at joining the attack as well as being able in defence.
On the club level, Candela played for Toulouse FCToulouse (1992–95), En Avant GuingampGuingamp (1995–97), A.S. Roma (1997–2005), Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers (2005), Udinese CalcioUdinese (2005–2006) and A.C. SienaSiena (2006–2007). He won one ''Serie Ascudetto'' with Roma.
On 28 January 2007 he played his last Serie A match for Messina against Ascoli Calcio 1898Ascoli.cite webtitle=Tactical Formationwork=Football-Lineups.com
url=
For France, Candela was cap (sport)capped 40 times, scoring five goals. His playing time was often limited by Bixente Lizarazu, but he did play in one match during the 1998 triumph. During the winning 2000 European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 Candela did play two matches, both as a starter. He also played at the 1996 Summer Olympics1996 Olympic Games and the 2002 FIFA World Cup.
Candela and his wife, Mara, welcomed their first child, Angelica, in April 2005.
He was a dubbing actor in the Italian-language version of Shaolin Soccer.

Matt Brazier.name: Matt Brazier
Matt Brazier.intro: '''Matthew Ronald Brazier''' (born 2 July 1976 in Whipps Cross, Leytonstone) is a retired EnglandEnglish football midfielder.

Ryan Bertrand.name: Ryan Bertrand
Ryan Bertrand.intro:
'''Ryan Dominic Bertrand''' (born 5 August 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Southampton F.C.Southampton as a Defender (association football)#Left-backleft back.
Born in Southwark, London, Bertrand began his youth career at Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, before signing for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in July 2005. Where he graduated from their youth system and was sent on loan to various clubs between 2006 and 2010. He made his full debut for Chelsea on 20 April 2011, six years after joining them, in a fixture against Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. In the 2011–12 season, Bertrand signed a new four-year contract with Chelsea and was made understudy to Ashley Cole, whom he described a "fantastic role model."  On 19 May 2012, Bertrand became the first player to make his Champions League debut in the 2012 UEFA Champions League Finalfinal, starting in an unfamiliar left wing role in front of Cole; Chelsea beat Bayern Munich 4–3 on penalties. He has honours with Chelsea, including an FA Cup and UEFA Champions League titles.
Bertrand is an England national football teamEngland international, having represented 'the three Lions' at England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-18 football teamunder-18, England national under-19 football teamunder-19, England national under-20 football teamunder-20, England national under-21 football teamunder-21 and England national football teamsenior levels. On 15 August 2012, he made his debut for the England senior team, in a friendly against Italy national football teamItaly, in a 2–1 win.
Ryan Bertrand.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Craig Liddle.name: Craig Liddle
Craig Liddle.intro: '''Craig George Liddle''' (born 21 October 1971) is an English association footballfootballer who made more than 300 appearances in the Football League playing for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Darlington F.C.Darlington, where he spent most of his professional career. His predominant position was as a defender (association football)defender. He is currently the U15/U16 academy coach at Middlesbrough.

Steve McMillan.name: Steve McMillan
Steve McMillan.intro: '''Stephen Thomas "Steve" McMillan''' (born 19 January 1976 in Edinburgh) is a Scottish peopleScottish former Football (soccer)footballer, who retired from professional football in February 2007. He played for Motherwell F.C.Motherwell and Wigan Athletic.

Oussama Assaidi.name: Oussama Assaidi
Oussama Assaidi.intro:
'''Oussama Assaidi''' (; born 15 August 1988) is a MoroccoMoroccan Association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (association football)winger for Al-Ahli Dubai F.C.Al-Ahli Dubai, and the Morocco national football teamMoroccan national team.
Assaidi began his career in the Netherlands with AZ Alkmaar. After failing to earn a contract with AZ he played with Eerste Divisiesecond tier club Almere City FCFC Omniworld and then De Graafschap before joining SC HeerenveenHeerenveen in 2009. His performances at the Abe Lenstra Stadion earned him international recognition with Morocco national football teamMorocco and also attracted the attentions of bigger European clubs. Assaidi signed with English Premier League side Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in August 2012 for a fee of £2.4 million. However he struggled to break into the first team at Anfield and joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan for the 2013–14 Stoke City F.C. season2013–14 and 2014–15 Stoke City F.C. season2014–15 seasons.

Craig Eastmond.name: Craig Eastmond
Craig Eastmond.intro:
'''Craig Leon Eastmond''' (born 9 December 1990) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder, for Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town. He is also capable of playing at Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back. A product of the Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal Academy who came to prominence during the 2008–09 FA Youth Cup, Eastmond would make ten first team appearances between 2009 and 2013 for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in the Premier League, FA Cup, Football League CupLeague Cup and UEFA Champions League.
Eastmond had three loan spells away from the Gunners. He joined Millwall F.C.Millwall on loan in 2011, with whom he spent some of his early youth career. He was loaned to Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United in 2012, and signed for Colchester on a permanent basis in 2013 following the expiry of his contract with Arsenal. He made over 50 appearances for Colchester before his release in February 2015.

Mike Phelan.name: Mike Phelan
Mike Phelan.intro:
'''Michael Christopher "Mike" Phelan''' (born 24 September 1962 in Nelson, Lancashire), also known as '''Mick Phelan''' or '''Micky Phelan''', is a former player and current assistant manager at Hull City A.F.C.Hull City.
As a player, he spent most of his career at Burnley F.C.Burnley, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, with a short spell at West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion before retirement. Whilst with Manchester United, he also gained his one cap for England national football teamEngland.
In 2002, Norwich fans voted Phelan into the club's Norwich City F.C. Hall of FameHall of Fame.

Sylvain Distin.name: Sylvain Distin
Sylvain Distin.intro:
'''Sylvain Distin''' (born 16 December 1977) is a French association footballfootballer who plays for English Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton. He is left-footed and plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, and is also capable of playing at Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back.
Distin began his career playing for French amateur sides in the Championnat de France amateurCFA, and worked his way up to professional sides FC GueugnonGueugnon and subsequently Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain. He moved to England in 2001, first joining Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United on a loan move from PSG, before signing a permanent contract with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, where he spent five seasons. He then spent two years at Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth where he won the FA Cup, before joining Everton F.C.Everton in 2009.
He is currently in his thirteenth consecutive season in the Premier League, with over 400 appearances in England's top flight – the most of any foreign outfield player.

Marcos Angeleri.name: Marcos Angeleri
Marcos Angeleri.intro: '''Marcos Alberto Angeleri''' (born 7 April 1983) is an Argentine association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Málaga CF as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Marcos Angeleri.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Gary Hooper.name: Gary Hooper
Gary Hooper.intro:
'''Gary Hooper''' (born 26 January 1988) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
Hooper started his career at non-League Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic in 2003. While there he won the 2004-05 Football Conference2004–05 Conference South, as well as the FA Trophy twice in 2005 and 2006. After this Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Southend United F.C.Southend United signed him on a free transfer in 2006. He was loaned out twice by the club, on a three-month loan to Football League OneLeague One club Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient in 2007 and a six-month loan to Football League TwoLeague Two club Hereford United F.C.Hereford United in 2008. Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United signed him in 2008, for a fee of £175,000. After two years he was signed by Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic for £2.4 million. In his first season with the club he was the top scorer and also won the 2011 Scottish Cup Final2011 Scottish Cup.
Hooper has scored in the Premier League, Football League ChampionshipChampionship, Football League OneLeague One, Football League TwoLeague Two, FA Cup, Football League CupLeague Cup, Football League Trophy, FA Trophy, UEFA Champions League, UEFA Europa League, Scottish Cup, Scottish League Cup and the Scottish Premier League, the first and only player to achieve this feat. On top of this, he has also scored in the Conference Premier and the Conference South.
Hooper was born in England but has not represented the England national football teamnational team at any level. In March 2011 it was thought that he may be eligible to represent Scotland national football teamScotland. However, this possibility was later closed off. Since his move to Celtic he has been considered for England duty and was called up to the England under-21 national football teamunder-21 squad for a friendly but had to pull out due to injury. He was then included in the provisional squad for the 2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship2011 European Under-21 Championship but did not go to the tournament.

Joe Allen (footballer, born 1990).name: Joe Allen (footballer, born 1990)
Joe Allen (footballer, born 1990).intro: '''Joseph Michael "Joe" Allen''' (born 14 March 1990) is a Welsh peopleWelsh professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the Wales national football teamWales national team as a midfielder.

Jon Newsome.name: Jon Newsome
Jon Newsome.intro: '''Jon Newsome''' (born 6 September 1970) is an English peopleEnglish former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender from 1989 until 2000, notably in the Premier League for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He also appeared in the Football League for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Victor Anichebe.name: Victor Anichebe
Victor Anichebe.intro: '''Victor Chinedu Anichebe''' (born 23 April 1988) is a Nigerian Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He has been described as a fast and powerful player, in the mould of a "traditional" centre forward. He has played on the right of midfield as well, though.

Paul Dummett.name: Paul Dummett
Paul Dummett.intro:
'''Paul Dummett''' (born 26 September 1991) is a Wales national football teamWelsh international association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
Dummett began his career with his local side Newcastle United. After progressing through the youth ranks at the club, he had loan spells at Gateshead F.C.Gateshead and Scottish side St. Mirren F.C.St.
Mirren. He made his Premier League debut in the 2013–14 Newcastle United F.C. season2013–14 season and scored his first Premier League goal against Liverpool F.C.Liverpool on 19 October 2013.

David Speedie.name: David Speedie
David Speedie.intro: '''David Robert Speedie''', born 20 February 1960,  is a Scottish former association footballfootballer who played for several clubs in England during the 1980s and 1990s, most notably Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He accumulated more than 500 football league appearances and scored almost 150 goals in a 14-year professional career. He also earned ten international caps for Scotland national football teamScotland.

Doni.name: Doni
Doni.intro:
'''Doniéber Alexander Marangon''' (born 22 October 1979), known as '''Doni''', is a Brazilian former Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He was born in Jundiaí, State of São PauloSão Paulo.
He is the elder brother of João Paulo Fernando Marangon. Doni also holds an ItalyItalian passport. His parental family came from Veneto and his grandmother came from Mantua

Eddie Johnson (American soccer).name: Eddie Johnson (American soccer)
Eddie Johnson (American soccer).intro: '''Edward Abraham "Eddie" Johnson''' (born March 31, 1984) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays for D.C. United.

Richard Dunne.name: Richard Dunne
Richard Dunne.intro:
'''Richard Patrick Dunne''' (born 21 September 1979) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender and currently plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He also played internationally for the Republic of Ireland national football team from 2000 until 2014. With Ireland he was a member of the 2002 FIFA World Cup squad and played in UEFA Euro 2012.
Dunne began his professional career at Everton F.C.Everton. He later spent nearly a decade at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City before joining Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 2009.
Dunne holds the unique Premier League record of being sent off joint eight times along with Patrick Vieira and Duncan Ferguson.[
Richard Dunne.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Fabrice Fernandes.name: Fabrice Fernandes
Fabrice Fernandes.intro: '''Fabrice Fernandes''' (born 29 October 1979 in Aubervilliers) is a FranceFrench former football (soccer)footballer who played for several clubs, most particularly Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Federico Macheda.name: Federico Macheda
Federico Macheda.intro:
'''Federico '''"'''Kiko'''"''' Macheda''' (; born 22 August 1991) is an Italian professional association footballfootballer who plays for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City as a Forward (association football)striker.
Born in Rome, Macheda began his career with local club S.S. LazioLazio, but joined Manchester United when he turned 16 in 2007. He turned professional in 2008, before scoring on his first-team debut in April 2009. Macheda spent the next couple of years on the fringe of the United first-team, before twice going out on loan – first to U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria in his native Italy in 2011, and then to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 2012, the latter of which was curtailed by injury. He spent further spells on loan, at VfB Stuttgart, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. Having failed to break into the Manchester United first team, Macheda was released at the end of his contract in June 2014, leaving him free to sign for Cardiff City.
Macheda is also an Italian youth international, having made appearances for the national Italy national under-16 football teamunder-16, Italy national under-17 football teamunder-17, Italy national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Italy national under-21 football teamunder-21 teams. He made his under-21 debut in August 2009 in a friendly against Russia national under-21 football teamRussia, and scored his first goals for the team just over a year later in a match against Turkey national under-21 football teamTurkey.

Danny Guthrie.name: Danny Guthrie
Danny Guthrie.intro: '''Danny Sean Guthrie''' (born 18 April 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham on loan from Reading F.C.Reading as a midfielder. He has represented the England national under-16 football teamEngland under-16s at international level.

Steve Brooker.name: Steve Brooker
Steve Brooker.intro:
'''Stephen Michael Lord''' "'''Steve'''" '''Brooker''' (born 21 May 1981) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker who plays for Northern Premier League Premier Division side Buxton F.C.Buxton.
He began his career with Watford F.C.Watford in 1999, before moving on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 2001, following a short loan spell. With Vale he won the Football League Trophy in 2001 Football League Trophy Final2001. He transferred to Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in 2004, where he would spend the next five years. In 2008 he spent time on loan at both Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, before he joined Doncaster permanently in 2009. He spent two years with the club before he was released due to injury concerns. He signed with Buxton in October 2012.

Salomon Kalou.name: Salomon Kalou
Salomon Kalou.intro:
'''Salomon Armand Magloire Kalou''' (born 5 August 1985) is an Ivory CoastIvorian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker and Winger (association football)winger for Hertha BSC in the Bundesliga and the Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast.
He previously played for Feyenoord from 2003–2006 and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea from 2006–2012. While at Chelsea he won numerous honours, including the Premier League, the UEFA Champions League, four FA Cups and the Football League CupLeague Cup. He moved to Lille OSCLille on a free transfer in July 2012 upon the expiry of his contract at Chelsea, where he spent two seasons before moving to Hertha for an undisclosed fee.
A full international for the Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire since 2007, Kalou has played 75 internationals, and represented his country at two World Cups, four Africa Cup of Nations tournaments and the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Olympics.

Gareth Hall.name: Gareth Hall
Gareth Hall.intro:
'''Gareth Hall''' (born 20 March 1969 in Croydon[
He started his career as an apprentice at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and made his first team debut on 5 May 1987 against Wimbledon F.C., having featured in a reserve match earlier in the day. He made a total of 138 League appearances during his time at the club, although the number of matches he played was limited by the presence of Steve Clarke. Hall was a member of the Chelsea team that won the 1990 Full Members Cup Final1990 Full Members Cup at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley Stadium.[
He moved to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in January 1996, having originally been on loan there. Hall went on to make 48 League appearances for the club.
Hall joined Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town in May 1998 and played in most games during his first two seasons. Following the arrival of Colin Todd he was told he could leave on a free transfer, but continued training with the team and he ended up playing a few more matches for them, before leaving in May 2001 to join Havant & Waterlooville. In total he made 97 senior appearances for Swindon, scoring 3 goals.
He attained 9 international caps for Wales national football teamWales, first being selected for the senior side on 23 March 1988, in a 2-1 friendly defeat to Yugoslavia national football teamYugoslavia. His last cap came on 29 April 1992 in a 1-1 friendly draw with Austria national football teamAustria.

Yuri Zhirkov.name: Yuri Zhirkov
Yuri Zhirkov.intro:
'''Yuri Valentinovich Zhirkov''' (; born 20 August 1983 in Tambov, Soviet Union) is a RussiansRussian footballer who plays for FC Dynamo MoscowDynamo Moscow and the Russia national football teamRussian national team.
A left-sided player who can play full-back or winger, he began his career at local Spartak Tambov before joining top-flight PFC CSKA MoscowCSKA Moscow in 2004. Domestic and European success followed, and in 2009 he moved to English Premier League club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for £18 million. After two seasons there he returned to Russia with Anzhi Makhachkala, who sold him to Dynamo in 2013.
Zhirkov has earned 62 international caps since 2005. His performance at Euro 2008, in which Russia reached the semi-finals, was recognised with his inclusion in the Team of the Tournament and award as well as Footballer of the Year in Russia (Futbol)''Futbol''s Russian Footballer of the Year. He was also selected for Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Yuri Zhirkov.birth_place: Tambov,Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|RSFSR,Soviet Union

Steve Clarke.name: Steve Clarke
Steve Clarke.intro:
'''Stephen "Steve" Clarke''' (born 29 August 1963) is a ScotlandScottish former football player and the current manager of Reading F.C.Reading.
Clarke played for St. Mirren F.C.St. Mirren, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Scotland national football teamScotland, winning three major trophies with Chelsea towards the end of his career. After retiring as a player he moved into coaching and worked at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Chelsea,  West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Liverpool F.C.Liverpool before becoming manager of West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, a post from which he was sacked in December 2013.

Carlos Vela.name: Carlos Vela
Carlos Vela.intro:
'''Carlos Alberto Vela Garrido''' (born 1 March 1989) is a Mexican professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Real Sociedad and the Mexico national football teamMexico national team as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
He started his career at Mexican club C.D. Guadalajara and caught the eye of various European clubs after finishing as the top scorer at the 2005 FIFA U-17 World Championship, finally joining Barclays Premier LeaguePremier League club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal that year. After joining Arsenal he had loan spells at Spanish clubs UD SalamancaSalamanca and CA OsasunaOsasuna, as well as fellow English club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, finally joining Real Sociedad on loan, then permanently on 10 August 2012.
Vela made his debut with the Mexico national football teamsenior national team in 2007 in a friendly match against Brazil national football teamBrazil, and scored his first goal for Mexico in a friendly against Guatemala national football teamGuatemala. He participated in Mexico's CONCACAF Gold Cup victory in 2009 CONCACAF Gold Cup2009, and participated in the 2010 FIFA World Cup held in South Africa. His last participation with the national team came on 29 March 2011 in a match against Venezuela national football teamVenezuela, with Vela rejecting all subsequent call-ups to tournaments such as the 2011 CONCACAF Gold Cup2011 Gold Cup, 2011 Copa América, Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics2012 Summer Olympics, 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup2013 Confederations Cup and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup, citing various reasons for his refusals. In November 2014 Vela made his return to the national team.
Aside from his Mexican nationality, Vela holds a Spanish nationality law#Spanish nationality by naturalisation and residenceSpanish passport.

Scott Taylor (footballer, born 1970).name: Scott Taylor (footballer, born 1970)
Scott Taylor (footballer, born 1970).intro:
'''Scott Dean Taylor''' (born 25 November 1970 in Portsmouth, England) is a retired former professional football (soccer)footballer, who most notably played for Reading F.C.Reading.
Taylor started his career as a trainee with Reading, going on to make over 200 first team appearances for the club.  While at Reading, he was part of the team that narrowly missed out on promotion to the Premier League in the 1994-95 in English football1994–95 season, losing 4–3 after extra time in the playoff final against Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.
Following Reading's playoff defeat, Taylor refused a new contract, and was sold to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, aiding them in their promotion to the Premier League.  After an injury-blighted 1997–98 in English football1997–98 season, he moved on a free transfer to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.  However, injuries took their toll, so Taylor retired from professional football to play non-league football for Cambridge City F.C.Cambridge City and Hayes F.C.Hayes, before fully retiring in 2002.

Garry O'Connor.name: Garry O'Connor
Garry O'Connor.intro:
'''Garry Lawrence John O'Connor''' (born 7 May 1983) is a Scottish professional association footballfootballer, who plays for Lowland Football LeagueLowland League club Selkirk F.C.Selkirk. He has previously played for Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Peterhead F.C.Peterhead, FC Lokomotiv MoscowLokomotiv Moscow, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, FC Tom TomskTom Tomsk, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton and represented Scotland national football teamScotland.
O'Connor began his career with Hibernian, where his performances in 2002 earned him selection for Scotland as an 18-year-old, and he later earned a lucrative transfer to FC Lokomotiv MoscowLokomotiv Moscow. He scored a winning goal in the 2007 Russian Cup (football)Russian Cup final for Lokomotiv. O'Connor struggled to settle in Russia, and he returned to the United Kingdom later that year by signing for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. O'Connor struggled to hold a place in the Birmingham side due to injuries, and he spent most of the 2010–11 season with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He then returned to Hibernian for the 2011–12 season, scoring 12 goals in 33 league appearances. O'Connor signed for Russian club FC Tom TomskTom Tomsk in July 2012, but was released after making only six appearances.

Mathieu Flamini.name: Mathieu Flamini
Mathieu Flamini.intro: '''Mathieu Flamini''' (born 7 March 1984) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a midfielder. He has also been capped by the France national football teamFrance national team in the past.

Toni Kallio.name: Toni Kallio
Toni Kallio.intro: '''Toni Kallio''' (born 9 August 1978 in Tampere) is a FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Ykkönen side FC IlvesIlves. His preferred position is left back, but he can also operate as centre back and used to play as Forward (association football)forward when he joined HJK HelsinkiHJK. His nickname is "Bonecrusher", coming from his great physical presence and playing style.
Toni Kallio.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Scott Mean.name: Scott Mean
Scott Mean.intro: '''Scott James Mean''' (born 13 December 1973) is an English peopleEnglish former Association footballfootball midfielder. Described by BBC journalist Tom Fordyce as having "dashing good looks, very ordinary skills", after retiring from football he turned his hand to acting.

Jermaine Wright.name: Jermaine Wright
Jermaine Wright.intro: '''Jermaine Malaki Wright''' (born 21 October 1975 in Greenwich) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder and could also operate as a Defender (association football)defender.

Brian Laws.name: Brian Laws
Brian Laws.intro:
'''Brian Laws''' (born 14 October 1961) is an English former Association footballfootballer who was most recently the manager (association football)manager of Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United.
Playing as a defender (association football)defender, Laws made over 100 appearances for each of Burnley, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. In 1994, Laws became player-manager of Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town before taking a similar position with Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United in 1997. For the next nine years, Laws served as manager of Scunthorpe, guiding them to promotion twice. In 2006, he accepted the managerial role at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, lasting three years in the job during which time Burnley approached him for their managers job when Steve Cotterill left, but were put off by the compensation demanded by Wednesday.  Wednesday later struggled with financial problems and he was sacked in December 2009 after a poor run of results.
After only a brief spell out of the game, Burnley appointed Laws as their manager, giving him his first chance to manage in the Premier League after Owen Coyle left the club for Bolton in January 2010 and took the entire management team with him.  He was sacked by the club in December that year. Laws returned to manage Scunthorpe United in 2012 only to be sacked in November 2013.

Darren Ambrose.name: Darren Ambrose
Darren Ambrose.intro:
'''Darren Paul Francis Ambrose''' (born 29 February 1984) is an English professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. Ambrose, an attacking midfielder, started his career at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, and played for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace prior to his move to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He spent time on loan at Greek Superleague club Apollon Smyrni F.C.Apollon Smyrni before leaving Birmingham when his contract expired at the end of the 2013–14 season.
He also made ten appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side, scoring twice.

Stephen Warnock.name: Stephen Warnock
Stephen Warnock.intro:
'''Stephen Warnock''' (born 12 December 1981) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County. He plays as a left-back.
He has been cap (sport)capped by England national football teamEngland twice and was part of the nation's 2010 FIFA World Cup squads#Englandsquad at the 2010 FIFA World Cup. Warnock previously played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Bradford City F.C.Bradford City, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Leeds United F.C.Leeds United.
Stephen Warnock.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Michael Clegg.name: Michael Clegg
Michael Clegg.intro:
'''Michael Jamie Clegg''' (born 3 July 1977) is an English former professional footballer who played as a Defender (association football)football defender from 1995 to 2004.
He notably played in the Premier League for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and then moved on to play in the Football League for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic.

Robert Kozluk.name: Robert Kozluk
Robert Kozluk.intro:
'''Robert Kozluk''' (born 5 August 1977) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays for Ilkeston F.C.Ilkeston in the Northern Premier League Premier Division. He predominantly plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back, but can also operate on the left or at the centre of defence when needed.
Born in Mansfield he came through the Derby County F.C.Derby County youth-team ranks before turning professional in 1997 before joining Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in March 1999. He spent eight years with the Blades, and made close to 250 appearances for the club, helping them to the Premier League at the end of the 2005–06 season.  A three-year spell at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley followed after which he returned to Sheffield United for a further season although by this time was a rarely used squad player.  He joined Port Vale F.C.Port Vale on a short-term deal in September 2011, before signing with Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City for the remainder of the season in January 2012. He joined Ilkeston in January 2013.
Kozluk has also had loan spells at Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town in 2000, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in 2005 and seventeen days on loan at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in 2001 where he failed to make a single first team appearance. He has also been capped twice for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s.
Robert Kozluk.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right Back

Jamie Forrester.name: Jamie Forrester
Jamie Forrester.intro:
'''Jamie Mark Forrester''' (born 1 November 1974 in Bradford, West Yorkshire) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Striker between 1991 and 2010.
He played in France, the Netherlands and his native England. He notably played for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, having also had spells with AJ Auxerre, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, FC Utrecht, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Lincoln United F.C.Lincoln United and Lincoln Moorlands Railway F.C.Lincoln Moorlands Railway. Forrester has since set up home in Lincoln, EnglandLincoln and runs his own business as well as coaching youngsters in the city.

Stan Lazaridis.name: Stan Lazaridis
Stan Lazaridis.intro:
'''Stanley "Stan" Lazaridis''' (born 16 August 1972) is an Australian former Football (soccer)footballer.!--
Wikipedia's Manual of Style says that "Ethnicity or sexuality should not generally be emphasized in the opening unless it is relevant to the subject's notability." Lazaridis is notable for being a footballer, not for which bit of Europe his family came from. If his ethnicity is important enough to go in the article, it should go in the body of the article, or in a personal life section, not in the lead, and any claims made should be backed up by reliable sources. Without reliable sources, any mention of Greek and/or Macedonian will be removed from there as well.
-- He was predominantly a left winger though he had been known to perform at left-back. He last played for his home-town club Perth Glory FCPerth Glory and made 58 official appearances for Australia national football teamAustralia and was in the Australian 2006 FIFA World Cup squad.

Jake Livermore.name: Jake Livermore
Jake Livermore.intro: '''Jake Cyril Livermore''' (born 14 November 1989) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the England national football teamEngland national team.

Christian Nad\u00e9.name: Christian Nadé
Christian Nad\u00e9.intro:
'''Christian Nadé''' (born 18 September 1984 in Montmorency, Val-d'OiseMontmorency) is a French professional Association footballfootball player of Côte d'IvoireIvorian descent who is currently with Scottish Championship club Raith Rovers F.C.Raith Rovers.
He has played for clubs such as Troyes AC, Le Havre ACLe Havre, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian and has also represented the France national under-21 football team.
Despite being a striker, Nadé has never been a prolific goal scorer. Instead he uses his physical stature to play a target man role, "holding up" the ball and linking up with team mates.

Jos\u00e9 Fonte.name: José Fonte
Jos\u00e9 Fonte.intro:
'''José Miguel da Rocha Fonte''' (born 22 December 1983) is a Portuguese Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He started his professional career in Portugal and moved to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 2007. In 2010, he signed with Southampton F.C.Southampton.
Jos\u00e9 Fonte.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Christian Dailly.name: Christian Dailly
Christian Dailly.intro: '''Christian Eduard Dailly''' (born 23 October 1973) is a ScotlandScottish former professional association footballfootballer. He was a versatile player, often seen in defence or defensive midfield, but has played in most outfield positions during his career. Dailly is Scotland national football teamScotland's sixth-most capped player, having won 67 cap (sport)caps. Unlike most other modern-day footballers, he does not have an Sports agentagent and negotiates deals himself. The largest transfer fee any team paid for Dailly was when he joined Blackburn Rovers from Derby County for £5,350,000 in 1998. Dailly retired from professional football in July 2012 to concentrate on studying for a sports science degree and working for his coaching badges.
Christian Dailly.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Adam Rachel.name: Adam Rachel
Adam Rachel.intro: '''Adam Rachel''' (born 10 December 1976 in Birmingham, West Midlands (county)West Midlands) is an English professional football goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who last played in the Conference North for Solihull Moors F.C.Solihull Moors.

Sandro Raniere.name: Sandro Raniere
Sandro Raniere.intro: '''Sandro Raniere Guimarães Cordeiro''' (born 15 March 1989), or simply '''Sandro''', is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer, who plays for English Premier League club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.

Andy King (footballer, born 1988).name: Andy King (footballer, born 1988)
Andy King (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Andrew Philip "Andy" King''' (born 29 October 1988) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as a midfielder.
He has made over 250 league appearances for Leicester, where he has spent his entire career, in the top three divisions of English football.
Born in England, King is a Wales national football teamWales international, qualifying through his grandfather. He made his international debut in 2009 and has since earned over 25 caps, scoring twice.

Fernando Morientes.name: Fernando Morientes
Fernando Morientes.intro:
'''Fernando Morientes Sánchez ''' (; born 5 April 1976) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for DAV Santa Ana as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
He played for a number of clubs during his career, including Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, AS Monaco FCMonaco, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Valencia CFValencia. In La Liga he scored 124 goals in 337 games, over the course of 15 seasons.
Morientes played 47 times for the Spain national football teamSpanish national team, representing the country in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups (totalling five goals) and one UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship.

Kenny Sansom.name: Kenny Sansom
Kenny Sansom.intro: '''Kenneth Graham Sansom''' (born 26 September 1958) is an EnglandEnglish former football (soccer)footballer. Until overtaken by Ashley Cole in February 2011, he held the record for the number of cap (football)caps for an England national football teamEngland national team Defender (association football)#Full backfull back, having appeared 86 times for his country between 1979 and 1988.

Yannick Bolasie.name: Yannick Bolasie
Yannick Bolasie.intro: '''Yannick "Yala" Bolasie''' (born 24 May 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger. Born in Lyon, he has played in the Football League for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Barnet F.C.Barnet, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and his current club. Bolasie has been Cap (sport)capped at international level by the DR Congo national football teamDemocratic Republic of the Congo.

David Jones (footballer, born 1984).name: David Jones (footballer, born 1984)
David Jones (footballer, born 1984).intro: '''David Frank Llwyd Jones''' (born 4 November 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Burnley F.C.Burnley. Jones began his football career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but struggled to get into the first team and spent loan spells at Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, NEC Nijmegen and Derby County F.C.Derby County, before joining Derby on a permanent basis. However, he left Derby at the end of the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 season to join Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers before leaving them at the end of the 2010–11 Premier League2010–11 season. Jones has represented England national under-21 football teamEngland at Under-21 level, but he also has a parental qualification to play for Wales national football teamWales.

Esteban Fuertes.name: Esteban Fuertes
Esteban Fuertes.intro: '''Oscar Esteban "Bichi" Fuertes''' (born 26 December 1972 Coronel Dorrego PartidoCoronel Dorrego, Buenos Aires ProvinceBuenos Aires) is a former ArgentinaArgentine association footballfootball striker who played most of his career for Colón de Santa Fe.
Esteban Fuertes.birth_place: Coronel Dorrego Partido|Coronel Dorrego,Buenos Aires Province|Buenos Aires,Argentina
Esteban Fuertes.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Tore Andr\u00e9 Flo.name: Tore André Flo
Tore Andr\u00e9 Flo.intro:
'''Tore André Flo''' (born 15 June 1973) is a retired NorwayNorwegian association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker and youth coach. He was capped 76 times, scoring 23 goals for Norway national football teamNorway, and represented his country in 1998 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000, and scored Norway's first goal when Norway won 2–1 against Brazil and advanced to the second round of the 1998 World Cup.
During his professional career, he played for Sogndal FotballSogndal, Tromsø ILTromsø and SK BrannBrann in Tippeligaen, before he moved abroad and played for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. After a successful spell with the English club, he was sold to Rangers F.C.Rangers for £12 million and became the most expensive Norwegian player. Flo later had spells at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, A.C. SienaSiena, Vålerenga FotballVålerenga and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before he announced his retirement in March 2008. He later made two comebacks; for Milton Keynes Dons in November 2008 and the Norwegian club Sogndal FotballSogndal in March 2011. In August 2012 he announced his retirement for the third time. He subsequently rejoined Chelsea and is currently a member of their coaching staff.
Flo hails from the village of Flo, NorwayFlo in the municipality of Stryn in Sogn og Fjordane, Norway. He comes from a family of footballers, and his brother Jostein Flo and his cousin Håvard Flo have also been capped for Norway.

Ariza Makukula.name: Ariza Makukula
Ariza Makukula.intro:
'''Ariza Makukula''' (born 4 March 1981) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Centre forwardcentre forward.
He only amassed Primeira Liga totals of 26 games and nine goals over the course of three seasons, spending the vast majority of his career abroad. He competed in Spain, England, Turkey, Greece and Thailand, being Süper Lig topscorer with Kayserispor.
Ariza Makukula.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Andy Peake.name: Andy Peake
Andy Peake.intro:
'''Andy Peake''' (born 1 November 1961, Market Harborough) is a retired English Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder.
Andy is a former England youth international and U21 player who professional forms with Leicester City in January 1979 two days after his league debut against Blackburn Rovers. ;

Ayoze P\u00e9rez.name: Ayoze Pérez
Ayoze P\u00e9rez.intro:
'''Ayoze Pérez Gutiérrez''' (born 23 July 1993), simply known as '''Ayoze''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as a Forward (association football)forward.
He began his career at hometown club CD Tenerife, where he received several personal awards for his performances in the 2013–14 Segunda División season before joining Newcastle for around €2 million.
Pérez has represented Spain internationally at Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Iain Jenkins.name: Iain Jenkins

Wilfried Zaha.name: Wilfried Zaha

'''Dazet Wilfried Armel Zaha''' (born 10 November 1992), known as '''Wilfried Zaha''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
He advanced into the Crystal Palace first team from their academy in 2010. In January 2013, he transferred to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United for an initial fee of £10 million, but remained on loan at Palace until the end of the season, helping them return to the Premier League. After an unsuccessful 2013–14 season with Manchester United (partly spent on loan at Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City), Zaha returned to Palace in August 2014 on a season-long loan, before rejoining the club on a permanent basis in February 2015.
Born in the Ivory Coast, Zaha made his debut for the England national football teamEngland national team in 2012.

Colin Cameron.name: Colin Cameron

He was part of the Rovers side that won the Scottish League Cup in 1994, leading to the team's first and only foray in Europe, which included the memorable ties against German giants FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. He also won two Scottish Football League First DivisionFirst Division championships with Raith, and won the Scottish Cup with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts in 1998.
Cameron made a £1.75m move to English club Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolves in 2001 and played for them in the Premier League. He was capped 28 times by Scotland national football teamScotland, scoring twice. He made his international debut on 28 April 1999, in a 1–0 friendly win in Germany national football teamGermany. Cameron is currently the player-manager of Berwick Rangers F.C.Berwick Rangers.

Badir scored 12 goals in 74 games for the Israel national football team between 1997 and 2007.

He was also an integral part of the Denmark national football team from 1996 to 2001, playing a total of 44 matches and scoring seven goals. He competed for Denmark in the international UEFA Euro 19961996 European Championship (Euro 1996), 1998 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000 tournaments.

He also played in the Premier League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and in the Football League for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon. He also earned two caps for England national football teamEngland between 1989 and 1993.

He has also represented England at England national under-19 football teamEngland U19 and England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 level.
