He is nicknamed "Pitbull".

Michael Ballack.name: Michael Ballack
Michael Ballack.intro:
'''Michael Ballack''' (; born 26 September 1976) is a retired German Association footballfootballer. He is among the List of Germany international footballerstop goal scorers in the history of the German national team. Ballack wore the number 13 shirt for every team he has played for except for 1. FC KaiserslauternKaiserslautern. He was selected by Pelé as one of FIFA 100FIFA's 125 Greatest Living Players, and as the UEFA Champions League Best MidfielderUEFA Club Midfielder of the Year in 2002. He won the German Footballer of the Year award three times – in 2002, 2003 and 2005. Ballack was known for his passing range, powerful shot, physical strength and commanding presence in midfield.
Ballack began his career as a youth at Chemnitzer FCChemnitz, his local team, and made his professional debut in 1995. On 26 March 1996, Ballack made his debut for Germany national under-21 football teamGermany's Under-21 side. Although the team were relegated in his first season, his performances in the Regionalliga the following season led to a transfer to 1. FC Kaiserslautern in 1997. He won the Bundesliga in his first season at the club; his first major honour. He became a first team regular in 1998–99 season and also earned his first senior national cap for Germany. He moved to Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen for €4.1 million in 1999. The 2001–02 Bayer 04 Leverkusen season2001–02 season saw him win a slew of runners-up medals: Bayer Leverkusen The Treble#Near treblesfinished second in the Bundesliga, DFB-Pokal, UEFA Champions League and Germany lost to Brazil national football teamBrazil in the 2002 FIFA World Cup Final2002 World Cup Final.
A €12.9 million move to FC Bayern Munich led to further honours: the team won the Bundesliga and DFB-Pokal Double (association football)double in 2003, 2005 and 2006. Ballack had become a prolific goalscorer from midfield, scoring 58 goals for Bayern between 2002 and 2006. He joined Premier League club Chelsea in mid-2006 and won his first English honours, the 2006–07 FA CupFA Cup and 2006–07 Football League CupFootball League Cup, in his first season at the club. Injury ruled out much of 2007 but he returned the following season, helping Chelsea reach their first ever 2008 UEFA Champions League FinalChampions League final. He also went on to win the 2008–09 FA CupFA Cup again in 2009 and then once more as part of a 2009–10 Premier Leagueleague and 2009–10 FA Cupcup double in 2010.
Internationally, Ballack has played in the UEFA European Football Championship in UEFA Euro 20002000, UEFA Euro 20042004 and UEFA Euro 20082008, and the FIFA World Cup in 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 and 2006 FIFA World Cup2006. Jürgen Klinsmann appointed him captain of the national team in 2004. Ballack scored consecutive game-winning goals in the quarter-final and semi-final to help his country to the 2002 FIFA World Cup Final2002 World Cup final, and led his team to the semi-finals of the 2006 World Cup and the UEFA Euro 2008 FinalEuro 2008 final.

Jan Stejskal.name: Jan Stejskal
Jan Stejskal.intro:
'''Jan Stejskal''' (born 15 January 1962) is a retired CzechsCzech Association footballfootball goalkeeper. He played for Czechoslovakia national football teamCzechoslovakia and later the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic, for both he played a total of 31 matches, participating in the 1990 FIFA World Cup.
In his native country he played for AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague and SK Slavia PragueSlavia Prague. He also had a successful spell at Queens Park Rangers from 1990 to 1994. He was one of only 13 foreign players to play on the opening weekend of the FA Premier League along with Peter Schmeichel, Andrei Kanchelskis, Robert Warzycha, Roland Nilsson, Eric Cantona, Hans Segers, John Faxe Jensen, Anders Limpar, Gunnar Halle, Craig Forrest, Michel Vonk and Ronnie Rosenthal.
Stejskal was a very tall commanding goalkeeper with a sound trade, but his language problem let him down from time to time. His QPR days were marred by this but he will still go down in history as one of the best keepers QPR ever had.
After ending his career, he worked as a goalkeeping coach for both AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague and the Czech Republic national football team. He ended this in 2008 as his commitment to Sparta proved too great.
Stejskal is also a qualified mechanic, a trade learned whilst serving on national duty for the former Czechoslovakia.

In August 2007, he was sold on to Preston North End F.C.Preston North End for a fee of up to £1.25 million. Loaned out to Millwall F.C.Millwall in the 2010–11 season, he later had to spend the 2011–12 season without a club after tearing a groin muscle during a trial game. He returned to action in the 2012–13 campaign with Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, and signed for Northampton Town ahead of the 2013–14 season.

De Guzmán is also known for being a Direct free kickfree-kick specialist.

He is famed for being a prime example of a Journeyman (sports)Journeyman footballer, having represented 29 different teams in his career, and with that making over 350 appearances in the Football League between 1995 and 2008. He most notably spent time in the Premier League with Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, who he joined in 2000 from Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United. He was also capped by England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 but went on to feature for Jamaica national football teamJamaica as a full international, where he earned two caps. Benjamin has also played as a professional in the Football League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, Watford F.C.Watford, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Boston United F.C.Boston United, Walsall F.C.Walsall and Hereford United F.C.Hereford United.
At the age of 28, Benjamin dropped out of the professional game and firstly signed for Conference North side Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity. He has since gone on to play for Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria, Hednesford Town F.C.Hednesford Town, Wellingborough Town F.C.Wellingborough Town, Kidsgrove Athletic F.C.Kidsgrove Athletic, Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town and Woking F.C.Woking. In 2010 he briefly joined Australian semi-pro side Sunshine George Cross FCSunshine George Cross, but failed to make an appearance and returned to the English Non-league game where he went on to feature for Bedlington Terriers F.C.Bedlington Terriers, Wroxham F.C.Wroxham and Morpeth Town F.C.Morpeth Town. Danny Welbeck.name: Danny Welbeck
Danny Welbeck.intro:
'''Daniel Nii Tackie Mensah "Danny" Welbeck''' (born 26 November 1990) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Centre-forwardcentre-forward for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the England national football teamEngland national team. He can also play as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
Welbeck made his way through the Manchester United F.C. Reserves and Academyyouth teams at Manchester United before making his senior debut in 2008 and scoring in the process. He was with United when they won the 2008–09 Football League Cup and the 2008 FIFA Club World Cup before being sent on loan to Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and more recently Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. From the 2011–12 season, Welbeck was a regular figure in the Manchester United first team. He transferred to Arsenal in September 2014 for an estimated fee of £16 million.
He made his senior England national football teamEngland debut in March 2011 in a 1–1 friendly draw against Ghana national football teamGhana, the homeland of both of his parents. He scored his first senior international goal on 2 June 2012, the only goal in a  friendly victory over Belgium national football teamBelgium. Welbeck has gone on to represent England at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup, earning over 30 caps.

David Beckham.name: David Beckham
David Beckham.intro:
'''David Robert Joseph Beckham''' ,  (born 2 May 1975) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer. He played for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, A.C. MilanMilan, LA Galaxy, Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain, and the England national football teamEngland national team for which he holds the appearance record for an Outfield#Association footballoutfield player. He was the first English player to win league titles in four countries, England, Spain, the United States and France. He announced his retirement at the end of the 2012–13 season and, on 18 May 2013, played the final game of his 20-year career.
Beckham's professional career began with Manchester United, where he made his first-team debut in 1992 aged 17. With United, he won the Premier League title six times, the FA Cup twice, and the UEFA Champions League in 1999. He then played four seasons with Real Madrid, winning the La Liga championship in his final season with the club. In July 2007 Beckham signed a five-year contract with Major League Soccer club LA Galaxy. While a Galaxy player, he spent two loan spells in Italy with Milan in 2009 and 2010. He was the first British footballer to play 100 UEFA Champions League games.
In international football, Beckham made his England debut on 1 September 1996 at the age of 21. He was Captain (association football)captain for List of England national football team captainssix years, earning 58 caps during his tenure. He made 115 career appearances in total, appearing at three FIFA World Cup tournaments, the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998, 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 and 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 editions and two UEFA European Championship tournaments, the UEFA Euro 20002000 and UEFA Euro 20042004 editions.
Renowned for his range of passing, crossing abililty and Curl (football)bending free-kicks, he has twice been runner-up for FIFA World Player of the Year and in 2004 he was named in the FIFA 100 list of the world's greatest living players. Consistently ranked among the sport's highest earners, in 2013 Beckham was listed as the highest paid player in the world, earning over $50 million in the previous 12 months.
He has been married to Victoria Beckham since 1999 and they have four children. Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn currently plays football for Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal U16.[

Stephen Crainey.name: Stephen Crainey
Stephen Crainey.intro: '''Stephen Daniel Crainey''' (born 22 June 1981) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back for Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town. He has also played for the Scotland national football teamScottish national team on 12 occasions.
Stephen Crainey.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Gary Speed.name: Gary Speed
Gary Speed.intro:
'''Gary Andrew Speed''', Order of the British EmpireMBE (8 September 1969 – 27 November 2011) was a Welsh peopleWelsh Association footballfootballer and Manager (association football)manager.
As a player, he is best known for his spell between 1988 and 1996 at Leeds United F.C.Leeds United where he won the English Football League First Division Championship in 1992, and also for his spell between 1998 and 2004 at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as well as three and a half years at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers during their days under Sam Allardyce's management. He captained the Wales national football team until retiring from international football in 2004. He remains the most capped outfield player for Wales and the second overall, having appeared 85 times at senior level between 1990 and 2004, playing mainly as a left-side attacking midfielder. He started off his career in 1988 and retired in 2010. Speed was appointed manager of Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in 2010, but left the club after a few months in December 2010 to manage the Wales national team, remaining in this role until his death 11 months later. Speed played professionally for Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, Everton F.C.Everton, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. Rarely troubled by injury or suspension, he held the record for the most appearances in the Premier League at 535, until it was surpassed by David James (footballer)David James.
At the time of his death, only James and Ryan Giggs had played in more Premier League matches than Speed. Including his appearances in The Football League and cup competitions, he made 840 domestic appearances. He played in the Leeds United team that won the Football League First Division championship in 1991-92 Football League1991–92, the year before the Premier LeagueFA Premier League was formed. He also played in consecutive FA Cup finals for Newcastle United, losing to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 1998 FA Cup Final1998 and to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 1999 FA Cup Final1999. Speed hanged himself on 27 November 2011, aged 42, though it was not clear whether he had intended to kill himself.

Rob Newman.name: Rob Newman
Rob Newman.intro: '''Robert Nigel''' "'''Rob'''" '''Newman''' (born 13 December 1963 in Bradford on Avon) is an English football coach and former player.

Horacio Carbonari.name: Horacio Carbonari
Horacio Carbonari.intro:
'''Horacio Carbonari''' (born 2 May 1974) is a former ArgentinaArgentine football (soccer)footballer who played as a defender (football)defender.
Born in Santa Teresa, a town in the southern end of Santa Fe Province, Carbonari began his career at Rosario Central.  His debut at the first division was in 1993.  In the Argentinian club, he won the Copa Conmebol (currently known Copa Sudamericana) in 1995.  In that edition of the internacional cup, he scored 4 goals.
He was signed by Derby County F.C.Derby County in the summer of 1998 for £3million by former Derby manager Jim Smith (footballer)Jim Smith where he quickly became a fans favourite. He went on to play ninety times for the club, scoring nine and winning praise from the fans after scoring twice against rivals Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.  However in 2002 while John Gregory (footballer)John Gregory was manager he became out-of-favour at the club and had a short loan spell at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 2002, before being released by Derby.
He went back to Rosario Central later that year and helped the club qualify for the Copa Libertadores de AméricaCopa Libertadores. When an injury ended his season he was released on a free. Carbonari decided to retire at the end of 2004–05 season.
At the beginning 2006–07 season, he was appointed the general manager of Rosario Central.

Nuno Morais.name: Nuno Morais
Nuno Morais.intro:
'''Nuno Miguel Barbosa Morais''' (born 29 January 1984) is a PortugalPortuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Cypriot club APOEL FC. Mainly a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder, he can also appear as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He was signed by Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2004, but only stayed a few months with the club, going on to spend the vast majority of his career with APOEL FCAPOEL and win ten major titles, including four Cypriot First Divisionnational championships.

Brian Carey.name: Brian Carey
Brian Carey.intro: '''Brian Patrick Carey''' (born 31 May 1968) is a former Republic of Ireland national football teamIrish international Association footballfootballer who played in the Football League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as well as Wrexham F.C.Wrexham, whom he also served them as manager. Since his playing retirement he has also worked as the Assistant Manager at Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolves. He is a UEFA A Licence Coach, holds a BSc in Sport Coaching and Exercise Science and represented his country at International Level.

Jonathan Gould.name: Jonathan Gould
Jonathan Gould.intro:
'''Jonathan Alan Gould''' (born 18 July 1968) is a former professional association footballfootballer, manager and is currently Goalkeeping coach of Barclays Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1989 until 2009 playing for numerous clubs, notably in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic. He also played in the Football League for Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City. He joined New Zealand side Hawke's Bay United as player/manager in 2006, before moving to Wellington Phoenix as player/assistant coach in 2009.

Aruna Dindane.name: Aruna Dindane
Aruna Dindane.intro:
'''Aruna Dindane''' (born 26 November 1980) is an Ivory CoastIvorian Association footballfootballer who is currently unattached and plays as a Forward (association football)striker.
He has 62 caps and 17 goals for the Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast since his debut in 2000, and has played at four Africa Cup of Nations and two FIFA World Cups.

Kieran Trippier.name: Kieran Trippier
Kieran Trippier.intro:
'''Kieran John Trippier''' (born 19 September 1990) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for Burnley F.C.Burnley.
Trippier started his career in the youth system at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City but failed to make the breakthrough to the first team and didn't make a professional appearance. In February 2010, he joined Football League Championship side Barnsley F.C.Barnsley on a one-month loan. He re-joined the club in August 2010 for a six-month loan which was later extended until the end of the season. In July 2011, he signed for Championship side Burnley F.C.Burnley on a season-long loan which was made permanent in January 2012 for an undisclosed fee, signing a three-and-a-half year contract. He was named in the Championship PFA Team of the Year for two consecutive seasons in 2012–13 and 2013–14. In 2014 he secured promotion with Burnley to the Premier League as the side finished runners-up in the Championship. He has also represented England at all levels from under-18 to under-21, featuring in the 2009 UEFA European Under-19 Championship and 2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup.
Kieran Trippier.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Carl Serrant.name: Carl Serrant

'''Carl Serrant''' (born 12 September 1975) is an English former association footballfootballer and now coach (sport)fitness coach, for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.
Born in Bradford, West Yorkshire, Serrant made more than 100 appearances in the Football League with Oldham Athletic F.C.Oldham Athletic, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Bury F.C.Bury as well as earning a cap for England B national football teamEngland B before his professional career was cut short by injury. He later returned to play in non-league for Bradford Park Avenue A.F.C.Bradford Park Avenue, Droylsden F.C.Droylsden and Farsley Celtic A.F.C.Farsley Celtic. Whilst at Farsley he joined the coaching staff at Leeds United.
In November 2007 he joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a coach (sport)fitness coach. After less than a year with Palace, Serrant moved to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United as a strength conditioning coach.cite news

David Bentley.name: David Bentley
David Bentley.intro:
'''David Michael Bentley''' (born 27 August 1984) is an English retired Association footballfootballer who played in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He usually played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, but also played in midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfield or as a second striker.
Bentley started his career with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, and despite being earmarked as one for the future, saw his playing opportunities limited by a strong senior squad. He spent two seasons on loan with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, and sealed a permanent transfer to Rovers in January 2006. Bentley produced strong performances for his new club, and soon featured regularly for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team. He made his England national football teamsenior international debut against Israel national football teamIsrael in September 2007. In July 2008, Bentley joined Tottenham Hotspur. He spent time on loan with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, West Ham United, FC Rostov and a brief return to Blackburn before being released by Tottenham in 2013. After not playing for more than a year, Bentley retired from football in 2014, citing his loss of passion for the sport.

Shabani Nonda.name: Shabani Nonda
Shabani Nonda.intro: '''Shabani Christophe Nonda''' (born 6 March 1977 in Bujumbura, Burundi) is a retired Democratic Republic of the CongoDR Congolese international association footballfootballer who played as a striker. He earned 36 caps and scored 20 goals for the DR Congo national football teamDR Congo, and was selected for their squad for the 2002 Africa Cup of Nations.

Andros Townsend.name: Andros Townsend
Andros Townsend.intro:
'''Andros Darryl Townsend''' (born 16 July 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and for the England national football teamEngland national team. A product of the Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and AcademySpurs academy, Townsend had loan spells with nine different clubs before gaining a regular first team place for Spurs in the 2013–14 season.
He has represented England at England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19, England national under-21 football teamunder-21 and England national football teamsenior level. On 11 October 2013, he scored on his senior debut for England in a 4–1 victory against Montenegro national football teamMontenegro.

James Morrison.name: James Morrison
James Morrison.intro: '''James Clark Morrison''' (born 25 May 1986) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. After representing various England junior sides, Morrison chose to play for Scotland national football teamScotland at full international level.

Bobby Zamora.name: Bobby Zamora
Bobby Zamora.intro:
'''Robert Lester "Bobby" Zamora''' (born 16 January 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. Zamora began his career at The Football LeagueFootball League club Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, but was soon signed by Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, where he found first team success. Zamora scored 77 goals in three seasons and helped the club achieve two successive promotions.
Following a spell at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Zamora was signed by West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, where he played for five years and won promotion to the Premier League. Zamora joined Fulham in 2008, where, in his first season, he played regularly but scored only four goals. However, Zamora's form in the 2009–10 Premier League2009–10 season gained praise and subsequently saw the player gain a call-up for England national football teamEngland. Zamora  had an important role in Fulham's successes in the Premier League, FA Cup and UEFA Europa League, before transferring to Queen's Park Rangers F.C.Queen's Park Rangers in January 2012. Zamora also played for the England national under-21 football teamEngland national under-21 team before gaining his first full cap at senior level almost a decade later.

He is also the club's goalkeeping coach.

'''Borja Oubiña Meléndez''' (born 17 May 1982) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder for Celta de Vigo.

Tom Lawrence.name: Tom Lawrence

Born in Wrexham, he joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United at the age of eight and made his way up through the age groups, but he was unable to make it as a first-team regular and spent time on loan at Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town before joining Leicester in September 2014. He has also represented Wales at Wales national under-17 football teamunder-17, Wales national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Edward Copeland.name: Edward Copeland

Lee Sharpe.name: Lee Sharpe
Lee Sharpe.intro:
'''Lee Stuart Sharpe''' (born 27 May 1971) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, sports television pundit and reality television personality, who as a player was predominantly a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger from 1988 to 2004.
Sharpe joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United from Torquay United F.C.Torquay United as a youngster in 1988, playing for the club up until 1996. He won a total of eight caps for England national football teamEngland, but his later career failed to live up to its potential after leaving Manchester United in his mid-twenties. Sharpe moved to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in 1996, but persistent knee injuries kept him from making an impact on the squad, and he was loaned to U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria at the start of the 1998–99 season. Another loan to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in March 1999 turned into a permanent deal at the end of the season. He stayed at Bradford for three seasons, but he gradually slipped down the league ladder, eventually moving to Iceland to play for Knattspyrnudeild UMFGGrindavík in 2003. He retired from professional football in 2003, but achieved renewed celebrityfame after a number of reality television appearances. He briefly returned to football in 2004, playing for Garforth Town A.F.C.Garforth Town, but his return was short-lived.

Jamar Loza.name: Jamar Loza
Jamar Loza.intro: '''Jamar Kasheef Loza''' (born 10 May 1994) is a Jamaican Association footballfootball player. He is a Striker (association football)striker who currently plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

Giuseppe Rossi.name: Giuseppe Rossi
Giuseppe Rossi.intro: '''Giuseppe Rossi''' (born 1 February 1987) is an United StatesAmerican-born Italian peopleItalian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for ACF FiorentinaFiorentina and the Italy national football teamItalian national team. Born in Teaneck, New JerseyTeaneck, New Jersey, he began his career with the Clifton Stallions in nearby Clifton, New Jersey, but joined the youth team of Italian club Parma F.C.Parma at the age of 12. When he was 17, he was signed by English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but he was unable to break into the first team; after loan spells with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and back at Parma, he signed for Spanish club Villarreal CFVillarreal in 2007. After five-and-a-half years with Villarreal, he returned to Italy, signing for Fiorentina in January 2013.

'''Daniel da Cruz Carvalho''' (born 2 November 1976), commonly known as '''Dani''', is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played mainly as a Forward (association football)forward.
He spent most of his eight-year professional career with AFC AjaxAjax after starting out at Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting, appearing in nearly 100 official games and winning three major titles. He also competed abroad in Spain, with Atlético Madrid.

Thomas S\u00f8rensen.name: Thomas Sørensen
Thomas S\u00f8rensen.intro:
'''Thomas Løvendahl Sørensen''' (born 12 June 1976) is a DenmarkDanish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Sørensen started his career with his local side Odense BoldklubOdense BK. After impressing on loan at Vejle Boldklub and FC SvendborgSvendborg he was signed by English side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 1998. After five years as first choice 'keeper on Wearside he joined Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa for £2 million. He was first choice at Villa until a fall out with Martin O'Neill saw him out of the side and he was released in May 2008. He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in June 2008 on a free transfer. He was first choice goalkeeper at Stoke for three seasons helping the club consolidate in the Premier League. He eventually began to lose his place in the side to the younger Asmir Begović and became his back-up.
Between 2000 and 2012, he was the starting goalkeeper for the Denmark national football team, the successor to the legendary Peter Schmeichel, and he played 101 matches for his country. He was part of Denmark national football teamDenmark's 2002 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2004, and 2010 FIFA World Cup squads.

John Piercy.name: John Piercy
John Piercy.intro: '''John William Piercy''' (born 18 September 1979) is an EnglandEnglish former Association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder.

'''Jermaine Anthony Jenas''' ( ;) born 18 February 1983) is an English professional Association footballfootballer central midfielder who is currently a free agent after his Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers contract expired at the end of the 2013–14 Queens Park Rangers F.C. season2013–14 season.
He began his career at local side Nottingham Forest, and joined Newcastle United of the Premier League for £5 million at the age of 18. After three seasons at the club, he joined Tottenham Hotspur for £7 million, where he scored 21 goals in 155 league matches before joining Queens Park Rangers in January 2013.
A full international since 2003, Jenas has earned 21 caps for the England national football teamEngland national team, and was included in the squad for the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Michael Duberry.name: Michael Duberry
Michael Duberry.intro:
'''Michael Wayne Duberry''' (born 14 October 1975) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back.

He has also previously played in the Football League for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers and Oxford United F.C.Oxford United.

Gunnar Halle.name: Gunnar Halle
Gunnar Halle.intro: '''Gunnar Halle''' (born 11 August 1965) is a NorwayNorwegian association footballfootball manager and former player. In total he was cap (football)capped 64 times and scored five international goals, including a memorable hat-trick against San Marino national football teamSan Marino, and was included in the squads for the 1994 FIFA World Cup and 1998 FIFA World Cup. '''Gábor Ferenc Király''' () (born 1 April 1976) is a HungaryHungarian association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is currently playing for English club Fulham F.C.Fulham.
Since making his international debut against Austria in 1998, Király has amassed 90 caps for his country. In a senior career which started in 1993, the experienced stopper has played 753 professional games.

John Oster.name: John Oster
John Oster.intro:
'''John Morgan Oster''' (born 8 December 1978) is an English-born WalesWelsh professional Association footballfootballer, who plays as a midfielder for Conference Premier side Gateshead F.C.Gateshead.
Oster was a product of the youth team at Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town where he was added to the first team squad in 1994, however he didn't make his debut until the 1996–97 season. His performances that season caught the eye of Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton who paid £1.5 million for him during the summer of 1997. Two years later he was sold to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland where he remained until 2005. Whilst with The Black Cats he spent time on loan with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley before returning to Grimsby for two separate loan spells during the 2002–03 season, in his time back at Blundell Park he was unable to save the club from relegation. He later moved on loan to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before joining Burnley F.C.Burnley permanently. His stay with Burnley was brief and moved to Reading F.C.Reading where he helped them earn promotion to the Premier League for the first time, in 2008 he moved to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace where he remained for a year before transferring to Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. He departed Rovers in the summer of 2012 and joined League Two side Barnet F.C.Barnet, prior to his move to the North London club he had played his entire professional football career inside the top two divisions of English football. He joined Gateshead F.C.Gateshead in September 2013.
During his career, Oster represented Wales national football teamWales at international level, where he earned 13 caps between 1997 and 2004. He is renowned for his excellent first touch and wide range of passing. He was often deployed on the wing, but played the role of Midfielder#Deep-lying playmakerdeep-lying playmaker most effectively throughout his career.
John Oster.position: Midfielder Winger Winger,Midfielder Deep lying playmaker deep lying playmaker

Stephen Clemence.name: Stephen Clemence
Stephen Clemence.intro:
'''Stephen Neal Clemence''' (born 31 March 1978) is a retired English Association footballfootball midfielder who last played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City where he was team captain.
Clemence began his career with Tottenham Hotspur, where he spent six years as a professional, but never established himself as a regular first-team player. He was capped once for England national under-21 football teamEngland at under-21 level. He moved on to Birmingham City in 2003, where he was chosen player of the 2006–07 season, at the end of which he signed for Leicester City. An injury prone player, Clemence was well known for his passion, drive, leadership and commitment on the pitch. He suffered a series of long-term injuries in his career, the worst being a damaged heel while at Leicester, which brought his career to an end after 18 months on the sidelines. After retirement he joined the coaching staff at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland before moving to Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as reserve team manager.

Lee Naylor.name: Lee Naylor
Lee Naylor.intro:
'''Lee Martyn Naylor''' (born 19 March 1980) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County.
Naylor started his career with Football League First DivisionFirst Division side Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, joining the club in 1996. He made his debut the following year and soon established himself as the first choice left back.
His first trophy came when Wolves win the 2003 Football League First Division play-off Final, gaining them promotion to the Premier League where he continued to play in the first team. Naylor moved to Scottish Premier League side Celtic F.C.Celtic in 2006 for a fee of £600,000 plus Charlie Mulgrew. Naylor quickly established himself as first choice left back for Celtic and was nominated for the SPFA Players' Player of the Year2007 SPFA Player of the Year award. During his time at Celtic Naylor won the Scottish Premier League twice in Scottish Premier League 2006-072007 and Scottish Premier League 2007-082008 as well as the Scottish Cup in Scottish Cup 2006-072007. Naylor moved to English Championship side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in 2010 after his contract expired at Celtic.
Naylor represented England under-21 national football teamEngland under-21s several times but despite being linked with the England national football teamfull national team, while at Celtic, he never received a call-up.
Lee Naylor.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990).name: Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990)
Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990).intro:
'''Daniel Lee "Danny" Rose''' (born 2 July 1990) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur as a Defender (association football)#Full backleft back and a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
Rose started his professional career at Leeds United F.C.Leeds United in 2006, having progressed through the club's youth ranks, but left for current club Tottenham Hotspur in July 2007, having never played for Leeds. Having failed to break into the first team, he joined Watford F.C.Watford on loan in March 2009, making seven appearances, and then joined Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United on loan in September 2009. Having made six appearances for Peterborough, he returned to Tottenham, and made his debut for the latter club. Having still been unable to establish himself as a regular player, he joined Bristol City F.C.Bristol City on loan in September 2010, and made 17 appearances. Although Rose became more involved in the Tottenham side during the 2011–12 season, making 20 appearances in all competitions, he spent the following season on loan to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, where he made 29 appearances.
Rose played for England national football teamEngland at the England national under-17 football teamunder-17 and England national under-19 football teamunder-19 levels before making his England national under-21 football teamunder-21 debut in 2009. Since then, he has established himself in the side, having made 29 appearances to date, although he is yet to make his full international debut.
Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990).position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Christian Eriksen.name: Christian Eriksen
Christian Eriksen.intro:
'''Christian Dannemann Eriksen''' (born 14 February 1992) is a Danish Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur as an attacking midfielder. He made his debut for the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team in March 2010, and was the youngest player of the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa.
In 2011, Eriksen was named Danish Football Player of the Year, Dutch Footballer of the Year#Dutch Football Talent of the Year (Young player)Dutch Football Talent of the Year, List of AFC Ajax records#AFC Ajax prize winnersAjax Talent of the Year (Marco van Basten Award), and made the 2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship#Team of the TournamentUEFA Euro U-21 Team of the Tournament. He won the Eredivisie with Ajax in 2010–11 Eredivisie2010–11, 2011–12 Eredivisie2011–12, and in 2012–13 Eredivisie2012–13 before signing with Tottenham Hotspur in August 2013. Eriksen won Tottenham Hotspur 'Player of the Year' award for the 2013–14 season. In 2015, Eriksen won the Danish Football Player of the Year for the second year in a row.

Hameur Bouazza.name: Hameur Bouazza
Hameur Bouazza.intro:
'''Hameur Bouazza''' (; born 22 February 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Red Star F.C.Red Star in the Championnat National. He usually plays as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger, but can also play on the right.
He has spent most of his football career in England, apart from brief spells in Turkey, Cyprus, Spain and Algeria. Although born in France, he plays for Algeria national football teamAlgeria as it is the birthplace of both his parents, who emigrated to France from Algeria.

Neil McCann.name: Neil McCann
Neil McCann.intro:
'''Neil Docherty McCann''' (born 11 August 1974 in Greenock, Inverclyde) is a former Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who is currently on the coaching staff of Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic.
His professional career saw him play for Dundee F.C.Dundee (two spells), Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian (two spells), Rangers F.C.Rangers, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Falkirk F.C.Falkirk. He also played 26 times for the Scotland national football team.

Szil\u00e1rd N\u00e9meth.name: Szilárd Németh
Szil\u00e1rd N\u00e9meth.intro:
'''Szilárd Németh''' (born 8 August 1977) is a retired SlovakiaSlovak Association footballfootballer who played as a striker.
After playing for clubs in his country of birth and the Czech Republic, he spent four-and-a-half seasons at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough of the Premier League from 2001 to 2006. After a brief stint at France's RC Strasbourg, he played for Alemannia Aachen in Germany until his retirement in 2010.
Németh is the second-highest scorer in the history of the Slovakia national football team, with 22 goals in 58 matches from 1997 to 2006.

Emerson Mois\u00e9s Costa.name: Emerson Moisés Costa
Emerson Mois\u00e9s Costa.intro:
'''Emerson Moisés Costa''' (born 12 April 1972 in Rio de Janeiro), simply '''Emerson''', is a Brazilian retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
As well as in his country, he played professionally in Portugal, England, Spain and Scotland. He also received Portuguese nationality lawPortuguese citizenship after he married his Portuguese peoplePortuguese wife.

Al Bangura.name: Al Bangura
Al Bangura.intro:
'''Alhassan "Al" Bangura''' (born 24 January 1988 in Freetown, Sierra Leone) is a Sierra Leone association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for League One side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
He has played for the Sierra Leone national football teamSierra Leone national team and is notable for having been the victim of human trafficking when he was a teenager and also the subject of a deportation case in the United Kingdom in 2007.

Brian Linighan.name: Brian Linighan
Brian Linighan.intro:
'''Brian Linighan''' (born 2 November 1973) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. He started his career at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, making just one appearance on 11 January 1994cite web
url=
title=Brian Linighan and was sold to Bury F.C.Bury in 1998. After that, he played for non-league sides Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity, Worksop Town F.C.Worksop Town and Whitby Town F.C.Whitby Town. He is the younger brother of former Arsenal F.C.Arsenal Defender (football)defender Andy Linighan and former Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town Defender (football)defender David Linighan.

Didier Digard.name: Didier Digard
Didier Digard.intro: '''Didier Frédéric Digard''' (born 12 July 1986) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays for Ligue 1 club OGC NiceNice as a midfielder, having previously played for Le Havre ACLe Havre, Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. He has represented France at youth international level.

Tyrone Mears.name: Tyrone Mears
Tyrone Mears.intro: '''Tyrone Mears''' (born 18 February 1983 in Stockport) is a professional footballer who currently plays as a right-back for Seattle Sounders FC. His previous clubs include Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, West Ham United, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Olympique de Marseille and Burnley F.C.Burnley. From Oldham in the north of England, Mears once played for the Jamaica national football team despite not being eligible to do so.
Tyrone Mears.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Micah Hyde.name: Micah Hyde
Micah Hyde.intro:
'''Micah Anthony Hyde''' (born 10 November 1974) is an EnglandEnglish-born Jamaican former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1993 to 2012.
He notably played for Watford F.C.Watford and was part of the Hornets squad that played in the Premier League during the 1999–00 season. He made over 250 league appearances for the club between 1997 and 2004, having previously played for Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United and FinlandFinnish club Euran Pallo. Following his departure from Watford he went on to play for Burnley F.C.Burnley and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United before slipping out of professional football in 2009 where he joined Conference Premier side Woking F.C.Woking.
He briefly returned to the Football League with Barnet F.C.Barnet before returning to finish his career in Non-league with Billericay Town F.C.Billericay Town, Aveley F.C.Aveley and St Albans City F.C.St Albans City. During his career he made 17 appearances for Jamaica national football teamJamaica, scoring once.

Steve McManaman.name: Steve McManaman
Steve McManaman.intro:
'''Steven "Steve" McManaman''' (born 11 February 1972) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder, Winger (soccer)winger and playmaker for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. McManaman is the most decorated English footballer to have played abroad, with the UEFA website stating that "of all England's footballing exports in the modern era, none was as successful as McManaman."url="
After nine years at Liverpool, during which time he won the FA Cup and Football League CupLeague Cup, McManaman moved to Real Madrid in 1999. The transfer became one of the most controversial and high profile Bosman rulings of all time. He became the first English player to win the UEFA Champions League with a non-English club in 2000, and two years later became the first English player to win the Champions League twice. He also won La Liga twice before moving to Manchester City in 2003, and retiring from football in 2005. After his retirement he worked as a football Pundit (expert)pundit for Setanta Sports, ESPN and BT Sport. In 2008, he was ranked third in a Top 10 of the greatest British footballers to play overseas, just behind Kevin Keegan and John Charles.

Pierre Laurent.name: Pierre Laurent
Pierre Laurent.intro: '''Pierre Laurent''' (born December 13, 1970 in Tulle, France) is a former Association footballfootball (soccer) player who played as a Forward (football)forward.

Ben Sahar.name: Ben Sahar
Ben Sahar.intro:
'''Ben Sahar''' (, changed his last name from ''סהר''; born 10 August 1989) is an Israeli Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker who currently plays for Willem II (football club)Willem II in the Dutch Eredivisie.
At just 16, Sahar was already the equivalent of a second-year apprentice at Chelsea.  He first caught Chelsea's eye in an Under-16 fixture against Ireland in 2004 and has since played for the Israel national under-21 football teamIsraeli Under-21 national team and the Israel national football teamIsraeli national team. Before transferring to Chelsea, Sahar was on the Hapoel Tel Aviv F.C.Hapoel Tel Aviv books, and while he was promoted to the first team by the manager Itzhak Shum, Sahar did not feature in any matches due to his transfer being completed before the start of the 2006–07 season.
Before coming to Chelsea, he got Polish citizenship (his mother Batya is of Polish origin), which grants him an automatic right to play in the UK, as Poland is an European UnionEU member state.

Zavon Hines.name: Zavon Hines
Zavon Hines.intro: '''Zavon Hines''' (born 27 December 1988) is a professional Association footballfootballer for Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.Dagenham & Redbridge. Hines was born in Jamaica but has represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. He began his career with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a product of The Academy of Footballtheir youth team and has also played for  Burnley F.C.Burnley, Bradford City A.F.CBradford City and Loan (sports)on loan at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth.

Brian O'Neil (footballer, born 1972).name: Brian O'Neil (footballer, born 1972)
Brian O'Neil (footballer, born 1972).intro: '''Brian O'Neil''' (born 6 September 1972 in Paisley) is a former ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defensive midfielder. O'Neil was forced to retire from the playing staff of Preston North End F.C.Preston North End in October 2006, due to long standing injury problems.

Samba Diakit\u00e9.name: Samba Diakité
Samba Diakit\u00e9.intro: '''Samba Diakité''' (born 24 January 1989) is a French-born Malian Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and the Mali national football team.

Jimmy K\u00e9b\u00e9.name: Jimmy Kébé
Jimmy K\u00e9b\u00e9.intro: '''Jimmy Boubou Kébé''' (born 19 January 1984) is a French-born Malian Association footballfootballer who currently is a free agent. He plays as a Right wingerwinger, and is a Mali national football teamMalian international.

Stephan Andersen.name: Stephan Andersen
Stephan Andersen.intro: '''Stephan Maigaard Andersen''' (born 26 November 1981) is a DenmarkDanish professional association footballfootball player, who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Danish Superliga side F.C. Copenhagen. He is also a full international for the Denmark national football team and was chosen to represent his country at UEFA Euro 2004, the 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012.

Chuba Akpom.name: Chuba Akpom
Chuba Akpom.intro: '''Chuba Amechi Akpom''' (born 9 October 1995) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest on loan from Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He has represented England at youth international levels.

Roque Santa Cruz.name: Roque Santa Cruz
Roque Santa Cruz.intro:
'''Roque Luis Santa Cruz Cantero''' (; born 16 August 1981) is a Paraguayan peopleParaguayan Association footballfootballer who plays for Mexican club Cruz Azul as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker and is also captain of the Paraguay national football teamParaguayan national team.
Santa Cruz started his career with Club OlimpiaOlimpia Asunción, progressing through their youth system to the first-team squad where he made his debut at the age of 15 in 1997. He finished his career with the club having scored 13 goals in 24 Primera Division ParaguayaPrimera División appearances where Olimpia claimed the 1997, 1998 and 1999 Primera División titles. Santa Cruz scored three goals in four appearances for Paraguay at the 1999 FIFA World Youth Championship before debuting for the Paraguayan national team at the 1999 Copa América, where he scored three goals in four appearances. He immediately joined Bundesliga club Bayern Munich in August 1999 for a fee of €5million where he scored five goals in 28 league appearances in his first season. He faced a series of injuries and heavy competition from team mates Giovane Élber, Roy Makaay and Claudio Pizarro which limited his impact and restricted his appearances for the club.
He was part of the successful team for Bayern, winning numerous Bundesliga, DFB-Pokal and DFB-Ligapokal titles. He also won the 2000–01 UEFA Champions League and the 2001 Intercontinental Cup. He left Bayern Munich in July 2007 to join Blackburn Rovers for a transfer fee of €5 million where he scored 19 goals in the 2007–08 Premier League season. In June 2009, he joined Manchester City for a fee of £17.5 million on a four-year deal. Since his transfer, he was loaned out to Blackburn Rovers and Real Betis. Holder of a Spanish passport, Santa Cruz is eligible for unrestricted selection in all European Union-based sides.
Santa Cruz is currently the all-time leading goal scorer, with 30 goals, of the Paraguayan national team's history and the sixth ever player to reach 100 appearances. He represented the national team at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002, 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 FIFA World Cup tournaments, he also participated at the 1999 Copa América, 2007 Copa América and the 2011 Copa América, where Paraguay finished runners-up.

Nigel Quashie.name: Nigel Quashie
Nigel Quashie.intro: '''Nigel Francis Quashie''' ( ; born 20 July 1978) is a association footballfootballer who has played more than 300 games in the Football League. A midfielder, he plays for Icelandic club BÍ/Bolungarvík. Between 2004 and 2006, he represented Scotland national football teamScotland, the country of his grandfather, at full international level on 14 occasions.

Jamie Slabber.name: Jamie Slabber
Jamie Slabber.intro:
'''Jamie Andrew Slabber''' (born 31 December 1984) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Bromley F.C.Bromley as a forward (association football)striker. He started his career as a youth at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, where he made one appearance in the Premier League. Slabber was loaned out twice whilst at Spurs, to DenmarkDanish side Akademisk BoldklubAB in 2004 and to Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town in 2005.
He then dropped down into non-League football signing a short-term contract with Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town in April 2005 until the end of the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 season. The following season he moved to Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic, before joining Oxford United F.C.Oxford United on loan in November 2006. Slabber moved to Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough in January 2007, staying for five months before joining Havant & Waterlooville F.C.Havant & Waterlooville the following season. He returned to Grays Athletic in November 2008. Slabber signed for Conference South club Woking in December 2009. Slabber signed for Eastleigh F.C.Eastleigh in July 2010, before moving onto Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City in March 2012. Following a succefful spell with the Essex club, Slabber joined Sutton United F.C.Sutton United, where he scored 14 goals in 31 appearances during the 2013-14 season. This included two goals against Bromley F.C.Bromley, the club for which he and team-mate Damian Scannell would sign for at the end of the season.

Neil Shipperley.name: Neil Shipperley
Neil Shipperley.intro:
'''Neil Jason Shipperley''' (born 30 October 1974 in) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer turned manager.
As a player he played as a Forward (association football)centre-forward from 1992 until 2007 notably in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He also played in the Football League for Watford F.C.Watford, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon and Brentford F.C.Brentford. He was also capped 7 times by the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 team, scoring 3 goals. Following retirement he moved into management with Bedfont F.C.Bedfont before becoming manager of Walton Casuals F.C.Walton Casuals of the Isthmian League Division One South. He was manager of Southern Football League side North Greenford United F.C.North Greenford United having been in the post from December 2011 to May 2012, before leaving to pursue opportunities at a higher level, however he returned in October 2012 following the sacking of Jon-Barrie Bates, only to resign in February 2014.

Steve Whitton.name: Steve Whitton
Steve Whitton.intro: '''Stephen Paul "Steve" Whitton''' (born 4 December 1960) is a former EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer who played as a striker. He was born in East Ham, London.

Ollie Shenton.name: Ollie Shenton
Ollie Shenton.intro: '''Oliver''' "'''Ollie'''" '''Shenton''' (born 6 November 1997) is an English footballer who plays as a midfielder for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.

Blessing Kaku.name: Blessing Kaku
Blessing Kaku.intro:
'''Blessing Kaku''' (born 5 March 1978 in Ughelli, Nigeria) is a  former Nigeria national football teamNigerian international football (soccer)football player, who was a member of the national squad at the 2000 Summer Olympics in Sydney. He played for Enosis Neon Paralimni. He has also played for K.R.C. Genk in Belgium, Hapoel Be'er Sheva F.C.Hapoel Be'er Sheva, Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.Maccabi Tel Aviv, F.C. Ashdod, Maccabi Petah Tikva F.C.Maccabi Petah Tikva (all in Israel), Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, and Derby County F.C.Derby County but failed to make an impact in England in his short spells with the latter two clubs.
His transfer from F.C. Ashdod to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in August 2004 is one of those about which the 2006 allegations of corruption in English football#Stevens reportStevens inquiry report in June 2007 expressed concerns because of the apparent conflict of interest between agent Craig Allardyce, his father Sam Allardyce - the then manager at Bolton - and the club itself.cite news  title = What Stevens said about each club  publisher = www.telegraph.co.uk date = 16 June 2007 url =
accessdate =2007-06-17

Marco Materazzi.name: Marco Materazzi
Marco Materazzi.intro:
'''Marco Materazzi''' (, Order of Merit of the Italian RepublicUfficiale OMRI; born 19 August 1973) is an Italian Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back for and manages Indian Super League club Chennaiyin FCChennaiyin.
At the beginning of his career, Materazzi played with various Italian teams in Serie B and Serie C, and with Everton F.CEverton in the Premier League. He spent two periods with Perugia CalcioPerugia (1995–98 and 1999–2001) and signed for F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale, in 2001 for €10 million. At club level, he won a number of major honors with Inter including five Italian Serie ASerie A league titles in a row from 2006 to 2010, one UEFA Champions League, one FIFA Club World Cup, four Coppa Italia titles, and the Supercoppa Italiana four times.The Matrix – Marco Materazzi:
Materazzi earned 41 caps for Italy from his debut in 2001 until 2008, playing in two World Cups and two European Championships. He was one of the key players in the 2006 FIFA World Cup Final against France, as he scored Italy's goal and later, in extra time, he received a headbutt from Zinedine Zidane, which was punished with a red card. Italy then went on to win the World Cup in a penalty shoot-out, during which Materazzi scored again.
A controversial, racist and provocative figure in football, he was known for his very physical and aggressive style of play, as well as his tight marking and strong, harsh tackling, which led him to receive more than 60 yellow cards and 25 red cards throughout his playing career. Due to his temper, lack of discipline, racism, and his commitment to rash, heavy challenges, he has been involved in several altercations with other players during matches. ''The Times'' placed Materazzi at number 45 in their list of the 50 hardest football players in history. During the 2006-07 Serie A2006-07 season, Materazzi was voted the Serie A Defender of the Year.
Marco Materazzi.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Daryl Murphy.name: Daryl Murphy
Daryl Murphy.intro: '''Daryl Murphy''' (born 15 March 1983) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker or Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.

Diego Costa.name: Diego Costa
Diego Costa.intro:
'''Diego da Silva Costa''' (, ; born 7 October 1988), known earlier in his career simply as '''Diego''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Spain national football teamSpanish national team. He plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker and has been described by pundits as a player whose main attributes are his physicality, goalscoring and ability to keep possession.
He began his career with S.C. BragaBraga and FC PenafielPenafiel in Portugal, and was signed by Atlético Madrid in 2007. He was loaned back to Braga, and then to Celta de VigoCelta and Albacete BalompiéAlbacete before being sold to Real ValladolidValladolid in 2009. He returned to Atlético the following season and went on to play a key role in their attack, scoring 27 goals as they 2013–14 La Ligawon the league title in 2014, and then joined Chelsea for £32 million.
Internationally, Costa played twice for Brazil national football teamBrazil in 2013, but later declared his desire to represent Spain national football teamSpain, having been granted Spanish nationality lawSpanish citizenship in September 2013. He made his début for his adopted nation in March 2014, and was selected for 2014 FIFA World Cupthat year's World Cup.

Tim Cahill.name: Tim Cahill
Tim Cahill.intro:
'''Timothy Filiga "Tim" Cahill''' (born 6 December 1979) is an AustraliansAustralian professional association footballfootball player, who currently plays for Shanghai Greenland Shenhua F.C.Shanghai Shenhua in the Chinese Super League. Cahill is the Australia national soccer team records#Top goalscorersall-time top scorer for the Australia national soccer team. Prior to joining Shanghai, he played his club football for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Everton F.C.Everton and then New York Red Bulls. Cahill plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder, but has also played as a Forward (association football)forward on several occasions. A Midfielder#Box-to-box midfielderbox-to-box midfielder, Cahill has become recognised for "his direct and powerful approach and his late runs into the penalty area."
Cahill has become one of the highest profile footballers in the Asian Football Confederation (AFC), earning 81 caps and scoring 39 goals for his country. He was the first Australian to score at a FIFA World Cup and has scored the most goals by any Australian in the World Cup with five goals. In 2007 he became the first Australian player to score at an AFC Asian Cup. Cahill is known for his adept heading ability and high vertical leap, having scored a majority (20) of his goals with his head.

Fraser Forster.name: Fraser Forster
Fraser Forster.intro:
'''Fraser Gerard Forster''' (born 17 March 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton.
He started his career with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and had brief loan spells with Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers.  He then spent a successful season on loan at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, helping the club win the Football League OneLeague One title and promotion to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship.  Forster then joined Celtic F.C.Celtic on loan for the 2010–11 Celtic F.C. season2010–11 season, and helped them win the Scottish Cup.  He spent a further season on loan there, winning the Scottish Premier League before becoming a permanent squad member in 2012 in a £2.2 million transfer.  Forster won many plaudits for his performances at Celtic and holds the Scottish Premiership record of 1,256 minutes without conceding a goal. In August 2014, he joined Southampton for an estimated £10 million.
Forster was selected for several England national football teamEngland squads during 2012 and 2013 before finally making his first international appearance in November 2013, and was named in England's squad for the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Michel Ngonge.name: Michel Ngonge
Michel Ngonge.intro:
'''Félix-Michel Ngonge''' (born 17 August 1967 in Huy, Liège (province)Liège Province, Belgium) is a retired professional association footballfootballer. He played international football for Zaire national football teamZaire, and later the renamed Congo DR national football teamDemocratic Republic of Congo team.
He started his footballing career in Belgium with Racing Jet de Bruxelles (4549), K.A.A. Gent (7), R.F.C. Seraing (17), R.A.A. Louviéroise (93) and K.R.C. Harelbeke (1615) at the late age of 28, before moving to TurkeyTurkish side Samsunspor and then Watford F.C.Watford in June 1998.
During his time at Watford he became an integral part of the team scoring 11 goals in 56 games. He also played an important role in the 1998/1999 season in which Watford gained promotion to the Premier League for the first time, via the play-offs.Ngonge scored 6 goals in his first season at Watford, scoring the all-important goal in the first leg of the Division One play-off against Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. In the 1999/2000 season, despite starting the season well, scoring in the opening match of the season, Ngonge found himself out of favour at Vicarage Road and was loaned out to Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town in March 2000. Following the relegation of Watford back to Division 1 ( Football League Championship ) Ngonge failed to make much of an impression and was subsequently sold to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers for £50,000, where he played 15 games and scored 3 goals. Ngonge then finished his career at Scottish side Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock, where he scored 3 goals in his 12 games at the Rugby Park-based club.

Ander Herrera.name: Ander Herrera
Ander Herrera.intro:
'''Ander Herrera Agüera''' (; born 14 August 1989) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder for the English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United.
He began his career at Real Zaragoza before moving to his home-town club Athletic Bilbao in 2011, and then to Manchester United for €36 million in 2014. Herrera won tournaments with Spain at Spain national under-20 football teamUnder-20 and Spain national under-21 football teamUnder-21 level and represented the nation at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics.

Xisco (footballer, born 1986).name: Xisco (footballer, born 1986)
Xisco (footballer, born 1986).intro:
'''Francisco Jiménez Tejada''' (born 26 June 1986), commonly known as '''Xisco''', is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for RCD Mallorca on loan from Córdoba CF as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
After making a name for himself with Deportivo de La Coruña, he signed in 2008 with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, but in could only amass 11 official appearances for the club during his spell (one goal), also being loaned several times during his contract. He left in January 2013 and returned to his country.

Michele Padovano.name: Michele Padovano
Michele Padovano.intro: '''Michele Padovano''' (born 28 August 1966 in Turin) is an ItalyItalian retired football (soccer)football player.

Carles Gil.name: Carles Gil
Carles Gil.intro:
'''Carles Gil de Pareja Vicent''' (born 22 November 1992) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
He began his career at Valencia CFValencia, playing mostly in Valencia CF Mestallatheir reserves and making his debut with the first team in 2014. He also spent two seasons on loan at Elche CFElche, winning promotion to La Liga in 2012–13 Segunda División2013.

Adam Forshaw.name: Adam Forshaw
Adam Forshaw.intro: '''Adam Forshaw''' (born 8 October 1991) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough as a midfielder. He began his career in the Everton F.C. Reserves and Academyacademy at FA Premier LeaguePremier League side Everton F.C.Everton and came to prominence at Brentford F.C.Brentford, winning the Football League Awards2014 League One Player of the Year award.

Richard Shaw.name: Richard Shaw
Richard Shaw.intro:
'''Richard Edward Shaw''' (born 11 September 1968 in Brentford, London) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who was Caretaker Manager at Football League OneLeague One side Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1996 until 2008, notably in the Premier League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He also played in the Football League for both Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Millwall F.C.Millwall.

Dan Burn.name: Dan Burn
Dan Burn.intro: '''Daniel Johnson '''"'''Dan'''"''' Burn''' (born 9 May 1992) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham. He plays as a defender (association football)defender. Burn made his debut in the Football League for Darlington in 2009 and joined Fulham at the end of the 2010–11 season, having made 19 appearances for Darlington. He spent the 2012-13 in English football2012–13 season on loan to Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town, where he made 41 appearances.

Nii Lamptey.name: Nii Lamptey
Nii Lamptey.intro:
'''Nii Odartey Lamptey''' (born 10 December 1974) is a former Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer and current assistant manager of Sekondi Wise Fighters. During his career he played as a Forward (association football)striker from 1990 until 2008 notably for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, PSV Eindhoven, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and the Ghana national football team.
He is known foremost for his erratic career, in which he became a superstar as a teenager and then suffered a long string of failures which burnt him out well before his time. Lamptey has been used as a byword for a cautionary tale of putting too much pressure on young players to be successful.
He also played for R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht, F.B.C. Unione VeneziaVenezia, Unión de Santa FeUnión Santa Fe, Ankaragücü, U.D. LeiriaUnião Leiria, SpVgg Greuther FürthGreuther Fürth, Shandong Luneng Taishan F.C.Shandong Luneng, Al-Nassr, Asante Kotoko F.C.Asante Kotoko and Jomo Cosmos.

Michael Chopra.name: Michael Chopra
Michael Chopra.intro:
'''Rocky Michael Chopra''' (born 23 December 1983), known as '''Michael Chopra''', is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Scottish Championship club Alloa Athletic F.C.Alloa Athletic.
A product of the Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academyyouth system, he spent six years at the club without managing to secure a regular first team place, instead spending time on loan at Watford F.C.Watford, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. He was sold to Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City for £500,000 in June 2006, and won a place on the PFA Team of the Year for his performances in the 2006–07 season. He then made a £5 million move to Premier League side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in July 2007, before returning to Cardiff on a loan deal that was made permanent in July 2009 for £3 million. He again was named on the PFA Team of the Year for the 2009–10 campaign, before being sold on to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town for £1 million in June 2011. He joined Blackpool F.C.Blackpool on a free transfer in July 2013, before moving to the Indian Super League with Kerala Blasters FCKerala Blasters for the inaugural 2014 season.
He has represented England at the England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 levels. In 2006, he scored what was then the fastest goal by a substitute in Premier League history, scoring after being on the pitch for 15 seconds. With an Indian father, he was also the first player of Indian parentage to play and score in the Premier League. A gambling addict, during the peak of his football career he was in severe debt and had to seek professional help to overcome his addiction.

Gareth Davies (footballer, born 1973).name: Gareth Davies (footballer, born 1973)
Gareth Davies (footballer, born 1973).intro:
'''Gareth Davies''' (born 11 December 1973 in Hereford) is a retired Welsh peopleWelsh footballer who played as a central defender. His career was ended prematurely after a long-term knee injury.
Although he was born in England he grew up just across the border in Wales, and represented them at Wales national under-21 football teamUnder 21 level. He joined his local club Hereford United F.C.Hereford United as a trainee and made his debut for the first team in 1992. He was sold to Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1995 for a £120,000 fee, and was later transferred for £175,000 to Reading F.C.Reading. He made one Premier League appearance for Crystal Palace in a game against Leicester City.cite news
url=
title=Izzet's late leveller rewards Leicester's fighting spirit
publisher=The Independent
date=6 December 1997 accessdate=12 November 2009
location=London
first=Paul
last=Newman
He first suffered an injury to his knee while playing for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, which severely restricted his appearances for the club. He retired from professional football in 2002 and played for Chippenham Town F.C.Chippenham Town, before retiring from football altogether in 2003 to work in the recruitment industry.

Ryan Taylor (footballer, born 1984).name: Ryan Taylor (footballer, born 1984)
Ryan Taylor (footballer, born 1984).intro:
'''Ryan Anthony Taylor''' (born 19 August 1984) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender or midfielder for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.
He began his career at Tranmere Rovers before moving to Wigan Athletic for £750,000 in 2005. He has been at Newcastle since January 2009. Noted for his free kicks, Taylor's career has been marred by injury. He earned 4 caps for England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21 in 2005.
