Alex Nimely.name: Alex Nimely
Alex Nimely.intro:
'''Alex Tchuimeni-Nimely''' (born 11 May 1991), commonly known as '''Alex Nimely''', is a Liberian-born English peopleEnglish footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Football League OneLeague One side Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He is the elder brother of Liberia national football teamLiberia international Sylvanus Nimely.
An England national under-20 football teamEngland under-20 international, he played for Mighty Barrolle (Liberia) and Coton Sport FC de GarouaCoton de Garoua (Cameroon) before joining Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2008. He spent six years at the club but only played one Premier League game, and instead spent time on loan at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He signed with Port Vale in November 2014.

Eddie Newton.name: Eddie Newton
Eddie Newton.intro:
''' Edward John Ikem "Eddie" Newton''' (born 13 December 1971) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and was the assistant manager of Premier League side Chelsea F.C.Chelsea to manager Roberto Di Matteo before he was replaced by Rafael Benítez.
As a player he was a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder from 1990 until 2001 notably for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea where he scored in the 1997 FA Cup final. He also played in the Football League for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United and Barnet F.C.Barnet and in the Conference National for Hayes F.C.Hayes. He also earnt two caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 side.

Danny Hill.name: Danny Hill
Danny Hill.intro: '''Danny Hill''' (born 1 October 1974) is an English Association footballfootball who plays as a midfielder (football)midfielder.

Hei\u00f0ar Helguson.name: Heiðar Helguson
Hei\u00f0ar Helguson.intro:
'''Heiðar Helguson''' (born 22 August 1977) is an  Icelandic former association footballfootballer who played as a striker. He started his career in the Icelandic league system, with UMFS Dalvík and Knattspyrnufélagið ÞrótturÞróttur. Following a one-season spell in Norway with Lillestrøm SK, Heiðar moved to England to join Watford F.C.Watford in 1999, with Lillestrøm receiving a transfer fee of £1.5 million. The English media anglicised his name to '''Heidar''' when he joined Watford – it is by this given name that he is commonly known in England.
Although Watford were relegated from the Premier League during his first season at the club, Heiðar was a prolific goalscorer, finishing as the team's top scorer in the 1999–2000 Watford F.C. season1999–2000, 2002–03 Watford F.C. season2002–03 and 2004–05 Watford F.C. season2004–05 seasons, before being sold to Fulham F.C.Fulham in 2005. He played Premier League for them between 2005 and 2007, and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton until 2009, before transferring to Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Queens Park Rangers F.C.QPR in 2009. After a return to Watford on loan in the 2009–10 Watford F.C. season2009–10 season, Helguson played regularly for QPR in 2010–11, as they secured promotion to the Premier League as champions. In QPR's first Premier League season since 1995–96, Heiðar finished as the team's top scorer, helping them to secure Premier League survival on the last day of the 2011–12 season. He subsequently joined Cardiff City.
Heiðar played and scored for his country at under-19 and under-21 levels, before making his debut for the senior team in 1999. He earned 55 cap (football)caps for Iceland, scoring 13 goals, before retiring from international football in 2011.

Lilian Nalis.name: Lilian Nalis
Lilian Nalis.intro: '''Lilian Bernard Pierre Nalis''' (born 29 September 1971) is a French former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. Born in Nogent-sur-Marne, he played in Ligue 1 for Stade Malherbe CaenCaen, En Avant de GuingampGuingamp, Le Havre ACLe Havre and SC Bastia, Serie A for A.C. ChievoVeronaChievo, the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, and the Football League for Leicester, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town.

Luis Antonio Jim\u00e9nez.name: Luis Antonio Jiménez
Luis Antonio Jim\u00e9nez.intro:
'''Luis Antonio Jiménez Garcés''' (born 17 June 1984), more commonly known as '''Luis Jiménez''', is a Chilean–PalestinePalestinian Association footballfootballer who plays for Al-Ahli Dubai as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
He was also a member of the Chile national football teamChilean national team, and scored 2 goals in 22 appearances for them, playing at the Copa América in 2004 Copa América2004 and 2011 Copa América2011.

Matt Heath.name: Matt Heath
Matt Heath.intro: '''Matthew Philip "Matt" Heath''' (born 1 November 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Harrogate Town F.C. Harrogate Town. Heath has previously played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and in the Football League for Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and Southend United F.C.Southend United.

James Harper.name: James Harper
James Harper.intro: '''James Alan John Harper''' (born 9 November 1980) is an English association footballfootballer who plays in Midfieldermidfield for Basingstoke Town F.C.Basingstoke Town.

George Boyd.name: George Boyd
George Boyd.intro:
'''George Jan Boyd''' (born 2 October 1985) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Burnley F.C.Burnley.
Boyd started his career in the Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic youth system, joining Stevenage F.C.Stevenage Borough of the Conference National in 2001 and making his first-team debut in 2002. Boyd spent five seasons at Stevenage, scoring over thirty goals from midfield in all competitions. He left in January 2007 to join Football League TwoLeague Two side Peterborough United for a fee of £260,000, and won two successive promotions in the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 and 2008–09 in English football2008–09 seasons. In March 2010, Boyd joined Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest on loan until the end of the 2009–10 in English football2009–10 season. On return to his parent club in July 2010, Boyd signed a new three-year contract at Peterborough. In February 2013, Boyd joined Hull City on loan for the remainder of the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 season, and he helped the club earn promotion back to the Premier League during his time there. Shortly after the end of the season, he signed for the club on a permanent basis.
He also played for the England C national football teamEngland National Game XI team, who represent England at non-League footballnon-League level, from 2005 to 2006, earning six cap (sport)caps and scoring one goal. Although Boyd was born in England, his maternal grandfather comes from Scotland and after playing for the Scotland B national football teamScotland B team in 2009, he earned his first cap at Scotland national football teamsenior level in 2013.

Jamie McClen.name: Jamie McClen
Jamie McClen.intro:
'''James David "Jamie" McClen''' (born 13 May 1979 in Cramlington, Northumberland) is a retired English Association footballfootball player who Football (soccer) positionsplayed as a Defender (football)defender or midfielder.
He attended St. Benet Biscop Catholic High School in Bedlington, Northumberland. He honed his footballing skills at the youth academy of Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United at the age of 10 after being spotted whilst playing for Cramlington Juniors.

Claus Lundekvam.name: Claus Lundekvam
Claus Lundekvam.intro: '''Claus Lundekvam''' (; born 22 February 1973) is a former Norwegian Association footballfootballer, who spent most of his career at English side Southampton F.C.Southampton. He played for Southampton in the 2003 FA Cup Final against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. Lundekvam was capped 40 times playing for Norway national football teamNorway.

Kieran Lee.name: Kieran Lee
Kieran Lee.intro: '''Kieran Christopher Lee''' (born 22 June 1988) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentre midfielder or Defender (association football)#Full-backfull-back for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, having signed on a free transfer from Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic in May 2012. He began his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but left for Oldham on a free in May 2008. He played on loan at Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers during the 2007–08 season.

Pierre-Yves Andr\u00e9.name: Pierre-Yves André
Pierre-Yves Andr\u00e9.intro:
'''Pierre-Yves André''' (born 14 May 1974 in Lannion, Côtes-d'Armor) is a retired French Association footballfootballer. He spent most of his career playing for SC Bastia, and retired after the club suffered relegation to the French third tier following the 2009–10 Ligue 22009–10 season.
In 2003, André had a six-month loan spell at the English club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and successfully helped the side stave off relegation.

Dmitri Kharine.name: Dmitri Kharine
Dmitri Kharine.intro:
'''Dmitri Viktorovich Kharine''' (, (born 16 August 1968 in Moscow) is a Russian former professional association footballfootballer turned goalkeeping coach.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1982 until 2004, notably in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, after playing  for  Moscow clubs FC Torpedo MoscowTorpedo, Dynamo MoscowDynamo and PFC CSKA MoscowCSKA. He finished his professional career in the Scottish Premier League with Celtic F.C.Celtic, before returning to England to play for non-league Hornchurch F.C.Hornchurch. He earned international caps for the USSR national football teamUSSR, CIS national football teamCIS and the Russia national football teamRussian national football teams. Kharine joined Luton Town F.C.Luton Town in 2004 as goalkeeping coach, and remained with the club until 2013.

Mark Clyde.name: Mark Clyde
Mark Clyde.intro: '''Mark Graham Clyde''' (born 27 December 1982, Limavady) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former professional Association footballfootballer, who played for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and represented Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland. His career was cut short by persistent injuries aged 24 but later made a successful return to football with Worcester City F.C.Worcester City, earning a contract after a successful trial.

Marc-Antoine Fortun\u00e9.name: Marc-Antoine Fortuné
Marc-Antoine Fortun\u00e9.intro:
'''Marc-Antoine Fortuné''' (born 2 July 1981) is a French professional association footballfootballer who plays as a striker (association football)striker for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.
Fortuné started his professional career at Angoulême CFCAngoulême in 1998, and made 63 league appearances in four seasons before switching to Lille OSCLille in 2002, where he made 16 league appearances. He spent the 2003-04 Ligue 22003–04 season on loan to FC RouenRouen, making 34 league appearances, and switched permanently to Stade Brest in July 2004. He made 33 league appearances in his single season at Stade Brest, and moved to FC UtrechtUtrecht in 2005, where he made 53 league appearances. He joined AS Nancy in January 2007, and made 71 league appearances, also spending a six-month loan to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion from January 2009 until the end of the 2009-10 West Bromwich Albion F.C. season2009–10 season. Having made 17 appearances for West Brom, he joined Celtic F.C.Celtic in July 2009, and made 32 appearances in his solitary season for the club. He rejoined West Brom in August 2010, this time on a permanent deal, and made 62 league appearances for the club, also spending a month on loan to Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in 2011, making 5 league appearances for the club. He joined current club Wigan Athletic in July 2013.

Mauro Formica.name: Mauro Formica
Mauro Formica.intro:
'''Mauro Abel Formica''' (born 4 April 1988) is an Argentine association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Cruz Azul in Mexico.
He is nicknamed ''el Gato'' (''the cat'').

Glenn Helder.name: Glenn Helder
Glenn Helder.intro: '''Glenn Helder''' (born 28 October 1968 in Leiden) is a former NetherlandsDutch football (soccer)footballer.  He was a product of Ajax Amsterdam's youth system, though to get first team football he moved to Sparta Rotterdam in 1989 where he played 93 games, scoring nine goals.  In 1993 he moved to Vitesse Arnhem where he played 52 games, scoring 12 goals and attracting the interest of English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.

Sean Dundee.intro: '''Sean William Dundee''' (born 7 December 1972 in Durban) is a South African-GermanyGerman Association footballfootballer.

BournemouthBournemouth before finishing his career in Non-league with Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.Dagenham & Redbridge and Waltham Forest F.C.Waltham Forest.

Johnnie Jackson.name: Johnnie Jackson
Johnnie Jackson.intro: '''John Alec "Johnnie" Jackson''' (born 15 August 1982) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic where he is captain. He usually plays as a Midfieldercentral midfielder or as a Midfielderleft sided midfielder but can also play as a Defender (association football)left-back.

Johann Smith.name: Johann Smith
Johann Smith.intro: '''Johann Smith''' (born April 25, 1987 in Hartford, Connecticut) is an United StatesAmerican Association footballsoccer player who currently plays for FC Edmonton in the North American Soccer League as a Forward (association football)forward, Midfielder#Wingerwinger, and Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.

Danny Crow.name: Danny Crow

Lewis Kinsella.intro: '''Lewis Kinsella''' (born 2 September 1994) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.

Abel Xavier.name: Abel Xavier
Abel Xavier.intro:
'''Faisal Abel Xavier'''  (born '''Abel Luís da Silva Costa Xavier''' () on 30 November 1972) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back, and is the current coach of S.C. Farense.
Xavier played for clubs in Portugal, Italy, Spain, the Netherlands, England, Turkey and Germany before retiring with Los Angeles Galaxy of Major League Soccer in 2008.
From his debut in 1993, Xavier played 20 games for the Portugal national football teamPortugal national team, and was selected in their squads for Euro 2000 and the 2002 FIFA World Cup.
Abel Xavier.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Owen Garvan.name: Owen Garvan
Owen Garvan.intro: '''Owen William Garvan''' (born 29 January 1988) is an Irish association footballfootballer who  plays as a midfieldercentral midfielder for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He previously played for the Irish schoolboy team Home Farm F.C.Home Farm, before moving to England to join Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.

Emmerson Boyce.name: Emmerson Boyce
Emmerson Boyce.intro:
'''Emmerson Orlando Boyce''' (born 24 September 1979) is a professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He usually plays as a Association football positions#Defenderright back, but can also play in the centre of defence or at right wingback.
Born in Aylesbury, England, Boyce started his career at the age of sixteen as an apprentice at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. He rose through the ranks and eventually established himself in the first team, and went on to make 185 league appearances for the club, scoring eight goals.
He joined Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace on a free transfer (football)free transfer in 2004, where he played in the Premier League for the first time, but he and his teammates were unable to prevent the club from being relegated to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship. He spent two years at the club, making 69 league appearances and scoring one goal.
After Crystal Palace failed to gain promotion, Boyce returned to Premier League football in 2006, this time with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic after completing a move for a fee of £1 million, and was a key player during his first season when the club narrowly avoided relegation. He has remained an active member of the first-team throughout his spell at Wigan, and is the club's Premier League appearance record holder.
In May 2013, he captained Wigan Athletic to victory in the 2013 FA Cup Final in a 1–0 win over Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
Boyce has also represented the Barbados national football teamBarbados national team, making his debut for the side in 2008.

Cameron Lancaster.name: Cameron Lancaster
Cameron Lancaster.intro: '''Cameron Paul Lancaster''' (born 5 November 1992) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Louisville City FCLouisville City.

Georgios Georgiadis.name: Georgios Georgiadis
Georgios Georgiadis.intro: '''Georgios Georgiadis''' (, born 8 March 1972) is a former Greek Association footballfootballer, now a football coach. He made 61 appearances for the Greece national football teamGreek national team, and played for several Greek clubs including Panathinaikos FC and two spells at PAOK FCPAOK Thessaloniki FC. He was also signed by the English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle for a season. Roberto Mancini.name: Roberto Mancini
Roberto Mancini.intro:
'''Roberto Mancini''' (; born 27 November 1964) is an ItaliansItalian Association footballfootball manager and former player, currently in charge as head coach of Inter Milan. As a player Mancini was best known for his time at U.C. SampdoriaSampdoria, where he played more than 550 matches, and helped them win the Serie A league title, four Coppa ItaliaCoppe Italia and the European Cup Winners' Cup, whilst being capped 36 times by Italy national football teamItaly. In 1997, after 15 years at Sampdoria, Mancini left the club to join S.S. LazioLazio where he won a further List of Italian football championsScudetto, Cup Winners' Cup, UEFA Super Cup and two more Coppe Italia.
As a player, he gained a penchant for becoming a future manager and would often give team talks at half-time and ultimately became an assistant to Sven-Göran Eriksson at Lazio near the end of his playing career.
Mancini's first manager role was at a cash stricken ACF FiorentinaFiorentina at only 35 years old and managed to win a Coppa Italia, but left with Fiorentina facing bankruptcy. Months later, he took over as manager at S.S. LazioLazio, where again he inherited financial constraints and was forced to lose a number of key players. With limited resources during his two season tenure, he managed to guide the club to another Coppa Italia.
In 2004, Mancini was given the chance to manage a major club with more resources when he was offered the manager's job at Inter Milan. During his first tenure at Inter, the club won three consecutive Serie ASerie A titles — an Inter club record  — and a European association football club records#Most consecutive wins (Big 5 Leagues).5B7.5D.5B8.5DEuropean record 17 consecutive league game victories stretching nearly half a season; Mancini became Inter's most successful manager in 30 years. Despite his domestic success, many pundits saw the repeated failure to win the coveted UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League as the main reason for his dismissal in 2008.
After being out of football for over a year, Mancini was appointed Manchester City F.C.Manchester City manager in December 2009. Under his stewardship, he instilled a winning culture at the club taking Manchester City from a mid-table club to the pinnacle of English football. In the 2010–11 in English football2010–11 season, his first full season at Manchester City, Mancini guided the club to Champions League football and the 2011 FA Cup FinalFA Cup. In the 2011–12 in English football2011–12 season, Mancini guided Manchester City to the club's first league title in 44 years, in an enthralling last day of the season, winning 3–2, with two goals in Last-minute goalinjury time in what was called "the best match of the best last day of the season in English football history". Under Mancini, Manchester City progressed to the 2013 FA Cup Final, but were defeated by Wigan Athletic 1–0. Mancini was sacked on 13 May 2013,
Mancini has won a total of 25 trophies; 13 as a player and 12 as a manager. Regarded as a cup specialist, Mancini has reached at least a semi-final of a major national cup competition in every season he has been a manager, from 2002 to 2013. He holds a number of records including most consecutive Coppa Italia#FinalsCoppa Italia finals from 2004 to 2008, with 2003–04 Coppa ItaliaLazio once in 2004 and with Inter in the following four seasons.

Rory Delap.name: Rory Delap
Rory Delap.intro:
'''Rory John Delap''' (born 6 July 1976) is a former Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder. Born in England, he made 11 appearances for the Republic of Ireland national football team.
Delap started his career at Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and impressed enough to earn a move to Premiership side Derby County F.C.Derby County in 1998. In 2001, Delap joined Southampton F.C.Southampton for a club record of £4 million. After spending five years on the south coast, he moved to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. Following a brief spell on Wearside, Delap was loaned to Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in October 2006. In just his second match for Stoke, against his parent club Sunderland, Delap suffered a broken leg. Despite this, Delap signed a permanent contract for Stoke in January 2007. He went on to become a vital member of the squad and his long throw-ins helped Stoke gain promotion to the Premier League and consolidate in the league.
A midfielder by trade, he was renowned for his long throw-in ability.[
He is currently coaching the Derby County F.C.Derby County under-14s and has recently completed his UEFA B coaching license.

Christian Benteke.name: Christian Benteke
Christian Benteke.intro: '''Christian Benteke Liolo''' (born 3 December 1990) is a Belgian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Premier League club Aston Villa FC and the Belgian national football teamBelgium national team.

Luc Nijholt.name: Luc Nijholt
Luc Nijholt.intro:
'''Luc Nijholt''' (born 29 July 1961) is a Dutch association footballfootball manager and a former player, who played for a number of clubs, both home and abroad.
Nijholt began his career in the early 1980s with HFC HaarlemHaarlem, spending six years with the club. Nijholt was a member of the famous Haarlem team that competed in the UEFA Cup in the 1982-1983 season, for the first time in the club's history. However this campaign was to be overshadowed by the Luzhniki disaster. He then moved on to single seasons with AZ (football club)AZ, FC UtrechtUtrecht and SwitzerlandSwiss side Old Boys. In 1990, Nijholt moved to ScotlandScottish side Motherwell F.C.Motherwell and helped them win the Scottish Cup 1990-91Scottish Cup in his first season.
In 1993, he moved to EnglandEnglish side Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town for a fee of £175,000, spending two years with ''The Robins''. He joined them after they won promotion to the FA Premier League, but couldn't prevent from being relegated after just one reason with a mere five wins and a defence that leaked 100 goals in the league. However, he did score his only goal for Swindon on 19 March 1994 in a surprise 2-2 home draw against that season's Double (association football)double winners Manchester United. A year later he was part of the side which reached the Football League Cup semi finals but suffered a second successive relegation.
After leaving Swindon in 1995, Nijholt joined Volendam and spent three years with them before retiring in 1998.
Nijholt became manager of Stormvogels Telstar in 2005 and has since declared his interest in managing former clubs Swindon and Motherwell, although neither application was successful.
His son is Gianluca Nijholt. He was the  assistant-trainer of FC Red Bull Salzburg (Austria) during 2008-09 season.  In 2010 he reunited with Co Adriaanse and is part of his coaching staff with the Qatar national team.

Juan Cobi\u00e1n.name: Juan Cobián

A former Argentinian under-23 international, Cobián joined Sheffield Wednesday from Boca Juniors before the start of the FA Premier League 1998-991998-99 Premiership season. He made 9 league appearances for the club before receiving a free transfer to Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. After a spell at Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen, he joined Swindon on a Bosman rulingBosman free transfer during the 2000/2001 pre-season. He made his debut for the Town in the Football League CupLeague Cup, in a 1-1 draw with Exeter on 22 August 2000, his league debut came just four days later in a 4-1 defeat at home to Walsall.
Juan Cobi\u00e1n.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

'''Igor Bališ''' (born 5 January 1970) is a former Slovakian football (soccer)footballer. Bališ played for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in England. He has also appeared for Spartak Trnava and ŠK Slovan BratislavaSlovan Bratislava, as well as the Slovakia national football teamSlovakia national team.
Bališ joined Albion in November 2000 for £150,00. He made his Albion debut on 23 December 2000, coming on as a late substitute in a 3–0 win against Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. Despite being a penalty specialist in international football he failed to convey this when arriving at West Brom and it was only later discovered that he was the international penalty taker for Slovakia. This came in useful when he converted a dramatic stoppage time penalty against Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in the penultimate game of the 2001–02 in English football2001–02 season, which put Albion on the brink of promotion to the Premier League. After completing a season in the Premiership with Albion, Bališ quit the club and returned home to Slovakia, after suffering a recurrence of tinnitus.cite news date=9 July 2003 url=
title=Balis ends Baggies career publisher=BBC Sport accessdate=22 April 2007
Igor Bali\u0161.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Dan Gosling.name: Dan Gosling
Dan Gosling.intro: '''Daniel "Dan" Gosling''' (born 1 February 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth as a midfieldercentre midfielder, midfielderright midfielder or Fullback (association football)right fullback. Gosling is a versatile player, having operated as a box-to-box midfielder on several occasions and occasionally deputised at right back to accommodate substitutions. His previous clubs are Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Everton F.C.Everton.

Paul Ritchie (footballer, born 1975).name: Paul Ritchie (footballer, born 1975)
Paul Ritchie (footballer, born 1975).intro: '''Paul Simon Ritchie''' (born 21 August 1975) is a Scottish association footballfootball player and coach. Ritchie started his playing career with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian (Hearts), making 133 league appearances for the club and helping it win the Scottish Cup in 1998 Scottish Cup Final1998. He played for several clubs after leaving Hearts during the 1999–2000 season. Ritchie made seven appearances for the Scotland national football team between 1999 and 2004, scoring one goal. Since retiring as a player he has worked as a football coach, most recently as assistant coach with Vancouver Whitecaps FC in Major League Soccer.

Erik Edman.name: Erik Edman
Erik Edman.intro:
'''Erik Kenneth Edman''' (; born 11 November 1978) is a retired Swedish Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. His last club was Helsingborgs IF in Allsvenskan.
Edman earned 57 caps for Sweden national football teamSweden from his debut in 2001, and was selected for two FIFA World Cups and Euro 2004.

Claude Mak\u00e9l\u00e9l\u00e9.name: Claude Makélélé
Claude Mak\u00e9l\u00e9l\u00e9.intro:
'''Claude Makélélé Sinda''' (; born 18 February 1973) is a retired French Association footballfootballer and current manager.
In his playing career, which ended at Paris Saint-Germain, Makélélé also played for FC NantesNantes, Olympique de Marseille, Celta de VigoCelta Vigo, Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He won league titles in  France, Spain and England. Makélélé was a French international for 13 years, and part of the team which reached the final of the 2006 FIFA World Cup.
Makélélé has been credited with redefining the defensive midfield role in English football, especially during the 2004–05 FA Premier League season when Chelsea F.C.Chelsea won the title with 95 points. In homage to Makélélé, many fans and pundits alike have dubbed the defensive midfield position as the "Makélélé Role."

Gary Taylor-Fletcher.name: Gary Taylor-Fletcher
Gary Taylor-Fletcher.intro:
'''Gary Taylor-Fletcher''' (né '''Fletcher''', born 4 June 1981) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall, on loan from Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He has scored in each of the top five divisions of English football. He has been known as ''Gary Taylor-Fletcher'' since his marriage to Viv Taylor in June 2004.cite web
url=
title=All change for front man Fletch
publisher=Lincoln City F.C. Official Website
date=2 July 2004
accessdate=24 May 2010
Taylor-Fletcher began his senior career at Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria in 1999, and made 43 league appearances whilst at the club. Towards the end of his time there, he had a brief loan spell with Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, before switching permanently to Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient in June 2001. He struggled to break into the Leyton Orient team, and spent a loan spell at Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic, and two at Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.Dagenham & Redbridge. In August 2003, after 21 league appearances for Leyton Orient, Taylor-Fletcher joined Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City; a successful spell saw him play 90 league games in two seasons. He then moved to Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town in June 2005, making 81 league appearances in two seasons. Taylor-Fletcher then joined Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in July 2007, and established himself as a regular player for the club. After 215 league appearances for Blackpool, he joined current club Leicester City in September 2013.

Wayne Collins.name: Wayne Collins
Wayne Collins.intro: '''Wayne Collins''' (born 4 March 1969) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football midfielder (football)midfielder.

Alan McLeary.name: Alan McLeary
Alan McLeary.intro:
'''Alan McLeary''' (born 6 October 1964 in Lambeth) is a retired English football defender. He spent the majority of his career at Millwall F.C.Millwall, but also had spells at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, as well as loan spells at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon.
In 1998, McLeary was appointed assistant manager at Millwall, and in May 1999, he was promoted to co-manager alongside longtime teammate Keith Stevens. The duo were sacked in September 2000. He later had a short spell as caretaker manager at Millwall following the departure of David Tuttle at the end of the 2005-06 season.

John Welsh.name: John Welsh
John Welsh.intro: '''John Joseph Welsh''' (born 10 January 1984 in Liverpool) is an English association footballfootball player who plays for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End. He was also captain of the England national under-20 football teamEngland under-20 team, and has been Cap (football)capped eight times for the England national under-21 football teamunder-21s. He represented England U20 at 2003 FIFA World Youth Championship.

C\u00e9dric Roussel.name: Cédric Roussel
C\u00e9dric Roussel.intro: '''Cédric Roussel''' (born 6 January 1978) is a Belgian football (soccer)football striker currently at RUS Beloeil in Belgium.

David Linighan.name: David Linighan
David Linighan.intro:
'''David Linighan''' (born 9 January 1965) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1982 until 2002.
He notably spent time in the Premier League with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and in the Scottish Premier League with Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic. He also played in the Football League for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town and Chester City F.C.Chester City. He also had spells in Non-league with Southport F.C.Southport and Hyde United F.C.Hyde United.

Nedum Onuoha.name: Nedum Onuoha
Nedum Onuoha.intro: '''Chinedum "Nedum" Onuoha''' (born 12 November 1986) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He is a defender, typically a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back, but he can also play at Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back.

Stephen Carr.name: Stephen Carr
Stephen Carr.intro:
'''Stephen Carr''' (born 29 August 1976) is an Irish former Association footballfootballer who played for and captained Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City from 2009 to 2013. He previously played for Premier League teams Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and, for a shorter spell, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. He is a former international player with the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. His primary position was Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, but had been known to deputise at left back or centre back when required.
In May 2013, he confirmed his intention to retire from football.
Stephen Carr.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Giorgos Donis.name: Giorgos Donis
Giorgos Donis.intro: '''Giorgos Donis''' () born on 22 October 1969 in Frankfurt, West Germany) is a retired professional football player and the current manager of Al-Hilal FC. He was the first ever GreeceGreek to play in the English Premier League. In England, he was also known as '''George Donis'''.

Darnell Furlong.name: Darnell Furlong
Darnell Furlong.intro: '''Darnell Anthony Furlong''' is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a Defender (association football)defender. He is the son of former Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers striker Paul Furlong.

Andy Robinson (footballer, born 1992).name: Andy Robinson (footballer, born 1992)
Andy Robinson (footballer, born 1992).intro: '''Andreas Sonny "Andy" Robinson''' (born 16 October 1992) is an English Association footballfootballer who primarily plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder for Gosport Borough F.C.Gosport Borough.

Gareth Farrelly.name: Gareth Farrelly
Gareth Farrelly.intro: '''Gareth Farrelly''' (born 28 August 1975 in Dublin) is an Irish footballer who played for both Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League, he also played six times for Republic of Ireland national football teamIreland. He last played for Warrington Town F.C.Warrington Town.

Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1990).name: Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1990)
Ashley Westwood (footballer, born 1990).intro: '''Ashley Roy Westwood''' (born 1 April 1990) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a midfielder.

Armand Traor\u00e9.name: Armand Traoré
Armand Traor\u00e9.intro: '''Armand Traoré''' (born 8 October 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back. Traoré is a product of the Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal Academy. He has represented France at France national youth football teamunder-19 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels, but has since opted to represent his parents' native country, Senegal, at the senior level.
Armand Traor\u00e9.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Hamilton Ricard.name: Hamilton Ricard
Hamilton Ricard.intro: '''Hámilton Ricard Cuesta''' (born 12 January 1974 in Quibdó) is a Colombian peopleColombian Association footballfootballer who plays for Colombian team Cortuluá as a striker, and has played for Deportivo Cali, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, CSKA Sofia, Club Atlético IndependienteIndependiente, Club Sport EmelecEmelec, Shonan Bellmare, APOEL F.C.APOEL, CD NumanciaNumancia, Danubio F.C.Danubio and Club de Deportes ConcepciónConcepción over the course of his career.

O'Neill Donaldson.name: O'Neill Donaldson
O'Neill Donaldson.intro: '''O'Neill McKay Donaldson''' (born 24 November 1969) is an EnglandEnglish former football (soccer)footballer.

Willie Boland.name: Willie Boland
Willie Boland.intro:
'''William John "Willie" Boland''' (born 6 August 1975 in Ennis, County Clare) is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Northern Football LeagueNorthern League side Guisborough Town F.C.Guisborough Town.
He notably played in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, and in the Football League for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United. He has also played for Limerick F.C.Limerick.

Lee Carsley.name: Lee Carsley
Lee Carsley.intro: '''Lee Kevin Carsley''' (born 28 February 1974) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played in the Football League and Premier League for Derby County F.C.Derby County, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Everton F.C.Everton and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. Although born in Birmingham, England, he represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland internationally. He played as a midfielder and is currently manager of the Brentford F.C. Reserves and Academy#Development SquadDevelopment Squad at Brentford F.C.Brentford.

Richard Stearman.name: Richard Stearman
Richard Stearman.intro: '''Richard James Michael Stearman''' (born 19 August 1987) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers of the Football League Championship. He is a versatile defender, being able to play in any defensive slot although primarily a centre half or right back.

Micky Adams.name: Micky Adams
Micky Adams.intro:
'''Michael Richard''' "'''Micky'''" '''Adams''' (born 8 November 1961) is an English peopleEnglish former professional association footballfootballer turned football manager who is in charge of Football League TwoLeague Two side Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. As a player he was a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back, and made a total of 438 league appearances in a nineteen-year professional career in the Football League, including five years with Southampton F.C.Southampton at the highest level. He began his managerial career as player-manager for Fulham F.C.Fulham in 1994 and has led several teams at varying levels with mixed success, being named Manager of the Season twice, sacked a number of times and earning four promotions for the teams he has managed.
Born in Sheffield, Adams was part of the youth team at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United from the age of twelve until released in 1977. He turned professional at the Third Division team Gillingham F.C.Gillingham in 1979, where he  established himself in the first team, winning a move in 1983 to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City who were in the First Division. He spent four years at Coventry before being sold on to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in 1987. He was bought by Southampton for £250,000 in 1989, where he enjoyed five years of top-flight football. He was loaned out to Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in 1994, before he signed with Fulham later in the year. Appointed as Fulham's player-manager in March 1996, he led the club out of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division in 1996–97 in English football1996–97, and was named as the Third Division Manager of the Season. Sacked by Fulham despite his success, he walked out on Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City after less than two weeks in charge, and instead took charge at Brentford F.C.Brentford in November 1997. He was sacked after the club were relegated at the end of the season. At this point he ended his playing career.
He joined Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest as assistant manager, taking charge for one Premier League game in a caretaker capacity. He returned to management with Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion in April 1999. He led the club to the Third Division title in 2000–01 in English football2000–01, winning the division's Manager of the Season award for a second time. He then moved to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as an assistant, before finally being named as the club's manager in April 2002. He took the club to the Premier League as Football League First DivisionFirst Division runners-up in 2002–03 in English football2002–03, though he tendered his resignation in October 2004, having failed to keep the club in the top-flight. He took charge at former club Coventry City in January 2005, though lost his job in January 2007 after failing to take the club out of the Football League ChampionshipChampionship. He returned to Brighton in May 2008, though his second spell in charge would only last nine months. He was appointed as manager of Port Vale in June 2009, before he departed for Sheffield United in December 2010, with Vale heading for promotion out of League Two. He failed to prevent United being relegated into Football League OneLeague One, and was sacked in May 2011; this enabled him to return to Port Vale as manager. Despite starting the season in administration, he led Vale to promotion into League One in 2012–13. He resigned as Vale manager in September 2014, and took charge at Tranmere Rovers the following month. He has been married twice and has four daughters and one son.
Micky Adams.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Gareth Barry.name: Gareth Barry
Gareth Barry.intro:
'''Gareth  Barry''' (born 23 February 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Everton F.C.Everton.
Barry moved to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa from Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion as a youngster, and spent 12 years at the club. He Captain (association football)captained Aston Villa and is ninth in their Aston Villa F.C. statistics and records#Most appearancesall-time list of appearances. In June 2009, he joined Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, where he won the FA Cup in 2011 and the Premier League title the following season. After a season on loan, he joined Everton on a 3-year contract in July 2014.
Barry is a former England national football teamEngland international, having won his first full cap (sport)cap in 2000 and captained the side in 2010 in a friendly against Egypt. He earned 53 caps in total, scoring 3 goals, and was included in England's squads at UEFA Euro 2000 and the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Trevor Challis.name: Trevor Challis
Trevor Challis.intro:
'''Trevor Challis''' (born October 23, 1975 in Paddington, England) is a former professional association footballfootballer who retired from the game after a number of operations in his knee. His most recent club was Eastleigh F.C.Eastleigh, where he played at left back.
Trevor was part of the successful Queens Park Rangers youth team that won the South East Counties League and Southern Junior Floodlit Cup final beating West Ham.
Trevor played in the premier league for Queens Park Rangers during the 1995-1996 season playing left back earning a call up for England under 21's in the Toulon tournament, making 2 appearances against Angola and Portugal. Trevor represented England at under 16,18,21 levels as well as Ireland at under 16 level. During the 1996-1997 season Trevor received a bad knee injury in a heavy challenge with Norwich city footballer Rob Newman. It took Trevor 20 months and 5 knee operations to regain full fitness, when ex team mate Ian Holloway invited Trevor to play for Bristol rovers and rebuild his career. Trevor won all 3 player of the year awards during the 1998-1999 season.
Trevor scored the winning penalty for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town when they beat Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town in the Conference National Playoff Final 20042004 Conference playoff final. Trevor also helped Weymouth f.c. to the conference south title in the 2005-2006 season.
In 2010 he started working for Bristol City FC and works as the Academy Recruitment Officer. Trevor now coaches in the youth development phase at Bristol city f.c.

Leon Andreasen.name: Leon Andreasen
Leon Andreasen.intro: '''Leon Hougaard Andreasen''' (born 23 April 1983 in Aidt, Jutland) is a DenmarkDanish professional Association footballfootball player, who plays as a defender (association football)defender or midfielder. He has won twenty caps and scored three goals for the Denmark national football team. He currently plays for Hannover 96.

Marlon Broomes.name: Marlon Broomes
Marlon Broomes.intro:
'''Marlon Charles Broomes''' (born 28 November 1977) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back from 1994 to 2012.
He also played as a Defender (association football)#Sweeper (libero)sweeper (leading to his nickname of "Broomes, the sweeper"), although he could play at Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back as well. He began his career in 1994 with Premier League club Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, he was part of the squad that went on to win the title in the 1994–95 season but didn't play a match all season. Whilst with Rovers he spent time on loan with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town. In September 2001 he notably scored the equaliser in Grimsby's 2-1 victory over Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the Football League CupLeague Cup third round. He later went on to join Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday permanently before moving on to Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. He dropped out of the professional game at the end of the 2010–11 season where he signed for Clitheroe F.C.Clitheroe. His stay with the club was brief and he moved back up the leagues by joining Conference North side Altrincham F.C.Altrincham. He left Alty at the conclusion of the 2011–12 season. In 1997 whilst a Blackburn player, Broomes was capped twice each by the England national under-20 football teamEngland U20 and England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 sides.
Marlon Broomes.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Patrick Colleter.name: Patrick Colleter
Patrick Colleter.intro: '''Patrick Colleter''' is a former French peopleFrench professional football player.
Patrick Colleter.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Steve Robinson (Northern Ireland footbal.name: Steve Robinson (Northern Ireland footballer)
Steve Robinson (Northern Ireland footbal.intro: '''Stephen "Steve" Robinson''' (born 10 December 1974) is a association footballfootball player and coach. During his career he played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland.

Dean Hammond.name: Dean Hammond
Dean Hammond.intro: '''Dean John Hammond''' (born 7 March 1983 in Hastings) is an English association footballfootball player who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He previously played in the Football League for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Adam Federici.name: Adam Federici
Adam Federici.intro:
'''Adam Jay Federici''' (born 31 January 1985) is an Australian association footballfootball (soccer) player who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Reading F.C.Reading and the Australia national association football teamAustralia national team.
Federici began his senior career at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2003, but was only there briefly and soon switched to A.S.D. Torres CalcioTorres. After a reasonably successful season for the Italian side, he joined Reading in 2005, and, following loan spells at Maidenhead United F.C.Maidenhead United, Northwood F.C.Northwood and Carshalton Athletic F.C.Carshalton Athletic, turned fully professional in 2006. A brief loan spell to Bristol City F.C.Bristol City followed, before Federici made his Reading debut during the 2006–07 Reading F.C. season2006–07 season. However, he was still unable to dislodge Marcus Hahnemann from the starting position, and remained second choice, even going on loan to Southend United F.C.Southend United in 2008. However, after this loan spell, an injury to Hahnemann gave Federici a prolonged run in the team, and he remained first choice for several seasons.

Florent Malouda.name: Florent Malouda
Florent Malouda.intro:
'''Florent Johan Malouda''' ( ; born 13 June 1980) is a French professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger for Ligue 1 side FC Metz.
He spent most of his career at Olympique LyonnaisLyon and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, winning four consecutive Ligue 1 titles with the former and the UEFA Champions League in 2012 UEFA Champions League Final2012 with the latter, among other honours.
A France national football teamFrance international since 2004, Malouda represented "Les Bleus" on 80 occasions, including in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and two UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships. He was part of the French team which reached the 2006 FIFA World Cup Final.

Darren Ward (footballer, born 1974).name: Darren Ward (footballer, born 1974)
Darren Ward (footballer, born 1974).intro: '''Darren Ward''' (born 11 May 1974) is a former WalesWelsh international Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper and current First Team goalkeeping coach at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United.

Eike Immel.name: Eike Immel
Eike Immel.intro:
'''Eike Immel''' (born 27 November 1960 in Stadtallendorf) is a former German Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper and manager.
A leading youth international goalkeeper for West Germany national football teamWest Germany in 1978, Eike Immel was still seventeen years of age when he succeeded Horst Bertram as Borussia Dortmund's first-choice. He remained Dortmund's top choice until his two million German markDeutsche Mark transfer to VfB Stuttgart in 1986, the biggest fee ever paid for a goalkeeper in the history German football at that time. He served nine years as Stuttgart's regular goalkeeper, winning the Bundesliga title in 1992 and the UEFA Cup runner-up medal in 1989 with them. Afterwards he left for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, where he retired at the end of the 1995–96 season.
His West Germany national football teamWest Germany career lasted for just eight years due to his decision to retire from the West German team following EURO'88. Immel had been the starting goalkeeper since Harald Schumacher's ban from the team in 1987, and his 19th appearance in the semi-final of the UEFA Euro 19881988 UEFA European Football Championship at Volksparkstadion, Hamburg, remained his final international capcap for his country and made him miss out on the title winning 1990 FIFA World Cup squad for which Bodo Illgner then served as starting goalkeeper. The mentioned UEFA Euro 19881988 UEFA European Football Championship was Immel's fifth participation in a big international tournament. The son of a farmer later admitted his decision to retire from the international game at barely 28 just because of the competition from Bodo Illgner for the goalkeeper's jersey, was extremely hasty. He was however part of the squad that won the UEFA Euro 19801980 UEFA European Championships.
Following his retirement from the game after a stay with Manchester City, whom he joined after his Stuttgart manager had preferred a younger goalkeeper in 1995, Eike Immel was working in a coaching role, performing a similar role under Christoph Daum at Fenerbahçe in 2005.
Immel currently holds the dubious record for 'most goals conceded by a Bundesliga goalkeeper' with 829 goals conceded in 534 games.
In January 2008, he was a contestant at Ich bin ein Star – Holt mich hier raus!, the German edition of I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!.

Matt Doherty (footballer, born 1992).name: Matt Doherty (footballer, born 1992)
Matt Doherty (footballer, born 1992).intro:
'''Matthew James "Matt" Doherty''' (born 16 January 1992) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for English club Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
Doherty was signed by Wolves in 2010, who played his Irish club Bohemian F.C.Bohemians during pre-season. He gained senior football experience with loan spells at Hibernian F.C.Hibernian and Bury F.C.Bury, respectively, before beginning to regularly feature in Wolves' first team.
Matt Doherty (footballer, born 1992).position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Steve Potts.name: Steve Potts
Steve Potts.intro: '''Steven John "Steve" Potts''' (born 7 May 1967 in Hartford, Connecticut, United States) is an American born English football coach and former professional association footballfootballer. He played as a defender (association football)defender and is associated with his time spent at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He also represented the England national football teamEnglish national team eleven times at youth level.

Nick Colgan.name: Nick Colgan
Nick Colgan.intro:
'''Nicholas Vincent "Nick" Colgan''' (born 19 September 1973) is an Irish former professional association footballfootballer who works as the head goalkeeping coach for Football Championship side Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1991 to 2013 and first briefly played for his hometown club Drogheda United F.C.Drogheda United between 1991 and 1992 before signing for Premier League side Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. Whilst at Stamford Bridge (stadium)Stamford Bridge he often found himself as back-up to the likes of Dmitri Kharine and Frode Grodas and spent time on loan at Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Brentford F.C.Brentford and Reading F.C.Reading. He joined A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth permanently in 1998 where he stayed for a year before a move to Scottish Premier League club Hibernian F.C.Hibernian. Colgan made over 120 appearances in the league between 1999 and 2004 and went on to earn his first full international cap for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. In 2004 following a loan spell with Stockport County F.C.Stockport County he joined Barnsley F.C.Barnsley where he played for four years and also helping the club to promotion to the Football League Championship in 2006. In 2008 he joined Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town as an understudy to Stephen Bywater but left the club a few months later after failing to make an appearance, and with that returned to the Premier League when he joined Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. A year later he returned to Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town and was the first choice keeper when the club were to lose their Football League following relegation to the Conference NationalConference. Colgan lost his place in the team the following year and was loaned out to Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town before later making the move permanent.
During the 2011–12 season Colgan began coaching youngsters back at former club Barnsley F.C.Barnsley as well as continuing to play with Huddersfield. In July 2012 he signed a new contract with Huddersfield to make him the club's academy goalkeeping coach as well as still making himself available as a player.

Malik Buari.name: Malik Buari
Malik Buari.intro: '''Malik Buari''' (born 21 January 1984 in Accra, Ghana) is a Ghanaian Association footballfootball midfielder and left-sided Defender (association football)defender. He currently plays for the Combined Counties League team Chessington & Hook United F.C.Chessington & Hook United.

Andy Hinchcliffe.name: Andy Hinchcliffe
Andy Hinchcliffe.intro:
'''Andrew George "Andy" Hinchcliffe''' (born 5 February 1969 in Manchester, Lancashire) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer and Sports Television pundit.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1986 until 2002 for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Everton F.C.Everton and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.

Lee Camp.name: Lee Camp
Lee Camp.intro:
'''Lee Michael John Camp''' (born 22 August 1984) is a association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth and internationally he represents Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, who he qualifies for through his Northern Ireland-born grandfather, although he previously played for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team.
Camp started his professional career with Derby County F.C.Derby County in 2002, having progressed through the club's youth ranks. During a five-year spell at the club, he made 89 league appearances for Derby, and also went on loan to three clubs: Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion in 2003, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 2004 and 2007, and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, in 2006. He switched to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in July 2007, and made 50 league appearances for the club in a two season spell, taking his total number of QPR appearances to 73. Between October 2008 and January 2009, Camp was loaned to Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, signing permanently for the club in July 2009. In total, he made 182 league appearances for Nottingham Forest before returning to Norwich City in January 2013. He made three appearances in his second spell at the club, before being released on a free transfer in May 2013. He joined West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in September 2013 and spent two months on-loan at A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth. He was released by West Brom in January 2014 and subsequently joined Bournemouth on a two-and-a-half-year-deal.

Gr\u00e9gory Vignal.name: Grégory Vignal
Gr\u00e9gory Vignal.intro:
'''Grégory Vignal''' (born 19 July 1981 in Montpellier) is a French association footballfootballer. A left defender (association football)full back or midfielder, he plays for Championnat de France amateurCFA club AS Béziers (2007)AS Béziers.
Vignal has played in the top division in five countries – England, France, Spain, Scotland and Greece – and in the second tier in a sixth, Germany, though as of 2012 he is yet to play more than 30 league games for any of his clubs. At international level, he represented France at France national under-20 football teamunder-20 level in the 2001 FIFA World Youth Championship and has also been cap (sport)capped at France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Dietmar Hamann.name: Dietmar Hamann
Dietmar Hamann.intro:
'''Dietmar Johann Wolfgang Hamann''' (born 27 August 1973), also known as '''Didi Hamann''', is a German former professional Association footballfootballer who was most recently manager (association football)manager at Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. Throughout his career, he has played for FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City primarily in a defensive midfield position. He also spent time at Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons as a player/coach before joining Leicester City as a first team coach. He was a member of the Germany national football teamGerman national side from 1997 until 2006. He is known in Ireland as a soccer pundit on RTÉ's live coverage of major European and International competitions.
Throughout his playing career Hamann gained a reputation for being a highly consistent and reliable player. He is highly respected by supporters of Liverpool due in large part to his involvement in the 2005 UEFA Champions League Final2005 Champions League Final.
On 5 July 2011, Hamann was named as the new manager of Stockport County, replacing former manager Ray Mathias. He resigned from the post on 7 November 2011 after only four months with Stockport struggling in 17th place in the Conference Premier citing failure of a proposed takeover by Tony Evans.

Paulo Alves.name: Paulo Alves
Paulo Alves.intro:
'''Paulo Lourenço Martins Alves''' (born 10 December 1969) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Centre forwardcentre forward, and the current Coach (sport)coach of S.C. Beira-Mar.
He amassed Primeira Liga totals of 301 games and 78 goals over the course of 13 seasons, mainly with Gil Vicente F.C.Gil Vicente (five years). He also represented in the competition C.S. Marítimo, Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting (three apiece) U.D. LeiriaUnião de Leiria (two) and S.C. BragaBraga.
Alves started coaching in 2005 and went on to be in charge of several clubs, including Gil.
Paulo Alves.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Fredi Bobic.name: Fredi Bobic
Fredi Bobic.intro: '''Fredi Bobic''' () (born 30 October 1971) is a former German Association footballfootballer of Slovene and Croatian descent. He worked last as board representative for sport for Bundesliga club VfB Stuttgart.

David Prutton.name: David Prutton
David Prutton.intro:
'''David Thomas Michael Prutton''' (born 12 September 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer, currently a free agent after being released by Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday.
He has previously played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and  Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, as well as representing England at England national under-21 football teamUnder 21 level 25 times. He spent a 3-month loan spell with Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United at the start of the 2012–13 season and a brief spell on loan at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City at the end of the 2013-4 season.

Robinho.name: Robinho
Robinho.intro:
'''Robson de Souza''' ( or , born 25 January 1984), more Mononymous personcommonly known as '''Robinho''' , is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Santos FC on loan from A.C. Milan. He is known for his ball control, attacking instinct and dribbling.
In 1999, at only 15 years of age, Robinho was personally picked by Brazil legend Pelé as his heir apparent[

Grant Watts.name: Grant Watts
Grant Watts.intro:
'''Grant Watts''' (born 5 November 1973) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball striker (football)forward.
He started to play for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace but after suffering a broken leg, he made two further appearances before joining Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and then Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. After Gillingham he played non league football for Sutton United F.C.Sutton United, Welling United F.C.Welling United, Banstead Athletic F.C.Banstead Athletic, Egham Town F.C.Egham Town, Croydon F.C.Croydon and Bromley F.C.Bromley.
He is now a coach at Holmesdale F.C.Holmesdale.

Salif Diao.name: Salif Diao
Salif Diao.intro:
'''Salif Alassane Diao''' (born 10 February 1977) is a former Senegalese Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensivedefensive midfielder.
Diao moved from Senegal to France when he was seventeen and started his career at AS Monaco FCAS Monaco with whom he helped with the Trophée des championsFrench Super Cup and Ligue 1French Division 1. He failed to hold down a regular place at Monaco and moved to CS Sedan ArdennesSedan in 2000. Diao then had an impressive 2002 World cup with Senegal national football teamSenegal which attracted the attention of several Premier League sides. It was Liverpool F.C.Liverpool who won the race and signed Diao for £5 million in 2002.
His time at Liverpool was unsuccessful and was sent out on loan to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. He joined the latter Stoke permanently on a free transfer in 2007 and helped the club to promotion to the Premier League in 2008.

Ian Taylor.name: Ian Taylor
Ian Taylor.intro:
'''Ian Kenneth Taylor''' (born 4 June 1968) is an English former Association footballfootballer, best known for his time at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. A midfielder, he had a fifteen-year career in the Football League and Premier League, making 478 league appearances.
He made the move from non-league Moor Green F.C.Moor Green to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1992. With Vale he lifted the Football League Trophy in 1993 Football League Trophy Final1993. His impressive performances earned him a place on the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division PFA Team of the Year in 1992–93 Port Vale F.C. season1992–93 & 1993–94 Port Vale F.C. season1993–94, as well as the club's Port Vale F.C. Player of the YearPlayer of the Year award in 1993. He made a million pound move to Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in June 1994, and he was sold on for another million to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa later in the year. He lifted the Football League CupLeague Cup and reached the FA Cup final with the club he had supported as a boy. In 2003, he signed with Derby County F.C.Derby County, helping the club to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship play-offs before signing with Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town in June 2005. He helped the club to win promotion out of Football League TwoLeague Two in 2005–06 Football League2005–06, before he announced his retirement in April 2007.

Steve Morison.name: Steve Morison
Steve Morison.intro:
'''Steven William "Steve" Morison''' (born 29 August 1983) is a Wales international Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Leeds United F.C.Leeds United.
Morison started his career at Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town at the age of 16, progressing through the club's youth systemcentre of excellence. After featuring regularly for the club's reserve team, Morison made his first-team debut in 2002, and played a total of 28 times for the club during his three years with Northampton. He left Northampton and joined Conference South side Bishop's Stortford F.C.Bishop's Stortford for an undisclosed fee in November 2004. Morison spent just under two years with Stortford, scoring prolifically, before joining another Hertfordshire team in the form of Stevenage F.C.Stevenage for a "small four-figure fee" in August 2006.
During the 2006-07 in English football2006–07 season, Morison scored a total of 34 times in 53 games, including the winner in Stevenage's 3–2 victory over Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers in the FA Trophy final in May 2007 – the first competitive cup final to be held at the new Wembley Stadium. The following season, Morison netted 22 times in 45 matches, before scoring 30 times during the club's 2008-09 in English football2008–09 campaign; scoring again in Stevenage's 2–0 win against York City F.C.York City in the FA Trophy final in May 2009, his last game for the club. He subsequently joined Millwall for £130,000 ahead of 2009-10 in English football2009–10 season, and helped the club to promotion to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship by scoring 23 goals in 52 games. He finished as Millwall's top goalscorer 2010–11 Millwall F.C. seasonthe following season, before signing for Premier League side Norwich City for an undisclosed fee in June 2011. In January 2013, Morison signed for Leeds United as part of a swap deal. After just five months at Leeds, Morison rejoined Millwall on a season-long loan in June 2013. Morison earned eight cap (sport)caps for the England C national football teamEngland C team, scoring three goals. In August 2010, Morison made his senior international debut for Wales national football teamWales.

Andrew Johnson (English footballer).name: Andrew Johnson (English footballer)
Andrew Johnson (English footballer).intro: '''Andrew Johnson''' (born 10 February 1981), also known as '''Andy Johnson''', is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker. He previously played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Everton F.C.Everton, Fulham F.C.Fulham and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. He was cap (sport)capped eight times for England national football teamEngland.

Craig Fleming.name: Craig Fleming
Craig Fleming.intro: '''Craig Fleming''' (born 6 October 1971 in Halifax, West YorkshireHalifax, Yorkshire, England) is a former association footballfootballer, He played as a defender (football)defender. Fleming is currently Director of football at Conference North side Lowestoft TownLowestoft Town F.C., a position he has held since 2009.

Sieb Dijkstra.name: Sieb Dijkstra
Sieb Dijkstra.intro: '''Sybrandus Johannes Andreas "Sieb" Dijkstra''' (born October 20, 1966 in Kerkrade, Netherlands) is a former Football (soccer)footballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Dani Rodrigues.name: Dani Rodrigues
Dani Rodrigues.intro: '''Daniel 'Dani' Ferreira Rodrigues''' (born 3 March 1980) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Oscar (footballer, born 1991).name: Oscar (footballer, born 1991)
Oscar (footballer, born 1991).intro:
'''Oscar dos Santos Emboaba Júnior''' (; born 9 September 1991), better known as simply '''Oscar''', is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an attacking midfielder or winger (sports)winger for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team.
Oscar began his career at São Paulo FCSão Paulo, where he won the Brazilian League in 2008. In 2009, he went to court against the club due to irregularities in his contract. After a series of controversies, he left for Sport Club InternacionalInternacional, where he spent the next three years of his career. His displays for club and country led to him signing for Chelsea for £19.35 million,
He is a Brazilian international and has represented his country at the under-20 level, at the 2012 London Olympics and at senior level. On 20 August 2011, Oscar scored three goals in the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup final win against Portugal, becoming the first player to score a hat-trick in the FIFA U-20 World Cup final. Oscar later described his performances at the tournament as being a "gateway to the senior side." His playing style and ability have drawn comparison to Brazilian attacking midfielder Kaká.

Adri\u00e1n.name: Adrián
Adri\u00e1n.intro:
'''Adrián San Miguel del Castillo''', simply known as '''Adrián''' (born 3 January 1987), is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He started playing for Real BetisBetis, making his debut with the first team in 2012.

Marko Arnautovi\u0107.name: Marko Arnautović
Marko Arnautovi\u0107.intro:
'''Marko Arnautović''' (born 19 April 1989) is an Austrian Association footballfootballer who plays for as a Forward (association football)forward for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Austria national football teamAustria national team.
Arnautović began his career in his native Austria playing in the youth teams for a number of clubs in the Vienna area before he signed a contract with Dutch club FC TwenteTwente in 2006. He impressed at De Grolsch Veste and after a fine 2008–09 Eredivisie2008–09 season he joined Italian giants F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale on loan. Arnautović's time at the San Siro was disrupted by injury and only managed three appearances for the Nerazzurri. He joined German side SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen in June 2010 and became a regular member of the first team as well with the Austria national football teamAustria national team. In September 2013 Arnautović joined English Premier League side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.

Aaron Ramsey.name: Aaron Ramsey
Aaron Ramsey.intro:
'''Aaron James Ramsey'''  (born 26 December 1990) is a Welsh association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder (association football)midfielder for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and the Wales national football team. Ramsey mainly plays as a Midfielder#Box-to-box midfielderbox-to-box midfielder, but has also been deployed on the left and right wings. He played as a schoolboy for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, where he spent eight years in youth football, became the club's youngest ever first team player, and made 22 appearances for the senior team – including the 2008 FA Cup Final.
Ramsey moved to Arsenal in 2008 in a £5 million deal, where he quickly gained first team experience. However, his career stalled significantly after he suffered a broken leg in a match against Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in February 2010. After two loan spells away from Arsenal, he returned to full fitness and re-established himself as a regular starter during the 2011–12 Arsenal F.C. season2011–12 season. Ramsey was a key player for Arsenal in the 2013–14 Arsenal F.C. season2013–14 season campaign, scoring 16 goals in all competitions, including the winner in the 2014 FA Cup Final.

Andy Thomson (English footballer).name: Andy Thomson (English footballer)
Andy Thomson (English footballer).intro:
'''Andy Thomson''' (born 28 March 1974) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer, who has played for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers.
Thomson's career began at his home town club, Swindon Town, as a trainee where he progressed to the first team and made 22 league appearances without scoring a goal. He moved to Portsmouth for a fee of £75,000 in 1995 and went on to make 93 appearances for Pompey, before the club's financial problems forced his sale to Bristol Rovers for a fee of £50,000 in 1999. During his time at Rovers, Thomson became the club captain and made 127 league appearances, scoring six goals in the process. He ended his league career at Wycombe Wanderers, where he spent two years and played 50 league games.

David Vaughan.name: David Vaughan
David Vaughan.intro:
'''David Owen Vaughan'''  (born 18 February 1983) is a Welsh association footballfootballer who plays for Championship club Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He plays as a midfielder.
Vaughan previously played for Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, where he spent seven years between 2000 and 2007. He then spent one season playing in Spain with Real Sociedad before returning to England to join Blackpool F.C.Blackpool for three seasons (2008–09 to 2010–11).
He plays internationally for Wales national football teamWales, having previously played for the Welsh Wales national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Wales national under-21 football teamunder-21 sides earlier in his career.

Li Weifeng.name: Li Weifeng
Li Weifeng.intro: '''Li Weifeng''' (; born 1 December 1978 in Changchun, Jilin) is a Chinese peopleChinese footballer who currently plays for Tianjin Teda F.C.Tianjin Teda in the Chinese Super League.

St\u00e5le Solbakken.name: Ståle Solbakken
St\u00e5le Solbakken.intro:
'''Ståle Solbakken''' (born 27 February 1968) is a NorwayNorwegian former Norway national football teaminternational association footballfootball player and the current head coach of Danish Superliga side F.C. CopenhagenCopenhagen.
As a manager, he was named Kniksen award#20042004 Norwegian Manager of the Year, and has won five Danish Superliga championships with F.C. CopenhagenCopenhagen. Solbakken was also in charge of German club 1. FC Köln during the 2011–12 Fußball-Bundesliga2011–12 season and, most recently, served as manager of English side Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in a six-month tenure.
During his playing career, Solbakken was named Kniksen award#19951995 Norwegian midfielder of the year, and he won the Danish Superliga championship with both AaB FodboldAalborg BK and Copenhagen (in 1999 and 2001 respectively). He played 58 matches and scored nine goals for the Norwegian national football teamNorwegian national team during the end of the 1990s, and represented Norway at the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup and UEFA Euro 20002000 European Championship tournaments. He ended his active career in March 2001 following a myocardial infarctionheart attack.

Darren Purse.name: Darren Purse
Darren Purse.intro:
'''Darren John Purse''' (born 14 February 1977) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Conference South club Staines Town F.C.Staines Town.
He began his career at Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, before winning a £100,000 move to Oxford United F.C.Oxford United in July 1996. He continued to impress, and was bought by Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for £700,000 in February 1998. He played for the "Blues" in the Premier League and the 2001 Football League Cup Final, before switching to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion for a £750,000 fee in June 2004. After a year with the "Baggies", he was transferred to Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City for just under £1 million. Appointed as club captain, he was an unused substitute in the 2008 FA Cup Final, where they were defeated by Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He joined Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in July 2009, and was again appointed as captain. The "Owls" suffered relegation into Football League OneLeague One, and he moved on to Millwall F.C.Millwall in January 2011. Loaned out to Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town, he switched to Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle for a 12-month spell in January 2012. He left Plymouth for Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in January 2013, and helped the club to secure promotion out of Football League TwoLeague Two in 2012–13.
