He left England in August 2013 to play for Finnish club IFK Mariehamn, before joining English non-League side Chesham United F.C.Chesham United in January 2014. He later played for Welling United F.C.Welling United and Staines Town.
Darren Purse.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jacob Burns.name: Jacob Burns
Jacob Burns.intro: '''Jacob Geoffrey Burns''' (born 21 April 1978 in Sydney, Australia) is a retired Australian Association footballfootball (soccer) player who last played for A-League club Perth Glory FCPerth Glory.

Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa.name: Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa
Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa.intro: '''Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa''' (born 15 May 1989) is a association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club A.S. RomaRoma, and the France national football teamFrance national team as a Defender (football)#Centre backcentre back.
Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Pablo Hern\u00e1ndez (footballer, born 1.name: Pablo Hernández (footballer, born 1985)
Pablo Hern\u00e1ndez (footballer, born 1.intro:
'''Pablo Hernández Domínguez''' (; born 11 April 1985) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Al-Nasr Dubai SC on loan from Al-Arabi SC (Qatar) as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
In a spell which also included two loans, he played the early part of his career with Valencia CFValencia, appearing in 173 official games (25 goals) and winning the 2008 Copa del Rey Final2008 Copa del Rey. He also competed two years in Wales, with Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.
Hernández represented Spain national football teamSpain at the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup2009 Confederations Cup.

Eliaquim Mangala.name: Eliaquim Mangala
Eliaquim Mangala.intro:
'''Eliaquim Mangala''' (born 13 February 1991) is a French professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the France national football team as a Defender (association football)central defender.
Born in France, he moved to Belgium as a child and began his career there at Standard Liège, going onto FC Porto in 2011 where he won consecutive Primeira Liga titles before joining Manchester City for £31.8 million.
Mangala made his debut with the French national team on 6 June 2013 against Uruguay national football teamUruguay, and was included in the nation's squad for the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Scott Parker.name: Scott Parker
Scott Parker.intro:
'''Scott Matthew Parker''' (born 13 October 1980) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham as a midfielder. He is known as a tough tackling central midfielder.
Parker began his career at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, and was loaned to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, before joining Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for £10 million in January 2004. He did not play regularly at Chelsea, and moved to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United the following year, where he was made captain. Parker joined West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in 2007, and was the FWA Footballer of the Year for the 2010–11 season despite the club being relegated. He was then signed by Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and joined Fulham in 2013.
He has represented England at every level from England national under-16 football teamunder-16 to senior, making his full debut in 2003. Uniquely, he won his first four England caps while playing for four different clubs. Parker was a member of the England team which reached the quarter-finals at UEFA Euro 2012.

Ricardo Quaresma.name: Ricardo Quaresma
Ricardo Quaresma.intro:
'''Ricardo Andrade Quaresma Bernardo''' (; born 26 September 1983) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for F.C. Porto as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
He began his career at Sporting Clube de Portugal, and has also played for FC BarcelonaBarcelona, F.C. PortoPorto, F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş and Al Ahli Dubai. He is popular for incorporating a repertoire of tricks into his style of play, including the rabona and Curl (football)trivela. A winger who can play on either flank, his qualities of speed and finesse cause a regular problem for opposing defenses.
A full international since 2003, Quaresma represented Portugal national football teamPortugal at the European Championship in 2008 and 2012.

Ian Wright.name: Ian Wright
Ian Wright.intro:
'''Ian Edward Wright''', Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 3 November 1963) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer turned television and radio personality.
Wright enjoyed success with London clubs Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, spending six years with the former and seven years with the latter. With Arsenal he has lifted the Premier League title, both major domestic trophies, and the UEFA Cup Winners' CupEuropean Cup Winners Cup. He played 581 league games, scoring 387 goals for seven clubs in Scotland and England, earning 33 caps for the England national football teamEnglish national team.
He also played in the Premier League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic and the Football League for Burnley F.C.Burnley and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
After retiring from the game he has been active in the media, usually in football related TV and radio shows. His sons, Bradley Wright-PhillipsBradley and Shaun Wright-PhillipsShaun are both professional footballers.

Eyal Berkovic.name: Eyal Berkovic
Eyal Berkovic.intro:
'''Eyal Berkovic''' (, sometimes ''Berkovich''; born 2 April 1972 in Regba) is an IsraelisIsraeli former footballer. He played as an attacking midfielder making 78 appearances for the Israeli national team.
Berkovic was well known for his vision and incisive passing, as well as for his suspect temperament. He had several clashes with managers and players, most notably Kevin Keegan (his manager when at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City), and Welsh striker John Hartson.
Graeme Souness described Berkovic as "a tremendous passer. In the last third of the field, he is the best that I've ever worked with."
He is the older brother of former footballer Nir Berkovic.[

Roland Nilsson.name: Roland Nilsson
Roland Nilsson.intro: '''Roland Nilsson''' (born 27 November 1963 in Helsingborg) is a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootball manager. As a player, Nilsson played 116 games for Sweden national football teamSweden, making him third only to Thomas Ravelli and Anders Svensson (footballer)Anders Svensson in international appearances for Sweden. He also won the UEFA Cup and played in the semi-finals of the Football World CupWorld Cup, the UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championships, and the UEFA Champions LeagueEuropean Cup during a playing career lasting over two decades. He won his first major honour as a manager in 2010 with Malmö FF when the team won Allsvenskan. On 1 April 2011 FC Copenhagen confirmed Nilsson as the club's new manager to replace Ståle Solbakken who left Copenhagen to become manager of 1. FC Köln in the summer of 2011. Nilsson joined F.C. Copenhagen on 1 June 2011 but was sacked after six months on 9 January 2012.

Danny Granville.name: Danny Granville
Danny Granville.intro: '''Daniel Patrick "Danny" Granville''' (born 19 January 1975) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Hemel Hempstead Town F.C.Hemel Hempstead Town in the Southern League Premier Division, having signed for them in October 2009. He plays as a left back.

Stig Inge Bj\u00f8rnebye.name: Stig Inge Bjørnebye
Stig Inge Bj\u00f8rnebye.intro:
'''Stig Inge Bjørnebye''' (born 11 December 1969) is a retired NorwayNorwegian Association footballfootballer who played in Norway, England, and Denmark, most notably for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. His preferred position was Defender (association football)#Left backleft back, which he occupied for domestic clubs and the national team. Bjørnebye was appointed assistant manager of Norway in 2003, relinquishing the role three years later to succeed Tom Nordlie as manager of IK Start.
For club and country, Bjørnebye was noted for his precise deliveries from the flanks. Described as a "solid, no-nonsense full-back", Bjørnebye played competitive football for 16 years, and appeared in 194 Premier League matches, until injury compelled retirement in March 2003. He represented the Norway national football teamNorwegian national team in the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 and 1998 FIFA World Cup and the UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000 and was capped 75 times, scoring once
Stig Inge Bj\u00f8rnebye.position: Defender  association football  Left back Left back

John Polston.name: John Polston
John Polston.intro:
'''John David Polston''' (b. 10 June 1968 in Walthamstow) is a former professional footballer. He was a defender who began his career with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham before playing for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and Reading F.C.Reading.
His brother Andy PolstonAndy was also a professional player and the two were on the books of Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham at the same time. In March 1990, they became the first brothers to lay together in the Spurs first team since 1912, although neither was a regular player and Andy played just once for Spurs. John left Spurs in 1990, after making 28 appearances for the club, when Norwich manager Dave Stringer paid £300,000 for him.
Polston was a key member of the Norwich team that finished third in the inaugural season of the Premier League (1992–93) and captained the side in the club's first ever European tie (in the UEFA Cup against Vitesse Arnhem) the following season, scoring the second goal in a 3-0 win. In the run-in to the end of the 1992-93 season, he scored a vital winning goal against Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa at Carrow Road the day after his wife had given birth to their first child, Jordan Jamal Tyrone Polston.
Following his release from Norwich in 1998, Polston joined Reading F.C.Reading. Polston retired from football in April 2001 after failing to recover from a knee injury. John is now a personal trainer.

Matty Holmes.name: Matty Holmes
Matty Holmes.intro: '''Matthew''' "'''Matty'''" '''Holmes''' (born 1 August 1969 in Luton, Bedfordshire) was an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who went into semi-retirement at the age of 30 due to an injury inflicted by Australian defender Kevin Muscat.

Pablo Barrera.name: Pablo Barrera
Pablo Barrera.intro: '''Pablo Edson Barrera Acosta''' (born 21 June 1987) is a MexicoMexican Association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (football)winger or outside forward for Liga MX club C.F. MonterreyMonterrey. He spent the early part of his career playing for Club Universidad Nacional in Mexico, before transferring to Barclays Premier LeaguePremier League club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He has also spent a loan period with La Liga club Real Zaragoza. He has represented the Mexico national football teamMexico national team.
Pablo Barrera.position: Forward  association football  Winger Winger Forward

Karim Rekik.name: Karim Rekik
Karim Rekik.intro: '''Karim Rekik''' (; born 2 December 1994) is a NetherlandsDutch footballer who currently plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for PSV Eindhoven, on loan from  Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
Karim Rekik.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Neil Sullivan.name: Neil Sullivan
Neil Sullivan.intro:
'''Neil Sullivan''' (born 24 February 1970) is a former professional footballer who is a goalkeeping coach at Football Championship side Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1988 to 2013, starting his career with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon shortly after the club's FA Cup triumph. He remained with The Dons for twelve years and made 181 league appearances while at times covering for the likes of Dave Beasant, Hans Segers and Paul Heald and also spent a period on loan at Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, though by the time of his departure he was firm number one. In 2000 he moved to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur where he replaced Ian Walker (footballer)Ian Walker as the club's favoured keeper. In 2003 he departed after losing his place in the team and was signed as a back-up keeper by rivals Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. In 2004 he moved to freshly relegated Football Championship side Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United where he remained until 2007. Whilst at Leeds he eventually lost his place in the team and was loaned out to Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in both 2006 and 2007. In 2007 he joined Rovers on a permanent deal where he remained the club's favoured keeper until the 2012–13 season when he was loaned  to A.F.C. WimbledonAFC Wimbledon the side formed out of the ashes of his first club. Sullivan returned to Doncaster towards the end of the year and aided Doncaster to the League One title. In July 2013 he announced he was leaving Rovers and after rejecting offers to prolong his playing career he joined former club Leeds as an academy goalkeeping coach confirming his retirement from professional football.
Between 1997 and 2003 Sullivan was capped 28 times by Scotland national football teamScotland, he was selected for the 1998 Fifa World Cup but was the second choice keeper behind Jim Leighton and ahead of Jonathan Gould for all three games.

David Connolly.name: David Connolly
David Connolly.intro:
'''David James Connolly''' (born 6 June 1977) is a retired professional Association footballfootballer who last played as a Forward (association football)striker in Football League TwoLeague Two for AFC Wimbledon. He has previously played for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland and for various clubs including Feyenoord and SBV ExcelsiorExcelsior in the Netherlands as well as Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in the Premier League.
Although born in England, Connolly has represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at international level. He was a member of Ireland's 2002 FIFA World Cup squad that lost to Spain national football teamSpain in the 2002 FIFA World Cup knockout stageknockout stage where his penalty kick was saved by Iker Casillas during the shootout.

Anderson (footballer, born 1988).name: Anderson (footballer, born 1988)
Anderson (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Anderson Luís de Abreu Oliveira''' (born 13 April 1988), commonly known as '''Anderson''', is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Sport Club InternacionalInternacional and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team. He plays as a box-to-box midfielder noted for his vision, and strength.
Anderson began his career with Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto AlegrenseGrêmio, joining the youth team before rising through the ranks. His goal against Clube Náutico CapibaribeNáutico during the Batalha dos Aflitos (2005)2005 play-offs gained Grêmio promotion to the Brazilian Série A. Before the start of the 2005–06 season, Anderson moved to F.C. PortoPorto, gaining first team status during his two seasons with them. There, he won the Portuguese Liga twice, along with the Taça de PortugalPortuguese Cup and Supertaça Cândido de OliveiraSuperCup during 2005–06. He moved to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United before the 2007–08 season, and has won the Premier League three times, the 2007–08 UEFA Champions League and the Football League CupLeague Cup.
Anderson made his Brazil national football teamBrazil debut in 2007 during the Copa América 20072007 Copa América, which they went on to win. He also played for the Brazil Olympic football team during the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, helping them secure the bronze medal.

John Gayle.name: John Gayle
John Gayle.intro: '''John Gayle''' (born 30 July 1964) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, who played as a Forward (association football)Striker for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United.

Stefan Oakes.name: Stefan Oakes
Stefan Oakes.intro: '''Stefan Trevor Oakes''' (born 6 September 1978) is an English former professional footballer, who notably represented Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in the Premier League during a career which began in 1998 and ended in 2013.

Mark Kennedy.name: Mark Kennedy
Mark Kennedy.intro:
'''Mark John Kennedy''' (born 15 May 1976 in Clonsilla, Dublin) is an Irish retired Association footballfootballer who is part of the coaching staff at Football League Championship side Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
As a player he was a defender (association football)#Full-backleft back and midfielder#Wingerleft winger from 1992 to 2012. He notably featured in the Premier League with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, as well as in the Football League for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He has been capped 34 times by Republic of Ireland national football teamIreland, scoring 4 goals.
Mark Kennedy.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

John McGinlay.name: John McGinlay
John McGinlay.intro: '''John McGinlay''' (born 8 April 1964) is a Scottish former association footballfootballer who is best known for his spell at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in the mid to late 1990s.  McGinlay is a product of the Scottish Highland Football League and a Scottish International.

Darren Pitcher.name: Darren Pitcher
Darren Pitcher.intro: '''Darren Pitcher''' (born 12 October 1969 in Stepney) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender and a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1988 until 1999.
Darren Pitcher.position: Defender  association football  Defender,Midfielder  football  Midfielder

Josh Murphy.name: Josh Murphy
Josh Murphy.intro: '''Joshua''' "'''Josh'''" '''Murphy''' (born 24 February 1995) is an English professional footballer who currently plays for Norwich City.  He scored on his professional debut in a Football League Cup match against Watford F.C.Watford.  He is the twin brother of professional footballer Jacob Murphy. The brothers are nephews of former Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town utility player Tommy Parkin.

David Wetherall.name: David Wetherall
David Wetherall.intro:
'''David Wetherall''' (born 14 March 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a defender (football)central defender, finishing his playing career with Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City at the end of the 2007–08 season. Born in Sheffield, he supported Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday as a child, and started his playing career there. Before he made a league appearance for Sheffield Wednesday, he transferred to Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and made more than 200 appearances. After this he joined Bradford City for a then club-record fee of £1.4 million and played every minute of every match in his first season for the club. Relegation from the Premier League soon followed and the club went into administration (law)administration in 2002 but when Stuart McCall departed for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Wetherall became the captain (association football)team captain. Wetherall missed several games through injury in the seasons that followed and Bradford City were further relegated to Football League OneLeague One in 2004 and then to Football League TwoLeague Two in 2007. He played his final game in professional football on 3 May 2008 against Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers.
Wetherall had two spells as caretaker manager of Bradford City, and was an integral part of club's coaching setup following his retirement as a player. He left Bradford in June 2011 after 12 years with the club to take up a position with the Football League. He was inducted into Show Racism The Red Card's hall of fame for his involvement in their anti-racism campaign.

Phil Gee.name: Phil Gee
Phil Gee.intro: '''Philip John "Phil" Gee''' (born 19 December 1964) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a striker (football)forward from 1984 to 1998.

Ray Ranson.name: Ray Ranson
Ray Ranson.intro: '''Raymond "Ray" Ranson''' (born 12 June 1960) is an English entrepreneur and a former professional Association footballfootballer. He started his football career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, and played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Reading F.C.Reading. After his playing career ended in 1995, he went on to amass a multimillion pound fortune from the sale of various sports-related businesses.

Patrick M'Boma.name: Patrick M'Boma
Patrick M'Boma.intro: '''Henri Patrick M'Boma Dem''' (born 15 November 1970 in Douala, Cameroon) is a former Cameroonian Forward (association football)football striker and the former all-time top goal-scorer for the Cameroon national football teamCameroonian national team.

Gary Teale.name: Gary Teale
Gary Teale.intro:
'''Gary Stewart Teale''' (born 21 July 1978) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who is player/manager of Scottish Premiership club St. Mirren F.C.St. Mirren.
Teale started his career in Football in ScotlandScotland in 1995 with Clydebank F.C.Clydebank before spending three years with Ayr United F.C.Ayr United. He moved to Football in EnglandEngland in 2001 when he signed for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and played an important part in the Wigan side that rose from the third tier (Football League OneDivision Two) to second (Football League ChampionshipDivision One) for the first time in the club's history and then went one step further to reach the Premier Leaguetop flight. Whilst at Wigan he started in the 2006 Football League Cup Final. He then left for Championship side Derby County F.C.Derby County where he achieved promotion to the Premier League for the second time, although Teale was not a member of the matchday 16 for the 2007 Football League Championship play-off Final. During his time at Derby, he spent time on loan with Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.
After three years and over 100 appearances for the club, Teale left Derby in June 2010, signing for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday on a two-year deal. Teale has also represented Scotland national football teamScotland at international level, winning 13 Cap (sport)caps for his country between 2006 and 2009.

Adrian Bakalli.name: Adrian Bakalli
Adrian Bakalli.intro:
'''Adrian Bakalli''' (born 22 November 1976 in Brussels) is a BelgiumBelgian Association footballfootballer of AlbaniansAlbanian origin. He represented the Belgium national under-21 football teamBelgium Under-21 side.
He played for R.W.D. Molenbeek and K.F.C. Rhodienne-VerrewinkelRode Verrewinkel before joining English side Watford F.C.Watford in January 1999. During the 1999-2000 in English football1999–00 he made two substitute appearances in the Premier League. He subsequently signed for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, before returning to Belgium.

Marko Marin.name: Marko Marin
Marko Marin.intro:
'''Marko Marin''' (; born 13 March 1989) is a German professional Association footballfootballer who plays for R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
Marin previously played for Bundesliga clubs Borussia Mönchengladbach and SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen. He is known for his acceleration, dribbling, agility, creativity, versatility, technical ability and as an assist-maker. A full German international since 2008, he represented the country at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.

Dean Yates.name: Dean Yates
Dean Yates.intro:
'''Dean Yates''' (born 26 October 1967 in Leicester) is a retired EnglandEnglish football defender. He is currently commentating alongside Colin Slater for BBC Radio Nottingham on their coverage of Notts County F.C.Notts County matches. He is now living in Burton Joyce close to the home ground of Notts County.
He enjoyed considerable success as a player, making his Notts County debut in their 1984-85 in English football1984-85 Football League Second DivisionSecond Division campaign which ended in relegation. He was a regular first team player from 1985-86 in English football1985-86 onwards, helping them win promotion back to the Second Division in 1990 and to the First Division a year later (both through the playoffs). However, a serious knee injury in February 1992 ruled him out for the next two years and meant that County were without him when they needed him most - during the final quarter of the 1991-92 in English football1991-92 season when they battled against relegation from the First Division. The relegation battle was lost, and he managed just one appearance in the 1993-94 in English football1993-94 season as he made his comeback from injury.
He was fully fit for the 1994-95 in English football1994-95 season, but his presence in the team wasn't enough to prevent a relegation battle which was ultimately lost.
By the time County went down from Division One (as the old Second Division became known following the creation of the FA Premier League for the 1992-93 in English football1992-93 season), Yates had transferred to their local rivals Derby County F.C.Derby County - a £350,000 fee taking him to the Baseball Ground on 26 January 1995. He had played 314 league games in 10 years for Notts County.
The Rams had been favourites for promotion every season since their relegation from the top flight in 1991, but the closest they had come to achieving Premier League status was playoff defeats in 1992 and 1994, and when Yates arrived the playoffs were looking beyond their reach. They could only manage a ninth place finish in 1994-95, but they achieved automatic promotion 1995-96 in English footballthe following season as Yates's contributed 38 league appearances and two goals. However, the arrival of Igor Stimac restricted Yates to just 10 appearances in 1996-97 in English football1996-97 and nine 1997-98 in English footballthe following season as Derby established themselves as a consistent mid table Premier League side.[
He departed to Watford, newly promoted to Division One as Division Two champions, on 16 July 1998 on a free transfer. However, injury problems restricted his first team opportunities at Vicarage Road and he played just 10 games, scoring once, in the 1998-99 in English football1998-99 season. Watford won a second successive promotion via the playoffs and reached the Premier League, but Yates did not feature in the 1999-2000 in English football1999-2000 campaign as Watford were relegated. After the end of the season, he retired from playing.[

Fredrik Stoor.intro: '''Fredrik Olof Esaias Stoor''' (born 28 February 1984) is a Swedish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back for Viborg FF in the Danish Superliga. He has been capped 11 times playing for Sweden national football teamSweden, and has previously played for Hammarby FotbollHammarby, Rosenborg BKRosenborg, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Vålerenga FotballVålerenga and Lillestrøm SKLillestrøm.
Fredrik Stoor.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Andy Thorn.name: Andy Thorn
Andy Thorn.intro:
'''Andy Thorn''' (born 12 November 1966 in Carshalton) is an English football manager and former professional association footballfootballer. He was most recently the manager of Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers.
As a player he was a defender from 1984 until 1998. Whilst with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, he was part of the side that achieved the famous victory over Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in the 1988 FA Cup Final. He also played in the 1990 FA Cup Final for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, although this time ended up on the losing side. He also played for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Hearts F.C.Hearts and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers.

Toby Alderweireld.name: Toby Alderweireld
Toby Alderweireld.intro:
'''Tobias Albertine Maurits "Toby" Alderweireld''' (; born 2 March 1989) is a Belgian
professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton, on loan from Atlético Madrid, and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team. Mainly a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, he can also play as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
Alderweireld began his professional career at Dutch club Ajax AmsterdamAjax, where he won honours including three consecutive Eredivisie titles. In 2013 he moved to Atlético, where he won La Liga and reached the UEFA Champions League final in his first season.
A full international since 2009, he has earned over 40 caps for Belgium and represented the country at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Andy Ritchie (English footballer).name: Andy Ritchie (English footballer)
Andy Ritchie (English footballer).intro: '''Andrew Timothy "Andy" Ritchie''' (born 28 November 1960 in Manchester, Lancashire) is an English former Association footballfootballer and manager.

Luke Chadwick.name: Luke Chadwick
Luke Chadwick.intro:
'''Luke Harry Chadwick''' (born 18 November 1980) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United as a midfielder.
Chadwick began his career at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United where he made 25 Premier League appearances in four seasons. While at Old Trafford he spent time out on loan at Reading F.C.Reading and Burnley F.C.Burnley before joining West Ham United F.C.West Ham United on a permanent basis in the summer of 2004. He spent a season with the Hammers before joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan in August 2005 before making the move permanent in January 2006. He remained at Stoke until November 2006 making 55 appearances before joining Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. Injuries restricted his time at Carrow Road and he moved to Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons in October 2008.

Alexander Tettey.name: Alexander Tettey
Alexander Tettey.intro:
'''Alexander Banor Tettey''' (born 4 April 1986) is a Norwegian professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.
Tettey was born in Ghana, but moved to Norway when he was young. He has previously played for Rosenborg BKRosenborg and Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes. Since 2007, he has played for the  Norway national football teamNorwegian national team.

Savio Nsereko.name: Savio Nsereko
Savio Nsereko.intro:
'''Savio Magala Nsereko''' (born 27 July 1989), more commonly known as '''Savio''',cite news

He can play as a Forward (association football)striker, or a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, but tends to play on the left wing, so that he is able to cut inside the Defender (association football)defence and shoot with his right foot.

Ritchie Humphreys.name: Ritchie Humphreys
Ritchie Humphreys.intro:
'''Ritchie John Humphreys''' (born 30 November 1977) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Football League OneLeague One side Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield. He is chairman of the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) and holds a UEFA A Licence coaching qualification.
Humphreys started his career with Premier League side Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 1996. Whilst with the club, he was loaned out to Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. He also won five caps for England at England national under-20 football teamunder-20 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels. He left the club in 2001 and joined Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United for a short period, after which he joined Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United. He joined Port Vale F.C.Port Vale on loan in 2006. He left Hartlepool in July 2013, and moved on to Chesterfield. Whilst at Chesterfield in 2014 he appeared at Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley in 2014 Football League Trophy Finalthe final of the Football League Trophy and helped the club to the Football League TwoLeague Two title in 2013–14.
In 12 seasons with Hartlepool he made a club record 544 appearances, and picked up numerous club awards, including two Player of the Year awards from fans, one Player of the Year award from his teammates, as well as the award for Player of the Decade (2000s). He was also recognised at regional and national levels, being named on the PFA Team of the Year twice, and recognised as the North East League Player of the Year in 2006. He helped the club win promotion out of the fourth tier in 2002–03, and again in 2006–07. However he suffered play-off heartbreak with the club on three separate occasions.

Gary Charles.name: Gary Charles
Gary Charles.intro: '''Gary Charles''' (born 13 April 1970 in London Borough of NewhamNewham, London) is an EnglandEnglish former football (soccer)footballer who played at right-back.

Bojan Krki\u0107.name: Bojan Krkić
Bojan Krki\u0107.intro:
'''Bojan Krkić Pérez''' (;  ; born 28 August 1990), also known as simply '''Bojan''', is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward or Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Bojan began his career at FC BarcelonaBarcelona after progressing through the youth ranks at La Masia. His early promise saw him make his first-team debut at the age of 17 years and 19 days, breaking the record set by Lionel Messi. In his 2007–08 FC Barcelona seasondebut season he scored 12 goals in 48 matches. In total he spent four seasons at the Camp Nou scoring 41 goals in 162 games before he was sold in July 2011 to Italian side A.S. RomaAS Roma for a fee of €12 million. Whilst in Rome he scored seven goals in 37 appearances in 2011–12 A.S. Roma season2011–12 and then spent the 2012–13 A.C. Milan season2012–13 on loan at A.C. MilanMilan where he scored three goals in 27 games.
Roma did not exercise their option of additional €28 million to sign Bojan definitively and so Barcelona re-signed him for €13 million. He spent the 2013–14 AFC Ajax season2013–14 season on loan at Dutch club AFC AjaxAjax with whom he helped win the Eredivisie title. In July 2014 Bojan joined English Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City for €1.8 million.
As a Spanish youth international, he won European Championships with the 2007 UEFA European Under-17 ChampionshipUnder-17 team in 2007 and the 2011 UEFA European Under-21 ChampionshipUnder-21 team in 2011, as well as earning his only cap for Spain national football teamthe senior team in 2008. He has also represented the Catalonia national football teamCatalonian national team seven times since 2007.

Tomas Antonelius.name: Tomas Antonelius
Tomas Antonelius.intro:
'''Tomas Antonelius''' (born '''Tomas Gustafsson'''; 7 May 1973) is a Swedish former Association footballfootballer, who became an economics student since his retirement. He began his career playing as "Tomas Gustafsson", before changing his name in 2001. The reason for this change was that "Gustafsson" is a very common name in Sweden and it caused a lot of confusion, he chose "Antonelius" as it was the married name of his older sister.
A self-confessed AIK supporter, Antonelius played for IF BrommapojkarnaBrommapojkarna, AIK FotbollAIK, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in the Premier League and F.C. CopenhagenCopenhagen in Danish SuperligaDenmark. He also had a brief stint with Canadian side Winnipeg Fury, during a year in college in North America.

Daniel Agger.name: Daniel Agger
Daniel Agger.intro:
'''Daniel Munthe Agger''' (; born 12 December 1984) is a Danish peopleDanish association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)Defender for Danish club Brøndby IF and captains the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team. Agger has been described as "a fine reader of the game, comfortable on the ball and blessed with a ferocious shot."
He started his senior career with Brøndby in July 2004, winning the Danish Superliga and the Danish Cup, before moving to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in January 2006. He made 175 Premier League appearances for the club and won the Football League CupLeague Cup and FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield. Agger returned to Brøndby for personal reasons in August 2014.
A full international since 2005, Agger has earned over 60 caps and played for Denmark at the 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012.

Alexandre Bonnot.name: Alexandre Bonnot
Alexandre Bonnot.intro: '''Alexandre Bonnot''' (born July 31, 1973 in Poissy, Yvelines) is a former Association footballfootball Midfielder (football)midfielder.

Tobias Linderoth.name: Tobias Linderoth
Tobias Linderoth.intro: '''Tobias Jan Håkan Linderoth''' (; born 21 April 1979 in Marseille, France) is a former SwedenSwedish association footballfootball player.

Chris Black.name: Chris Black
Chris Black.intro: '''Chris Black''' (born 7 September 1982) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a  midfielder.

Paris Simmons.name: Paris Simmons
Paris Simmons.intro: '''Paris Simmons''' (born 2 January 1990 in London Borough of Lewisham) is an English Association footballfootballer currently playing for New Orleans Jesters in the USL Premier Development League.

Stephen Pearson.name: Stephen Pearson
Stephen Pearson.intro:
'''Stephen Paul Pearson''' (born 2 October 1982) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Scottish Premiership club Motherwell F.C.Motherwell.
Pearson is a full international for Scotland national football teamScotland, and also played for Bristol City F.C.Bristol City, Motherwell F.C.Motherwell, Celtic F.C.Celtic, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Kerala Blasters.

Xabi Alonso.name: Xabi Alonso
Xabi Alonso.intro:
'''Xabier "Xabi" Alonso Olano''' (, ; born 25 November 1981) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for German club FC Bayern Munich as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Alonso began his career at Real Sociedad, the main team of his home province Gipuzkoa. After a brief loan period at SD Eibar, he returned to Sociedad where then-manager John Toshack appointed Alonso as his Captain (association football)team captain. Alonso succeeded in the role, taking Real Sociedad to second place in the 2002–03 La Liga2002–03 season. He moved to Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in August 2004 for Pound sterling£10.5 million. He won the UEFA Champions League in his first season at the club, scoring the equalising goal in the 2005 UEFA Champions League FinalFinal against A.C. Milan. The following season, he won the FA Cup and the FA Community Shield. He moved to Real Madrid for the start of the 2009–10 La Liga2009–10 season in a deal worth around £30 million. After five seasons at the club, winning honours including a league title in 2012 and the Champions League in 2014, he was signed by Bayern Munich on a two-year contract.
He made his international debut for Spain national football teamSpain in April 2003 in a 4–0 victory against Ecuador national football teamEcuador. While playing for Spain, Alonso has won UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008,  UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012 and the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup, and he has also represented his country at UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 and the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup. On 23 June 2012, Alonso won his 100th cap for Spain in the quarter-final of Euro 2012 against France national football teamFrance: he celebrated the occasion by scoring both of Spain's goals to send them into the semi-finals. Following Spain's failure to progress out of the group stages at the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup, Alonso retired from international football on 27 August 2014. His 114 caps make him the fifth most capped player in the nation's history.

Jem Karacan.name: Jem Karacan
Jem Karacan.intro: '''Jem Paul Karacan''' (, ; born 21 February 1989) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays for and captains Reading F.C.Reading as a midfielder. He has played internationally for the Turkey national youth football teamTurkish youth team, and has captained the U-21 side.

Elliott Ward.name: Elliott Ward
Elliott Ward.intro: '''Elliott Leslie Ward''' (born 19 January 1985, Harrow, LondonHarrow, Middlesex) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth in the English Football League Championship. He has played in the Premier League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

Thomas Butler.name: Thomas Butler
Thomas Butler.intro: '''Thomas Anthony Butler''' (born 25 April 1981 in Dublin) is a former professional footballer who last played for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in the Premier League. He has played for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at under-21 and senior level.

Giuseppe Mazzarelli.name: Giuseppe Mazzarelli
Giuseppe Mazzarelli.intro:
'''Giuseppe Mazzarelli''' (born 14 August 1972 in Uster) is a former SwitzerlandSwiss football (soccer)footballer.
During his career he played for FC Zürich, Manchester City F.C., Grasshopper Club Zürich, FC St. Gallen, A.S. Bari and FC Baden.  He earned 12 caps for the Switzerland national football team.

Josh Payne.name: Josh Payne
Josh Payne.intro: '''Joshua James "Josh" Payne''' (born 25 November 1990) is an English association footballfootball player who plays as a midfielder for Woking F.C.Woking. He has previously played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United and Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town.

Laurent Blanc.name: Laurent Blanc
Laurent Blanc.intro:
'''Laurent Robert Blanc''' (; born 19 November 1965) is a French association footballfootball manager, former Football playerplayer and currently the manager of Paris Saint-Germain F.C.Paris Saint-Germain. He was the manager of the France national football teamFrance national team until 2012, having replaced Raymond Domenech in the wake of the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa.
Blanc played professional football for numerous clubs, including Montpellier HSCMontpellier, S.S.C. NapoliNapoli, FC BarcelonaBarcelona, Olympique de MarseilleMarseille, F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, often operating in the Defender (association football)#Sweeper (libero)sweeper position. He is also a former France national football teamFrench international, playing in several international tournaments, including the 1998 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2000, both of which France national football teamFrance won. On 28 June 1998, Blanc scored the first golden goal in FIFA World CupWorld Cup history against Paraguay national football teamParaguay. Blanc has the nickname ''Le Président'', which was given to him following his stint at Olympique de MarseilleMarseille in tribute to his leadership skills.

Ron Vlaar.name: Ron Vlaar
Ron Vlaar.intro: '''Ron Peter Vlaar''' (; born 16 February 1985) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Premier League club Aston Villa F.C., who he captains. Vlaar is also a regular at centre back for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team. Vlaar has regularly been acknowledged as one of the best defenders at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Ron Vlaar.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mike Galloway.name: Mike Galloway
Mike Galloway.intro:
'''Mike Galloway''' (born 30 May 1965) is a retired football (soccer)football defender (football)defender.  He earned a single cap for the Scotland national football team in 1991.
A player with an aggressive attitude to the game but with a skilful left foot.  A hard-tackling and aggressive ball winner the red-haired Galloway started his career with Berwick and after spells at Mansfield Town and Halifax he moved to Tynecastle in the autumn of 1987. Galloway’s combatative performances for Hearts were a key reason why the Edinburgh side were able to push Celtic all the way during the 1987/88 season.
Bhoys boss Billy McNeill turned to Galloway to add steel to his side and Mike would make his competitive debut in a 3-1 win at old club Hearts on August 12. He would be a regular feature in that first year with the club and despite a weight problem and some inconsistent performances which saw him in and out of the team he would earn a Scotland cap in October 1991.
On his game he was an excellent midfield enforcer but at other times his slackness could be costly and as managers came and went at Parkhead a lack of discipline off the field saw Galloway lambasted by boss Lou Macari over missed training sessions.
From that time on he was seldom more than a bit-part player at Celtic Park and he eventually departed in 1995 for Leicester City. Serious injuries sustained in a car crash would end his football career.
On April 27, 2011 he was appointed manager at East Of Scotland League Club Coldstream FC for
season 2011/12.
[
On June 15, 2011 he was appointed manager at Northern Alliance League Club Berwick United for
season 2011/12.
[
On September 22, 2013 he was appointed manager of East of Scotland League side Eyemouth United F.C..
[

Chris Plummer.name: Chris Plummer
Chris Plummer.intro: '''Christopher Scott "Chris" Plummer''' (born 12 October 1976) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, and former manager of Conference North side Corby Town F.C.Corby Town and current manager of Peterborough Sports F.C.Peterborough Sports.

Markus Babbel.name: Markus Babbel
Markus Babbel.intro: '''Markus Babbel''' (; born 8 September 1972) is a former international GermanyGerman Association footballfootball player and coach who is the manager of FC Luzern. He played as a Defender (association football)defender for clubs in Germany and England.
Markus Babbel.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Aron Gunnarsson.name: Aron Gunnarsson
Aron Gunnarsson.intro:
'''Aron Einar Malmquist Gunnarsson''' (born 22 April 1989) is an Icelandic professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Welsh club Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. He can play either at Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or in Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfield.
Aron has played club football in Iceland, the Netherlands, England and Wales for Þór Akureyri, AZ (football club)AZ, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City respectively. He also plays for Iceland national football teamIceland at international level, having made his senior debut in 2008, and has been Iceland's captain since mid-2012.

Lee Boylan.name: Lee Boylan
Lee Boylan.intro:
'''Lee Martin Boylan''' (born 2 September 1978) is a former Association footballfootballer and currently is a player coach with Heybridge Swifts F.C.Heybridge Swifts. He has made over 450 first-team appearances, almost all in the Football Conference.
Boylan began his career with West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in 1995, and progressed through the club's recognised West Ham United F.C. Reserves and Academyyouth academy. He played one game for West Ham in the Premier League, as a substitute (association football)substitute during the latter stages of the 1996-97 in English football1996–97 season. He was sent out on loan Kingstonian F.C.Kingstonian in 1998, and was released on return to his parent club in 1999. He had brief spells with Trelleborgs FFTrelleborg in Sweden and with Exeter City F.C.Exeter City, before rejoining Kingstonian on a permanent basis in 2000. He left the club in November 2000, and he had brief spells with both Hayes F.C.Hayes and Stevenage during the final months of the 2000-01 in English football2000–01 season.
Ahead of the 2001-02 in English football2001–02 season, Boylan joined Canvey Island F.C.Canvey Island, where he was hugely successful; playing 210 games and scoring 176 goals for the club during his five-year tenure with the Essex side. When Canvey resigned from the Conference in 2006, he joined Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic on a one-year contract, but was later loaned to Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City after struggling for first-team appearances at Grays. Boylan joined Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United on a free transfer shortly before the 2007-08 in English football2007–08 season, as Cambridge narrowly missed out on promotion to the Football League in May 2008. He joined Stevenage F.C.Stevenage for an undisclosed fee in June 2008, scoring the second in a 2–0 win against York City F.C.York City in the FA Trophy final at Wembley Stadium in May 2009. Boylan was also part of the side that won promotion to the Football League the following season. Boylan was released by Stevenage in January 2011, and he subsequently re-joined Chelmsford City in March of the same year. After just five appearances for Chelmsford, Boylan joined Thurrock for the rest of the 2010-11 in English football2010–11 season. He spent a further season at Thurrock, before leaving the club following their relegation. In July 2012, Boylan joined A.F.C. SudburyAFC Sudbury. Mid-way through the 2012–13 in English football2012–13 season, Boylan joined divisional rivals Maldon & Tiptree.

Darren Patterson.name: Darren Patterson
Darren Patterson.intro: '''Darren James Patterson''' (born 15 October 1969) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former association footballfootballer and manager (association football)manager. He was most recently the caretaker manager of Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United following Andy Scott (English footballer)Andy Scott's dismissal as manager on 19 March 2012. As a player he was primarily a central defender who could also play at full back or as a defensive midfielder. He is the interim assistant manager at Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, where he has previously held the positions of Head of Youth, Assistant Manager and Caretaker Manager. On 10 June 2011, he became Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United's assistant manager.

Rick Holden.name: Rick Holden
Rick Holden.intro: '''Richard William "Rick" Holden''' (born 9 September 1964 in Skipton, North Yorkshire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer. He played for six clubs in a decade-long career. He moved into management after retiring.

Shaka Hislop.name: Shaka Hislop
Shaka Hislop.intro:
'''Neil Shaka Hislop''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 22 February 1969) is a former association footballfootball goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper. The majority of his career was spent in the top division in England where he was a part of the Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United team which finished second in the Premier League for two successive seasons under Kevin Keegan's first tenure. Before this he played for Reading F.C.Reading where he was on the losing side in the Football League Championship Play-Offs1st Division play-offs despite finishing second overall (which became an automatic promotion slot the following season). He later played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United on two separate occasions (receiving an FA Cup Runner-up medal during his second term in 2006) and also Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth (where he won the Football League Championship1st Division in 2002/03).
He was eligible to play for both England national football teamEngland and Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago.  He initially played for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U-21 team and was on the bench for a full International against Chile national football teamChile, but in the end opted to play for Trinidad & Tobago. A dispute with the national team ruled him out of contention for several years, but he returned to play and starred in the country's first ever World Cup appearance in 2006.
He is now working for sports news and broadcasting service ESPN and regularly provides commentary on Eredivisie, Serie A, and Mexican Liga MX matches. He had also briefly worked as a goalkeeping coach for the football team at Quinnipiac University.

Kevin Ball.name: Kevin Ball
Kevin Ball.intro: '''Kevin Ball''' (born 12 November 1964) is an English former footballer who holds the position of senior professional development coach at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.

Tom Cowan.name: Tom Cowan
Tom Cowan.intro:
'''Thomas''' "'''Tom'''" '''Cowan''' (born 28 August 1969) is a former ScotlandScottish association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender.
During his career he played for Clyde F.C.Clyde, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, York City F.C.York City, Dundee F.C.Dundee, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Barrow A.F.C.Barrow, Workington A.F.C.Workington, Hucknall Town F.C.Hucknall Town, Stalybridge Celtic F.C.Stalybridge Celtic, Hyde United F.C.Hyde United and Retford United F.C.Retford United.

Clint Dempsey.name: Clint Dempsey
Clint Dempsey.intro:
'''Clinton Drew "Clint" Dempsey'''  (born  March 9, 1983) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays for Seattle Sounders FC in Major League Soccer. He is the Captain (association football)captain of the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team. He has also played for New England Revolution, Fulham F.C.Fulham and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
Growing up in Nacogdoches, Texas, Dempsey played for one of the top youth soccer clubs in the state, the Dallas Texans Soccer ClubDallas Texans, before playing for Furman University's men's soccer team. In 2004, Dempsey was drafted by Major League Soccer club New England Revolution, where he quickly integrated himself into the starting lineup. Hindered initially by a jaw injury, he would eventually score 25 goals in 71 appearances with the Revolution. Between 2007 and 2012, Dempsey played for Premier League team Fulham and is the club's highest Premier League goalscorer of all time. Dempsey became the first American player to score a hat-trick in the English Premier League, in the 5–2 win over Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in January 2012.
Dempsey first represented the United States at the 2003 FIFA World Youth Championship in the United Arab Emirates. He made his first appearance with the senior team on November 17, 2004, against Jamaica national football teamJamaica; he was then named to the squad for the 2006 FIFA World Cup and scored the team's only goal of the tournament. Dempsey recorded the fastest goal in US World Cup qualifying history by scoring after 53 seconds of an eventual 8–0 defeat of Barbados national football teamBarbados. He later bested that feat in 2012 scoring just 36 seconds into a 2–1 qualifying loss at Jamaica. In the 2010 FIFA World Cup, Dempsey scored against England national football teamEngland, becoming the second American, after Brian McBride, to score goals in multiple World Cup tournaments.  In the 2014 FIFA World Cup, Dempsey again bested his previous feat, scoring 30 seconds into a match against Ghana, the fifth fastest goal in World Cup history.
Clint Dempsey.position: Forward  association football  Forward,Midfielder Attacking Midfielder Attacking Midfielder

Ryan Seager.name: Ryan Seager
Ryan Seager.intro: '''Ryan Paul Seager''' (born 5 February 1996) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton. Seager signed a professional deal with Southampton in 2013 and primarily plays as a Forward (association football)forward.

Neil Kilkenny.name: Neil Kilkenny
Neil Kilkenny.intro: '''Neil Martin Kilkenny''' (born 19 December 1985) is a association footballfootball player who plays for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End. A midfielder, he began his career in the youth system at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, and went on to play league football for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before joining Bristol City in 2011.

Emre Can.name: Emre Can
Emre Can.intro:
'''Emre Can''' (, born 12 January 1994) is a German professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder. A versatile player, Can can also play as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder, Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back or Defender (association football)#Full-backfull-back.
He began his career at Bayern Munich, playing mostly in Bayern Munich IIits reserve side before transferring to Bayer Leverkusen in 2013. A season later, he was signed by Liverpool for £9.75 million.
He has represented Germany from Under-15 to Germany national under-21 football teamUnder-21 level.

Ian Holloway.name: Ian Holloway
Ian Holloway.intro:
'''Ian Scott Holloway''' (born 12 March 1963) is an English association footballfootball Coach (sport)manager and former player.
A midfielder, he began his career at hometown club Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers in 1981, going on to play for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Brentford F.C.Brentford, Torquay United F.C.Torquay United (on loan), back to Bristol Rovers for a second spell, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and, finally, a third spell back at Bristol Rovers, where he became player-manager before ending his playing career in 1999. He has also managed Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. As he did with Blackpool three years earlier, Holloway managed Crystal Palace to promotion to the Premier League in May 2013, but after the club had won only one of their opening eight games he left, by mutual consent, on 23 October 2013 after less than a year in charge. On 6 January 2014 Holloway signed a two-and-a-half-year deal with Millwall F.C.Millwall; this was terminated in March 2015.
He is known by the nickname "Ollie", which is also the title of his autobiography. Holloway has a reputation amongst football fans for his Bristol accent, off-the-wall interviews and amusing answers to questions from the media, with a wide selection of quotes and soundbites being printed.

Geraint Williams.name: Geraint Williams
Geraint Williams.intro:
'''David Geraint Williams''', known as '''Geraint Williams''' (born 5 January 1962 in Cwmparc) is a WalesWelsh Manager (football)football manager and former international association footballfootballer.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1980 until 2000 for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. He also played for Wales national football teamWales where he was capped 13 times. Williams is currently manager of the Wales national under-21 football team.

Mark Brennan.name: Mark Brennan
Mark Brennan.intro:
'''Mark Robert Brennan''' (born 4 October 1965, Rawtenstall, Lancashire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played in the Football League for Ipswich Town, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Manchester City, in the Premier League for Oldham Athletic, in the Chinese Jia-A League for Guangdong Hongyuan F.C.Guangdong Hongyuan, and in the Australian National Soccer League for Sydney Olympic.
He went on to play state league football in Australia and non-League football in England. At international level, Brennan was cap (sports)capped five times for the England under-21 national football teamEngland under-21 team.

Marc Overmars.name: Marc Overmars
Marc Overmars.intro:
'''Marc Overmars''' (, born 29 March 1973) is a Dutch former association footballfootballer who is the director of football at AFC AjaxAjax. Throughout his footballing career, he played as a Winger (soccer)winger and was renowned for his speed.
Overmars was born in Emst and was passionate about football at an early age. He began his playing career at SV Epe, before joining Go Ahead Eagles' youth team in 1987. He secured a place in the first team by the 1990–91 season, but joined Willem II (football club)Willem II in time for the following season. His stay at the club was short; after 31 appearances he signed for Ajax in 1992. He established himself as a key member of the team that won three Eredivisie titles from between 1994 and 1996 and the UEFA Champions League in 1995 UEFA Champions League Final1995. In December 1995, Overmars sustained a cruciate ligament injury which ruled him out of playing for eight months.
In 1997, he joined Arsenal F.C.Arsenal; his performances at the club were indifferent to begin with and attracted criticism from football pundits and fans alike. By the end of his first season at the club, Overmars became a focal point of the team's league and cup Double (association football)double success. He scored the winning goal against league rivals Manchester United F.C.Manchester United which set Arsenal on their way to securing the Premier League title and opened the scoring against Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in the 1998 FA Cup Final. In 2000, he moved to FC BarcelonaBarcelona in a deal worth £25 million and became the most expensive player in Dutch football history. The club failed to win silverware during his stay and numerous managerial changes made him a peripheral player. A persistent knee injury prompted Overmars to announce his retirement in 2004, but he reversed his decision in 2008 and went on to play one season for Go Ahead Eagles before retiring again. In 2012, he was named as Ajax's director of football.
Overmars represented the Netherlands national football team for eleven years. He made his debut in 1993 against Turkey national football teamTurkey, a match in which he scored in, and was a member of the Netherlands squads for four major tournaments, the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 and 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 FIFA World Cups, and UEFA Euro 20002000 and UEFA Euro 20042004 UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships.

Dean Whitehead.name: Dean Whitehead
Dean Whitehead.intro:
'''Dean Whitehead''' (born 12 January 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough as a midfielder.
Whitehead joined his local non-league club Abingdon Town F.C.Abingdon Town before he signed for The Football LeagueFootball League side Oxford United in 1999. He impressed in the lower divisions and was signed by Championship side Sunderland in 2004. He won promotion in his first season with the Black Cats however, Sunderland were relegated from the Premier League with a record low points tally of 15. He was made captain by Roy Keane as Sunderland claimed an instant return to the top flight. After two more seasons in the north-east Whitehead joined Stoke City for a fee of £5 million in August 2009. He helped Stoke reach the 2011 FA Cup Final where Stoke finished runners-up to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. After spending four seasons with the Potters, Whitehead moved to Middlesbrough in July 2013.
Dean Whitehead.position: Midfielder Central midfielder Centre midfield,Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Michael Jeffrey.name: Michael Jeffrey
Michael Jeffrey.intro: '''Michael Jeffrey''' (born 11 August 1971 in Liverpool, Merseyside) is a former Association footballfootball player, whose career lasted from 1989 to 2002. He played for Fortuna Sittard and various British teams, including Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Simon Stewart.name: Simon Stewart
Simon Stewart.intro: '''Simon Stewart''' (born 1 November 1973) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball defender (football)defender.

Terry Gibson.name: Terry Gibson
Terry Gibson.intro: '''Terence Bradley''' "'''Terry'''" '''Gibson''' (born 23 December 1962 in Walthamstow) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward for several clubs, including Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon.

Christophe Berra.name: Christophe Berra
Christophe Berra.intro:
'''Christophe Didier Berra''' (born 31 January 1985) is a ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town as a Defender (association football)centre back.
Berra began his professional career with Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian in his home city of Edinburgh, playing 146 times for them before he moved to England in 2009 in a £2.5 million transfer to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. He was part of their promotion to the Premier League months later and played in the top flight with the team for three seasons before relegation. His contract was not renewed in 2013, after which he signed for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.

Moritz Volz.name: Moritz Volz
Moritz Volz.intro:
'''Moritz Volz''' (born 21 January 1983 in Siegen) is a GermanyGerman Association footballfootballer currently playing for German 2. Fußball-Bundesliga2. Bundesliga club TSV 1860 München.
Volz generally prefers to play at right-back, although he is comfortable at any defensive position and has played in midfield as well.
Moritz Volz.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Alan Cork.name: Alan Cork
Alan Cork.intro:
'''Alan Cork''' (born 4 March 1959) is an English former professional association footballfootball player. He played as a striker for several clubs, most notably Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon (where he spent 14 years and played in all four divisions of the Football League and gained an FA Cup 1988 FA Cup Finalwinner's medal) and has held a number of managerial and coaching posts since his retirement from playing.
He holds the record for first team appearances and first team goals at Wimbledon, and is also the only player to have scored in all four divisions of the pre-1992 Football League and also the Premier League.
He is the father of Swansea City F.C.Swansea player Jack Cork.

Dickson Etuhu.name: Dickson Etuhu
Dickson Etuhu.intro: '''Dickson Paul Etuhu''' (born 8 June 1982 in Kano) is a Nigerian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Swedish AIK FotbollAIK in Allsvenskan. His younger brother Kelvin EtuhuKelvin is also a footballer. He grew up in Peckham, south London, but plays international football for the Nigerian national football team.

Jordan Cook.name: Jordan Cook
Jordan Cook.intro: '''Jordan Alan Cook''' (born 20 March 1990) is an EnglandEnglish professional association footballfootballer, who plays as a striker (football)striker for Walsall F.C.Walsall.

Franck Queudrue.name: Franck Queudrue
Franck Queudrue.intro:
'''Franck Queudrue''' (born 27 August 1978) is a French Association footballfootballer who last played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back for FC Red Star Saint-Ouen. He began his career with RC LensLens, for whom he played in Ligue 1, and went on to play in the Premier League for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Fulham F.C.Fulham and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, and in the Football League for Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. He returned to Lens in 2010, and joined Red Star on a free transfer in 2012. Queudrue retired at the end of the 2012-13 season.
Queudrue played one match for France at B international level, and considered playing for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland until being deemed ineligible by FIFA to play for them.
Franck Queudrue.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Mladen Petri\u0107.name: Mladen Petrić
Mladen Petri\u0107.intro: '''Mladen Petrić''' (; born 1 January 1981) is a Croatian Croatia national football teaminternational association footballfootballer who plays for GreeceGreek club Panathinaikos F.C.Panathinaikos. He also holds Swiss nationality lawSwiss citizenship. He has previously played for Grasshopper Club ZürichGrasshopper, FC BaselBasel, Borussia Dortmund, Hamburger SV, Fulham F.C.Fulham and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United  and for the Croatia national football teamCroatian national team.

Brede Hangeland.name: Brede Hangeland
Brede Hangeland.intro:
'''Brede Paulsen Hangeland''' (born 20 June 1981) is a Norwegian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace of the Premier League as a central defender.
He began his career with Viking FKViking, where he won the Norwegian Cup in 2001. In 2006 he moved to F.C. Copenhagen, and went on to win two Danish Superliga titles at the club. From 2008 to 2014 he played for Fulham F.C.Fulham, helping the team to the 2010 UEFA Cup Final, but was released in 2014 after the club's relegation, subsequently joining Crystal Palace.
Hangeland played for the Norway national football teamNorway national team between 2002 and 2014. He was the team captain from 2008 until his resignation. In total he played 91 matches and scored 4 goals.

David Smith (footballer, born 1970).name: David Smith (footballer, born 1970)
David Smith (footballer, born 1970).intro:
'''David "Dave" Smith''' (nickname ''Smudger'') (born 26 December 1970) is a former professional association footballfootballer. He was a midfielder who played for Norwich City F.C. (where he began his career), Oxford United F.C., Stockport County F.C., Macclesfield Town F.C. and Drogheda United.
He came through the youth team and reserves at Norwich and played 18 times for the first team. His league debut was in April 1990 against Derby County. He played 198 times for Oxford (2 goals), and 60 games for Stockport.

John Hendry.name: John Hendry
John Hendry.intro: '''John Hendry''' (born 6 January 1970) is a ScotlandScottish Association footballfootball striker (football)forward.

Dean Austin.name: Dean Austin
Dean Austin.intro:
'''Dean Barry Austin''' (born 26 April 1970 in Hemel Hempstead) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (football)defender.
He started his career at St Albans City F.C.St Albans and went on to play for Southend United F.C.Southend United, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He retired after the 2002–03 season while at Woking F.C.Woking and has since worked as a coach.

Nathaniel Clyne.name: Nathaniel Clyne
Nathaniel Clyne.intro: '''Nathaniel Edwin Clyne''' (born 5 April 1991) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)#Full-backright-back for Southampton F.C.Southampton and the England national football team.
Nathaniel Clyne.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Frank Yallop.name: Frank Yallop
Frank Yallop.intro:
'''Frank Walter Yallop''' (born 4 April 1964) is an English-born Canadian former professional association footballsoccer player and the current head coach of the Chicago Fire Soccer ClubChicago Fire in Major League Soccer.
Although he grew up in Vancouver, Watford-born Yallop spent the majority of his playing career in England, spending 13 years and making over 300 appearances for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, including playing in the first three seasons of the Premier League. He also played in Major League Soccer for the Tampa Bay Mutiny, and earned 52 caps for the Canada men's national soccer teamCanada national football team.

Dean Ashton.name: Dean Ashton
Dean Ashton.intro: '''Dean Ashton''' (born 24 November 1983) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer. He made over 240 appearances as a forward in the The Football LeagueFootball League and Premier League for Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, and was also capped by England national football teamEngland. He was highly praised as a talented centre forward, but had a career frustrated by injury. He retired on 11 December 2009, aged 26, after failing to recover from a long-term ankle injury sustained during international duty with England.

Christopher Samba.name: Christopher Samba
Christopher Samba.intro: '''Veijeany Christopher Samba''' (born 28 March 1984), known as '''Christopher Samba''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for FC Dynamo Moscow in the Russian Football Premier LeagueRussian Premier League. Born in France, he plays for the Congo national football teamCongo national team.

Steve Froggatt.name: Steve Froggatt
Steve Froggatt.intro: '''Stephen "Steve" Junior Froggatt''' (born 9 March 1973 in Lincoln, LincolnshireLincoln, Lincolnshire), former student of Yarborough School (now Lincoln Castle Academy), is an EnglandEnglish former Association footballfootballer. His senior playing career lasted from 1991 until 2001, when he announced his retirement after failing to recover from injury.

Jorge Cadete.name: Jorge Cadete
Jorge Cadete.intro:
'''Jorge Paulo Cadete Santos Reis''' (born 27 August 1968), known as '''Cadete''', is a PortugalPortuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Born to White African#Former Portuguese coloniesPortuguese settlers, he was groomed in Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting's prolific youth system, and later was noted while at Celtic F.C.Celtic, as he led the goalscoring charts in 1996–97 Scottish Premier Division1996–97.
Cadete amassed Primeira Liga totals of 233 games and 73 goals over the course of 12 seasons. A Portugal national football teamPortuguese international throughout the 90s, he represented the nation at UEFA Euro 1996Euro 1996.

Steve Watson.name: Steve Watson
Steve Watson.intro: '''Steven Craig "Steve" Watson''' (born 1 April 1974 in North Shields, England) is a former English Association footballfootballer, who retired after being released by Sheffield Wednesday on 15 May 2009.

Chris Armstrong (footballer, born 1982).name: Chris Armstrong (footballer, born 1982)
Chris Armstrong (footballer, born 1982).intro:
'''Christopher "Chris" Armstrong''' (born 5 August 1982 in Newcastle upon Tyne, England) is a retired professional association footballfootballer, who most recently played for Reading F.C.Reading in the Football League Championship. In 2011 he retired due to Multiple sclerosis.  He is the younger brother of former Sunderland F.C.Sunderland and Burnley F.C.Burnley midfielder Gordon Armstrong.
A former England national football teamEngland U20s full-back (football)full-back, and Scotland national football teamScotland B International, Armstrong was a tough tackler despite only standing at 5 ft 9in (1.75 Metres).

Lauren.name: Lauren
Lauren.intro: '''Laureano Bisan Etamé-Mayer''' (born 19 January 1977 in Kribi), commonly known as '''Lauren''', is a retired Cameroonian Association footballfootballer of Equatorial GuineaEquatoguinean origin, who formerly played for the Cameroon national football teamCameroonian national team. As an Arsenal player he won several trophies and is known as one of the 'Invincibles'; a title given to the Arsenal squad in 2004, after they went the whole (2003–04 in English football2003–04) season undefeated and subsequently won the Premier League title. He also won an Olympic Gold Medal at the 2000 Sydney Olympics with Cameroon. He also holds SpainSpanish citizenship due to being raised in Spain.
Lauren.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Pontus K\u00e5mark.name: Pontus Kåmark
Pontus K\u00e5mark.intro:
'''Pontus Kåmark''' (born 5 April 1969) is a SwedenSwedish former association footballfootballer. He played for AIK FotbollAIK, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, IFK Göteborg and Västerås SK FotbollVästerås SK.
Born in Västerås, Västmanlands län, Kåmark, a defender, was part of the third-place Sweden national football teamSwedish squad at the 1994 FIFA World Cup.[
Today Kåmark works as a football expert at Viasat.

Henri Lansbury.name: Henri Lansbury
Henri Lansbury.intro: '''Henri George Lansbury''' (born 12 October 1990) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He previously played for Arsenal, whom he had been associated with since the age of eight, and had loan spells with Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Watford F.C.Watford, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He achieved back to back promotions from the Football League Championship as he was a member of the Norwich team which finished runners-up in the 2010-11 Football League Championship2010–11 Championship and the West Ham squad that were promoted via the play offs in the 2011-12 Football League Championship2011–12 Championship. He has also played international football to England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 level.

Gerald Dobbs.name: Gerald Dobbs
Gerald Dobbs.intro: '''Gerald Dobbs''' (born 24 January 1971) is a retired EnglandEnglish association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder. He started his career with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, scoring a solitary goal in 33 league appearances, then in 1995 had a loan spell with Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and moved to Conference NationalConference side Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic. After 2 seasons he moved to Ireland, where he played for Cork City Football ClubCork City and Cobh Ramblers F.C.Cobh Ramblers.

Dave Tuttle.name: Dave Tuttle
Dave Tuttle.intro: '''David Philip "Dave" Tuttle''' (born 6 February 1972 in Mortimer Common, Berkshire) is a former EnglandEnglish football (soccer)footballer and is currently manager of Newbury F.C.Newbury.

George McCartney.name: George McCartney
George McCartney.intro: '''George McCartney''' (born 29 April 1981) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish association footballfootballer. He is a free agent having most recently played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He began his career at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 1998. In 2005 he won club's player of the 2004–05 season award, the 2004–05 Football League Championship and was named in the PFA Team of the Year#Championship2004–05 Football League Championship PFA Team of the Year. He moved to West Ham in 2006 before returning to Sunderland under Roy Keane's managership in 2008. He spent one season, the 2010–11 season, on loan with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United before returning in 2011 to play on loan for West Ham. From 2001 until 2010 he also played international football for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland.
