Alex (footballer born 1982).name: Alex (footballer born 1982)
Alex (footballer born 1982).intro:
'''Alex Rodrigo Dias da Costa''', better known as '''Alex''' (; born 17 June 1982), is a Brazilian association footballfootballer who plays for A.C. MilanMilan and the Brazil national football team as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender. Alex is known for his physical strength and the power of his shot, which has gained him the nickname of "The Tank".
Having been bought by the Premier League club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2004, he was loaned to Dutch team PSV EindhovenPSV and he won 3 Eredivisie titles with them. Alex finally joined the Chelsea squad in the summer of 2007 after three years in the Netherlands. In his time at Chelsea, he won the 2009 FA Cup FinalFA Cup in 2009 and a 2009-10 Chelsea F.C. seasonleague and FA Cup "double" in 2010, as well as reaching the 2008 UEFA Champions League Final. He joined Paris Saint-Germain for £4.2 million in January 2012 and won Ligue 1 twice with the club, moving to Milan on the expiration of his contract in 2014.
Alex earned 17 caps for Brazil national football teamBrazil between 2003 and 2008, winning the 2007 Copa América and finishing as runner-up at the 2003 CONCACAF Gold Cup.
Alex (footballer born 1982).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ray Parlour.name: Ray Parlour
Ray Parlour.intro:
'''Raymond "Ray" Parlour''' (born 7 March 1973 in Romford, London) is an England national football teamEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1992 to 2007.
He spent his career playing for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City. During his Arsenal career he was nicknamed "The Romford Pelé"; although the nickname was given with an ironyironic sense of humour,  on account of his solid performance but unglamorous image. He has been described as an "unsung hero" and praised as a "fans' favourite" for his high-energy performances. He is now a pundit on television, as well as on radio stations BBC Radio 5 Live and Talksport. In 2012 Parlour briefly came out of retirement to play for Wembley F.C.Wembley in the club's FA Cup fixtures.

Josip Skoko.name: Josip Skoko
Josip Skoko.intro: '''Josip Skoko''' (born 10 December 1975) is a former Australian Football (soccer)footballer who played as a Midfielder (football)central midfielder for North Geelong Warriors, HNK Hajduk SplitHajduk Split, K.R.C. GenkGenk, Gençlerbirliği S.K.Gençlerbirliği, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Melbourne Heart FCMelbourne Heart. Skoko has been described as a central midfielder with "superb on-ball ability, inch perfect passing, and his ability to turn defence to attack in an instant."

F\u00e1bio Pereira da Silva.name: Fábio Pereira da Silva
F\u00e1bio Pereira da Silva.intro: '''Fábio Pereira da Silva''' (born 9 July 1990), commonly known as '''Fábio''' or '''Fábio da Silva''', is a Brazilian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull-back for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team. He and his twin brother Rafael Pereira da Silva (footballer born 1990)Rafael began their careers with Fluminense FCFluminense in their native Brazil before being signed by English club Manchester United in February 2007. Unlike his brother, Fábio struggled to hold down a place in the Manchester United first team, and after a loan spell with Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 2012–13, he made a permanent move to Cardiff in January 2014.
F\u00e1bio Pereira da Silva.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Jason Brown.name: Jason Brown
Jason Brown.intro: '''Jason Roy Brown''' (born 18 May 1982) is a Wales national football teamWelsh international association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Conference Premier side Dartford F.C.Dartford.

Fraizer Campbell.name: Fraizer Campbell
Fraizer Campbell.intro:
'''Fraizer Lee Campbell''' (born 13 September 1987) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He has previously played for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.
A product of Manchester United's youth academy, Campbell progressed to their first-team in the 2006–07 in English football2006–07 season. He made four appearances without scoring in his tenure at the club. He had a Loan (sports)loan spell at Belgian club Royal Antwerp, where he scored 24 goals in 38 games. He also had loan periods with Hull City and Tottenham Hotspur, where he scored 15 goals in 37 matches and three goals in 22 games respectively. He signed for Sunderland at the beginning of the 2009–10 in English football2009–10 season for £3.5 million. His involvement at Sunderland was limited due to an anterior cruciate ligament injury he sustained in his 2010–11 in English footballsecond season at the club, as well as a recurrence of the same problem later in the season. He moved to Cardiff in January 2013 on a three-and-a-half-year deal, and then Crystal Palace 18 months later.
Having previously represented the country from Under-16 to Under-21 level, Campbell earned his only cap for the England national football team in 2012.

David May.name: David May
David May.intro:
'''David May''' (born 24 June 1970) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back, and Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back from 1988 to 2006.
He played Premier League football for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Manchester United F.C.Manchester United where he collected numerous trophies in a nine-year spell at Old Trafford. He went on to play in the Football League for Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Burnley F.C.Burnley before finishing his career with non-league footballnon-league Bacup Borough F.C.Bacup Borough.
David May.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ryan Nelsen.name: Ryan Nelsen
Ryan Nelsen.intro:
'''Ryan William Nelsen''', New Zealand Order of MeritONZM (born 18 October 1977) is a former New Zealand professional football player and former head coach of Major League Soccer side Toronto FC.
Nelsen commonly played as a Defender (association football)defender, and his professional career began in 1995. He notably captained the New Zealand national team, the All Whites and started his professional football career in his native country for Christchurch United. In 2001 he joined MLS side D.C. United and went on to play 81 times in the league, scoring 7 goals. In 2005 he moved to England with Premier League side Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he scored 8 times in 172 appearances. In 2012 he made a move to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur but only managed 5 appearances before joining Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in the summer of 2012. He agreed to return to MLS on 8 January 2013 by signing with Toronto FC as Head Coach. He was fired from Toronto FC on 31 August 2014.

Leam Richardson.name: Leam Richardson
Leam Richardson.intro: '''Leam Nathan Richardson''' (born 19 November 1979) is an English Association footballfootballer and assistant manager of Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield FC. His previous clubs include Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley.

Karim El Ahmadi.name: Karim El Ahmadi
Karim El Ahmadi.intro: '''Karim El Ahmadi Aroussi''' (Arabic: كريم الأحمدي; born 27 January 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a defensive midfielder for Feyenoord in the Eredivisie and the Morocco national football teamMorocco national team. El Ahmadi was born in the Netherlands and played for FC Twente and Feyenoord before moving to the Premier League with Aston Villa in 2012.

Phil Stamp.name: Phil Stamp
Phil Stamp.intro: '''Philip Lawrence "Phil" Stamp''' (born 12 December 1975 in Middlesbrough, England) is an English Association footballfootball midfielder. He made his first-team league debut, aged 17 for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough on 10 October 1993, in a 2–0 defeat to Watford F.C.Watford. He started for Middlesbrough in the 1997 FA Cup Final and featured in the cover of Let's Dance released by the club for the final by Bob Mortimer. After Middlesbrough he played for Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts and Darlington F.C.Darlington, scoring a superb free kick for the latter against Shrewsbury Town. and including a match against Notts County where he played in goal for the second half.

Andy Booth.name: Andy Booth
Andy Booth.intro: '''Andrew David "Andy" Booth''' (born 6 December 1973 in Huddersfield, England) is a retired professional association footballfootballer. Whilst at Huddersfield he announced his retirement on 22 April 2009, but remains at the club as an ambassador, he also played for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League and represented his country with the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21's.

Ga\u00ebl Clichy.name: Gaël Clichy
Ga\u00ebl Clichy.intro:
'''Gaël Clichy''' ( ; born 26 July 1985) is a French professional footballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the France national football team. He is predominantly left footed but naturally right footed, he primarily plays as a Leftbackleft-back that is also capable of playing as an offensive-minded Leftwingbackwingback. Clichy is described as a player who possesses "almost unrivaled stamina" that is "quick in the tackle and willing to drive forward". He was a member of Arsenal's famous 2003–04 Arsenal F.C. seasonInvincibles team before leaving the club in 2011.
Clichy was born in the city of Toulouse and began his football career playing for a host of amateur clubs in the Haute-Garonne département such as JS Cugnaux, AS Muret, and AS TournefeuilleTournefeuille. In 2001, he moved to the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur Regions of Franceregion to play for professional club AS CannesCannes. Clichy made his professional debut for the club in the 2002–03 season while the club was playing in the Championnat National, the third level of Football in FranceFrench football. After three seasons with Cannes, in 2003, he was convinced by manager and French peoplecountryman Arsène Wenger to join Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in England.
In Clichy's 2003–04 FA Premier Leaguefirst season with the club, he was a member of the team, dubbed the 2003–04 Arsenal F.C. seasonInvincibles, that went undefeated in the league season. As a result of the title, at 18 years and 10 months, Clichy became the youngest player to win a Premier League medal. After three seasons of backing up Ashley Cole, in the 2006–07 FA Premier League2006–07 season, Clichy took over the starters' role permanently. In the 2007–08 Premier League2007–08 season, he appeared in all 38 league matches. His performances during the season earned him an appearance on the Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) PFA Team of the YearTeam of the Year. Aside from the 2003–04 league title, he has also won the 2004 FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield and 2005 FA Cup FinalFA Cup in 2004 and 2005, respectively, with Arsenal.
Clichy is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international and has represented his nation at every level for which he was eligible. Prior to playing for the France national football teamsenior team, he played on the France national under-17 football teamunder-17 team that finished runners-up to Switzerland national under-17 football teamSwitzerland at the 2002 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship. Clichy made his senior international debut in September 2008 in a 2010 World Cup qualification match against Serbia national football teamSerbia. He made his first major international tournament appearance for France at the 2010 FIFA World Cup. Clichy made one appearance in the competition against South Africa national football teamSouth Africa in the final group stage match.

\u00c9mile Mpenza.name: Émile Mpenza
\u00c9mile Mpenza.intro: '''Eka Basunga Lokonda "Émile" Mpenza''' (born 4 July 1978) is a BelgiumBelgian former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He has been Cap (sport)capped at international level by Belgium national football teamBelgium. His older brother, Mbo MpenzaMbo, was also a footballer who represented Belgium.

Guly do Prado.name: Guly do Prado
Guly do Prado.intro: '''Guilherme "Guly" do Prado Raymundo''', (born 31 December 1981) is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for the MLS club Chicago Fire Soccer ClubChicago Fire.

Florent Laville.name: Florent Laville
Florent Laville.intro: '''Florent Laville''' (born 7 August 1973 in Valence, Drôme) is a retired FranceFrench Association footballfootball defender.

Wayne Bridge.name: Wayne Bridge
Wayne Bridge.intro:
'''Wayne Michael Bridge''' (born 5 August 1980) is a retired English Association footballfootballer who played as a left back most recently for Football League Championship club Reading F.C.Reading.
A graduate of the Southampton F.C. AcademySouthampton Academy where he made his debut in 1998, he has also played for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, West Ham United F.C.West Ham, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Fulham F.C.Fulham during his Premiership career. Bridge made 36 appearances for the England national football teamEngland national team, including representing England in the FIFA World CupWorld Cup.

Samassi Abou.name: Samassi Abou
Samassi Abou.intro:
'''Samassi Abou''' (born 4 April 1973 in Gagnoa) is a former professional Football (soccer)footballer from Côte d'Ivoire, who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He played internationally for the France national under-21 football teamFrench under-21 team.
Abou started playing in France for FC Martigues, before moving to Olympique LyonnaisLyon. In October 1997, after a spell at AS Cannes, he made the move to EnglandEnglish football, signing for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United for £250,000. Signed by manager, Harry Redknapp, to give more options for strikers, Abou made his West Ham debut on 9 November 1997 in a 2-1 away defeat to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea coming on as a substitute for John Moncur. His opening West Ham goal came on 6 January 1998 in the Football League CupLeague Cup. In a 5th round game at the Boleyn Ground Abou came on as a substitute for Paul Kitson to score their only goal in a 2-1 defeat. In the following game, on 10 January 1998, Abou scored twice as West Ham beat Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, 6-0. Abou received his only red card (football)red card in the next game, a 1-0 away defeat to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. Fouling Ramon Vega in an off-the-ball incident, Abou was dismissed by referee, David Elleray. Abou finished the 1997-98 West Ham United F.C. season1997-98 season with 6 goals from 26 games including two on the last day of the season in a 4-3 home defeat of Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. West Ham United F.C. supportersWest Ham fans would booingboo Abou whenever he scored making an "Abooooooooo" noise. In 31 appearances in all competitions he scored six times, before being released to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in December 1998, where he scored once against Sheffield United.cite web
url=
title=Naylor provides Suffolk punch
publisher=The Independent
date=20 December 1998 accessdate=27 February 2010
In October 1999, he signed for Walsall F.C.Walsall, an unsuccessful spell which lasted little over a month. He also spent time on loan at Troyes ACTroyes, and played in Scotland for three months at Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock.
Abou continued his career back in France, playing for AC AjaccioAjaccio and FC LorientLorient.

Lee Durrant.name: Lee Durrant
Lee Durrant.intro:
'''Lee Roger Durrant''' (born 18 December 1973 in Great Yarmouth) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootball midfielder (football)midfielder. He represented England national football teamEngland as a schoolboy.
Durrant began his career as a trainee with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, turning professional in July 1992. His league debut came on 12 March 1994, a 1-0 win away to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in the Premier LeaguePremiership. He played six further league games for Ipswich that season, with his final first team appearance coming on 13 December 1995 as Ipswich hosted ItalyItalian side Salernitana in the Anglo-Italian Cup.
He was released in May 1996 and went on trial with Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town. He joined Torquay United F.C.Torquay United on trial on 22 July 1996.''Herald Express'' (1996-07-23) He played in the friendly against Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth but went off with an injury. He left Torquay by his own choice on 1 August and subsequently joined Harwich & Parkeston F.C.Harwich & Parkeston.
In July 1997 he moved to Lowestoft Town F.C.Lowestoft Town. He later had an eight-month absence from the game before returning to play for Lowestoft.

Brad Friedel.name: Brad Friedel
Brad Friedel.intro:
'''Bradley Howard Friedel'''  (born May 18, 1971) is an American soccer player who plays as Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League.
He played 82 games for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team between 1992 and 2005, and represented his country at three FIFA World Cup tournaments. He is the current holder of the Premier League record for most consecutive appearances with 310, a feat he achieved during spells at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, and Tottenham Hotspur. Until he was left out of the Tottenham team on October 7, 2012, the last Premier League games Friedel missed were Blackburn's final two fixtures of the 2003–04 in English football2003–04 season against Tottenham and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, on 10 May and May 15, 2004 respectively.
He is also officially Aston Villa's oldest ever player, a record he achieved on February 1, 2011 by playing in the club's Premier League fixture away at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Friedel's age of 39 years and 259 days surpassed the previous record held by Ernie Callaghan who last played for Villa against Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town in April 1947, aged 39 years and 257 days. Friedel's last appearance for Villa was on May 22, 2011 in a 1–0 home win against Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, aged 40 years and 4 days.
On May 6, 2012 he also became the oldest player to appear in a competitive match for Tottenham Hotspur when he played in the club's Premier League fixture at Aston Villa, beating Jimmy Cantrell's near-80-year-old record.

Paul Warhurst.name: Paul Warhurst
Paul Warhurst.intro:
'''Paul Warhurst''' (born 26 September 1969) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (football)defender, midfielder or as a makeshift striker (football)striker from 1987 to 2007.
Warhurst notably played for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and was part of the club's Premier League winning squad of 1995. Before that he had experienced relative success with Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, reaching several cup finals. He also featured for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers, Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham and Barnet F.C.Barnet before finishing his career with a brief stint at Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria. Throughout his career he represented 16 different clubs and in his later years he was regarded as one of the quintessential journeyman (football)journeymen of English football.

Emmanuel Petit.name: Emmanuel Petit
Emmanuel Petit.intro: '''Emmanuel Laurent "Manu" Petit''' (; born 22 September 1970) is a French retired Association footballfootballer, who played club football for AS Monaco FCMonaco, Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, FC BarcelonaBarcelona, and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He represented France national football teamFrance at international level, and scored the third goal in France's 3–0 victory in the 1998 FIFA World Cup Final.

Laurens ten Heuvel.name: Laurens ten Heuvel
Laurens ten Heuvel.intro: '''Laurens ten Heuvel''' (born 6 June 1976) is a former NetherlandsDutch association footballfootballer.

Craig Cathcart.name: Craig Cathcart
Craig Cathcart.intro:
'''Craig George Cathcart''' (born 6 February 1989) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Watford F.C.Watford and the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team. He has also captained his country's Northern Ireland national under-21 football teamunder-21 side.
A product of the Manchester United F.C.Manchester United youth academy, Cathcart spent time on loan at BelgiumBelgian club Royal Antwerp FCRoyal Antwerp, and English Football League Championship sides Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle and Watford, before joining newly promoted Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in 2010. Cathcart returned to Watford in July 2014 on a permanent deal.
Craig Cathcart.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ji\u0159\u00ed Jaro\u0161\u00edk.name: Jiří Jarošík
Ji\u0159\u00ed Jaro\u0161\u00edk.intro:
'''Jiří Jarošík'''  (born 27 October 1977) is a Czech Association footballfootballer. His playing position is Defender (association football)defender and midfielder. He started his club career in his native Czech Republic, winning six league titles in seven years with AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague. He headed abroad to continue his football career, spending eight years playing for various teams including PFC CSKA MoscowCSKA Moscow, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Celtic F.C.Celtic, FC Krylia Sovetov SamaraKrylia Sovetov and Real Zaragoza. During this time he won league titles in three different countries. He then returned to Sparta, although only for two seasons, after which he headed to Spain to play for Deportivo Alavés, for whom he currently plays.
Jarošík played for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech national team, making 23 appearances without scoring between 2000 and 2005.

Bradley Orr.name: Bradley Orr
Bradley Orr.intro: '''Bradley James Orr''' (born 1 November 1982) is a retired English Association footballfootballer. He is the uncle of the Liverpool F.C. full back Jon Flanagan.
Bradley Orr.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

John Moncur.name: John Moncur
John Moncur.intro: '''John Frederick Moncur''' (born 22 September 1966) is an English former association footballfootballer. He played in Midfieldermidfield for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. While at White Hart Lane he went on loan to Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Brentford F.C.Brentford and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.

Lee Barnard.name: Lee Barnard
Lee Barnard.intro: '''Lee James Barnard''' (born 18 July 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)Striker for Southend United F.C.Southend United.

Alfred N'Diaye.name: Alfred N'Diaye
Alfred N'Diaye.intro: '''Alfred John Momar N'Diaye''' (born 6 March 1990) is a Senegalese professional footballer who plays for Spanish club Real Betis and the Senegal national football team, as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.

Vincent P\u00e9ricard.name: Vincent Péricard
Vincent P\u00e9ricard.intro: '''Vincent de Paul Péricard''' (born 3 October 1982 in Efok, Cameroon) is a FranceFrench-Cameroonian former professional association footballfootball player, who played in France with AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne and in Italy with Juventus before moving to England, where he played for several clubs.  He has also played for the France national under-21 football teamFrance U21 team.  On 6 October 2011, he signed for Havant & Waterlooville F.C.Havant & Waterlooville on a free transfer, before retiring from the game in February 2012. He came out of retirement in January 2015 to play for Moneyfields F.C.Moneyfields.

Paul Hall.name: Paul Hall
Paul Hall.intro: '''Paul Anthony Hall''' (born 3 July 1972 in Manchester, England), is a retired EnglandEnglish-born Jamaican international football (soccer)footballer. He is currently a coach at Conference National side Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, during his career, Hall was a striker who could also play on the right wing.

Kemy Agustien.name: Kemy Agustien
Kemy Agustien.intro: '''Germaine "Kemy" Agustien''' (born 20 August 1986) is a Dutch-Curacaoan professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion. He previously played for Willem II TilburgWillem II, AZ (football club)AZ, Roda JC and RKC Waalwijk in the Netherlands and for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in Football in EnglandEnglish football. An adaptable player, capable of playing anywhere in midfield, his preferred position is as one of two central midfielders.

Daryl Janmaat.name: Daryl Janmaat
Daryl Janmaat.intro:
'''Daryl Janmaat''' (born 22 July 1989) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
He began his career at ADO Den Haag, and went on to play for the Eredivisie clubs SC HeerenveenHeerenveen and Feyenoord before joining Newcastle on a six-year deal in 2014.
A full international since 2012, Janmaat has earned over 20 caps and was part of the Dutch team which finished third at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Daryl Janmaat.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Cobi Jones.name: Cobi Jones
Cobi Jones.intro:
'''Cobi N'Gai Jones''' (born June 16, 1970) is an United StatesAmericanStaff. [
As a player, he was a Midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1994 until 2007, starting his career in England with Premier League club Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, before playing for Brazilian side CR Vasco da GamaVasco da Gama.
He is one of a significant group of American national team stars who returned from overseas to aid the then new Major League Soccer in 1996, beginning an 11-year spell with the Los Angeles Galaxy. Jones is the all-time leader in cap (sport)caps for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States national team and a member of the National Soccer Hall of Fame.
Following retirement, he served as an assistant coach with the former club Galaxy for two seasons.

Mamady Sidib\u00e9.name: Mamady Sidibé
Mamady Sidib\u00e9.intro:
'''Mamady Sidibé''' (born 18 December 1979) is a Malian former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward.
Sidibé moved from his native Mali to France when he was two years old. After playing football for a number of lower French league sides he joined Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in 2001. He spent a single season at the Welsh club before signing for Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. After three and a half years in Kent Sidibé rejected an offer of a new contract and joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in July 2005 on a free transfer.
He went on to become a key member of Tony Pulis first team and help to the club to gain promotion to the Premier League in 2008. Since the 2009–10 season Sidibé has picked up numerous long term injuries. Sidibé spent time out on loan at Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers before his contract at Stoke ended in May 2013. He then joined Bulgarian side PFC CSKA SofiaCSKA Sofia in August 2013.

Tom Carroll (English footballer).name: Tom Carroll (English footballer)
Tom Carroll (English footballer).intro:
'''Thomas James "Tom" Carroll''' (born 28 May 1992) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, on loan from Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur.
He plays as a deep-lying creative central midfielder, and is particularly valued for his high passing percentage accuracy and creativity.

Mario Balotelli.name: Mario Balotelli
Mario Balotelli.intro:
'''Mario Barwuah Balotelli''' (; born '''Mario Barwuah'''; 12 August 1990) is an Italian footballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the Italy national football teamItalian national team. Balotelli is nicknamed ''Super Mario''.
He started his professional football career at A.C. LumezzaneLumezzane and played for the first team twice before having an unsuccessful trial at FC Barcelona, and subsequently joining Inter Milan in 2007. Inter manager Roberto Mancini brought Balotelli into the first team, but when Mancini left, Balotelli's disciplinary record fell away. He had a strained relationship with new manager José Mourinho and was suspended from Inter's first team in January 2009 after a number of disciplinary problems. In March 2010, he came under criticism by Inter fans after he appeared on the Italian TV show ''Striscia la notizia'', wearing an A.C. Milan jersey. This damaged the prospect of him having a long career at Inter, but he did make several appearances after that.
With doubts over his career at Inter, former coach Roberto Mancini had since moved to Manchester City and decided to give Balotelli a fresh chance at a new club. He joined Manchester City in August 2010, where his performances and off-field activities continued to be enigmatic and unpredictable. Balotelli eventually fell out of favour with Mancini after a "training ground bust up" between the two in January 2013. His departure from City and return to Italy with A.C. Milan followed several weeks later. After 18 months at Milan, he returned to the Premier League with Liverpool.
Balotelli earned his first cap for Italy in a friendly match against Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire on 10 August 2010. He has since amassed over 30 caps and represented his country at UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup, helping them reach the final of the former.

Lee Williamson.name: Lee Williamson
Lee Williamson.intro: '''Lee Trevor Williamson''' (born 7 June 1982) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. Born in Derby he started his career at Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town before spending time at Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Watford F.C.Watford, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth before joining Blackburn. He has been called up for Jamaica national football teamJamaica but was an unused squad player.

Brian Launders.name: Brian Launders
Brian Launders.intro: '''Brian Launders''' (born 8 June 1976) is a former Republic of IrelandIrish Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.  Born in Dublin he began his career as a junior with Cherry Orchard F.C.Cherry Orchard in Ireland before moving to Australia to play for Croydon Kings. In 1993 he moved to England to play for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.  He subsequently moved between a number of clubs in England, along with a spell in the Netherlands before eventually returning to Australia, where he finished his career.

Jonathan Greening.name: Jonathan Greening
Jonathan Greening.intro:
'''Jonathan Greening''' (born 2 January 1979) is an English semi-professional Association footballfootballer and Coach (sport)coach who plays for Tadcaster Albion A.F.C.Tadcaster Albion as a midfielder and is the Development Phase Coach at York City F.C.York City.
Greening began his career in 1996 with York City, but moved to Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in 1998, with whom he won the 1998–99 UEFA Champions League as a non-playing substitute in the 1999 UEFA Champions League FinalFinal. However, he failed to make a breakthrough in the Manchester United first team and followed United assistant manager Steve McClaren to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in 2001. During his time at Middlesbrough, Greening earned his first call-up to the England national football teamEngland national team, but he did not make an appearance. In 2004, he joined West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion for £1.25 million, and, in 2008, captained the team to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship title. Greening signed for Fulham F.C.Fulham in 2009 and helped them to the 2010 UEFA Europa League Final, before signing permanently the following summer. He signed for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in 2011 and had a three-year spell with the club.

Joel Ward.name: Joel Ward
Joel Ward.intro: '''Joel Edward Philip Ward''' (born 29 October 1989 in Emsworth, England) is an English peopleEnglish footballer who plays for Premier League club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He is naturally a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back, but has mostly played at right Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back for Crystal Palace.

John Obi Mikel.name: John Obi Mikel
John Obi Mikel.intro: '''John Michael Nchekwube Obinna''' (born 22 April 1987), known as '''John Obi Mikel''', '''John Mikel Obi''' or '''Mikel John Obi''', is a Nigerian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Nigeria national football teamNigeria national team.

Andr\u00e9 Sch\u00fcrrle.name: André Schürrle
Andr\u00e9 Sch\u00fcrrle.intro:
'''André Horst Schürrle''' (born 6 November 1990) is a German Association footballfootballer, who plays as a Striker (association football)striker or  Midfielder#Wingerwinger for VfL Wolfsburg and the Germany national football teamGerman national team.
He began his career at 1. FSV Mainz 05 in 2009, spending two years at the club before a £6.5 million transfer to Bayer 04 Leverkusen. His performances there gained the attention of Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, who signed him for a reported £18 million in 2013. Schürrle played one-and-a-half Premier League seasons at the English club before joining Wolfsburg for £22 million.
Schürrle has been a full international for Germany since 2010, gaining over 40 caps and scoring 17 goals. He was a member of the German squads which reached the semi-finals at UEFA Euro 2012 and won the 2014 FIFA World Cup. During extra-time in the 2014 FIFA World Cup Final he provided the cross for Mario Götze's winning goal against Argentina national football teamArgentina.

Kenny Miller.name: Kenny Miller
Kenny Miller.intro:
'''Kenneth "Kenny" Miller''' (born 23 December 1979) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker, who currently plays for Scottish Championship club Rangers F.C.Rangers. Miller is one of only five Aftermath of World War IIpost-war players to have played for both Rangers F.C.Rangers and Celtic F.C.Celtic. He is known as a versatile and pacy striker who is skilled with headers and can play as a supporting or centre-forward.
Miller began his career at Hibernian F.C.Hibernian before moving on to Rangers F.C.Rangers then to the The Football LeagueEnglish First Division side Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, where he won his first career honour, the 2003 Football League First Division play-off Final2003 First Division play-off final. After five seasons with Wolverhampton, Miller returned to Scotland, signing for the other side of the Old Firm – Celtic. He finished his only full season at Celtic with Scottish Premier LeagueSPL and Scottish Cup winners medals.
After one season with Derby County F.C.Derby County, he returned to Scotland to play for Rangers F.C.Rangers. Miller won back to back SPL titles, the Scottish Cup and the Scottish League Cup in two full seasons with Rangers. He moved to Turkish club Bursaspor in January 2011, but returned to the UK later that year, signing for Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. After one season with Cardiff, Miller played in Major League Soccer for Vancouver Whitecaps FC. He returned to Rangers in June 2014.
Miller was a regular Scotland national football teamScotland international player from his debut in 2001 until his retirement in 2013. He often played as an isolated lone striker, scoring 18 goals in 69 appearances.

Tony Sheridan.name: Tony Sheridan
Tony Sheridan.intro:
'''Tony Sheridan''' (born 21 October 1974 in Dublin) is a retired Irish association footballfootballer.
Sheridan signed for Coventry City in 1991 and made his Premier League debut at Elland Road on 31 October 1992. After a further 8 appearances in the 1993–94 FA Premier League season Sheridan returned home to sign for Shelbourne F.C. in August 1995.
During Sheridan's first season with Shels he helped them win both the League of Ireland Cup and the FAI Cup. In the semi-final against Sligo Rovers, he scored the only goal of the game, a majestic lob after running with the ball from box to box and he scored a late equaliser in the cup final at Lansdowne Road when Shels were down to ten men and with no regular goalkeeper. In the cup final replay at Dalymount Park he scored the equaliser and Shels went on to win 2–1 to deny St Patrick's Athletic the league and cup 'double'. Sheridan was acclaimed man of the match in both the drawn match and the replay by the media.
The following season, Sheridan again helped Shels to FAI Cup success as they defeated league champions Derry City F.C.Derry City 2–0 in the cup final. Once again, he won the man of the match award.
Disappointment followed in 1997/98 as Shels missed out on the league title on the last day of the season, and lost the FAI Cup Final to Cork City Football ClubCork City.
Damien Richardson left the managerial hotseat at Tolka Park as a result of the failure to win the championship and in came the uncompromising Dermot Keely. Despite an excellent season under Keely, Sheridan was allowed to sign for Portadown FCPortadown in the IFA PremiershipIrish League at the start of the 1999/2000 season. At the start of the 2000/2001 season he signed for Cardiff City but was released without playing a first team game.
Sheridan returned for a couple of brief spells with the Reds and also played for Dublin City FCDublin City before signing for Glenavon F.C. in 2003 [
He played for the Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team in the qualifiers for the 1993 UEFA European Under-18 Football Championship and scored against Romania in October 1992 at the RDS Arena.

Ivano Bonetti.name: Ivano Bonetti
Ivano Bonetti.intro:
'''Ivano Bonetti''' (born 1 August 1964 in Brescia) is an Italian Association footballfootball manager and former player. His father Aldo played for Brescia CalcioBrescia until the Second World War, brother Mario played for Atalanta B.C.Atalanta and brother Dario BonettiDario played over 100 games for A.S. RomaRoma and won two caps for Italy.
He is the current director of football of Lega Pro Prima Divisione club A.S. Pescina Valle del Giovenco.

James Collins (footballer, born 1983).name: James Collins (footballer, born 1983)
James Collins (footballer, born 1983).intro: '''James Michael Collins''' (born 23 August 1983) is a WalesWelsh association footballerfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and the Wales national football team. Collins is in his second spell with West Ham. He started his career with Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and played for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in between his two periods with West Ham.
James Collins (footballer, born 1983).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

David Goodwillie.name: David Goodwillie
David Goodwillie.intro: '''David Goodwillie''' (born 28 March 1989) is a Scottish peopleScottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen in the Scottish Premiership. Goodwillie has previously played for Dundee United F.C.Dundee United, Raith Rovers F.C.Raith Rovers (loan), Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace (loan) and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool  (loan). He has also played for the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.

Steve Harper.name: Steve Harper
Steve Harper.intro:
Quote_box
width=30%
align=right
quote="I hadn't played for a while ... you're walking along shaking hands and you're thinking 'That's Pavel Nedvěd and that's Alessandro Del PieroDel Piero' and there's the Champions League music blaring."
source=Steve Harper
'''Stephen Alan "Steve" Harper''' (born 14 March 1975) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is best known for his time playing at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, having amassed 157 league appearances over a twenty-year period between 1993 and 2013. Such was the longevity of his Newcastle career that, in August 2012, Harper became the longest-serving player in the club's history.

Chris Doig.name: Chris Doig
Chris Doig.intro:
'''Christopher Ross "Chris" Doig''' (born 13 February 1981) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town as a Defender (association football)defender. He is also the club's assistant manager.
Doig started his career with Queen of the South F.C.Queen of the South, where he made four appearances before being signed by Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in 1997. Having made 93 appearances for Forest, he was released in 2005. He joined Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, who he had previously played for on Loan (sports)loan. In his 2005–06 in English footballfirst permanent season with Northampton, Doig won Promotion and relegationpromotion to Football League OneLeague One before being released by the club in 2009. After spells abroad with Central Coast Mariners FCCentral Coast Mariners in Australia and Pelita Bandung RayaPelita Jaya in Indonesia, he returned to England with Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town in 2011. He then moved to York City, with whom he won promotion to Football League TwoLeague Two after playing in the 2012 Conference Premier play-off Final. He was released in 2013 before signing for Grimsby Town.

John Burridge.name: John Burridge
John Burridge.intro: '''John Burridge''' (born 3 December 1951 in Workington, Cumberland) is an English former association footballfootball goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who played for 29 different clubs in a career that lasted nearly 30 years. Overall, Burridge played 771 league games in the English and Scottish leagues, and several more at non-league level.  Burridge (nicknamed ''Budgie''),  played for fifteen The Football LeagueFootball League teams, which is a still-existing record.

Scott Minto.name: Scott Minto
Scott Minto.intro: '''Scott Christopher Minto''' (born 6 August 1971 in Heswall) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a left back in the Football League and the Premier League for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, and for S.L. BenficaBenfica in Portugal.  He now works for Sky Sports as the main presenter for their La Liga coverage.
Scott Minto.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

John Swift (footballer, born 1995).name: John Swift (footballer, born 1995)
John Swift (footballer, born 1995).intro: '''John David Swift''' (born 23 June 1995) is an English association footballfootballer who currently plays for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town as a Midfielder (association football)midfielder, on loan from Chelsea F.CChelsea.

Artim \u0160akiri.name: Artim Šakiri
Artim \u0160akiri.intro: '''Artim Šakiri''' or '''Šaćiri''' (, ; born 23 September 1973) is a retired association footballfootball midfielder from the Republic of Macedonia, who last played for Qarabağ FK in Azerbaijan in 2009.

Ray Wallace.name: Ray Wallace
Ray Wallace.intro: '''Raymond George''' "'''Ray'''" '''Wallace''' (born 2 October 1969 in Lewisham) is an English former association footballfootballer who played in the Football League and Premier League for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Swansea City F.C.Swansea City, Reading F.C.Reading, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, in the Scottish Football League for Airdrieonians F.C. (1878)Airdrieonians, and in the League of Ireland for Drogheda United F.C.Drogheda United. He was cap (sport)capped for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team.

Wayne Hennessey.name: Wayne Hennessey
Wayne Hennessey.intro:
'''Wayne Robert Hennessey''' (born 24 January 1987) is a WalesWelsh Wales national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace.
Hennessey's first professional games saw him set a new League Two record for consecutive clean sheets while on loan at Stockport County F.C.Stockport County. He played 166 times for Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers over eight seasons, including three years at Premier League level. After several injury setbacks, he moved to join Crystal Palace in 2014.

Kingsley Black.name: Kingsley Black
Kingsley Black.intro:
'''Kingsley Terence Black''' (born 22 June 1968) is an English-born Northern Ireland former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1987 until 2002[
He also notably had spells with Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town where he picked up honours for both clubs. He also appeared in the Football League for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Millwall F.C.Millwall before finishing his career with Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City.

Lu\u00eds Boa Morte.name: Luís Boa Morte
Lu\u00eds Boa Morte.intro:
'''Luís Boa Morte Pereira''' (; born 4 August 1977) is a PortugalPortuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays  as an Midfielder#Wingerattacking winger, forward (association football)forward and Midfielder#Centrecentre midfielder for Hampshire Premier League Division One side Four Marks.[
Having come through the youth ranks with Sporting Clube de Portugal, Boa Morte received his first big break by joining Premier League side Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 1997. He also went on to play in England's top flight for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Fulham F.C.Fulham and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He was released by The Hammers in 2011 and joined GreeceGreek side AEL 1964 FCLarissa before moving on to South African side Orlando Pirates. In October 2012 he returned to England and joined fourth-tier side Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield.
A full international from 2001 to 2009, Boa Morte earned 27 caps for Portugal national football teamPortugal and was selected for the Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics2004 Olympics and the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Julian Darby.name: Julian Darby
Julian Darby.intro:
'''Julian Timothy Darby''' (b. 3 October 1967, Farnworth, Lancashire) is a former English professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1986 until 2001, notably in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.
He also played for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.

Terry Dunfield.name: Terry Dunfield
Terry Dunfield.intro: '''Terence "Terry" Dunfield''' (born February 20, 1982) is a Canadian Association footballsoccer player. He currently plays for Ross County F.C.Ross County in the Scottish Premiership.

David Lee (footballer, born 1969).name: David Lee (footballer, born 1969)
David Lee (footballer, born 1969).intro:
'''David John Lee''' (born 26 November 1969 in Kingswood, South Gloucestershire) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1988 until 2004.
He notably played in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and in the National Soccer LeagueAustralian top flight for Parramatta Power. He also played in the Football League for Reading F.C.Reading, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and Exeter City F.C.Exeter City. He then went on to play in Non-league for Havant & Waterlooville F.C.Havant & Waterlooville, Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers, Weston-super-Mare A.F.C.Weston-super-Mare, Yate Town F.C.Yate Town and Mangotsfield United F.C.Mangotsfield United. He was capped 10 times by England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 and after retiring became a scout and later assistant manager of Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town where he briefly managed in a caretaker role.

Marcus Bent.name: Marcus Bent
Marcus Bent.intro:
'''Marcus Nathan Bent''' (born 19 May 1978) is an English former Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker. An England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 international, the Journeyman (sports)#Association footballjourneyman striker played 574 games and scored 113 goals for fourteen different clubs. His numerous transfer fees totalled over £10 million.
He began his career at Brentford F.C.Brentford in 1995, before he signed with Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in 1998. The next year he joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United via Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. In 2000 he transferred to Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, where he got his first taste of Premier League football, before he moved on to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in 2001. He spent 2003–04 on loan at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, before he transferred to Everton F.C.Everton in 2004. Two years later he was sold on to Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic. He spent the 2007–08 season on loan at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, before he moved on to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2008. He spent three years with Birmingham, during which he spent time on loan at Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. After leaving the club he spent six months in Indonesia with Mitra Kukar FCMitra Kukar.

Paul Dalglish.name: Paul Dalglish
Paul Dalglish.intro: '''Paul Kenneth Dalglish''' (born 18 February 1977 in Glasgow) is a Scottish former professional association footballfootball player and manager currently managing in the United States.

Alan Tate.name: Alan Tate
Alan Tate.intro: '''Alan Tate''' (born 2 September 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra on loan from Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.

Sylvinho.name: Sylvinho
Sylvinho.intro:
'''Sylvio Mendes Campos Júnior''' (born 12 April 1974 in São Paulo, Brazil), commonly known as '''Sylvinho''' (sometimes alternatively spelled '''Silvinho''') is a retired Brazilian Association footballfootballer who usually played  as an attacking Defender (association football)#Full backleft back, known for his overlapping runs.
Having begun his career at Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians, he was signed by  Arsenal F.C.Arsenal of the Premier League in 1999, and was a popular player in his two seasons at the club. He left for Celta de VigoCelta Vigo of La Liga, before joining FC Barcelona in 2004, with whom he won the UEFA Champions League in 2006 and 2009 among other honours. He returned to England to spend his final season as a player with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 2009-10 Manchester City F.C. season2009-10.  He has since been employed as an assistant manager at leading Brazilian clubs as well as at Italian club Inter MilanInternazionale.

Richard Naylor.name: Richard Naylor
Richard Naylor.intro:
'''Richard Alan Naylor''' (born 28 February 1977) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. Naylor started his career at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, where he played as a striker up until he was moved to centre back by Joe Royle in 2002; he continued to play as a centre back ever since. He has now retired from professional football and was formerly Under 18's manager of Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, he also included a brief spell as Leeds' Caretaker Assistant manager after the sacking of Neil Warnock in 2013..cite web
url=
title=Richard Naylor returns to work with youngsters...
publisher=Leeds United
date= 13 July 2012 accessdate=13 July 2012
Richard Naylor.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Michael Thomas (footballer, born 1967).name: Michael Thomas (footballer, born 1967)
Michael Thomas (footballer, born 1967).intro:
'''Michael Lauriston Thomas''' (born 24 August 1967, in Lambeth, London) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1986 to 2001.
He is best remembered for scoring a last-minute goal in injury time during Liverpool 0–2 Arsenal (26 May 1989)the final match of the 1988-89 in English football1988-89 season, which allowed Arsenal F.C.Arsenal to claim the Football League First DivisionFirst Division title over Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. Later in his career, Thomas went on to play for Liverpool and scored a goal for the Reds in the 1992 FA Cup Final. He also had spells at S.L. BenficaBenfica and Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon before retiring in 2001, after a career that saw him win medals in all of English football's top three domestic football trophies. He was capped twice by England national football teamEngland.

Richard Smith.name: Richard Smith
Richard Smith.intro:
'''Richard Geoffrey Smith''' (born 3 October 1970) is a former EnglandEnglish professional Association footballfootballer who played as a  defender (football)defender from 1988 until 2001.
He notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City, having also played for Nuneaton Borough F.C.Nuneaton Borough and Cambridge United on loan. He joined Grimsby Town in 1996 and remained with the club until 2001 where he then retired through injury.

Ashley Williams.name: Ashley Williams
Ashley Williams.intro: '''Ashley Errol Williams''' (born 23 August 1984) is a Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City and the Wales national football teamWales national team as a defender (association football)defender. He is currently captain of both teams. He plays mainly as a central defender.

Michel Vonk.name: Michel Vonk
Michel Vonk.intro:
'''Michel Vonk''' (born 28 October 1968) is a Dutch peopleDutch former professional Association footballfootballer and the current manager of Eerste Divisie side SC TelstarTelstar.
As a player he was a Defender (association football)defender from 1986 to 2001, notably playing in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He also played in England for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, as well as also playing in his native land for AZ (football club)AZ, FC DordrechtSVV Dordrecht and MVV Maastricht.

Lee McCulloch.name: Lee McCulloch
Lee McCulloch.intro:
'''Lee Henry McCulloch''' (born 14 May 1978) is a Scottish association footballer and coach who currently Captain (association football)captains and coaches the Scottish Championship side Rangers F.C.Rangers.
McCulloch was capped on eighteen occasions by the Scotland national football team. During his career he has played for Motherwell F.C.Motherwell, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Rangers F.C.Rangers at club level. He plays as either a central defender or a centre forward for Rangers but has also played as an attacking midfielder and winger during his time in football in EnglandEnglish football.

Ilan.name: Ilan
Ilan.intro: '''Ilan Araújo Dall'Igna''' (born 18 September 1980 in Curitiba), commonly known as '''Ilan''', is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for SC BastiaBastia. He also holds an Italian passport.

Claudio Reyna.name: Claudio Reyna
Claudio Reyna.intro:
'''Claudio Reyna''' (born July 20, 1973) is a retired American association footballsoccer player and the current director of football operations for New York City FC.
He was the captain of the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States men's national team before retiring from international football following the U.S.'s exit from the 2006 FIFA World Cup. He is widely considered one of the greatest players the United States has ever produced. Reyna last played for New York Red Bulls of Major League Soccer, where he was team Captain (association football)captain.

J\u00falio C\u00e9sar (footballer, born.name: Júlio César (footballer, born 1978)
J\u00falio C\u00e9sar (footballer, born.intro: '''Júlio César Santos Correa''', known as '''Júlio César''' (; born 18 November 1978), is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer.

Pierre van Hooijdonk.name: Pierre van Hooijdonk
Pierre van Hooijdonk.intro:
'''Petrus Ferdinandus Johannes "Pierre" van Hooijdonk''' (, born 29 November 1969) is a retired Dutch international association footballfootball player who played as a striker. He had spells with clubs across Europe where he was a prolific goal scorer. Van Hooijdonk was capped 46 times for the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team, scoring 21 goals, and played in the 1998 FIFA World Cup, 2000 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 and 2004 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2004. He was noted for his spectacular free kicks.
Van Hooijdonk was born in Steenbergen. His Moroccan biological father left Van Hooijdonk's mother before his birth. He grew up in a small village nearby Steenbergen named Welberg. While playing in one of SC Welberg's youth squads Van Hooijdonk became familiar with football. His favourite team was NAC Breda and he was already watching their games at a young age. When he was 11 years old he took part in a talent pool on the open day of the team and he impressed the NAC scouts. He was asked to join NAC, which he did and played mainly as a right midfielder. When he was 14 he was told he was not good enough for NAC and he switched to amateur side. Here he switched to the striker position and he would play five years for the team, of which the last two seasons in their first team.
As RBC were facing financial trouble in these days they were forced to use youth players faster than other teams and in the 1988–89 season Van Hooijdonk was brought in as a substitute for a few times and soon scored three goals, which resulted in more appearances throughout the season. Because RBC's main striker suffered from an injury Van Hooijdonk played almost the whole second half of the season, scoring a total of six goals in 32 matches. He signed his first professional contract and his final breakthrough came in the following season in which he became a key player for the team, scoring 27 times in 37 matches. Several teams showed interest and NAC Breda was one of the teams. Van Hooijdonk did not hesitate and signed a contract at the team he supported as a child.

Paul Robinson (footballer, born 1979).name: Paul Robinson (footballer, born 1979)
Paul Robinson (footballer, born 1979).intro:
'''Paul William Robinson''' (born 15 October 1979) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is a former England national football teamEngland international, earning 41 cap (sport)caps between 2003 and 2007.
He joined Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United at 16 years of age, becoming professional aged 18, and made 119 appearances for the club, 95 of which were in league matches, and scored a goal in a Football League CupLeague Cup tie. He also was voted Leeds United's Player of the Year in 2003 by the supporter's club. In 2004, following Leeds' relegation from the Premier League into the Football League Championship, he moved to Premier League side Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He played in 175 matches for Tottenham, including 137 Premier League games, and scored another goal (this time in a Premier League match, whilst he also won the 2008 Football League Cup Final2008 League Cup with the club. He was signed by current club Blackburn Rovers in 2008, being voted the Blackburn Rovers Player of the Year in 2011 by the supporters' club.
He made his full international debut in a 3–1 friendly (sport)friendly defeat against Australia national association football teamAustralia on 12 February 2003. His competitive international debut came a year later in a 2–1 victory over Polish national football teamPoland, during a qualification match for the 2006 FIFA World Cup. 25 of his 41 appearances came in competitive internationals, with his last cap coming in a 2–1 defeat to Russian national football teamRussia on 17 October 2007. He retired from international football on 8 August 2010.

Papiss Ciss\u00e9.name: Papiss Cissé
Papiss Ciss\u00e9.intro:
'''Papiss Demba Cissé''' (born 3 June 1985) is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and the Senegal national football teamSenegal national team.
Formerly of SC Freiburg, he holds the record of most goals scored by an African player in a single Bundesliga campaign – 22  in the 2010–11 Bundesliga2010–11 season. That same season, Cissé won the EFFIFU award for being the most efficient striker in the league.
A full international since 2009, Cissé has earned over 30 caps for Senegal and played for the country at the 2012 and 2015 Africa Cup of Nations.

Frode Grod\u00e5s.name: Frode Grodås
Frode Grod\u00e5s.intro: '''Frode Grodås''' (born 24 October 1964) is a NorwayNorwegian association footballfootball coach and former Norway national football teamnational team Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper originally from Hornindal in Sogn og Fjordane. Capped 50 times for his country, he participated at the 1998 FIFA World Cup as well as being an unused substitute at the 1994 FIFA World Cup.

Danny Williamson.name: Danny Williamson
Danny Williamson.intro: '''Daniel 'Danny' Williamson''' (born 5 December 1973 in West Ham, London) is an English retired professional Association footballfootballer who was a product of the The Academy of FootballWest Ham United academy and played for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Everton F.C.Everton in the 1990s. He played in midfield.

Thomas Gravesen.name: Thomas Gravesen
Thomas Gravesen.intro:
'''Thomas Gravesen''' (born 11 March 1976) is a Danish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.
Gravesen played as a professional in Denmark, Germany, England, Spain and Scotland for Vejle Boldklub, Hamburger SV, Everton F.C.Everton, Real Madrid CFReal Madrid and Celtic F.C.Celtic.
For the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team, Gravesen was Cap (football)capped 66 times and scored five goals, from his debut in August 1998 until he ended his national team career in September 2006. He represented Denmark at the international UEFA Euro 2000Euro 2000, 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup and UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 tournaments.
He is the older brother of footballer Peter Gravesen.

Michael Reddy.name: Michael Reddy
Michael Reddy.intro:
'''Michael Reddy''' (born 24 March 1980 in Kilkenny) is an Irish former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward from 1997 to 2007.
He played for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town. He also appeared as a professional for Kilkenny City F.C.Kilkenny City, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, York City F.C.York City and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. Reddy retired from professional football in 2007 after failing to regain his fitness following three operations from a hip injury he endured while playing with Grimsby Town in 2006. He was capped eight times by the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland Under-21 side, scoring three goals.

Cosmin Contra.name: Cosmin Contra
Cosmin Contra.intro:
'''Cosmin Marius Contra''' (born 15 December 1975) is a Romanian retired Association footballfootballer who played mainly as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, and the current manager of Guangzhou R&F F.C.Guangzhou R&F FC.
Offensive-minded, he could also appear as a midfielder, and played professionally in four countries (his own included), mainly in Spain where he appeared for mainly Getafe CFGetafe, which he helped consolidate in La Liga. He amassed totals in the competition of 188 games and eight goals over the course of one full decade, also playing with Deportivo AlavésAlavés and Atlético Madrid.
A Romania national football teamRomanian international for nearly 15 years, Contra represented the nation in two UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships.
Cosmin Contra.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Ray Houghton.name: Ray Houghton
Ray Houghton.intro:
'''Raymond James "Ray" Houghton''' (born 9 January 1962) is a retired Association footballfootball player, and current analyst and commentator with RTÉ Sport. Born in Glasgow, Scotland, Houghton played international football for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, for whom he qualified through his Irish father.
Houghton is particularly remembered by Irish fans for scoring two of the most important goals in the national team's history, which resulted in 1–0 victories over England national football teamEngland in Stuttgart at the UEFA Euro 19881988 European Championship, and Italy national football teamItaly at the Giants Stadium in New York at the 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 World Cup. At club level Houghton is best remembered for his success in the Liverpool F.C.Liverpool side of the late 1980s.

Valentin Roberge.name: Valentin Roberge
Valentin Roberge.intro: '''Valentin Sébastien Roger Roberge''' (born 9 June 1987) is a French professional  Association footballfootballer who plays for Stade de Reims on loan from English club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Valentin Roberge.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Tom Ince.name: Tom Ince
Tom Ince.intro: '''Thomas Christopher ''' "'''Tom'''" '''Ince''' (born 30 January 1992) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County on loan from Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a Winger (football)winger. He has also played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Notts County F.C.Notts County, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and internationally for England national football teamEngland at England national under-17 football teamU17, England national under-19 football teamU19 and England national under-21 football teamU21 levels. He is the son of former England national football teamEngland captain Paul Ince.

Maynor Figueroa.name: Maynor Figueroa
Maynor Figueroa.intro:
'''Maynor Alexis Figueroa Róchez''' (born 2 May 1983) is a Honduran peopleHonduran professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)centre back or Defender (association football)left back for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and the Honduras national football team.
He spent most of his career at Wigan Athletic, where he made 179 Premier League appearances and won the 2013 FA Cup Final.
Figueroa has made over FIFA Century Club100 international appearances since 2003, including at three CONCACAF Gold Cups, the 2010 FIFA World Cup and the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics.

Muzzy Izzet.name: Muzzy Izzet
Muzzy Izzet.intro: '''Mustafa Kemal "Muzzy" Izzet''' (; born 31 October 1974) is a former association footballfootballer who played for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and the Turkey national football teamTurkish national team. His father is a Turkish Cypriot who came to England as a small boy, and his mother is English. His younger brother, Kemal IzzetKemal, also became a professional footballer.

Jamie Redknapp.name: Jamie Redknapp
Jamie Redknapp.intro:
'''Jamie Frank Redknapp''' (born 25 June 1973) is an English retired professional Association footballfootballer who was active from 1989 until 2005. He is now a Pundit (expert)pundit at Sky Sports and an editorial sports columnist at the ''Daily Mail''. A midfielder, Redknapp played for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, captaining the latter two. He also gained 17 England national football teamEngland caps between 1995 and 1999. He won seven honours during his time at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. Throughout his career, Redknapp played in and won one final, the 1995 League Cup.
In a career that was blighted by a succession of injuries, Redknapp was as famous for his media profile off the field as much as on it. He married the pop singer Louise RedknappLouise in 1998. Redknapp comes from a well-known footballing family. His father is the football manager Harry Redknapp. He is also a cousin of Frank Lampard, and a nephew of former West Ham United F.C.West Ham United coach Frank Lampard, Sr.Frank Lampard Senior.

Gabriel Obertan.name: Gabriel Obertan
Gabriel Obertan.intro:
'''Gabriel Antoine Obertan''' (born 26 February 1989) is a French professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. He plays primarily as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, but can also play Midfielder#Central midfielderattacking midfield and as a Forward (association football)striker.
A former attendee of the famous Clairefontaine academy, Obertan began his professional career playing for FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux in France. He then joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in July 2009 for an undisclosed fee, before signing for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United for another undisclosed fee in August 2011.
Obertan has represented his country at France national under-16 football teamunder-16, France national under-17 football teamunder-17, France national under-18 football teamunder-18, France national under-19 football teamunder-19 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level but is yet to earn his France national football teamsenior debut.

Neil Ruddock.name: Neil Ruddock
Neil Ruddock.intro:
'''Neil''' "'''Razor'''" '''Ruddock''' (born 9 May 1968) is an English former professional association footballfootballer, television personality, and actor. As a footballer he played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender from 1986 to 2003, and was voted the 17th "hardest footballer of all time". The nickname "Razor" was taken from the Canadian heavyweight boxer Donovan RuddockDonovan "Razor" Ruddock.
He made his debut at Millwall F.C.Millwall (having been associated with the club since age 13), and he had a long career playing for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, West Ham United F.C.West Ham, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, and finally a short-lived spell as a player/coach at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town (working under Director of Football Roy Evans in a two-tier managerial structure). He was capped once by England national football teamEngland.
In January 2015 a 46-year-old Ruddock came out of retirement to sign for United Counties League side Wellingborough Whitworth.
Neil Ruddock.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

James Ward-Prowse.name: James Ward-Prowse
James Ward-Prowse.intro: '''James Michael Edward Ward-Prowse''' (born 1 November 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Premier League club Southampton F.C.Southampton and the England national under-21 football teamEngland national under-21 team. Originally a member of Southampton's Southampton F.C. Academyyouth system, Ward-Prowse made his first-team debut for the club in October 2011, and signed his first professional contract in May 2012 before becoming a regular in the Southampton team. He primarily plays as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder or a right-sided Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Steve Staunton.name: Steve Staunton
Steve Staunton.intro:
'''Stephen "Steve" Staunton''' (born 19 January 1969) is an Irish association football manager and former professional footballer, who was most recently manager of Darlington F.C.Darlington. He earned 102 Cap (sport)caps for the Republic of Ireland national football team, captained his team to the knock-out stage of the 2002 FIFA World Cup and earned his place in the List of footballers with 100 or more capsFIFA Century Club.
Staunton enjoyed a distinguished club career with Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. After retiring, he served as Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team coach prior to Giovanni Trapattoni.

John Arne Riise.name: John Arne Riise
John Arne Riise.intro:
'''John Arne Semundseth Riise''' (born 24 September 1980 in Molde, Norway) is a Norwegian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)left back for APOEL FCAPOEL in the Cypriot First Division.
With 110 caps, he is the most-capped player for the Norway national football teamNorwegian national team, but did not play at Euro 2000 and scored 17 goals before his retirement from international duty in 2013. Riise spent seven years playing for Premier League side Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, in which he won honours including the 2005 Champions League Final, before moving to AS RomaRoma in 2008. He is the older brother of Bjørn Helge Riise, who is also a Norway international.
John Arne Riise.position: Defender  association football  Wing back Left back

Steven Pienaar.name: Steven Pienaar
Steven Pienaar.intro: '''Steven Jerome Pienaar''' (; born 17 March 1982) is a South African professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Everton F.C.Everton and was Captain (association football)captain of the South Africa national football teamSouth African national team until October 2012. He primarily plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger. He can play on either the right or left Midfielder#Wingerwing and as an attacking midfielder.  Pienaar has previously played for Ajax Cape Town FCAjax Cape Town, AFC AjaxAjax, Borussia Dortmund and Tottenham Hotspur.

Ian Culverhouse.name: Ian Culverhouse
Ian Culverhouse.intro: '''Ian Brett Culverhouse''' (born 22 September 1964 in Bishop's Stortford, Hertfordshire), is an English former professional Association footballfootballer. He was a defender (association football)defender who played in the position of right-back. In May 2014 he was sacked following suspension from his duties as Assistant Manager of Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.

Steve Redmond.name: Steve Redmond
Steve Redmond.intro:
'''Stephen 'Steve' Redmond''' (born 2 November 1967) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer, who played as a Defender (association football)central defender for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Bury F.C.Bury. Captain of the Manchester City youth team that won the 1986 FA Youth Cup, Redmond made his first-team debut at 18. He quickly established himself in the side, and was named the club's Player of the Year in 1988. The same year, he became the youngest ever Manchester City captain. Between 1987 and 1990 he played every single game in three straight seasons.
Redmond transferred to Oldham Athletic in 1992, where he spent six years. He then played for Bury for five seasons, and also had a period as caretaker-manager in the 1999–2000 season. He left Bury in 2003, and spent a season in non-league football before retiring.

Alain Goma.name: Alain Goma
Alain Goma.intro:
'''Alain Goma''' (born 5 October 1972) is a French retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back or a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
In a 16-year professional career he appeared in 196 Ligue 1 games, mostly for AJ AuxerreAuxerre. He then played 147 matches in the Premier League, with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle and Fulham F.C.Fulham.

C\u00e9sar Azpilicueta.name: César Azpilicueta
C\u00e9sar Azpilicueta.intro:
'''César Azpilicueta Tanco''' (; born 28 August 1989) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Spain national football teamSpanish national team, as a Defender (association football)#Full backfull back.
After playing three seasons in La Liga with CA OsasunaOsasuna in whose youth system he grew, he represented Olympique de MarseilleMarseille in Ligue 1, winning four major honours with the French club. In the summer of 2012 he moved to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, 2013 UEFA Europa League Finalwinning the Europa League in his first season.
Azpilicueta gained 55 Cap (sport)caps for Spain national youth football teamSpain at youth level in all categories comprised, and represented the Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21s in two UEFA European Under-21 ChampionshipEuropean Championships, 2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championshipwinning the 2011 edition. In 2013, he made his first appearance with Spain national football teamthe full side, and was selected for the 2014 FIFA World Cupfollowing year's World Cup.
Due to his surname being difficult for some speakers of English to pronounce, Chelsea fans gave him the Mononymous personmononymous nickname "Dave".
C\u00e9sar Azpilicueta.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Alan Reeves.name: Alan Reeves
Alan Reeves.intro:
'''Alan Reeves''' (born 19 November 1967 in Birkenhead, Cheshire, England) is a former English football (soccer)football player.
