He was known primarily as a reliable centre half for The Football LeagueFootball League clubs, although he did have Premier league experience with Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon. He also played for Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Chester City F.C.Chester City, Rochdale F.C.Rochdale and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, where he played out his career, also as a player/coach, before becoming assistant mananger.
Reeves served as assistant manager for Brentford F.C.Brentford, from where he left with manager Scott Fitzgerald (footballer born 1969)Scott Fitzgerald on 10 April 2007 after the club's relegation. He interviewed for the vacant Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town manager role in May 2007, but was unsuccessful in receiving the job, reportedly due to differences with then chairman James Moore.
His twin brother Dave ReevesDavid, also played professional football for a number of clubs and has most recently been a coach at Gainsborough Trinity. Alan stated on an interview with LBC Radio that he sent letters to prospective clubs, purporting to be from his brother, in order to secure trials with them.

Alan Thompson (footballer, born 1973).name: Alan Thompson (footballer, born 1973)
Alan Thompson (footballer, born 1973).intro: '''Alan Thompson''' (born 22 December 1973) is a retired Association footballfootballer. He made 550 appearances for six different clubs. He played as a midfielder and was Cap (sport)capped by England national football teamEngland, against Sweden national football teamSweden in 2004. He is currently first-team coach at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.

Jean-Michel Ferri.name: Jean-Michel Ferri
Jean-Michel Ferri.intro:
'''Jean-Michel Ferri''' (born 7 February 1969 in Lyon) is a former France national football teamFrance international association footballfootballer who played midfielder (football)midfielder.
He won the championship with FC Nantes in 1995. He joined Liverpool F.C.Liverpool near the end of his career in 1998, but left after playing just 47 minutes for the club in two appearances as a substitute.

Apostolos Vellios.name: Apostolos Vellios
Apostolos Vellios.intro: '''Apostolos Vellios''' (Greek languageGreek: Απόστολος Βέλλιος) (born 8 January 1992) is a Greek Association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker who plays for Danish Superliga club FC Vestsjælland on loan from Lierse S.K.. He came out of Iraklis Thessaloniki F.C.Iraklis' academies before moving to the club's first team. Vellios played in England for three and a half years representing Everton and Blackpool. He has also represented his country at all youth levels.

Leon Britton.name: Leon Britton
Leon Britton.intro: '''Leon James Britton''' (born 16 September 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootball player, who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. Having joined Swansea on a permanent transfer in 2003, Britton went on to make 270 appearances for the club over a seven-year span. Britton joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United in the summer of 2010, but transferred back to Swansea in January 2011. Britton instantly became a central figure in Swansea's successful promotion campaign. He remains one of a handful of players to have represented any club in all four professional divisions of the English footballing pyramid, along with Brett Ormerod, Alan Tate (footballer)Alan Tate and Garry Monk.

Mattias Jonson.name: Mattias Jonson
Mattias Jonson.intro: '''Mattias Jonson'''  (born 16 January 1974) is a SwedenSwedish former professional association footballfootball player, who played as a midfielder for Swedish club Djurgårdens IF FotbollDjurgårdens IF in the Allsvenskan championship. He played 57 games and scored nine goals for the Sweden national football team, and represented Sweden at two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and the 2004 UEFA European Football Championship2004 European Championship.

Gerard Wiekens.name: Gerard Wiekens
Gerard Wiekens.intro: '''Gerard Wiekens''' (born 25 February 1973) is a former NetherlandsDutch Association footballfootballer who played for BV VeendamVeendam of the Eerste Divisie. Wiekens was born in Oude Pekela.  He usually played as a Defender (association football)defender, but could also play in Midfieldermidfield or as a Defender (association football)#Sweeper (libero)sweeper.
Gerard Wiekens.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Liam O'Neil.name: Liam O'Neil
Liam O'Neil.intro: '''Liam Christian James O'Neil''' (born 31 July 1993) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United on loan from West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.

Martin Andresen.name: Martin Andresen
Martin Andresen.intro: '''Martin Andresen''' (born 2 February 1977 in Kråkstad) is a former NorwayNorwegian football player. From 2008 to 2012, he was the manager of Vålerenga FotballVålerenga.

Carl Robinson.name: Carl Robinson
Carl Robinson.intro: '''Carl Robinson''' (born 13 October 1976) is a retired Welsh Association footballfootballer who is currently the head coach for Vancouver Whitecaps FC in Major League Soccer.

Steve Simonsen.name: Steve Simonsen
Steve Simonsen.intro:
'''Steven Preben Arthur''' "'''Steve'''" '''Simonsen''' (born 3 April 1979) is an English association footballfootballer  who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Scottish Championship side Rangers F.C.Rangers.
Born in South Shields, Tyne and Wear, he started his senior career at Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers before spells with Everton F.C.Everton, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and Scottish sides Dundee F.C.Dundee and Rangers F.C.Rangers. Whilst at Tranmere, he received four caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21s.

Joel Campbell.name: Joel Campbell
Joel Campbell.intro:
'''Joel Nathaniel Campbell Samuels''' (; born 26 June 1992) is a Costa Rican professional association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Villarreal CF, on loan from English club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, and the Costa Rica national football teamCosta Rica national team. Campbell plays as a Forward (association football)forward but can also be deployed on the Winger (soccer)wings.
He joined Arsenal in 2011, but spent his first three seasons out on loan at three clubs in three different countries: FC LorientLorient, Real Betis and Olympiacos. Campbell made his competitive Arsenal debut as the club won the 2014 FA Community Shield.
Campbell has earned over 40 caps for Costa Rica. He made his senior international debut in 2011 and was selected for that year's 2011 CONCACAF Gold CupCONCACAF Gold Cup and 2011 Copa AméricaCopa América, as well as the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Jason Euell.name: Jason Euell
Jason Euell.intro:
'''Jason Joseph Euell''' (born 6 February 1977) is a former Association footballfootballer and now the Under 21s coach at Charlton Athletic FC. He played as either a Forward (association football)forward or a midfielder. He has also been cap (sport)capped three times by Jamaica national football teamJamaica.
He spent much of his career playing in the Premier League, with all but one season between 1995 and 2007 in the top flight — firstly with Wimbledon F.CWimbledon, where he spent six years, including one season in the First Division, then  Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic for five years, before a season with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.
He then dropped to the second tier of football in England, initially with Southampton F.C.Southampton, where he spent two years, before his move to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool in 2009, where he was part of the team which won promotion to the Premier League. In 2011, he rejoined Charlton Athletic – by now in League One – for a second spell and helped them win promotion to the Championship. Later that season he was loaned to AFC Wimbledon, the successor to his first club.

Adam Johnson.name: Adam Johnson
Adam Johnson.intro:
'''Adam Johnson''' (born 14 July 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
A product of the Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough youth Middlesbrough F.C. Reserves and Academyacademy, he came to prominence after making his debut aged 17 in a UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup game. He played 119 games for Middlesbrough, also spending time on loan at Leeds United F.C.Leeds United and Watford F.C.Watford. In February 2010 he moved to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, where he won the FA Cup in 2011 and the Premier League the following season. He was signed by his hometown club Sunderland for £10 million in 2012.
Johnson has played at various levels for England, earning 12 cap (sport)caps at England national football teamsenior level.

Tomas Danilevi\u010dius.name: Tomas Danilevičius
Tomas Danilevi\u010dius.intro: '''Tomas Danilevičius''' (born 18 July 1978 in Klaipėda) is a Lithuanian professional Association footballfootballer, who plays for Parma F.C.Parma. A Forward (association football)striker, he stands 1.91m tall and weighs 82 kg.

Gareth Evans (footballer, born 1981).name: Gareth Evans (footballer, born 1981)
Gareth Evans (footballer, born 1981).intro: '''Gareth Joseph Evans''' (born 15 February 1981 in Leeds) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played in the Football League as a defender (association football)full back for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He was forced to retire at the age of 24 because of a longstanding knee injury. He now works in marketing for leading electronics distributor Premier Farnell

Nigel de Jong.name: Nigel de Jong
Nigel de Jong.intro:
'''Nigel de Jong''' (; born 30 November 1984) is a Dutch professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Italian Serie A club A.C. MilanMilan and the Netherlands national football team. He joined the Jong AjaxAjax youth academy as a youngster and worked his way through the ranks to make the first team at age 17. Two years later, in 2004, he made his international debut. Additionally, in 2010 he won a 2010 FIFA World Cup FinalWorld Cup runners-up medal.
De Jong moved on from Ajax in 2006 to join Hamburger SVHamburg in search of first team football and then moved to Manchester City in January 2009 for an estimated £18 million, where he became an important part of City's holding midfield. A tireless grafter, he has garnered a reputation of being a combative and feisty player in his performances, a reputation that has earned him nicknames such as ''"The Terrier"'' and ''"Lawnmower"''. He moved to Italian side A.C. MilanMilan in August 2012.

Ross Barkley.name: Ross Barkley
Ross Barkley.intro:
'''Ross Barkley''' (born 5 December 1993) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Everton F.C.Everton and the England national football teamEngland national team. He has also played on loan for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United.
Barkley made his full international debut in 2013 and played for England at the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Managers and teammates have compared his style of play to those of Michael Ballack, Paul Gascoigne and Wayne Rooney.

Philippe Clement.name: Philippe Clement
Philippe Clement.intro: '''Philippe Clement''' (born 22 March 1974 in Antwerp) is a BelgiumBelgian retired football (soccer)football defender (football)defender. He also played a defensive midfielder. His former clubs include K. Beerschot V.A.C.Beerschot, K.R.C. GenkGenk, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in England and Club Brugge. Clement played 38 times with Belgium national football teamBelgium national team and was in the team for the 2000 European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 and the Football World Cup 19981998 World Cup.

Danny Shittu.name: Danny Shittu
Danny Shittu.intro: '''Daniel Olusola "Danny" Shittu''' (born 2 September 1980) is a Nigerian Association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Millwall F.C.Millwall for the second time in his career.
Danny Shittu.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

William Prunier.name: William Prunier
William Prunier.intro:
'''William Prunier''' (born 14 August 1967 in Montreuil, Seine-Saint-DenisMontreuil) is a French former Association footballfootballer. He played in the defender (football)centre back position. He is currently the manager (association football)manager of Championnat de France amateur side US Colomiers FootballColomiers.
Prunier spent most of his playing days in France, primarily with AJ AuxerreAuxerre where he spent nine years, but also played for clubs in England, Denmark, Scotland, Italy, Belgium and Qatar, where he finished his career. He also represented France national football teamFrance, gaining his only cap in 1992.

Diego Gavil\u00e1n.name: Diego Gavilán
Diego Gavil\u00e1n.intro: ''' Diego Antonio Gavilán Zarate''' (born 1 March 1980, Asunción) is a Paraguayan former Association footballfootballer and current coach of Cerro PorteñoCerro Porteño U15. As a national team player, he earned 43 caps for his country.

Djamel Belmadi.name: Djamel Belmadi
Djamel Belmadi.intro: '''Djamel Belmadi''' (; born 27 March 1976) is a retired Algerian Association footballfootballer and the head coach of Qatar national football team.[

Paul Bodin.name: Paul Bodin
Paul Bodin.intro: '''Paul John Bodin''' (born 13 September 1964) is a former Wales national football teamWales international footballer. A left-back, Bodin's domestic career is best remembered for his two spells at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town.

Marcus Gayle.name: Marcus Gayle
Marcus Gayle.intro:
'''Marcus Anthony Gayle''' (born 27 September 1970, Hammersmith, London) is an EnglandEnglish born Jamaican former professional football (soccer)footballer, who was most recently manager of Staines Town F.C.Staines Town. Gayle's primary position was as a striker but also played as a midfielderwinger and defender (football)central defender towards the end of his career. His most notable clubs included Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon and Watford F.C.Watford before he finished his playing career at AFC Wimbledon. He won 14 caps for Jamaica national football teamJamaica and was a key player for his country at the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup tournament.
After retiring as a player, he became manager of the AFC WimbledonAFC Wimbledon reserve team for three years before taking charge of Staines Town F.C.Staines Town in 2012.

Efan Ekoku.name: Efan Ekoku
Efan Ekoku.intro: '''Efangwu Goziem''' "'''Efan'''" '''Ekoku''' (born 8 June 1967) is an English-born Nigerian former Association footballfootballer who played as a striker.

Ond\u0159ej \u010cel\u016fstka.name: Ondřej Čelůstka
Ond\u0159ej \u010cel\u016fstka.intro: '''Ondřej Čelůstka''' (born 18 June 1989; ) is a Czech association footballfootball defender who plays for 1. FC Nürnberg. He is a member of the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic national team and represented the under-21 team at the 2011 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship.

Omar Pouso.name: Omar Pouso
Omar Pouso.intro:
'''Omar Heber Pouso Osores''' (born February 28, 1980), is a football (soccer)footballer currently playing for Club de Gimnasia y Esgrima La Plata. He plays in midfielder (soccer)central midfield.
Pouso has 14 caps for Uruguay national football teamUruguay
and scored one goal, a volley in a friendly international  against  England national football teamEngland at Anfield on March 1, 2006.
Pouso moved to Europe on August 31, 2006 when he joined Charlton Athletic of the Premier League on a season-long loan from CA PeñarolPeñarol.

David Perpetuini.name: David Perpetuini
David Perpetuini.intro: '''David Perpetuini''' (born 26 September 1979 in Hitchin) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer, who plays for Arlesey Town F.C.Arlesey Town.

Abdul Razak.name: Abdul Razak
Abdul Razak.intro: '''Abdul Razak''' (born 11 November 1992) is an Ivory CoastIvorian association footballfootballer who currently plays for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. He has played for the Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire national team. He was born in Abidjan.

Gary Cahill.name: Gary Cahill
Gary Cahill.intro:
'''Gary James Cahill'''  (born 19 December 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the England national football teamEngland national team as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender. He usually plays centre back for both club and country. Despite being a defender, Cahill is noted for his technical ability and distribution, and occasionally, for his finishing prowess, and strength with his head. A quick, consistent and reliable centreback, Cahill is also known for his positioning and his ability to read the game.
Cahill began his career playing for the AFC Dronfield youth set-system in Derbyshire. In 2000, he joined the Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and AcademyAcademy and continued his development. In 2004 he joined Burnley F.C.Burnley on a season-long loan (sports)loan, where he performed well before returning to make his Aston Villa debut. Later, he signed for hometown club Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United on a three-month loan deal. On 30 January 2008, he signed for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers for approximately £5 million. Cahill performed well for Bolton through the years, cementing a place in the first-team and becoming vice-captain. He made 130 league appearances and scored 13 league goals for Bolton. In January 2012, Cahill signed for Chelsea for approximately £7 million. Cahill won the 2011–12 UEFA Champions LeagueUEFA Champions League and the 2011–12 FA CupFA Cup in his debut season at Chelsea.
Cahill is an English international with over 30 caps and represented the nation at the 2014 FIFA World Cup. He was eligible to play for either England or the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, but chose to play for England. On 6 February 2007, he made his England national under-21 football teamunder-21 debut for England, coming on as a substitute against Spain national under-21 football teamSpain. On 4 June 2009, Cahill was called up to the England squad for the match against Kazakhstan national football teamKazakhstan. However, he only made his debut on 3 September 2010, coming on as a substitute against Bulgaria national football teamBulgaria. On 29 March 2011, Cahill made his first start for the national team in the friendly against Ghana national football teamGhana. He scored his first international goal against Bulgaria national football teamBulgaria in a UEFA Euro 2012 qualifyingUEFA Euro 2012 qualifier. In September 2014 he was named England's vice-captain to Wayne Rooney, after the international retirements of Steven Gerrard and Frank Lampard.
Gary Cahill.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Petr \u010cech.name: Petr Čech
Petr \u010cech.intro:
'''Petr Čech''' (; born 20 May 1982) is a Czech Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Premier League club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic national team. Čech previously played for FK Chmel BlšanyChmel Blšany, AC Sparta PragueSparta Prague, and Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes. He is the second Czech Republic national football team#Most capped Czech Republic playersmost capped player in the history of the Czech national team with List of footballers with 100 or more caps112 caps, and represented the country at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup, as well as the UEFA Euro 20042004, UEFA Euro 20082008 and UEFA Euro 20122012 UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships. He was voted into the Euro 2004 all-star team after helping the Czechs reach the semi-finals. Čech also received the individual award of Best Goalkeeper in the 2004–05 UEFA Champions League2004–05, 2006–07 UEFA Champions League2006–07 and 2007–08 UEFA Champions League2007–08 seasons of the UEFA Champions League. In addition, he was named in the FIFPro and UEFA Champions League teams of the season in 2006. He is considered to be one of the best and most respected goalkeepers of his generation.
He joined Chelsea in 2004 and, to date, has made over 450 appearances for the club, putting him sixth in its List of Chelsea F.C. records and statistics#All-time appearancesall-time appearances list. With Chelsea, Čech has won three List of English football championsPremier League titles, four FA Cups, three Football League Cups, one UEFA Europa League and one List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League finalsUEFA Champions League.
Čech holds a number of goalkeeping records, including the Premier League records and statisticsPremier League record for fewest appearances required to reach 100 clean sheets, having done so in 180 league appearances. He also holds a Czech professional league record of not conceding a goal in 903 competitive minutes. In addition, he has a club record at his former club Sparta Prague, having gone 928 minutes unbeaten in all competitions in 2001–02, when his unbeaten run in the Czech First League was combined with his performances in the Champions League. During the 2004–05 season, Čech went 1,025 minutes without conceding a goal – a Premier League record, until it was surpassed by Edwin van der Sar of Manchester United F.C.Manchester United on 27 January 2009. Čech also won the Premier League Golden GloveGolden Glove three times; in the 2004–05 FA Premier League2004–05, 2009–10 Premier League2009–10 and 2013–14 Premier League2013–14 as the Premier League goalkeeper with the most clean sheets. As of 22 April 2014, Čech has kept a List of Chelsea F.C. records and statisticsclub record 220 clean sheets for Chelsea in all competitions.

Lewin Nyatanga.name: Lewin Nyatanga
Lewin Nyatanga.intro: '''Lewin John Nyatanga''' (born 18 August 1988) is a Welsh peopleWelsh international Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in the Football League One.

Pascal Chimbonda.name: Pascal Chimbonda
Pascal Chimbonda.intro:
'''Pascal Chimbonda''' (born 21 February 1979) is a Guadeloupean-FranceFrench professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for French Ligue 2 side AC Arles-Avignon.
Born in Guadeloupe and raised in metropolitan France, Chimbonda began his professional career in 1998 with Le Havre ACLe Havre, where he featured over 100 times combined for the club's first team and B team before moving to SC BastiaBastia in 2003. In 2005 he moved to Premier League club Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic where after enduring a decent season with the club he was signed by Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur a year later. After two seasons with Spurs he later moved on to fellow top flight club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland before briefly returning to Spurs in 2009. In the summer of 2009 he signed for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers which is where he remained until 2011 when he joined Football Championship club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers. During the 2011–12 season he was one of a number of ex Premier League players who turned out for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers but he went on to be released at the end of the season. Having remained clubless for the following year, Chimbonda dropped six leagues down to sign non-contract terms with Market Drayton Town F.C.Market Drayton Town, remaining at them briefly before joining Carlisle.
Despite initially playing his international football for Guadeloupe national football teamGuadeloupe, Chimbonda went on to be selected for the France national football teamFrance squad for the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup, but he was an unused substitute in each of France's matches including the final, in which they lost on a penalty shootout to Italy national football teamItaly. His only French cap came in a World Cup warm-up match against Denmark national football teamDenmark.

Iwan Roberts.name: Iwan Roberts
Iwan Roberts.intro:
'''Iwan Wyn Roberts''' (born 26 June 1968 in Bangor, Gwynedd)Cite web
url =
accessdate = 12 November 2007
title =The goal kings
publisher = Eastern Daily Press
archiveurl =
Roberts notably played in the Premier League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, as well as earning 15 caps for Wales national football teamWales. He also played in the Football League for Watford F.C.Watford, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham and Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United. Local Norwich football newspaper ''The Pink'un'' described him as "one of the greatest goal scorers ever to pull on a Norwich City shirt" and he was elected to the Norwich City F.C. Hall of Fame.
Since retiring as a player, Roberts, who speaks fluent Welsh (language)Welsh, has worked as a commentator for Sky Sports, Radio Cymru and BBC Wales. His book, ''All I Want for Christmas...'', a reference to his gap-toothed appearance, prompted both controversy and praise when it was published in 2004.

Leighton Baines.name: Leighton Baines
Leighton Baines.intro:
'''Leighton John Baines'''  (born 11 December 1984) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Everton F.C.Everton and the England national football team.
Baines started his career with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, with whom he won the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in the 2002–03 in English football2002–03 season and was a runner-up in the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 Football League ChampionshipChampionship and the 2006 Football League Cup Final. He joined Everton in 2007, helping them reach the 2009 FA Cup Final. He has played for England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 and senior levels.

Anthony Knockaert.name: Anthony Knockaert
Anthony Knockaert.intro: '''Anthony Knockaert''' (born 20 November 1991) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.CLeicester City.

Collins John.name: Collins John
Collins John.intro:
'''Collins John''' (born 17 October 1985 in Zwedru) is a Liberian-born Dutch Association footballfootballer who last played as a forward (association football)forward for Pittsburgh Riverhounds.
John notably played in the Premier League for Fulham F.C.Fulham where he notched up 20 goals in 92 appearances in a five-year stay at Craven Cottage. He also played in the English football league for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Watford F.C.Watford, and Barnet F.C.Barnet, in the Eredivisie for FC Twente and N.E.C. (football club)NEC Nijmegen, in Belgium for K.S.V. Roeselare, the United States for Chicago Fire SCChicago Fire, Azerbaijan for Gabala FC and in Iran for Mes Sarcheshmeh F.C..

John Carew.name: John Carew
John Carew.intro: '''John Alieu Carew ''' (; born 5 September 1979), is a NorwayNorwegian former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward. He was capped 91 times, scoring 24 goals for the Norway national football teamNorwegian national team.

F\u00e1bio Aur\u00e9lio.name: Fábio Aurélio
F\u00e1bio Aur\u00e9lio.intro: '''Fábio Aurélio Rodrigues''' (born 24 September 1979) is a retired Brazilian peopleBrazilian Association footballfootballer, having previously played for Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto AlegrenseGrêmio,  São Paulo FCSão Paulo, Valencia CFValencia and Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. He played as either a left back or Winger (soccer)left winger and has represented Brazil national football teamBrazil at Under-17 and Under-20 levels and at the Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics2000 Sydney Olympics. He is known for his superb crossing and free kick taking abilities. He is married with two children.

Anthony Le Tallec.name: Anthony Le Tallec
Anthony Le Tallec.intro: '''Anthony Le Tallec''' (born 3 October 1984) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Valenciennes FC in Ligue 2, as a Forward (association football)forward or Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.

Jason Davidson.name: Jason Davidson
Jason Davidson.intro: '''Jason Alan Davidson''' (born 29 June 1991) is an Australian peopleAustralian Association footballfootball (soccer) player.  The left-footed defender has had contracts with Hume City FCHume City and PortugalPortuguese Liga Sagres club F.C. Paços de FerreiraPaços de Ferreira and Dutch Eredivisie Club Heracles Almelo. Davidson currently plays for English Premier League football club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. His father Alan Edward DavidsonAlan was also a former professional and International football player.

Nile Ranger.name: Nile Ranger
Nile Ranger.intro: '''Nile Ranger''' (born 11 April 1991) is an English Association footballfootballer who is on the payroll of Blackpool F.C.Blackpool as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker. He has also played in the Premier League for Newcastle United, for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and on-loan for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, as well playing international football for England national under-19 football teamEngland U19.

Gary Penrice.name: Gary Penrice
Gary Penrice.intro:
'''Gary Kenneth Penrice''' (born 23 March 1964) is a former professional footballer (soccer)footballer. He played for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Watford F.C.Watford, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as a striker. Following a career that saw him make over 400 appearances, he became an assistant manager, attacking coach and later a  talent scout.
As of August 2013, he is a talent scout for Everton F.C. specialising in the European market.

J\u00fcrgen Macho.name: Jürgen Macho
J\u00fcrgen Macho.intro: '''Jürgen Macho''' (born 24 August 1977 in Vienna) is an Austrian Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper who last played for FC Admira Wacker Mödling.

Bj\u00f8rn Helge Riise.name: Bjørn Helge Riise
Bj\u00f8rn Helge Riise.intro: '''Bjørn Helge Semundseth Riise''' (born 21 June 1983 in Ålesund) is a NorwayNorwegian professional association footballfootballer. He currently plays for Lillestrøm SK. Riise plays either a central midfielder or a right winger, and has earned 35 international caps for Norway national football teamNorway. He played for Fulham F.C.Fulham of the Premier League from July 2009 to August 2012. He is the younger brother of former Fulham player John Arne Riise, also a Norwegian international.

Obafemi Martins.name: Obafemi Martins
Obafemi Martins.intro:
'''Obafemi Akinwunmi Martins''' (born 28 October 1984) is a Nigerian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Seattle Sounders FC and the Nigeria national football teamNigeria national team. He is known for his speed on the ball.
After leaving Nigeria for Italy at age 16, he has since played for a number of List of top-division football clubs in UEFA countriestop-division clubs around Europe. He began his senior career in 2002 at the Italian Serie A club F.C. Internazionale MilanoInter Milan, before moving to the English Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle in 2006, and then the German Fußball-BundesligaBundesliga club VfL Wolfsburg in 2009. Having joined Russian Premier League side Rubin Kazan in July 2010, they loan (sports)loaned him to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in January 2011.
In club football, Martins has won the Italian Serie A title, the Coppa ItaliaItalian Cup (twice), and the Supercoppa ItalianaSuper Cup, all with Inter. With Birmingham he scored the winning goal in the 2011 Football League Cup Final. He has played European football with Inter, Newcastle and Wolfsburg, winning the UEFA Intertoto Cup with Newcastle. His highest scoring league seasons so far have seen him score 11 goals in the 2004–05 Serie A, and 17 2006–07 FA Premier League2006–07 English Premier League. In international football, Martins has been in the Nigerian squad for the Africa Cup of Nations in 2006 Africa Cup of Nations2006, 2008 Africa Cup of Nations2008 and 2010 Africa Cup of Nations2010, and for the FIFA World Cup in 2010 FIFA World Cup2010.
Martins had two brothers who also played football professionally. His elder brother, Oladipupo Martins, played for A.C. Reggiana 1919Reggiana, FK PartizanPartizan and Innsbrucker ACInnsbruck before retiring from football in 2009 due to heart problems. He died on 8 August 2011 of a suspected heart attack in Lagos, Nigeria. Martins' younger brother is John Ronan Martins. The name "Obafemi" translates literally to "the king loves me" in the Yoruba language.

Rafael Schmitz.name: Rafael Schmitz
Rafael Schmitz.intro:
'''Rafael Schmitz''' (born December 17, 1980) is a Brazilian association footballfootballer. Schmitz, born in Blumenau, is a commanding central defender who is good in the air but also very agile and has good passing ability.
Schmitz spent six seasons with Lille OSC, for whom he played 99 Ligue 1 games and appeared in the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League and UEFA Cup.cite web
url=
He joined Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City on loan for the Premier League 2007-082007–08 season on July 6, 2007.cite news
title = Birmingham seal Schmitz loan deal
url =
publisher = BBC Sport
date = 2007-07-06
accessdate = 2007-07-06
He made his Birmingham debut as a very late substitute on September 15, 2007 against Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, and his first start on October 20, 2007 against Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in place of the injured Johan Djourou.  He returned to Lille following Birmingham's promotion and relegationrelegation at the end of the season.
On June 23, 2008, Schmitz signed a three-year contract with Valenciennes FCValenciennes.cite web
url=

Philipp Degen.name: Philipp Degen
Philipp Degen.intro:
'''Philipp Degen''' (born 15 February 1983) is a Swiss association footballfootballer. Degen is usually a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back but can also play at Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back or on the Midfielder#Wingerright wing. Degen reached the last 16 in the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup with the Switzerland national football teamSwitzerland and was selected again for UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008 but did not play any games.
He began his professional career at the local Swiss club FC Basel, playing four seasons in the first team before moving to Borussia Dortmund. He spent three years at the German club, his last season being marred by injury. Degen signed for Liverpool on a free transfer (football)free transfer on 3 July 2008, his stay at Liverpool was also blemished by many injuries. His Liverpool contract was terminated by mutual consent on 31 August 2011 and he returned to Basel.
Philipp Degen.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back,Striker Winger Right winger

Chris David.name: Chris David
Chris David.intro: '''Christofer David''' (born 6 March 1993) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer of Aramean descent who plays as a Midfield (association football)midfielder for Dutch Eredivisie side FC Twente, on loan from Fulham F.C.Fulham.

Lee Mills.name: Lee Mills
Lee Mills.intro:
'''Rowan Lee Mills''' (born on 10 July 1970) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.
In a career spanning fourteen years he made 293 appearances in the Football League, scoring 86 goals. He played for numerous clubs and was transferred for some big money moves; totalling around £2 million. Arguably his most successful period came at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in the late 1990s. He helped Vale to their highest post-war finish in the league, whilst he helped Bradford win promotion into the Premier League.

Shola Ameobi.name: Shola Ameobi
Shola Ameobi.intro:
'''Foluwashola "Shola" Ameobi''' (born 12 October 1981) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for English club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and the Nigeria national football teamNigeria national team.
He spent 14 years at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, where he received a winner's medal in 2010 when Newcastle lifted the Football League ChampionshipChampionship trophy. He holds the record for the most appearances as a Substitute (association football)substitute in the Premier League.
Born in Nigeria but raised in England, Ameobi was capped by the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team before making his Nigeria national football teamNigeria debut in 2012 and representing them at the 2014 FIFA World Cup. He is the older brother of fellow footballers Tomi AmeobiTomi and Sammy AmeobiSammy.

Nigel Pearson.name: Nigel Pearson
Nigel Pearson.intro: '''Nigel Graham Pearson''' (born 21 August 1963) is an English Association footballfootball Coach (sport)manager and former professional player. He is currently in his second spell as manager of Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, having previously managed Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Southampton F.C.Southampton and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, and been assistant manager for England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21s and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. During his playing career, he was a Defender (football)defender and played for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough.

Gary Mills (footballer, born 1961).name: Gary Mills (footballer, born 1961)
Gary Mills (footballer, born 1961).intro:
'''Gary Roland Mills''' (born 11 November 1961) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who is the current Manager (association football)manager of Gateshead F.C.Gateshead.
Mills, who played as a Defender (association football)defender and as a midfielder, started his career with Football League First DivisionFirst Division club Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He became the club's youngest league player after making his first team debut at the age of 16 in 1978. He played in the victorious 1980 European Cup Final, which made him the youngest finalist in UEFA Champions LeagueEuropean Cup history. He joined North American Soccer League (1968–84)North American Soccer League team the Seattle Sounders (1974–83)Seattle Sounders in 1982 and played for them as they were beaten by the New York Cosmos (1970–85)New York Cosmos in Soccer Bowl '82. While with them Mills had a Loan (sports)loan at Derby County F.C.Derby County, making 23 appearances for the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division club. He returned to Forest in 1983, and made 168 appearances over two spells at the club. He left for their rivals, Notts County F.C.Notts County of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division, in 1987. Mills then joined Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in 1989, and after two unsuccessful forays into the Football League Championship play-offsFirst Division play-offs he helped them win Promotion and relegationpromotion to the Premier LeagueFA Premier League in 1994. He soon returned to County, by this time playing in the First Division, after 232 appearances for Leicester. Here Mills earned the last honour of his playing career, winning the Anglo-Italian Cup in 1995. He retired from professional football in 1996 due to an injury, having made 159 appearances for County over two spells.
He started his managerial career as Player-coach#Player-managers in association footballplayer-manager with Grantham Town F.C.Grantham Town in 1996. He left the club after leading them to the Southern Football LeagueSouthern League Midland Division title in his second season. He then served as player-manager at Southern League Premier Division club King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn from 1998 to 2000, which was brought to an end after he resigned. He was appointed player-manager of Southern League Premier Division team Tamworth F.C.Tamworth in 2001, before leaving to join the  Coach (sport)coaching staff at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 2002. Mills was handed his first managerial role in the Football League with Notts County in 2004, but was sacked several months after the club was relegated to Football League TwoLeague Two. He managed Alfreton Town F.C.Alfreton Town of the Conference North from 2005 to 2007 when he returned to Tamworth. The club was relegated from the Conference PremierConference National before Mills led them to the Conference North title in 2009. He left Tamworth in 2010 to become manager of their Conference Premier rivals York City F.C.York City. Mills oversaw York's victories in the FA Trophy and Conference Premier play-offs in 2012, the latter resulting in promotion to League Two. He sacked by York in 2013 before taking over at Gateshead, and after leading them to the Conference Premier play-offs in 2014 he was named the Non-League Manager of the Year.

Paulo Ferreira.name: Paulo Ferreira
Paulo Ferreira.intro:
'''Paulo Renato Rebocho Ferreira''' (; born 18 January 1979) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender. He was known for his versatility and ability to play on both the right and left side of defence.
Ferreira was signed by José Mourinho for FC Porto from Vitória de Setúbal in 2002. He won the league title in both of his seasons at Porto, as well as the 2003 UEFA Cup Final and 2004 UEFA Champions League Final. He then followed Mourinho to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2004 on a €20 million transfer, winning honours including three Premier League titles and four FA Cups as well as another UEFA Champions League Cup and the UEFA Europa Cup before retiring in 2013.
He earned 62 caps for the Portuguese national football teamPortuguese national team between 2002 and 2010, playing at two European Championships and two World Cups, finishing as runner-up at Euro 2004 and in fourth at the 2006 World Cup.

Lazar Markovi\u0107.name: Lazar Marković
Lazar Markovi\u0107.intro:
'''Lazar Marković''' (Serbian Cyrillic alphabetSerbian Cyrillic: Лазар Марковић; born 2 March 1994) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the Serbia national football teamSerbia national team as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger. He was described by Andrea Stramaccioni as a player with exceptional qualities and impressive acceleration.[
He started his career at FK PartizanPartizan, and moved to S.L. BenficaBenfica in 2013 where he won a domestic treble in his only season before a £20 million move to Liverpool.
Marković made his full international debut for Serbia in 2012.

John Mensah.name: John Mensah
John Mensah.intro: '''John Mensah''' (born 29 November 1982) is a Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer who last played for FC NitraNitra as a defender (association football)defender. Mensah spent the 2009–10 Premier League2009–2010 and 2010–11 Premier League2010–2011 seasons on loan at English club Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in the Premier League. Mensah last played for Stade RennaisRennes in the Ligue 1French Ligue 1.
John Mensah.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Adam Newton.name: Adam Newton
Adam Newton.intro: '''Adam Lee Newton''' (born 4 December 1980 in Grays) is an English-born Saint Kitts and NevisSaint Kittitian and Nevisian professional association footballfootballer, who currently plays for Woking F.C.Woking in the Conference Premier. Although he has represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, Newton has been a member of the Saint Kitts and Nevis national football team since 2004.
Adam Newton.position: Defender  association football  Full Back Full Back

Mark Robinson (footballer, born 1968).name: Mark Robinson (footballer, born 1968)
Mark Robinson (footballer, born 1968).intro:
'''Mark Robinson''' (born  November 21, 1968) is a Football (soccer)footballer born in Rochdale, Lancashire. He is a former West Bromwich Albion, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Newcastle United, Swindon Town and Chippenham Town F.C.Chippenham Town Defender (association football)#Full backfull back.
Robinson started his career with Midlands based outfit West Bromwich Albion F.C. where he made only 2 league outings before a move to Barnsley F.C.. Robinson played over 150 games for the Tykes before Kevin Keegan paid £450,000 to take the defender to Newcastle United in March 1993. Robinson helped the Magpies secure promotion to the Premier League later that season.
In 1994 Mark Robinson was the unlucky player who suffered a broken leg in a horror tackle by a Hartlepool player, and Keegan said "we came to Hartlepool to help the club out financially, and we've ended up with a player fighting to save his career". Kevin Keegan also once said he would never return to Hartlepool's Victoria Park after a pre-season friendly went wrong.
He signed for a substantial amount by Keegan to bolster the defence, but was never the same player after the game at Hartlepool. He lost a lot of pace, which was his major strength.
Robinson made only 16 appearances during Newcastle's return to the top flight and in the summer of 1994 Swindon Town paid £600,000 for his services.
Robinson spent the rest of his career at the Wiltshire outfit playing 316 matches - scoring 4 times.
After injuries plagued him during the 2001–02 season Robinson retired from professional football and joined nearby Chippenham Town F.C..

Chris Allen (footballer, born 1972).name: Chris Allen (footballer, born 1972)
Chris Allen (footballer, born 1972).intro:
'''Christopher Anthony''' "'''Chris'''" '''Allen''' (born 18 November 1972 in Oxford) is an English peopleEnglish former Association footballfootball midfielder, who now works at Oxford United F.C.Oxford United as a youth team coach.
A former England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 international, he started his career at Oxford United in 1991, playing 181 games in five years, helping to send the club on their way back to the Football League First DivisionFirst Division in 1995–96 Football League1995–96 before he signed with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest for a £400,000 fee. He played 26 Premier League games for Forest, though played little part in the club's 1997–98 Nottingham Forest F.C. season1997–98 First Division promotion campaign. Instead he was loaned out to Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Football League Third DivisionThird Division promotion winners Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, before he was allowed to sign with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in March 1999. His career diminished in brief spells with Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, before he featured for non-league sides Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic, Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town and North Leigh F.C.North Leigh. He retired from playing in 2010, having helped North Leigh to win promotion from the Hellenic Football League in 2007–08.

Vince Grella.name: Vince Grella
Vince Grella.intro:
'''Vincenzo "Vince" Grella''' (born 5 October 1979) is an Australian former Football (soccer)footballer who played as a midfielder. Grella began his senior career in Australia before moving to Italy, where he spent over ten years, playing for Empoli F.C.Empoli, Ternana CalcioTernana, Parma F.C.Parma and Torino F.C.Torino. He moved to Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers of the English Premier League in 2008 where he spent four seasons, before returning to Australia in 2012 to play for Melbourne Heart FCMelbourne Heart.
He retired from professional football in January 2013, after a long-standing struggle with injuries. Grella represented the Australia national association football teamAustralian national team on 46 occasions, and played at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cups. His 2010 FIFA World Cup profile describes him as a possessing the "ability to mop up loose balls and halt opposition counter-attacks."

David Cotterill.name: David Cotterill
David Cotterill.intro:
'''David Rhys George Best Cotterill''' (born 4 December 1987) is a Welsh international Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City.
Born in Cardiff, Cotterill began his career at Bristol City F.C.Bristol City before signing for Premier League Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic where he spent two seasons before switching to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, initially on loan and then later on a permanent deal.  From United, Cotterill transferred to Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in his native Wales, before spending a spell on loan at Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and then transferring to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.  It was from Barnsley that Cotterill signed for near neighbours Doncaster Rovers, where he spent two seasons before joining Birmingham.
Cotterill has represented Wales national football teamWales at full international level on more than 20 occasions, scoring twice.

Vincenzo Montella.name: Vincenzo Montella
Vincenzo Montella.intro:
'''Vincenzo Montella''' (; born 18 June 1974) is a retired Italian Association footballfootballer and current manager of ACF FiorentinaFiorentina, who played as a Forward (association football)forward.
Montella's nickname during his playing career was ''L'Aeroplanino'' ("The Little Airplane"), in reference to his small stature and trademark goal celebration, in which he spread his arms like wings. He was known as a quick, opportunistic striker with an eye for goal, and a "fine all round player, with excellent passing and dribbling skills." Montella is remembered for his performances with A.S. RomaRoma (1999-2007), winning the Serie A title and the 2001 Supercoppa ItalianaSupercoppa Italiana with the club during the 2000–01 Serie A2000-01 season, also later reaching the 2003 Coppa Italia Final. In 2013, Montella was inducted into the A.S. Roma Hall of Fame. At international level, he was notably a member of the Italian national football teamItalian team that reached the final of UEFA Euro 2000, and he also represented his country at the 2002 FIFA World Cup.
As a manager, Montella led Fiorentina to the 2014 Coppa Italia Final.

Davor \u0160uker.name: Davor Šuker
Davor \u0160uker.intro:
'''Davor Šuker''' (; born 1 January 1968) is a retired Croatian Association footballfootballer and president of the Croatian Football Federation since July 2012. He played as a Forward (association football)striker for a number of European clubs as well as the Croatia national football teamCroatian national team, where he is the all-time top scorer with 45 goals.
Šuker was born in Osijek. He began his footballing career in his hometown, playing for the local first division team NK OsijekOsijek as a 16-year-old. During his final season there, he became the league's top goal scorer. He signed for a bigger club, NK Dinamo ZagrebDinamo Zagreb in 1989. The Croatian war of Independencewar in Croatia halted a promising season for the 21-year-old, eventually resulting in Šuker's move to Sevilla FCSevilla in 1991.
In La Liga Šuker was highly regarded, showing consistent form with Sevilla and being amongst the top goal scorers for consecutive seasons. He signed with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid 5 years later, and was again amongst the league's top scorers, which helped Madrid claim the La Liga title, the Supercup trophy and win the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League during his tenure there.
His move to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal turned out to be a disappointment, as he managed to only rarely find his goal scoring form, but distinguished himself in the Gunners' UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup final berth in 2000. He concluded his career with shorter spells at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and in German BundesligaGermany where he played for TSV 1860 München1860 Munich.
The crowning moment of Šuker's career was the 1998 FIFA World Cup1998 World Cup in France, where he became the top goal scorer and won the World Cup Golden BootGolden Boot by scoring 6 goals in 7 matches and also won Silver Ball 1998 at France as second best player of tournament (behind Ronaldo). His goal-scoring prowess proved instrumental as the Croatians surprisingly took third place, upsetting a strong Netherlands national football teamNetherlands side, in their debut World Cup as an independent country. Croatia did not lose a single match in which Šuker scored prior to the semifinal loss to eventual champions France national football teamFrance.
Named as Croatia's UEFA Jubilee AwardsGolden Player for the UEFA 2003 Jubilee anniversary, he came third in the FIFA World Player of the Year awards in 1998, and is also on the FIFA 100 list of the top 125 greatest footballers, the only Croatian on the list.
Davor \u0160uker.birth_place: Osijek,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Niclas Alexandersson.name: Niclas Alexandersson
Niclas Alexandersson.intro: '''Jens Niclas Alexandersson''' ( (born on 29 December 1971 in Halmstad, Sweden) is a retired SwedenSwedish Association footballfootball midfielder. He played as a right winger and right full back. Apart from his versatility, he is known for his dribbling and stamina.

Gary Twigg.name: Gary Twigg
Gary Twigg.intro: '''Gary Twigg''' (born 19 March 1984) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays for Portadown F.C.Portadown in the NIFL Premiership.

Lars Jacobsen.name: Lars Jacobsen
Lars Jacobsen.intro: '''Lars Christian Jacobsen''' (born 20 September 1979) is a Danish association footballfootballer. He currently plays for En Avant de GuingampGuingamp as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.

Stephen Dobbie.name: Stephen Dobbie
Stephen Dobbie.intro:
'''Stephen Dobbie''' (born 5 December 1982) is a ScotlandScottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. For most of his career Dobbie has mainly played as a striker, but has in recent years been used as an attacking midfielder.
Dobbie began his career with Rangers F.C.Rangers in 2002, but did not play in a first team match. He had more opportunities at Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, whom he joined in 2003 and then St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone whom he joined, initially on loan, in 2005. However, he failed to command a regular starting place at either club. His career was revived by a loan spell at Dumbarton F.C.Dumbarton in 2006 and he then became a prolific goalscorer for Queen of the South F.C.Queen of the South, who he joined in 2007, scoring 47 goals in 83 league appearances plus seven cup goals.
Dobbie moved to Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in 2009. He was loaned to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and helped them win promotion to the Premier League, by winning the 2010 Football League Championship play-off Final2010 play-offs. He returned to Swansea and helped them to win promotion to the Premier League in the 2011 Football League Championship play-off Final2011 play-offs, but was again loaned to Blackpool in 2012.
On 31 August 2012, Dobbie signed for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion before joining Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace on an initial loan move before completing a permanent switch to the South London side on 1 July 2013.

Deon Burton.name: Deon Burton
Deon Burton.intro: '''Deon John Burton''' (born 25 October 1976) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Eastleigh F.C.Eastleigh as a Forward (association football)striker.

Steven Caldwell.name: Steven Caldwell
Steven Caldwell.intro:
'''Steven Caldwell''' (born 12 September 1980) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays for Toronto FC and serves as their Captain (association football)team captain. He plays as a defender (association football)defender, predominantly as a centre back. Caldwell has won 12 caps for the Scotland national football teamScotland national team since 2001, and has played over 300 league matches in his career, all in the top three tiers of English football. Before joining Toronto FC, he represented seven English clubs: Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City.
His younger brother Gary CaldwellGary is also a defender and Scotland international.

Amdy Faye.name: Amdy Faye
Amdy Faye.intro:
'''Amdy Moustapha Faye''' (born 12 March 1977) is a Senegalese former Association footballfootballer. He plays as a defensive midfielder, and he could also play as a centre back.
Faye began his career with French clubs AS Monaco FCAS Monaco, ES Fréjus and AJ AuxerreAuxerre before moving to English Premier League side Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in August 2003 for a fee of £1.5 million. He spent a season and a half at Fratton Park before leaving for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in January 2005 for £2 million. He then had spells with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Scottish side Rangers F.C.Rangers. He joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2008 and spent the 2008–09 Stoke City F.C. season2008–09 season with the Potters. He ended his career with a short stay at Leeds United F.C.Leeds United.

Paul Mason.name: Paul Mason
Paul Mason.intro:
'''Paul David Mason''' (born 3 September 1963 in Kensington, LiverpoolKensington, Liverpool) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1984 until 2000.
He notably played in the Premier League for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, the Scottish Premier League for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen and in the Netherlands for F.C. GroningenGroningen.

Andy Gray (footballer, born 1977).name: Andy Gray (footballer, born 1977)
Andy Gray (footballer, born 1977).intro:
'''Andrew David 'Andy' Gray''' (born 15 November 1977) is a Association footballfootballer who currently is a Free Agent after leaving Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City by mutual consent.
He is the son of the former Scotland defender Frank Gray and nephew of Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United legend Eddie Gray (footballer)Eddie Gray. His cousin Stuart Gray (footballer born 1973)Stuart Gray was also a pro footballer. He started his career as a midfield player but later moved into a forward position. Gray began his career with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and has also played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Bury F.C.Bury, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Burnley F.C.Burnley. He has also won two cap (football)caps for Scotland national football teamScotland against Lithuania national football teamLithuania on 2 April 2003 and New Zealand national football teamNew Zealand on 27 May 2003.

Kasey Keller.name: Kasey Keller
Kasey Keller.intro:
'''Kasey C. Keller''' (born November 29, 1969) is an American former association footballsoccer player who last played for Seattle Sounders FC in Major League Soccer in 2011 as well as being the former starter goalkeeper for the United States men's national soccer team. He now works as the Sounders' color commentator in local broadcasts.
He is a four-time FIFA World Cup participant and was the first American goalkeeper to become a regular in the German Fußball-BundesligaBundesliga, the English Premier League, and the Spanish La Liga.

Con Blatsis.name: Con Blatsis
Con Blatsis.intro: '''Constantinos "Con" Blatsis''' (born 6 July 1977 in Melbourne) is a former Australian Association football player.

Mart\u00edn Herrera.name: Martín Herrera
Mart\u00edn Herrera.intro: '''Martín Horacio Herrera''' (born 13 September 1970) is an Argentine retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Ian Andrews.name: Ian Andrews
Ian Andrews.intro:
'''Ian Edmund Andrews''' (born 1 December 1964 in Nottingham) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper in the Football League for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, Southampton F.C.Southampton and A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, and in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic. He was cap (sport)capped by England under-21 national football teamEngland at under-21 level. His last appearance in the League was for Bournemouth in 1996, but while working for Leicester City as goalkeeping coach (sport)coach and physiotherapist, he was an unused substitute (association football)substitute as late as the 2001–02 season. In 2004 he joined Team Bath F.C.TeamBath as physiotherapist.
He is an alumnus of Manchester Metropolitan University

Lloyd Sam.name: Lloyd Sam
Lloyd Sam.intro: '''Lloyd Ekow Sam''' (born 27 September 1984) is an English professional Association footballfootballer, who plays as a winger (association football)winger who is comfortable playing on either side of the pitch. He plays for the New York Red Bulls in Major League Soccer.  Sam is eligible to represent either England or Ghana internationally. He has been capped once by England at England national under-20 football teamU20 level, he was called up to the Ghana national football team during the 2009–10 season but had to pull out of the squad due to injury.

Danny Thomas (footballer, born 1981).name: Danny Thomas (footballer, born 1981)
Danny Thomas (footballer, born 1981).intro: '''Danny Justin Thomas''' (born 1 May 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who most recently played for Fimleikafélag HafnarfjarðarFH as a Left-Back.

Ca\u00e7apa.name: Caçapa
Ca\u00e7apa.intro: '''Cláudio Roberto da Silva''', commonly known as '''Cláudio Caçapa''' or simply '''Caçapa''' (born 29 May 1976) is a retired Brazilian Association footballfootballer who played as a central defender (association football)defender. Having made his senior debut in 1996 for Clube Atlético MineiroAtlético Mineiro, Caçapa went on to play for Olympique LyonnaisLyon, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Cruzeiro Esporte ClubeCruzeiro, Évian Thonon Gaillard FCÉvian and Avaí Futebol ClubeAvaí. He was Cap (sport)capped three times by the Brazil national football teamBrazil national team.

Shaun Cummings.name: Shaun Cummings
Shaun Cummings.intro: '''Shaun Michael Cummings''' (born 25 February 1989) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall as a defender (association football)defender. Born in England, Cummings represents Jamaica national football teamJamaica at international level.

Callum Robinson.name: Callum Robinson
Callum Robinson.intro: '''Callum Jack Robinson''' (born 2 February 1995) is an English peopleEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and internationally for the  England national under-20 football teamEngland U20 side.

George Ndah.name: George Ndah
George Ndah.intro:
'''George Ebialimolisa Ndah''' (born 23 December 1974 in Camberwell, England) is an English-born Nigerian former professional association footballfootballer who played as a striker (association football)striker from 1992 until 2006.
He played in the Premier League for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and in the Football League for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. In 1999 he was called up to play international football by Nigeria national football teamNigeria, but injury prevented him from making his debut and he was never selected again.

Eduardo Vargas.name: Eduardo Vargas
Eduardo Vargas.intro: '''Eduardo Jesús Vargas Rojas''' (; born 20 November 1989) is a Chilean Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers, on loan from S.S.C. NapoliNapoli, and the Chile national football teamChilean national team as a Forward (association football)forward or winger (association football)winger.

Jason Scotland.name: Jason Scotland
Jason Scotland.intro:
'''Jason Kelvin Scotland''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 18 February 1979) is a Trinidad and TobagoTrinidadian association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Hamilton Academical F.C.Hamilton Academical
Scotland started his footballing career in Trinidad and Tobago before moving to play professionally for Scottish club Dundee United F.C.Dundee United. He has also had spells with St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, Swansea City F.C.Swansea City, Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Barnsley F.C.Barnsley.[

Brian Deane.name: Brian Deane
Brian Deane.intro:
'''Brian Christopher Deane''' (born 7 February 1968 in Leeds) is an English Association footballfootball coach and former player whose most recent position was as the manager of the NorwayNorwegian side Sarpsborg 08.
During his playing career, he played as Forward (association football)forward from 1985 until 2006. He was the scorer of the first ever goal in the Premier LeagueFA Premier League in 1992, when he was a Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United player. Deane also played in the Premier League for Leeds United F.C.Leeds United and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough as well as playing top-flight football in Portugal and Australia for S.L. BenficaBenfica and Perth Glory FCPerth Glory respectively. He also played in The Football League for Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland before finishing his playing career in 2006 with a brief spell back at Sheffield United. Deane was capped three times by England national football teamEngland.

Adam Armstrong.name: Adam Armstrong
Adam Armstrong.intro: '''Adam James Armstrong''' (born 10 February 1997) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.

Arnold Mvuemba.name: Arnold Mvuemba
Arnold Mvuemba.intro: '''Arnold Makengo Mvuemba''' (born 28 January 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for French club Olympique LyonnaisLyon as a midfielder.

Paul Moulden.name: Paul Moulden
Paul Moulden.intro: '''Paul Anthony Joseph Moulden''' (born 6 September 1967) is an EnglandEnglish former association footballfootballer who played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City as a striker.

Louis Moult.name: Louis Moult
Louis Moult.intro:
'''Louis Elliot Moult''' (born 14 May 1992) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Wrexham F.C.Wrexham.
Moult, a prolific goal scorer in Stoke City's academy and reserve side, made his League debut against Burnley in March 2010. However since then Moult has struggled to gain a place in the Stoke squad and has been sent out on loan to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley and to Mansfield for a second time. He was released by Stoke in June 2012 and signed for Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town.

Steve Basham.name: Steve Basham
Steve Basham.intro: '''Steven Brian Basham''' (born 2 December 1977 in Southampton, England) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer.

Mick Harford.name: Mick Harford
Mick Harford.intro:
'''Michael Gordon "Mick" Harford''' (born 12 February 1959), is an English former association footballfootball player turned manager. He is currently the head of recruitment at Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Millwall F.C.Millwall.
He is former manager of Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and has also been caretaker manager of Nottingham Forest and QPR.

Leonardo Ulloa.name: Leonardo Ulloa
Leonardo Ulloa.intro: '''José Leonardo Ulloa''' (; born 26 July 1986) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.

Stuart Nicholson.name: Stuart Nicholson
Stuart Nicholson.intro:
'''Stuart Ian Nicholson''' (born 3 February 1987 in Newcastle upon Tyne, England) is a former professional association footballfootballer, currently playing for Moreland Zebras FCMoreland Zebras.
Stuart was also a former England Under-19 international.

Paul Butler (footballer, born 1972).name: Paul Butler (footballer, born 1972)
Paul Butler (footballer, born 1972).intro:
'''Paul John Butler''' (born 2 November 1972) is a former association footballfootballer where he played as a Defender_(football)#Centre_backcentre-back. Despite being born in Manchester he played for Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. He is a first team coach at Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers. He was most recently a player at Football League TwoLeague Two side Chester City F.C.Chester City, where he also had spells as captain and assistant-manager.
He has previously played in the Premier League for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, and was also a former captain of Leeds United.

Andreas Lund.intro:
'''Andreas Lund''' (born 7 May 1975) is a former NorwayNorwegian football (soccer)footballer.
During his career he played for IK Start, Molde FK, and Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon. He earned eight caps and scored four goals for the Norway national football team.

Born in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, he was a product of Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United's academy before breaking into their first team in 2008.  He has represented England at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level as well as having loan spells with Gretna F.C.Gretna, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Norwich City F.C.Norwich City.

Aidan Davison.name: Aidan Davison
Aidan Davison.intro:
'''Aidan John Davison''' (born 11 May 1968 in Sedgefield, County Durham) is an English-born Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former professional association footballfootballer and coach who is without a club after previously holding the position of Head Coach at USL Premier Development League side FC JAX Destroyers until the club disbanded in 2012.
As a player he played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1987 until 2008. Having started his career with non-league side Billingham Synthonia F.C.Billingham Synthonia, he moved on to Notts County F.C.Notts County and subsequently spent loan spells with Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient and Bury F.C.Bury before joining the latter on a permanent deal. He went on to play for Chester City F.C.Chester City, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Millwall F.C.Milwall before earning his biggest break yet by signing for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and in 1995 gaining promotion to the Premier League. Loan spells with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Hull City A.F.C.Hull City followed before joining Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City permanently. In 1997 he signed for Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town where he arguably played some of his best football having won promotion and a domestic cup in his two years at the club. He went on to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and then returned to Premier League football when he re-joined Bradford City in 2000. In 2003 he returned to Grimsby Town for a year before finishing his career with a four-year spell at Colchester United F.C.Colchester United. In his career he was capped three times by Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland.
In 2009 following his retirement he joined the coaching staff of Premier League Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and became the club's reserve team manager. In 2010 he briefly came out of retirement and signed as a player to add to the club's goalkeeping cover, however he only made the substitute bench for the reserve team he managed. In 2011 he became Head Coach of American side FC Jax Destroyers.

Abdoulaye Faye.name: Abdoulaye Faye
Abdoulaye Faye.intro:
'''Abdoulaye Diagne-Faye''' (born 26 February 1978), known as '''Abdoulaye Faye''', is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (football)#Centre backDefender for Malaysia Premier League side Sabah FA.
Faye began his career playing for ASEC Ndiambour and ASC Jeanne d'ArcJeanne d'Arc in his native Senegal before moving to French side RC LensLens in 2002. After spending time out on loan at FC IstresIstres he attracted the attentions of Sam Allardyce who signed him for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in July 2005. After two seasons at Bolton he followed Allardyce to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United where he spent one season before joining Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2008 for £2.25 million. Faye became a popular player at the Britannia Stadium in 2008–09 Stoke City F.C. season2008–2009 as he won the Stoke City F.C. Player of the Yearplayer of the year and was named captain by Tony Pulis for the 2009–10 Stoke City F.C. season2009–2010 season. He lost the capacity to Ryan Shawcross for 2010–11 Stoke City F.C. season2010–2011 and then had a third spell working with Allardyce at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. Faye helped the Hammers gain promotion to the Premier League in 2011–12 West Ham United F.C. season2011–12 before joining Hull City A.F.C.Hull City where he was again involved in a promotion winning season in 2012–13 Hull City A.F.C. season2012–13 before being released at the end of the 2013–14 Hull City A.F.C. season2013–14 season.

Anthony Grant.name: Anthony Grant
Anthony Grant.intro:
'''Anthony Paul Shaun Andrew Daure Grant''' (born 4 June 1987) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Football League OneLeague One side Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra.
Grant began his career at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, progressing through the youth ranks before making his first-team debut in 2005. Grant was loaned out four times during his time at Chelsea; briefly playing for Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic in 2006, before spending the 2006–07 in English football2006–07 season at Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. He then joined Luton Town F.C.Luton Town on loan in November 2007, spending a month with the club. Grant later joined Southend United F.C.Southend United in January 2008, on loan until the end of the 2007–08 in English football2007–08 campaign. He signed for Southend on a permanent basis ahead of the 2008–09 in English football2008–09 season, and spent four seasons with the club. In June 2012, Grant signed for Stevenage F.C.Stevenage on a free transfer. After one season at Stevenage, Grant joined Crewe Alexandra.

Stewart Downing.name: Stewart Downing
Stewart Downing.intro: '''Stewart Downing''' (born 22 July 1984) is an English peopleEnglish professional footballer who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and the England national football teamEngland national team. He has played most of his career as a Winger (soccer)winger, where he operates predominantly on the left-hand side, though he can play on the right and go inside on to his stronger left foot. Downing has also played in the left-back position and more recently as an attacking midfielderattacking central midfielder. Downing has previously played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, and has won the Football League Cup twice in his career.

Steve Harkness.name: Steve Harkness
Steve Harkness.intro:
'''Steven "Steve" Harkness''' (born 27 August 1971) is an English former professional footballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1989 to 2002.
He notably had spells in the Premier League with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as well as playing in Portugal with S.L. BenficaBenfica. He also played in the Football League with Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Chester City F.C.Chester City.

Marlon Beresford.name: Marlon Beresford
Marlon Beresford.intro: '''Marlon Beresford''' (born 2 September 1969) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is now an accountancy tutor and sports commentator.

Esteban Cambiasso.name: Esteban Cambiasso
Esteban Cambiasso.intro:
'''Esteban Matías Cambiasso Deleau''' (born 18 August 1980), nicknamed ''"Cuchu"'' (Rioplatense Spanish: ''Old man''), is an Argentine association footballfootballer who plays for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.
During his professional career, Cambiasso has won 23 official titles (as of the end of 2011), being the Argentine footballer with most honours in history, one more than Alfredo Di Stéfano. The majority of his titles were won during his ten seasons at Inter Milan, including five ''ScudettoScudetti'' and the 2010 UEFA Champions League Final2010 Champions League.
A full international since 2000, Cambiasso won 52 caps for Argentina, and represented the country at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup and the Copa América in 2007 Copa América2007 and 2011 Copa América2011.

Brad Jones.name: Brad Jones
Brad Jones.intro: '''Bradley "Brad" Jones''' (born 19 March 1982) is an Australian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He was a member of the Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough team for over a decade as well as having a number of loan spells at a succession of lower league clubs; Stockport County F.C.Stockport, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, he also had a brief loan spell in Ireland with Shelbourne F.C.Shelbourne. In August 2010, he made a £2.3m move to Liverpool.

Cristian Gamboa.name: Cristian Gamboa
Cristian Gamboa.intro:
'''Cristian Esteban Gamboa Luna''' (born in 24 October 1989), commonly known as '''Cristian Gamboa''', is a Costa Rican Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. He is a pacy right back with both attacking and defensive capabilities.
Gamboa is an international player for Costa Rica national football teamCosta Rica and played in the team at the 2014 FIFA World Cup that reached the quarter-finals.

Devon White.name: Devon White
Devon White.intro: '''Devon Timothy White''' (born 2 March 1964) is a former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a striker for seven different The Football LeagueFootball League clubs.

Stefan Schnoor.intro:
'''Stefan Schnoor''' (born April 24, 1971 in Neumünster) is a retired GermanyGerman football (soccer)football Defender (football)defender.
Schnoor made his name at Hamburger SV but left the club on a free transfer in 1998 to join Derby County F.C.. After two and a half years in England, scoring twice against Leicester Citycite news
