Emmanuel Mayuka.name: Emmanuel Mayuka
Emmanuel Mayuka.intro: '''Emmanuel Mayuka''' (born 21 November 1990) is a Zambian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Peter Kennedy.name: Peter Kennedy
Peter Kennedy.intro:
'''Peter Kennedy''' (born 10 September 1973) was a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish Association footballfootball defender (football)defender/midfielder (football)midfielder. He has three children, Annie, Olivia and Peter. In 1995/96 he was named as the Ulster Footballer of the Year.M. Brodie (ed.), ''Northern Ireland Soccer Yearbook 2009–2010'', p. 102. Belfast:Ulster Tatler Publications After his first spell in Northern Ireland he had a successful spell in English football, initially joining Notts County in August 1996 where he scored once against Newcastle Town in the FA Cup,cite news
url=
title=County's nervous passage
publisher=The Independent
date=17 November 1996 accessdate=9 February 2010
location=London
first=Phil
last=Shaw before moving onto Watford F.C.Watford a season later. In his first season, he led Watford to promotion to Division One as their highest goalscorer. He scored two goals in quick succession in the derby with Luton Town, a hat-trick against Southend United, and a splendid long-range effort against Sheffield Wednesday in the FA Cup. The following season was arguably the highlight of his career as he helped Watford gain promotion to the Premier League in 1999. In the Premier League, he scored Watford's first goal of the season, a penalty against Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon.cite news
url=
title=Watford let Dons take advantage
publisher=BBC
date=9 August 1999 accessdate=6 August 2013 He left Watford at the end of the 2000/01 campaign and spent three seasons at Wigan, spending a period on loan at Derby County where he scored once against Ipswich Town.cite news
url=
title=Derby 2-2 Ipswich
publisher=BBC
date=8 November 2003 accessdate=9 February 2010 His final English club was Peterborough United, after which he returned to Northern Ireland. At the end of the 2007–08 season Peter did not have his contract renewed by Portadown and left the club. He began training with Ballymena United FC but decided to retire from his footballing career to focus on becoming an accountant. After a year Peter came out of retirement and made a return to football by signing for Donegal Celtic FC who play in the IFA Championship.

Iyseden Christie.name: Iyseden Christie
Iyseden Christie.intro: '''Iyseden Christie''' (born 14 November 1976 in Coventry) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays for Northern Premier League Division One South side Halesowen Town F.C.Halesowen Town, where he plays as a Forward (association football)striker.

Martin \u0160krtel.name: Martin Škrtel
Martin \u0160krtel.intro:
'''Martin Škrtel''' (; born 15 December 1984) is a SlovakiaSlovak Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back for English club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and captains the Slovakia national football teamSlovakia national team.
He previously played for FK AS TrenčínTrenčín and FC Zenit Saint PetersburgZenit Saint Petersburg, before joining Liverpool for £6.5 million in January 2008. He has won the Russian Premier League and the Football League Cup, as well as being named Slovak Footballer of the Year four times.
Škrtel made his international debut for Slovakia in 2004 and represented the country at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Simon Barker.name: Simon Barker
Simon Barker.intro:
'''Simon Barker''' (born 4 November 1964) is an English former Association footballfootballer. A blond haired, tough tackling midfielder, he scored 70 goals in 529 league appearances throughout a 17-year career in the Football League. He also represented England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21's four times.
He began his career at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 1983, winning the Full Members Cup with the club in 1987 Full Members Cup Final1987, before moving on to Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers the following year for £400,000. He played 351 league and cup games for QPR, before moving on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1988. He retired in 2000.

Filip \u0110uri\u010di\u0107.name: Filip Đuričić
Filip \u0110uri\u010di\u0107.intro: '''Filip Đuričić''' (Serbian Cyrillic: Филип Ђуричић; born 30 January 1992) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for English club Southampton F.C.Southampton, on loan from Portuguese club S.L. BenficaBenfica, and the Serbia national football teamSerbia national team.

Leon Osman.name: Leon Osman
Leon Osman.intro:
'''Leon Osman''' (born 17 May 1981) is an English Association footballfootball player who plays for Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League as a midfielder.
He has spent his whole career as an Everton player, making over 300 Premier League appearances. Earlier in his career he spent time on loan at The Football LeagueFootball League clubs Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Derby County F.C.Derby County.
Osman earned two international caps for England national football teamEngland, making his debut at the age of 31.

Ian Ironside.name: Ian Ironside
Ian Ironside.intro: '''Ian Ironside''' (born 8 March 1964 in Sheffield) is a retired EnglandEnglish football goalkeeper, who spent most of his playing career at Scarborough F.C. but since retiring has returned to Sheffield and is now working as a joiner.

David McDonald.name: David McDonald
David McDonald.intro: '''David McDonald''' (born 2 January 1971) is a retired Republic of IrelandIrish football (soccer)football defender (football)defender.
David McDonald.position: Defender  football  Full back Full back

Nicola Berti.name: Nicola Berti
Nicola Berti.intro: '''Nicola Berti''' (born 14 April 1967, in Salsomaggiore Terme) is an Italian former footballer whose career spanned three decades. Despite his initial lack of notable technical ability (which he developed with time), he was a versatile, tenacious, tactically intelligent, and hard tackling Midfielder (association football)midfielder, who was known in particular for his pace, stamina, determination, work-rate, and passing range, which made him capable of playing anywhere in midfield. He was regarded as a linchpin for Internazionale Milano F.C.Internazionale and the Italy national football team during the late 1980s and the early 1990s, notably reaching the final of the 1994 FIFA World Cup with Italy, and finishing in third place in the 1990 FIFA World Cup1990 edition on home soil.

Bernard Mendy.name: Bernard Mendy
Bernard Mendy.intro: '''Bernard Mendy''' (born 20 August 1981) is a French association footballfootballer who plays for AEL Limassol. He is a right back/right wing-back who is known for his blistering pace and constant overlapping runs.

Rod Wallace.name: Rod Wallace
Rod Wallace.intro:
'''Rodney Seymour''' "'''Rod'''" '''Wallace''' (born 2 October 1969) is an English professional association footballfootballer and reserve team coach of Combined Counties Football League side Epsom & Ewell F.C.Epsom & Ewell. As a player he was a striker (association football)striker from 1987 to 2004.
Wallace was born in Lewisham but started his football career at Southampton F.C.Southampton in 1987 playing 128 league games scoring 45 goals.  This form earned him a transfer to Leeds United F.C.Leeds United where he won the First Division championship.  After spending seven years at Leeds, Dick Advocaat signed him on a Bosman ruling transfer for Rangers F.C.Rangers where he scored 41 league goals and was part of the squad that won five out of six trophies in their first two seasons.  After leaving Rangers in 2001 he signed for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers on a free transfer for a season and then Gillingham F.C.Gillingham before retiring from professional football.

Yaya Sanogo.name: Yaya Sanogo
Yaya Sanogo.intro: '''Yaya Sanogo''' (born 27 January 1993) is a French professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, on loan from Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, as a Forward (association football)striker. He is a France national youth football teamFrench youth international having represented his country at France national under-16 football teamunder-16, France national under-17 football teamunder-17, France national under-19 football teamunder-19, France national under-20 football teamunder-20 and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

John Aloisi.name: John Aloisi
John Aloisi.intro:
'''John Aloisi''' (born 5 February 1976) is a retired Australian association footballfootball (soccer) player and the former manager of A-League club Melbourne Heart FCMelbourne Heart. In a professional career that spanned 20 seasons, with league totals of 459 games and 127 goals, he was the first Australian ever to play and score in La Liga, the Premier League and Serie A.
He returned to his country in 2007, with four seasons in the A-League. Aloisi was an integral member of the Australia national association football teamAustralia national team for more than one decade, and represented the nation at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup, being an essential figure in 2006 FIFA World Cup qualification (OFC)the qualifying stages.[

Paul Gerrard.name: Paul Gerrard
Paul Gerrard.intro:
'''Paul William Gerrard''' (born 22 January 1973), is an English football (soccer)football Coach (sport)#Association footballgoalkeeping coach. He is currently employed by Football League Championship side Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, having previously been employed as a player-goalkeeping coach at  Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic.
Gerrard started his career in the Premier League with Oldham Athletic as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, and his 22 year playing career saw him play for Oldham, Everton F.C.Everton, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, before he finished his playing career in a second spell at Oldham. Towards the end of his playing career, he was employed as a part-time goalkeeping coach by Oldham and Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, before signing on as a full-time player/coach with Oldham at the start of the 2011-12 in English football2011–12 season. Gerrard is also a former England national under 21 football teamEngland Under 21 international, having made 18 appearances between 1993 and 1996, but he never made an appearance for the full national side.

Peter Degn.name: Peter Degn
Peter Degn.intro: '''Peter Degn''' (born April 6, 1977) was a DenmarkDanish professional football (soccer) player, who is now retired. He has played 25 games and scored three goals for the Denmark national under-21 football team.

Graham Rix.name: Graham Rix
Graham Rix.intro: '''Graham Cyril Rix''' (born 23 October 1957) is an English former association footballfootball player. He is currently the head coach of A.F.C. Portchester.

Borja Valero.name: Borja Valero
Borja Valero.intro:
'''Borja Valero Iglesias''' (; born 12 January 1985) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club ACF FiorentinaFiorentina as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
Best known for his technique and passing ability, he began his career with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid but did not have any impact with its first team, and played for RCD MallorcaMallorca and in England for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion before joining Villarreal CFVillarreal in 2010.
Over the course of five seasons, Valero amassed La Liga totals of 139 games and 16 goals.

Seyi Olofinjana.name: Seyi Olofinjana
Seyi Olofinjana.intro:
'''Seyi George Olofinjana''' (born 30 June 1980) is a Nigerian association footballfootballer who play as a midfielder who last played for IK StartStart in Tippeligaen.
Olofinjana began his career with local sides Crown F.C.Crown and Kwara United F.C.Kwara United before moving to Europe with Norwegian side SK Brann. After two seasons at Brann he moved to English club Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. He became a regular at Molineux StadiumMolineux making 213 appearances for the club over four seasons before joining Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in August 2008 for a fee of £3 million. He played only the 2008–09 Premier League2008–09 season with the team before joining another top flight side, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, again for a fee of £3 million. At Hull Olofinjana struggled to hold down a regular place in the side and spent time out on loan before his deal expired.

Ricardo (footballer, born 1971).name: Ricardo (footballer, born 1971)
Ricardo (footballer, born 1971).intro:
'''Ricardo López Felipe''' (born 30 December 1971), known simply as '''Ricardo''', is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
Over the course of 15 seasons he played in 278 La Liga games, starting his career at Atlético Madrid without much impact, then representing mostly Real ValladolidValladolid (four seasons) and CA OsasunaOsasuna (eight). He also spent two years with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United in the Premier League.
Ricardo won two international caps for Spain national football teamSpain and was part of their squad for the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup.

Diego Penny.name: Diego Penny
Diego Penny.intro: '''Diego Alonso Roberto Penny''' (born 22 April 1984) is a Peruvian international Association footballfootballer who plays professionally for Sporting Cristal, as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He stands at 1.97m tall.

David Marshall.name: David Marshall
David Marshall.intro: '''David James Marshall''' (born 5 March 1985) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Welsh club Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He has been capped at international level by Scotland national football teamScotland.

Dwight Yorke.name: Dwight Yorke
Dwight Yorke.intro:
'''Dwight Eversley Yorke''' Chaconia MedalCM (born 3 November 1971 in Canaan, TobagoCanaan, Tobago) is a Tobagonian former association footballfootball player. He played for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Sydney FC and Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. He was the assistant manager of the Trinidad and Tobago national football teamTrinidad and Tobago national team until the completion of the 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF Fourth Roundqualifying matches for the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
Along with Russell Latapy and Pat Jennings, Yorke holds the record number of participations in different World Cup competitions, including qualifying stages – six in total (1990 FIFA World Cup1990, 1994 FIFA World Cup1994, 1998 FIFA World Cup1998, 2002 FIFA World Cup2002, 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010).[
He has signed deal with IMG-Reliance to take part in proposed football league, being played next year in India.

Carlos Cu\u00e9llar.name: Carlos Cuéllar
Carlos Cu\u00e9llar.intro: '''Carlos Javier Cuéllar Jiménez''' (; born 23 August 1981) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. He is primarily a centre back, but can also operate as a right back.

Stephen Cooke.name: Stephen Cooke
Stephen Cooke.intro: '''Stephen Lee Cooke''' (born 15 February 1982 in Walsall, England) is a Association footballfootballer currently signed to Pelsall Villa F.C.Pelsall Villa in the Midland Football Combination Midland Football Combination#2011-12 members#Premier DivisionPremier Division, where he plays as a Midfielder (football)midfielder and is also a coach. Once considered a bright prospect for the future of English football, Cooke's career has been seriously affected by a number of injuries.[

Karel Poborsk\u00fd.name: Karel Poborský
Karel Poborsk\u00fd.intro:
'''Karel Poborský''' () (born 30 March 1972) is a Czech retired association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (football)right winger. He was most noted for his technical ability.
He began and finished his club career at SK Dynamo České BudějoviceČeské Budějovice, also winning Gambrinus liga titles at the two largest clubs in Prague, Slavia PragueSlavia and Sparta PragueSparta. Between these domestic triumphs, he won a Premier League title at Manchester United and also played for S.L. BenficaBenfica and S.S. LazioLazio.
Poborský is the all-time leader in cap (football)appearances for the Czech Republic national football teamCzech national team, with 118 between 1994 and 2006, retiring from international football after playing at the country's first World Cup. He also played in three European Championships, being named in the Team of the Tournament at UEFA Euro 1996 after helping the Czechs to the final.

Aaron Mokoena.name: Aaron Mokoena
Aaron Mokoena.intro: '''Teboho Aaron Mokoena''' (born 25 November 1980 in Boipatong), known as '''Aaron Mokoena''', is a South African association footballfootballer who last played for South African football team Bidvest Wits F.C.Bidvest Wits and the South Africa national football teamSouth African national team.

Alejandro Faurl\u00edn.name: Alejandro Faurlín
Alejandro Faurl\u00edn.intro: '''Alejandro Damián Faurlín''' (born 9 August 1986) is an ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootball midfielder, who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.

G\u00e9rald Cid.name: Gérald Cid
G\u00e9rald Cid.intro: '''Gérald Cid''' (born 17 February 1983 Talence, Gironde) is a retired French association footballfootballer. He was primarily a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back, who last played for OGC Nice.[

Louis Laing.name: Louis Laing
Louis Laing.intro: '''Louis Mark Laing''' (born 6 March 1993) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Motherwell F.C.Motherwell on loan from Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.

Martin Dahlin.name: Martin Dahlin
Martin Dahlin.intro: '''Dan Martin Nataniel Dahlin''' (born 16 April 1968 in Uddevalla) is a former SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer.

Antonio N\u00fa\u00f1ez.name: Antonio Núñez
Antonio N\u00fa\u00f1ez.intro: '''Antonio Núñez Tena''' (born 15 January 1979) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Recreativo de Huelva as a Midfielder#Wide midfielderright midfielder.

Martin Scott (English footballer).name: Martin Scott (English footballer)
Martin Scott (English footballer).intro: '''Martin Scott''' (born 7 January 1968) is an EnglandEnglish football (soccer)football player and coach. Scott made over 350 The Football LeagueFootball League appearances as a left back during the 1980s and 1990s.

Edin D\u017eeko.name: Edin Džeko
Edin D\u017eeko.intro:
'''Edin Džeko''' (; born 17 March 1986) is a Bosnian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the Bosnia and Herzegovina national football teamBosnia and Herzegovina national team for which he is Captain (association football)captain.
He was named Idol NacijeBosnian Footballer of the Year for three years in a row. In Bosnia and Herzegovina, he is known as ''Bosanski dijamant'' (The Bosnian Diamond). Prior to joining Manchester City, he made a name for himself while playing for German club VfL WolfsburgWolfsburg, with whom he won the Bundesliga in the 2008–09 Bundesliga2008–09 season. He was second highest goal scorer with 2008–09 Bundesliga#Statistics26 goals. In the 2009–10 Bundesliga2009–10 season, Džeko was the top scorer with 2009–10 Bundesliga#Top goalscorers22 goals. He also registered ten assists in both seasons.
Džeko has played 70 times for his country and scored 41 goals since 2007, becoming the highest Bosnian and Herzegovinian goalscorer of all time on 7 September 2012 in a game against Liechtenstein national football teamLiechtenstein where he scored a hat-trick to surpass Zvjezdan Misimović and Elvir Bolić.  His ten goals in the qualifying campaign helped his national team qualify for its first international tournament, the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
During the 2011–12 Premier League season, Džeko scored four goals in one game for Manchester City, completing a "perfect hat-trick" against Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur at White Hart Lane. On the final day of that season, he scored an equaliser against Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in the 92nd minute, before Sergio Agüero won it for City with seconds to go, ensuring the team won a league title for the first time in 44 years. He later stated that the goal was one of the most important of his career.

Steve Yates (footballer, born 1970).name: Steve Yates (footballer, born 1970)
Steve Yates (footballer, born 1970).intro: '''Stephen "Steve" Yates''' (born 29 January 1970 in Bristol) is a retired EnglandEnglish professional association footballfootballer, who played as a Defender (association football)defender. In 2013, he returned to his first club, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, as the club's new kit manager.

Christian Mayrleb.name: Christian Mayrleb
Christian Mayrleb.intro: '''Christian Mayrleb''' (born 8 June 1972 in Wels) is an Austrian footballer who currently plays for Austrian team FC Pasching.

Amine Linganzi.name: Amine Linganzi
Amine Linganzi.intro:
'''Amine Linganzi''' (born 16 November 1989) is a professional French association footballfootballer who most recently played for English club Gillingham F.C.Gillingham as a midfielder. He was released by the club in March 2015.
Born in Algeria, Linganzi was raised in France and represents Congo national football teamCongo at international level.

Dennis Bergkamp.name: Dennis Bergkamp
Dennis Bergkamp.intro:
'''Dennis Nicolaas Maria Bergkamp''' (; born 10 May 1969) is a NetherlandsDutch former professional Association footballfootballer, who is the assistant manager to Frank de Boer at AFC AjaxAjax. Originally a wide midfielder, Bergkamp was moved to main striker and then to second striker, where he remained throughout his playing career. Bergkamp has been described by Jan Mulder (footballer)Jan Mulder as having "the finest technique" of any Dutch international and a "dream for a striker" by teammate Thierry Henry.
The son of an electrician, Bergkamp was born in Amsterdam and played as an amateur in the lower leagues. He was spotted by AFC AjaxAjax at age 11 and made his professional debut in 1986. Good form led to an international call-up a year later, attracting the attention of several European clubs. Bergkamp signed for Italian club Inter MilanInternazionale in 1993, where he had two disappointing seasons. After joining Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 1995, he rejuvenated his career, helping the club to win three Premier League titles, four FA Cup trophies, and reach the 2006 UEFA Champions League Final, which marked his last appearance as a player. With the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team, Bergkamp surpassed Faas Wilkes's record to become the country's top goalscorer of all time in 1998, a record later eclipsed by Patrick Kluivert and Robin van Persie.
Widely regarded as one of the greatest players in his generation, Bergkamp twice finished third in the FIFA World Player of the Year award and was selected by Pelé as one of the FIFA 100 greatest living players. In 2007, he was inducted into the English Football Hall of Fame, the first and so far only Dutch player ever to receive such honour. Due to his fear of flying, Bergkamp has been affectionately nicknamed the "Non-Flying Dutchman" by Arsenal supporters.
Dennis Bergkamp.position: Forward  association football  Second striker Second striker

Oguchi Onyewu.name: Oguchi Onyewu
Oguchi Onyewu.intro: '''Oguchialu Chijioke "Oguchi" Onyewu''' (born May 13, 1982) is an American association footballsoccer player who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcenter back for Charlton Athletic F.C. He has played for clubs in France, Belgium, England, Italy, the Netherlands, and Portugal.

Mark Watson (English footballer).name: Mark Watson (English footballer)
Mark Watson (English footballer).intro: '''Mark Watson''' (born 28 December 1973) is a retired EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball striker (football)forward.

Magnus Wolff Eikrem.name: Magnus Wolff Eikrem
Magnus Wolff Eikrem.intro: '''Magnus Wolff Eikrem''' (born 8 August 1990) is a Norwegian professional association footballfootballer who currently is playing for Allsvenskan side Malmö FF. His regular playing position is in Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfield, though he can play anywhere across the midfield. Eikrem was born in Molde in the Norwegian county of Møre og Romsdal, and began his football career with his local club, Molde FK, before joining Manchester United F.C.Manchester United at the age of 16 in 2006. Eikrem transferred back to Molde in January 2011, where Ole Gunnar Solskjær had become the new manager. Solskjær had also been Eikrem's manager at the Manchester United reserve team. He joined Dutch club SC HeerenveenHeerenveen in June 2013, but only stayed for just over six months before making the move to Cardiff City in January 2014. Eikrem departed Cardiff City on the 19th December 2014 after being released as a free agent after playing a total of only 173 minutes for Cardiff in 11 months.

Mark Hateley.name: Mark Hateley
Mark Hateley.intro: '''Mark Wayne Hateley''' (born 7 November 1961 in Derby) is a retired English association footballfootball player who played as a centre-forward. He was capped 32 times for the England national football teamEnglish national team (including games in the 1986 FIFA World Cup1986 World Cup), and played in top-level football leagues in England, Italy, France and Scotland. His nickname is '''Attila'''.[

Gary Elkins.name: Gary Elkins
Gary Elkins.intro:
'''Gary Elkins''' (born 4 May 1966 in Wallingford, OxfordshireWallingford) was an England English Football (soccer)football player; notable for having started exactly 100 league games for both Fulham F.C. and Wimbledon F.C.. Elkins was signed for £20,000 by Wimbledon - at that time an established top-flight club - following seven years of largely unheralded and irregular service for a then third-tier Fulham side.  It was thought that new Wimbledon manager Ray Harford remembered Elkins fondly from his own time as Fulham manager in the mid-1980s.
Brentford F.C. manager Steve Perryman revealed that he resigned as manager of Brentford in 1991 on account of his chairman's refusal to let him sign Elkins for a nominal fee. The reason given by the chairman was that the player had 'shifty eyes'.[
He was a sturdy and tough defender, slow to commit to a rash challenge but instead prone to holding up wingers by strong positioning. Indeed, some of the game's best wide-men, in particular Andrei Kanchelskis and Anders Limpar, found Elkins tough to negotiate, their game preferring defenders to put a foot in. Elkins finest moment was probably a last-minute equaliser, albeit heavily deflected, against Liverpool F.C. at Selhurst Park in 1994.
In 1996, Elkins' career took a turn for the worse as he was signed by Steve McMahon (footballer)Steve McMahon at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town. Signed for £100,000 by a club facing financial difficulties, the pressure was on Elkins to help inspire a promotion bid to the FA Premier LeaguePremiership. As it was, he started only 19 games for the club, his form and fitness (in particular his weight) in doubt. He soon moved into non-league football, working too as a coach at the Elms Soccer School in Middlesex.
Elkins was also a successful Sunday Morning Soccer Coach for The Royal Standard in Wallingford, a team that played in the Reading Sunday League.
In 2006, Gary joined BGB Southern League South & West team Didcot Town FC as Reserve Team Manager but was then promoted the season after to First Team Coach. At the start of the 2012-13 season Elkins became manager of Didcot Town F.C.Didcot town.

Zolt\u00e1n Gera.name: Zoltán Gera
Zolt\u00e1n Gera.intro:
'''Zoltán Gera''' () (born 22 April 1979) is a Hungarian Association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder. He is currently plays for Ferencvárosi TC and the Hungary national football teamHungarian national team. He has previously played for Fulham F.C.Fulham, Ferencvárosi TCFerencváros, Pécsi Mecsek FCPécsi Mecsek and Harkány SE, as well as enjoying two spells at West Bromwich Albion.
Gera is known for his overhead-kick goals and his cartwheel to back-flip celebration, which he demonstrated in Fulham's UEFA Europa LeagueEuropa League quarter-final win against Juventus F.C.Juventus in 2010. He was named Hungarian Player of the Year in 2002, 2004 and 2005. For his efforts in the 2009–10 season and his goals in the Europa League, Gera was named Fulham's Player of the Season.
Gera made his international debut in 2002 against Switzerland, losing 2–1. In 2009, Gera briefly retired from the national team following a dispute with then-manager Erwin Koeman. Koeman was replaced by Sándor Egervári in 2010 and Gera returned to Hungary's international squad.

Ousmane Dabo.name: Ousmane Dabo
Ousmane Dabo.intro:
'''Ousmane Dabo''' (born 8 February 1977 in Laval, Mayenne) is a retired FranceFrench Association footballfootballer.
He has previously played for Stade Rennais FCRennes, F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale, Vicenza CalcioVicenza, Parma F.C.Parma, AS Monaco FCMonaco, Atalanta B.C.Atalanta, S.S. LazioLazio, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and New England Revolution. He has represented France national football teamFrance three times at full international level. His younger brother, Moussa DaboMoussa, is currently without a club and also plays as a midfielder.

Kevin Horlock.name: Kevin Horlock
Kevin Horlock.intro: '''Kevin Horlock''' (born 1 November 1972 in Erith, South LondonSouth East London) is an English born Northern IrelandNorthern Irish Association footballfootball player. He is a player and reserve team manager of Needham Market F.C.Needham Market and assistant manager of the Northern Ireland national under-21 football teamNorthern Ireland under 21 team.

George Weah.name: George Weah
George Weah.intro:
'''George Tawlon Manneh Oppong Ousman Weah''' (born 1 October 1966) is a Liberian humanitarian, politician, and an ex-Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker. Regarded as one of the greatest African players of all time, in 1995 he was named FIFA World Player of the Year and won the Ballon d'Or. In 1989, 1994 and 1995 he was the African Footballer of the Year. In 2004 he was named in the FIFA 100 list of the world's greatest living players.
Weah spent fourteen years of his professional football career playing for clubs in France, Italy, and England. Arsène Wenger brought him to Europe when he signed for AS Monaco FCMonaco in 1988. Weah moved to Paris Saint Germain in 1992 where he won Ligue 1 in 1994 and became the top scorer of the UEFA Champions League 1994–95. He signed for A.C. Milan in 1995 where he spent four very successful seasons, scoring some spectacular goals (the most notable running the length of the field against Hellas Verona F.C.Verona), and won Serie A twice. He then moved to the English Premier League towards the end of his career and had spells at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
An idol in Africa, Weah has been heavily involved in politics in his homeland Liberia. He ran unsuccessfully for president in the Liberian general election, 20052005 election, losing to Ellen Johnson Sirleaf in the second round of voting. In the Liberian general election, 20112011 election, he ran for vice president on Winston Tubman's ticket. Running as a Congress for Democratic Change candidate, he was elected to the Senate of LiberiaSenate in Liberian Senate election, 20142014.

Erland Johnsen.name: Erland Johnsen
Erland Johnsen.intro:
'''Erland Johnsen''' (born 5 April 1967 in Fredrikstad) is a NorwayNorwegian former professional Association footballfootballer and current manager.
He played mainly as a Defender (association football)centre back from 1983 until 1999 notably in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and in the Bundesliga for FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich. He also played for Moss FKMoss, Rosenborg BKRosenborg and Strømsgodset IFStrømsgodset and earned 24 caps for Norway national football teamNorway. He moved into management in 1999 with Strømsgodset and later with Moss, Follo FKFollo, Lillestrøm S.K.Lillestrøm and Strømmen IFStrømmen.
Erland Johnsen.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Michael Johnson (footballer, born 1988).name: Michael Johnson (footballer, born 1988)
Michael Johnson (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Michael Johnson''' (born 3 March 1988) is a former English peopleEnglish professional Association footballfootballer.
Johnson was a product of the Leeds United F.C.Leeds United, SBV Excelsior, Everton F.C.Everton and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City youth academies. He made his Premier League debut for City during the 2006–07 season and went on to become somewhat of a first team regular. While with City he was an England youth international, for both the England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 teams.
Several injury setbacks that started during the 2008–09 season hampered his progress and he went on to only make four appearances for City in his final five years of his contract, playing his final game in a League Cup tie against Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United in 2009. During the 2011–12 season Johnson was loaned out to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City on a season long loan deal, but it was cut short due to injury. He was released from his contract with Manchester City in December 2012, over three years since his last appearance for the club.

Slaven Bili\u0107.name: Slaven Bilić
Slaven Bili\u0107.intro:
'''Slaven Bilić''' (; born 11 September 1968) is a former Croatian football (soccer)footballer, currently managing Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş in Süper LigTurkish Süper Lig. He started playing in 1988 for his hometown club HNK Hajduk SplitHajduk Split and later had successful foreign spells with Karlsruher SC in Germany, and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Everton F.C.Everton in England before retiring from active football in 2001. At national level, Bilić served as one of Croatia's most consistent defenders during the tenure of coach Miroslav Blažević, earning 44 caps between 1992 and 1999 and playing in UEFA Euro 1996 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
Following his playing retirement in 2001 at Hajduk Split, Bilić immediately turned to coaching, his first job being a five-month stint at Hajduk's helm in the latter stage of the 2001–02 Prva HNL2001–02 season. Between 2004 and 2006 he managed Croatia national under-21 football teamCroatia under-21 football team, before taking over the senior national side from Zlatko Kranjčar in August 2006.
Credited with successfully overseeing the introduction of a series of young players from the under-21 squad to the senior side, Bilić led the team to the UEFA Euro 20082008 European championship where they reached the quarter-finals. In spite the fact that under Bilić's tenure Croatia failed to qualify for the 2010 FIFA World Cup, his contract with the Croatian Football Federation was extended in 2009. He then went on to qualify for the UEFA Euro 20122012 European championship, his second managerial success and major tournament appearance with Croatia. Upon his formal departure, Bilić was praised for his long-standing service to the national side. Domestic media outlet labelled him as Croatia's only manager to depart on such positive terms and credited him for his strong revival of the national side during his six-year tenure.
On 10 May 2012, Bilić confirmed that he would step down after the UEFA Euro 2012 tournament. Four days later, it was confirmed that Bilić had signed a coaching contract with the Russian club FC Lokomotiv Moscow. After leaving Moscow in June 2013, Bilić went to Turkey to manage Beşiktaş.
Slaven Bili\u0107.birth_place: birth_place,Croatia,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Emre Bel\u00f6zo\u011flu.name: Emre Belözoğlu
Emre Bel\u00f6zo\u011flu.intro:
'''Emre Belözoğlu'''  (, born 7 September 1980 in Istanbul) is a Turkish football midfielder who plays for Fenerbahce S.K. (football)Fenerbahçe. His past clubs include Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray, Inter Milan, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Atlético Madrid.
Emre has been a part of the Turkey national football teamTurkey national team since 2000, earning over 90 caps and helping the team to the semi-finals at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup and at Euro 2008. Pelé named him in the FIFA 100, a list of the 125 greatest living footballers as a part of FIFA 100FIFA's centenary celebrations.

Andy Oakes.name: Andy Oakes
Andy Oakes.intro:
'''Andrew Mark''' "'''Andy'''" '''Oakes''' (born 11 January 1977) is an English former Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper. His uncle is the legendary Manchester City F.C.Manchester City midfielder Alan Oakes. His cousin Michael Oakes, also a goalkeeper, played for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.
He spent his early years at Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Winsford United F.C.Winsford United, before playing for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City in 1998–99. He then was signed by Premier League side Derby County F.C.Derby County for £465,000. He spent his six years at Pride Park StadiumPride Park as a back-up keeper, and also spent brief spells on loan at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He signed with Walsall F.C.Walsall in March 2005, before moving on to Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in August 2006. He signed with Darlington F.C.Darlington in May 2007, before leaving the game two years later.

Felipe Caicedo.name: Felipe Caicedo
Felipe Caicedo.intro:
'''Felipe Salvador Caicedo Corozo''' (born 5 September 1988) is an Ecuadorian Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club RCD Espanyol as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
A full international since 2005, he has represented Ecuador national football teamEcuador at the Copa América in 2007 Copa América2007 and 2011 Copa América2011.

Aaron Doran.name: Aaron Doran
Aaron Doran.intro:
'''Aaron Brian Doran Cogan''' (born 13 May 1991), known as '''Aaron Doran''', is an Irish professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Scottish Premiership (football)Scottish Premiership club Inverness Caledonian Thistle. He previously played at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, from where he spent time on-loan with Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons and Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient.
He has also represented the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland U21 team.

Danny Allsopp.name: Danny Allsopp
Danny Allsopp.intro: '''Daniel Lee "Danny" Allsopp''' (born 10 August 1978) is a former Australian Association footballfootball (soccer) player who played as a Forward (association football)striker. He last played for Croydon City Arrows. He is a full international for the Australia national football team, and is well known for being Melbourne Victory FCMelbourne Victory's second highest, and the A-League's seventh highest all-time goalscorer, behind Archie Thompson, Shane Smeltz, Besart Berisha, Sergio van Dijk, Mark Bridge and Carlos Hernández (footballer)Carlos Hernandez.

Michael Ball.name: Michael Ball
Michael Ball.intro:
'''Michael John Ball''' (born 2 October 1979) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back. He last played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in 2012.
Ball started his professional career at Everton F.C.Everton, making his debut as a 17-year old in 1997, and then played abroad for Scottish side Rangers F.C.Rangers and Dutch side PSV Eindhoven. He returned to England in 2007 with  Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, and joined  Leicester City F.C.Leicester City a year later.
In 2001, he was capped by the England national football teamEngland national team for the first and only time.
Michael Ball.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1980).name: Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1980)
Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1980).intro:
'''Thomas William "Tommy" Smith''' (born 22 May 1980) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Brentford F.C.Brentford. He is normally used as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger or a Forward (association football)striker.
Smith started his career at Watford F.C.Watford, where his younger brother Jack Smith (footballer born 1983)Jack was also a trainee. He played a part in Watford's consecutive promotions from the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division, reaching the Premier League in 1999. Although Watford were relegated in 2000, Smith represented his country at England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level the following season. He left Watford to join Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland on a free transfer in 2003, before moving to Derby County F.C.Derby County in 2004. He was voted Derby Player of the year in 2006, before re-joining Watford. After the club's relegation in his first season back at Vicarage Road, Smith's subsequent performances earned him consecutive Watford Player of the Season awards in 2007–08 and 2008–09. At the start of the following season he was sold to Premier League club Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. The club faced administration that season, and were eventually relegated. The following season, Smith joined Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, becoming a regular in a team challenging for promotion to the Premier League.  Smith joined current club Brentford F.C.Brentford in the summer of 2014.

Giorgos Karagounis.name: Giorgos Karagounis
Giorgos Karagounis.intro:
'''Georgios "Giorgos" Karagounis''' (; born 6 March 1977) is a GreeksGreek former professional association footballfootballer.
In his club career he has played for Panathinaikos, Internazionale, S.L. BenficaBenfica and Fulham F.C.Fulham.
Internationally, Karagounis represented the Greece national football teamGreece national team between 1999 and 2014. He was a member of the Euro 2004 winning squad, and also represented Greece in Euro 2008, the 2010 World Cup, Euro 2012 and the 2014 World Cup. With 139 appearances, he is the List of association football players with 100 or more caps#Menmost capped player in the history of the Greek national team.He is widely regarded as one  of the greatest Greek players of all time.

Paul Thirlwell.name: Paul Thirlwell
Paul Thirlwell.intro: '''Paul Thirlwell''' (born 13 February 1979) is an English Association footballfootballer who currently plays as a midfielder for Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and is a former England national under-21 football teamEngland Under 21 player.

Bruno Berner.name: Bruno Berner
Bruno Berner.intro: '''Bruno George Berner''' (born 21 November 1977) is a former Swiss association footballfootballer who retired from professional football on 1 March 2012. Berner last played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. Throughout this career, Bruno played predominantly as a left back, but had also been deployed in other roles, such as central defence, left wing and also in central midfield towards the end of his career at Leicester.

Khalilou Fadiga.name: Khalilou Fadiga
Khalilou Fadiga.intro: '''Khalilou Fadiga''' (born 30 December 1974) is a former Senegalese Association footballfootballer midfieldermidfielder. He also holds a Belgian passport.

Hatem Trabelsi.name: Hatem Trabelsi
Hatem Trabelsi.intro: '''Hatem Trabelsi''' (, ; born 25 January 1977 in Aryanah, Tunisia) is a former Tunisian Association footballfootballer. A right-sided defender (association football)defender or midfielder, he has played for CS Sfaxien, AFC AjaxAjax Amsterdam, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Al-Hilal Riyadh. He has represented the Tunisia national football teamTunisian national team in three FIFA World CupWorld Cups, gaining a total of 66 caps before retiring from international football in 2006.
Hatem Trabelsi.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Danny Mills.name: Danny Mills
Danny Mills.intro:
'''Daniel John Mills''' (born 18 May 1977 in Norwich, Norfolk) is an English peopleEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer best known for his time at Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. His main position was right-back, though he could also play as central defender. On 7 August 2009 he announced his retirement from the game at the age of 32, due to an ongoing knee injury.
Due to the Gary Neville's injury before the tournament, he was England national football teamEngland's first choice right-back at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup.
Danny Mills.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Anthony McNamee.name: Anthony McNamee
Anthony McNamee.intro: '''Anthony McNamee''' (born 13 July 1983 in Kensington, London) is an English association footballfootballer. He is a left-sided midfielder currently without a club after being released by Woking F.C.Woking. He is also cousin to Bobby Reid (footballer born 1993)Bobby Reid.

Laurent Courtois.name: Laurent Courtois
Laurent Courtois.intro: '''Laurent Courtois''' (born 11 September 1978) is a French  former professional association footballfootballer who last was a player/coach for USL Pro club LA Galaxy II.

Jay-Jay Okocha.name: Jay-Jay Okocha
Jay-Jay Okocha.intro: '''Augustine Azuka "Jay-Jay" Okocha''' (born 14 August 1973) is a Nigerian peopleNigerian former professional Association footballfootballer.  He is widely regarded as the best Nigerian player of his generation. He is also known for his stepovers, skill, technique, and being 'so good that they named him twice' (a line immortalised in a terrace chant while Okocha played for Bolton Wanderers). He is a dual Nigerian-TurkeyTurkish citizen, having acquired Turkish citizenship as "'''Muhammet Yavuz'''" while playing for Süper Lig team Fenerbahçe S.K. (football team)Fenerbahçe.

Steve Chettle.name: Steve Chettle
Steve Chettle.intro:
'''Stephen "Steve" Chettle''' (born 27 September 1968) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and current first team assistant manager and academy manager of Northern Premier League side Ilkeston F.C.Ilkeston.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1986 to 2005 and was best known for his time as a player at Forest. Despite playing most of his career in the top level of English football, Chettle never made the England squad, but came close in 1992, despite this Chettle played 12 games for the England national under-21 football teamEngland Under-21s, captaining them in his final appearance. He also played as a professional for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Walsall F.C.Walsall and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town before ending his career in Non-League football with stints at Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion and Ilkeston Town F.C.Ilkeston Town.
Since his retirement Chettle had coached at former club Forest at academy level before joining Ilkeston F.C.Ilkeston in 2014. As a result of his relatively high-profile career, his name has entered use as a rhyming slang alternative to "kettle".cite web
url=
title=Football Rhyming Slang
publisher=Facebook
date=18 October 2012 accessdate=12 December 2012
Steve Chettle.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Ilie Dumitrescu.name: Ilie Dumitrescu
Ilie Dumitrescu.intro: '''Ilie Dumitrescu''' (; born 6 January 1969 in Bucharest) is a Romanian former Association footballfootball player and coach, who was last manager of FC Steaua BucureştiSteaua Bucureşti. A tricky forward, he shot to fame when his frontline partnership with Gheorghe Hagi and Florin Răducioiu led the Romania national football teamRomania national team to the 1994 FIFA World Cup quarterfinal, eliminating Argentina national football teamArgentina en route.

Dedryck Boyata.name: Dedryck Boyata
Dedryck Boyata.intro:
'''Anga Dedryck Boyata''' (; born 28 November 1990), known as '''Dedryck Boyata''', is a Belgian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back or Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City. He made his senior debut in 2010, and was Manchester City's Young Player of the Year for 2009–10. Since 2011 he has spent most of his time on loan to other clubs. For the 2011–12 season he was loaned to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, and for the first half of 2012–13 he was at FC Twente.
Boyata has been capped by Belgium national football teamBelgium at youth and senior level, making his senior debut in 2010.

Christian Negouai.name: Christian Negouai
Christian Negouai.intro:
'''Christian Negouai''' (born 20 January 1978 in Fort-de-France, Martinique) is a FranceFrench football (soccer)football player who has played for R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi, Standard Liège and F.C. Molenbeek Brussels StrombeekFC Brussels in Belgium, for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Coventry City F.C.Coventry in England, and for Aalesunds FKAalesund in Norway.
Negouai was bought for £1.5 million by Manchester City F.C.Manchester City from R. Charleroi S.C.Charleroi in 2001. He made six league appearances of which two were match starts and scored once against Rotherham.cite web
url=
title=Man City 2-1 Rotherham
publisher=BBC
date=23 November 2001 accessdate=2 November 2009 He also appeared for Manchester City in the UEFA Cup scoring against The New Saints F.C. Negouai proved to be a versatile success for Manchester City F.C. Reserves and AcademyManchester City Reserves in the Premier Reserve League, scoring nine goals in 19 games after being converted to a Target_man#Centre_forwardCentre forward from a Defensive_midfielder#Defensive_midfielderDefensive midfielder although his time at Manchester City was hampered by a serious injury which required operations on both knees restricting his appearances.
Upon joining Standard Liege Negouai scored the fastest goal in Belgian League history when he struck after just 11 seconds in a 2-0 win over KVC Westerlo.

Serhiy Rebrov.name: Serhiy Rebrov
Serhiy Rebrov.intro:
'''Serhiy Stanislavovych Rebrov''' (, born on 3 June 1974 in Horlivka, Donetsk Oblast) is a retired Ukraine national football teamUkrainian Football (soccer)football strikerforward turned midfielder, who is currently managing the Ukrainian club FC Dynamo Kyiv.
Rebrov gained international fame as an attacking partner of Andriy Shevchenko at FC Dynamo KyivDynamo Kyiv throughout the 1990s and remains the Ukrainian Premier League#Top scorersall-time top scorer of the Ukrainian Premier League.
From his debut in 1992, he was capped 75 times by Ukraine national football teamUkraine, scoring 15 goals. He played in the nation's first ever FIFA World CupWorld Cup, in 2006 FIFA World Cup2006.

Mark Beeney.name: Mark Beeney
Mark Beeney.intro:
'''Mark Beeney''' (born 30 December 1967 in Pembury) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and Goalkeeping Coach for Premier League side Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Youth TeamChelsea's Reserve and Youth teams.
As a player he was a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1986 to 2003. He notably played in the Premier League for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He also played for Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Maidstone United F.C.Maidstone United, Aldershot F.C.Aldershot, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic and Sittingbourne F.C.Sittingbourne.

Regi Blinker.name: Regi Blinker
Regi Blinker.intro:
'''Reginald "Regi" Waldi Blinker''' (born 4 June 1969) is a retired Dutch Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
During his career, he was also known for his Dreadlocksdread-locked hairstyle, and played three years in Scotland with Celtic F.C.Celtic, after representing Feyenoord for 10 years.

Teddy Lu\u010di\u0107.name: Teddy Lučić
Teddy Lu\u010di\u0107.intro:
'''Teddy Mark Šime Lučić''' (, ; born 15 April 1973 in Biskopsgården, Gothenburg) is a SwedenSwedish Association footballfootballer and Manager (association football)manager who currently is Player-coachplayer-manager for KF Velebit in Swedish Football Division 4Division 4. He plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back.
Lučić made his debut for Sweden national football teamSweden in 1995, and competed at three FIFA World Cups and two European Championships, earning a total of 86 caps.
Teddy Lu\u010di\u0107.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ashley Cole.name: Ashley Cole
Ashley Cole.intro:
'''Ashley Cole''' (born 20 December 1980) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)left back for Italian club A.S. RomaRoma. Cole is considered by many critics and fellow professional players as one of the best defenders of his generation,
Born in Stepney, London, Cole began his youth career at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and made his full debut for the club in November 1999, going on to make a further 228 appearances, scoring ten goals. With Arsenal he won two Premier League titles, three FA Cups, and was an integral member of "2003–04 Arsenal F.C. seasonThe Invincibles" team of the 2003–04 season, who went the entire league season undefeated. Cole also made an appearance in Arsenal's first UEFA Champions League final in 2006 UEFA Champions League Final2006; the club lost 2–1 to FC BarcelonaBarcelona.
In August 2006, after a protracted transfer saga, Cole completed a move to Arsenal F.C.-Chelsea F.C. rivalryrival club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, with whom he won further honours, including the Premier League in the 2009–10 Premier League2009–10 season, four FA Cups, one Football League Cup and one UEFA Champions League. He was released by Chelsea at the end of the 2013–14 Premier League2013–14 season. With seven winners' medals, Cole has won the FA Cup more times than any other player in history, and is one of two players to have won the Double (association football)Double with two different clubs, along with Nicolas Anelka.
Cole was an England international between 2001 and 2014, playing at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002, 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 and 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cups, as well as UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004 and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012. He was voted England Player of the Year in 2010. When he retired from international football in 2014, he had won List of footballers with 100 or more caps107 caps, making him England's most capped full back.

Tahar El Khalej.name: Tahar El Khalej
Tahar El Khalej.intro: '''Tahar El Khalej''' (pronounced '''Taher Lakhlej''' ) (born 16 June 1968) is a MoroccoMoroccan former Association footballfootballer.

Dominic Samuel.name: Dominic Samuel
Dominic Samuel.intro: '''Dominic James Samuel''' (born 1 April 1994) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, on loan from Reading F.C.Reading, as a Forward (association football)striker.

\u00de\u00f3r\u00f0ur Gu\u00f0j\u00f3nss.name: Þórður Guðjónsson
\u00de\u00f3r\u00f0ur Gu\u00f0j\u00f3nss.intro: '''Thordur Gudjonsson''' (Icelandic languageIcelandic: ''Þórður Guðjónsson'') (born 14 October 1973) is a retired Icelandic Association footballfootballer.

Rushian Hepburn-Murphy.name: Rushian Hepburn-Murphy
Rushian Hepburn-Murphy.intro: '''Rushian Hepburn-Murphy''' (born 19 September 1998) is an English professional Association footballfootballer, who plays for Premier League club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a forward.

Vlado Bozinovski.name: Vlado Bozinovski
Vlado Bozinovski.intro: '''Vlado Bozinovski''' (born 30 March 1964) is an Australian retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
Vlado Bozinovski.birth_place: Ohrid,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Ricardo Carvalho.name: Ricardo Carvalho
Ricardo Carvalho.intro:
'''Ricardo Alberto Silveira de Carvalho''', Order of Infante D. HenriqueOIH (; born 18 May 1978), is a Portuguese association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for AS Monaco FC and the Portugal national football teamPortuguese national team.
Carvalho was born in Amarante where he played for the local team, Amarante Futebol Clube. By his great performance as a youngster, he was spotted by the Portuguese powerhouse, F.C. PortoPorto, and in 1996 he was brought to FC Porto Junior team. Between 1997 and 2001 he had loan spells at Leça F.C.Leça, where he made his professional debut, Vitória F.C.Vitória de Setúbal and F.C. AlvercaAlverca, but it was in José Mourinho’s reign that he really started to make big strides forward. It was in the 2002–03 season that Carvalho made his name known all around Europe, winning his first domestic league title under Mourinho’s commands, the Portuguese Cup, and the UEFA Europa LeagueUEFA Cup. His good form led to an international call-up in 2003. In the next season, Carvalho won his second league title in a row, and his first UEFA Champions League title, in which tournament he was named UEFA Club Football Awards#Best Defenderbest defender of the tournament.[
In international football, Carvalho's Portugal national football teamnational team career began in 11 October 2003 in a friendly match against Albania national football teamAlbania. He represented Portugal in the UEFA Euro 2004, 2006 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2008, and 2010 FIFA World Cup. He was a regular in Portugal's lineup during the UEFA Euro 2004, when his country advanced all the way to the final before losing to Greece national football teamGreece. Later, at the 2006 FIFA World Cup, Carvalho was a mainstay in defense for the national team. He played in six matches for Portugal, which made the semifinals before being eliminated by France national football teamFrance. In  Euro 2008, he played in three of Portugal's four matches, being eliminated in the quarter-finals by Germany national football teamGermany. Two years later, in the 2010 World Cup, he was a regular in Portugal's lineup again when Portugal reached the round of 16, conceding only one goal in all four matches.
Ricardo Carvalho.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Tony McMahon.name: Tony McMahon
Tony McMahon.intro:
'''Anthony "Tony" McMahon''' (born 24 March 1986) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full backright back for Bradford City A.F.CBradford City, on loan from Blackpool F.C.Blackpool.
Born in Bishop Auckland, County Durham, McMahon started his playing career with Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, with whom he spent eight seasons before his move to Sheffield United in 2012. Having had loan spells with Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, McMahon was capped at international youth level, playing in the 2003 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship2003 Under-17 and 2005 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship2005 Under-19 European Football Championships.

Stig T\u00f8fting.name: Stig Tøfting
Stig T\u00f8fting.intro:
'''Stig Tøfting''' (born 14 August 1969 in Aarhus), nicknamed '''Tøffe''', and '''The Lawn Mower''', is a former DenmarkDanish professional Association footballfootballer and assistant coach, who most recently was the assistant of Erik Rasmussen (footballer)Erik Rasmussen at Aarhus GymnastikforeningAGF.
Tøfting played most of his career as a Midfielderdefensive midfielder, and he was a hard-hitter who often engaged in rash tackles. He started his career with Aarhus Gymnastik ForeningAGF Aarhus, with whom he won two Danish Cups, and most notably went on to play for GermanyGerman clubs Hamburger SV and MSV Duisburg, as well as Bolton Wanderers in England. He ended his career in 2007 with Randers FC, having won the 2006 Danish Cup with the team.
He played 41 matches for the Denmark national football teamDanish national football team between 1993 and 2002, in which he scored 2 goals. With Thomas Gravesen, Tøfting formed a fearsome midfield duo on the national team from 1998 to 2002, playing the 2000 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2000 and 2002 FIFA World Cup together.

Per Pedersen.name: Per Pedersen
Per Pedersen.intro:
'''Per Werner Pedersen''' (born 30 March 1969) is a DenmarkDanish former Association footballfootball player, who played the majority of his career for Danish clubs Odense BK and Lyngby BK. Pedersen scored two goals in six games for the Denmark national football teamDanish national team between 1991 and 1997. In 1997, he became the most expensive player sold by a Danish football club, when he signed a Pound sign£2.5 million transfer deal with EnglandEnglish club Blackburn Rovers, where he scored once against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.cite news url=
date=6 March 1997 accessdate=30 May 2012  first = Matt  last = Tench Pedersen also had short stints with GermanyGerman club Borussia Mönchengladbach and Racing Strasbourg in France. He moved back to Denmark to play for Odense BK, where he suffered a career-ending injury, and retired in June 2001.
Pedersen also appeared in matches for Denmark's league selection, in which he played in several matches not considered fully official. A high point of his career came in 1997, when he scored four goals in a game for Denmark against the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States at the 1997 U.S. CupU.S. Cup.

Ahmad Elrich.name: Ahmad Elrich
Ahmad Elrich.intro: '''Ahmad Elrich''' (born 30 May 1981 in Sydney) is a former Australian association footballfootballer.

Kevin Moran.name: Kevin Moran
Kevin Moran.intro:
'''Kevin Bernard Moran''' (born 29 April 1956) is a former Irish footballer who excelled at the top levels in both Gaelic footballGaelic and soccer. In Gaelic football, he is known for his time as a Dublin GAADublin senior team player, winning two All-Ireland Senior Football Championships with them, and in soccer for his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and Republic of Ireland national football teamIreland. He was the first man to be sent off in an FA Cup Final.
Moran grew up in Rialto, Dublin until his early teens, before he moved to the Long Mile Road in Walkinstown. While there, he attended James' Street CBS and Drimnagh Castle Secondary SchoolDrimnagh Castle CBS where gaelic football was the dominant sport although soccer proved to be the sport he played on the streets while growing up.[

Stuart Campbell.name: Stuart Campbell
Stuart Campbell.intro:
'''Stuart Pearson Campbell''' (born 9 December 1977) is an English-born Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer and assistant coach for the Tampa Bay Rowdies.
As a player he was as a midfielder (association football)midfielder between 1996 and 2013. He has previously played for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City where he played in the English Premier League before moving on loan to Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town. He signed with Grimsby on a permanent basis in 2001, and he remained with the club until joining Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers in the summer of 2004. Campbell became club captain at Rovers and in 2012 he briefly managed the club on a caretaker basis before leaving the club at the end of the season. At international level, he won 14 cap (sports)caps for the Scotland national under-21 football teamScotland under-21 team.

Mido.name: Mido
Mido.intro:
'''Ahmed Hossam Hussein Abdelhamid''' (; born 23 February 1983), more commonly known as '''Mido''', is an Egyptian football manager who is currently the director of Zamalek SC#Youth academy squadZamalek Youth Academy. He most recently managed Zamalek SCZamalek in the Egyptian Premier League. He is also a TV presenter and former Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.
Mido started his career with Zamalek SCZamalek in Egypt in 1999. He left the club for K.A.A. GentGent of Belgium in 2000, where he won the Belgian Ebony Shoe. This led to a move to NetherlandsDutch side AFC AjaxAjax in 2001, from where he joined Celta de VigoCelta Vigo on Loan (sports)loan in 2003. His next destination was Olympique de MarseilleMarseille in France and he left them for Italian side A.S. RomaRoma in 2004. He joined English side Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur on an 18-month loan in 2005 and eventually joined the club permanently in 2006. He left the club in 2007 to join Middlesbrough, from whom he joined Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Zamalek, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Ajax on loan. In 2011, he rejoined Zamalek, before joining Barnsley in 2012. He also played for  Egypt national football teamEgypt 51 times scoring 20 goals. Mido retired from football in June 2013.

Boris \u017divkovi\u0107.name: Boris Živković
Boris \u017divkovi\u0107.intro:
'''Boris Živković''' (;''Boris'' in isolation: . born 15 November 1975) is a former Croatian footballer. He played as right and left Defender (association football)#Full backfull back and centre back. At one point of his career he even played as Midfielder#Defensive_midfielderdefensive midfielder.
Živković started his career at FK Sarajevo as a youth player, before being signed by NK Marsonia (from Slavonski Brod). He gained a good reputation at Marsonia, first appearing in the 1994/95 season, during which he made 13 appearances. The next season he played a further 31 games before transferring to NK Hrvatski Dragovoljac (from Siget, Zagreb). He only spent one season at his new club however, before impressive performances persuaded GermanyGerman club Bayer Leverkusen to sign him.
Živković went on to play 6 seasons for the German club, playing over 150 times, including the 2002 UEFA Champions League Final. Following his contract expiring in the summer of 2003, Živković stated his desire to play in the EnglandEnglish FA Premier League, and was signed later that summer by Portsmouth F.C.
Živković started his Pompey career well, instantly claiming a regular starting place. However, in December, a public fall-out with manager Harry Redknapp led to him being released, having played only 18 times for the club. VfB Stuttgart stepped in to bring Živković back to Germany, and the Croatian joined them in January. In August 2006 he moved to Hajduk Split.
Živković was a regular for the Croatia national football teamCroatian national team, making 39 appearances and scoring twice. He was part of the squad at the 2002 FIFA World Cup, but in his first game against Mexico, he caused a penalty in the 59th minute after which he was sent off and the Mexicans went on to score from the penalty mark and win the game by 1-0. He was no longer in the team for the remaining two games Croatia played on the tournament before being relegated — Italy and Mexico progressed from the group to the playoffs instead.
He also played two games at 2004 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2004. Boris was out of favour for the Zlatko Kranjčar's 2006 Fifa World CupWorld Cup 2006 campaign but many defender injuries forced Slaven Bilić to give him a call for the 2008 UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuro 2008 spring qualifying games.
Boris \u017divkovi\u0107.birth_place: Živinice,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia
Boris \u017divkovi\u0107.position: Full back  association football  Full Back

Carsten Fredgaard.name: Carsten Fredgaard
Carsten Fredgaard.intro: '''Carsten Fredgaard''' (born May 20, 1976) is a former DenmarkDanish professional football (soccer)football player. His position was on the left, mainly as midfielder, but could also act both as a Fullback (association football)fullback or a Winger (sport)winger. He has played for a number of clubs in Football in DenmarkDanish and Football in EnglandEnglish football, winning two Danish Superliga titles with F.C. Copenhagen and the 2006 Danish Cup with Randers FC. He has played a single game for the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team, and has represented his country 13 times on the various national youth squads.

Anderson Silva de Fran\u00e7a.name: Anderson Silva de França
Anderson Silva de Fran\u00e7a.intro: '''Anderson Silva de França''' or simply '''Anderson de Silva''' or '''Anderson''' (born 28 August 1982) is a Brazilian Association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Rentistas in the Uruguayan Primera División.

George Thorne.name: George Thorne
George Thorne.intro: '''George Louis Elliot Thorne''' (born 4 January 1993) is an English footballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County, as a midfielder.

Zeki Fryers.name: Zeki Fryers
Zeki Fryers.intro: '''Ezekiel David "Zeki" Fryers''' (born 9 September 1992) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Ipswich Town F.CIpswich Town on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He is a youth international, having played for the England national under-16 football teamEngland under-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17 and England national under-19 football teamunder-19 teams.

Mike Williamson.name: Mike Williamson
Mike Williamson.intro: '''Michael James "Mike" Williamson''' (born 8 November 1983) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United as a defender (association football)defender. He signed for Newcastle from Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth on 27 January 2010.

Darron Gibson.name: Darron Gibson
Darron Gibson.intro:
'''Darron Thomas Daniel Gibson''' (born 25 October 1987) is an Irish peopleIrish association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Everton F.C.Everton and the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national team. He has also played for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and on loan for Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
In 2007, Gibson, who was born in Derry, Northern Ireland, was at the centre of a dispute between the Football Association of Ireland (FAI) and the Irish Football Association (IFA), after he opted to play for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland instead of Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland. The issue was referred to FIFA and was discussed in the Northern Ireland Assembly. The issue was settled in 2010 when it was declared, as Irish nationality lawIrish citizens, Northern Ireland-born people are entitled to play for either the Republic or Northern Ireland.

Jay McEveley.name: Jay McEveley
Jay McEveley.intro:
'''James Michael "Jay" McEveley''' (born 11 February 1985) is a association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United.
Born in Liverpool, he represented Everton F.C.Everton at junior level before signing for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers where he made his professional debut. He spent five seasons with the Lancashire club, playing for them in the Premier League, but was unable to hold down a regular first-team place and was eventually sold to Derby County F.C.Derby County in January 2007. Although he finally cemented himself as a regular starter with his new club, McEveley struggled with injuries and was eventually released in the summer of 2010. He subsequently spent two seasons each with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town before joining Sheffield United in 2014. During his career, McEveley also spent short spells on loan with a number of clubs; Burnley F.C.Burnley, Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and a brief spell at Swindon Town before his permanent switch.
Having initially represented England at both England national under-20 football teamunder-20 and England national under-21 football teamunder-21 level, McEveley also qualified to represent Scotland through his family and duly represented them, playing for both the Scotland B national football teamScotland B and Scotland national football teamScotland national sides, making three appearances for the latter between 2007 and 2008.
Jay McEveley.position: Defender  football  Full back Left back

Eddie McGoldrick.name: Eddie McGoldrick
Eddie McGoldrick.intro:
'''Edward John Paul "Eddie" McGoldrick''' (b. 30 April 1965) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (sport)winger and Midfielder (football)central midfielder from 1981 until 2000. He is currently youth team manager of Football League TwoLeague Two side Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town.
He played in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, as well as playing in the Football League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Stockport County F.C.Stockport County as well as playing in non-league for Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town, Nuneaton Town F.C.Nuneaton Town and Corby Town F.C.Corby Town.
Despite being born in London, he was also capped at international level for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland on 15 occasions due to his Irish ancestry; he was a member of Ireland's 1994 FIFA World Cup1994 World Cup squad though he did not play in the tournament.
Eddie McGoldrick.position: Winger  sport  Winger,Midfielder  football  Central Midfielder

James Hurst.name: James Hurst
James Hurst.intro: '''James Hurst''' (born 31 January 1992) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Hednesford Town F.C.Hednesford Town as a defender (association football)defender.

Kevin Ellison.name: Kevin Ellison
Kevin Ellison.intro: '''Kevin Ellison''' (born 23 February 1979) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Morecambe F.C.Morecambe, as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.

Shaun Teale.name: Shaun Teale
Shaun Teale.intro:
'''Shaun Teale''' (born 10 March 1964 in Southport) is a former English professional Association footballfootballer and manager. He played as a defender (association football)defender from 1988 until 2004 and was notably part of the League Cup winning team of Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 1994.
He also played in the Football League for A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United, the Scottish Premier League for Motherwell F.C.Motherwell. As well as having a spell in Hong Kong with Sing Tao (football)Sing Tao he has played at a Non-league level for Weymouth F.C.Weymouth, Southport F.C.Southport, Burscough F.C.Burscough and Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria before moving into management with the two latter clubs, as well as having a spell in charge of Chorley F.C.Chorley.

Robbie Stockdale.name: Robbie Stockdale
Robbie Stockdale.intro:
'''Robert Keith "Robbie" Stockdale''' (born 30 November 1979 in Redcar, North Yorkshire) is an English-born ScotlandScottish former professional Association footballfootballer and youth team coach of Premier League side Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.
As a player he was a Defender (association football)defender from 1997 to 2012. He notably played Premier League football for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough having also appeared as a professional for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Darlington F.C.Darlington and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers before joining Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town in 2008. Stockdale has five international caps to his name whilst representing the Scotland national football team. In 2010 he mixed his playing duties with a new role as Grimsby's youth team manager, a position he held until moving to Sunderland in 2012.

Iv\u00e1n Ramis.name: Iván Ramis
Iv\u00e1n Ramis.intro:
'''Iván Andrés Ramis Barrios''' (born 25 October 1984) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Levante UD as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
He spent most of his professional career with RCD MallorcaMallorca since making his debut in 2004,[
Iv\u00e1n Ramis.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Mikel Alonso.name: Mikel Alonso
Mikel Alonso.intro: '''Mikel Alonso Olano''' (born 16 May 1980) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Real Unión as a midfielder.

Steve Howard.name: Steve Howard
Steve Howard.intro: '''Steven John "Steve" Howard''' (born 10 May 1976) is a Association footballfootballer who plays as a striker.  He is currently a free agent after his contract with Hartlepool United was terminated early on 25 November 2013.   Howard is usually cited as a typical target man and is renowned for his aerial strength.

Kim Bo-kyung.name: Kim Bo-kyung
Kim Bo-kyung.intro:
