Matthew Taylor.name: Matthew Taylor
Matthew Taylor.intro: '''Matthew Simon Taylor''' (born 27 November 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley. He has previously played for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.

Titus Bramble.name: Titus Bramble
Titus Bramble.intro:
'''Titus Malachi Bramble''' (born 31 July 1981) is an English association footballfootballer who currently is without a club, having left Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland at the end of the 2012–2013 Premier League season. He plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back.
Bramble began his career at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town in 1998, where he made 48 appearances between 1998 and 2002. During his time at Ipswich, he had a loan (football)loan spell at Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, where he made two appearances during the 1999-2000 in English football1999–2000 season. He left Ipswich for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United in 2002, making 105 appearances for Newcastle in five seasons, before leaving on a free transfer. Bramble then joined Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, making 96 appearances between 2007 and 2010, before his move to Sunderland at the start of the 2010-11 Premier League season. He made 51 appearances for Sunderland before being released at the end of the 2012-13 Sunderland A.F.C. season2012–13 season.
Bramble also made 10 appearances for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s between 2000 and 2002.

Lewis Holtby.name: Lewis Holtby
Lewis Holtby.intro: '''Lewis Harry Holtby''' (born 18 September 1990) is a GermanyGerman professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Hamburger SV on loan from Tottenham Hotspur F.C..

Richard Hughes.name: Richard Hughes
Richard Hughes.intro:
'''Richard Daniel Hughes''' (born 25 June 1979) is a ScotlandScottish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
He started his professional career as a junior in Italy for Atalanta B.C.Atalanta before moving to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and Bournemouth A.F.C.Bournemouth. He most prominently previously featured for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth from 2002 until 2011, and had a brief loan spell with Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town in 2003. He was capped 5 times by Scotland national football teamScotland before retiring from football in 2011, however after a year out of the game, in August 2012 it was reported that Hughes was to re-sign for his first club, A.F.C. BournemouthAFC Bournemouth. He retired in May 2014 aged 34.

Luciano Becchio.name: Luciano Becchio
Luciano Becchio.intro:
'''Luciano Héctor Becchio''' (born 28 December 1983) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City. Born in Córdoba, Argentina, Becchio began his career in Buenos Aires at Boca Juniors but moved to Europe aged 20 after failing to make the grade at ''Los Xeneizes''. Through his ancestry, Becchio was able to claim an Italian passport and subsequent citizenship of the European Union, allowing him to sign for Spanish club RCD Mallorca BMallorca B in 2003. He would go on to play for a variety of other lower league clubs in the country over the next five years, including the FC Barcelona BBarcelona B team.
After an impressive season at Mérida UDMérida in the 2007–08 season, Becchio was recommended to Leeds United Director of Football Gwyn Williams by former Newcastle United midfielder Marcelino Elena.cite news
url =
title =
publisher =  BBC Football
date =  1 August 2008
accessdate = 10 September 2011
The Argentine went on to feature in over 200 games and scored over 80 goals at Leeds, achieving promotion from Football League OneLeague One in 2010 and playing in the same team that knocked reigning English Champions Manchester United out of the F.A. CupFA Cup in January of the same year. Becchio became a firm fans' favourite at Elland Road. Becchio signed for Premier League club Norwich City as part of a swap deal for Welsh striker Steve Morison on 31 January 2013.cite news  url =
title =
publisher =  BBC Football
date =  31 January 2013
accessdate = 31 January 2013

Marlon Harewood.name: Marlon Harewood
Marlon Harewood.intro:
'''Marlon Anderson Harewood''' (born 25 August 1979) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United as a forward (association football)striker.
Harewood started his career at Nottingham Forest. During his career there, he had loan spells at FC HakaHaka and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town before joining West Ham United F.C.West Ham United in 2003 and then Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 2007. In 2009 he spent short periods on loan at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. In 2011 he was on-loan with Barnsley F.C.Barnsley and completed a six-month contract with Guangzhou R&F F.C.Guangzhou R&F in China League One.

Filipe Oliveira.name: Filipe Oliveira
Filipe Oliveira.intro: '''Filipe Vilaça Oliveira''' (born 27 May 1984) is a Portuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Videoton FC in Hungary. Mainly a Midfielderright midfielder, he can also appear as an attacking Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.

Bryan Gunn.name: Bryan Gunn
Bryan Gunn.intro:
'''Bryan James Gunn''' (born 22 December 1963) is a Scottish former professional Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper and Manager (association football)football manager. After learning his trade with Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen in the early 1980s, he spent most of his playing career at Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, the club with which he came to be most closely associated. This was followed by a brief spell back in Scotland with Hibernian F.C.Hibernian before his retirement as a player in 1998.
Gunn feels the peak of his playing career was making what he calls the Glossary of association football terms#Ssave of his life in Bayern Munich v Norwich Citythe UEFA Cup match against Bayern Munich in 1993. This event was called the summit of Norwich City's history by ''The Independent''. He is one of only nine Norwich players to win the club's Norwich City F.C. Player of the YearPlayer of the Year award twice. He was made an inaugural member of Norwich City F.C. Hall of FameNorwich City's Hall of Fame. He was a member of the Scotland national football team, making six appearances for his country in the early 1990s.
Gunn worked for years behind the scenes at Norwich in a variety of roles, from matchday hosting to coaching. He was appointed temporary manager towards the end of the 2008–09 Football League Championship2008–09 season and then confirmed as permanent manager during the summer. However, after a 7–1 home defeat in the opening game to local rivals Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, he lost his job a week into the 2009–10 Football League One season.
Since the death of his young daughter from leukaemia in 1992, Gunn has been extensively involved in fundraising to combat the disease and its effects. As of 2011 he has raised more than £1 million for research into childhood leukaemia. The money has been used to fund projects to improve the lives of children with leukaemia and their families, notably a national telephone support line. The city of Norwich recognised Gunn's charity work and his long association with the city's football club by naming him List_of_shrievalties#Town_sheriffsSheriff for 2002. Published in 2006, his autobiography, ''In Where it Hurts: My Autobiography'', includes a foreword by his former manager Alex Ferguson.

Mark Halstead.name: Mark Halstead
Mark Halstead.intro: '''Mark James Halstead''' (born 17 September 1990) is an English association footballfootballer who currently plays for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Danny Hay.name: Danny Hay
Danny Hay.intro: '''Daniel "Danny" Hay''' (born 15 May 1975) is a New Zealand Football (soccer)footballer who has represented New Zealand national football teamNew Zealand as a Defender (football)#Centre-backcentre back and Captain (association football)captained Waitakere United in the New Zealand Football Championship.
Danny Hay.position: Defender  football  Centre back Centre back

\u00c1lvaro Arbeloa.name: Álvaro Arbeloa
\u00c1lvaro Arbeloa.intro:
'''Álvaro Arbeloa Coca''' (; born 17 January 1983), is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid. He is predominantly a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back, although he can also play on the left side.
Arbeloa started his career with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, playing mostly with the reserves. In 2006 he moved to Deportivo de La Coruña, joining Liverpool F.C.Liverpool after half a season and going on to appear in 98 official games over the course of three Premier League seasons. In 2009 he returned to Real Madrid, for a fee of Pound sterling£3,500,000.
Internationally Arbeloa gained 56 Cap (sport)caps for Spain national football teamSpain, representing the country at the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup, UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008 and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012, and winning all tournaments.
\u00c1lvaro Arbeloa.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Juan Cuadrado.name: Juan Cuadrado
Juan Cuadrado.intro:
'''Juan Guillermo Cuadrado Bello''' (; born 26 May 1988) is a Colombian professional Association footballfootballer who plays primarily as a Winger (soccer)winger for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Colombian national football teamColombian national team. He is known for his direct style of play, including pace on and off the ball, as well as dribbling skills.
Having begun his career at Independiente Medellín, he moved to Italy in 2009 when signed by Udinese CalcioUdinese. Used sparingly at the club, he was loaned to US LecceLecce for the 2011–12 Serie A2011–12 season, where despite relegation from Serie A, his performances earned a transfer to ACF FiorentinaFiorentina. In February 2015, he was signed by Chelsea.
Cuadrado made his senior international debut in 2010, and has since earned over 35 caps. He was part of the Colombian squads which reached the quarter-finals at the 2011 Copa América and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Lloyd Doyley.name: Lloyd Doyley
Lloyd Doyley.intro:
'''Lloyd Colin Doyley''' (born 1 December 1982) is a professional association footballfootballer who plays for Watford F.C.Watford as a Defender (association football)defender. He is primarily a right-back, but can also play as a centre-back and left-back. He is the longest-serving current player for Watford, and is contracted until 2015.
In 2012, the Jamaican Football Federation were tracking Doyley's progress, and in March 2013, Doyley received his first call up to the Jamaican national team.

Sergei Kornilenko.name: Sergei Kornilenko
Sergei Kornilenko.intro: '''Sergei Aleksandrovich Kornilenko''' (; born 14 June 1983) is a Belarusian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for FC Krylia Sovetov Samara of the Russian Premier League. In Belarus, both Belarusian languageBelarusian and Russian languages are official. Thus his name, usually transliterated as '''Sergei Kornilenko''' (), can be alternatively spelled as '''Syarhey Karnilenka''' ().

Paul Cook.name: Paul Cook
Paul Cook.intro:
'''Paul Anthony Cook''' (born 22 February 1967 in Liverpool) is an English Manager (association football)football manager and former player who is currently manager of Football League One side Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield.
Cook played as a Centre midfieldercentral midfielder during a playing career that spanned 23 years from 1983 until 2006, notably in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He also played in the Football League for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Burnley F.C.Burnley. He also played Non-league football for Marine F.C.Marine and Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley. He moved into management in 2006 with Southport F.C.Southport and later Sligo Rovers F.C.Sligo Rovers. In February 2012, he returned to English management with Accrington before moving to Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield in October of the same year.

Neil Maddison.name: Neil Maddison
Neil Maddison.intro: '''Neil Maddison''' (born 2 October 1969) is an English former association footballfootballer. His main position was in Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfield, but he played in all outfield positions during his career. He is the co-commentator on Middlesbrough games for BBC Tees since the start of the 2013/14 season.

John O'Shea.name: John O'Shea
John O'Shea.intro:
'''John Francis O'Shea'''  (born 30 April 1981) is an Irish Association footballfootballer, who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and the Republic of Ireland national football team. He is known for his versatility in playing several positions on either side of the pitch or the centre.
O'Shea made his Republic of Ireland debut in 2001 against Croatia national football teamCroatia and has since gone on to make 100 appearances for his country, scoring three goals, his first in 2003 against Australia national football teamAustralia. He was part of the team that 2009 Republic of Ireland v France football matchescontroversially lost to France in a play-off for the 2010 FIFA World Cup and went on to play in UEFA Euro 2012.
Born in Waterford, O'Shea joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United when he was 17. He spent loan spells at A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth and Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp before establishing himself in the Manchester United first team, going on to make almost 400 appearances in all competitions over 10 years. O'Shea won five Premier League titles, one FA Cup, three Football League Cups, the 2008 UEFA Champions League FinalUEFA Champions League and the 2008 FIFA Club World Cup FinalFIFA Club World Cup while at Manchester United. He joined Sunderland in July 2011.

Cabral.name: Cabral
Cabral.intro: '''Adilson Tavares Varela''' (born 22 October 1988 in Praia, Cape Verde), commonly known as '''Cabral''', is a Cabo Verdean Association Footballfootballer who currently plays as a midfielder formerly for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland.

Joe Parkinson.name: Joe Parkinson
Joe Parkinson.intro:
'''Joseph "Joe" Parkinson''' (born 11 June 1971 in Eccles, Greater ManchesterEccles, Lancashire) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Football (soccer)footballer, who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1989 until 1999.
He notably played in the Premier League for Everton F.C.Everton, while with the club he won the FA Cup in 1995. He also played for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth.

Julian Dicks.name: Julian Dicks
Julian Dicks.intro:
'''Julian Andrew Dicks''' (born 8 August 1968), is an English former professional Association footballfootballer, manager and former professional golfer. He is the current manager of West Ham United L.F.C.West Ham United Ladies.
Playing from 1985 until 2002, he was a defender (association football)defender, notably in the Premier League for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. He was voted West Ham's player of the year four times between 1990 and 1997. He also played in the Football League for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City where he started his footballing career, ending it in 2002 in Non-League footballnon-league football with Canvey Island F.C.Canvey Island. He became manager of Wivenhoe Town F.C.Wivenhoe Town in 2009, before moving to Grays Athletic F.C.Grays Athletic later that year. He was capped by both the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 and England B national football teamEngland B sides. He was known as a "hard man" adopting the nickname of The Terminator. He was a tough tackler with a strong shot in regular demand as a Penalty kickpenalty and free-kick taker. Dicks had a reputation for poor on-field discipline which brought him to the attention of referees, the press and footballing authorities.

Julian Watts.name: Julian Watts
Julian Watts.intro: '''Julian Watts''' (born 17 March 1971 in Sheffield) is an English peopleEnglish professional Association footballfootballer, best known as a player for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town and Australian side Northern Spirit FCNorthern Spirit who, after a spell of 2 and half years, was the manager of Hallam F.C.Hallam. He resigned from his post in May 2013 before taking up the position as manager at Shirebrook Town F.C.Shirebrook Town later that month.

David Lowe.name: David Lowe
David Lowe.intro:
'''David Anthony Lowe''' (born 30 August 1965) is an English former Association footballfootballer who is now head of youth coaching at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers. He made 563 league appearances in the Football League and Premier League, scoring 133 goals, in a career spanning 17 years. He played in the top five levels of English football, and also won two caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21s.
He began his career at Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in 1983, and helped the club to lift the Football League Trophy in 1985 Football League Trophy Final1985. He won a £80,000 move to Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town two years later, and helped the club to the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division title in 1991–92, though he spent the end of the campaign on loan at Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He was sold on to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City for £250,000 in July 1992, though he returned to Port Vale on loan in February 1994, helping the "Valiants" to win promotion out of the Second Division. On his return to Leicester he found the club in the Premier League. In March 1996, he returned to Wigan Athletic for a fee of £125,000, and helped the club to the Football League Third DivisionThird Division in 1996–97. He joined Wrexham F.C.Wrexham for the 1999–2000 campaign, though ended it on loan at high-flying Football ConferenceConference club Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds. He then turned his hand to coaching, and took charge of the Derby County F.C.Derby County first team for one game in January 2009.

Anthony Forde.name: Anthony Forde
Anthony Forde.intro: '''Anthony Forde''' (born 16 November 1993) is an Republic of IrelandIrish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielderwide midfielder for English League One side Walsall F.C.Walsall. He has represented the Republic of Ireland at numerous youth levels. He played for Ballingarry AFC as a schoolboy. He has one sister and a brother called Kevin also known as "Pigeon" who is a sub for Ballingarry AFC Junior team.

Mineiro.name: Mineiro
Mineiro.intro:
'''Carlos Luciano da Silva''', nicknamed '''Mineiro''' (born on 2 August 1975, in Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul) is Brazilian Association footballfootballer who last played for Fußball-RegionalligaGerman fourth division side TuS Koblenz.
His nickname "Mineiro" means somebody from the state of Minas Gerais, even though he is actually from the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul. This nickname was given to him because of his shy and quiet personality, typical of someone from Minas Gerais.

Dino Baggio.name: Dino Baggio
Dino Baggio.intro:
'''Dino Baggio''' (born 24 July 1971) is a former Italian professional association footballfootballer, who played as a defensive midfielder. He obtained 60 caps at international level for the Italy national football teamItalian national team, notably reaching the final of the 1994 FIFA World Cup Final1994 FIFA World Cup.
In his club career, Dino Baggio played for Torino CalcioTorino (1989–91), Internazionale Milano F.C.Inter Milan (1991–92), Juventus (1992–94), Parma A.C.Parma (1994–2000), S.S. LazioLazio (2000–03 and 2004–05), Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers 2003–04 in English football(2003–04), and A.C. AnconaAncona (2004). After having joined U.S. TriestinaTriestina in the Italian Serie B in the summer of 2005, he rescinded the contract because of personal issues with coach Pietro Vierchowod, playing just three times for the ''giuliani''. He won the UEFA Cup three times in his career, twice with Parma and once with Juventus.

Paul Boertien.name: Paul Boertien
Paul Boertien.intro: '''Paul Boertien''' (born 20 January 1979 in Haltwhistle, Northumberland, England) is a former English Association footballfootballer who has played for six English clubs.

Roland Lamah.name: Roland Lamah
Roland Lamah.intro: '''Roland Conde Lamah''' (born 31 December 1987) is a Belgian footballer who plays as a midfielder.

Paul Scharner.name: Paul Scharner
Paul Scharner.intro:
'''Paul Josef Herbert Scharner''' (born 11 March 1980) is an Austrian retired Association footballfootballer. He operated mainly as a Defender (association football)#Centre backdefender, although he could play almost every Midfielder (association football)midfield position as well. He was known for his great flexibility and haircuts.
Scharner started his professional career with Austrian Football BundesligaAustrian Bundesliga sides FK Austria WienAustria Wien and FC Red Bull SalzburgSV Salzburg, before moving to NorwayNorwegian Tippeligaen in late 2004, starting for SK Brann. In January 2006, he entered the Premier League where he played for over six years, playing for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, respectively. After a short time as a free agent, he transferred to Bundesliga veteran club Hamburger SV in August 2012, before returning to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic on loan in January 2013. He announced his retirement, at age 33, in September 2013.

Mauro Boselli.name: Mauro Boselli
Mauro Boselli.intro:
'''Mauro Boselli''' (born 22 May 1985) is an ArgentinesArgentine professional Association footballfootballer, who plays as Forward (association football)forward for Club LeónLeón. Boselli began his career at Argentine Primera DivisiónArgentine First Division clubs Boca Juniors and Estudiantes de La PlataEstudiantes before moving to England in 2010 to join Wigan Athletic. He has also made four appearances for the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team.
His style of play has been described by Roberto Martínez as "a clever player and natural finisher ... who can create havoc in the penalty area."
Mauro Boselli.position: Forward  association football  Centre forward Centre forward

Jack Butland.name: Jack Butland
Jack Butland.intro:
'''Jack Butland''' (born 10 March 1993) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, and for the England national football teamEngland national team.
Butland began his career with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, and made his debut in the Football League in September 2011 while on loan to Football League TwoLeague Two club Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town. Butland established himself as first choice keeper at St Andrew's (stadium)St Andrew's in 2012–13 Birmingham City F.C. season2012–13 and was transferred to Premier League club Stoke City in January 2013 for a fee of £3.3 million. He was loaned back to Birmingham and went on to play in every league match in 2012–13. Butland then spent time out on loan at Barnsley F.C.Barnsley before making his Premier League debut in January 2014.
At international level, he represented England at all age-group levels, playing for the England national under-17 football teamunder-17 team that won the 2010 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship2010 European championships and for the England national under-20 football teamunder-20s at the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup. He was part of the England squad at UEFA Euro 2012, and later that year was the first-choice goalkeeper for the Great Britain Olympic football teamGreat Britain team at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournamentOlympic tournament. He became the youngest goalkeeper to play for the England national football teamsenior England team when he made his debut in August 2012.

Radostin Kishishev.name: Radostin Kishishev
Radostin Kishishev.intro:
'''Radostin Kishishev''' (, born 30 July 1974) is a Bulgarian retired association footballfootballer and current manager of FC VereyaVereya Stara Zagora.
Kishishev earned 88 caps for Bulgaria national football teamBulgaria, representing them at Euro 96 and the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
Radostin Kishishev.position: Defender  association football  Full bck Right back

John Curtis (footballer, born 1978).name: John Curtis (footballer, born 1978)
John Curtis (footballer, born 1978).intro: '''John Charles Keyworth Curtis''' (born 3 September 1978) is an English association footballfootballer. He is a versatile defender (association football)defender who can play anywhere along the back four or as a defensive midfielder.

Phil Warner.name: Phil Warner
Phil Warner.intro: '''Phil Warner''' (born 2 February 1979) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball defender (football)defender, who currently plays for Heidelberg United FCHeidelberg United, having previously oplayed for AFC TottonTotton.

Stanislav Varga.name: Stanislav Varga
Stanislav Varga.intro: '''Stanislav Varga''' (born 8 October 1972 in Lipany) is a former Association footballfootball player from Slovakia and currently manager of 1. FC Tatran Prešov.
Stanislav Varga.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Steve Elliott (footballer, born 1978).name: Steve Elliott (footballer, born 1978)
Steve Elliott (footballer, born 1978).intro: '''Steven William "Steve" Elliott''' (born 29 October 1978) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender. He's currently assistant to caretaker manager Russell Milton at Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town.

Kim K\u00e4llstr\u00f6m.name: Kim Källström
Kim K\u00e4llstr\u00f6m.intro:
'''Kim Mikael Källström''' (; born 24 August 1982) is a Swedish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for FC Spartak MoscowSpartak Moscow and the Sweden national football teamSweden national team. He is noted for his play-making ability and free-kick taking.
He started his career at several clubs in Sweden, winning consecutive Allsvenskan titles with Djurgårdens IFDjurgårdens before moving to France where he represented Stade RennaisRennes and Olympique LyonnaisLyon. Källström won a range of domestic honours with Lyon and joined Spartak in 2012.
Källström has earned List of footballers with 100 or more caps116 caps for Sweden since his debut in 2001, making him their joint fifth most capped player of all time. He has played in three UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships and the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

R\u00e9mi Garde.name: Rémi Garde
R\u00e9mi Garde.intro: '''Rémi Garde''' (, born 3 April 1966) is a French professional association footballfootball coach and former player. During his career he won several honours, including the 1997–98 FA Premier League Championship, and was Cap (sport)capped by the France national team.

Bruno Ribeiro.name: Bruno Ribeiro
Bruno Ribeiro.intro:
'''Bruno Miguel Fernandes Ribeiro''' (born 22 October 1975) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wide midfielderleft midfielder, and the current coach of Vitória F.C.Vitória de Setúbal.
His main asset was a powerful left-foot strike, and he spent most of his career playing for Vitória F.C.Vitória de Setúbal, also having a four-year abroad spell in England. He amassed Primeira Liga totals of 198 games and eight goals over the course of 11 seasons, also representing in the competition U.D. LeiriaUnião de Leiria, S.C. Beira-MarBeira-Mar and C.D. Santa ClaraSanta Clara.
In 2011 Ribeiro started working as a manager, with precisely Setúbal.

David Weir (Scottish footballer).name: David Weir (Scottish footballer)
David Weir (Scottish footballer).intro:
'''David Gillespie Weir''' (born 10 May 1970) is a ScotlandScottish former association footballfootballer and who is currently Manager (association football)assistant manager of Brentford F.C.Brentford in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship.
Born in Falkirk, Scotland, Weir began his professional career with his home-town club, Falkirk F.C.Falkirk, after having attended the University of Evansville in the United States. After four seasons with the Bairns, Weir then moved on to Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian where he won the 1998 Scottish Cup Final1998 Scottish Cup. He joined Everton F.C.Everton in 1999 and spent seven years with the club, becoming club captain under two different managers. Weir then moved to Rangers in 2007 and became club captain after Barry Ferguson was stripped of the role in April 2009. Weir called time on his playing career in May 2012. Weir won his first cap (sport)cap for the Scotland national football team in 1997. He retired from international football in 2002 under Berti Vogts but returned when Walter Smith took charge. He is Scotland national football teamScotland's Scotland national football team records#Most capped playerssixth-most capped player, having won 69 Cap (sport)caps.
David Weir (Scottish footballer).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Kevin Ellis.name: Kevin Ellis
Kevin Ellis.intro: '''Kevin Ellis''' (born 11 May 1977) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball defender (football)defender.

Greg Halford.name: Greg Halford
Greg Halford.intro: '''Gregory "Greg" Halford''' (born 8 December 1984) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion on loan from Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He is naturally a Defender (association football)#Full-backright-back or Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre-back but can play in numerous positions including Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfield, Midfielder#Wingerright midfield and even as a Forward (association football)striker. Born in Chelmsford, Halford began his career with Colchester United F.C.Colchester United where he came through the youth system before moving to Reading F.C.Reading in 2007. His stay at Reading was a short one and Halford transferred to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland later the same year. After failing to hold down a regular place with Sunderland, he moved to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 2009 and later to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 2010 and Forest in 2012. Halford has also played for Braintree Town F.C.Braintree Town, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United on loan at various points in his career, as well as representing England at England national under-20 football teamEngland U20 level.

Kevin Pressman.name: Kevin Pressman
Kevin Pressman.intro:
'''Kevin Paul Pressman''' (born 6 November 1967) is an EnglandEnglish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1987 until 2009, he is currently employed as a goalkeeping coach at Millwall F.C.Millwall.
As a player Pressman made 588 appearances in English and Northern Irish league football for 5 different clubs over 3 decades, notably playing in the Premier League for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. He also played in the Football League for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town and Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United. He also played in Northern Ireland for Portadown F.C.Portadown.

Matt Derbyshire.name: Matt Derbyshire
Matt Derbyshire.intro: '''Matthew Anthony''' "'''Matt'''" '''Derbyshire''' (born 14 April 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United. He is a Forward (association football)striker, who played for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers for five years, and had loan spells with Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Wrexham F.C.Wrexham and Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos, before joining the latter club on a permanent basis in 2009. He played for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City on loan for the 2010–11 season. He won 14 cap (sport)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 side.

Jussi J\u00e4\u00e4skel\u00e4inen.name: Jussi Jääskeläinen
Jussi J\u00e4\u00e4skel\u00e4inen.intro:
'''Jussi Albert Jääskeläinen''' (; born 19 April 1975) is a FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer, who plays for English side West Ham United in the Premier League as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
He holds the record for being the longest serving foreign player in the Premier League after playing for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers from 1997 until 2012. At age 38 in season 2013–2014 at West Ham United, he is the oldest starting goalkeeper for the Premier League. He left Bolton for West Ham at the end of the 2011–12 season after turning down a contract extension.
He earned 56 caps for the Finland national football team, making his debut in 1998 and retiring from international football in 2010.

Mart\u00edn Demichelis.name: Martín Demichelis
Mart\u00edn Demichelis.intro:
'''Martín Gastón Demichelis''' (; born 20 December 1980) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club  Manchester City F.C.Manchester City mainly as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, although he can operate occasionally as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
Demichelis spent most of his professional career with FC Bayern MunichBayern Munich in Germany (seven and a half years), winning 11 major titles with the team. He also competed in his home country with Club Atlético River PlateRiver Plate, and in Spain with Málaga CFMálaga.
Demichelis gained 44 Cap (sport)caps for Argentina national football teamArgentina, representing the country in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and finishing second in 2014 FIFA World Cup2014.
Mart\u00edn Demichelis.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Lilian Laslandes.name: Lilian Laslandes
Lilian Laslandes.intro: '''Lilian Laslandes''' (; born 4 September 1971) is a retired FranceFrench association footballfootballer. He was capped seven times and scored three goals for the France national football teamFrench national team. He ended his professional footballing career at OGC Nice in 2008.

Vassilis Lakis.name: Vassilis Lakis
Vassilis Lakis.intro: '''Vasilis Lakis''' () (born 10 September 1976 in Thessaloniki) is a retired GreeceGreek football (soccer)footballer and he was named "Turbo" for his speed on the attacking wing and making great crosses in the area for the strikers.

Taye Taiwo.name: Taye Taiwo
Taye Taiwo.intro: '''Taye Ismaila Taïwo''' (born 16 April 1985) is a Demographics of NigeriaNigerian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Süper Lig side Bursaspor. Taiwo's primary position is Association football positions#Left-back (LB) and Right-back (RB)left back (number 3 position)
Taye Taiwo.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Damian Matthew.name: Damian Matthew
Damian Matthew.intro:
'''Damian Matthew''' (born 23 September 1970) is an English association footballfootball coach and former player. He is the first-team coach at Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic.
As a player he was a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1989 until 1999, notably in the Premier League with Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace. He also played in the Football League for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town.
After his playing days were over, Matthew was briefly a pundit for Chelsea TV.

Martyn Waghorn.name: Martyn Waghorn
Martyn Waghorn.intro: '''Martyn Thomas Waghorn''' (born 23 January 1990) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic as a Forward (association football)striker. Waghorn had been with Sunderland since the age of eight and made his first team debut for the club in December 2007 against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United at the age of 17. He has had loan (association football)loan spells with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City before joining the side on a permanent deal on 31 August 2010.

Phil Whelan.name: Phil Whelan
Phil Whelan.intro: '''Philip James "Phil" Whelan''' (born 7 August 1972) is an EnglandEnglish former professional association footballfootballer. A defender (association football)defender, he played for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough, Oxford United F.C.Oxford, Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham and Southend United F.C.Southend.

Winston Bogarde.name: Winston Bogarde
Winston Bogarde.intro:
'''Winston Bogarde''' (born 22 October 1970) is a Dutch retired professional Association footballfootballer.
A player of immense physical strength, he played mostly as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, although he could occasionally appear on Defender (association football)#Full backthe left, and was best known for his spells at AFC AjaxAjax, FC BarcelonaBarcelona and Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
With the latter he garnered worldwide attention as, although he received almost no playing time (no Premier League appearances whatsoever in his last three seasons combined), he preferred to see out his lucrative contract.
Bogarde represented the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team in one FIFA World CupWorld Cup and one UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championship.

Dominic Foley.name: Dominic Foley
Dominic Foley.intro: '''Dominic Joseph Foley''' (born 7 July 1976) is a retired Irish Association footballfootballer who last played for Limerick F.C.Limerick as a Forward (association football)forward.

Trevor Sinclair.name: Trevor Sinclair
Trevor Sinclair.intro:
'''Trevor Lloyd Sinclair''' (born 2 March 1973) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and assistant manager of Lancaster City F.C.Lancaster City.
Sinclair was a versatile winger, able to play on both the left and right flanks who played in the Premier League and made twelve appearances for the England national football teamEngland national team, including four at the 2002 FIFA World Cup. He retired in 2008, after a nineteen-year professional career, after being released by Football League Championship side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City.

Kevin Harper.name: Kevin Harper
Kevin Harper.intro: '''Kevin Patrick Harper''' (born 15 January 1976) is a ScotlandScottish former association footballfootballer who played for Hibernian F.C.Hibernian, Derby County F.C.Derby County, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United and Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic.

Brett Angell.name: Brett Angell
Brett Angell.intro:
'''Brett Ashley Mark Angell''' (born 20 August 1968) is an English association football coach and former player, now coaching in New Zealand. His brother Darren AngellDarren also played football professionally.
Turning professional with Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth in 1986, he made his mark as a Forward (association football)striker the following year after moving to Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town. In 1988 he joined Stockport County F.C.Stockport County via Derby County F.C.Derby County, before signing with Southend United F.C.Southend United in 1990. Impressing at the club, he won a move to Everton F.C.Everton four years later. In 1995 he transferred to Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, after spent part of 1996 on loan at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, before he returned to Stockport later in the year. Successful in his second spell with the club, he was loaned out to Notts County F.C.Notts County and Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, before ending up at Walsall F.C.Walsall in 2000. Two years later he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers via Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He retired in 2003 having scored 200 goals in 540 games, in all competitions.
With Southend he was promoted out of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division 1990–91 Football League1990–91, and was also named on the PFA Team of the Year. He won promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division with Stockport County, and was later inducted into the club's Hall of Fame. He topped the Second Division with Preston North End in 1999–2000 Preston North End F.C. season1999–2000, and won his fourth promotion with Walsall after winning the Second Division play-off final in 2001 Football League Second Division play-off Final2001. He was also listed in the 2006 book ''Cheltenham Town Football Club 50 Greats''.

David Kerslake.name: David Kerslake
David Kerslake.intro: '''David Kerslake''' (born 19 June 1966 in Stepney), London  is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and coach who played for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers.

Alan Miller.name: Alan Miller
Alan Miller.intro: '''Alan John Miller''' (born Epping, 29 March 1970) is an English former professional Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper.

Ulrich van Gobbel.name: Ulrich van Gobbel
Ulrich van Gobbel.intro: '''Ulrich van Gobbel''' (born January 16, 1971 in Paramaribo, Suriname) is a NetherlandsDutch former football (soccer)football player who played as a Defender (football)defender for Feyenoord Rotterdam (where he had two spells), Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray and Southampton F.C.Southampton.

Darius Vassell.name: Darius Vassell
Darius Vassell.intro:
'''Darius Martin Clarke Vassell''' (born 13 June 1980) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker. He previously played for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, MKE AnkaragücüAnkaragücü and Leicester City F.CLeicester City.
Vassell began his career at his home town club Aston Villa in the Premier League, being developed by their academy and making his first team debut in 1998. He was sold for £2m in 2005 to another Premier League club, Manchester City, staying for four seasons before being released in 2009, moving abroad to Turkey for a season to play for the Süper Lig team Ankaragücü. In October 2010 he was brought back to England by his former England manager Sven-Göran Eriksson to play for the Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Leicester City.
Under Eriksson with England, Vassell scored six goals from 22 international Cap (sport)#Association footballcaps awarded between 2002 and 2004, including appearances at the 2002 FIFA World Cup in Korea/Japan, and UEFA Euro 2004 in Portugal.

Emerse Fa\u00e9.name: Emerse Faé
Emerse Fa\u00e9.intro: '''Emerse Faé''' (born 24 January 1984 in Nantes) is a retired French-born Côte d'IvoireIvorian professional association footballfootball midfielder who last played for Ligue 1 side OGC Nice. He was also a member of the Côte d'Ivoire national football teamCôte d'Ivoire national team.

Darren Bent.name: Darren Bent
Darren Bent.intro:
'''Darren Ashley Bent''' (born 6 February 1984) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Derby County F.C.Derby County, on Loan (sports)loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, as a Forward (association football)striker.
Bent started his career with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. After progressing through their youth system he made his first team debut in 2001. He made 122 appearances and scored 48 goals in the league for Ipswich, before joining Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic for a fee of £2.5 million in 2005. He was Charlton Athletic's top goalscorer for two consecutive seasons and joined Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur for a club record fee of £16.5 million in 2007. After two seasons at Tottenham he joined Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. After a successful 18 months at Sunderland, he joined Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in 2011. Bent has scored List of Premier League players with 100 or more goalsover 100 Premier League goals.
He has represented England at under-15, England national under-16 football teamunder-16, England national under-17 football teamunder-17, England national under-19 football teamunder-19, England national under-21 football teamunder-21 and England national football teamsenior levels. He made 14 appearances and scored nine goals for the under-21 side, after making his debut against Italy national under-21 football teamItaly in 2003. He made his debut for the senior England side in 2006 against Uruguay national football teamUruguay, and has since made 13 appearances for England, scoring four goals. He scored his first goal on 7 September 2010 in a 3–1 UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying match victory against Switzerland national football teamSwitzerland.

Arjan de Zeeuw.name: Arjan de Zeeuw
Arjan de Zeeuw.intro: '''Adrianus Johannes "Arjan" de Zeeuw''' (born 16 April 1970 in Castricum, North Holland) is a retired Dutch Association footballfootballer, who played as a defender (football)centre-back.
Arjan de Zeeuw.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Paulo da Silva.name: Paulo da Silva
Paulo da Silva.intro:
'''Paulo César da Silva Barrios''' (born 1 February 1980 in Asunción) is a Paraguayan association footballfootballer  who plays for Deportivo Toluca F.C.Toluca FC in Mexico, as a defender (association football)centre back.
He has previously played top-flight football in Paraguay, Italy, Argentina, England and Spain.
He  has played for the Paraguay national football team since 2000, earning over FIFA Century Club100 caps and playing at two World Cups and two Copa América tournaments.[
Paulo da Silva.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Alan Kimble.name: Alan Kimble
Alan Kimble.intro: '''Alan Kimble''' (born 6 August 1966) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and current manager of Maldon & Tiptree F.C.Maldon & Tiptree.

Jon Routledge.name: Jon Routledge
Jon Routledge.intro: '''Jonathan Joseph "Jon" Routledge''' (born 23 November 1989) is an English professional association footballfootballer.

Clarence Acu\u00f1a.name: Clarence Acuña
Clarence Acu\u00f1a.intro: '''Clárence Williams Acuña Donoso''' (born February 8, 1975 in Rancagua) is a Chilean former professional football (soccer)football player. He played as a midfielder.

Jermaine Pennant.name: Jermaine Pennant
Jermaine Pennant.intro:
'''Jermaine Lloyd Pennant''' (born 15 January 1983) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder#Wingerwinger for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.
Born in Nottingham, Pennant played for his local side Notts County F.C.Notts County as a youngster. He earned promising reviews in the youth team at County and Arsenal F.C.Arsenal signed him in 1999. He struggled to make much of an impact at the North London club and spent time on loan at Watford F.C.Watford, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City before joining the latter permanently. While an Arsenal player, he won 24 cap (sports)caps for the England national under-21 football teamEngland under-21 team. He gained notoriety in 2005, when he had to play a match while on probation—he played while wearing an electronic taggingelectronic tag following a Driving under the influencedrink-driving conviction. Following Birmingham's relegation in 2006 Pennant signed for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool for a fee of £6.7 million. He won the 2006 FA Community Shield and also played a vital role in the club's run to the 2007 UEFA Champions League Final where Liverpool lost 2–1 to A.C. MilanMilan.
However off the field problems continued to affect him and consequently led to him being left out of the side. He joined Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth on loan before leaving to join Spanish side Real Zaragoza in 2009. His time in Spain was overshadowed by disciplinary problems. He returned to the Premier League for the 2010–11 season signing on loan at English MidlandsMidlands club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. Following a successful loan spell he signed a permanent contract at Stoke in December 2010. He played in the 2011 FA Cup Final, Stoke losing 1–0 to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and also played in the UEFA Europa League the 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. seasonfollowing season. Pennant fell out of favour with Tony Pulis in 2012–13 and spent time out on loan at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. With his Stoke career looking to be coming to an end new manager Mark Hughes gave Pennant a new contract. However after failing to make an impact he left Stoke in January 2014.

Karl-Heinz Riedle.name: Karl-Heinz Riedle
Karl-Heinz Riedle.intro:
'''Karl-Heinz Riedle''' /kɑrl haɪnts riːdlə/ (born 16 September 1965) is a GermanyGerman retired professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
Nicknamed "Air" due to his notable jumping and timing skills for headers, he appeared in 207 Bundesliga games over the course of eight seasons, scoring 62 of his 72 goals for SV Werder BremenWerder Bremen and Borussia Dortmund. He also played for S.S. LazioLazio in Italy and Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in England.
A German national football teamGerman international for six years, Riedle represented the country in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups – 1990 FIFA World Cupwinning the 1990 edition – and UEFA Euro 1992Euro 1992.

Brian Borrows.name: Brian Borrows
Brian Borrows.intro:
'''Brian Borrows''' (born 20 December 1960 in Liverpool) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (association football)defender from 1980 until 1999.
He played for Everton F.C.Everton and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, but spent the majority of his career with Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He finished playing with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town.

Adnan Januzaj.name: Adnan Januzaj
Adnan Januzaj.intro: '''Adnan Januzaj''' (; born 5 February 1995) is a Belgian professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Born in Brussels, he began his career with R.S.C. AnderlechtAnderlecht before joining Manchester United in 2011 at the age of 16. Januzaj made his full international debut in 2014 and later that year played for Belgium at the 2014 FIFA World CupWorld Cup.

Hatem Ben Arfa.name: Hatem Ben Arfa
Hatem Ben Arfa.intro:
'''Hatem Ben Arfa''' (, ; born 7 March 1987) is a French footballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger and an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder. Currently a free agent, he was last contracted to OGC NiceNice, but left the club without making an appearance, due to FIFA Legislation stating that a player can only play for two clubs in a football season. He had been on loan at Hull City A.F.C.Hull City from his parent club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, and whilst he did not make an appearance for the First Team, he did play one match for the Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academyreserve side, which is categorised as an Official match by FIFA.
Ben Arfa has been described as "one of the best-rated talents in France", but has been criticised by the media and players alike for lacking discipline.
Ben Arfa started his career throughout various clubs in the Île-de-France (region)Île-de-France Regions of Franceregion, having trained at Athletic Club de Boulogne-BillancourtAC Boulogne-Billancourt and FC VersaillesVersailles. In 1999, he was selected to attend the Clairefontaine academy. Ben Arfa spent three years at the academy and, upon leaving, signed with Olympique LyonnaisLyon, where he won four Ligue 1 titles. In his early career at Lyon, he played as a Strikercentre forward, but moved into a Midfielder#Wingerwinger role during the Ligue 1 2007–082007–08 season. In the summer of 2008, Ben Arfa signed with rivals Olympique de MarseilleMarseille for €11 million through a move which required the intervention of the Ligue de Football Professionnel. With Marseille, he won the 2009–10 Ligue 12009–10 league title, his fifth overall, as well as the 2010 Coupe de la Ligue FinalCoupe de la Ligue in 2010. After two years at Marseille, Ben Arfa joined English club Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United on loan for the 2010–11 season; the deal was made permanent later in the season.
Ben Arfa is a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international having played at all levels. At under-17 level, he was a part of the team that won the 2004 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship. Ben Arfa was called up to the France national football teamsenior team for the first time in October 2007 for a UEFA Euro 2008 qualifying match against the Faroe Islands national football teamFaroe Islands. Currently, he has made thirteen appearances for France, scoring twice.

Aleksandar Tonev.name: Aleksandar Tonev
Aleksandar Tonev.intro:
'''Aleksandar Antonov Tonev''' (; born 3 February 1990) is a Bulgarian peopleBulgarian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Scottish Premiership club Celtic F.C.Celtic on loan from Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, and for the Bulgaria national football team.
He began his career at PFC CSKA SofiaCSKA Sofia, also spending a season on loan at OFC Sliven 2000 before joining the Polish Ekstraklasa club Lech Poznań in 2011. In his second season he inspired them to runners-up position in the league, and was signed by Aston Villa.
A full international since 2011, Tonev has earned over 15 caps for Bulgaria.

Paul Gallagher.name: Paul Gallagher
Paul Gallagher.intro:
'''Paul Gallagher''' (born 9 August 1984) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Preston North End F.C.Preston North End on loan from Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.
Born in Glasgow, he has played in the Premier League for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, and the Football League for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City (two spells), Preston North End F.C.Preston North End (two spells), Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He has been Cap (sport)capped once by the Scotland national football teamScotland national team.

Scott Marshall.name: Scott Marshall
Scott Marshall.intro: '''Scott Roderick Marshall''' (born 1 May 1973) is a Scottish former professional association footballfootballer and coach, who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back. Marshall was one of the two interim club managers at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa along with Andy Marshall following the sacking of Paul Lambert in February 2015.
Scott Marshall.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Mick Stockwell.name: Mick Stockwell
Mick Stockwell.intro:
'''Michael Thomas "Mick" Stockwell''' also known as '''Micky Stockwell''' (born 14 February 1965 in Chelmsford) is an EnglandEnglish former professional football (soccer)footballer, and manager who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1985 until 2007.
He spent fifteen years of his career at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, notching up 506 league appearances for the club and taking part in several Premier League seasons. He moved on to Colchester United F.C.Colchester United in 2000, where he ended his professional career three years later. He then spent time as player-coach of Non-league side Heybridge Swifts F.C.Heybridge Swifts before becoming player-manager of Woodbridge Town F.C.Woodbridge Town.

Marcus Hahnemann.name: Marcus Hahnemann
Marcus Hahnemann.intro:
'''Marcus Stephen Hahnemann''' (born June 15, 1972) is a retired American United States men's national soccer teaminternational Association footballsoccer player.
Graduating out of Seattle Pacific University, he played for the Seattle Sounders (USL)Seattle Sounders between 1994 and 1996. Between 1997 and 1999 he turned out for the Colorado Rapids, signing with English club Fulham F.C.Fulham in 1999. Unable to become the first-choice goalkeeper at Fulham, he enjoyed loan spells with Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and Reading F.C.Reading, before signing permanently with Reading in 2002. In 2009, following 276 league appearances for the club, he transferred to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers.
He has won nine caps for the United States men's national soccer teamUnited States, featuring as back-up for Kasey Keller and Tim Howard in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups. Following his debut for the States in 1994 he played two further games within the same month, however he had to wait almost nine years before his next international appearance, making him a player with one of the longest ever gaps between caps.

Kit Symons.name: Kit Symons
Kit Symons.intro: '''Christopher Jeremiah "Kit" Symons''' (born 8 March 1971) is an English-born association football manager and former Wales national football teamWelsh international footballer. Symons is currently in charge of Fulham F.C.Fulham in what is his first permanent managerial appointment following brief stints as caretaker manager for several clubs. As a professional player, he had lengthy spells at Portsmouth, Manchester City and Fulham as well as earning 36 Cap (sport)caps for the Wales national football team.

Philipp Wollscheid.name: Philipp Wollscheid
Philipp Wollscheid.intro:
'''Philipp Wollscheid''' (born 6 March 1989) is a GermanyGerman Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan from Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen.
Wollscheid began his career playing amateur football for various clubs in Saarland. He progressed to semi-professional level with Rot-Weiss Hasborn-DautweilerSV Rot-Weiss Hasborn in 2007 and then 1. FC Saarbrücken. He was released by Saarbrücken in the summer of 2009 and then joined 1. FC Nürnberg following a successful trial. After spending time playing for the 1. FC Nürnberg IIsecond team he broke into the Nürnberg first team and became a regular in the Bundesliga. His performances for Nürnberg saw him transfer to Bayer 04 LeverkusenBayer Leverkusen in July 2012. Wollscheid was a regular under Sami Hyypiä at Leverkusen in 2012–13 Bundesliga2012–13 and 2013–14 Bundesliga2013–14. However he fell out of favor with new manager Roger Schmidt (football manager)Roger Schmidt and joined 1. FSV Mainz 05 on loan in August 2014. Wollscheid joined English side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City on loan in January 2015.
Philipp Wollscheid.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Kyle Walker.name: Kyle Walker
Kyle Walker.intro: '''Kyle Andrew Walker''' (born 28 May 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Left backdefender for English Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, and the England national football team.

Michael Barron.name: Michael Barron
Michael Barron.intro: '''Michael James “Mickey” Barron ''' (born 22 December 1974 in Chester-le-Street) is a association footballfootball Coach (sport)coach and a former professional footballer. He retired from playing in May 2008. His last job in football was assistant manager and reserve team manager at Hartlepool United F.C.

B\u00fclent Ak\u0131n.name: Bülent Akın
B\u00fclent Ak\u0131n.intro: '''Bülent Akın''' (born 28 August 1978 in Brussels) is a Belgian-born Turkish former Association footballfootballer.

Rob Lee.name: Rob Lee
Rob Lee.intro: '''Robert Martin "Rob" Lee''' (born 1 February 1966 in West Ham, London) is a retired English Association footballfootballer who played the majority of his career for Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.

Sebasti\u00e1n Blanco.name: Sebastián Blanco
Sebasti\u00e1n Blanco.intro: '''Sebastián Marcelo Blanco''' (born 15 March 1988) is an ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootballer. He currently plays as a midfielder for San Lorenzo de Almagro, on loan from West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion.
Sebasti\u00e1n Blanco.birth_place: Lomas de Zamora,Buenos Aires Province|Buenos Aires,Argentina

Rob Elliot.name: Rob Elliot
Rob Elliot.intro: '''Robert "Rob" Elliot''' (born 30 April 1986) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.

Nicklas Bendtner.name: Nicklas Bendtner
Nicklas Bendtner.intro:
'''Nicklas Bendtner''' (; born 16 January 1988) is a Danish association footballfootballer who plays for VfL Wolfsburg and the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team. His preferred position is centre forward, but he has also played on the right side of attack, and possesses a powerful header.
Having progressed through the youth ranks at Tårnby Boldklub, Kjøbenhavns Boldklub and Arsenal F.C. AcademyArsenal, Bendtner signed his first professional contract with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 2005. He made his professional debut in October 2005 in the Football League Cup, in a game against Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland. For the 2006-07 Birmingham City F.C. season2006–07 season, Bendtner was loaned out to Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, where he made 48 appearances. Following his return to Arsenal, he became a regular first team player, but began to slip out of favour during the 2010-11 Arsenal F.C. season2010–11 season. As a result, he moved on loan to Premier League side Sunderland for the majority of the 2011-12 Sunderland A.F.C. season2011–12 season, where he made 30 appearances. He then spent the entire 2012-13 Juventus F.C. season2012–13 season on loan to Serie A side Juventus F.C.Juventus, where he made 10 appearances, but failed to score. Bendtner was released by Arsenal in 2014, and subsequently joined Wolfsburg on a free transfer.
Bendtner has played internationally for Denmark national football teamDenmark at Denmark national under-16 football teamunder-16, Denmark national under-17 football teamunder-17, Denmark national under-19 football teamunder-19, Denmark national under-21 football teamunder-21 and senior levels. He made his senior international debut on 16 August 2006, in a friendly match against Poland national football teamPoland, and scored his first international goal in that match. Since then, he has been capped 66 times, scoring 29 goals. He has also featured in Denmark's 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012 squads.

Nicky Maynard.name: Nicky Maynard
Nicky Maynard.intro: '''Nicholas David "Nicky" Maynard''' (born 11 December 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Welsh Championship side Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City as a Forward (association football)striker.

Steve Finnan.name: Steve Finnan
Steve Finnan.intro:
'''Stephen John "Steve" Finnan''' (born 24 April 1976) is a retired Irish Republic of Ireland national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back.
He is the only player to have played in the World Cup, UEFA Champions League, UEFA Cup, Intertoto Cup, all four levels of the English league football and the Football Conference. Among the honours won during his career was the 2005 UEFA Champions League Final for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool. Finnan is known for his attacking role and ability to cross the ball.
He played 52 internationals for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland from his debut in 2000, scoring twice. He played for them at the 2002 FIFA World Cup.
Steve Finnan.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

John Halls.name: John Halls
John Halls.intro:
'''John Halls''' (born 14 February 1982) is a former English Association footballfootballer.
Halls began his career with Arsenal F.C.Arsenal making three appearances in the Football League CupLeague Cup for the "Gunners" before spending time out on loan at Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, Belgian club K.S.K. BeverenBeveren and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. He joined Stoke on a permanent basis in December 2003 and became a regular in the side. He left for Reading F.C.Reading in January after rejecting a new contract with Stoke but he struggled to force his way into a Reading side who were well on their way to gaining promotion to the Premier League and despite spending three season at the Madjeski Stadium Halls managed just eight appearances and spent time on loan at Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He ten played for lower league sides Brentford F.C.Brentford, Aldershot Town F.C.Aldershot Town and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. After leaving Wycombe in May 2012 Halls decided to retire and set up his own male fashion business.

Andy Barlow.name: Andy Barlow
Andy Barlow.intro:
'''Andrew John Barlow''' (born 24 November 1965 in Oldham, Lancashire) is an English former professional football (soccer)football player. He played as a left-back in a career spanning fifteen years, and made more than 400 league appearances.
Barlow began his career with his hometown club, Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, and spent ten of his eleven years at Boundary Park playing under manager Joe Royle.
In 1995, he signed for Sam Allardyce's Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, with whom he spent two years before joining Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale. He brought his playing career to a close at Spotland. He scored his only goal for the club, against Brighton and Hove Albion F.C.Brighton in a 1–1 draw, with the very last touch of his professional career.[
Barlow retired with Ramsbottom United F.C.Ramsbottom United.
Post-retirement, he became a coach (sport)coach with the Professional Footballers' AssociationPFA, a role he continues to fulfill.
Andy Barlow.position: Defender  football  Full back Left back

John Hendrie.name: John Hendrie
John Hendrie.intro:
'''John Grattan Hendrie''' (born 24 October 1963) is a Scottish former professional association footballer who played on the Midfielder#Wingerright wing or in strikerattack.
His career started at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City but he moved to Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, where he played 173 consecutive league games, winning one promotion and narrowly missing out on another. Following spells with Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, he moved to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and scored the final goal at Ayresome Park among his 44 goals for Boro. When he was replaced by Brazilian Juninho PaulistaJuninho he moved to Barnsley F.C.Barnsley where he finished his career and also served as manager.
His uncle is another Scottish former pro footballer, Paul Hendrie. Paul has two sons (John's cousins) in the game; Lee Hendrie made a late substitute appearance for England in 1998 and Stuart Hendrie plays for Morecambe.

Vladimir Stojkovi\u0107.name: Vladimir Stojković
Vladimir Stojkovi\u0107.intro:
'''Vladimir Stojković''' (; born 28 July 1983) is a Serbian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Israeli club Maccabi Haifa F.C. and the Serbia national football teamSerbian national team as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
During his career he played for the two biggest clubs in his country, Red Star Belgrade and FK PartizanPartizan, but also represented teams in five other countries, notably with Sporting Clube de Portugal who loaned him several times for the duration of his contract.
A Serbia national football teamSerbian international on 59 occasions, Stojković appeared in the 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 World Cup.
Vladimir Stojkovi\u0107.birth_place: Loznica,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Ian Bennett.name: Ian Bennett
Ian Bennett.intro: '''Ian Michael Bennett''' (born 10 October 1971) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper and is currently Academy Goalkeeping Coach at Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town.

Tony Hibbert.name: Tony Hibbert
Tony Hibbert.intro: '''Anthony James "Tony" Hibbert''' (born 20 February 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Everton F.C.Everton in the Premier League. Originally a midfielder, Hibbert now plays at Defender (association football)#Full-backright back. He has List of one-club menspent his entire career with Everton, having joined the club in 1991. He made his senior début for Everton in 2001, and has since made over three hundred appearances for the club in all competitions. Hibbert's one-club man status, coupled with his down to earth demeanour, has since earned him the status of cult figure among Everton fans.
Tony Hibbert.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Rodrigo Beckham.name: Rodrigo Beckham
Rodrigo Beckham.intro:
'''Rodrigo Juliano Lopes de Almeida''' (born 7 August 1976), usually called '''Rodrigo''' or '''Rodrigo Beckham''', is a former Brazilian footballer.
During his career he has played for Associação Atlética Portuguesa SantistaPortuguesa Santista, Guarani Futebol ClubeGuarani, Sociedade Esportiva do GamaGama, Botafogo de Futebol e RegatasBotafogo, Everton F.C.Everton, Clube Atlético MineiroAtlético-MG, Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians, Esporte Clube JuventudeJuventude, Clube Atlético ParanaenseParanaense, Club de Regatas Vasco da GamaVasco da Gama, Paraná ClubeParaná and Boavista Sport Club.
Rodrigo was signed for Everton F.C.Everton in July 2002, He was injured in September and never played again before released in May.
Whilst at Everton, he chose for his name to be printed on his shirt as '''Rodrigol'''.

Darren Ward (footballer, born 1978).name: Darren Ward (footballer, born 1978)
Darren Ward (footballer, born 1978).intro: '''Darren Philip Ward''' (born 13 September 1978) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for Crawley Town F.C.Crawley Town. Ward has played for all three major South London derbySouth London teams, Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace and Millwall F.C.Millwall.
Darren Ward (footballer, born 1978).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jamie Pollock.name: Jamie Pollock
Jamie Pollock.intro: '''Jamie Pollock''' (born 16 February 1974 in Stockton-on-Tees) is a retired professional football player.

Anders Lindegaard.name: Anders Lindegaard
Anders Lindegaard.intro:
'''Anders Rozenkrantz Lindegaard''' (; born 13 April 1984) is a Danish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, having joined the club in November 2010. He initially came through the ranks of his hometown club, Odense Boldklub, but left due to a lack of first-team opportunities. He got his senior breakthrough winning the 2009 Norwegian Football Cup with Aalesunds FKAalesund. He was named 2010 Goalkeeper of the Year in both Denmark and Norway.
He represented Denmark at U19 and U20 level, before making his senior debut on 7 September 2010 against Iceland national football teamIceland.

Dan Smith (footballer, born 1986).name: Dan Smith (footballer, born 1986)
Dan Smith (footballer, born 1986).intro:
'''Daniel "Dan" Smith''' (born 5 October 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who is currently a free agent.
A defender (association football)full back, he previously played professionally in the Premier League for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, in the Football League for Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, and in the Scottish Premier League for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen. He also appeared in the Scottish Football League as a Loan (sports)#Unpaid trialiststriallist for St Johnstone F.C.St Johnstone, and played in non-League football for Gateshead F.C.Gateshead, Blyth Spartans A.F.C.Blyth Spartans, Chester-le-Street Town F.C.Chester-le-Street Town, Darlington 1883, Dunston UTS F.C.Dunston UTS and Seaham Red Star F.C.Seaham Red Star.

Ruud Boffin.name: Ruud Boffin
Ruud Boffin.intro: '''Ruud Boffin''' (born 5 November 1987) is a BelgiumBelgian professional association footballfootballer who plays for Turkish club Eskişehirspor, as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.

Stefan Beinlich.name: Stefan Beinlich
Stefan Beinlich.intro:
'''Stefan "Paule" Beinlich''' (born 13 January 1972) is a retired GermanyGerman Association footballfootballer, who played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
His main asset was a powerful long-range shot, and he often scored from Direct free kickfree kicks; he was one of the first players from the country to play in the Premier League, although he would have little impact at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa.

Richard Rufus.name: Richard Rufus
Richard Rufus.intro: '''Richard Raymond Rufus''' (born 12 January 1975) is a former EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball player, who spent his entire career at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic.

Patrizio Billio.name: Patrizio Billio
Patrizio Billio.intro: '''Patrizio Billio''' (born 19 April 1974) is a former ItalyItalian Football (soccer)footballer.

Joey Hutchinson.name: Joey Hutchinson
Joey Hutchinson.intro: '''Jonathan "Joey" Hutchinson''' (born 2 April 1982) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender.

Darko Kova\u010devi\u0107.name: Darko Kovačević
Darko Kova\u010devi\u0107.intro:
nationalcaps1= 59  nationalgoals1 = 10
'''Darko Kovačević''' (; ; born 18 November 1973) is a former SerbsSerbian Association footballfootball player. He is known for his spells at Real Sociedad where his partnership with Nihat Kahveci was one of the best in Spain. His key attributes are his strength and aerial ability. Kovačević also had positive spells with Juventus and Olympiacos F.C.Olympiakos. In international competition, he represented Serbia and MontenegroYugoslavia at the 1998 FIFA World Cup.
Darko Kova\u010devi\u0107.birth_place: Kovin,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Ryan McGivern.name: Ryan McGivern
Ryan McGivern.intro:
'''Ryan McGivern''' (born 8 January 1990) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish Association footballfootballer, who plays for Football League OneLeague One side Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He can play as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft-back or a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender, and has represented Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland in international football.
He began his career with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, and after he won the FA Youth Cup with the club in 2008 he played on loan for Morecambe F.C.Morecambe, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Hibernian F.C.Hibernian. He spent the 2012–13 season on loan at Hibernian, playing on the losing side in the 2013 Scottish Cup Final2013 final of the Scottish Cup, before he joined the club permanently for a one season stay in the Scottish Premier League. He joined Port Vale in June 2014.
He won caps for Northern Ireland at under-16, under-17, Northern Ireland national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Northern Ireland national under-21 football teamunder-21 levels before he won his first senior cap in August 2008. He has also played for the Northern Ireland national football B teamNorthern Ireland B team.

Andreas Isaksson.name: Andreas Isaksson
Andreas Isaksson.intro:
'''Andreas Isaksson''' (; born 3 October 1981) is a SwedenSwedish football (association football)footballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Kasımpaşa Spor KulübüKasımpaşa in the TurkeyTurkish Süper Lig.
He began his career at local Trelleborgs FF, before briefly representing Juventus, and returned to Sweden where he won two Allsvenskan titles at Djurgårdens IF FotbollDjurgårdens. After two seasons at Stade Rennais, he was signed for £2 million by Manchester City of the Premier League, where he was not a regular. After four seasons in the Eredivisie at PSV Eindhoven, he joined Kasımpaşa on a free transfer in 2014.
Isaksson has earned 118 caps for Sweden from his debut in 2002, putting him third in their most capped players of all time. He was included in the Swedish squads for two World Cups and three UEFA European Championships.

Liam Fontaine.name: Liam Fontaine
Liam Fontaine.intro: '''Liam Vaughan Henry Fontaine''' (born 7 January 1986) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Hibernian F.C.Hibernian as a defender (association football)defender. He previously played in the Premier League for Fulham F.C.Fulham, in the Football League for Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and in the Scottish Premier League for Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock.

Demba Ba.name: Demba Ba
Demba Ba.intro:
'''Demba Ba''' (born 25 May 1985) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş and the Senegal national football teamSenegal national team.
He made his first-team debut with French team FC RouenRouen in 2005 before moving to R.E. MouscronMouscron and onto TSG 1899 Hoffenheim1899 Hoffenheim in Germany in 2007. In 2011, he moved to English Premier League side West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He played only 12 games for West Ham and despite being their league top goal scorer in the 2010–11 season, they were relegated to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship and Ba moved to Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. In January 2013, he completed a move to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for an undisclosed fee, before joining Beşiktaş for €6 million 18 months later.
Born in France, Ba has been a full international for Senegal since 2007 and represented the country at the 2012 Africa Cup of Nations.

Marcos Painter.name: Marcos Painter
Marcos Painter.intro:
'''Marcos David Painter''' (born 17 August 1986) is a association footballfootballer who plays predominantly as a left back.
Painter started his professional career with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in 2005, having progressed through the youth ranks at the club. He only made seven appearances for the club in a two-year spell, and moved to Football League OneLeague One club Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in November 2006, initially on loan (sports)loan, but on a permanent transfer in January 2007. He played 68 league games in three seasons for Swansea.
