He then spent three-and-a-half years with Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion for whom he played 90 league games for Brighton, and had a brief loan spell with League One AFC Bournemouth in February 2013. Released at the end of the 2012–13 season, he signed for Portsmouth in August 2013.
He represented the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland at under-21 level.cite news
url=
Marcos Painter.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Terry Phelan.name: Terry Phelan
Terry Phelan.intro: '''Terrence "Terry" Phelan''' (born 16 March 1967) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played as a defender (football)left-back from 1984 to 2009. He played in the Premier League for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Everton F.C.Everton, as well as in the Football League for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Fulham F.C.Fulham, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He finished his career abroad for Charleston Battery and Otago United. He also made 42 appearances for the Republic of Ireland national football teamIrish national team, whom he represented at the 1994 FIFA World Cup.

Carlos Villanueva.name: Carlos Villanueva
Carlos Villanueva.intro: '''Carlos Andrés Villanueva Rolland''' (born 5 February 1986) is a Chilean Association footballfootball player who is currently playing for Al-Shabab (United Arab Emirates)Al Shabab.

Lee Makel.name: Lee Makel
Lee Makel.intro: '''Lee Robert Makel''' (born 11 January 1973) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Cowdenbeath F.C.Cowdenbeath.

Lamine Diatta.name: Lamine Diatta
Lamine Diatta.intro: '''Lamine Diatta''' (born 2 July 1975 in Dakar) is a Senegalese Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender.

Cesc F\u00e0bregas.name: Cesc Fàbregas
Cesc F\u00e0bregas.intro:
'''Francesc "Cesc" Fàbregas i Soler''' (; born 4 May 1987) is a Spanish association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Spain national football teamSpain national team. Fàbregas plays mainly as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder or attacking midfielder but has also played as a Right wingerwinger or a second striker on some occasions.
Fàbregas started his career as a trainee with Barcelona but was signed by Premier League side Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in September 2003 at the age of 16. Following injuries to key midfielders in the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 season, he went on to establish himself as Arsenal's starting central midfielder, playmaker and Captain (association football)captain. He broke several of the club's records in the process, earning a reputation as one of the best young players in his position. After protracted transfer negotiations, Fàbregas returned to Barcelona; the Catalan giants signed the midfielder for an initial fee of £35 million with a further £5 million in variables on 15 August 2011. Despite competition from his international teammates Xavi and Andrés Iniesta, Fàbregas was a regular goalscorer in his three seasons at Barcelona, and won the first league title of his career in 2013. He signed for Chelsea in June 2014, for a fee in the region of €33 million.
In international football, the Spaniard's national career began when he represented the Under-17 side at the 2003 FIFA U-17 World Championship in Finland. As a result of his club performances, he was called up to the senior squad in 2006. He has played in the 2006 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2008, 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 2012, helping Spain to become eventual winners in the three most recent tournaments, and most notably setting up Andrés Iniesta for the winning goal in the 2010 FIFA World Cup Final in South Africa.

Mervyn Day.name: Mervyn Day
Mervyn Day.intro: '''Mervyn Day''' (born 26 June 1955 in Chelmsford, Essex) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played in the Football League as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United. He later managed Carlisle United. He was formerly chief scout at Leeds United F.C.Leeds United.

Jon Sheffield.name: Jon Sheffield
Jon Sheffield.intro: '''Jonathon Sheffield''' (born 1 February 1969 in Coventry) is an English peopleEnglish former professional association footballfootball goalkeeper.

Chris Kiwomya.name: Chris Kiwomya
Chris Kiwomya.intro:
'''Christopher Mark "Chris" Kiwomya''' (born 2 December 1969 in Huddersfield) is an English former professional association footballfootballer of Ugandan descent and was the manager of Football League One side Notts County F.C.Notts County. On 27 October 2013 Kiwomya left Notts County by mutual consent.
He played as a Forward (association football)forward from 1987 until 2002 notably in the Premier League for Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town and Arsenal F.C.Arsenal. He also played in the Football League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, as well as playing abroad for Le Havre ACLe Havre, Selangor FASelangor and AaB FodboldAaB. He also played for the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 team, and after retiring began coaching at former club Ipswich.

Sergio Ag\u00fcero.name: Sergio Agüero
Sergio Ag\u00fcero.intro:
'''Sergio Leonel "Kun" Agüero Del Castillo''' (; born 2 June 1988) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Premier League club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team. On 5 July 2003, he became the youngest player to debut in the Argentine Primera División at 15 years and 35 days, breaking the record previously established by Diego Maradona in Seasons in Argentine football1976. He plays with the shirt name '''Kun Agüero'''.
At international level, Agüero represented the Argentina national under-20 football teamArgentina under-20 team at the FIFA U-20 World Cup in 2005 FIFA World Youth Championship2005 and in 2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup2007, winning both tournaments. Agüero played at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Beijing Olympics, he scored two goals in the 3–0 semi-final win against Brazil national under-23 football teamBrazil as Argentina went on to win the gold medal. Agüero was selected to represent Argentina in the 2010 FIFA World Cup, 2014 FIFA World Cup and the 2011 Copa América.
In 2006, Agüero moved to Europe to play for La Liga side Atlético Madrid for a fee of €23 million from Club Atlético IndependienteIndependiente. He made a name for himself, attracting attention from Europe's top clubs by scoring 101 goals in 234 appearances while winning the UEFA Europa League and the UEFA Super Cup in 2010. Agüero moved to Premier League club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in July 2011 for List of most expensive association football transfersan undisclosed fee thought to be in the region of £35 million. On the last day of his debut season with the club, Agüero scored a 94th-minute winner against Queen's Park Rangers that earned Manchester City F.C.Manchester City its first league title in 44 years. In 2012, he won Manchester City F.C.Manchester City's player of the year as voted for by the fans. As of the end of the 2013–14 season, Agüero has the highest goals per minute ratio in the history of the Premier League averaging a goal every 115 minutes.

Joe Cole.name: Joe Cole
Joe Cole.intro:
'''Joseph John''' "'''Joe'''" '''Cole''' (born 8 November 1981) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a midfielder. He has been described as "a technically gifted player with the creativity to unlock a defence".
He started his career with West Ham United, where he played more than 120 Premier League  games during five years, until he left for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea in 2003. Cole won a number of trophies with Chelsea, including three Premier League titles and two FA Cups before leaving on a free transfer in July 2010 to join Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, who a year later loaned him to Lille OSCLille. In January 2013 he returned to West Ham and then joined Aston Villa after being released in May 2014.
A full international since 2001, Cole was capped by the England national football teamEngland national team on 56 occasions, scoring 10 goals. He was selected in the England squads for three World Cups and Euro 2004.

Titi Camara.name: Titi Camara
Titi Camara.intro: '''Aboubacar Sidiki "Titi" Camara''' (born 17 November 1972 in Conakry) is a former association footballfootball player who was also the coach of Guinea national football teamthe Guinean national team, which he captained and played for. He was also the Guinea sports minister before being replaced in October 2012. He is best known for his stint with Liverpool Football ClubLiverpool in the 1999-2000 season, where he scored 9 goals in 33 games, memorably scoring the winner in a game against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal at Highbury.

Michael Stewart.name: Michael Stewart
Michael Stewart.intro: '''Michael James Stewart''' (born 26 February 1981) is a Scottish former association footballfootballer. He is notable for beginning his career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and having played for both of the Edinburgh derby rivals, Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts and Hibernian F.C.Hibernian. He has also played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic during his career. Stewart has been capped four times for the Scotland national football team.

Steve Morrow.name: Steve Morrow
Steve Morrow.intro:
'''Stephen Joseph "Steve" Morrow''' (born 2 July 1970 in Belfast) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish former professional Association footballfootballer, manager and currently International Partnerships Performance Supervisor at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.
As a player Morrow operated as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1988 until 2003, playing in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and in Major League Soccer for Dallas Burn. He also played in the Football League for Reading F.C.Reading, Watford F.C.Watford, Barnet F.C.Barnet, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers and Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United. He received 39 caps for Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland, scoring once before moving into management with FC Dallas

Christian Edwards.name: Christian Edwards
Christian Edwards.intro: '''Christian Edwards''' (born 23 November 1975 in Caerphilly) is a Welsh peopleWelsh professional Association footballfootballer. He played in the centre of Defense (sport)defence and has also played on the right. He is currently the Director of Football at the University of Wales Institute Cardiff and Aberystwyth Town F.C.Aberystwyth Town.

Dorus de Vries.name: Dorus de Vries
Dorus de Vries.intro:
'''Dorus de Vries''' (born 29 December 1980) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
De Vries began his professional career in his native the Netherlands with Telstar (football club)Telstar, before spending three seasons with ADO Den Haag. He moved to Britain in 2006, when he spent a season at Scottish club Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic. before moving to Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City where he spent four seasons, culminating in promotion to the Premier League in 2011. He rejected a new deal with Swansea to instead join Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, with whom he spent two seasons largely as back-up before signing for his current club in July 2013.

Mark Noble.name: Mark Noble
Mark Noble.intro:
'''Mark James Noble''' (born 8 May 1987) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfieldercentral midfielder and is vice-captain of West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. He has played almost all his youth and first team football for West Ham apart from two short loan spells, at Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He has played for England national football teamEngland at England national under-16 football teamU16, England national under-17 football teamU17, England national under-18 football teamU18, England national under-19 football teamU19 and England national under-21 football teamU21 levels. He captained the U21 side, scoring three goals in twenty appearances. Noble is the longest serving player in West Ham's current squad, having been in the first team since 2004. He is West Ham's first-choice taker for penalty kicks and has won the club's Hammer of the year trophy twice.
In 2014 he was ranked in the top 5 penalty takers in the top European leagues and was in the top 10 in the world based on the percentage of penalties successfully converted since 2009. Noble has played more Premier League games for West Ham than any other player. He overtook Steve Potts (footballer)Steve Potts' previous record of 204 appearances on 29 November, 2014 in a 1–0 win against Newcastle United F.CNewcastle United.

Alan Wright.name: Alan Wright
Alan Wright.intro:
'''Alan Geoffrey Wright''' (born 28 September 1971 in Ashton-under-Lyne, Lancashire) is a retired English professional Association footballfootballer and more recently manager of Southport F.C.Southport after spells coaching at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria.
He has played over 750 league and cup games for eight clubs, including an eight-year spell for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He has also played for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Blackpool, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United plus he has had loan spells at Derby County F.C.Derby County, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest
His position was left back, and he is known for being one of the shortest players in Premier League history standing at only 5 feet 4 inches tall.

Peter Ndlovu.name: Peter Ndlovu
Peter Ndlovu.intro:
'''Peter Ndlovu''' (born 25 February 1973) is a Zimbabwean former professional association footballfootballer and is currently Manager at Mamelodi Sundowns F.C. (South Africa)
Born in Bulawayo, he played as a Forward (association football)striker from 1988 until 2011. He spent time playing in England, where he appeared in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and in the Football League for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town and Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He also played for Highlanders F.C.Highlanders, Mamelodi Sundowns F.C.Mamelodi Sundowns, Thanda Royal Zulu F.C.Thanda Royal Zulu, Highfield United and Black Mambas F.C.Black Mambas in South Africa. He was capped 100 times by his country, scoring 38 international goals.

Nikos Dabizas.name: Nikos Dabizas
Nikos Dabizas.intro: '''Nikolaos "Nikos" Dabizas''' (, born 3 August 1973 in Amyntaio) is a retired GreeceGreek professional Association footballfootballer and former Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos  and Larissa F.C.Larissa Defender (association football)defender. He was also in Greece national football teamGreece's 2004 European Football Championship winning squad.
Nikos Dabizas.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Paul Rideout.name: Paul Rideout
Paul Rideout.intro:
'''Paul Rideout''' (born 14 August 1964) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and Youth team coach of Major League Soccer side Sporting Kansas City.
As a player he was a striker (association football)striker from 1980 until 2002, notably in the Premier League with Everton F.C.Everton where he scored the winning goal in the 1995 FA Cup final. He also played in his native land for Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Notts County F.C.Notts County and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. During his career he also spent time in Italy, Scotland, China and the United States with A.S. BariBari, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Chongqing LifanQianwei Huandao, Chongqing LifanChongqing Huandao, Shenzhen Jianlibao and Kansas City Wizards. He was capped 6 times by England under-21 national football teamEngland U21, scoring one goal.

Damien Francis.name: Damien Francis
Damien Francis.intro: '''Damien Jerome Francis''' (born 27 February 1979 in Wandsworth, England) is a retired Jamaica national football teamJamaican international association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.

Elliot Grandin.name: Elliot Grandin
Elliot Grandin.intro:
''' Elliot Grandin ''' (born 17 October 1987) is a French association footballfootballer of Democratic Republic of the CongoCongolese origin who plays for Romanian side FC Astra GiurgiuAstra Giurgiu.
A Winger (association football)winger, Grandin can also play as a central attacking midfielder. He previously played in France for Stade Malherbe CaenSM Caen, Olympique de Marseille and a loan spell at Grenoble Foot 38Grenoble, as well as in Bulgaria for PFC CSKA SofiaCSKA Sofia.
He has played for France at France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level.

Gifton Noel-Williams.name: Gifton Noel-Williams
Gifton Noel-Williams.intro: '''Gifton Ruben Elisha Noel-Williams''' (born 21 January 1980) is an English association footballfootballer currently playing for Daventry Town F.C.Daventry Town.

Emmanuel Omoyinmi.name: Emmanuel Omoyinmi
Emmanuel Omoyinmi.intro: '''Emmanuel 'Manny' Omoyinmi''' (born 28 December 1977) is a Nigerian born EnglandEnglish former Association footballfootballer. He also played for England Schoolboys. He began his career at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, where he was most noted for an incident in which he played in a Football League CupLeague Cup quarter-final game when ineligible; West Ham were later knocked out of the competition in a replayed game. Following a series of loans to other clubs, Omoyinmi joined Oxford United F.C.Oxford United in 2000 for whom he made 67 league appearances, scoring nine goals. He then went on to play non-league football.

James Beattie.name: James Beattie
James Beattie.intro:
'''James Scott Beattie''' (born 27 February 1978) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)striker.
Born in Lancaster, LancashireLancaster, Lancashire, he came through the ranks at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, eventually signing professionally for them in 1995. Beattie then went on to have spells at Southampton F.C.Southampton, Everton F.C.Everton, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Rangers F.C.Rangers, and a short spell on loan at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, before eventually returning to Sheffield United for a second term. When signed by Everton, and for his first spell at Sheffield United, he commanded the highest fee ever paid for a player by each club at that time.

Michael Turner.name: Michael Turner
Michael Turner.intro: '''Michael Thomas Turner''' (born 9 November 1983) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Fulham F.C.Fulham on loan from Norwich City F.C.Norwich City as a Defender (association football)defender.

Stephen Hunt (footballer, born 1981).name: Stephen Hunt (footballer, born 1981)
Stephen Hunt (footballer, born 1981).intro:
'''Stephen Patrick Hunt''' (born 1 August 1981) is an Irish peopleIrish Republic of Ireland national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who plays for Football League ChampionshipChampionship club Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
Hunt's position is left midfieldermidfield, although he can also play at Defender (association football)#Full backleft back and as an attacking midfielder. He previously played for Brentford F.C.Brentford, Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace, Reading F.C.Reading, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. His younger brother, Noel HuntNoel, is also a footballer.

Gary McAllister.name: Gary McAllister
Gary McAllister.intro:
'''Gary McAllister''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 25 December 1964 in Newarthill, Motherwell, ScotlandMotherwell) is a ScotlandScottish former Professional sportprofessional football (soccer)footballer.
McAllister played primarily as a midfielder, in a successful career spanning over nineteen years. He started his career at local side Motherwell F.C.Motherwell before moving south of the border to Leicester City F.C.Leicester City at the age of 20. He then went on to play for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, and he later had spells at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City intersected by a brief, yet triumphant, stint at Liverpool F.C.Liverpool.
McAllister also represented his Scotland national football teamnational side for nine years, winning 57 Cap (sport)caps and scoring five goals. His leadership qualities were noticed, and he spent four successful years as Scotland captain in addition to two seasons as Leeds United captain. He was awarded an Order of the British EmpireMBE in the 2001 New Year Honours in recognition of his contribution to football.
As his playing career drew to a close he decided to enter the managerial side of the game. He did this first during his second stay at Coventry when he was appointed Manager (football)manager in April 2002. He resigned a month later and did not enter management again until he returned to Elland Road in January 2008 to replace Dennis Wise.
In April 2011, McAllister became the Caretaker Manager at Barclays Premier LeaguePremier League club Aston Villa due to the ill health of the then current Manager Gérard Houllier, McAllister was previously the Assistant Manager to Houllier prior to Houllier's ill health.

John Filan.name: John Filan
John Filan.intro:
'''John Richard Filan''' (born 8 February 1970 in Sydney, Australia) is an Australian former Association footballfootball player and Goalkeeping coach of A-League side Sydney F.C.
As a player he was a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1989 until 2008 and notably played in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic, having also been contracted without playing for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in England's top division. He also played in the The Football LeagueFootball League for Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers, and in his native country for St. George Saints Football ClubSt. George Saints, Wollongong Community Football ClubWollongong Wolves and Sydney F.C.. He was capped three times by Australia national football teamAustralia.

Richard Sneekes.name: Richard Sneekes
Richard Sneekes.intro: '''Richard Sneekes''' (born 30 October 1968 in Amsterdam) is a NetherlandsDutch former football (soccer)footballer, who played as a midfielder. He is now manager of Rushall Olympic who play in the Premier Division of the Northern Premier League

Garry Parker.name: Garry Parker
Garry Parker.intro:
'''Garry Parker''' (born 7 September 1965 in Oxford) is an English former professional association footballfootballer. He is currently first team coach at Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.
As a player he was a midfielder from 1983 to 2001, notably in the Premier League for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He also played for Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. He was cap (sport)capped by his country at England under-21 national football teamunder-21 and England B national football teamB international level. In 2001 he became caretaker manager of Leicester City F.C.Leicester City.

Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1991).name: Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1991)
Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1991).intro: '''Daniel "Danny" Wilson''' (born 27 December 1991) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who currently captains Scottish Championship club Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian, where he plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back. Wilson has previously played for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and Rangers F.C.Rangers and had loan spells at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City. He has also represented the Scotland national football teamScottish national team at Scotland national under-17 football teamU-17, Scotland national under-19 football teamU-19, Scotland national under-21 football teamU-21 and at full Scotland national football teaminternational level.
Danny Wilson (footballer, born 1991).position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Frank Sinclair.name: Frank Sinclair
Frank Sinclair.intro:
'''Frank Mohammed Sinclair''' (born 3 December 1971) is a association footballfootballer who is currently playing for Brackley Town F.C.Brackley Town in the Conference North. Between 2013 and 2015, he was the player-manager of Colwyn Bay F.C.Colwyn Bay.
Sinclair, a defender (association football)defender most notably spent time playing in the Premier League for both Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He has also played as a professional for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham and Hendon F.C.Hendon.
Born in England, Sinclair's Premier League appearances led him to be selected for Jamaica national football teamJamaica where he picked up 28 caps in his career including games played during FIFA World Cup 1998

Hugo Rodallega.name: Hugo Rodallega
Hugo Rodallega.intro:
'''Hugo Rodallega Martínez''' (born 25 July 1985) is a Colombian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for English club Fulham F.C.Fulham.
Rodallega started his professional career with Deportes Quindío in 2004. An impressive first season with the club earned him a call-up to represent Colombia national under-20 football teamColombia at the South American Youth ChampionshipU-20 South American Championship in 2005, where he went on to set a new record for most goals scored in the tournament. A move to Deportivo Cali and his senior international debut followed later in the year before he moved abroad, signing for Liga MXMexican Primera División side C.F. MonterreyMonterrey. A disappointing spell resulted in a loan move to Club AtlasAtlas before being transferred to Club NecaxaNecaxa in 2007.
In January 2009, he moved to Wigan Athletic for a fee of £4.5 million. After initially struggling at the club, he finished as the club's top goalscorer in his first full Premier League season. He scored 24 goals for the club, making him their all-time leading Premier League goalscorer.

Eduard Campabadal.name: Eduard Campabadal
Eduard Campabadal.intro: '''Eduard 'Edu' Campabadal Clarós''' (born 26 January 1993) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Córdoba CF. Mainly a Defender (association football)#Full backright back, he can also play as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Eduard Campabadal.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

\u00cdvar Ingimarsson.name: Ívar Ingimarsson
\u00cdvar Ingimarsson.intro:
'''Ívar Ingimarsson''' (born 20 August 1977), is an Icelandic former professional association footballfootballer. He began his career in Iceland with Valur and Íþróttabandalag VestmannaeyjaÍBV before moving to England where, after an initial loan spell with Torquay United F.C.Torquay United, he joined Brentford F.C.Brentford, making over 100 appearances. He moved to Reading F.C.Reading in 2003, spending the next eight years with club and amassing 281 appearances before ending his career with a short spell at Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town.
At international level Ívar represented Iceland at Iceland national under-17 football teamunder-17, Iceland national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Iceland national under-21 football teamunder-21 level before making his Iceland national football teamsenior debut in 1998. After thirty appearances he retired from international football in 2007.
\u00cdvar Ingimarsson.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Sulley Muntari.name: Sulley Muntari
Sulley Muntari.intro:
'''Suleyman Ali "Sulley" Muntari''' (; born 27 August 1984) is a Ghana national football teamGhanaian international Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Centralcentral midfielder for A.C. MilanMilan.
During his time at Internazionale, he helped the team win the UEFA Champions LeagueChampions League in 2009–10 UEFA Champions League2009–10 and the Serie A title in 2008–09 Serie A2008–09 and 2009–10 Serie A2009–10. He was also part of the Portsmouth team that won the FA Cup in 2007–08 FA Cup2007–08. A full international for Ghana national football teamGhana since 2002, he has earned over 80 caps for the national team and has been selected for two Africa Cup of Nations tournaments and all three of their World Cups.
He is the elder brother of CFR Cluj player Sulley Muniru.

Frazer Richardson.name: Frazer Richardson
Frazer Richardson.intro:
'''Frazer Richardson''' (born 29 October 1982) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United.
Richardson began his career with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United where he spent nine years making 186 appearances only interrupted by two loan spells at Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in 2003. He joined Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic in July 2009 where he spent the 2009–10 Charlton Athletic F.C. season2009–10 season. He then  had spells with Southampton F.C.Southampton, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town before joining his home-town club Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United in June 2014.

Ifeanyi Udeze.name: Ifeanyi Udeze
Ifeanyi Udeze.intro:
'''Ifeanyi Udeze''' (born 21 July 1980) is a Nigerian football player. He played for Nigeria national football teamNigeria and was a participant at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup and is currently a free agent after being released by PAOK FCPAOK Thessaloniki in the winter of the 2007-08 season.
With a height of 1.79 m, he usually plays as a left fullback, being also used as center back when needed.

Paolo Tramezzani.name: Paolo Tramezzani
Paolo Tramezzani.intro:
'''Paolo Tramezzani''' (born 30 July 1970) is an Italian born retired footballer and currently assistant coach of Albania national football teamAlbania.
Tramezzani was born at Castelnovo ne' Monti, in Emilia-RomagnaEmilia.
He started his career at Italian team A.C. PratoPrato, and also played for Cosenza Calcio 1914Cosenza, A.S. Lucchese Libertas 1905Lucchese, Inter milanInter Milan, F.B.C. Unione VeneziaVenezia, A.C. CesenaCesena and Piacenza CalcioPiacenza before transferring to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in the summer of 1998, managed at the time by Christian Gross. Although scoring on his debut in a friendly against Peterborough United F.C.Peterborough United, his time at Spurs was short-lived. He was transferred to A.C. PistoiesePistoese in Italy for £400,000. He later returned to Piacenza CalcioPiacenza, and finished his career at Atalanta B.C.Atalanta.

Christian Poulsen.name: Christian Poulsen
Christian Poulsen.intro:
'''Christian Bjørnshøj Poulsen''' (born 28 February 1980) is a DenmarkDanish association footballfootballer who currently plays for FC Copenhagen. He has played for a number of European clubs, winning the Danish Superliga championship with F.C. Copenhagen, the German DFB-Ligapokal trophy with FC Schalke 04, and the European UEFA Cup with SpainSpanish team Sevilla FC and with ItalyItalian Serie A club Juventus.
He has been a regular member of the Denmark national football team since his debut in 2001, and has played 92 matches, scoring six goals for his country. He represented Denmark at the 2002 FIFA World Cup, 2010 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 20042004 European Championship international tournaments. Poulsen was named 2001 Danish Football Player of the Year#Young Players of the YearDanish ''under-21 Player of the Year'', and won the 2005 and 2006 Danish Football Player of the YearDanish ''Player of the Year'' awards; the first to win two years in a row.

Paul Merson.name: Paul Merson
Paul Merson.intro:
'''Paul Charles Merson''' (born 20 March 1968) is an English professional footballer and manager, turned football television pundit. As a player he played as a Forward (football)forward and later as a playmakerplaymaking midfielder (association football)midfielder in a career that lasted from 1985 to 2006.
He notably played in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, as well as appearing in the Football League for Brentford F.C.Brentford and Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth. He also played for Walsall F.C.Walsall where he spent two years as player-manager before finishing his career in Non-League football with Tamworth F.C.Tamworth. He briefly came out of retirement in 2012 for Welshpool Town F.C.Welshpool Town where he played in a one-off game. Merson earned 21 caps for England national football teamEngland, scoring 3 times.

David Bardsley.name: David Bardsley
David Bardsley.intro: '''David John Bardsley''' (born 11 September 1964 in Manchester) is an English former professional association footballfootballer. His career lasted 20 years, and included one appearance for the national team. After his retirement, he opened football schools in England and the United States.

Grant Holt.name: Grant Holt
Grant Holt.intro:
'''Grant Holt''' (born 12 April 1981) is an English professional footballer who plays for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He commonly plays as a Forward (association football)striker.
Holt played for a number of non-league and professional clubs, notably making nearly 100 league appearances for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest before signing for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town in 2008 where he became top goalscorer, from Shrewsbury he signed for Norwich in 2009. The move was an immediate success: in the 2009–10 in English football2009–10 season, Holt finished the season winning the Norwich City F.C. Player of the YearNorwich City Player of the Year award, after scoring 30 goals in 44 appearances for the club (24 in the league) and was one of the leading scorers in Football League One. In the 2010–11 in English football2010–11 season, Holt continued to be a prolific scorer, and was runner-up in the League Player of the Year awards.

Davide Santon.name: Davide Santon
Davide Santon.intro: '''Davide Santon''' (; born 2 January 1991) is an Italian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale and the Italy national football teamItaly national team as a left-back. He started his career as a right sided attacker or winger, later reverting to an attacking full back who can play on both sides, and is known for his pacy, energetic runs down the flank. Santon also possesses notable strength, as well as good dribbling technique and defensive awareness. His precocious displays for Internazionale Milano F.C.Inter and Italy in 2009 led his coaches at the time, José Mourinho and Marcello Lippi, to describe him as a "predestined player", also comparing him to legendary Italian left-backs such as Paolo MaldiniMaldini and Giacinto FacchettiFacchetti. In 2010, he was included in the Don Balón list of the best young footballers in the world, born after 1989.

Albert Crusat.name: Albert Crusat
Albert Crusat.intro:
'''Albert Crusat Domènech''' (born 13 May 1982) is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played mostly as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger, from where he often relied on his dribbling ability and incredible pace.
After starting out at RCD EspanyolEspanyol he spent most of his professional career with UD AlmeríaAlmería, appearing in 212 official games and scoring 34 goals over the course of six seasons, four of those in La Liga. He also played two years in England with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic.

Sotirios Kyrgiakos.name: Sotirios Kyrgiakos
Sotirios Kyrgiakos.intro: '''Sotirios Kyrgiakos''' () (born 23 July 1979) is a GreeksGreek association footballfootballer who last played for Sydney Olympic as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Sotirios Kyrgiakos.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Ian Henderson.name: Ian Henderson
Ian Henderson.intro: '''Ian Henderson''' (born 24 January 1985) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who currently plays for English Football League OneLeague One club Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale as a Forward (association football)forward or as a midfielder. He has previously represented England at England national under-18 football teamunder-18 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level and is also eligible to represent Scotland national football teamScotland.

Carl Tiler.name: Carl Tiler
Carl Tiler.intro: '''Carl Tiler''' (born 11 February 1970) is an English former association footballfootballer who played as a defender (football)central defender. He made more than 250 appearances in the Football League and Premier League, representing nine different clubs.

Peter Reid.name: Peter Reid
Peter Reid.intro:
'''Peter Reid''' (born 20 June 1956) is an English Association footballfootball Manager (association football)manager, pundit (expert)pundit and retired player, who is currently with Mumbai City FCMumbai City.
A Midfielder (association football)#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder in his playing days, Reid enjoyed a long and successful career. He built his reputation as one of England's brightest midfield talents of the time at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, before signing for Everton F.C.Everton in 1982. It was there that he enjoyed the most fruitful spell of his career, as he helped the club win domestic and European honours, including the Football League twice. He was voted as the PFA Players' Player of the Year in 1985 and came fourth in the World Soccer Player of the Year award, behind Michel Platini, Preben Elkjær LarsenPreben Elkjær and Diego Maradona. He also received his first senior England national football teamEngland call-up that year, and represented his country at the 1986 FIFA World Cup and UEFA Euro 19881988 UEFA European Championship. He won 13 Caps (sport)caps in total. Reid joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 1989, but moved on to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City a year later to begin his managerial career.
He spent three years at Maine Road as player-manager, and guided them to two fifth-place finishes in the Football League First DivisionFirst Division, the first of which saw them finish above their city rivals Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. He was persuaded to resume his playing career after leaving Manchester City, and briefly played for Southampton F.C.Southampton, Notts County F.C.Notts County and Bury F.C.Bury before returning to management with Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland in 1995. He won promotion to the Premier League with the club on two occasions and achieved two seventh-place finishes in the top division. He combined his role at the Stadium of Light with the job as manager of the England national under-21 football teamEngland U21 for a brief spell in 1999. His seven-year association with Sunderland ended in 2002 and he returned to management a year later, helping Leeds United F.C.Leeds United avoid relegation from the Premier League. Reid left Elland Road the following season.
He was appointed manager of Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 2004 but his tenure lasted less than a year. He then worked as a pundit for the BBC at the 2006 FIFA World Cup, and also worked for Sky Sports and ESPN before returning to management with Thailand national football teamThailand in 2008. He won the T&T Cup with the country before returning to England as assistant manager to Tony Pulis at Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, and helped them to an eleventh-place finish in the Premier League. He then managed Plymouth Argyle, taking over in June 2010, but was sacked after just over a year at the Devon club.
Peter Reid.position: Midfielder  association football  Defensive midfielder Defensive midfielder

Michael Bridges.name: Michael Bridges
Michael Bridges.intro: '''Michael Bridges''' (born 5 August 1978) is an English Forward (Association football)football striker who plays for Lambton Jaffas FC in the NBN State Football League.

Jamal Campbell-Ryce.name: Jamal Campbell-Ryce
Jamal Campbell-Ryce.intro: '''Jamal Julian Campbell-Ryce''' (born 6 April 1983) is an EnglandEnglish-Jamaican Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Notts County F.C.Notts County, on loan from Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. Born in Lambeth, Greater London he began his career with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic in 2001 from where he has moved to a number of clubs including Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, Southend United F.C.Southend United, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Bristol City F.C.Bristol City and Notts County F.C.Notts County before joining the Blades in 2014. He is also a former Jamaica national football teamJamaican international, qualifying through his parentage.

Asamoah Gyan.name: Asamoah Gyan
Asamoah Gyan.intro:
'''Asamoah Gyan''' (,  , born 22 November 1985 in Accra) is a Ghanaian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker for Al Ain FCAl Ain of the UAE Pro-League and Captain (association football)captains the Ghana national football teamGhanaian national team.
Gyan began his career in 2003 with Ghanaian Premier League club Liberty Professionals F.C.Liberty Professionals scoring a prolific ten goals in sixteen matches then spent three seasons with Serie A club Udinese via two seasons Loan (sports)loan at Modena F.C.Modena netting on fifteen occasions in fifty-three league matches and at Udinese CalcioUdinese where he scored eleven times in thirty-nine league matches. In 2008, Gyan joined Ligue 1 club Stade Rennais F.C.Rennes, netting fourteen times in forty-eight league matches during two seasons. In 2010, Gyan joined Premier League club Sunderland, breaking the club's Transfer windowtransfer record and netting on ten occasions in thirty-four Premier League matches during two seasons. In 2011, Gyan joined Al Ain FCAl Ain of the UAE Pro-League on loan and become the league's top-goalscorer, scoring twenty-four times in twenty-seven matches. In the following season, Gyan permanently joined Al Ain and once again became the league's top-goalscorer while he helped Al Ain retain the UAE Pro-League title, scoring an impressive twenty-eight goals in thirty-two matches. In the 2013–14 Arabian Gulf League2013–14 season, Gyan prolifically scored on forty-four occasions in forty matches with Al Ain.
Gyan represented Ghana at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup scoring the fastest Goal (sport)goal of the tournament after 68 seconds, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 FIFA World Cups, scoring three Goal (sport)goals in 2010, and also missing a crucial penalty kick in the last minute of extra-time in a 2010 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Uruguay vs Ghanaquarter-final defeat at the hands of Uruguay national football teamUruguay. In 2014, at the 2014 FIFA World Cup2014 World Cup Gyan became the top African goalscorer in the history of the FIFA World CupWorld Cup.
Gyan is the all-time leading goalscorer of the Ghana national football team nicknamed ''Black Stars'', and Gyan has represented Ghana at the Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2004 Summer Olympics and in 5 Africa Cup of Nations in 2006 Africa Cup of Nations2006, 2008 Africa Cup of Nations2008, 2010 Africa Cup of Nations2010, 2012 Africa Cup of Nations2012 and 2013 Africa Cup of Nations2013 finishing third-place at the 2008 Africa Cup of Nations and runner-up at the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations then fourth-place twice in a row at the 2012 Africa Cup of Nations and at the 2013 Africa Cup of Nations.

Leandro Bacuna.name: Leandro Bacuna
Leandro Bacuna.intro: '''Leandro Jones Johan Bacuna''' (born 21 August 1991) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a Midfielder#wingerwinger and Defender (association football)right back. Bacuna has been capped 20 times at youth levels for the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team and also represented the Netherlands Antilles national football teamNetherlands Antilles at youth level.

John Johnson.name: John Johnson
John Johnson.intro:
'''John James Johnson''' (born 16 September 1988) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Indian club Bengaluru FC. A graduate of the Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough youth academy he made his debut for the club against Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. A lack of first team opportunities saw him being Loan (sports)loaned to Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, before being loaned to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town.
After playing for a season on loan, Northampton signed Johnson on a permanent basis. He was also given captain (association football)club captainship but was replaced in the role after the arrival of Clarke Carlisle. In the 2012-13 Football League Two2012–13 season, his appearances for the club were hindered due to a cartilage injury. Johnson then signed for debutant Bengaluru FC in the I-League in India, managed by his former Northampton Town teammate Ashley Westwood (footballer born 1976)Ashley Westwood. Johnson, along with Kenyan Curtis Osano, became the first foreigners to play for the club.

John Hills.name: John Hills
John Hills.intro: '''John David Hills''' (born 21 April 1978) is a former English Association footballfootballer.

'''Gary Oliver Kelly''' (born 9 July 1974) is an Irish former Association footballfootballer who played his entire professional career with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United.
He played as a Defender (association football)#Full backright back or a right midfielder from 1992 until 2007 and made 531 appearances in total for Leeds, being the only player at Leeds to make more than 500 appearances from outside the stewardship of Don Revie.
Gary Kelly (footballer, born 1974).position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Torben Piechnik.name: Torben Piechnik

Kieran Richardson.intro: '''Kieran Edward Richardson''' (born 21 October 1984) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. He is a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger, but has proven to be versatile, having also played as a left-back, right winger, central midfielder and on occasion as a support striker. Richardson began his career as a trainee at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United, going on to have extended spells at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and Fulham F.C.Fulham. He has also been capped eight times for England national football teamEngland, scoring twice.

Dwight Tiendalli.name: Dwight Tiendalli
Dwight Tiendalli.intro:
'''Dwight Tiendalli''' (; born 21 October 1985 in Paramaribo) is a Surinamese-born Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full backfull back for Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough on loan from Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City.
He is a former Netherlands national under-21 football teamDutch Under-21 international, and was part of the FC Twente team which won the 2009-10 Eredivisie. After his first season with Swansea, in which the team 2013 Football League Cup Finalwon the League Cup, Tiendalli was capped for the first time by the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team.
Dwight Tiendalli.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Tony Caig.name: Tony Caig
Tony Caig.intro: '''Antony''' "'''Tony'''" '''Caig''' (born 11 April 1974 in Cleator Moor, Cumbria) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball goalkeeper (football)goalkeeper who is currently goalkeeping coach for Football League Two club Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.

Carlos Marinelli.name: Carlos Marinelli
Carlos Marinelli.intro:
'''Carlos Marinelli''' (born 14 March 1982 in Villa de Mayo, Buenos Aires) is an ArgentinaArgentine Association footballfootballer who plays for Universidad San Martín in Peru, as an attacking midfielder.
Marinelli started off his career with his boyhood club Boca Juniors. He stayed at Boca until 1999 when Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough signed him for £1.5 million. He was billed as the new Maradona,[

title=Rampant Boro thrash Derby

date=1 October 2002 accessdate=2 November 2009 He generally failed to live up to expectations, and on 31 January 2003 left the Riverside Stadium  to sign on loan for Torino F.C.  During the 2005–06 season, he joined Portuguese side SC Braga on a transfer, playing until the end of that season.
In 2007, he joined the Kansas City Wizards of Major League Soccer.[
However, twelve games into the Copa Mustang I 2009, he was released by Millonarios along with four other under-productive players. He was linked with a return to England with Exeter City before moving back to Argentina in the second division with Aldosivi.[
Marinelli then signed with Peruvian first division team Universidad San Martín de Porres.

Tom Cleverley.name: Tom Cleverley
Tom Cleverley.intro:
'''Thomas William "Tom" Cleverley'''  (born 12 August 1989) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, on loan from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, and England national football teamEngland.
After starting his career in the youth set-up at Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Cleverley joined Manchester United at the age of 12. Between 2007 and 2009 he played for Manchester United's reserve team, and occasionally in first team friendly matches. Cleverley was loaned to Football League OneLeague One side Leicester City F.C.Leicester City at the start of 2009, for whom he made his first Football League appearances, helping the team secure the League One title and promotion to the Football League ChampionshipChampionship. He spent the 2009–10 Watford F.C. season2009–10 season on loan with Watford F.C.Watford in the Championship, where he scored 11 goals in 33 league games and was voted as their Watford F.C. Player of the SeasonPlayer of the Season. On 31 August 2010, he joined Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic on a season-long loan, where he scored four goals in 25 appearances and helped them to avoid relegation on the final day of the season. He returned to Manchester United for the start of the 2011–12 Manchester United F.C. season2011–12 season and made his first competitive appearance in the FA Community ShieldCommunity Shield victory against Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
Cleverley played for Great Britain Olympic football teamGreat Britain at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics, and later that year made his debut for the senior England team.

Nico Yennaris.name: Nico Yennaris
Nico Yennaris.intro: '''Nicholas Harry "Nico" Yennaris''' (born 24 May 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers on loan from Brentford F.C.Brentford as a Defender (association football)full back. He began his career in the Arsenal F.C. Academyacademy at Premier League side Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and has been described as a "rugged, all action defensive player, with a positive, winning mentality".

Ignasi Miquel.name: Ignasi Miquel
Ignasi Miquel.intro: '''Ignasi Miquel Pons''' (born 28 September 1992) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer player who plays for English club Norwich City F.C.. Ignasi is a Defender (association football)central defender, but can also be utilized at left back. He is a Spain national youth football teamSpanish youth international and has played for the Spain national under-21 football teamunder-21 team, Spain national under-19 football teamunder-19 team and Spain national under-16 football teamunder-16 team.

Peter Billing.name: Peter Billing
Peter Billing.intro:
'''Peter Graham Billing''' (born 24 October 1964) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played in Defender (association football)central defence. He made 224 league appearances in an eleven-year career in the Football League.
A former South Liverpool F.C.South Liverpool player, he turned professional with Everton F.C.Everton in January 1986. He featured in the Super Cup (English football)Super Cup final, but was sold on to Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra for £12,000 in December 1986. He helped the "Railwaymen" to win promotion out of the Football League Fourth DivisionFourth Division in 1988–89, before he was sold on to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City for £120,000 in June 1989. He made 58 top-flight appearances for the "Sky Blues", before joining Port Vale F.C.Port Vale for a £35,000 fee in May 1993, following a successful three-month loan spell in which he featured in the club's Football League Trophy 1993 Football League Trophy Finalsuccess. He helped the "Valiants" to win promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division in 1993–94, but was allowed to leave on a free transfer in May 1995. He then spent a season each with Hartlepool United F.C.Hartlepool United and former club Crewe Alexandra, before he went into non-league football with Northwich Victoria F.C.Northwich Victoria.

Craig Beattie.name: Craig Beattie
Craig Beattie.intro:
'''Craig Beattie''' (born 16 January 1984) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer, who currently plays for Scottish League One side Ayr United F.C.Ayr United, where he plays as a Forward (association football)striker.
He started his career with Celtic F.C.Celtic before moving on to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and then Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City where he has had loan spells with several Football League clubs. He then returned to Scotland to play for Heart of Midlothian F.C.Hearts, where he won a Scottish Cup winners medal. Beattie has since played for St Johnstone F.C.St Johnstone, Barnet F.C.Barnet and Dundee F.C.Dundee.
He has seven caps for the Scotland national football team scoring once. He has also represented Scotland at Scotland national under-19 football teamu-19, Scotland Under-21 national football teamu-21 and Scotland B national football teamB levels.

Georgi Kinkladze.name: Georgi Kinkladze
Georgi Kinkladze.intro:
'''Georgi Kinkladze''' (; born 6 July 1973), also spelled as '''Georgiou''', or '''Giorgi''', or shortened to '''Gio''', is a Georgia (country)Georgian former Association footballfootballer, who played as a playmakerplaymaking midfielder. Born in the Georgian capital Tbilisi, his first professional club was Mretebi Tbilisi. In Georgia he won three league titles and two cups with FC Dinamo TbilisiDinamo Tbilisi, and was named national player of the year twice. He first came to international prominence with his performances for the Georgia national football teamGeorgian national team against Wales national football teamWales in 1994 and 1995.
Kinladze transferred from Dinamo Tbilisi to English Premier League club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1995, where his dribbling ability and spectacular goals made him a cult hero, winning the club's Player of the Year award in two consecutive seasons. Kinkladze stayed with Manchester City despite Promotion and relegationrelegation to the Football League First Division in 1996, but the club continued to decline, and after a second relegation in 1998 he joined Dutch champions AFC AjaxAjax. Kinkladze was unable to settle in the Netherlands, and returned to England with Derby County F.C.Derby County a little over a year later. He spent four years at Derby, making nearly 100 appearances. After leaving Derby in 2003, he became a Journeyman (sports)#Association footballjourneyman footballer, having unsuccessful trials at several clubs before joining Cypriot club Anorthosis Famagusta FCAnorthosis in 2004, where he won a Cypriot First Divisionleague championship medal. He finished his playing career with Russian club FC Rubin KazanRubin Kazan in 2006.

Owen Morrison.name: Owen Morrison
Owen Morrison.intro:
'''Owen Morrison''' (born 8 December 1981 in Derry) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish Association footballfootballer who is currently unattached.
He has previously played in the League of Ireland for Sligo Rovers F.C.Sligo Rovers and had three separate seasons for his hometown club Derry City F.C.Derry City. He has also played for English sides Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, as well as Dunfermline Athletic F.C.Dunfermline Athletic in Scotland.

Erik Pieters.name: Erik Pieters
Erik Pieters.intro:
'''Erik Pieters''' () (born 7 August 1988) is a Dutch peopleDutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)left back for Premier League club Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team.
Pieters began his career with FC UtrechtUtrecht and made his professional debut in August 2006. He impressed enough at the Stadion Galgenwaard to earn a move to PSV Eindhoven in July 2008 for €2.5 million. At PSV he won the Johan Cruijff Shield in Johan Cruijff-schaal XIII2008 and the KNVB Beker in 2011–12 KNVB Cup2011–12 and also became a regular member of the Netherlands national football teamDutch national team. Injuries hampered his progress in 2012–13 Eredivisie2012–13 before he moved to English side Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in June 2013 for €3.6 million.
Erik Pieters.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

'''Ian James Rush''', Order of the British EmpireMBE, (born 20 October 1961 in St Asaph, Wales) is a Welsh former association footballfootballer. Rush played for Liverpool F.C. from 1980-1987 and 1988-1996, and is the club's List of Liverpool F.C. records and statistics#Top goalscorersall-time leading goalscorer, having scored a total of 346 goals in all competitions during his two spells at the club. Regarded as one of the greatest ever Liverpool players, Rush  came 3rd in the "100 Players Who Shook The Kop" – an official Liverpool fan poll.[
Rush also had short spells playing at Chester City F.C.Chester City, Juventus, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, Wrexham F.C.Wrexham and Sydney Olympic.  He made 73 appearances for the Wales national football team and he remains the record goalscorer for Wales with 28 goals between 1980 and 1996.
Since retiring as a player in 2000, Rush has had a stint as manager of Chester City (2004–05), and has worked as a television football pundit.
He is also acclaimed for his moustache

Jes H\u00f8gh.name: Jes Høgh
Jes H\u00f8gh.intro: '''Jes Høgh''' (born 7 May 1966) is a former DenmarkDanish association footballfootball player. He was a part of the Denmark team that won the King Fahd Cup 19951995 King Fahd Cup.

He was forced to retire in 1997 following a succession of injuries. Barnes represented England national football teamEngland at England national under-19 football teamunder-19 level.
David Barnes.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Kevin Kyle.name: Kevin Kyle
Kevin Kyle.intro: '''Kevin Alastair Kyle''' (born 7 June 1981 in Stranraer, Scotland) is a association footballfootballer who plays as a centre forward. Kyle has represented Scotland 10 times at full international level.

Nery Castillo.intro: '''Nery Alberto Castillo Confalonieri''' (born 13 June 1984) is a Mexican peopleMexican Association footballfootballer who is a free agent.
Nery Castillo.position: Midfielder Winger Winger,Forward  association football  Forward

Shayne Bradley.name: Shayne Bradley
Shayne Bradley.intro: '''Shayne Bradley''' (born 8 December 1979 in Gloucester) was a professional Association footballfootballer before having to retire through an ankle injury in 2003.

Kelvin Etuhu.name: Kelvin Etuhu
Kelvin Etuhu.intro: '''Kelvin Peter Etuhu''' (born 30 May 1988 in Kano) is a Nigerian Association footballfootballer who currently plays for Bury F.C.Bury following his release from Barnsley F.C.Barnsley. Etuhu has two older brothers, Dickson Etuhu, also a professional footballer, and Michael Etuhu, who is still at university. Etuhu grew up in Peckham, South London and attended Saint Thomas the Apostle boys school.

Tom\u00e1\u0161 Rosick\u00fd.name: Tomáš Rosický
Tom\u00e1\u0161 Rosick\u00fd.intro:
'''Tomáš Rosický''' (; born 4 October 1980) is a Czech Association footballfootballer who plays for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and is the current captain of the Czech Republic national football teamCzech Republic national team. He was nicknamed "the little Mozart" for his ability to orchestrate the midfield.
He started his professional career at his hometown club AC Sparta Prague, playing three seasons in the Czech First League before moving to Borussia Dortmund in 2001 for Deutsche MarkDM 25 million (approximately Pound sterling£18 million), at the time a record transfer fee paid by a Bundesliga club. Rosický joined Arsenal in 2006, and has since made over 200 appearances for the club, including their victory in the 2014 FA Cup Final.
Internationally, Rosický made his debut for the Czech Republic in 2000 and became captain (association football)captain of his country in 2006. He has taken part in three UEFA European Championships as well as the 2006 FIFA World Cup.

Tommy Carroll.name: Tommy Carroll
Tommy Carroll.intro:
'''Thomas James Carroll''' (born 28 May 1992) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers on loan from Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur as a central midfielder.
He plays as a deep-lying creative central midfielder, and is particularly valued for his high passing percentage accuracy and creativity.

Pablo Cou\u00f1ago.name: Pablo Couñago
Pablo Cou\u00f1ago.intro:
'''Pablo González Couñago''' (born 9 August 1979) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for Finnish club PK-35 Vantaa as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
After having played in 35 La Liga matches for Celta de VigoCelta and Málaga CFMálaga, scoring three goals (75/11 both Spanish football league systemmajor levels of Spanish football combined), he spent the bulk of his professional career in England with Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town, where he scored a total of 65 official goals.
Couñago represented Spain national under-20 football teamSpain in the 1999 FIFA World Youth Championship1999 World Youth Championship, winning the tournament.

Paul Trollope.name: Paul Trollope
Paul Trollope.intro:
'''Paul Jonathan Trollope''' (born 3 June 1972) is a former Wales national football teamWelsh international Association footballfootball midfielder and current head coach of Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City. He was manager of Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers from 2005 to 2010.
As a player, he began his career with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town in 1989, but made his name at Torquay United F.C.Torquay United between 1992 and 1995. He then transferred to Derby County F.C.Derby County, before signing with Fulham F.C.Fulham in 1997. After five years he moved on to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town via Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He joined his final club, Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers, in 2004, before retiring as a player in 2007.
While still a player, he was appointed caretaker-manager of Bristol Rovers in 2005. Impressing in the position he was handed the job permanently, and took the club to the Football League Trophy final in 2006–07 Football League Trophy2007, as well victory in the 2007 Football League Two play-off FinalLeague Two play-off Final. Stabilizing the club in Football League OneLeague One, he took Rovers to the FA Cup quarter-finals in 2007–08 FA Cup2008, equalling a club record in the competition. After two more seasons finishing mid-table in League One, he was sacked after a poor start to 2010–11 Bristol Rovers F.C. season2010–11. He was first-team coach at Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City for the 2011–12 season, and then followed manager Chris Hughton to Norwich City F.C.Norwich City until April 2014.

Nayim.name: Nayim
Nayim.intro:
'''Mohammed Alí Amar''' (born 5 November 1966), commonly known as '''Nayim''', is a Spanish retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder.
He scored a last-minute goal for Real Zaragoza in the 1995 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup Final against Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, with a 40-yard lob in the final minute of Overtime (sports)extra time. Over the course of eight seasons in La Liga, he played 130 games and scored five goals.
Having started his professional career with FC BarcelonaBarcelona, Nayim also represented Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham for five years.

Tommy Goodwin.name: Tommy Goodwin
Tommy Goodwin.intro: '''Tommy Goodwin''' (born 8 November 1979) is an English Association footballfootball defender (football)defender.

Fredrik Ljungberg.name: Fredrik Ljungberg
Fredrik Ljungberg.intro:
'''Karl Fredrik "Freddie" Ljungberg''' () (born 16 April 1977 in Vittsjö, Sweden) is a Swedish former footballer who played as a Winger (sports)winger.
He began his career at Halmstads BK and went on to spend most of his career at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal, where he won honours including two Premier League titles and two FA Cups, scoring in two finals including the 2002 FA Cup Finalvictory in 2002. After leaving Arsenal in 2007, he had short spells at a number of clubs in England, Scotland, the United States, Japan and India. An international for a full decade, Ljungberg earned 75 caps and was captain of the Sweden national football teamSwedish national team until he announced his international retirement after UEFA Euro 2008.
Ljungberg was a model for Calvin Klein underwear until 2007. He previously represented brands such as Nike, Inc.Nike, Procter & Gamble, L'Oreal and currently represents Puma AGPuma, ESPN and Pepsi, as well as running his own blog since October 2009.

Gary Doherty.name: Gary Doherty
Gary Doherty.intro:
'''Gary Michael Thomas Doherty''' (born 31 January 1980) is a retired Irish professional Association footballfootballer who previously played for Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. He plays as a defender, having previously also played as a centre forward.
Doherty played international football for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland but has not been in the squad since the reign of former manager Giovanni Trapattoni. He began his career at Luton Town F.C.Luton Town before having a spell with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League, however, most of his career was with Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, for whom he won the Norwich City player of the yearplayer of the year award.
Gary Doherty.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Defender

Colin Hendry.name: Colin Hendry
Colin Hendry.intro: '''Edward Colin Hendry''' (born 7 December 1965) is a Scottish football player and coach. Hendry, who played as a Defender (association football)defender, started his career with Dundee F.C.Dundee in 1983. and spent spells at Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Rangers F.C.Rangers, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers and Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He was part of the Blackburn squad that won the Premier LeagueEnglish Premiership in 1994–95 in English football1995 and the Rangers squad that won the Scottish domestic treble in 1998–99 in Scottish football1998–99. He has had management stints at Blackpool and Clyde F.C.Clyde.

Tom Craddock.name: Tom Craddock
Tom Craddock.intro: '''Thomas "Tom" Craddock''' (born 14 October 1986) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth as a forward (association football)striker.

Bernie Slaven.name: Bernie Slaven
Bernie Slaven.intro:
'''Bernard Joseph''' "'''Bernie'''" '''Slaven''' (born 13 November 1960) is a Scottish-born former Republic of IrelandIrish Association footballfootballer. A Forward (association football)striker, with 162 goals in 423 league games, in a 12-year career, he also earned seven caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. On 19 August 1992, he became Ireland's first goalscorer in England's newly formed Premier League.
He started his career in his native Scotland with Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton in 1980, before moving on to Airdrieonians F.C. (1878)Airdrieonians, Queen of the South F.C.Queen of the South, and then Albion Rovers F.C.Albion Rovers in 1983. He stayed with Albion Rovers until 1985, when he signed with English the Football LeagueFootball League club Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. It was with "Boro" that he made his name, staying for eight years, he made over 300 appearances, scoring an average of one goal every three games, and being promoted three times. He then transferred to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, where he spent one season, before finishing his career at Darlington F.C.Darlington in 1995.
Despite being born in Scotland, his Irish grandfather enabled him to win seven caps for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, which he did between 1990 and 1993. This short international career resulted in the honour of being named in Ireland's 1990 FIFA World Cup squad – though he did not feature in the tournament.

Johann Vogel.name: Johann Vogel
Johann Vogel.intro: '''Johann Louis François Vogel''' (born 8 March 1977 in Geneva) is a former SwitzerlandSwiss Association footballfootballer.

Lee Glover.name: Lee Glover
Lee Glover.intro:
'''Edward Lee Glover''' (born 24 April 1970) is an English-born Scottish former Association footballfootballer and football manager.
A Forward (association football)forward, he started his career with Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in 1987. He spent seven years at the club, and also spent time on loan at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, and Luton Town F.C.Luton Town. He moved on to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in 1994. Two years later he signed with Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United, and stayed with the "Millers" until 2000. He then played for Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town and Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town, before moving into non-league football with Burton Albion F.C.Burton Albion and Corby Town F.C.Corby Town. He travelled to Wembley Stadium (1923)Wembley three times: in the 1991 FA Cup Final1991 FA Cup and 1995–96 Anglo-Italian Cup1996 Anglo-Italian Cup finals, and was also an unused substitute at the 1992 Football League Cup Final – he picked up a runners-up medal on all three occasions.
After retiring as a player, he managed two non-league clubs: Corby Town and Grantham Town F.C.Grantham Town, and also spent time as assistant manager of King's Lynn F.C.King's Lynn.

Steve Sidwell.name: Steve Sidwell
Steve Sidwell.intro:
'''Steven James "Steve" Sidwell''' (born 14 December 1982) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City.
Sidwell began his career at Arsenal F.C.Arsenal and after winning two FA Youth Cups he had constructive loan spells at Brentford F.C.Brentford and Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion which saw him join Reading F.C.Reading in January 2003. Sidwell spent four-and-a-half-years with the Royals helping them to gain promotion to the Premier League in 2005–06 Reading F.C. season2005–06. He joined Chelsea F.C.Chelsea on a free transfer for the 2007–08 Chelsea F.C. season2007–08 season, however opportunities were limited at Stamford Bridge (stadium)Stamford Bridge and he moved on to Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa in July 2008 for a fee of £5 million. In his two-and-a-half-year stay at Villa Park he played 64 times scoring four goals. Sidwell spent three-and-a-half-years at Craven Cottage making 115 appearances scoring 17 goals. His time at Fulham ended after the club was relegated from the Premier League in 2013–14 Fulham F.C. season2013–14 and he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in June 2014 on a free transfer.

David Beresford.name: David Beresford
David Beresford.intro:
'''David Beresford''' (born 11 November 1976) is an English former Association footballfootballer. A midfielder, he made 236 league appearances in a 12-year career in the Football League. He also won 14 caps for the England national under-16 football teamEngland under-16s and England national under-18 football teamunder-18s.
He began his career at Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, making 64 league appearances between 1994 and 1997, also playing briefly for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City on a loan spell in 1995. He transferred to Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town for a £350,000 fee in March 1997, but never lived up to his price tag at the John Smith's StadiumGalpharm Stadium. He enjoyed short loan spells at Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, before joining Hull City A.F.C.Hull City on a free transfer in June 2001. He switched to Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in July 2002. Loaned out to Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town in October 2003, he was allowed to join Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers the following month. He signed with Macclesfield Town in July 2005, before retiring the following year.

Chris Kirkland.name: Chris Kirkland
Chris Kirkland.intro: '''Christopher Edmund "Chris" Kirkland''' (born 2 May 1981) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday. Kirkland started his career at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, where he was regarded as one of the country's most promising young goalkeepers. He was later signed by Premier League side Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2001, where he went on to win one Football League CupLeague Cup, one FA Community Shield, one UEFA Super Cup and the UEFA Champions League. However, his time at the club was blighted by recurring injuries, which almost caused him to retire from football altogether. He would later sign for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in 2006, after a successful loan period, and he had further loan spells at both Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers before being signed by Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday in 2012. Internationally, Kirkland has one Cap (sport)cap for the England national football teamEngland national team.

Sander Westerveld.name: Sander Westerveld
Sander Westerveld.intro:
'''Sander Westerveld''' (born 23 October 1974) is a retired NetherlandsDutch professional Association footballfootball Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper who is currently the goalkeeping coach of South African Premier Soccer League club Ajax Cape Town.
The highlight of his playing career, spent in five different countries, was a treble of the FA Cup, Football League Cup and UEFA Cup with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2001. Westerveld was included in the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands' squads for Euro 2000 and Euro 2004, but due to the consistency of Edwin van der Sar, earned 6 international caps over five years.

Zesh Rehman.name: Zesh Rehman
Zesh Rehman.intro:
'''Zeshan "Zesh" Rehman''' (; born 14 October 1983) is a British-Pakistani professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Pahang FA in the Malaysia Super League as a Defender (association football)defender.
He was the first British Asian to start a Premier League match and is the first to have played in all four divisions of professional football in England. He also plays for the Pakistan national football team and was the first Pakistani international footballer to play professional football in England, Thailand, Hong Kong and Malaysia, as well as the first Pakistani international to play in the AFC Cup. He has played over 300 senior career games in four different Nations. Over 100 of those games have been played in Asia. (
The third transfer of his career involved him moving to Bradford on a free transfer in June 2009. So far Rehman has made fifteen appearances for the Pakistan national team and has participated in the 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC First RoundWorld Cup 2010 qualifiers. Outside of football he is known for being an ambassador for Kick It Out (football's equality and inclusion campaign)Kick It Out and the Show Racism The Red Card campaign.

Paulo Wanchope.name: Paulo Wanchope
Paulo Wanchope.intro:
'''Paulo César Wanchope Watson''' (; born 31 July 1976), more commonly known as '''Paulo Wanchope''', is a Costa Rican peopleCosta Rican former association footballfootballer.
As of February 2009, Wanchope is the second most prolific goalscorer in the history of the Costa Rica national football team, behind Rolando Fonseca, with 45 goals in 73 international matches.[

Jos\u00e9 Dominguez.name: José Dominguez
Jos\u00e9 Dominguez.intro:
'''José Manuel Martins Dominguez''' (born 16 February 1974) is a Portuguese retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, and the current Coach (sport)coach of Recreativo de Huelva.
A diminutive player with above-average technical skills and speed, he started playing professional football not in his own country but in England with Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He also had spells abroad in Germany, Qatar and Brazil.
Dominguez is one of the shortest players to have ever played in the Premier League.

Lee Martin (footballer, born 1987).name: Lee Martin (footballer, born 1987)
Lee Martin (footballer, born 1987).intro: '''Lee Robert Martin''' (born 9 February 1987) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays for Millwall F.C.Millwall. Martin is usually referred to as a winger, although he has stated that he prefers to play down the middle as either a central midfielder or supporting striker, a role he currently occupies.

Michael Doughty (footballer, born 1992).name: Michael Doughty (footballer, born 1992)
Michael Doughty (footballer, born 1992).intro: '''Michael Edward Doughty''' (born 20 November 1992) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.

Petter Rudi.name: Petter Rudi
Petter Rudi.intro: '''Petter Normann Rudi''' (born 17 September 1973) is a retired NorwayNorwegian Association footballfootballer. He finished his career at Belgian club K.A.A.
