Gent in 2007 after playing professionally in several countries in Europe during his career. He is currently contracted to Molde FK as analysis manager and talent scout.

Peter Enckelman.name: Peter Enckelman
Peter Enckelman.intro: '''Peter Mikael Enckelman''' (born 10 March 1977) is a retired FinlandFinnish Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. Enckelman represented Finland national football teamFinland and previously played for Turun PalloseuraTPS Turku, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone and Heart of Midlothian F.C.Heart of Midlothian.

Richard Graham (footballer, born 1974).name: Richard Graham (footballer, born 1974)
Richard Graham (footballer, born 1974).intro:
'''Richard Graham''' (born 28 November 1974 in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire) is a former EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball defender (association football)defender. The centre back joined Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic as a trainee and went on to make over 160 league and cup appearances for the club.
Richard now runs [

Park Ji-sung.name: Park Ji-sung
Park Ji-sung.intro:
'''Park Ji-sung''' (Hangul: ; Hanja: ; ; born 25 February 1981) is a South Korean former association footballfootballer who currently serves as a club ambassador at Manchester United.
Born in Goheung, South Jeolla ProvinceJeollanam-do, he was the captain of the South Korea national football teamSouth Korean national team until his retirement from international football. He is one of the most decorated Asian Football ConfederationAsian footballers in history, as the first Asian footballer to have won the List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League winning playersUEFA Champions League trophy, the first Asian footballer to play in a 2009 UEFA Champions League FinalUEFA Champions League Final, as well as the first Asian footballer to have won the 2008 FIFA Club World Cup FinalFIFA Club World Cup. Park is able to play anywhere across the midfield and is noted for his exceptional fitness level, discipline, work ethic and off-the-ball movement. His remarkable endurance levels and pace earned him the nickname 'Three-Lungs' Park.
Park began his football career in his native South Korea and played for the Myongji University team before moving to Japan to play for Kyoto Sanga F.C.Kyoto Purple Sanga. After Park's national team manager Guus Hiddink moved back to the Netherlands to manage PSV Eindhoven, Park followed him to the Dutch side a year later. After PSV reached the semi-finals of the 2004–05 UEFA Champions League, Park's talents were recognised by Manchester United F.C.Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson and he signed Park for a fee of around £4 million in July 2005. In his time at Manchester United, Park won the Premier League four times and also won the 2007–08 UEFA Champions League and the 2008 FIFA Club World Cup. He moved to Queens Park Rangers in July 2012 after suffering a reduction in his number of appearances for Manchester United the previous season. However, an injury-interrupted season with QPR, combined with the club's relegation, led to Park rejoining PSV on loan for the 2013–14 season.
As a member of the South Korean national team, Park won 100 caps and scored 13 goals, and was a member of the team that finished fourth at the 2002 FIFA World Cup. He also represented his nation at the 2006 FIFA World Cup and was captain at the 2010 FIFA World Cup. Park scored in all three consecutive tournaments (the first South Korean and only second Asian player to do so) and is currently Asia's joint all-time leading goalscorer at the FIFA World Cup finals with three goals, alongside compatriot Ahn Jung-hwan, Tim Cahill and Saudi Arabia national football teamSaudi Arabia's Sami Al-Jaber. After the 2011 AFC Asian Cup2011 Asian Cup, on 31 January 2011, Park announced that he was retiring from international football at a press conference held by the Korea Football Association in Suwon.[
On 14 May 2014, Park announced his retirement from football, citing his knee injury as the reason for his departure.
On 2 October 2014, Park returned to Manchester United as one of the club's global ambassadors. He was presented by Sir Alex Ferguson at the home game against Everton F.C.Everton. Park became the first Asian to become an ambassador at Manchester United and the sixth ambassador overall, following Bobby CharltonSir Bobby Charlton, Andy Cole, Sir Alex Ferguson, Denis Law, and Bryan Robson.

Boaz Myhill.name: Boaz Myhill
Boaz Myhill.intro: '''Glyn Oliver Myhill''' (born 9 November 1982), more commonly known as '''Boaz Myhill''' , is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. Myhill also represented Wales national football teamWales until his international retirement in 2014. Having started his professional career at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa he later moved to Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, establishing himself as first choice goalkeeper.

Mohamed Diam\u00e9.name: Mohamed Diamé
Mohamed Diam\u00e9.intro:
'''Mohamed Diamé''' (born 14 June 1987), also known as '''Momo Diamé''', is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Hull City A.F.C.Hull City as a Midfielder#Central midfieldcentral midfielder.
Born in France, Diamé represents Senegal national football teamSenegal at international level.

James Keene.name: James Keene
James Keene.intro: '''James Keene''' (born 26 December 1985) is an English Association footballfootballer who last played for NorthEast United FC in the Indian Super League as a Forward (association football)striker.

Andrea Dossena.name: Andrea Dossena
Andrea Dossena.intro:
'''Andrea Dossena''' (born 11 September 1981 in Lodi, LombardyLodi) is an Italian association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger or Defender (association football)left back for English Football League OneLeague One club Leyton Orient F.C.Leyton Orient.
Dossena started his professional career at Hellas Verona F.C.Verona in 2001, having progressed through the club's youth ranks. Having made 99 league appearances for Verona, he joined Treviso F.B.C. 1993Treviso in 2005, and made 21 league appearances for the club. He then joined Udinese CalcioUdinese in 2006, and had a successful two-year spell, which, after making 63 league appearances, saw him switch to English side Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in July 2008. However, he struggled to adapt to the English game, making just 18 league appearances in two seasons, and he returned to Italy in January 2010, when he signed for S.S.C. NapoliNapoli. Although he quickly established himself in the team, he fell out of favour during the 2012–13 season, and was loaned to U.S. Città di PalermoPalermo, where he made 11 league appearances. In September 2013, having made 83 league appearances for Napoli, Dossena returned to England when he joined Sunderland. In November 2014 it was announced that Dossena had joined Leyton Orient on a free until the end of the season.
He made his full international debut for Italy in 2007, and was part of their team at the 2009 FIFA Confederations Cup, earning 10 caps in total.

Quincy Owusu-Abeyie.name: Quincy Owusu-Abeyie
Quincy Owusu-Abeyie.intro:
'''Quincy James Owusu-Abeyie''' (born 15 April 1986), often known simply by his first name, '''Quincy''', is a Ghana national football teamGhana international association footballfootballer who plays for Portuguese club Boavista F.C.Boavista. He plays as a Forward (association football)forward or Midfielder#Wingerleft winger.
He was born in the Netherlands, and played international football for his country of birth at youth level, but in 2007 requested to become eligible to represent his parents' country, Ghana, instead. FIFA approved his request on 10 January 2008, just ahead of the 2008 Africa Cup of Nations. Main characteristics in his game are speed, technique and vision.

Darren Randolph.name: Darren Randolph
Darren Randolph.intro:
'''Darren Edward Randolph''' (born 12 May 1987) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Football League Championship club Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City. He is a Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland international, having previously played for the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland U-21 team. Randolph has also represented Ireland national basketball teamIreland at basketball.
Having progressed through the youth ranks at Ardmore Rovers and Premier League side Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic, Randolph turned professional in 2004 with Charlton. He spent time on loan at Welling United F.C.Welling United, Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley and Gillingham F.C.Gillingham before making his Charlton debut in the last game of the 2006-07 Premier League2006–07 season. Despite the club's relegation from the Premier League, he was unable to cement a regular starting position, and had two loan spells during 2008, at Bury F.C.Bury and at Hereford United F.C.Hereford United. Having made just fourteen appearances for Charlton in six years, he moved on to Scottish Premier League side Motherwell F.C.Motherwell in July 2010. He played regularly for Motherwell over three years, then returned to England to join Birmingham City.
In 2006, Randolph made ten appearances for the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football teamRepublic of Ireland under-21 side, and a single appearances for the Republic of Ireland B national football teamRepublic of Ireland B team. He made his full international debut for the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland in September 2012, in a 4–1 victory over Oman national football teamOman.

Garry Monk.name: Garry Monk
Garry Monk.intro:
'''Garry Alan Monk''' (born 6 March 1979) is an English football manager and former professional footballer who played as a central defender.
He is the manager of Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in the Premier League, whom he also played for in all four divisions of professional football from 2004 to 2014, for the majority of that time as captain.
Garry Monk.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Craig Burley.name: Craig Burley
Craig Burley.intro:
'''Craig William Burley''' (born 24 September 1971) is a television pundit and Scottish former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder from 1989 until 2004.
He played in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Derby County F.C.Derby County and in the Scottish Premier League for Celtic F.C.Celtic. He also played for Dundee F.C.Dundee and finished his career in the Football League with Preston North End F.C.Preston North End and Walsall F.C.Walsall. He earned 46 caps for Scotland national football teamScotland, scoring 3 goals.

Per Kr\u00f8ldrup.name: Per Krøldrup
Per Kr\u00f8ldrup.intro:
'''Per Billeskov Krøldrup''' (born 31 July 1979 in Farsø) is a DenmarkDanish professional Association footballfootballer who is currently a free agent.
He has played 33 games for the Denmark national football team, and was part of their squad for the 2004 European Football Championship2004 European Championship.
Per Kr\u00f8ldrup.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Steven Naismith.name: Steven Naismith
Steven Naismith.intro:
'''Steven John Naismith''' (born 14 September 1986) is a Scottish association footballfootballer who plays as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder for English club Everton F.C.Everton and the Scotland national football team.
Naismith began his career with Kilmarnock F.C.Kilmarnock in 2004. He spent four years with the Ayrshire side where he won the SFWA Young Player of the Year award in 2006 and the SPFA Young Player of the Year award the following season. Naismith joined Rangers F.C.Rangers in the summer of 2007 for a fee of £1.9m. While with the club he won three consecutive league titles, the Scottish Cup in 2008 and the Scottish League CupLeague Cup twice in 2010 and 2011. At the start of the 2012/13 season he signed for Everton as a free agent.
Naismith made his full international debut in 2007 against the Faroe Islands national football teamFaroe Islands and has 35 caps, including four goals against Spain national football teamSpain, Lithuania national football teamLithuania and  Croatia national football teamCroatia.

Stephen McPhail.name: Stephen McPhail
Stephen McPhail.intro: '''Stephen John Paul McPhail''' (born 9 December 1979) is an Irish Association footballfootballer who plays in the League of Ireland for Shamrock Rovers F.C.Shamrock Rovers. He has won 10 caps for his country, the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, and scored one goal. He plays as a PlayMaker Footballplay-making association football positionscentral midfielder, as he uses his great passing qualities to pick out attackers. In February 2014 he signed for Shamrock Rovers on a one-year contract.

Ulrich Le Pen.name: Ulrich Le Pen
Ulrich Le Pen.intro: '''Ulrich Le Pen''' (born 21 January 1974 in Auray, Brittany (administrative region)Brittany) is a former French peopleFrench footballer.

Richie Ryan.name: Richie Ryan
Richie Ryan.intro: '''Richie Ryan''' (born 6 January 1985) is an Irish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Ottawa Fury FC.

Conor Coady.name: Conor Coady
Conor Coady.intro:
'''Conor David Coady''' (born 25 February 1993) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Football League Championship club Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town, as a Midfielderdefensive midfielder.
Born in Liverpool, Coady had an unsuccessful stint with the club as he has spent a season on loan at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United and in 2013 was sold off to Huddersfield Town A.F.C.Huddersfield Town. He has also represented England at youth level, winning the 2010 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship2010 under-17 Euro and captaining the England national under-20 football teamEngland under-20 team at the 2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup2013 under-20 World Cup.

Steve De Ridder.name: Steve De Ridder
Steve De Ridder.intro: '''Steve Danny Marc De Ridder''' (born 25 February 1987) is a BelgiumBelgian Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)#Wingerwinger for Danish club,  FC Copenhagen. He has played in the Netherlands for De Graafschap and FC Utrecht and in England for Southampton F.C.Southampton and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He was born in Ghent.
Steve De Ridder.position: Midfielder Winger Winger,Forward  association football  Forward

Gerhard Tremmel.name: Gerhard Tremmel
Gerhard Tremmel.intro:
'''Gerhard Martin Tremmel''' (born 16 November 1978 in Munich) is a German Association footballfootballer who plays for Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. Tremmel is a vastly experienced goalkeeper having played at the highest level in the Premier League, Bundesliga, Champions League and European League. He is renowned for his shot stopping abilities and his reflexes.
Tremmel holds a number of goalkeeping records. At a rate of 4.2, Tremmel has the best saves per goal conceded ratio in the Premier League for the season 2012–13.  He also has the best save percentage in the Premier League at 80.9%. His saves-to-shots ratio in the Premier League and on a European basis have made him second only to Manuel Neuer of Bayern Munich.

Simo Valakari.name: Simo Valakari
Simo Valakari.intro: '''Simo Johannes Valakari''' (born 28 April 1973) is a FinlandFinnish former association footballfootballer and the current manager of Seinäjoen Jalkapallokerho.

Anthony Modeste (footballer, born 1988).name: Anthony Modeste (footballer, born 1988)
Anthony Modeste (footballer, born 1988).intro:
''' Anthony Mbu Agogo Modeste ''' (born 14 April 1988 in Cannes) is a French professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for German club TSG 1899 Hoffenheim1899 Hoffenheim in the Bundesliga.
On 13 August 2010, Modeste joined FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux from OGC Nice for an undisclosed fee thought to be €3.5 million and signed a four-year contract with the club.
On 19 January 2012, Modeste joined Blackburn Rovers on loan for the rest of the 2011–12 Premier League season but with the French employers insiting there would be no option to buy at the end of the loan period.
Modeste single handedly got Blackburn Rovers relegated in the 2011–12 Premier League season after he got a red card in one of the final games of the season against West Bromwich Albion F.C. which Blackburn ultimately lost 3 – 0 and made survival for the next season practically impossible.
On 31 July 2012, he signed on loan for SC BastiaBastia. He scored on his debut in a 3–2 victory over Sochaux.
On 9 July 2013, Modeste signed with 1899 Hoffenheim on a 3-year contract.

Clive Allen.name: Clive Allen
Clive Allen.intro:
'''Clive Darren Allen''' (born 20 May 1961) is a retired England national football teamEnglish Association footballfootballer, a prolific scorer for a number of clubs.
Allen is the son of ex-Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur forward Les Allen, who was a member of the team which won the Football League First DivisionFirst Division title and FA Cup "double" in 1961. He is the brother of former footballer Bradley Allen and cousin of football manager Martin Allen (footballer)Martin Allen and ex West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paul Allen (footballer)Paul Allen.
In 1997, he was playing for the London Monarchs in NFL Europe.

Samuele Dalla Bona.name: Samuele Dalla Bona
Samuele Dalla Bona.intro: '''Samuele Dalla Bona''' (born 6 February 1981 in San Donà di Piave, Province of Venice), sometimes referred to as '''Sam Dalla Bona''', is an Italian association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder. He has been without a club since 2012.

Matt Oakley.name: Matt Oakley
Matt Oakley.intro:
'''Matthew "Matt" Oakley''' (born 17 August 1977) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Exeter City F.C.Exeter City. His last club was the Football League Championship side Leicester City F.C.Leicester City where he was Captain (association football)captain from 2008 to 2011. He had previously played for Southampton F.C.Southampton and Derby County F.C.Derby County.
Oakley played for Southampton for over a decade, including their defeat to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in the 2003 FA Cup Final. However, a proneness  to injury cost him nearly two years of football, and he left the club after being offered only a one-year contract. At Derby County, he captained the club to promotion via the Championship play-offs in 2007. After one-and-a-half years at Pride Park, Oakley signed for Leicester City, but could not prevent their relegation to Football League OneLeague One. He enjoyed an injury-free season when he captained the team to promotion as league winners at the first attempt.

Trevor Francis.name: Trevor Francis
Trevor Francis.intro:
'''Trevor John Francis''' (born 19 April 1954 in Plymouth, England), is a former Association footballfootballer who won the European Cup with Nottingham Forest and played for England national football teamEngland 52 times. He was England's first pound sterling£1 million player.
Between 1988 and 2003 he was a football manager, most notably with Sheffield Wednesday and then Birmingham City. Francis is currently working as a pundit with Al Jazeera Sports and Sky Sports.

Matt Phillips.name: Matt Phillips
Matt Phillips.intro: '''Matthew "Matt" Phillips''' (born 13 March 1991) is an EnglandEnglish-born  ScotlandScottish Scotland national football teaminternational professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Winger (sports)winger for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers.  Born in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire, Phillips began his career at Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers before a move to Blackpool F.C.Blackpool, and has also had a spell on loan at Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United. He has represented England at England national under-19 football teamunder-19 and England national under-20 football teamunder-20 level but has subsequently represented Scotland national football teamScotland at senior level, qualifying through his grandparent's nationality.

Rob Page.name: Rob Page
Rob Page.intro:
'''Robert '''"'''Rob'''"''' Page''' (born 3 September 1974) is a Welsh former international association footballfootball defender (association football)defender, now manager at Football League OneLeague One club Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. In an eighteen-year career in the Premier League and the Football League he made 475 league appearances for six different clubs. He both captained a team and scored a goal in all top four divisions of English football. He also gained 41 caps for Wales national football teamWales in a ten-year international career, captain (association football)captaining the side once, before he retired from international football in September 2006.
He began his career with Watford F.C.Watford in 1993, who he would captain to two successive promotions in 1998 and 1999, thereby winning the club a place in the top-flight of English football. Two years later he transferred to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United, where he would play over 100 games in a three-year stay. He signed with Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City in 2004, before moving on to Coventry City F.C.Coventry City the following year. In 2008 he moved on to Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield via Huddersfield Town F.C.Huddersfield Town, before retiring in 2011.
He worked as a coach at Port Vale for three years before he was appointed as manager, initially on a caretaker basis, in September 2014.

Lee Crooks.name: Lee Crooks
Lee Crooks.intro:
Leading Aircraftsman '''Lee Crooks''' (born 14 January 1978 in Wakefield, England) is a gunner in the RAF Regiment, and former professional association footballfootballer best known for having played for Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.
As a combative defensive midfielder, Crooks made 222 competitive appearances in his playing career in the top three divisions of English football, including 196 in league competition. Possessing a powerful strike, he scored a total of 5 goals.
A product of the Manchester City youth system, Crooks signed with the Northern England based club at age 16, and spent 6 years there during a turbulent period or promotion and relegationrelegations and promotions, including the 1999 Football League Second Division play-off Final1999 Division 2 playoff final against Gillingham F.C.Gillingham. He went on to play for the other northern clubs of Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale, as well as loan spells at Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Notts County F.C.Notts County in the East Midlands.
After further appearances below The Football League in the lower leagues with West Yorkshire clubs Guiseley A.F.C.Guiseley and Ossett Town F.C.Ossett Town, at age 32 he embarked on a new career in the British Armed Forces, joining the RAF Regiment, the infantry unit of the Royal Air Force.

Idan Tal.name: Idan Tal
Idan Tal.intro: '''Idan Tal''' (; born 13 September 1975 in Jerusalem) is a former Israeli JewsIsraeli professional Association footballfootballer who now works as a manager.

Asmir Begovi\u0107.name: Asmir Begović
Asmir Begovi\u0107.intro:
'''Asmir Begović''' (born 20 June 1987) is a Bosnian association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City and the Bosnia and Herzegovina national football teamBosnia and Herzegovina national team.
Aged four, Begović and his family emigrated from their Bosnian Warwar-torn home of Trebinje to Kirchhausen, a borough of Heilbronn, near Stuttgart in Germany. Begović developed a keen interest in football and played with the local youth club before the Begović family moved again this time to Edmonton, Canada. After playing with Minor League side Southwest Sting he earned a call up to the Canada U-17 squad. In the summer of 2003 he signed for English club Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth after impressing on trial. After playing with Portsmouth's youth team for two years he moved on loan to Belgian side R.A.A. LouviéroiseLa Louvière in 2005.
After gaining a UK Visa in the summer of 2006 he was able to get match experience in the Football League playing for Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, A.F.C. BournemouthBournemouth, Yeovil Town F.C.Yeovil Town and Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town. He finally made his Premier League debut for Portsmouth in May 2009 and took over from David James (footballer)David James in 2009–10 Portsmouth F.C. season2009–10. However Portsmouth's financial problems led him to be sold to Stoke City F.C.Stoke City in January 2010 for a fee of £3.25 million. He began as second choice to the veteran Thomas Sørensen before becoming a regular in the side in 2010–11 Stoke City F.C. season2010–11 and 2011–12 Stoke City F.C. season2011–12. In 2012–13 Stoke City F.C. season2012–13 he played in every league match and his performances saw him win the Stoke City F.C. Player of the YearPlayer of the Year award. In November 2013 Begović became the fifth goalkeeper to score a goal in the Premier League, scoring from 97.5 yards against Southampton after 13 seconds.
Begović represented Canada at youth level playing for them at the 2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup before deciding to change his allegiance to Bosnia and Herzegovina national football teamBosnia and Herzegovina in 2009. He soon established himself as Bosnia's number one and helped them reach the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
Asmir Begovi\u0107.birth_place: Trebinje,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Jerzy Dudek.name: Jerzy Dudek
Jerzy Dudek.intro:
'''Jerzy Dudek''' (; born 23 March 1973) is a PolandPolish former Association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper.
After beginning his career in his home country, he went on to have successful spells in the Netherlands and England, winning the UEFA Champions League with Liverpool F.C.Liverpool in 2005 UEFA Champions League Final2005 and appearing in 186 official games for the club over the course of six seasons. He also spent four years at Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid.
Dudek played 60 times for Poland national football teamPoland – the second most-capped player in his position for several years – representing the nation at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup.

Dave Beasant.name: Dave Beasant
Dave Beasant.intro:
'''David John''' "'''Dave'''" '''Beasant''', (born 20 March 1959) is an English Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper, who is player/goalkeeping coach for Stevenage F.C.Stevenage.
He began his career in the late 1970s. A well-travelled player, Beasant's former clubs include Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Southampton F.C.Southampton, Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. He is best remembered for his part in Wimbledon's 1988 shock FA Cup Final 1988FA Cup victory, during which he was the first goalkeeper to save a penalty in an FA Cup final. He made two appearances for the England national football team.

Paul Williams (footballer, born 1969).name: Paul Williams (footballer, born 1969)
Paul Williams (footballer, born 1969).intro: '''Paul Richard Curtis Williams''' (born September 11, 1969) was a professional association footballfootballer, probably most remembered for his time at Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in the mid-1990s.

Giannis Skopelitis.name: Giannis Skopelitis
Giannis Skopelitis.intro: '''Giannis Skopelitis''' (Greek languageGreek: Γιάννης Σκοπελίτης; born 2 March 1978) is a GreeceGreek football (soccer)football player who currently plays for AEK Larnaca in the Cypriot First Division.

Ben Thatcher.name: Ben Thatcher
Ben Thatcher.intro:
'''Benjamin David "Ben" Thatcher''' (born 30 November 1975 in Swindon, Wiltshire) is a former association football player. He played for a number of English clubs, and has featured in more than 300 English league games from his position as a left-sided defender (association football)defender, all of which were in the top two leagues in the country.
He represented England national under-21 football teamEngland's under-21 national team on four occasions, but chose to represent the Wales national football teamWales national team in his senior years, for whom he earned seven cap (sport)caps.
Ben Thatcher.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Johan Elmander.name: Johan Elmander
Johan Elmander.intro: '''Johan Erik Calvin Elmander''' (; born 27 May 1981 in Alingsås) is a Swedish professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)striker for Brøndby IF, and the Sweden national football team. He joined in 2014 a free transfer after his contract with Turkish club Galatasaray expired. Elmander has scored 20 goals in 72 games for the Sweden national football teamSwedish national team, and was chosen to represent his country at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup, UEFA Euro 2008Euro 2008 and UEFA Euro 2012Euro 2012. His 2–0 goal away to Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers on 13 November 2010 was voted the greatest Premier League goal ever in a poll by ''The Guardian''.

Denis Irwin.name: Denis Irwin
Denis Irwin.intro:
'''Denis Joseph Irwin''' (born 31 October 1965) is an Irish former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull-back from 1983 to 2004.
Born in Cork (city)Cork, Republic of IrelandIreland, he is best known for his long and successful stint at Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, where he established himself as one of the most important players in the United team that won a host of domestic and European trophies in his time there between 1990 and 2002. He has been regarded by Alex Ferguson as, pound for pound, his greatest ever signing. Earlier in his career he played for Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United and then Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic, and finished his career with a two-year spell at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. Irwin was Cap (sport)capped by the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland national side 56 times, scoring four goals and featuring in the side that reached the second round (last 16) at the 1994 FIFA World Cup.
Denis Irwin.position: Defender  association football  Full back Full back

Ned Zeli\u0107.name: Ned Zelić
Ned Zeli\u0107.intro: '''Nedijeljko "Ned" Zelić''' () (born 4 July 1971) is an Australian former Association footballfootball player, and is currently a commentator for Fox Sports (Australia)Fox Sports.

Richard Irving.name: Richard Irving
Richard Irving.intro:
'''Richard James Irving''' (born 10 September 1975) is a retired EnglandEnglish association footballfootball Forward (association football)forward.
He signed for Manchester United as a schoolboy in 1989, and, after leaving school, signed a trainee contract on 13 July 1992. He played in the youth side that were FA Youth Cup runners-up in 1993. He promptly signed professional forms with the club, but never played a first-team game and was transferred to Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest in a £75,000 deal at the start of the 1995–96 in English football1995–96 season. Irving's solitary first-team appearance was as a substitute at home to his former club on 29 November 1995 – a Premier League fixture at the City Ground which ended in a 1–1 draw.
Irving left Forest in the summer of 1997 and signed for Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town, who had just won promotion to the Football League as Football ConferenceConference champions. He played nine games in the Football League Third DivisionDivision Three 1997–98 in English football1997–98 campaign which saw Macclesfield secure a second successive promotion, but he left soon afterwards and never played professional football again.
He now franchises lettings agencies and lives in Alderley Edge, Cheshire.

Olivier T\u00e9bily.name: Olivier Tébily
Olivier T\u00e9bily.intro: '''Olivier Tébily''' (born 19 December 1975) is a former professional association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)defender. A French citizen, he won 18 full international cap (sport)caps for his native Ivory Coast national football teamIvory Coast national team. He played in the top level league in four countries: for LB ChâteaurouxChâteauroux in Ligue 1, for Celtic F.C.Celtic in the Scottish Premier League, for Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in the English Premier League, and for Toronto FC in Major League Soccer.

Nadir Belhadj.name: Nadir Belhadj
Nadir Belhadj.intro:
'''Nadir Belhadj''' (, born 18 June 1982) is an Algerian professional association footballfootball player who currently plays as a left wingback or as a left winger for Qatar Stars League side Sadd Sports ClubAl-Sadd. He is well known for his pace and stamina.
An Algerian international, Belhadj was a former France national youth football teamFrench youth international having played for the French Under-18's for a couple of games in 2000. Belhadj was among the first footballers to profit from the 2004 change in FIFA eligibility rules as he had played as a French youth international. After his switch of national allegiance to Algeria, he was called up to an unofficial friendly on 30 March 2004 against BelgiumBelgian club R.A.A. Louviéroise. He made his senior international debut in a friendly against China national football teamChina on 28 April 2004.[
Belhadj played a vital role for Qatari club Al Sadd in the 2011 Asian Champions League final, by beating South Korean side Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors 4–2 in a penalty shoot-out. Belhadj scored the decisive penalty after the game had finished 2–2 in regulation time, holding his nerve to beat Kim Min-Sik.

Adel Taarabt.name: Adel Taarabt
Adel Taarabt.intro:
'''Adel Taarabt''' ( – born 24 May 1989) is a Moroccan professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers as an midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder and can also be used as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger.
He began his playing career in France at RC LensLens before moving to English Premier League team Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 2007. Having been unable to break into the first team at Spurs under either Juande Ramos or Harry Redknapp, Taarabt moved to QPR on loan in July 2009. He was signed permanently in August 2010 and quickly established himself at Loftus Road. QPR were relegated in 2013, and in the ensuing summer Taarabt moved to Fulham FCFulham on loan. In January the temporary deal was terminated, and he joined AC Milan for the remainder of the season, on loan.
He represented France national football teamFrance at youth levels but opted to play for his native Morocco national football teamMorocco at senior level. Taarabt made his Morocco debut in February 2009, and scored his first international goal the following month.

Mbulelo Mabizela.name: Mbulelo Mabizela
Mbulelo Mabizela.intro:
'''Mbulelo Mabizela''' (born 16 September 1980 in Pietermaritzburg, KwaZulu-Natal) is a South African Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder and defender (association football)defender for AmaZulu.
Nicknamed "Old John" as a young player for showing maturity beyond his years, he holds the record as the youngest player to captain the South African national team at the age of twenty. Whilst he has all the ability required to be an outstanding player with good pace, strength, composure on the ball with both feet and the timing of tackles, Mabizela has had a career littered with troubles.
Mabizela was released by Tottenham Hotspur after only fourteen months with the club for disciplinary problems in 2004, this followed him having been stripped of the Bafana Bafana captaincy for going AWOL a few months earlier. Other troubles have included a six-month ban for the use of a banned substance in 2006 and in December 2008 a charge of driving under the influence of alcohol.
Mbulelo Mabizela.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Marians Pahars.name: Marians Pahars
Marians Pahars.intro:
'''Marians Pahars''' (born 5 August 1976) is a  Latvian former football (soccer)footballer, currently the manager of Latvia national football team.
He spent most of his career as a striker with Southampton F.C.Southampton in the Premier League and with Skonto F.C.Skonto in the Latvian Higher League.
His Latvian languageLatvian given name is ''Marians''; however, most football media have internationalised his name as ''Marian'' since he began playing in England.

James Scowcroft.name: James Scowcroft
James Scowcroft.intro: '''James Benjamin Scowcroft''' (born 15 November 1975 in Bury St Edmunds) is a retired association footballfootballer who is currently a coach for the Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town academy.

Jared Hodgkiss.name: Jared Hodgkiss
Jared Hodgkiss.intro: '''Jared Hodgkiss''' (born 15 November 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back. He is currently with Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers having recently been with Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers. This followed his release by Premier League side West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. His boyhood hero was Paul Gascoigne.
Jared Hodgkiss.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right back

Adrian Littlejohn.name: Adrian Littlejohn
Adrian Littlejohn.intro:
'''Adrian Sylvester Littlejohn''' (born 26 September 1970) is an English former Association footballfootballer, who played as a midfielder and a Forward (association football)striker. He scored 74 goals in 425 league appearances in an 18-year career in the Football League.
He began his professional career at Walsall F.C.Walsall, after moving from West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in 1989. He moved on to Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United two years later, before making a £100,000 move to Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle in September 1995. He helped Plymouth to win promotion out of the Football League Third DivisionThird Division in 1996 Football League Third Division play-off Final1996, before moving on to Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic in March 1998. Eight months later he was sold on to Bury F.C.Bury for £75,000. He returned to Sheffield United in October 2001, before transferring to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in February 2003. In August 2004 he switched to Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, before ending the season at Rushden & Diamonds F.C.Rushden & Diamonds. In September 2005 he signed with Mansfield Town F.C.Mansfield Town before moving on to non-league club Leek Town F.C.Leek Town the following year. He retired in 2008 following a brief spell at Retford United F.C.Retford United.

Gerry Taggart.name: Gerry Taggart
Gerry Taggart.intro:
'''Gerald''' "'''Gerry'''" '''Taggart''' (born 18 October 1970) is a former professional Association footballfootballer. He played for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and Stoke City F.C.Stoke City as well as the Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland national team.
Taggart began his career as an trainee with Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in 1989 but joined Barnsley F.C.Barnsley in 1990 after being unable to break into the first team at Maine Road. He soon became a popular player with the "Tykes" supporters due to his passionate and committed performances. After spending five years with Barnsley making 249 appearances he joined Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers where he helped them to win the Football League First DivisionDivision One title in 1996–97 in English football1996–97. He signed for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City in 1998 and played in back to back Football League CupLeague Cup Finals with Leicester winning the cup in 2000 Football League Cup Final2000. He remained with Leicester until 2003 when he joined Stoke City F.C.Stoke City. He spent three seasons at the Britannia Stadium and after a short spell with Tamworth F.C.Tamworth he retired from playing.
After his retirement in 2007, he began his coaching/managing career for Leicester. On 10 June 2010, he was announced as the new assistant manager at Oldham Athletic A.F.C.Oldham Athletic. He was placed on garden leave by the club on 31 December 2012 following a run of poor results.

Peter Schmeichel.name: Peter Schmeichel
Peter Schmeichel.intro:
'''Peter Bolesław Schmeichel''' Member of the Order of the British EmpireMBE (; born 18 November 1963) is a Danish peopleDanish retired professional association footballfootballer who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper, and was voted the "World's Best Goalkeeper" in 1992 and 1993. He is best remembered for his most successful years at English club Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, whom he captained to the 1999 UEFA Champions League to complete the Treble, and for winning UEFA Euro 1992 with Denmark national football teamDenmark.
Born in Gladsaxe MunicipalityGladsaxe, Copenhagen, Schmeichel was famous for his intimidating physique (he is  tall and weighed about  during his playing days), and wore specially made size XXXL football shirts. Unusual for a goalkeeper, Schmeichel scored 11 goals during his career, including one for the national team. He is also the most cap (football)capped player for the Denmark national team, with 129 games between 1987 and 2001. In addition to Euro 92, he played for his country at the 1998 FIFA World Cup and three additional UEFA European Football ChampionshipEuropean Championship tournaments. He captained the national team in 30 matches. He also represented Gladsaxe Hero, Hvidovre IFHvidovre, Brøndby IFBrøndby, Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting CP, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in a career that lasted from 1981 until 2003.
The IFFHS ranked Schmeichel among the top ten keepers of the 20th century in 2000, and in 2001, Schmeichel won a public poll held by Reuters, when the majority of the 200,000 participants voted him as the best goalkeeper ever, ahead of Lev Yashin and Gordon Banks. In 2003, Schmeichel was inducted into the English Football Hall of Fame in recognition of his impact on the English game. In March 2004, he was named as one of the "125 greatest living footballers", at the FIFA 100 celebrations. His son, Kasper SchmeichelKasper, is also a professional football goalkeeper currently playing for Premier League side Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and the Denmark national football teamDenmark national team.

Lee Harper.name: Lee Harper
Lee Harper.intro:
'''Lee Charles Philip Harper''' (born 30 October 1971) is an English former association footballfootballer, and manager who played as a goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1993 until 2010. He notably played in the Premier League for Arsenal F.C.Arsenal.
After beginning his career with Sittingbourne F.C.Sittingbourne he went on to play in the Football League for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town and Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons. He finished his career in Non-league where he was briefly player-manager of Kettering Town F.C.Kettering Town.

Mohamed Sissoko.name: Mohamed Sissoko
Mohamed Sissoko.intro:
'''Mohamed Lamine "Momo" Sissoko Gillan''' (born 22 January 1985) is a Malian footballer who currently plays for Spanish club Levante UD and the Mali national football teamMalian national team as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
Although he could have elected to play for France national football teamFrance internationally, he chose to play for the country of his descent, Mali.

Michael Duff.name: Michael Duff
Michael Duff.intro: '''Michael James Duff''' (born 11 January 1978) is a Northern IrelandNorthern Irish Northern Ireland national football teaminternational association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley. He plays in the centre of defender (association football)defence or at right-back.

Tom Heaton.name: Tom Heaton
Tom Heaton.intro: '''Thomas David "Tom" Heaton''' (born 15 April 1986) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootballer who plays as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper for Burnley F.C.Burnley, having joined them from Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in May 2013. Heaton began playing at a very young age at Chester School boys. He was managed by Darryl Pickering, a well established junior football manager. He said when interviewed "Darryl helped me a lot over the years." He began his professional career with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United but was unable to break into the first team and spent time on loan with Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, Royal Antwerp F.C.Royal Antwerp, Cardiff City, Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers, before joining Cardiff permanently after his release by Manchester United in July 2010. He then joined Bristol City F.C.Bristol City on a one-year deal with an option of a second year but turned it down in May 2013 in favour of staying in the Championship with Burnley F.C.Burnley.

Julien Faubert.name: Julien Faubert
Julien Faubert.intro: '''Julien Faubert''' (born 1 August 1983) is a Football in FranceFrench-born MartiniqueMartiniquais international footballer who currently plays right back or midfielder for Bordeaux. Faubert started his footballing career in France with AS CannesCannes before moving to FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux. In 2007 he moved to England to play for West Ham. In 2009 he spent a short period on loan with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid before returning to West Ham for the beginning of the 2009–10 season. He has represented both France national under-21 football teamFrance U21 and France national football teamFrance; the latter on only one occasion, scoring one goal. In 2014 he made his international debut for Martinique national football teamMartinique. He is nicknamed " ''TGVLe TGV'' " or "''The Express Train''" from his time in French football.

Andreas Jakobsson.name: Andreas Jakobsson
Andreas Jakobsson.intro: '''Bo Janne Andreas Jakobsson''' (born 6 October 1972) is a SwedenSwedish professional Association footballfootball player in the Defender (association football)defender position and the defensive midfielder. He has played 36 international matches for the Sweden national football teamSweden national team, and was a squad player for the 2002 FIFA World Cup and the 2004 UEFA European Football Championship2004 European Championship.

Filipe Teixeira.name: Filipe Teixeira
Filipe Teixeira.intro: '''Filipe Andrade Teixeira''' (born 2 October 1980) is a PortugalPortuguese professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Romanian club FC Petrolul Ploiești as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.

Craig Russell.name: Craig Russell
Craig Russell.intro:
'''Craig Russell''' (born 4 February 1974) is an English former Association footballfootballer. He played 305 league games in a 13-year career in English and Scottish football.
He began his career at Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, firing the "Black Cats" into the Premier League in 1995–96 as champions of the Football League First DivisionFirst Division. He was sold to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City in November 1997. Rarely featuring at Maine Road, he was loaned out to Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Port Vale F.C.Port Vale, Oxford United F.C.Oxford United, and St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone, before signing with St. Johnstone permanently in July 2000. He spent two full seasons in the Scottish Premier League, before signing with Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United in January 2003. An unused substitute in the 2003 Football League Trophy Final, he moved on to Darlington F.C.Darlington in January 2004, before leaving the Football League in May 2005.
Craig Russell.position: Forward  association football  Forward,Defender  association football  Left back

Alan O'Brien.name: Alan O'Brien
Alan O'Brien.intro:
'''Alan O'Brien''' (born 20 February 1985) is an Republic of IrelandIrish association football player who is currently playing for Hungerford Town F.C.Hungerford Town.
O'Brien, who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger, has represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland at full international level five times, all while he was on the books of Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United.

Andy Myers.name: Andy Myers
Andy Myers.intro:
'''Andrew "Andy" Myers''' (born 3 November 1973 in Hounslow, England) is a former professional association footballfootballer and U-15s team coach at Premier League side Chelsea F.C.Chelsea.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1991 until 2005 notably playing for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City in the Premier League. He also had spells in the Football League with Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and Brentford F.C.Brentford.

Andrea Orlandi.name: Andrea Orlandi
Andrea Orlandi.intro:
'''Andrea Orlandi Stabilin''' (born 3 August 1984) is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Blackpool F.C.Blackpool as a Midfielder#Wingerleft winger or Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
After playing as a youth with Deportivo AlavésAlavés, he went to spend the vast majority of his professional career in the United Kingdom, starting out at Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City in 2007.

Danny Webber.name: Danny Webber
Danny Webber.intro:
'''Daniel Vaughn "Danny" Webber''' (born 28 December 1981) is an English professional association footballfootball Forward (association football)striker and Midfielderwinger who plays for Northern Premier League Division One North club Salford City F.C.Salford City. He represented England national under-20 football teamEngland under-20s in 2002.
Born in Manchester, Webber began his career as a trainee with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, but failed to cement a first team place and spent loan spells with Port Vale F.C.Port Vale and Watford F.C.Watford before joining Watford on a permanent basis. After two years with Watford, Webber joined Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United for the second half of the 2004–05 season. That loan also became a permanent transfer at the end of the season, and during the 2005–06 season, Webber's goals helped Sheffield United to promotion to the Premier League for 2006–07. Three years later, after scoring 20 goals in 107 league appearances for the Blades, Webber's contract was allowed to expire and he was released from the club. He then joined Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth for an injury-plagued two-year spell. He signed a short-term deal with Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United in February 2012 and, after being released at the end of the season, was left with no club until he joined Doncaster Rovers F.C.Doncaster Rovers in March 2013 on non-contract terms. He signed with Accrington Stanley F.C.Accrington Stanley in July 2013, where he remained for one season before joining non-league side Salford City in August 2014.

Javier Mascherano.name: Javier Mascherano
Javier Mascherano.intro:
'''Javier Alejandro Mascherano''' (, ; born 8 June 1984) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club FC Barcelona and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team, as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder or Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Mascherano began his career at Club Atlético River PlateRiver Plate. He earned his first senior honours in 2003–04, winning the Primera División Argentina. He moved to Brazilian side Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians in 2005, winning the Campeonato Brasileiro Série ABrazilian Série A in his first season. Mascherano moved to Europe, signing for Premier League side West Ham United F.C.West Ham United. However, unusual contract terms with Global Soccer Agencies blighted his brief time at the club and at the beginning of 2007 he joined Liverpool F.C.Liverpool on loan.
He was runner up in the UEFA Champions League during his loan spell in Merseyside, and officially signed for Liverpool in February 2008 for £18.6 million, parting ways with Global Soccer Agencies. After three years playing for Liverpool, Mascherano joined FC Barcelona in 2010, changing his position of defensive midfielder to central defender. With Barcelona he has won La Liga twice and the UEFA Champions League and FIFA Club World Cup once each, among other honours.
Mascherano has made over List of footballers with 100 or more caps100 appearances for the Argentina national football team, making him the fourth-most Cap (sports)capped player in the country's history, after Javier Zanetti, Roberto Ayala and Diego Simeone. He has represented the nation at the Copa América in 2004 Copa América2004, 2007 Copa América2007 and 2011 Copa América2011, the FIFA World Cup in 2006 FIFA World Cup2006, 2010 FIFA World Cup2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup2014, and the Football at the Summer OlympicsOlympic Games in Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2004 and Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008, winning both Olympic tournaments, becoming the first male footballer to win two Olympic gold medalgold medals since 1968, and reaching the 2014 FIFA World Cup Final. Between 2008 and 2011, Mascherano served as the Captain (association football)captain of Argentina.
Mascherano's two most used nicknames (in Argentina) are ''Masche'' and ''El Jefecito'' (The little chief).
Mascherano also holds an Italian passport, which makes him eligible as an EU player.

Konstantinos Mitroglou.name: Konstantinos Mitroglou
Konstantinos Mitroglou.intro:
'''Konstantinos "Kostas" Mitroglou''' (; born 12 March 1988) is a Greek professional association footballfootballer who plays for Superleague Greece club Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos on loan from Fulham F.C.Fulham, and the Greece national football teamGreece national team, as a Forward (association football)striker.
Raised in Germany, he started his career at Borussia Mönchengladbach, where he established himself as an excellent prospect. He was signed by Olympiacos in the summer of 2007, and had two loan spells at Panionios G.S.S.Panionios and Atromitos F.C.Atromitos. He is nicknamed ''Mitrogoal'' and ''Pistolero'' by fans due to his goalscoring abilities.
A full international since 2009, Mitroglou has earned 35 caps for the Greek national team. He was selected in their squads for UEFA Euro 2012 and the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Gavin Ward.name: Gavin Ward
Gavin Ward.intro:
'''Gavin John Ward''' (born 30 June 1970) is a former professional Football (soccer)footballer and coach (sport)coach who is goalkeeping coach of Football League Championship side Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
He played in the position of Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1987 until 2011. He notably played Premier League football for Leicester City F.C.Leicester City as well as playing for Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, Bradford City A.F.C.Bradford City, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, Walsall F.C.Walsall, Coventry City F.C.Coventry City, Barnsley F.C.Barnsley, Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, Chester City F.C.Chester City, Wrexham A.F.C.Wrexham, Hednesford Town F.C.Hednesford Town and Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity.

Jason Koumas.name: Jason Koumas
Jason Koumas.intro:
'''Jason Koumas''' (born 25 September 1979) is a WalesWelsh professional Association footballfootballer. Currently in a second spell with Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers, his former clubs include Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic. Koumas (Greek Ιασωνας Κούμας) is of Greek CypriotsGreek Cypriot descent and is a former Wales national football teamWelsh international.
Koumas operated as a creative midfield playmaker having played as a winger (sports)winger earlier in his career, creating goals for others as well as scoring many himself. He was selected in both the 2005–06 in English football2005–06 and 2006–07 in English football2006–07 Football League Championship team of the season.

Matt Ritchie.name: Matt Ritchie
Matt Ritchie.intro:
'''Matthew Thomas "Matt" Ritchie''' (born 10 September 1989) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Football League Championship club A.F.C. BournemouthAFC Bournemouth as a Midfielder#Wingerright winger. He previously played for Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth and Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town before joining Bournemouth in 2013.
Ritchie was born in England but is eligible to play for Scotland through his Scottish father, and made his senior international debut on 25 March 2015 against .

Boudewijn Zenden.name: Boudewijn Zenden
Boudewijn Zenden.intro: '''Boudewijn''' "'''Bolo'''" '''Zenden''' (; born 15 August 1976 in Maastricht) is a retired Dutch peopleDutch Association footballfootballer who played as a Winger (soccer)left winger or as an attacking midfielder. He served as the interim assistant manager to Rafa Benitez at Chelsea F.C.Chelsea during the 2012-13 Chelsea F.C. season2012-13 season. He is currently Darije Kalezic's assistant at Jong PSV in the Eerste Divisie.

David Raven.name: David Raven
David Raven.intro: '''David Haydn Raven''' (born 10 March 1985 in West Kirby, The Wirral PeninsulaWirral) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootball player currently playing for Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.Inverness Caledonian Thistle. He can play as a right-sided or central defender.
David Raven.position: Defender  association football  Full back Defender

Bruno N'Gotty.name: Bruno N'Gotty
Bruno N'Gotty.intro:
'''Bruno N'Gotty''' (born 10 June 1971) is a French former professional Association footballfootballer of Cameroonian descent. He played as a defender (association football)defender from 1988 until 2008, however he came out of retirement briefly in 2011.
As well as his native country he has played in the top flight divisions in both Italy and England. He has notably played for Olympique Lyonnais, Paris Saint-Germain FCParis Saint Germain, AC Milan, Olympique Marseille and Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers as well as earning 6 caps for France national football teamFrance. He has also played for S.S.C. VeneziaVenezia, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City and Hereford United F.C.Hereford United. He came out of retirement to join French 6th tier side l'AS Lattes in 2011.

Marcelino Elena.name: Marcelino Elena
Marcelino Elena.intro: '''Marcelino Elena Sierra''', simply known as '''Marcelino''' (born 26 September 1971), is a Spanish retired professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defender.
Marcelino Elena.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Marouane Chamakh.name: Marouane Chamakh
Marouane Chamakh.intro:
'''Marouane Chamakh''' ( ; ; born 10 January 1984) is a MoroccoMoroccan association footballfootballer who plays for Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace in the English Premier League and the Morocco national football teamMorocco national team as a Forward (association football)striker. He is described as a prototypical Forward (association football)target man and is noted for his "tall stature" and "excellent heading ability".
Chamakh started his career training throughout various clubs in the Aquitaine Regions of Franceregion. In 2000, he signed with FC Girondins de BordeauxBordeaux. Chamakh made his professional debut for the club in the 2002–03 Ligue 12002–03 season. He spent nine years at the club and helped Bordeaux win the Coupe de la Ligue in 2007 Coupe de la Ligue Final2007. In the 2008–09 Ligue 12008–09 season, Chamakh won his first league title as Bordeaux were crowned champions for the first time since the 1998–99 French Division 11998–99 season. The club also won the 2009 Coupe de la Ligue FinalCoupe de la Ligue completing the Double (association football)league and league cup double. In May 2010, Chamakh joined Arsenal of the Premier League on a Free transfer (football)free transfer after agreeing to a four-year contract with the club. In October 2010, Chamakh became the first player in UEFA Champions League history to score in six consecutive matches.
Although born and raised in France, Chamakh chose to play FIFAinternational football for Morocco, because he had Moroccan parents. He made his national team debut in July 2003 and has played at three Africa Cup of Nations tournaments, including the 2004 tournament in which Morocco finished runner-up. In August 2010, he Captain (association football)captained the national team for the first time.

Russell Anderson.name: Russell Anderson
Russell Anderson.intro: '''Russell Anderson''' (born, 25 October 1978) is a Scottish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back for Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen. He has played in the Scottish Premier League for Aberdeen, the Premier League for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, and the Football League for Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Burnley F.C.Burnley and Derby County F.C.Derby County. Anderson won 11 Cap (sport)caps for Scotland national football teamScotland at full international level.
Russell Anderson.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Jason Roberts.name: Jason Roberts
Jason Roberts.intro:
'''Jason Andre Davis Roberts''' Order of the British EmpireMBE (born 25 January 1978) is a former professional Association footballfootballer and now a football pundit.
Born in Park Royal, London, Roberts was playing football from an early age, and spent time in the youth academies at several professional clubs, but was not retained. After a spell in non-league football with Hayes F.C.Hayes, he joined Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers in 1997. He failed to make a first-team appearance for Wolves, and had loan spells at Torquay United F.C.Torquay United and Bristol City F.C.Bristol City before signing for Bristol Rovers F.C.Bristol Rovers in 1998. He quickly established himself in the first team, scoring 38 goals in his two seasons at the club.
After the club failed to gain promotion, Roberts handed in a transfer request and was sold to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion in July 2000. His goals helped the team reach the Football League First Division play-offsFirst Division play-offs in his first season at the club. West Brom then won promotion to the Premier League in the following season. Roberts scored three goals in his first Premier League season as the club were relegated back down to the Football League First DivisionFirst Division. He was loaned out to Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth at the start of the 2003–04 in English football2003–04 season, and was then sold to Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in January 2004. Roberts went on to score 21 goals in Wigan's promotion-winning campaign in the 2004–05 in English football2004–05 season, and won the club's Player of the Year award at the end of the season. His goals in the following season helped the club finish tenth in its inaugural Premier League campaign, as well as taking the team to the 2006 Football League Cup Final at the Millennium Stadium – the club's first ever major cup final.
After failing to agree a new contract with the club, he was sold to Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers in 2006, where he played European football for the first time. He made over 150 appearances for Blackburn, scoring 28 goals. In 2007, he established the Jason Roberts Foundation, and was awarded an MBE for services to sport in 2009. In 2011, he began working as a presenter for BBC Radio 5 Live's ''6-0-6'' programme. In January 2012. he signed for Reading F.C.Reading on an eighteen-month contract and helped them to promotion from the Football League Championship as champions.
On 20 March 2014, he announced his immediate retirement from the game due to persistent injuries.

Jemal Johnson.name: Jemal Johnson
Jemal Johnson.intro:
'''Jemal Pierre Johnson''' (born 3 May 1985) is an EnglandEnglish-AmericansAmerican association footballsoccer player who plays for Jacksonville Armada FCJacksonville Armada in the North American Soccer League.
He started his career at Premier League club Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, making several appearances for the club between 2004 and 2006, having graduated through the club's academy. After a season at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers, he joined Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons in summer 2007. As well as these three clubs, he has also spent loan periods at Preston North End F.C.Preston North End, Darlington F.C.Darlington, Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, Stockport County F.C.Stockport County, and Port Vale F.C.Port Vale. He spent the first half of 2011 with Bulgarian side PFC Lokomotiv SofiaLokomotiv Sofia, before returning to England in the summer to sign for Southend United F.C.Southend United; he was released by Southend in December 2011, and two months later signed with Dover Athletic F.C.Dover Athletic. He joined Tamworth F.C.Tamworth in September 2012. Having made one appearance for the club, he left Tamworth to return to the United States with the Fort Lauderdale Strikers. He went on to play for the New York Cosmos (2010)New York Cosmos and Jacksonville Armada.

Lawrie Sanchez.name: Lawrie Sanchez
Lawrie Sanchez.intro:
'''Lawrence Philip "Lawrie" Sanchez ''' (born 22 October 1959) is a Northern Irish association footballfootball manager and former international association footballfootball player.
The defining moment of his playing career came in the 1988 FA Cup Final, when he scored the winning goal for Wimbledon F.C.Wimbledon against Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, producing one of the biggest Cup upsets.
Career highlights as a manager include taking Wycombe Wanderers on a memorable F.A. Cup run that climaxed in a semi-final against Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and driving Northern Ireland national football teamNorthern Ireland from a FIFA ranking of 124th to 27th; a period during which he notched up notable results against England_national_football_teamEngland, Spain_national_football_teamSpain, Denmark_national_football_teamDenmark, Sweden_national_football_teamSweden and Portugal_national_football_teamPortugal.

Dejan Lovren.name: Dejan Lovren
Dejan Lovren.intro:
'''Dejan Lovren''' (; born 5 July 1989) is a Croatian association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Center-backcentral defender for Premier League club Liverpool F.C.Liverpool and the Croatia national football teamCroatian national team.
Lovren began his career at GNK Dinamo Zagreb before moving to Olympique Lyonnais in January 2010. He spent three-and-a-half seasons with the Ligue 1 team, winning the 2012 Coupe de France. In 2013, he signed for Southampton F.C.Southampton, and after one season there, he joined Liverpool for £20 million.
Although born in what is now Bosnia and Herzegovina, Lovren has represented Croatia at many levels and has been a full international since 2009. He has gone on to make 30 appearances and score two goals for his country, as well as being selected for the 2014 FIFA World Cup in Brazil.
Dejan Lovren.birth_place: Zenica,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

\u00c9tienne Capoue.name: Étienne Capoue
\u00c9tienne Capoue.intro: '''Étienne Capoue''' (born 11 July 1988) is a French professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. He can play as either a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder or Defender (association football)defender. Capoue was a France national youth football teamFrench youth international having earned caps at France national under-18 football teamunder-18, France national under-19 football teamunder-19, and France national under-21 football teamunder-21 level. Capoue served as Captain (association football)captain for a portion of his stint with the latter team. He is the younger brother of US BoulogneBoulogne player Aurélien Capoue.

Fernando (Brazilian footballer, born 198.name: Fernando (Brazilian footballer, born 1987)
Fernando (Brazilian footballer, born 198.intro:
'''Fernando Francisco Reges''' (born 25 July 1987), simply known as '''Fernando''', is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City as a Midfielder#Defensive midfielderdefensive midfielder.
He spent most of his career with F.C. PortoPorto with whom he signed in 2007, going on to appear in 236 official games and win 12 major titles, including four Primeira Liganational championships and the 2011 UEFA Europa League Final2011 Europa League.

Nathan Ak\u00e9.name: Nathan Aké
Nathan Ak\u00e9.intro: '''Nathan Benjamin Aké''' (born 18 February 1995) is a Dutch professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)defender for English club Reading F.C.Reading, on loan from Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, and for the Netherlands national under-21 football teamNetherlands under-21 team.

Marcos Alonso Mendoza.name: Marcos Alonso Mendoza
Marcos Alonso Mendoza.intro:
'''Marcos Alonso Mendoza''' (born 28 December 1990) is a Spanish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Italian club ACF Fiorentina as a Defender (association football)#Full-backleft back or midfielder.
He started his career with Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid, going on to represent Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in England, where he amassed Premier League totals of nine games and one goal over the course of two seasons, spending three in total with the club.
Marcos Alonso Mendoza.position: Defender  association football  Full back Left back

Leo Cotterell.name: Leo Cotterell
Leo Cotterell.intro: '''Leo Cotterell''' (born 2 September 1974) is an EnglandEnglish association footballfootball defender (football)defender.

Chris Herd.name: Chris Herd
Chris Herd.intro:
'''Christopher''' "'''Chris'''" '''Herd''' (born 4 April 1989) is an Australia national soccer teamAustralia international association footballfootballer who plays for Premier League side Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. Herd can be described as a Utility player#Association footballUtility player who can perform competently in a number of positions, including Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentral defence, Defender (association football)#Full-backfull back and Midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfield. He represented Australia at Australia national under-20 association football teamunder-20 level, and won his first senior cap in September 2014.
A graduate of the Aston Villa Under-21s and AcademyAston Villa Academy, he was loaned out to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale and Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers in 2008, before spending the 2009–10 Football League Two2009–10 campaign on loan at Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City. He made his Premier League debut in November 2010, and went on to become a regular first team player in the 2011–12 season. He was largely absent from the first team for the next two seasons, and was loaned out to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in September 2014, and then Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in January 2015.

Kevin Mirallas.name: Kevin Mirallas
Kevin Mirallas.intro:
'''Kevin Antonio Joel Gislain Mirallas y Castillo''' (; born 5 October 1987) is a Belgian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Everton F.C.Everton and the Belgium national football teamBelgium national team. He has previously played for Lille OSCLille, AS Saint-ÉtienneSaint-Étienne and Olympiacos F.C.Olympiacos.
Mirallas has earned over 45 caps for Belgium since his international debut in 2007, competing at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Olympics and helping the country to the quarter-finals of the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Jaime Moreno.name: Jaime Moreno
Jaime Moreno.intro:
'''Jaime Moreno Morales''' (born 19 January 1974 in Santa Cruz de la Sierra) is a former Bolivian Association footballfootballer now serving as Youth Academy Technical Training Coach for D.C. United in Major League Soccer, and as the head coach of D.C. United's D.C. United U-23U-23 side.
Moreno began his career at Club Blooming and then played for Colombia's Independiente Santa Fe before spending two seasons at the English club Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. The rest of his career was spent at D.C. United apart from one season at the New York MetroStars in 2003, and he was the all-time leading scorer in Major League Soccer at the time of his retirement in 2010. On 22 August 2007, in a match against the Red Bull New YorkNew York Red Bulls, he scored his 109th MLS goal, surpassing the previous league record set by former FC DallasDallas Burn and Real Salt Lake forward Jason Kreis. On 17 April 2009, Moreno became the first MLS player ever to reach the mark of 100 goals and 100 assists when he assisted on a Ben Olsen stoppage time goal.
From 1991 to 2008, Moreno played 75 matches for the Bolivia national football team, scoring eight goals. He represented the nation in five Copa América tournaments and the 1994 FIFA World Cup.

Gus Poyet.name: Gus Poyet
Gus Poyet.intro:
'''Gustavo Augusto "Gus" Poyet Domínguez''' (; born 15 November 1967) is a Uruguay national football teamUruguayan former Association footballfootballer and manager.
Poyet played as a midfielder and began his career with short spells at Grenoble Foot 38Grenoble and Club Atlético River Plate (Montevideo)River Plate. He then spent seven years at Real Zaragoza, with whom he won the Copa del Rey and the 1995 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup FinalUEFA Cup Winners' Cup. In 1997, Poyet moved to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea on a free transfer and helped the club win the 2000 FA Cup FinalFA Cup and the 1998 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup FinalUEFA Cup Winners' Cup. In 2001 he moved to Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, where he saw out the remainder of his career. He was also part of the Uruguay national football teamUruguay side which won the 1995 Copa América.
After his playing career ended, Poyet moved into coaching. He served as assistant manager to Dennis Wise at Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United, and Juande Ramos at Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur. In November 2009, Poyet was appointed manager of Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion and in his first full season led the club to promotion as Football League OneLeague One Champions, for which he was named League One Manager of the Year by the League Managers AssociationLMA. In October 2013 he was hired by Premier League team Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland and guided them to the 2014 Football League Cup FinalLeague Cup Final in his first season, but was sacked in March 2015 after a poor run of results.

Steve Guinan.name: Steve Guinan
Steve Guinan.intro: '''Stephen Anthony "Steve" Guinan''' (born 24 December 1975) is an English former Association footballfootballer who played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest, Carolina DynamoGreensboro Dynamo, Darlington F.C.Darlington, Burnley F.C.Burnley, Crewe Alexandra F.C.Crewe Alexandra, Halifax Town A.F.C.Halifax Town, Plymouth Argyle F.C.Plymouth Argyle, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United, Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, Hereford United F.C.Hereford United, Cheltenham Town F.C.Cheltenham Town, Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers and Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers.

Carl Jenkinson.name: Carl Jenkinson
Carl Jenkinson.intro: '''Carl Daniel Jenkinson''' (born 8 February 1992) is a professional Association footballfootballer who plays for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United on loan from Arsenal F.C.Arsenal as a Defender (association football)defender. Jenkinson began his career with Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic before joining Arsenal in 2011. He represented both the English and Finnish national teams at youth level before making his debut for the England national football teamEngland national team in 2012.

Pedro Mendes (footballer, born 1979).name: Pedro Mendes (footballer, born 1979)
Pedro Mendes (footballer, born 1979).intro:
'''Pedro Miguel da Silva Mendes''' (Portuguese pronunciation: [ˈpeðɾu ˈmẽðɨʃ]; born 26 February 1979) is a PortugalPortuguese former footballer who played as a midfielder.
Starting his career with home town club Vitória S.C.Vitória de Guimarães, Mendes won the 2003–04 UEFA Champions LeagueUEFA Champions League with F.C. PortoFC Porto in the 2003–04 F.C. Porto season2003–04 season. He then moved to the English Premier League, initially with Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur in 2004, where he famously scored a 50-yard goal against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, which was disallowed.[
Mendes was cap (sport)capped ten times by the Portugal national football teamPortuguese national team and was a member of their squad for the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

Cyril Chapuis.name: Cyril Chapuis
Cyril Chapuis.intro: '''Cyril Chapuis''' (born 21 March 1979) is a FranceFrench Football (soccer)football player.

Branislav Ivanovi\u0107.name: Branislav Ivanović
Branislav Ivanovi\u0107.intro:
'''Branislav Ivanović''' (, ; born 22 February 1984) is a Serbian professional association footballfootballer who plays for English club Chelsea F.C.Chelsea and the Serbia national football teamSerbia national team which he Captain (association football)captains. He is a versatile defender who can operate as a right-back or as a right-sided centre back.
Ivanović started his career in Serbia, playing for FK Remont ČačakRemont, FK Srem and OFK Beograd, where he earned his first cap for Serbia, before moving to Russia to play for FC Lokomotiv MoscowLokomotiv Moscow. After two years in Moscow he moved to Chelsea. Ivanović was selected as the right-back of the season for the 2009–10 Premier League season as Chelsea won the league title and the 2010 FA Cup Final. In 2012 he was part of the Chelsea team that won the Champions League, playing a pivotal role in their win against FC BarcelonaBarcelona in the semi-finals, however a yellow card in that game meant he missed the team's victory in the final. The following year Chelsea again reached a final in Europe, this time winning the 2013 UEFA Europa League Final with Ivanović scoring a stoppage-time header to win the match.
Ivanović was first capped for Serbia in 2005 and has since earned over 70 caps. He played for the nation at their first international tournament as an independent country, the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa.
