Branislav Ivanovi\u0107.birth_place: Sremska Mitrovica,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Justin Edinburgh.name: Justin Edinburgh
Justin Edinburgh.intro: '''Justin Charles Edinburgh''' (born 18 December 1969) is an English professional association footballfootball manager and former player. He is currently manager of Gillingham F.C.Gillingham.

Radhi Ja\u00efdi.name: Radhi Jaïdi
Radhi Ja\u00efdi.intro: '''Radhi Ben Abdelmajid Jaïdi''' (), born 30 August 1975 in Tunis) is a retired Tunisian Association footballfootballer. He played as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. He is currently an Under-21s coach at Southampton F.C.Southampton.
Radhi Ja\u00efdi.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Kevin McDonald (footballer, born 1988).name: Kevin McDonald (footballer, born 1988)
Kevin McDonald (footballer, born 1988).intro:
'''Kevin David McDonald''' (born 4 November 1988) is a Scottish professional Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers as a midfielder.
Born in Carnoustie, Scotland he began his career with Dundee F.C.Dundee before moving to England to sign for Burnley F.C.Burnley, for whom he played in the Premier League. He spent two full seasons with Sheffield United F.C.Sheffield United before moving to his current club in August 2013.

Kevin McLeod.name: Kevin McLeod
Kevin McLeod.intro:
'''Kevin Andrew McLeod''' (born 12 September 1980 in Liverpool) is an English professional Association footballfootballer. His preferred position is as a left-sided midfielder.
Starting his career as an Everton F.C.Everton trainee, by 2000 he made his way into first team contention. Unable to establish himself at the Premier League side he joined Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers in 2003, following two successful loan spells. After two seasons with QPR, he then spent a season with Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City. In 2006 he moved on to Colchester United F.C.Colchester United, where he spent another two years before moving on again, this time to Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.Brighton & Hove Albion. His time at Brighton was rather less successful than at his previous clubs, and he departed in 2010 for a brief spell at Wycombe Wanderers F.C.Wycombe Wanderers. As of September 2010 he was playing for Redbridge F.C.Redbridge in the Ryman One North.

Dan Potts.name: Dan Potts
Dan Potts.intro: '''Daniel''' "'''Dan'''" '''Potts''' (born 13 April 1994) is a professional association footballfootball player for West Ham United F.C.West Ham United as a Defender (association football)full back and a current England England national under-20 football teamU20 representative.

Mark Davies.name: Mark Davies
Mark Davies.intro: '''Mark Nicholas Davies''' (born 18 February 1988) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays for Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers in the Football League ChampionshipChampionship.

Micka\u00ebl Deb\u00e8ve.name: Mickaël Debève
Micka\u00ebl Deb\u00e8ve.intro: '''Mickaël Debève''' (born December 1, 1970 in Abbeville) is a former FranceFrench Association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder.

Nigel Spink.name: Nigel Spink
Nigel Spink.intro:
'''Nigel Philip Spink''' (born 8 August 1958) is an English former professional football (soccer)footballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper from 1976 until 2001.
He made his name at Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa and also made one appearance for England national football teamEngland at international level on the tour of Australia in 1983. He also played in the Football League for West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Millwall F.C.Millwall, as well as playing in Non-league for both Chelmsford City F.C.Chelmsford City and Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers.

Liam Cooper.name: Liam Cooper
Liam Cooper.intro: '''Liam David Ian Cooper''' (born 30 August 1991) is a professional footballer who plays for Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Leeds United F.C.Leeds United as a defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back. He is a former Scotland national under-19 football teamScotland U19 international. He is the current Captain (association football)Captain of Leeds United F.CLeeds United
Liam Cooper.birth_place: Kingston upon Hull,East Riding of Yorkshire,England
Liam Cooper.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre Back

Gjorgji Hristov.name: Gjorgji Hristov
Gjorgji Hristov.intro:
'''Gjorgji Hristov''' or '''Ǵorǵi Hristov''' () (born 30 January 1976 in Bitola, Socialist Republic of Macedonia, Yugoslavia) is a Macedonia (country)Macedonian soccerfootball coach and former striker.
Hristov played for FK PartizanPartizan Belgrade when EnglandEnglish team Barnsley F.C.Barnsley[
Hristov is the Macedonia national football team's second all-time leading scorer, with 16 goals.

Pablo Zabaleta.name: Pablo Zabaleta
Pablo Zabaleta.intro:
'''Pablo Javier Zabaleta Girod'''  (; born 16 January 1985) is an Argentine professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back for Manchester City and the Argentina national football teamArgentina national team. Zabaleta can operate on both sides of the pitch as a Defender (association football)#Full-backfull-back and is known for his tenacious style of play. Zabaleta contests for the Manchester City right-back position with Bacary Sagna. He has Captain (association football)captained the side on numerous occasions.
With Manchester City, Zabaleta has won all three of English football's major honours: the FA Cup (2010–11 FA Cup2011), the List of English football championsPremier League (2011–12 Premier League2012 and 2014), and the Football League Cup (2013–14 Football League Cup2014). Before joining Manchester City, Zabaleta played for La Liga club RCD Espanyol, where he won the 2005–06 Copa del Rey.
A full international since 2005, Zabaleta represented Argentina at the 2011 Copa América and was also in their team which won gold at the Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2008 Olympics.

Chris Fairclough.name: Chris Fairclough
Chris Fairclough.intro:
'''Courtney Huw "Chris"  Fairclough''' (born 12 April 1964, Nottingham) is an English former professional Football(soccer)footballer and coach.
As a player he was a defender (association football)defender from 1981 to 2001. He most notably played for Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest and Leeds United A.F.C.Leeds United. He also played for Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers, Notts County F.C.Notts County and York City F.C.York City. He was capped 7 times by the England under-21 national football teamEngland U21 side.

Michael Essien.name: Michael Essien
Michael Essien.intro:
'''Michael Kojo Essien''' (born 3 December 1982) is a Ghanaian Association footballfootballer who plays for A.C. MilanMilan and the Ghana national football teamGhana national team. He is a midfielder who has often been touted as a Midfielder#"Box-to-box" midfielderbox-to-box midfielder for his ability to exert energy in supporting offensive and defensive play and for his tough tackling style which has earned him the nickname "The Bison".[
Essien started his career playing for Liberty Professionals F.C.Liberty Professionals in his home country. In 2000, he moved to France joining SC BastiaBastia. Essien spent three seasons at the club appearing in over 60 matches before joining 2002–03 Ligue 1league champions Olympique Lyonnais in 2003. At Lyon, Essien won back-to-back league titles in Ligue 1 2003–042003–04 and Ligue 1 2004–052004–05 and also played in the UEFA Champions League for the first time. During his five-year stint in France, he acquired French citizenship. In 2005, Essien signed with Chelsea for a fee of £24.4 million and, at the time of his signing, was the most expensive African footballer in history. At Chelsea, Essien helped the club win the Premier League in 2005–06 FA Premier League2006 and 2009–10 Premier League2010, as well as three FA Cups and one Football League Cup. In 2008, he appeared in the 2008 UEFA Champions League FinalUEFA Champions League Final. He has won the Chelsea Player of the YearChelsea Goal of the season award twice, in the 2006–07 and 2008–09 seasons.
Essien is a Ghana national football teamGhanaian international. At youth level, he represented his country at the 1999 FIFA U-17 World Championship and 2001 FIFA World Youth Championship with the latter team finishing as runner-up. Essien made his senior team debut in January 2002 and has represented his nation at three Africa Cup of Nations tournaments and the 2006 FIFA World Cup, where Ghana reached the 2006 FIFA World Cup#Knockout stageRound of 16. He is often referred to as ''the Bison'' for his tough tackling style, boundless energy and physical presence on the pitch.

Grant Hanley.name: Grant Hanley
Grant Hanley.intro: '''Grant Campbell Hanley''' (born 20 November 1991) is a Scottish footballer who plays as a defender (association football)defender for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers and the Scotland national football team.

Des Lyttle.name: Des Lyttle
Des Lyttle.intro:
'''Desmond''' "'''Des'''" '''Lyttle''' (born 24 September 1971) is an English former Association footballfootballer turned football Manager (association football)manager.
He started his career with Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, but dropped into non-League football with Worcester City F.C.Worcester City in 1991. A good season earned him a move to Welsh side Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City, and in 1993 he moved on to Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest. After six years with the club, including a spell in the Premier League, he signed with Watford F.C.Watford. After just a season he switched to West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion. In 2003 he transferred to Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, and a year later he left the Football League for the second and final time, signing with Forest Green Rovers F.C.Forest Green Rovers. He transferred to Worcester City F.C.Worcester City in 2005, before joining Tamworth F.C.Tamworth in 2007.
In 2010 he was appointed caretaker manager at Tamworth, before being made player-manager on a full-time basis. He resigned the following year, claiming he was being undermined by the club's directors. He was appointed manager of Hucknall Town F.C.Hucknall Town in October 2011, before departing seven months later. He later had a spell as Coach (sport)first team coach at York City F.C.York City.

Jon Newby.name: Jon Newby
Jon Newby.intro: '''Jonathan Philip Robert "Jon" Newby''' (born 28 November 1978) is an English peopleEnglish association footballfootballer Forward (association football)striker and manager.

Kagisho Dikgacoi.name: Kagisho Dikgacoi
Kagisho Dikgacoi.intro:
'''Kagisho Evidence Dikgacoi'''
He made his international debut in 2007, and since then has earned 54 caps, scoring twice. He played at the Africa Cup of Nations in 2008 and 2013, and at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
Kagisho Dikgacoi.position: Midfielder Defensive midfielder Defensive midfielder,Midfielder Central midfielder Central midfielder

Danny Livesey.name: Danny Livesey
Danny Livesey.intro:
'''Daniel Richard''' "'''Danny'''" '''Livesey''' (born 31 December 1984 in Salford, Greater ManchesterSalford, Greater Manchester) is an English football player who currently plays for Barrow A.F.C.Barrow after being released by Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United.
Livesey started his career at Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton, and made his league debut at Reebok Stadiumthe Reebok in a 3–2 defeat versus Liverpool F.C.Liverpool at 17 (one of the youngest FA Premier LeaguePremiership and Wanderers players ever). He only made one more league appearance and a couple of cup appearances, and joined Rochdale A.F.C.Rochdale and Notts County F.C.Notts County on loan in 2003 and 2004, respectively. After this he joined Blackpool F.C.Blackpool on loan, but in his debut he suffered a serious injury and returned to the Trotters.
On Christmas Eve 2004, Livesey signed for Carlisle, who were then in the Conference NationalConference and since joining has played a major part in the clubs rise to Football League OneLeague One and in August 2007, signed a contract extension until 2010. Livesey was named in the The Football League 2007-08League One 2007–08 team of the year. He was also awarded the captaincy due to Paul Thirlwell's injury problems.
On 4 June 2012, Livesey signed a new 1-year deal with Carlisle United with the option of a further year.
On 31 January 2014, Livesey joined Wrexham F.C.Wrexham on loan for the rest of the season.

Clint Marcelle.name: Clint Marcelle
Clint Marcelle.intro:
'''Clint Sherwin Marcelle''' (born 9 November 1968 in Port of Spain, Trinidad & Tobago) is a former professional footballer who played between 1995 and 2006 in his native Trinidad as well as Portugal and England.
He notably played Premier League football for Barnsley F.C.Barnsley as well as also playing for United PetrotrinTrintoc, RD Agueda, Vitoria F.C.Vitoria Setubal, Rio Ave F.C.Rio Ave, FC Felgueiras, Scunthorpe United F.C.Scunthorpe United, Goole A.F.C.Goole Town, Hull City A.F.C.Hull City, Darlington F.C.Darlington, Harrogate Town F.C.Harrogate Town, Hucknall Town F.C.Hucknall Town, Stevenage Borough F.C.Stevenage Borough, Ossett Town F.C.Ossett Town, Scarborough F.C.Scarborough, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Tamworth F.C.Tamworth, Arnold Town F.C.Arnold Town, Gainsborough Trinity F.C.Gainsborough Trinity and Armthorpe Welfare F.C.Armthorpe Welfare. He previously managed the North East Stars in Trinidad and Tobago's Professional Football League (Trinidad and Tobago)Professional Football League.[

Mark Hughes (footballer, born 1986).name: Mark Hughes (footballer, born 1986)
Mark Hughes (footballer, born 1986).intro: '''Mark Anthony Hughes''' (born 9 December 1986) is an English association footballfootballer who plays as a defender for Morecambe F.C.Morecambe. An Everton F.C.Everton academy graduate, Hughes has also played for clubs Northampton Town F.C.Northampton Town, Walsall F.C.Walsall, North Queensland Fury FCNorth Queensland Fury and Bury F.C.Bury. Although he plays as a central defender, he is capable of being a regular goal scorer, both from the penalty spot and in open play.

Matt Murray.name: Matt Murray
Matt Murray.intro: '''Matthew William "Matt" Murray''' (born 2 May 1981) is an English former Goalkeeper (association football)football goalkeeper who spent his entire career at Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. His career was plagued by injuries which eventually forced him to retire aged 29. Since retiring Murray has worked as a match reporter and in-studio summariser for Sky Sports News.

Louis Saha.name: Louis Saha
Louis Saha.intro:
'''Louis Laurent Saha''' (born 8 August 1978) is a French former professional association footballfootballer. Saha was capped 20 times for the France national football teamFrench national team and scored four goals. A former scholar at the Clairefontaine football academy, he started his career at FC MetzMetz before playing on loan at Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United. Before the start of the 2000–01 season, Saha moved to Fulham F.C.Fulham where he established himself as first-choice striker, helping them to gain promotion to the Premier League in his first season with them.
His performances gained attraction from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, who eventually secured his signing for around £12.4 million midway through the 2003–04 FA Premier League2003–04 season. Injuries plagued his Old Trafford career, however he did enjoy success with twice winning the Premier League, the 2007–08 UEFA Champions League and also scored six times en route to victory in the Football League CupLeague Cup, including one goal in the 2006 Football League Cup Finalfinal. Despite Saha's injury woes, United stars Wayne Rooney and Rio Ferdinand have stated that they believe Saha to be the best striker either have ever played with or against.
After four and a half years at United, Everton F.C.Everton took him to Goodison Park, where he opened the scoring in the 2009 FA Cup Final after 25 seconds, setting the record for the fastest goal scored in FA Cup Final history. He moved to Tottenham Hotspur on a free transfer in the 2012 January transfer window. Saha made his France debut in 2004 in a 2–0 victory over Belgium national football teamBelgium. He represented France at UEFA Euro 2004 and the 2006 FIFA World Cup, at which they reached the 2006 FIFA World Cup Finalfinal.
Saha became first marquee player for the IMG-Reliance League, to be played in India in 2014.

Andy Melville.name: Andy Melville
Andy Melville.intro:
'''Andrew Roger Melville''' (born 29 November 1968 in Swansea) is a  former Wales international association footballfootballer. In the early years of his career, he played in midfield. He was later converted into a central defender.
He started his career at Swansea City A.F.C.Swansea City before earning a move to Oxford United F.C.Oxford United in July 1990 for £275,000. He later went on to play for Sunderland A.F.C.Sunderland, Bradford City F.C. and Fulham F.C.Fulham, before finishing his career with short spells at West Ham United F.C.West Ham United and Nottingham Forest F.C.Nottingham Forest.
He won 65 cap (sport)caps for the Wales national football teamWelsh national team between 1989 and 2004, scoring three times.
Andy Melville coaches the Oxford Brookes University football club first teamcite web

Matt Jarvis.name: Matt Jarvis
Matt Jarvis.intro:
'''Matthew Thomas "Matt" Jarvis''' (born 22 May 1986) is an English England national football teaminternational Association footballfootballer who plays as a Midfielder#Wingerwinger for Premier League club West Ham United F.C.West Ham United.
After an unsuccessful spell as a youth team player for Millwall F.C.Millwall, Jarvis began his professional career with Gillingham F.C.Gillingham, making his The Football LeagueFootball League debut for the Kent-based team at the age of 17.  He made more than 100 appearances for Gillingham and became a target for a number of larger clubs, eventually signing for Wolverhampton Wanderers in June 2007.  He became a first team regular for the club, helping them win promotion to the top flight in 2009.  In August 2012 he joined West Ham United.
He received his first call-up to the England national football teamEngland squad in 2011 and made his debut as a substitute against Ghana national football teamGhana in a Wembley StadiumWembley friendly.

Steve Vickers.name: Steve Vickers
Steve Vickers.intro: '''Stephen "Steve" Vickers''' (born 13 October 1967), is an English former association footballer who played as a defender (association football)central defender. He made nearly 600 appearances in the Football League and the Premier League, the majority of which were for Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers and Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough. While with Middlesbrough he played in the 1997 FA Cup Final.

Andy Morrison.name: Andy Morrison
Andy Morrison.intro: '''Andrew Charles "Andy" Morrison''' (born 30 July 1970) is a ScotlandScottish ex-association footballfootball player who played at defender (association football)centre half.  He is currently Assistant Manager at Welsh Premier League club Airbus UK Broughton F.C.Airbus UK Broughton and official Fan Ambassador at Manchester City F.C.Manchester City.

Bacary Sagna.name: Bacary Sagna
Bacary Sagna.intro:
'''Bacary Sagna''' () (born 14 February 1983) is a French Association footballfootballer who plays for English club Manchester City F.C.Manchester City and for the France national football team.  Arsenal manager Arsène Wenger has described him as the best right back in the Premier League. In addition to his regular duties in the full-back position, Sagna played for Arsenal as a Defender (association football)#Centre backcentre back on several occasions.
He began his career at AJ AuxerreAuxerre, before transferring to Arsenal F.C.Arsenal for £7 million in 2007.  In 2014, shortly after 2014 FA Cup Finalwinning the FA Cup, his first trophy at the club, he declared he would not continue as an Arsenal player and subsequently moved to Manchester City F.C.Manchester City when his contract expired. A full international since 2007, he was selected by France for two World Cup tournaments.

Malcolm Allen.name: Malcolm Allen
Malcolm Allen.intro:
'''Malcolm Allen''' (born 21 March 1967 in Deiniolen, Gwynedd) is a WalesWelsh former professional Association footballfootballer who played for Watford F.C.Watford, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Millwall F.C.Millwall, Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Stevenage Borough F.C.Stevenage Borough. Allen played 14 times for Wales national football teamWales between 1986 and 1993.
After retiring from the professional game he moved into coaching and television punditry. He is a Welsh speaker.Jones, pp 23

Steve Walsh.name: Steve Walsh
Steve Walsh.intro: '''Steven "Steve" Walsh''' (born 3 November 1964) is a former professional association footballfootballer, who spent most of his career at Leicester City F.C.Leicester City. He also played for Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan, Norwich City F.C.Norwich, Tamworth F.C.Tamworth and Coventry City F.C.Coventry City. He was normally a defender but at times was used as a striker. He is the record holder for the most Penalty card#Red cardred cards in the The Football LeagueFootball League, with 13, a record he holds jointly with Roy McDonough.[

Sean Flynn.name: Sean Flynn
Sean Flynn.intro:
'''Sean Flynn''' (born 13 March 1968) is a former English association footballfootballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder.
Flynn notably played in the Premier League for Coventry City F.C.Coventry City and Derby County F.C.Derby County, and in the Football League for Stoke City F.C.Stoke City, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Tranmere Rovers F.C.Tranmere Rovers. He finished his professional career with Kidderminster Harriers F.C.Kidderminster Harriers, before moving into non-league appearing part-time for Evesham United F.C.Evesham United, Redditch United F.C.Redditch United, Bodmin Town F.C.Bodmin Town and Penzance A.F.C.Penzance. He was briefly player/manager of Mullion as well as holding various coaching roles at other clubs he has played for in recent years.

Pablo Ib\u00e1\u00f1ez.name: Pablo Ibáñez
Pablo Ib\u00e1\u00f1ez.intro:
'''Pablo Ibáñez Tébar''' (born 3 August 1981), sometimes known as just '''Pablo''', is a Spanish Association footballfootballer who plays as a Defender (association football)#Centre-backcentre back. He has been a free agent since leaving Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City at the end of the 2012–13 season.
Pablo was born in Madrigueras. He began his football career in the youth teams of his local professional club, Albacete BalompiéAlbacete, with whom he earned promotion from the Segunda División to La Liga in 2003. A year later, he signed for Atlético Madrid where he made nearly 200 appearances over six seasons. His career with Atlético was marred by controversy when one of the 2006 presidential candidates for their city rivals Real Madrid C.F.Real Madrid claimed that a deal was in place for Real to sign Pablo should he win the election. Although he re-established himself in the Atlético team, contributing to a fourth-place finish in 2008, he played increasingly rarely towards the end of his time with the club, and in 2010 he moved to England. He spent a season with Premier League club West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion before joining Football League Championship (second-tier) club Birmingham City in 2011.
At international level, Pablo was cap (sport)capped 10 times for Spain national under-21 football teamSpain's under-21 team before making his first appearance for the Spain national football teamsenior national team in 2004. He went on to earn 23 caps and represented his country at the 2006 FIFA World Cup2006 World Cup.
Pablo Ib\u00e1\u00f1ez.position: Defender  association football  Centre back Centre back

Franck Dumas.name: Franck Dumas
Franck Dumas.intro: '''Franck Dumas''' (born 9 January 1968 in Bayeux, Calvados) is a former FranceFrench professional football (soccer)football player. Since February 2013, he has been the manager of AC Arles-AvignonArles-Avignon in the Ligue 2.

Alan Neilson.name: Alan Neilson
Alan Neilson.intro:
'''Alan Neilson''' (born 26 September 1972) is a German-born WalesWelsh former professional association footballfootballer and assistant manager of Football League Two side Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United.
He played his entire career in England as a Defender (association football)defender from 1991 until 2007, notably in the Premier League for Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United and Southampton F.C.Southampton. He also played for Fulham F.C.Fulham, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Luton Town F.C.Luton Town, Tamworth F.C.Tamworth and Salisbury City F.C.Salisbury City. He later re-joined Luton Town in 2008 as a youth coach, before becoming assistant manager and having three spells as the club's caretaker manager. He left the club in July 2013 and joined Cambridge United F.C.Cambridge United as assistant coach later that year.

Mark Jackson.name: Mark Jackson
Mark Jackson.intro: '''Mark Graham Jackson''' (born 30 September 1977 in Leeds) is an EnglandEnglish Association footballfootballer who plays for reformed Farsley A.F.C.Farsley, after his last club Farsley Celtic F.C.Farsley Celtic was wound-up by its administrators on 12 March 2010.

Paul Ince.name: Paul Ince
Paul Ince.intro:
'''Paul Emerson Carlyle Ince''' (born 21 October 1967) is an English Association footballfootball manager and a former professional footballer who played as a midfielder (association football)midfielder from 1982 to 2007.
Born in Ilford, London, Ince spent the majority of his playing career at the highest level; after leaving West Ham United F.C.West Ham United he joined Manchester United F.C.Manchester United where he played in the Premier League. After two years in Italian Serie A with F.C. Internazionale MilanoInternazionale he returned to England to play in the top flight for Liverpool F.C.Liverpool, Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough and Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers. After a spell as player-coach of Swindon Town F.C.Swindon Town, he retired from playing while player-manager of Macclesfield Town F.C.Macclesfield Town in 2007. He went on to manage Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons (twice), Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Notts County F.C.Notts County and, after an almost-two-year break, Blackpool F.C.Blackpool. He was capped 53 times by England national football teamEngland, scoring two goals.
As a player he won numerous honours with Manchester United F.C.Manchester United, became the first Black Britishblack player to Captain (association football)captain the England national football teamEngland team and was also the first black Briton to manage a team in the Premier Leaguehighest tier of English football.[

Keith O'Neill.name: Keith O'Neill
Keith O'Neill.intro: '''Keith O'Neill'''  (born 16 February 1976 in Dublin) is a former professional Football (soccer)footballer who represented the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland. He played as a left-sided midfielder, but could sometimes play as a striker. Despite being an exceptionally talented youngster, his career was ultimately cut-short by successive injuries caused by a degenerative bone disease.

Celestine Babayaro.name: Celestine Babayaro
Celestine Babayaro.intro: '''Celestine Hycieth Babayaro''' (born 29 August 1978 in Kaduna) is a former Nigerian Association footballfootballer. He was named after Pope Celestine V.

J\u00f4.name: Jô
J\u00f4.intro:
'''João Alves de Assis Silva''' (born 20 March 1987), known as '''Jô''' (), is a Brazilian professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker.
He has previously played for Sport Club Corinthians PaulistaCorinthians, PFC CSKA MoscowCSKA Moscow, Manchester City F.C.Manchester City, Everton F.C.Everton, Galatasaray S.K. (football team)Galatasaray and Sport Club InternacionalInternacional. Jô made his full international debut for Brazil in 2007, and was in the squads which took bronze at the 2008 Olympics and won the 2013 FIFA Confederations Cup, and also played at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Richard Wright.name: Richard Wright
Richard Wright.intro:
'''Richard Ian Wright''' (born 5 November 1977) is an English professional Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper and Goalkeeper coach who plays for Manchester City. Born in Ipswich, he joined Ipswich Town F.C.Ipswich Town as a trainee, going on to play for the club more than 200 times between 1995 and 2001.
He moved to Premier League club Arsenal F.C.Arsenal in 2001 before being signed by Everton F.C.Everton in 2002 where he spent five years. A brief spell on loan from West Ham United F.C.West Ham United with Southampton F.C.Southampton was followed by a transfer back to Ipswich Town. Having made over 50 more appearances for the club, he was released at the end of the 2010–11 season. He joined Premier League champions Manchester City on a free transfer on 31 August 2012.
He has been a member of the England national football teamEngland squad, earning two cap (football)caps, and was included in their squad for UEFA Euro 2000.

Isa\u00edas Marques Soares.name: Isaías Marques Soares
Isa\u00edas Marques Soares.intro:
'''Isaías Marques Soares''' (born 17 November 1963), simply known as '''Isaías''', is a Brazilian retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward.
Over the course of ten seasons he amassed Primeira LigaPortuguese top division totals of 279 games and 97 goals, mainly with S.L. BenficaBenfica (five years, three major titles won).

Dar\u00edo Silva.name: Darío Silva
Dar\u00edo Silva.intro:
'''Darío Debray Silva Pereira''' (born 2 November 1972) is an Uruguayan retired Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
After making a name for himself in his country and in Italy with Cagliari CalcioCagliari, he spent the following seven years of his career in Spain – scoring 48 La Liga goals in 163 games, mostly for Málaga CFMálaga – before moving to England. He suffered a serious car accident shortly after leaving Portsmouth F.C.Portsmouth, which caused him to lose a leg and effectively end his career.
Amongst other tournaments, Silva represented Uruguay national football teamUruguay at the 2002 FIFA World Cup2002 World Cup, gaining nearly 50 Cap (sport)caps.

Gast\u00f3n Ram\u00edrez.name: Gastón Ramírez
Gast\u00f3n Ram\u00edrez.intro:
'''Gastón Exequiel Ramírez Pereyra''' (; born 2 December 1990) is a Uruguayan Association footballfootballer who plays for Hull City A.F.C.Hull City (on loan from Southampton F.C.Southampton) and the Uruguay national football team as an Midfielder#Attacking midfielderattacking midfielder.
A full international for Uruguay since 2010, he represented the nation at the Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament2012 Olympics, 2013 Confederations Cup and 2014 World Cup.

Luke Moore.name: Luke Moore
Luke Moore.intro: '''Luke Isaac Moore''' (born 13 February 1986) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays for Toronto FC in Major League Soccer as a Forward (Association football)striker.

Daniel Amokachi.name: Daniel Amokachi
Daniel Amokachi.intro:
'''Daniel Owefin Amokachi''' (born 30 December 1972 in Kaduna) is a Nigerian former professional football (soccer)footballer of Idoma peopleIdoma descent and assistant manager of the Nigeria national football team.
As a player he was a striker from 1989 until 2005, starting his career with Ranchers Bees before earning notability by playing outside his native country with Premier League side Everton F.C.Everton, as well as Club Brugge and Beşiktaş J.K.Beşiktaş before initially finishing his career in the United States with Major League Soccer club Colorado Rapids. He returned to Nigeria in 2005 to briefly play for Nasarawa United F.C.Nasarawa United, who he went on to manage before moving on to Enyimba International F.C.Enyimba. He is now in his second spell as assistant manager of Nigeria national football teamNigeria.

Djibril Diawara.name: Djibril Diawara
Djibril Diawara.intro: '''Djibril Diawara''' (born on 3 January 1975 in Dakar) is a retired FranceFrench-Senegalese footballer.

Ben Roberts.name: Ben Roberts
Ben Roberts.intro: '''Ben James Roberts''' (born 22 June 1975 in Bishop Auckland) is a former English association footballfootballer who played as a Goalkeeper (association football)goalkeeper. He is currently goalkeeper coach at Charlton Athletic F.C.Charlton Athletic.

Jay Spearing.name: Jay Spearing
Jay Spearing.intro: '''Jay Francis Spearing''' (born 25 November 1988) is an English professional Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers on loan from Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers.

Mauricio Sol\u00eds.name: Mauricio Solís
Mauricio Sol\u00eds.intro:
'''Mauricio Solís Mora''' (born 13 December 1972 in Heredia, Costa RicaHeredia) is a retired Costa Rica national football teamCosta Rican professional association footballfootballer, who played as a defensive midfielder.
He is one of Costa Rica national football teamCosta Rica's best players in the past decade. He is a tough, hard working central midfielder who is a strong tackler and is also good at distributing balls and starting attacks from the center of pitch, he is also a great finisher from long distances.

Steve Livingstone.name: Steve Livingstone
Steve Livingstone.intro:
'''Stephen''' "'''Steve'''" '''Livingstone''' (born 8 September 1969) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer who played as a Forward (association football)forward and makeshift defender (association football)defender from 1986 to 2004.
He began his career at Coventry City F.C.Coventry City in 1986, though had little impact at the club before he joined Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers for a £450,000 fee in January 1991. He helped Rovers to win promotion to the top-flight via the play-offs 1992 Football League Second Division play-off Final1992. In March 1993 he was sold on to Chelsea F.C.Chelsea for a £350,000 fee, but only played the one league game for the club. He was loaned out to Port Vale F.C.Port Vale in September 1993, before being moved on to Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town for £140,000 the following month. He spent the next ten years at the club, helping the "Mariners" to win promotion out of the Football League Second DivisionSecond Division via the play-offs in 1998 Football League Second Division play-off Final1998, as well as the Football League Trophy title, again in 1998 Football League Trophy Final1998. He joined Carlisle United F.C.Carlisle United in 2003 following a short loan spell, before retiring due to injury in January 2004.

Jack Hunt.name: Jack Hunt
Jack Hunt.intro: '''Jack Paul Hunt''' (born 6 December 1990) is an English Association footballfootballer who plays for Rotherham United F.C.Rotherham United on loan from Crystal Palace F.C.Crystal Palace as a defender (association football)defender. Though primarily a right back, Hunt can also play on the right of midfield.

Chris Sutton.name: Chris Sutton
Chris Sutton.intro:
'''Christopher Roy "Chris" Sutton''' (born 10 March 1973) is an English former professional Association footballfootballer and coach (sport)manager.
He played as a forward (association football)forward from 1991 to 2007 for Norwich City F.C.Norwich City, Blackburn Rovers F.C.Blackburn Rovers, Chelsea F.C.Chelsea, Celtic F.C.Celtic, Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa. Sutton scored over 150 career goals in over 400 league appearances spanning 16 years in the Premier LeagueEnglish and Scottish Premier Leagues. He was cap (football)capped once by England national football teamEngland.
Sutton played principally in midfield or attack, although usually in the latter role as a striker. A very physical player, Sutton was a fairly prolific goalscorer throughout his career and was joint top goalscorer (with Dion Dublin and Michael Owen) in the FA Premier League 1997–98 season. He is also known as being one of the foremost exponents of the glancing header. He scored many goals with this technique which made him particularly effective from set-pieces.
In September 2009, Sutton was appointed manager of Lincoln City F.C.Lincoln City, but he resigned due to personal reasons twelve months later. In 2012 he came out of retirement briefly and featured for Non-league Wroxham F.C.Wroxham.

Jon Goodman.name: Jon Goodman
Jon Goodman.intro: '''Jonathan "Jon" Goodman''' (born 2 June 1971) is an EnglandAnglo-Republic of IrelandIrish former professional Association footballfootballer, and was the Sports scienceSports Scientist at Reading F.C.Reading before leaving to concentrate on his consultancy business. He left his role as Fitness Coach at Leeds United in May 2014.

Joey Gu\u00f0j\u00f3nsson.name: Joey Guðjónsson
Joey Gu\u00f0j\u00f3nsson.intro:
'''Jóhannes "Joey" Karl Guðjónsson''' (born 25 May 1980 in Akranes) commonly known as '''Joey Guðjónsson''' is an Icelandic professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Fylkir. He plays as a midfielder and has 34 caps for the Iceland national football teamIceland national team.
His previous clubs include Real Betis, Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa, Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolves, Leicester City F.C.Leicester City, AZ (football club)AZ Alkmaar and Burnley F.C.Burnley. He has played in five top flight league across Europe.

Istv\u00e1n Kozma.name: István Kozma
Istv\u00e1n Kozma.intro: '''István Kozma''' (born 3 December 1964 in Pásztó) is a former HungaryHungarian soccerfootball player who played in midfieldermidfield.

Derek McInnes.name: Derek McInnes
Derek McInnes.intro:
'''Derek John McInnes''' (born 5 July 1971) is a Scottish Association footballfootball player and manager who is currently the manager of Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen. McInnes featured prominently for Greenock Morton F.C.Greenock Morton, Rangers F.C.Rangers, West Bromwich Albion F.C.West Bromwich Albion and Dundee United F.C.Dundee United during his playing career. He won two caps for the Scotland national football team while with West Bromwich.
McInnes became manager of St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone where he had been on the playing staff, in November 2007. He guided the club to promotion to the Scottish Premier League in 2009 and retained that status for two seasons. McInnes was appointed manager of Football League Championship club Bristol City F.C.Bristol City in October 2011. Despite avoiding relegation in 2011-12 Football League Championship2011–12, McInnes was sacked by Bristol City in January 2013 with the club bottom of the Championship. He was appointed Aberdeen F.C.Aberdeen manager in March 2013.

Andy Sinton.name: Andy Sinton
Andy Sinton.intro: '''Andrew "Andy" Sinton''' (born 19 March 1966 in Cramlington, Northumberland) is an English former professional association footballfootballer and now a manager, most recently with AFC Telford UnitedA.F.C. Telford United. During his playing career, he notably played for Queens Park Rangers F.C.Queens Park Rangers, Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday and Tottenham Hotspur F.C.Tottenham Hotspur, and also earned 12 caps playing as an international footballer for England national football teamEngland.

Duncan Ferguson.name: Duncan Ferguson
Duncan Ferguson.intro:
'''Duncan Cowan Ferguson''' (born 27 December 1971) is a Scottish former association footballfootballer. He was nicknamed "''Big Dunc''"[
Ferguson began his football career at Carse Thistle before being signed by Dundee United F.C.Dundee United in 1990 on his first professional contract. He moved to Rangers F.C.Rangers in 1993 for a then British transfer record of £4 million. He spent the remainder of his career in England with two spells at Everton F.C.Everton (1994 to 1998 and 2000 to 2006) and Newcastle United F.C.Newcastle United between 1998 and 2000. Ferguson retired from football in 2006.
During his career, Ferguson won the FA Cup with Everton in 1995, competed in the qualifying stages of the UEFA Champions League in 2005, also with Everton, and participated in the UEFA Cup in 1999 with Newcastle and 2005 with Everton. He was Cap (football)capped for Scotland national football teamScotland seven times but made himself unavailable for selection in his national team due to a dispute with the Scottish Football Association.[

Dean Marney.name: Dean Marney
Dean Marney.intro: '''Dean Edward Marney''' (born 31 January 1984) is an English association footballfootballer who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley as a midfielder.

Nenad Milija\u0161.name: Nenad Milijaš
Nenad Milija\u0161.intro:
'''Nenad Milijaš''' (Serbian Cyrillic: Ненад Милијаш; born 30 April 1983) is a Serbian Association footballfootballer who plays as a midfielder for China League One club Hebei China Fortune F.C.Hebei China Fortune. He represented 2010 FIFA World Cup squads#SerbiaSerbia at the 2010 FIFA World Cup.
Milijaš rose to prominence in his homeland with his first club FK Zemun before moving to Red Star Belgrade where he won league and cup honours. Decorated with individual awards for his performances at Red Star, he broke into the Serbian national side in 2008. He moved to England in 2009 when he signed for Premier League side Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.Wolverhampton Wanderers but returned to his former club three years later.
Nenad Milija\u0161.birth_place: Belgrade,Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia

Keith Southern.name: Keith Southern
Keith Southern.intro: '''Keith William Southern''' (born 24 April 1981) is an English professional association footballfootballer who currently plays for Shrewsbury Town F.C.Shrewsbury Town, on loan from Fleetwood Town F.C.Fleetwood Town. He is a midfielder#Central midfieldercentral midfielder, and spent ten years at Blackpool F.C.Blackpool prior to his move to Huddersfield. He was the longest-serving player at Bloomfield Road at the time of his departure.

Robin van Persie.name: Robin van Persie
Robin van Persie.intro:
'''Robin van Persie''' (; born 6 August 1983) is a Dutch Association footballfootballer who plays as a forward (association football)striker for Manchester United F.C.Manchester United and is the Captain (association football)captain of the Netherlands national football teamNetherlands national team. He is a youth product of Feyenoord.[
The son of two artists, Van Persie was encouraged to follow in his parents' footsteps, but he instead preferred football and joined SBV Excelsior's youth squad. He made his breakthrough at another hometown club Feyenoord, where he spent three seasons and won the 2002 UEFA Cup Final2002 UEFA Cup.[
Van Persie was a Dutch youth international, having represented the Netherlands Netherlands national under-17 football teamunder-17, Netherlands national under-19 football teamunder-19 and Netherlands national under-21 football teamunder-21 sides. He made his senior international debut in 2005 in a friendly match against Romania national football teamRomania. One month later, he scored his first senior international goal in a 4–0 win over Finland national football teamFinland. Van Persie has 96 Cap (sport)caps and has scored 49 goals for the Netherlands, making him their top scorer of all time.[

Mark Nicholls.name: Mark Nicholls
Mark Nicholls.intro:
'''Mark Nicholls''' (born 30 May 1977) is an English former professional association footballfootballer who played as a striker from 1994 until 2012, notably remembered for playing in the Premier League for Chelsea F.C.Chelsea. He was assistant manager to Neil Shipperley at North Greenford United F.C.North Greenford United before the pair left after the 2011/12 season. He then returned with Shipperley to North Greenford United in October 2012 after Jon-Barrie Bates left by mutual consent.
He also played in the Football League for Reading F.C.Reading, Grimsby Town F.C.Grimsby Town, Colchester United F.C.Colchester United and Torquay United F.C.Torquay United, as well as playing in the Scottish Football League for Partick Thistle F.C.Partick Thistle, Hamilton Academical F.C.Hamilton Academical and Clydebank F.C.Clydebank.

Jay O'Shea.name: Jay O'Shea
Jay O'Shea.intro:
'''James''' "'''Jay'''" '''O'Shea''' (born 10 August 1988) is an Irish professional association footballfootballer who plays for Football League OneLeague One club Chesterfield F.C.Chesterfield. He is primarily a Midfielder#Wingerright winger, but can also operate as a forward (association football)striker.
O'Shea began his career with St Joseph's Boys AFC before moving on to play for Home Farm F.C.Home Farm of the Leinster Senior League (association football)Leinster Senior League in 2005. He signed for Bray Wanderers A.F.C.Bray Wanderers after just two appearances for Home Farm, and spent a year-and-a-half with Bray. In 2008, O'Shea signed for Galway United F.C.Galway United, playing 60 games for the club in all competitions, and attracted a lot of interest from The Football LeagueFootball League and Premier League teams.
He subsequently joined Birmingham City F.C.Birmingham City in August 2009 for an undisclosed fee, and made his Premier League debut shortly after against Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. However, he found first-team opportunities hard to come by during his first season at Birmingham, and was loaned out to Middlesbrough F.C.Middlesbrough in March 2010. O'Shea was loaned out again in October 2010, this time to Football League TwoLeague Two side Stevenage F.C.Stevenage where he spent two months, and then to Port Vale in January 2011. He was released when his contract expired at the end of the 2010–11 season, and joined Milton Keynes Dons F.C.Milton Keynes Dons. He joined Chesterfield on loan in November 2012, and joined the club permanently two months later. He played for Chesterfield in the 2014 Football League Trophy Final2014 final of the Football League Trophy, before helping them to win the Football League TwoLeague Two title in 2013–14.

Jay Bothroyd.name: Jay Bothroyd
Jay Bothroyd.intro:
'''Jay Bothroyd''' (born 5 May 1982) is an English Association footballfootballer.
He has also played for the England national football teamEngland national team. He was a product of the Arsenal Academy and came to prominence during the 1999–2000 FA Youth Cup Final win against Coventry City F.C.Coventry City.[

Will Keane.name: Will Keane
Will Keane.intro: '''William David "Will" Keane''' (born 11 January 1993) is an English professional association footballfootballer who plays as a Forward (association football)forward for Sheffield Wednesday F.C.Sheffield Wednesday on loan from Manchester United F.C.Manchester United. Having been with Manchester United since the age of 11, Keane also spent a month on loan with Wigan Athletic F.C.Wigan Athletic in December 2013, and played the second half of that season at Queens Park Rangers. His twin brother, Michael Keane (footballer, born 1993)Michael, is a Defender (association football)defender who plays for Burnley F.C.Burnley. Keane has also represented England at youth level.

Nolberto Solano.name: Nolberto Solano
Nolberto Solano.intro:
'''Nolberto Albino "Ñol" Solano Todco''' (born 12 December 1974), commonly known as '''Nobby Solano''', is a retired Peruvian professional footballer, and former manager of Peruvian Primera División club Universitario de Deportes and Canadian semi-professional team Internacional de Toronto, from League1 Ontario. He has spent much of his playing career in the English Premier League and also played 95 times for Peru national football teamPeru between 1994 and 2009. He is a popular figure in his native Peru, where he is seen as one of the most famous Peruvians, appearing on telephone cards and having his wedding televised live. ''"Solano is a hero in Peru where his face appears in TV adverts. The 29-year-old winger is such a household name there that even his wedding was televised live."''
His talents in football range from accurate crosses to accomplished dead-ball skills and he has traditionally played either on the right side of midfield, or as a right back during his career. He is the first choice player to take corner and direct free kicks. Solano is the first Peruvian to play in the Premier League and the FA Cup Final. He is also an accomplished trumpet player and has set up his own Salsa musicSalsa band, ''The Geordie Latinos''. He has described himself as an "adopted Geordie."

Mark Delaney.name: Mark Delaney
Mark Delaney.intro: '''Mark Anthony Delaney''' (born 13 May 1976 in Haverfordwest) is a retired Welsh peopleWales Association footballfootballer who played for Carmarthen Town F.C.Carmarthen Town, Cardiff City F.C.Cardiff City and Aston Villa F.C.Aston Villa as a Defender (association football)#Full-backright back. He is also a former member of the Wales national football teamWelsh national team.
Mark Delaney.position: Defender  association football  Full back Right Back

H\u00e9lder Postiga.name: Hélder Postiga
H\u00e9lder Postiga.intro:
'''Hélder Manuel Marques Postiga''' (; born 2 August 1982) is a Portuguese Association footballfootballer who plays for Spanish club Deportivo de La Coruña as a Forward (association football)#Strikerstriker.
After starting professionally at F.C. PortoPorto, Postiga amassed Primeira Liga totals of 185 games and 49 goals over the course of ten seasons, with Porto and Sporting Clube de PortugalSporting. He also played abroad, most notably in Spain.
A Portugal national football teamPortuguese international on 71 occasions, Postiga represented the country in two FIFA World CupWorld Cups and three UEFA European ChampionshipEuropean Championships, helping the national team reach the final at UEFA Euro 2004Euro 2004.

Owen Coyle.name: Owen Coyle
Owen Coyle.intro:
'''Owen Columba Coyle''' (born 14 July 1966) is a former professional association footballfootball player and manager (association football)manager who is the current head coach[
Paisley-born Coyle began his career at Dumbarton F.C.Dumbarton. He played for a number of Scottish teams as well as a spell at English club Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton Wanderers. He was cap (sport)capped once by the Republic of Ireland national football teamRepublic of Ireland, having qualified through Irish descent. He also played for the Republic of Ireland national under-21 football team.
Upon retiring from playing, he managed Falkirk F.C.Falkirk and St. Johnstone F.C.St. Johnstone before heading to then Football League ChampionshipChampionship side Burnley F.C.Burnley. In his first full season in charge, Burnley won promotion to the Premier League. He then moved to Bolton Wanderers F.C.Bolton halfway through his first season in the English Premier LeaguePremier League. Coyle was appointed manager of Wigan Athletic in June 2013 only to leave the club on 2 December 2013.
